11121.content:
Squeezing through a gap in the picket fence you left the berry farm with your prize. A trio of Oran berries were dangling from your mouth by their stems, swaying as you joyfully swaggered back into the forest. Setting up right next to the small agricultural town of the humans was the best decision you've ever made, there were cultivated berries of all types and a staggering amount of them to boot so you never went hungry. You may have had to dodge and sneak past the odd Pokemon that were helping the humans guard them, but it was a non-issue for an illusionary fox Pokemon like you. While you were just a small grey thing you made up for it with pure cunning.

Walking deeper into the forest you found a sunny spot to enjoy your meal. You were still feeling proud of today's heist. A Houndoom that was guarding the particular patch you were invested in stealing from simply refused to wander away to give you a moment to snatch the berries so you decided to do something bold. Instead of waiting, you decided to simply take the berries right in front of him by disguising yourself as a man that was tending to the next field over. The Houndoom was thinking none the wiser as he watched your illusionary human body bend down and pluck a few Oran berries. You even had the nerve to walk up to him and make your illusionary human pat him on the head! He acknowledged you and turned away to go patrol some other corner of the patch, allowing you to sneak away without worry.

It was the culmination of years of experience in trickery and deception that had made your illusions so extremely powerful and realistic, they perhaps even surpassed what a Zoroark could pull off. You were right to be proud of your abilities; there was only a select few Pokemon that could see past your illusions. Although, just as fate would have it, you could see one of them approaching you right now as you were getting ready to eat your food. Your heart sunk as you recognized the grey and black fur of the larger Pokemon. It was Mightyena, the forest's resident bully and he seems to be eyeing your berries.

Try as you might, this guy more often than not sees past your illusions. Having a keen set of senses and the experience of scuffling with you many times made him a difficult Pokemon to deceive. Still, that didn't mean you wanted to give him what he wanted. You felt anxiety welling up in your chest as he slowly approached you. "Hey, small-fry! Did you get those berries for me?"

"No. Their mine." You defiantly muttered.

"Too bad. I'm taking them." He said. Mightyena was a very intimidating Pokemon, especially since he had the reputation of being the most toughest male in the entire forest but that still doesn't mean he should get your berries. Your thoughts were darting between running away and suffering the shame of defeat or trying a new illusion on the off-chance that it might scare him away. Looking down at your small pile of Oran berries inspired a surge of determination as you remembered all the other times he stole your berries. You decided to risk it.

It would have to be something big that would scare the likes of any strong Pokemon, something that would trigger their in-built survival instincts and get them to run away in fear. Not only that, the illusion would have to be perfect. Mightyena was still waiting for you to mutter a reply of defeat which gave you time to envision your grand illusion. You imagined yourself getting bigger, almost standing taller than the trees with your paws pressing hard into the forest soil. Concentrating with a focus you never thought you had, light began to bend around you as your illusion rapidly began to develop before the Mightyena's eyes. Your body quickly expanded and not a few seconds later you were at the size you envisioned.

Although, something was off. Usually, if you were using an illusion to take on the form of something else your point of view was still that of your original Zorua body. In this situation you should be hidden in plain sight between your illusions two ginormous legs, yet instead you were looking down at the Mightyena from a giant's point of view. Shrugging it off, you lift your paw and slam it on the ground next to Mightyena, imagining the weight the body would have and what sounds it would produce as its paw would impact the forest floor. A large thud echoed through the forest and you noticed that you could feel what the illusion was feeling, too. Were you getting so good at deception that you were literally fooling yourself now? The display was definitely worrying Mightyena and for a moment you thought he was going to turn tail and run.

Unfortunately it would seem it wasn't enough. Mightyena knows you and while he seemed shaken at first, he quickly got a hold of himself. "You think you can trick me? I'll show you!" He roared. Watching from above you flinched when he charged at you, fully expecting him to bash through your illusion and send you flying but all you got was a gentle thud against your forelimb as he bounced off of you. You were both just as confused as you tried to comprehend what that exactly implied. Testing, you brought your leg up and flicked a paw against his body, effortlessly making him tumble backwards a few feet as if he was no heavier than one of the berries you collected. Then it clicked.

Your illusion wasn't an illusion. It was real!

Somehow you had managed to make yourself bigger. The thought left you giddy as you stretched your head to peak over the canopy and became more aware of how the weight of your paws were making them sink into the ground. Looking back down you were saddened to see that Mightyena had taken the opportunity to run away, leaving you alone in the small clearing. As much as you would love to have a moment to fantasize on the things you could do to him at this size, you felt that learning about this new ability to be a more pressing matter.

Instead of having to concentrate on the intricate process of crafting an illusion, you found that merely thinking about changing size was enough. You shrunk yourself to your original size, then made yourself shorter than a blade of grass and then made yourself big enough that the trees were only up to your ankles. The sudden increase in size demolished a bunch of trees at your feet as your stance widened and you shrunk down to your original size again when you quickly realized the whole town next to the forest could most likely have seen you.

Sadly it seemed your other random illusions you know weren't physically manifesting and no matter how hard you tried you just couldn't materialize that deluxe Poke Puff. Still, suddenly gaining the ability to change your size at will filled you with adrenaline as you considered that it quite possibly made you the most powerful Pokemon in the entire region. You were no longer hungry for the berries you pilfered earlier as you contemplated all the ways you could have fun with this new ability and you were keen to test if it worked on Pokemon besides yourself. And what if it worked on humans?

Right away you were keen to test out this newfound power. You could finally get back on Mightyena for being a massive jerk to everyone, or you could go and find a way to play with the humans.... The possibilities seemed endless.
11121.title: Zorua's very realistic illusion

111333113331.content:
Deep in a frost forest in the mountians, many strange pokemon lives in there. Most have been seen, but there are tales of a massive four leg pokemon that hides in snow storm. Its step rumbles the mountain and terrifies even the most scariest of pokemon that lives in the mountain. Not a single soul ever got close to the pokemon, and those that did simply disappeared when in its path. It has destroy villages, homes and many other things, and no one knows what this pokemon is, all they know is that they called it, the Queen of the mountain. You are that very pokemon.


"Glace?" You, a female Glaceon, was simply minding your own buisness, just trecking through forest in a carefree attittude.You pass through many trees until you started to get hungry. You look around and saw a fruit on a tree. Now, normally, the fruit is too high for any normal glaceon. However, you aren't a normal glaceon, you have a special gift, one you don't know how you got, but it was one you never questioned as the gift is too much fun. You have the gift to change size of everything and anyone, including yours. It was this gift that many pokemon that lives on the mountain.

With a simple wish, you will yourself to grow until you were as tall as the tree and pluck the fruit off the tree. You shrunk yourself back down and began to feed on the fruit. After finishing the fruit, you decide to have some "fun"
111333113331.title: Glaceon, queen of the mountain

1113331133311.content:
You peek behind a nearby bush and see a small village in the distant. A grin forms on your face as you decide to have some fun with the village But not before making sure a unexpected snow storm started to appeared. Using one of your regular moves, you used blizzard and watch as a strong snow storm forms. With everything prepare, you start to make your way to the village, slowly growing in the process.


Meanwhile in the village, many humans and pokemons were busy doing their normal activities until someone saw the blizzard rushing right at them. The people sound the alarm, fearing the snow storm might be the work of the Queen of the mountain. Their fears were confirm when they felt a strong earthquake. The earthquake were getting stronger as the blizzard continues to rush towards the village. Its only when the blizzard was right on top of the village when the earthquake was at their strongest.

You were right on top of the village, the village is right between your paws. You can hear everyone panicking when they see a massive silhouette standing over them. You smile as the village is at your mercy. You raise your paw annd hover it over the village gate and stomps it.

Everyone watch in fear as the queen of the mountian place her paw on one of the gate. The paw was bigger than most of the buildings and that was the smallest part of the being. Suddenly the paw start to move, dragging on the ground. The massive pokemon was making a large circle on the entire village, trapping everyone in it.

You giggle to yourself as you now have the entire village to yoirself with no one in it having a chance to escape. You put some thought of what you want to do to the village.
1113331133311.title: Glaceon's fun

choices: Crush the Village then and there
Eat the Entire Village in One Bite

11133311333111.content:
As the blizzard rages on you grin to yourself, thinking of all the things you could do to the village. Eat the village inhabitants? Nah, too much work. Crush all the buildings and let them freeze to death? The wood wouldn't feel all that nice on your paw-pads. 'Oh, I got it!' You think to yourself, as you look at the tiny village in front of you slowly get smaller and smaller and smaller until the highest building is only up to the start of your claw! The village is so unbelievably tiny you don't know what to do with yourself. Meanwhile on the other side, things aren't looking too good...

You are a villager

You slowly gape up at the Queen of the Mountain in front of you. Her grinning face, her sharp teeth, her growing paws. Wait...GROWING?!? You rubbed your eyes in disbelief, watching as her paws got larger and larger until even one of her furry toes could crush your entire village to dust. You fall to your knees in, staring up at the Queen and bowing your head in defeat.

You are the Queen

You are giddy with excitement as you carefully pick up the village with one paw, letting it rest on the indent between your palm and toes. As you slowly make your way back to your cave you let the blizzard stop and you look at your creation. It's a gaping hole in a small field, the only representation that a village was really there. As you reach your cave you shrink down yourself to your normal size, thus shrinking the village smaller with you, though the villagers don't notice. As you walk into your small cave you set the miniscule town on a ledge and look at it, your pupil about the size of the village and the chunk of earth that came with it. You think of so many things to do with your new toy. You finally think of three things...

Many villagers try to throw stuff and many other things at the meteor like paw, many try to run as fast as they can away from the paw's path, and some just prey to arcius or and legendary pokemom to help them. With the village destroy, you wanted to shrink the remains into nothing, but not before making sure no villagers survive. You doubt anyone survive your fun, but there were rare times someone survive and they become annoying to you in your sleep.

After careful examination of you tiny paws...

1131122.content:
With your new pokemon, a bulbasuar, you decide to go out to the nearby forest and hunt for new pokemon to add to your team. Strangely enough, you have encounter next nothing during the entire time you and your pokemon has been in the forest. You both wonder if there are any pokemon until you heard something making noise behind some bushes.

Carefully to not make noise, you both peak out and to your surprise, you spot a cheerful, female Braixen that is walking around. You were amaze to see a pokemon out here, though dread a bit as you know bulbasuar is weak to fire type. But if you can catch this pokemon, you will have a good pokemon in your team.

You were about to summon your pokemon when you notice Braixen stopping...and looking at your direction. A sly smile starts to form on the fox's face as she raise the stick in her hand like a wand and points it at your direction. A strong light shots out and blasts you and bulbasuar.

You open your eyes to see what just happened, only for you and your pokemon to be in a different area. Massive green pillars and giant boulders surrounds you, but that's not the only thing you see. All around you, you see many pokemons, all seemingly hiding from something. Before you can ask what is going on, a powerful earthquake could be felt. You fell on the ground and accidently summon bulbasaur, who lands on your back. If the earthquake wasn't strange enough, you and bulbasaur look around and see the pokemons that were hiding beginning to run away from the area. The earthquake continues only gettting stronger and stronger.

The earthquake continues it one last time as something massive lands behind you and bulbasaur. You both turn around and were shock to see a massive structure, shape like a paw, tower high above you. Its only when you both look up you realize not only what this structure belongs to, but what happened to you and every pokemon in the forest. "Braix!"

Braixen giggles as she admires her work. She squats down and see a pitiful speck that was once the human she sensed. Feeling giddy, the pokemon wonders what to do with this trainer and his pokemon.

Picking up bulbasaur, you try to run away from the towering pokemon that did nothing but giggle to herself as she watch you run from her. The earth rumbles as Braixen stands up and....
1131122.title: Braixen's forest

11311221.content:
The Braixen looks at you and decided to leave you to fend yourself. But before she leaves, she has a new idea for this trainer and that not only he is has to find a way to be back normal but he is going to be a lot smaller than the pokemon she has shrink in the forest. It would be interesting concept for this trainer to find help on a smaller pokemon and then find help from different other pokemon she hasn't shrink yet. So it is like a little game for her to see if the trainer would be able to get the Braixen to notice him and maybe unshrink back to normal or back to the size of a shrunken pokemon. Of course she would probably be near this area to check on the trainer time to time if she remembers of course.

As you were keep running away from the Braixen, you realized that she hasn't moved yet and you were probably think she is thinking of what she is going to do of course. You didn't want to looked back because you know that if you do, she'll probably step on easily or something. Of course you kept running as fast as you can as you can from her but you never notice that she is pointing the stick at you and that a light hits you again as you feel beginning to shrink.

"NO NOT AGAIN!" You shouted out loud as your world has gotten a lot bigger than before. You see the surrounding of grass becoming as bigger than a skyscraper and the pokemon who was hiding from the Braixen seems to get bigger to as well and that you were becoming microscopic to the shrunken size pokemon while the huge Braixen seems to be a whole bigger planet to you. You can't believe she has shrunk you again and that you hear her giggle very loudly up there that cause you to fall over and being blown away by her powerful voice. You thought your ears would burst but it didn't from the sonic boom. You tried to get up but it looks like the paw of the Braixen was making her move and made contact to ground with sonic BOOM! It was only one step and that step blew you like a hurricane away from her paws and landed back down in the ground. The earth shakes as she was walking away with her stick behind her tail and leaving you off to fend for yourself.

You wanted to cry as you felt weak into your stomach and that you regretted trying to capture her in the first place before you had shrunk down to even further than the shrunken pokemon she had shrink. You didn't know what to do in this situation since a lot of pokemon could step on without knowing or that you happen to be hungry, eating something in the forest while a pokemon could eat you without know that you are eating a berry or something. The possiblity of death scares you but you tried not to lose hope since you still have some pokemon in your pockets to use for help or immediate danger. You decided on what to do before something happens....

113112213.content:
You try to look around and look for your Bulbasaur, seeing as you lost it as you shrunk further. Sadly, your search immediately ends as you felt the ground shaking again. You fear it was Braixen again, coming to finish what she started with you, but you soon notice the earthquakes weren't anywhere near as powerful as the omnisize fox. That didn't make things better as you realized that you aren't the only one Braixen shrunk, you just happened to be the only one she choose to shrink further than any of her other victims. The earthquake grows more stronger as whatever being is making their way towards you direction. You try to figure out where the source of the earthquake is coming from so you can run away from the spot. That proof useless as a shadow soon engulfs your area and you look up to see a landscape slamming right in front of you.

Strong cloud of dirt and dust blocks your vision as you look in fear to see that the very thing that almost step on you was a pokemon, a pokemon that looks bigger than Braixen was before she shrunk you a second time. When the dust settle, you look up and see the pokemon that almost crushed you was a titanic Lurantis, who's scanning the area before speaking in her own language. "Lu-raan." Her voice booms down hard for you, though thankfully not as bad as Braixen when she giggles.

In Lurantis's point of view.

"Phew, finally, i thought that witch would never leave." Lurantis spoke to herself. "Still, sucks to be that human, whatever Braixen did to him exactly." Seems neither Lurantis nor any of the pokemon in the area saw exactly what Braixen did, only that she point her stick a second time. For all they know and care for, the cruel, mischief maker could have evaporated the human and their pokemon. "Oh well, need to focus on finding the others." Lurantis says to herself as she prepares to stomp off to find her friends.

Back to your point of view.

The titanic pokemon's words were slowly, distorted, and painfully booming for a solid minute or two. As You try to keep your ears from aching, you look up in fear and wonder if this pokemon is worth trying to get the attention of as right now, she's the only creature in this forest that is close enough to grab on to. At her size, just holding on would be a tremendous to even accomplish, let alone scaling her. Still, at your current situation, you may not have a choice. You can't find your pokemon, and there are far more pokemons than just this Lurantis to worry about stepping on you. After the titanic Lurantis finally stop talking....

1131323.content:
"The recent disappearance of this man, last seen entering Merdo Forest, if you see or find any trace of him please contact-" You zoned out as you watched the video saved on your phone, connected to a portable battery, sighing as you sipped at the cold can of coffee in your hand, the crisp early morning air being your only companion as you watched your breath exhale, ready to be done with this.

"This bites..." You mutter, you really didn't want to be out in this forest, something about it had seemed off lately, almost sinister...but as unfortunate as it was, you were looking for your sister's boyfriend...guy was an asshole, but here you were. One of the missing persons happened to be him and if you could at least find him one way or the other then you could bring her closure. You sipped the cold coffee a bit more, looking back at your bag. You'd only been out here for about a day but you already wanted to make back for town.

"Whatever the hell happened...probably shouldn't have come out here, stupid prick." You muttered. You told yourself one more day, then you'd head back. This was a crummy way to spend your extended weekend, but you promised your sister you'd try. You didn't know why...you were pretty sure the guy was abusive anyway. You went to get up and get ready to keep looking before you felt something odd...almost as if some eyes were on you. You turned to look at some bushes, not seeing anything.

"...It's way too early." You muttered, pocketing your phone and going to grab your bag. The second you did though, something wrapped around your arm and sent you flying into the air quicker than you could think as you soared, only to find yourself dangling by your arm, a rope wrapped around it. "Hey, what's the, ow, ow ow..." You said as your arm started to hurt and you looked down to see your bag...and what looked to be something riffling through it. Probably a wild pokemon...

"H-hey...hey! Get out of there!" You yelled, getting no response. You started to grab at your pockets, trying to get your knife to cut the rope before you suddenly felt yourself plunging to the ground, the rope having unwrapped from whatever was supporting it, you gulped, getting ready for a rough landing as you hit the cold ground, the wind knocked out of you.

You just laid there, groaning before a chuckle...a feminine sounding chuckle entered your ears. "Wow, guess I didn't quite make the rope tight enough. Oh well, live and learn." You heard as you looked up, seeing dancing blurs of color in front of you. "W-what..." You said, reaching to your lip to find it bleeding.

"Ow, ow..." You said, trying to sit up, though you found that your whole body ached from doing that. "Wow, you're a tough one, aint'cha?" The same voice from earlier chimed as your vision started to come back. You looked in front of you to see...a small black fox, with piercing blue eyes, and red tinging its fur...a zorua.

"H-huh?" You said, trying to process things, that voice...pokemon can't talk.

"That really all you got to say?" The zorua asked nonchalantly, throwing your assumption back in your face. This zorua...wait, you also saw it was eating...

"Hey, that's my stuff!" You said, staggering to your feet as you tried to make for the zorua, it just grinned at this and hopped back from your feeble attempt to grab it as it casually had the bag of chips it swiped from you in its mouth.

"Too bad so sad for you, if I were you, i'd take that bag of yours and make for the exit to this forest." The zorua said, at this point you were pretty sure it was female.

You rolled your eyes. "Would that I could, i'm out here for a reason." You said annoyed, and the zorua sat down. "Oh?" She asked, a bit curious. You looked her over and pinched the bridge of your nose in annoyance. May as well vent to an open ear, and maybe get some info.

"Hey uh...do you just go by Zorua?" You asked and she nodded. "Can I show you something?" You asked and she gave you a wary look. "This isn't a trick right? You'll really REALLY regret it if it is." She said and you held up your hands in defense. "No tricks, promise, I was just wondering if you've seen someone, i'm stuck out here looking for him..." You said as you went to pull out your phone. The zorua approached you as you got down on your knees to her level to show her the picture of the guy you were looking for.

"Oh...him?" She said, not seeming so surprised. You looked at her.

"Do you uh...know what happened to him?" You asked and she nodded, looking a bit proud of herself. "I sure do?"

"Could you please tell me?" You asked, hopeful now that maybe you'd be led to him and you could just leave.

"You reeeeaaaally wanna know?" The zorua asked, smirking. You just nodded.

"You suuuuuuuuuure?" She asked, you not noticing the more sinister smile she had.

"Y-yes, I need to find him so I can leave." You said.

"Oh...well okay. I killed him." Zorua said nonchalantly, as if it were nothing. You blinked, processing this information. Zorua just smirked at you.

"W-what?" You asked, not entirely comprehending what she just said.

"Yup, that guy came out here, drunk one night and off his rocker. Pissing on my favorite tree and then when I tried to stop him he kicked me. Me! What a grade A moron! An idiot! A bad person...and bad people get what's coming to them." Zorua said ominously as she lifted a paw and crushed a twig. "Just like that he went...ah well, I doubt anyone would miss him...that's what I thought at least, until you." Her sadistic grin ringing alarm bells in your head to flee. You staggered back from this fox, now incredibly worried about what would happen next.

"Hmm hmm hmm, and now ya know. You can go home, right?" She said, almost sugary sweet, you jaw hanging open as the Zorua seemed to be getting...bigger?

"Wait...you can't go home, nope. Not an option anymore sadly." Her voice almost seemed to be getting louder too as you couldn't tear your eyes from her.

"Such a shame you came out here looking, but I can't let you leave here." She looked down at you, at this point her form looking as large as a great cathedral to you, the grin from earlier and her piercing blue eyes nearly making you piss yourself, you didn't know if this was an illusion, but you didn't care, you had to get out of here!

A paw raised slowly, as if she was making a show of it and loomed over you, you shut your eyes, expecting her to render judgement before the great paw descended and pinned you to the ground.

"Now...should I dispose of you? Hmm? Maybe keep you around? I dunno, are you a good person?" She was musing to herself, but she had already made up her mind as she looked at her prey. It was then that you finally took in your surroundings and found out what had truly happened.
1131323.title: Meeting the size changing Zorua

choices: "... a new owner!"
"... a mate!"
11313231.content:
You couldn't bring yourself to believe what was going on.

It seemed that you had, somehow, shrunken down to the size of a blade of grass!

Far above, the Zorua kept her grin painted on her face as she stared you down, pondering your sentence.

This was an illusion, your mind reasonably told, just a trick of the vixen to scare the hell out of you. But if that was the explanation, why the paw that was on you felt truly heavy like it was actually there?

Your agitated mind was interrupted by the sound of the Zorua's voice, who finally spoke up again,

"Tell ya what," she intoned with childish, yet sadistic glee,
"I'm gonna assume that you coming from that guy - may he not rest in peace - means that you're a good person. So, I guess I'll keep ya around."

That was when you realized that this was no illusion of the tricky fox, but cold, hard reality.

"W-Wait!" you stuttered in fear,
"Yo-You can't keep me!"

The vixen cocked her head.

"I think I'm the one calling the shots right now," she spoke,
"And why not anyway? You know, you should consider yourself lucky, I could've disposed of your furless lil' behind like I did with that other guy."

"And that's something I am really grateful for, believe me," you said, regaining some of your composure. A hard task, given that you were still trapped under a giant, murderous vixen's paw,
"But I gotta go back home! I've got a sister, and she's waiting for me!... I've gotta deliver the bad news, she needs me..."

Okay, you wouldn't call those 'bad news', but still you believed that murdering someone solved nothing.

The Zorua's paw relieved you of the pressure for a brief moment, before it came back down on you. You realized she had shrugged.

"And now you've got me. Your sister will move on... eventually!" she snickered.

You gulped, realizing that you had no way out of this; trying to escape would only result in this vixen changing her mind, leading her to crudely dispose of you like she initially thought about.

"Ah, wipe that expression off your face, shrimp. Ya should cheer up, actually, " the Zorua gained a smirk while saying this, her azure eyes sparkled with malicious glee and her fangs shined sinisterly,
"After all, ya got yourself-"
11313231.title: Property of the vixen

choices: "We're heading back to my den."
We're gonna go have some fun!"
113132311.content:
The words bore down on you as you looked up at this titaness grinning...'owner'. She owned you...you gulped as you tried to look away from her, not wanting to meet her gaze, only to see your surroundings once more, towering over you. Even your bag looked positively mountainous. Why? Why did you come out here? Why did he come out here? How many-

"Z-zorua?" You asked, your voice clearly laced with fear. She smirked as she looked down at you. "Yeah twerp?" She said, in a confidant tone. "H-how many humans have you had, or k-killed?" You asked, afraid of the answer.

"Oh? Odd question...well honestly, you're the first i've spared after I shrunk, so you really ought to consider yourself lucky. Other humans have either been like the guy you were looking for, trainers looking to catch me, or actually smart enough to give me a wide berth and move on from here." She said, your stomach had butterflies as you had to swallow a sense of dread you had. That's when you realized how easily she could kill you now. With wide eyes you looked up and squeaked out. "T-thank you for not killing me!" You said as the Zorua lifted her paw off of you.

"Oh man, you are absolutely terrified, aren't you!" She said, grinning, showing off her razor sharp canines that could easily shred you to pieces. She lowered her muzzle down to you, making you yelp as you felt a large suction of air around you, she was sniffing you.

"Yup, you're mortified!" She said before she giggled a bit. You tried to curl up away from her before she offered you a toothless smile. "Listen shrimp, I genuinely need you to calm down. You don't realize how good you've got it! Do you know how many people or pokemon mess with a zorua that can change the size of anything at will? The answer is none! And i've been a bit lonely as is anyway...i'm not going to hurt ya." She said, trying to at least get you to come out of your ball. It didn't work.

She rolled her eyes before her eyes glowed, using her power again.

You didn't know what she was doing, what was going on, you just wanted this nightmare to end. It was then that a small thud sounded off near you as you looked up. "Take your damn bag, but know that any snacks from it will be grown and eaten by your lovely new owner~" The Zorua cooed. She had shrunken your bag...at least you had your stuff with you. Unfurling yourself you sighed, trying to calm your nerves before you reached for the bag and took out a bottle of water, opening it, you chugged it greedily, emptying its contents in seconds before you sighed and put the bottle in your recycling pouch on your bag.

"Better?" Zorua asked and you sighed. "No, but it doesn't really matter." You said, at least no longer having fear in your voice. "Hmm, well you'll adjust, my little human." She said. "Grab your bag, we're out of here." She said as her muzzle lowered down to you. You grabbed your bag as you walked over to her towering face. "So what do you want me to do?" You asked. She rolled her eyes at your question before a grin crossed her face. "Relax, i'll help you this time." She said, laughing a bit before her mouth opened wide, showing you her cavern as the face approached you much too quickly.

"W-wait, don't eat me please!" You said before the mouth that was coming towards you suddenly lifted and bit at the scruff of your jacket. "Huh?" You said, holding your bag as suddenly you went soaring into the air. "Aaaaaahhhh!" You screamed as you flailed about, landing quicker than you expected on something soft. All around you was dark fur....you had landed on Zorua. It looked like you landed on her head.

"Yeesh, I expected to catch you off guard but you're so absolutely fragile right now. We're gonna need to work on that." You heard her loud voice in front of you, almost felt it beneath you as suddenly, she rose to her paws, the sudden ascent making your stomach lurch. "Now come on..."
113132311.title: Zorua's little pet

choices: "I mean you're my friend dude, my mate, my chum." She said.
"I mean that...well, i'm a vixen and you're a guy...you know..." She said
113132312.content:
"...A mate?" You said, still trying to comprehend the situation. It was then that a great weight was lifted off of you as Zorua moved her paw, letting you sit up slowly. You looked up at those piercing blue eyes and fangs of hers as she snickered to herself.

"Yup, you're gonna be my mate little human." She said, teasingly as she lowered her muzzle down to you, making you flinch as you looked into this mammoth sized Zorua's eyes...there didn't seem to be malice in there anymore, but there was certainly mischief, a sense of glee with her find. "I'm gonna be honest with ya, you're the first human i've talked to that hasn't tried to pick a fight or yell at me or generally do something to piss me off. It's kinda refreshing...and pokemon tend to avoid me for various reasons, so I get a bit lonely out here." She said, her breath wafting over you as she explained this on what you assumed to be her attempt to see you eye to eye.

"And honestly, that dude you were trying to find, you know he wasn't worth it, right?" She said and you sighed. "That isn't the point...it was for my sister, he's her...WAS her boyfriend...he was a sack of shit but I did say i'd try to find him..."

"Aw, what a sweet brother you are~" Zorua cooed down at you. "Though i'm sure she's better off without him." Zorua snickered and you clenched your fists, though you were way too afraid to try anything. "That isn't...the point." You said, sighing. "And there's no way my sister is better off without me, right?" You said, though the look in Zorua's face didn't change at your plea.

"Hmm, well...maybe, but like I said, she'll move on! Honestly, two disappearances in a row, maybe humans'll wise up and just stay away for a bit." Zorua said, raising her head once more into the heavens as she towered above you at her full height.

"You really are a decent sort, aren't you? Well I just want you to trust in me pipsqueak, because we're gonna have the best of times together!" Zorua said, the ground shaking as she walked away from you to get your bag. She picked it up between her teeth and brought it's mountainous form over to you.

"Okay, climb in." She said, You looked up at your bag to see an open pouch...one you were sure you left empty. It was at this point that another thought crossed your mind. "You say i'm the first human that hasn't pissed you off...does that mean..." You said and she grinned down at you, her fangs showing as you shuddered.

"Do you really need me to answer that, my mate?" She asked.

"No...no, not really...though I do gotta ask, how does a Zorua gain the power to talk? Or change the size of things? Or...I guess that's it really." You muttered.

"Eh, just came over me one day. Since then i've pretty much ruled the roost." Zorua said as you sighed, getting ready to climb into the towering structure of your own camp bag.

"Wait! One more thing, when you say i'm your mate, uh...what exactly do you mean?" You asked, not sure how you'd feel about this answer.
113132312.title: Zorua's little mate

choices: "Relax, i'm teasing. Here, i'll make you a bit bigger."
"Yeah...yeah, let's keep you this size!"
"Oh, you don't like this size? Smaller still then?"
1131323121.content:
"...What do you think I mean? It means you're my friend, my compadre, my mate..." Zorua said rolling her eyes, before her eyes widened as she realized something...then she blushed, but after that she started to laugh, a large laugh that nearly made you cover your ears as it echoed around you.

"W-wait, I think I know why you were confused! Oh man! Yeah, no little guy, not like that." Now you were flushed red with embarrassment as she laughed at you, grinning in a completely non threatening way at you. "Puh-lease...anyways just uh...g-go ahead and get in the bag..." She was still giggling at you as you closed your eyes, groaning.

'You're the one that used the word 'mate'' You thought, but you opted to not voice this thought. No telling if it'd backfire or not, you eventually managed to worm your way into the little pouch before you felt some lift happen, as Zorua picked up the bag in her teeth.

You swayed to and fro, chaotically as the Zorua walked away from the clearing, leaving no indication that you were ever there. Zorua seemed to have a skip in her step...and this lasted all of 5 minutes before your movement was halted and the bag was set down.

"Phew, what did you pack in this thing!? It's kinda heavy you know!" You heard Zorua intone. "Hmm? Oh..." Zorua seemed to be reacting to something as you peaked out of the bag, you saw the titanic Zorua's side looming over you, then moving your head a bit you saw a titanic Bidoof in front of her too...and it looked frightened as all get out!

"B-bidoof? Bidoof?" It said with a bit of fear as it looked at the Zorua.

"Yeah, another human was here...why should it really matter though? I handled it like I always do...honestly, I don't know what you all would do if I WASN'T around..." This was a huffy side to Zorua you weren't familiar with. She almost sounded annoyed that this Bidoof was wasting her time. You weren't sure if this was a usual thing or if she was just eager to mess with you some more.

"Bidoof! Bidoof!" The Bidoof sounded grateful, but then it turned around and walked away as quick as it looked like it could.

"...Annoying." Zorua said with a sigh before turning her attention to the bag. It was then that she smirked as she saw you peaking out, and you ducked back in.

"Y'know, it's kind of a pain that you packed this bag soooo full. It's so heavy! It really is a good thing I have a trick for that! If not then I might have to tire myself out carrying this thing! Welp, let's get too it!" You didn't know what was going on, as you'd ducked back in...but it didn't take you long to figure it out.

"THERE! THAT SHOULD BE A MORE MANAGEABLE SIZE!" The voice rang through your head as you clamped your hands to your ears, her voice now a booming thunder to you. You peaked back out of the bag to see something that truly terrified you...if Zorua was big before, she had to be the size of a mountain now! She shrunk the bag down!? It couldn't have been bigger than a small piece of chocolate.

"SO UH...HEADS UP! DON'T GET OUT OF THE BAG AT ALL UNTIL I SAY! AT LEAST, IF YOU WANT TO LIVE!" Zorua said as a shadow cast over your world, her mall sized head lowering to you and the endless cavern of her mouth, with teeth as big as buildings and as sharp as swords surrounding you. You expected death, you expected it all to end as you were thrown about in your tiny pouch, trying to get your bearings while ducking down back in as Zorua sucked the bag to the side of her cheek, safely out of the way as she continued her walk.

You had no time to rest as you clamped your hands to your head, and curled up as the world shook and a thunder roared around you as she hummed about.

You only hoped this hell was temporary as you thought about your life up until now...no more work...no more drinks with friends...no more games, or sports...just a life with this pokemon of mischief...and one that wasn't afraid to shed blood should you so speak back either. At the very least she didn't seem to want to kill you, she even said you were her 'friend'. You weren't sure what measure of that made her care about your well being though, and you weren't about to test those boundaries.

It was with this thought that your world started to move once more as you rapidly started to feel a falling motion. She had spit out your bag, and you were at least cushioned when it landed by your own pouch.

"ALRIGHT! YOU CAN COME OUT NOW!" It took you a moment to work up the courage, but you started to climb out, only to find yourself adhered to the outside of the bag by her...warm saliva.

"H-hey! A little help!" You cried out, yelling as she tilted her head in confusion at your squeaks, but she eventually comprehended what you had said and looked at you, stuck like a little bug to her saliva, and she stifled a giggle.

"O-OH MAN! YOU REALLY ARE PATHETIC, AIN'TCHA? NEED SOME HELP HUH?" She was laughing, the roar now descending uninterrupted, your hands stuck to her saliva as you winced.

"J-just grow me! Please! At least to the size I was at before!" You pleaded as she raised a godlike paw to her chin in mock thought.

"HMM? YOU SURE? I COULD JUST KEEP YOU THIS SIZE Y'KNOW? I MEAN, WHAT'S THE DIFFERENCE?" She said, as if she didn't see the issue, the grin on her face definitely betrayed her true thoughts though.

"P-please! I don't want to stay this size!" You pleaded once more. It was then that she lowered her paw and spoke.
1131323121.title: Zorua's tiny friend...and getting tinier

choices: Submit to the Zorua's whims. Not like you could do anything...
Try to jump out of the bag! Hopefully, she won't notice you...
1131323122.content:
The gigantic Zorua towering above you flushed red at the mention, though you couldn't see her blush, hidden beneath countless strands of slate grey fur.

"Well, y'know... c'mon..." she said, letting go of your camping bag to speak properly.

You were completely clueless what she was talking about and expressed it with a blink of your eyes.

The Zorua blushed further.

"Aw, dude, you know..." she groaned seeing your confused expression,
"... I mean, you're a guy, I'm a vixen... y'know, that kind of mate..." she finally clarified, staring at you with those shining blue eyes of hers sparkling in frustration.

You paid the rather annoyed gaze she was giving you no mind, too focused on blushing furiously.

"W-What!?" you exclaimed, unable to wrap your mind around the statement that just left the Zorua's mouth,
"... You want me as-"

"Can we continue this conversation after you've climbed in this damn bag and I've gotten far enough from pokemon who know me? I usually get rid of your kind, ya know; someone sees any of this, my rep will be ashes." she interrupted, her blush crystal clear on her cheeks now.

You wondered how could she think about such thing when she was basically asking... no, demanding you to-

You didn't even dare to think about it, this couldn't be real! And yet, it was, and you couldn't explain how. How frustrating it was!

As for the vixen, she quickly had enough of your hesitation, and of the awkward conversations, and quickly moved up behind you, the ground under you quaking each step the dark-type giantess took.

"In ya go." she spoke quietly, her voice not carrying that mocking tone she used so far; no, this was pure embarrassment.

Before you could get back to your senses to even think about protesting, you were plunged into the darkness of the pouch you were assigned to by your new 'mate'.

Shortly after, the whole bag began moving, dragged by the Zorua from the outside.

You heard her groan.

"Urgh, what did you bring along? I hope it's all snacks in here..." she said.

You were left flabbergasted by how quick this had escalated and gone out of control.

You came in these woods hoping to find your sister's boyfriend, but found his executioner instead; the same executioner who was now sentencing you to be hers!

You sat in darkness and silence, which was only broken by the huffs and groans of the vixen who was dragging outside.

Left alone with your thoughts, you began wondering if you could escape. You couldn't care less about your size right now, you had to get away from this crazy, murderous pokemon that could kill you easily if you ever made the mistake of saying something wrong.

Your mind told you that it would be impossible now, and you would only anger the Zorua, leading her to get rid of you for real.

But then, another thought retorted.

The Zorua wasn't really paying any attention right now, busy as she was trying to drag your bag. Would she notice if you 'accidentally slipped out' of the pouch?

Could you take the risk?
1131323122.title: Zorua's little interest

choices: You accept your life as her mate
You try to reject Zorua but she's keeping you anyway
You try to reject Zorua...it ends poorly
You try to reject Zorua and she takes it surprisingly well
11313231221.content:
The thought left your head almost as quick as it entered. If you somehow got out of the bag you'd be left alone in this forest at a pitiful size, and if a pokemon happened to find you it would definitely know that you crossed paths with this Zorua, and it'd either finish you off or give you back in which case...she's probably finish you off. Much as it frustrated and frightened you, your best shot at surviving this was sticking with Zorua, and you did NOT want to be her next victim.

You heard her grumbling outside, probably about how heavy your bag was. Truth was you had packed a decent amount of snacks, though you'd packed a lot of hygiene and grooming necessities, some survival gear, clothes...stuff you'd need if you looked for him for a while and even stuff that'd help the bastard if you had found him alive. You shuddered to think about how he went out. Zorua snapped a twig, but he was probably crushed and mangled pretty thoroughly if that's what she did...what a way to go. A part of you couldn't help but think it served him right for the way he treated your sister, and even you sometimes though.

You tried to get comfortable as the whole world seemed to shake around you, with this gargantuan vixen that had decided to make you her...mate dragged you along with your bag to god knows where. It at least seemed to settle down after a while as everything was still and quiet for a moment...and it was then that you heard her voice. "Alright dude, we're home, go ahead and come out!" She said as you looked up at the opening of the pouch you were in. You gulped a bit, trying to steel yourself for talking to Zorua more, with a shaky resolve you started to climb out of the pouch, it taking a surprising amount of effort on your part. To think this was your own bag too.

You finally managed to get out, before you felt yourself dropping a small distance. You expected to land harshly on grass or rock, but your landing was surprisingly soft...you looked down to see that you were on a blanket. Zorua looked down at you, a smile evident on her muzzle and a spark in her eye. "Well, what do ya think? Nice place, right?" She said, eager for praise it seemed. Though when you looked around, all you could feel was a pit in your stomach as you started to feel weak in the knees and shuddered a bit. All around you was bags...empty pokeballs...some discarded snack wrappings...various trinkets that must've come from her victims.

She didn't seem to notice your terror though, just that you were quiet. "Speechless, right? See, even if you're absolutely puny and far from human civilization, you're still gonna live in comfort with your mate, so don't stress about a thing~" She said sweetly as you tried to stand up, feeling shaky on your feet.

"Uh...y-yeah..." You stammered out, trying to figure out how to proceed from this. Zorua for her part decided to lay down in front of you, dropping to her stomach as her paws sprawled out from beneath her. This caused the ground to quake as you fell back down, and she smiled a bit. "Sorry about that, here...let me help ya." She said as a paw reached forward for you. You nearly yelped, half expecting to be crushed beneath its immense weight, but surprisingly, it just reached gently behind you, making you stand up as she started to move you close to her face...was she going to eat you? You closed your eyes, but instead of razor sharp teeth and a moist cave, you were pressed against a soft and plush surface...warm too. You opened your eyes to see her hugging you to her cheek.

"See, this ain't so bad...right?" She said, her voice loud and close to you. You blushed a little bit too before you shook your head. This Zorua was a dangerous killer...one false move and...

"You're scared, I can tell, but i'm serious dude, I like ya...I know i've killed quite a few of your kind but trust me, they had it comin'" She said. You gulped before retorting.

"B-but all this stuff, h-how many have you..." You started before she cut you off. "Oh? Most of this I just nicked off of idiot travelers or campers that never even realized I was there. They left my forest grumbling about lost or stolen stuff, but they left alive. Only humans that have tried to catch me or be a jerk have faced my wrath." Zorua said casually. She then broke the hug as you stepped back.

"B-but you've killed trainers, they're just-"

"What, just trying to catch and trap members of my kind and force them from their homes to fight or be pets?" Zorua said, you looked down, fearful of her gaze.

It was then that you felt a stiff breeze as you were blown onto your back, she had blown on you. You scrambled back as she giggled at you.

"Couldn't resist." She said. You looked into those eyes of hers, those large pools full of mischief and mirth, but at the moment, nothing malicious. She didn't see trainers as good people, but then there was your sister's boyfriend, the guy that got himself killed and you stuck here...that guy...you couldn't help but blurt out something that even caught yourself off guard.

"That guy was beating my sis...I know he was...I hoped I wouldn't find him." Zorua's eyes widened at this before she grinned. "It was a good thing I took care of him then, right?" She said. You didn't respond to this, but you stood back up and looked Zorua in the eye.

"Mate huh? Why me?" You asked before her smile got gentler. "I told you, pokemon either fear or annoy me, and most humans aggravate me or are targets for me to pilfer. You were the second before my trap didn't hold...but you never once tried to attack me after that, which is refreshing, hell you even tried to carry a conversation...you're a good guy, and..." She blushed a bit. "Kinda cute I suppose..." Was she serious?

It was true you'd never had a girlfriend, but this was NOT what you expected to happen. Was it worth trying? Hell, it wasn't like you could escape this situation...and turning her down may not end well.
11313231221.title: To Zorua's home

choices: Zorua wanted to get to know you better
Zorua wanted to play with you, if only to calm you down
Zorua was hungry...
113132312211.content:
You pondered your next move carefully, VERY carefully. In the end, you decided to reason with Zorua, since you quite certainly couldn't stay like this, shrunken and with a potentially murderous Zorua. What if she was just messing with you? What if she was just luring you into a false sense of security before actually striking?

You couldn't risk that. But you didn't want to join your sister's former boyfriend either, so you picked your words with care.

"Um... Zorua?"

"Whaddya want, shrimp?" she asked teasingly, clearly enjoying reminding you of who called the shots in this so called 'relationship'.

"Um... as much as c-"

"Don't you say that. Ever." she brusquely interrupted you.

"... Cool. You're cool."

"Hm."

"... Anyway, I don't think it would work... us, I mean." you told with your heart slowly going in your throat.

Zorua's teasing smile fell and she set an intense stare on you. She wasn't angry, but she wasn't sad either. You honestly couldn't tell how she was feeling, at least not from her expression.

A minute passed, and a deafening silence filled the entire cave.

Then, as if her voice was coming right from the hell below, Zorua spoke a single word.

"Why."

Was she really asking that? There were so many reason, with the first being her being a pokemon!

"Because it's kind of... illegal?" you tried.

Zorua sneered.

"Illegal." she parroted back in a sarcastic tone,
"You think your silly laws would have any effect here, human dear?"

"Um..." you hesitated,
"Yes?"

Zorua went back to staring at you in silence for a few moments, before speaking again,

"Let me ask you something, then: who do you think calls the shots in this forest?" she asked.

You took a step back, beginning to realize the real threat this Zorua represented.

"... You?" you tried.

The black and red giantess gave a nod.

"And whose laws do you think prevail here?"

"Yours?"

Another step back.

"So is there any problem if I say you're mine?"

"I guess not..."

"So when I say you are my mate, are you my mate or not?" she asked, and you knew this was the final question.

If you answered wrong, you feared you were going to end up as a small corpse on what basically was a giant blanket inside of a cave, a little bit of civilization, a home away from home.

"Well..." you hesitated again, for longer this time. You pondered which one was the correct choice of words and, in the end, you opted to reply to her question with another,
"If I... were to say 'no', so to ask..."

"How do you taste, so to ask?" Zorua asked, grinning while she did, showing you a full set of razor sharp teeth.

You paled at the sight, your face becoming nearly as white as her teeth, but the giantess suddenly started laughing.

"Kiddin'!" she exclaimed, before making a poor attempt to straighten her face; the look on yours backed her into laughing.

"N-No, seriously," she said after a while in which your face gradually collected enough blood cells again,
"As I said, I like ya. Quite a lot in fact, so I don't think I'll get rid of ya."

"Well, that's awfully nice of-"

"And that's why I'll just kick you outta here at that size and leave you to wait for the first pokemon out there to come out and deal with your furless lil' butt." she finished, causing the color to drain from your face once more.

Zorua smiled in a somewhat cute way, and you wondered how you could find her devilish muzzle cute in such situation.

"Of course..." she continued,
"That is if you refuse to be me mate. 'Cause, otherwise, you get a life free of responsibilities... except, of course, pleasing me. What's not to like?"

She would be right, you mused, if she wasn't a freaking murderer!

Still, you preferred this to the alternative and, since you seemed to not have any other choice, you did the only logical thing to do in a situation like this.

You surrendered.

"... Okay." you said, lowering your head and taking a deep breath, not able to believe you would throw all your life away to start a new one with your next few words,
"I will... I will be your mate then."

"Good choice, shrimp." Zorua praised in approval, before leaning forward.

Her shadow engulfed you and, before you knew it, the giantess was right in front of you with a grin on her face once more.

"And wipe that look from your face. You should be happy, ya know," she said, bringing a paw forward.

You feared she would knock you back or mess with you in any other way, but instead she brought her paw behind your back and pushed you closer to her; black fur invaded you from every angle, except your back, which was pressed against Zorua's soft paw-pad.

"I promise I'll make this great for ya..." she said, before briefly rising her eyes to the sky, then looking back at you with a grin,
"Until you piss me off, in which case I can guarantee I won't be so great."

You adopted a frightened expression and made a mental note not to anger this Zorua.

Apparently, for the foreseeable future, you were stuck with her.

"Aren't you excited?" Your friend asks to you "next year we're going to be Pokémon trainers, earning gym badges, capturing Pokémon, Seeing the world, it's going to be so EPIC!" Most children who go to school usually get the chance to become a Pokémon trainer at the age of 10 the best trainers one day become Pokémon masters, and since you and your friend will be turning 10 next year your time was coming up

Five minutes later your friend takes off along another path towards the direction of his house, waving goodbye you continue along the pathway deeper into the forest, as you continue walking you hear rustling in the bushes and the snap of twigs on the ground, in a way it almost feels like you're being watched do you swallow hard and try to focus on getting out of the forest but to no avail suddenly...

"Eevee~ Eevee~" She sings to herself. "Eevee~ Eev....vee?" She stops when she saw something glowing. She runs towards the source and spots a gem. She reaches towards the gem, which is smaller than her paw, before its grew bright and engulf the tiny pokemon.

You pet her on the head until you spot something on her chest, a small gem. "Hey Eevee, what's this thing on your chest?" You said as you try to pull it off Eevee with no luck. Eevee looks down and instantly smile.

Eevee gives you a gesture that says to cover your eyes. Deciding to humor her, you listen to Eevee and cover your eyes. As you do, the gem on Eevee's chest glow as she...
