1132112232111.content:
Come see the beautiful and powerful Espeon fight that nasty jerk the so called Lieutenant Surge who insulted the lovely tournaments around here where we met all our adoring fans.. I bet my Espeon can wipe his team without taking a scratch!

Ho boy. Well L.T Surge could be a bit of a jerk and a bully, and you wouldn't mind seeing him humbled.

Wait, when did she post this? You had your phone in your pocket. Could it be when she had you pinned down on the couch? But you would have felt your phone leave your pocket. And could she have typed this in that small a window of time, especially while playing with you?

Unless.... She used her reality warping powers to post this. Had she become even more powerful than you realized? Maybe she had been practicing in secret or hid what she could really do? You want to scold her for disobeying but right now you feel like a Caterpie on her back. Besides you were curious to see where this could lead. He was kind of a jerk so maybe he was due for comeuppance. You just hoped she wouldn't cause to much trouble.
Scrolling down most of the replies were amused or excited by Espeon's post, though some angry Surge fans had posted defending him. Oh boy would they be there to? How would they react to your colossal pokemon?

Espeon's paced quickened as she drew closer to the gym. The ride became bumpy, as you could feel her excitement in each.

She turned to, now looking like a kid about to enter a candy store

"Ready for this?"

"I-" You don't know how to answer. You suspect it doesn't really matter what you say as you know she's going to do it anyway. "Be careful Espeon"

"Aren't I always?"

"The city might disagree."

You gesture to the marks she left in the road.

"Hmmph they should really build accommodation for a Pokemon of my stature."
1132112232111.title: Didn't mean for this to be a 2 parter got carried

11321122321111.author_name: This site is dead.I wana leave
choices: Surge yeilds
Surge wants to continue
Something interrupts them
11321122321111.content:
(This is the 2nd part of a 2 part chapther, press back to read the first)

As she approached the gym fans could her head from a couple of streets away, the sight of her came gasps and cheers, though a few cries of panics also feared the air, likely from Surge's fans (if they were here). She put her head up pridefully and posed.

"Don't be alarmed." Her voice boomed around telepathically. You're pretty sure she was doing that deliberately.

"it's just me, albeit bigger and stronger than ever!" Some people cheered though others slooked scared.

She approached slowly and sat down, stretching herself out across the street.
"Don't be afraid i'm not here to hurt anyone. Though I am here for a certain so called Lighting Lieutenant."

She got up and approached the gym and slammed a front paw against the wall. She didn't appear to put much effort into that strike but the building shook and the part of the wall her paw struck crumbled. Had her psychical strength increased beyond her size or ha she always been this strong?

Her telepathic voice filled the area.

" "Lightning Lieutenant" I hear you've been insulting my favorite tournaments, telling everyone only wars, or gym battles or the Pokemon League matters. I'm here to prove you wrong, I'll show just how powerful those tournaments have helped me become." She gave the building another strike, shaking it again. "Come outside and face my "puny power".
"Hey! Stop messing up my gym! I'll be glad to come and pound you!!"

Espeon giggled. You could feel some of the muscles on her back tensing in anticipation. Everyone could hear the sound of Surge's heavy boots.. Seconds later his burly frame emerged from the door frame, holding a pokeball.

"Ok where are you?" He looked left and right, not noticing the large pink pokemon a short distance away. I'll crush you!"

Espeon giggled and pounced,, landing right in front of Surge.

"Crush me? I'd like to see that."

Surge's gawked up at the enormous espeon, his mouth hanging open for a moment.
"Those "worthless" tournaments have helped me grow as strong as I have. That and the love of my adoring fans." She turned to them and did a wink and a smile and some cheered back..

"Right now I'd say I'm so powerful I could defeat your entire team without using a single attack."

Surge bristled, suddenly forgetting his fear. He had instinctively taken a combat stance.

"Oh yeah wise guy? Prove it!"

"I'm not a guy. But I'll gladly prove it."She bent her legs, assuming her battle pose.

"Everyone please clear a space for me and Thunder Thighs."

Surged shouted at her.

"That's lighting lieutenant!"

"Whatever."

Physics energy wrapped around as she lowered you to the ground. She gave you a reassuring look.

"I'll hardly feel a thing but I wouldn't want you to get shocked by Thunder Thigh's pokemon."

It was good to know she was still thinking of you. But she had already caused some destruction just getting her. If they fought here, you didn't know what she might do.

"Wait shouldn't you battle in a wider area? If you fight here you could do some damage to the city."

She thought about it for a second.

"Hmmm.. This gym is near the beach. I suppose we could it there."

"True. Ok lighting butt, lets take this to the beach."

"It's SURGE! But fine whatever."

She looked at her fans and swished her tail forward.

"Come along everyone, follow me to the beach."

She walked onwards to the beach, alternating between watching her fans and the road.
Surge grumbled but walked along and talked to fans. You had to respect his courage. Though maybe he was just acting tough for his fans.

Even walking slower to mingle with her fans, Espeon still reached the beach first. She stepped onwards, seemingly amused by the confused people there.

"I mean you know harm I'm just here to settle things with Sergeant Sparkle."

"THAT'S L.T SURGE!"

She ignored him. "Clear a space for us. And feel free to watch the fun."

Espeon waited for people to clear an area for them. Crowds formed around them. You were sure Surge has to be sweating bullets, but he still hadn't lost his bluster. He looked up at Espeon.

"I don't care how big you are! Fighting in tournaments is nothing compared to war! I don't need my entire team to crush you, go Raichu!" He threw his pokeball and Raichu emerged.
Wow Raichu already? Surge didn't normally start with his strongest pokemon, Espeon must have gotten under his skin


"Raichu!" It yelled with bravado as it came out of it's pokeball. Then it caught sight of Espeon and ran behind Surge. She laughed.

L.T Surge was flustered. He put a hand on Raichu's shoulder.

"Raichu don't be a baby! You know what they say, the bigger they are the harder they fall, give it a Thunderbolt!"

Raichu hesitated for a second but put on it's best game face, standing up straight and facing Espeon. She waited to see what it would do.

"RAIIIIIIIII-" Electricity built up around it's cheeks and then it's body. "-CHUUUUUUUUUUU!"
A brilliant flash of lighting burst fourth from raichu, the light briefly hurting your eyes. Espeon made no attempt at dodging the attack, looking on with casual dismay.

The thunderbolt struck Espeon, electrocuting her entire body. However she didn't didn't twitch or show even the slightest hint of pain, in fact she looked bored, even as the lighting danced on her. Surge gritted his teeth.

"Keep going!"

"CHUUUUU!"

This lasted about half a minute before the Raichu stopped and panted for air. The lighting cleared, Espeon was completely unharmed, the only indication she had even been struck was some of her fur was standing straight up. It didn't even look blackened. She licked her paws, and tried to comb down some of it down.

"Is that it?"

She casually walked towards, looming directly above Surge and Raichu. Raichu shook and dived behind surge. Surge's face twitched.

"Raichu don't be a coward you can take that oversized pussy cat! Use Body slam?"

Espeon rolled her eyes.

"Are you serious?"

Raichu ran at her then leapt into the air, aiming to come down on her front paw. Espeon effortlessly moved it out of the way, causing him to crash into the sand.

"Again!"

Raichu tried another body slam, but Espeon merely took a step back, once again causing Raichu to crash into the sand. She repeated this a few more times.

"Fine for pity's sake I'll let you get a hit in."

She didn't move and Raichu slammed down on her front paw. She showed no sign of injury or pain.

"Ow." She said in a deadpan tone.

"Unbelievable!"

She hoisted Raichu up by it's tail, pulling it like a you. Raichu yelped as it was flung into the dangling upside down, as she slowly raised it towards her face. She grinned like a cat going in for the kill.

"Hmm you know what they say about cats and mice...."

Raichu ran on air trying to get away from her, but her grip was too tight. He fired other thunderbolt, lighting up Espeon but not hurting her in the slightest.

"We both know that wasn't going to work."

It was as though Surge didn't know whether to be scared or furious. "Put him down!"

"Gladly."

She opened her mouth wide, dangled him over and let go. He tumbled into the blackness.

She wasn't really going to eat him was she?!

Raichu fell, its screams filling the airs, but it stopped midflight caught by Espeons telekinetic power.

"Hmm scratch that, you look like your high in fat anyway.."

She lifted him out of her mouth

Surge was stamping his feet in the sand "PUT HIM DOWN!"

"You aren't MY lieutenant, Thunder thighs you don't give me orders. But just this once I'll listen."

She released her mental grip and Raichu feel through the sky. It first tried to flap his arms like a bird, then tried to grab onto something, but with nothing around it Raichu fell.
Surge and the crowd watched in suspense, but just when Raichu was about to hit the ground, Espeon teleknetically caught it and lowered it down gently.

Raichu breathed a sigh of relief, only to suddenly find Espeon's paw onto of it. He struggled with all his might to push the paw off him, but Espeon pushed harder, still not putting much effort into but looking like she was going to crush him. He pushed as hard as he could and Espeon increased the pressure ever so slightly, looking bored while doing so. As it looked liked Raichu was about to be flatted she smiled at Surge grunted and returned Raichu to his pokeball.

Laughter and cheers filled the air.

"Well Private Pluse? See how powerful those "worthless" tournaments have helped me become? Forget your team, at this point I could probably take on your entire army! Do you really want to continue this display? Though I'm happy to put on a show for my fans."
11321122321111.title: Was busy over Easter but had fun

choices: Accept her offer and go on an adventure to fight the other gym leaders.
Watch her play with the crowd for a while and stay in the city longer.
The police are making a move!
113211223211112.content:
Surge looked absolutely livid. "Oh, I'll give them a show alright," he said as he grabbed another Pokeball.

"By all means," she chuckled.

Throwing it a short distance a metallic Pokemon made of screws and magnets was released; a Magneton. The three conjoined Magnemites immediately began to levitate and orbit around Espeon and Surge wasted no time giving them orders.

"Magneton, use zap cannon!" he demanded.

Espeon's mouth crept into a smile as she casually ducked the first shot and it was clear that the Magneton was not going to relent as it continued firing electric bolts at her. The crowd forming the circle around the fight widened as she started briskly walking around the beach to dodge the attacks, her great size giving her a surprising amount of speed. Still, as large of a target she was, a few of the attacks eventually connected but she paid them barely any recognition. You weren't sure if she was showing off to the crowd or toying with the Magneton but she continued evading the attacks, her feet kicking up large volumes of sand. Eventually she must have grown bored and the gem on her forehead shined as she held the Magneton in place with her psychic powers. Suspended mid-air, Espeon brought a paw up to the Magneton and started flicking at it with one of her clawed fingers.

Clang... Clang... Clang... On the last flick the psychic aura around Magneton vanished and it got launched down to the ground at Lieutenant Surge's feet. He quickly retrieved the fainted Pokemon and began fumbling for more Pokeballs.

"Next," she sang.

"That was just a fluke," Surge growled.

"Somehow I doubt that."

When Surge sent out his next Pokemon you noticed that he threw not one, but two Pokeballs. A pair of Pokemon similar in shape and colour emerged from the balls, two confident looking Electrodes.

"Sergeant Sparky," she chided. "I didn't know this was a double battle."

Surge ignored her comment and ordered the two Pokemon to attack. "Both of you, use explosion!

You were a bit worried when the two ball Pokemon began bouncing towards her. Explosion is typically a move used for last ditch efforts and usually results in the creature fainting in exchange for dealing a large amount of damage. Even though there were two of them, Espeon seemed almost amused as they approached. With one last bounce, the pair flew up and bumped into the violet fur of her chest before being engulfed in a bright glow. You and many spectators shielded your eyes and ducked for cover as they both detonated in a deafening explosion, engulfing the beach in black smoke. The dark smoke lingered on the battlefield and people were whispering to each other as they tried to guess the outcome of Surge's risky attack.

The smoke slowly dissipated and you were relieved to see Espeon still standing strong. The fur on the front of her body was covered in black soot and a quick shake made most of it fall to the ground. Espeon chuckled, "I think I felt that one."

"What are you?" Surge blurted out in complete disbelief.

"Just an Espeon," she said.

Surge had only one Pokemon left after he retrieved the two Electrodes and from the look on his face he seemed to know he was defeated, especially since his desperate tactic failed to work. Despite that he still threw the last ball and released a yellow and black Pokemon standing on two legs; an Electrabuzz. Once it gained its bearings after being released it nearly tripped over upon seeing the large Espeon and looked back to Surge as if it was questioning his judgement.

Espeon sighed as she looked the electric Pokemon down."You should have just surrendered," she said as she raised a paw above the Electrabuzz. You jumped in fright as her paw suddenly sped towards it and crashed it into the ground, the force kicking up a shock wave of sand. The thoom her paw made was followed with an eerie silence as she kept her paw down but eventually she raised it to reveal a fainted Electrabuzz. Surge quickly retrieved it back into its Pokeball and kicked the sand at his feet in frustration. It made you feel slightly uneasy at how quickly and effortlessly she dispatched his team; even holding back, the amount of power she held over the other Pokemon was just too great.

"You win," he begrudgingly said. Surge turned to leave before Espeon coughed rather loudly to grab his attention.

"Aren't you forgetting something?"

"What?"

"The badge," she said. "You're a gym leader and I beat all your Pokemon, give my trainer a badge."

You suddenly found a lot of eyes pointing towards you, including Lieutenant Surge's. "He didn't even participate."

"If you watched some of the tournaments I take place in you should know that we communicate psychically," she said, winking at you. "He told me what moves to do. I admit, I did some improv here and there but he's still the trainer that called you out and beat you."

Half of that was right, you do actually tell her what move to use psychically but you usually use it as an excuse to let Espeon take some creative liability during the fights. It was an aspect that gave you your own persona of being silent and calculating at the tournaments and you enjoyed it since not many people bothered you because of it. In this case, though, you weren't sure if you deserved the badge but it was clear that Espeon merely brought it up to further attack Surge's pride. The massive smug grin she was sporting was proof of that. Surge rolled his eyes and started digging deep into his pockets, eventually finding one in hidden away in his shirt. When he approached to hand you the badge you had to crane your head up as you accepted the Thunder badge from him.

Taking the badge you pocketed it and watched as Surge silently removed himself from the beach, his head hanging low in defeat as his fans rushed to his side. Meanwhile, Espeon looked very pleased with herself; it was clear that she wanted to do something like this to him for a long time. With the battle over, many of the spectators moved in closer to her and some even dared to pet the fur on her legs, the confidence of the crowd urging even more onlookers to be courageous and get a closer look. Espeon was practically basking in the attention the people were giving to her but you were more concerned about the large group all keeping a serious gaze on her from a distance.

There were people in police uniform and riot gear cautiously watching on. Pokemon of every shape and size were standing by their side and from their demeanor, you assumed they were poised and ready to strike on a moments notice. You couldn't blame them for being wary, it was almost expected that the authorities would quickly catch on to a giant Pokemon entering the city and deploy to meet it but that didn't mean their presence wasn't making you nervous. The giant Pokemon was yours, after all. The possibility they might close in and attempt to subdue Espeon crossed your mind but given her performance in the battle against Lieutenant Surge, you were more worried for them rather than her. Your attention was taken away from them as Espeon spoke to you.

"That was fun!" she beamed. "And we got you a nice shiny badge, too!"

"I'm not sure if I deserve it, you did everything."

She laughed, "you were my moral support. Hey, speaking of badges, we should definitely go challenge the other gyms. Think about it; it would give us something to do while we wait for tournament season to come around again and we can go and travel around like we used to!"

That was true. You never really bothered with the whole gym scene but it would be a good way to spend some time with your new and improved Espeon as you journeyed the countryside. If anything, it would be more of a comfy tour around the region rather than some horrible gauntlet of challenges thanks to her immense powers. "Maybe," you said.

You pondered it for a while before you noticed that the police squad had discreetly moved in closer and you were fairly certain that you even saw a tank or some armored vehicle behind all the police and Pokemon. You had to calm yourself down as you realized that they probably wouldn't try anything with the large crowd surrounding Espeon but their presence was still concerning. Espeon seemed oblivious as she mingled with the large crowd and she even sat down and let a few of them climb onto her.

The scene was oddly wholesome if you ignored the powder cache waiting to blow just behind her. You just hoped the crowd would deter them from doing anything silly. What is it you decide to do?
113211223211112.title: Insult to Injury

1132112232111123.author_name: This site is dead.I wana leave
choices: Things go well
Something goes wrong
Someone interrupts
1132112232111123.content:
"That's an interesting offer..."

You said "but shouldn't we deal with them first?" You pointing to the police.

Espeon shifted back into her battle stance.

"Are they here to fight? I don't want to cause too much destruction but-"

"Hopefully their just here about the potholes you made through the city."

She glowers at you.

"And they brought a tank for that?!"

The tank and cars drew closer. Espeon's crowd of fans looked tense, muttering among themselves.

"Well they don't know what you're like or what you're capable of, and have probably never seen a Pokemon of your size. But let's try and talk things out first."

"Fine but if this goes sideways I'm grabbing you and clearing an escape route. I don't need to seriously hurt anyone, if I overturn that tank and a few cars I should be able to sprint away ith you."

"Lets hope it doesn't come to that."

They were almost upon you and Espeon . You step forward and hold your hands up
"Don't shoot! She's with me!"

Espeon looked att he crowd for a moment and they stepped back, watching on nervously. You wonder what she said to them. Hopefully that things we're going to be OK and to clear away if they wern't. Though she was never prepared for failure.

The vehicles stopped, but tension still hanged in the air. Espeon kept her stance, as though she was expecting an attack. A moment later a green haired lady emerged from the police car, holding a megaphone. Other Officer Jenny? Did they grow them in cloning vats or something?

The Officier Jenny glared at you and shouted through the megaphone.

"Do you own this pokemon?!"

Espeon looked at you expectantly One could only imagine how she'd react if you said yes. But you also couldn't say no.

"Uh... We're partners." Phew. Dodged a bullet.

"Why is she so big?"

"Uh she had recently discovered a new ability and we were testing it out. Sorry about this."

Jenny's stern face soured.

"Do you have any idea how much damage she caused?!"

Espeon butted in.

"Hey I avoided hurting anyone!"

Jenny seemed momentarily surprised Espeon could respond to her, but took it in stride. Had she encountered a talking pokemon before? She looked at Espeon with the same scolding look she was giving you. If she was at all intimidated by Espeon's size, she was a doing a great job hiding it.

"You caused thousands of Pokedollars worth of damage to the city! Damage to the road, the and some of the buildings."

You give Espeon a quick, dirty sideways eye. "I told you to be careful."

She hissed. "I'm still new at this!"

Now wasn't the time to argue you with her. You turned back to Jenny.

"We're sorry officer. We'll try to be more careful next time. Is there anything we can do to make up for this? We aren't here to cause trouble, we're just here for Espeon's fans and maybe some pokemon battles, but we'll try and keep it out of the city.

Jenny let out a sigh and her shoulders relaxed.. She was still tense but didn't seem as as angry.

"Ok I can tell you didn't do this maliciously but you still did hundreds of thousands of pokedollars of damage and it will take us a while to fix the damage."

"Uh... Give us a second."

You glared at espeon. She actually looks sheepish for a second. Huh, you don't remember the last time you saw her look that way. You hear her voice in your head and you're sure she's only speaking to you.

"Ok I know a made mess."

"An expensive mess."

"But I do make a lot of money"

"I guess...."

She stuck up her head.

"You might even say I'm the breadwinner."

"Technically we both are."

"Hmmph. Anyway what if we didn't have to pay hundreds of thousands of Pokedollar to fix the city. What if I used my "other" powers." That smile returned to her face.

You hesitated.

"I don't know...." You were worried what she could do with them, especially if they had got any stronger and what if she did damage further damage using them?

The smile didn't leave her face.

"It's that or empty our coffers, if we even have enough."

It's obvious she wanted an excuse to use them again, but did you have a choice?

You groan.

"Ugh."

"Didn't you say a pokemon trainer has to trust their pokemon?"

That felt like a cheap shot. But she had a point.

"Ok but be careful."

"Aren't I always?"

"No."

"Well I usally am, I just got carried away today."

"Make sure you don't get carried away this time."

Espeon looked back at Jenny and the vehicles assembled. She projected her thought speech out to them

"Fine officer what if I was to repair you good City?" Oh boy she was trying to turn on the charm.

Jenny blinked in surprise.

"You can do that?"

Espeon nodded.

"Definitely."

How could Espeon be so sure of a power she had never used before?

Jenny narrowed her eyes.

"Ok but no funny business and be careful with the city time!" She had to have stones talking your Espeon like that.

"I'll pay attention to all you little people." She flashed a winning smile."

You turn away from Officer Jenny "Espeon are you sure about this? How are you even going to walk through the city without causing more damage?"

"I've already thought of that." She said impatiently, as though it should have been obvious to you. "I didn't want to use telekinesis to lift my entire body, but If I just lift my paws slightly I should be able to avoid making imprints in the road. Let me practice first.

She flashed that same smile to the police.

"One moment officer! I'm just going to use my power so I can walk through the city, please do not be alarmed." Espeon's gem glowed. Some of the vehicles affixed their weapons on her but Jenny held her arms out. Espeon concentrated and jer paws glowed. She took a small step forward, making a thinner imprint in the sand han before. Her gem glowed again and she took another step, barely marking the sand. As per usual Espeon looked satisfied with herself.

"See? Nothing to it. Now let's clean this place up." She picked you up in her aura and lifted you onto her back and headed towards the city. Even with the impacts of her steps reduced, you could still feel a strange spring in her step...
1132112232111123.title: And yes I know the symbol is the yen sign

choices: Try out the demolition industry for a while
Challenge the gym leaders across the region
Something interrupts the both of you
11321122321111231.content:
Espeon moved back into the city and quickly returned to the road she took to get to the beach. You heard no cracks coming from the asphalt as she stepped on it this time but leaning to the side from her back you could still see many paw-shaped potholes she made in the road. With Espeon craning her head down and focused on it you saw the cracked rubble begin to shake, bounce and levitate before they all started joining together, even the paint of the road lines seamlessly coming back. Officer Jenny walked to where the hole once was and cautiously poked at the area with her foot before giving Espeon the thumbs, quickly backing off and joining the formation of officers and Pokemon stalking just behind.

"How did you know you could do that?" you asked.

"Dunno, just did," she simply said.

Retracing her steps, Espeon moved throughout the city and continued working on fixing all the damage she had done and from the look of things, that was a lot. Getting deeper into the city, around where Surge's gym was, you began to see a myriad of flashing orange lights and high visibility vests. The city council was out in full force trying to fix the damage to the roads and getting traffic moving again. From how many of the workers threw their hands up at upon seeing Espeon showed they were more annoyed at her returning than anything else. They were still too intimidated by impede her approach and stood to the side to watch, however, they were pleasantly surprised when they noticed she was somehow repairing the road.

After a while Espeon eventually sped up until she was just casually walking across the city again and was starting to leave the police in the dust. For a moment you suspected she was pulling a runner but looking behind you noticed that all the potholes and cracks in the road had been mended as good as new.

"You got good at that quick," you pointed out.

"Yeah, almost easy as just thinking about it!"

"Huh."

Like earlier you found yourself idly resting on her back as she made her way through the city, this time repairing all the damage in her path as if she was on some sort of reverse-rampage. You guessed that both everyone and yourself was very lucky that she was so friendly despite her mischievous streaks. On top of being able to turn herself into a giant she could alter the things around her with a passing thought; it was scary to think what would have happened if a malicious Pokemon possessed the powers she had. As if sensing your thoughts, she spoke to you.

"Hey, so why don't you like the idea of me using all my powers?"

"I, well," you stuttered, caught off guard. "I mean you're pretty strong and I've never heard of any other Pokemon that can do the things you can. Maybe legendary Pokemon, but most of what we know about them could just be myth. I don't really understand it."

"Maybe I'm a legendary Pokemon," she joked.

You laughed, "maybe."

"I won't abuse them if that's what your worried about," she explained. "And from now on, if i'm not sure if I can fix it, I won't do it."

"Thanks," you said, rubbing the long fur on her back.

You hardly noticed but Espeon was starting to enter the suburbs again and the police were starting to catch up after being free from the congested traffic of the city. The size of their group was very diminished and even lacked the heavy weaponry you saw before. You assumed it was thanks to Espeon fulfilling her promise of repairing the city which might have gained the trust of Officer Jenny. After a while she stopped at a familiar light pole she accidentally tackled and it was a spectacle seeing the metal pole upright itself and stick down into the ground, the light briefly flickering as she turned away from it. As she continued walking, though, you noticed something else strange. You remembered what the sight looked like from her back when you were coming into the city and this looked different...

Letting her walk you focused and felt the sensation of slowly going up, just the same as being on an elevator. When you became aware of that that her back felt a bit more spacious and her fur seemed a bit longer. You had to bring it up.

"Are you making yourself bigger?" you asked.

"I was trying to be discreet but I'm surprised you didn't notice earlier," she chuckled, stopping her growth. It might have been a little game she was playing with you to pass the time but you weren't sure.

For a moment you were silent before you posed her a question about this whole scenario. "So why do you want to be bigger, anyway?"

Another silence followed as she thought about how to reply. "I know it sounds conceited but I'm not a normal Espeon; I'm different, powerful. I kind of felt like my normal size was a bit inadequate, like I was fit to burst out of my skin or something. I feel a lot more comfortable like this."

Espeon laughed for a second. "Besides, the face you made when I first showed you this was worth it. This is really fun!"

"And I bet you like all the attention, too, don't you?" you chided.

"Maybe," she admitted.

You were slightly caught of guard about how aware she was of her 'over-leveling' situation but how she explained it put you a bit more at ease. Using her powers to turn herself into a giant was just a way of her expressing herself, as strange as it sounds. Continuing along the road the both of you arrived back home. As she turned around you noticed the road was fixed to perfection and waited for the police to catch up. Officer Jenny arrived in a brisk jog and was hardly phased by the run Espeon made them do. Without breaking a sweat she pointed a finger up at Espeon.

"You fixed everything as promised. I'm thankful for your cooperation but what you did still inconvenienced a lot of people and while I don't fully trust you let, I will let you off with only a single warning."

You let out a sigh of relief, glad that you dodged a hefty fine but it was clear the two of you weren't completely off the hook.

"Now, we're going to leave you alone but I've let every department in the region know about you two and we're at the ready if you try anything, got it?"

"Yes," the both of you solemnly said. With that she turned around and started walking back to the city, the leftover police forces following close behind. The both of you waited until she was a fair distance away until you spoke to each other.

"So that was a thing," Espeon said. "Hey, do you think they would care if I crush a few houses if I repair them?"

"What?" you blurted out at the random question. "Of course. I'm definitely sure they would a hundred percent not like that."

"Just curious."

"Well, there are demolition jobs, but I'm not sure..."

"We can ask if they want help!" she interrupted. "Come on, it's a change from doing tournaments and sitting around all day, huh, huh?"

"Earlier you wanted to go challenge all the other gym leaders," you pointed out.

"Oh, yeah. Well, we can do either! I don't mind."

The thought of a giant Espeon shoulder-tackling a huge building and wrecking it was oddly amusing as you pictured it in your head and if you got the right permissions it would be totally legal, to boot. You also recalled her offer from before about touring the region to challenge the gym leaders and considered talking to her about that again, especially since you cleared that whole altercation with the police. It was plain to see that Espeon had many activities she wanted to do now that she was letting loose with her powers. The demolition thing just might have been one of her attempts at trying to shoot suggestions at you to see what sticks.

She was looking at you expectantly just like on the beach. Even though she had most of the power in the relationship she still wanted to make sure you were enjoying yourself, too. It was a nice feeling. What do you decide to do?
11321122321111231.title: Fixing up the town

113211223211112311.author_name: This site is dead.I wana leave
choices: She draws unwanted attention
She draws attention she enjoys
She somehow finishes up without signficant intteruption
113211223211112311.content:
Well considering she did such a good job repairing the city you saw no harm in letting her have some fun, especially if it could help the city. Hopefully she would actually be careful this time. She did seem to be trying to consider your feelings. Though you still wonder if she'd go off and do it anyway if you said. All the more reason to agree so you can watch her.

"Sure but-"

Espeon rolls her head.

"Be careful. I know. I'm still experimenting but I'm not going to demolish the entire city"

"I thought it bared repeating"

Espeon turned around slowly, facing officer Jenny again.

"Good police officer I am sorry for the trouble we have caused but I had an idea how to help your fair city.". You try with all your might to avoid rolling your eyes. Espeon was really trying to turn on the charm.

Jenny blinked.

"Oh? What do you have in mind?"

"Well it occurs to me a city like this must have some buildings due for demolition and at my current size I'm sure I can do much to help your fair city."

Jenny narrowed her eyes.

"Are you asking my permission to knock down buildings?!"

"Not any old buildings, I'm not some rampaging beast." You're relieved she didn't want to act out a b movie. Or if she did, she wasn't silly enough to be open about that. "Just ones that needed to be knocked down."

Jenny thought about it and looked carefully at Espeon, who was doing her best angel face.

"Well.. I guess it would save a lot of time and money. BUt are you sure you can do this safely? "

"Absolutely."

“Hmm.. I think I should give test you before letting you to town. There’s a rundown apartment store on 3rd street due for demolition. The areas has been cleared so it should be safe to It down.”

“Gladly, good officer.”

Jenny lead the way and your espeon followed behind. Although Espeon was playing it cool, you could feel some of her fur sticking up and the buzz in her softened steps.

“You’re looking forward to this aren’t you?” You said quietly

“Shhhhhh” She said in private thought speech. "If they catch on they might get the wrong.

Jenny stopped at a dilapidated, dirty looking building.

“This is the place.”

Espeon regarded it with amusement. She took a second to figure out the best approach, then brought her paw down on the right side, like she did with Surge’s gym, only applying much more force, taking off a good part of the building, while shaking the rest. She smirked but you’re not even sure that was her full strength. She did the same with her other paw, causing more to crumble off, then you could see the light of her gem shine. The building glowed, including the pieces she had taken off, it lifted off the ground then crumpled and compressed as though she was crushing something much smaller in her palm. She lowered it back down, leaving only the ruins of the building in a surprisingly neat pile.

For a moment Jenny stared blankly. Then she smiled.

“Wow that was very impressive. Ok you got the job.”

Espeon did her best low key smile.

“Thank you good officier.”

“I'll get you in touch with someone and draw you up a list. They can show you which ones to knock down. But we're stil keeping an eye on you."

Espeon lowered herself and nodded.

"I know. Thank you very much."

Not to long after, Jenny came back with a list of addresses.

"Here you go. Only stick to these buildings. We still have our eyes on you."

"i know. I'll do this city proud." Espeon said. You felt like rolling your eyes again.

You skimmed the list forr the nearest buildings around you, then she took it off you with telekenesis. She waked through the city again, but for a second took her eyes off the road, glancing att he list.

"Ohh this one is near by.", almost forgetting to watch her steps.

She quickly walks to the first address.

"Espeon!"

"Oh sorry was just looking forward to this."

You reach the first building, another delipidated apartment like the first. Espeon looked around, seeing if anyone was watching her and seemed relived when no was around. She smiled and looked at the building like a cat holding a mouse.

She lashed the building with her tail, tearing off some of the roofing, then she slammed the bottom part with her hip, enjoying the building giving way to her body.

"Did that hurt at all?"

"Not a bit."

Strange, her body still seemed as soft as ever. Was this because of her size, her level or her other abilities? Either she was still at work.

Espeon lightly jabbed the building, a few times, knocking out some windows, purring all the while.

"This feels so freeing! Like living one of those cheesy b movies"

She turned around gave the building a kick with her back legs. A part of the building snapped off and the entire thing fell, Espeon laughed and dusted herself off with her paws, then used her psychic powers to move more dust off her.

"How was that?"

"Nice technique."

"Thank you What's next?"

The next one was a house. She seemed disappointed for a moment that it was so much smaller than her last two, but she sat down next to it, delighting that she towered over it. Sitting down it barely came to her lower legs. No it was smaller than that.. wait was she making herself bigger again?

"Oh you noticed?" She teased

She swung her tail, delighting it as it smashed through the glass, and took a side of the building off. Even at her size, you were surprised this didn't hurt her. She then swung her paws again, started with slow strikes chipping off a bit of time, then brought the full force of her paws down, smashing the house to bits. She smiled at her work, then began cleaning it.

"Your really getting into this."

"Yes, it feels good I have a chance to finally cut loose.. within reason of course. Mmm in fact...."

She smiled at you and began growing again, this time not even trying to be subtle about it. You could see a gleam in her eyes as everything got smaller compared to her and as you became smaller than one of her eyes you couldn't help feel a certain sense of awe, only further her delight. She grew until she was higher than most of the buildings in the city, and fit tightly between them

"Now this feels good." Her mental voice boomed out.

"Ss the booming effect really necessary?"

She laughed

"No but I like it. Do you think I'm stronger than a legendary now?"

"Unless they can grow or are monster movie size probably. How are you going to get around the city now?"

"I'll manage, I'm getting the hang of this. Why don't you take a front row seat?" She mentally lifted you off her back and onto her head. Looking down you were surprised at how much of the city you could see. The skyline was certainly clearer from here.

She walked, no strutted through the city with surprising grace, but she still didn't crush anything when she walked, and did place her paws away from cars. This didn't stop people stopping to look at her and some from panicking. She tried to reassure them with her thought speech.


"It's ok, I mean you no harm, I'm just doing some work for your fair city."

You walk over to her ears, trying to keep your balance, though you have a lot of room.

"I know you're trying to be careful and having fun, but don't you think you're going overboard? Even if you're trying not to hurt anyone or break anything they won't know that."

"But I feel so free!" She looked down, noticing it was more of a struggle to move through the city and almost stepping on a car. "Hmm maybe I'll see after i do a few more items on the list."

You reach another item on a list. A house. At this point she positively towards over it and brings her paw down, which almost match's it in size. You have no doubt if she had aimed true she would have smashed it in one strike, but either by accident or on purpose, she was just a little to the left, still managing to take a good chunk off. She brings her other paw down and flattens it, grinning as it shatters into pieces. She waits a second, still looking at the destruction, then finally cleans up her mess.

"I can feel your unease but we'll be finished soon. Unfortunately."
113211223211112311.title: Demolitieon

1132112232111123113.author_name: This site is dead.I wana leave
choices: You reach Celadon with no issues
Something happens
Espeon stops to have some fun
1132112232111123113.content:
(Writers note: my membership expires tomorrow but I don't want it renewed. I appreciate the year generously given to me but this site is pretty dead now.

And Rawk I know you're writing another branch and maybe you moved on, but I was in a rut and wanted to write this, dont feel pressured to writ. Anyway)

It didn't take too long for espeon to finish up. Despite her increasing size, she was getting better at weaving between buildings and roads, though of course any car would veer out of the way of your towering Pokemon. For her part she did her best to ensure those she came across that she meant no harm, giving them a friendly smile and wave, and even posing for any pictures taken.

Faster than you thought possible, despite her playing around and having fun with the "job", she was done with her assignments. And you had to admit the way she neatly arranged the rubble afterwards made it look as good, if not better than a professional job.

You could feel how proud she was of her work, and also a pat of her was sad that it was over.

"Wow that was..."

"Impressive?"

"Yeah"

She chuckled.

"I know. I'm sure I'd do well in the demolition industry. I could be a demoliteon"

You didn't know whether to laugh or groan.

"Anyway let's tell Jenny."

"Agreed, I'd be happy to show her my work."

Espeon took you back to Jenny,

"All done officer."

Jenny looked up slowly then glared at you.

"Why is your Espeon even bigger than before?!"

"Relax, I didn't break anything I wasn't supposed to, I'm getting the hang of moving around your fair city. You can visit my sites and see it for yourself."

"I will." SHe drove around and inspected them, with espeon slowing her walking pace so she could stay just a bit ahead. When they were done Jenny stepped out of the car and smiled

"Well that certainly is impressive work. Ok you're free to go, just be more careful, you can do a lot damage at the size even without meaning to."

"We know."

Jenny drove off and Espeon turned to you..

"So where to now?"

SHe was actually asking you? It felt strange but good.

"Hmm I guess we can tackle the other gyms in any order. Cerulean City would be the closest, but it would be hard to get anywhere from Viridian City."

"Maybe we should do that one last then? I could go from Cinnabar island to Virdian city"

How did she plan to do that? Return to her pokeball or shrink down so you could travel by boat? Use her physic powers to walk on water? Or possibly even grow large enough to wade through the ocean? Could she be thinking about that right now? Hmm you'd cross that bridge when you came to it.

Saffron City was closer than Celadon City and Sabrina was a psychic gym leader. And a powerful pyschic herself. There had been rumors of her doing terrible things to trainers who angered her. Then again you were sure if it came to it your espeon could overpower her. Espeon had already been very powerful, but you wondered if her powers were growing with her stature... As well as her ego. And you hoped the stories you heard about Sabrina were just rumors.

Celadon city was a little further away. It's the biggest city in Kanto, so espeon would definitely have fun there.. Maybe too much. As fair as you knew Erika was a nice enough gym leader, though there were stories of her turning nasty if someone rubbed her the wrong way. And you could see Espeon saying the wrong thing if she felt offended. There was also the possibility of Espeon causing damage in Celadon if she made herself too big or was too careless, though she was trying to do better.

If you were going to fight all 8 gym leaders you'd have to go both of them eventually, and Celadon City is a longer distance from here than Saffron.

Well might as well get this over with.

"To Saffron city!"

"Great!" She winks at you. SHe pulled your phone out of your pocket. "Let me make a few posts first."

"SO espeon, why are you still making yourself bigger?"

"it's fun! I feel myself being just. More and more! I bet my power is growing by the second!" SHe sounded downright giddy. "Say could you check my level again?"

You suddenly realized it had been a while since you last did so. You were quite curious if it had gone up at all and pointed the dex at her
.
"255." It said, loudly enough for both of you to hear.

255?! She had grown more than 20 levels in this short space of time? You were momentarily lost for words.
"Ohhh lovely!" She clapped her front paws together, which made a tremendous sound at her size

How could it have increased so much? SHe had only gained 2 levels in 2 weeks but had gained this many in a few hours? And although she battling now, Surge's team were not a challenge for her and likely would not have been even at her normal stature. Was her size affecting her level? No that couldn't be right. Had it somehow caused her level to go up?

"Wow.. That's really quite incredible."

She beamed at you.

"Isn't it?" She was quivering now, inadvertently shaking you about.

"Why do you want to get strong so much anyway?"

She quickly turned her head away. You couldn't see the expression on her face, but she was clearly embarrassed.

"Do I have to say it?" She sounded uncharacteristically meek. It had been a while since you saw her appear vulnerable.

You were curious and maybe she'd tell you if you really asked, but you didn't want to force it out of her.

"I guess not...."

She looked at you with a conflicted look.

"Mmm... But I can tell you want to know."

"Well. I am curious, but if it makes you uncomfortable you don't have to tell me."

She paused for a moment. Then she sighed.

"It's not a time I wish to recall but ... If you really want to know." She winced "I was a small, sickly, weak eevee, and I hated it.I was the runt of my litter and my siblings and other Pokemon never let me forget it." She shivered. "I was glad when you found and helped me grow stronger, and when I went from such a weak little run to marvelous specimen I am now! Thank you, I do owe you a lot."

"You're welcome, though I don't think I could have done this all myself."

Espeon winked at you. "True. Though clearly you helped awaken some hidden talent inside of me."

"Do you think your power has capped out?"

She laughed. "Not even close!"
It occurs to you. Your dex likely only measure up to 255. No known record of a Pokemon exceeding that level was known. It was rare for most to even exceed 99. But what if your espeon was different? What if it was actually far higher or if there was no cap at all?! Just how powerful was she and just how powerful could she become?

"Why do you think your level is increasing so much?"

"Mmmm... could be ay number of things. Maybe its the support you showed me? Maybe its the battle? maybe the support of my fans?"

"You don't know do you?"

She laughed again. Was she hiding something from you?

"Well I can't be certain. But I think it's something along those lines... maybe. Anyway...." She says before you can reply. You noticed she had left Vermillion city behind. She took a few steps and purred, wearing that same wry smile

"You know what would make this journey shorter"

"You growing really big."

She winked.

"My it's almost as though you read my mind. I thought I was the psychic one here."

"Lucky guess."

"So shall I?"

You wondered if she'd do it even if you said not to, but you wanted to see this.

"Sure."

You suddenly feel your "seat" rumble and shake and her fur rise up around you as Esepon grows yet bigger.

You feel yourself getting lost amiss an increasing wall of purple, when her aura surrounds you and you feel yourself being slowly lifted up by her. She turns to you and purrs.

She's enormous! It's hard to judge just how big she is, though you have trouble taking all of her in. The gem on her head is larger than your entire body!

"What do you think? Impressed? " Her psychic voice boomed around you, sounding more.

"Wow..." you are lost for words. Can she get any bigger than this?

"And before you say it, don't worry, I don't plan to enter Saffron city like this, i'd rather avoid flattening an entire district under my paws. This just to make the journey that much shorter... and more enjoyable."
She placed you onto her head, which felt very soft. You couldn't help notice how much of the country side you could see from her. Then you wondered how many houses you could fit on your Espeon's ears.

She took a long, slow step, dropping the purple aura around her paws, leaving a great impact on the ground. She lift her paw up, proudly inspecting the crater she left behind.

"Wonderful! And don't worry I don't plan to leave too many of those I just wanted to see how strong I was now. Hmm maybe one more." She took another slow step and did the same thing.
1132112232111123113.title: On the road to Celadon City

She agrees to do so

11321122321111231131.content:
(Authours note: Sorry realized I typed Celadon instead of Saffron. I guess writing on my on interactive where I can edit later gave me some sloppy habits. If it matters I can message Cmwrite with an edited chapter that fixs that and the backstory. Also made some mistakes with Kanto geography, though Vermillion was directly south of Ceruleun and that Celadon was bigger than Saffron)

As Espeon promised, she covered a lot of distance with her new size, even when she walking slowly to avoid crushing anyone who might be near by and to enjoy her new height. She made a few more paw print craters and admired her work, also letting you feel the weight of each step, before putting her aura back on.
Trainers yelled and gasped as the sight of her, some stopping to gawk and admire her, others running for the hills. You couldn't believe how small they appeared from up here.As per usual, Espeon welcomed the attention putting on her best usual friendly smile.

"Don't mind me, just the world's biggest Espeon passing through. Feel free to take a photo." She said, posing for any oncoming camera shots.
"I bet I'm going to be all over the internet when this is done".

"What if you end up on the news?"

"Ohh even better! I always wanted to be on tv."

"What if people think your dangerous?"

She huffed. "Well I'll show them I'm not!"

"It might not be that easy."

"Well I won over officer Jenny didn't I?"

"You did but were a lot smaller."

"I can shrink down if needed... even though I'd rather not. Ohhh look at that, I got you here in record time."

Looking ahead you saw Saffron City up ahead. It was supposed to be the largest city in Kanto, though to Espeon it almost certainly looked like a partciular small model set.

"Mmm the biggest city in Kanto... though not so big to me."

"Maybe you should shrink down before we reach the city."
11321122321111231131.title: One more before my membership ends

choices: Espeon shrinks down and joins you
Espeon remains her size and fights where she is
Espeon suggests a way to even the odds
113211223211112311311.content:
Espeon kept her pace as she neared Saffron City. "I think I'll stay like this, for now," she said.

Skirting on the outside of the city it still looked incredibly small in comparison to your Espeon and scores of people could be seen in a panic running between the buildings. Espeon circled the city and found a spot that was relatively devoid of buildings where she could sit down. After settling down on her belly, even the largest building in the town, the Silph Co. Headquarters, was dwarfed by the pink psychic Pokemon. Since she was just sitting there and not changing her size, you assumed she had a plan in mind.

"What are we going to do?" you asked.

"I was thinking you could go down there and bring out the gym leader for me."

"You're not coming?"

She shrugged. "I'll be sitting right here, you can have a look around town if you want. I can take in the sights from up here, anyway!"

"If you insist," you answered. With that, you felt her psychic energy wrapping around your body and plucking you from her fur. As you floated from her side you were greeted with the faraway ground below, though thankfully she handled you carefully so you didn't panic at the sheer drop. Soon enough you were deposited on solid ground. From below, Espeon seemed even more imposing, looking more like a grand piece of the landscape rather than an actual Pokemon. Standing at the base of her body, her smiling face up above looked so close yet so far away.

Raising a paw she motioned towards the city, accidentally kicking up a huge gust of wind. "Go on, then!"

Giving her a small wave you entered Saffron city. The atmosphere of the city was soaked in anxiety. People were looking up at Espeon, worriedly talking to each other and on their phones. Her social media fans stood out, though, who all seemed ecstatic at her arrival. Meanwhile, the local police department was deployed in full force and were organizing their units as they tried to calm the crowd, an officer with a megaphone assuring them that the Espeon wouldn't hurt them. It was clear they got word from the Officer Jenny you talked to but it was obvious they still didn't trust such a giant Pokemon would play nice.

Well, since you were in town you decided you might as well get some things squared away. The first thing you did was stop by a food vendor and get something to eat, though it took some insistence on your part to get them to serve you since they were transfixed on the Pokemon looming above the city. Next, you stopped by the post office and sent your Pokedex and a letter to the professor you work with regarding your Espeon. You briefly wrote about the events that transpired and requested a new Pokedex that read a higher level since you were sure the one you had now was capped out. For the delivery of the Pokedex, you just put down a town you were likely going to be visiting in the future.

Lastly, you had to find the city's gym leader, the apparent master of psychic Pokemon, Sabrina. Searching through the city, most of the denizens were engrossed with your Espeon that was absentmindedly looking over the city. She seemed to be enjoying herself just watching all the small people run around the model city before her and she was holding an endearing grin on her face.

"So cute," she beamed down at everyone. "I won't hurt any of you, don't worry!"

After a while of exploring you found Sabrina outside of her gym pointing up to the Espeon and barking orders to some trainers standing around her. From the cast of psychic Pokemon sitting next to her, she was apparently already prepared for a fight. Getting closer, she scared you when she suddenly spun around to your location.

Pointing a finger, she addressed you. "You're that Pokemon's trainer, aren't you? I could sense a challenge with trainer using a powerful Pokemon in the future but I'm still not sure what you two want."

Holding your hands up in front of you at the accusation, you quickly explained yourself. "We just want to challenge you to a battle, that's all!"

Sabrina stared daggers for a moment longer. "You're telling the truth. But I ask you to please leave the city after the battle, she's distressing the populace."

"Don't worry, we will."

"This won't be a typical Pokemon battle," she continued. "If I'm expected to face off against something as large as that, I'm going to use my whole team."

You thought that was fair enough. With how effortlessly Espeon took out Lt. Surge's team, you wouldn't blame Sabrina if she enlisted all the other trainers to help fight alongside her, too. Still, you wanted to see what Espeon thought and yelled up to her. "Do you want to shrink yourself and come down here, or what?"

Espeon tilted her head, looking amused. It was apparent she could hear the conversation you were having with Sabrina. "I could," she hummed. "Let me think about it."
113211223211112311311.title: Towering over Saffron City

1132112232111123113112.author_name: This site is dead.I wana leave
choices: You or Sabrina stop her before it's too late
She causes an earthquake
1132112232111123113112.content:
"Face me here" Espeon insisted.

Sabrina didn't seem to react.
"Very well. Let's get this over with."

The pokeballs around Sabrina's waist glowed and all six of tem came up out. An Alakazam, Mr Mine, Jynx, Wobbuffet, Gallade and to your Espeon's amusement, an Espeon. All six were wide eyed at the sight of your behemoth, especially Sabrina's own espeon, who stared blankly into your own.
Your espeon laughter filled the air as she bent down and looked at Sabrina's Espeon in the eye, who nervously backed away.

"Ahhh she's so small and cute, she's like a mini me!"

Even you had to laugh. Sabrina did not seem amused, but he face had been in a permanent scowl since you arrived. Her pokemon shook in terror, while your Espeon playfully stretched in front of them and let out a yawn. Only Sabrina remained stoic.

"I know that pokemon is entirely too large, but I'm asking you to do this battle as gym leader pokeon. I will not let get seriously hurt and will call you back if things get too rough."

Her pokemon still looked shook. Sabrina just seemed to stare straight ahead.

"Are we doing this or not?"

"Be patient."

Suddenly Sabrina's Pokemon looked ready to battle. They took in a fightnig stance, Wobbuffet in front of them, clearly ready to take an attack, with the other five looking ready to fire psychic blasts.

Sabrina might have been out matched and reluctant to battle, but she was clearly very disciplined and had some kind of plan.

"Begin."

Espeon waited, with the usual amused smirk on her face. Four of Sabrina's pokemon attacked in sync, sending a green sphere, a black sphere, a yellwo blast or elltricy and even a small blizzard at Espeon. Sabinra wasn't just using psychic attacks?

The projectiles struck Espeon, leaving only a comparatively tiny mark on her fur. She gave a mocking yawn. However, Espeon didn't notice the almost insect sized Gallade running at her. You weren't sure it mattered but you felt you should warn her.

"Esepeon look out!"

The gallade dashed through, conjuring a purple blade to stab into espeon's paw.

"OW!" Espeon flinched. "Hey that stang a bit. like being stung by an insect"

"You are immense but you are not invincible."

Gallade was already speeding away from her, when she slammed her paws down. The paws missed Gallade but the impact of them shook the entire area, and the tremor knocked Gallade down and made Sabrina's other Pokemon lose there balance.

"And you're still out matched! First i'm going to deal with the sharp one."

Espeon playfully chased the Gallade, who was now running for his life, Esepon let it stay just a bit of her, enjoying its increasing fear as she got closer and closer to it and her every step caused a tremor. Sabrina's own Espeon and Alakazam seemed to be concentrating, while her Mr mine was making a wall. Her Jynx called another blizzard, the chill spreading through the air, making you wish you had wrapped up, though Espeon paid it no heed. She had almost caught the gallade and was bringing her building sized paw down when Wobuffet got in the way, spreading its stubby arms out and glowing. Gallade used the opportunity to get away Espeon disdainfully lowered her paw, but was suddenly forced back and yelped in pain.

It wasn't enough to seriusly hurt her, but you were both shocked, it was rare for an attack to hurt espeon even at her regular size.

"You little pest! What was that?"

"Counter it reflects physical attacks." You said.

"Oh using my own strength against me huh? Well let's see how you handle thi-"
You suddenly heard loud, ominous singing. Following the sound you noticed it was Jynx, and black clouds of energy were coming off her.You also notice Sabrina had recalled her Espeon.

"Espeon quick! That Jynx is using Perish Song! "

"it's just bad music, what's it going to do to me?"

The black waves were building.

"it doesn't matter how big or strong you are you, it kos ANY pokemon."

"Fine if only because I hate bad singing."

She bent her knees, preparing to jump over, but something was holding her. What could bind her at this size? Every other Pokemon seemed to also be weighed down, and you also felt suddenly heavier as though the ground was pulling you down. You looked around. The Alakazam! He had his spoons raised and was deep in concentration, but he wasn't attacking, he must have been doing this.


The song grew louder. You had seen this before, if it reached the next verse, she'd faint.

"I wasn't planing to get serious but you asked for it!"

Espeon's gem glowed and you felt an overwhelming surge of pyschic energy that lit the entire field. Every other Pokemon felt it to and even Sabrina blinked, something you hadn't seen her do all battle.
Sabrina's pokemon were gripped in surging purple fields, her light so bright that anyone around could see it it. Jynx dropped onto the ground, spirals around its eyes, then Gallade, then Alakazam and finally Mr mine, leaving only Wobuffet.

"It's been a while since I've even broken a sweat."

Wobbuffet glowed again and shot a small blast back. Apparently Espeon had been holding him/her/it? YOu couldn't tell . Espeon looked mildly annoyed rather than hurt by the blast.

"I've had enough of you." She telekentically lifted it towards herself and looked ready to bury it under her paw.

Though Sabrina tries to keep a game face, you catch an instant of a smile as Eespeon does so.

"Wait I think she's trying to trick you! Wobuffet going to use Destiny Bond!"

"OH i remember a trainer we fought did that. Though he didn't call it out fast enough."

"Sabrina won't have that issue."

"Mmm you right. So what do we do with this one here?" She bent her head so she could look it in the eye.

She held the Wobuffet under her paw, softly enough that it couldn't' counter the grip."

"Oh I have an idea. You can counter my paws but can you counter this?" She tried to jump, but the gravity seemed too heavy. She waited.

After a few seconds you suddenly felt a lot lighter, whatever Sabrina's Alakazam had done had worn off. And given the smile on you're Espeon's face, you could tell she had noticed it as well.

She jumped up and down, shaking the whole area. She jumped again, landing with even more force, and leaving an increasingly large crater.
Another jump. That one would have knocked you off your feet if you weren't aware of it. If she kept going like this she might even cause an earthquake! Espeon always possessed and incredible power, but at this size she would be capable of doing some serious damage! Espeon didn't even seem to notice, only looking with amusement at the fear in wobbufet's eyes. She jumped again, the impact forcing you a few feet back.
1132112232111123113112.title: Didn't meant for this to be 2 parts but had fun

11321122321111231131121.author_name: This site is dead.I wana leave
choices: You talk more
Something happens
11321122321111231131121.content:
"Enough!" Sabrina said returning her wobuffet to it's pokeball. "I surrender. You defeated me. Take the Soul badge and go." She levitated the soul badge towards you, forcefully thrusting into your hands.

"We weren't done battling yet!"

"You were going to cause an earthquake, do you have any idea of the damage you could have done?!" She pointed at saffron city. The screams were getting louder. Even Espeon's fan club seem afraid. Espeon leaned over.

"Oh Im sorry... I'm not used to being this size"

"Then maybe you shoudn't rush into things without thinking of the consequences. You could have done serious damage to Saffron city if I hadn't stopped you."

"I-I-I'm sorry." She hung her head. You almost never saw her like this, she would normally have a snappy response for everything. She turned away from Sabrina and you.

The silence hung in the air and you weren't sure what to say.

"I do not like to talk about it but I was not so different from you."

"Though I am nowhere near as powerful as your Espeon, I am a powerful psychic. I might be more powerful than any human alive."

"Prove it."

Sabrina disappereaed.

"Over here." She teleported "Over here."

"Fine you can teleport. That's impressive... for a human."

"I know you more powerful than me but can you and your trainer battle psychically?"

"Yeah of course."

"Prove it. Order your espeon to use an attack through a pyschic verbal command."

"uhh.."

Espeon casually lifted a tree with her powers. Sabina was unimpressed.

"I know you to are not in sync."

"What do you mean? He totally told me to do that."

"It was obvious during our battle. I commanded my Pokemon without speaking a single word, and they understood my plans and intentions instantly.. Meanwhile had you're trainer not warned, you would have succumbed to your own arrogance.

"I-I could have taken that Perish Song or Destiny Bond!"

"No you couldn't they take down a pokemon regardless of who they are. There are some things you cannot achieve with raw power. You're own arrogance would be your undoing."

Espeon stood up to her full height and glowered at Sabrina, taking a step towards her.

"WHo are you to lecture me?!".

If Sabrina was scared she didn't she show it. How she did hang her head a little, as if recalling a painful memory.

"When I said I wasn't so different I didn't just mean that I'm a psychic. I to flaunted my power . I thought my power was mine to do what i wished and that by virtue off having it i was superior to those around me."

Espeon silent.

"But I overlooked how lonely living like that was and how empty it was. Until one boy and haunter showed me the light in a series of events that didn't entirely make sense. I remembered what it was like to think of others, rather than to live only for my amusement. So I ask you again, what do you want?"

"Hmmph. I guess I want to leave."

Espeon turned and psychically lifted you and the Soul Badge, not even bothering to look back. You assumed she was walking to Celadon city

She was still silent. YOu don't remember the last time you saw her like this.
"Have I not been helping you pursue you goal? Even if it entwined with mine?"

"Yeah but she had a point, you could caused a lot of damage in Vermillion city and you could have caused a disaster in Saffron.
"
"Fine i'll shrink down when we get to Celadon. I suppose that's where we're going."

"Something else she said stuck with me to, what will we do after we beat the gym leaders and elite four?"
"I don't know, I haven't decided yet. We'll cross that bridge when we come to it.
"

"DOes the lack of challenge ever bother you?"

She paused.

"Sometimes.Though usually I enjoy it. I suppose the battle was kinda fun." She was silent again. "I always thought about getting stronger but never thought about an endgame..."
11321122321111231131121.title: To have power is not to be strong

113211223211112311311211.author_name: This site is dead.I wana leave
choices: Espeon wants to look around the city
Espeon wants to find the gym
Something interrupts you
113211223211112311311211.content:
Espeon started walking to Celadon, still unusually quiet. Even as you took to Route 7, she didn't exhibit the same delight she normally experienced towering over people, or having people and people look up at her in awe or back away in fear.

You don't remember her being silent for so long, but after a few long minutes you hear her voice in her head.

"Is not the aim of any Pokemon to be strong? As far humans believe we exist to battle."

You weren't sure what to say to that.

"Well Pokemon and humans are also companions."

"I thought humans like strong Pokemon."

"Well they do but.."

She cut you off.

"I know... I might have endangered others. I suppose there's no point being strong if I endanger others... thats not the kind of Pokemon I want to be."

"We can still have fun together, just try to consider the effect you might have on other people and Pokemon"

"I know... I got too carried away." She said sadly. Then she sniffed and raised her snout proudly. "Though I could totally have taken that Perish song."
"i don't know, its supposed to knock out any pokemon."

"Even one larger than a skyscrapper?" She made her voice boom more than normal, the vibrations making you shake.

"Well no ones tried before."

"Hmmm... I wonder just how durable I am at this size...."

You wanted to get her mind off that before she tried something crazy.

"Have you thought of what you plan to do after we get through the elite?" Barring any incidents it should be pretty easy. You didn't think even the Elite 4 would have a Pokemon that could keep up with her.

"No. But I'll keep thinking. I suppose i'l have some fun with my fans on social media... if this saffron thing doesn't cause me problems."

"You aren't going to be this big when get to Celadon city are you?"

"Obviously not. Besides even if it feels liberating I hardly need to be that big to beat any of these gym leaders pokemon!"

That was true. Even without her size ability you doubt many would have posed a challenge. Though if Sabrina was any indication, they wouldn't just rely on brute strength. And as powerful as she was one of them might even find a way to use Espeon's recklessness against her.

Espeon went quiet again.

After a short time you could see tall buildings in the distance.

Well they were tall, but most of them wouldn't even reach Espeon's knees. You had forgotten how short Route 7 was. If you could see Celadon city it was a given Celadon city could see your immense Espeon.

You were about to ask her to shrink down, when you could feel your seat shake. You instinctively clutched onto the fur in front of you and felt yourself getting lower.

Amazing, Espeon was actually shrinking herself down without you prompting! It felt strange seeing the sky move away from you and the ground rush closer.

When she stopped shrinking she was a lot smaller than before but still big. It was hard to tell how big she was, all you could really be sure of was there still a wall of pink around you and you were still smaller than one of her ears, but judging from the scenary around you, you estimate she was about the size she was in Vermillian City.

"Huh I didn't think you'd-"

"Yeah I know. I don't want to cause an earthquake. Or a riot. Though I must admit, I do feel somewhat constrained, having gotten used to my previous size."

"You're still bigger than any Pokemon I've come across."

"Thank you for saying so." You could hear and feel the happiness in her telepathic voice.

"Now when we get to Celadon city-"

"I'll try not to cause any uneeded haoc or property damage, I know. Be careaful and all that." You're sure she was rolling her eyes.

"I was going to say the Gym leader Erika. I hear she's usally nice enough but if someone insults her perfume she can turn real nasty."

"Hmmm... I'll keep that in mine."

You look down to see if she's wearing that mischievous smirk. Espeon apparently removed it quickly enough, but you were sure you could feel her face muscles twitch.
"Anyway let's go meet some adoring fans!" She said, regaining a spring her step
113211223211112311311211.title: Hope I didn't wreck things, but I have a plan

1132112232111123113112111.author_name: Just here for the poke story
choices: She plays around with you
She performs for the onlookers
She heads for the gym or something happens
1132112232111123113112111.content:
Espeon started walking around Celadon. Her pace was slower and she was actually watching her steps. And also kept her paws levitated.

Though she was trying her best, she was having trouble maneuvering through the busy streets, Celadon was much more densely packed than any other city you had gone to, with more people and more cars than anywhere either of you had been to. Whether or not this was Kanto's capital, it sure felt like it was.

Although many of the roads and streets were wider, there were also more cars and people, many not appreciating a giant Pokémon roaming through their streets, if not screaming with terror. She even, grudgingly, shrank down a little further.

"Ugh I'm not used to moving through Celadon like this. This is far harder than Vermillion.”

"This city does seem a lot more active. I hate to say it but-"

Espeon sighed.

"You want me to shrink down further?"

"Yeah."

She grunted

"Fine. I do enjoy towering over buildings, but it’s no fun having my moments be so constrained. Plus I don't want this city to view me as a menace, and I definitely don’t want the cops on me again...." She smiled devilishly. "Though knocking down those buildings was a lot of fun."

"You aren't getting any ideas more you?”

She stuck up her nose.

"Of course not! I am not some savage movie creature, I am a noble Espeon!"

She backed away from the road, used her telekinesis to lift some parked cars out of her way and slowly sat down, presumably being aware what would happen if she just slammed her rump down.

Her gem stone, and from your perspective the already tall buildings of Celadon began to rise higher. Espeon looked up at them with a sigh.

"I know you enjoyed being the biggest around, but I'm glad you're doing this."

"Thank you. I suppose."

You shuffled closer and could see a somewhat pained look on her shrinking face.

"When we leave the city you can make yourself as big as you like."

She purred.

"I suppose that’s something to look forward to."

The ground continued to race towards you and you had to admit you were missing the view your enormous Espeon provided. She was shrinking rapidly, not even half the size of the buildings she had towered over before and dwindling by the second. Was she going back to her normal size?

She levitated you off her back. Perhaps she was unsure if she could bear your weight at a smaller size? As she shrank further, she backed away, briefly taking a moment to look around before moving onto the pavement and smiling back at those cars and people who had stopped to look at her.

You also looked up, watching her shrink down. Riding her at her biggest size you felt like such a speck, though now you were almost eye level with the lowest part of your stomach. It was going to feel strange being bigger than her again, even though you still knew she was much more powerful than you. Then she was around three times you size and then, without warning she jumped on top of you!

You defiantly weren’t ready for this, she was still easily big enough to bowl you over, and you fell backwards. Just before you hit the ground the hard concrete, you felt Espeon's psychic aura around and the impact you would have felt didn’t happen.

But you still felt a wall of fluff on top of you! Even though she was still getting smaller, she was still larger enough to pin or smother you if she wished. though she wasn’t pressing down hard enough to hurt you.
This was just like when you were on the couch and she showed off her new ability for the first time. You liked her being affectionate but there a lot of people watching.

"Espeon we're in public."

She smiled at them and then back again.

"Mmmmm."

"Espeon please."

"Scratch behind my ears first." She pressed harder, still not enough to hurt, but to remind you were trapped. She lowered her head expectantly. It was obvious you were not getting out till you complied and if you tried to argue she would only keep you here longer. You did so, a couple of time still she purred and stepped off you, giving you a chance to get your feet.

You dust yourself off and looked at Espeon. She had stopped shrinking, but she was still a lot bigger than her normal size. Even standing on her four legs, she was nearly your height, while being a whole lot longer.
She smiled, standing up on her hind legs and putting a paw on each of your shoulders. Even at her diminished size you could feel it weighing you down, she could easily knock off balance if she wanted.

She was amused at the surprise on your face.

“You didn’t think I’d shrink down all the way did you?”

It did make sense, she wanted to be a more practical size, and judging from the way she looked back and forth between you and the people watching, she also wanted attention. Though maybe there was more to it than that.

She took her paws off you and waved to the onlookers, then turned back to you.

"Ugh I feel so constrained, like this but there's at least some fun I can have like this." She stood on her hind legs, and effortlessly pull you into her chest, with just enough to force to show that you couldn't escape, then let you go. Even for her size, she seemed very strong. You knew she was a gifted psychic but had you underestimated her physical strength?
1132112232111123113112111.title: Because big cities aren't built for big mons

11321122321111231131121112.author_name: Just here for the poke story
choices: You reach the gym
You talk some more
Something happens
11321122321111231131121112.content:
Espeon turned her attention to the on lookers. a crowd was gathering, even as traffic had mostly resumed, though a few cars had parked in the middle of the road at the sight of Espeon, forcing others to drive around.

Even some who had previously ran away from her were curious, presumably finding her much less scary when she wasn't monster movie size, though some were still apprehensive.

For her part she smiled and strolled some of the closest onlooker.

"I bet you've never seen an Espeon like this before, have you? Sorry if my previous size startled you, I was trying something out. Don't worry I don't bite."

Espeon always loved attention, though you weren’t sure this was the best time to be fishing for it. Still she was a
good a showperson... showmon?
