11321122322.title: Espeon's shrinking power

choices: Show you off to her friend
Explore the park a bit
Battle one of those trainers
113211223222.content:
Well, you figure that if anyone could protect you at this size it would be Espeon so perhaps you could risk a trip to the park for her. It was what she wanted and from experience you knew she can get a tad hyperactive if she doesn't get out of the house every now and then. You sighed. "Okay, okay, we can go to the park if you want but you have to look after me, all right?"

Espeon's face lit up at your words. "Of course I would look after you, let's go!" You soon found yourself being levitated over her head before the psychic energy around you suddenly dissipated. As gravity pulled you down you let out a yelp that was cut short as your body collided with the top of her head, letting you grab at her pink fur in a desperate panic. Now stabilized near the back of her head you huffed as the brief rush of adrenaline left you.

"Can you please be more careful?" You begged.

"Sorry." She feigned before crouching up. The shift in view gave you a brief sensation of vertigo as Espeon stood up and jumped her way off the couch. You almost felt like you were about to be flung off when you felt a pressure push you back down onto her. Letting out a sigh of relief you tried to calm your nerves because at least she was well aware of how vulnerable you were right now. The psychic-type was the only one that could possibly protect you if anything happened right now. Making her way through the house you couldn't help but notice how deadly the drop from the top of her body to the floor looked. Ignoring that thought you noticed Espeon had already found her way to the sliding door at the back of the house.

Using her psychic powers, the door slid open with ease. She left the house and closed the door behind her, even flicking the lock of the door up as she walked away from it. You were somewhat glad Espeon chose to avoid taking the main street to the park since you weren't really looking forward to being discovered at this size. Taking the path through the small undeveloped woodland behind your house would be a quicker route, anyway. As for your back yard, it was small but from your perspective atop Espeon's head it looked impossibly large.

You had to wonder how she was going to get out of the yard, though. A large wooden fence with trees looming over it surrounded the yard and there was no door attached to it. Was there a hole under it somewhere you didn't know about? You were snapped from your pondering as you noticed Espeon was leisurely heading straight for a segment of fence with no obvious pathway she could take. A shiver ran down your spine as you realized she was just going to jump it. "Espeon?" You worriedly called out. There was no reply but you could almost sense a mischievous smirk on her face.

You were feeling apprehensive about her doing acrobatics while you were this small so you pressed yourself down and grabbed onto her fur. You had a sneaking suspicion that she discreetly made you smaller as she made her way out of the house but you were almost glad she did because it allowed you to wrap her pink fur around your hands. Espeon poised to make the jump and you hid the view of the world from sight as you hunkered down. Gravity pulled you back as she jumped and soon you found your legs dangling free in the air when she cleared the fence, elegantly landing on the other side. Although, that elegance was lost on you as gravity caught up to you. Once again you found yourself recovering after being tossed around.

Meanwhile Espeon was walking along as if nothing happened. Catching your breath you called out to her. "Did I do something wrong?" You asked.

"No? Going over the fence was the fastest route to the park." She said. Her voice had a casual air to it but you could hear an inflection that sounded like she was trying to withhold laughter. "Besides, if you did fall off I could have easily caught you."

"I think I know what you meant when you said I wouldn't like it at first."

"Oh okay... Sorry." Espeon apologized, sounding a bit more sincere. "I'll be more careful with you, alright?"

"Thanks." You said after letting out a relieved sigh. She was just having fun but it was clear she didn't really understand things from your perspective. From the looks of things she was starting to approach the park and passing a few more trees you soon found yourself in a large plaza. In the middle was a large fountain surrounded by neatly trimmed hedges and uniform grey bricks that were stretching in a few directions to different locations of the park. There were a few people and Pokemon around the place, either out for a walk or sitting on one of the various benches talking. In the distance you could even see some trainers having a battle.

Espeon stayed at the border of the park by the trees and turned her head from side to side as if she was looking for something. Then, you found yourself being telekinetically plucked from her head and levitated in front of her face. "What should we do?" She excitedly asked. She left you no time to suggest something as she came up with suggestions of her own. "Hey, want to go challenge one of those trainers to a battle? Sitting up there you could see what a Pokemon battle is like from my perspective."

"That doesn't sound safe." You said. It also sounded like more of being thrown around like when she jumped over the fence, something that definitely won't be comfortable for you. It would definitely be a thrill-ride, though.

"You forget who you're talking to. Did you just want to go for a walk or something then? We could look around or find a nice sunny spot." Espeon suggested.

"Maybe, that sounds relaxing."

"Oh, oh, I forgot!" She suddenly piped up. "I promised my friend that I would go and meet him when I got this ability working. He lives here and he helped me learn how to use the ability properly."

"What, does he know how to change the size of things as well?" You asked.

Espeon laughed. "No, he was sort of my test subject." She must have seen the worried look you were giving her and clarified. "And no, I didn't force him, he actually volunteered to help me."

"Really?" You asked.

"Yes!" Letting out a small snicker, she continued. "Besides, I'm pretty sure he's into it."

"Huh? Okay then," you said. Moving on you tried to shift the conversation to the matter of what the two of you will be doing with your time about the park. "Alright, so How about we..."

You were cut off as Espeon suddenly started to fidget on the spot, clearly excited. You suddenly regret not spending more time with her and letting her work off some of that pent up energy. "We're gonna have so much fun! Okay, here's what we're gonna do..."

She paused for a second before she quickly decided the activity for you, swiftly levitating you back to the top of her head as she announces her decision. She decides to...
113211223222.title: Off to the park

1132112232221.author_name: Just here for the poke story
choices: Continue
Another take on this idea
Wild card option
1132112232221.content:
Espeon alternates between looking for her friends and spinning on the spot. Sometimes she got carried away and you had to hold tighter to avoid being thrown off.

"Espeon be careful!"

She smirked but tried to hide it.

"Sorry I'm not used to having a passenger."

"You're enjoying this aren't you?"

"I do admit it amuses me how my slightest movement can effect your entire body."
Demonstrating her point, she flings her hip to the left with a enough force to send you flying,only to catch you with her telekinesis.

"Espeon!"

She laughed.

"I couldn't help myself. But I promise to not let any harm befall you." She carefully put you back and waited till you were settled in. "I suppose I'll try to be a bit less... vigorous. Or i'll carry you the other way if need be."

Despite her caviler attitude, you were sure she was serious about protecting you. She sat back down, still looking for her friend. Instead of running around, she seemed content to fidget with her front paws instead. You start to relax. Although it wasn't very thick, her fur was soft and surprisingly comfortable. Then you start to wonder.

"So how did you meet this friend?" You don't remember anyone mentioning Espeon shrinking things in your walks with her.

Do I detect a note of a jealousy?" She said playfully. "He posted on my fanclub and i arranged to meet him on one of my walks." Espeon, being very independent would sometimes leave to go for walks on her own. Or other activities you weren't sure about.

"So he isn't a pokemon?"

Espeon huffed

"Ha ha. I can be friends with humans to!"

"I wasn't saying otherwise-"

"Anyway like a lot of others in my fan club he was fascinated by my powers, and he to is a budding pyschic, though nowhere near my level of course."

"Huh." You weren't sure what to say that. While the last remark might have been a little conceited, it was true you didn't know a human psychic as powerful as your espeon. But then you didn't know too many psychic in the first place. But from what you heard it was rare for them to match the more powerful psychic Pokemon.

"Oh there is he is!" Espeon reared up, waving her paws at someone. You clutched on tightly again.

She looked behind, watching you repostion yourself.

"Sorry about that, got lost in the moment.

She ran forward, though tried to make her movements more steady than before. You were not at risk of being knocked off Espeon, but you could feel a bump with each step. Looking up you see someone about your age and even of a similar appearance, smiling at your espeon with expectation and curiosity.

Espeon breaks, the sudden stop nearly flinging you forward

""Careful!""

"Sorry, still getting used to this."

The figure in front of you looks confused, not sure who Espeon is talking to. Espeon smiles and looks at him

"Oh hello Eric. You'll be happy to know I made progress."

You feel Espeon's telekinetic grip around you again as your hoisted you above her.

"This is my trainer, he's raised snce I was a little eevee"

"Uhh hi?"

Eric looks at you as though you were a science project, still with that same fascinated smile.

"Oh wow you managed to shrink him!"

Espeon gestured to Eric.

"And this is Eric, a member of my fanclub, and a budding psychic."

"Thanks but I'm nothing on you Espeon!"

She smiled at the compliment.

"Anyway would you like to see my new power first hand?"

Eric pumped his fist into the air.

"Oh yeah!"

He wasn't even a little bit nervous?

Espeon put you down her head, presumably to allow you a front row seat.

You couldn't help feel nervous.

"Espeon are you sure this is-"

"Relax I know what I'm doing."

11321122323.content:
Espeon's gem glew brightly and you suddenly felt strange. Why was everything in the room getting bigger? The pokedex in your hand felt heavier and heavier and you dropped it. As you look on the coach you notice how big Espeon looked.

"Espeon, are you shrinking me!?" You said startled before her voice chimed in your head. "Yup I am! Remember, you agreed!"

Wait your Espeon can shrink things?! But then you noticed, Espeon was taking up more and more of the coach, you weren't just shrinking she was getting bigger!
"And you're growing!"

She looked at herself, also surprised, though much less than you.

"Oh, I wasn't sure wheter to shrink you or make myself bigger, I guess I ended up doing both. What can I say? I'm still new at this."

"I hope you don't end up destroying the house."

"Relax I'm not going to get that big. Though I am curious how big I can grow..."

She stood up. It was hard to judge how big she was from your vantage point, but she looked at least twice as long as she normally appeared.

She jumped off the coach and landed in front of you, the impact almost knocking you off her your feet. She may not have been THAT much bigger, but to you she appeared gigantic! You barely came up to her knees!
Your jaw almost dropped as you looked at her, and that's when you felt yourself lifting up as she used her psychic to bring you towards her, her form even more impressive and imposing looking as she held you in front of her face. You looked at her, and she at you for a moment or two of silence before she spoke telepathically once again. "You're so small and adorable!" She seemed enthusiastic as she nuzzled you with her power against her cheek. You opened your mouth to speak, only to find that all you accomplished was getting thick, lilac covered fur in your mouth. You internally wondered just how this was possible.

You knew your Espeon was powerful. Stupidly, absurdly powerful, but this was on another level...she could SHRINK living things AND grow herself! That was absolute insanity! As you thought this, you were pulled back in front of her face, smiling at you as you took the moment to think on your words.

"Espeon...you can shrink things now... and grow them!"

"Great isn't it?"

You were still shrinking and she was still growing, now longer than your entire couch.
"How big are you gong to get and how small am I going to get?"

"I'm not sure, I think it will stop soon, and I can always try to fix it. Don't worry I won't let you get microscopic, though if you did I'd let you live on me."

You didn't appreciate the attempt at humor though you didn't feel like arguing. She placed you her head.

"How about we get outside?"

"That would be a good idea."

"And to the park! Don't worry I'll take good care of you." She said, maneuvering through you sitting room, and brushing against some furniture as she did so.

Sneaky of her to tack that on but maybe not a bad idea

113211223331.content:
It was a lazy, boring afternoon.

You sat on a chair in your kitchen, a half-drank cup of coffee and an open book in front of you.

Everything was quiet in the house, the only sound that could be heard was the noise of the pages being turned, the occasional sip you would take from your cup and the ticking of a clock on the wall.

Despite the coffee, you were starting to feel drowsy. It seemed like the ticking clock had some kind of hypnotic power. Either that, or you were incredibly bored.

You would have gladly played with your pokemon to fight off the boredom, but, sadly, she was upstairs, in your bedroom, sleeping.

You found the lines growing blurry, your whole being begging you to shut your book and take a nap.

You ignored the sensation and kept reading, sipping your coffee more often, until the cup was completely empty.

You sighed resignedly as you finally decided to listen to yourself.

Quietly, you closed your book and got up, heading to the living room where the couch seemed to be inviting you to sleep.

An invitation you gladly accepted.

You laid down, tentatively glancing at the TV. You shook your head, deciding against it.

Slowly, your eyes closed, your heart and breath slowed down as you relaxed.

Sadly, it didn't last long.

"Sy!"

Something silky and heavy dropped onto you, giving out happy cries. If it wasn't so noisy, you could've told that you were hit by a heavy, silky blanket.

Your eyes opened a bit, revealing a moving mix of white, pink and blue. You smiled: it looked like she had woken up from her own nap.

You smiled, fully opening your eyes to notice a happy Sylveon standing on top of you, staring at you.

"Yeah yeah... you wanna play Sylveon?" you laughed as she stood back, letting you sit upright. You reached out to pet her head and, in response, she nuzzled your hand lovingly.

You had Sylveon since she was an Eevee.

An Eevee that loved being around you. She was always full of energy, and liked to play with you several times a day, being pampered, and she liked you in particular. Also, she was a bit mischievous, you could tell by her sometimes sneaking behind you and performing a ‘playful’ Take Down on you. The results were hilarious... to her anyway.

It was a surprise when the little brown fox began glowing one day. When the glow died down, you had a Sylveon staring at you with glee.

Okay, maybe you expected it a bit, but it still was a big surprise: it meant that your pokemon loved you.

"Sy!" Sylveon exclaimed happily, jumping in your arms; four silky ribbons wrapped around you.

Happily, you hugged back.

She did lose some of her old habits when she evolved, though she still liked to play with you or you pampering her. Both things happened quite often.

"You're being affectionate today, huh?" you stated, Sylveon giving a happy cry in response.

Then, you took notice of something odd: one of her ribbons was pointing to the glass door that led outside, to your backyard.

"You wanna go outside, Sylveon?" you asked, well aware of what the answer was going to be. In fact, the white and pink pokemon nodded her head twice.

Silently, you put her down. She hastily jumped from the couch and ran to the glass door, standing on her hind legs as she pushed against the glass, shooting you an expectant look.

"Coming." you calmly said, happy to have something to do.

You reach the glass door and open it. Your overexcited Sylveon bolted outside. You briefly wondered why she was acting like this: she stopped being hyperactive when she evolved. Were some of her old instincts coming back?

You decided to let it slide with a shrug as you glanced at Sylveon again.

Noticing that she was sitting in the middle of the backyard, looking at you.

"On!" four ribbons rose, two pointed to you, two fell on herself.

"You... uh... want to show me something?" you guessed.

Sylveon nodded repeatedly.

You walked towards your pokemon, who craned her neck to look at you. She began snickering, and you wondered if you had to worry.

"So? What do you have to show me?" you asked.

Sylveon grinned at you, before she...
113211223331.title: Pixie surprise

11323112.content:
The summer heat combined with the physical exertion of pulling back branches and pushing past dense shrubbery left you sweating as you tried to catch up to your Ninetales. This was the fourth time this week you two had decided to go exploring in the dense forest to the side of town which was both a vast historical site and a nature reserve. A long-gone civilization used to live where the forest grew and the evidence of their once-great city lay strewn about almost everywhere. Large weathered statues, stone foundations and vine-covered pillars were intermingled among the vegetation. One of the common themes among the eroded ruins were depictions of Ninetales, be it faded stone carvings or large stone statues which led Historians to believe that this ancient society worshiped them. Although, some of them argued that they actually revered a single, specific Ninetales as a god.

Coincidentally, these ruins also happened to be where you first found Ninetales when she was just a little Vulpix.

Purely by chance, one day you got lost as you walked off one of the interpretive trails and came across a large stone statue of a Ninetales. It was sitting on its haunches on a blocky pedestal and between its two stone legs was a curled up Vulpix. She was so exhausted, bony and weak that you were able to simply scoop her up in your arms without resistance. After taking her to a Pokemon center and getting her healed up you began bonding with her and suddenly you were taking her home to live with you. Present day - she had evolved and grew into an adventurous and strong Ninetales, a stark contrast to the meek little Vulpix you first met.

Ducking under a vine-laden branch you emerged into a small clearing where your Ninetales was waiting and you could see why she was so needy in her demands for you to catch up. Rows upon rows of stone pillars jutted up into the canopy as light shafts beamed down through the trees. You had to take a moment to take in the sight before you could move again, moments like these is why you loved exploring the forest with Ninetales. The ruins covered an extremely large area and she had a knack of finding cool new areas you haven't explored yet. You couldn't stand still and take in the sight forever, though. You could see Ninetales' fluffy tails bobbing to and fro as she left and started walking in between the rows of pillars.

Catching up to her and walking between the pillars you could see that the that they were forming what looked like a walkway through the forest. Naturally, you two decided to travel along it and see where it leads. Walking besides Ninetales she would often look back up at you with her happy red eyes as she excitedly trotted along. The path was surprisingly long and even started winding to the left and right but eventually the repeating pillars abruptly ended. Looking around all you saw were trees and it didn't seem to actually lead anywhere. Pulling out your phone to check the time you decided it was probably a good idea to head home.

"Ninetales, It's about time we head back." You called out. Pulling your eyes up from the phone you noticed the distinct lack of disappointing whining and you couldn't see hide nor hair of her. It was only for the crunch of a stick did you spot her tan fur through the bushes. With a sigh you started the bush-bashing again to catch up to her. Parsing through another set of bushes and branches you emerged into a rather large clearing. A lone statue of a Ninetales stood on a small hill surrounded by nothing but grass, the trees thinning out around it to reveal the blue sky. Taking in the sight, a realization dawned on you. This was where you found Ninetales when she was just a Vulpix!

Ninetales was staring at the statue from a distance and it was clear she remembered it. You couldn't help but smile and cross your arms as she slowly approached the statue as you waited for her to finish having her sentimental moment. She drew nearer to the statue before she hesitantly brought her snout up to the weathered stone to sniff at it. You jumped in fright when the statue shined brilliantly for a second before the light appeared to transfer over to your Ninetales, your Pokemon now taking on that same glow as if she was evolving again. She was shining so bright it was difficult to look directly at her but before you knew it the glowing stopped.

You rushed over to her to check if she was okay. Kneeling down you stroked the fur on the side of her face as you tried to get her to look at you. "Are you okay, girl?" You asked her. She had a look of being utterly dumbfounded but it seemed nothing about her was changed, her expression flitting between confusion, contemplation and finally understanding. "Ninetales?"

She jumped as if she forget you were there but now she was looking at you with a happy, excited face. You rubbed the soft fur on her neck as she stared at you. The strange glow didn't seem to harm her but you could tell that something was definitely different about her. As you tried to inspect her for what could have possibly changed about her you became aware of the fact that you were having to hold your arm up higher and higher to pet the fur on her neck. Not only that but when you knelt down next to her she was eye level with you and now you found yourself craning your neck to look up at her. Your face scrunched up in confusion as you tried to comprehend what was happening...

1132322311.content:
Lights, strange noises and metal changs filled the darkened room. The casino hall was lit by one bulb and dozens of slot machines. Mike starred at the slot machine as though hypnotised. Red bags formed under his eyes and his arm had grown heavy after constantly pulling that lever but he couldn’t stop now. He was on a losing streak but he was certain the next pull would change that.

The reels turned. Another miss. He would have to try again. He pulled the leaver again. Nothing.

Mike was so absorbed by the slot machine he didn’t notice a pokeball shake loose from his belt. It dropped to the floor. With a flash of white light a Lilligant emerged from it. Several casino goes turned there heads at the sight, but Mike was still focused on the slot machine, not even noticing what had happened. The lilligant stared up at it’s trainer, surprised and somewhat distressed she hadn’t been noticed.

“Lilli?”

Mike took no notice. Could he not hear her?

Lilligant starred at him again. She didn’t know what was going on but she knew something was wrong/

“Lilligant!”

Still no response. The stranger machine clearly held her trainer captive. She tugged at him, but was ignored yet again. She applied more force, grabbing both his legs and pushing with all her might, but Mike easily pulled away.

She called to him once more and was ignored. Something needed to be done, but what?

She didn’t want to do this but saw no other way.

Lilligant looked around. There didn’t seem to be anything that could help her and her trainer wasn’t responding. Something had to be done but what?



Lilligant thought intensely. An idea occurred to her, something she normally wouldn’t do, but this was an emergency, if she didn’t act now her trainer could remain captive to that machine forever.

113232231311.content:
Uggggghhh, this is such a pain! I can’t believe I managed to get lost the second i set foot here! Now I’m stumbling around in a dark forest like an idiot to find my way back. Just great.

Why i went into this god forsaken forest in the first place was because my mother wanted me to gather berries for the cake that she was going to make, since she had sprained her ankle a little and had me do it instead. Even though it probably would’ve been easier to let me just go to a store, my mother insisted that the cake would taste better if Mother Nature had a hand in the making of it. Well, since she was stubborn to use berries not coming directly from the forest, i actually never tasted any berries coming from a store, same with all the other fruits growing in this forest, so i’m not sure if Mother Nature’s magic touch did much of anything.

Either way, i got to admit: the fruits that grow here do make for some delicious cakes as well as other pastries my mom feels makes. So despite me not knowing the layout of the forest, i agreed to go in anyway because the cake those berries were going to be a part of would’ve definitely been worth it. And yet, here i am...... *sigh*, here i am indeed.

So yeah, no dice after who-knows how many hours of wandering around aimlessly. I guess the silver lining here is that i was able to fully surround myself with Mother Nature, as well as understanding despair a little bit better. While i could say that the fact i found a good berries plucking spot was the silver lining here, it’s not like i get to enjoy those berries in the form i want, at least not today. The only thing i get to enjoy now was the dreadful taste of the despair i understand now oh-so clearly; almost tastes like bitter almonds if you ask me.

Suddenly, i could hear a faint sound coming somewhere at my right. I had no idea what it was. My best guess was that it a pokemon crying, since i find it hard to imagine a kid being here in the woods so late at night, unless they were stupid enough to get lost...... wait.

W-well it doesn’t really matter what let to this moment. If a pokemon is sad or hurt, you have to do everything you can to help them. That’s what i have been taught to do if i ever were to become a pokemon trainer. And while i am at the age to become one, i wasn’t able to since two of the three starter pokemon in Professor Elm’s lab have already been taken, and one of them has even been stolen! Though I admittedly forgot which one when the professor told me about. Following that up, he told me to come back when the replacement starter pokemon have arrived, but he also said that it will take a while since those pokemon aren’t very common, unless i was fine with taking the one remaining pokeball. I agreed to wait for the replacements because I wanted to make a decision when seeing all three at once instead of only ever seeing one and never knowing who the other two were. But come on man, I finally become the age to become a pokemon trainer and now all of this had to happen.

.....oh crap. I’m getting sidetracked here. I should go looking for that pokemon instead of complaining about my own misfortune. Hope i can be of help to them. With that, I branched off the path i was taking earlier and headed to the one on my right. Like a game of hot and cold, i felt myself getting warmer when the faint sound grew louder by each step i took. I could hear now that it was the sound of a pokemon trembling heavily; it was most likely having trouble keeping itself warm. And yes, i refer the pokemon as a “it” since I don’t know it’s gender yet. Rather be save then sorry, or wrong i guess.

Soon enough, i managed to reached the source of the sound: some rocks piled on top of each other, almost like a makeshift doghouse. When I peeked inside this l “doghouse” i able to see a small green pokemon. It was in terrible shape and the poor thing kept rolling left and right troubled in it’s sleep. It seems that it was being tormented by a nightmare.

Aside from the bruises, the most noteworthy thing about the pokemon visually was the large leaf on top of it’s head..... wait.... oh, I remember now! It was Chikorita! The one who got stolen i mean. But what was it doing here? Didn’t the thief take Chikorita with them? If so, why is it here all alone? Did Chikorita escape from the thief or has the thief disposed of Chikorita they lost interest? Either way, that thief is nothing more than a scum! I hope they get what they deserve!

.....*sigh*, but more importantly, i need to find a way to help Chikorita out, there’s just no way I’m going to leave it behind as well. I should return it to Professor Elm, at least if i ever get out of this stupid forest. Though it would probably struggle in order to break free if it were to wake while i’m carrying it, so i should make it trust me first before i do anything else.

I know I probably shouldn’t do this, but I lightly rubbed Chikorita on the head so to wake it up. Of cours I’m aware that nobody likes to be woken up while they sleep, but if they’re woken up from a nightmare then it isn’t be so bad. I kept up the rubbing until consciousness had started to return to Chikorita as it’s eyes slowly opened with a dazed expression on it’s face.

When it looked around to see what woke it up, our eyes had met each other. Now that i could properly see it’s face, i was suddenly completely certain that it was a girl. I don’t know why but I immediately believed that it was a female the second our eyes met and even now I’m having a difficult time disagreeing with it. Maybe my brain thought such cuteness was too much for a boy to pull off.

Of course, silence wasn’t going to bring us anywhere so I needed to break the ice in order to get her to trust. Not sure how it’ll go but let’s give it a shot.

“H-hi!” I said with just “absolute mastery” of my vocabulary. Ugh, is there even a worse way to start a conversation?

“......chi....chika..?”

She spoke! Well now we’re getting somewhere! Although she spoke still in her dazed state; probably thinking this was part of her dream, so I should be careful with how i phrase things to her. But that shouldn’t be too hard, right?

“I-im sorry for bothering you but you didn’t look too well to me, so i came here to see if there is a way i can help you. Don’t be afraid, there’s nothing to worry about.” I said while being glad i had put so much time to train how to handle with pokemons. I’m killing it, i tell ya!

Didn’t seem to impress Chikorita much though as she kept staring at me with that dazed expression of hers. Took her a good while to realize what i had said to her or that i was even human until her eyes shot wide open when the realization hit her like a truck. Maybe i sucked at with handling pokemon after all since she looked a lot more tense when she realized i was there. Ouch, felt like i have been stabbed through the heart. Hopefully it’s her newfound suspicion of humans and not skills as a possible pokemon trainer.

“Hey, sorry to ask you this but i need you come with me for a bit. Some nice people will be able to take care of you if you come and I don’t want to see you so hurt, so please come with me just for a little while.” I said while being aware that she probably wasn’t going to buy it.

Sure enough, that’s the case as she:
