11332.content:
Life can be really weird at times.

It was life itself that led you to take a walk in the woods for no apparent reason. For you, it was just a way to get rid of the stressful city, if only for a few hours.

Clean air, nice views and most importantly, sheer, unbroken, wonderful silence.

Your hands in your pockets, you wandered around the forest, sunlight seeping through the curtains of green leaves above, giving this place an almost surreal appearance.

You had already came in these woods before, just wishing to explore, pleasing your adventurous side, the same adventurous side you let down by refusing to become a pokemon trainer and follow a normal life.

Not that you didn't like pokemon, you just had no wish of pursuing fame or power like every trainer did. You liked to consider yourself a humble person.

Still, there were numerous, though casual times were you got the chance to see pokemon from up close.

For example, there were plenty of critters usually coming near your place seeking for food or, in case of particularly playful ones, a playmate.

Like your neighbor's Meowth, who apparently never got tired of sneaking inside your house to steal stuff and watch you struggle to retrieve it with its hateful grin on its face.

Pokemon simply entertain you for a while before leaving, and it was perfect like this.

And in these occasional walks through the woods, you always saw plenty of pokemon, who would briefly observe you before taking its leave, startled by the sudden appearance of a human.

Today seemed like any other one you decided to take a walk.

You could never guess how wrong you were.

Usually, you never ventured too deep in these woods lest you met some particularly dangerous pokemon; but today, you decided to get rid of that stupid fear of yours.

You never met any dangerous pokemon, what could go wrong if you just went a little deeper?

Soon, you came to a point where vegetation became thicker, where sunlight struggled to penetrate with the result of this part of the woods being darker.

A bit spooked but not daunted, you kept walking, curious to see what was on this side of the forest.

Back in town, several stories were told, the most famous being the one that a powerful pokemon resided deep in this forest.

You wondered what'd happen if you ran into such beast and if it was anything but friendly.

You shivered slightly at the sensation, but kept walking... only to come to a halt shortly after - haven't you already gone past that weirdly-shaped tree? You were sure you did.

Shrugging, you decided you must have been mistaking and resumed walking, though you could not deny you were beginning to feel a bit uncomfortable.

Then, you began feeling a new though familiar sensation - you were being watched.

Hastily, you looked around, spotting nothing. Yet you were sure you heard a noise behind you...

Okay, now you were officially scared and began looking around frenetically, the same noise you were sure you heard ringing around.

Finally your gaze landed on a particular tree... on a branch, you spotted a Pidgey chirping.

Tranquilized, you put a hand to your chest, waiting for your heart to calm down while mentally scolding yourself for being scared.

There was nothing to be scared of here, you mused while taking a step, then another, resuming your walk.

However, the sensation you were being watched didn't end, and once again fear began invading your heart.

That was it, you decided before turning around, this was the end of your stroll.

As you were about to walk away the way you came from, your gaze casually landed on what appeared to be... something flying through the air and behind a tree.

A tiny hand poked out from behind said tree as well a shining blue eye, which briefly landed on you before its owner retreated upon taking notice you were aware of its presence.

Confused, startled and curious, you made your way to the tree, cautiously peering behind it to see-

You were stunned to indescribable levels.

In front of you, staring at you with an intimidated gaze, was a small, slim green pokemon, hovering in mid-air thanks to a pair of tiny wings on its back; it had bright blue eyes and two tiny antennae on top of its head, which was shaped like a seed. Dark eyelids surrounded the eyes of the creature, who also has long, slender arms but almost comically short legs with petite, toeless feet.

A quick glance at the pokemon's lower body made you blush furiously as you spotted its-

Weren't legendary supposed to be genderless? Because this one was clearly a female, you mused awkwardly.

All of a sudden, you realized the stories they told back in town were true - there WAS a powerful pokemon living deep in this forest.

And what pokemon could be more powerful than the mythical Celebi?

You stepped back - you just got to meet Celebi, which could easily be the equivalent of striking gold!

"Hey there little one," you began after calming down a little - though she was considered very very powerful, this creature was supposed to be friendly,
"Did I scare you? I'm sorry." you reached out a hand to pet the head of the legendary, who briefly glanced at your hand, then back at you.

"Now, if you just allow me to-" your hand slid towards your pocket.

You intended to just take out your phone to take a picture of the legendary, but she evidently mistook your intentions.

Perhaps she thought you wanted to pull out a poke-ball or some sort of weapon to stun her, point is the time-traveler didn't let you.

A cry came from the Celebi as she extended her paw forward, blasting you with a psychic attack which sent you flying; surprised, you didn't even notice when your head hit a tree.

You were already unconscious before you ungracefully fell to the ground.

As for the legendary who struck you, she hoverer over your body, her tiny hands over her mouth.

Her move had a side effect she did not know about, she noted.

The legendary tried to reverse what she had done, not wanting to leave a harmless creature, not even a human, to such fate.

Sadly, the fairy couldn't do anything for your current situation despite all of her efforts.

A sigh escaped her lips.

How did she even manage to shrink someone to such pathetically small size, she wondered.
11332.title: The wrong side of the forest

choices: Groudon.
Next.
11333.content: How about the legendary ground type Groudon.
11333.title: Other legendary pokemon

choices: Latias
Latios
Neither, next
113332.content: How about Latias and Latios, but who will get the power to control size?
113332.title: Wonder twin legendaries, go

choices: Yes!
Nope!
1133323.content: How about you met a Shaymin who gain ability to change size?
1133323.title: The gratitude pokemon?

choices: The Shaymin timidly approaches you...
The Shaymin runs off in fear!
11333231.content:
A quiet day, the nice sunshine and a stroll through the forest.

Yup.

This is what you'd call the start of a nice day. You aimlessly walk through the forest, your mind free from any thoughts at all and your nose filled with fresh air.

Then, you suddenly come into a small clearing. Just an ordinary clearing, you note... except for a large patch of colorful flowers right in the middle.

You smile to yourself as you walk towards the flowers and pick a pink one up...

Only to immediately let it go when the thing actually moves!

You step back as a startled, small creature runs out from the flowers.

You look at it as it looks back at you terrified. You notice that it's a small white hedgehog with grass instead of quills and pink flowers on the sides of its head and green eyes.

A Shaymin.

You just found the legendary Shaymin!

"H-Hey little guy," you gently say, remembering the nature of such pokemon, shy and easily scared.

"I'm sorry for scaring you..." you apologize as you kneel down, starting to pet the Shaymin on the head.

It tries to back away, but you keep it down with your hand as you keep rubbing its head.

The Shaymin closes its eyes and starts shaking, before giving a small cry, the flowers on its body releasing pollen all around.

Startled, you stagger to your feet.
"Wha-" you say, before inhaling some of the pollen. Immediately, you feel very dazed.

You stumble around, trying to snap out of it, but you end up falling down to the ground. The silhouette of the Shaymin rushing behind a tree is the last thing you see as you black out...

--

You fidget in your sleep as you start to regain consciousness.

What happened?

You recall walking through the forest, meeting the Shaymin... but then?

You hazily open your eyes. Initially, all you see is an indistinct mix of green.

But then, as things begin to take a shape, you notice you're still in the forest, surrounded by green, thin, leafless trees...

Your eyes shoot open as you abruptly sit upright and start looking around.

You look down, noticing that the ground is way closer than before...

Your mind puts two and two together: those aren't trees. Those are blades of grass!

You shrunk!

"Wha- what happened to me?!" you cry in alert, before remembering.

The Shaymin... that pollen must have been the cause... there's really no other explanation, you figure.

You stand up, noticing that you're barely taller than the grass, meaning that you must be an inch or so tall...

"This... is a nightmare..." you mumble as you pinch yourself. Nope, you're wide awake.
"Damn..."

You desperately look around, hoping that someone would pass by so you could get help... but that's when you spot something peering in your direction from behind a tree.

The Shaymin!

"Hey! You!" you cry. Immediately, the legendary hides behind the trunk.

You sigh, yet again remembering that you shouldn't startle it. If you manage to befriend it, you could convince it to help you... possibly, if it shrunk you, it can also give your size back!

"Hey," you start in a quieter tone.
"I'm... I'm sorry I startled you earlier. But I swear - I meant and mean you no harm! Just come out please!" you exclaim.

Slowly, the white muzzle of the Shaymin comes out from behind the tree as it looks at you with its green eyes as it tries to decide whether should it trust you or not.
11333231.title: A rough meeting

choices: "I... I guess I can try to help you..."
"I... I don't know how to help... but I could keep you with me..."
"I... I don't know how to help... but I could bring you out of the forest..."
113332311.content:
You watch as the Shaymin looks down, before quietly coming out from behind the tree and slowly walking towards you.

You sigh in relief, glad that the legendary is able to understand you.

The Shaymin halts as it steps in front of you, timidly sitting down in front of you.
"H-Hey..." you start, taking notice that as one of the Shaymin's flowers.

It stares at you in silence for a good minute, before...

"What do you want from me...?" it asks, sounding female.

You look bemused for a moment.
"Y-You talk!" you exclaim, causing the Shaymin to shiver and leap back.

She suddenly turns around, seemingly wanting to leave, but you stop her,
"W-Wait! Don't you see I'm harmless?" you cry, making the hedgehog slowly turn around again.

Slowly - very slowly - she steps towards you again.
"You... You scared me..." she says meekly as she sits down in front of you.

You sigh.
"I... I need help. Could you... grow me back, please?" you ask.

Shaymin looks at you with a hint of sadness, before shaking her head.
"I'm sorry... I don't know how I could..." she admits.

Your heart skips a beat.
"But... you did this to me! Don't you know how to turn me back to normal?" you ask.

Again, Shaymin's head moves sideways.
"I... I don't know how I did that... I simply did..." she says.
"I'm sorry...

You look down, sighing.

Does this mean you'll have to stay this size for the rest of your days? How are you going to survive at such vulnerable size? Your only chance would be sticking to someone...

You look up at the towering Shaymin, who now seems comfortable with you.

Maybe...

"Could you... help me please?" you ask as gently as you can.

Shaymin looks confused.
"I... I would help you, but I don't know how..." she meekly says.

"B-But... you can't simply leave me here! I need you to help me... I won't make it out of this forest alive without help..." you say.

Shaymin looks at you pitifully.

"Please..."

The grass type stare at you for a while, trying to formulate an answer, before finally speaking again.
113332311.title: Seeking help from a shy giantess

choices: "I'll... I'll stay with you..." you said
"I'll... I'll be fine on my own... but thanks anyway..." you said
1133323112.content:
"I-I... I don't know how I could help you..." the Shaymin timidly said.
"B-But maybe... I could keep you with me... if you'd like..."

You perked up.

She wanted to keep you? What did that even imply? Living in the forest, shrunk to the size of a really small doll with some shy pokemon who was the cause of your shrinking?

"B-But... how am I going to stay with you...?" you asked incredulously.

Shaymin sat down, giving you an uncomfortable look.
"I... I don't know... it could be fine..." she said.

"... This is absurd... how am I going to live? I can't do anything at this size! Even a Magikarp is a threat to me!" you yelled in frustration, and Shaymin hastily got up and backed up, startled.

"Aw - come on! I'm not going to do anything to you Shaymin!" you cried, walking closer to the grass type, who blushed.
"Sorry..." she mumbled quietly, before offering a small smile.
"And about you sticking with me... I'd take care of you... I'd feed and protect you until we figure out how to help you..." she said.

You went quiet and meekly looked at the giantess, considering your options.

You were probably the smallest living being on the planet right now and you could either stick with Shaymin or take your chances on your own.

And, while trying to survive on your own made as much sense as trying to fight a Garchomp with bare hands, sticking with Shaymin wasn't exactly what you'd call the best option.

The giantess was shy, and practically scared of her own shadow, how could she offer a decent protection against dangers? Heck, she could be a danger.

"I..." you try to speak, but quiet down, uncertain on what to do.

The grass type stares at you, waiting for any kind of answer... she was hoping you'd stick with her. She felt guilty for accidentally shrinking you down, and the only thing she could do to make it up to you was protect you...

"I... I'm not sure Shaymin..." you told her, and she smiled a little.
"Take your time... decide." she said comprehensively.

You took another minute to ponder about this.

But you finally made your choice.
1133323112.title: An offer of help

choices: Shaymin made it to a small cave and released you
Shaymin accidentally swallowed you!
Shaymin suddenly encountered another pokemon...
11333231121.content:
You opened your mouth, a loud sigh erupting from it.

How did you even end up in this situation...?

Shaymin sat in front of you, waiting for an answer. You meekly looked up, adopting a resigned expression.

"... Fine. I'll stay with you," you said.

This could be literally your only chance of getting help, you couldn't risk to waste it.

Shaymin's face seemed to brighten up as a smile appeared.

"Good... I promise I'll take good care of you..." she whispered, flushing red.

You didn't answer.

The grass-type stepped forward. You saw her lips parting slowly.

"Hey!" you exclaimed, causing the hedgehog giantess to snap back in place, startled.
"What are you doing?" you continued.

Shaymin blushed as she meekly looked at the ground.

"I-I t-thought... I'd need someplace t-to carry you..." she stuttered shyly.

"... Carry me where?" you asked. Again, Shaymin's cheeks flared up.
"I... we need to go somewhere safer... If I'm going to protect you, we can't stay o-out here... I could lose you..." she timidly explained.

"... And you want to carry me in your mouth?" you questioned, dumbfounded. A mouth was an all-but-safe mode of transport... if she so much thought about swallowing, you'd be dead.

The grass-type hedgehog started nodding slowly.
"I-I know it's not safe... b-but I need to hide you," she said gently.

You relented a bit.

"Look... you need to be careful with me... I'm too fragile right now, this is really, really scary..." you explained, and she nodded.

"I'm not going to hurt you... I'll be very c-careful," for a moment, her voice was firm, before it became shaky again.

She leaned forward, mouth opening again. This time, you remained silent and stood tall as her pink insides were exposed for the second time.

Shaymin placed her mouth near you, her warm breath blowing past you gently.

"Chimb igh..." a sonic wave assaulted your ears as she spoke, keeping her mouth open.

You reluctantly took a step forward, but your body refused to take another.

"Is this... really necessary?" you asked, unsure about this whole thing. One wrong flip of Shaymin's tongue and you'd be thrown into her throat, sliding down the tight tube before landing into her stomach and melting away in a pool of gastric acid. The mere thought made you go white as a sheet.

Maybe you should have considered better before accepting her protection...maybe you were still in time...

Shaymin closed her mouth, smiling a bit, reassuringly.

"It's full of other pokemon in this forest... they may want to eat or hurt you and I need to hide you somewhere..." she explained again,
"Whenever you're ready..."

Again, Shaymin opened her mouth.

You gulped, before reluctantly stepping forward, forcing yourself to walk towards Shaymin.

"B-Be careful..." you meekly stammered, before leaping inside the confines of her mouth.

Slowly, the lips fell back in place, sealing you in darkness.

You discovered that being inside of another living being was totally weird.

You were trapped in a dark, wet, sticky and hot place. Big drops of saliva fell from the fleshy ceiling and onto the squishy floor that was the tongue. Behind you - you accurately avoided to look at it - was a large pit that lead to a certain death; all around you, white teeth that could crush your bones into dust.

A rhythmic sound echoed inside the slick cavern: Shaymin's heartbeat.

Your surroundings shook and you fell onto the soft, slick tongue, getting bombarded by drops of saliva.

You could only assume that the hedgehog started walking, hopefully towards somewhere safe.

She was walking slowly, you noted from the weak vibrations that were caused by her steps.

You sat inside the mouth for an incalculable amount of time.

The only thing you could do to keep your mind off things was constantly wiping the saliva from your body, saliva that was almost immediately replaced by other drops of the sticky liquid.

You choked back a sigh, avoiding to get a disgusting mouthful of spittle.

When was Shaymin going to let you out...?
11333231121.title: The shrunken and the shy

choices: She tries more to make you feel better
She catches on and leaves you be for now
113332311211.content:
You sat for a while in the darkness, trying to stay as far away from the pit behind you and the teeth in front of you as you could...it was slimy, wet, sticky and humid but you couldn't help but shiver as reality seeped in.

What started as a nice day turned real south real quick...you were pitifully small, and in the...hands? paws?...care of a pokemon that could talk to you. A legendary even...but she was very shy, scared of her own shadow, and didn't really seem to know how she even shrunk you.

You didn't know if you'd ever be big again. She said she'd take care of you, but what did that mean? A diet of water and berries for the rest of your life in a cave while Shaymin hid you from anything she perceived to be a threat...which you were sure was everything.

To be fair, everything WAS a threat to you now.

Your thoughts were cut off as you saw the wall of teeth in front of you part and her mouth opened. A breeze came into her mouth as the outside temperature caught you, you shivered again, damp from saliva as you climbed out to find yourself in a cold cave, on a harsh stone floor.

"See...I was careful..." Shaymin said gently as you looked up at her towering visage. You started rubbing your arms, trying to get sticky saliva off as she pushed a leaf towards you to dry yourself off.

"...Thank you." You said, as you used it to try and absorb the saliva. Shaymin just smiled at you, she could tell you truly were grateful to her efforts at least.

"This is where I live...where we live for now I suppose..." She said as you looked around. There was a little bed of soft looking grass in the corner...but other than that, it just seemed to be a cold, quiet and dark cave.

"...kinda dreary, isn't it?" You said and she frowned.

"Oh, not at all...it's perfectly safe...no one to chase me or...c-catch me." She said as you looked to the quivering giantess in front of you.

You almost wanted to ask why she was so shy, but that last thing you needed was to get kicked out of this cave...or for her to get mad at you.

You opted for silence.

"...um...just outside the cave is a little stream...and I get berries from pretty close too. When you need anything please let me know...i'll help you, okay?" She said as she looked at your still shivering form.

You must've looked pathetic to her...but she nuzzled you all the same, leaning her head down and into your small form. You think she was trying to comfort you, but the close vicinity of her face only proved to make you more nervous around this titan.

What an existence...
113332311211.title: Into the cave

choices: "L-Let's get to know each other," Shaymin timidly suggested
"Want something to eat?" Shaymin asked
1133323112111.content:
You took a step back, putting some distance between you and Shaymin's large cheek.

The shy giantess looked at you after noticing the she was nuzzling the air; she smiled shyly.

"Are you still sad?" she asked gently.

You didn't reply.

‘Yes, I'm sad... you did this to me, and you don't know how to make me normal again...’ you sourly thought, still shivering because of the cold air on your damp clothes and body.

You truly appreciated what she was doing for you, but the fact that she was the one shrinking you didn't let you feel completely safe around her.

Almost as if sensing your thoughts, Shaymin smiled reassuringly.

Once again, she closed the distance between you and her.

"Come on, cheer up a bit... I-I know, it was my fault and I-I'm sorry about this b-but I'll try to protect you the best I can," she said.

You huffed.

"Everything and everyone is a threat to me..." you stated calmly.
"Then I'll protect you from everything and everyone," for the first time, you saw a hint of determination on Shaymin's face.

You thought about something to answer with, but you ultimately opted to remain silent. You distractedly resumed removing the sticky saliva from your body with the now soaked leaf the giantess gave you.

Your silence was an enough of an answer to Shaymin, who gently leaned forward, her lips parting.

For a moment, you thought that you offended her and that she was going to eat you.

But all your fears proved to be for naught.

Shaymin's lips closed around the back of your shirt, her cheeks flaring up as she started walking towards the patch of grass where she probably slept.

Quietly, the grass hedgehog stepped on the tickling grass and gently let you down; you estimated that you were as tall as a blade of grass.

"It'll be fine, human," she said, and for the first time you detected a cheerful tone in her usually low, squeaky voice.

You sat down, sighing resignedly, without replying.

Shaymin laid down beside you.

You noticed her closing her eyes, adopting a focused expression in the meantime. She let out a grunt as she shook a bit... all she accomplished was a cloud of pollen being ejected from the flowers on the sides of her head.

She blushed again, looking at you dejectedly.

"Sorry... I don't know how to grow you back..." she said.

You sighed.
"Appreciate the effort..." you said, waving a hand.

Shaymin's blush spread throughout her face.

Maybe it was inappropriate - she literally just met you - but she knew no other method to make you feel better... and, considering she was the one shrinking you, she had to make things right. Plus, you were still shivering; some warmth wasn't going to hurt you.

How did she even manage to shrink you, she wondered, she never knew she could do that...

You noted Shaymin's fore-paws suddenly sliding out from under her white body as they reached for you. You couldn't describe your shock when two soft paws grabbed a hold of you, her smooth paw-pads pressing into your sides as Shaymin pulled you towards her.

The hedgehog giantess raised her head a bit and pushed you into her smooth cheek, which was burning bright red.

Shaymin was hugging you.

You too blushed.

The white and green giantess kept you restrained in a hug for a while. And you had to admit, you felt slightly better.

Despite the cold insides of the cavern, Shaymin's bodily warmth was the same, and she was warming you up as well.

Maybe she was called the Gratitude Pokemon for this, because she made others feel grateful towards her?

Slowly, Shaymin released you, blushing and smiling at once.

"Feel better?" she asked softly, causing you to smile a little.

"Actually... yes. I feel slightly better, thank you..." you responded with sincerity.

Shaymin blushed again, not used to others thanking her for a simple hug... not that she had anybody to give hugs to though.

"Y-You're welcome," she said.

You smiled at her again, before giving a sigh.

"... What now, Shaymin? Are we going to be cooped up in here the whole time?" you asked.

She smiled.

"Well... maybe I could bring you out sometime... when nobody is around..." she replied,
"As for now..."
1133323112111.title: The soft embrace of a sorrowful hedgehog

choices: Go to sleep
Ask Shaymin about herself
11333231121112.content:
"T-There's a few berry bushes outside... If you're hungry I can go get some." Shaymin softly asked.

Now that she mentioned it you did feel really hungry, the thought of food bringing on an involuntary growl from your stomach. You blushed, but thankfully it seemed she didn't notice. "Food would be good." You say up to her.

A smile spread on her face. "Okay, I'll be right back!" She said as she turned around and waddled outside, leaving you alone in the dim cave sitting on the bed of over-sized grass. It certainly wasn't where you thought you would be when you decided to take that morning walk earlier this day. For now, though, all you could do is hope that Shaymin could figure out how to reverse whatever she did to you, but it seemed you were going to have to hunker down with this shy Pokemon for a while until that happened.

Your attention was already brought to the entrance of the cave as you saw Shaymin pop back into view, the grass hedgehog holding a pair of pink berries by the stems in her mouth. Coming back to your position on the grassy bed, she gently lowered the berries before you - and you had to say, they were absolutely massive. The pink heart-shaped berry was nearly twice your height!

"Thanks" You say to your gracious host as you size up your meal. A Pecha berry, if you remembered correctly.

"These ones are my favorites." Shaymin quietly declared as she started chewing on her own berry.

The berry before you was almost intimidating. Where do you start? Pressing your hand against the berry it felt surprisingly soft and with a bit of effort you were able to dig your hand into the juicy flesh. With a handful of Pecha you start eating the surprisingly sweet berry. Unfortunately it was incredibly difficult not getting saturated in sticky juices as you ate, a fact that Shaymin quickly picked up on as she put down another leaf beside you to clean yourself with. "Thanks." You simply say while suppressing your embarrassment.

Eventually your feasting ended and you couldn't eat another bite, the Pecha berry still mostly intact after your meal. "Are... Are you full?" Shaymin asked, her eyes trained on the berry, clearly still hungry.

"Yeah, thanks. You can have the rest if you want." You said. Shaymin took the berry and you waited as she made quick work of it. Your eyes wandered over to the front of the cave where you could see dull orange light beaming in through the entrance. Was it really the late afternoon already? You shuddered a bit as you could feel the cool night air starting to seep into the cave.

"We s-should stay inside until tomorrow morning..." Shaymin muttered as she looked out the cave, too. "I-It's not safe at night, a lot of strong Pokemon come out when its dark, u-usually."

That was easy enough to understand, although the only activity you could really do in the darkening cave was go to sleep until the sun rose again. Shaymin looked concerned as she saw you looking throughout the cave. "Um... S-Sorry there isn't much to do in here..." She said. "I usually go to bed when the sun sets."

"That's alright" You sighed as a weak gust of wind made you shiver.

"A-Are you cold? You can come lay against me if you are. I-I don't mind."

She looked almost visibly upset at the fact you were cold and it was clear she was feeling bad about the situation she put you in. It was a tempting offer though, looking up at Shaymin it reminded you of the hug you shared before and how warm and comforting it was. The current time was a good few hours before your regular bedtime and you weren't at all tired but you felt you could fall asleep laying against something soft and warm. Instead of going to sleep right away, there was also the option of spending some time you talking with her. Besides, it would be helpful to know more about the Pokemon that was going to be acting as your caretaker.
11333231121112.title: Gracious host

choices: The next morning...
During the night...
113332311211121.content:
You pondered the possibility of talking to Shaymin, know something more about her, but you quickly discovered that you were in no mood to talk.

However, Shaymin misunderstood your lack of words and actions.

You saw her blushing, looking down at the ground, a rather disappointed expression painted on her face.

"I-It's okay... If you don't want s-sleep here... with m-me..." she said shyly.

"What?" you said as another gust of wind penetrated the already cold cavern, causing you to shiver,
"N-No, I'm fine with it Shaymin..."

To empathize your words, you walked towards the hedgehog giantess and stared at her for a moment, wondering what you should have done.

Then, you uncertainly sat down in front of her and laid back against one of her white cheeks, which was just as smooth and warm as it was before. Shaymin was certainly the only source of warmth inside this cavern.

The grass-type smiled timidly as she saw you leaning back against her.

"Are y-you c-comfy?" she asked.

No reply.

You WERE somewhat comfy, but your butt was still on the soft yet cold grass, and yours wasn't a comfortable position.

"H-Hey..." Shaymin stuttered, drawing your attention.
"Hmm? Oh, yeah, I'm comfy. Don't worry." you replied, but your expression betrayed your words.

Surprisingly, Shaymin smiled.

"If you're not... y-you could climb onto my b-back..." she offered, causing you to perk up.

"What?"

"Y-Yeah... just climb onto my ba-back... trust m-me, you'll be c-comfy up there..." she assured, flushing bright red as she did.

You looked at the white wall in front of you, a green field on top of it, two gigantic pink flowers laying at the sides of Shaymin's head.

A doubt penetrated your thoughts.

"Ehm..."

"G-Go ahead... it's fine." she reassured, though she was still blushing.

"That's not... how am I supposed to climb?" you said, noting the lack of fur on Shaymin.

Again, she smiled.

And you suddenly found her nose, and when muzzle, sliding forward, between your legs.

Then, before you could try to protest, up went your world as you made a short flight before landing on top of Shaymin's back, which was incredibly soft.

The grass that naturally grew on her back was beyond simple grass: it was exceptionally smooth and warm, it almost felt like fur at contact; the two flowers at the sides of her head gave away a sweet scent, almost as if they were welcoming you to your new bedding.

"S-So?" Shaymin chimed beneath you,
"H-How is it?"

"It's... great Shaymin, really. Thank you." you said sincerely, appreciating the effort the hedgehog was making to make it up to you.

Even though you couldn't see her face, you guessed that Shaymin was blushing and smiling at once, because no reply came to your comment.

"Well... g-good night..." she stammered shyly, clearly not entirely comfortable with your closeness.

"Yeah... good night Shaymin..." you responded as you sank into the soft grass of Shaymin's back.

Soon enough, you felt the ground beneath you rising and falling, suggesting that Shaymin was asleep; shortly after that, you fell asleep too.

Darkness came to claim your consciousness, and you let it end your (not completely) disastrous day without opposing.
113332311211121.title: A night in the grass

choices: "W-Well... m-maybe we can walk around for a while..."
"Le-Let's go back... w-we can talk for a bit, if that's o-okay..."
"Actually... co-could you help me with something?"
1133323112111211.content:
Sunlight crept inside the cavern, bringing the slightest hint of warmth after a cold night, though you had spent it in the smooth fur of Shaymin.

You woke up first.

Your eyes opened, your mouth yawned and your hands rubbed your eyes to physically get the drowsiness out of them.

You sat up and looked around, finding yourself surrounded by green. For several seconds you were utterly confused.

But then, memories began seeping back into your mind as you remembered what had happened yesterday: you met Shaymin, she shrunk you down and then promised to keep you safe out of regret.

The ground under you began shaking; a loud moan erupted from the giantess resting beneath you.

Upon waking up, Shaymin drowsily blinked several times, before looking around. She adopted a dejected expression.

"O-Oh... was it a-all a dream?" she asked herself, and you got that she was talking about you.

"Trust me, I only wish this all was a dream..." you chimed out loud, causing Shaymin to jump up in surprise,

"Oh!"

The landing caused as much tremors as the leap itself, but also made you fall down onto the smooth back of the hedgehog giantess.

"Careful there..."

Shaymin blushed.

"Y-You're still there?" she asked, and a sigh of relief followed the question.

"S-Sorry..." she added.

You got back on your feet and traveled to the edge of Shaymin's head, where the two large pink flowers were; a nice yet strong scent assaulted your nose, which you had to cover.

"Um... is it okay if...?" you asked,

"Oh?... Oh, s-sure. Climb down..." Shaymin replied, and you stepped forward, sliding past the eyes of the giantess and landing on top of her nose: being able to stand on it only made you feel pathetic in comparison to this hedgehog.

Shaymin smiled and gently lowered her nose so that you could jump down, getting lost in the jungle that was the grass bed where she slept.

"Sle-Slept well?" she asked, blushing furiously.

You took a moment to consider the question and smiled,

"... Yeah. It was nice." you admitted, blushing yourself while causing Shaymin's own blush to grow brighter, but also making the giantess smile.

The legendary's smile then faded as she suddenly began shooting random stares across the cavern, avoiding your gaze.

Then, before you could ask what was going on, she looked back at you; she stared at you intently for a second, before reluctantly leaning forward.

"Uhh-" you discovered how hard it was to talk when a giant is busily nuzzling you.

You found Shaymin's reddened cheek brushing against you softly, for a brief time, before she stood on all fours.

"... I-I'll get us something to eat now... wanna come with me?" she asked.

Your dry throat reminded you that you haven't been drinking since you were shrunken down.

"Um, yeah. I'm thirsty." you replied. Shaymin didn't need to hear more.

With two quick moves of her nose, you were back onto what had been your bed throughout the whole night.

Without talking, Shaymin walked out of the grass bed and headed for the exit of the cavern, stepping out.

Sunlight bathed both you and your host, who stretched while a pleasant feeling spread through her body.

Then, Shaymin resumed walking; true to what she had previously said, after a short trip, you came across a stream of water.

The legendary you were riding made her way to it and stopped, while you repeated the process of sliding down on her nose, which the hedgehog helpfully lowered for you.

You thanked her and knelt by the stream so that you could drink; behind you, you heard Shaymin muttering a ‘You're welcome’, before you felt tremors beneath yourself.

You rose from the water to look backwards, noticing that Shaymin was walking away from you.

You watched as she walked towards a few bushes, grabbed a hold of something with her mouth and pulled back, two Pecha Berries held by their stems in her closed lips.

The giantess walked back to you, placing the food in between you and her.

"Y-You seemed to like them y-yesterday..." she recalled with a blush, before hastily beginning to eat her meal. You emulated her.

Shaymin's berry disappeared in a few bites; yours was still far from being half-eaten when you pulled back from it, letting the hedgehog finish it up.

"So..." you chimed,
"What do you usually do in the morning?... We aren't going back in the cave, are we?"

Shaymin smiled.
1133323112111211.title: Good morning, giant world!

choices: ... Sneasel!
... Pikachu!
... Another legendary?!
11333231121112111.content:
"Well, I usually walk around for a while after I eat. M-Maybe we can do so..." Shaymin timidly stammered, though she wore a smile on her face.

You, on the other hand, looked perplexed.

"... Didn't you mention there were dangerous pokemon around here?" you recalled.

The hedgehog nodded.

"Y-Yes... but it'll be quick, i-if you want..." she said, shivering at the thought of big bad pokemon chasing her down just to get the human she was housing and protecting.

You thought about it, and decided to agree.

Walking around was way better than being confined in a cave all day.

Though being confined in a cave was way better than being confined in the stomach of some random pokemon.

"Yeah," you replied while shaking the thought off by moving your head back and forth,
"Let's do it Shaymin..."

"Marvelous!" she exclaimed in a happy tone, before blushing madly upon realizing that she nearly broke both your eardrums.

She could tell, given how you were holding your ears and glaring at her.

"S-Sorry," she apologized, before adopting a small smile.
"Don't worry, I will protect you."

"I sure hope so..." you said while Shaymin's nose slid in between your legs, before she gently tossed you on top of her back.

"Let's go..."

With that, Shaymin began walking, each step she took causing you to shake on top of her back.

You didn't mind though, you were comfortable and the flowers up here smelt good. You allowed yourself to relax as you rode the giantess, who walked in silence.

The morning forest was pretty peaceful, you discovered, and you caught yourself thinking about the possibility of its inhabitants being all nocturnal predators, which would have justified the lack of pokemon around.

You discarded the idea, though, Shaymin wasn't a nocturnal predator, and quite certainly there were other pokemon too.

You only hoped you didn't run into them. Not every pokemon was going to be as nice as Shaymin, you figured, and Shaymin was nice only because she was tremendously shy.

"Isn't this n-nice?" the giantess stuttered from beneath you as she walked aimlessly.

"Um? Oh, yeah. It is quite peaceful..." you admitted.

Though you couldn't see it, you were sure that Shaymin was smiling.

"So... aside from walking around, what else do you do?" you asked, trying to make casual conversation.

"Not much... you know, t-there isn't much to do aside from exploring, eating and sleeping." Shaymin replied.

"Seems-"

"... Boring?" Shaymin finished before you could, and you swore you felt the skin beneath her smooth fur burning hot.
"Oh no, it isn't like that! I-I mean, when there are predators or other humans I run... that's kinda-" she trailed off, and you repressed a laugh. Seeing her acting like that was adorable, despite the fact you couldn't see her face.

"... Shaymin, why do you run?" you asked instead.

"H-Huh?"

"I mean," you began to explain, feeling like this wasn't the right question to ask,
"... Why do you run? Don't you ever try to fight back?... I mean, you're a legendary, no?"

At this point, the giantess stopped, and your feeling became a certainty.

"... I'm sorry." you said before she could say anything, hanging your head shamefully.

She was doing so much for you and you were repaying her by asking questions she didn't want to answer to.

"For what?" came her voice.

You saw her head shaking.

"No... it's just... I d-don't like fighting like certain pokemon do." a deep sigh,
"... But it's not always like this. There's another side of me... one much braver than I currently am... I know, you think I'm a coward."

"Shaymin," you started, your hand beginning to slide across the hedgehog's back as you caressed her,
"I don't think you're a coward. You're helping me when others would have simply left me on my own. You're not a coward, you're wonderful. I-I'm just trying to get to know you better..." you admitted.

At this point, the skin beneath your hands began burning with great intensity as she blushed, while a smile grew wide on her face.

"I-If that's the case..." she said after a few moments of being silent,
"... You see, I c-can change. With a special kind o-of flower-"

"Wait... is it called ‘Gracidea Flower’?" you interrupted, sure you read about the same thing Shaymin was talking about somewhere.

She turned her head up (you noticed the massive blush that never left her cheeks during your conversation) and gave a slight nod.

"... I can change my form," she continued,
"... B-But my personality changes as well. T-That Shaymin isn't like I am. That Shaymin is tougher... "

"And you can fly too?" you asked, now remembering a few things,
"... Your other form is called ‘Sky Forme’, right?... I read about thi- I mean you on a book or something..." you clarified as you noticed her confused expression, which probably came from the fact you seemed to know more about her than she did.

Again, she blushed.

"Yeah..." she replied while looking away for a second, before looking at you again; this time, she wore a small smile.

"N-Now, I told you everything about me..." her blush covered a good percentage of her face at this,
"... Why don't you tell me something about yourself? In the meantime, I'll get back to the cave... i-if that's a-alright..."

"Of course," you replied with a smile while awkwardly thinking that the closest thing to a girl you ever got near to just asked you to talk about yourself,
"... But there's not much to say, really. I'm just... was a normal guy until yesterday-"

"Sorry..."

"... Nothing exciting, really. Well... aside from me being a few inches tall..." you concluded.

Shaymin gave an amused ‘hm’,

"And... what do you humans do f-for... entertainment?" she asked.

"Uh..." you said, recalling various human activities that would leave her slack-jawed,
"... A lot of things, Shaymin. Majorly Internet, technology in general and many more activities."

"Seems f-fun..." the hedgehog replied, though you were sure she didn't have a clue of what Internet was.

"And... what does the world l-look like when you're s-so small?"

You didn't answer immediately, struggling to find better words than ‘it sucks, it really does’.

But you discovered you didn't have to answer: Shaymin arrived to the cave, which began filling your sight.

"Well, it's been nice..." you said to change subject.

"Yep, it was-" Shaymin abruptly stopped.

You wondered why, before you felt the familiar feeling of you being watched from somewhere, an imprecise spot behind you and Shaymin.

Slowly, the hedgehog giantess turned around... at least, to you was a giantess. But to whoever was watching you, unless it was a Joltik, she was all but intimidating.

Shaymin made a 360 degree turn, with the effect of making you turn around as well.

You discovered that, indeed, there was someone staring at you intently: a pokemon.

It was a...
11333231121112111.title: An awkward exploration

choices: Back to normal size, but there now a GIANT Shaymin!
Become microscopic & lost on the Shaymin's back DEEPLY in her fur!
1133323112111212.content:
As you sleeping comfortably, you're wake up by the ground who suddenly start to shaking. Not too long you found out that its Shaymin who shivered she must have a bad dream. You decide to try to calm her down by petting the giantess hedgehog as possible, when you notice her two gigantic pink flowers begin to glowing white and that make you nervous.

"Hum... Shaymin?..." you call her nervously but that was not loud enough for her to heard you.

Then Shaymin continues to shivering in her sleep and suddenly let out a small scream and her giant glowing flowers flashing the zone and blinding you for a while.

Once the light is clear, Shaymin calms down and continues to sleep peacefully.

Meanwhile with you, you recovered from the flash and...

A: You found yourself still on the Shaymin's back but you notice something is different as you can see the sky? You look around and saw the small trees surrounding the giant Shaymin? Wait, you realized what just happened, Shaymin has accidentally use her change size power again in her slumber and her power has enlarged both you and Shaymin. Now you seem to be back to your normal size, but the new problem is the shy Shaymin is now a giant! How she will reach at her new size once she wake up?

B: You found yourself in a strange jungle, the strange tall grasses are white and up to your waist, the world raising up and down and you heard loud snores. You realized what just happened, Shaymin has accidentally use her change size power again in her slumber and her power has shrink you down even further! Now you must be microscopic and lost on her back! And the worst part its Shaymin don't even knows about your fate! Now you have a new goal : getting her attention sooner as possible! Before she found out you're missing or worst! Your micro adventure begins!
1133323112111212.title: A bad dream accident.

choices: "... What did you mean, Shaymin?" you decided to go on
"It's... It's okay Shaymin, let's just go to sleep..." you relented
113332311211122.content:
Seeing you unmoving, Shaymin looked down.

"I-It's okay... I u-understand..." she said, sounding dejected while interrupting your thoughts.

Another small gust of wind penetrated the cave, and you shivered.

"W-What? No... it's fine..." you responded, walking closer to the hedgehog giantess. You had to halt though, wondering what were you supposed to do now. Was she going to lay on top of you? You took one step back, comprehensibly uncomfortable.

The pokemon perked up, smiling and blushing at once.

"H-Here..." she stuttered, one of her paws traveling behind your back and gently pushing you against her right cheek. The paw lingered against your body, the soft pad pressing into your chest.

"D-Do you m-mind?" she asked, the white wall behind you burning as she blushed.

"No." you replied, noting how similar this was to when she hugged you earlier.

Shaymin smiled.

Right above you, the twin green lakes that were her eyes closed.

"S-See you in the m-morning..." she stammered. You weren't sure if because she was utterly shy or because this cave was cold. You assumed it was because of both.

However, you didn't feel like sleeping just yet - was this really going to be your life now? Sleeping when the sun set down?

"Shaymin." you called, deciding to at least try to talk to her, ask her a few questions about herself. Talking was literally the only thing you could do to entertain yourself while in this cave.

You had quite a few other ideas of what you could have done in such precarious situation, but they were... inappropriate.

One green eye opened.

"Hm?"

"Can we... talk for a bit? I... usually go to sleep much later..." you admitted, hoping she'd understand your problem.

The hedgehog nodded.

"About what?" she asked, her other eye opening as well as she gazed at you.

"Well... about yourself. I mean, why are you so... huh..." you kept yourself from saying it, but you were certain that the giantess got the gist.

Damn your mouth.

Shaymin blushed, and for a moment looked away from you.

"There's... nothing special to say, r-really..." she shyly replied, showing no hard feelings.

You nodded, while mentally formulating an explanation: seeing the world from a small perspective like hers was sure intimidating... you could tell, since you were smaller than her.

"... Shaymin, what do you do aside from eat, drink and sleep?" you asked again, changing subject.

"W-Well... I wander around the forest... when no one is around. There's a lot of scary and strong pokemon out there and I d-don't want to fight. Nothing more..." she explained, her paw gripping you with a bit more strength as she thought about the big, powerful beasts hunting and killing mercilessly.

"That's all?" you asked, wondering if this all was real of if you were just living some kind of very lucid nightmare. You sourly realized that Shaymin's life was going to be your life as well now...

Shaymin flushed red.

"I know, it's a bit..." she trailed off.

"... Boring? Monotone?" you finished bluntly.

Shaymin didn't reply, but the blush on her face grew wider.

"... How d-do you humans e-entertain yourselves?" Shaymin asked you, before she lowered her head.
"I-I mean... aside from... making pokemon fight..." she asked, suddenly looking at you with what had to be dread.

You sighed.

"Relax, I'm not even a trainer... I mean, I wasn't..." you replied,
"And there's really a lot of ways to keep ourselves entertained among us humans..." you said, before starting to explain about human entertainment.

Shaymin listened with amusement.

You finished your speech with a sigh.

"I wonder why I even ended up like this..." you said, thinking that you weren't going to enjoy the things you told her about ever again.

The hedgehog looked at you sorrowfully.

"... I'm sorry..." she repeated those words for what had to be the tenth time today.

You stared at the legendary, finding the courage to ask your question openly.

"Shaymin..." you started,
"Why are you so... y'know... shy?" you blurted out before your brain could even process what kind of question you were asking.

You couldn't conceive the fact that she was a legendary, and was scared of even you... you were hardly an inch tall!

At this, the hedgehog blushed bright red.

She didn't initially respond. And, just as you thought that she was going to release you and send you on your own, she spoke,

"I-I'm not... always like this..." she responded quietly, dejectedly.

You saw an opportunity to apologize.

"... Shaymin, I'm sorry, I didn't mean to be rude..." your mouth said,
‘Please don't kick me out.’ your mind said.

Even though the situation was clearly embarrassing, the giantess smiled.

"I-It's okay..." she replied,
"You see... I can change..." she vaguely said.

You looked at her curiously.

"... What's that supposed to mean?" you asked.

But Shaymin answered you with a yawn.

"C-Can we talk about this another time?" she asked, blushing again.

This was the perfect excuse to put an end to this awkward conversation, albeit you were extremely curious about what she meant by ‘I can change...’.

Either she was really sleepy or it was a strictly personal question.

Was this the case to press on?
113332311211122.title: An awkward chat before bed

choices: "We could go outside... if you'd like..." Shaymin replied
"Let's just stay in here... it's way s-safer..." Shaymin replied
1133323112111222.content:
Lest that she might just change her mind and kick you back where she shrunk you if you asked personal questions like the one that just came out of your mouth, you decided to relent.

"It's fine, Shaymin," you replied, the white wall that was her cheek behind you,
"Let's just go to sleep."

You weren't feeling tired at all, but any excuse was a good one to put an end to this awkward branch of the conversation.

It started nicely... at least you thought, and it ended with you making the hedgehog giantess more embarrassed than she already was.

Hearing your words, Shaymin offered a small smile.

"O-Okay then," she stuttered,
"Sleep well. And... I'm sorry..."

You sighed.

"That's alright... you are helping me, I can't thank you enough for that," you replied, causing the white and green hedgehog to blush.
"Sleep well too..."

You offered a smile, a feeble resistance to fight back the thought that you were probably condemned to live the rest of your days like this, tiny and in the middle of the woods, in the paws of a shy legendary who wasn't probably going to let you out of this cave if she believed it was for your safety.

The thought alone nearly sent you spiraling into depression.

As if picking up on your sour thoughts, Shaymin offered a reassuring smile,

"Don't worry," she spoke on a confident voice,
"It'll be fine..."

You didn't reply, and the giantess luckily got the gist: you no longer wanted to talk.

She adjusted a bit, pushing you further into her cheek by doing so, and closed her bright green eyes.

After several minutes of unbroken silence, you felt the hedgehog snoring softly , meaning she had fallen asleep, cuddling you like you were a mere doll.

You allowed yourself to sigh, before you leaned back against Shaymin and closed your eyes too.

Again, you weren't tired, but you couldn't bear being awake and in such pitiful predicament.

Only sleep could bring you relief now.

What seemed endless hours of mulling over, you finally felt your eyelids growing heavy.

You yawned, letting darkness embrace your mind like a soft blanket as you finally drifted off to sleep, marking the end of your day.

Hopefully, your suffering wasn't going to affect your dreams.

--

A small breeze, which could easily be a powerful gust of wind for you, penetrated the cavern where you and Shaymin slept in.

Even though the legendary was admittedly a nice, warm bed, the sensation still made you shiver while also waking you up.

You yawned in a drowsy fashion, before slowly commanding your eyelids to part.

Much to your disappointment, you weren't home, in your bed, but you were still in the cave where you fell asleep, meaning that what you had experienced was no dream.

A soft snoring beside you confirmed that.

You saw sunlight creeping in distance, meaning that it was morning.

Still drowsy, you looked to the side, noticing the giant Shaymin you had met yesterday sleeping beside you in the same position she fell asleep in; her paw still acted as a heavy blanket for you, pressing you into her cheek, the soft pad slightly tickling your chest.

She looked adorable, you mused, but just as intimidating.

You sighed, briefly wondering if this shy giantess was ever gonna find a way to restore you.

She wasn't a threat, but other pokemon out there surely were. You didn't want to be like this when a hungry Ursaring suddenly came out in one of Shaymin's strolls through the forest and found the nice little snack she carried around.

Shaymin possessed a great power, which earned her the title of legendary, but her behavior didn't assure that she'd protect you.

You sighed deeply as you leaned back again, deciding to wait for the hedgehog to wake up before you did anything.

...

You must have drifted off again at some point, because you woke up at as something gently shook you.

Once again, you opened your eyes, only to find Shaymin's large paw poking you, its owner looming above you, having released you from her hug while you slept.

"Oh... you're awake," she unnecessarily stated while her paw retreated,
"How are you feeling?"

You sighed.

"I'm fine." you simply replied, not in the mood to talk,
"Or at least I'll be... I think..."

Shaymin seemed uncomfortable with your statement.

"Look, if y-you want to talk or anything, I'm here, okay?" Shaymin kindly spoke, leaning forward to nudge you with her nose.

There was so much care in the hedgehog's voice that you couldn't help but crack a smile. You couldn't end in better paws, you figured.

"Thanks..." you replied half-heartedly.

Shaymin took a step back,

"I-I'll go get something to eat, you must be hungry..." she changed subject.

"... Yeah. Food sounds nice about now." you agreed, your stomach gurgling softly at the mention.

Shaymin nodded uncomfortably, blushed and quickly walked out of the cave, returning about two minutes later with the usual berries held by the stems in her mouth.

These ones were round and blue, you noted: Oran Berries.

Shaymin dropped one in front of you, before she began eating her own part of the meal.

You took a few bites of the giant berry you were given, the juicy loudly sliding its way into your empty stomach.

Much like yesterday, you didn't finish your meal, and allowed Shaymin to finish it up yet again.

"So, what are we gonna do today?" you asked in a monotone voice,
"Are we gonna be cooped up in here the whole day?"

Shaymin blushed, but offered a gentle smile.
1133323112111222.title: Bedtime with a shy hedgehog

choices: Let Shaymin use the Gracidea, you wanted to see what happened
"It's okay if you don't want to," you quickly reassured Shaymin
11333231121112221.content:
"We could go outside... i-if you wish..." Shaymin shyly suggested,
"I like doing that, sometimes..."

"Yeah, whatever." you replied,
"Anything is better than staying in here all day..."

You didn't want to sound rude, but your mouth was faster than your brain; you shortly Shaymin a sorrowful glance, but she didn't seem to have taken it bad.

"Wonderful." she said instead, her muzzle inching closer to you, to the point you could feel her warm breath gently blowing in your chest.

For a moment, you thought she wanted to nuzzle you and blushed, but Shaymin's nose slid in between your legs and was raised upwards with the result of you being lifted off the ground as well.

"S-Shaymin...?" you called, startled by the sudden lack of solid ground beneath your feet, but before you could figure out what she was up to, the hedgehog roughly rose her whole head, and your body was launched up, landing on Shaymin's back after a short flight.

"Whoa..." you dizzily muttered while the giantess giggled.

"There we go," she said while you sat up on the smooth grass that was Shaymin's fur. It felt incredible, although it was grass, it felt soft and warm like it was real fur!

"Ready?" the giant hedgehog asked you.

"Huh?" you said, your thoughts interupted by the voice of the giantess,
"W-Wait, didn't you say something about dangerous pokemon being out there?" you recalled nervously. You didn't wish to be uncovered when one of those came out and spotted you riding a small legendary.

Shaymin's expression fell.

"Indeed, there are some r-really scary pokemon," she admitted, her body shivering at the thought, sending vibrations under your butt.

But then, the shy hedgehog adopted a slight smile.

"But, don't worry, I will protect you. I-I think I can handle them i-if they try to attack us..." she assured.

You remained silent, feeling conflicted; on one side, you knew that Shaymin possessed a great power... on the other, you knew she'd be all but willing to use it against some wild pokemon and would probably prefer running away, much like she did when you first met her.

What to do...? Express your concerns or play along?

"... Okay." you said in the end, deciding to trust that Shaymin would be able to protect you if anything happened.

The grass hedgehog smiled to herself, while her cheeks grew a slight shade of red. She was getting used to the idea of having someone to talk to.

Maybe, she thought, this situation wasn't so bad like you both believed...

The legendary shook her head - what was she thinking? Of course the situation was bad, she out of all pokemon knew how being so small felt like.

It was why she had decided to protect you. Not only you weren't a threat like humans usually were, but you were in need of help, and she was doing just that, helping you.

"L-Let's go," she said while you wondered what was going on in her head.

Quietly, your giant host began walking and soon found herself out of the cave that has been your shelter throughout the night; warm sunlight showered you as Shaymin began walking through the woods.

Everything was quiet, you thought as you looked around, not a single pokemon could be seen except for the eventual Pidgey that chirped on a branch or the passing Weedle that hastily crawled through the forest floor.

It was... oddly nice, you mused while Shaymin took her stroll in silence.

"Hey." you said at some point, causing the legendary hedgehog to slow down for a second,

"Hey..." she replied.

"Is this what you do, Shaymin?" you asked,
"I mean... don't you do anything else?"

Albeit you couldn't see it, you were sure Shaymin was blushing.

"There's... there's r-really nothing much to do here..." she hesitated,
"A-All I do it exploring, eating and sleeping..." by this point she had stopped, and her head lowered.
"... I know, it sounds boring."

"No no, it's not that!" you quickly said, not wanting to demoralize the hedgehog giantess,
"It's just... not my kind of amusement, you understand?"

Shaymin perked up, a giggle escaping her.

"Right, y-you told me how you h-humans have fun..." she recalled the (awkward) chat you and her had before going to sleep.

"Yeah," you replied, before remembering something.

Something about her.

"Shaymin? May I ask something?"

"Hm?"

You hesitated, recalling that this had been a delicate branch of the conversation you had last night.

"R-Remember..." you began,
"When I asked you why... why you were so s-shy?"

Shaymin slowed down again, her cheeks flaring up.

"... Yeah?" she squeaked.

"Well, you told me that you could change... can you tell me what you meant by that?"

Shaymin didn't reply to this, but kept walking in silence with you on her back.

You wondered if you did wrong bringing that up again; a voice in your head told you that it was clear.

You thought about apologizing, but decided to wait for a bit, until Shaymin ‘calmed down’.

However, as you suddenly discovered, the legendary wasn't mad at all.

"... I'm only s-shy this when I-I'm like this," she timidly broke the silence, surprising you,
"... But I can change m-my form with th-the power of a special flower called Gracidea Flower,"

You were left shocked, what did that mean?

"With it, I become a totally di-different Shaymin," the hedgehog clarified,
"T-That Shaymin is much tougher than I am..."

"Wow..." you said in awe, imagining what form Shaymin could assume once she had absorbed the power of the Gracidea Flower,
"I wish I could see it."

"You can." Shaymin replied nervously, blushing furiously.

"H-Huh?"

"Lo-Look." the hedgehog said, leading you to look forward to see where she had arrived while you chatted.

It was a relatively small patch of colorful flowers.

You felt like you were punched in the stomach.

"A-Are... are those...?" you asked, but Shaymin shook her head no.

"... O-Only one of them is," she stuttered while she walked towards the patch, walking in circles around it until she stopped in front of a pink flower that was easily taller than you.

"Oh..." you said.

"This is what makes me change my form..." Shaymin said, before looking up, trying to spot you on her back.

She couldn't see you, but you could definitely see the red shade across her cheeks and her reluctant expression.

"Y-You... want t-to see it?" she offered.

‘Yes!’ your mind exclaimed, thinking that it'd be better: if Shaymin was tougher, she'd be able to protect you better, no?

A second look at the hedgehog's face caused you to shut the voice in your head up.

Shaymin was clearly reluctant to use the Gracidea Flower, and you quite certainly didn't want her to feel bad because of your wish to see her change.

But still, you were definitely curious enough...
11333231121112221.title: Shaymin's revelation

choices: Shaymin sat on you!
Shaymin snatched you in her mouth!
Shaymin threw you on her head and took flight
113332311211122211.content:
"It's up to you Shaymin, really," you reassured,
"Though I'd like to see your other form..." you muttered, wishing for something different than eating, drinking and sleeping inside of the same cavern everyday.

Shaymin heard your musings and flushed red, feeling conflicted. On one side, she didn't exactly want to change. But on the other, she wanted to satisfy her little friend's curiosity.

And the voice that told her to do it ended up prevailing over the other.

"A-Alright," she timidly spoke up,
"I'll do it."

You perked up.

"Really?" you asked. The legendary offered a slight nod.

"Could you... climb down first?" she asked in a shy squeak.
"Sure." you replied in a eager as you walked to the edge of the hedgehog's body and began climbing down to the forest floor.

Your feet touched the tickling grass that went up to your waist and you looked up to the towering grass-type legend, who sighed.

"Step back, please..." she instructed.

You obeyed and took a few steps back, before turning to the green and white behemoth, who reluctantly stepped forward.

She turned her head to you one last time.

"Remember... I will return to being myself when the sun goes down..." she explained.

You felt the need to ask,
"Wait, what does that mean?"

In response, Shaymin blushed.
"My transformation isn't permanent. The effects of the Gracidea will wear off when the sun sets and I will return to the form you are s-seeing now." she offered her explanation, before adopting a look of... remorse?
"If I do anything bad to you... please forgive me..." she said, eyed shut and lips trembling as if she was on the verge of tears.

You wondered what she meant by that, but were left no time to question about it; Shaymin leaned forward and her nose just barely touched the pink flower that went by the name of Gracidea.

Instantly, Shaymin was enveloped in a blinding light, forcing you to shut your eyes.

You couldn't see it, but Shaymin's form began changing; her short paws became longer, her body grew in height.

Soon, the light died down, allowing you to finally open your eyes again.

Your eyes met with the sight of a completely different pokemon.

She was taller, and no longer a hedgehog, but instead what appeared to be a small deer; she had antlers now, and two red petals on the left side of her neck, while the rest of her body was covered in ruffled, white fur. Her paws were green, like her eyes.

"Whoa..." you muttered.

You expected her to change, but not this much! Shaymin was utterly unrecognizable!

The pokemon in front of you finally opened her eyes and her green gaze traveled down as she looked straight at you.

Her expression didn't change for a moment, before it shifted into a smug grin.

"So? Whaddya think buddy?" she asked in a tone you didn't recognize; her previous tone was quiet and squeaky. This one was playful, mischievous even, and it carried a lot of confidence.

Yup, you stuck to your earlier line of thinking: Shaymin was unrecognizable.

"It's... you're not yourself anymore..." you commented.

Shaymin snickered.

"I AM myself! I just ain't small and afraid anymore! That's why I looove this form of mine!" she exclaimed.

That didn't quite match with her earlier behavior, you mused.

Your thoughts were interrupted as the giantess in front of you lowered her head towards you.

"Now dude, I have a limited time to spend in this amazing form. What do you say if we use that to... have some fun?" she asked, her nose inches away from you.

You instinctively took a step back. The 'old Shaymin' never asked you that in the short amount of time you've known her for.

"Um..." you began, but were cut off as a green paw came down on you, pinning you down to the ground as its owner began toying with you.

"H-Hey, cut it! You're gonna hurt me!" you protested.

Far above, Shaymin laughed, but regardless took her paw off you.

"Ah, sorry bud, guess I got carried away. You're, like, so small!" she exclaimed cheerfully.

You stood back up.

"Yeah, I knew that..." you murmured, though the giantess didn't even hear you. What had gotten into her?

"Anyway, back to business," she said with a grin,
"Wanna see something cool?"

You discovered you were feeling nervous, and didn't know what to think of this Shaymin.

Regardless, you replied,

"... Su-re?"

Shaymin smirked as she proceeded to show you what 'something cool' she was talking about...
