1133323221.title: Lake trio!

choices: Azelf reluctantly grew you back and sent you on your way
Azelf decided to keep you!
11333232211.content:
It was a quiet day, the sun was shining and a small breeze blew around, tickling the leaves of the mighty trees that surrounded you.

You had opted to not let this wonderful Saturday go to waste, and so you opted to go for a nice, relaxing walk in the woods to ease your mind from the struggles of work.

The forest near your house seemed a perfect place.

There were a lot of pokemon to see, but the possibility to catch one didn't seem appealing to you.

You simply didn't feel the need to own a pokemon, even though quite a few showed up at your house sometimes, and you'd provide them with some food while they'd provide them with a few minutes of company before wandering off again.

It was perfect.

Sighing contentedly, you walked aimlessly in the forest, your arms resting behind your head as you walked past huge trees, observing the many pokemon that cautiously stared back at you.

You never wandered this far in the forest, you mused, you couldn't wait to see what was on the other side, though a part of you worried about the possibility of you getting lost in these woods.

You kept going, lost in your thoughts, surrounded by a perfect silence, until you halted your walk as something drew your attention.

Between trees, you saw something sparkling; this forest was quite thick, and the sunlight hardly managed to get past the thousands leaves of the trees.

Evidently, something was there, on the other side of those trees over there.

Curious enough to risk checking what it was, you walked past the trees and into an enlightened clearing. You felt amazed as you noticed what was sparkling: a huge lake, hidden in the middle of the woods, its water shining brightly under the warm sunlight.

"Wow..." you muttered to yourself as you began regretting leaving home your camera.

You began walking deeper to the lake-shore and knelt, staring at your reflection into the water. And, for moment, you took notice of something odd: something was behind you, like a shadow or something.

Hastily, you turned around, but no one was there aside from you.

"What the-" you didn't get to finish.

As you were about to spring up in alert, you randomly began feeling drowsy.

"W-Wha..." you mumbled dizzily as your eyelids grew heavier and heavier.

You tried to pull yourself together and got back on your feet, before trying so stumble away, hoping to find help.

But after only four steps, you felt the hard ground under you again as you fell down.

The last thing you noticed before falling into a deep sleep was a shadow appearing in front of you.

Then, everything became dark.

--

After hours of sleeping dreamlessly, you woke up, feeling incredibly dizzy.

With a groan, you opened your eyes, taking notice of a lingering ache assaulting your head. Which was quite weird, given how your brain seemed to have shut down all of a sudden.

"W-What happened...?" you mumbled to no one in particular as you sat upright, trying to recall how you fell asleep.

You remembered getting to the lake, before you lost consciousness. It must have been this annoying headache, you told yourself, though you were sure your head didn't ache before.

And it must have been worse than you thought: when you fell asleep, you were in a forest. But now, the ground looked blue.

"Must have fallen on my head..." you murmured as you finally stood up.

Only then you noticed that something was definitely wrong; below you was the more familiar sight of the verdant grass.

You felt a lump in your throat.

Just what happened to you?

"Oh, you're awake."

A chill traveled down your spine as a feminine voice spoke behind you.

Hastily, you turned around, and your heart sank completely.

It was blue, and it was incredibly big, with golden eyes and a red jewel in the middle of its forehead; also, it was hovering in mid-air and had two tails. And it carried an unreadable glare on its face.

"W-Wait..." you murmured breathlessly as you stared at the giant pokemon, sure you had seen it somewhere.

"Greetings, human," the creature spoke in a neutral tone, though from it you could tell this titan was a titaness because its voice carried the same feminine hint you noted before,
"I am Azelf, guardian of this lake."

Of course, Azelf! The legendary pokemon who could manipulate willpower and protected a lake and... and...

... And was supposed to be one foot tall...

"Wh-What is going o-on...?" you stammered in confusion as you looked around, noticing that the blue ground you were standing on was nothing more than the palm of the giantess, who was hovering in front of the now ocean-sized lake.

The glare of the legendary hardened.

"I shrunk you." she said bluntly as your gaze went back to her, allowing you to notice the look on her face.

You felt like you had been just kicked in the crotch.

"... But why?" you asked as a strong fear assaulted you, overwhelming your other senses.

"Because..." the palm of the giantess shifted, and you suddenly found yourself trapped in her rock-solid fist, which she brought dangerously closer to her face,
"... You humans only come here to fight me, don't you? You only wanted to capture me like they all do, right?" she asked with fury.

Her fiery gaze made you shiver, but you weren't letting her hurting you when you did absolutely nothing wrong to her.

"That has nothing to do with me!" you hastily retorted,
"I didn't come here to ‘fight’ you or ‘capture’ you! I didn't even know this lake or you were here until this morning!... I'm not even a trainer!"

The Azelf seemed taken aback.

"... You're not-" she trailed off.

"No! I don't capture pokemon, I was just wandering around when you shrunk me! What's wrong with you!?" you shouted in response, causing the blue mountain to look even more surprised.

"I-" she started, but then stopped as she figured that this could be a trick to save your skin.

Still, she couldn't be sure.

"... Why should I believe you?" she said instead, causing you to sign in frustration while you fidgeted in her fist.

"If I came here to fight you or capture you or whatever, I would have brought pokemon with me, no? And even if I did, they would have came out to help me while you shrunk me, right?" you said, causing the Azelf to shut her eyes open.

Crap.

"O-Oh..." she stuttered, feeling like she messed up big time.

"... Sorry?" she apologized.

Azelf was tired of humans coming to her lake to try and enslave her or simply fight her.

She always manged to fight back - being a legendary has its uses, and a nearly unlimited power is one of them - but she had enough of foolish trainers coming to ruin her peace!

She had to do something!

And when she first did something, she messed up. Great. Just great.

"Whatever." you replied,
"Now just grow me back and I'll be on my way, okay? I swear I'll never come back here."

The giantess stared at you, feeling conflicted.

She knew she had done wrong, so she had to let you go now... but if she did, how many chances there were this human was going to tell others of his kind about this episode?

A lot.

They were going to hunt her down!

The logical thing to do seemed to just keep this human, but she knew it was a dumb idea.

Still, she had to do something, fast...
11333232211.title: Mistaken Break

choices: You were still in your bed... with a huge Azelf next to you...
You were... back at the lake!?
113332322111.content:
The humongous Azelf stared at you, those golden eyes of hers being quite enough to strike fear into you, though they had a remorseful sparkle within them.

You awaited for her answer, which would seal your fate.

And it finally came.

"If you promise to not tell anyone..." she began with a hint of reluctance.

She was literally trusting the first human she met from this close, being reluctant was a natural reaction to this whole situation.

"I promise I'm not going to tell anyone about this lake or about you, really." you spoke, desperately trying to sound firm.

If Azelf didn't think you were trustworthy, you were going to be stuck with this size for who knew how long.

Luckily, the gaze of the blue giantess softened.

She hesitated before answering, her lips opening but with no sound coming out of them.

Eventually though, she managed to speak up,

"... Very well, human," she spoke,
"You don't represent a threat to me or to this lake, so you may go..."

Your heart leaped in relief.

Gently, Azelf placed you back on the ground and stood at her full height, which was doubled due her floating in mid-air.

She inhaled deeply, before looking at you again, her eyes carrying a cyan glow.

The same glow surrounded your whole body as you began feeling a pleasant sensation spreading.

And then, you started growing; your surroundings shrunk down to size around you as you grew past the towering blades of grass, past Azelf's tails and eventually past Azelf herself, until she was no longer a towering giant to you, but it was the other way around.

The growth came to an end.

"There. I believe you were more of less that big..." she said.

"Y-Yeah..." you stammered, before backing up a bit. Your mind was telling you to run away screaming while you still had your full size, but you decided against it.

"S-So... I'll be going now. It was, uh... almost nice to meet you..." you awkwardly said, before turning around to leave without even waiting for an answer.

Before disappearing in the woods, you shot one last glance backwards, discovering the Azelf who shrunk you staring in your direction blankly.

You opted to ignore her and entered the woods, beginning to walk away from the lunatic legendary and her lake.

Little you did know what the little legend was planning.

As soon as she noticed you leaving, Azelf looked back at her lake and floated towards it, feeling awkward.

Hesitating, she dove underwater and seam to the bottom of the lake, where she reached an underwater cavern. She hastily floated inside and sat down in the middle of the place, droplets of water falling from her body.

The legendary closed her eyes.

She couldn't believe what she was about to do, but she couldn't be sure the human wasn't going to snitch.

With those thoughts in mind, the blue legendary focused.

Slowly, a colorless shadow began floating out of her body; her soul was free to move now.

Leaving her body behind, she exited the cave and swam up, surfacing.

Hopefully, the human wasn't far.

--

You made your way through the woods rather hastily, wishing to put as much distance as you could from yourself and that legendary you just miraculously escaped from.

Soon enough, you were back home.

Upon entering, you locked the door behind you and stumbled to your kitchen.

You had to make yourself a steaming cup of tea in order to calm your scared mind. You couldn't believe what just happened.

For a few minutes, you were basically kidnapped by a legendary who held a grudge against humanity and tried to ‘punish’ you when you didn't actually do anything!

It was crazy! It was unbelievable! It was-

You groaned, the Azelf-related memories were enough to make your body shiver.

You had to stop thinking about her. You were home, you weren't doll-sized, you were safe.

You simply had to stop thinking about that legendary...

Oddly, you felt like you were being watched, but you just assumed that you were still scared by what has been going on.

To keep your mind off things, you discarded your now empty cup on the kitchen table, before getting up to go watch some TV while mentally making a decision.

No more walks in the woods for some time... or no more walks in the woods at all.

--

Your day passed rather fast as you did your best to forget Azelf and what she did to you.

It seemed to work as at some point you stopped being afraid of wandering through your own house.

Eventually, daylight faded away, replaced by moonlight.

It was a good few hours before your bedtime, but you didn't care. Right now, all you wanted was hit the hay and try to leave behind the spooky situation you had been through in the morning.

You reached your bedroom and undressed, before slowly sliding under the warm blankets of your bed.

Oddly, you fell asleep almost immediately, sliding in a sweet, dreamless slumber, which was more than you asked for since you were expecting nightmares.

However, already in deep sleep, you didn't know what was going on outside of the window of your bedroom.

If you did, you would have probably began screaming out of terror.

There, right out of your window, was Azelf.

She had been watching you.

She had been watching you throughout the day to check if you kept your promise and didn't say anything about her.

She felt relieved, you were truthful and didn't say a word.

With some regret, she understood that not all humans were bad after all. Not only this guy didn't make pokemon fight or foolishly hunted down legendaries, but he was honest.

The blue pixie leaned against your window, watching you sleep.

She felt bad for shrinking you earlier this morning.

You were a good human...

The legendary was about to turn around and leave, but she felt her heart leaping inside her chest as she did, leading her to fly right back at your window.

Why didn't she want to leave you?

You were just a human...

But, she realized, you were a good one. For some reason, she felt like she didn't want to leave you, but couldn't realize why.

With a sigh, the legendary made a decision and psychically, noiselessly opened the window to hover inside your bedroom.

Cold air made you fidget in your sleep, but you remained asleep.

Azelf stared at you sleeping.

She didn't know why, but if her heart told her to stick with you, she wasn't going to deny her own wishes.

After all, wasn't that what humans did?

Fulfill their wishes without caring about the others.

Why should have she?

--

Sunlight seeped in your closed eyes, bothering you.

With a deep yawn, you began waking up by stretching your arms. You felt rather content with your good night's sleep. Only, you felt a lingering ache in your head for some reason.

You shrugged, deciding you were going to take something later on.

For now, you simply laid down, your vision blurry with drowsiness.

You couldn't tell why, but you felt like something was... off. Like something was not like it was when you went to sleep, but you couldn't tell what it was.

Maybe... you were still scared after the experience of yesterday?

You blinked to get the sleep out of your eyes and yawned again, before sitting up.

Only then, with a gasp, you realized what was wrong.
113332322111.title: Grown and stalked

choices: You decide to go with it.
You protest, wanting to be grown back
Before you can say anything, a trainer is approaching the lake
1133323221112.content:
You looked at your surroundings...this was not your bed...nor your bedroom. A chill ran by you as you shivered and looked around. Just what the hell was going on? You looked down. You were on something soft...and felt a gentle movement from it. It was a green surface, you stood up, and it supported your weight as you looked around.

Water surrounded you, and it went on and on for a while. You gulped. This was a lake...and you assumed you were on a lily pad. Which also meant that you were small again. You felt your breathing get erratic as you sat down on the lily pad, feeling stranded out here on your own.

"Okay, okay...I just...need to calm down. Azelf probably did this right, but she seemed nice and I didn't say a word about her. I just need to explain to her that I really won't do anything...yeah...then she should grow me back..." You said, as you rubbed your arms together to try and both warm yourself, and calm yourself down. It was then that a ripple started to move the water...it was getting rougher and rougher, threatening to throw you off of your lily pad as you desperately clung to it.

With a great roaring splash, the giantess you expected to see emerged...Azelf. She looked down at you with an unreadable expression and she gulped.

"I heard you talking to yourself, and I want you to know that I already am aware you didn't tell anyone about me." She gave a slight smile at that as she lowered down into the water until only her head was above water, allowing you to speak eye to eye to her...relatively, her face alone still dwarfed you by quite a lot.

"You are a good human, truly, and I have grown a bit...fond of you." She said.

"So i've decided that you're going to stay with me!" She chimed as she smiled and you looked at her bewildered.

"B-but I...bu..." You stammered as she looked at you, still smiling, as if she expected this reaction.

"I'm sure that you think this to be upsetting news, but I promise you it isn't." She said as her face moved closer and closer to your lily pad, until you could feel her warm breath.

"No more stress from people, no more worries...with me, all you need to concern yourself with is being happy and enjoying my company." She said and you gulped.

She was serious! She intended to keep you here in this lake with her.

"Um...what about what you said about humans trying to catch you...?" You said and she smiled.

"Well you never tried that, any human that does will just face the consequences." She said, and you blinked. You didn't want to think about that.

"I uh..." You looked around at the water.

"I can't swim..." You said, a meek defense, if true.

"I can teach you." She said, not missing a beat. You looked at this looming legendary. It didn't seem like you had much say in this. It was then that a paw came from the water, and dripping wet, came towards you.

You flinched, but all she did was ruffle your hair a bit, leaving it damp.

"You really don't need to be scared, if a legendary is protecting you, you should consider yourself lucky." She said. A bit pompous, but that was true...
1133323221112.title: Back at Azelf's lake

choices: "Let's get to know each other."
"I bet you're hungry. Let me get something to eat."
11333232211121.content:
You forced a lump that had formed in your throat to go back from where it came from with a deep swallow.

This legendary randomly went from hating mankind to like you and wanted to keep you at a pitifully and, most important, dangerously small size.

You were feeling like a bug in presence of a goddess.

The cheerful titan towered above you, even though her whole body but her head was submerged in the water!

"I..." you finally mustered enough courage to let a sound escape your mouth, though you sounded like a startled mouse,
"... I... I can't stay," you politely declined her offer, deciding that your best shot was talking your way out of this mess.

If the idea of losing your cool ever came across your mind, this conversation would probably end with your own ending.

Azelf seemed unaffected by your statement, her smile was still there, glued to her face.

"And why, may I ask?" she asked calmly, almost motherly. You hesitated, taking several moments to ponder the right choice of words.

"Because," you eventually began,
"I have my life to live, don't you think? How am I supposed to do it when I'm..." you paused to do a quick estimation of how small you currently were,
"... only a few inches tall?"

Instead if shrinking or maybe fading like you expected, Azelf's smile widened.

"Oh, you can still do without issue! You still have your life, just... you'll stay with me!" she chimed happily, before her smile finally faltered,
"I know, this is a lot to take in, and you'll probably take some time to adjust, but I'm sure you'll eventually come to enjoy this."

Your heart sank at the declaration - this legendary was determined to keep you, no matter what you said to try to convince her.

But what else could you do? You couldn't possibly fight her, not like this... and probably not even if you were normal-sized.

Seeing you hesitating, Azelf smiled reassuringly.

"You don't have to worry, human. You'll be fine - we'll be fine." she said.

The water beneath your lily pad began shaking as the towering giantess hovered out of and above the crystalline water, her body creating a huge shadow that eclipsed your whole view.

You couldn't see past this titan, and it made you feel powerless to stop her from doing whatever she wanted to you.

Not like you had many chances anyway, even if you were your original size. This pokemon could literally control willpower: a flick of her hand, and not only you'd stay with her, but you'd be happy to do so.

Her messing with your willpower was definitely something you didn't want to experience. Being shrunken was already enough, you mused.

Intimidated by the enormous size of the legendary, you watched as her paw descended towards you and grabbed a hold of your body; oddly, even though she had just gotten out of the water, her body seemed completely dry, like the lake hadn't even laid a single drop of water on her body.

"So, human? What do you say?" she asked, leading you to wonder if your opinion made any difference.

"... Everything and everyone would be a danger to me. You're literally dooming me." you said, trying to reason with the titaness one more time.

Azelf smirked smugly.

"They won't even get close enough to lay their eyes on you, I promise," she said, before bringing you closer to her blue body,
"You'll be fine." she repeated once more.

Something you didn't expect to occur happened: this giant pokemon, who openly declared her disdain for humanity, pulled you forward, closing your minuscule body in an embrace.

You couldn't help but flush red with embarrassment.

This experience would have probably been more enjoyable if you weren't so ridiculously tiny and this situation wasn't so awkward and dangerous.

This was it, you thought. Azelf wasn't going to let you go, and you couldn't do anything about it, with or without your size.

Might as well not upset the legendary by insisting too much, you mused.

"W-" you paused, taking a moment to consider what was going to be your life from now on: nothing but this lake and its guardian, and the occasional trainer whose butt she would kick before shrinking them down like she did to you.

You sighed deeply - why you?

"... Whatever." you replied after a long hesitation.

Azelf, who had momentarily lost her smile, grinned down at.

"Great. I promise nothing's gonna happen to you. I'll take good care of you... you know, I saw you yesterday, you're all alone," she declared, making you feel annoyed.

Privacy must be a foreign concept to pokemon, you mused.

Azelf's voice interrupted your train of thought, and your gaze went back to her. You noted that she was talking again.

"We can keep each other company, it'll be great!" she said, obviously still trying to break through your disappoint.

There WAS some truth in what she was saying, you thought.

"Whatever." was the only reply you could offer once again aside from a frown.

The blue giantess smiled sympathetically,
"Great," she cheered,
"As for now..."
11333232211121.title: Lake life

choices: You both make it back to the lake
Something happens on the way to the lake
113332322111212.content:
"I'd imagine you're hungry, right?" She said and you felt your stomach grumble as she looked at you with a smile, you sighed and hung your head in her grip.

"I suppose I am...a bit." You said, this whole situation was something to take in, you weren't too concerned with your hunger right now. All the same, you did need to eat.

"Great! in that case let's go and remedy that, i'm a bit peckish myself." She said as you felt your stomach rattle when she started to fly with you in her grip. You swallowed hard as the wind whipped at you, and she looked down at you before stopping and frowning. Evidently your face must've explained the whole situation to her.

"...hmm, let's try this." She said before pressing you to her chest again with her paw. This time you felt her other paw join behind the first one, effectively pinning you securely to her chest, you doubted you could move if you wanted to.

"That should keep you nice and secure!" You heard her say as she started to fly again, your face pressed into her chest pretty much and you were left to think for a bit as she proceeded to her destination.

No more job...no more friends...not that you really had any...just you and this pokemon. What a weird turn of events, but she was certainly nicer to you than you had expected, especially for a pokemon that seemed to be pretty annoyed with humans as a whole, or at least ones that tried to capture her.

...You hoped you didn't see any trainer unfortunate enough to cross her path.

Also, what exactly would you eat? Berries? Fruit? You had to admit the idea of much less food choices didn't sit the best with you on that front, but you didn't want to say anything to annoy Azelf. You felt a lurch in your stomach as Azelf started to descend, and she landed on top of a tree branch before pulling you from her chest, cupping you in her paws as she smiled down at you.

"We're here little guy, just let me grab the food." She said as her eyes glowed and an apple bigger than you floated towards you...you looked at it, before you were surprised to see it shrink. It plopped down right next to you, and it looked like an ordinary apple...normal sized to you and everything. You picked it up before you heard a loud *CRUNCH*, only to look up and see Azelf eating an apple too. She seemed to be enjoying it, with a sigh you bit into the apple...certainly tasted normal. And biting it you realized just how hungry you were.

You ate in relative silence for a bit, looking around as much as you could, though it was a lot of tree and a lot of Azelf pretty much from your perspective.

You finished your apple a bit after Azelf seemed to finish hers and she sighed, looking down at you and your apple core. It floated away from you as it joined her empty core until...they both vanished?

"See little human, this is all going to work out, you just need to give it a shot." She said and you leaned back in her palm, supporting yourself with the bottoms of your palms and let off a shrug.

"Thank you for the apple." Was really all you could say. Arguing wouldn't really get you anywhere and Azelf seemed intent on keeping you regardless.

She nodded before you felt a shift as she pressed you to her chest again.

"Now, let's go back to the lake." She said as she started to float, and take to the skies again.
113332322111212.title: Eating with Azelf

choices: Saved with a Scolding.
Falling Deeper in Obsession
A new Lake Guardian Emerges.
11333232211122.content:
You knew that if this dragged on you would eventually be convinced to stay, by merit of Azelf being a legendary Pokemon, and not just any legendary Pokemon, a Pokemon that literally controls willpower. You had to strike hard and fast before she got any ideas.

"Azelf, I'm serious. Grow me back, I have to go back to my family and friends."

"Why should I?" Azelf shot back, a smug look on her face.

"W-what. What do you mean by that?"

"I mean exactly what I mean. Why should I give back the one thing I've grown attached to all these years? Do you know how lonely that is? Hundreds of years with no companionship, only meeting with my sisters in times of crises."

"Azelf, I could never understand that loneliness, but it still doesn't change the fact that I have a family and friends that will miss me if I sudden-"

All of a sudden, an intense wave of nausea hits you as you are bombarded with an intense presence from the blue giantess in front of you. "Like I said, why do I care. Humans are selfish beings who take and take. Why should I be reluctant to do the same?"

"As I said, I'm not one of those people!"

"Yes, but the concept still stands. I was hoping to not have to do this, but you forced my hand."

You tried to step back but quickly found yourself held in place by a psychic power that you could never hope to overcome. You try to sputter out some words but it seems the psychic powers limit you from doing anything other than keeping yourself alive with basic bodily functions like breathing. All you could do was think your questions, not that they would have any way of reaching Azelf.

'Just what the heck is she going to do to me' You thought to yourself, unaware that Azelf was indeed fully capable of reading your thoughts, only when she wanted to, of course. She had been so blinded by rage at the thought of a trainer trying to capture her again that she shrunk you without reading your mind but now that she was more at peace than ever with you by her side, she could think things with greater clarity than ever before.

"Well, It's quite simple, really. I intend to keep you on my island, whether you give me your consent or not. It's rather hard to find someone that we legendaries can bond with you know?"

'Y-you can read my mind?!' You thought, now even more worried at the prospect of not even being able to plan about escaping without her knowing.

"Well duh. I am a Psychic-type. Of course, I could forcefully change how you think of me with my powers but I'd rather just savor your slow descent into accepting me and forgetting everyone else."

Azelf then used the psychic powers that were previously holding you still to lift you towards her paws. Upon contact, the psychic powers dissipate and you struggle almost immediately. Azelf, not expecting this fumbles you and you drop towards the water floor. What happens next?

A: Azelf catches you with her psychic powers and scolds you, but doesn't punish you
B: Azelf catches you with her psychic powers and, as a result of you almost dying she gets even more protective. Say goodbye to any of the freedom you would've had, had you not struggled.
C: Mespirit teleports you away using her powers, having sensed her Sister's love and decided to take a look for herself. Of course, she ends up falling for you as well.
11333232211122.title: You protest, wanting to be grown back

choices: “Friend”
“Pet”
She’s interrupted by one of her sisters
She’s interrupted by a trainer!
113332322112.content:
Azelf looked at the tiny human still struggling in her fist and bit her lip. He was innocent of wrong doing, and she just robbed him of his size. She knew what the right thing to do was.

But she couldn’t do it. It was far too risky to let him go, he could lead so many humans back here, no, she hardened herself when she decided that she would use this power. Any human that came here to capture her would be shrunken down and disposed of, while their pokemon would be released...but for this innocent one, she wouldn’t go that far. That would be far too cruel.

“I’m afraid I can’t grow you back human.” The Azelf said. Your heart sank and you almost felt your skin prickle with those words.

“Wh-wha-bu-“ You stumbled over your words as Azelf looked at you sadly. But she steeled her gaze again.

“If I let you go you could tell others what happened here, and where to find the legendary Azelf. It’s far too much of a risk to let you leave freely.” She said. Now the human looked far more panicked.

You were starting to hyperventilate it felt like and you looked into the massive eyes of the pokemon.

“Please! I won’t say a word! I’ll never come back! Just please let me go!” You cried out. The fist holding you softened and loosened up to reposition you, having you sitting in her palm. After this a shadow was cast over you as she lifted her other paw above you. She was going to crush you, you just knew.

“Please no!” You cried and shut your eyes, expecting oblivion at any moment. It never came though as you felt a warm soft feeling rubbing against your head...then down your back as you sat in her palm. You opened your eyes and found that she was petting you. This felt degrading!...But she didn’t kill you. The face of Azelf looked kind for the first time.

“This is my fault little human, I’ve done something terrible to you, but don’t worry, I won’t punish you as I would another member of your kind that would seek my capture. I’ll take care of you, and in time I’m sure you’ll come to enjoy being my little...”
113332322112.title: Azelf decided to keep you!

choices: "... I suppose so," Azelf admitted
"No deal," Azelf replied, "Sorry, but you're stuck with me."
1133323221121.content:
"Friend." you parroted back, trying to keep your cool while the giantess in front of you nodded repeatedly, a smile taking place on her blue face.

"Yep!" Azelf exclaimed cheerfully, her previous behavior completely vanished.
"Since we're stuck together, might as well be friends, no?"

You inhaled deeply.

"I literally just met you, and you ruined my life for no reason." you said bluntly, causing the blue legendary to blush.

"I knew this was coming." she muttered dejectedly, feeling bad because of your words. Even worse, because your words were completely true.

Quietly, the Being of Willpower sat down on the tickling grass. Her other paw joined you as she brought you up to her face. Behind you, her twin tails rose and cupped together, forming a platform; Azelf set you down on top of them, her paws lowering.

"Listen, I'm sorry. I'd really let you go, believe me, but I can't take the risk of others like you coming here. They'd hunt me down, understand?" she explained once more.

"And I told you that I won't snitch, but you just won't believe me!" you hissed angrily, causing the pixie to sigh.

"Listen, I know you'll take time to adjust, and you'll take even more time to forgive me, but I'm sure you'll eventually do, if you just cooperate. You just need to make an effort and this friendship is going to be great." Azelf said, making you feel even more frustrated.

"There is no friendship! You just kidnapped me and are keeping me against my-" you trailed off, remembering what powers this legendary had.

You were sure that, if you spoke the last word, she'd be more than glad to change your will and make you glad to stay with her.

And you certainly didn't want her to mess with you any further.

The blue mountain seemed to have understood anyway,

"Oh, don't worry, I won't mess with your willpower. It think I've caused you enough problems already." she said sympathetically, with a dejected time that would have sounded adorable to anyone else listening.

But to you, she sounded like a total hypocrite, first shrinking you down for no reason before deciding to keep despite you being completely innocent.

"... There is no friendship yet. You just need to get used to it. I'll take good care of you, trust me, I'll feed and protect you. You could be a great company, y'know, we'd have each other and stuff like that..." she said, her smile appearing once more on her face.

The perspective seemed improbable to say the least, but it was truly amusing: a pokemon keeping a human. It was like some sort of role reversal, the pokemon being the master and the human like a pet.

Only, she couldn't keep you like a pet. Her conscience would have never let go of her if she did, and she already felt guilty enough.

"... So I'm basically your pet. Wow, that's totally what I wanted when I woke up this morning." you sarcastically said, causing the giantess to feel even more uncomfortable.

"You're not my pet, you're my friend." she insisted stubbornly, causing you to sigh deeply.

"Okay, listen here. If you were my friend, or if you meant to be my friend, you'd grow me back right now and you'd send me home, believing me when I say that I won't tell about you! That's what friends do, you know!" you cried.

The legendary smiled smugly.

"Well, you'll understand if I don't fully trust a human," she replied with a calm tone,
"Seriously, your kind keeps coming here, thinking they can fight me and capture me. I simply had enough at some point, I had to do something. Just... I messed up and shrunk an innocent human." she blushed,
"... Sorry."

You paid the last comment no mind.

"... Wait, you mentioned you don't trust me?" you recalled, before a hope lifted your heart.
"But then, if I manage to convince you that I won't tell about you, you'll let me go?"

The golden eyes of the pokemon sparkled at the request, but she didn't initially respond.

It took her a while to answer your question,
1133323221121.title: Non-existent friendship

choices: Marshadow it is!
Other
1133323222.title: Shadow legendary

choices: ... you began shrinking...
... the Marshadow began growing...
11333232221.content:
A thunder briefly enlightened the sky, causing you to look up with an annoyed expression: a little while more and it was going to rain.

You groaned, wondering why you had to come here in the first place.

Right, the pokemon.

Recently, the rumor that a very rare pokemon inhabited the forest just out of your town began spreading at light speed, drawing everyone's attention.

You were no glory seeker, and normally didn't join the groups of people that ventured out in the woods to try to catch it; but today, with the weather that would have drawn no one outside, you thought that maybe you could have your chance to at least see this pokemon, just out of curiosity.

Maybe it was just crazy, but at least you were right: there was absolutely no one in these woods today.

Happily wondering about what pokemon you were looking for (something highly unusual, you guessed) you walked around the forest, hands in your pockets as you observed the forest, taking notice of the very few Pidgey and Rattata passing by, noticing you and fleeing.

It seemed like this forest was populated by ghosts, you mused, just very few sounds were heard at all.

Okay, one would expect a forest to be quiet, but not this quiet. It was almost kind of frightening, considering that it was 6 PM and there was no sun in sight.

Only half an hour, you decided back home while discarding the idea of bringing a camping bag, you were going to stay for just half an hour. Luckily, you still had your phone, if anything went wrong you could call for help. That's all you needed for this little trip to the woods.

As quietly as you could, you navigated around the forest, hoping not to scare this mysterious pokemon off.

You felt small, fallen branches and dead leaves crunching beneath your feet as you walked.

You would have never admitted in front of a crowd, but you were staring to feel kind of nervous.

Being alone in the woods at such hour didn't seem like a good idea. Forests were the place where a lot didn't come back from...

You quickly shook your cowardly thoughts off and proceeded, your left hand feeling the phone under your palm. If anything went wrong, you could still call for help, you comforted yourself again as you kept going, gazing around to check if the pokemon jumped out or if you at least caught a glimpse of it.

Sadly, the most interesting creature you saw was a Snivy, who gave you a smug look before wandering off.

You wandered through the forest until you had enough of searching and looked at your phone.

6:45 PM.

Slightly upset because of your poor results, you turned back, intending to leave.

You began walking the way you came from, hoping to get out of these woods by 7:00. You may have had little success, but you could still watch your favorite show in TV if you were quick.

You walked past the thick, green vegetation, a small rain beginning to fall from the sky.

'Great.' you sarcastically thought as you began speeding up, cursing your earlier predictions that turned out to be true.

But, as you walked around in search of a way out of these woods, it soon became clear that you were lost.

Haven't you already passed that really tall tree?

You groaned, guessing you've been just walking in circles.

A vague fear beginning to seep in your heart, you tried a different way.

No luck.

No matter how hard you tried or which way you took, you couldn't figure how to get out of here.

"Damn..." you muttered, cursing your stupidity. You could have stayed home like everyone else but no, you had to come in the middle of a godforsaken forest in the middle of a rainy afternoon!

You groaned, taking out you phone, deciding to call someone that might've helped you...

Odd.

For some reason, your phone appeared... blurry.

You rubbed your eyes with a hand, before looking again.

It definitely looked blurry.

You wondered what was happening and rose your head up, discovering that, for some reason, the woods looked darker, like you had spent a very long time in darkness with only a small source of light.

That's how everything appeared to your eyes.

Then, as if it had been holding back this whole time, the rain came like a thousand cold pins falling from the sky and you quickly began soaking wet.

You cursed and hastily began dashing into the dark woods, hoping to find a shelter before you caught your death.

You ran and ran, until you reached a rocky wall; there was a large opening in it.

A cave.

Maybe not everything had gone wrong, you thought while you ran towards the cavern and stumbled inside, your heart in your throat from the run.

You leaned against a wall and rested, watching as droplets of rain slid down your hair and head, falling down to the stone floor.

You rose your head, praying that there wasn't any dangerous pokemon in this cave; luckily, no sound came from deeper within, suggesting that you were alone...

You couldn't guess how wrong you were.

You turned around to check the rain again... but stumbled back and tripped over your own feet, falling down on your rear in surprise.

Standing there, in front of the entrance to this cave, was a small, almost humanoid creature.

It had a weirdly shaped dark grey head and a small body of the same color, and it had bright orange eyes; it looked like this... thing had no lower body, just its arms sticking out.

But you were proved wrong as the creature suddenly rose up, showing you the rest of its body.

It was just as tall as your knee, yet it looked truly dreadful to you.

"H-Hi?" you stammered.

No reply.

The pokemon - you assumed it was one - just stared at you, apparently examining you.

You briefly wondered where it came from and if this was the pokemon you were looking for earlier; seeing no hostile intentions in its current behavior, you slowly took out your phone and focused on the screen, which didn't look blurry anymore.

Odd, you mused again as you did a quick research, trying to find a match with the pokemon in front of you.

It just stood unmoving and silent, allowing you to focus on your phone.

It took several minutes, but soon the image of a pokemon identical to the one you had in front of you caught your eye.

'Marshadow' it read.

You hastily read the description, hoping this wasn't a dangerous beast. Even the most adorable pokemon such as Jigglypuff were unpredictable after all.

'This legendary detains the power of hiding in the shadows and is known for observing without making any noise. If enraged, it can be extremely dangerous. Caution is highly recommended.'

Startled by the description, you looked up at the 'Marshadow' again.

A legendary no less! And if it got mad for any reason... you had to get out of here.

"H-Hey..." you stammered, but trailed off rather quickly as you saw the small pokemon in front of you finally doing something.

At first, it only looked like it had closed its eyes; but then, it opened them again, those two fiery red eyes, and your own eyes widened in surprise as...
11333232221.title: A stalker from the shadows

choices: It was a male Marshadow
Actually, this titan was a titaness...
113332322211.content:
As soon as the Marshadow's fiery red eyes fixed on you again, you could tell that something was going on.

You began feeling dizzy, nauseous even, with no apparent reason.

"W-Wha... hap-pening...?" you stuttered incoherently, your vision growing blurry.

You felt like you were going to lose your conciousness at any moment, and looked down at the Marshadow, noticing its eyes glowing.

Finding it hard to focus, you pulled back a leg, wanting to kick the little guy; you knew it was going to enrage the creature, but if it helped you pull yourself out of this, you were willing to do so, imagining yourself sprinting into the rain again and out of these woods once and for all.

Sadly, the kick you had readied never landed; your leg just fell back to place as you took notice that something odd was going on.

The little creature in front of you... didn't look so little anymore.

You choked back a surprised exclamation, wondering what the hell it was going on.

Before your incredulous eyes, the Marshadow offered the smallest grin one could imagine and giggled silently, watching what was happening with some sort of sadistic glee.

You were shrinking!

You watched as the creature in front of you grew larger and larger; soon, your height matched its, but your shrinking didn't stop there.

"Q-Quit it!" you shouted, finally able to speak a coherent sentence, assuming that it was the Marshadow who was doing this to you.
"I'm serious, if you don't stop, I'll..."

You trailed off, your threat dying down in your throat as you saw the pokemon growing larger than you; it cocked its head in an amused manner, as if saying 'You'll what?'.

Powerless to stop the legendary, you could do nothing but let out interjections with your voice growing squeaky, until you weren't taller that one of the Marshadow's feet; you were probably smaller than even those.

And that's when your shrinking finally ended.

Realizing that, intimidated, you slowly looked up at the dark grey titan, who in turn stared back at you, unmoving, but with a small grin on its face.

From your current point of view, you noticed with a growing blush spreading across your cheeks, you had a pretty clear view of the monolith's genitals; by the sight, you could judge what gender this Marshadow was.

1212312.content:
Deep within a forest, a massive lake is said to be in the middle of the forest. The lake is a mystery as no creak, stream or even river seems to connect it. On top of that, a thick mist shrouds the whole lake, giving the lake the name of Mist Lake. Many pokemon never saw the lake, yet very few said they've had. The ones that do spot the lake would always say it clear drinking water with some nice healing properties.

However, a dangerous pokemon guards the lake, preventing anyone from trying to do anything to it. This dangerous pokemon is none other than Milotic, the protector of the lake. She has guarded the lake for many generations with a special gift she has. She will not let anyone do any harm to the lake as within the lake itself houses a secret. A tiny island that houses hundred of pokemon, and she will not let someone endanger any of the pokemon in the tiny island.

The day was going by peacefully for the majestic pokemon until she felt a disturbance. Taking little time to swim around, she looks around until she found the cause of the disturbance.

She plays with him to calm him down
12123121.content:
Near the shore of the lake, a small Sandshrew was trying to get some water from the mythical lake itself, he even brought a small bottle. Looking around, he doesn't see anything that respresent a monster or gaurdian the other pokemons were talking about. Feeling like its safe, the little ground pokemon rushes towards the lake. What he doesn't know is that Milotic already spotted him and slowly making her way towards him, while also changing his size.

Sandshrew kept running towards the water until he reaches it and turns his head so he could get the bottle on his back. But when he turn his head back, he saw the water was another distant away. Confuse, Sandshrew puts the bottle back and runs towards the water again. He reaches it a second time and repeats what he was about to do, only for the water to be distant away again. A little scare, but more annoyed, Sandshrew once again puts the bottle on his back and rush towards the water. However, as soon as Sandshrew was about to rush towards the water, he slams into something that knock him on his back. He looks ahead and see a massive yellow spuishy wall....that seems to be covered with building size scales. Sandshrew nervously looks up and panicks when he sees a massive pupil staring right at him.

"And what are you doing here youngling?" Milotic ask as she stares down at the small pokemon that she progressively shrunk until he was a grain of sand. Sandshrew, understandably scare, ran towards other direction as fast as his stubby legs could. Unfortunately for him, his path was cut short as Milotic slams the tip her tail in front of Sandshrew, blocking any exit. Sandshrew watch in fear as the mountain range like tail surrounds him.

"P-please d-don't hurt m-me..." Sandshrew says as he looks like he's in the urge to wet himself in fear. His fear grew more once Milotic moves her head close the tiny ground pokemon.

"You're clearly not here to harm my lake," Milotic says as she wojders what to do with the young pokemon. She has no intention of harming a young pokemon, but it doesn't mean she's not going to intimidate the little one to get answers. "So what brings you here?"

"I-I just wanted some w-water... I was thirsty..." Sandshrew says, scare stiff as to what the massive pokemon is going to do with him.

"Kind of a long way just to water, don't you think?" Milotic ststes, not believing the pokemon's story.

"I got lost in the forest, and i was thirsty."

"And how long have you been lost, little one?"

"Last time the moon was full..." Sandshrew says, not seeing the disbelief look on Milotic's face. That was a week ago, you mean to tell me this kid had noone looking after him that long? Milotic thoughts. She looks closely at the terrify pokemon as she wonders what to do with the pokemon. After some thought, she comes with a decision.

121231211.content:
Sandshrew was shaking like a leaf seeing this mountain sized pokemon staring him down. Her look softened seeing him, and she figured that if he had been out on his own for a week he must be tired, hungry and incredibly thirsty...no wonder he was out here. "Very well little Sandshrew...you may have a drink." She said as she stopped blocking his path. The earth shook for him as she moved, just a small movement for her but it almost knocked him off of his feet. He was still very scared, but slowly, cautiously he made his way towards the water.

It took him about a minute to reach it from his position, but when he did he pulled out his tiny bottle and filled it up, taking a drink...and drinking...and drinking like he hadn't drank before, crying tears as he did. It was so good! Milotic couldn't see his face, but she did note that he was going back for a second bottle. He really must've been thirsty, possibly very dehydrated at the point he was at.

She considered her options at this point...she could restore the young pokemon she supposed...he seemed harmless enough and he could be on his way...but at the same time he knew about her now, and he could very well tell more pokemon about her. At the same time, would she feel comfortable sending the young one out on his own again? It seemed clear to her that no one was coming for him and for all she knew she could be growing him back to send him out to starve or get hurt...or worse.

As the Sandshrew finished filling his bottle up he slowly turned to the giant giant pokemon, looking up and up and up...intimidated to his very core. "S-so m'aam I uh...g-got the w-water...th-thank you miss...can you grow me back now...?" He asked, scared of her clearly. She looked a bit sadly at him.
