12123121122.content:
To say the house was big would be an understatement. It was a veritable shelter of tons of different pokemon, it's own small village contained within these 4 walls. He nervously looked around as slowly, he felt like many many many eyes fell on him. A great rumbling overtook the air as a voice rang out, gentle but immeasurably powerful. "Do not worry, I have brought this little Sandshrew to join us today, he was lost and abandoned in the forest before he found his way to our lake, he is young and frightened, please show him hospitality and treat him gently, he is one of our own now." The voice intoned, and slowly, a few of the pokemon approached him before a bigger one made his way to the front. "Well if big sis says that you're good people then i'll believe it! Good to meet ya! I'm Diggersby!" A big friendly smile played on the face of a Diggersby as he towered over the little Sandshrew. "U-um, good to meet you too..." Sandshrew said, overwhelmed by all of this. Soon two tiny pokemon approached him. "Are you" "From the world of giants?" The female Plusle and female Minun asked and slowly he nodded.

"I-if that's what you refer to as outside of here...y-yes." He stammered and the two danced around him. "What's it like? What's it like?" They said in unison. "Girls, girls, don't overwhelm him." A female Raichu stepped forward and bowed her head. "Don't mind them, they're just curious. I'm Raichu, are you hungry dear?" She asked as Sandshrew looked down. "I'm o-okay ma'am, thank y-you though..." He said as his stomach growled. She laughed a bit at this. "It's no trouble, I understand this may seem...alien to you, but if Milotic brought you here that must mean you have a good heart, you'll find that this place is a sanctuary in time..." She said, smiling as she reached a paw out to lead the little Sandshrew inwards towards a corner of the giant structure. Reluctantly he took her hand and followed, the two younger electric pokemon following as well.

Eyes followed the little Sandshrew as he walked, some waved, said hi, and he tried to wave back sometimes but mostly kept his head down. Soon he was greeted by a little alcove with an electic symbol above it and he ducked into it with Raichu. "This is where me and my girls stay here, cozy, right?" There was a small alcove for food and heating up wood to cook with, two beds, and a table with a few chairs. No modern conveniences in sight however.

"It's...n-nice..." He muttered and she smiled. "Go ahead and sit down, Plusle, Minun, be polite, okay?" She said and they nodded. "We will!" They said in unison as they sat in other chairs smiling at him, he nervously smiled back. "So what happened to make you be brought here?"

"Did bad pokemon drag you here?"

"Did you wander here by mistake?"

"Did you-"

"GIRLS!" They heard from the corner with Raichu cutting up a bit of a fish sliver with a tiny sharp implement. "I'm so sorry about them Sandshrew..." She said and he shook his head. "I-it's okay...I th-think..." He said, sitting there nervously as the girls just smiled at him. He felt awkward. "B-but to answer, I-I wandered he-here by mistake..." He said, recalling the past week, and he shivered.

"Woooow."

"Well you have GOOD luck then!" They said, and he wasn't sure if they meant that or were trying to cheer him up. He didn't think it was good luck, the scenery didn't distract his mind from the fact that he was practically a speck now, a precarious speck on an island in the lake, surrounded by who knows what water pokemon...a magikarp would be a sea monster now beyond comprehension! He shivered before a small wood plate with fish on it was placed in front of him. "Go ahead, you need to build up your strength again...you've probably had a harrowing day..." The Raichu said gently as she also handed him a wooden fork and small cutting implement.

"So did big sis Milotic play with you yet?" Plusle asked.

"I love it when she visits us! She's so nice and tells the best jokes!" Minun finished. And Raichu just smiled at them, while Sandshrew shivered a bit before taking a bite of the fish, not answering their question. "T-thank you ma'am..." He muttered quietly, as he ate and stayed silent for the rest of it. "Just take your time...okay?" She gently placed a paw on his shoulder as he was eating, to try and reassure him.
12123121122.title: Sanctuary

choices: Sandshrew seeks out Shinx
Sandshrew keeps to himself for a bit longer
121231211222.content:
Sandshrew had been giving it a try, he was polite to every pokemon that greeted him or wanted to talk but...it was such an impossibility to think of, what was going on. He couldn't shake the terror he felt. It was the middle of the night when he was sitting outside, looking at the calm, endless stretch of water before him. If we was the size he was born at he was sure he would see the shore...at least if it weren't misty he'd be able to. He sighed before he heard a door opening at the massive structure behind him.

"Still thinking about it huh?" A Pancham, around his age came out. This guy had been doing his best to keep tabs on Sandshrew, but...he wasn't sure why, he just asked questions then left Sandshrew alone. "I-I know yo-you don't understand but..." The Pancham sat next to him, chewing on the leaf in his mouth. "Nah, it's cool. I can't say i've gone through with it, but your life just got upended right? Gotta be something to think on for quite a while." The Pancham said, nodding. "Still though, gotta admit, it's a nice place ain't it?" Pancham said, putting his paws behind his head and grinning. Sandshrew looked at him. "H-how do y-you all do this, w-without being afraid?" He asked and Pancham looked confused.

"Why would we be afraid? That's an odd question..." He said and Sandshrew looked at him. "W-we're all so small here...w-what if a water pokemon c-came and-and..." Sandshrew said as he shivered. "Ooooh, I get it...you DON'T get it, no pokemon in that lake would dream to mess with this island, they avoid it." Pancham said shrugging. "Yeah, they're big I guess, but no one messes with us here...big sis won't let them." Pancham said casually and Sandshrew looked down.

"W-what is the whole story w-with that?" Sandshrew asked and Pancham shrugged. "Ask an older pokemon, I don't know all the details...don't care to know 'em. Something about divine punishment on our ancestors or something and I guess that Milotic took pity on them. She's not normal...been around longer than anyone here, that's for sure. Probably be around a long time after us...yup." Pancham said as he got up stretching. "Dude, it's late. You should go to bed."

"Pancham...you and Raichu are a-always checking on me...why?" Sandshrew asked and the other pokemon was walking away, and called back not turning his head. "It'd be a jerk move to try and let you adjust on your own right? You should look for the Shinx in this place...he's a little older than us, still a kid though, and in something of the same boat as you." He said and Sandshrew turned his head. "W-what do you mean...?" He asked and Pancham replied. "He was big too, until about a year ago...though he's a neurotic mess...to be expected I suppose. He watched Milotic do...well...he saw the nasty side to big sis, his dad was a bad pokemon, dragged Shinx out here with him and...and he fears her. To be honest...I was hoping to talk to you so you could try and talk to him. No one else can get through to him. Big sis has given her best effort too but he refuses to go out on the lake with her. Some of us were thinking...you came from the same world as him right? Maybe..." The Pancham seemed at a loss for words. "Think about it, maybe you can help each other, who knows. I'm going to bed, just wanted to talk to you when we were alone. Later dude." And with that Pancham left Sandshrew out there alone, to look out on the water.
121231211222.title: Pancham's ask

choices: Shinx remains calm
Shinx runs away
1212312112221.content:
'Someone else like me huh? Maybe...in the morning i'll look for him...this place is huge but...if I ask around I should find him, right?' Sandshrew thought as he slowly stood up, looking out at the water one last time before he turned around to go inside and make his way over to Raichu's den, she was allowing him to sleep there for the time being.

Slowly, a monolithic head emerged from the water, Milotic watched for a second and Sandshrew turned his head to see her, she was still so...intimidating. She smiled at him as she lowered her head back down to submerge once again, leaving Sandshrew alone in silence. He shivered slightly.

'Thank you little Pancham, I was hoping...maybe Sandshrew could talk to him.' Milotic thought, relived that maybe someone might be able to get Shinx to open up a little...she did feel bad for him, he didn't ask for what happened to him...nor was it hard for her to blame his fear after she killed his dad in front of him, but still...if he could accept it, he'd at least be able to find happiness, as everyone else had here, right? 'Sins of the father passed to the child.' She thought. That summed up this entire island, in a way.

-

Sandshrew was making his way through the titanic fortress he now called home, hoping to find his target. If he could talk to Shinx, maybe he'd be able to alleviate some of his own anxiety here too! He hadn't fully explored everywhere there was to see in this place yet, but he was hoping to map it all out. He didn't want to impose on Raichu forever, he needed to strike out and find his own alcove to stay...if only because Plusle and Minun were driving him insane.

"W-will you get off p-please..." Sandshrew asked as Plusle was latched around his neck and Minun was holding onto her tail. "Only if you tell us what we're doing!" They said in unison. He wasn't sure how to respond. "I'm l-looking for someone today, a-and exploring the rest of this b-building hopefully..." He said and they still were latched on. "Oh, we can help!" "Yeah, let us help!" They said and Sandshrew sighed. "Please...girls, I-I need to f-find Shinx..." Immediately they let go of him and backed away. Sandshrew was surprised by this turn of events. "Oh...you're looking for him..."

"Are you sure you want to talk to him...?" This was NOT their usual attitude Sandshrew noted, slowly he nodded.

"He...kind of just wanders around, not talking to anyone...sometimes he'll have a panic attack, or snap at someone randomly who didn't say anything."

"We've found him passed out half starved on top of a wooden beam on the second floor of here once..."

So he could be anywhere, Sandshrew gathered. He nodded, welp, time to start his search. "Y-you girls s-should go play something f-fun, okay?" He offered and they nodded.

"Let's go see if Aipom wants to play!" They said in unison as they hopped off, Sandshrew scratched his head. 'They don't have a care in the world...' He thought as he kept walking away from this scene, glad to have the feeling in his tail back.

-

Sandshrew felt like he must've searched every inch of the place, and it was starting to get dark. He had at the very least met some nice new pokemon he hadn't seen before, but every time he brought up Shinx they either shrugged, gave a sad look, or scowled...nothing. "M-maybe I s-should make my way b-back..." He said as he turned around, bumping into someone, he fell back onto his butt and shook his head. "S-sorry..." He said only to see a terrified looking Shinx staring back. "You...I haven't seen you...I don't know you...who...what..." The Shinx was saying as he slowly backed away from Sandshrew. "Pl-please, I need to t-talk to you...you were b-big like me, r-right?" Sandshrew said and the Shinx slowed down. "You...came from out there...you came from home..." He said, almost wistfully, savoring the words. Sandshrew nodded.
1212312112221.title: Seeking Shinx

choices: She listed off multiple other pokemon
She wants to talk to Sandshrew alone
12123121122211.content:
"...Okay. So you're like me then." The Shinx said, as he slowly smiled. "That means...we can leave together!" He said as he held out his paw. "L-leave...?" Sandshrew said confused as the Shinx nodded. "Well...duh. I've been planning this for...for..." He seemed to look down and then muttered. "Today is day 382 I believe...yes...yes..." He nodded slowly. "Y-you okay...?" Sandshrew asked and Shinx slowly shook his head.

"Not until i'm out of here. I'll be okay then." He said and Sandshrew tilted his head. "B-but w-we're small...too s-small to go back t-to our world, r-right...?" Sandshrew said and the Shinx looked at him. "If we stay here, we die." He said simply. "You understand that, right?" And Sandshrew started to back away from Shinx. "W-what?" And the Shinx looked around to see if anyone was listening before getting close.

"You and me, we aren't like them. That...that monster Milotic...she kills everyone that comes close to this lake. I saw what she did to my dad! Without mercy! Without remorse!" He said, almost sounding hysterical and Sandshrew tried to back up again. "B-but she didn't k-kill us..." Sandshrew said and the Shinx looked at him, Sandshrew took note of his eyes, there were black circles under them...and he looked like he didn't eat much either. "We're their entertainment! A novelty Sandshrew, oh look, the giants! And then they'll discard us...they've tried to with me, I just know it! Milotic...she's tried to get me to go out on the water with her alone...I hide and evade when the bell sounds...she'll never get me...i'll get off this island, WE'LL get off this island!"

"W-we won't s-survive!" Sandshrew cried, he wanted to get the hell away from Shinx right about now. He was starting to realize why he got all those looks when he asked about Shinx. "We won't survive here! At least we have a shot out there!" Shinx cried as he looked at the Sandshrew. "Unless...you don't understand...you want to stay?" The Shinx said as he looked over Sandshrew before he...started to whimper and back away from Sandshrew. "No...i'm still alone aren't I...no...stay back!" His body language changed instantly to hostile. "Stay away from me! You can die if you want! I won't!" Shinx said as Sandshrew started to back off too. "I-I just wanted t-to talk to you...b-but that's okay...I-I understand that y-you don't want to..." Sandshrew said, clearly nervous around Shinx.

"I don't! No one gets it! The monster that she is! Only I saw!" Shinx now sounded very scared and hysterical as he ran away.

"...I'm s-sorry..." Sandshrew said as he saw the Shinx running.

-

"Dear, Shinx went through more than anyone here...he wasn't born here like most...and he was with a bad pokemon when he was brought here, even if he doesn't know it...he hasn't come to terms with what his dad was doing out here...and he won't listen to us, or Milotic. And not even you then..." Raichu sighed as Sandshrew sat at her table resting his head on his paw. "Here, I want to thank you for trying at least." She set an oddly cut bit of...he assumed it was an orange. 'Man, what does an orange look like to me now?' He thought as he picked up the chunk of citrus and took a bite. Still tasted the same. "T-thank you m-ma'am...to b-be honest I was h-hoping he'd help me c-come to terms with m-my situation too..." Sandshrew said as her paw gently patted his back. "Well, I think you're coming to terms just fine myself, i'm happy to have you with us Sandshrew." Raichu smiled at him. "Now do you know where my girls are?" And as if on cue two boundlessly energetic electric rodents appeared through the entrance to Raichu's alcove. "SANDSHREW! YOU'RE HERE!" They said in unison as they latched to him, knocking him over as he attempted to hold his orange still. "Girls..." Raichu sighed as they got off of him giggling. "H-hey..." Sandshrew said as he slowly set the orange down on the table and waved.

"So..." "Did you...?" They asked a bit quieter and he slowly nodded. "I-I understand n-now..." They nodded back. There was a silence before

*GONG*

*GONG*

Immediately Plusle and Minun's faces seemed to light up. "Big sis! Big sis!" They said as they went out the entrance and Sandshrew looked out to see a crowd of pokemon gathering into a central area. "W-what's t-this?" Sandshrew asked and Raichu walked over to take his hand. "It's Milotic's visit. She brings us supplies, food, medicine, sometimes sweets for the kids, or some frivolity she got off of...someone trying to do something with the lake." Raichu said as Sandshrew nodded. "She can shrink all of that stuff down for us, it's...kinda nice." Raichu said smiling, almost a bit sadly.

*GONG*

*GONG*

Sandshrew also noted quite a few big Pokemon standing near a platform. A Zoroark, a Scizor, a Pangoro, an Ursaring...and quite a few more. "They cut up the Magicarp that she delivers to us...it's a big job...takes them a while...but it's vital that they do it." She smiled. "B-but it must b-be huge!" Sandshrew said and she nodded. "They have a process..."

"And someday i'll be up there doin' it too!" They heard a voice call out as Pancham stood next to them. "That's my old man up there, and someday, it'll be me there with him!" He grinned. "Ah, Pancham...how are you tonight?" Raichu asked and he shrugged. "I'm good...waiting for big sis...hope I get to go out with her tonight!" He grinned and Raichu giggled. "Transparent, aren't you?" Right after she said this Sandshrew felt a shaking as he noted the roof of the fortress...was raising. Soon enough he saw it. The...would goddess be wrong? He didn't know, but he did know that she stretched into forever it seemed. She was there, with a mountain sized Magicarp in her mouth, but her eyes reeked of kindness. She gently set it down as it seemed to shrink from what would've been a mountain to a mere house sized Magicarp in what seemed to be a dedicated blocked off area in the fortress and she smiled down. "Hello, just the Magicarp tonight friends, he was...dying and so I eased his suffering and delivered him here." She looked around. "But i'm not opposed to doing the usual trip on the water with some of you~" She said as she looked around and everyone seemed to be clamoring for the opportunity. "J-jeez..." Sandshrew muttered and Raichu smiled. "Must seem odd to you, right? You'll understand in time." And Milotic chuckled, a rumbling to them. "Okay, okay, jeez...I already made my choice, okay?" She said with what seemed to be a light tone as Sandshrew felt the place quiet down.
12123121122211.title: A damaged Shinx and a usual visit

choices: She takes him back to the island peacefully
There are ill intentioned pokemon out and about
Shinx is making his move
121231211222112.content:
"I'd like to speak to Sandshrew...our newest friend. Shinx...is welcome as well." She said, but they all knew it was a formality. Shinx was nowhere to be seen. "Pssh...lucky." Pancham grinned before patting Sandshrew on the back. "It's rare to be able to go out on the water with her, let alone doing it with no one else around! Welp, hop to it man!" He said enthusiastically as he felt all eyes on him. "W-w-w-w-" He wanted to say something but he felt Raichu pat his back. "Here, i'll show you where to go." She said as she took his hand and led him forward, the crowd seemed to disperse around the two as she walked over to a small wooden platform and led him on it. "Don't worry Sandshrew, you'll have a good time." She smiled as Sandshrew seemed confused and soon the platform he was on was raising. Higher and higher he went, it was dizzying he found higher...higher...soon he wasn't able to make out the pokemon down below as he found he was outside, he was level with Milotic's snout...and he could see her moon sized eyes looking at him gently. "Hi...Sandshrew." She said kindly as he timidly stepped onto her snout.

-

Sandshrew had been quiet as he sat on top of the monolith, though she hoped he would initiate the conversation. "So...are you adjusting?" She asked and he nodded, before realizing she probably couldn't see him. "U-um...i'm a-adjusting okay ma'am..." He said nervously. "I'm glad...it isn't often that I bring outside pokemon here Sandshrew...but I can tell, you're a good child. I've seen some of your interactions here." She said and he looked around "Wh-wha...?" He asked and she smiled. "Oh yes, I have, I can see a lot of things out there Sandshrew...many many things that would blow your mind." She said in a mystical tone. "I know what you want to eat right now!" She said seriously before finishing. "...It's fish, right? Tell me i'm right?" She said in a light tone and he seemed puzzled by this before smiling a little bit and laughing. "U-um...actually, t-that does sound kinda good..." He said, he had acquired a taste for it since he came here he found and she laughed a bit. "See, told ya." Her voice was still so powerful but...it felt oddly disarming right now.

"Y-you're good..." He said and she chuckled. "I really am..." It got a bit quiet again before she thought. 'He really is shy, isn't he?'

"U-um, I do ha-have a question..."

"Oh?" She said.

"H-how can you h-hear me?" He said. "Y-you're so b-big..." He said and she smiled. "You don't tell a lady she's big Sandshrew, that's just rude." She said playfully. "And...I can hear all of you, just fine, as if you were the size I first saw you at." She said and his eyes widened. "R-really?" He asked. "Yup...I have a bond with you, all of you that's tied to this lake, and the power I used to shrink you." She said. "Anyone else out there...no way you'd ever be able to hope of contacting them, even if you got into their ear somehow...but I can hear you clear as day." She smiled a bit at this, and his retort was not what she expected. "W-why isn't it a t-two way street and you q-quiet down..." He was still stuttering, but she could hear the playfulness in his voice.

"Rude." She simply stated, but chuckled all the same. "Can't i'm afraid, this is as quiet as it gets for you. Can get louder if you want?" It was a joke, but Sandshrew snapped to attention. "N-no ma'am."

It got quiet again before Sandshrew muttered something again. "I don't t-think I d-deserve this..." He said and she seemed confused.

"Taking it hard still?" She asked and to her surprise he said the opposite of what she expected. "N-no...I mean...t-this place is n-nice...too n-nice for me..." He said dejectedly and she wanted to tilt her head before remembering her tiny passenger.

"...Why were you out there all alone Sandshrew? You know this lake is well hidden right? To find this place...to STUMBLE on it...talk about achievement in ignorance..." She said as he looked down. "I-i'm not ignorant..." And she smiled. "It really is well hidden though, finding this place takes deliberation or dumb luck."

"...I-I had to r-run..." Sandshrew said, Milotic got quiet, she felt like he was going to say his piece. "I-I never knew m-my parents...I-I was on t-the streets for...a l-long time...I h-had friends though...a-all of us had n-nothing but...e-each other..." He said. "T-the new...m-mayor I t-think...the city I-I was in...h-he didn't like t-the homeless problem...c-clean our streets I think he said...n-no more trash..."

Milotic closed her eyes.

"W-we all either h-had to leave or..." He cut himself off.

"...so I did...I w-went into the f-forest, h-hoping to find somewhere t-to go...I ha-had a small stockpile of f-fruit and my w-water bottle...I ran out w-within 2 days..."

"T-this place..." He wanted to cry. He was tiny. Hopelessly naked to the elements, not even a speck worthy of attention but. "I-i'm so happy..." He said and she smiled.

"Sandshrew...the world out there abandons what it doesn't want and takes what it desires...it has no business here...and it won't do anything to you ever again..." She said and he nodded. "B-but Shinx, he-he doesn't see it that w-way..." Sandshrew said sadly. He was hoping he would make a friend with him, someone else who used to be big.

"...I have to do sorry business to protect this place Sandshrew, it is necessary and Shinx was present when I needed to do this to his father. I spared Shinx because he was not brought here of his will and I would hope that he wouldn't do something in poor judgement...i'm hoping to not have to do that to him." She sounded sad...and serious. "W-what do you m-mean?" Sandshrew asked and she sighed.

"Sandshrew...this place is a haven and sanctuary...I treasure the pokemon here, in the lake and on the island...I guard this place...but the pokemon here know secrets...and are sadly paying for the mistakes of their ancestors. My duty isn't only to guard this lake from outsiders...it's to keep you all here." She said and Sandshrew's eyes widened.

"It is my duty, and I carry it out without hesitation, those that would spurn my protection...I must cast out...and when I cast them out..." She didn't need to finish her statement. Sandshrew felt the weight of it all the same.

"...T-that's scary..." He said nervously. "It's necessary. Please don't be scared Sandshrew, I don't want you to have to think about this, I tell you because I want you to stop Shinx from doing something rash." She said gently and he felt even more pressure from that statement.

"...W-would you have...k-killed me?" He asked and she was silent for a second before answering.

"If I deemed you unworthy or ill intentioned...yes." And he gulped.

"H-how long h-have you guarded t-the lake...Pancham s-says you're r-really old..."

"Rude rude rude! First you make a statement about my size, then my age! Yeesh...you'll be a real hit with the ladies Sandshrew. I'll talk to that little leaf chewer too..." She was joking again, trying to lighten the mood...he did smile a bit at this.

"...I-I s-still don't t-think I deserve t-this." He said.

"You do Sandshrew...you do."

"H-how m-many pokemon have y-you taken i-in like us...?" He asked

"It doesn't happen often...you and Shinx are the last ones in the past decade or so...before that...it was a little Pichu with her sick mom. She's Raichu now..." Sandshrew seemed surprised by this. "S-she was f-from the outside world t-too?"

"She was, poor dear was with her mom hoping for a fairy tale miracle from my lake...her mom was too far gone though...I took her in, she...also had a hard time adjusting." Milotic said and Sandshrew grew quiet again, he looked out on the water, letting the stillness of it calm him. "Here, i'll take you back now, i'm sure you're hungry and tired...and want to berate more women with your debonair charm." She said jokingly as she turned around, rocking his world as she did, even if it was a gentle motion for her.
121231211222112.title: On the water

choices: Sandshrew takes it easy the next day, not wanting to find him yet
Sandshrew looks for Shinx again
Follow the perspective of Shinx
1212312112221121.content:
Sandshrew looked out on the water, from his perch on the monolithic Milotic and he couldn't see her small smile either as she gently glided on the water, back to the tiny island. "Sandshrew...take heart okay? You belong here...and i'm trusting you to get through to Shinx...I also want you to let Pancham know that he's going on the water with me next, and that i'm going to teach him the proper way to talk about young ladies~ with manners." She finished that with a serious tone that Sandshrew couldn't help but laugh at.

"I'll i-inform him of his f-fate." Sandshrew said as she let him down at the shore. It wasn't much of a walk to the doors from there. He looked at Milotic. The impossible titan before him...she wielded immense power, she had every control of his fate but...he was starting to understand why the pokemon here loved her so. He allowed himself to feel a little more at ease as he waved. He didn't know if she could see it, but he had a smile too she nodded to him and sunk into the water, leaving Sandshrew there alone.

"O-okay...t-time for dinner, t-then bed." He said as he nodded to himself and approached the door.

-

"I didn't call her old! I just said she had been around a while!" Pancham said, losing his cool for the first time Sandshrew had seen. Raichu for her part was laughing hysterically.

"B-but you said s-she was around w-with your ancestors..."

"She WAS! I didn't say she was old! Do you know what she's gonna do to me!?"

"Lecture you for hours on end on pointers with women, while bringing all girl pokemon your age out on the water with you. Then tell your dad." Raichu grinned.

"Probably! Sandshrew...why..." He was holding his paws out, looking comically distressed as Sandshrew looked down.

"S-sorry..."

"It's fine, it just means Pancham has something to look forward to now." Raichu grinned and he looked down, defeated. "I'm going home...see you two around..." He muttered sadly as he waved. His cool image was certainly dinged in Sandshrew's eyes...but he couldn't help but snicker.

"Um...let's h-hang out together s-sometime...for r-real!" Sandshrew said and Pancham looked back and smiled, looking a bit less sad.

"Sure...i'll drag you out there with me when she comes back." He said and waved again.

"Come on Sandshrew, you must be hungry." Raichu said as she led him back to her alcove, where a plate of fish waited.

-

Sandshrew had finished his meal, but Raichu wasn't letting him leave the table until he said how the trip went. Sandshrew for his part was struggling because he didn't know how much he wanted to bring up. He eventually started talking though.

"She...w-was funny, i-in good spirits a-and tried to s-settle me d-down and comfort me. She also t-told me a little b-bit of her d-duties and..."

"Don't leave the island?" Raichu offered and Sandshrew nodded with a gulp.

"She's serious about that, don't take it lightly...but you won't try that, right?"

And Sandshrew shook his head. "No w-way! This is...the b-best thing that's ever h-happened to me." Sandshrew said, taking Raichu aback a little before she laughed.

"Really? That committed huh?" She grinned and he nodded.

"I-I never had a h-home...only a few f-friends on the street w-with me...t-they made fun of my s-stutter too..." Sandshrew was rubbing his paws together and Raichu frowned a bit at him.

"Rough life huh?" She said as she patted his head. "So did she tell you about me then?"

Sandshrew was surprised to hear Raichu bring it up.

"A l-little..." He said and she nodded.

"You know my dad was against it, my mom and I trying this. Said she should spend her last days in peace, not on a journey like this, chasing a fantasy...a fairy tale. I stubbornly refused to accept it...she just wanted to be with me. I wonder if he's still out there sometimes...in the outside world." Raichu said a bit wistfully.

"D-do you think of t-trying to l-leave?" Sandshrew said and Raichu chuckled a bit.

"When I first got here...yeah, I thought about it. My mom died the day we got here...it wasn't Milotic though...it was the water. The water heals pokemon...but it specifies itself to the unique needs of the pokemon. My mom...there was no saving her. What she needed...she needed to be eased, she died at peace, Milotic kept saying. I didn't want to accept any of it and I found myself here...the size I am now, crying."

"H-how'd you g-get by?" Sandshrew asked and she smiled.

"The pokemon here were eager to take me in, they tried to comfort me. Milotic too...she took me out like she did for you tonight. Though she didn't tell me what would happen if I tried to escape that night, she only wanted to talk about my mom...I understood a lot about this place that night."

She looked towards the corner of the room, where Plusle and Minun were curled up on their cots.

"Their parents...didn't heed her warnings, they were born here but...wanted better than this island for their daughters." Raichu said sadly.

"They were infants, and Milotic wasn't going to punish them for what their parents tried. I offered to take them...I was a teen at the time." She smiled. "I have a lot Sandshrew, a life. I'm glad that you're counting your blessings too."

"...D-do they k-know?" Sandshrew asked and Raichu looked at him. "...Yeah. They know."

"...I n-need to f-find Shinx t-then..." Sandshrew said and Raichu gave a small nod.

"I'm glad you don't want to give up on that...for now though, I think you need to go to bed." Raichu smiled and pointed to the cot Sandshrew had been using.

"Y-yeah...I am t-tired..." He said as he made his way from the table towards it. "Wash up first!" He heard and he looked to see her smiling. He nodded, getting ready for bed.

In the morning...he'd decide what to do.

Zorua saw Gothorita, a new girl from another town. He doesn't know too much of the girl other than the fact that most of the students find her a bit weird, and she is supposed to be a very strong pyschic pokemon. Before Zorua could debate wheither it might be a good idea to prank the girl or not, Gothorita stops walking exactly one step before the mark where the prank is supposed to set off.

"My, what do we have here?" Gothorita says in a quiet cheery, yet eery tone. She looks up where the prank is, even though its very well hidden.

Shoot, did she found my prank already? Zorua nervously thought to himself as he wonders how she can even sense his prank. No, there's no way she can-

Before Zorua could finish that thought, Gothorita's eyes glows, and psychically pulls down the bucket with enough force, she also pulls Zorua along with the rope. Zorua screams a bit when he felt himself falling to the ground when he stops in midair. He looks and see Gothorita's smiling face looking at him.

"And whose this little guy?" Gothorita says as she pinches Zorua's cheek. "Might it be the famous prankster i heard so much about in class? I thought the other pokemon said you were good at pranking." She says with a small chuckle.

"Um, hi, i was expecting a friend, um... a mimikyu to come by." Zorua says, lying as his friend move out of town last week. Gothorita laughs a bit.

"For a great prankster, you're a really awful lier." She says as she taps her head, indicating she read his thought. Zorua gulps a bit as he knew he was caught. "Still, since you and I are talking, why not be friends?" She asks her cheery and still eery tone.

"Um... S-Sure?" Zorua says as he figures he doesn't have a choice.

"Tee hee, good." Gothorita says with a sweet smile, before opening her eyes. "Since we are friends, would you like to help me with a new move i have been working on?"

Zorua got really nervous as he has no idea what this girl is going to do with him. Though, with the fact he is still in her psychic grip, he figures he doesn't have a choice, again. "What exactly is the new move?"

Gothorita smiles as she says nothing and raise one of her hands below the hovering fox. Her eyes glow once again as she says one simple word. "Shrink."

In one quick section, in a blinding flash, Zorua found himself falling. He flails his arms and leg in fear until finally he landed on a soft yet very dark ground. He was confuse of what just happen before he heard a voice that made him nervous.

"Oh my, what a wonderful 'shrinking' result." Gothorita's voice could be heard follow by her giggling, except it was different, her voice is very loud. He looks up and sees why, he sees Gothorita's gigantic face above him. He soon saw that he shrunk, he shrunk to the size of....

12233221121.content:
Zorua's heart sank completely as he noted that he couldn't be bigger than a pesky insect.

And, judging by the expression painted on Gothorita's expression, he was going to be treated like one.

The psychic-type was smirking at him.

"Hm..." Gothorita contemplated the bug-sized Zorua sitting on her paw, held down by psychic.

"... The results are... interesting," she murmured.

Zorua stared at the giantess for a moment.

"Well... then grow me back!... Please?" he tried.

Gothorita smirked.

"Not quite yet," she responded, giggling.

For the second time, Zorua's heart sank.

"You see, my tiny friend, I still haven't tested the growing part yet... that aside, I'm planning to keep you for quite some time anyway,"

Zorua's jaw dropped as a scream erupted from his mouth,

"WHAT?!"

Gothorita giggled again,

"Oh don't worry... yet. I'll feed you... and I'm not going to hurt you... I mean, I'll try not to," she said, pointing to the fallen bucket that was meant to hit her.

Zorua sighed resignedly.

‘Great, now I'm going to be some pet to this weirdo?’ he thought sourly.

Somehow, Gothorita seemed to sense his thoughts, because she smirked.

"... ‘Pet’ isn't exactly the word I'd use..." she chimed, shaking the paw that held Zorua a bit, rocking his world.

Probably a payback because he called her weirdo’.

He looked up, feeling dizzy.

"... What are you going to do to me?" he asked, thinking of all the hideous scenarios that this girl was probably going to subject him to.

After all, pokemon DID consider her weird, and she had a reputation for being really powerful.

And Zorua just had a taste of her power... now, he was the one powerless. He was too tiny to do anything on his own, and he was at the mercy of this unknown psychic-type, who seemed quite mischievous. Her intentions could mean no good.

"Relax, will you? Don't tense up like that, it isn't good for someone your size," she spoke.
"And what I am going to do to you? You'll find out very, very soon Zorua," she spoke his name for the first time, mischief seeping in her tone.

Before the tiny fox had a chance to reply, Gothorita spoke again,

She had been watching Zorua longer than he had realized, and had intended to test this on him anyway, what she'd do to him...who knows? No one was gonna miss him, she knew that, and he was intriguing for more than just his size right now...it wasn't like he had a say in the matter anyway.

Zorua's world shook, it was chaos as this monolithic pokemon simply carried him out of the forest. His eyes widened as she approached the village, if anyone saw him...!

"Don't worry, no one will even spare you a second glance, it takes a close look to make out your features right now." Gothorita said playfully, not sure if this was reassuring, Zorua simply looked down at the expansive paw he was on.

Gothorita was pretty happy with her catch though, he had no way to push back on this and it wasn't like she could even grow him right now. Maybe eventually...hmm...maybe.

"We're almost there my new...'friend'." Gothorita said as Zorua gulped.

Gothorita casually entered her house and went to her room, looking at the tiny dark type with an eerie smile. As she shut her door she set Zorua on the bed and simply stood over him, paws on her hips.

He was...truly tiny, and he was taking in this titanic pokemon, she was bigger than any building he had seen, far far too intimidating, and something he had no hope of pushing back against. Whatever happened next, it wasn't up to Zorua, it was up to Gothorita...and they both knew that.

Gothorita smiled down at her speck friend. Zorua wasn't going to be away from her at any point in the near future...and for now, she'd allow him to be quite close to her. With a smirk she pulled a tube of red lipstick from her bag with psychic.

He found himself lifted with psychic as, with a loud pop to him, she opened her tube of lipstick.

He found himself in front of a red expanse, her lips...miles in each direction, behind him, a sea of a slightly darker red...the tube itself.

"Don't worry...i'll be gentle~" She whispered, still a roar to Zorua as the breeze created by her talking pounded upon Zorua like a hot tornado. She giggled at his thoughts before, very gently, edging him into the lipstick. A sea of red to him.

With a pucker, Zorua watched as slowly, from his sticky prison, her lips grew closer and closer. He touched down onto the soft, squishy surface...slightly wet with saliva as Gothorita gently put a layer of lipstick on.

Zorua was adhered...safely, and unable to move. Gothorita giggled at his thoughts, something that rocked Zorua to his core and threatened his eardrums. She went about her business, going home as Zorua attempted, with little to no success, to see beyond the red that coated and matted his fur, and beyond the red that took up his entire world now. This...this goddess of a pokemon wasn't intending to let him go at all! He was her friend...or pet...or plaything...maybe all 3!

'Close to all 3, my little specky Zorua.' Gothita thought, as she made it to her home...and made for her room where she looked in the mirror, not even able to make him out with her eyes, figuring because of how covered in red he was. His world rumbled and a sound akin to an explosion assaulted his ears. Gothorita groaning as she woke up. Her eyes fluttered open, and she smiled, once again rocking Zorua's world. She picked up on his thoughts...he felt lost, so so lost, and sticky.

Zorua was seeing nothing but red, tasted the awful taste of red, and was absolutely covered in the makeup. Her simple little lipstick tube did all of this to him...he was frightened. Gothorita enjoyed having Zorua under her grasp, but she didn't intend to hurt him, and him being frightened wasn't something she necessarily wanted, though she understood it. She'd keep it to herself for now though, as it stood, she'd release him from the simple prison and landscape that was her lipstick coated lips.

"Well Zorua, let's see if I can find you now." She whispered as she got up. Zorua quickly started to tumble, but he landed in a still sticky goop of red and was adhered safely as his world traveled to her mirror.

He could see more of her than just her lips like this...it was such a surreal experience, but she smirked, something that once again hurled Zorua too and fro.

"Don't worry specky...I know where you are..." She said, as soon Zorua was pulled from the lips, gaining a headache from her mere whisper. Farther and farther from the landscape until he could see more of her face...his entire view. He shivered as he saw her.

"Please don't be afraid, i'm your friend Zorua...you'll come to know that...the only friend you'll ever need." She said and Zorua realized that there really was no out for him.

"Indeed...I can't grow you back, but that doesn't mean it's the end for you...think of it as a new life. An opportunity to experience what no other pokemon has ever experienced before. For now though..." She levitated a glass forward, of water and lowered Zorua into it. It was like a massive ocean. He looked up at the distant sky, glass rising higher and higher...and looking down he couldn't even see the bottom of the glass. The red that coated and matted his fur began to wash away, and soon he could see his own black fur again.

"Drink little one, i'm sure you're thirsty." The voice pounded upon his head, grimacing and he began to drink. Gothorita pondered this. She was being as quiet as she could...maybe she should invest in learning to speak psychically. She didn't want to blow his ears out. Smiling she walked away.

"Don't worry, i'm just going to get a little food for us...you can wade water, right?" She said as she walked off, leaving the floating speck in the glass of water.

The red of the lipstick faded away though and he sighed...this was his existence now? The pet, or friend or whatever of this new pokemon in town? This wasn't what he expected or wanted...still, what could he do? It wasn't like she could grow him back, or if she could, she didn't seem to want to do that either.

He waited, floating until eventually, the water around him shook and raged...she was entering the room.

Carefully, she approached the table the simple glass was on and reached out psychically. Gothorita found Zorua soon enough, and confirmed it by seeing the tiny speck floating. She smiled and levitated him out, very gently setting him on a napkin on her desk.

"Now...I brought food, okay?" She said, trying to be as absolutely gentle as possible, but it was still a roar to the tiny pokemon, he grimaced and soon, she took off a tiny amount of ham and tiny crumb of bread and dropped them before Zorua.

To him, they were veritable mountains, skyscrapers honestly...this was two simple specks of food, and yet...

He shook his head, he started eating and Gothorita smiled before starting to eat her meal.

'What am I gonna do?' Zorua thought bitterly. 'This freak...she shrunk me to nothing...I gotta figure out how to get the hell away from this bi-' Zorua thought before he realized...Gothorita could read minds...and she was reading his!

He gulped down his bite of food and slowly looked up before he heard her.

"Ok, guess all i can do is somehow make Gothorita to notice me or try to get out of this mess." Zorua says to himself as he tries to keep his footing as he can feel Gothorita walking around.

Hours has past, and so far, Zorua has no luck. Evrything looks the same, and he can't tell what's safe and what's a recent lipstick. As Zorua continues to explore, he was able to hear what's going on, though it wasn't much as Gothorita hasn't done much to communicate with anyone other than her family.

With Gothorita constantly moving, Zorua continues to struggle to not get fling into the wet lipstick and risk being stuck on it. As time went on...

Finally, Zorua made to the exit....only to quickly be reminded that he practically a nanoscopic organism as he see the outside world once again.

Time has past alright as it was the next day apperantly and Gothorita is out in middle of the village. Blurry galaxies that are none other normal size pokemon going about their daily lives, all completely unaware of the sad fate that has bestow on Zorua.

Sadly, this also applies to Gothorita, the main cause of Zorua's new size, as she has not only completely forgotten about shrinking Zorua, but the said event is nothing more than a long lost faded memory in the girl's mind.

This doesn't stop Zorua from looking up and sees the celestial planets that is Gothorita's eyes high above. If he can make it up there, he might have a chance, a be it miniscule chance like himself, to get her to notice and remember him. There was one major problem for the poor fox. One slip up and Zorua will most likely fall off his only salvation and will be force to live the remainer of his days as a nanoscopic speck, struggling to survive.

Preying for Arceus to give him strength, Zorua attempt to scale the face of Gothorita as she goes about her daily life, blissfully unaware of Zorua. After a while...

Gothorita doesn't hear anything, and she is about to rub her body with soap
Gothorita hears something in the tub, but doesn't know what it is
122332211233322123.content:
Time has gone on for quite a while to the point Zorua has lost track of it. He doesn't know if he has been stranded on Gothorita's lips for minutes or hours. It doesn't help at all that Gothorita kept conversation, mostly to herself, to a minimum. The galaxy size pokemon walkimg and moving around was also makimg things extremely difficult for the nano fox as so much gunk of the lips stick were getting on his fur and covering him head to paw. With so much of the gunk on him, Zorua doubts he's going to wash the stuff off for weeks.

Though, it seems fate is going to test that theory as Gothorita looks at the time, seeing that its almost been several hours since her nice nap, and forgetting Zorua's exsistent, and its starting to get late. "Hmmm, I think a lovely bath would be nice before going to bed." Gothorita tells herself as she make her way to her bathroom. There she stands in front of the tub as she turns some knobs and warm water pours out.

As Zorua traverse the endless red landscape, he hears a extremely loud noise coming from the outside. "Ugh, what is she doing now?" Zorua says outloud as he tries to ignore the loud noise. However, shortly after hearing the noise, Zorua takes a few step before his paw sinks into a what's supposed to be a dry spot but now wet section of the makeup. Zorua tries to pull himself out but notices that the whole area is getting wet. Zorua looks around and see that the whole makeup is melting. "What's going on?!" He screams in fear as endless mounds of red lipstick is melting and a tsunami is rushing towards Zorua. Zorua closes his eyes as he is engulf by the red sea.

Gothorita looks at the running water, waiting for the tub to be fill. Hot steam can be seen from the tub and making contact against her face. Soon, she felt the makeup on her lip is running. "Oops, forgot i put on a layer earlier." She chuckles to herself as she sees drops of the lipstick falling into the tub. She waits a few seconds before closing the knobs. She then starts ti get inside the tub.

Zorua felt like he enter the world's most nuassciating ride in as he felt himself dropping for countless miles until finally a loud splash surrounds him. He felt himself still trap in a gulp of the makeup before he slowly started to feel warm. Soon warm water engulfs Zorua, causing him to figure out where is the surface of where ever he is now. After trying to not drown, Zorua manage to make it to the surface, chocking a bit as he see himself lost in a endless ocean of warm water. "W-where am i now...and...w-where's gothorita?" Zorua nervously ask himself as he looks around and sees no traces of Gothorita anywhere. He tried looking up, but a extremely thick layer of what looks like fog or cloud block his view. Unfortunately, things were getting worse as a loud rumbling can be heard high above. Zorua looks up in time to see a omni size black horizon coming right down into the ocean thousands of miles away from Zorua, yet close enough to create a tsunami wve that crash into Zorua. Soon another horizon came crashing down on the opposite side of the fox as that wave crash into him, making the poor fox to bounce around in the ocean, more confuse of what is going on. Sadly, the wasn't the end as a loud rumble can be hear high above Zorua, making him wish the crazy ride would just end as he looks up. He gulps as he sees nothing but a black sky falling towards his direction. He swims as fast as he could be the sky just basically lands almost right on top of him, creating a wave below him and dragging him away from the impact. As soon as the wave finally settle, Zorua looks around to see what almost crush him. The fog was cleared out due the landscapes impacting into the ocean, giving the fox a sight that made him wish he was bigger so he could escape, Gothorita's everlooming body.

To both sides of the fox is Gothorita's knees, her hip just below Zorua. Gothorita's stomach and chest can be seen "slightly" above the ocean surface. And finally, Gothorita's galactic face can be seen countless miles ahead of the fox, looking very please and relax with herself as she enjoys the warm water against her skin. Zorua realizes he must be in Gothorita's tub, and in some sense, taking a bath with the very forgetful psychic. He wish he could swim away, but knows he need her help some how, provided he can even get her to notice him. "Hey, Gothorita!" Zorua shouts, preying the galatic pokemon can hear him, but should've remember that its pointless to try to speak normally at his size, it has to be mentally.

Zorua wonders if its even possible, but he thought that, even though the current situation is akward, this might be a good oppurtunity as surely Gothorita can hear his thoughts now that she is relax with nothing to distract her.....ok, he highly doubts that how being a psychic even works, he's a dark type for crying out loud, bit what choice does he have left other than swim to any part of her body for safety.

After some time to try to broadcast his thoughts to Gothorita....

Zorua struggle to swim to the surface of the water as he tries to call out for Gothorita. "Gothorita, please stop, i'm right here!" With no other option, Zorua tries to swim towards the psychic's knees before she finishes her foot and brings the soap close to Zorua just to clean her legs.

It was too late however as Gothorita's celestial size body moves again as she submerge her foot to wash the soap off, moving the soap out of the water and have it hovering directly above Zorua's position. To make matters far worse than it need to be, the soap start to get slippery and soon Gothorita lost her grip and the soap drops. Zorua gulps as his area grew dark and he looks up to see a system size bar of soap filling his sky as he covers his eyes before it impact.

Gothorita saw the soap slip and only giggles to herself of not paying attention to the little thing as she reaches for it. As for Zorua, the good news for him is that by some dumb amount of miraculous luck, the soap didn't turn him into paste. However, the nightmarish news for the poor nano fox as he felt the world rumble violently....

1223322113.title: Next

choices: A city size Absol towering over him.
A mountain size Absol with him between her claws covered in honey.
A rough endless plain with countless cayons and a red pupil filling the horizon
12233221131.content:
Zorua sees the one person he wasn't expecting to see at all to venture the forest, Absol, the class president. Everyone at school knows her very well, even Zorua, as he did once or twice try to prank her only to end with a disaster. While showing no signs of distast or anger towards his shenanigans, Absol has given Zorua reason to be very intimidated of her. She can be either the most caring classmate to talk to, or the most terrifying force on the planet. Even the bullies at school shuts up and listen to her when she enters the facility.

"Maybe this might be a bad idea...." Zorua says as he trembles of the thought of pranking Absol again. Last time he tried it with a couple of cookies and a spicy berry, Absol forced him in a maid outfit and force him to clean the whole school for everyone to see.....it was very embaressing. "Then again, what else she could that's worse than that?" Zorua say as he waits for Absol to get into posistion and debates on the possible consequences.

Absol, wearing her usual attire of glasses, a megastone as a hairpiece and a bow on her main, was walking through the forest for the first time, only for one thing. Word through the vinewhip is that Zorua might be trying to pull a prank again, which she had to get the info through one of Zorua's friends, so she figures she should look into it. Normally she would ignore such thing as she knows that while Zorua's pranks are usually harmless, they are starting to annoyed the teachers and principle enough that they ask her if she can convince him to dial it down by alot. Begrudgingly, she accepts the request and goes out to look for him. So far she sees nothing that can indicate a prank, but once she got into few feet close to a certain spot, her sense for disaster kicks in and she stops a foot before the spot beneath the bucket. She looks up to see the prank and scoffs a bit. "Not one of his more inventive pranks." She says, somewhat sounding a bit disapointed as she uses shadow swipe and destroys the buckter, covering her claws with a bit if honey.

Zorua trembles at the spot as he watch the class president destroy his prank with ease and now is scanning the area for him. Nervously, Zorua tries to see if he either remains quiet as he could or back away slowly, he might have a chance to avoid the wrath of Absol. Unfortunately, luck was nowhere at his side as Absol scans the area a bit before instantly pouncing towards the direction where Zorua is and knocks him on his back with her planting on his chest and stomach. "Hello Zorua, fancing seeing you hear." She says while adjusting her glasses.

"H-hi A-Absol." He says in fear as he looks up at the terrifying pokemon's face as she looks like she's judging his fate. "S-so what are you d-doing here in this fine f-forest?"

"Funny you should mention that," Absol says in a stern tone as she moves her face close to Zorua's face to where her nose boops his, letting Zorua see the eyes of fear. "I was about to mind my business and head home to read some books when Principal Gardevoir asks me to talk to you about your last prank you did with Mawile. She really didn't appreciated the poster you drew and plaster in the gym wall for everyone to see." She says as she remembers the poster, which had Mawile in a swimsuit as some pokemon storm by and accidentally knocks her clothes half way through, one of Mawile's embaressing memories.

"I t-thought she c-could use some attention, since she always claim boys n-never go to her for s-some reason. Figure a nice look of her w-would be nice..." Zorua, somewhat trying to justify his prank and doing it poorly. Absol cleary sees through the lie and nudge her face closer, making Zorua more nervous. Though she does know Zorua spoke some truth as Mawile did talk to her the other of the topic, truth was that Mawile is one of those types of tough people whose very hostile towards people who try to see her as easy target to flirt, she just needs to learn some patience is all.

"Hmph, well whatever your intentions are, your prank seem to be enough for me JUSTIFY my next punishment for you." Absol says as she stand back again to full height, but not letting her paw off Zorua.

"Y-your going to force me in a maid outfit again and clean the whole town this time?" Zorua says in nervousness, as he has no idea how to recover from that type of embaressment.

"Tempting on the thought and might be more humoress for me to see, but not this time. This time you are going to play test dummy for something i just recently came up with. A new pokemon move no one has ever came up with if you would call it that." Absol says as she closes her eyes to focus on the very move she talked about.

"What type of move i-is it?" Zorua says in fear, scared to see what Absol is going to try on him.

"This..." is all she said as her eyes open up with a bright look the created a flash the blinded Zorua. He rubs his eyes as tries to figure out what exactly the move Absol did on him did, besides blinding him. His vision slowly recovers a bit, but he doesn't see Absol in front of him. However, when he is able to see again, he saw a sight that terrify him to his very core.
12233221131.title: The class president might not had been a good idea

choices: Does her role of class president and try to find the fox
Decide to give up, and stomp her paw as a way of saying Zorua's gone for good
Unknowingly catapulted Zorua off her paw and somewhere else
122332211313.content:
Zorua gulps, as all he could see ahead of him was a vast endless desert like plain. This area is so strange and alien to him, almost like he got transported to a new world. The ground was black, hard as rocks, and there are so many ditches and cayons, Zorua looks inside one of them and gulps as he could not see the bottom of the cayon. Zorua then looks up and was rather disturb by horizon in the distant. Far in the distant looks like a red sun that can fill the sky any second with a black center.

When the who situation finally settle enough, Zorua got up from his spot and calls out for the class president. "Absol, where are you!?" He scream out, thinking this must be some weird trick the pokemon did. His voice echos in the distant as nothing replies to him. He tries to call out again, but soon the air explodes as a powerful force knocks the fox down as he covers his ears.

The force was so strong and powerful, Zorua could not figure out where it came from or what causes it. He could only wish that the class president is somewhere close by to save him. Unbeknowst to Zorua, she is far closer than he realizes.

Zooming out, far, far out, the fox hasn't realizes that what he is standing on is just a pad that belongs to the paw of Absol, the smallest pad on her paw. Absol scans her paw as she tries to find Zorua.

"Hmmm," Absol looks at her paw, not blinking as to not risk making her task more difficult than it is. "Oh dear, should have restrain myself more than i had when using this new move." She says to herself. "I've only just started using this move, and already i went far more than i wanted to with Zorua." She says with a sound of both slight concern and mostly stoicism. She wanted to shrink the fox, but not to a size where she can't even see the little guy. This would only prove more difficult as Absol is not a psychic pokemon, so there is no way she could hear Zorua's thought to even have a clue where he is. Yet, she shows little concern of the matter. "Hmmm," Absol wonders to herself just how much she should even try to find Zorua, for all she knows, she shrunk so much that at this point, he's a lost cost to even find. However, she's class president, and someone that tries to care for anyone. Then again, Zorua has been proving quite the trouble maker as of late. "The shrinking move is supposed to make the shrunky much more durable the smaller they get. So it could be far too mean to just abandon the little guy, epsecially since i'm still in the foresr." She debates with herself. "Then again, i just made Zorua my testing dummy for this new move, and i still need practice so that way i don't go this far again, so it might prove more beneficial for me to find him. Ugh, what to do, what to do?"

After some time of thinking to herself, Absol....
122332211313.title: Within her paws

choices: Absol looks for a small Pokemon to get a closer look
Absol looks for psychic Pokemon to locate him
Absol tries something else
1223322113131.content:
Considering the responsibilities Absol had to uphold as class president she decided that she should try her best to find Zorua, it was the right thing to do even considering his character. Not to mention, if all goes well Zorua would make the perfect test subject for her new move. The trouble was finding him, he was apparently so small that his presence seemed to be all but gone. Nonetheless she tried her best to look for the fox somewhere on her paw and started squinting to get a better look.

Meanwhile, Zorua's world began to violently shake and the red and black sun in the far distance began to rapidly get closer. As more red took up the sky he was sure it was going to crash down onto him so he hunkered down and cowered, only to risk a peak to see that it stopped advancing. It looked strangely familiar somehow but it was far too large to make out. The dark center surrounded by all the red was constantly moving, turning from side to side and sometimes even pointing right at him. Gathering the courage to stand up and study the thing that was dominating the upper half of this strange world Zorua was on the cusp of realizing what it actually was until suddenly, the landscape started moving.

Absol was currently turning her paw, testing if a new angle would help her spot the small fox but after moving her limb for a bit it was quickly apparent that it didn't. She leaned her head back in momentary defeat and let out a frustrated sigh while she thought of what else she could do. But back on the paw, Zorua was having the worst troubles of his life.

The world turned lopsided and he found himself tumbling down the black landscape. Through some luck he was able to grab onto a small bump in the terrain and stabilized himself but the sight just behind scared him stiff, the edge of one of the large canyons he saw just before. Before he could scramble away a large gust of wind ruined his footing and down he plummeted, impacting and tumbling off the cliff-face for what felt like forever. The fall was so long, in fact, that Zorua's panic began to wear off and he realized that all the collisions weren't hurting for some reason. After the light grew dim, he lightly hit the bottom where the floor felt warm and slightly soft. he sat there, not sure what to do.

Unaware of Zorua's hectic journey, Absol continued brainstorming. She didn't want to reveal her secret and let other Pokemon know of her new move but if Zorua was to be rescued, it might be required. A Pokemon that was small enough to get a closer look might work, she figured, but a psychic Pokemon might also be able to locate him.

Thinking on it, she decides.
1223322113131.title: The search for Zorua

choices: Ribombee, class vice president and Absol's best friend
Joltik, science club president and Zorua's friend
a different pokemon
12233221131311.content:
Absol pouts a bit, realizing that she's going to have to require help as much she didn't want in order to even find Zorua at whatever size he's at. She did thought of maybe some psychic pokemon, but there's no telling if they even can sense Zorua. On top of that, it would be rather difficult to convince them that she capable of shrinking pokemons without demonstrating the move she has yet to fully control. The only other option is small, tiny pokemon and see if maybe they can even help. Though that may prove slightly troubling as she only knows very few pokemon that go to school while are the size that any pokemon could accidentally step on them without knowing, some of which she embarrassingly had a part of stepping on as well. She smiles as she easily could think of one pokemon that would be willing to believe her and help her search for Zorua.

"Zorua, if you can hear me, try to stay on my paw. I'll have someone to look for you." Absol spokes at her paw, hoping the shrunken fox understood her. With that, she prepares to move while awkwardly walking with three of her other paws and tries to avoid using the paw Zorua is trap on.

Zorua sadly was not having the most pleasant experience as he was trapped in "cayon," unaware that he's practically trapped in one of countless cracks and wrinkles that makes up the surface of the rather smooth to the naked eye pad on Absol's paw. At first, the light above was still dim and making everything hard to see, but at the red sky that stares down at the location of where the fox is at. That soon changes as the red sky soon vanishes, and a slightly clearer light could be seen. However, things gets worse as a almighty force booms down and hurt Zorua's ears as he tries to cover his ears. The sound was so loud and intense, he thought for sure that he was going deaf any second now. The loud celestial thunder noise was going on for a while before finally things got quiet. Zorua, still having his ears ache in pain, looks up in hopes that this was the worst things would only get. Sadly, it was not as the world started rumble and soon everything shakes as if someone strapped a galaxy size rocket to the world and everything got shove to one direction from the sheer amount of g-force. Zorua felt himself get slingshot to one side of the walls and his body is practically glue to the warm, rough surface as the world rumbles and moves violently. Thankfully for Zorua, him getting trapped where he is made it to where he wouldn't have to worry about flying off the millisecond the alien world start moving. That being said, Zorua had no choice but to endure the terrifying ride of his life as he has no idea when the world will finally stop.

Neither pokemon realizes just how lucky Zorua is in his current situation. had the fox stay on the surface of Absol's paw, Absol would've unknowingly catapulted Zorua off her paw before she even finishes her first step. Thankfully for Absol, she wouldn't have to go far to meet the pokemon she's sure will help her, which will only take her about five to ten minutes of walking, even by walking awkwardly with three of her legs. Unfortunately for Zorua, that is five to ten minutes to the normal size world of having to endure a terrifying ride.

Five minutes later, Absol made it back to school and begin scanning the area for the pokemon she's looking for. "Come on, she normally loves to stay around at school." She says as she's having difficulty find the particular pokemon. A few seconds later, and her eyes spot the pokemon she's looking for. Smiling at herself and adjusting her glasses a bit, Absol makes her way to...
12233221131311.title: Seeking Small help for someone even smaller

choices: Ribombee sees Zorua
Ribombeee doesn't see Zorua and gives up
Ribombee doesn't see Zorua, but accidentally picks him up somehow
122332211313111.content:
It was exactly who Absol was looking for, Ribombee! Not only was she the class vice president, she was what Absol considered to be her best friend. While she could be trusted with the knowledge of Absol's size-changing abilities she was also the smallest Pokemon she knew and would hopefully be able to perceive the shrunken fox Pokemon. The tiny bee-fly Pokemon was lazily hovering around and noticed Absol out the corner of her eye, prompting her to happily fly over.

Ribombee flew right up to Absol's face and excitedly waved. "Hey, Absol!"

"Hello, Ribombee. I was wondering if you might be able to help me with something."

"Like what?" she asked, perching on one of the claws of her raised paw. "School stuff?"

"Not exactly, It's a bit embarrassing really. Long story short, I was tasked with talking to Zorua about his behavior and I thought cutting him down to size with this new move I learned would make him more agreeable. The trouble is, I don't exactly have the hang of it yet and I made him too small, I'm pretty sure he's on my paw somewhere."

Ribombee looked at Absol with doubt and crossed her arms. "That's something. So you can change the size of Pokemon and you made him so small that you can't even see him?"

"Yes!" Absol nodded. "I know it sounds like a joke but I'm serious. I figured that you could get a closer look and find him for me?"

"Sounds far fetched, but since your my best friend I'm going to trust you, okay?" Saying that, Ribombee hopped down onto her paw proper and leaned down...

Zorua was absolutely knackered. The massive earthquake lasted for nearly ten minutes and after being repeatedly catapulted back and forward his muscles were incredibly sore and he barely had the energy to stand up. The booming noises came back for a while but after the ten minutes of shaking the thunderous rumbling felt like nothing so he just laid there, staring up at sky from the bottom of the valley.

Then he saw something huge rush by. Struggling to sit up, Zorua tried to follow where the giant blur went and just over the horizon of the cliff-face, he saw something that made his jaw drop. It was a Ribombee, a terrifyingly huge one. Zorua could only see her head and the brown scarf around her neck but he was certain that this massive bug Pokemon in the far distance was the class vice president from school. Zorua had never messed with her that much for the simple fact her ability to fly made her a difficult target but she was always on his case about his attitude. The sight made no sense to him and as Ribombee started to talk he could hear the words she was saying, even if they were extremely loud and distorted. She was talking to Absol!

But wait..., Zorua thought. No, this is obviously an illusion of some type. A dark-type move I don't know about. That would be impossible, that would mean... His train of thought was interrupted when Ribombee jumped closer, sending Zorua flying into the air several feet. Now she was right above him and her face got so close that it took up most of the sky, just like that strange red and black thing from before. Her head slowly moved side to side until her eyes seemingly locked onto him.

To Zorua, it felt like they had just made eye contact.
122332211313111.title: Ribombee joins the search

choices: Can you please climb up here so we can get a better look at you?"
Stay where you are, Absol's going to try to grow you back to normal."
Hang on tight, we need to find a microscope to see you better."
1223322113131111.content:
Zorua got extremely nervous, worrying what exactly is happening. First I'm in a alien world that shakes nonstop, and now the vice president is at a size that i can barely comprehend. Zorua thoughts to himself as the eyes of Ribombee looks at his location. Absol, what exactly you did to me?

Time felt slow as the vice president's face not moving as her eyes looks like she focusing her sights right at him. Soon the world rumbles a bit as she slowly squints her eyes and soon moves her face even closer. Soon, just the tinies part of her eye fills up the whole sky as she looms over where Zorua is stuck at.

Ribombee wonder to herself if she can even help Absol find Zorua considering what she just said about shrinking him so much that she can't find him. If anything, she was beginning to wonder if maybe all the task that of being class president was making her friends slightly imagine the whole thing. But she trust her friend enough that there should be some form of truth of what she said. The bee had to scan the paw thoroughly as she didn't want to risk missing the tiny fox. After maybe a minute, nothing happens. However, she looks down, right between her knees and saw a tiny, even to her, crack or wrinkle, and inside the crack is a miniscule speck, so small and pathetically insignificant, that Ribombee can easily thought it was nothing more then dust that is stuck inside Absol's paw. Scratch that, its even smaller and even more insignificant than a speck of dust that its a miracle that Ribombee notices. Slightly curious, Ribombee had to move her face closer to the paw, enough that tip of her face is almost touching the paw pad. She had to squint really hard before she could see the miniscule speck slightly clearer. As soon as she did, she gasp a bit as she could make some form of details of the speck.

"Wow, you weren't kidding Absol, you shrunk the little guy a lot." Ribombee spoke as she looks at her friend with a smile.

"You found him?" Absol ask.

"Barely, he's so small, i think he's inside one of the cracks on your paw pads." Ribombee says as she looks back at Zorua's location.

While the two talk about Zorua, they can't see how terrify the poor fox is as he covers his ears. Ribombee's words slow and distorted, yet so powerful that just a mere whisper could wipe out a city with ease. It only got worse as the familiat thunder that is Absol speaking came up and booms down on Zorua. Zorua was so confuse of what's going on that he doesn't see that not only Ribombee is back at looking at his location, but so is Absol, even though she can't see him.

"So what should we do next?" Ribombee spoke down, trying to look down on Zorua, not realizing her words hurt the poor fox. Soon the thunderous noise of Absol spoke, which Zorua could not understand at all. "Yeah, i think that's a good idea." Ribombee spoke, as she can understand Absol perfectly. Zorua has no idea what the girls' talking about, as he can barely understand Ribombee. "Hey Zorua," Ribombee spoke down tk the fox, making him nervously look up to the goddess like bee, even if she doesn't notice him looking up. "We're going to help you, but first.... Ribombee continues to speak, while somewhat giving the fox comfort that they are willing to help, what she says next makes Zorua very nervous.
1223322113131111.title: Miniscule luck

Absol accidentally enlarges Ribombee
Nothing happens so they think of something else
12233221131311111.content:
Ribombee's request left Zorua both nervous and confused. Not only did he lack the experience of a mountain climber, the cliff walls to the either side of him stretched so high up that it would probably take days to scale them. Shifting nervously on the spot he was about to try and yell up to the godly bee Pokemon that it was impossible when suddenly, she began lowering a hand toward him. The sight made him yelp in surprise as he watched the giant limb that was many times the size of the canyon descend and impact the ground up above. He was further shocked to see that the cliff-face didn't crumble and break, but rather bend and distort like a soft pillow.

It pushed further and further down until it was essentially pressing against the bottom of the valley a short distance away from him. The sheer size of Ribombee's hand intimidated Zorua but he clung onto hope that she was legitimately trying to help him. He ran toward the black bug-like limb as fast as he could and reached it a few minutes later before gathering the courage to try and climb onto it. Saying that, it was incredibly difficult because he essentially had to go under it and climb upward from there. He thought about dropping down and trying to take another route but the hand suddenly began moving, giving Zorua no choice and taking him with it.

Zorua held on for dear life as it rapidly rose, breathing a sigh of relief when the surface rotated and gave him the luxury of laying down rather than being forced to hold himself up. He could still feel it rising while the gravity of the motion pinning him down but eventually it stopped and he got a moment to re-orientated himself. Before him was the utterly massive face of Ribombee and she had a smile that Zorua couldn't figure out was for relief, endearment or complacency. He was about to try and yell out to her when something from behind sent shock-waves through the air that risked knocking him off his new platform.

A moment later, Ribombee spoke. Her mind-boggling loud voice was still as powerful as ever. "Yeah, he's right on the top of my hand. You don't see him?"

Looking behind him, Zorua once again let out a yelp. The huge red and black thing from before was back, though this time he was beginning to piece together what it was, or rather, who it belonged to. That, combined with the paw-like landscape and claws he could just see far down below only confirmed it. "Absol?!" he blurted out.

Of course, they didn't hear him and they continued their conversations and Absol's voice blared over him before Ribombee replied. "Well, I see him. He's really small. Are you sure you don't need a microscope or something for this?" Once again there was more booming, followed by Ribombee's thunderous voice. "Well, if you're sure, he's right here. But have you really got the hang of this, Absol? This is what, the second time you've done something like this to a Pokemon?"

Absol said something that was unintelligible to Zorua and her red eyes faded into the far distance, leaving only the concerned face of the god-like Ribombee looking down at him. It was distressing to him that Absol was going to try and fix this when she apparently couldn't even see him but he desperately hoped it would turn out okay. After a brief pause, Zorua could feel something start to happen.
