choices: to the size of a large pokemon
to the size of a tree
to the size of a sckyscrapper (No adding different size option after this one)
122332211313111112.content:
Zorua wait as he tries to look towards the direction where Absol's face is at, waiting for the class president to attempt to grow him back to normal. Soon, a familiar bright flash blinds him, and Ribombee, as Absol does her size changing move again. Zorua rubs his eyes before he manages to see again. He was expecting to be back to normal size, or at least a size that isn't so miniscule, but looking around him, he was still the same size. However, something, or in this case, someone, definitely got hit by Absol's move. Zorua felt the "ground" he is standing on vibrating and shifting below him. He looks around and all around him, Ribombee's body glows a bit as her body is changing. Zorua looks up and can see the goddess like bee's face, wondering at first why the fox hasn't grew at first before her expression turn to shock and concern as she felt her body changing. "Oh no..." Is all Zorua could say as he thinks he knows what the class president just did.

"A-Absol, what going on with me?" Ribombee stammers as she felt the world around her slowly shrinking.

"Oh no, I missed Zorua." Absol got nervous, not only for Zorua, who must be, and is most certainly is, terrify as his "world" is about to get a lot bigger. Ribombee hears this and got nervous as she looks at her hand, and sees the miniscule speck she struggle to see is shrinking before her eyes as she is growing. The bee got nervous for the fox as she's worry she is going to lose track of Zorua any second now before she immediately thought of something. She grabs her backpack and pulls out a bottle.

Zorua stumbles back as he lands on his back, watching the vice president slowly growing before his eyes as she grows and grows before her face starts to get blurry. Soon as she spoke, Ribombee's booming voice got louder and far more distorted before her voice is reaching the level of Absol's. Zorua soon sees Ribombee looking at his direction again, with a face of worry as she has to squint very hard to keep track of where he is. Zorua fears of having the same experience as Absol and that Ribombee will reach a size where she no longer can see him. However, her face changes as she looks like she has a idea. Zorua had to immediately hold on to where he is at as Ribombee shifts her body. Loud metal clangs could be heard in the distant as Zorua struggles to see what the ever growing bee is doing. Soon a loud "pop" like sound could also be heard before Ribombee looks back at Zorua's direction. Zorua was worry what the bee is going to do before he got his answer as his world tilts. Zorua felt himself drifting towards the side of the bug hand as Ribombee tilts her hand more and more. Zorua was scare of what the bee is doing that he tries to grab to the hand as much as possible but it was too late as he fell off the hand and is falling down. Zorua flails his paws as he tries to close his eyes and brace himself for a painful drop. After what felt like an hour for the poor fox, Zorua did indeed lands on something, but it was surprising soft....and very gooey.

Zorua looks around and founds himself in a strange sticky ocean like world where the surface just shifts and jiggles. Wondering where he is, he takes a scoop of the strange substance and likes it. "....Honey?" Before Zorua could even wonder where he is, a loud booming voice hurts his ears as he struggle to look up before he saw the eyes of Ribombee gazing down at his location.

Turns out, Ribombee simply grabs her lunch, which was a very tiny bottle of honey and drops Zorua in it, a bottle of honey that is dwindling in the growing bee's hand. "S-stay safe in there, Zorua." She says as she soon loses track of the shrunken fox before she closes the lid on the bottle. "Absol, please tell me you know how big you just made me." Ribombee pleas to her friend as she starts growing past Absol's shoulder and is about to reach her head, and that's just Ribombee standing on the ground.

"I-I don't know, I only try to grow Zorua a little bit that way we could see him better." Absol says, while worry for the fox no trapped in the tiny bottle of honey, is worry just how big she just made her friend. All three pokemon watches as Ribombee grows....

122332211313111113.content:
Ribombee and Zorua waits for Absol to grow Zorua any second now, however, nothing has happen and so far its just Absol and Ribombee at normal size with a very minuscule Zorua on the bee's hand.

"Um, is it supposed to take this long?" Ribombee ask, as she figure something should have happened by now.

"Huh?" Absol was also confuse, thinking the same thing and that Zorua should have change size by now. Ribombee looks at her hand and can thankfully see the miniscule fox still on her hand and still at the same size. "I don't get it, I should be able to grow Zorua by now." She says as she ponders to herself.

"Have you ever try growing something before?" Ribombee asks, now both girls ponder why Absol's size changing ability isn't working. This might be dangerous for the fox as the two could be talking for quite a bit while also forgetting that their simple actions are heavily affecting Zorua's world.

"Yes actually, I tried on a tiny pebble back home when I first made this move." Absol says, remembering the moment. "Accidentally grew the thing into a boulder. Shrunk it later and like that it was back to normal.

"Hmmm..." Ribombee tries to think a bit as she moves her hand to her mouth, the same hand Zorua is on.

The two girls' voice were painful for the poor fox as they continue their conversation. Zorua struggles to keep his ears from hurting as he hears the omni-sun exploding voice of Absol and the distorted thunderous voice of Ribombee. As Zorua winces in pain, he felt his world shaking a lot. He grabs hold on to the land immediately as he felt the bug hand landscape moving and tilting a bit as he looks and is terrify to see the sky-filling face of Ribombee growing bigger as she moves her hand to her face. "R-Ribombee, please stop!" Zorua tries to shout out to the vice president, but it was no use as his voice can't be heard by anyone. Zorua was scare that the bee is about to scratch her face or something and forgot that Zorua is still on her. Zorua closes his eyes as he could see the bee's lips soon filling up his vision and it looks like he's about to smack right into it.

A loud thud and rumble could be heard and felt, but Zorua notices that he wasn't getting squished. He looks behind himself, which is easier said than done as he is clinging to the hand while trying to no let go and fall to who knows where, and see the plateaus and mountain region of Ribombee's lips. She simply place her hand above her lips as she and Absol were deep in thought. As much as Zorua is worry of looking down and see that he would fall quite a bit somewhere one the bee's body should he let go, his worries got worse as he sees the lips moving and parting as they-

"Maybe you are out of energy for the move." Ribombee's voice plaster Zorua into her hand as being so close to her mouth was so much worse than being a distant from it. Zorua's ears ring hard as he tries his best to keep his grip on the hand and not fall, or worse, get launch from the sheer force of Ribombee's voice and what's straight in front of her, Absol's face.

"No, I have more than enough energy that if I wanted to, I could shrink this whole school to a quarter and still have enough energy to at least grow it to maybe a large bug." Absol boasts, though not 100% sure if she can even go that far of shrinking the whole school.

"Then could it because the little guy is so small?" The two continue their conversation, not realizing that they, especially Ribombee, are putting the poor fox through a lot.

"Hmm, it could be possible." Absol ponders on the idea and is worry of what Ribombee might be going to.

"Maybe you have to see physically see Zorua and order for the move to actually work." The bee proclaims.

"If that's the case, then Zorua is stuck at that size." Absol says. "The only way that I can fix this is to somehow shrink myself to where i can see him enough."

"Have you ever tried something like that?"

"No, I thought it would be too risky for a move that I only just create." Absol says," True, I did, more or less, carelessly use the move on Zorua, but I never thought I had the ability to shrink him that far." She says with a bit of embarrassment of her screwing up this badly.

As the two continue to talk, Ribombee's voice pounding on Zorua was getting more and more painful that Zorua could feel his grip on the bee's hand slipping. He has no idea how long he can hold on, which doesn't help that these two omni goddess-like pokemon show no signs of finishing their conversation.

"So what should we do?" Ribombee asks, wondering how the two can even solve this problem.

"The way I see it, here are our possible options." Absol states. "One option is that I try one more time, and see if it works this time. Second option is that I attempt to shrink myself and hope I can grow Zorua. Third option is that I try to practice this move and see if i can thoroughly master this move. Fourth option would be to just leave Zorua like this then as I have no idea where to go from there, but I refuse to take that idea." Ribombee couldn't help but smirk a bit, respecting her friend of taking her responsibility seriously that she's ll try to help the little guy.

"Hmm, I think i like the third option far more, though now that i think of it what should we do with the little guy?" Ribombee asks. "No one is going to believe that you shrunk him, and he's far too vulnerable at his size to do anything. "

"True, hmm..."Absol did wonder a bit on what should they do with Zorua. I could just ask Ribombee to stay with me at my house for the night and we could get Zorua to grow hopefully soon. Though it might take a while and it might be better to just have Ribombee to look after him since she can see him. Absol ponders a bit before she looks at Ribombee and notices that she has her hand on her mouth. "Um, speaking of which, where is Zorua?"

"Huh?" Ribombee wonder what Asbol means before she gasp a bit and realizes she move her hand to her mouth, not realizing the sheer havoc she put Zorua in. Ribombee moves her hand back to the position she had earlier and looks for the fox. Looking around, Ribombee....
122332211313111113.title: Well that plan did not work

choices: Absol makers herself smaller and searches through Ribombee's fur
Absol looks for more Pokemon to join the search
Ribombee insists on finding Zorua herself while Absol practices her move
1223322113131111132.content:
On her hand, the small speck that was Zorua was nowhere to be seen. In a moment of panic Ribombee scanned over it several times before looking up at Absol with shame. "I think he fell off. Sorry..."

Absol sighed, forgiving her mistake. "Don't worry about it, at that size Zorua should be relatively safe, we just need to spend some more time looking for him again. Do you have any idea where he fell?"

Ribombee shrugged, feeling bad for losing him. Without a word both of them got to the ground and started searching, parting blades of grass and analyzing the surface of stray leaves. They both searched for nearly half an hour and were no closer to finding him, becoming worried that at his size the small fox would be indistinguishable from all the particles of dirt. Ribombee sat back, defeated. "We might need to get more help," she said.

Ribombee stared down at the grass below her and then, out of pure coincidence, her eyes wandered just below her brown scarf to her yellow-furred stomach where she spotted a small speck on the tip of one of her furs. She jolted up when she realized that it might have been Zorua but unfortunately the movement sent it falling deeper into her short fur. "I think I just saw him!"

Absol's head bolted up from the ground. "Where?"

"I'm pretty sure I just saw him on my stomach somewhere in my fur. I saw it for a second but I'm confident it was him..."

And she was right. Thirty minutes earlier Zorua was unable to withstand all the massive movements and bone-shaking rumbling until it all became too much. The fox lost his grip and because of the angle Ribombee was holding her hand at time, he was sent falling towards her body. The fall was agonizingly long but eventually he harmlessly impacted against what felt like a massive tree log. It was brown and stretched an incredibly long distance, interweaving with a whole bunch of other brown fibers.

Though before he could acclimate to his new surrounding, Ribombee began to move, causing Zorua to slip off the massive strand of fur. He tumbled and tumbled, smacking against countless other furs until they changed from their brown colour to a bright yellow. With some luck, Zorua was able to dig his claws into one massive fur and stop his descent down her body. Looking around him at the horizontal forest of hairs, he guessed he was half-way inside her short fur coat. Starting to get really annoyed about his predicament, he grit his teeth and crawled along the seemingly endless strand of fur toward the light.

After a while, it began to get thinner and it was getting more difficult to hold on while the end of the fur bobbed more noticably from Ribombee's movements. Thankfully, he was starting to see more than just fur now. Trying his best, he could just see her face far, far above him. "Hey, down here!" he yelled, waving a paw. He smiled hopefully when her eyes wandered down to where he was sitting but his joy was short lived when Ribombee suddenly jolted, sending him flying back into her fur...

"So he's around there somewhere?" Absol asked, pointing a claw at Ribombee's mid-section.

"I'm certain," she nodded, carefully prodding a hand through her fur. It felt strange to her that the school trouble-maker was stuck somewhere on her body.

Absol let out a quiet groan, this was all becoming too much of a hassle. If they knew his location Absol probably would have left him with Ribombee while she practiced her new move some more but she thought it was too dangerous to leave him lost like this. It was possible he could fall off to the ground somewhere and then they would never find him! With their options dwindling, she thought that more Pokemon might have to be roped into the situation to help. She also considered just shrinking herself now and taking on the task of finding him herself with the hopes the move works as intended. That way, she could even make Zorua bigger again as soon as she found him. Still, she thought about it.

Ribombee then held still, while laying on her back on the bench with her paw n her stomach, knowing this was the easiest way to find him, but if it failed then things would be much harder. She asks while scanning her hand. She pouts as she sees no trace of the familiar speck and looks back at her stomach, fearing Zorua is still trapped in there. She looks at the time and sees that she still has plenty of time before she needs to start heading home. "Ok Zorua, I'm going to try to find you myself. Try to not move." She says as she adjusts herself.

The fox hears this and panics as he tries to run to the hand and grab it before it was too late. It was too late however, as his world violently shakes as the bee herself moves herself into a comfortable position, unaware she knock Zorua around and away from her hand a bit. Thankfully for Zorua, he was still at the same area, but things were not looking great as he looks ahead of him and watch the gigantic platform that is Ribombee's hand lifting up and leaving him behind. He looks up and could barely see the distant planet of Ribombee's face gazing down at his location, unaware of where exactly Zorua is. That soon change as Ribombee's face is immediately replace as a massive black landmass covers the sky and is about to drop right on top of Zorua's location. Zorua panics and runs as fast as he could away from the area.

Ribombee looks at her belly and lowers the tip of her hand down on her belly and began moving around as slowly as she can to look for Zorua. She could barely see the bottom of her fur, so finding Zorua is going to prove incredibly difficult, but it doesn't mean she can enjoy it.She hums to herself as she moves her hand around, giggling here and there as she accidentally tickles herself. If only the bee knows just how much trouble she is causing Zorua.

Zorua ran in fear as a horizon filling hand nearly lands on him and is bulldozing the area. The ground trembles as the hand creates tremors. The strands of furs groan as they bend under the hand as it runs over them, some of which nearly pinned Zorua down. If Zorua wasn't running for his life, he would hear the thunderous hums Ribombee is making as she searches for Zorua. Zorua could feel the terrifying gigantic bulldozer of Ribombee's hand chasing after Zorua, going significantly faster than the fox is, even though Ribombee is going at a very slow pace. Zorua fears he will get run over any second now and will get dragged around by the titanic plateau.

As this massive game of Hide and Seek continues for some time...

1223322113131111132331.content:
Ribombee continues to comb over her belly in search for the speck that is lost in her fur. Keeping herself from getting bored, she hums softly as she moves her hand slowly, trying to see the bottom of her fur to find any traces of Zorua. Searching for the little guy is getting harder than I thought, maybe I should have gone with Absol's idea of shrinking herself down. Ribombee thought to herself. Still at least if i find Zorua soon, I can have some fun with him by myself when i get home. Meanwhile, Zorua wasn't having the best time at all as he struggles to flee from the bee goddess's hand. No matter where he goes, Ribombee's hand would soon immediately brush past and threaten to flatten the nano size fox, making him change direction. For what felt like forever, Zorua nearly got ram four time in just the last thirty seconds, making him wonder if the bee pokemon is even trying to look for him or using this as a excuse to brush her fur. He could look up and can see the smiling face of both his savior and tormentor as he wishes that the sheer size Ribombee has over him would make it easier for her to see him, but that wasn't the case. As Zorua tries to focus on running, his path got block once again as Ribombee moves her hand and unknowingly slams it right in front of him, knocking him back a bit of a distant. Zorua groans to himself as he tries to recover, only to panic as he felt the ground rumble and looks ahead in fear. Moving towards him was none other than Ribombee's hand as she slowly drags it towards Zorua. There was no way Zorua was going to avoid getting ram and could only close his eyes as he waits for the hand to drag him all over the bee goddess's body in a vain attempt to find him. The world shakes violently as the hand draws closer and closer, practically a good mile away. The area soon grew dark as the hand is ready to run over Zorua when...

"HHHMMMM?"

A powerful thunder roars over Zorua as he notices that the hand stops just a mere few feet away from. He looks up and gulps a bit as he see Ribombee looking right at his direction, squinting as she thinks she sees something.

"Hhmm?" Ribombee has been searching her stomach for a good minute, not really in a rush to leave the area and head home, when she moves her hand a bit and soon spot a very minuscule speck at the very bottom of her fur. She had to squint her eyes and try to move her face closer before a smile forms on her face. "Aha, find you." She chimes as she can barely see Zorua. "Hold still for one second, I'll get you out of there." She says as she moves her hand again and slowly tries to grab the tiny fox.

"Hold still for one second, I'll get you out of there." Is what Zorua barely understood as he tries to cover his ears a bit from the bee goddess's words. He was so busy to cover his ears, he didn't had time to react when the ground shakes again and the hand that almost ran over him moves again, this time ramming into the fox. If it wasn't for one of the effect's of Absol's shrinking ability to make the shrunken victim far more durable the smaller they get, Zorua would have been immediately turn to paste, but instead feels the immense weight of something that feels like a hard pillow pressing on him. He was ok, but still was scare as Ribombee continues to press on him. Soon, Zorua felt a strong gust of wind on him as he opens his eyes and saw that he is being lifted up and is leaving the forest of fur that was on Ribombee's stomach. While he was glad to be out of the dense area, he was still terrified for his life as he soon is greeted by the familiar omni-size face of Ribombee as he is stranded on the middle of her palm.

"Hope you had fun exploring your vice president." The sheer explosive force that escapes from the bee's mouth blast against Zorua as he covers his ears. He wishes that the gigantic pokemon could see that her voice is so powerful that its literally hurting him, but due to his small size, that will not happen anytime soon. "Sorry for dropping you, but at least you're perfectly ok." She says with a "small" giggle.

"Y-yeah...ok..." Zorua could only muster the energy to say that to himself as he endures his classmate's voice. That would soon change as Ribombee's face is soon replace by some gigantic landmass. "W-wait, she wouldn't!" Zorua panics as his sky is darken and is dropping.

Ribombee giggles a bit as she uses her other hand to press down on Zorua, like he was a tiny toy or something to pet. "I got to say, you are quite adorable at this new size." Ribombee says as she lifts her hand up and sees Zorua in the middle of her hand. "Too bad I can't convince you or Absol to stay at this size, you be the cutest thing to have." Once recovering from getting press down and nearly turn into a pancake, Zorua got very nervous of the idea of staying this small for the rest of his life with everything that has happen in the last hour....that and blush a bit of being called adorable and cute.

"Oh well, at least you get to hang out with me until Absol can grow you back to normal." Ribombee says with a peppy smile, which still didn't instill confidence for the poor fox. "Don't worry, I'll keep you from getting bored until then." She says as she soon closes her hand as she then gets up from her position to finally stand. "Now then, how about we head to my place finally, then we can figure out on what we can do to pass the time." She says with a smile, seemingly to enjoy this moment a lot now that she has Zorua in her hands.

"...I'm doom..." Zorua says before his world grew dark. He soon sees Ribombee closing her hand again as she didn't want to lose Zorua in her flight home. Zorua braces himself as he was in for a very bumpy ride as the cheerful bee goddess in preparing to take flight.

Grabbing her school bag with her other hand, Ribombee soon takes flight and soon leaves the school ground. She keeps a close eye on the close hand that Zorua is in as she flies home. Thankfully for her, at this time of day, flying home would be a easy breeze that wouldn't take her long, provided she doesn't get distracted.

After some time of flying....
1223322113131111132331.title: Spotted and Plucked

choices: Ribombee played it safe and kept her activity at a minimum
The temptation was too strong! Ribombee wanted to play!
Ribombee wanted some playful payback and started messing with Zorua
12233221131311111323311.content:
Ribombee strolled, or rather flew home with her tiny 'companion' held in her hand. She made sure to check on him every now and then, careful not to tilt her paw by accident, leading Zorua to fall to his grave.

Thankfully, it was a nice day. Even a small breeze would have threatened to blow Zorua off her hand without her even noticing, and that was why Ribombee kept a close eye on her paw.

As for the diminutive fox himself, the perspective ahead of him looked pretty grim.

Not only he was impossibly tiny, but he was forced to wait for Absol to learn how to reverse the shrinking, and who knew how long that was going to take. And, as if it wasn't enough, Zorua was stuck with the vice president, who had already mentioned she was 'keeping him from getting bored' until the moment he was going to grow again.

He supposed he didn't have a choice though. He was better off with Ribombee, who was supposedly going to take care of him, instead of being lost in her fur. Zorua's only pray was that she wasn't going to 'play rough' with him...

"Oh, there we are," he suddenly heard the booming voice of his fellow classmate, causing him to look past her ship-sized palm, only to notice an impossibly big building in front of the two of them, but he knew that was only the front entrance of Ribombee's house.

Upon entering, the fairy-type let go of her bag and stretched.

"Finally home..." she moaned, her voice raining over Zorua like the explosion of a bomb... several bombs.
"Now, let's get somewhere more... private before thinking about you. "

With that, the titaness fluttered deeper into the house while Zorua glanced at what was going to be his home for a while. He didn't suppose the bee was going to return him to his forest and, honestly, he didn't really want that right now, despite how badly his fur was tingling as he wondered what this bee goddess was going to do with/to him.

Finally, Ribombee reached her room, closing the door behind herself before going to close the window with her free hand immediately after.

Then, she was finally free to focus on her tiny passenger.

"Well, Zorua," she addressed her paw with a smile,
"Looks like it's just the two of us now, as it'll be for a while apparently. Just until Absol learns how to grow you back up. Shame though, you look so cute like that~,"

Zorua didn't even pay attention to the comment, too busy shielding his ears with his paws to really listen to what she was saying.

"I can barely even see you," Ribombee continued, donning a fascinated smile on her face,
"Honestly, I bet you're having lots of fun! I mean, with that size, it's like you're on another planet!"

Zorua glared in direction of the bee fairy.

"Fun?" he snarled, irritated by her carefree behavior,
"Are you out of your damn mind!?"

The insult went unheard, mostly because Ribombee couldn't hear him at all, and partly because she was busily examining him, wondering what she should have done first.

Then, while thinking how to 'pass the time' like she promised, she felt a growl coming from her stomach.

Even from afar, Zorua's mind registered the noise and he was suddenly glad he wasn't on her yellow-furred tummy anymore.

"Um, let's get something to eat first, then we can talk about what to do." the giantess spoke, sounding vaguely eager.

Something Zorua did not like at all, albeit Ribombee being excited meant that she didn't hold any hard feelings for his pranks, meaning she wasn't going to play rough.

Either that, or she was luring him into a sense of false security before tormenting him.

The thought made the dark-type fox shiver, though he quickly forgot his train of thought as he felt Ribombee moving.

The fairy-type fluttered over to her desk; a plate of cookies conveniently rested on top.

Ribombee picked one in her free hand and broke off a tiny piece, before placing it on top of her other hand, in front of Zorua.

"Eat up, you're going to need it," she recommended, before eating the rest of the cookie that was on her other paw, quickly picking another.

Zorua felt his stomach growling too and approached the giant piece of cookie that was in front of him.

--

After a while, when Ribombee had her fill of cookies and Zorua had eaten his fill as well, the giantess hovered to her bed and sat down, looking at the tiny fox with a familiar smile on her white face.

"Well, let's get down to business, Zorua," she said playfully, once more causing her the shrunken prankster that was her classmate to cover his ears.

It was going to be a miracle if he got out of this with his hearing still intact... no, it was going to be a miracle if he got out of this.

"Cut it out..." he murmured, knowing she couldn't hear him.

"Are you saying something down there? I sorta can't hear you. Um... I'm sure we'll find some way to communicate," Ribombee spoke,
"That can wait though. As for now, let's kill the time."

After that, she began thinking what to do with her little classmate and, for the time being, roomie.

Part of her wanted to play a game, but she knew that moving too much would meant losing Zorua again, and she didn't want that, not when it took nearly an hour to find him on her belly.

Surely, there were a few activities that didn't involve moving around; sure, they'd be far less exciting, but it was better than risking, right?

"Hmm..."

While the bee giantess thought, Zorua could only look at her and hope for the best.
12233221131311111323311.title: Small predicament

choices: The girls are done talking and Ribimbee heads home
Whatever the girls said, they convince Ribombee to come with her for something
One of the girls reaches into Ribombee's backpack for something
12233221131311111323312.content:
The peppy bee was making her way to her home with Zorua safe in her hands. The flight is rather pleasant that if she wanted to, she could make several detours and still make it safely to home without any problems. Ribombee occasionally looks at her close hand, making sure the tiny fox is still safe inside.

Zorua, while really wishing he was back to normal right now, is doing ok for the most part. The ride is extremely bumpy for the poor fox, even if the omni size vice class president flying as gently as she could. Zorua could never keep his footing or stay at the same spot for a second. It felt like he was trap in a world made of trampoline as he would bounce in one direction and bounce to the next. If it wasn't for the fact that Ribombee's hand is thankfully not hard as a rock at Zorua's size, the fox might've been bruise.

"Don't Zorua, we're almost at my place." Ribombee says. She was about five minutes to her home, with her about to enter the neighborhood. However, as determine the bee pokemon is to return home with her shrunken classmate, she hears something that stops her in her track.

"Hey, Ribombee!" Ribombee hears a voice familiar to her and looks around. In the distant, she sees several classmates from her school, all of which she knows. She spots a Mawile, a Leavanny, a Hatterene, and a Pheromosa.

"Oh hey everyone!" Ribombee says cheerfully as she was about to fly towards the group before she stops herself and remembers one particular fox. She wanted to get home, but she wants to have a quick chat with the girls, with her hands being free. There was no way she would ever convince any of the girls that she has Zorua, especially with Haterene and Pheromosa, each girls are far to big to see and sense the fox. She would have to store Zorua in her backpack.

She quickly pulls her backpack and opens it, seeing some stuff like school supplies, a tiny bottle of honey, makeup supplies,a diary, and clothes for something like gym or going out. She's not going to have time to choose where to stuff Zorua, so she did what she simply could think off. "Hey, Zorua, i need to talk to some friends, but i need you to stay in here. I'll look for you later, until then just try to wait around.....and don't read my diary." She says as she lowers her hand and drops the fox inside.

Zorua panics when he felt hinself sliding off the hands of Ribombee and is left in the dark abyss of her backpack. He could only watch up in nervousness as he could only see Ribombee's cheerful face before the world grows dark as the bee goddess closes the backpack, with only a small glimmer of light that allows the fox to barely see outside. Soon the worse happens and Zorua is bouncing around as Ribombee puts her backpack back on and flies towards her friends. The fox was at complete disaray as he couldn't tell what's going on as he struggles to grab on to anything to prevent him being catapulted from one side to the next. Thankfully, the flight didn't last long, unfortunately, something familiar comes back to Zorua and in full horrific force.

Before Zorua could try to muster his senses, his ears get blasted but thunderous explosions that could be heard high above, almost as bad when Absol spoke, or sometimes even far worse. It didn't help that he hears four seprate explosion and they vary from loud to extremely painful. Once again, if it wasn't for Absol's shrinking ability to also allow Zorua to be very durable to anything painful at his current size, he probably would've gone deaf already.

Zorua, in a attempt to even see what's going on, looks up and is immediatly terrify of what he sees, more pokemons, more pokemon that are far bigger than Ribombee or even Absol. The fox is scare of the sight as each girls are terrifying huge and would be nightmarish to be lost on if Zorua was very unfortunate to ger caught by them. And he recognizes every single one of them, as he has try to prank them in the past.

Mawile, while she is one of the smallest of the group, excluding Ribombee at the moment, would be terrifying for Zorua to get lost with. She may be smaller than some of the others, but she is one of the toughest girls Zorua ever seen at school. She would be consider the school star athelete, as she participate with many sport activity like swimming and soccer, but especially martial arts. She also has a very big appetite, one that could rival a snorlax and yet stay so slim. She's practially the main reason why Zorua was shrunk today as she was a bit of a victim of Zorua prank where, in a attempt to have boys wanting to come up to her and try to get a date, he place poster of her in a swimsuit just as some pokemon accidentally knock half of her clothes. Defiantly one moment Mawile isn't going to let go anytime soon. (There's actually a chapter that goes more into this, but i don't remember where exaclty, try looking at the first chapter with Absol involve)

Leavanny, a rather fashion pokemon, enjoy making clothes while also being a bit nosey into other people's buisness. She tends to be one of the classmates who enjoys making small gossips around the school, usually harmless. Zorua did try to prank her once, but it fail spectaurally on him. Zorua once try to make Leavanny mess up on one of her clothes she was making, one thing that lead to another, Zorua end up creating a mess and ends up stuck in pink rabbit suit for a whole day. While it wasn't Zorua's best day, it only got worse when Leavanny later spread a gossip that Zorua did it to impress someone at school for their affection.

Hatterene is one of the tallest girls in school and defiantely one of the classmates everyone is scare of. She's a antiscocial to everyone, not liking everyone trying to force their way to be friends with and would use her powers to scare them away. Though, rumor has it that she's one of of the wealthiest students in school, so something like that maybe why she doesn't like it when the other students try to be friends with her. Though, here, she looks very calm and peaceful, almost like she could be one of the nicest pokemon to talk to as she seems to have a lovely confersation with the tiny bee pokemon. Anyways, Zorua once try to prank her, and never tried to ever again as the tsundare-like pokemon threaten his existence, and let's leave it like that.

And the last one, Pheromosa, defiantely the one pokemon Zorua is absolutey terrified to be lost on, as she is easily one of the tallest pokemon, if not, the tallest student at school. Everyone, including teachers, had to look up even when Pheromosa squats down to talk to other pokemons. While her freakish size is one that makes other nervous to talk to her, she's consider one of the most popular girls at school. She tends to be one of the girls everyone would talk about at school, only second behind Absol. While word has it she's a bit of a clean freak, she is consider to be a rather considerate person and can be quite cute, provide you don't get on her bad side where she pummels you to the ground that is. Zorua try a few times to prank her, but Pheromosa's size, and surprising hidden power, makes her extremely difficult to prank on. The last time he almost succeded on pranking her, she manages to not only avoid getting prank on, but manages to grab Zorua and lifts him up to her face. While she did gave him a warning to never prank her again, he remembers Pheromosa being rather flirty to him as well.

Each of these girls are now so nightmarishily titanic, and at Zorua's small size, there would be no way they would ever see him. Zorua is scare what the girls would try to do if they ever knew of his shrunken fate. However, his mind is quickly interrupted as he felt his world violently shake. Confuse, Zorua looks up and sees....
12233221131311111323312.title: Encounter of more Goddesses

choices: Absol and Ribombee returning with their stuff they need.
A classmate whose here to finish her project (reader's choice of pokemon)
The professor who return as she forgot to something (reader's choice of Pokemon)
12233221131311113.content:
The minuscule fox panics as he hears what the vice president is saying and tries to brace himself as he knows what is going to happen. Time was slow for the fox, but he could feel the terrifying action of Absol moving as he is paster to the somewhat spongy walls as the class president begins to walk again, this time inside the school itself. Zorua struggles to look up and see the world zooming past at what might as well be the speed of light for the fox. He struggles to see the silhouette Ribombee as she sat on Absol's paw, mainly to enjoy the ride, and blocks most of Zorua's view of the outside world.

Thankfully for Absol and Ribombee, the school wasn't going to close down completely for the night for another hour or two, which gives them plenty of time to head to one room in particular. The two make their way past the halls and doors until they see the room they're looking for, the science room. The two enter the room and find no one inside.

"Professor? Professor?!" Absol shouts out to the teacher and can't seem to find her. "Hmm, guess she must've left already."

"Well, the better for us I guess." Ribombee says, "Now let's hurry up and find a microscope to look for Zorua." She says with enthusiasm.

"Right," Absol says as she closes the door behind her. She sees a microscope that is already set out, which was a bit annoying to the class president as rules states that all lab equipment must be put away, though she'll make a small exception for this one. "Ribombee, can you find a petri dish so i can set Zorua on it."

"Right away." Ribombee says as she gets up and starts flying around to find a good petri dish. Absol makes her way to the microscope and begins fiddling with it to turn it on and begin changing the setting.

Zorua was begin to feel both sick of this terrifying movement speed that has him stuck to the wall for quite a bit while also surprisingly use to the feeling enough that he wonders how long this moving planet is going to keep moving. All he could here from the safety of his area to the outside world is Ribombee speaking and the thunderous boom that hurts his ears for a long time now. After while, the movement finally stops, letting the fox to relax a bit and tries to not puke from the nauseating ride.

"Found one!" The familiar booming voice of Ribombee could still be heard before a loud "clang" like noise could be heard in the distant.

"What is she doing now?" Zorua spoke to himself, wishing that this insane ride would finally end already. Sadly for the fox, its far from even being remotely ending as his world start shift and tilt. The world rumbles and shakes as the sky shifts in stir, making the fox wish he was looking at Ribombee's face again. Soon, Zorua felt himself sliding from the wall and is heading to the sky. He struggles to grab on to anything as the world is going upside down, literally. He felt the familiar feeling of him falling through the canyon, this going outside. He did everything he could as he didn't want to fall again, but this prove fruitless as he fail to grab anything and is outside the deep canyon. He looks down and sees something in the distant the look very weird and clear. The fox feel for what felt like thousands of mile before he makes contact to the ground. He groans in pain, but is shock to see that he is perfectly ok. He looks around at his new surrounding and see that he is on some kind of glass surface, with a bright sun high above.

"There, he's perfectly safe on the petri dish." The familiar loud rumble hits Zorua from behind as he looks and see Ribombee's face far away while looking at his direction. He was confuse as to who he was talking to before a loud thunderous click and rumble could be heard high above him. He looks and saw something that he couldn't see too well moving across the sky as something similar takes its place. This happens twice before whatever was above sets in place and soon a loud noise could be heard far above those, a sound of something gasping. A low rumble could be heard towards the direction next to Ribombee as a endless wall of white could be seen lowering itself. Zorua was confuse before he was terrify to see not only the familiar sight of red black sun, this time two of them, was starring at his direction, but he sees a blurry absurdly massive face of Absol, looking right at him.

A powerful boom escapes through the class president's mouth as she otters one word, "Zorua," as she is amaze to see the fox at such a minuscule size, she had to use the strongest setting on the microscope to properly see the fox. Zorua watches Absol moving herself back up to look through the microscope again, leaving Zorua to look up and could barely see her mouth in the distant. Before Zorua could do anything, he covers his ears when he hears Ribombee speak again.

"See, told you that you shrunk the little guy a lot." Ribombee says, not noticing that Zorua is wincing in pain from her voice, but thankfully Absol does now.

"Ribombee!" Absol tries to stop her friend from speaking before stopping herself when she also realizes her voice must be far more powerful than the flying bug pokemon. "Zorua, can you understand me?" Absol whispers her voice as quietly as possible. To Zorua, Absol's voice is still powerful and booming, but thankfully for him, he can somewhat understand the celestial size class president. Absol looks at her friend. "Our voice are so strong to Zorua because of his size that its hurting him if we speak normally."

Ribombee gasp a bit before feeling a bit embarrass, but mostly sorry, that she didn't thought of how strong her voice must be to Zorua. Absol looks at Zorua again.

"I'm sorry Zorua, I didn't mean to shrink you this much." Absol says, feeling very sorry that she put Zorua through quite a lot in just a short time. "I'll make this up to you later, but let's try to see if we can at least grow you to normal size, or any size that's better than that." Zorua, while still covering his ears, smiles that the class president is willing to help him when she could have easily abandon him at his size.

"Can you grow him back to normal?" Ribombee ask, while whispering as well.

"Hmm, I could, but I've yet to figure out to master the size changing move. If I'm not careful, I could shrink Zorua even more, prabably down to a size we will never find him." Absol says, making Zorua scare of the idea. "S-sorry Zorua, but I'm being honest. Listen, I got my journal that I used to write down the size changing move, though its in my locker. Let me go get it and see if maybe i can thinking of a way to try it out on something here and then I'll try to grow you back." Absol says as she carefully move down from the microscope. "Ribombee, can you find me something that i can try the move on? Something that at least no one will miss if i accidentally shrink it?"

"I got something, but its in my locker." Ribombee says. "I'll go get it quickly." She says as she bolts from the room to make her way to her locker at the other side of the school.

"Zorua, just try to stay where you're are and remain calm. We'll be back shortly." Absol says as she makes her way out of the room as well, leaving the minuscule fox alone under the microscope.

"....Please don't take to long..." Zorua says, as he sits down to relax for a bit. He smiles as he's glad the girls are going to him. He hopes they can grow back to normal, as he doesn't want to be stuck at this size any longer. After what felt like forever, Zorua lays on the glass surface of the petri dish, wondering how long he got to wait for the girls. He looks around at his surrounding to get a better understand of the area he's in. He can see the walls of the petri dish stretching high into space, further then how deep it was to be in Absol's paw pad. He tries looking outside from the dish, but everything was far too huge and blurry for him to make any details of what they are. He sighs in boredom as he waits for Absol and Ribombee to return. After few minutes, Zorua hears loud noise coming from the direction of one of the doors of the classroom. He sighs a bit, thinking it must be the girls finally back from their lockers. He looks out and struggles to see the blurry silhouette of the door a galaxy away.

The door swings open and Zorua sees....
12233221131311113.title: A Better Way to See

choices: Braixen was growing
Zorua was shrinking
12233221132.content:
The Pokemon that Zorua saw walking along the path where he laid his trap was Braixen, a student that Zorua had pulled tricks on in the past. The biped fox was meandering along, her fluffy tail bobbing behind her. As usual, her yellow and white fur was delicately combed. She was whistling a tune, most likely a song from one of her cheerleading routines, while she playfully twirled her signature stick in her hand.

Her reactions to his mischief were typically low energy for the simple reason that she knows she'll eventually get her revenge. Zorua shuddered as he recalled how his tail had been shaved after he pulled a simple prank on her at school. She definitely was a master of revenge, to be sure. For that reason, he was teetering on the side of not pulling the rope that would dump the payload of honey, berries and feathers onto her.

But then again, the thought of getting a rise out of her sounded dreadfully appealing. Besides, chances are no other Pokemon would happen across this path today and Zorua figured he could just use his illusions to slip away. More importantly, he also needed his entertainment for the day. With all that in mind, he decided to spring the trap and in an instant the contents of his trap fell over her head.

Braixen let out a shrill squeal as she was coated in honey and feathers. The sight alone made Zorua quietly cackle in the bush he was hiding in and he had to bring his paws up to his mouth to stifle his laughs. For just a second she looked down at herself with an expression of unbridled annoyance before she took a deep breath and sighed.

Waving her stick to the trees around her, she yelled out with a laugh."That was a good one! Real good." Braixen took a moment to wipe most of the honey and feathers off herself before she cheerfully continued. "Wow, you really got me. It's going to take ages to get this stuff out of my fur! Come on, who did it? Come on out."

How easily she took the humiliating prank in stride made Zorua's stomach sink with regret. Even with her fur matted with sticky substances she was laughing happily and held a toothy smile. If anything, her lack of anger was intimidating. Normally to be one to gloat at his victim's misfortune, Zorua decided that he better stay hidden in the bush and avoid her wrath.

Braixen continued waving her stick around, the movement causing some of the feathers to fly off her. "Where are you? I know you're here." Soon her stick came to point in the general area Zorua was hiding in, and before he could use his illusions so hide himself, Braixen happily beamed at him. "Zorua! I knew it had to be you."

Her gaze triggered a fight or flight response in him, but instead of fleeing or fighting, Zorua froze. His hesitation gave Braixen the time to skip over and by the time he regained his senses she was upon him. After creating an illusionary copy of himself in his place, he started running. He didn't get that far, though, because Braixen saw through it and whacked him with her stick, sending him tumbling onto his back. The stick came back down on him and poked him on the chest, keeping him pinned on the ground.

Braixen looked down at Zorua with a smug grin, her red nose held high in the air. "You always run to the right, you know that? I know you try and avoid playing tricks on me but that doesn't mean I don't witness your antics on the other Pokemon."

"Right, sorry about that," Zorua nervously chuckled. "It was pretty good though, right?"

"Yeah, it was," she sighed. "You know what happens now, don't you?"

Zorua gulped and struggled against the stick pinning him down. "Don't shave my tail again," he begged.

"Tempting, but I have something else in mind. You see, I recently gained an ability that I've been itching to try out."

"An ability, huh?" Zorua said, trying to keep her talking. "What's that, then?"

Braixen replied with a short laugh and kept looking down at him. The silence was making Zorua uncomfortable so he tried struggling against the stick again, only to find that it felt heavier than it did before. Wrapping his paws around it to try and wrench it off him, he finally noticed something odd about it. Slowly but surely, the piece of wood appeared to be getting larger. Looking up at Braixen, she too looked like she was bigger than she was a moment ago.

Zorua quickly caught on to what was happening.
12233221132.title: Prank the cheerleader

choices: "You're gonna have to make it up to me, first!"
"Let's make a deal!"
"I'm gonna keep you for some time, then we'll see!"
122332211322.content:
Much to the horror of the dark-type fox, the world around him began growing, but he knew that it wasn't what was happening, no. He knew that, in reality, he was the one getting smaller and smaller.

The stick on his back, which was more or less as big as a small branch before, now felt like a whole tree, and it kept him from running from the growing vixen-cheerleader in front him, who kept staring at the scene with a smirk on her muzzle.

Soon, Zorua came to the point where he couldn't be bigger than one of her paws, in which point he finally stopped shrinking.

He took notice of that.

"What the heck!?" he spluttered, his breathing rendered difficult by the now gigantic stick on his chest.

Braixen started snickering,

"Hehehe, look at you, Zorua," she said,
"You're almost kind of cute like that."

Zorua huffed, but then tranquilized himself as the initial scare subsided. The fox began laughing,

"Okay, okay," he said,
"You got me good, I would have never seen this coming."

"I doubt anyone would've." Braixen agreed with a chuckle of her own.

Both pokemon, big and small, shared a laugh. Zorua felt relief washing over him - Braixen's revenge may have been odd and somewhat humiliating, but at least there was no one around to watch aside from the vixen herself.

When both were done laughing, Zorua asked with his friendliest grin,

"Good one. Now, will you get this thing away from me and grow me back so I can go back?"

Braixen smirked.

"Oh, I'll take my stick back alright," she said, bending to take a hold of her stick, a drop of honey falling from her fur and near Zorua.

"Th-"

"But only because I have something better in mind, although just watching you like that alone is amusing." she cut him off with a scary smirk.

The worry came back to the diminutive fox, who jumped back on all fours and stared nervously at the bipedal giantess while she placed her stick in her tail before shooting him a smirk.

"W-What are you going to do?" he wondered.

Braixen's smirk widened - she loved seeing Zorua so helpless.

"Oh, you'll see..." she said, bending to grab a hold of Zorua this time. Needless to say, he tried to run when he saw her paw rapidly approaching, but she was too fast and grabbed him in her fist, before scooping him up.

"Whoa!" Zorua screamed as his world was rocketed sky high in a moment.

Braixen snickered, before putting her plan into action: before Zorua could even recover from the dizzying ride, Braixen moved him forward.

"Ready, Zorua?" she teased with anticipation,
"You made quite a mess on my fur, so it's only fair you're the one to clean it up!"

"Wh-"

Before Zorua could even wonder what the giant vixen was up to, she pushed him in her honey/berry/feather-covered fur.

A sticky mess transferred to Zorua's own fur and, before he could offer any protest, Braixen began rubbing him up and down across her fur, not bothering to be gentle.

This of course caused Zorua to scream, but his mouth was soon filled with the feathers of his own prank, which silenced him while Braixen used the victim of her revenge as a rag to clean herself off.

Of course, she knew this wouldn't get the mess away from her fur, but the results would be hilarious.

She carefully rubbed Zorua against her chest, before moving on, starting to rub him against her furry shoulders, wiping off the sticky honey and berries with the poor prankster.

Next was her muzzle, before Braixen ultimately began rubbing her head with Zorua.

In all of this, the smaller fox felt sick. She was moving him around so fast that he couldn't even keep track of where he was going or where he was coming from; to make things worse, he was choking on the stuff that entered in his mouth and the friction of his fur with Braixen's own burned.

Luckily, his torment wasn't meant to last for more than ten minutes.

Braixen eventually pulled back when she felt satisfied enough and laughed when she saw Zorua covered in his own prank and on the verge of throwing up.

"Hehehe! Look Zorua!" she exclaimed,
"Now you are the one covered in feathers and honey! Isn't it fun!?"

Of course, now she had to add insult to injury, Zorua thought sourly as he spluttered out the gunk in his mouth; it took him several spits to take everything out, and he still had honey lingering around his tastebuds.

He glared at Braixen, who, still covered in the same mess, was staring right back at him with a smug grin. Zorua sighed.

"Okay, you got me." he said, admitting defeat.

"And?" Braixen chirped.

"I deserve this." Zorua continued.

"And?"

"I'm a dork." he finished, before looking at her with a blush, feeling his pride stinging,
"Now can you grow me back up so we can go clean off and forget any of this happened?"

"Oh, not so fast," Braixen replied,
"You see, I'll admit I was eager to try my new ability out. In fact, I was kind of hoping you'd pull a stunt like that!"

Zorua's eye twitched.

"You came here just for this!?"

"Yup. Old habits die hard, huh Zorua?" she mocked,
"But, y'know... I feel like I shouldn't let you off the hook so easily."

"Hey, you got your payback, we're even!" the small fox protested.

"Not exactly. This was just a little fun," she teased, empathizing the word 'little',
"The real deal's another."

Zorua groaned.

"What do you want?"

Braixen smiled.
122332211322.title: Sweet revenge

choices: Meet up with Braixen
Ditch her and hide
Look for help
1223322113222.content:
"A deal?" Zorua muttered. Based on his powerless situation and her tone he assumed that this deal of hers was only going to end up pleasing one party. "What deal?"

"Well, I was thinking..." Braixen looked away for a moment and smiled as if she was entertaining an amusing thought. "...Hey, what do you do on the weekends?"

"What? Nothing, really," Zorua replied, confused at the random question.

"Good, because here's my deal," she started. "I'm going to return you to your original size and let you go. Then, in a few days we're going to be starting a new routine together. It will go like this; you meet up with me after school before the weekend, I'll make you all tiny again, I take you over to my place and then finally we'll spend some quality time together before I release you for the week!"

The dark fox Pokemon's face contorted in equal parts terror, confusion and disbelief. He didn't like the sound of her plan one bit and scowled at her. "And if I accept, just how long is this routine going to go on for? "

"Oh, I don't know. Until I think you've received enough payback or until I get bored of you, I guess," she explained.

Zorua wasn't at all satisfied at the answer. There was a chance it could only last for a few weeks or stretch over for who knows how long. He decided she wouldn't elaborate further on that so Zorua pressed her for the other part of the deal. "This is a deal, right? What do I get out of it?"

The fire fox chuckled and held Zorua closer to her face, training her massive red eyes onto him. "If you refuse... Well, I haven't quite tested just how small I could make something yet. Or I could just leave you this size and pawn you off to one my friends you most-likely terrorized. Perhaps I just might leave you out in the wild like this. Or better yet..."

She trailed off as she raised Zorua above her head. Zorua found himself flailing as her white-furred hand shifted around him until it was only pinching the scruff of his neck, leaving all four of his limbs dangling in the air. "...I could just eat you."

After the ghastly statement she opened her mouth revealing a set of sharp white teeth and a red tongue before she began lowering him towards them. Zorua began kicking and crying out but thankfully he saw Braixen clamp her jaws shut with a click. "Just kidding!" she innocently laughed.

Even if it was a mere joke at his expense, Zorua was still rattled for the fact that she probably could eat him if she wanted. Braixen deposited him on another paw and looked down at him with an expression of forced concern. "Come on little guy, what's it going to be?"

"Fine," Zorua spat. Just as he figured, it was going to be a very one-sided deal and realistically he knew his only option was to accept it. The consequences of not accepting all felt like death sentences. "It feels like I'm getting the short end of the stick, though."

Braixen snorted at the comment and sat him down on the ground. Once again Zorua found himself at paw level with the giant Pokemon and watched as she stood back and retrieved the stick from her tail. With stick in hand, she swung the piece of wood down at Zorua until it gently pushed against the fluffy tuft of fur on his head. In an instant, he found himself at his original height.

The cheerleader fox excitedly bobbed up and down in joy before she stopped to bend down and pat Zorua on his head. "I'm glad we could come to an agreement! We'll meet up by that huge tree just outside the school. As for now, though, I plan on cleaning up the mess you made," she said, motioning to her matted fur. "So see you then!"

With that she practically bounced off, twirling her stick again. After passing a tree and getting out of sight, Zorua could hear her yelling out a reminder to not make her wait. For a moment Zorua just stood alone there in the forest, stunned at what he got himself into. There was only a couple of days until the weekend, too, and Zorua was not looking forward to it. Zorua straight up knew she was just going to try and humiliate him the whole time. In the mean time, he supposed he would clean himself up and get some rest.

*****


The next couple of days passed dreadfully slow. The anxiety of eventually having to spend time with Braixen in that shrunken form sapped most of Zorua's energy and he could barely focus on anything else during his classes. Zorua came to the conclusion that it was a part of her plan; to make him come willingly to his punishment and to make him fret about it. Somehow, he had managed to avoid seeing her for the two days but now the time he was supposed to meet her was drawing near. School had just finished for the day and in a few minutes they would be meeting by the tree she specified.

However, Zorua was having second thoughts. He only accepted her deal in the forest so she would release him and now that the time drew near all he could think about was how he really did not want to meet her. While he feared the consequences of not turning up, the thought that he might avoid humiliation by laying low for a while until she gave up had entered in his mind. She couldn't get him during class and he knew a few good hiding spots around the place, after all.

Zorua could see her in the distance, she stood out like a sore thumb with the red tufts of fur sticking out her long ears. He grumbled as he thought about his course of action.
1223322113222.title: Braixen's deal

choices: "We're going home. There's just so much to do!"
"Let's hang out for a bit, we can have some fun."
"I'll take you to meet my friends!"
12233221132221.content:
Zorua gritted as he eyed the one Pokemon he was supposed to meet. She was talking to somebody Zorua didn't really focus on, busy as he was staring at the dreaded vixen.

He was sure she had already seen him with the corner of her eye, judging from the smirk she had on her muzzle. Either that or she was waiting with anticipation the moment when she would shrink him down to a couple inches and do whatever she wanted to him for the weekend.

The thought did really tempt Zorua to turn tail and disappear among the crowd of Pokemon leaving school, but he remembered that Braixen was a master of revenge: if he didn't show up, there was no telling what she'd do to him, potentially in public.

He couldn't allow that.

Before the dark-type fox even knew, he decided to go to Braixen, but the thick crowd didn't let him walk freely.

With a grumble, he strolled to a nearby tree, deciding to wait for the crowd to disperse. That would be for the best, especially if Braixen was planning to do something when everyone was around.

So, he waited, ignoring all the Pokemon that went past him, to head either home or to hang out.

Eventually, the crowd dispersed, though the voices of the leaving Pokemon were heard for a while more. They gradually got lower and lower, until no more noise could be heard.

Then, reluctantly, Zorua came out from behind the tree to look over Braixen's own tree. It was truly huge, with the vixen waiting just beneath it.

Zorua shuddered thinking that the size of that tree was gonna be about Braixen's size when he was going to be shrunken.

Swallowing his fear, Zorua began strolling towards where Braixen was standing, taking notice that she was staring at him with a playful smirk on her muzzle.

She didn't speak or act until Zorua wasn't standing right in front of her.

"Gotta say," she said cheerfully, leaning over to place a paw on Zorua's back,
"Didn't think you'd come."

"Neither did I." he replied coldly.

She was smiling in a friendly manner, but the circumstances and the outcome Zorua knew he was going to face soon didn't let him relax.

"What are you going to do to me, Braixen?" he asked, backing up, freeing himself from her paw.

"I think you already know, Zorua," she said with a grin,
"But, that can wait. Let's take a walk, shall we?"

Saying that, she began to walk, leaving a flabbergasted Zorua behind. She stopped after five feet, noticing the fox wasn't following.

"Well?" she said, turning her head,
"You coming or not?"

"Uh... yeah?" he hesitated, before hurrying behind the fire-type vixen as she resumed walking.

Both walked in silence, though Braixen was carrying a smile on her face, while Zorua was wondering where she was bringing him.

He expressed that doubt, and her reply was very vague,
"Someplace I know."

Zorua made no more attempt to know where he was going and resigned himself to follow the vixen. Was she teasing him? Delaying her plans to the very last moment? Was she pranking him?

Those questions were answered when both arrived into town and Braixen led him to a nearby café.

She took a seat, inviting Zorua to do the same.

Still wondering what was going on, he jumped on a chair while Braixen picked up the menu.

"Pick something, Zorua. My treat." she offered.

This caught Zorua off guard and he muttered,

"... No, thanks."

Braixen shot a friendly smile.

"Come on, pick something! There's nothing up my sleeves, trust me!" she encouraged.

Zorua said nothing for several moments, before blushing and murmuring,

"... Coffee."

Braixen gave a quick nod and got up, disappearing inside for a few minutes, returning with two steaming cups of coffee.

She set one in front of Zorua and laughed,
"Drink up, soon-to-be little guy!"

Zorua growled while she began sipping from the cup. Then, noticing he wasn't drinking, she put it down.

"Aren't you gonna drink?"

"Look, just what are you up to?" the dark-type snarled, unable to take it anymore,
"This is ridiculous, why am I here right now? I thought you... you..."

Braixen began giggling, further irritating her fellow fox,

"Oh, Zorua," she said cheerfully,
"I'm going to, in time. I wanted you to enjoy your size for a while longer before I take that for the weekend. But don't worry," she smirked,
"We'll have plenty of things to enjoy these days."

Zorua gulped while Braixen resumed sipping her coffee.

Diffidently, the unevolved fox did the same.

Then, once they were both finished, Braixen disappeared inside once more to pay for the coffee, before coming back.

"There. Now come along Zorua, you know what happens now." she said. Zorua looked back, tempted to run, but followed her anyway.

She led him to an alley, made sure no one was watching and looked at Zorua with glowing eyes.

As expected, the fox began shrinking down to about the same size he had been a couple days ago.

"There." Braixen said cheerfully, reaching down to grab a hold of him.

"There." he parroted back, diffident and startled by the giantess who now held him,
"What now?"

Braixen smirked and replied,
12233221132221.title: The begin of a penalty

choices: Yes, it was Sylveon
It was someone else
12233221133.content:
Perhaps Zorua saw Sylveon? She was a caring classmate of the fox himself and, while they weren't exactly friends, she at least tolerated his pranks.

Was that her?
12233221133.title: That's not who Zorua sees.

choices: Yes
Someone else
122332211332.content: Was it perhaps an Alola Vulpix?
122332211332.title: Alolan Vulpix

choices: Zorua began shrinking!
Vulpix began growing!
1223322113321.content:
From behind the tree that served as his hiding spot, Zorua spotted what would be his next victim, and grinned maliciously as the Pokemon approached.

It was Vulpix. She was one of the fellow students in school, though she was no normal Vulpix; her fur was way curlier than a normal one's, and it was also pristine white.

That was because Vulpix moved to the village from very far away, according to what she said, and where she came from, others like her weren't rare to see.

As for her relationship with Zorua, there was none.

He didn't prank her, she ignored him, though he was sure that she knew who he was, because each time their gazes met, Vulpix would shoot a solemn look before turning her head away.

Zorua snickered.

This was the perfect opportunity. If he hadn't pranked her in the past, now it was his chance, and he would not miss it.

So he patiently waited for Vulpix to stroll towards the tree where his bucket stood, held by the rope that was, in time, held in between Zorua's paws.

He waited for Vulpix to be right underneath where the bucket would land.

His patience paid off.

Vulpix walked right by the tree.

Zorua pulled the rope with one swift motion.

The bucket fell.

The result was inevitable.

Or at least it would have been if Vulpix didn't look up at the very last second, shooting a wave of frosty air from her mouth.

The bucket was flung away, encased in solid ice that shattered into pieces when it landed, spilling the contents of Zorua's failed prank onto the forest floor.

A flabbergasted Zorua dropped the rope in his paws.

No way...

Without losing her composure, though visibly surprised, Vulpix began looking around.

"Who is behind this? Come on out!" she said, looking to the side when she heard a few bushes rustling.

Grumbling to himself, Zorua showed himself, standing a few feet in front of Vulpix.

"Ah." she said, her tone indecipherable. It sounded like contempt and pity at the same time,
"You."

"Me." Zorua agreed, looking at the spilled honey and feathers that were formerly was his prank,
"You know, it really took me a lot of time to organize that." he said, deadpan,
"I know it sounds easy, but it was not. Had a really angry Pidove chasing me. And it was really hard to get that thing on that tree. The least you could've done was to play along."

"Sorry, but no way I'm letting any of those things get anywhere near my fur." Vulpix sarcastically apologized, before continuing,
"We've never officially met, did we? Despite that, I hear that you're a famous, and infamous, prankster around here. I see that you really live up to your title, Zorua. Come to think of it, they told me to expect something like that when I told I was going for a walk in these woods."

Zorua blinked at the barrage of words.

"Uh... not to be rude, but do ya ever shut up?" he asked,
"You have, like, a button, or a switch or... I dunno."

Vulpix looked offended.

"That's very, very rude, Zorua." she said, glaring.

All of a sudden, the dark-type could feel the air around him growing chilly, though it quickly stopped as Vulpix sighed.

"But I'll let it slide, because that's not what I'm here for." she added.

Zorua felt a droplet of sweat run down the side of hid head. He didn't know why, but something told him he had just dodged a bullet. Or did he? Something was off about the Pokemon that was speaking so calmly to him...

"Wh-" Zorua paused, trying to control his voice,
"What are you here for, then?"

He knew he shouldn't have asked, but curiosity was simply too strong.

Vulpix gained a small grin.

"I was looking for someone to try out a new move on," she explained,
"And I found you. I've asked around town, but they were all... unwilling."

"Yeah? And why should I agree then?" Zorua asked, mentally wondering what this move she was talking about was.

Part of him was curious to find out, but he told himself that, if others disagreed, this 'move' could be dangerous.

Vulpix pointed to the bucket and said,

"You owe me, both for that unmotivated prank and for your mean words."

Zorua backed up.

"I'll have you know, I'm not used to paying for my pr-"

He stopped, because he felt a sudden cold in his paws; looking down, he found them frozen solid, while Vulpix froze his hind paws as well, effectively gluing him to the ground.

He was not going anywhere.

"Too bad Zorua, you don't have a choice. Not anymore, at least," the white vixen giggled, seeing the dark-type trying to break free from the grip of ice,
"Just consider this as one of your pranks... only, you're the one being pranked."

Zorua growled.

"Ugh... let me go!" he said after uselessly trying to break the ice keeping him from going anywhere.

He was simply stuck.

"In a moment," Vulpix replied, positioning herself in front of him,
"Now, just relax. You won't feel a thing, I promise." she reassured.

Then, before Zorua had a chance to reply, something happened before his very, incredulous eyes.
1223322113321.title: Revenge is best served cold

choices: Time for a game!
Vulpix decided to bring Zorua home with her
Vulpix suddenly noted how cute Zorua looked when tiny
12233221133211.content:
Without any kind of warning, Vulpix let loose an icy gust of wind from her mouth and from her curly tails; it hit Zorua without him being possibly able to dodge, and he felt his fur rise up as a cold shiver traveled down his spine, causing his tail to rise up and several strands of his fur to freeze.

The attack didn't last more than ten seconds.

Vulpix stopped, standing before the dark-type, who slowly reopened his eyes.

At first, it seemed like nothing was different to the poor Zorua, who was growing more and more afraid of the white vixen in front of him.

However, after blinking a couple times, Zorua realized that something was definitely different.

At first, he didn't notice it, but as Vulpix kept an eye with him, he could see her slowly growing in height, while the smile on her face grew in length.

"W-What's happening...?" the predator-turned-prey stuttered, watch as that vixen in front of him became bigger and bigger.

But then, Zorua noticed that it wasn't just Vulpix growing; in fact, the world around him seemed to be getting bigger as well. The bucket that nearly fell on Vulpix was now as large as he was, before it became even bigger.

Zorua was so surprised he couldn't speak a single word, but just watched in pure shock.

Smaller and smaller he got, until he barely came up Vulpix's azure toes, which was when the dark-type finally stopped shrinking.

The now towering Vulpix contemplated her work with a smile on her face.

During that time, Zorua just stared back at her, afraid. Despite what everyone said back at the village, he was not dumb, or at least he wasn't enough to not understand that Vulpix's wasn't the smile of someone who just wants to have a friendly talk.

Vulpix was now a towering goddess to the shrunken fox, and he certainly didn't want it to be this way.

"Vulpix, what's this!?" he exclaimed, panick taking over him.

Vulpix cocked her head, smiling,

"Right," she said,
"Sorry, Zorua, guess I got caught up in the excitement. Anyway, that's my new move! I call it 'Shrinking Blizzard'. And it works!"

Zorua said nothing, but looked at the giantess in confusion, having never heard of such move.

"You're probably thinking how I could make up such move," Vulpix said, as if reading his mind,
"Well, Zorua, it was not easy. Where I'm from, Pokemon can use particular, the Z-Moves, moves so powerful that they can break through Protect! Can you believe that? Point is, I wanted one of my own, so I began doing some tests to develop one of those moves. And, while not particularly strong as an attack, I soon discovered it had an interesting effect: it shrunk down whatever got hit by it, hence is why I only used it on inanimate objects so far. I needed a living lab rat," she explained, donning a bit of a smirk,
"I suppose I should thank you, Zorua,"

"I don't care!" the diminutive fox snapped back, deciding he didn't care about the explanation. He didn't get much, anyway.
"Just grow me back!"

In response, Vulpix shrugged.

"Oh, yeah." she said, now looking a bit embarrassed,
"Thing is... I didn't really develop a counter move for that. I don't know how to grow things yet... and I don't think I have a Growth TM. You see, I created Shrinking Blizzard combining Blizzard and Minimize and-"

While Vulpix went on with her explanation, Zorua took a step back.

This titaness was utterly crazy, using him as a live test subject. And even worse, she had no idea how to grow him back to his original height.

Quickly, tiny or not, Zorua decided he had more chances alone than in the paws of this crazy chick.

While she explained her move, the fox began backing away, shooting nervous glances backwards. If only he could reach that bush over there and make a run for it...

A suddenly cold made Zorua stop. But not because he wanted to, but because he simply couldn't move anymore.

As he soon discovered, Vulpix had froze him from the neck down, leaving his head sticking out of what basically was an ice ball.

"Nuh-uh, Zorua," she playfully scolded, smirking at victim,
"You're not going anywhere. I think I deserve some payback, don't you?"

With that, she rose a paw and placed it on the sphere Zorua's body was encased in and began applying pressure.

Despite the ice, the fox could feel it, and a pain worse than the grip of ice itself began manifesting, causing him to grit his teeth in pain.

"I kind of get it why you do this, now," Vulpix said,
"It's kind of fun! I shouldn't really say this, but taking on someone smaller than me feels great!"

Zorua couldn't really tell the same about himself.

"S-Stop!" he yelled, his voice shaky from both the pain and the cold.

However, one of those problems was soon fixed.

The pressure became so much that the ice around the fox shattered, and Vulpix's paw pinned him down to the ground.

"How does it feel like, Zorua..." the titaness said, savoring the moment,
"... Being the one to be pranked?"

This was not a prank, Zorua thought, feeling in so much pain; it was torture.

He just prayed for it to stop.

His prayers were answered.

He felt the weight fading as Vulpix rose her paws.

"Ahh~," she moaned,
"That was fun!"

"Not for me..." Zorua groaned, feeling his back aching.

"Ah, don't be like that, Zorua," Vulpix cooed,
"After all, the fun has really just begun..."
12233221133211.title: Frozen in fear

choices: Vulpix makes it home
Vulpix walks into another Pokemon
Something else
122332211332113.content:
The giant Vulpix paused for a second as she continued looking down at Zorua. The little fox saw the much larger fox switch her expression from her empowered self-satisfied look to something more endearing, a change that failed to inspire confidence in him. Zorua ignored her and tried to break off the ice that was encasing his body, the cold making him shiver and feel numb.

"If I unfreeze you, will you run away?" Vulpix sang with a patronizing tone, as if she knew the answer.

Zorua scoffed, it was more of a fact that he couldn't if he tried. "I won't..."

His admission seemed to trigger a reaction around the ice and piece by piece it began to break away until he was standing on his four legs again. Tiptoeing away from the cold bits of frozen water only made his inability to run away from the giant ice-type more apparent, especially now that he could barely stand he was that cold. Chattering his teeth, he looked up Vulpix and was happy to see that she was at the very least looking sorry for freezing him.

What he wasn't happy was how she lowered her body to the ground and started moving her paws toward him. Having her body closer to the ground only made her seem larger and the two paws that were making their way towards him after she got settled down only made him flinch, fearing he was going to get crushed again. Zorua curled up in a ball to protect himself but never felt that painful pressure. Instead, they gently pushed against him, the pads of one paw pushing him against the fur of the other.

Instinctively, he pushed against the cold surface but failed against her superior strength. "Hey!" Zorua yapped. "Stop that!"

"Calm down, alright?"

Zorua did calm down, though it was more because he was getting too tired of fighting against her than actually wanting to relax. The two paws around him tightened for a moment and dragged him closer to the ice-fox until he was being pressed against the white fur of her chest. It was cold, at first, but as he was held there it gradually got warmer. If Zorua was going to get smothered against another giant Pokemon for warmth he would have preferred it to be a fire-type but somehow the ice-type was managing.
