After a while Zorua stopped shivering and he returned to a state that wasn't mind-numbingly cold, something that Vulpix quickly took note of. He was pushed away from her but still had those paws surrounding him, one of them rubbing against the back of his head all the way to his tail like she was petting him. The look of her face still held that adoring expression, too, which confused Zorua. It was such a shift in attitude and it only made him even more unsure of the giant fox.

Zorua grumbled up at her. "So you really can't turn me back?"

"No, not yet at least," she said. "Though I have to say, you look much cuter this way!"

"Um..." The small fox wasn't sure how to take that.

"Well, I think I'll take you home for now. Can't have you stranded in the middle of the forest like this can we? Oh, and don't worry, my room isn't as cold as you would think."

Zorua looked up at the smiling Vixen with an uncertain glare. He was confused why she was suddenly being so nice to him when a moment ago she was taking a whole lot of pleasure in bringing him discomfort. It made him wary. "Are you gaslighting me or something? What is this?"

"What?" Vulpix blurted out. After a moment in thought, she continued. "...Well I admit I might have been a bit too harsh, shrinking you while not being able to turn you back. The least I could do is look after you until I can."

"I guess," Zorua pouted. "Just don't step on me anymore."

Vulpix ignored his comment and spoke up."Hey, why don't you climb up on my back?"

He peered past her and took in how much taller she was compared to him. Even while sitting, Vulpix was taller than the largest house in the village relative to him. "Excuse me?"

"Unless you want me to carry you home in my mouth," she teased. With Zorua not replying to her joke, she sighed. "Fine, I'll give you permission this one time to climb up on my tails for an easy lift."

Vulpix sat up on her haunches and laid her tails flat against the ground. It was a much more accessible way to get back up on her back but Zorua still didn't want to go, unhappy with the implication that he was going to be living with her like this until she learned to grow him back. Though when he thought about it, he begrudgingly assumed it was a better alternative than being left alone in the wild, by himself and extremely tiny. Maneuvering his way around the giant vixen, the dark-type reached the tails and heaved himself up.

He tumbled for a bit and was quickly met with a rush of gravity when Vulpix stood back up. The simple act sent Zorua fumbling upward and he managed to find purchase on the white fur on her rump. Regaining his bearings, he could see the vixen arching her neck back to smile back at him.

"Aww," she cooed before getting to the point. "Alright, let's get you home!"

That was fine and all, but Zorua was a tad worried about how open and exposed he currently was. Even though he was so small, his black and red coat contrasted greatly against her white fur. He dismissed it to just hunker down and hope this ordeal would be over sooner than later. He held on tight as Vulpix started walking.
122332211332113.title: Sudden adoration

choices: Yes
No
1223322113322.content: Was it perhaps an Espeon?
1223322113322.title: Someone else

12233221133221.author_name: Just here for the poke story
choices: Zoura start's shrinking
Espeon starts glowing
Nothing happens yet (delayed effect or Espeon holds her fire)
12233221133221.content:
Zoura's classmates had grown wise to his pranking ways, and were ever wary of his lurking traps. Plus a few had threatened terrible vengeance if he ever messed with them again, and some of them seemed like they could be dangerous if they wished.

However Espeon was new, having transferred only a few days ago and wouldn't be aware of Zoura's schemes. She seemed very sure of herself and some had said was conceited about what she could do, but as far as Zoura could tell she was relatively chilled and laidback. Hopefully she'd take a harmless prank in good fun?

Zoura spotted her walking along the path, her nose in the air. Perfect! He sped ahead of her, set up his trap and dived into some nearby bushes, his body shivering with anticipation.

Espeon strolled along as though nothing was out of the ordinary. Zoura shivered with anticipation as she approached the trap. Any second... any second.

As Espeon's paw hit the marker, a net burst open, dropping honey, berries and feathers all over the pokemon.

Espeon usually looked very dignified, serious and graceful, but right now she looked comical. Parts of her fur stuck up, not only from the mixture Zoura had prepared, but from sheer shock. Her normally narrow, focused expression, was replaced with wide eyes shock, and her usually immaculate, polished had some feathers stuck to it..

Zoura had wanted to remain hidden, but couldn't resist rolling around and howling with laughter, tumbling out of his hiding spot.

At the sight of him Espeon hissed, more of her fur sticking up. She tried to wipe some of the muck off with her paws and psychic powers, though the honey soaked fur fought against her paws.

"I suppose you think that's funny, don't you?"

"Hahahahaha no! I think it's hilarious!"

Espeon growled, bent her knees and her gem briefly shone
12233221133221.title: Trying something new

choices: ... Playfully, she was in the mood to mess with Zorua some more
... Mischievously. Time for the actual punishment
... Seductively? Apparently, she thought the tiny Zorua was... cute?
122332211332211.content:
Busy as he was laughing his tail off, Zorua failed to notice what was going on in front of him; Espeon set on him a vengeful stare as she focused psychic energy on the gemstone in the middle of her forehead, causing some of the honey around the area to retreat.

Zorua didn't know, but he was in for some serious trouble.

"Hehehe, oh wow!" Zorua laughed, before deciding that was enough; laughing for too much in one of his victim's face usually came to bite him in the behind,
"Hope you're n- wait, what're ya doin'?" he wondered, suddenly noticing Espeon focusing while glaring daggers at him.

Was she a neat freak? Was she acting that way because he had caked her fur in honey and feathers?

"Hey, uh... are you-"

"I'm alright." Espeon bluntly interrupted, as if reading his mind - and who knew, she probably could - before donning a small, unsettling smirk, her gem shining more brightly,
"Sadly, I don't think I'll be able to tell the same about you in a moment."

Being a prankster made Zorua quite good at reading the atmosphere, and the tension now was so thick he could probably slice it with a claw.

He decided that this was probably the best time to take his leave but, as he tried to step back, he discovered that... he couldn't move!

"C'mooon, don't tell me you're leaving," Espeon spoke mockingly,
"After all, you'll be the first Pokemon to witness this new technique of mine. Consider it as a 'little' payback for your prank." she continued, giggling.

"What d'you... huh?" Zorua couldn't finish as he began feeling a little dazed, his body feeling lighter for some reason.

It was like he was floating in mid-air, and maybe he really was.

"Esp..." he tried to speak, but couldn't put a word after another to form a sentence; however, as he soon discovered, something was happening around him.

The trees, the plants, what used to be his pranks, even Espeon herself, all of it was... growing? Why was everything larger all of a sudden?

Confused and startled, Zorua could only watch as the world around him slowly grew to an immensely big size compared to him, who didn't take long to figure out what was happening: this must have been Espeon's doing! She was somehow shrinking him!

Before Zorua even knew, he was brought down to the size of a tiny doll!

"Wh-Wha..." he stuttered, unable to believe what was happening around him. Speechless, he just stared at Espeon, who held the now small fox in mid-air thanks to a psychic grip.

She laughed.

"Say, how's this for a prank?" she asked sarcastically,
"I don't believe we've introduced ourselves before, but I think I know who you are. Zorua, right? Pokemon told me about you. You're a prankster, though I've already experienced that on my own fur. Speaking of which-" Espeon suddenly interrupted herself to adopt a murderous glare. To anyone else, seeing an angry Espeon covered in feathers and honey would have probably seemed adorable; to Zorua, it was frightening.

"Do you still think this is funny?"

Zorua abruptly regained the use of word, albeit an improper one.

"N-No!" he stammered fearfully, causing Espeon to smirk once more.

"Well, good... because now you get to make it up to me for what you've done. "

"Hold on a sec!" Zorua interrupted, adopting a more nervous tone; he had to buy himself some time and craft an illusion.
"I'll have ya know I'm not used to paying!"

Espeon's smirk became wider.

"There's a first time for anything, don't you think?" she said, getting no reply.

Zorua was almost ready but, sadly, his focus was broken when the giant Eeveelution thrusted his body forward with Psychic; unable to stop himself, Zorua crashed right into... a silky smooth, sticky surface: his new 'friend's' fur.

The fox groaned as the psychic grip on him began dragging him along the fine, pink fur, getting honey stuck to Zorua's own fur.

"Stop!" he exclaimed after a couple of seconds, feeling a sense of nausea settling in as Espeon sped up.

Obviously, she didn't listen and kept rubbing him against her fur like a rag to wipe herself from the gunk that was all over her.

To spice things up, she even began rubbing all around herself, dragging Zorua around her stomach area, around her tail and even her back. The dark-type felt like he could catch fire at any moment, and the nausea certainly wasn't getting any better.

Only after a couple minutes of extenuating payback, Zorua was finally brought back to his original position in front of Espeon's face, though he couldn't clearly see it. In fact, he couldn't see very well at all, everything was a blur and he was fighting not to throw up. If he added barf to the stuff in Espeon's fur, there was going to be hell to pay.

"Say Zorua, wasn't that funny?" the giantess mocked, though sounding more mischievous than malicious,
"Don't bother answering, I already know your response. I don't think it was funny either, I think it was hilarious." she said, mocking him even further by repeating one of his previous lines.

After a while, Zorua managed to get a hold of himself and finally regained sight of things when they finally stopped spinning around him.

Only then he got to look at his captor and noticed that she was staring at him...
122332211332211.title: Fight fire with fire

1223322113322111.author_name: Just here for the poke story
choices: The massage goes well
Something goes wrong
Something interrupts them
1223322113322111.content:
As the world stopped spinning, Zoura noticed Espeon was still smirking at him. She seemed to enjoy watching his dizziness wear off. But the look on her face terrified Zourra because the smile on her face reminded him of the smile he wore when he thought of a particularly devious prank.. Still he might as well try and talk his way out of this.

"Ok Espeon I'm sorry I pranked you. I shouldn't dumped that stuff over your fur. If you let me go and fix my size I promise to never ever ever prank you again."

"I'm afraid it's not that simple. First I don't think you got all the gunk off me, no matter how good a rag you make. Second I don't think you're actually sorry, you're just scared. You MIGHT avoid pranking me again, but only because you're scared of what I'll do to you. I think I will teach you a lesson and make sure you never do this to anyone ever."

Zoura started shaking, which amused Espeon further.


"Oh nothing as severe as that. At least unless you really invoke my fury. Thirdly, I hardly think using you as a rag makes up for what you did to me and fourthly.. there's still plenty of fun to be had."

Zoura felt a pit in his stomach.

"Wh-what do you have in mind,"

"Well your prank did make me jump, so I suppose I could use a nice relaxing massage."

She levitated him behind her ears.

"Uh-" ZOura had never given anyone a massage before, though a part of him was relieved Espeon could have asked or done much worse to him than this... unless this was only a warm up
.
"I've never massaged a pokemon before so if I mess up don't hurt me too much."

"Try your best. It's the least you can do."

He started scratching Espeon's ears, a little thrown when she started wiggling them.

"Mm not bad. A little lower"

Zoura gingerly complied.

"Is this ok?"

"I suppose it will do."

Zoura looked relieved.

"Now do the rest of me. Start with the neck."

Zoura suppressed a sigh and got to work, rubbing her neck and trying to avoid the bits of honey left.

"Watch yourself!"

Zoura's own body was covered in honey after Espeon had cleaned herself with him, and some of it had pushed against a patch of fur. He pull free and Espeon grunted with discomfort. She turned her head slowly to him, making the little fox shiver again.

"S-sorry I didn't mean to do that! I'm still dirty."

"Would you like me to clean you off?"

"Yes." Zourra spoke without thinking. Espeon flashed that prankster smile again.

"N-no wait" She levitated him and started walking with with purpose.

"Relax, I'm not going to hurt you."

"What are you going to do? Are you going to lick me clean?!"

Espeon looked disgusted.

"No, I wouldn't put something as dirty as you in my mouth. I have a different idea."

Zourra looked around. What did she have in mind? Was she going to take him home and wash him herself? That wouldn't be so bad, though he had a feeling Espeon wouldn't be too gentle.

Instead Espeon seemed to be searching for something. Zourra looked around to see if he could guess what.

"Here we are.."

Zoura looked left and right. He still couldn't see what Espeon was referring to.

Suddenly he felt the ground race towards him. He yelled out and braced for impact, though Espeon's telekinetic grip pulled against him. He could finally see what it was a... a lake?! No it was only a pond, but at his size there wasn't much difference. Was she going to drown him?!

He hit the water with a splash, and flailed his paws, trying to stay afloat, only to notice he wasn't drowning, Espeon was still keeping his head of the water.

"Now lets get you clean." She grinned. He could actually see her teeth this time. His stomach clenched, he had an idea what was about to happen.

She spun him around, dragging him in and out of the water, and rubbed him against the water, his yells filling the air. She even made him skid along the water, before bringing him back on land, making him tumble at her paws.

He paused to catch his breath and clenched his churning stomach. Espeon waited for a second. Maybe it was an act of mercy, maybe she just didn't want him to throw up on her. He dared to look up, his entire view being fiiled with a wall of light purple fur. She was still grinning down at him and Zorua couldn't help but step back.
The glow surrounded him again and he was lifted into the air. He cried out in pain as Espeon appeared to be squeezing him, but as he spun around again he realised she was wringing him out. She did this a few more times, though it didn't hurt as much, then put him down on her back.

He paused to get his bearings, but noticed while she did take some sadistic glee in his discomfort, he was a lot cleaner and not as soaking wet.

"Now back to work!"
1223322113322111.title: The punishment should fit the crime

choices: Espeon went to take a bath, bringing Zorua with her
Espeon carried Zorua to her bedroom. Now what?
1223322113322113.content:
Zorua blinked, confused.

After the thrilling ride he had, he expected the giantess to be angrier beyond his imagination, ready to deliver a big punishment to the now small fox.

However, never he would have dreamed of seeing Espeon smiling brightly in such moment.

"Well, I guess we can call it even. " she said, beginning to levitate Zorua to the ground where she placed him on his rear,
"You're off the hook, Zorua."

The dark-type looked up - was she messing with him? Was she just luring him into a sense of false security? Was she actually going to let him go?

The massive Pokemon before Zorua was smiling down at him as she too sat on the ground, her behind making enough of an impact to make the ground tremble beneath the fox - and it was a soft landing.

After a couple moments, the diminutive fox finally gathered the courage to speak,

"Does... Does this mean you'll grow me back?" he asked, retrieving a bit of a smile; he could say Espeon was cool, after all. Sure, he had gotten what was coming to him, but unlike most other Pokemon, Espeon didn't seem to be holding a grudge right now.
"Am I free to go?"

Espeon giggled.

"Of course... not." she replied with a smirk.

Zorua's heart, which had been fluttering for a moment, sank hard as he realized that the titaness was toying with him.

"H-Hey! You told me I was off the hook!" he protested.

"In fact, you got off easy with getting used as a rag. Your size however, I'm afraid that's another story." the fork-tailed Pokemon said, wiggling her toes, making it clear that she intended to keep him that size, at least for the time being.

Just then, Zorua realized how big the grudge Espeon had against him was.

He had to get away.

The dark-type quickly glanced backwards. If only he could put some distance between himself and the psychic-type so that he could craft an illusion and run... yeah, that was a good strategy.

However, the moment Zorua attempted to back up, he discovered he couldn't move. In fact, his paws weren't touching the ground at all as, he discovered, he was being held in mid-air by a pinkish glow.

"Seriously? You're so predictable, Zorua." Espeon, whose eyes were glowing, scoffed, sounding disappointed. Then, with a smile, she flopped belly-down onto the ground, her face near where Zorua's body was floating,
"Though I'm gonna admit, you look much cuter like this!"

Zorua's eyes shrunk.

Had he really just heard what he just heard?

His thoughts were brutally interrupted as the psychic force around him was released and he hit the ground with a small thud.

"Don't run. I'm not in the mood to give chase." Espeon warned, though keeping the smile on.

As if it mattered since she could catch him anyway, Zorua mused, although deciding that trying to run was pointless.

He had to talk his way out of this.

"Um... Espeon, miss?"

"Oh, please. What's with the formalities all of a sudden?"

"... Espeon, then. Seriously, if you could give me my size back, I'll be on my way. It's, uh, pretty la-"

"Why would I now?" Espeon interrupted,
"I told you, you look waaay cuter like this. Plus, I'm sure you and me can think of plenty of ways for us to have some more fun." she said with a wink.

Zorua shuddered, wondering her idea of 'fun'. Who knew though, perhaps she wasn't as bad as he believed. She was being pretty friendly after all...

Zorua shook his head - of course she was bad! She shrunk him!

"Um... what is that supposed to mean...?" he asked, concerned about his near future.

Espeon laughed, caused the more sensible ears of the poor fox to be unable to hear anything else for several seconds after she stopped.

"Aw, look at you, you've retreated in the shell. Adorable." she said, before giving a second wink,
"Don't worry, Zorua. You'll find out very soon what I have in mind for us two... in the meantime-" she stopped to stand back on all fours, looming over Zorua while also bathing him in her shadow,
"... Let us head back to my place so that I can wash this stuff off."

If it could sink any further, Zorua's heart would've done so.

"... Wait, 'us'?"

Espeon nodded as she turned around, giving a clear view of her bottom and her - ehm - undertail. Zorua blushed furiously and said nothing as Espeon's tail came down to wrap around his waist before rising once more, dropping him in the middle of her back; before anything, Zorua was enveloped in that familiar purple glow again and was carried all the way up to Espeon's head, where she let go of him in between her humongous ears.

Looking up with a smile, the psychic-type chirped,
"Let's go."

--

It was a short, silent trip across the woods to get to Espeon's home.

Nothing special, aside of course from the fact that, to Zorua, it looked like several houses stacked together.

With Psychic, Espeon pulled the door handle and opened, entering her house and closing the door back up.

"Well, welcome home cutie." the giantess said flirtingly, shooting a smile upwards, leaving Zorua anxious for what was coming next, which was absolutely unclear.
"Now, let's see what kind of trouble we can get ourselves in."
1223322113322113.title: No hard feelings

122332211332212.author_name: Just here for the poke story
choices: She uses him as a brush to wipe some of the honey off
She does something else with him
Another take on this idea
122332211332212.content:
Espeon's gem pusled with light. Zoora wasnt worried, what was she going to do? Shoot a psybeam? Didnt she know he was a dark type?

Instead of an attack, her body glowed. At first nothing appeared to happen, but Espeon didn't look preturbed. Then Zooura noticed something strange.

As far as Zoura remembered, Espeon was a head and a bit taller than him, though quite a bit longer. But now it looked like she bigger and that'd he only come up to around her stomach. Was this an optical illusion or was Espeon taller than he initially thought? Was she using an illusion to?

Espeon was getting bigger, and it was clear to Zoura this wasn't just his perception, either she was getting bigger or using an illusion of her own, she was twice the fox pokemon's height and growing rapidly.

The scowl Espeon wore turned into a smirk and she took a step towards him. Her paw sank deeper into the ground and left an imprint, as she continued to grow, now approaching three times his size.

Zouura watched with a mix of fascination, then fear. This has to be a trick of her own... right?

Espeon, now at least five times his size, was still smirking and took a step towards him, deliberately putting her paw down with a slam. If this was an illusion it was a very good one, her honey drenched fur had increased proportionally, but the feather drifting off her looked smaller.

She slamed down the other paw, and Zoura swore he felt a shake. This was no illusion! WHat was she going doing?! From the look on her face he was worried he might try to eat him.
With a yip, Zooura dashed away fast he could. Espeon waited a second and gave chase, still not running as fast she could.

Looking behind, he could see a large, pink shape, rapidly getting closer by the second. Zoura didn't know what to do! Maybe he could try an illusion!

He dived into a bush and concentrated, hoping to make the towering pokemon believe he was he jumped to the bush to the left, letting him scurry away. He was focused, picturing in his mind and....

A great paw came down, pinning him to the ground.

"Still think your little prank was funny?" Espeon's voice was much louder and boomed, the little fox couldn't help but shake in fear.

"N-n-no."

His fear only served to amuse Espeon. She picked him slow, holding her in front of her smiling face, savoring his quivering reaction, and wondered what to do with with him.
122332211332212.title: Is Espeon pink or purple?

choices: How about a Gardevoir
Maybe a tsareena
Different pokemon
122332212.content: Now what pokemon would be perfect as a teacher?
122332212.title: A teacher

choices: Mew
Celebi
Different legendary
12233222.content: What legendary pokemon will the little mischief choose to prank?
12233222.title: A legendary pokemon

choices: Mew makes herself a towering giantess
Mew shrinks Zorua to a tiny size
Mew shrinks Zorua to a very VERY tiny size
122332221.content:
Zorua snickered, keeping the rope in his mouth that would drop the bucket. Today...he was going to get the miss prissy pants Mew.

She was always trying to play mediator, friend, and guardian to many of the pokemon in town...it turned his stomach raw the way she acted, and she seemed to think herself so above it all, above him, just because she's a legendary!

It was the other day when she'd stopped Zorua in his tracks from half-inching some sweets off of Pichu that Zorua decided...he'd get Mew with a simple little prank. She was always one for a good natured laugh he knew, but oh this...he'd be the one laughing. He'd heard through the grapevine she'd be in his forest today and he was gonna finally cement his status as a legendary prankster by pranking a legendary.

Mew herself was calmly walking down the path, not even floating, and taking in the simple sights of the little forest away from the village. She knew Zorua lived here, and he was part of the reason she had come to this forest...it was high time someone got him to stop his pranks, either gently or by force she didn't know, but she'd soon come to her decision on that. She was blissfully unaware of what Zorua was planning though.

As Zorua saw her approach he timed it right to release the rope and...

The bucket stopped mid air and was flung aside by Mew's psychic, she let out a weary sigh.

"Zorua, I figured you'd attempt something like this, and I can't say i'm surprised...just a bit disappointed." She said with a weary look in her eye.

Zorua for his part found himself floating out of the brush, flailing a bit as he looked at the small pink legendary.

"Oh come on, I went to a lot of trouble setting that up, you could've had the neighborly decency to let me have my laugh at least." Zorua said, trying to play off the situation. Mew just gave him a wry smile.

"You've been messing with this whole village for a long time now, I came to talk to you about that...you need to stop Zorua, i've tried a lot of ways to get through to you to-"

"All you do is lecture and talk down to me, that isn't the way to ask someone to stop." He flailed more in her grip and she looked at him.

"You're right on that, which is why i'm taking more drastic measures this time...i've been working on a new technique, and I have it down now...you're going to be the first pokemon to witness it, be a part of it." Mew said in a foreboding tone.

"This is for your own good Zorua...I need to scare you straight...save you from yourself and make the village better for it." Mew finished as her eyes glowed.
122332221.title: Mew's power

choices: "as my pet"
"as my slave"
"until you learn to be nice"
1223322212.content:
As Zorua looked in Mew's eyes a strange feeling started to overtake him...it started with his skin feeling prickly, before it almost felt like an intense heat washing over him...his body itched and itched and he was feeling odd.

"M-Mew, what are you doing to me...?" Zorua asked, having a hard time keeping the fear out of his voice as he felt dizzy.

He fell to his side and as he did the intense heat and itching turned into a roaring pain that swelled throughout him. He had no idea what was going on, but the pain was more than he'd ever felt before. He started to scream. His vision was distorted and blurred and he couldn't make anything out.

Mew bit her lip as she concentrated, she had never used the technique on a living being before, and now she was worried she may not have entirely mastered it as she looked at the screaming Zorua in a heap before her. She felt a pang of guilt, but then saw it start to take effect...Zorua was getting smaller.

She watched, enraptured as his body compressed and got smaller and smaller, Zorua still screaming.

The pain was starting to slow Zorua noted...it was getting dull, and the odd feeling he had was fading too, he was left with some bitter aches, and his head was pounding...he still felt dizzy too, his eyes were shut tight, and he felt like he didn't want to get up at all.

"Okay Mew...I get the message, i'll back off, alright?" He got out, feeling like the worst was done, but he had no idea what had truly happened to him.

"I'm sorry Zorua...but we're not done." Mew's voice felt loud...powerful, something he wasn't used to, it rang out high above him too.

Zorua opened his eyes, but he wasn't prepared for what he saw...there, towering high into the sky...was Mew. She must've been as big as a skyscraper to him! Zorua slowly got to his feet and took in his surroundings. The grass...it was slightly taller than him, he looked to the trees, that expanded far, far, far into the sky.

Zorua's breathing started to pick up.

"M-Mew...you...shrunk me?" He said, the voice a mere squeak to the legendary. She nodded.

"I did Zorua, admittedly I didn't expect the process to be as rough on you as that, but the results are what I wanted...you're about as big as the tiniest dolls you can buy." Mew said, and a great crash echoed around Zorua as he couldn't keep his footing and stumbled to the ground, the titaness getting down and looming over him with a mighty paw.

"Mew, please..." Zorua said, now scared, and Mew shook her head as her paw wrapped around Zorua. He felt a sense of vertigo as he was lifted up and up...until her entire face took up his vision. He gulped.

"I've tried to get through to you with diplomacy, and admittedly i'd like to resolve this as peacefully as possible. I don't relish in conflict, but you've brought us to this Zorua, now i'm gonna teach you this way, you're always picking on weak and small pokemon...and now you're the smallest, weakest, most fragile pokemon around, and until I decide otherwise you'll be staying with me..."
1223322212.title: A painful shrinking process

choices: "Home."
"To show my new pet off to my friends, of course!"
12233222121.content:
"Your pet?!" Zorua squeaked.

"Mhm. My own little pet Zorua!" She cooed mockingly.

"I don't want to be your pet!"

"Of course not. This is a punishment and It wouldn't be much of a punishment if I did something to you that you wanted, right?" Mew said as she brought her other paw up to Zorua's head and carefully pet him. Zorua tried to struggle against her paws but he had barely enough strength in his shrunken state to make a difference. In a futile fit of anger he bit down on the paw holding him, the bite accomplishing nothing more than annoying the gigantic Mew. Seeing her huge, annoyed eyes staring down at him made rethink his attempts at resistance and he slowly withdrew his jaws from her paw.

"I've noticed you don't like being in situations where you have no choice. That's kind of what it's like for your victims, isn't it? The Pokemon you bully usually don't have a choice if they're suddenly in your cross-hairs to be picked on or tricked." Zorua just scornfully averted his gaze from Mew, an action which was getting increasingly harder to do as she kept turning him around in her paws to look him in the eyes.

"Well, if you really want a choice then I guess you can choose to be my pet or I can leave you here right now to fend for yourself." The statement definitely caught Zorua's attention. He almost opened his mouth to ask to be let go and not suffer the humiliation of being her pet, but he stopped himself as he thought about it. Even though his part of the forest was well secluded there was still the odd Pokemon that wandered through and an even higher chance of that Pokemon utterly hating him. He knew without a doubt that there were some Pokemon that wouldn't even think twice about crushing or eating him in this state. Then came the topic of finding food...

Mew looked down amused at the Zorua having his internal debate, his face growing more frustrated as he weighed the pros and cons of each choice. It was clear by his expressions what choice he should choose, but he stubbornly resisted. Mew decided to speed up the process. "Zorua, if you choose to be my pet I have an obligation to provide you with all your basic needs. Food, water, shelter..."

Zorua bitterly looked up to the pink giantess and sighed. He had never aggravated Mew enough to actually set her off like this so he knew without a doubt she was serious about this. The two choices essentially boiled down to potential death or damaging his dignity and he begrudgingly decided on the latter. It might be his ultimate test of patience but it seemed like the best choice. "Fine."

Mew grinned. While she regretted having to turn to such drastic measures she had to admit it was fun teasing the small dark type and giving him his comeuppance. "What's fine? Of the two choices which do you want?"

The Zoroua grumbled. She wanted him to say it. "I... I want to be your pet." The statement was more humiliating than he thought when he said it out loud, his face burning fiercely as he blushed.

Zorua barely had time to recover from his mental ordeal before he was pushed against her pink, furry chest in a hug. "Good choice!"

"It wasn't really much of a choice..." He pouted as he tried to push away from her. Mew only giggled.

"Maybe, but it was still a choice." She teased before holding him in front of her face again. "So it's settled. You're going to be my little pet until I decide you learned your lesson. I will keep you well-fed and comfortable and in exchange you will let me play and cuddle with you all I want!"

"I guess." Zorua sighed dejectedly. "My life is literally in your hands."

Mew brought a paw up and started stroking his fur. "Don't look so glum. While it does seem a bit harsh and I may be getting some personal enjoyment out of this my overall aim is to adjust your bad behavior towards other Pokemon. This is for everyone, including you. When all this is over there's a chance you may even see all of this as a humbling experience."

"...A humiliating experience." Zorua muttered under his breath.

Mew cupped both hands over Zorua and held him against her chest. "Okay, let's go."

"Where?"
12233222121.title: Mew's new pet

choices: Zorua wakes up later, and Mew is back
Zorua wakes up alone
122332221211.content:
"We're going home my pet." Mew said, her voice reverberating through Zorua as he winced. His head was still pounding from the shrinking process, and he'd probably be contending with it for a while considering how big and loud everything felt right now.

Even Mew's steps shook Zorua to his core, and Mew looked down to see he looked fairly out of it and uncomfortable with it all.

"Something wrong?" She asked, and Zorua huffed.

"Aside from the shrinking, the degrading, and the general situation i'm in?" He said bitterly and Mew glared down at him, her eyes making him gulp.

"...Look, you said that shrinking thing wasn't something you'd used on pokemon before, well as your test dummy...it hurt like hell, some of the worst pain i've felt, and I still have a headache from it, okay?" Zorua said, exasperated.

"And your voice being so loud and the shaking when you walk isn't helping matters..." Zorua muttered and Mew dropped the glare and nodded.

"That's reasonable Zorua...here, i'll float home, alright? And when we get there i'll get you something for the headache." Mew was saying it much quieter, but her voice still echoed through Zorua since he was right to her chest.

He sighed but took the token kindness Mew was offering him. "Thanks..." He muttered and Mew smiled at this.

She'd get Zorua to come around, this would work out well...and she'd get her fun too.

She fluttered to her house, being gentle to try to not jostle Zorua too much.

-

Zorua looked around Mew's home as she entered it...it was small, cozy looking. It gave off a welcoming air...not that it mattered much since Zorua was here against his will, Mew started walking again, but tried to be careful with Zorua all the same, she rounded a corner until she came to a small room with a bed, nightstand, TV, book shelf, and in the corner...a wooden box.

"This is where you'll be staying." Mew said as she walked towards it, She lowered Zorua down, and dropped him on a cushion...he looked up, up at the sky to see Mew smiling down at him. Zorua looked around his prison, this wooden box and saw the cushion he was on...and two tiny dishes, one with water and one with some cut up berries.

"You planned this..." Zorua spat out, practically a growl, though Mew found it amusing how squeaky and high his voice sounded, and he was trying to be threatening, Mew nodded, her face far up to him, smiling tauntingly.

"I wanted to make accommodations for my pet, now let me go get you some medicine." She said and she started walking away, being less careful now that Zorua was in his prison and the thuds shook Zorua as he looked around.

The wood was thick to him...hard, he'd probably be unable to break through it.

He wondered if he could scale it, but seeing how high up it went...it was a daunting challenge.

And this was a simple wooden box, he grunted in frustration as he laid down against his cushion...at least it was comfy.

He almost drifted off when the thuds came back and a shadow was cast over him.

"Aw, you look adorable like that, getting comfortable already?" Mew cooed and Zorua glared up. She lowered her paw.

"Here, I shrunk them for you." It was two tablets...probably for his headache. "I got you this too, in case it gets cold."

She lowered a pink piece of fabric...basically a large, thick blanket to the tiny dark type.

"...thanks." Zorua muttered again as he took the tablets in his mouth and chewed, the chalky bitter taste making him wince. The piece of fabric was set down on his cushion as Mew rose up to her intimidating full height.

"Now then, I have things to do in the world of big pokemon, you can stay here and rest like the cute little pet you are." She said, tauntingly, talking down to him. Zorua glared and flushed red with frustration but didn't say anything. He hated this, but he also had to admit he was tired.

"...fine then." He said, the bitterness creeping in his voice as Mew giggled.

"Be back later~" She said, she blew him a kiss as she waled away, the shaking almost seeming intentional now, as she left Zorua in his prison.

"Stupid Mew...stupid box...stupid shrinking ability." Zorua bitterly muttered as he approached the water bowl, wanting to get the medicine taste out of his mouth. He started thinking as he looked at his reflection in the bowl...did Mew even HAVE a way to grow him back? Was she going to? And if she did, would it hurt like the shrinking. He shuddered to think of going through that again.

"Whatever...guess i'll go to sleep, not much else to do." Zorua said to himself, as he got on the cushion, and wrapped himself in the pink fabric.

"Of course she made it pink..." He muttered, drowsily as he tried to slip away from his frustrating situation, if only briefly with the peace that comes with sleep.
122332221211.title: Zorua's new home with Mew

choices: "We're going to play a game."
"You're going to pamper me."
"You're gonna tell me your story."
1223322212111.content:
Zorua was having a restless sleep when thumping started to bring him back to reality. His eyes fluttered open and he noted his surroundings and the events of the day came back to him. With a groan he got up, his limbs feeling stiff and sore, probably residual effects of the shrinking.

The thumping was getting closer, and stronger, and with a great whoosh a door opened, allowing more light to filter into the room, Zorua looked up, seeing as how he couldn't see beyond the wooden walls that were enclosed around him, and soon a smiling face entered his view.

Mew.

"Well there little guy, i'm back~" She said, her voice loud on Zorua's ears. He said nothing, and glowered at her.

"My my, you're gonna need to be more friendly than that if you ever want to stop being my pet. Though if you don't want to grow back ever then that's fine too." Mew said casually, the threat clear.

Zorua's blood was boiling at this point, but he took a deep breath, closed his eyes, then looked up at the towering giant.

"Hey Mew." He said, trying to remain calm. She smiled before reaching in, picking him up with her paws.

He was dizzy as he soared high into the air, in front of her face.

"That's better...now then, you and I are gonna spend some time together."

Holding Zorua still infront of her face she went to her bed, making Zorua dizzy still as she got on it. She laid back and set Zorua on her belly, her face far in the distance to him.

A paw came down and pinned him to her stomach, and he struggled against it, getting no purchase.

"H-hey, what gives!?" Zorua yelled as he kept struggling.

Mew just giggled at this, it reverberating through Zorua.

"Just messing with you a little." Mew said as he paw lifted up.

Zorua took a deep breath of air, and then considered biting down on her stomach...but doing so would probably only end badly for him.

"Okay Zorua, here's what we're gonna do..."
1223322212111.title: Mew returns

choices: Zorua finds the pictures in time
Zorua finds them, but just as he ran out of time
Zorua does not find them
12233222121111.content:
"A game...?" Zorua said as Mew nodded, her face still in the distance. An immense digit from her paw came down and gently rubbed Zorua's head. "Yes, a game my little Zorua~" She said and he winced, not liking the way she said that. There was no way he'd enjoy this. Her smile grew as she saw his obvious look of dread.

While she enjoyed drawing this out and making Zorua feel uncomfortable, it really wouldn't be all that bad. Mew was curious how resourceful how Zorua could be, even at such a tiny size. And there would be certain motivations for him too...

"All you need to do is find something that i'm gonna hide in this house. You don't even need to reach it, though I don't think you could." Mew said coyly, enjoying the dark type's annoyance and confusion.

"So what, it's hide and seek then?" He said with a bit of hesitance. And Mew giggled, rocking Zorua a bit, still on her stomach as she rubbed his head again.

"Something like that, see, simple enough that you can do, right?" She said and he sighed. "I guess..." He said, but he knew there HAD to be a trick to this, no way there wasn't.

"So uh...what exactly am I looking for?" He asked and she wrinkled her nose before answering, almost hesitating as she did. "Something I got from your forest...under the stump I believe?" Mew said and Zorua's voice paled immediately.

"Y-you went into my-you...you!" Zorua said, flitting between rage, stupor, confusion, and amazement all in one sentence. The reaction Mew expected.

"Though I must say, there are some things I didn't expect to find out about you when I went to search your forest just now...I really do think this'll benefit you in the end Zorua, just let me help you." Mew said, a hint of sympathy entering her tone for the first time.

Pictures, that's what she'd found. They wouldn't get out she'd make sure...so long as Zorua cooperated?...No, they wouldn't get out at all she'd decided, it'd be too cruel, even to him.

The pictures also seemed to go a long way into explaining why Zorua might be the way he was, and they had a Zoroark in them sometimes...probably the one that took all the pictures. To Mew's surprise though, Zorua was dashing across her stomach and had his teeth bared as he leapt for her face. She caught him with psychic as he flailed and she glared at him, what surprised her more was that this didn't intimidate Zorua into stopping his flailing.

"You bitch! Too far! You've gone too fucking far!" Zorua screamed, his voice cracking. Mew shook her head before a look of sympathy appeared. This really did have an effect on Zorua beyond embarrassment.

"Zorua, listen....listen!" She yelled as he kept protesting and flailing. She sighed before she dropped him onto the sheets, then pinned him with her paw before he could do anything.

Immediately he was winded and dazed as the bulky and powerful force stopped him from moving. "Zorua, i'd like you to know that I truly want to help you, but you ARE my pet right now and you WILL behave! Now, i'm going to give you the pictures back when we're all done, but if you find them, IF, within the hour, then i'll do something nice for you!" She said and he started struggling.

"Will it be grow me back so I can get out of this nightmare!" He yelled and she shook her head.

"No, but how does a nice steak dinner sound, all you can eat?" She said, hoping that would catch his attention.

Zorua did struggle a bit more, but he was slowing down on it. His stomach grumbled. He hadn't eaten any of those cut up berries she had for him, and truth be told they didn't look appetizing. He gulped.

"...and if you win..." Zorua spat out, still barely containing his rage, but trying to contain it at least.

"...I don't know yet..." Mew said. She'd considered pushing him to talk about the stuff she'd found, but his reaction was far more emotional than even she'd bargained for. She'd probably figure out some light humiliation later, but right now she was starting to second guess starting with this with Zorua.

She gently lifted her paw and Zorua slowly stood up. He closed his eyes and sighed before turning and looking up to Mew, her eyes hiding her emotions well. He bit his lip and his ears pulled back.

"Mew, please don't push things." And her eyes hardened.

"Don't forget why you're here Zorua. You've been pushing things for years." She said harshly making him wince, and he was lifted with psychic force. "But I won't take things further for now. I'm going to set you down on the floor, you have half an hour...and I won't interfere. Use your noggin~" Mew said, trying to lighten the mood with that last bit of her statement and Zorua nodded as he was set down. When she did that he immediately bolted out of her room, and she giggled.

"He's probably going to try to find an exit before even looking for the pictures..." She muttered to herself

Zorua for his part was running for any open door that might've led to outside, a long shot he realized but he hoped. His hopes were dashed though as he wasted a good few minutes running around, seeing closed wooden monuments that he had no hope of opening.

When he came upon the last one he lifted up a hind leg and kicked it in frustration.

"Arceus damn it!" He exclaimed, frustrated before settling down.

"Okay, okay Zorua...think...you need to find those pictures...why the hell didn't I destroy them...why the hell did I even take them, he wouldn't have done shit with them..." Zorua was muttering shakily as he settled his breaths.

"Okay...okay...look around..." He said as he took in his environment. This room he was in...it looked to be a living room. He had no idea if Mew lived on her own or not, but either way it was a nice looking place...huge to him, but nice.

"She said I could see it, but maybe not reach it..." He muttered. "That might mean up, but...she might be trying to trip me up with that. It's possible it means gated...hmm..." He was using his brain to try and piece things together. Mew was annoyingly smart and regardless of finding the pictures or not, she was gonna press him on the issue he knew.

"...Just focus on the damn steak, I could at least use that after a crappy day like today..." He was drooling as he thought this. Steak was a definite rarity to him. He started to explore more slowly and methodically.

Mew for her part just lay in the bed. She stashed the pictures in her grandfather clock, though at an angle that might be hard for Zorua to catch with his low to the ground perspective if he didn't stand from a distance. Still, it was possible and Zorua was probably smart enough to figure it out eventually.

She didn't want him to know that she was kinda rooting for him. She looked at her own digital clock in her room...20 more minutes...
12233222121111.title: Pushing things a little far, and the game is set

choices: "He looks so cute!" Sylveon said.
"He looks scared..." Delcatty said.
"Seems like a good way to make him pay." Salazzle said.
"What are you girls doing?" A new voice sounded off.
122332221212.content:
"I'm going to show my cute little pet off to my friends, of course! So that they can see how adorable he is!" Mew cooed mockingly. Zorua's eyes widened in fear as he started to struggle in futility. "Oh come on! Mew please don't do that!" He said as Mew giggled. "Why not, you'll get lots of pets i'm sure. They won't hurt you, I promise that." Zorua started to struggle more as Mew said that, though she held him tight to her chest with a smirk.

"I changed my mind, i'd like to fend for myself!" Zorua said as Mew giggled. "Oh hush, you don't mean that and you know it. This is part of your punishment you know, and it'll help you in the long run too. Imagine when I grow you back, you're reformed, but no one in the village will want to accept you. That won't do! They need to see this side of you too." Mew said as Zorua gulped. Mew was taking him into the village...for all to see. Forget about being a legendary prankster, his reputation was about to be torn to shreds. Hell, there was a chance HE'D be torn to shreds if certain pokemon got a hold of him right now.

Zorua got an idea though as he used his illusions to make himself invisible. Mew looked down at him on occasion and gave a bit of a giggle at this. "You can't keep that up forever, we both know that." Mew said as she maneuvered one of her paws to be around Zorua's stomach. She then started to stroke and prod at it, trying to agitate and tickle him out of his concentration. Zorua's eye twitched at what she was doing as his concentration broke. He was soon visible again, with Mew still prodding at him. "Coochie coochie coo~" She said mockingly as Zorua bared his teeth, only to quickly retract it. He didn't want to annoy her...

"Hey Mew, what are you doing?" A feminine voice called out and Zorua gulped. "Mew, i'm begging you. Don't do this..." Zorua pleaded. She just smiled at him.

"Not much girls, let me come join you, I want to introduce you to my pet, I think you might already know him, but not like this!" Mew said as she approached a group of pokemon. Mew held out her paws, him being out in the open he acted as quick as he could think, Zorua curled up, trying to make himself as small as possible, but it was useless. Soon he heard murmurs.

"Is that...Zorua?"

"Wow, he's so tiny!"

"What happened?"

Zorua sighed as he opened his eyes, and looked at the giants before him. He sighed and hung his head in shame. Yup, it was one of Mew's circle of friends. Before him stood the towering forms of Sylveon, Salazzle, and Delcatty...Mew then moved her free paw that he wasn't on up and started to pet him. He groaned.

"Well, I made him small. I figured that since he likes to be a pain in the butt around the village, i'd try to do what I could to solve the issue, and my solution was to make him my cute little pet~" Mew said. Soon his senses were overloaded as the 3 giant pokemon leaned in close. He tried to take a step back, though doing that made him bump into Mew's chest.

"Huh..." Salazzle muttered.

"I didn't know you could shrink things!" Sylveon commented.

"Are you gonna keep him that way?" Delcatty asked.

Mew smiled at this. "Not forever, just until I think he's learnt his lesson."

Zorua looked down, feeling overwhelmed right now. He wanted to look at anything that wasn't a giant, though they surrounded his vision. He shut his eyes tight before he heard a pokemon chime in.
122332221212.title: Introduced to Mew's friends

choices: "Um, maybe next time girls, i'm gonna get my new pet settled in."
"Sure, that could be fun...might cheer the little guy up too."
1223322212123.content:
Zorua kept his eyes clenched shut as he heard Salazzle comment. "Wow! This seems like a good way to make him pay for all his bullcrap. Good on you Mew!" Of course she would feel that way...it wasn't like Salazzle was some innocent pokemon either. She used to be a rabble rouser herself before Mew befriended her...It was then that Zorua felt a harsher touch as Salazzle scratched at him with one of her claws.

"Look at the wittle runty Zorua..." She said in a cooing voice, making him glare at her. She just smirked at him. It didn't help that Salazzle was much bigger than Mew, who already was a titaness to him. "Bite me Salazzle." Zorua snarled as Salazzle's eyes widened. Rather than retort back though, she just grinned as an idea entered her head. She had never seen eye to eye with Zorua, and Zorua knew that. Even when she raised hell the two didn't like each other...and she could definitely make a statement right now. "Say Mew, mind if I hold him for a sec?" Salazzle asked. Delcatty gulped at this...she had a bad feeling about what Salazzle was up to. Zorua also felt a pit in his stomach open as his eyes widened. "Mew, don't hand me to her!"

Mew didn't really think much of this as she blinked at her friend, trusting her. "Uh...sure, just be careful, he's really fragile." Mew said with a smile as Zorua felt himself being transferred over. Soon he was in the much rougher, scaly hand of Salazzle, who took a few steps back from her friends as she looked at the tiny ball of dark fluff she was holding with a smirk. "Now Zorua, you need to learn manners to be a good pet." She said mockingly.

"Salazzle..." Delcatty said wearily, though the poison type wasn't paying attention.

"It's an awful big world for you, isn't it, I mean, just look how high up you are just with me lifting you." With that Salazzle pinched Zorua with her free hand and lifted him into the air, letting him dangle and look down. Zorua gulped as he did, he almost felt like he was looking down a cliff.

"Okay, that's enough Salazzle." Mew said, now starting to worry as Sylveon chimed in. "Y-yeah, just give him back to Mew." She said smiling, though Salazzle didn't hear them as she reangled her claws to make it so Zorua was forced to look straight at the ground. For him this was sensory overload as he saw just how far away, and how fatal the drop to the ground looked, in the claws of a pokemon he knew hated him. He wasn't able to quite comprehend the fact that he was whimpering at this point, but the others heard it and Salazzle grinned.

"Now what was it you said runt? Bite you?" She then opened her maw before Mew intervened at this point and roughly used psychic to yank Zorua from her grasp.

"SALAZZLE! WHAT THE HELL WAS THAT!?" Mew said, shocked, horrified, and angry about the past minute or so. "That was way too far..." Sylveon said quietly as Salazzle just rolled her eyes. "I wasn't ACTUALLY gonna do it, and besides. This is Zorua we're talking about. ZORUA! Hell, you shrunk and kidnapped him, I figured i'd just help you with punishing him." She said as Mew levitated the shaking Zorua over to her. He wasn't really hearing the giants right now though, all he wanted was to get the hell away from them. He was deposited into Mew's paw, when she half cradled, half trapped him against her chest.

"I'm trying to humble and rehabilitate him, not scar him for life or make him think i'm gonna kill him!" Mew said as Salazzle winced. She felt the glares of her friends on her as she once again knew she'd gone over the line. "Sorry...guess I went too far then...still though, you can't tell me he didn't have it coming." Salazzle said, though got nothing in response.

"Alright, I won't do something like that again. Sorry. Okay Zorua? Sorry." She said, though he was doing anything he could to not look at anything, even the wall of pink before him.

"Um...we won't do anything like that to you Zorua, if you want to do something fun with us tonight." Delcatty said, trying to smile.

"Yeah! We were gonna talk to you about that before this whole weird Zorua thing Mew! Wanna go grab a bite to eat, maybe catch a movie!?" Sylveon asked excitedly. Mew looked at the cowering ball of fluff that wasn't trying to keep up and pretenses right now.

"Yeah, I won't do anything like that again..." Salazzle was scratching the back of her head at this point, trying to avert her eyes.
1223322212123.title: Salazzle's scare

choices: Mew wants to play a game
Mew simply wants to talk to Zorua
Mew decides to leave him be for now and do her own thing
12233222121231.content:
Mew looked at her friends, and at the tiny Zorua and decided it would probably be best if she dealt with him alone right now, and as fun as it sounded to be with her friends right now, it would most likely get in the way of what she was trying to do, especially if Zorua did end up getting another scare.

Mew smiled at her friends. "Maybe next time girls, i'm gonna get my new pet settled in." Mew said and Sylveon's smile dimmed at this. "Oh...okay. That's fine." Delcatty nodded. "Sounds good, try not to be too frightened now Zorua." She said teasingly and Salazzle wasn't saying anything, she was still averting her eyes. Mew took note of this.

"Maybe...if we do this in a more controlled environment you can see him again before this is all over." Mew said to them all. "And even without him, I definitely want to hang out with you girls soon, so don't worry! Next time!" She said excitedly. Zorua for his part was at least thankful he wouldn't be dealing with these titans, and only needed to worry about Mew, though he was still shaken up by the past few minutes.

It was when Mew started to float away and head home that he peaked his head out. Mew looked down and he gulped. "...Sorry about that Zorua. I didn't think that would happen." There was no teasing in her voice, only concern. "Mew this is...really, really fucked up, okay? REALLY messed up! Look, I get it, i'll stop with the pranking crap, but you've gotta grow me! Please!" He said and she just shook her head. "It's WAY too early for that. Look, this is a punishment for you! You're not going to get out of it THAT easily."

"EASILY!? DID YOU SEE WHAT JUST-" He was cut off as he saw Mew glaring at him and he gulped before shrinking back in her paws as she floated through the village towards her home. She let off a sigh before smiling at him. "Zorua, look at this as an opportunity! You don't just have to be my pet, why not also try to be friends? Come on..." She said, but Zorua didn't respond. He didn't want that at all, but what was he supposed to say? "Look, if I go missing, what will my dad say, huh?" Zorua said. It was a bluff, he doubted his dad would really care, even if he noticed, but Mew didn't know that...

"No offense to you Zorua, but your dad...um...I don't know how to say this..." She was struggling with her words, but it made something clear to Zoura. She DID know that.

"Don't. Fine." Zorua said in a flat tone, before he sighed. "Just let me at least have the rest of the day off." He muttered before curling into a ball in her paw, making Mew frown slightly. She was arriving close to her home and would decide what to do then. She figured her mom was still at work so that gave Mew plenty of opportunity to get things set up, and keep Zorua hidden for now too.

As she entered her home she took note that, indeed, no one was home and with that went to her room before she deposited Zorua onto her desk.

He looked up at her and she tried to give a slight smile, though he just frowned. Not sneered, or growled or bared his teeth. Just a frown.

"Um...hey, you know what, i'll be back!" Mew said in a chipper tone as she exited the room. She went for the fridge, hoping her mom had left SOMETHING she could use as an olive branch and possibly an apology for what Salazzle did. She sighed with relief as she saw her mom had left a leftover burger that she could heat up. She bet that this would at least get Zorua to maybe open up a little.

Zorua for his part was walking around the desk, looking for a possible way down to get the hell away from here. Zorua had no idea what he'd do if he did though...he'd made an enemy of more villagers than he hadn't and it wasn't likely anyone would forcefully try to make Mew grow him back. As he was looking around he noticed his time was up as Mew entered the room...and something smelled really good.

"Hey, figured that maybe you were hungry little guy...normally i'd reserve a treat like this for when a pet is being good, but...it's your first day, and things started rough for you, so I figured this would cheer you up a little!" She said as Zorua noted what she had. A burger. He gulped...and his stomach growled. Damn, he was hungry he had to admit. He forced himself to look up at Mew.

"What will it take to grow me back Mew?" Was all he asked, she didn't change expression, but set the burger down. "I don't know, it really depends on how you act Zorua. I really do have your best interests at heart here you know...not just everyone else's." She said before sitting at her desk and tearing a chunk off of the burger, not too big and not too small she surmised as she set it held it in front of Zorua. He went to chomp at it before Mew pulled it back.

"What do we say little guy?" She asked before he grumbled. He seemed to be fighting with himself as he sighed before looking at Mew with a deadpan an expression as he could manage. "Yeah thanks." He said and she raised an eyebrow. "You can do better than that." She said before he wanted to glare and bare his teeth, but thought better of it. Best case scenario, he lost dinner. Worst case...he didn't want to think of it. He sighed, cleared his throat and tried to look as normal as possible. "Thank you for the burger Mew." He said in a normal tone. He tried not to make it sound forced, though he wanted to choke on the words. Mew smiled though.

"You're welcome Zorua. Enjoy." She said as she set it down in front of him and he started tearing into it. As Mew ate her far larger portion she was debating what she wanted to do with Zorua for the evening...it was true he had been through a bit today, but all the same it would probably be good to try and establish a better relationship, right?
12233222121231.title: Going home with Mew

choices: "Fine then, this is what happens when a pet is naughty..."
"Okay, if we're done then i'm calling Salazzle to take you..."
Before Mew could say anything, she noted that Zorua was on the verge of tears...
122332221212312.content:
Mew couldn't help but want to talk with Zorua. The whole point of this was to get him to realize how rotten he was being and try to harshly make him realize that. He HAD been through a rough day, but Mew still needed to establish some common ground with Zorua and that would hopefully make him more receptive to all of this. The last thing she needed was for him to be uncooperative right now, it wouldn't help either of them. She looked down at him chewing through his portion of burger...quite crudely and quickly too. "You're gonna get a stomach ache if you go like that." Mew said in a scolding tone, but Zorua seemed to ignore her. She sighed as she kept eating her burger, getting ready to open a bottle of water she had brought with her too.

It was then that she heard coughing as she looked at Zorua to see that he was trying to choke down a bite. "Zorua!" She said in a panicked tone before she thought quickly and looked at her water. She quickly poured a bit of it into the cap and set it down next to the tiny dark type, who greedily started to drink from it. She sighed as she looked down at the fox, who pulled back from the cap and let out a breath of relief before he started to go back to his chunk of burger. Before he got to it though, Mew picked him up in her paw, bringing him to her face. He looked annoyed by this.

"Zorua, I told you to slow down!" She said, as if scolding a child. He averted his eyes. "I'm fine, thanks for the water." Was all he said before Mew narrowed her eyes at him. "Zorua...do you want the rest of your burger?" She threatened, and this made him look at her. He was still hungry, he hadn't gotten to eat THAT much of it. She kept her eyes narrowed while he bit his lip and sighed. "Alright, fine, i'll slow down and listen to you, that's what you want right?" He said, Mew didn't change her eyes for a few seconds, but finally she relented. "Yes that's what I want. And after we're done with dinner I also want us to get to know each other better." She said smiling, Zorua frowned at this. "What's to know? You know as much as you need to know about me and I don't care to know more about you." Zorua said harshly before Mew smiled.

"You're my pet, and if you want to eat fun things like burgers or sweets that means being good and doing what I say Zorua." Mew said in a matter of fact tone. Zorua for his part was starting to lose his patience with all of this very fast, but he knew as well as Mew did that he couldn't do anything about it. He started grumbling and muttering to himself before he narrowed his own eyes at Mew. "...fine." Was all he said before he was lowered back to the burger and cap of water that he had now. He still had his appetite at least, and he considered exactly what he was going to talk to Mew about.

-

It was after Mew had eaten and cleaned up that Zorua had been transferred to a pillow on Mew's bed. Mew's face was in front of him, taking up his vision as she looked intently at the prankster she had shrunken down. It was silent before Mew cleared her throat, as if expecting Zorua to say something. He was quiet though. "Zorua...tell me a bit about yourself aside from what I know. You skip school a lot, prank tons of pokemon, and live in the forest with your dad, but there's more to you than that, right?" Mew tried to gently nudge Zorua into talking, but he didn't seem to bite. "That's really all there is to know." Zorua said simply. "I live with my dad and live to prank." Zorua shrugged at this before Mew frowned. "Well, there's gotta be more...here, let me tell you a bit about myself." Zorua internally rolled his eyes before Mew started. "I'm 15, live with my mom who took me in when I was young, I moved to this village when I was 8, my favorite subject is..." Mew kept going, telling Zorua what must've been her life story, he did his best not to yell at her to shut up, but it was getting harder and harder to do that. He zoned out after about a minute, not even realizing when Mew had stopped talking. She looked at him, realizing that he wasn't saying anything before she prodded him with a finger. "Hey!" Zorua said as Mew frowned.

"You didn't even listen, did you?" She said sadly before Zorua grunted. "No, I zoned out." He said simply. "Zorua, you need to start taking this seriously, if you ever want to get back to your life that is." Mew said in a scolding tone. That threat was the last push for Zorua as far as he was concerned. "This is stupid Mew! I don't care about whatever the hell your life is and I ain't telling you about my life either!" Zorua yelled in a harsh tone, his patience worn down, he didn't care that Mew was a legendary that towered over him right now, he'd had enough of today. "I don't know where the hell your self righteous ass gets off, but I want none of it! You ain't getting shit from me!" Zorua finally said before Mew glared. "Zorua..." She said in a harsh tone.
122332221212312.title: Talks...or not

choices: She lets him rest on her bed, setting her anger aside for now.
She makes him rest in an unpleasant spot.
1223322212123123.content:
Mew felt rage burning in her chest, wanting to take this puny pokemon and make him truly pay for all of his crimes. She had been trying her best to be diplomatic with him while also making him realize his mistakes. As she glared at him and got ready to take her form of retribution she stopped when she saw something she hadn't expected...or seen from the fox before. In his defiant tiny face, looking in his eyes, she saw that he looked unsteady, emotional...but not with just rage, she saw tears welling up too. She was hitting a nerve with him...but that meant that there probably was more to him than he wanted to say, regardless of if he wanted to let her in or not.

Zorua for his part was staring down the giant legendary, feeling indignant as his vision started to blur. He wiped at his eyes with his paw to see that he was starting to cry. "Arceus damn it!" He yelled, frustrated, his voice cracking as he tried to turn and run from Mew's face, before a warm, furry, and immovable force pinned him to the pillow he was on. Her paw.

"That was very...very rude Zorua." Mew said icy cold. She wasn't sure how she was going to proceed with Zorua right now, part of her still wanted to just take his little body and throw it against something, but that was far from rationale and would only accomplish sinking to his level, or doing what she had scolded Salazzle for. She could feel Zorua struggling under her paw, but did nothing for right now, instead letting him tire himself out. This would give her time to think and make him ultimately easier to deal with.

Zorua thrashed and thrashed, trying to claw and bite his way past her paw, but he was getting nowhere. At this point tears were freely flowing, warm and wet as he kicked and kicked at Mew's paw, his frustration mounting and energy fading. For about 10 minutes he kept at this before he had expended everything, and breathing, panting, and silently crying he stopped, only for Mew to lift her paw and look at the disheveled mess that was Zorua. She wasn't sure what she should say...what she could say. She just blurted out the only thing she felt needed to be answered at this moment.

"What is wrong with you!?" Mew said, her voice charged as Zorua looked up at her, not really able to answer as he wasn't even really capable of words right now. "Don't you get it Zorua? I'm trying to help! You're throwing that back at me time and time again but in the position you're in you have no choice! You don't get to leave, you don't get to grow, none of that until you tell me what the hell is wrong with you!" Mew said, her patience officially spent.

Zorua still said nothing, still panting as he had stopped crying now. He was breathing heavy, until he finally spoke. "Fine...fine, i'll spill my guts...just let me rest first please...ain't like I have any dignity left anyway..." It came out like a slur, but the words surprised Mew. His fur was a mess from thrashing about like he had, and tears stained him too. His eyes were definitely red and puffy and he looked like he could use a drink of water, but Mew also remembered his harsh words, and his attitude, and just how unnecessary it all was.

"Fine..." She relented, though wasn't sure if she should let him off right now.
1223322212123123.title: Zorua's outburst

choices: Later that night...
In the morning...
12233222121231231.content:
She considered punishing him, putting him somewhere unpleasant to sleep but as she looked at him, she saw he had already passed out. Mew looked at him before she sighed and readjusted herself on her bed to look at him closer. He had halfway curled inward and was sleeping pretty soundly. She could see he was breathing slightly heavier too. He looked almost precious like this.

"Why do you have to be such a jerk..." She muttered to herself. She was frustrated with the little fox and wasn't exactly sure how to get that frustration out. This wasn't out of the norm for her, he pretty much always found ways to get on his nerves with his attitude and pranks, and she thought this would be the way to vent that out. Instead all that happened was they just clashed again, Zorua clearly unable to do anything to her, but she herself didn't want to take advantage of how fragile she'd made him either, this was supposed to be the way to a long term solution.

After observing the sleeping fox for a minute longer she got up and went to her desk. There wasn't much that could be done right now anyway while he slept. He'd just better have been telling the truth when it came to talking things out. As she opened up her computer, she decided it'd probably help get her mind off of things if she just browsed around on it, getting her mind off of things...but as the seconds ticked to minutes, to eventually a half hour she couldn't focus her mind on anything but what was going on right now. She'd peak glances at the pillow Zorua was on, the little ball of fluff still not having moved any time she looked.

It didn't take long before she herself started to get tired, almost nodding off before she heard the front door of the house open. "Mew, honey, i'm back!" She heard. Her Mom walked in and she heard the familiar footsteps, and Mew looked at her pillow. 'Crap!' Mew got up to meet her in the hallway. She didn't need her mom knowing about what was going on right now.

As Mew exited her room, she saw the familiar white fur of the pokemon that had taken her in and raised her, standing on her four legs, smiling at her daughter. "How are you this evening? Did you make sure to eat?" Absol said as she started walking back into the living room to relax.

"Oh, i'm good...yeah, I saw the burger and made sure to eat..." Mew still thought her mom treated her too much like a kid, but that was what moms did she supposed.

Absol went to the couch and made sure to get comfy on it, taking up quite a bit of it being a quadruped. She fumbled a bit with the remote to flicker her TV on and still wore a smile. "Well why don't you sit with me, we could watch a movie, or maybe just talk for a bit?" Mew was tempted to do just that but...

"Sorry mom...not tonight, i'm getting pretty tired myself."

'And have a headache waiting for me in the next room I have to attend to.' She thought, though her mom was more than accommodating.

"Okay dear, that's alright. I'll see you in the morning, okay?" Her mom did sound disappointed...Mew knew that she worked a lot of hours. It was hard on her...normally Mew would've loved to spend time with her...

Zorua was her priority right now though.

-

Mew got herself laying down in her bed, trying not to disturb Zorua, before wondering why she even cared if she did. Jerk probably deserved it. When she was laying down though with her lights out though she heard something from her side. "Mew." The voice was distinctly Zorua's, but the tone itself was far from what she had expected from him. There was no edge of mischief or malice in it, and it was eerily calmer than she had expected from the energetic prankster. She flicked the lights on with her psychic and took a look at him. He still looked tired...and pretty calm too, his face didn't seem readable aside from the fatigue etched on it.

"...You ready to talk?" Mew asked and his mouth opened, it was working to say something, his muzzle shifting as if unsure of something before he closed his mouth. He shook his head and Mew frowned. Before she said something though he sighed and decided to at least break the silence.

"I...some pokemon know probably, you moved here after it happened, though maybe you've heard...I don't...it's..." Zorua sighed, struggling to find the words. He looked at the face of the giant legendary, he didn't even like her, he found her annoying and way too snooty with self righteous justice. He wanted to yell at her again, but it wasn't like he'd be able to accomplish much doing it. He figured maybe being straight with her about this would help him talk about it. "Mew. I really don't like you. I don't like many pokemon I guess, but you get on my nerves a lot. You've got me boxed into a corner and i'm only telling you my past because of that. This doesn't change anything between us so don't think this is a sign of respect. What i'm going to say is a deeply personal matter that would normally be none of your business. Know that." He didn't even sound mad when he said it, just frank. Mew felt a bit annoyed by the words but went with it. "You're the one that boxed yourself in Zorua...you've hurt and tormented a lot of pokemon that did nothing to you. I won't let you forget that, this is a punishment of your own making but...if what you're saying is true then I can at least say i'll keep it to myself." Mew was curious now. Just what was Zorua going to say.

He took a few deep breaths, before looking into Mew's giant eyes. "So you know I live with my dad, out in the forest. Not the best home but...it's home. He and I don't necessarily see eye to eye a lot. Always been like that between us, even back when." Zorua's voice was soft, the only source of noise in the room. "We used to live in the village though, I had a mom...a sister too, older. She was really talented, I looked up to her. All I wanted was to impress her really." Zorua said, sounding wistful. He sighed before he cut himself off. "Shit, Mew I don't want to talk about this..." He groaned, flushing red as his eyes darted about. Mew gave a gentle smile at him, trying to calm him. "Zorua please, just tell me about yourself, okay?" She said as Zorua sighed.

"I uh...fine...we lived like that for a while I guess, I was young, the details are fuzzy but I basically only hung out with my sis. My mom and dad, they got into a fight some night...my sister was involved I think but after that..." Zorua shut his eyes, sighing. "Well not every pokemon gets a fair end I guess. My mom and sister left, I don't know why, don't know what happened, but their bodies were found the next day. When my dad found out...I don't know what happened to him, he changed around then. Stopped caring about stuff, drank a lot. I don't know how he feels about it, or what happened really that night." Zorua hadn't noticed Mew's expression shifting, he was in his own world at this point, thinking about it. He didn't like to think back on this much at all, it never ended well for his thoughts.

"Dad couldn't keep the house...we moved. A lot happened really fast back then, I dunno, details are fuzzy, like I said...my sister you know...she's not here anymore, wasn't around. Even that was hard for me to fathom. She liked my little tricks, my pranks. That all ended when she was..." Zorua stopped, seemingly needing to recompose himself before he continued. "I started doing them, harmless little jokes to others. At first a lot of pokemon found it funny. I liked that." Zorua smiled a little. "I wanted to scale it up, ramp it up, but after a while everyone hated it. I guess they got too mean, but I didn't care, why did it matter? My pranks were the best around, regardless of what anyone thought..."

Zorua sighed, he didn't know what else he could say at this point. Mew herself was struggling to say something. That was a lot to process, and it wasn't exactly her right she felt to touch on this subject with her own commentary or advice. Not yet at least. She wasn't sure anyone had asked him in a long while.

"Are you okay?" She said gently and he looked at her, he almost looked ready to cry again, but there was no anger.

"I don't know if I am. I really don't." He swallowed the lump in his throat and took some deep breaths before looking Mew square in the face.

"This doesn't change anything though. I don't care for you, I only want my size back." Zorua said, trying to sound defiant but failing. Mew instead of saying anything, just flicked the lights off with her psychic.

"Get some rest, it's going to be another day tomorrow my pet...if you need a friend though, someone to talk to some more, please just let me know." There wasn't much else she could say at this point, Zorua was the one that needed to open up to her, and she was sure that he was needing someone to make this happen for a long time. Mew's voice broke through the darkness and Zorua closed his eyes, he got himself comfortable on the pillow, unsure of where things would go from here.
12233222121231231.title: Zorua opens up

choices: Started to grow as she stomps her way after Zorua
Blast Zorua in the back, knocking Zorua out.
122332222.content:
