At of all the pokemons from poke school to come, It was Celebi. She was the smart popular girl at school, being that she is the only legendary who can travel in time and all that. However, this was a opportunity for Zorua to finally catch the pokemon of guard since she always avoided his attempted pranks. She was distracted in a book she was reading that she didn't notices at all of what she was about to walk into.

With one quick pull, Zorua releases a rope that was holding a bucket containing honey and berries and a bag of feathers. Celebi only had time to hear a something fall above her before she shrieks as the honey splashes on her. Zorua watches as his pranks makes Celebi look like a big pidove.

Celebi, understandably furious, looks around to try to find whose responsible. It didn't took her long to figure out who did, as she can easily guess what little mischief might do something foolish. "Zorua!" Zorua could hear Celebi's voice and figure it might be best that he run before Celebi decides to turn him into paste.

Unfortunately for him, he didn't ran far as boulders amd trees smash right in front of him. He didn't need to turn around to know that Celebi spots him, and boy she was fuming.

"H-hey Celi..." Zorua says as he nervously turns around in time for Celebi to psychically throw a tree next to him like a javelin.

"I take it this is your work." Celebi says as she prepares another tree.

"Um.... Would you believe me if i said that was meant for Nosepass?" Zorua says as he tries to think of a way out of the mess he got himself in. Celebi looks so mad that she was ready to throw the next tree. However, she simple drops the thing.

"*Sigh* You got ten seconds to run. One. Two." Celebi says as Zorua wasted no time to bolt faster than a pikachu. "....Nine...Ten." Celebi says as she looks at the direction at where Zorua was running and...
122332222.title: The wrong pokemon to prank with

choices: Celebi eventually caught Zorua...
Zorua used an illusion and gave the giantess the slip...
1223322221.content:
A the word ‘ten’, Zorua started sprinting faster, snickering.

That stupid bookworm had let him go, thinking she'd catch him! That was the smartest girl in the school? There was no way she could catch him in HIS forest!

He glanced backwards, seeing Celebi... doing absolutely nothing.

She had her eyes closed, her book was on the ground, her arms were crossed as she hovered above the ground.

Zorua run slowed down as he started trotting away, wondering what Celebi was doing...

Eventually, the dark-type halted... the same moment, Celebi opened her eyes, which were glowing of a bright cyan.

An azure aura enveloped Celebi, the ground started trembling beneath Zorua; he saw her looking at him, smirking deviously.

"What the...?" he couldn't finish.

Celebi was... bigger? He couldn't tell, he was very far from her...

"I'd run if I were you, Zorua," she said with a cold grin as she REALLY started growing.

Before Zorua's eyes, the green fairy reached an immense height.

Soon, Celebi came to the point where she was tall as the forest's trees... maybe even taller!

The dark-type prankster started sweating, since when they bookworm could do that?!

Zorua discovered that he didn't have much time to think about, Celebi was looking down at him, still smirking.

One of her now car-sized feet rose into the air, before it came crashing down as the giantess took a step, which made the ground quake.

A second quake. A third.

Celebi was walking... towards Zorua!

"Ah!" he cried in fear as he suddenly remembered what he was supposed to be doing right now: running.

The fox turned around and sprinted away.

Celebi watched him, a cold stare on her face.

She didn't care about the feathers still covering her, she'd deal with that later.

No, she was enjoying Zorua's terror, seeing him running from her was hilarious! But he couldn't run from her.

"GOING SOMEWHERE?!" she deliberately shouted those words at top of her lungs, seeing Zorua suddenly collapsing to the ground, holding his ears and shivering.

She smirked, knowing that she probably broke both his eardrums.

Snickering loudly, the fairy giantess started walking again; she was going to love teaching Zorua a lesson like this, she knew it...

As for the unfortunate fox, he stood on shaky legs, a lingering pain in his ears.

He glanced back, seeing Celebi walking towards him again... although he didn't need to see it, the quaking ground told him enough.

Somehow managing to keep his balance, the fox started running again, feeling like he wasn't going to make it out of this situation alive...

Unless...

For a moment, Zorua's eyes widened, he smirked.

He WAS safe!

Celebi was impossibly big, if he managed to make her lose his tracks, she'd lose him!

All he had to do was hiding somewhere!

Regaining some confidence, Zorua glanced back, not stopping his dash.

"Ya hear me? No way you're getting me!" he exclaimed, encouraged by his thoughts... even if her earth-shattering steps were all but encouraging.

For a moment, the green giantess stopped... Zorua wasn't scared anymore? She could do all sorts of things to him, from crushing him with a finger to eating him!

How was he not sca-

Lost in her thoughts, Celebi noted that she had stopped walking. As for Zorua, she could see him... but he was very far.

She could close the distance but... he was too small for her to see properly.

Celebi's grin faded as she understood the fox's line of thinking: if she let him out of her eyesight for a couple seconds, he'd be gone!

She couldn't let it happen, Zorua had to pay!

"Don't be so sure!" she cried, accelerating as she stomped behind him, furious.

That was why Zorua was so confident! He was going to trick her again!

Celebi gritted her teeth, she wasn't going to let him escape.

It was time the fox learned a lesson.

Her rage rising, she suddenly knelt and lowered a giant paw right were Zorua was... but the fox made a great leap in the air and dodged the large paw, which made the ground shake again.

He landed onto the soft back of Celebi's hand and sprinted forward, leaving behind her wrist, knuckle and fingers as he jumped onto the ground and resumed running.

Celebi snarled as she got back up, towering above the comparatively tiny dark-type as she started walking in his direction again, the ground shaking under her feet...
1223322221.title: A giant problem

choices: She pops him into her mouth!
She drops him down to the ground!
She shrinks herself down to normal...and Zorua with her!
12233222211.content:
Zorua felt himself grin a little as he kept running from the green giantess. He was evading and eluding her at a decent rate and he just needed to give her the slip once to throw up an illusion and be gone. It was as good as done in his eyes!

He looked back to see her still following him, he couldn't look up to see her face, too much time would be lost, but he could imagine how furious she was that even now he was STILL being tricky.

Celebi for her part was getting frustrated at the dark type, but she looked around as she saw him running and got a devilish thought. She reached one of her paws forward and pushed on a tree. She had to excert herself on it, grunting, she pushed until it gave and toppled down.

The crash almost sent Zorua sprawling as the ground beneath him rumbled far more than it had when Celebi took her steps, but he kept running. Smirking, Celebi did the same with another tree, this one landing in front of Zorua, he almost crashed into it, and his footing was slipping, but he managed to turn and keep running in a different direction...right into Celebi's paw.

"Thought you were so clever, huh?" Celebi said, smiling deviously as she pinched the dark type between two fingers and lifted him to her face.

Zorua was dizzy, scared, and his ears were still ringing from her shout as soon Celebi's entire face took up his vision.

He winced as her fingers pinched into him a bit harder, but he tried to smile, he wouldn't give her what she wanted so easily.

"Hey green, didn't know you had a trick like this up your sleeve..." He tried to sound casual, but she simply glared at him.

"Oh, i've been working on this for a little while, first time i've used it. The results are...encouraging." Celebi boomed as she shook Zorua a bit, rattling him up as he looked even more dizzy.

"Now...you've been quite the trouble maker for some time, haven't you? But now...I wonder what I should do with you." Celebi mused as Zorua looked at her. Was this bookworm actually gonna do something to him?

"Alright, look...maybe I shouldn't have tried to prank you Celebi, full admission, it was a dumb move on my part, i'm sorry okay? Just let me go and I won't do it again." Zorua said and Celebi glared at him.

"Oh, you won't be pranking ANYONE again after i'm through with you." Celebi intoned, she had decided what she was going to do with Zorua.
12233222211.title: A giant's catch

Prepares to treat him like a small toy

Zorua runs in all his might as the ten seconds were up and he see a ball of light fly right behind him. Zorua tries to put as much distant as possible, but the ball of light prove to be far faster as it smacks Zorua in the back. Zorua got hit so hard by the ball it made him fly into a tree. Zorua was losing his vision, only was able to watch a Celebi walks towards him as he was knock out.

Hours later, Zorua was starting to wake up. However, he didn't know where he was at first.

"Ow...for a bookworm, Celi knows how to knock a pokemon down." Zorua says as he gets up. He started to notice that ground was very soft and squishy. When his vision returns, he saw the ground was very green. However, before he looks around, he hears a loud and very familiar voice.

"Better I know how to make a pokemon unconscious than the alternative." Celebi says, yet her voice was loud. Zorua, confuse and worry, looks up and was shock to what he sees.

"C-Celi?!" Zorua shouts as he Celebi was massive to him, she was a small mountain to him, he couldn't any more bigger than a pebble to her. He quickly saw that the ground he is standing on was her hand. "You're huge?"

"Oh no, I'm not the only whose size has change." Celebi says. "Look around." Zorua nevously looks around and saw what Celebi meant. They were in Celebi's room, yet to Zorua, it was gigantic. Zorua quickly guess what actually happened to him.

"You...you shrunk me?" Zorua says as he can see Celebi smiling.

"Yup, i always thought of you as a little prankster, so i decide that until you had enough, you shall be a LITTLE prankster." Celebi says as her other hand pokes at Zorua, making him feel smaller. "Oh, and if you think me shrinking you was enough, you're wrong." Zorua trembles in fear as Celebi pulls out a small book. "I have kept track of every prank you have been doing these few years, and not just on me, but on everyone. And just telling you now, for every prank you have commited, you are going to pay big time."

"What do you mean exactly?" Zorua ask.

"Oh, that very simple to explain." Celebi says as she...

Celebi was merciless with the shrinking, she doesn't know how small she made him

"Oh no you don't, you have been a very annoying little prankster, so its time to be punish." Celebi says as she she shrink Zorua more in her hand. Zorua could not escape as Celebi shrinks more and more.

After a few minutes, Zorua looks around and sees that Celebi shrunk him a lot.

She couldn't sense nor see Zorua
Someone knock Celebi's door, causing her to flinch.
122332222213.content:
Zorua watch in a instant as Celebi shrinks more and more as he he could do nothing. Celebi then closes her fist to trap Zorua as she shrinks him. She smiles to herself as she thinks she is giving a perfect punishment of Zorua's pranks. She closes her eyes and decides to give Zorua a full blast of her shrinking power. In a blink of a eye, she finishes shrinking Zorua.

"So Zorua, how do you like your new size?" Celebi says as she opens her fist, expecting to find Zorua as a pitiful speck. However, she quickly notices that Zorua is not there, in fact, she can't sense him. "....oops..."


Zorua panics once Celebi closed her fist and trap him inside while he still shrinks. All he could do was wait until Celebi was finish while preyong she doesn't go overboard. After what felt lile forever, Zorua doesn't feel his body shrinking anymore. However, it was still dark for a awful long time that he wonder what in the world Celebi is doing. Not even a second later, Zorua heard a indescribable boom as the world around him rumbles and light started to shine. He knew Celebi was opening her fist finally, but he didn't know just how small he truely was. To make matters worse, once the fist opens, Zorua could still not tell how small he was, mainly because he couldn't see Celebi's face, in fact, all he sees around him is a endless green field that is Celebi's hand.

"Oh dear, i didn't think i could make him that small." Celebi says to herself as she couldn't see Zorua anymore. "Should have listen to Gardevoir." She says as she carefully pulls out a magnifying glass to search for Zorua. "Hey Zorua, are you there?" Celebi says quietly as she searches all over her hand.

After ten minutes of searching....
122332222213.title: A little to much punishment perhaps.

choices: Perhaps, this is excessive. Celebi grows Zorua back... a little...
No way! This is what Zorua deserves! Celebi leaves him like that!
1223322222131.content:
"Hey Zorua, are you there?" Celebi's voice booms from above, even though she's being relatively quiet.

With his now extremely reduced size, even the faintest sound wouldn't escape Zorua's ears. And, right now, Celebi's voice sounded like a bomb exploding, when it is in reality a bit more of a whisper!

Startled, Zorua looks upwards. It takes several moments of doing so, but he finally manage to see Celebi's face through a ceiling made of glass.

It doesn't take long for the small prankster to deduce what the fairy is doing.

"Celebi! I'm here!" he shouts out at top of his lungs, hoping that the now monolithic pokemon holding him would hear his screams for help.

Sadly - though expectedly - she doesn't.
"Zorua?" she calls again from above, a noticeable hint of regret in her voice.

Perhaps, she did realize that she went overboard. Zorua needed a punishment, no denying that, but this wasn't what she had planned for him.

Starting to grow worried, Celebi closes one eye, and moves the other closer to the magnifying glass, while gently moving the glass closer to her paw. Though stopping it at a few inches from it, afraid that any wrong movement would brutally squish Zorua into an invisible paste on her hand.

"Celebi!" the little dark type cries in despair as he tries to get noticed by the giant fairy.

An idea springs up in Zorua's mind as he starts leaping up and down. There's no chance Celebi would even feel the movement, but there's a small change that she could see him.

And, finally, Celebi's eyes widen as she notices a nanoscopic black creature leaping up and down on her paw.
"Zorua?" she quietly calls out, although perfectly knowing that that black thing on her paw couldn't be anyone else.

"Yes!" Zorua shouts in response, though the giantess can't hear him.
"Change me back!"

Relieved that she didn't kill Zorua by accident, Celebi removes the magnifying glass from her paw and throws it aside while sighing in relief, before placing her paw over her mouth, remembering that a too loud sound might break Zorua's eardrums.

Celebi then starts to slowly rise her hand up to her eyes, two immense oceans starting to fill Zorua's eyesight. The extremely tiny fox sighs: Celebi managed to find him.

As the fairy manages to find the little prankster on her paw, she can't help but give a mischievous, though very low giggle.
"Wow, Zorua," she says.
"I honestly didn't know that I could shrink you that far! Look at you! You're probably the tiniest living being ever!" Celebi exclaims, before remembering the reason why she did this.

The fairy smirks.
"A fitting punishment. I'm almost tempted to just let you go on your own and see how you deal with... everything!" she exclaims.

Zorua's heart skips a beat.
"I'm sorry! I'm sorry for what I did!" he exclaims, hoping that Celebi would hear his apology.
"Please, change me back! I promise I'll make it up to you!"

The remark luckily didn't escape Celebi's hearing. True, Zorua is a jerk.

But does he really deserve all of this? Maybe, Celebi really went overboard after all...

Another voice speaks up inside of the fairy's mind.

Yes. Zorua DOES deserve all of this. He's paying the price of being a prankster... he simply should have thought twice about his actions...

Celebi shakes her head, trying to rid herself of the voices in her mind.

Finally, all comes to an end as she decides what to do with Zorua.
1223322222131.title: A way-too-harsh punishment... or not?

choices: Simply blows her hand gently, launching Zorua to be lost somewhere in her room
She goes to her desk where she has some stuff that she wanted to use on Zorua
Picks up a phone and invites one of her friend, but not tell her about Zorua
12233222221312.content:
Celebi couldn't help but enjoy this moment for every second its worth. A small giggle escapes her mouth as she made up her mind.

"Sorry Zorua, but this size is absolutely perfect for someone like you." Celebi says as she stands up. Zorua could feel Celebi moving, it was bad enough that just Celebi talking was enough to shake his world, but her finally moving, it was a nightmare. Zorua tries to plead for Celebi's mercy, but her movement constantly made him speechless. "After all the years of constantly having to deal with your mean pranks, this shall be your punishment." Celebi says as she finishes standing up.

If Zorua was at the edge of Celebi's hand, he would be terrified of see just how high he was. But right now, all he could focus on was Celebi talking to him as he trembles. "I may not be able to see you completely...." Celebi says as she looks at her hand, "but i can guess as to how much you are trembling right now."

"Celi, please, this is too much." Zorua shouts but with no luck as his voice doesn't even make it pass the first tiny wrinkle that is on Celebi's hand.

"Now then, Zorua...." Celebi says as she say something that made Zorua nervous, "let's have some fun." Celebi says as she...
12233222221312.title: No way! This is what Zorua deserves! Celebi lea...

choices: He's in the carpet floor of Celebi's room
He's somewhere near Celebi's backpack
He's on the window, which is slightly open
122332222213121.content:
Zorua, trembling in fear of the fairy pokemon, fears of what Celebi meant by them having fun. Celebi says nothing as she smiles of what she has in mind for the nano fox. Soon, Zorua's world rumble as Celebi moves her hand somewhere near her face.

High above, Zorua watch as many miles of Celebi's face passes until only her lips were above him. Confuse, he wonder what in the world Celebi is doing. He quickly finds out as soon her saw the lips perk a bit. Before Zorua could even grab on to anything, a powerful hurrican came crashing down on the fox and soon he was blown off the living planet herself.

In normal size, Celebi simple moves her hand near her mouth and just gently blows on it. She then looks down and doesn't see Zorua any more. She giggles before wondering how long can the little fox last before she finds him...if she bothers to finds him.

Meanwhile, Zorua flails his arms in fear as everything flies past him until he landed somewhere.

"Ow...." is all he said. He was completely fine, surprisingly he wasn't hurt, maybe slightly bruise, but still perfectly fine. That might not last long as he looks around, trying to figure out where was he now.
122332222213121.title: A gentle breeze

choices: Zorua was on one of the legs of her bed, climbing up...
Zorua was laying on the floor by her desk, exhausted and unmoving...
1223322222131211.content:
Zorua discovered himself in a thick, creamy forest.

It didn't take long for the fox to realize that it was actually the carpeted floor of Celebi's room. That was what broke his fall, he deduced... before panic took him.

He was nanoscopic into the room of a girl who couldn't see him!

The tiny fox started hyperventilating as he began running around, trying to find a way out of this forest - he couldn't see past the thick creamy strands of the carpet.

He had to do something... but what?! His only hope was Celebi, and she couldn't even see him!

Then, the voice of the fairy giantess echoed in the room.

"Do you hear me Zorua? Oh, sure you do you speck - listen. From now on, you'll have to survive this room... and me." she said.

Zorua gulped - she wanted him to what?!

Celebi giggled.
"But unlike you, I'm not heartless. I'll try to find you... but I'm not putting that much of an effort into it. You, on the other hand, will have to put a lot of effort into trying to make me notice you... understand?" she said, putting particular emphasis on the word ‘lot’.

The floor beneath Zorua started to shake as Celebi took a few steps, before she started giggling again.
"Hey, we could make some sort of game out of this! Let's see... whenever I find you, I'll give you some of your size back... the longer I take to find you, the longer I'm keeping you like that... the more it takes for me to find you, the less I'm growing you." she explained, not really waiting for a confirm.

She knew, Zorua had to play, whether he wanted or not... and she couldn't hear him anyway.

She raised her foot to take a step and move to her bed... but her foot never descended.

What if she stepped on Zorua? He had no chance of escaping her feet... even worse, if she tripped over something, Zorua would be crushed to an invisible paste on her floor.

"Hmm..." she pondered, before flapping her wings and starting to hover in midair.
"Okay Zorua, I'm giving you a little headstart - I won't walk around while in here. That said... game on~"

The fairy flew to her bed and grabbed a book.

This was going to be fun, she thought as she started reading.

--

The rest of the day went on quite uneventfully.

The nanoscopic Zorua had been trying to get Celebi's attention in all the ways he could think of, and Celebi, truthful, had tried to look for him.

But neither he did manage to make her find him or her search went on for too long before she just shrugged and laid back in bed.

Eventually, night came.

And Celebi got under the covers of her bed. The whole room went dark.

"Good night speck~ wherever you are~" she sang.

--

Zorua sighed as he laid down on the floor.

He needed to rest.

--

"Hmm... nothing. Looks like you don't want your size back, Zorua," Celebi stated as she flew to her desk and sat down, starting to write something.

Deep inside herself, she felt a slight hint of worry - she didn't want to actually harm Zorua, just teach him a lesson.

But she quickly shook off the sensation - Zorua was fine, it was less than a day she had started this.

As for the nanoscopic fox, he finally realized how he could finally get Celebi's attention. He didn't have to run back and forth to get the fairy, no, he had to reach one of the places where she usually read!

It was easy... relatively easy. Celebi mostly spent time by her desk or bed - did this girl never go out with friends? - he only had to get on top of one of those!

Obviously, easier said than done...

--

"Wow Zorua, you must like your new size a lot... it's been two days, I still don't see you!" Celebi said as she flew around, trying to locate the small fox.

That feeling of worry again.

Was Zorua alright? He didn't eat or drink for two whole days, and she was quite sure that he hadn't been sleeping...

"He's fine..." she murmured, not sounding so convinced like she hoped to.

Meanwhile, Zorua laid exhausted onto the floor, resting, not sleeping... he couldn't dare to sleep, not in these dire circumstances.

He felt life abandoning him, he hadn't been eating or drinking for a while now. And the sting of hunger was one of the worse things someone can feel, now he knew it. The lack of sleep too was starting to get to him, but he had to carry on... he couldn't lose this sick game Celebi was forcing him to play.

Celebi.

That hateful green girl... once he was big again, he never wanted to see her again.

It wouldn't be long, he hoped... his destination was now ahead of him.

--

"Hm..." Celebi muttered somewhat dejectedly as she flew on top of her bed.

Now, feelings of guilt were getting quite persistent. It was three days ago since she dropped the nanoscopic Zorua into her room, and she still didn't manage to find him.

Now she could only hope that he was okay.

She went to grab a book... but found that she read them all; she already read the others. To facilitate things for the fox, she had spent most of her time confined in her room, reading... and now, she had no more new books to read.

She smiled.

That only gave her the perfect excuse to get out a bit.

Zorua wouldn't certainly die if she left for a short bit... right?

--

The dark type finally stopped to pant. After two days of non-stop running, he finally reached his destination.

Now, the only obstacle was climbing...

He sourly realized that he was a quadruped pokemon.

Zorua sighed in desperation... was he going to die like this, in the room of a giant green fairy, alone?

... Well, he wasn't going to die without at least trying to win this.

He had to get Celebi's attention in the next days... or he was going to starve to death, he just knew it.

--

This one search had lasted for longer, Celebi thought as she kept looking around.

She was starting to worry for Zorua more and more each day that passed.

Was he still alive? Did he starve to death? Die of dehydration?

It made Celebi sigh - the worst part was that she couldn't know if he was still alive.

"Please... don't be okay, but don't be dead or seriously injured either..." she muttered, not wanting him to hear her doubts.

--

His fangs sank into the hard wood. He was breathing heavily, and it was quite hard to do so with his mouth full of wood and his nose as an only way of respiration.

Zorua felt like he was never going to make it to the top. All his energies were abounding him.

‘Almost there... almost there...’ he thought as he kept climbing, hoping that he wouldn't fall... if he did, it was over.

--

Now she was officially worried.

Celebi placed her book on top of her bed and looked around.

Five days. It was five days ago she left Zorua to fend for himself in her room.

Maybe she definitely took things too far, she thought as she got up from her bed.

"Zorua? I'm going to find you today... this is starting to get ridiculous..." she said, not wanting to admit that she was worried for him... if he was still alive to hear her.

He surely learned his lesson, she decided as she started looking around, hovering instead of walking as usual.

She looked around for a while, having a hard time with finding the nanoscopic fox.

Celebi huffed loudly - this game had to end.

The fairy focused and tried to sense the small fox in an attempt to locate him in her room.

She quickly detected a faint presence within the confines of her room and deduced it was Zorua... hopefully not some bug.

The fairy turned around, finally noticing the spot where Zorua should have been.

She hovered forward, only to see...
1223322222131211.title: A game coming from hell

choices: Zorua had a look of fear
Zorua had a look of pure hatred
Zorua had passed out from exhaustion
12233222221312111.content:
She barely saw it, near the bottom of one of the legs of her bed, an almost imperceptible black dot. She squinted but couldn’t see much more...what she didn’t know was that he was climbing, as much as he could before he saw the green goddess close in, her eye as large as the sun to him. He wanted to quiver but if he did he’d surely fall...not a very pleasant prospect. He could barely see the ground now with how high up he was.

Then a whisper, gentle to her, a roar to him echoed.

“I found you. The game is over.”

With that he was gripped by a psychic force as he shot up at ludicrous speeds before landing on a green landscape. Her paw.

The sun that was her eye returned as an odd sensation overtook him. The world around him was shrinking as he grew larger and larger, a titan to the size he was just at.

He stopped growing at half an inch. Celebi could make him out now, as tiny as he still was and she swallowed a lump on her throat. He looked absolutely miserable. He’d clearly lost weight, she could see that from how thin he was, and his fur was absolutely frayed and haggard. She couldn’t see anything in his eyes beyond exhaustion, she was sure she’d see hate but...he just looked tired. Carefully, as if he was precious glass she set him on her bed and gulped. She had definitely pushed him further than necessary, but...

“For now, this is as big as you get, you took too long to win the game and I had to seriously try to find you. However...I’m going to go get you some food or water now.” She said, hoping that worry didn’t creep too much into her voice. He looked at her with those exhausted eyes as she left the room to grab him something.

She had left the room and was panting a bit and had to calm herself down. He really had almost died from exhaustion, hadn’t he? He still could if she didn’t hurry. She went to her kitchen and frantically grabbed a bit of sausage and cheese. Small amounts but it should fill him up. She re-entered the room and he was laying on his side when she approached him, still a monolithic giantess to him. She set the bit of meat and cheese next to him and like a feral animal he tore into them. He made no attempt at dignity as he swallowed, chewed and gulped loudly. She could hear him she noted, barely. When it seemed he had finished she help up a glass of water and levitated him over it. He drank for quite a while before he finished and she gently lowered him to the bed. She looked away for a few seconds, closed her eyes and took a deep breath.

“So Zorua...” She turned to look at him to see...
12233222221312111.title: Found

choices: "... Take a nice, long rest. You deserve it."
"... Let's play again... something less tough, okay?"
122332222213121111.content:
Celebi's words died down and fell right back down her throat as she took a look at Zorua - he was looking up at her with sheer fear in his eyes, he was trembling.

Celebi pieced it together and realized that she was the cause of his fear.

"Zorua..." Celebi mumbled, part of the hard feelings she held against him evaporating like snow under the hot sun rays. But, just like a days-long blizzard, some of those feelings simply didn't melt and Celebi remembered why she was doing this.

‘But... I shouldn't actually hurt him...’ she thought as she watched the tiny fox looking up at her, shaking like a leaf in a windy day.

"... Okay Zorua, that was admittedly excessive. I didn't actually mean to take things this far... still, I hope you learned a lesson from this..." she said solemnly.

In response, Zorua turned around and ran away from her. He reached the left side of the bed and dug his way underneath Celebi's pillow.

All he wanted to do was get away from the green giantess, no matter he if was still shrunken. Sure, the pillow didn't offer much protection, but at least he wasn't seeing her.

Zorua didn't know how to feel.

He wanted to cry, to throw all his frustration right in the face of that green girl... but all he could do was shake in fear.

Celebi looked at the shaking lump beneath her pillow with pity. Surely enough, Zorua would have panic attacks in the near future...

She felt conflicted - did he deserve all this over a few stupid pranks?

She psychically levitated her black log book into her paws and started flipping through the pages.

‘Pichu, stolen ice cream.’ she flipped another page.
‘Azurill, destroyed doll.’ she flipped the page again.
‘Swinub, psychologically traumatized.’ she came to the last written page.

‘Celebi, covered in honey, berries and feathers.’ under this last one was another sentence,
‘Punishment: shrinkage.’

Celebi sighed and closed the log book.

Those all seemed childish pranks... except for Swinub, that was truly horrible.

Celebi gently put the black book on a nightstand and reached under the pillow, gripping Zorua and pulling him out, holding him mid way between herself and the pillow.

Terrified, the fox started flailing in an useless attempt to free himself from her grip.

"Stop it." Celebi said, annoyed. Zorua didn't listen, but kept flailing helplessly.

"STOP IT!" Celebi cried, shaking her paws back and forth, causing Zorua to feel dizzy.

His head kept spinning for several minutes after she stopped shaking her paw.

When he finally managed to fight off the nausea, he saw Celebi clenching her free paw and inhaling sharply. Then, she looked back at him with a soft look.

"... I'm sorry for this situation... I definitely took it too far, but it's undeniable that you deserved it... a bit... I mean, I'm not going to let you starve to death or die of dehydration just because of a few childish pranks... although you still have a long way ahead before I give you back your size, understood?" she said.

Zorua didn't respond.

Celebi sighed.
"And... I'm not going to do stuff that lethal with you again, okay?" she said.

Zorua still didn't answer.

She wasn't going to do lethal stuff with him, huh? Still... she wanted to keep him like a pet, torturing him day after day until he either regained his full size and left or his mind shattered like a glass sculpture hit by a heavy hammer.

The fox's limbs went limp as he laid motionless on top of Celebi's paw. The fairy bit her lip - she was trying to be honest. She didn't want to hurt him, but she also couldn't let him go until he learned his lesson... although she didn't want to let him know that she actually wasn't going to harm him.

His terror was a big part of this game... because to Celebi, this was all a big game. She only had to make sure Zorua stayed alive and that his brain didn't suffer permanent damage... then, she was letting him earn his food, water and size.

The fairy spoke again,
"... For now, Zorua..."
122332222213121111.title: Terror

choices: "Okay Zorua, we're going to do a physical game."
"Okay Zorua, let's see how smart you are in a battle of wits."
"Zorua...why don't we do a game of getting to know each other?"
1223322222131211111.content:
"Go ahead and take a long rest...you deserve it." She said gently as she put his limp body on a pillow on her bed before she grabbed a small hankie and draped it over his lower body, leaving his head still exposed. Zorua didn't fight, but the fear in his eyes was still evident, even if Celebi was smiling at him.

"Enjoy it Zorua...when you wake up, we'll continue with an...easier, less stressful game." She said. Zorua internally screamed, but Celebi tried to mean it as both a reassurance and a statement that he wasn't done.

Zorua though, eventually let the softness he was on and the warmth over his body take him. He was comfortable...full of food and water finally...and tired. So, so tired. He fell into a dreamless sleep as Celebi carefully got into the bed and opened a new book. She'd make sure Zorua learned his lesson. Messing with pokemon like that...it was wrong, and he needed a taste of his own medicine. He had gotten that taste she supposed, but she was going to drill it into him. No more pranks.

Plus, this might be better in the end for him right? A bit of humble pie and a few manners would serve him well in life, she was doing him a favor...well...the last 5 days weren't doing him any favors, but from now on she'd have focused games and lessons...enough to teach him respect and fear, but nothing to hurt or kill him. Discomfort and humiliation at the most, she mentally gave herself that rule.

She looked over to see that he was sleeping hard. She smiled a bit, he looked cute like that...but he didn't look very peaceful. Hard to blame him she supposed.

"Enjoy the rest Zorua, you did legitimately earn it...and who knows, maybe you'll have fun too when you wake up. Though I doubt it~" She whispered to herself as she continued reading.

-

Zorua's eyes slowly opened as he groaned. He didn't know how long he slept, but he did feel much better now. He groggily got up, his body felt stiff...a bit sore too, but his belly was full, which meant...

"I gotta go..." He groaned, looking around to see that it was dark. Everything was still huge though, so he was definitely tiny...she didn't grow him back at all...she said he had more games to go.

"...Damn psycho...overkill to the max for some dumb pranks...yeesh. When I get out of this..."

"You'll what, exactly?" The feminine voice, loud and booming echoed around him as he turned around to see the giant face of Celebi grinning at him.

"C-C-Cele-"

"You're still scared, huh?...You said you gotta go, did you mean..." He turned away, turning red as she sighed. "Here, get on." She lowered her paw. He was small enough that he had to clamber onto it, struggling to climb on as she carried him to her bathroom sink.

-

Zorua was avoiding the gaze of the smiling Celebi towering above him, as she pondered what to do now...it was time for a game she supposed. But what? Something physical? He did look sore...maybe mental? She wasn't sure how smart Zorua was honestly...she wouldn't figure very but he could surprise her she supposed with how outlandish some of his pranks had been in the past.

Maybe she should simply get to know him and let him get to know her? She wasn't sure how to frame that as a game with incentives but she could figure that out, and it might speed up the whole getting him to learn his lesson thing, which was the point.
1223322222131211111.title: Rest and the next challenge

choices: Celebi catches Zorua
Zorua reaches the top and evades Celebi
Zorua falls to the ground, and does his best to evade Celebi from there
12233222221312111111.content:
Celebi noted that Zorua seemed sore, and tired...and exercise would probably drill a lesson into him more. She smiled. 'Won't hurt him, but he'll certainly remember this.'

Celebi picked Zorua up to her face and he winced, trying to back up, but he only reached the edge of her paws.

"J-just leave m-me alone..." He said, damn near whimpered it. All Celebi did was smile.

"Oh, we aren't done yet though Zorua, don't worry, you'll live, but you still have a ways to go before you and I are through, we're gonna play a game~" Celebi said as she carried him to her living room. Psychically she moved the furniture to block any hallways, and shut any doors, essentially making her living room an inescapable pen for Zorua. She set him on the ground, and with a boom sat down in front of him, whimpering Zorua looked up and up at the green giantess. At a half inch she was an imposing sight...he wasn't a speck anymore at least.

"Now then...the rules. This game will take one hour, as you can see you're trapped in this room with me...all you need to do is find the one, the ONE single route i've left to you to leave this room. It's not an easy route to find, and even harder for you to traverse at your pathetic size, but all the same it is possible. If you win...you gain an inch." She said and Zorua just stared at her incredulously.

"After a half hour if you haven't escaped i'll attempt to...lazily stop you, you'll need to dodge me. If I catch you...i'll make you a QUARTER of an inch." She smiled and he gulped.

She was going to make him even smaller!?

"If you last an hour without escaping or me catching you...you'll stay the same I guess." She said as she got up and with booming steps, went over to a couch she blocked a hallway with, with a yawn staring down at him, she got on it and laid back, resting her head on her paw, she gave him a smug smile.

"Tick tock tick tock~" She said, his sign that the game had started. He bolted, taking a perimeter. He didn't give a crap about her game beyond finding the exit and getting away from this absolute psycho.

He looked all around. She had blocked the bottoms of anywhere for him to get, he grunted, running in what he felt to be circles for 20 minutes...he took note of the room again. A TV, doors he couldn't get through, a cabinet...with a cord dangling down and...

"You...you...!" He said, giving Celebi an angry look as she grinned. He ran for the cord and started climbing it. As a quadruped it was tough, but he KNEW the way out of here was at the top of this cabinet...but he was still sore, so sore.

"And a half hour is up~" Celebi said, quaking as she, with great theatrics, stretched up her paws, yawned, and slowly, ever so slowly got up from the couch and walked forward towards the cabinet...so slowly.

Zorua attempted to speed things up, he was near the top...he knew he was...! Her lazy, slow steps boomed all around him though, and the quakes were getting closer. All this effort on his part and she didn't need to exert any energy at all...it wasn't fair!
12233222221312111111.title: A physical challenge

choices: ... a small grumble. Zorua was finally waking up!
... her mom knocking at the door. She had to hide Zorua!
12233222221312112.content:
The sight made the air leave Celebi's lungs in the form of a terrified gasp; both the fairy's paws rushed to her mouth, her wings seemed to lose energy as she landed on the carpeted floor, her eyes unable to leave the pitiful sight.

There, lost in the soft jungle of the carpet, by the legs of her desk, was Zorua.

The five days of being shrunken had affected him in a horrible way, Celebi noted: he was definitely thinner. Of course, the brain of the legendary registered this as a secondary thought, because Zorua had collapsed on his side and wasn't moving.

Celebi's heart jumped in her chest like a spring.

Was he dea-

The dark-type began levitating in mid-air; after a short flight, he reached the green face of his tormentor; Celebi noted with horror that his eyes were closed, like his mouth, while his limbs laid limp in her psychic grasp.

"Zo-Zorua..?"

No reply.

"Zorua!"

Celebi's scream had the effect of making the fox fidget: after several moments, his eyes opened into two minuscule slits, which he pointed on the indistinct mass of green in front of him.

Just before everything went dark again. Luckily, Celebi had noticed the momentary flash of blue across Zorua's dark face and breathed in relief.

Zorua was alive.

But panic soon took the fairy again: Zorua was alive, but he was still in need to eat and drink. As for sleep, he was probably going to sleep forever if she didn't hurry.

But first...

A blue gleam surrounded Zorua as he grew up to the size of a small ball. There was going to be plenty of time later to decide on what to do with him, Celebi thought as the now bigger Zorua floated on top of her bed, while she hurried out of her room.

Five minutes later, Celebi made her way back with a small slice of cheese and a few pieces taken from a slice of meat. A shrunken cup of water flew behind her.

She knew that after starving for so long, eating too much was going to kill Zorua.

Carefully, the fairy set everything in front of the shrunken fox.

"Zorua..." she said gently, using a finger to poke him.

No reply from the fox, not even the slightest hint of a movement or a growl.

"Zorua, you need to wake up... please..." she intoned, her heart pounding her chest.

She still got no answer.

But, after a moment or two, Zorua began to move. His legs rose shakily, his eyes opened slowly as he looked around, his gaze immediately falling on the food.

Without paying any mind to the giant fairy that was watching him, the fox made his way to the food like an ant; but it was like a Pyroar that he dug into the cheese and meat, like a Gyarados he gulped down the entire glass of water.

Only once all the food was gone, he looked up at Celebi, who met his gaze.

The two stared at each other for an eternity; it seemed like Zorua wanted to say something, she judged by the way his lips moved without producing any actual sound.

And then, Zorua collapsed again, his eyes closing as he passed out from exhaustion.

Celebi sighed in relief - at least, he wasn't in danger anymore... she hoped.

Quietly, the fairy sat down beside the fox and grabbed a hold of him. It has been five days ago since she had felt his fur on her paws.

Celebi regarded her unfortunate prisoner with pity.

What was she thinking? This was supposed to be a punishment! Zorua was a jerk, everyone hated him for his pranks! Why should she have pitied him when he fully deserved all of this?

It was with those harsh thoughts that Celebi was desperately trying to remember why she had done this whole thing.

But her mind's resistance fell like a house of cards.

‘What have I done, Zorua?’

--

Zorua didn't wake up that night.

Or the nights that followed.

For another eight, horrible days, Celebi watched over Zorua, though there was no need to: the shrunken fox did absolutely nothing but sleep throughout days and nights. The only thing that made Celebi hope was the fact that he was actually breathing.

The fairy uselessly tried to feed him in his sleep: he was going to be very hungry when he woke up.

If he woke up.

Each day that passed without Zorua giving any signs of wanting to wake up, Celebi felt more and more guilty.

She tried to keep herself from feeling pitiful for the fox, but it was useless. She still didn't know what she was going to do with him whenever - if - he woke up, but one thing was certain: things were even between them right now.

The only dilemma was if she was going to let him go or if she was going to try and heal whatever Zorua had.

Whenever she mused about that, her heart usually began beating painfully faster at the second thought, like it was trying to force its owner to actually take care of Zorua.

For the first two nights, the fox had to sleep wrapped up in some cotton in her drawer.

But the third night, Celebi decided to let him rest in her bed - with her. She thought that maybe a bit of closeness might have helped as well as making Zorua realize that she was genuinely sorry, despite the fact that she was still trying to deny it.

Anything was possible at this point.

And so, the days passed quickly, leaving behind books, meek attempts to make Zorua eat in his sleep and the concerned musings of her mother, who noted that something was wrong.

She must have looked horrible, she judged: she hadn't been going out since Zorua first woke up, save for begrudgingly leaving him hidden somewhere in the mornings, when she had to go to school, and she had begun stay awake at nights to check if the fox woke up. She knew he was going to hate her for sure whenever he did, but she didn't care; actually, she didn't care about anything at all, she discovered.

The ninth night after Zorua's first, brief awakening, Celebi was laying in bed, the sleeping fox beside her.

She had just eaten dinner, and was now reading a book, occasionally shooting glances at the sleeping pokemon beside her.

But then, a sound distracted her from her book.

All her attention immediately shifted on the sound, which she immediately registered as...
12233222221312112.title: A long sleep and a heavy guilt

choices: "J-just stay away...please."
"W-what are you going to do with me now?"
"W-who are you? Why am I so small?"
122332222213121121.content:
Zorua grumbled as he woke up, and started coughing too, a thick, hoarse cough that immediately caught Celebi's attention. She turned from her book with great speed, snapping her book shut as she loomed over the little black ball of fur.

"Let me go get something to eat and drink for you! I'll be back!" Celebi said, noting that she was moving very quick, not even noting if Zorua was fully coherent.

She flew into the kitchen to see that she was alone, her mom wasn't around and she quickly got in the fridge and got some meat, a slice of cheese, and a tiny bit of cake too. She got a glass of water, keeping it normal sized for now in case he needed multiple drinks, and shut the fridge door.

She went back into the room to see Zorua hadn't moved much, he didn't seem to have the strength to really...he had lost even more weight in his small coma and what spirit he had before this whole ordeal didn't seem to be there in his eyes. His eyes looked hazy...no hint of mischief in them at all. His attention snapped to Celebi, a great behemoth to him as she approached him and gently set the meat and cheese down. "Please eat..." She said, and his stomach grumbled as he looked at it and he lunged for it with a ferocity Celebi didn't expect.

He tore into it, making no attempt at dignity as he did, gulping down all he could. Celebi frowned at him, not mad at him, but at herself for letting this go this far.

When he was done she set the tiny bit of cake down too.

"Dessert..." She said, trying to say it gently and he swallowed the cake down too in a matter of moments. She wasn't even sure if he tasted it. She lifted him with psychic to the glass of water and he drank thirstily from it, glad to be getting anything into his stomach right now.

Soon enough he stopped and sighed, a good sign that he was done, and he was lowered to the bed, Celebi got on it too and got as close as possible to him, though he seemed to squirm and move back himself.

"Zorua..." She said, and that's when he opened his mouth to speak for the first time since he woke up.
122332222213121121.title: Awake at last

choices: "I did this to you Zorua, it's a long story..."
"I just...found you like this, a few days ago."
1223322222131211213.content:
The words caught Celebi completely off guard as her eyes widened.

"What...?" She answered his question with a question. Zorua looked around, he was sure that he was tiny...this was a normal looking room aside from it being giant. And the girl in front of him...she was monstrously huge!

He looked around until his eyes fell on Celebi's and she saw the look in his eyes...the glint she'd see in there, the snickering smile...none of it was on him, no look of hate, or anything. It seemed to be a dull sadness and a hint of confusion...that's all she saw in him right now.

"What happened to me? I don't remember...anything like this happening to me." Zorua frowned. The last thing that had happened was...he had run out on his dad about two days ago...that bastard. Zorua frowned. He was hungry, cold, and he saw some town lights in the distance, right? He found a surge of energy to run towards them and then...

nothing.

Celebi for her part wasn't sure what was going on. Was Zorua trying to pull a prank on her? No way would he do something like that after all of this right...and how would he have come up with it. And that look in his eyes, could he fake it?

She doubted it severely.

"Zorua..." She said.

"And how do you know my name?...Well I suppose most Zorua's are named that." He mused, but shook his head.

"Look um...miss...I don't know what's going on, just please tell me." He said.

She looked to be a few years older than him, right? This whole thing was throwing him for a loop.

Celebi needed to fix this, she was scratching her head and was about to tell him what was going on before something dawned on her.

Whatever happened to Zorua, he was acting very different from the one she knew, was this how he was at one point? Maybe if she played this right, the prankster Zorua...maybe she could work it out that Zorua was no longer that way.

But if she lied to him...wouldn't that be wrong? Plus, it was her fault he went through...whatever this was. A regression? Celebi sighed and made her decision.
1223322222131211213.title: Forgotten history

choices: Anger. Zorua remembered everything!
Confusion. What was going on?
12233222221312112131.content:
Ultimately, Celebi decided that the best thing to do was to tell the truth. Even if he was selfish, rude, picking up on weaker pokemon, she wanted the old Zorua.

Leaving the fox like that would mean him finding himself in a village where everyone hated him, and he couldn't know why.

"Listen up, Zorua," Celebi started as she sat down beside the forgetful fox.

"... How much time have you been here?" she asked.

The tiny pokemon swallowed, uncomfortable with talking to a giantess.

"It... It's been just a day. I had a fight with my father, miss, and I-" Zorua trailed off.

Celebi felt pitiful - was that why he was always alone?

"And... did you come straight here?" she asked. She had to see where Zorua's memories stopped.

Zorua rubbed his head with a paw.

"Not exactly miss... I ran without really caring where I was going... I just found this town and then... I don't remember anything..." he said.
"Miss-"

"Celebi. My name is Celebi. Celi." she said, fidgeting nervously.
"And Zorua, this is going to shock you." she added.

Zorua blinked, confused.

Celebi gently picked him up and held him close.

Right now, that wasn't the rude, spoiled Zorua she knew. It was a totally different, helpless pokemon.

"Listen... whatever happened with your dad... your running away... it all happened about five years ago."

Much to her predictions, Zorua's facial expression became one of confusion.

"... Five years?" he parroted back.

Celebi nodded.

"Yeah... you've known me for a few years now... and everyone knows, and hates, you." she said bluntly.

"... They hate me?" Zorua couldn't wrap his mind around the concept.
"Why? I didn't do anything!"

"You didn't do anything that you can remember right now," Celebi retorted, frowning as the images of Zorua's past actions flashed across her mind,
"But you actually caused a lot of trouble since you showed up... so many troubles, that you're in fact shrunken down right now."

Zorua tilted his head.

"M-Me? Causing trouble? And what does it have to do with my condition?" he asked, growing more and more confused.

He tried to think really hard to himself, but his memory went back to a particular violent slap he received from his dad two days ago.

Celebi gently put the tiny pokemon down on her bed.

"Zorua..." this was the moment of truth,
"I shrunk you."

The dark-type took a few moments to process what Celebi had just said, before he took a few steps back.

"Y-You miss...?"

"Ce-le-bi," the fairy corrected,
"And yes, it was me. Y'see, you are... were a prankster. I shrunk you to punish you for some particularly mean pranks, but things went too far. Shortly, you starved and ended up in a coma. You've been sleeping for nine days, Zorua, and you woke up shortly ago."

Again, the fox looked at her like she was crazy.

He opened and closed his mouth, but nothing came out of it.

Celebi hung her head, the words that she didn't want to tell coming out of her mouth on their own,

"I'm sorry..." she said,
"I-I tried to wake you up, to feed you, but you simply wouldn't wake up or eat... It's so good to see you alive..."

Zorua took another step back.

"N-No, no, no!" he exclaimed.
"Mi- Celebi, that's impossible! I-I mean, I really came here one day ago, I didn't do anything wrong!" he justified.
"I-If you shrunk me, please grow me back!"

Celebi looked at the fox pitifully. He seemed to not remember anything at all about his career as a prankster, not his punishment.

The fairy didn't reply, but placed a hand on her forehead, deep in thought.

What could she have done...?

...

An idea sprang into her mind.

She opened her eyes, a small smile spread across her cheeks as she looked at Zorua.

"Of course." she said, and Zorua found himself enveloped in a blue light.

His surroundings shrunk as he grew back to his original size.

"... Thanks." he said, backing up a bit and jumping from the bed to the floor.
"Now, if you'll excuse, I'll get out and-"

Sadly, Zorua's plan to get away from this new, lunatic pokemon was spoiled.

"We are getting out, Zorua," Celebi said,

"There's someone I want you to meet..."

--

"One moment..."

Celebi pulled back beside Zorua.

"... Celebi, it's the middle of the night." he noted.

"I know. But we need to solve your problem, and-"

The door opened, revealing a drowsy Chansey rubbing one eye.

"Celebi and... Zorua?" Chansey smirked, remembering all the times Zorua had come to her, showing an irresistible pair of puppy dog eyes to make her heal whatever wound he had.

Chansey are naturally kind, so she generally lend a hand.

"What did this scoundrel do this time? Did you end up in your own trap again?"

The dark-type shot a look of confusion, but Celebi spoke up,

"I found him in the forest, doctor, he was fainted. I think he hit his head or something, because he doesn't remember anything but things happened years ago."

Chansey yawned.

"Hm... amnesia." she commented.

Celebi nodded, while the uncomfortable Zorua fidgeted.

So, it was true that someone knew him...

"What... what can we do about it?"

Chansey smiled.

"Well... if he hits his head again, with a hit similar to the first, he should regain his memories," she said.

Celebi swallowed, not really wanting to slam Zorua around until he regained his memory.

"Is there... is there anything else we can do?" she asked.

The doctor seemed deep in thought.

"Well..." she spoke,
"If we manage to stimulate his mind with things he may be able to recognize, his brain should be able to retrieve the lost memories."

The words sank into Celebi, who nodded.

Before...

"I know what to do!" she exclaimed, causing Zorua to wince beside her.
"Thanks doctor Chansey!"

The pink pokemon smiled.

"Always glad to help... and if whatever you have in mind doesn't work, bring him to me again tomorrow. We'll see what we can do. As for now, good night to both of you."

The door closed, and Zorua shot Celebi another confused look.

"Miss-"

Again, the world grew bigger as he suddenly shrunk down and floated into Celebi's arms.

"Come on Zorua, now I need to show you something, okay?" she said.

Before the tiny fox had any time to reply, Celebi disappeared into the night, swallowed by the flow of time.

--

The rope was pulled back as Zorua bolted behind a tree and snickered.

Nearby, a bush glowed as Celebi appeared behind it.

"Look, Zorua." she instructed gently, peering from the bush while gently putting the head of the shrunken fox out of the bush.

What he saw shocked him.

Himself, letting go of the rope, causing a bucket full of feathers to fall on the same pokemon that was holding him.

"See, Zorua?" Celebi asked.

No reply.

"Zorua?... Zorua?" Celebi called out again, getting the same silence as a response.

It was then, right while the past Celebi shot her shrinking ball to past Zorua, that the fairy from the future checked the tiny fox.

Only then she noticed the expression on his face.
12233222221312112131.title: The road to lost memories

choices: That day, during their game....
A few days later and Zorua still doesn’t remember...
A few days later, Zorua is remembering...
122332222213121121312.content:
Zorua frowned at the sight before him, he was watching...himself, giant and a little older looking, doing what the pokemon holding him had claimed.

Maybe it all was true...but he still didn’t remember any of it.

“Miss-“

“Ce-le-bi.”

“...Celebi. What is all of this?” He asked and she sighed, turning Zorua around to face her.

“The prank you pulled on me a few weeks ago...then I shrunk you and...truth is, I can time travel, I suppose you forgot that too.” Celebi smiled wryly as Zorua appeared deep in thought.

“So it’s been 5 years since I ran away...” Zorua murmured and Celebi frowned. A glow enveloped them as they returned to the present, Celebi gently holding Zorua.

“The you I know would never talk to anyone about this but...what happened to you?”

This was the body of the Zorua she knew, but the amnesia...she was talking to essentially a 10 year old that hadn’t pulled a stunt on anyone.

“...I told you, I ran out on my dad. I’d gotten tired of the way he treated me, so even if it led me nowhere, I had to get away.” Zorua said it in a raw voice Celebi had never heard.

She was about to say something when he continued.

“He beat me, berated me, starved me bec-because I was no use to him-always wanting me to evolve when I can’t! I-I just wanted-“ Zorua was crying at this point and Celebi’s eyes widened. She held him to her chest as she started walking home.

“Don’t worry...we’ll figure something out, okay Zorua.” She didn’t know how to get Zorua to remember, but it’s possible that something happened to him in this state that turned him into the jerk she knew.

If she could figure THAT out...maybe she could make up what she’d done to him, and make him a better pokemon in one fell swoop!

She made glances at the tiny fox nestled to her chest, he seemed to be getting drowsy, she was worried he’d sleep for another week if he passed out now.

“Hey Zorua, when we get back why don’t we put a hold on the amnesia thing? Let’s have some sweets and play a game or something.” She said gently

He looked up to her smiling, giant face and tried to wipe his eyes with a paw, finding it hard with being pinned. Celebi wiped his eyes very gently with her free paw as she approached her home.

“Sure Celebi...that sounds fun...” Zorua said as they entered the house.
122332222213121121312.title: Still not remembering

choices: "You! You put me through hell!" Anger
"Ahahahaha! That's right, i'm the best prankster around!" happiness
"Oh Arceus...what have I done over the years!?" Remorse
1223322222131211213123.content:
As the days passed Celebi did what she could to care for the tiny, regressed Zorua as well as she could. She found that she actually liked his company...at least the Zorua that he was right now. She knew it was wrong what she did to him, and she was intent on making him remember, but part of her hoped that when...if...he did, that he'd consider the days where he didn't remember and look over his actions, maybe not go back to his prankster self.

Celebi still had to go to school, and when she did she made sure to put Zorua in a drawer with soft sheets and a couple of snacks and a little tiny cup of water that was still big enough to last all day.

She shrunk some books for him too and was shocked to find that he tried to read them...though from what she gathered he struggled with it a bit...he wasn't entirely literate as it turned out, partially from his upbringing, but he made do.

It was after about 4 or 5 days of this that Celebi considered something that might make Zorua remember, she looked at the tiny fox on her bed idly munching on a small bit of cookie and he looked up.

"What's up Celi?" He asked and she looked at him with a smile. "I think I know how to get your memories back." She said and Zorua tilted his head.

"Does that really still matter?" He asked and she looked surprised.

"What? Of course it does! Zorua, don't you want to remember?" She asked and he seemed to shrug. "If the truth is that I was a jerk then I don't want to remember all that..."

Celebi understood where he was coming from, this Zorua was the farthest thing from what she knew him as.

As if he read her mind he followed up his statement.

"I'm probably better this way as it is, i'm not making pokemon hate me or tormenting them..."He said and Celebi leaned in close.

She gently smiled at him as her breath wafted over him, with her close proximity.

"Just because you were a jerk doesn't mean you need to be one when you remember..." She said, and with that she kissed his cheek, taking up his whole side. He blushed like mad as she giggled and pulled back, he seemed dumbstruck by what had just occured.

"Besides, i'm sure at some point you'll want to be big and on your own again, right?" She asked and he seemed to register what she said, as much as he was still taken aback.

"I don't really care about that, truth be told...even if i'm small right now, these past few days have been the best days I can remember." He said and Celebi frowned.

"If this is the highlight of what you can remember I can only imagine how rough things were for you before coming to this village...all the same, we need to make this right." Celebi got up and went over to her shelf to grab a book...a journal.

"I've logged every prank you've done that I know of in this book...if I read them I might jog your memory." She said and Zorua, though he seemed to not like the idea, nodded.

Celebi took a breath as she opened it.

"Okay...so you dropped Swinub in a pit for 11 hours...and them dropped Munchlax on top of him." She started and Zorua's eyes widened.

"I did WHAT!?" He said horrified and Celebi nodded.

"And Swinub is only a little kid too..." She said and Zorua shook his head in guilt.

Celebi bit her lip but continued.

"Um...you dropped Buneary into a sticky syrup trap and made her sing a degrading song until Braixen chased you off." She said and Zorua looked down.

"I don't like this Celebi..." He said and she ignored it, continuing.

If she could just find something to get him to remember...

"Ah...you uh...used illusions to make a bag of rocks seem like rock candy and traded it with Togepi for his bag of chips...he broke one of his teeth on it..."

Zorua furrowed his brow on this and Celebi watched him.

He started murmuring something. "I think...I remember that...yeah..."

His eyes shot open.

"I do remember! That's right!" He turned his gaze fully to Celebi and said...
1223322222131211213123.title: Zorua remembers

choices: "... Will you know what? I'm in."
"Ehm, I think I'll pass. Lemme go, please."
12233222221312112131232.content:
"Hahaha! Yeah, I remember! I remember who I am!" Zorua howled with laughter as his mind started to fill itself with memories of crying kids, seething teens and furious grown ups chasing him down in the woods, only to end up in the traps he had set.

Another memory found him too: being smaller than he already was, struggling to survive before...

But he shook his head. He was too happy about having regained his memories that he found it hard to be mad at Celebi right now.

Said fairy smiled at the sight.

"And the scoundrel was back. That aside..." she muttered as she put her book down and turned to face the dark-type.

"Zorua!"

The tiny fox found a green rocket flying towards him at supersonic speed; before he could move out of the way, he was tackled down by Celebi.

When the world around him finally stopped spinning, Zorua looked up to see that he was trapped by both the arms of the fairy.

She was hugging him, smiling massively.

"I never thought I'd say this one day, but... I'm glad you pulled those pranks after all..." she commented, again kissing the fox on his cheek to express her own happiness, causing him to blush again.

She felt a knot untying itself from her heart as the guilt was washed away by the relief and the happiness.

Though some of the guilt remained.

"I... I'm sorry Zorua... for sending you in a coma and for causing you the amnesia..." she apologized.

Zorua's expression fell asleep he lowered his head, before he sprang up with a grin.

"Celi," he started,
"You put me through hell. And when I say hell, I mean it." his grin faltered at the mention.

Celebi shot a sorrowful stare while Zorua inhaled deeply to rid his mind of horrible memories.

The grin appeared again.
"It was horrible, alright, but ya did your best to make up for it. I can't explain this but I... I heard you while I was in coma... I heard your voice when you told me to wake up, I simply couldn't. Then you took care of me during my amnesia, then you solved it."

Celebi was starting to blush again as the fox praised her.

She readjusted a bit and hugged him more tightly. He nestled himself in her chest,

"And, after all, the good you did outweighs the bad."

"Zorua..."

"You're one pokemon I'm not going to prank anymore."

That sentence alone had the power to shatter the atmosphere like a heavy hammer thrown in a mirror.

Celebi was dumbstruck.

"Y-You... you still want to prank?" she asked breathlessly.

Zorua grinned.

"Well, of course! I mean, that's fun!" he noted the glare on Celebi's face,
"... Let me finish. As a token, I'll try to make pranks less... traumatizing." he recalled when Swinub was pulled out of the pit.

Celebi's glare softened, and an expression of childish curiosity took place.

"... That's fine, I guess. Just don't pick up on weaker pokemon again..." she said.

Zorua grinned, but didn't reply.

"Now, if you would be so kind to grow me back, I'll be on my way to my forest." he mused.

Again, Celebi felt a knot around her heart.

He was right, he had learned his lesson (and a couple others too), it was time for him to leave.

Celebi bit her lip, contemplating the pokemon that slept in her bed for countless hours, the pokemon she tried to feed in his coma, the pokemon she kissed...

After that all, did she really have the heart to send him back to a cold, dark forest and let him start pranking again?

"Celi?"

The fairy didn't register the call.

She thought, if she took Zorua under her wing, maybe he would have stopped pranking for good.

Given what she now knew about his backstory, Zorua only pranked because of a dark past. But if she pulled him out of such memories...

"Zorua."

"Hey, are you alright? You seemed off..." Zorua chimed.

Celebi nodded as she sat up, holding the fox close.

"Yeah, I was thinking. Zorua, why don't you... stay?" she asked, a blush spreading across her cheeks.

Zorua's jaw hung open.

Celebi closed her eyes, blushing even more.

"Y'know... I've really gotten used to you in here and... we're friends now, no?"

"I never said that." Zorua mused, perplexed. Celebi's expression fell asleep Zorua adopted a thoughtful look.

Before he fell in a coma, she hated him; now she was even inviting him to live with her?

But there he was, having a normal, friendly chat with someone. Wasn't that what friends did?

"... But, yeah. I think that we can be friends after all." he continued, grinning.

The disappointed Celebi smiled in satisfaction.

"Well, friends help each other, no? I can pull you out of your forest and your loneliness..." she said.

"And in exchange, I'll...?" Zorua mused.

Celebi giggled.

"Well... I suppose you could come to school with me, help me with stuff when I ask you to..." she explained.

"School? Never." Zorua retorted.

"Do you prefer the drawer?"

"I didn't say I'm going to stay here, Celebi. Keep that in mind."

Celebi mentally slapped herself.

"Right. The decision is yours of course... but you have nothing to lose and all to gain, Zorua." she said in a convincingly happy tone.

"Hm..."
12233222221312112131232.title: Celebi's offer

choices: "Sure...I guess it couldn't hurt to try it."
"Eh, i'll stick with the drawer thanks."
122332222213121121312321.content:
Zorua considered his options...he got himself back, but he remembered what it was like with Celebi these past few days...and honestly he had fun, even trying to read he had fun...something he'd have never really tried otherwise.

He had a more serious contemplative look that Celebi took note of, and hoped that he'd say yes...the Zorua that he was now, the one she had always known...she saw a side to him she didn't know he even had. With a bit more work she could make Zorua the pokemon he could be, should be...kind, empathetic...happy.

Zorua let out a sigh before he gave Celebi a grin.

"Sure Celi, i'll hang around for a while." He said. Truth was, he was used to sleeping either with Celebi or in that comfy drawer and as much as being this size DID limit his options, it sure as hell beat sleeping in his forest.

And he could leave anytime he figured.

Celebi for her part had a wide smile before a paw wrapped around Zorua and lifted him to her cheek where she nuzzled him.

"This'll be great! You won't regret it Zorua!"

"H-hey..." He said, blushing like mad, but the soft fur felt great. Celebi giggled.

"You didn't seem to mind this the few times I did this over the last few days." She said and he tried to push her cheek away, to no avail.

"That was different, I wasn't myself!" Zorua insisted before Celebi pulled him away.

"You were Zorua, you were yourself...that was before anyone in this village knew you right? What happened?" Celebi coaxed gently but Zorua shut down like a steel trap.

"Celebi, that's not something I want to go into right now." He said, a bit colder than she had anticipated. She smiled gently after a second of shock.

"Of course, but if you need a friend to lean on, i'll be here anytime you want to open up." She gently pet his head with a finger before she set him down and got up, stretching.

"I don't know about you, but I could go for a cup of tea. You want some?" She tried to defuse some of the tension and Zorua looked up at her and nodded.

"Uh...yeah, that sounds nice actually." He said smiling. Celebi leaned down to grab him but he shook his head.

"Nah, let me relax on your nice bed for a bit please?" He asked and she looked at his eyes, they seemed to be asking for a little privacy and she nodded.

"I'll be back in a few minutes." And with that she walked off, the familiar boom of her mighty steps registering in Zorua's ears.

He sat back and put a paw to his chin...he had his memories back, though the way he felt the past few days and the way he felt now...that was some serious whiplash.

And Celebi was curious about it, Zorua knew that for sure now.

He supposed he COULD tell her, but it wouldn't solve much, or he could just ride out however long she wanted to put up with him...he wasn't the cuddly little meek and weak Zorua anymore, he wasn't gonna let that Zorua come to the surface ever again. He might be doll sized at the moment, but he had his backbone damn it!

And he had his wits on top of his pride.

Zorua did admit though...staying with Celebi was fun. Some of the most fun he'd had since coming to this village. Well, he could let it be for now he supposed.

As his thoughts settled he noted the familiar booms again as Celebi entered the room with a cup of steaming tea and she smiled at the tiny fox on her bed.

He felt a familiar invisible tug as he was lifted by psychic and Celebi sat on her bed, settling the fox in on her lap as she took a sip of tea and lowered the cup down to him, where he took a few licks.

"So Zorua, any thoughts on what you want to do now that you're staying with me?" She asked and he gave her a confused look.

"Well, tomorrow is a school day...and if you want to come with me you can. I'll keep you hidden of course..." Zorua looked thoughtful for a second before responding.
122332222213121121312321.title: Zorua stays

choices: He miraciously made it to the backpack and climb inside
It was too late as Celebi grabs the baclpack and leaves Zorua behind.
1223322222131212.content:
After brushing himself off, Zorua looks around to try to see where he was. Unfortantly, he couldn't make head or tails as to where he was for a while. But after a few, he saw he was on a strand of carpet fibers. He then turns and saw the biggest backpack he ever seen in his life. It was Celebi's backpack, on she usually like to wear for pokeschool.

Before he could question the exsitance of such a massive objcet. His world shakes violently as the goddess fairy is preparing to have her words for the fox.

"Ok Zorua." Her voice booms down, it was so loud as Celebi was talking in her normal voice. "The fun for you will be to get my attention somehow. No time limit, just because i'm fair like that. However, i won't be looking for you." Hearing those words terrify the fox, it meant he is completely on his own. And sad thing for him, she meant it. "As i said, I won't look for you, so you need to find a way to get my attention somehow. And if i were you, i best do it fast, for i might end up forgetting i shrunk you soon." Celebi says, "Or for the more likely chance, something might happen to you before you even get close to me." She says. Zorua shook in fear, how is he going to get her to notice him at his size?

Unfortantly, that question was interrupted as the fairy start to move. The simple movement of moving her foot was enough to cause the world to rumble. But the second she took a single step, the world just drop for Zorua. Just a single step, and Celebi shook Zorua's entire world, and she didn't even stomp. The fairy was starting to walk, and true to her words, she show no signs that she was going to look or be catious for the nano fox. Zorua was on his own.

"Well, i guess i better get ready for school." Celebi says in her normal tone, as she walks to her desk to start preparing for the school as it turns out that its early morning.

Zorua watches the living planet is going about her day, not caring for him. Fearing for his safety of being stuck as this size for the rest of his life, Zorua takes Celebi's advice and tries to think of something that would get her to notice him. However, he realizes that at his size, it would be impossible as long he is on the floor. He did however got a idea as he looks at the massive backpack, miles away from him. He figures if he can get on the backpack and climb to the top, the hoepfully Celebi might notice him. But two major problems, he's miles away from the backpack, and Celebi is grabbing her stuff for class.

With no more hesitation, the fox bolts towards the backpack. Ten minutes has past, and Zorua is only a mile away from the massive object. Unfortantly, a voice can be heard that made him dread in terror. "Celebi, its almost time for school." Celebi's mother's voice could be heard, rumbling across the fox's world.

"Ok mother, almost done!" Celebi's voice, being far louder as she shouted, booms down on the fox, making him stop just to cover his ears. The worst just started as the fairy herself is moving again, and she is heading to the backpack.

Zorua struggle to run to the backpack as each step Celebi took would hamper his progress horrifically, and it only got worse the closer she gets. It was only a matter of time before the fairy stood right above the fox. Zorua could see Celebi's body loom over him like astronamical entity. Celebi was busy packing her stuff into the bacpack, which gave the fox tike to stsrt running to the thing. He ran and ran as fast as he could until.....
1223322222131212.title: Ever looming backpack

choices: Zorua has to get her attention - he tries to get out during Celebi's class
Better safe than sorry - he waits inside the backpack until school is over
12233222221312121.content:
Zorua ran as fast as his microscopic legs could.

The backpack seemed to be getting bigger and bigger, but he knew that it was only him getting closer. Nonetheless, it was still huge to him.

The world around the fox shook tremendously as Celebi took another step, reaching for her backpack... she was about to leave!

Desperation seeping in his heart, Zorua sprinted forward. He didn't care that he was rapidly losing his breath, he didn't care about his heart pounding his chest, he didn't care about his tongue sticking out of his mouth.

The only thing that mattered was just grab a hold of the backpack.

And, the second Celebi grabbed it, Zorua mustered all his remaining strength to jump forward. His paws touched something soft, his fangs sank into whatever it was.

Did he make it? He didn't know, the crazed run had left him breathless, vision blurred and sweat running down his face.

Cold air hit his sweating body, making him shiver. He kept his grip on whatever he was holding onto and finally looked forward... he was being lifted far up in the air.

He felt blissful for the shortest moment - he made it! Now, he only had to get Celebi's attention and this torment would be over... he hoped.
