"Celi..." the voice of her mother echoed inside again, and Celebi put her backpack on her back and readjusted it with a shake as she started walking to her door, happily ignoring the tiny Zorua who was probably crying somewhere in her room.

Little did she know was that Zorua suddenly found himself soaring the skies of her room for a split second. He felt horrified - when Celebi shook her backpack, he was launched up in the air at supersonic speed.

It was over. He'd land straight back onto the floor... and this height was surely enough to kill someone his size.

His own life flashed before his eyes, which he closed, bracing himself for the impact as he started descending with the same speed he was thrown in the air with.

He waited for the imminent impact. But it never came. Instead, the sunlight seemed to fade away. He kept falling for a while, before hitting the ground... which was inexplicably soft.

Was he dead...?

Silence.

He felt his heart beating, he was breathing, the world around him was shaking.

Zorua reluctantly opened his eyes... he wasn't dead. But he wasn't quite sure where he was either.

Around him, darkness. It wasn't a problem - he was a dark type, his vision was quite good in the dark.

Zorua got up and started inspecting his surroundings. Something huge and solid was towering above him... it smelt funny.

Like pages...

A sound drew his attention... humming? It was a familiar voice... a voice he feared right now.

Celebi.

His eyes shot open, his heart seemed to perk up as he finally realized. He didn't fall onto the ground... he somehow fell inside Celebi's backpack! Not only he was spared, but he had another shot at getting her attention too!

He turned around, the monolith behind him was nothing more than one of the fairy's books!

He felt relieved, but nauseous. His world kept shaking, meaning that the green planet that was Celebi was probably walking to school.

Zorua sighed. While she walked, he had no possibility of getting her attention... even worse, she was humming. The only chance would be throwing himself straight into one of the two blue suns that were Celebi's eyes... but that would mean not only having to climb out of this backpack, but having to climb up to Celebi's head, climb down her face... he would take too long... plus, he doubted that the fairy was going to grow him back after he threw himself in her eye.

No, he had to wait, Zorua decided. He could use this time and rest to regain the energy he lost in that mad dash he made earlier.

And whenever Celebi stopped, he would start climbing out...

A new doubt... if Celebi was at school... she wouldn't be paying attention to him, no? And, if he managed to somehow get her attention, she couldn't grow him back, not in the middle of class...

Could he risk climbing out during Celebi's class...?

His thoughts were interrupted as his world finally stopped shaking.

--

Celebi smiled brightly, her mind having registered Zorua as a secondary thought.

She had reached her destination.

The school.
12233222221312121.title: School time

choices: The bell is ringing, Celebi is about to be late
One of Celebi's friends walk up to the fairy to talk to her
The zipper above is opening, Celebi is reaching for her book and pencil
122332222213121211.content:
Not wanting to stay inside the backpack, Zorua decides it might be best to climb out Celebi's backpack and try to climb her. Only problem was that there was one opening and its very high up. In all honestly, Zorua only has to climb one of Celebi's books and he should be able to get out. But with his size, and Celebi moving around, it might prove extremely difficult. Nonetheless, the fox gathers his strength and tries to scale a nearby book.

Five minutes has pass and so far Zorua has made next to no progress. Because he is so small, the book was extremely massive for him to climb as he barely made a millimeter up. It doesn't help that he had to top to get a good grip every time Celebi takes step.

"If i make it out of this.... I'm going to take mom and dad's advice of going to...sports team at this rate." Zorua struggles to says while catching his breathe, jokingly to himself to keep his mind off things. As he continues to climb, he heard a massive loud noise that shook him to his core.
122332222213121211.title: Higher education climbing

choices: Frostlass leaves to go to her own classes, with Zorua in tow
Zorua couldn't hold on landed safely on the ground somehow
The girls bump onto another student
1223322222131212112.content:
"H-Hello Celebi." A gentle female voice could be heard behind Celebi. She turns and see a timid, shy Frostlass with glasses.

"Oh hello, Frostlass." Celebi says to the floating ice ghost.

"I-I didn't see you y-yesterday at the library." Frostlass says. Celebi winced a bit as she completely forgot about meeting Frostlass yesterday no thanks to Zorua.

"Oops, Sorry." Celebi says with a sheepish smile. "I was walking to the forest yesterday. Let's just say i had a bad run in with a cetain fox." She explain.

"Oh, y-you mean Z-Zorua. I k-keep forgetting he l-likes to be there. T-then again, he never seem to p-prank me." Frostlass says. "W-well, since w-we're here, do you still have my b-book?"

"Oh right, Its in my backpack." Celebi says as she was about to open the backpack.

"Oh, l-let me." Frostlass says as she rushes behind Celebi and proceed to open the zipper.


Zorua heard the two giantesses talking very loud above before he wince in fear when he hears one of the pokemon opening the zipper. He looks up and see the small light source starts to grow massive before it started to blind him. A strong chilling feeling starts to hit Zorua as he looks up and sees Frostlass's massive hand reaching into the bag. The world rumbles alot as the timid ghost looks for the book, bumping many things that bump on the book that Zorua was on. He held on tight as he can until he felt the rumbling stops a bit. It was only when he looks up again and saw why. The book he was on was the book that belongs to Frostlass.

He felt the inside world of Celebi's backpack zoom past him as Frostlass pulls the book out of the backpack. Zorua looks up and see's thr ghost's massive head looking at him, or more specifically, at the front of the book to confirm its her.

"T-thank for bringing my b-book." Frostlass says, completely unaware of Zorua on her book and that her gentle quiet voice is booming down on his body. Before Zorua could have the time to wince on pain and cover his ears, the world began to turn a bit as Frostlass moves the book under her arm. Zorua struggles to hang on to the book as the two pokemon continues to walk and talk to their classes. Zorua continues to struggle holding the book until...
1223322222131212112.title: One of Celebi's friends walk up to the fair...

choices: Frostlass stops as she spots Zorua
Frostlass spots Zorua, but mistake him as dirt and blows him off
The pencil made contact and cover Zorua, he still lives
12233222221312121121.content:
Zorua continues to struggle until he heard the loudest bell ring he ever heard. First class is about to begin.

"Oh d-dear, I need to go. T-talk to you later, C-Celebi." Frostlass says as she bolted towards her class.

"Good luck on you test Frostlass." Celebi's voice could be heard in the distant. Zorua gulp, he was stuck on a timid pokemon that he never had contact with and is completely unaware of his prescence.

Frostlass continues to float past many pokemon until she finally made it to her classroom. Frostlass moves towards her desk and sets the book in her hands down, knocking Zorua off and landing on the table. He shook his head as he looks around, only to see Frostlass's everlooming body towering over him.

"Alright class, do remember that today is your test. Test paper is already on your desk." The teacher, a Kangaskang, can be heard as she instructs her students. Zorua gulps as he look down and saw that he was standing on a white plain before realizing he is on the very test paper itself. "When you're ready, begin." The teacher says before the world for Zorua rumbles.

He looks up and see the massive, and blissfully unaware Frostlass moving her hand to write on the test. The pencil looms over Zorua before landing many miles behind him. He gulps again, he is in danger if he is in the way of the pencil. Unfortantly for him, its multiple choice test, in he was on the middle of one answers.

Zorua started to run as fast as he could, trying to get away from the massive target that will eventually get fill by the massive girl. Unfortantly, Frostlass is a smart girl and was filling these questions fast. It will be one minute before she gets on question Zorua is on.

Thirty seconds has pass and Zorua was nowhere near safety. To make matters worse, Forstlass's pencil lands on a answer that was directly ahead of him. Not onky those this cause Zorua to fall on his face be the sheer earthquake cause by the penicil, but it also mean Frostlass is about to write on him.

Fearing for his life, Zorua looks up and can see the ghost's massive face looking right at his direction. Her eyes were reading the question before knowing the answer, the very answer Zorua is on. He sees her moving the pencil aiming at his direction. With no choice, Zorua does the only thing he could think of.

"Please, don't, I'm right here!" Zorua tries to wave his arms, trying to get the pokemon to notice before its too late. The pencil continues to draw dangerously close before....
12233222221312121121.title: Ever looming test

choices: "You poor thing..." Froslass says.
"Hmph, look at you Zorua, absolutely pitiful...and deserved." Froslass says.
"Hey Froslass, how'd the test go?" Celebi was sitting at her table.
122332222213121211211.content:
Froslass was about to fill in the white dot before she noticed it. She didn't know how, but it was a tiny tiny speck...something she shouldn't notice but she felt a niggle as she saw it...was it moving?

Zorua feared for his life as the eye of Froslass seemed to be getting bigger and bigger...and bigger still as it took up his entire vision. He whimpered, the size of these...these gods still being something he wasn't used to.

"Please..." He whimpered and, though she certainly didn't hear him, she thought she could...see that there was more to this speck than she could tell right now, but she had a test to finish. Looking around, she gently used a finger on her paw to slide the speck up.

This simple action hurt Zorua...badly. He didn't die, but the monolithic finger impacted him with overwhelming force as his nose started bleeding from the impact and his legs flayed about. He groaned as the impossible speed with which he was carried at brought him yet closer to Froslass's eye and she put him...down, down he went, into a pouch on her bag.

She'd look at it later.

Zorua looked around, he was in darkness again, in her pack, and his eyes adjusted, he was sore, he was stiff, and he was hopelessly tiny...and possibly wouldn't get out of this alive. He couldn't help it, the situation finally overwhelming him, he started crying in the darkness, the wetness coming down to meet with the blood still dripping from his nose, he laid down, just wanting this nightmare to end, but the only way out was Celebi, a pokemon that actively wasn't looking for him and in fact didn't seem to care if he lived or died.

"I'm sorry...i'm sorry..." He cried to no one, but the only response he got was the sounds of the outside world...

-

Froslass finished up her classes and went to lunch, picking up her bag. This jolted Zorua, who had drifted off as soon he found himself looking up at light...and the giant Froslass, she flashed a light into the bag and looked in it intently...Zorua figured she was looking for him, though he had NO clue how she'd spot him a second time he waved his paws frantically. "HERE! I'M HERE!" He shouted and got no response, but after a minute he felt those planet sized eyes...seem to lock on him. The finger descended and he closed his eyes.

"Not again!" He cried as the finger met with him and he found himself being carried up and up...and down, and in various directions before he landed on a white sheet...on a lunch table in the quiet corner of the cafeteria. He staggered to his feet, dazed and then promptly fell down again. He was exhausted at this point...far too exhausted to do anything really. He turned his head to see...Froslass looking at him, but with a magnifying glass.

And it was then that, just barely...Froslass saw Zorua, as if seeing him in a distant crowd. He looked beat up though and...wait, Zorua!?

This tiny speck was Zorua!?

He DID look rough though, she tried to get a closer look to see...dried blood on his nose...his eyes were red from crying she could tell, and he looked absolutely terrified. Tired as well.

The infamous prankster Zorua. The one that skipped out on class constantly to harass kids. The one that made an ass of himself in the village at every opportunity.

Was here, barely even big enough to qualify as being a speck, and absolutely terrified of it all.

The silence that Zorua was experiencing soon came to an end.
122332222213121211211.title: Froslass discovers

choices: There was only one class and the two head home
Forstlass has many classes to go and Zorua fell asleep
1223322222131212112111.content:
"Oh d-dear, you m-must have been through a l-lot." Frostlass says as she adjust her glasses and the magniflying glass. The timid pokemon smiles a bit as she is glad she spot the nano pokemon in time, she wouldn't imagine what would happen if she didn't. "So, are you Z-Zorua everyone talks about?" She ask, considering this is the first time she ever seen Zorua in person.

"Y-yes!" Zorua nervously shouts, but only sees that Frostlass not responding.

"Opps, sorry, you m-must be too small for me to h-hear you." Frostlass says as she tries to think of something. "Think you can jump up and down? One jump yes, two jumps no?"

Zorua understood and jumps up once. Frostlass smiles as she is happy she is able to communicate. "Ok, at least we can t-talk with each other." Her face flares up a bit as she is usaully nervous around boys...or anyone in general. "Um, so listen, i will k-keep you safe untill we can find out what s-shrink you." She says, clearly unaware of Celebi's shrinking power.

"Its your friend, Celebi, she shrunk me to punish me! Please, convince her I'm sorry!" Zorua shouts, until he realizes it is pointless, Frostlass is far to massive to even notice him trying to shout. As far as Zorua knows, he's stuck like this.

"You are going to have to s-stick with me until s-school is over." Frostlass continue, never noticing Zorua's attempt to talk to her. "However, I don't think its s-safe to be in my backpack." She says as she reaches into her backpack and pull out a scarf she likes to use from time to time. "Do you think you will be c-comfortable staying on...me?" The shy pokemon blushes a bit but keeps herself calm down a bit. Zorua sighs as he figures he doesn't have a choice and jumps up to say yes. Frostlass smiles as she wraps the scarf around her neck before lifting Zorua up a bit. "P-please stay on my scarf, you're so small that it will be e-easy to bump into someone and lose you."

Frostlass then carefully opens her scarf a bit and places Zorua between the scarf and her neck. "Ah, cold cold cold." Zorua shouted and shover a bit as he is quickly reminded that Frostlass is a ice ghost pokemon, so some parts her body is defiantly freezing on him. The shy ghost then tightens the scarf a bit, securing Zorua more until his upper body is expose a bit. She then looks at a small mirror she has to examine Zorua.

Zorua looks across and could see Frostlass's reflection. For some reason, he sees her blushing and smiling a bit about this. The ghost then puts her stuff away then prepares to leave. "Just wait until school is done, then you and i can talk at my house." She says, though she tries to sound a bit more confident for Zorua's sake. With that, Zorua felt his world moves as Frostlass proceed to head out to her next class. He hopes thing don't take forever.
1223322222131212112111.title: Such a gentle soul

choices: We get to know each other first?"
We figure out what shrunk you?"
Frostlass is interrupted when she hears her mom or sister calling for her.
12233222221312121121111.content:
Frostlass, and Zorua, went to a classroom, which appearently is math class. Zorua sighs a bit as he figures he might get very bored of this that he might fall asleep. Unfortantly, with the teacher's voice, a Delphox, teaching the classroom math, and some of the students talking, even Frostlass is speaking to make things worse now that he is close to her mouth. He knows why she has to speak in her normal voice, but its still hurt his ears alot.

As the classroom is about ten minutes away from being done, Zorua continues to listen to the leason. "If there is one thing i can take from this size problem, at least i can prepare myself for the next math test if i ever grow back to normal." He says to himself. However, he felt the scarf nudging a bit, creating a massive shake to him. He looks and sees Frostlass is moving the scarf on purpose, trying to get his attention. He looks around until he looks down at the ghost's desk and see that she writen something for him to read.

Sorry for the long wait and me having to talk normally. Hope you are comfortable in my scarf.

Zorua did blush a bit, he did actually enjoys the surprisingly softness of the scarf. He didn't even mind the cold feeling that is on his back nonstop. He continues to read the rest.

Will head home soon, hope we can talk and stuff...if that is ok. He sees what look like a blushing chibi version of Frostlass herself next to the writing.

"Cute..." He said as he has no idea why she made the small drawing, but still smile a bit that she is concern of him. Ten minutes has past and he felt his world shake again. Frostlass grabs her stuff and makes her way out. She didn't stop as she wanted to make it home as soon as possible. She couldn't help but smile about the idea of bringing someone so tiny to her house.

Thanks to her being a ghost, Frostlass was able to zoom past many things and make it to her house safely. "M-mom, b-big sister, i'm home." Frostlass says outloud, hoping she didn't burst Zorua's eardrum. She expects to hear her family call back, but no one is home. "Hmm, guess they are out." Frostlass says, smiling a bit as she takes this as a oppurtunity to safely get inside her room and have her "conversation" with Zorua.

She gets inside her room and carefully pulls Zorua out. Adjusting her glasses and pulling out a magnifying glass. She sees that he perfectly fine. "H-hi..." She sheepishly says as she waves gently. Zorua waves back at the shy pokemon, though he sighs a bit as he know that now he has to do the jumping method just to comunicate with Frostlass. "Don't w-worry, i'll try to make the q-question breif." Frostlass says as she thought of what to ask first. "Ok, how about..."
12233222221312121121111.title: Class together

choices: They "talk" for a few hours
They "talk" until it was time to sleep
They talk until it was dinner time
122332222213121211211111.content:
Zorua was rather confuse, wondering why in the would this goddess of ice would want to get to know each, especially considering only one is able understand the other perfectly while the other has to watch the other jump around to answer her question. It sucks more considering Zorua can't just simply ask Frostlass.

"S-Sorry, j-just wanted something to talk about." Frostlass says with a sheepish smile as she sees that Zorua isn't jumping. "Though, after the day you had, i thought maybe you want to focus on something that isn't r-related to your size." She says with a innocent look, trying to hid the blush on her face. Zorua looks at the timid pokemon and sighs a bit, he does want to talk about anything other then how increadibly tiny he is, though he does want to be at a size that isn't smaller than a speck of dust. Looking at the innocent look of the ice titaness. He pouts a bit befire jumping once. Frostlass sees this and smiles as her eyes gleam.

"T-thank you..." She says as moves her hand to gently pet Zorua, who blushes at the pet, shivers from the icy touch of Frostlass's hand, and tries to not panic in fear as the looming hand pins him a bit before finally rising away from him. Zorua looks up at the smiling Frostlass and waits for the questions that she will be asking.
122332222213121211211111.title: Strange time to get to know each other.

choices: "I can...call her..."
"W-when I go to school next, i'll t-talk to her."
"M-maybe I should keep you a secret...for now..."
12233222221312121121112.content:
Zorua, as he looked around, found that though he could see the outside world, he had a hard time comprehending it. He had to admit, Froslass discovering him was a boon, and he didn't worry that he'd...well, he still was worried he'd die, but it was much less. He just hoped that he could either get across what happened to him to her, or that Froslass would show him to Celebi on her own since the two were friends. Froslass had been sitting in this class for...Arceus knows how long...ugh. He felt his eyes droop. The scarf was comfy and warm...and he was so bored and tired from all the running he had done, even still.

He was hungry too. And thirsty. Though he'd need to wait on those unfortunately. As the class boomed on around him, he found himself drifting off...more and more before he finally fell asleep.

Froslass had been sneaking peaks at the nano sized dot when she could, trying to make sure he was still there. She had no idea what he was doing...which was sleeping, but she hoped he was okay. She needed to find a way to communicate better with him...try and figure out what happened. Delinquent or not, Zorua didn't deserve THIS, did he? She smiled.

No, he didn't, but if he couldn't be fixed she'd at least take care of him to the best of her ability. She could see him through the magnifying glass, and he could jump to communicate with her. She'd figure something else out, but something about all of this scared her.

She was sad for Zorua, and she truly wanted to help him and cared for him.

But she can't deny...having him like this felt like a rush of power. She shook her head.

It was a nasty thought, one best left alone. After her classes she'd communicate more with him, try and help.

-

"Zorua." It was a boom, a cacophony of sound much like the entire world was to him at this point, but it was pointed and directed at him. Zorua groaned and got up, seeing himself on a sea of red...the scarf.

He looked up to see...Froslass. With the magnifying glass in a room he didn't recognize. She was...damn intimidating. A goddess on this scale, one so far above Zorua it wasn't even funny. But she was kind...benevolent, right?

She smiled, she could see he was awake. She gently waved at him with her paw, far in the distance...Zorua could feel the harsh breeze that generated and Froslass noticed this before she stopped.

"S-sorry..." She stammered but Zorua just tried to put on a smile. His stomach growled and that's when he got an idea. He rubbed his belly with a paw.

"O-oh...right...I have s-some food here..." She said as she gently lowered the tiniest crumb of bread she had, near Zorua on the scarf.

It was still as big as a house to Zorua. He approached it, something that took him a full minute, and went to bite into it. It was soft enough for him to do that luckily as he started devouring it. Froslass watched him. He must've been hungry. Very carefully she grabbed an eyedrop, and splashed the tiniest drop of water she could.

It was like a lake dropped from the sky as Zorua felt the impact. He looked to see...the oddest thing he had ever seen as the drop somehow towered above him. This drop of water was almost like a monument. With great trepidation he approached it and stuck his tongue out...he was able to drink it like normal water. Relieved, he did as much of that as he could, being damn careful to try and not disturb the drop from swallowing him into it, lest he drown.

Froslass observed all of this, and relieved that Zorua had received nourishment...she couldn't help but find the whole thing adorable. This cute little speck, that had been quite the terror until now...completely reliant on her.

She shook her head again. No, not the time. He needed her help and she was providing it to be kind. She dropped the third thing she had near him. A tiny bit of graphite from her pencil. It landed with a boom.

"U-um...you can use your claws to dig into it...to write...I think...I hope..." She boomed and Zorua nodded. This was how to communicate! He grinned.

Froslass gained any and all immunity to pranks if he got out of this!

He approached it, and though he grunted and had to work his claw into it, he scribbled it in as big of letters as he could, as deep into the graphite as he could, and Froslass read his message.

'Celebi shrunk me'

Froslass's eyes widened.

"C-C-Celi...?" She was reeling. Her friend did this? Her friend COULD shrink things?

That was...nuts.

More than that, should she even confront Celebi about this? Surely she wouldn't leave Zorua to die like this...would she?

Celebi had voiced her frustrations about Zorua more than once...Froslass bit her lip.
12233222221312121121112.title: Communication

choices: Tangled Aurora's tail fur as she finishes the test and leaves
On her test paper, in the same situation as before with Frosslass
122332222213121211212.content:
Frosslass spotted the speck, and thinking it was just dirt blew it off her paper, before continuing her test.

Unfortunately for Zorua that blow sent him flying through the air torwards the desk in front of Fosslass. Zorua looked to see who it was, and paled. It was the foreign exchange student, Aurora, the Alolan Vulpix, who took that name to differentiate herself from the male Kanto Vulpix that had traded places in the exchange program. Unfortunately he also knew a lot about her since he had been planning a going away prank before Celibi shrank him.

She loved taking Freezing Ice Cold baths every night before she went to bed, and would spend several hours just soaking in the water cold enough to give a fire type hypothermia. She also had the habit of not noticing anything around her unless she already knew you were there during those baths, which while makes it alot easier to prank her, though he was shrunk before he could, would make getting her attention at the only time she was guarenteed to be still, both deadly from the cold, and almost impossible from the lack of attention.

To make matters worse, Zorua knew that Aurora was leaving back to her home village after this class, and if he was on her then he would have to wait a year for a chance to get back to Celibi with whichever pokemon is chosen for the exchange progam next year goes to Aurora's village.

As Zorua blew closer, he tried to control his path to somewhere else, only to land...
122332222213121211212.title: Frostlass spots Zorua, but mistake him as dirt ...

choices: Zoura managed to get free somehow
Zoura still is tangled on her while on her way home
Aurora feels an itch on her tail and decide to inspect it
Reader's choice
1223322222131212112121.content:
Zoura could see the ever looming pokemon getting closer to him as he flies through the classroom. He tried to steer his way onto her desk or somewhere close so she can notice him more,, but unfortunately her tail move in his way as the pokemon shifted in her sit. Aurora was still doing her test and was thinking for the answers. She was unaware that a tiny speck of zoura had landed in her tail fur and get stuck between her fur.

Aurora got to the beach at the other side of the forest path, where she purchased a ticket for the ride back home using the Mantine Ride.

As she rode, the wind, instead of helping Zorua, just caused him to be tangled even further. To make things even worse, the spray hit him, causing him to be wet, while Aurora's ice energy caused the water to freeze, leaving him completely immobile.

Several hours later, Aurora finally made it to the beach connected to her village, far away from the village with Celebi that Zorua was from, and needed to get back to. Once there she headed to the Alakazam transport that took her the rest of the way to her home, which was barely in range from there, and completely out of range before, being very far away from Celebi and Zorua's village, where she met up with her mother.

"I'm home!" She called.

"Oh, Aurora." Her mother, an Alolan Ninetales said coming over, and nuzzling her, while her tails intertwined with Aurora's. "How was the exchange program?"

"It was good." Aurora said. "We finished a test, which the results, along with my report card will be mailed to me in a few weeks."

To make things worse Aurora's mom's tail fur then rushed over him as well, causing him to be tangled in both their tail fur. He then heard something that caused him to pale.

"Okay dear." Aurora's mom said as Aurora pulled away, seperating their tails, as she headed to the bathroom, while Aurora's mom, Crystal, went to get some leftover's for Aurora's dinner, since it was really late, before sitting down to reread the paper while she waited.

However Zorua was tangled in both of their tail fur, so where is Zorua now?

"Of course sweetie. I'm just glad you want to clean your room finally. It must be very dusty in here." The mother says nonchanatly as she walks inside to set the bag on the nearby desk. From down below, Zorua panics of what he heard, these two are going to clean Celebi's room while he's this small.

"Celebi, please wait, I'm down here!" Zorua tries to shout out to planet like pokemon, but Celebi clearly couldn't hear him and soon started to shift her foot. It was clear from Celebi's view, she has no hope of finding Zorua, so no point in even bothering to look for him.

"Righty, let's dust the place first off before vacuuming the room." The mother says as she and Celebi walks around. Zorua needed to get out of this room before he either gets step on by these too, or get vacuumed.

Running with his microscopic body might, Zorua tries to make his way to the door, which thankfully can still be seen even within the carpet forest. Unfortantly, any progress he could hope to make would either be halted or undone by the two pokemon's simple action. More than once has Zorua almost been stepped on as the two unaware pokemon continue their cleaning. Within a few minutes....

122332222213122.content:
Celebi smirked a bit, letting Zorua's predicament hopefully sink in with him as she very slowly went over to her desk. She put down her prank journal on the table with telekinesis and opened it up. Looking at her hand again she said "You know Zorua, I still need to log your latest prank into the book, but it seems I have you in my writing hand. I guess i'd better set you down" And with that she gently deposited the microbe of a pokemon onto the blank page.

These simple actions were completely dominating the dark pokemon's senses as the largest quake he's ever experienced in his life left him standing on an endless plane of white. A simple page on Celebi's log book. He felt another quake as a pillar, far far in the distance that stretched up to eternity set down. Her pen. Zorua gulped a bit at this "Oh no..."

"If I were you speck, i'd start running~" And that echo from the goddess was all he needed to spur him into action. He took off as far and fast down the page as his little legs would carry him, as his world shook from the simple action of Celebi writing.

Celebi herself was smirking, just very barely able to see the tiniest of black dots, though she couldn't perceive much movement she was sure he was as much as he could. She was writing very slowly, dragging it out herself and internally giggling. As time went on she noticed she was getting a bit closer to him. Better speed it up Zorua, or my pen will crush you into paste."

Zorua at this point was exhausted, but he kept going, he was far beyond pleading or having the energy to even do that. But no matter how far he got he had no hope of outrunning the monolith behind him, and the quakes got stronger the closer it got. All he could do was shut his eyes as he ran. Soon though it reached the line on the paper above him and he could no longer keep going between the lack of energy and the quakes being too strong. He collapsed down onto the paper and started whimpering. 'I just want to go home...' he thought to himself.

Celebi meanwhile had noticed that she was on the line above him and was glad she had calculated it right. She knew she would finish on the line above where she deposited him, and was feeling rather proud of herself with her little prank on him. She wasn't about to let him know that though. "Well, you're quite lucky I finished when I did Zorua, just needed to log the little prank you pulled on me, and the dues that you're paying now." Satisfied with her work she set the pen to the side and stood up. "And now I just have to go grab something, don't go anywhere...as if you could you little cretin." She went over to her closet, ready to grab her microscope. The magnifying glass wasn't enough, she had to see the look on Zorua's face.

Zorua meanwhile, still collapsed curled up into a ball and started weeping "She's going to kill me...i'm going to die here...please, if I get out of this i'll never pull a prank again."

Soon Celebi returned, ready to see the look of shock on Zorua's face, setting the microscope down as gently as she could she centered it on where she knew the barely perceptible dot was and put the settings to max, where she saw the sad sight of him curled into a ball crying to himself. When she noticed him look up a bit at what must have been a tower beyond comprehension he looked to whimper and curl into an even smaller ball. Celebi bit her lip...

1223322222131222.content:
Celebi could see that Zorua is terrify as she contemplate her action. "I know I want to punish Zorua, but its best to not over do it to the point of hurting him." Celebi thoughts to herself. "Still, until I think he has enough, need to keep in mind that he's smaller than what i wanted him for the rest of the punshment." She says she reaches for something that is on her desk.

As for Zorua, all he could do was look up and fear as he wonder what Celebi has in store for him as he knows her well enough that she got far more stuff for him. Suddenly, the living green world in front of him was finally starting to move as he could barely see Celebi reaching for something.

"Ok Zorua, i think you at least deserve something for making quite the run." Celebi says as she drops something right in front of Zorua. The sudden shockwave knock him on his back as he tries to see what exactly Celebi place in front of him. What ever it was, it was massive enough to be a mountain.


*CRUNCH*

A loud thunderous noise broke Zorua concentration that he didn't notice Celebi chewing on something. It was nothing more than a small cookie that was from a cookie bag on Celebi's desk. Turns out the mountain in front of Zorua is a crumb from the cookie

"Well Zorua, what are you waiting for?" Celebi says as she take another bite. "You are going to need all the energy you can get before i'm through with you tonight." Celebi's words stung Zorua a little as he figures Celebi has something in store. Zorua nervously moves towards the cookie as he expects Celebi to do something, meanwhile Celebi is just watching from above and munching away on more cookies. Finally giving in, Zorua begins to munch on the crumb. Celebi smiles a little as she sees Zorua listening to her and eating the crumb. After a while, Zorua has his fill, though he was still anxious as he sees that Celebi seems to finish eating as well.

"I see you had you're fill. Now let's continue on our fun." Celebi says as she thinks on what to make Zorua do next. "I will give you a choice this time. Do you want to see how well of a swimmer you are?" Celebi says as she pulls out a glass cup of water. "Or, do you want to see how good you are of climbing my hand in a certain time?" Celebi say as she lays her hand next to Zorua. "Best pick or I shall pick something else, and you might not like it." Celebi say as Zorua struggles to decide which option would be best.
1223322222131222.title: Best to not over do it

choices: Zorua makes it in time!
Zorua fails to make it before the time runs out...
12233222221312222.content:
Zorua thinks about his choices for about two minutes. He didn't really want Celebi to come up with new ideas to torture him.

At least, to him was torture. To Celebi, it was all just a game.

Through the microscope, Celebi watches the tiny fox ponder his choices. He's been thinking for a bit now...

Zorua is distracted by a sudden noise coming from above.

Celebi just yawned.
"Thirty more seconds, Zorua," the goddess warns.
"Then, I'll be picking for you."

This successfully scared Zorua into making more mental struggles to take a decision.

In the end, the dark type concludes that swimming in the glass of water might end with him drowning. Climbing Celebi's paw was a safer alternative - although she mentioned a time limit.

If such time ran out, Celebi would surely enough punish him further...

"Ten... nine... eight..." Celebi counts teasingly, her voice growing more mischievous each second she counted.

However, before she could reach ‘two’, Zorua finally decides.
"Your hand! I'll climb your hand!" he shouts, walking closer to the fairy's extended paw for good measure.

Luckily for him, Celebi seems to understand.
"So, it'll be my paw, I guess," she says with a smirk.
"Good choice Zorua. Now, you have one hour to climb and reach the centre of my palm," she explains.
"Who knows, if you make it in time, I might even consider growing you back up... a little..."

The green fairy's words seem to encourage the tiny fox as a hopeful glint appears in his eyes.

Without adding another word, he starts to run in direction of Celebi's paw, an immense green field that rests on her desk.

Sooner than he had anticipated, Zorua reaches Celebi's finger, which is the size of a small skyscraper. He swiftly runs towards it, ready to climb up... when he bitterly realized that he was a quadruped pokemon.

All of sudden, the task ahead of him seemed impossible.

Zorua sighs in desperation as the chance of growing back up, at least a little, seems to wane, disappear into nothingness...

Deciding that he should at least give it a try, Zorua walks up to the enormous finger of Celebi. The tiny fox stands on his hind legs while pushing his forelegs against the large, green finger.

Then, he risks moving his mouth, biting Celebi's finger. As expected, the fairy didn't feel that at all as she watches the tiny prankster with an amused look.
"I see you've made the first step," she says, her head slipping onto her other, free paw.
"Let's how far do you get."

Ignoring the comment - an extremely hard task to achieve given how loud Celebi's voice is - Zorua starts scaling the finger...

--

"Half an hour," Celebi mutters as her gaze travels on a clock.

Then, she eyes the side of her finger again; Zorua is still climbing.
"Hurry up, Zorua. You've got half the time now," Celebi remarks.

Zorua was living a nightmare.

Due having to use his mouth to climb, he couldn't breath properly. Plus, he was extremely tired from all the struggles he had to do so far.

But the hope that Celebi might grow him to some less precarious size drove him to keep climbing.

And his heart leaps in his chest as he finally manages to stand on all fours onto the endless field that is Celebi's paw.

Zorua's eyes fix on his objective: the centre of Celebi's hand, far in distance.

Without caring less about his tired body, the tiny fox sprints towards the middle of Celebi's huge paw.

"Only five minutes left~" the legendary chirps from above as she watches the tiny fox sprint towards her palm.

She could barely see him - a nanoscopic black dot on her green hand.

Soon enough, Zorua physique couldn't bear the situation anymore.

The dark type collapsed onto Celebi's paw, panting as her tries to regain his breath.

With his vision blurry from the lack of energy, he looks forward, noticing a few wrinkles in distance. That was the centre of the incredibly large paw.

With one last sprint, he could make it...

"Are you quitting now?" Celebi asks from above, before glancing to the clock again.
"When you've got only a minute left?"

Zorua muttered something incomprehensible in response as he stood onto shaky legs and started running again...
12233222221312222.title: A big game

choices: She leaves Zorua on the desk, hopefully he stays there in the morning
He deserves a break for now, let's him sleep with her tonight.
122332222213122222.content:
Zorua, fill with desperation, ran as fast as he could towards his goal. Unfortantly, desperation can only go so far for the poor fox as he was clearly slowing down. Zorua could only run for twenty second before his whole body gave up and he laid flat on his stomach on Celebi's hand.

"*huff* no...just...one more..." Zorua could only muster up the energy to say those words before his vision grew dark and passes out from exhaustion. Celebi was looking at the clock at the moment, not noticing that Zorua wasn't moving.

"Five...four...three...two....and...one. Time's up Zorua...huh?" Celebi looks back at Zorua and could see that Zorua was completely unconscious from his climb. "Heh, guess it was too much to task him to climb something as my little hand." Celebi smirks as she knows full well that Zorua's nano size body and the difficulty of climbing her hand would prove a very difficult task. "Still, I'm amaze that he climb to the top. I wasn't expecting him to make it up a tenth of my finger." Celebi says as she moves her other hand towards Zorua. Using the microscope, she carefully and gently as she could to pet Zorua's back.

"You didn't do what I ask Zorua, and I'm a girl of my words, so you're still stuck in that size." Celebi says, knowing that Zorua can't exactly hear her. "But...I guess you do deserve a nice rest." Celebi says as she looks at the clock again and sees that its very late. The fairy pokemon figures she can continue her games with Zorua in the morning.


However, one thing she wonders before going to bed is where to place Zorua in the mean time. She was planning to leave Zorua on the desk and just leave it like that. Although, after the difficult tasks she put him through, she figures that Zorua at least deserves to sleep on something nice. She looks at her bed and wonders if Zorua derserves to sleep with her.
122332222213122222.title: Time's up

choices: Celebi plans to go easy on him for now, giving him a simple game
Celebi intends to give him a tougher game, possibly the swimming one
1223322222131222221.content:
Celebi thought that it would be a nice gesture towards Zorua to at least give him a pillow to sleep on...but she realized that if she slept with him in her bed it'd be very easy for something catastrophic to happen to him, or her to lose him and never find him again. "No...Zorua can be a jerk but I won't let that happen to him..." Celebi thought to herself. The desk didn't look very comfortable, but at least he'd be relatively safe there...short of a breeze carrying him away. That's when she got an idea. Very carefully she grabbed a small clean nose hankie from the corner of her desk and folded it over. she set it down on the desk and then gently as she could, set the nanoscopic pokemon on it. grabbing her microscope she looked at him to see that he was still sound asleep. "Aw...he's adorable when he isn't being a little punk..." She thought to herself. It also helped that his black, for as minuscule as it was, stood out on the white hankie, at least to where she could find him again. Now for the second part...Celebi crept away, careful not to disturb the scenario she set up and grabbed a small Styrofoam cup, and put a hole at the top of it. she then placed the cup over the hankie and sleeping pokemon, to protect him from outside elements. "Sleep tight Zorua...we'll continue in the morning." Celebi whispered, giggling a little before she set off for her bed.

-

Zorua found himself standing on a dimly lit table, about pebble size. In front of him were many of the pokemon that were victims of his pranks. Marill, who was always the victim of a thumb tack on a chair here, a whoopie cushion there. Sandile, who he'd used stink bombs on in the past. Wynaut, who he had tricked into losing his way many a time. "Well, well well...look at what we have here..." Said Marill, grinning evilly at the tiny Zorua. "It's payback time..." He said as he grabbed a tack and started to stab it down to where Zorua was. Zorua, panicking started running when the tack impacted where he had just been standing. "Oh no you don't!" He said as he continuously stabbed the tack around where Zorua was running. Zorua shut his eyes as he continued to run, though when he opened them he found himself in a forest.

He was alone again, wondering what was going on when he saw...himself standing in the bushes with a rope, snickering. He followed the rope up to see a bucket...with honey, berries, and feathers. He ran to the bushes. "No, stop this! This won't end well for you!" Zorua said panicked when the phantom Zorua turned to him, eyes completely glazed over. "Since when do you care about it ever ending well for us? You know why we do this...you know you just want the attention...who cares if it ends well? You certainly don't." The phantom Zorua started to melt as the rope gave way and Zorua heard a crash behind him. Ears now back in his head in fear he turned around to see a furious Celebi covered in honey, berries and feathers. "Zorua...you little gnat...i'm going to wipe you out for good..." Said Celebi as Zorua felt the ground coming closer to him and the world around him expanded. "No...please...i'm sorry..." Zorua pleaded, but his cries were cut off as Celebi raised her now cruise ship sized sole over him "Goodbye pest. You won't be missed." Said Celebi as Zorua's world went black.

-

Waking in a sweat Zorua looked around. The ground around him felt...soft. He couldn't make out much except a pillar of light far in the distance, unknown to him being sunlight creeping in through the air hole. "W-wha...?" He muttered to himself before standing up. He certainly felt stiff and sore from yesterday...yesterday..."That's right...Celebi is putting me through the ringer." He groaned a bit, hoping she'd at least give him SOME of his size back today. "I'm going to go crazy or die of exhaustion if she keeps going with these 'games' of hers." He said to no one in particular, at least glad to hear his own voice. As if on cue the cup around him lifted and he was greeted with the harsh sun. A quake soon followed and he assumed the green behemoth was grabbing her microscope to get a look at him. His suspicions were confirmed a second later. "Well you certainly look groggy, hope you rested because we have some games ahead of us! I'm sure you're hungry though..." She whispered, rocking him to the core with her voice before a mountain that was the sliver of a berry appeared before him. He certainly was hungry, and opting to go for her offer started digging in. Once he had finished eating, not even leaving a noticeable dent in the sliver, Celebi leaned in a bit "So about our game..."
1223322222131222221.title: A safe compromise and a restless sleep

It look like a drawing of a board ment for chess or checkers
Some other mental game (readers choice)

"Please tell me she is going to grow me." Zorua says as he preys to any other legendary pokemon like Arceus to let Celebi be very kind today. Heck, at this point he would prey to a magikarp.

"This next game shall be a lot more simple for you as I won't exactly task you to do something physically impossible." Celebi say as she pulls out a paper and pen. Zorua was scared to move as he watch the moving green landscape of Celebi's hand heading towards him. He close his eyes as he was expecting to get accidently crush. He does feel a massive pressure on his body, but he sees that Celebi picked him up as gently as she could. Celebi says as Zorua wonders what exactly Celebi has in store this time.

Walking to the very tip of Celebi's finger, Zorua looks down amd could see what Celebi drew.

choices: Zorua clinches it, finishing the maze in 28 minutes
Zorua just barely passes at just under 45 minutes
Zorua fails and doesn't get out of the maze in time
122332222213122222111.content:
"A maze..." Zorua muttered. She had drawn the lines incredibly tiny and close together, he could tell so he at least had a shot to navigate it. On the flip side was the fact that at his height he had no way to chart a course since it was a blur to him from the palm of her hand. "I hope you enjoy this one Zorua, i'm very curious to see your navigation skills since you always seem to know your way around the forest. I have a time limit on this one too, and even better incentives than the last game. If you can clear the maze in 45 minutes i'll grow you...a bit. But the faster you finish it, say 35 minutes, 25 minutes, the larger i'll grow you. Sound enticing?" This got Zorua's heart racing. Oh yeah, he could definitely do this one!

-

"It's been 12 minutes Zorua." Said the goddess leaning down from the heavens as Zorua glared at another line indicating that he'd hit a dead end. "Yeah yeah, I know Celebi!" He shouted, knowing full well she couldn't hear him. This was such a crummy situation and he was starting to let his annoyance overtake his other emotions, which he knew would hinder his thought process for the maze. "That nightmare certainly didn't help either..." Zorua shuddered a bit before turning around and taking off. "Fine, two lefts and center this time!"

-

Celebi was certainly entertained watching him through the microscope. He had his spirit back at least, she had been worried that she had seriously damaged it yesterday after the pen and paper run. "Keep going Zorua" She thought, almost rooting for him. Though she had no intention of going easy on him if he failed the time limit on this one, this was definitely something he COULD do. No, she almost had a punishment in mind in fact if he didn't make it through.

-

As time wore on, Zorua felt himself getting more and more of a mental map, dodging routes he knew would send him down already traveled roads. "I've got this, i've got this!" He pumped himself up, running harder.
122332222213122222111.title: A winding road to getting back to normal

choices: Celebi explains her next game...
Celebi gives Zorua a small break before continuing...
1223322222131222221112.content:
Zorua keeps running within the confines of the maze, completely ignoring his heavy breath.

He had only one thought in his mind, and that was the task ahead of him: getting out of the maze before the 45 minutes were up.

And, almost like fate was delivering its help to the poor, shrunken fox, the so-accurately drawn maze comes to an end. Zorua grins to himself as he sprints forward...

A triumphant cheer escapes the fox's mouth, although no one could possibly hear him. Not even Celebi, whose eye widens through the microscope.

Quickly, the fairy rises her head to look at her clock.

Zorua stares up at the goddess, nervously waiting for the words that will determine his next size... if he made it in time, of course.

Time seemed to stand still as Celebi looked at her clock. Then, the fairy started to slowly rotate her head, almost as if taking as much time as she could.

Her gaze returns to Zorua.

"... 44 minutes and 38 seconds." she mutters, giving a small smile.
"Congratulations Zorua - you've gained an inch."

Zorua froze.

"ONE INCH?!" he shouted.

All those struggles for ONE INCH?!

Celebi cannot hear him, though she can perfectly understand as she notices his frustrated expression through the microscope.

The fairy huffs.
"Hey, a few more seconds and I wouldn't have grown you back of a millimetre. Be glad I'm doing this, Zorua," she scolds.

Zorua lowers his head as he quiets down, defeated.

Celebi assumes a much softer expression.
"Look on the bright side," she continues, causing Zorua to look up again.
"I'll be able to hear you..." she says, gently removing the microscope.
"... And I can stop using this,"

Celebi pulls back a bit as she stretches, before looking at the point where the tiny dot of a fox is.
"Ready?" she asks, not really waiting for an answer.

She was sure about the response, and she couldn't hear him anyway.

Celebi closes her eyes, which start glowing. Zorua is enveloped by a green light.

Then, the nanoscopic black pokemon felt a tingling sensation pervading his whole being as his surroundings started shrinking.

It almost felt kind of nice...

Sadly, as soon as it started, the growth ended, leaving Zorua at the promised size: a full inch.

Celebi's eyes open, her gaze landing upon the tiny fox. She smiles as she's now fully able to see him.

"Hi Zorua," the fairy giggles.

Zorua doesn't respond as he looks down. The huge 'walls' of the maze became just a normal drawing below the fox's paws.

The prankster sighs. At least, this new size is way better than the nanoscopic one.

"Thanks..." he mumbles.

Celebi's smile grows even wider. She could hear Zorua fine too.
"You admittedly deserved it," she responds, one of her paws sliding towards the tiny fox as she gently sccops him up.

"Nice work, Zorua," she compliments, gently petting him with a finger. Zorua blushes a bit from the contact.

Though, now that Celebi's paws cannot crush him by accident, he has to admit that they're really soft...

Zorua shakes the thought off as he focuses on his primary objective: growing back to his full height.

"S-So?" he stutters.
"What's next?"

Celebi grins.
"So eager to play now, are we?" she teases.
"Well..."
1223322222131222221112.title: Zorua's small reward

choices: This is the perfect height for a battle of wits with Zorua
It's time for another physical challenge
12233222221312222211122.content:
"You did good back there, Zorua, and i'm more interested in talking with you for a bit now that we can. We'll do some more games in a bit, consider this your break." Celebi said as she continued to stroke his back with her finger. She did have some questions for him, and it'd be much easier to get him to stop his obnoxious pranks if she could use convincing over threatening.

Zorua himself sighed a bit. Happy to have a break, trepidatious about the talk. 'This is gonna be ANOTHER lecture from another Pokemon, isn't it?' He'd heard it all before with the pranks. Though he couldn't give his usual cheeky responses here, he needed to be careful. Celebi for her part had definitely gotten him to think harder on it anyway through this ordeal anyways. Soon the finger stroking stopped, Zorua almost missed it, and she set him back down on the desk, leaning in with her arms folded under her head. Planet size or not she was pretty stinking intimidating at this size too!

"Zorua...w-" "Why do I do what I do? Am I looking for attention? Did they do something to make me mad and I was getting back? Am just a jerk? Heard it all, seen it all Celebi." Zorua said. Celebi gave him an annoyed look and he continued. "I...Celebi, i'm an illusion Pokemon, it's my talent, I pride myself in it but...it isn't good for much...not really anyway except for hiding and trickery. And boy is it fun to pull of a fun trick!...I know that a lot of pokemon don't appreciate what I do...most, and i've been thinking on that in this situation, believe me...you wouldn't believe the soul searching nightmare I just had...I dunno, I think I do it for a laugh, and for people to know what I can do. Show my stuff." Zorua sighed, smiling a bit to himself. It was true, and he'd found a way to put it into words. At this he felt a finger touch his back...before it pinned him to the table. Celebi was staring intently at him, intently at his eyes and he couldn't move. He gulped a bit before she shut her eyes and sighed, her finger relented and he nervously, slowly stood back up.

"Zorua, there's better ways to make friends, and there's plenty you can do with your talents that isn't mean spirited...there's...fun tricks! Fun illusions...when this is all over, why don't you try that to mend some fences with people...i'd like to see a few myself too." She gave him a gentle smile, hoping he'd take the advice and the boost. For his part he started blushing. Fun tricks? Like what...he looked at his paws before he slowly, methodically moved them back and a small glittering rainbow arched up from both points, connecting together. He looked away slightly before the warmth on his back returned and Celebi was stroking him. "See...that's nice Zorua...pokemon would love to see stuff like this." Celebi said, he looked at her and she was giving him and the rainbow the biggest smile he'd seen from her yet. "I-" Zorua gulped. "I'll keep it in mind..." He timidly said, embarrassed by the attention. He felt awkward with this praise, inch high or normal he'd probably feel just as awkward. Celebi noted this and considered it a block she'd help him get over through this. 'Though he isn't done yet...' She thought.
12233222221312222211122.title: Reasoning

choices: It took some effort, but she found him
By some luck for Zorua, he won and play fair
Zorua won alright.....but did he cheat?
122332222213122222111222.content:
"Well, break time is over." Celebi says as she stops stroking Zorua's back and gently picks him up. "And since you are in a more appropriate size, this shall be a another physical challenge."

Hearing those words made Zorua worry a little. "You're not going to make me climb all the way to the top of your head?" Zorua ask as he doesn't know if he has it in him to climb another mountain. Celebi hears this and remembers the climbing challenge last night, she giggle a little.

"No no, as amusing it would be to see you struggle to climb again, this next one is something even you surely have played before." Celebi says as she walks to the center of her room. "You and I shall be playing hide and seek."

"Ok, that doesn't sound bad." Zorua says as he felt Celebi lowering him to the ground.

"I would hold that thought, some rules this time." Celebi says as she set the small fox down. "First off, i will count to a hundread, you have one shot to pick a spot and stay there. Second, no leaving this room. Third, you can't hide on me. Oh and before i forget~" A large grin can be seen on the fairy's face and Zorua can't help but be nervous. "I still have to punish you if you fail in some way, so let's raise the stakes. Your current size, you win the game, I'll grow you another inch." Zorua couldn't help but pout that he would only get a inch if he wins.

"You're going to make me work to earn my size back, aren't you?" Zorua ask as the look on Celebi's face was to enough to convince him he's right. "*sigh* And what happens if i lose?"

"I shrink you." Celebi says bluntly and Zorua couldn't help feel shock and scared.

"You're going to shrink me back that small!" Zorua say as he terrify of the thought of being a nanoscopic speck.

"Arceus above, no. Listen, i wanted shrink you, but I didn't mean to shrink you that much. And to be honest, i should have been more responsible and grow you that instant, and I'm sorry." Celebi says as she does feel a little guilty of shrinking Zorua to such a scale. "But back to what i wanted to say, i will shrink you, but only to a millimeter, and that shall be the smallest you ever be from now if you keep losing the next games." Zorua does felt a little relief to hear that, until he felt a heavy force that was Celebi's finger on his back and pinning him down. "But most important thing i want to say," Celebi says in a tune that scare Zorua a little, "No cheating. If i catch you cheating, like using your illusion, i will change my mind about not shrinking you to nano size, understand?"

This was a complete buff on Celebi, she didn't want to put Zorua through that experience again, mainly because she was getting tire of using the microscope. If Zorua does cheat, she would just to do something to the little fox that is harmless and embarrassing to him. Fortunately for the fairy, Zorua believes her bluff. "Yes Celi." Zorua say weakly as he felt Celebi lifting her finger off him.

"Good," She says in a chipper tune as she stands up to her full height. Seeing Celebi from the ground made Zorua feel even smaller somehow as he watches Celebi close her eyes. "Time to start hiding. One...two...three..." Celebi started counting and Zorua start to run in search of a good hiding spot. "98...99....100, ready or not hear i come." Celebi say as she start her search for Zorua
122332222213122222111222.title: Time for a friendly game

choices: So Celebi gives him the win, and an inch
But Celebi considers it her win, reducing him to a milimeter
So she decides to call this one a wash
1223322222131222221112222.content:
Celebi opened her eyes after the count. "Hope you hid well Zorua~i'm coming for you~"She said in a sing song voice. She immediately looked under her bed, seeing nothing. "Hmm...i'd imagine he's more clever than that." She said to herself. "Better not be cheating!" She intoned.


'Yeah, yeah, i'm not' Zorua thought. He WAS proud of his hiding spot though. While she had been counting he made a mad dash for her book shelf. Just barely able to climb onto the bottom shelf of it he found a spot he could wedge in and had wormed his way to the back, hiding in the small cranny space between the back board and the indented pages of a hardcover. 'No way she finds me here, and I did this one legit' He thought, quite proud of himself.


Celebi had spent the past 15 minutes turning up cushions, looking through small spaces on her floor, searching everything she could think of before sighing. "Okay, fine Zorua, if you aren't cheating I give u-"

*GROWL*

'...you've GOT to be kidding me!!!' Zorua thought. His stomach growled!? Seriously!? He bent over, tummy full from the berry and cookie bits he'd had. 'Of all the stinking times!?' He thought as light filtered in from Celebi pulling the book from the shelf, seeing the tiny dark pokemon in his hiding spot. "Found~you~" Celebi said in a sing song voice. "Okay, this one isn't fair! I had you beat before my stomach decided to betray me...speaking of...can you uh..." Zorua said before leaning down a bit. Celebi for her part turned red and quickly picked him up before putting him on a napkin and leaving the room. "...it isn't like I can help it..." he murmured to no one since she was already gone, feeling quite embarrassed himself.

A few minutes passed and they sheepishly moved on from that before Celebi returned to the matter at hand. "So Zorua...I did think about it while...THAT happened...you hid well, i'll give you that, and I commend you for playing fair..."
1223322222131222221112222.title: Does this count as a win?

choices: Zorua manages to escape Celebi
Celebi manages to catch Zorua
12233222221312222211122223.content:
Zorua's heart starts to fill up with hope as Celebi speaks.

Sadly, the fairy says something else,
"But, technically, I did find you..." she says.

"Yes! But I wasn't my fault! I can't exactly control my stomach!" he retorts in desperation, dreading the chance that Celebi wants to shrink him down again.

The legendary shrugs as she offers a sigh.
"I know," she replies.
"And that's why we're calling it a draw." she says, adopting a small smile.

Zorua sighs in relief. Sure, Celebi isn't going to give him the inch, but she also won't shrink him down. As long as he wasn't reduced down to a millimetre, it was fine with him.

"BUT!" the fairy says excitedly, her smile growing wider. Zorua looks at her, not quite liking the excitement in her voice.
"On with the next game!" she exclaims, picking Zorua up.

"From what I've heard, Zorua, no one was able to catch you after you pulled your pranks... well, except me I guess..." Celebi says proudly, placing Zorua in the floor before standing back at full height. Which, from Zorua's reduced stature, was quite impressive.

"I want to see just how good you are at running. D'you think you can do it?" she asks rhetorically, fully knowing that the small fox had a reputation - everyone who was a victim of his pranks told that they didn't manage to catch him. Although some did mention that he used his illusions to escape.

Zorua looked at her silently, mouth wide open, before it cracked up in a toothy grin.

He would win this for sure! This was what he was best at!

"I'm in." he says confidently. Celebi smirks.
"Glad to see you excited, Zorua," she says.
"No illusions, and you can't hide, while I can't fly or use psychic powers. Sounds fair?" she asks.

Zorua's smirk shrank a bit as he thought about it for a brief moment, before nodding. Celebi giggled.
"Okay! Fifteen minutes, Zorua. You avoid getting caught, you win. I catch you, I win." she explains, before smiling brightly.

"Game on!"
12233222221312222211122223.title: Moving on to the next game

choices: Cat and mouse
Hide and seek
Planet exploring
1223322222131223.content:
Celebi couldn't believe what she is feeling; excitement, happiness, she bit her lips in elation. Sure Zorua's pranks, though somewhat mean or in most cases annoying, were harmless, Celebi was the one that most people ask to do something. And now she is and it feels great. Just the tiniest of movement she makes can easily rock Zorua's world. Part of her wants to go all out on the punishment and see just how much of Zorua she can shrink before she completely losses track of him. The other part on the other hand want to start the games, see just how much she can push Zorua before she thinks he has enough, or until she gets bored.

"Ok Zorua," Celebi's voice booms down on the terrified fox, scared to look up at his tormentor. "I think its time to see what to do to you. And i think i know what we can do." A smile can be seen on Celebi's fox, scaring the fox, which makes the fairy more giddy.

"What we going to do is something simple, we are going to play..."
1223322222131223.title: A Estatic Time Goddess

choices: A Lopunny
A Different Pokemon
122332222213123.content:
Zorua held tightly onto the green landscape as it shifted and the background began to jostle and move, the movements so intense and dizzying he was beginning to think he could be flung off any second. Thankfully the movement slows as Celebi steadies her hand, giving Zorua a chance to see what the planet-like Pokemon was doing as she reached for a phone with her other hand. "I think I have a good idea for what your punishment will be," She cooed. "As much as I would love to play with you and punish you myself, I think I've got the perfect test for you." Before Zorua could protest a flurry of deafening beeping sounds come from the device as she starts to dial someone. A brief silence follows as she waits for the person on the other end to pick up.

Zorua covers his ears with his paws as Celebi begins to talk into her phone at her normal speaking level, a thunderous roar to the shrunken Pokemon. "Hey! How are you doing?" She boomed into the phone. "Are you free? We haven't hung out in a while." A few moments passed as she listened to the person on the other end. "Hmm, Hmm, yeah. Absolutely, come on over! I'll get the tea ready."

With that the phone clicked off and Celebi shot a kind smile towards Zorua, or at least the general area he was on her hand. "Alright, Zorua. As I said before I've got a test for you. If you pass it I may consider returning you to your normal size and letting you go." As she paused however her smile took on a more mischievous tone which sent a shiver up Zorua's spine. "As you heard I invited a friend of mine over. One that you might remember, actually. Anyway, I'm going to give you to them and then pick you back up the next time we meet." The world started to spin as Celebi began moving to prepare tea for her guest. "One condition though. I'm not going to tell them about you."

Zorua felt his chest tighten as he thought about the implications of his punishment. Not only was he being passed over to another mystery Pokemon for an unknown amount of time, they wouldn't even know he was there. Once again the world around him began to move as Celebi started grabbing cups and spoons from a nearby cupboard. With everything laid out she set a kettle to boil before she spoke down to Zorua in a soft voice. "And I do suggest sticking to them like glue, my little trickster. If you decide to get lost somewhere then you can safely assume that you'll will be that size forever." Her so-casually-delivered sentence filled Zorua with a terror that made his body flush hot and his skin prickle.

Zorua looked up at Celebi and desperately begged. "B-but I would be dead meat then! And if they don't know I'm there-"

He was cut off as Celebi let out a sigh, his tiny voice falling upon deaf ears. "Don't worry, I won't leave you with them for too long, I guess. Just until I think you learned your lesson." In Zorua's eyes he had already learned his lesson but it seemed Celebi was intent on dishing out her justice. Zorua really hoped she wasn't vengeful enough to put his life in danger for too long but different scenarios began playing over in his head. He might be able to last a day or two but could he survive if it got stretched out over a week? He held onto the green landscape of Celebi's hand as she delicately prepared the tea for her guest and before long a wooden knocking was heard from the front door.

"Looks like my friend is here~" Celebi sang. Zorua held on and watched the door in morbid curiosity. What Pokemon would he be given to?
122332222213123.title: Celebi invites over a friend

choices: lopunny made home without anything happening for Zorua
Something goes wrong for Zorua before Lopunny made home
Lopunny decides to look around Celebi's town first before going home.
1223322222131231.content:
"Celebi~" A cheery Lopunny, whose already taller than Celebi by two feet, barges in the house as she prepares to give Celebi a hug. Zorua panics as the new walking talking planets walks towards the other looming planet he's on at break neck speed. Celebi had to close her fist to not risk Zorua flying off once the cheerful bunny hugs her.

"It's good to see you again." Celebi struggles to say as Lopunny hugs her tightly.

"It's been about a year i believe since you and I last spoke." She says as she sets Celebi down. She looks around and sees the tea set already made. "Oh, I see you already had things set up." Lopunny says as she makes her way to the tea....only to trip and fall on her face. "I'm ok."

Celebi got a little nervous for Zorua's safety as she forgot that Lopunny is a klutz and is a little dizty at times. "Maybe I should have called Frostglass for this one."

One hour later...

"And so far the town has been excellent." Lopunny says as she describes the town she lives in. The two pokemon has been spending the last hour getting caught up of each other and how things has been around the towns they lived in. "By the way, I thought I heard of people saying to beware a little prankster around the forest. Yet so far, the only thing i have seen were a slowpoke and a nosepass giving each other a staring contest."

"Oh, I'm sure they must mean another pokemon that lives in a different town." Celebi says as she can't help but wonder how many pokemon has told others about Zorua's mischief. "This town is actually very quiet."

"Oh phewy, I was hoping to at least see what type of prankster the little guy is." Lopunny says in disappointment as she was hoping to experience something exciting in the quiet town.

"Oh trust me, you don't want to experince his pranks." Celebi says quietly as she looks at her close fist. 'Zorua has to be scare or nervous about being there this whole time,' Celbi thought, though in actuality, Zorua is extremely bored from listening the two living planets talking to each other nonstop.

"Well, anyways, you should come by next week. My town is having a festival, there will be games, food, and some guys you and I can dance with." Lopunny says in her cheery tone as she sounds like she can't wait for the festival.

"Um, maybe skipping the last one," Celebi says as she has no interest in dancind, mainly because she's not great at doing it, "I'll be happy to take you on your offer." Celebi says with a smile as she also can't help wonder what Zorua will have to put up with in that time frame. Meanwhile, Lopunny bouncing up and down as she cheers in joy. Then she heard a clock chime and looks at the time.

"Oh dear, I have to head home." Lopunny says as she gots up and gives Celebi another hug. Celebi returns the hug as she takes this as a opportunity. She quickly opens her fist and pats down Lopunny's back. Zorua felt what Celebi is trying to do and tries desperately to hold on to the fairy's hand. Saddly, his attempt was fruitless as the sheer force of Celebi just moving her hand was enough to dislodge the nano fox off her hand into the back of the massive bunny. Zorua screams in fear, flailing his paws as thousands of brown strands of fur, each are as thick as a skyscraper is tall, passes him until he lands on one strand of fur on the rabbit's back. Zorua looks around, lost as he examines his new world, a walking, cheerful, ditzy rabbit whose also a klutz. "Got to go, bye." The cheerful ball of fluff says as she heads out, unaware of her new passenger. Lopunny left rather quickly before Celebi had time to say something else. She watch as her friend is already distant away. She smiles as she looks at her hand, no trace of Zorua at all.

"Have fun in you travel, Zorua." Celebi says as she looks at the back of Lopunny. All she does is hope Zorua is capable to last a week as she closes her door.
1223322222131231.title: A Cheerful Companion

choices: Before anything else happens, Zorua passes out
Zorua has enough energy to do what he wants, raise hell
Celebi shrinks him back down before he can pull anything
12233222221312311.content:
Lopunny skipped back to her town happily, looking forward to her friend coming to visit her for the festival next week. She even did a little twirl.

-

Movement. That's all Zorua knew at the moment and he knew that's all he would know for a while. His environment of brown, the cacophony of sound, all of it assaulted his senses like an unyielding battering ram as he desperately clung with teeth and claws to whatever he could find traction on. As she moved his world also spun a few times, nearly sending him flying. He clung until he thought his mouth would bleed and held tight though.

'Okay Celebi, this is your game, oh i'll survive it...I will...' He thought bitterly. His motivation, throw it back in that smug green girl's face.

-

"And so she's coming to our festival in 5 days, it's going to be so grand!" Lopunny was bragging to her friend, Smoochum about Celebi as she did a little twirl with sparkles in her eye before losing her footing and falling on her butt, she giggled a little.

"Lopunny, you have got to be the biggest walking accident I know." Smoochum said as she helped her friend up.

-

Another quake, another fall. Zorua had found ways to adapt to clinging when he needed to, but right now he was scrounging for anything to eat, anything edible at all but there was nothing. He was tired too. She moved in her sleep so he had to be constantly alert, he was getting maybe an hour a night if lucky he thought. His ears had also been ringing constantly from the sound, he only hoped they still worked when this was all said and done...if he made it.

'Still so long to go...i'll make it...i'll make it...' He thought bitterly. He would give up pranking for sure after this, he never wanted this to happen again...except one. One pokemon would have his ire. For eternity.

"Celebi..." he spat out venomously.

-

Lopunny was humming in the shower as she scrubbed at her head. "Tomorrow~singing~food~dancing~" She sung out as she scrubbed at her head.

-

Zorua dreaded this the most of any of her activities as his world was utter blackness, movement and chaos, trying to find any purchase on the slick wet surface as he was literally bombarded with oceans of water. He somehow had managed to avoid drowning and he had to attribute it to never staying in one place at one time. He just had to avoid the floor and ending up on her hand, or getting crushed.

'Over soon...over soon...over soon...' He thought, almost on the verge of losing it. He was so close, so desperately tantalizingly close.

He wouldn't fail now.

-

"Celi! You made it, i'm so glad~" Lopunny sang as she hopped over to her friend. It was a beautiful day, and many booths were set up for games. Celebi giggled nervously and said. "U-um yeah, of course...just no dancing, okay?" She said as Lopunny giggled. "Oh, we'll see about that~" She said as she went in for a hug. Celebi quickly felt out with her senses to see...a third presence was with them, very precisely she found his strand and grabbed it before the hug broke. "I'll be right back Lopunny...business calls." Lopunny blushed a bit at this before muttering. "TMI girl..."

-

Celebi found a clearing and set the strand down, secretly relieved that he'd lasted, She was scared he couldn't do a whole week and was trying to find contingencies to at least find him if he didn't. "Well Zorua, I must say i'm impressed, I didn't entirely believe you'd last. Still, guess you've earned your life I suppose, so i'll give it to you." She stated in a lecturing as she grew him back, expecting a mad Zorua, a bitter Zorua, a scared Zorua and what she got was...a very much not moving Zorua. She gasped. "Are you...are you breathing...?" She asked slowly as she approached him, slowly he started moving, trying to stagger to his feet before falling again, she went to try and support him but he just growled at her, causing her to back off. "I-i'd watch it if I were you..." She said, more meekly than she anticipated as he half crawled away from her.

"Hate....you..." His rough voice coughed out as he crawled away from her. Celebi was sure he couldn't even make 50 feet. He made it 20 before collapsing. She went to him. "Listen, let me go get you some water." she started moving and Zorua's eyes fell on the distant festival before chuckling. Celebi heard this and turned around to see him. "Zorua! Don't you dare think it, have you learned nothing!?" She said as he chuckled more before coughing. "No...pranks..." She sighed before he finished. "But...retribution...Lopunny...you..." He spat out before starting his crawl, deliriously chuckling as...
12233222221312311.title: Hell week

choices: The festival went alright and Zorua was able to behave throught the night
Something interrupted the festival....that wasn't Zorua
Everyone is having fun, buuuut, some size related mischief happened
122332222213123111.content:
Zorua looks like he was ready to make a mad dash towards the festival to where Celebi was thinking to shrink him back to his nano size. However, she stops herself as she realizes the Zorua wasn't going to make a inch before collasping. Zorua immediatly drops to the ground, collasping from exhustion, he barely ate or sleep the entire the time he spent with Lopunny.
