"...Guess a week was far from pushing it." Celebi says with a sheepish smile as she kind of felt guilty for leaving Zorua thay long with her friend. She bends down to poke him in the belly to see if he's budgung or not until she heard a familiar voice.

"Celebi, how much longer?" Lopunny says as the impatient bunny skips towards to where Celebi is. She stops once she spots Celebi and Zorua. "Oh, whose this cute little guy, and what happened to him?"

"Oh um, his name is Zorua, and well...he kind of exhausted himself." Celebi says, not wanting to explain to Lopunny what really happened. "He's from the same town as i am."

"Oh, so he's your date for the festival?" Lopunny says with a smirk as she looks at the now cherry color head Celebi.

"N-no, I'm just watching over him," Celebi says with a deep red blush on her face. "More like babysitting someone whose the same age as me."

"Hate you more...." Zorua says, was able to gain some of his conscious long enough to hear Celebi's remark. The two girls laugh as Lopunny picks the tired fox up.

"Soooooo....he's free for the night?" Lopunny says as she picks him up from the ground and hugs him tightly. Celebi hears the question and can't tell how to respond to that question.

"Um....sure...?" Celebi says as she has no idea if she should let her friend take Zorua after the week he had. Heck, she doesn't know if she should confess to Lopunny that she practically dump Zorua litteraly on her last week. It didn't matter as the cheerful rabbit hugs Zorua and grabs Celebi's hand.

"Well then come on, the night is young and there's far too much to do." Lopunny says as she drags the two smaller pokemon into the festival.
122332222213123111.title: Passing out before the fun starts

choices: Celebi lets him go
Celebi goes after him
1223322222131231111.content:
Lopunny dragged the two into the festival, blissfully unaware of the seething fury Zorua had beneath his tired face, though it didn't escape Celebi. 'Just behave Zorua, and we'll go home...' She thought nervously, hoping he didn't say anything.

As time wore on they got food in him though and Lopunny even got him to participate in some games. He was coldly polite about it but not much out. Lopunny made a few comments on him being too shy and opening up around Celebi, making her sweat even more.

"Alright you two~ I'm gonna go take care of something, you should mingle! You're friends right, be back~" Lopunny said as the sun was setting, and Zorua had at least regained the strength to stand, though he still looked frazzled, frayed, tired...and mad as all get out. Celebi gulped.

"So uh...I might've..."

"Don't.Talk.To.Me." Zorua gritted between his teeth.

"Look, i'm trying to say that i'm-"

"You're what? Oh, are you so SO sorry Celebi? Oh are you now!? Sorry that you almost DROWNED IN SHOWER WATER 7 TIMES ZORUA!? SORRY THAT I MADE YOU AN IMPERCEPTIBLE SPECK AND LEFT YOU TO SURVIVE ON A WALKING ACCIDENT ZORUA!? SORRY THAT I NEARLY STARVED YOU TO DEATH OR KILLED YOU FROM EXHAUSTION ZORUA IF YOU DIDN'T GET CRUSHED FIRST!? THAT IT CELEBI!? OH, BUT I DESERVE IT FOR SOME DUMB PIDOVE PRANK OR SOME DUMB PIT TRAPS OR ILLUSIONS THAT DIDN'T ACTUALLY HURT ANYONE! SCREW OFF!" He was shouting, and Celebi was holding her paws over her mouth. She didn't know if anyone had heard his outburst and Zorua far from cared as he stalked off.

"Quite frankly if I didn't NEED your directions to get home from this dumb festival and get away from that half wit bunny i'd be fine with NEVER seeing you again! By the way, that's what I want when we get back! Pranks are done, i've thrown in the towel there, don't want to set off your twisted and psychotic sense of 'justice' again after all!" He finished as he rounded a corner away from her, leaving a stunned Celebi. She hung her head...and thought of the smug grins and laughter Zorua always wore, or the last look of fear he had when he was pebble sized before she shrunk him even more and then...the venom in his eyes now, the pure unfiltered hate. She had broke him, hadn't she? But he wasn't gonna prank anyone anymore, so this was good...right?
1223322222131231111.title: Rage breaking point

choices: Zorua wakes up with Celebi and Lopunny with him, normal sized
Zorua wakes up with Celebi and Lopunny with him, but he's shrunken down
Zorua wakes up alone in somewhere unfamiliar
12233222221312311112.content:
Zorua rounded the corner, intent on getting away from this dumb festival, that dumb bunny, and the horrible pokemon that put him through all this, eyes were on him, whether they knew about his outburst, heard it, or just saw his crazed, tired face and were curious he didn't know, he just wanted away from other pokemon, he wanted to sleep and forget, he wanted a bed.

Celebi for her part was trying to keep her eyes on him in the crowd as she followed him. She didn't know how she would make things better by doing this, but she couldn't leave him out of her sights. Was she afraid he'd pull something? Was she concerned for him? She wasn't really sure, and she was afraid to talk to him and set him off again, but for now she would tail him at least, if anything he said he did need her to figure out the way home so she needed to know where he was for that...right?

A rumbling interrupted both of their thoughts as a Snorlax walked by, looking blissfully towards a food stall as it slowly edged closer towards them. The crowd of pokemon dispersed to make way for it, and Celebi cleared to one side of the road too before she noticed that Zorua...had stopped moving. He just stood there as the Snorlax slowly made its way towards him, saying or doing nothing, he looked like he had tensed up before he started muttering and clinging to the ground, it was hard to make out what he was saying though. The Snorlax, noticing Zorua doing this, merely shrugged as he stepped over Zorua and continued on, at this point a circle started to form around Zorua as he kept muttering something.

"What is he doing?"

"What a weirdo..."

Celebi made her way through the crowd to get into the ring formed around him and she slowly inched closer, in case she set him off. Now she could hear what he was saying though. "She's moving...she's moving again...moving...moving..." His face looked far more pale than it should, and his eyes were clearly not there as his claws were absolutely dug into the ground. She got a good look, without any of the intentional hate in his eyes, at just how...tired he looked. And she slowly looked at his paws to see that even clinging, they were having trouble staying still or finding purchase, he looked ready to collapse from a slight breeze. "moving...moving...hold on...make it Zorua...make it home Zorua..." He was muttering like a madman and suddenly another pokemon came through the crowd. Lopunny went over to Zorua to pick him up and said. "Alright, show's over everyone, continue to enjoy the festival!" As she made her way through the crowd, carrying the smaller pokemon with her. Celebi slowly followed...unsure of what she would do.

-

Zorua was stone silent in Lopunny's grasp. They had found a small clearing slightly away from the festival and Celebi floated in front of him. He was practically catatonic, though she couldn't know if it was exhaustion, trauma, or both. "Is he okay?" Lopunny asked, blissfully unaware that she was the other half of his issue right now. Celebi shook her head. "I don't...I don't know if he is. Right now I think I know what he needs though..." She said as she floated closer. He looked like he was barely clinging to consciousness as she got a look at him before saying. "You can sleep now Zorua, no more movement." Something seemed to register in his head as he looked at Celebi, she didn't know if he saw her or not though, he looked...confused by something before his eyes closed and he drifted off to sleep.

"What happened to him anyway?" Lopunny asked, curious. Celebi looked down. "If I told you, you'd just feel bad too." Celebi said, confusing her friend. "Want to tell me anyway?" She sat down, still holding the sleeping dark type. "If you screwed something up, or we screwed something up, maybe together we can make something right, right?" Lopunny said enthusiastically and Celebi sighed before sitting down. "Well Zorua is...maybe now was, a horrible trickster from our village..." Celebi began, as she went into detail about at least what she knew had happened to him.
12233222221312311112.title: Broken

choices: Subjecting herself to the same punishment that she put Zorua through.
Time traveling back and stopping herself from making such a sadistic choice.
122332222213123111121.content:
It appeared to be the beginning of the night.

This was the first thing Zorua noticed as he finally began to stir from his sleep. Moonlight trickled in from a window across the room from the bed he was on, giving the unfamiliar bedroom he was in a faint glow. Needless to say, Zorua was a bit bemused at the fact that he was in some room he didn't recognize, but figured it had something to do with the one who left him feeling enraged. And speak of the devil, that blue-eyed monster had just opened the bedroom door, flanked by the Lopunny who had unconsciously put him through hell. Zorua instantly turned away from them, not even wanting to associate with either, but they responded by both standing on the side of the bed. Knowing he was likely not going to get any alone time until he listened to whatever they were going to start on, he begrudgingly turned back to face them.

"What?" Zorua spat, wanting to get it over with.

"I've been talking with Lopunny, and..." Celebi began. "I just wanted to make sure you were feeling alright..."

"Alright" was a cruel overstatement for Zorua's current state. Sure, his body was a lot better, now that he had eaten and gotten some rest, but his mental state left a lot to be desired. He glowered at the two girls before him, letting silence overtake the room. Upon further inspection, Lopunny seemed to have been bawling earlier, as her fur was stained with tear streaks. 'At least someone here has some semblance of emotion,' Zorua mentally mused.

"We can head back to the village tomorrow, if you're feeling any better," the smaller girl continued.

"...Lopunny, do you mind giving us a moment?" Zorua intoned. "I have some words I'd like to say to her and her alone."

"O-okay, I guess..." the bunny girl replied, before stumbling towards the door. She went through and closed it, and Zorua waited for a moment before fixating his eyes directly on Celebi, non-verbally asking for eye contact. She obliged, fearing the worst.

"So, you're wondering if I'm 'alright', is that it? You put me through a week of hell, then just want me to kind of shrug it off and solider on, is that it?" Zorua coldly began. "You think that after all that, I can just move on with my life, act like none of this ever happened, is that it?!" His voice began to rise, but he didn't care, he had a lot to get off of his chest, and he didn't even care if Lopunny heard at this point. "Sure, I may have caused some physical discomfort for a lot of people, and a whole lot of them fear me now, but NONE OF MY PRANKS EVER EVEN CAME CLOSE TO KILLING ANYONE! YOU'RE STILL IN SCHOOL AND YOU DECIDED THAT THE BEST WAY TO DEAL WITH A PRANKSTER IS MANSLAUGHTER! HOW IS IT SOMEONE SMART LIKE YOU THOUGHT THAT JUST LETTING YOUR FRIEND UNAWARELY KILL SOMEONE, OR FAILING THAT, SCARRING THEM FOR LIFE, WAS A GOOD CHOICE?!"

Ironically, despite the fact that Zorua was formerly the small party here, his rant was causing Celebi to shrink back (figuratively). She wasn't expecting another emotional outburst from Zorua so soon after the last one, but this one was much worse. Now that he'd had time to sleep on what Celebi had done and her personality, he had concocted a rant that not only was severely scathing, but also entirely true. She was, in fact, the smartest girl in school, and yet she had done this?

Who was she anymore?

Celebi opened her mouth, but her rebuttal never came. She didn't have an argument for any of what Zorua had said. Ashamed, she simply turned away and sat down, hiding her crying eyes in her hands. Zorua felt a little sympathetic for her, but only a little, and turned back to face the wall next to the bed. Celebi, however, wanted to fix what she had caused... but how?
122332222213123111121.title: Owning Up

choices: He sighed "I don't want anyone else to go through that hell, not even you."
He coldly nodded "Do it."
1223322222131231111211.content:
Celebi turned to him, tears in her eyes, but he remains stalwart and cold in his gaze, she looked down. "What I did to you...it was wrong, I realize that...I meant it to scare you, deter you from doing anything like that again...but somewhere along the way I thought it'd be funny if you...struggled like that, I didn't think anything of it, didn't think of you being on your own for a week in those harsh conditions with no food, no water...I was so stupid. Stupid stupid stupid..." She said, trying to see him between wiping the tears from her eyes. He still said nothing, but she sniffled and continued.

"Lopunny...when I told her what you went through, after what happened out there with you...freezing up in the street like that, she gave it to me too, asked 'how could you?' over and over before she looked at you and started to cry and saying if she'd known she'd have helped you in a heartbeat over the week, if only she'd known she kept saying..." Celebi at this point had dried her eyes enough to look at Zorua's face soften a little, but not much.

"Well she didn't know...if anything I can at least say she has a heart..." Zorua muttered bitterly, not intending to let Celebi off with just this apology.

"Zorua I...I want to make this right...i'm smarter than this, I should've been anyway, I should've been kinder, I should've...I don't know...I should've at least been more fair to you even if I was mad at your prank...I abused my power, and I need to know that. I need to not forget that as you'll never forget it...that's why i'm going to do to me what I did to you..." Zorua at this snapped to attention with her. "You're going to...what?" He asked in disbelief.

"I'll shrink myself down, to that nanoscopic size, on an unaware pokemon for a week, no food, no water...just trying to make do...I won't grow myself back for a week, not until I know what you went through...and then I hope you can look me in the eye again." She said staring at the floor. Zorua for his part looked flabbergasted. 'She wants to go through that...no...she doesn't want to, same as I didn't. Hmph, well enjoy miss smartypants, I hope you enjoy hell as much as I did' He thought bitterly before imagining her cowering like he did every time Lopunny turned her head, or tripped, or all the tears he shed just hoping the next day would be the 7th. The endless hours of hunger and fatigue, refusing to let himself sleep because it may be the end. 'Can I...want another pokemon to go through with that...even her?' He thought.
1223322222131231111211.title: Zorua's Dilemma

choices: Celebi goes through with it anyway, to make it up to Zorua.
Zorua manages to convince Celebi to find another way to make it up.
12233222221312311112111.content:
There comes a time when people say, "that's a fate I wouldn't wish on my worst enemy", and this was that time for Zorua. Even though Celebi was the one who had put him through hell, he honestly believed that putting herself through it was a fate she didn't deserve, so he let her know this.

"I don't want anyone else to go through that hell, not even you." Zorua sighed, shocking Celebi. The time-traveler honestly believed that she deserved this; after all, Zorua had made it abundantly clear that he wanted her to do something to make up for his time in hell, and this was poetic justice at its finest. Seeing even the steely trickster showing sympathy for her, even after what she had done to him, just made Celebi cry even more. At that point, she felt as though she didn't deserve any sympathy, and was resolved to go through with her earlier statement.

"Even if you don't think I deserve to go through this..." Celebi began through her tears, "I think I do. Your outbursts have made it clear that you've gone through hell and back, and I'm not willing to live my life carefree knowing I put you through what I did. This is only what I deserve."

"No, it's not. Nobody deserves to go through that. I don't care how much you think it's the perfect penance, it's a punishment you don't deserve."

Celebi was listening to him, but wasn't sure if she agreed or not. Was there any other option?
12233222221312311112111.title: Zorua's Sympathies and Celebi's Compassion

choices: Zorua leaves Celebi there. She made it up, no need to see her ever again
Zorua carefully brings Celebi to his forest, moved by a fit of pity
122332222213123111121111.content:
Celebi carefully repeated Zorua's words in her mind, pondering if there was any other choice.

But, she decided, there wasn't any.

To be truly forgiven by Zorua, she first had to experience what he had. Then, she could finally apologize to him.

The fairy shook her head as she started to tear up again. Zorua looked at her.
"Celi-" she interrupted.
"... No Zorua... I'm doing it..."

She said nothing more. Zorua saw her taking a few deep breaths, before forming that familiar cyan ball in her paws and shooting it in the sky. Then, she placed her paws over her eyes and started crying harder, before the ball fell upon her.

Zorua blinked.

Before his eyes, Celebi shrunk down to size, until she completely disappeared from his sight, until he couldn't hear her anymore. Narrowing his eyes, he could actually see a green dot on top of Lopunny's bed... but he was distracted when Lopunny herself opened the door once more.

"... Are you..." she stopped, noticing that Celebi was no longer there.
"Where is Celebi...?" she asked with closing concern as she walked into the room... before tripping and falling face-down on the hard floor.

Zorua sighed, not sure how to feel.

"She left... told she had something important to do - so important that she left through the window... She told me to tell you she said bye." he intoned, remembering that Lopunny was a bit airhead.

In fact, the bipedal bunny nodded as she got back on her feet.

"... And... you? Are you going to stay... you need rest..." she offered. Zorua shook his head.
"No... I-" he abruptly stopped as he causally looked down.

The green dot was gone.

"... I'll be on my way now." he told.

He was big, no more Celebi to deal with.

He was free.

--

Celebi kept crying harder and harder as she gripped the flesh of the monolithic pokemon with all her strength. There was fur, surrounding her, but she didn't want to hold onto it. Nor she wanted to fly.

She had to know what she put Zorua through for a whole week before growing back.

The world around her shook endlessly, the pokemon was probably walking.

She mustered all her strength to climb up a bit and buried her face into the flesh, crying.

--

Zorua walked back to his forest. Finally, after a week of hell, he was seeing his beloved forest again.

All he wanted now was get something in his stomach, get some proper sleep and forget Celebi and Lopunny forever.

As for pranks... he had been inactive for a week... should have he resumed? He didn't know... after all, Celebi could shrink him again and keep him as a pet or something...

... Whenever she returned...

If she returned.

--

Three days.

She had been clinging for three days already.

Celebi felt sore, and the energy was abandoning her. She wanted to sleep, badly, but she knew that if she did, it would be over for her... sure, she always could grow herself back to normal, but she wanted to earn that.

Her stomach growled loudly, now it did incessantly, asking to be filled after three days of starvation; her throat was dry and she was quite certain that she didn't have anymore tears in her to cry again.

It was a miracle that she was still able to blink.

She had to go on.

Another four days...

--

While eating food in his underground cave, Zorua wondered how Celebi was doing... certainly not good, but was she still alive at least?

He didn't care that much, but something in him made his mind travel back to the fairy.

Was this pity?

He never pitied none of his victims... but now, he knew what Celebi was probably going through, he experienced it...

He shook his head - why was it so hard to rid it of Celebi? She lingered in his thoughts while he wanted her out. He hated her! She was getting what she deserved!

... The look on her face.

She was crying, genuinely sorrowful for what she did.

Zorua sighed - he had attempted to change her mind, but she was stubborn enough to willingly go through what the fox had already gone.

He sighed, and resumed eating, hoping to bury his pity under an avalanche of food.

--

She lost the track of time.

When did this all began? She didn't know.

She only knew that Zorua was right - this was hell. She was slowly starving to death, and if she didn't die from the lack of food, she'd die of dehydration or from the lack of sleep.

Because Celebi couldn't dare to sleep, not in these circumstances. She opted instead to close her eyes for at least five minutes a day. This was the closest thing to a rest she could do.

She was sure that, if she closed her eyes for more than five minutes, she would never open them again.

And this was only the tip of the iceberg.

Her world was constantly shaking and booming, and she had to hold on tight not too fall off. Her paws felt sore after so much time of clinging to the hot flesh - the fur around her made things even worse - but she couldn't let go.

Celebi's only hope was that she made it... then, she was going to crawl to Zorua's feet and beg for forgiveness.

Only that thought made her want to go on.

Nothing else mattered.

--

Five days.

Celebi had been gone for five days now.

Zorua sighed.
"If she's still alive, she only has two more days ahead of her..." he mused. He had desperately tried to rid his head from her, but the harder he tried, the stronger those thoughts came back.

He couldn't fight it.

Zorua was distracted as he noted a pokemon walking through his forest.

Nosepass.

The dark type snickered from his hiding spot in the bushes - he had a rope somewhere, the rock type could be hung by his giant nose...

Again, Celebi re-entered his thoughts.

Zorua sighed and laid back, deciding to let Nosepass go... for today.

"Ya saw this Celi? You better not bother me anymore..." he told, before starting to snicker.
"If you ever come back from hell."

--

Seven days.

Now it was a week since Celebi shrunk down to that nanoscopic size.

Zorua was somewhat expectant, he wanted to see in what pitiful state she was in.

He waited and waited for half the day, before deciding to head to the village. Wherever she was, she was coming back today no?

... Maybe she even spent the week with a Grimer! Or a Stunky!

That'd be hilarious!

...

However, Celebi didn't come back.

The day went on uneventfully - save for the glares he received, like he always did when he came to the village - and there was no trace of Celebi.

"... Aw come on! It's been a week! Where's that green-" he couldn't finish.

He felt a wave of heat on his side, before a cyan flash erupted...

Blinded, he closed his eyes.

When Zorua opened them again, an exhausted Celebi was laying on the ground in front of him, looking barely alive. She was in the pitiful state Zorua had imagined.

She clearly lost weight, he judged from how thin she was; her eyes were swollen, suggesting that she didn't do much sleeping. She was breathing slowly, practically gasping for air.

With the last amount of energy left, the fairy looked at Zorua, who suddenly realized... Celebi had been with him for the whole week.

"You..." he said.

Her vision growing blurry, she gave a small smile.

"W-We're... even..." she whispered, before falling unconscious.

Zorua stared at her.

Celebi had just fainted.
122332222213123111121111.title: Celebi's tiny hell

choices: "Never bug me again."
"I'll figure it out later, for now, don't worry about it. Eat."
1223322222131231111211112.content:
Zorua looked at the fairy that had just passed out before him. She had ACTUALLY done it. She went through the same ordeal he did...that she put him through...he couldn't believe it. On some level he even respected it.

On most levels he thought she was an idiot...he couldn't believe it...he looked her over...she was thin...really thin, and looked very frail like that. If he left her...alone like that who knows if she'd even be able to get up on her own.

Could he leave her like that?

...well she'd done this same thing to him right!? Of course she had...but she also did try to make it up to him...and he couldn't help but take pity on her state.

She gave him refuge after the fact, tried to apologize, he figured he could return the favor somehow...

Before he knew it he had her on his back, and was making his way to a hideaway...first thing, get her a place she could rest peacefully, then second, go and find her some food. Then he'd be willing to hash things out with her...he supposed.

She'd been with him, which meant she might be aware he wasn't doing pranks.

-

Celebi's vision returned to her as she saw herself in a dimly lit area. She looked around to see...she was on a pile of dirty pillows...she shook her head and groaned before smells assaulted her senses. In front of her...a plate of fruit, a cup of water, and a bag of fast food. If she had enough moisture in her body for her mouth to water, it would be. She immediately dove for the water, taking a long, long drink before she ate a whole banana in two bites. She practically ripped oven the bag of fast food and started in on the burger before she heard snickering.

"Never in all my life did I think i'd see you act in such a way Celebi, no manners huh? But I know that desperation..." Zorua was right there looking at her and she stared at him mid bite into a her burger before swallowing.

"Z-zorua...what are you doing here?" She asked and he snickered.

"I kinda live here sweetheart...I brought you back when you passed out in front of me...a whole week on me huh? must've been rough...I know how that goes." He said gently, but she looked away.

"Y-you were right Zorua, it was hell...true hell..." She squeaked out as she started sniffling.

"Hey hey, we're both here, we're both alive, so enough of that, alright?...I still have nightmares about it, a week later...probably will for a long time...you probably too...but that's behind us." He said

She stopped sniffling and looked at him.

"A-and we're even?" She said and he smiled.

"Hell no." He said and her smile fell.

"But-but-"

"Celebi...I pranked you, then you did that to me, then you nursed me to health. You did that to yourself to try and get even, something I didn't agree with, and then I nursed you to health now...if you want to be even with me, you're gonna need to do one more thing." He smiled and she looked down.

"What is it Zorua...?" She asked.
1223322222131231111211112.title: Pity for the fairy

choices: Zorua begrudgingly accepts to stay with Celebi
Shrunken or not, Zorua doesn't care. He decides to leave...
122332222213123111122.content:
Zorua kept sleeping a dreamless sleep.

He remained unconscious since after he collapsed on the ground in front of everyone in the festival. He didn't know how much time passed since then.

Slowly, the small dark type started to regain consciousness.

His eyes opened up a bit as he blinked a few times, before his eyelids fully parted. He looked around, discovering he was inside of what to appeared to be a bedroom.

A nice breeze blew inside through a window.

Zorua looked around, trying to recall what happened. He remembered himself in the middle of a festival with Celebi and Lopunny, he remembered himself screaming his hate towards the legendary... but then?

An accurate examination told Zorua something: everything around him was huge!

"W-Wha...?" he stutters, before glaring at nobody in particular.
"Celebi..." he says, teeth gritted. He notices, though, that he's not nanoscopic like he was just yesterday.

No, he's more like the size of a small doll.

As if the name he said - that cursed name - was heard outside the room, the door suddenly opens, letting two giantesses come inside.

Celebi and Lopunny.

Immediately their gazes went on the bed.

"Oh... you're awake..." Celebi mutters. Zorua glares at her, but remains silent.

"You're sure an heavy sleeper~" Lopunny says cheerfully.
"And that's not a surprise after what you went through..." she adds in an apologetic manner.

Zorua remains silent, and turns around, back turned to the two giantesses.

Celebi sighs.
"Lopunny," she says.
"Go get him something to eat... and drink..." she says.

Lopunny happily obliges as she heads for the door, humming to herself... before tripping and falling face down on the floor.
"Heh... sorry..." she awkwardly says as she gets up, walking out. Shortly after, another thud is heard, suggesting that she fell again.

Celebi sighs deeply, before approaching the small, silent Zorua.

The fox bounces slightly as the fairy sits down beside him.
"Zorua-"
"Don't. Talk. To. Me." he says through gritted teeth.
"I. Hate. You."

Celebi frowns.
"You know, you wouldn't be here if it wasn't for me..." she points out.

"I wouldn't have experienced that if it wasn't for you either. Guess we're even." Zorua responds.
"Now, leave me alone."

The fairy looks at the floor, remaining silent for a while.

"Zorua..." she starts, receiving no response.
"I... about that... I'm sorry..." she slowly says.
"As much as you deserved it... it was maybe too much. I've... I've been irresponsible, alright?"

Zorua huffs.
"Yeah, right." he responds without turning around.
"If you're so sorry like you say, why am I tiny again? Wasn't my week of insensate torture enough? Perhaps, you do hate me back?"

Celebi frowns again.
"I do not hate you. Do you think I would have rescued you if I did? It was for easier transportation."

"Keep telling that to yourself. I won't buy it." he responds.
"And even if you don't hate me, I. Hate. You."

Celebi sighs in exasperation.

She rises her paw, which then travels down to Zorua as she forces him to turn around. She lowers her head to the struggling fox, making eye contact with him.

"Look. You may hate me, but you need me. You're in a fragile state right now. I won't do anything to you - that size is only to make things easier." she says.

Zorua glares, all his hate flashing before his eyes.
"I want to have nothing to do with you! I hate you!" he spits venomously.
"The only thing I want is to get out of here, go back to my forest and never see you again!" he shouts.

"Then why don't you?!" Celebi snaps back, irritated.

She picks Zorua up and bends, lowering her paw to the ground before rising up again and pointing to the open door.
"Go ahead Zorua - leave! I'm not going to stop you! That doesn't mean, though, I'll give you back your size." she sternly says.

Zorua glares at her, but remains silent.
"I'm offering my help." Celebi states solemnly.
"Whether to accept it or not is up to you, Zorua."
122332222213123111122.title: Zorua's grudge

choices: "Not long, we'll probably head back in a few hours."
"Overnight was my plan, if that's okay."
"Is it alright if we stay here for a few days?"
1223322222131231111221.content:
Zorua looked at the open door, seething. He COULD go through it, but there was no way he'd be able to open the front door to this house if it were shut, even if he could he'd be in an area he doesn't know, tiny and helpless, with no direction on how to even get home. He knew that at this point he couldn't DO anything to even get back to his forest on his own, and his only shot at getting there was Celebi...and he couldn't stand that thought. He started to shake a bit before..."GrrrraaaAAAAAHHHHH!" He started to pound on the ground in front of him with his front paws, screaming at the top of his lungs for a good 30 seconds before he stopped and was huffing loudly. Celebi just looked at him, unimpressed by this before he turned around, glaring daggers at her.

"I have no choice but to deal with you for now, you've just made that clear." He said as she sighed. "Good, now that we've made that clear, we can hopefully move on from-"

"We ain't moving on from crap, let ME make something clear here Celebi, I have to rely on you right now, you've taken it upon yourself to shrink me AGAIN for whatever reason, and I more or less have no choice BUT to deal with you right now, this changes nothing!" He said seething before Celebi threw up her hands and huffed.

"Do you have any idea the state you were in before you passed out Zorua!? Any at all!? You were half dead, half crazed, and went into a panic attack at the slightest provocation! Do you think I can leave you in that state!? You were a potential danger to yourself and those around you and I couldn't predict what you'd do, when I said you're in a fragile state I wasn't just referring to your size!" She said, fed up with his attitude at this point, she knew what he was about to say. "And who-"

"Whose fault is that? Yes, it's mine Zorua, I screwed up, and you're not the only one who's let me know that, Lopunny even let me have it when I let her know what I did to you, and I stand by what I said, YOU provoked me into doing it Zorua...yes, I went too far, and I know I can't undo it, or take it back, so hate me all you want but Lopunny wants to make it right, I want to make it right, and if you don't want to give me the chance then at least give her a chance, she had no idea what she was putting you through." Celebi finally finished, her tone going gentler as she went on. Zorua just sat there, fuming as he listened to her. Finally he sighed and muttered "You say I provoked you...I had no idea you'd be so cold as to do what you did...you have no idea the hell I experienced Celebi, how could you? How could any pokemon know what it's like to be that insignificant...that powerless, or hopeless...I can't unsee the things i've seen, unthink the thoughts i've had, and you can't take it back, you're right. You will NEVER undo what you did to me...but fine, you're also right about something else, Lopunny didn't know what she was doing, as much as I want to blame her for this too. I'll behave until we get home...after that, please change me back and please never talk to me again. I won't do any pranks anymore in return. I think that's a fair trade. Quite frankly...you frighten me." He didn't yell any of that, he stated it, but Celebi definitely felt the rawness in his voice and the words he spoke probably hit her harder than any he'd said up to this point, but she didn't let it show on her face.

There was an awkward silence before Lopunny returned with a plate of food and a glass of water. "I'm back~" She sung, unaware of Zorua underfoot as he dodged out of the way, making Celebi gasp. Lopunny realized her mistake soon after as she looked down. "Oh my, I am so sorry Zorua! Why are you down there!? I could've hurt you!" She said, half scolding and half worried for him, as she handed the plate and water to Celebi, he just huffed. "I was thinking of taking off, but Celebi convinced me to stay, then you came in." He said simply. "Oh...well it's a good thing then, who knows what could happen to someone your size, here let me help you up." She bent down to pick him up but started to lose her balance. "Oh crap!" Zorua said as he ran away and a quake on the ground knocked him on his side as Lopunny landed on her floor. "Oof...S-sorry..." She said to the dazed Zorua. "Yeah...it's fine..." He said as he shakily got to his feet and she reached her paws out to grab him. He didn't fight it, more because he realized he couldn't and she got to her feet, setting him on her bed. "Here Zorua, let's eat and make up, alright?" She said kindly down to him as she sat on his side, and Celebi sat on his other side. They rose quite high up and he had to admit, despite them not being planet sized, these giantesses were damn intimidating. 'Just deal for now...when Celebi takes me home that'll be that.' He thought as Lopunny gently handed him a small slice of meat. "If you need water, just let me know, okay?" She said kindly, he nodded and muttered a thanks before he started to eat the meat.

"So Celebi, how long are you two going to be staying anyway?" Lopunny asked kindly, making Zorua look hesitantly in her direction, Celebi just sighed.
1223322222131231111221.title: A shaky peace

choices: In the same room with that airhead Lopunny? He had more chances with Celebi!
With that hateful green girl? No way, the airhead was better!
12233222221312311112213.content:
Celebi sighed.

"Zorua is in no condition to travel right now." she explained to Lopunny.
"So... is it alright if we stay here for a few days?"

Zorua almost choked on his meat.
"... WHAT?!" he didn't want to spend a few minutes with these two, now he had to spend a few days?!

Celebi looked at him.
"Yes Zorua, you can't move from here until your state of mind improves. I'm not taking the risk of you dying on the way back home, so just shut up." she said, causing Zorua to look at her, growling.

Lopunny smiled.
"Fine with me Celi~" she responded, getting up.
"I'll go prepared the guest room~" she chimed, starting to walk away... before tripping over her own feet and falling face-down on the floor.

She hastily got back up.
"Sorry... Sorry..." she said as she got out.

Zorua looked back at Celebi, glaring.
"You..." he growled as another thud was heard from outside the room.

Celebi quickly intercepted his words, sick of hearing him complaining,
"You can say whatever you want Zorua, we're staying here... now, during these few days, either we try to move on and actually forget all that happened between us or we can keep things like they are now... but I'll warm you, I'll hardly give you back your size then." she said.

Zorua growled.
"Move on? You almost killed me over a few dumb pranks! Congratulations smarty-pants, you found a new way to deal with pranksters - you simply kill them mercilessly! And if they somehow survive, why spare them? They make good pets! Oh, it's so fun when they have a panic attack!" he shouted with indignation.

Celebi glared.
"I said that I'm sorry about that all Zorua! Okay, I've been an idiot! And your pranks? I think you've been punished enough for those, so why can't you simply accept that I'm trying to help you?!" she cried angrily.

"I. Hate. You." Zorua seethed.

Celebi shot a cold stare. She hid it, but his comment hit her pretty hard. He told it a few times already, so he really meant it...

"Do as you wish. I'm not letting you go until you're feeling better... then we'll see." she said.

"... ‘We'll see’? Are you planning to keep me as a pet, ain't ya?! I didn't suffer enough, right?!" he cried.

Celebi sighed.
"No Zorua..." she said, exasperated.

Before the dark type could think about talking again, Lopunny came back into the room.
"Wow you two... I can hear you from the other room Zorua..." she said with a sigh, before walking towards the bed again.

Miraculously, she made it without tripping.

The bed shook as the brown giantess carelessly sat down next to Zorua. Now he was trapped in between the two girls she hated the most.

Great... although, he wasn't sure. He hated Celebi for sure; Lopunny... he didn't know. She was unaware that she had a nanoscopic pokemon on her, could he hate her for it?

"... Hey, I was thinking... someone will have to need to watch you Zorua... you could end up like that again overnight... that'd be bad..." Celebi mused.

Zorua shot her a look of hatred. Now he had to sleep with one of them too?

"Oh, he can stay in my room~ we'll have so much fun~" Lopunny chimed. Zorua growled in frustration. Yes, he could hate her if she was going to treat him like a doll.

Celebi sighed. Maybe, this was a good time to start acting nice. Hopefully, the dark type would relent and decide to move on.
"Zorua... why don't you pick?" she asked him with a small smile... which faded as she saw the look on the dark type's face.

He looked in between the two, pretending to be thinking.
"Hmm... I'll sleep on the floor." he said coldly.

Celebi huffed, while Lopunny giggled.

"Yeah... still angry about that huh? Sorry... but I can definitely make it up! Come on, come sleeping into my room~" she said excitedly.

"... I'm serious, I'm not sleeping with any of ya." Zorua responded, backing away and sitting behind the two, giving his abandoned slice of meat another bite.

"That's not a choice Zorua. If you sleep alone, you could have another panic attack and none of us would even hear you... so, pick already and let us go to sleep... I'm tired of this." Celebi said. Zorua looked at her, unimpressed.
"... Let me rephrase that - do you have a death wish?" the fairy asked.

Zorua perked up - Celebi actually had a point. So he really had no choice... but who was he going to sleep with?
12233222221312311112213.title: An unapproved decision

choices: Zorua attempts something at night
Zorua has a panic attack at night
Zorua sleeps through the night
122332222213123111122131.content:
Zorua gritted his teeth.

He hated to admit it. Hated hated HATED to admit it, but Celebi had a point.

Then the mentality he loathed as well...she was the more responsible between the two giant pokemon before him.

"I.will.stay.with.Celebi." He said, nearly having to choke out the words and the eyes of both giantesses widened with shock. Celebi thought for sure he'd pick Lopunny.

"Aww...I suppose that's fine." Lopunny giggled, but seemed disappointed as Celebi went to pick Zorua up. He didn't struggle, but his eyes narrowed.

"I can't believe it...you chose me?" She said and Zorua glared up.

"Oh don't get the wrong idea, between the two of you I hate Lopunny much much less, I just figure that i'm safer with you if you don't decide to shrink me further in a fit of rage."

Celebi sighed.

"Fine..." She was tired of Zorua's words and tired of trying to talk to him and just plain tired. She'd deal with his attitude in the morning...one way or another.

"Good night you two~ Get lots of rest Zorua and in the morning we'll have a biiiig breakfast before we all find a way to be friends and get rid of those nasty panic attacks!" Lopunny said enthusiastically as Zorua's eye twitched. What an idealistic moron.

"If I were normal, I swear i'd-"

"Do nothing, and if you want to BE normal again you won't make simple threats Zorua." Celebi chastised, tired.

Zorua grumbled in her grasp as she made her way to the guest room and shut the door, looking at the small, simple bed. "You'll sleep in the bed with me, and in the morning we'll talk." Celebi said simply as Zorua felt her shift into the bed, setting him on the pillow by her head. He looked at her giant unsmiling face before he turned around and laid on the pillow, saying nothing.

"...Try and get a good night's sleep at least." Celebi said as she shut her eyes, hoping she'd manage to do that as well.
122332222213123111122131.title: Staying with the hated one

choices: In the morning...
Later again at night...
1223322222131231111221312.content:
Celebi was having a nice sleep before the sound registered with her. She grumbled and turned over, but the sound wouldn't go away...groaning, the sound started to register more and more in her head...a boy's voice...Zorua's voice...that's right! Zorua! And he was saying...?

"shelter...shelter...before she trips again...she's moving to another class...need to hurry..." They didn't carry any of the resentment or malice she had come to know, any of the mischief or snark she had come to know...that was absent too. The words seemed hollow, empty...chanting. Her eyes snapped open as the pieces lined up in her head and she looked at him on his pillow.

His head was flailing about wildly, and he didn't seem to have proper footing as he stood on the pillow, his legs shaky...his breathing was abnormal too between the words he was saying. And his eyes looked terrified.

Zorua wasn't here. At least in his head he wasn't...it was another panic attack. Celebi bit her lip and reached her paws forward. "Zorua." She said it gently, almost whispering as she picked him up. He went limp in her grip, though his head still flailed about.

"Wha-where...what?" Zorua weakly mumbled as he was lifted to the giantess's face. She looked at him, his eyes still looked cloudy to her, but he blinked once...then twice. His breathing seemed to settle as he looked into her giant eyes.

"Celebi...?" He sounded confused as he said that, and he looked around...that's right. The guest room. He was sleeping with...

He glared at her.

"What the hell!? What are you doing!?" He asked as he tried to kick his paws about to get her to let go. She just got an annoyed expression.

"You're welcome should be more like it Zorua...you were having another panic attack. It sounded...bad." She said. He stopped kicking and eyed her suspiciously.

"I was...?" He said with some trepidation and she nodded. He looked down and contemplated this.

"Damn...how am I gonna come back from this..." Zorua muttered and Celebi tried to smile.

"Don't worry...Lopunny and I will help you, just try and open yourself up to us." She said and he glared at her.

"You two are the reason this is happening at all!" He shot back and her smile instantly faded.

"Zorua, i'm serious, if you ever want a sense of normalcy again, or your size and mind back you're gonna need to rely on us. The sooner you accept that, the happier you'll be and the quicker this all can take." She said sternly. He just huffed.

Celebi got an idea...she was sure Zorua would hate it though.

"For the remainder of the night, so that I can get a better sense if THIS happens again..." She started before laying back down, her paws wrapping around Zorua like a snare. He struggled but didn't even manage to budge a finger before he found himself pressed into a warm surface. Celebi's chest.

"Let.Go.Now." Zorua seethed and she shook her head.

"I won't Zorua, get some sleep. This way if you have another attack like that i'll wake up easier." She said and Zorua struggled again with all of his might, grunting...but was met with no success and soon the green fairy was asleep.

"Damn it all...damn it..." Zorua said drowsily, as sleep took him as well in the humiliating...though admittedly comfortable...grasp of the pokemon he probably hated most...she was in his top 3 at least.
1223322222131231111221312.title: Panic and a humiliating safety blanket

choices: Shrunk a tenth of the pokemon in the festival to who know what size
Accidentally grows a pokemon to massive heights (reader's choice)
Both things happened (again, reader's choice)
1223322222131231113.content:
The festival was rather fun for the group as they go around the whole town. Thankfully for Celebi's case, Zorua was able to calm down enough to at least enjoy the festivities that was going on to not chew Celebi out. The games were fun, the food was excellent, though Zorua focus more on stuffing himself than enjoying it co sidering what he went through. The last thing Lopunny wanted to do before going to the middle of the town where people would be dancing is the big ferris wheel that over look the whole town.

"Wait here, I'll go see if I can get tickets to the ride." Lopunny says with her usual cheery voice as she heads off, leaving the other two alone on a bench.

"Well, when she isn't busy being planet size and threatening to erase me from existence, she actually fun to be with." Zorua states as he sips on a drink the size of a snorelax.

"Please don't talk out loud about it, she doesn't know about about my size abilities." Celebi says as she also didn't want Zorua to blurt out to the whole town.

"Hey, I had to deal with a week straight of suffering, I think I deserve to be a little peeve about it." Zorua says as he continues his drink. "Besides, last thing i want to hear is Lopunny thinking I purposely shrunk myself to be on her when i don't even know her."

"Look, I'm sorry that I may have overdid the shrinking part by a bit..."

"Just a bit?" Zorua says in a snarky tone.

"And that letting you stay on her for a week was pushing it. But at least you get to go to a festival." Celebi says with a sheepish smile as she knows that she isn't helping her case.

"Yeah fine, look, if I promise to either stop the pranks or at least make them be not so....painful, can you at least promise not to shrink me down to nano size again?" Zorua ask, but before Celebi could say anything, a familiar voice could be heard behind them that made choke a bit.

"Wait, what's this about Celebi shrinking you?" Lopunny says as she return with three tickets.

"Busted." Is the only thing the two small pokemon could think.

One long explanation while on the ferris wheel...

"My goodness, Celebi, you would dare shrink someone that small and use me like a punishment." Lopunny says in both a upset voice and annoyed. "You could at least told me, I would at least had fun with someone that small."

Zorua gulps as he thinks he was rather glad that Lopunny didn't knew about him while Celebi was rather confuse.

"Wait, so you're not mad I used you without telling you?"

"Oh no, I'm quite upset, but I'm rather curious about this whole size thing." Lopunny says as she turns her gaze at Zorua. "Can you show me what he looks like as a speck?"

"NO, I'm getting off." Zorua says nervously as he tries to get out, on to feel a cold shiver on his spine once he realizes that the door is look and they where halfway up.

"Oh come now, Celebi can grow you back before the ride ends." Lopunny says as she grabs Zorua and hugs him tightly, mainly so he can't move.

"*sigh* You're not letting us leave till I do?" Celebi says as she knows Lopunny well enough that she can be stubborn once she is curious of something. Lopunny only giggles and smile as she hugs Zorua tighter. "Zorua, just... just stay still. I'll quickly grow you back."

"Oh come on." Zorua whines in defeat as he knows he not going to win this battle.

Celebi prepares to hit Zorua with the size ability when suddenly the ferris wheel stops abruptly, causing the cabin the three were in the rock, and to make things worse, made Celebi missed her target and....
1223322222131231113.title: Small or big problems, depending who you ask

choices: Follow Celebi, Zorua and Lopunny in their search for the ones that shrunk
Follow the unfortunate that shrunk (reader's choice of who to exactly follow)
12233222221312311131.content:
The ride made a abrupt stop, causing Celebi to not only missed Zorua by a mile, by cast the shrinking part she used outside. Celebi aim hits a reflective crystal ball that absorb some the shrinking energy and bounces out to several parts of the festival, all of which hitting some unfortunate pokemon.

"W-hat happened?" Zorua was the first to spoke.

"The maintenance guy down there must have stop the ride to let people out." Lopunny says as she and everyone looks outside. Yet they seem to see about the same amount of pokemon in the festival.

"I think you miss, Celi, i don't think anyone got hit." Zorua says, hoping he's right.

"No....I defiantly hit some pokemon..." Celebi says in scared tone as she sensed some pokemon getting hit by Celebi's shrinking move. About a tenth of the pokemon that were here at the festival shrunk, not enough to make everyone stop and notice, and if that wasn't bad enough, no one saw the pokemons shrunk. To top it off, every pokemon were shrunk to a different size, some were shrunk to bug size, while some unfortunate few got the unfortunate luck of being shrunk about the same size Zorua was earlier. Thankfully those that shrunk that small were in a secluded area, but it would only be a matter of time before a unsuspecting pokemon comes into their lives.
12233222221312311131.title: The party just got bigger, literally for some

choices: Yes
No
122332222213123111312.content: A young Eevee out at the festival with his mother, a Glaceon, was hit by the blast and shrunk down to the size of an incredibly tiny bug. Do you want to follow his unfortunate journey?
122332222213123111312.title: First choice

choices: He's at the feet of his mother, Glaceon!
He's at the feet of either Celebi, Lopunny, or Zorua!
He's at the feet of an unknown pokemon!
1223322222131231113121.content:
Young Eevee had been looking forward to this day for quite some time, the festival was gonna prove to be a good time, and though he had a penchant for mischief, he had a good heart and had promised his mother he would behave if he got to go. Though the wait had been excruciating, he was a pokemon of his word and had been quite well behaved for the past few months, never crossing a line. Finally, this would be his reward. His mom had left him to go use the restrooms briefly for only a moment, when he was hit by Celebi's blast.

...This was not what he had in mind for a fun time. "Mom..." He called out frightened at his now alien surroundings. He was on the side of a stall that rose higher and higher and higher still into the sky, and he couldn't see the top of it at all. Quakes resounded all around him as titans that were fellow pokemon passed by. He whimpered and backed as far into the stall as he could. "Anyone..." He mumbled, hoping someone would look down and see him. Suddenly a wind picked up and started to carry him away from his safe spot.

"No...no no nonononono!" He cried as he shut his eyes, powerless to stop the gentle breeze that was carrying his speck of a body somewhere into the festival. He cried as his speed picked up, hoping for a gentle landing, that someone would save him when he rolled into the ground in the middle of a path. He groaned, he wasn't seriously injured thankfully, but the possibility was there that he'd definitely have bruises later on. He winced as he staggered to his feet, only to see in front of him a monolithic pokemon, he had to crane his head just to see who it was, up and up his eyes went and he saw...
1223322222131231113121.title: Eevee's tiny times

choices: Lopunny plays it safe and stays where she is.
Lopunny enters the festival grounds again.
12233222221312311132.content:
As the Ferris wheel abruptly stopped and Celebi let loose her size changing ability the machine violently jostled once again and threatened to send her falling down onto the cabin floor. Zorua, still at his original size, had apparently face-planted onto the cold cabin floor during the confusion and was groaning in pain. "Wh...What happened?" He whimpered.

"Um... The Ferris wheel stopped for some reason." Celebi said as she tried to regain her bearings. "Are you okay? Lopunny how about... You?" She trailed off as she looked over to Lopunny's seat. She was gone. In fact, the roof, floor and walls surrounding her seat were missing. Zorua scampered closer to Celebi as he realized his tail was hanging over the edge of the cabin which was dangling right at the top of the wheel.

"W-where's Lopunny? She didn't fall did she?"

Celebi's eyes widened at his words. "Lopunny!" She yelled as she hopped off the seat to look over the edge. They both jumped as a flurry of cream and brown fur suddenly dominated the view from the cabin. Zorua couldn't believe what he was seeing as the form of a massive Lopunny struggled to sit up, her enlarged body dangerously close to the Ferris wheel.

"I'm okay, I'm okay!" Lopunny thunderously announced as she rubbed her head and opened her eyes. "I'm... Um..." She was at a loss for words as she found herself sitting just as tall as the Ferris wheel she was just on, her legs splayed out to the either side of it. "I'm big?"

Both Celebi and Zorua jumped again as her giant red eyes focused on the cabin they were in and leaned in closer. While the size difference was nothing compared to what Zorua experienced, it was still intimidating seeing the giantess stare at them. "Wow!" She exclaimed as a small smile crept on her face. "You can do stuff like this, Celebi?"

"I didn't mean to! Um, I just need to get down from here and I should be able to reverse it..." A cacophony of screaming Pokemon distracted her and Lopunny as all the festival-goers finally noticed the giant Lopunny towering over everything.

"Oh! Sorry!" Lopunny said as she turned her attention to the Pokemon running about, her expression of amazement changed to worry. "Um, keep... festivalling!" The massive rabbit Pokemon planted a hand behind her so she could prop herself up. "I'll leave, please d-don't let me ruin your fun! Uh, I'm going to stand up now."

"No no no! Stay there!" Celebi called out to her as she began to stand up. Unfortunately Lopunny was too distracted with the chaos of the fleeing Pokemon to hear her. Planting another hand behind her to scoot herself away from the Ferris wheel she accidentally crushes one of the many stalls littering the festival, only adding to the panic around her.

"Ack, Sorry! I'm gonna leave the festival area, okay?" Zorua cringed at the thought of Lopunny navigating around the festival, given her penchant for being incredibly clumsy.

"Can't you shrink her back?" He asked.

"With the way she's moving around I can't! I'm going to try flying to her." Standing up she got ready to take flight but was knocked off her feet as the Ferris wheel rocked violently. The steel structure groaned when Lopunny's leg brushed against it as she brought herself to her full height. She was just about twice as tall compared to it and stood at approximately a hundred foot tall. Celebi and Zorua only had a good view of her thighs as she awkwardly backed away from the wheel, her paws thunderously crashing down on the ground despite how delicate she was trying to be. The two Pokemon stuck in the cabin were like Deerlings in the headlights as they stared at the giantess turn around and start walking.

"Um, coming through!" She blared as she tiptoed through the festival, trying her best not to demolish any stands or crush any fleeing Pokemon. The keyword being trying. Her paw suddenly got snagged on a stand causing her to stumble forward, sending debris from the small structure flying everywhere. She stomped about a bit as she awkwardly tried to balance herself and thankfully, was able to. Looking down Lopunny saw a shocked Electrabuzz staring at a giant paw that just barely missed him. "S-sorry about that!" She whined as the electric Pokemon ran away. With the road out clear Lopunny continued her trek.

Celebi was able to regain her thoughts when Zorua began nudging her side. "Aren't you going to do something?"

"I am!" She blurted out, embarrassed at how she froze up like she did. Looking back at Lopunny she let out a sigh of relief. "Look, she cleared the festival area already."

"I made it!" She cheered. "Celebi, where are you?" Her gaze scanned the area until it landed on the malfunctioning Ferris wheel. "Oh, bummer! Did I leave you two in there?"

"Don't worry, I can fly!" Celebi yelled out as she got to her feet but her voice was too distant to reach the giant Lopunny's ears.

"Hmm... I'm gonna have to come get you, won't I?" She pondered as she looked over the festival grounds. Both Celebi and Zorua shivered as they heard her. It was lucky nobody was hurt as she showed herself out but she was tempting fate if she decided to come back over. They watched as Lopunny put a finger up to her lip in thought. Meanwhile Celebi was getting ready to fly, despite what Lopunny decided to do. The giant Pokemon looked like she has come to a decision.
12233222221312311132.title: Big problem

choices: Celebi shrunk Lopunny, along with her and Zorua
Celebi made Lopunny's size worst
Lopunny stops Celebi from shrinking her
122332222213123111321.content:
"Hmmmm, I guess I'll stay for now. Kind of messed up the festival already." Lopunny says, though doesn't sounds sad or upset about creating a panic in her town. With a ground shaking thud, Lopunny sits down and waits for Zorua's Celebi.

"Lopunny!" The massove rabbit's ears perk when she hears a familiar voice. She looks down and saw a flying green pokemon, along with a fox, heading for her.

"Ah, Celebi~" Lopunny says in her usual cheery tone as she lift one of her hands to let the two rest on. "Oh, and I see you brought the little guy." Lopunny says when she spots Zorou and raise her other hand towards him.

"Oh no, shrink her shrink her shrin-!" Zorua says nervously as he saw the large fuzzy paw aiming right at him and pinning him down as Lopunny pets him.

"Sorry about this." Celebi says while ignoring Zorua's cry for help.

"Oh this isn't bad, you two make it sound like nano size is a horrible size to be with, but if this is what people see me as nano size, it doesn't feel that bad." Lopunny, clearly not understanding measurements, says her peppy tone.

"Best to not tell her what nanosize really feels like." Celebi whispers to Zorua, who nods in agreement once he got his head free from the massive paw. "Ok, just, please stay still, I'll shrink you back." Celebi says as she prepares to shrink Lopunny.
122332222213123111321.title: Best to be patient

choices: Shrunk Lopunny down...and Zorua again by accident!
Grows herself and Zorua back to normal
...can't grow herself and Zorua back?
1223322222131231113211.content:
Celebi's eyes glowed a familiar color as her ability took hold and...Zorua noted that nothing happened. He was still being petted by a towering Lopunny. "Celebi...it didn't work." He said as Celebi looked around herself to see out her surroundings and realized her mistake. "Zorua...yes it did..." She said quietly as he looked out too to see the surrounding around him being massive once more. Not on a nanoscopic level but. "DANG IT CELEBI!" Imagine what the festival would be like!" Celebi sighs. 'Never change Lopunny' She thought as she...

1223322222131231113211332.content:
Celebi desperately tried to focus as he gigantic friend excitedly made her way to ride.

"Celi! Quick!" Zorua exclaimed in alert as he noticed Lopunny advancing again.
"This is going to be fun~" the bipedal bunny said cheerfully as she likes Zorua on top of her head.

Celebi focused harder...

A flash of cyan light erupted from Lopunny's head, although no one could possibly notice. But the rabbit definitely felt it.

She brought a paw up to the top of her head, seeking for her tiny friends.

But they were no longer there.

--

Zorua opened his eyes, looking at the green fairy in front of him.
"Did it work?" he asked hopefully while inspecting his surroundings...

Him and Celebi weren't on Lopunny's head, but in a forest of towering, leafless trees, rooted in pink ground...

Zorua paled, when Celebi looked around, trying to understand what was going on... did she and Zorua grow back? Did she teleport themselves by accident? It couldn't be - she couldn't learn Teleport...

But that meant... so that was why Zorua looked horrified - they shrunk to an even smaller height while still on Lopunny!

Celebi looked at her unfortunate companion, noting that he was cowering. Luckily, both were still on Lopunny's head, so that Zorua didn't have to cling. As for Celebi, she could fly, but there was no need to, gravity worked with them.

"Not again... I don't want to stay like this again..." Zorua whimpered, scared. He ended right back in hell!

He looked up, glaring at Celebi.

"You! If there's only one good thing in all this, is that you're in hell with me!" he shouted. Celebi looked offended - she was trying to be nice. He too had been for a while, why stop now?

"Shut up, Zorua, or I swear I'm leaving you here..." she threatened.

Zorua snarled.
"Grow us back!" he shouted, feeling scared and angry at once.

"I can't Zorua - my shrinking move is malfunctioning! If I try again, we could shrink so much that we could disappear from existence itself! Or we could grow to massive heights and destroy everything with even the slightest movement!" Celebi responded.

Zorua gulped.

"C-Celi... when are we going to get back to our original sizes then... are we going to be stuck like this?!" he shouted, starting to tear up.

Celebi sighed in exasperation as she sat down.

"I... I don't know Zorua, let's just hope not... I'll wait a few hours before trying again, we'll see how it goes..." she said, grabbing her face in her paws.

Zorua felt a lump in his throat.

"A-A few hours?! We're going to stay like this a few hours?! I've been like this for a week Celebi - this is hell!" he cried in fear.

The fairy looked at him pitifully, he was in the verge of tears... it was partly her fault if he was like this.

Celebi got up and moved to the fox, grabbing him by his sides.

"What are you doing?" he asked.

"What do you think I'm doing?" Celebi retorted as she started hovering.
"We need to get Lopunny's attention."

--

Officially worried about her friends, Lopunny walked away from the spinning tea cup ride and - carefully - made her way in a secluded place.

"Guys?!" she cried.

On top of her head, Zorua and Celebi cried in pain - Lopunny's voice was too loud for them.

"We're dead..." Zorua said desperately as Celebi flew higher in the air, headed for one of her friend's gigantic ears.

"Quit being pessimistic!" the fairy yelled as she kept hovering higher.

Suddenly, a brown pillar of fur came down as a creamy ceiling filled the duo's eyesight.

Celebi screamed as she avoided the giant finger by mere inches.

It didn't take long to understand that Lopunny was trying to locate them. With poor results.

But maybe... that finger was a help.

"Zorua! We need to work together - grab Lopunny's finger!" she exclaimed.

Zorua decided to comply and grasped the brown fur when Celebi flew closer to the finger.

"Guys?" Lopunny's voice came again as the finger fidgeted a bit, before rising up in the sky at supersonic speed. Zorua and Celebi clinged for dear life as the finger was lifted off the bunny's head.

When it reached a decent height, Celebi pulled Zorua back and flapped her wings, hovering at like 5000 ft from the solid ground...

Zorua paled - a fall from here and it was over...

Celebi started to descend slowly, holding the fox tightly.
"Hold on!" she shouted as she lowered herself to her destination - Lopunny's left ear.

It took quite some time, mostly because she had to avoid her friend's finger several other times, but she finally landed on top of the giant ear that traveled down Lopunny's back and stopped nearly at ground level.

"LOPUNNY! WE'RE HERE!" Celebi shouted at top of her lungs, nearly deafening Zorua.

Regardless, he started shouting too,
"LOPUNNY!" he cried.

But the bunny didn't seem able to hear them.

"This is ridiculous - her ears are bigger than her head and she can't hear us!" Zorua cried.

Celebi ignored him.

"LOPUNNY!" she shouted.

And finally, the worried bunny seemed to hear something... just a faint sound, comparable to a pin falling... but she heard it.

"Celebi? Zorua?" she whispered, her finger moving on top of her left ear.

Celebi flew on top of it as it traveled down to Lopunny's eyes.

Zorua sighed in relief and so did his green companion.

Lopunny narrowed her eyes, but finally managed to locate the two nanoscopic pokemon on her finger.

She smiled.
"There you are! Aw, you look so cute~" she chimed, almost done destroying the ears of the unfortunate duo.

"Lopunny, go home! We need a safe place!" Celebi cried.
"Please be careful!" Zorua added, remembering that Lopunny was a bit... airhead.

Much to their surprise, the bunny giantess seemed to hear them and quickly nodded her head, moving her free paw close to the other and gently dropping the nanoscopic pokemon on her palm, before holding her hand in front of her eyes.

She didn't have to lose sight of them. Most importantly, she had to be careful.

If she tripped over her own feet, for the shrunken duo would be the end.

Celebi looked forward, each step Lopunny took causing the palm to tremble.

She looked at Zorua, he was staring at the giant palm blankly.

Moved by a fit of sympathy, she moved closer to the fox.
"Don't worry Zorua... we're safe..." she said, before gulping.
"I hope..."

Lopunny walks into her room, and set the two pokemon on her bed. She then bends down to get a good look at the two pokemon. "See, I got here safe and sound." She says in her normal voice, still not noticing her friends' ear ache. "And with you two safely here...." Lopunny says as she...

122332222213123111321133211.content:
"Here! And now that you're safe and sound..." Lopunny suddenly got up and headed to the door of her bedroom, leaving Celebi and Zorua behind. Her head reappeared shortly after she exited as she smiled at the bed.

"See you later~" she said cheerfully as she exited again.

Celebi's jaw hung open.

"Lopunny wai-" the sound of the front door closing assaulted the ears of the two unfortunate, microscopic pokemon.

Zorua blinked, trying to process what just happened.

"... Your friend just left us alone at this size, didn't she?" he asked incredulously while looking around the immense landscape that was Lopunny's blanket.

Lopunny had managed to locate them - which, given her reputation as an airhead, was quite impressive - she had brought them back home without any accident - which was also very impressive - only to leave them alone in her house and go to the festival again?! That made no sense at all!

"We're doomed..." Zorua sourly said as he laid belly-down on top of the giant bed, looking at the green fairy in front of him.

Celebi sat down, looking deep in thought.

The last few hours had been quite eventful for her. She had managed to locate Zorua, grew him back, made sure he ate and drank... and now, he was back to square one, and she along with him. Even worse, Lopunny had left them on top of her bed, whenever she got back she could simply lay down without remembering about the two. And for Zorua and Celebi would be the end - even though she could pick Zorua up and fly away, Celebi would have no chance of escaping the planet that was Lopunny.

The fairy sighed, instinctively looking at her dark-type companion.

"Zorua..."

"Don't talk to me until you find a way out of this mess." he rudely interrupted, turning his back to Celebi.

The message was clear, he probably still hated her for the week on Lopunny... and for this whole accident of course.

The time-traveler bit her lip, feeling bad.

As much as Zorua deserved his punishment, she knew that this whole situation was all her fault. She shouldn't have called Lopunny in the first place. She felt desperation growing inside of her - was this what Zorua felt for the whole week? No... even worse, he felt desperation, hunger and thirst at once.

Now she felt horrible - was she going to suffer the same fate? If she didn't manage to grow them back up before Lopunny returned, things would get really rough...

The fairy looked at Zorua. If the two of them wanted to get out of this situation alive, they needed to cooperate... and if they needed to cooperate, all the sour feeling between them had to get lost. At least for now.

"Zorua..." Celebi tried again.

Silence.

"Zorua please..." she said, fluttering in front of the fox. He didn't even look at her, he was keeping his gaze low looking at an indistinct point behind the fairy.

"Zorua... talk to me..." she tried once more, her paws traveling under the fox's chin as she gently raised his head. He didn't fight back, but he didn't respond either.

"... Zorua, I'm sorry for this whole thing... can we make peace...?" Celebi meekly attempted to apologize.

Zorua didn't even blink, and she found that she couldn't blame him.

After a week of starvation, dehydration, lack of sleep, ‘I'm sorry’ couldn't exactly make Zorua flash his usual grin, telling ‘That's alright, I forgive you’...

The dark-type stared at the fairy, seeming bored by the whole thing. But Celebi knew, he was as desperate as she was.

Fighting back tears, the time-traveler tried again,

"Zorua... talk to me please... we need to find a way out of this situation, we need to work together... I did let you eat and drink, no?" she offered.

Zorua still didn't respond, seemingly deep in thought. He was totally ignoring her.

"Come on Zorua... we've got to help each other... we've got..." she didn't finish, the feeling of guilt now too strong for her to bear.

Zorua suddenly found Celebi clinging to his neck.

She was hugging him.

The fox was quite sure she was crying silently, he could tell by his fur feeling damp.

That told Zorua two things: one, having a girl crying on you isn't exactly the best thing ever; two, Celebi was truly sorry about what she did to him.

He finally looked at her, her minuscule body was shaken by sobs, her tears slid down her eyes and splashed onto Zorua's fur.

The dark-type's heart seemed to open up a little - if she was truly sorry... could he still hate her in this particular situation...?

... Yes! Of course he could! That hateful green girl had left him in hell for a week! He wasn't going to let a few sweet words and some salt water sliding out her eyes melt his heart!

Zorua kept a neutral look on his face, while Celebi kept crying her hug tightening around his neck.

Then, Celebi pulled off... Zorua felt pitiful.

How much time had passed since she started crying? Her eyes went from bright blue to red and swollen, tears kept falling.

Could he really deny her the chance to make peace...?

"Please Zorua..." she cried.

Those two words were enough to shatter Zorua's feeble resistance. And, while not liking her, he discovered that, all of a sudden, he didn't hate her anymore. She had humiliated herself by crying in front of the fox... he guessed that it was quite enough for now. He'd make sure she was going to make it up to him later.

"... Okay Celi. Let's make peace." he whispered.

Instantly, Celebi's face brightened up.

"Zorua..." she whispered, reaching forward to hug him again, but he hopped backwards, avoiding her arms which ended up grasping air.

"No hugs. No more hugs. We're not friends, I simply don't think I hate you. I just want to make it out of this situation alive." he bluntly stated.

Celebi looked at him dejectedly, before wiping her tears with a paw and nodding.

She supposed it was all she was getting from him now... she had his cooperation, it was good. She'd come to the subject ‘friendship’ later on.

--

The two unfortunate pokemon went quiet for a while as they simply laid on the giant bed of Lopunny.

The bunny giantess was still probably at the festiv-

"You two tinies~ I'm back~" the sound of a door opening.

She was coming inside the room!

Zorua sprang up in alert.
"Celi! You need to grow us back, now! If she doesn't find us, we're doomed!" he cried.

Celebi, who was laying down, sat upright.

"Well... it's been a few hours... let's just hope it works..." she mumbled hopefully, eyes glowing as she...

1223322222131231113211332122.content:
Unable to believe that her best friend just left her by herself, Celebi looked at the closed door longingly.

How was Lopunny supposed to even locate her when she got back? And Zorua! She could kill him!

...

Celebi blushed. Lopunny HAD almost killed Zorua once, though she did not know about him.

"I hope she's not doing anything awkward..." the nanoscopic fairy said, her paw connecting with her face as she sighed in exasperation.

This whole situation was... intriguing to say the least, but seeing the world from what had been Zorua's point of view for a whole week, she had already experienced that.

Now, she thought, it was time to grow back. As for Zorua... she didn't know. She had already grown him once, and he had promised to either stop pranking or make pranks less hurtful... but could she risk?

Plus, Zorua looked a lot more cute like that-

Celebi blushed heavily.

The name ‘Zorua’ and the adjective ‘cute’ in the same sentence in her thoughts?

"That's weird..." she shook her head,
"Better focusing on growing back now..." she mused.

Again, her eyes glowed, her arms spread and her head rose up.

Celebi began feeling very light-weight, using her size-changing ability always left her feeling like that; probably, she still hadn't gotten used to it (not that she had shrunken or grown anything in Zorua's week of ‘inactivity’).

Sadly, the glow disappeared from her eyes without the fairy having made any progress.

"Come on..." she said to herself, annoyed, as she tried again.

Only to achieve a similar result - she could swear she had seen her surroundings shrinking a teeny tiny bit, but aside from that nothing was different.

"Oh, you gotta be kidding! I've grown Zorua, grown and shrunk Lopunny, and then I shrunk Zorua and me! It wasn't that much!... Was it?" she mused, wondering if it really was too much power for one day.

Why was her ability even malfunctioning? Perhaps... didn't she fully master it? Because it seemed like she was pretty good at it.

Celebi sighed as, again, her eyes glowed of a soothing cyan color.

She let the sensation take her body, whole her mind imagined herself, floating above the bed, growing back to her normal height.

She looked around, and was surprised that it was actually working!

"Yes!" Celebi chimed as she grew up... sadly, as soon as the growing began, it ended.

Celebi looked around, everything was still massive to her. But the bed was not a planet anymore.

If she had to compare herself to something, she would tell she was the size of a small doll... a very small doll. A far cry from her original size.

Again, Celebi evoked her size-changing ability and focused it on herself, intent on growing more.

But the cyan light didn't even show up this time, suggesting that doll-size was all she was getting for the time being.

Celebi sighed, then giggled.

"Well... at least I'm taller than Zorua now!" she chimed to no one, before adopting a serious expression.

"Hmm... should I check on those two? Lopunny can be a bit... distracted at times... wouldn't want her to kill Zorua..." she mused out loud, feeling vaguely guilty for what the nanoscopic fox had gone through before of her.

And who knew what Lopunny was doing to him right now, Celebi wondered.

She sat down on the bed and looked around, admiring her giant surroundings. She was tall enough to be at least seen and heard now, so she could take a moment to do as Lopunny told and relax.

Everything to her was massive, but Celebi quickly discovered that she didn't mind... in fact, the way Lopunny's bed looked so gigantic to her was almost kind of amusing.

Not to mention the rest of the bunny's room: her closet was an immense castle, her desk an endless, wooden plain, the poke-dolls that were scattered around the room were veritable mountains.

She hadn't noticed before, but next to her was a gigantic, Zorua poke-doll.

Celebi smirked - Lopunny DID express her wish to meet the prankster. Was that why this thing was there?

Again, her mind went to Zorua.

‘I wonder if he's okay...’
1223322222131231113211332122.title: A little improvement

choices: "Let's go get some rest."
"Let's get some food."
"Why don't we figure out something to do to pass the time."
12233222221312311132113321221.content:
Celebi looked towards the large door and nodded.

This whole thing was unique...and kinda fun, but her friend was being a bit too...energetic for the current situation that she and Zorua were in. She figured she owed it to Zorua to at least make sure he didn't get hurt...he'd probably been through enough by now to dissuade him from ever trying to pull a prank again at this rate.
