She did smirk at some of the things he was going through...but then thought back to the state he was in when she first restored him and frowned. Since then he'd also been a lot more serious than she'd known him to be, not a grin or jab in sight. Just stoicism or a frown.

She decided to bail him out, and with that flew through the door and went to search for Lopunny and Zorua.

She didn't need to fly far to hear Lopunny's giggles though, and she made a sharp left towards Lopunny's living room...there she saw Lopunny giggling as she blew into her paw a bit, creating a torrent gale force for the nano sized fox on her enormous paw. He was using claws and teeth, with his eyes shut to hold on, and the giggling rang in his ears.

He couldn't believe he was in this hell again...but this time the bunny was aware.

"Hang in there Zorua, you're doing great!" Lopunny said, blissfully unaware of the intensity of the situation he was in right now.

Celebi saw this and flew in front of Lopunny's face.

Zorua looked up to see Celebi...looking as big as a mountain to him, though still nowhere near Lopunny's size.

"Celebi, hey! You grew yourself! Well grow me please!" Zorua yelled, a twinge of desperation in his voice. Celebi looked to him, then back to Lopunny.

"Look, I get that you're having a great time Loppy, but please...it's been a grueling time for us...him especially. He needs to take it a bit easy, why don't you head back to the festival, we'll wait for you?" Celebi said, trying to persuade her old friend.

Lopunny giggled.

"It's been forever since you called me Loppy...hmm..." Lopunny looked to the tiny black dot on her paw, then to the doll sized Celebi before smiling.

"Sure, go for it~" Lopunny said with a giggle. "Just play nice you two little 'friends'~" She said in a tone that made Celebi think Lopunny was getting entirely the wrong idea.

"That's not-...sure, yeah, we'll go with that." Celebi sighed, smiling as Lopunny shifted, completely rocking Zorua to the core as a psychic force took him into the smaller, but still quite large paws of Celebi.

"...are you gonna grow me back?" Zorua asked and Celebi smiled before shaking her head.

"Sorry, it took all I had just to do this for myself...I think I need rest, then i'll try it again." She said and Zorua groaned.

Lopunny at this point was at the door, about to head out.

"Don't do anything to wild, i'll be back in a few hours. Have fun!" Lopunny cried before her door shut.

"...Thank Arceus..." Zorua said, glad she was gone before he turned his attention once again to the giant Celebi. "So you can't grow me right now?" He asked.

"Sorry, it's really a no go...truth be told i'm worried about being able to use that ability again at all right now..."

Zorua gulped, the idea of spending the rest of his life like this...it wasn't something he wanted to confront at all. Then there was Celebi...

He had no idea how to process the many emotions related to this pokemon that were swirling in his head.

He had a question though.

"Why rescue me?" He said, a little bitter and Celebi looked at him.

"I thought...you could use a break...now come on..."
12233222221312311132113321221.title: Getting the troublemaker from the airhead

choices: "Well you two, bedtime~"
"Hey, why don't we play something? All three of us?"
"Zorua, I wanted to meet you badly... tell us about yourself!"
122332222213123111321133212211.content:
"Let's get some rest, Zorua," Celebi suggested, holding the fox to her face.

It was ironic: he was a doll to her, who was a doll to Lopunny, who was a planet to Zorua.

Said dark-type looked at the fairy warily.

"... Rest?" he parroted back,
"Whaddya mean by that?"

Celebi giggled.

"Well... we could just sit here, play something..."

"You're so planning to mess with me, aren't you?" Zorua interrupted.

At this, Celebi looked a bit of taken aback, but then grinned down at the fox.

"Y'know Zorua... that's a very tempting thought - I mean..." her paw tilted left-to-right and right-to-left, causing the fox to hang on for dear life.
"... When do I get to do stuff like this to you?" Celebi continued.

Zorua tried to muster up courage.

"Often if you don't find a way to grow me back soon!" he replied agitatedly.

The paw stopped, and Zorua breathed in relief.

"Hmm... you know, who says I will after all? I mean... this was supposed to be a punishment..." she mused, grinning smugly.

Zorua paled.

"W- I said I'm done with pranks! Haven't I suffered enough for one week?!" he retorted, and Celebi sighed with convincing dejection.
"OR make them less hurtful... but, y'see Zorua, the point was getting you to stop completely... and plus, I never got to play with you..." she recalled.

Zorua stared up at the green giantess, teeth gritted... but then, he smirked.

"You're messing with me." he declared, calming down.

Celebi blinked innocently.

"And what makes you think that?"
"Your lips are shaking. You're practically struggling to not laugh at my face." Zorua stated, before sighing,
"You know, I'm clueless how I feel about you."

Celebi finally dropped her solemn expression to giggle.
"Feeling's mutual, buddy," she said cheerfully as she sat down on Lopunny's couch.
"Good detective skills." she praised.

"Too bad that won't pull me outta this..." Zorua stated resignedly as he sat down as well, on top of Celebi's smooth palms.

At this point, Celebi sighed.

"I was... honest Zorua..." she said dejectedly.

"Hmm? About?" the nanoscopic dark-type asked, feeling oddly calm now, despite the fact that Celebi, the dangerous and unpredictable Celebi, was a giant again to him. But... she had mentioned that she was kidding.

Right?

Another sigh escaped Celebi.

"Us." she said, leaning back a bit, still holding the tiny fox to her face,
"I... don't know if I'll ever be able to grow us to our normal sizes again..."

Zorua gulped. She had said it once, and the scenario was already horrible; if she said it twice, it meant that she was serious.

"S-So? What do we do? Do we stay like this forever? How can we, Celebi?" he asked,
"I'm practically nothing! You're a doll!"

Celebi nodded with a grave look on her face.

He was right; they couldn't even get out of this house like this: Zorua would be blown away by the slightest breeze, other pokemon would see Celebi herself and try all sorts of things with a living doll such as herself.

"... There's Lopunny" she offered. Zorua snorted.

"An air-head 'n a walking accident. What else?"

"Watch your mouth..." Celebi sighed.
"And I... really don't know..." she admitted slowly.

Silence fell between the two shrunken pokemon.

"Promise me something." Celebi suddenly said, drawing Zorua's attention.

"What?"

Celebi looked down, avoiding his gaze.

"If I ever manage to grow us back... promise that you'll quit with pranks. I've had enough of this ‘shrinking’ you know..." she said.

"And if you don't don't grow us back?" Zorua questioned, causing Celebi to bite her lip.

"We'll... we'll see, okay? Now promise." she repeated.

Zorua looked away.

"... I repeat what I already said: either I'll quit or make them less hurtful... let's say, not to the traumatizing level, okay?" he said, recalling a few pokemon running from his woods, scared to death.

Celebi nodded.

"Fair enough."

The unexpected happened: Zorua was moved forward, right into Celebi's chest; her other paw joined the others.

An embrace.

Zorua blinked, then blushed. This was still the girl that sent him to hell twice.

"Let go." he said calmly, starting to squirm to break free, guessing where this was going.

"No..." the fairy responded,
"You were right, you suffered enough. I want us to move on Zorua... to be friends," she stated, a hint of guilt in her voice.

The tiny dark-type opened his mouth to reply, but Celebi continued uninterrupted,

"And if not friends, let's be what we are: two unfortunate companions who gotta figure a way out of this mess."

Zorua didn't reply to that. But neither he struggled anymore.

--

"Tinies~ I'm home~" a cheerful voice sang.

Celebi and Zorua looked up as the monolithic Lopunny came into view, seeing her green friend hugging the nanoscopic Zorua.

"D'aww..."

Both shrunken pokemon blushed, and Celebi was quick to let go of Zorua, holding him in one paw.

"S-So? How was the festival?" Celebi asked, embarrassed.

Lopunny (as gently as she could) picked the doll-sized Celebi up in her fist and took her place on the couch, rocking Zorua's world with the mere movement.

She let go, letting the green fairy sit on her palm while Zorua breathed free air again.

"Amazing!" Lopunny commented as she regarded her minuscule friend and her way-more-minuscule passenger.

"And you? Did you two anything fun?" she hinted with a smirk, causing the two to blush.

"You know you're a real-" Celebi's paw rushed to Zorua's mouth. Muffled cries came from beneath it.

"Lopunny, we're not like that! We're not even friends, remember? Punishment...?" she recalled.

Lopunny giggled.

"Yeah, but you're incredibly cute anyway." she said, causing the flow of muffled insults to resume under Celebi's palm.

"So... what now?" the fairy asked to deviate Lopunny's mind from such line of thinking.

The rabbit giantess grinned.
122332222213123111321133212211.title: Resting, talking and bonding

choices: Celebi has enough to grow both herself and Zorua back to normal
Celebi has just enough to grow herself to normal or Zorua to her height...
Celebi still can't grow anything...
1223322222131231113211332122111.content:
"Bedtime tinies, i'm tired, and i'm sure you're both ready for rest too~" Lopunny said, giggling. She was having her ideas about the two small pokemon with her.

Celebi sighed, glad that Lopunny wasn't going to try and get them to be active again. Some sleep may also help her to recharge her power, if she could even still use it. Celebi smiled up at her giant friend.

"Alright, let's get some shut eye." She said, and Zorua himself looked at the two titanic pokemon before it hit him how tired he himself was. When was the last time he got some good sleep? It had been at least a week right? He yawned, deciding he'd try to trust Celebi to keep him safe as he slept.

"Just...please be careful." Zorua said, the fatigue creeping into his voice.

"I will, and so will Lopunny...right?" Celebi said, and the planet sized bunny nodded.

"I'll make sure you both sleep safely." She said, Zorua was incredulous at this statement, but too tired to really protest.

Lopunny made her way to her room, setting the tiny pair on the bed.

"Let me get ready for bed, i'll be right back." Lopunny said as with thunderous steps she walked off.

"...I really hope your size powers come back." Zorua said and Celebi looked down at him.

"We'll see in the morning...maybe a good night's rest is all I need." Celebi said.

Zorua hoped she was right...

-

"I don't know how to feel about this." Zorua said, as he was cuddled to Celebi's chest.

"Look, it'll keep you from being blown away or hurt by anything. Trust me, alright."

"Yeah, trust her Zorua, she'll snuggle you and keep you nice and safe, same that i'll do for her~" Lopunny's giant voice rang in Zorua's ears.

He grunted, Lopunny was snuggling the tiny Celebi who was snuggling the tiny Zorua, and he knew Lopunny tossed and turned sometimes due to his time with her.

"Just...try not to move much." Zorua said and Lopunny giggled.

"Promise."

"Right..." Zorua closed his eyes, the soft field of green that enveloped him keeping him warm.

It didn't take long for him to drift off.

Celebi for her part closed her eyes.

'In the morning...I really hope I can grow us in the morning...' And with that, she drifted off too, with the hopes that the next day would give her better results.
1223322222131231113211332122111.title: Off to bed with the bunny and the fairy

choices: She grows Zorua to her size
She grows herself to normal
12233222221312311132113321221112.content:
Celebi woke up from her dreamless slumber to feel warm softness around her...and seeing the room still dark around her. If she had to guess, dawn was a bit away.

It didn't take long for the events of the previous day to come back to her as she looked to the tiny dark fox sleeping in her grasp. He seemed to be at peace right now, she cracked a smile. He was kinda adorable when he wasn't being a jerk...and he said if he got back to normal he'd put a lid on his shenanigans...at least make them less of a mean thing when he got back.

She frowned. If she could grow him...or herself for that matter. She struggled to get out of Lopunny's grasp but found that she was held fast. She sighed at this, but relented. Closing her eyes she reached into herself...to find that she felt like she had a bit of juice in her! Enough to grow at least one of them...but she still felt far weaker than she had yesterday before her power failed her...she frowned again. Rest was probably what she needed...she closed her eyes again, but had a hard time falling asleep. She sighed, trapped like this...and she knew Lopunny wasn't much of an early riser...she'd give her time to wake up.

-

Celebi had spent two hours holding the fox and being held by the bunny and she was bored out of her mind...the room was bright with sunlight now, and she looked around what she could see of Lopunny's room...but it wasn't too interesting after a while.

She heard a yawn behind her, a loud one and smiled. Finally! She felt a shift as Lopunny got up...and that shift turned catastrophic as she was launched with Lopunny raising her arms fast to stretch, completely forgetting about Celebi.

"Whoa!" Celebi shouted as the room spun, but she got her bearings in the air, sighing as she did. She looked down at the charge in her paws to see...he was still asleep.

"Wow..." She was impressed, but she did remember how exhausted he had been the day before.

"Oh, sorry Celi...guess I forgot." Lopunny said, rubbing the back of her head. Celebi shook her head but smiled.

"No harm no foul..." She said as she fluttered back towards her giant friend.

"I'll go make breakfast!" Lopunny said as she got up, the ground pounding below her as she went out of the room, and Celebi winced, hearing a crash.

"I'm fine!" She heard her friend say, giggling and Celebi groaned.

"Zorua..." She whispered to the fox in her paws. He groaned.

"Zorua." She said more firmly and his eyes cracked open.

"Myeah...?" He said drowsily and Celebi smiled.

"Hey...i've got some good news...I think rest is all I need to recharge my ability...I think I can grow one of us a bit." Zorua's eyes shot open at this as he stood in her paws.

"Yeah...?" He said, still tired, but very much at attention now. It was then that Celebi bit her lip.

"Yeah...I think I have enough to grow you to my size...or me to normal." Celebi said. Zorua looked down at her paws, dejectedly, both winced as they heard a crash from Lopunny. Zorua looked to the door, then to Celebi.

"Celebi, you swear I can trust you...no more hell games, no more...of that stuff?" Zorua said. Celebi nodded.

"I promise Zorua...i'm done punishing you, I just want to make this right."

"If...you were to grow yourself, could you keep me safe?" He asked and Celebi's mouth opened wide.

"Um...yes." She said, surprised Zorua was going down this line of thinking.

"If you grow yourself, we can get away from the...from your friend and her...ditzy tendencies." Zorua was trying to be nice about it. "And I don't think I can handle much more of her carefree attitude towards this whole situation...so..." Zorua sighed.

"Grow yourself and let's get out of here." He said and Celebi was shocked.

"But if I grow and you stay this size...it might be harder for me to keep track of you..."

"You just said you could manage it." Zorua said.

Celebi bit her lip.

"I mean...I should be able to protect you, but it's still such a size difference..."

"Lopunny managed, I trust you." Zorua said, this surprised Celebi...Zorua seemed willing to trust her right now at least. Celebi made her decision.
12233222221312311132113321221112.title: Celebi's decision

choices: "Let's go out! We'll have fun!"
"Hmm... I don't think you two should get out... we'll stay inside!"
122332222213123111321133212211121.content:
Celebi sighed deeply as her eyes glowed cyan.

Zorua watched her, expecting the giantess to grow to the size of a galaxy... but it never happened.

Instead, the fox himself was surrounded by the same cyan aura, and was quickly placed down on the undone bed.

Before he could ask what was going on, Zorua began to grow, and he grew up to until he could look at Celebi in the eye.

Right then, the psychic aura faded as the green fairy dropped on her knees, panting.

"... Wow... this is becoming hard..." Celebi stated.

Zorua frowned.

"Why didn't you grow back?" he mused,
"I may be bigger now, but we're still dolls in the hands of a walking disaster!"

"No need to be rude," Celebi scolded.
"She's just a little-" a loud this echoed through the house, followed by the noise of broken glass, which suggested how Lopunny was making breakfast.

"... Distracted."

Zorua huffed loudly.

Celebi finally stood back up.

"Come on Zorua, look on the bright side! We're on the same height now, Lopunny will be able to see you..."

"So that she can get more weird ideas with me..." Zorua said resignedly.

Celebi found nothing to counter with. Not that there was any need to, though.

"Celi~... Oh, Zorua, you're awake," Lopunny's head peered from the doorway as she entered the room, holding a plate with two cups of juice, a few cookies and some berries.

The large rabbit giggled awkwardly.

"Hehehe, I think I broke a cup at some point but... hey, Zorua is bigger!" Lopunny exclaimed upon noticing Zorua's new height.

"D'aww, you were so cute when you were so tiny... but you're both so adorable~!"

The declaration caused both the shrunken fairy and the shrunken fox to blush while Lopunny set the plate on top of her nightstand and sat down on the bed, making the duo to bounce from the shockwaves her rear caused upon impacting with the bed.

"Careful..." Celebi dizzily said,
"We're dead..." Zorua sighed in resignation.

The large Lopunny giggled again and took a single cookie, placing it in front of the duo.

"Hey, I bet all the food in the world looks so big and tasty from your tiny sizes~" the bunny chimed."

"Hm, yeah! It isn't so bad after all!" Celebi replied, trying to be positive about to whole thing, when in reality she had to share Zorua's opinion: being so tiny was really an exciting experience, but it was also very, very dangerous.

And if the two of them weren't careful enough, anything could have happened to them, from being eaten to the humiliating end of being sat on by someone.

Zorua remained quiet and kept eating the cookie wordlessly. There was nothing to say, he thought, not after a week in Lopunny Hell. That was something that scarred him for life, he knew.

Celebi seemed to notice the uneasiness emanated by her companion and hurried to change subject,

"So, Lopunny, any plans for today? I mean... we're staying until I find a way to grow us back, no?"

Lopunny grinned.

"Of course! I'll love having you two cute dolls in my house as long as it lasts!" she declared.

The statement was followed by Celebi and Zorua being scooped up from their cookie and being hugged hard to the chest of the bunny giantess.

Both shrunken pokemon blushed.

"This is so awkward..." Zorua said, letting a blush spread across his dark-furred cheeks.

Celebi blushed too, but masked her embarrassment with a nervous giggle.

"Come on Zorua, this isn't so bad!"

The dark-type shot her an annoyed stare; he would have replied to Celebi, but the overexcited giant Lopunny was hugging both of them so tightly that Zorua felt like his lungs were about to pop out of his chest.

Only after a while, the brown giantess released the shrunken duo from her way-too-affectionate embrace and placed them back on the bed as gently as she could... basically dropping them halfway from the bed.

Celebi giggled awkwardly while Zorua tried to catch his breath.

Lopunny laughed at the sight, which she judged adorable.

"As for today..."
122332222213123111321133212211121.title: Two dolls for the Bunny

choices: Giant Lopunny to giga Lopunny!
Giant Lopunny to giga GODDESS Lopunny!
1223322222131231113212.content:
Celebi tries to fix Lopunny's size, but her changing size power seems to backfired again and instead to shrink Lopunny down, it making even more gigantic!

But how big Lopunny will be now?

A: Lopunny grows so fast that she founds herself in the space and standing on the global earth!

B: Lopunny grows so fast that she founds herself floating in the space and saw the tiny planet earth right infront her eyes!
1223322222131231113212.title: Celebi made Lopunny's size worst

choices: Celebi manages to catch up and shrinks Zorua again!
Zorua manages to get away!
122332222213123112.content:
Zorua kept crawling away from Celebi, until his legs couldn't hold him anymore. He fell flat on the ground, looking exhausted.

Celebi felt a pit of guilt in her stomach. Seeing Zorua like that, exhausted and delirious, made her partly regret shrinking him and leaving him with Lopunny for a week.

"I-I'll get you some water," she repeats.
"Don't move."

With that, the fairy fluttered off, leaving Zorua by himself.

And, slowly, the fox started to fade away...

More specifically, the illusion of the fox started to fade away, leaving the real Zorua, standing at full height as he stared at the distant festival.

He started snickering.
"This is gonna be sweet." he muttered to himself as he started walking towards the town.

Right after he left, Celebi came back, holding a glass of water. However, Zorua was nowhere to be seen.
"Z-Zorua?" she called out as she looked around.
"If this is another one of your pranks, it's not funny!" she cried.

"Celebi?" Lopunny called from behind as she too came into the deserted clearing.
"Who are you talking to?"

Celebi swallowed nervously as she brought the glass to her mouth, taking a few sips of water.
"Oh... no one... I was just thinking aloud..." she responds.

Lopunny smiles.
"Oh, I do that a lot!" she exclaims cheerfully, clueless about Zorua.

The big bunny walks over Celebi, wrapping a paw around her shoulders.
"Come on, the festival has begun! Let's get going!" she suggests as she starts walking, Celebi following.
"Yeah... just no dancing..." Celebi replies distractedly.
"We'll see~"

Celebi didn't really care about the festival... if she cared at all. Right now, her thoughts were occupied by a single pokemon: Zorua.

She saw him. She saw the way he was snickering as he looked at the festival. That could be no good.

‘Behave Zorua... don't pull anything and we'll go straight home and forget what happened...’ she thinks.

--

"Come on Celebi! Have fun!" Lopunny exclaims, her voice almost as loud as the music.

The bunny grabbed Celebi's paws in hers as she started gleefully spinning around, doing a silly dance, taking the fairy along with her.
"Lopunny! I said no dancing!" she exclaims, trying to pull off.

She was in no mood to have fun right now. Her mind was still fixed on Zorua. He was still missing, and he was possibly planning for his reveng-

Loud screams.

Celebi turns around.

Confusion. Frightened faces.
"Wh-Wha..." she mutters breathlessly as she looks at something in distance.

A cloud of dust. As it nears the festival, Celebi notices that it's actually a herd of Tauros. Heading straight for the festival.

Everyone was stumbling away to find somewhere safe to hide.
In confusion, Celebi feels something tugging on her arm. She looks around to see... an oddly calm Lopunny.
"Celebi, we need to get away!" she says, dragging Celebi away.

Lopunny stops on top of a small hill. Both her and Celebi pant.
"Is this... does this happen often...?" Celebi asks.

Lopunny giggled.
"Oh no~" she sang cheerfully, while grinning down at Celebi.
"This is new! Don't you think it's beautiful?" she asks.

Celebi looks shocked.
"Lo-Lopunny...?" she stutters.

Lopunny' giggling changes into snickering... and Lopunny too changes.

An illusion dispels, leaving a snickering Zorua where once was Lopunny.

Celebi went pale.
"Z-Zorua?!" she exclaimed.

He laughed upon seeing her face.

"Where's... where's Lopunny?" Celebi asks the fox, unable to believe this all is going on. Zorua snickers even more.
"Oh~ your friend Celebi told me to tell you she went ahead. She also said you should catch up with her at the festival~" he laughs maniacally.
"That idiot even thanked me! Would you believe it?" he says.

Celebi stares at him breathlessly.

"Look Celebi!" he said, pointing to the ruined festival.

She does as told, noticing the Tauros running through the town... without causing any damage at all. One of them passed right through a building. Zorua's eyes glow, and some windows around the town shatter.

"Just to make sure~" he snickers.

Apparently, the illusion was real enough for the running pokemon, as they kept going, trying to find safe sports from the illusionary herd.

Celebi stares at them without moving or talking, mouth and eyes wide open. She spots Lopunny among the crowd. She looks scared as she runs, occasionally tripping.

"You know, they say ‘Revenge is sweet’. Man, are they right!" Zorua snickers as he observes the scene, remembering how he was tortured during his stay with Lopunny... although she was unaware of him. Nonetheless, payback is sweet for the dark type fox.

Lopunny is scared to death, and Celebi is suffering from watching the startled town. Zorua grins madly.

This was the best prank he ever pulled! And he got his revenge, too!

But, as much as he enjoyed the 'show', he quickly recalls that Celebi would be furious when she recovers from the shock... and she would surely shrink him to a nanoscopic dot again if he didn't get away soon.

Zorua snickers again before turning around.
"Now, if you'll excuse, I'll be on my way! Oh, and don't bother to show your face to me ever again!" he states, starting to walk away.

Celebi stands still, before slowly turning around to look at the leaving fox.
"Zorua." she quietly calls out.

"Hm?" Zorua asks, turning around.

Discovering Celebi with a glare and glowing eyes.

Zorua tensed up.
"Oh no you don't!" he seethed as he stood on his hind legs, before slamming his forelegs on the ground, a wave of pure darkness forming as Zorua performed Night Daze.

Celebi was knocked back as the darkness blinded her.

When she was able to see again, she noticed Zorua running away.

"Oh no, you don't!" she snarled as she gave chase.
122332222213123112.title: Zorua's revenge

choices: "Making it up to Lopunny as her pet."
"Being my pet."
"As a bug, a speck on the ground on your own."
1223322222131231121.content:
Zorua was pretty content with himself at this point, he had stunned that book worm, got back at that air head, caused a beautiful display of panic and chaos, and was damn close to getting away with it. He grinned 'served 'em right' as he thought about the week he just had. Once he was out of this he'd think about how to proceed from there, he didn't know if he'd ever top this prank but boy were there always options. He rounded a tree, starting to go into a forested area away from the panicked village when an aura surrounded him and he stopped moving.

"...oh no! Oh no no no!" He panicked trying to find purchase, but he was lifted from the ground and went flying back...right towards a seething Celebi. He growled at her and she said nothing as she levitated him back to the clearing for him to see his handiwork. The villagers at this point had figured out that the Tauros herd was fake, it had passed over many of them, and most were confused, others horrified, and many more sad at the damage done by their own running away. There was no way the festival was happening.

"Are you happy?" Celebi seethed, looking out. Zorua smiled. "Elated. This is what you get and this is what that idiot bunny gets for what I just went through." Zorua was slammed to the ground hard. He staggered to his feet only to find his surroundings getting bigger. 'Crap, she's doing it again!' He thought as he tried to run, only to be pinned by a psychic aura as everything around him got bigger and bigger. Celebi's voice, now much louder than a second ago, rang out behind him.

"I see, do you know what YOU get Zorua? You get to live out the rest of your life..."
1223322222131231121.title: Caught

choices: Celebi heads straight for the forest, wanting to confront Zorua
Celebi heads home... she'll confront Zorua later on
Celebi heads for the forest but doesn't find Zorua
1223322222131231122.content:
Zorua snickers to himself, quite proud of his day.

He got back to his size, got revenge on Celebi and on her dumb friend and pulled the best prank ever! Now, something in his stomach after starving for a week and he could call this ‘the perfect day’.

... If he managed to escape the raging Celebi, who was still chasing him.

"Stop Zorua!" she growled from behind him, he could hear the anger in her voice.

He started snickering.
"Make me!" he snapped back, focusing.

And, before Celebi had the chance to use her psychic powers to catch him, a tree suddenly appeared out of nowhere in front of her.

She attempts to stop, but she isn't able to do so as she bumps into... a fake tree.

The fairy opens her eyes again, noticing that the tree had disappeared. It doesn't take long for her to realize that Zorua just used his illusions.

"ZORUA!" she shouted as she looked around, expecting a snickering fox... instead, she noticed that no one was there.

Instead, the trees in front of her seemed to have doubled...

Celebi quickly realizes that Zorua had used his illusions again. She couldn't distinguish the real trees from the fake ones. If she ventured into the forest, she would get lost... the only option was to turn back.

Celebi sighed. Zorua got away.

He won.

Bitterly, the grass type turns around as she makes her way back to the town.

--

Zorua laughed in elation.

He was FREE! Free from Celebi, free from Lopunny, free from being a miserable speck!

Plus, he would never forget Celebi's face at the sight of the chaotic town.

Priceless!

With those happy thoughts, Zorua kept running through the forest. There was no way Celebi was still following him. If she did, she would have gotten lost, and she was smart enough to not even try.

So, Zorua was free to continue running in direction of the village. He just had to reach HIS forest.

Then, the inhabitants of the village would get what they didn't in Zorua's week of inactivity.

--

Celebi sighed as she returned to the hill where the fake Lopunny dragged her earlier. She watches the town; pokemon apparently took notice that the Tauros weren't actually real.

Some were confused about the whole thing, some still startled.

But one pokemon in particular, Celebi notices, was giggling while sitting on the ground.

Lopunny.

Quietly, Celebi moves in direction of the town, reaching her bunny friend.

"Lopunny?" she calls out.

Lopunny looks at her, still giggling.
"Hey Celebi!" she chimes cheerfully.
"Did you see all that?"

Celebi frown. Was this another one of Zorua's tricks? A parting gift?

"Lopunny... Is that really you?" she asks. The big bunny laughs.
"Of course it's me! Oh it was so fun~!" she exclaims.

Celebi sighs. Definitely Lopunny.

"Yeah... fun..." she thinks.

It was best for Lopunny to not know anything about Zorua. Otherwise, she would surely ask about him over and over. She already mentioned she wanted to meet him when she came to Celebi's house a week ago.

But, secretly, Celebi had already decided: whenever she gets back to the village, she'll go find Zorua.

--

It was nighttime when Celebi finally could head home.

The festival was canceled... but Lopunny insisted Celebi stayed at her house for a bit before going home.

Finally, Celebi reached the village and yawned, before deciding what to do.
1223322222131231122.title: Zorua escapes

choices: ... she was glaring at him angrily...
... she was... crying...?
12233222221312311223.content:
In the end, rage overcame drowsiness as the fairy decided to head for Zorua's forest to give him a piece of her mind.

Sure, she went overboard with his punishment, but he went overboard with his revenge by implying a whole town in it! She couldn't let it slide, neither she could consider it even between her and him.

She knew what she was going to do. He would be shrunk down again, she would make him her pet for Arceus knew how long.

Quietly, Celebi got away from the village as she moved towards the forest Zorua resides in.

‘Coming to get you Zorua...’ she thought to herself as she finally got to the edge of the forest. She gave a deep sigh, before venturing into the dark forest.

Celebi floats around, not able to see much in darkness - the forest was so thick that moonlight barely seeped through the vegetation.

Celebi stopped to look around.

"Zorua." she called out firmly, masking the great fear derivating from the fact that she was all alone in a dark forest... alone with the scoundrel she was searching for, and he was nowhere in sight.

She floated around, looking in all directions to try and spot the dark type in darkness... something that could be compared to trying to spot a specific blade of grass in a grassy field.

"Z-Zorua... Come on out! I want to talk!" Celebi exclaimed, her voice starting to shake a bit.

She looked around, she was sure she saw a shadow moving somewhere... or maybe it was her imagination... her mind tricking her...

"Z-Zorua... If that's you, y-you're only making things worse... come out!" the fairy repeated as she floated back... letting out a cry of fear as her back bumped into a tree.

She hastily floated back to check behind her, and sighed in relief when she saw that it was just a tree.

She turned around.

And paled as she saw a dark face staring at her with a maniacal smirk from the shadows.

Startled, Celebi let out a cry as she hastily backed up.

And she suddenly found the ground beneath her feet missing.

With a scream of terror, Celebi sank into the fake grassy floor and fell into a quite deep pit, hitting her head on the ground. The fairy dizzily looked up...weird...from this angulation, she noted, the leaves on the trees didn't seem like leaves...

Celebi urgently realizes that it was some kind of green sheet hanging from the tree branches. And it looked like it was going to break...

As Celebi predicted, the sheet falls from the branches, releasing countless colorful balloons that fall straight into the pit, hitting the poor fairy, splashing her with mysterious liquid.

She tried her best to get away from the barrage, but she couldn't get away.

One last balloon hit her. Celebi meekly opened her eyes, noticing that she was covered in paint...

Then, she looked up again...

Only to see a bucket falling straight on her, showering her in cold water while also hurting her.

Celebi whimpered.

And soon, she heard it. That devilish laughter that would hunt her in her dreams.

Zorua.

"Sorry for the predictable prank, I didn't have much time to prepare it... but it worked nonetheless!" she heard him saying.

"I knew all along you were coming... I made this all only for ya!" he said as he walked towards the pit and peered on the bottom of it, ready to enjoy Celebi's reaction...
12233222221312311223.title: Tricked

choices: She leaves him as is, feeling she’d done enough
She makes him her pet...but tries to treat him better at least
She shrinks him down and leaves him to his fate in the forest
122332222213123112231.content:
“{c:You’re going to regret every last action you’ve ever taken against this village.” Celebi spat with venom. Zorua merely grinned. “Good luck catching me, I know the forest here li-“ The bucket he dropped on Celebi was slammed into his muzzle at full force by her psychic powers. He was sent reeling and tried to keep his footing but was too dazed. His legs fell out from under him as he tasted his own blood.

“Ow...” He muttered as he hazily saw the small green legendary hovering over the pit he dumped her in. She gripped him with a psychic force and flung him back into a tree.

His back made harsh contact with it as he felt the breath he had immediately evacuate his mouth. He gasped in pain as he fell, ready to make contact with the harsh ground before she caught him again. With a wordless glare she spun him around and flung him Skyward at an arch, and he limply descended on his own into the pit he dropped her into. She didn’t catch him this time as he harshly landed on the wet ground of the hole.

Celebi approached the hole, still glaring. “Now Zorua, I’m going to shrink you down to a speck again and this time you’ll-”

She cut herself off.

He wasn’t moving.

“Get up, you won’t get any sympathy from me Zorua.”

He still wasn’t moving.

“Seriously Zorua, get up now.” Worry was creeping into her voice now. She levitated him out of the hole to see that...she had knocked him out. He was breathing but...she had done a number on him. Between his week without sleep and food and throwing him around like a rag doll now...he was in rough shape.
122332222213123112231.title: Retaliation

choices: "... Yeah, sure, whatever..." Zorua responded
"Celebi... I'll NEVER be your friend!" Zorua responded
Zorua doesn't respond, but faints from exhaustion
1223322222131231122311.content:
Zorua had enough, Celebi decided as she sighed.

She didn't want to take things this far... but Zorua forced her hand. They were even, she guessed as she started walking away.

Behind her, Zorua opened his eyes.

He moved his paw to his muzzle, feeling it wet... he briefly licked his own paw.

Blood.

He stared at it, before gritting his teeth in rage. Something in him snapped.

Furious, Zorua stood up and turned around. Celebi was leaving.

He snarled.

Celebi barely had the time to turn around to see a Shadow Ball coming her way.

The fairy dodged just in time, the ball colliding and exploding in a tree.

Celebi looked forward, seeing a seething Zorua glaring daggers in her direction.

She returned the glare.

"... That's it Zorua! If the week you spent with Lopunny was hell, prepare for what I've got in store for you!" she shouted angrily as she prepared to shrink the fox again.

She was going to leave him alone, but no - he had to fight back, attempt to attack her. And she had definitely enough of Zorua.

Celebi's eyes glowed as she focused on her target... only to find there were two Zorua... four... eight...

Celebi stared confused - which one was the real Zorua?!

"Shrink me now." he told, before shooting another Shadow Ball at his opponent... several Shadow Balls...

Startled, Celebi flew in the air and dodged the multiple attacks, the real one causing another explosion. She looked back at the many Zorua and gritted her teeth, her fists clenching.

"Why you-"

Zorua found the fairy descending in his direction at supersonic speed, a murderous glare in her eyes.

He snarled, standing on his hind legs and slamming the on the grass beneath his paws, a wave of darkness blocking Celebi's attack.

The fairy shielded herself with her own paws, before finding the dark type charging her, his multiples gone.

She blocked him with psychic at short distance from her, but Zorua was ready and shot a Shadow Ball right in her face.

Celebi cried in pain, blinded, but held her psychic grip on Zorua. The fairy screamed, enraged, as she threw him into a tree.

Zorua hit the trunk, hard, but landed on all fours as he glared at the fairy, who was rapidly approaching him.

Celebi attempted to slap her opponent, but he stepped aside and quickly moved behind her, pushing his forelegs on her back and shoving her into the tree and starting to stomp on her.

Celebi cried in pain and rage, as she used psychic again and pushed Zorua away, before hastily getting up.

This wasn't about punishing him anymore, she briefly thought.

Either she won, or he won. And the winner was going to decide the fate of the loser...

Zorua watched as his opponent flew close to him, her green paw slapping him across the face. He growled and bit the paw that slapped him, his fangs sinking deep into the hand.

Celebi cried in pain, her cry echoing around the deserted forest as she tried to remove her paw from the mouth of Zorua. But the fox didn't have any intention of letting go, blood starting to pour from Celebi's paw.

The fairy's foot rose up as she kicked Zorua in the chest, causing him to finally let go.

Celebi looked at her own paw, which was bleeding pretty bad. She snarled, and used psychic on Zorua again. The fox hovered in midair, flailing helplessly as Celebi launched him downwards with all her psychic strength, throwing him back into the pit.

The fox landed roughly.

And, before he could get up, Celebi was on him.

Her paws got a hold of his throat as she started choking him. Zorua coughed as he gasped for air. He tried to fight back... but was far too exhausted.

As he was about to pass out, Celebi let go.

And, his vision blurry, the dark type noticed a familiar glow... he saw her growing to a monolithic height before his eyes.

Then, he stopped shrinking. And Celebi's paw came down on him, pinning him down, the other paw rising in the air menacingly.

Zorua got the gist - he was about to receive the final blow.

He growled.

Celebi's paw shook in midair.

"Do it." Zorua said. She looked at him - he was bruised, scratched and in a pretty rough shape.

"Do it!" Zorua repeated.

Celebi looked at herself - she was still bleeding, she had bruises all over her body...

All this over a stupid prank...

"DO IT!"

Like deprived of energy, Celebi's arm fell. And so did she.

She dropped on her knees, before collapsing on the ground. And then, the fairy started crying loudly, tears running down her dark eyelids as she did.

Zorua looked at her in confusion.

"Wha-" he couldn't finish as Celebi pulled him in a hug, her bleeding paw dropping blood on his black fur.

"I-I..." she couldn't speak properly as she kept crying.

She couldn't believe it... she was about to become a murderer, just because of two dumb pranks Zorua pulled on her!

She called herself smart, but was about to make the biggest mistake of her life! She had let Lopunny torture him for a week, she had knocked him out - something that was deserved - and in the end she attempted to kill him!

At this point, who was the real jerk between the two?

Zorua watched as the fairy cried, laying down on the bottom of the pit, hugging him to her chest.

Celebi cried for a good while more.

Then, she slowly sat upright and started sobbing.
"I-I... I-I'm s-so-sorry! I d-di-didn't want it t-to go like t-this!" she cried.

Zorua huffed weakly, sore from all the hits he received and confused from Celebi's weird behavior.
"Little late for that." he said coldly.

He wasn't going to let the tears of this green girl melt his heart. She had attempted to kill him twice over a stupid prank, and he wasn't going to forgive nor forget that.

Celebi looked at him, tears falling on top of the fox's head, mixing with the blood coming from her paw.

She sniffled.
"B-But it's not too l-late to make things right..." she bitterly said, one paw leaving Zorua as she wiped her eyes.

"Whaddya mean?"

Celebi sobbed again.
"This... was far too much..." she said shakily.
"And... your pranks... my foolish actions... this nullifies them completely..." she explained.

"Like hell they're nullified!" Zorua shouted.

Celebi sniffled.

"Yes they are... Zorua, I didn't mean to do all this..." she bitterly said.

"Too bad, you did." the fox coldly said. Celebi hugged with more strength, frustrated.

"I know... and this will never be deleted... but we can... we can start over Zorua... be friends..." she suggested.

The fox snorted.

"Me? You? Friends?" he inhaled.
"NEVER!" he shouted at top of his lungs.

Now, he pretty much expected Celebi to crush him to paste... but he saw her letting a couple more tears fall.

"Zorua..." she whispered, exhausted and exasperated.
"I'm honest... I'm sorry about this all... I should have had better judgement... I should have been more responsible... this is all my fault..." she bitterly admitted.

The fox looked at her - she was desperate. Even in darkness, he could see her eyes completely red from tears, sadness in them. Celebi was genuinely sorry for her actions.

Zorua seemed to soften at the declaration. He remained silent.

The giant fairy continued.
"I know... I'll never make it up to you for this... but, let's move on... I promise I'll never attempt something like this again..." she said, adopting a dejected smile as she held out a paw.
"Friends?"
1223322222131231122311.title: Fox and fairy fighting

choices: She kept pressing
She lets off for now, trying to change the subject
12233222221312311223113.content:
Zorua looked at the paw in front of him as it grew hazy in his vision again. He was...losing focus fast he thought as his eyes grew heavier and heavier.

He couldn't comprehend Celebi anymore, only that something warm was holding him...and wet, and sticky too...smelled like blood.

Soon that faded too.

-

Celebi was looking at the tiny fox on her table with a mix of pity and contempt. She needed him to wake up soon...she needed to talk with him.

She was glad her mom was on a business trip right now, she had at least a week if needed to keep Zorua under her eye, she wasn't exactly sure what she'd do with him. Was he being punished? I suppose he saw it that way, which was well enough in her eyes but she was genuine about trying to make peace with him...she wanted to know more about him too. If she could get to the root of him maybe...he'd stop with the pranks?

She considered calling Lopunny, or maybe one of her other friends like Bellossom and getting one of them to help with him too but...she shook her head.

She would deal with him alone, she thought as she looked at her bandaged paw where he bit her. It was deep...not deep enough to need stitches luckily, though she could just heal it a bit if it did come to that. She considered healing herself or him but decided against it. Both of them probably deserved their lumps and bruises right now. She'd at least feed him...he hadn't eaten in at least a week and him being a jerk or not, that part was her fault.

Both of them had been jerks...

He started stirring and she turned her attention fully to him.

He groaned as he sat up, he felt like he'd been hit by a charging Rhyhorn...or 10. He looked around, realizing that he was small before memories came back to him and he looked up at the towering behemoth that was Celebi...with contempt in his eyes.

"...Before you say anything about what's been going on, what do you want to eat?" She asked with a gentle tone. Starting this way might open him up to talking at least.

He looked down, still glaring. "Meat." Was all he said and she nodded before getting up and went to her kitchen. He looked around and winced before trying to take a good look at himself. He had bruises and scratches in various places...some of the nastier ones were crudely bandaged too. He supposed Celebi did that. Trying to make peace huh? Yeah right...

She came back with a small slice of pepperoni that looked to be about as big as Zorua...maybe bigger. Just a topping for a pizza he supposed...she set it down in front of him and he took a bite before digging into it ravenously. He was finally filling his belly. Celebi watched him, he certainly had the look of a half starved pokemon and the way he tore into it...she looked at him with full pity in her eyes, not that he noticed.

It took a bit, but soon he backed off of the pepperoni...he had eaten probably a fourth of it...maybe even a third. It was an impressive amount considering his size. She held a cup of water at the edge of the desk, low enough for him to lower his head down if he wanted a drink, a silent offer to him. He approached and thirstily drank from it for what must've been a minute as well before backing off.

"Feeling better?" She asked. He grunted in response.

"...Yeah." He finally offered as she smiled.

"Zorua...about this tiny war we've been having..." He laughed at that.

"A war? I pranked you a few times, pranked a town and you nearly killed me twice."

"...Then you attacked me." She said quietly and he nodded.

"You won that...could've finished me off." He said and she looked down.

"If you had won...would you have finished me off?" He laughed at that as well.

"Me win? I don't think there's a world where that would've happened...even without that shrinking ability of yours, you're a legendary Celebi...on a different level than me." He said bitterly.

"Doesn't answer my question..." She said and he looked at her.

"...I don't know, I don't think things through well. Doesn't matter anyway, we're here now, so...what are you going to do with me?" He asked and she bit her lip.

"Zorua...I want to make peace, okay? I'm serious. If you hate me...I guess that's fine. I just want to try though...maybe get to know you? Do you have any friends?" She asked and he looked at her before looking away.

"No."

"Have you...thought about trying to make some?" She asked

"Why?" His tone was curt, as if he wasn't interested in the conversation.

"Zorua...why do you play such mean pranks on pokemon?"

He thought briefly of the first night he came to this village. Alone, crying...after leaving his dad. The dad that tormented him. Talked down to him. Insulted him. Beat him on certain nights when things didn't go his way. Starved him when he felt Zorua needed 'motivation'.

Then he came to this place...happy families, smiling kids, and him...alone, ignored.

He hated them all.

"I don't need to tell you." He said bitterly.

Celebi looked at him.

"What about...your parents?" She asked.

"SHUT UP!" He yelled, surprising maybe even himself, her eyes widened.

He looked on the verge of tears.
12233222221312311223113.title: Trying to make peace

choices: "Can we talk now? Please?" Celebi asked
"Let's just go to bed." Celebi sighed
122332222213123112231132.content:
Seeing the almost-crying Zorua in front of her, Celebi bit her lip and decided to relent for now. She was going to ask questions some other time.

She looked at the pokemon she was trying to befriend... he was still stained with her own blood, his fur was still damp where her tears had fallen on him earlier.

The fairy saw the perfect occasion to change subject.

"... You need a bath. I can't keep you in the house like this." she said, reaching for him.

Zorua backed up, avoiding her giant paw.

"Then don't keep me at all - let me go." he said coldly. Celebi stared at him for several moments.
"Are you nuts?" she asked with all the calm she could muster.
"Zorua, you're half dead... you need to be washed, disinfected and those bandages need to be changed." she said, pointing at the already blood-soaked bandages wrapped around Zorua's wounds.

Zorua sat down on the table, staring at the giantess in front of him, not sure if you feel grateful or indignant.

She had attempted to kill him, why did she want to heal him now?

"Why are you doing this?" he asked the fairy, who sighed.
"I recall saying it already... I want us to be friends... And if not, I don't want us to hate each other." she said.

Zorua snorted.
"And I recall saying that I'll never be your friend." he said. Celebi huffed in loud annoyance.
"Do as you wish - I'm still taking care of you." she said, cutting the conversation short by picking the fox up in her paw.

Zorua grunted in pain as the green paw wrapped around him. Celebi quickly softened her grip as she headed out of her room and into the bathroom.

--

Zorua was gently placed on top of the sink, which Celebi started to fill with warm water.

"... Ain't I using the tub?" Zorua asked, not really caring.

"... Please, let's not be stupid. It'd be lethal..." Celebi said in a voice that made her exasperation clear.

She was tired, she wanted to sleep badly. Only Zorua was keeping her from going to sleep. It was still very early... Celebi huffed. This was not how she spent the dark hours... she was going to wake up late tomorrow, she knew it...

One who would have seen her and Zorua from outside wouldn't have believed the sight of two blood-soaked teens, one doll-sized and the other covered in scratches apparently because of a doll.

The fairy sighed, noticing the water reaching a decent level for the fox to bathe. She turned it off, before focusing on Zorua.

She gently gripped him and started removing the bandages from his body. The dark type remained still - he knew, a wrong move and it was going to sting like hell.

Celebi successfully removed the bandages and unceremoniously threw them aside.
"Get in." she instructed, before opening a closet, reaching for some new bandages. She had to change hers as well.

Zorua looked into veritable lake below. He saw his reflection - he was tired, sore, bruised badly.

"This happens when you challenge a legendary..." he mumbled bitterly.
"Though you put up quite the fight... you're strong for an unevolved pokemon." Celebi chimed, having heard his words.

He looked at the fairy, she was sitting on a stool, busily removing the bandage around her wrist... but she was smiling at him.

"... You're just hoping to get on my good side. Nice try." Zorua said as he leaped in the water without saying a word more.

Celebi sighed, while Zorua surfaced and grunted in pain, feeling the hot water penetrating his wounds.

"Damn it, it stings!"

For the first time the whole day, Celebi giggled.

As for Zorua, he soon got used to the feeling of the hot water and floated motionless in the water, thinking.

Celebi wanted to kill him... Over a few, stupid, harmless pranks.

He had hurt no one, she had almost killed him mercilessly.

But... she was trying to make things right... she said she wanted to be his friend... she was taking care of him...

Zorua gritted his teeth - it didn't matter! She still tried to kill him!

... But she didn't...

Zorua softened and let out a sigh... perhaps...

Could he give her a chance to make peace...?

His train of thought was interrupted by the fairy giantess,

"Are you done?" she broke the silence, peering into the sink.

"... Yeah."

Celebi sighed, and gently grabbed him from the water, before placing him on top of the sink again.

She grabbed a towel.

"... This is going to sting... like a lot..." she warned, wrapping the towel around the fox and started rubbing delicate-

"OW OW OW!" Zorua cried in pain, kicking off the towel and shaking himself dry, water splashing everywhere.

He glowered up at the giantess, who giggled.
"That worked anyway..." she stated, grabbing a few clean bandages and wrapping them around Zorua's wounds.
"How are you feeling now?" she asked.

"Fine." Zorua simply responded.

He didn't want to talk. He needed to think.

Celebi nodded, gently grabbing the fox and returning to her room.

"So, what now? Are you going to try to ’punish’ me again?" he asked. Celebi sighed.
"You're stubborn... I want to make peace..." she answered.

"Good luck with that."

The fairy sat on the bed, exhausted and exasperated at the same time.
"... Anyway..."
122332222213123112231132.title: Bathing and bonding

choices: He'll attempt to make peace with her, maybe give her answers
He's not going to make peace
He's still conflicted
1223322222131231122311322.content:
"Let's just go to bed Zorua, i'm exhausted and i'm sure you are too." She said, the exhaustion creeping into her voice. She leaned over and sat him on a pillow next to where she normally slept.

He felt tremors as she adjusted herself into bed, getting under the covers and looking at him. He was staring at her giant face with an unreadable expression.

"Do you want to get under the covers too, or..." She said before he turned around, not facing her anymore and flopped down onto the pillow, pretty much proclaiming that he didn't want nor need her assistance right now.

"...Okay, good night Zorua." She said and he said nothing as she psychically flicked the lights off.

Zorua for his part had to admit that this situation was better than the one he was in for a week.

...That this pokemon put him in.

He was sure he'd have nightmares and night terrors about it for the rest of his days though, and he didn't want to forgive her for that yet. No matter how much she tried.

He sighed...she did seem to HAVE remorse and a heart though, he was sure if she had thought it through more she wouldn't have done that to him, right?

He could've died on Lopunny. Easily.

He could've died tonight. Celebi had her shot multiple times.

He closed his eyes. In the morning maybe his mind would be more clear and he'd have an answer.

-

Zorua slowly opened his eyes to see sunlight creeping in through Celebi's giant window. He blinked groggily before yawning and standing up to stretch, he winced as feeling came back to all of his wounds. He was sore as hell.

He turned around to see...Celebi still sleeping. She must've been tired. He grimaced before sticking his tongue out at her. Not like she'd ever know.

He sat on the pillow and contemplated his options before she woke up. He wasn't going to be the one to make her wake up at least...he wasn't sure how that'd end for him.
1223322222131231122311322.title: A night to consider

choices: “You wanted to know about me...right?”
“I can’t forgive you for what you’ve done to me.”
12233222221312311223113223.content:
Celebi began to stir after a few moments and she groggily stared ahead at the tiny fox looking at her before offering a small smile.

“Mornin...” She said as she sat up. She stretched, making Zorua realize once again just how small he was. Though not as small as he had just been. He shivered slightly. He was unsure if he wanted to make peace.

“Let’s get ready for the day...what’s left of it anyway.” She said as she gently picked him up and carried him to her bathroom.

-

“We can get something to eat soon, okay?” She said after brushing her teeth and was looking at her mirror as she washed her face and hair a bit in her sink and letting him take care of his private business. He said nothing as he stood on her sink. He merely nodded to show he understood.

“I...will need to change your bandages again later too.” She said. He was staring at something innocuous that she had set down. Her hair dryer, she was getting ready to use it. He looked...like he wasn’t all there.

“...Zorua?” She asked.

The monolith was there in front of him, ready to begin its torrent of heat and hell. A hurricane of noise and chaos that threatened to destroy his ears and rip him to shreds. He had to find safety, something to grip, anything. He ran off in a panic.

Zorua started to slowly breathe heavier and heavier before he panicked, running around her counter and hyperventilating. He looked terrified as he gripped onto the edge of her sink, turning his head wildly.

“Zorua!” She yelled but he didn’t respond.

“Drying her hair...gotta survive...drying her hair...not again...” He whimpered and Celebi pieces together what was happening. She looked at him with pity as she put the hair dryer away and used a towel.

He was thinking of his time on Lopunny. She hadn’t seen many of the effects yet but...there might be extensive damage to his mind she figured. She’d...she couldn’t let it be with him. Gently she picked him up and he seemed to flail a bit before going limp in her grip. She took him to her room.

-

Zorua stared ahead of him at the window as Celebi read a book on her bed. The only sound in the room being the pages turning. It had been a few hours and he was still like this. Unmoving and silent. When he did speak, it caught her off guard.
12233222221312311223113223.title: A damaged psyche

choices: "... T-Thanks... Celi..."
"... W-Why did you save me...?"
122332222213123112231132232.content:
"Celebi." Zorua said as he turned around to face the green giantess in front of him.

"Hm?" she asked, looking away from her book. Zorua was looking at her weirdly, she noted.
"I... despite all this... I can't forgive you for what you've done to me... you almost killed me..." he meekly said.

Clinging to her while she showered... getting almost drowned over and over...

Celebi sighed in annoyance - she was growing tired of Zorua's stubbornness.
"Do as you wish, Zorua, but I'm still keeping you here until you've healed. Hate me all you want." she said.

Countless hours remaining awake...

"Good." Zorua calmly responded, looking at her with eyes wide open.

Celebi noted that something was wrong with him, but she couldn't tell what.

Then, Zorua suddenly started coughing.

"T-That's right..." he blurted out.

"Zorua..." Celebi started with concern, but was interrupted by the coughing fox.

She tripping over and over...

"...B-Because me... and you... will never... ever... be..." Zorua never got to finish.

Starvation and dehydration...

Celebi gasped and watched with horror as the fox collapsed on the bed, eyes completely blank.

He was going into panic attack!

"Zorua!" Celebi let go of her book as she tried to pick the tiny pokemon up... but he screamed, and ran away from her paws.

He reached the other side of the giant bed before his legs couldn't hold him anymore.

He collapsed again, and started coughing, feeling his chest in pain, his traumatized mind shattering like glass as it flashed with images of the hellish week he spent with Lopunny...

But then, dark went his world.

Zorua stopped fidgeting as he laid motionless on top of the bed.

Celebi started at him, now officially worried.
"Zorua...?" she asked.

She got no response.

"Zorua... please..."

He remained quiet.

Celebi worriedly put her head near to Zorua's body... she looked in horror - he wasn't breathing anymore.

Immediately, the giant fairy moved a paw to his chest... his heartbeat was extremely slow...

Zorua was dying from a heart attack.

"Zorua no!" Celebi cried in alert as she quickly shoved the fox onto his back, placing both her paws on his chest... the heart had stopped beating completely.

Celebi stared at the fox, tears starting to roll down her cheeks. His trauma... his trauma had killed him... and Celebi was the one causing it... it was her fault...

Celebi started crying desperately - she had to do something, quick... but what?!

She looked at her own paws... those paws caused the death of Zorua...

...

But maybe could also revive him!

Hastily, Celebi put her paws back on Zorua's chest as she started glowing green, performing a healing move.

"Wake up Zorua!" she screamed in despair as she stopped glowing.

The heart still wasn't beating.

She tried her healing move again as she started glowing green a second time.
"Please..." the fairy cried, tears falling from her face and on the lifeless fox.

Nothing.

She tried again. And again.

"P-Pl-Please... I'll do anything... just don't die!" she screamed, desperately trying to revive the fox.

However, his heart still didn't get back to beating.

Zorua was...

Celebi hung her head and cried. Hard.

"Zorua... it's all my fault! I should have never done that to you! I'M SORRY!" she screamed, hoping that Zorua would somehow hear her... but at this point, anything that could save him was a miracle.

And miracles weren't something that happened often...

A beat.

Celebi kept crying as she laid onto the bed like deprived of energy. She hugged the lifeless body of Zorua, letting her tears roll down her cheeks.

Another beat.

The fairy opened her eyes to look at the tiny fox. She was sure she felt something beneath her paws...

She reluctantly touched Zorua's chest again...

"Zo-Zorua...?"

His heartbeat had resumed!

The fox started coughing again as he opened his eyes a little.

"Zorua!"

He felt a strong pressure on his back as Celebi hugged him tightly.

She couldn't believe it, Zorua was alive!

"I-I..." he coughed weakly.
"... I was about to die, wasn't I?" he asked.

"It doesn't matter now... you're alive... you're alive..." and Celebi started repeating those words countless times as she kept hugging the fox to her chest.

However, the giant fairy was interrupted as Zorua, after a good while of just staring incredulously, finally spoke up...
122332222213123112231132232.title: Deadly danger

choices: Zorua confides his past with her
Celebi gets them something to eat
1223322222131231122311322322.content:
"...W-Why did you save me...?" He asked, as if he couldn't believe it. She pulled back on the hug and looked at him, tears rolling down her eyes.

"Why do you think!? What, you think i'll just watch a pokemon in front of me die!" She said, crying and he looked down.

She had saved his life...that was clear, but...

"Maybe you should've let me..." He muttered.

He felt a sting on his cheek as Celebi pulled one of her paws away from holding him and slapped him with one of her fingers, she was gentle as she thought she could get away with but it needed to hurt. He winced and she was still crying, but had a firm look on her face.

"Don't you EVER say something like that!" He looked away from her.

"I don't care what we've done to each other right now! I don't care about your history of pranks or any of that right now! You almost died and you say that maybe that would be better!?" He closed his eyes.

"Celebi..." He started but found himself at a loss for words.

"Whatever caused your panic attack...your heart attack...I did that to you right? Lopunny...you said you can't forgive me for what you went through there...if it caused this much stress to your mind I can't blame you for it...but I will NOT let you die from it!" Her voice was cracking.

"...preciate it..." He muttered it, it was probably to closest thing to a sign of cooperating with her that she would get right now. She hugged him to her chest.

He pressed his face into her chest, the warm wall as he swallowed the lump in his throat, he was tearing up too. Damn it all...

"Celebi look...I..." He started to cry too.

"It was..." He couldn't stop it, the bitterness in his mind, the fear, desperation, sadness, all of it came pouring out.

"It was hell Celebi..." His voice was cracking. "Hell on earth with no end, I couldn't keep a semblance of time well, only Lopunny's activities gave me indication...it was so scary..." He cried.

She closed her eyes.

"If I could take it back then I would..." She said and he sniffled.

"I know...and then just now I-I...it hurt so much Celebi, so so much..." He cried as he leaned into her.

"I don't think I hate you...I just don't want to be alone anymore...no more Celebi..." He cried as she hugged him closer.

"I've got you, okay?" She said gently as she cried.
1223322222131231122311322322.title: Mended bridges

choices: I-I don't know... I still don't want to tell that..." Zorua responded
"O-Okay... I'll tell you something... listen up..." Zorua responded
Before he could respond, there was a knock at the door. A friend of Celebi?
12233222221312311223113223222.content:
After being scared nearly to death, one's first reaction is natural.

And for Celebi and Zorua was no different.

The two pokemon kept crying for a while longer, hugging each other

Celebi was crying because Zorua almost died from a heart attack, that was caused by a panic attack, that was caused by her shrinking him to a nanoscopic size and letting him go with an unaware Lopunny for a week;

Zorua was crying because he almost died right there and then... and because it stung him where Celebi slapped him, but mostly because he was about to die.

And, while definitely humiliated, Zorua felt all his hatred towards the green giantess slide out of his eyes in the form of salt water.

She had sent him straight to hell for a whole, eternal, hideous week, with that airhead Lopunny, she had almost killed him and caused him to have panic attacks for Arceus knew how long!

...

But... Celebi pulled him back from the cold embrace of death. And she was trying to be nice. Even the most hateful soul cannot ignore that.

The fairy too kept crying along with the fox, hugging him close to her chest. She had almost seen a pokemon die before of her actions...

The dark type's world shook as Celebi sat uptight, one of her paws leaving him as she wiped her eyes.

She inhaled and exhaled deeply in a attempt to calm herself.
"C-Come on Zorua... you're alive... nothing else matters..." she said, using a finger to gently wipe his eyes too. She gently slid her finger under his eyelids, careful not to cause irreversible damage to the eyeballs.

Zorua started sniffling.

"I-I... I'm fine..." he said, before inhaling sharply and exhaling heavily.

He looked at the giant fairy.
"... W-What now Celi?" he asked shakily, mustering all the calm he could.
"... You ain't got funny ideas, right?" he then inquired.

Celebi stared at him in silence, not sure if to smile or slap him again.
"... Zorua, you almost died. I'm done with funny idea." she spoke very softly, before adding:
"And what now? I'll tell you - you're not leaving this house until you're stable again."

Zorua's eyes shrunk - she wanted to keep him confined!

"... Can't y-you can simply let me go...? I'll be fine..." he told. Celebi got up in response.
"Forget it." she said firmly, before wiping a few other tears from her eyes.
"... For now, what about I grab something to eat? Then, I'll need to change your bandages again." she spoke very gently.

Zorua sighed and laid on the bed.
"Fine..." he muttered, resigned to the idea that he wasn't going anywhere... for now.

Celebi nodded and stumbled out of her room, still visibly shaken by what just happened. She even tripped at some point, and had to grab the door to not fall.

She returned to the room a few minutes later, holding a plate of meat - Zorua seemed to like it - cheese and crackers. A glass of water flew behind her.

The fox noted that she was hardly holding the plate - it probably still hurt her where he bit her...

Carefully she sat down, setting the plate between her and Zorua.

Timidly, he stepped forward and started munching on some of the meat, while Celebi made herself a meat and cheese cracker sandwich, before starting eating too.

The two ate in complete silence. Zorua felt partially better after having filled his stomach for the second time after a week of starvation.

Soon, nothing was left on the plate, which Celebi put on her nightstand , before grabbing a hold of Zorua and walking into her bathroom.

She carefully removed his bandages and distractedly looked at hers - they were stained red again.

She sighed as she carefully started to remove her own bandage, looking once again at the two deep red lines in her green skin... well, that wound was partly her fault. Sure, Zorua bit her, but when she kicked him to free herself, his fangs slid down her paw, creating two deep wounds that traveled down her wrist, paw and took two of her three fingers.

She touched it and gritted her teeth - it stung... but she was lucky, she guessed. If back then she had opted to hit Zorua with her knee under the jaw, her paw would have been cut off... that would have been far worse, she thought with horror.

For a moment, Zorua grinned - he had managed to do something like that to a legendary... he felt slightly proud.

"Yeah, be proud of yourself, because this. Hurts. A. Lot." Celebi said between playful and lecturing, noticing him smirking.

"Yeah... sorry about that... I was angry..." he said, shivering slightly at the sensation of cold air penetrating his body through his own wounds.

Celebi sighed.
"... We both were." she said, grabbing a bottle of disinfectant and a few clean bandages.

Zorua eyed the bottle with dread.

--

Celebi re-entered her bedroom, delicately holding Zorua in her paws.

She gently set the freshly bandaged fox on top of the bed as grabbed the untouched glass of water from the nightstand, drinking half of it, before offering it to Zorua, who nodded.

Celebi grabbed him gently and psychically lowered him into the glass. Zorua took a few sips, the water sliding down his throat and into his full stomach. It was nice to feel stuffed again.

Then, Celebi lifted him into her paws again, placing the glass back onto the nightstand .

Carefully, the giant fairy set her tiny companion on her bed, and laid belly-down in front of him, looking exasperated. It was hard to blame her.

"Feeling better?" she asked.

Zorua nodded. He looked reluctant for a few seconds, before finally giving an actual reply,
"Thanks Celi... for everything." he said, showing his first hint of sympathy towards the fairy.

She beamed.

"Now Zorua... what do you say of we... get to know each other? It could be nice... y'know, trying to be your friend?" she offered.

Zorua sighed - he saw this coming.

"... You don't want to hear it. My... past is dark. An endless suffering Celi... trust me, you're better off without hearing it." he replied.

This time, Celebi didn't relent.

"... I want to know you Zorua. Tell me every last detail." she said.

He meekly looked at her.
"... Why?" he asked in confusion.

Nobody ever asked, they all only hated him. And he hated them all right back.

Celebi smiled, and gently started to caress the fox. This was the most gentle action she did since it all began.

"Because we're friends."
12233222221312311223113223222.title: The bases of a friendship

choices: “When I’m healed...what’ll you do with me?”
“If you healed my heart attack...why not heal yourself?”
122332222213123112231132232222.content:
He looked at the giantess in front of him. “Friends...you’re still on that? After all of this...” He let out a sigh, unsure of himself.

“You and I are going to be spending a bit of time together Zorua...it’d be easier to share it as friends, right?” She said gently and he gulped.

“It’s not a fun story Celebi...it’s...okay...I’ll tell ya I suppose. You won’t let me get away with not telling you, will you?” He asked and she shook her head.

Well...he supposed he may as well start. He steadied himself and took a few shaky breaths before he spoke again.

“It isn’t hard to figure out that I’m not originally from this village, right?” He said and Celebi sighed.

“Yeah, you kinda turned up in the forest one day, didn’t you?” She said and he nodded.

“I uh...did have a life before here, I was raised by my dad I guess...never knew my mom...I don’t really know what happened there but...it was me and my dad and he...” Zorua seemed to falter a bit, he was looking for the words.

“He was terrible. A thief and a hunter...he kept me around I think hoping to have a scapegoat or bait when he needed it, said I was deadweight until I evolved.”

Celebi gasped. “Your dad did that? That’s-”

“Sometimes he got caught and had to escape, other times he didn’t get his mark. On nights when he came back from that, I was his punching bag. Sometimes he didn’t feed me hoping I’d ‘wise up’...it wasn’t the best of times. I think the longest I went without was 3 days.”

Celebi looked at him sympathetically. ‘Until I came along...’ She thought of how she starved him.

“One particularly bad night I remember him beating me and saying as long as I was a wimpy little Zorua he’d have no use for me...so stop being a waste of space. He left to get his mark shortly after and a lot of things went through my mind...I looked at the door...and when I walked through it I never looked back.” He sighed.

“Zorua, I-”

“I ran Celebi, didn’t know where to, didn’t much care. If it wasn’t with him I was content. I think after a day...maybe two I ended up here. I saw happy families, laughter...and I uh...” He trailed off before sighing.

“I hated seeing that, I don’t know why I did but...that’s where the rest of the village learned of me. I started my pranks, my theft, and...I kept it going for a few years until now. Truth be told Celebi...I’m just tired of it all.” He sat after finishing and Celebi looked at him with pity.

“If you’d just told someone...then they would’ve helped.” She said and he didn’t respond.

“Can I ask you something?” He said finally.
122332222213123112231132232222.title: "O-Okay... I'll tell you something... l...

choices: "Yeah... whatever... Just no weird ideas, please." Zorua responded
"... Let me heal, then I'm outta here." Zorua responded
"... Let me heal first - I'll consider it in the meantime." Zorua responded
1223322222131231122311322322221.content:
"Go ahead, ask." Celebi responded with a smile.

Zorua inhaled deeply.
"... What are you going to do with me once I'm healed? Are you going back to punishing me, ain't you?... You want to keep me as some sort of pet, don't ya?" he asked.

Celebi looked surprised. How did he-

The fairy giggled awkwardly, not wanting to reveal that keeping him as a pet was her original plan... before the fight happened.
"Zorua, I've almost killed you and you certainly did a number on me..." she held out her bandaged paw.
"I've already said it once, last night to be accurate: your pranks, my actions, that fight of ours nullified them. So, let's just he friends." she said, smiling brightly as she gently grabbed the fox and rolled on her back, hugging him gently.

He flushed red.

And Celebi suddenly frowned.
"... Did your dad really do all that horrible, horrible things to you, Zorua?" she asked, rage seeping in her voice. The dark type nodded.
"Yeah... ol’ Zoroark was a jerk..." he said.

Celebi gritted her teeth.
"That's... terrible! A thief and a hunter, what an example could he be for his son?! Mom can travel through time, and she has a normal life, job and family!" she cried with indignation, inadvertently making Zorua feel worse.

"At least you have one. I never knew mine. I really started thinking I existed only because I had to be his stress ball at some point..." he responded dejectedly.

Celebi looked at him pitifully, not quite knowing what to say. So, she just opted to start petting him.
"...Of course you weren't, Zorua... you're... uh... a..."

"... Scoundrel?" he finished, and started snickering. Celebi blushed.
"... Someone with your wits could do something great Zorua!" she continued. She was befriending him well enough, she couldn't let him slide away because of a dumb comment.

Zorua blushed.

"... Hey, Zorua?" he looked at the fairy.
"D'you think... your mom..." she didn't finish her sentence - she wasn't sure how Zorua would take it.

However he simply shrugged.
"I don't know if she's dead... I don't think though. My theory is that she ran too Celi... and she made a good choice... whenever she is, I hope she's not suffering... like I did..." Zorua told.

He looked down.

And, finding herself at a major loss for words, Celebi started caressing him again.

Then, after a few minutes, he broke the silence again.

"You didn't answer." he said.
"Hm?"

"You didn't answer. I asked you what you're going to do with me whenever we are healed." he repeated in a neutral tone. Celebi looked at him.
"Well... thinking about it, maybe you've learned your lesson plus quite a few other... so, I could grow you back and send you..." she stopped.

Zorua was homeless. Zorua had nobody. Zorua was alone.

Celebi smiled - maybe she found a way to make things right after all, she enthusiastically thought.

"... Say Zorua... you haven't got somewhere to go, have you?" she asked. Zorua looked at her, before shaking his head no.

"Then... why don't you remain here?"

The blue eyes of the fox widened as he stared into Celebi's own eyes.

Had he heard good? She had attempted to kill him last night... and now she was offering him to live in her house? This must have been some kind of prank, there had to be a price to pay.

"... There's a catch... what is it?" he asked, looking at the green giantess intently.

She giggled awkwardly.
