"Ehm... y'see, mom is coming home in a week or so... you'd have to avoid her somehow..."

Zorua's eyes shrunk - NO way she was suggesting that.

"... Let me understand - you want me to stay this miserable size in your house with your mom around?" he asked, and Celebi nodded.
"It won't be so bad Zorua... mom works all day, goes on business trips often and you would have a house to live in... it works to your advantage, and I'd take care of you - friends do that, no?" she offered.

Zorua looked skeptical.
"So you're practically asking me to become your pet." he said.

"Friend." Celebi corrected, before smiling.
"What do you say Zorua - will you stay here with me?" she asked, hopeful.
1223322222131231122311322322221.title: Weird suggestion

choices: "Okay...let's do it then, it'll be fun Zorua."
"Maybe...you should rest a bit."
12233222221312311223113223222213.content:
"...look, let me heal first, alright? I'll...think about being your pet I guess, probably beats what i've got going for me now..." He muttered as she sighed.

"Friend, not pet...and Zorua, it really would be good for you." She said as she gently caressed his head and he looked at the giant smiling face of Celebi.

How could him staying with her at this pitiful size not be considered being a pet...whatever, he'd consider it when the time came.

"Zorua...if you don't want to answer this that's fine but..." Zorua looked at her as she was biting her lip, and then she asked it.

"Have you ever had a good day? All of your life?" She asked and Zorua looked at her mouth open. The hell kind of question is that? Of course he had a good day, right!? There was the time he got to taste ice cream for the first time when he stole it from Pichu, there's the time he uh...

Zorua seemed to be looking down in deep thought, and Celebi took that as the answer she needed. He had to even THINK about it...well, if she could get him to change his ways through kindness it'd beat out the punishment route...they'd gone down that road and it wasn't pretty.

"You know...we could do something fun...it's getting a little late to go out and do something today...but we can stay in, watch something on TV maybe...have some sweets...it'll be fun Zorua." She said gently as she sat up, rocking his world again as she still held him.

"Uh...sure, I guess..." He muttered. He shook his head a bit.

The tremors got bigger as Zorua clung for dear life. The giggles echoed around him, not just Lopunny's but many pokemon as they watched her trip. The giggles assaulted his ears but he dared not cover them because then he'd have to let go of the pillar that was a strand of fur he was clinging to, whimpering.

"Zorua!" He snapped out of it to see her looking at him with concern.

"I'm fine...i'm fine..." He said, as he started taking a deep breath.

"A-are you gonna have another-"

"N-no...I don't think so, I just need...crap, can I get some water please?" He asked, clearly shaken as he shook his head and she immediately took him to her kitchen and got him some tap water. She picked him up and let him drink as much as he needed before he sighed.

"Y-yeah Celebi...yeah. TV and something sweet does sound good." He said, regaining a sense of where he was as she looked at him with pity.

"Are you SURE you're okay?" The giantess asked and he nodded. This was clearly something Zorua was going to carry with him for a while...
12233222221312311223113223222213.title: Consideration and lasting effects

choices: The next morning...
A few days later...
122332222213123112231132232222131.content:
Celebi bit her lip, sure that Zorua was all but fine... but now, it was too late she figured. She had already made her suggestion and she knew that Zorua was going to insist if she took her offer back.

Plus, this would be a good way to bond with the fox...

"Okay Zorua, it'll be fun... plus, when mom comes back, you'll have to stay here a lot of time... let's enjoy the house while we can." she said with a smile.

Zorua nodded, still unsure if he wanted to stay with her or not after he was healed... not every word about friendship Celebi told was ever going to convince him the he wasn't going to be her pet.

Sure, her company was becoming quite enjoyable, he couldn't deny, but he wasn't sure he would have been so comfortable being cooped up in her house with her mom around and with the lingering feeling of being nothing more than a pet to Celebi and a doll to her mother.

He snapped out of his thoughts, his attention drawn by Celebi gently bending to place him on one of the pillows of her couch.

Then, Celebi walked inside her kitchen, grabbing a bag of chocolate chip cookies and a bowl, filling it with cookies.

Then, Celebi walked back into the living room and put the bowl down next to Zorua's pillow before she sat down herself. Celebi eyed the light switch, and psychically switched off the lights, before turning on the TV.

"So... what do you want to watch Zorua?" Celebi asked the tiny fox as she gently picked him up, placing him on top of her lap.

The physical contact made him blush.

"... Horror?" he asked.

Celebi stared at him.
"Horror. You're suffering panic attacks and you want to watch horror." she said, before she sighed.
"No Zorua... oh, I know!" she exclaimed.

Zorua looked at her flip through TV channels... and slowly, his eyes went blank...

"I know! Let's-" she couldn't finish.

She was walking forward with decision, but tripped and fell on her behind.

Zorua's world shook as he clinged with all his strength. He could not let go, or he might have fallen straight to his death. He would have died anyway, either becoming an invisible red stain on the ground or being lost until hunger, thirst and lack of sleep killed him.

He had to keep going...

"Zorua!"

The voice of Celebi called Zorua back to reality.

He shook his head and looked up, noticing the worried face of the giant fairy.

"Zorua, why don't you rest instead? We can do this tomorrow..." Celebi offered.

But Zorua shook his head.
"... I want to do this." he said. Celebi stared at him in silence for a bit, before nodding her head.

One of her paws traveled down to the fox as she hugged him to her belly while she kept flipping through the channels.

Until she found something interesting... to her at least. The movie had already begun, but Zorua was able to tell that it was...

"... Romance? Celi, I don't want to watch it!" he complained. Celebi giggled.
"I sure do~"

Zorua sighed, but cheered up to some better mood as he was handed a giant cookie.

Maybe this size had its advantages, he thought.

--

The movie went on for two endless hours... and, even worse, Celebi didn't let him eat more than the single cookie she gave him, telling him that ‘you'll have tummy-ache if you eat more’.

But finally, the movie was over, the credits were rolling on the screen. Celebi yawned, and turned off the TV.

"Wasn't it beautiful Zorua?" she asked. The fox looked at her, he was quite sure there were sparkles in her eyes, her mouth wide open and a smile spread across her cheeks.

Zorua snickered.
"Want a honest answer? I kinda drifted off after I ate the cookie..." he admitted, stretching on his perch on Celebi's lap.

She pouted, her chest fell and her belly rose as she inhaled deeply, before sighing.

"Bedtime."

The green giantess got up from the couch and walked back inside her bedroom.

She climbed into the bed, placing Zorua on top of her pillow.

His world shook again as she carelessly leaped in her bed, turning off the lamp on her nightstand, trapping Zorua in darkness for yet another night...

-

"Why are you so... useless?!"

His cheeks stung as he slapped him across the face. He cried.
"I-I'm t-trying!" he shouted in response.

"That's not enough! When are you going to just evolve and make me proud? I'll tell ya kid - that ain't happening!

Zorua sniffled.

"Dad I-"

"Zorua!"

The fox panted as he snapped out of it, once again looking at Celebi.

"... Again, huh?" he asked, Celebi nodded. He felt a strong pressure, Celebi was hugging him tightly.

"... Zorua, if this doesn't stop in the next days, I'm bringing you to a doctor." she said firmly, before getting up, leaving the fox alone in the room as she left, returning after a short bit.

"For now, eat this."

Zorua bit the piece of cookie she gave him, the sweet flavor of chocolate slightly comforting him.

Celebi sighed as she climbed onto her bed again.

Then, she smiled.
"But for now, I'm giving you a better way to sleep."

Before Zorua could reply, he was grabbed by the fairy, who hugged him to her chest and giggled.
"Sleep tight~" she said to the blushing fox.

The dark type sighed loudly, before leaning his head against the warm wall that was Celebi's chest.

And soon, he fell asleep.
122332222213123112231132232222131.title: TV bonding

choices: Zorua asleep
Zorua awake
Zorua awake...and having a panic attack
1223322222131231122311322322221311.content:
Celebi woke up first, she was an early riser before she felt the small warm form wiggle in his sleep against her. She smiled a bit...he was cute when he slept. She thought about waking him up but figured she could let him keep sleeping...he probably needed as much as he could get at this point...if the panic attacks kept going though...she would need to take him to see someone.

She didn't relish the thought of that but it might be the only way to get him help...sighing, she gently put Zorua on her pillow where he seemed to stir a little...before falling right back into sleep. She got up and looked at her bandage.

She needed to change it again...but it seemed to be healing from what she could tell.

After disinfecting the wound again...not a fun part of it all, and wrapping the new bandage around it as well as washing up and doing her morning hygiene she went to her kitchen to consider making breakfast for the two of them...well, more for her, she didn't need to give him more than a bite or two and he'd be filled up. At least that part of taking care of him was easy.

She hoped he ultimately decided to stay with her...if he went back out there, who knows what that could mean. He could be on his own in the forest again...play more pranks...it'd be bad all around, here though...he could be fed, housed, loved right?

...she had to keep her mind in check though, he wasn't her pet, he was a pokemon with his own will and desires, and she needed to respect that, tiny or not.

"Bit of an easy breakfast...but it'll do..." She started the eggs and got some bread to toast as she prepared the simple food and hummed a bit.

That movie last night was really cute she thought...

After her simple preparations she got a glass of juice and put it on the table with her plate, looking at it cheerfully.

It was time to wake Zorua up, let him eat, and then she'd change his bandages and hopefully get him to enjoy the day. That was her goal...

She went to her room, smiling.

"Okay Zorua, time to get up..." She said as she looked at the pillow to see.
1223322222131231122311322322221311.title: Breakfast

choices: "Let's eat breakfast, change your bandages, and do something you want, okay?"
"Zorua...when we're done with eating i'm taking you to a doctor."
12233222221312311223113223222213113.content:
Celebi's smile faltered as she saw that Zorua was already up...and he was circling slowly, looking...scared. He gasped when he heard her enter and looked around wildly, as if he didn't really see her before his eyes fell on her. He slowly shrunk back, as if it would get him away from what was going on.

He was having another episode...they were getting more frequent it felt like.

Surprising Celebi he started to run in the opposite direction of her, which meant...

Zorua ran right off of the bed and Celebi acted fast to catch him with her psychic. If he fell that distance to the floor it could be disastrous in his state.

She slowly levitated him to her face, looking over the tiny frail pokemon before her. He was a far cry from the snickering sadistic prankster she had envisioned him as not that long ago...knowing what he'd gone through, what he was going through right now, and seeing the panic in his eyes, her heart went out to him.

"Zorua..." She said, and something seemed to register in his head.

He blinked a few times and clarity seemed to return to his eyes.

He was looking into the giant concerned face of his...friend? Owner? Still not sure.

"C-Celebi? Again...?" He asked and she nodded. "This is getting bad Zorua...really bad..."

He looked around before he saw the plate of food and his stomach gurgled.

"I'm fine Celi...i'll be okay..." He said as he took a few deep breaths before flashing a grin.

Celebi thought the grin looked forced.

Maybe she should take him to a doctor today...who knows what'd happen if she waited...but she'd rather wait until both of their regular injuries healed...it'd be less of a hassle to explain to a doctor and maybe...letting Zorua do something he wanted to do truly barring watching horror would get him back on track to a healthy mind.

Eventually she made her decision and gently spoke.
12233222221312311223113223222213113.title: Morning panic

choices: "Can we...go outside?"
"TV sounds fun...as long as it isn't romance."
"Celebi, I told you about my dad...tell me more about yourself."
122332222213123112231132232222131131.content:
"Okay Zorua...let's eat, i'll change your bandages, and then...i'll let you pick what we do, okay?" She said with a smile and he looked at her with...still distant looking eyes, but he nodded to say he understood. She levitated him down onto her bed and she sat down with him, careful not to disturb or jostle him as she sat down. She cut off a tiny bit of egg and tore off a bit of toast and set them down in front of him.

"Eat up, okay?" She said before she started eating from the plate. He slowly bit into the food, enjoying getting something in his belly again. He'd never take that for granted at this point. Celebi silently ate as she eyed him on occasion. She wanted to help him, she truly did, but she was worried about his mind. She hoped she hadn't shattered it...especially learning more about who Zorua REALLY was. He didn't need to be punished, from the start someone should've tried to reach out to him...maybe she should've been that someone before it escalated to a fight that nearly ended in her killing him...she shook her head. What was done was done and right now they both needed to move on from that.

"So Zorua...what were you thinking of for us to do today?" She asked gently and he looked up.

"I dunno...Celebi, if you're worried then...please don't, i'm fine, alright?" He didn't feel comfortable with Celebi trying to coddle him. Even if he couldn't do anything about it right now, especially considering the fact that he was tiny, injured, and not necessarily in the most healthy state of mind.

"I can't help but be worried Zorua...but let's not think about that, just think about what you want to do." She said as she continued eating.

They both finished their meal in silence, and Celebi quickly finished off what Zorua couldn't eat in a single bite, something that once again put things in perspective for Zorua. She simply smiled at him as she set the plate on her nightstand and picked up the dark fox in her paws. She looked him over. 'He's getting his weight back...he doesn't look nearly as emaciated as he did a few days ago...good.' She thought. But he still didn't give off an air of being entirely comfortable with his situation.

"I'm gonna change your bandages now...then we'll enjoy the day." She said as she carried him to the bathroom.

He hated this, hated the disinfectant on his wounds but...it couldn't have felt good on Celebi either he figured. He did a damn number on her paw. Something that on one level he was proud of considering that not only was she waaaaay out of his weight class in terms of power, but he felt pretty vindicated in doing it...but she was still dealing with it and taking care of making things right with Zorua.

"Look Celi...for real, sorry about the paw." He said and she smiled at him.

"Yeah...it hurts, but I certainly hurt you too..."

"Yeah but...I still want to say sorry." He muttered.

"That's very sweet Zorua, i'm sorry too." She was happy that slowly, he did seem to be coming out of his shell more and more. "Now let's get this over with okay?" She said as she started to undo his bandages. He sighed.

Time for this to sting.

-

Zorua sighed in relief when all was said and done and he was rebandaged. Celebi was holding him to her face.

"You alright?" She asked and he nodded. On some level he admitted to himself as coddled as he felt...it was a nice change of pace. Nothing he had ever really experienced. She was being nice and...her cuddling him last night in bed...he felt safe and warm...was he really starting to consider her offer? It was better than the forest ground he supposed...not to mention his 'bed' with his dad...that stupid carpet...His thoughts were interrupted however.

"So what do you want to do today Zorua?"
122332222213123112231132232222131131.title: Start of a new day

choices: She time travels back to the day Zorua pranked her
She opts to move on from it with Zorua in the present
1223322222131231122311322322221311313.content:
Zorua looked at the fairy holding him and contemplated exactly what he knew about her...he had seen two sides to her. Vengeful and angry, and kind and remorseful. He knew she liked books, and she liked sappy romance movies.

Beyond that...she was a legendary of extraordinary power, more than most pokemon had even assumed now that he knew she could shrink things, and that one of her friends was obnoxiously annoying.

Honestly he might know more about Lopunny than he knew about Celebi beyond these few things.

"Celebi...tell me a bit more about yourself. That's what I want."

Celebi blinked. "Really? That's um...odd of you to ask." She said. He just wanted to know about her? Not what she expected from Zorua. She looked at his tiny face though and it seemed genuine.

"Well...you're asking me to be your pe-...friend to stay here but I realized...honestly, I don't think I know you that well. You might know me more than I know you at this point." He said and she cradled Zorua in one paw as she raised her free paw to her chin in thought.

"...Well...I like to read, you know that..."

"You like dumb romance movies, I know that too." Zorua said, earning a slight glare from Celebi as she got defensive.

"They aren't dumb! They're cute!" She insisted and he snickered.

"Okay, okay. But beyond those two things, I know you're stupidly powerful and...that's it." He said.

She shrugged. "There isn't that much to me Zorua. I'm a girl that can change sizes of stuff, time travel, and generally pick up anything I want to with psychic."

She wasn't bragging really, it's what she can do. He nodded.

"But...you've got other things, right?"

"Well...I've got my friends! People at school love me but..." She smiled brightly, but it faltered a bit at the end. Zorua looked at her.

"But...?" He questioned and she sighed.

"...You told me about your dad so I guess it's only fair." She muttered as she fluttered into her living room and sat on the couch. She set Zorua in her lap, facing her stomach and he looked up at her far off face. She gently started to stroke him.

"Zorua...you met Lopunny..." He nodded.

"Yeah...I certainly did...in a way." He said bitterly and she smiled.

"Sorry..." She said again and he shook his head.

"Whatever, it's over, moving on."

"Well Lopunny used to live in this village...she was my best friend until she moved away and...I have friends in this village but..." She sighed and kept going.

"I don't think a lot of them really care so much about me, they more care about what I can do. They seem more interested in using me sometimes..." She finished.

Zorua tapped his paw to his chin in thought.

"Yeah, I could see that. Bookworm nice pokemon that happens to be able to time travel? Seems like a primo pokemon to befriend if you have something to gain." He said frankly and she nodded.

"My mom said...don't use your powers to impress and don't be peer pressured into doing something wrong with them...to be honest, a lot of guys have hit on me too that i'm pretty sure were more or less interested in just what I could do. Like...if I were unchanged in terms of personality, interests, all of that, but was say...a rattata...would any of those pokemon still talk to me?" She said and Zorua looked at her eyes. She seemed genuine in saying this so he was going to be honest.

He shrugged. "Yeah I doubt it, I don't know every pokemon in this village, but I could imagine the pokemon you're describing seeing a golden ticket to use time travel for something to help them out or maybe having a powerful friend so no one messed with them." Celebi nodded.

"Lopunny...and another few of my friends...they never bring up what I can do, never ask. They watch sappy movies or...invite me to dumb festival dances, play games with me...that kinda stuff...but most of the pokemon at school..." She stopped and nodded to herself.

"But I always have to tell them no, and some of them still try. I have yet to do it and I won't let my mother down in that regard." She smiled and Zorua shrugged.

"Well, you seem to have better character than most. I th-" He blinked for a second and then looked around. Celebi heard rain outside and looked at her window before looking down at Zorua again to see him staring at the window.

She was showering again. The dreaded part of the day. The water droplets that crashed like bombs and created mini oceans all around. He had almost drowned many a time. He still didn't quite know how he survived this part of the ordeal. He would see a hair strand and snatch at it for all his worth as the rapid oceans descended into the abyss below Lopunny. If he went down there he would surely die. But he needed to survive, he needed to get home to his forest...

Celebi stared sadly at the dark fox in her lap and considered something she hadn't before.

She COULD time travel...she could go back, and prevent herself from doing this to him! Right!? It was so obvious she really couldn't believe it slipped her by before now.

That would be ideal, he wouldn't be having these episodes anymore, he'd...

He'd be a jerk again. He'd prank more. He'd still be alone in his forest, bitter at every other pokemon.

But he'd be healthy...or as healthy as a homeless pokemon can be.

She bit her lip and looked at her wounded paw.

Maybe she could find a way to befriend him even going back in time, but...knowing what she knew about him now she'd have to be tough on him again probably to get him to open up. Could she bring herself to do that to him again?

Maybe...living with what they did was better, and she could find a way to end these episodes of his on her own, or maybe get a doctor to help.
1223322222131231122311322322221311313.title: Consideration for undoing a mistake

choices: "Hi Celi! Where have you been?" Zorua asked happily
"Oh... you're back..." Zorua said coldly, hatred in his voice
12233222221312311223113223222213113131.content:
Despite what her mom taught her about changing the future, Celebi decided to use, for once, her time-traveling powers to do it.

She smiled - she'd have a word with her past self. Zorua was going to be her friend in a way or another.

"Celi...?" Zorua chimed at some point, coughing as he recovered from his latest panic attack.

"Hm?"

"... Why are you smiling like that?" the dark-type asked, causing Celebi to giggle.
"Oh... nothing..." she said, suddenly removing him from her lap with her psychic and getting up from the couch, before telekinetically setting him back down.

"Now Zorua... I'm heading out to buy something..." she lied as she walked to the front door, now smirking.
"Who knows... you might feel better when I get back." she added, before Zorua heard the door closing.

Celebi quickly traveled to the back of her house for privacy, as time-traveling wasn't exactly something she could do in public without pokemon who knew her wondering why her unique powers were needed.

The fairy fluttered in the air, before focusing as she glowed green for a moment.

When the light died down, Celebi was gone.

--

Celebi traveled back in time, to a week and two days ago.

The day it all started.

She had to talk to herself.

The fairy from the future looked around, she was in Zorua's forest. She heard snickering and quickly hid, knowing who it was.

Peering through the leaves of a bush, Celebi spotted Zorua, with a rope in his mouth; said rope was tied to a familiar bucket, the bucket that would give the green light to a chain of events that would lead Celebi to almost kill Zorua twice and Zorua to cause her a deep wound in the arm.

"Zorua..." she murmured as he hid behind a tree, ready to pull the rope.

She knew this was a signal.

Celebi turned her head, noticing... herself, head buried in a book as she walked through the forest, coming right the way where the bucket full of feathers, honey and berries waited to make her look like a Pidove.

The Celebi from the future couldn't let it happen.

She hastily but silently moved through the bushes, until the past Celebi walked right in front of her hiding spot, in which point her arm darted out of the bush she was hiding in and got a hold of the oblivious fairy's ankle.

The past Celebi looked up from her book, startled, and glanced down at the bush... a pair of blue eyes and a green face greeted her from behind it.

Another Celebi...?

The paw pulled her into the bush, causing her book to fall down.

--

The two Celebi stared at each other in silence for a minute, before the one from the past dared to ask,
"So ehm... past or future...?"

The other fairy giggled.
"Future." she replied.

Her past counterpart nodded.
"Okay... so, what kind of catastrophe am I going to have to prevent?" she asked jokingly, giggling to herself.

In response, Celebi raised her bandaged paw.

Past Celebi stopped laughing instantly.
"Oh... how?" she asked, suddenly feeling an itch in her arm.

Celebi sighed.
"Do you see that snickering fox with the bucket over there?" she asked as the past fairy peered from the bushes, effectively noticing Zorua behind a tree, with a rope tied to a bucket full of mysterious substances.

"... Zorua? Zorua did that to you?" she asked, shocked. True, Zorua's pranks could be exaggerated sometimes, but he never actually hurt anyone... too much.

Celebi nodded, and her past counterpart frowned.

"That bucket is for you, it was for me," Celebi explained.
"I shrunk Zorua down and-" the eyes of the past Celebi lit up at the revelation.

"Shrunk?! Did it work then?!" she asked excitedly, Celebi pressing her finger against her mouth, silently telling her past self to shut up.

"... You'll regret it later." the fairy sourly revealed to a confused past Celebi.

Celebi sighed.
"Listen, Zorua isn't who you think he is... he had problems with his dad, okay? He needed compassion, not vengeance... and sadly, I used the size-changing ability to get revenge."

The Celebi from the past nodded.
"What did you do to him?" she asked, amused.

Celebi meekly looked up.

"I almost killed him."

The past Celebi put her paws over her mouth in shock.

Celebi nodded dejectedly.
"... I made him so tiny that I couldn't see him and sent him with Lopunny for a week... when I grew him back up, he pranked me again, before it all ended in a fight in which I... almost killed him again... now, poor Zorua suffers panic attacks and almost died before my eyes because of it..." she revealed shamefully.

"B-But..." the Celebi from the past stuttered, unable to believe it. If it was someone else telling that story, she wouldn't have believed it. But, coming from her own lips...

Celebi looked up.

"Listen... avoid that bucket, shrink Zorua, whatever... but don't call Lopunny. And don't shrink him to a nanoscopic size." she instructed.

"N-No... I'll ask him if he wants to talk instead..." past Celebi stated.

Celebi nodded, before smiling.
"Personally, I offered him to come living with me... us, he's homeless! I suggest you make that offer too... he's so cute at times!" she said cheerfully, while the past fairy looked confused.

"... Okay, if I manage to get him to open up, I'll make that offer." she said, and Celebi smiled.

"Well... gotta go now!" she said, getting up from the bush.

"Thanks... bye..." the Celebi from the past said as the future one glowed green, disappearing.

The lone grass-type sighed, before getting up and grabbing her abandoned book.

It was time to confront Zorua.

--

Celebi returned to her own timeline, eager to find out what happened.

She found herself out of her front door... her bandage was gone, her wounded paw was not wounded anymore.

She smiled - so the fight was avoided...

The fairy walked inside - she was going to see Zorua later. She wondered if her past self had made him the offer, and if he accep-

She suddenly stopped.

Zorua was there on her couch, shrunken, staring straight at her.

Celebi stared back at him.

For a moment, right before he spoke, she wondered what effects the time travel-had on him.
12233222221312311223113223222213113131.title: A trip through time

choices: "Pet."
"Friend."
"Boyfriend."
122332222213123112231132232222131131311.content:
Zorua's face immediately lit up upon seeing the giantess. "Hey Celi! Where have you been?" He asked in a light tone. Celebi took note of him. This was easily the happiest she had seen him...ever. At least happy without a hint of malice.

His bandages were gone...he also looked healthy. Not too thin, his eyes had a spark from what she could tell. He seemed...normal. Well, aside from being the size of a doll at least. She looked at her own paw. No bite. No bandage. No pain. She felt relieved at that before smiling back at Zorua.

It had worked. She had undone her mistake and somehow managed to befriend Zorua in what she imagined to be a cleaner fashion. The only question was how, but she'd fill in the blanks over time.

"Oh, just had to go out for a bit. Why, you miss me?" She asked teasingly and he nodded.

"Well...it's kinda boring just hanging out on this couch without you." He said as he looked down shyly. Not a side to him she had ever pictured.

"Sorry." Was all she said as she approached the couch and him. She gently picked him up and sat down. Not missing a beat she set him on her lap and looked down at him.

"So...what do you want to do today?" She smiled and he looked up at her.

"Really? My choice?" He said and she nodded. "I'd ask to go out to the forest but...it's raining I know." He said and didn't much care to get wet.

"I guess...TV is fine. Just NOT romance again!" He said and she giggled.

"But it's so cute~" She chimed at him and he just gave her a bit of a glare.

"No way! I fell asleep the last two times you did that!" He said and she laughed.

"Fine fine, i'll find something else that ISN'T horror either." She said and he sighed.

"But that would be fun to watch..." He pouted.

She smiled at him "Not for me it wouldn't be." she said before finding some sort of action movie on TV and leaving it on. She wasn't much paying attention to it, mostly to the tiny fox in her lap. She needed to figure out a few things. What did he know about her right now?

And what did she know about him? Did she know about his dad right now? And how did the shrinking and befriending happen? Was he staying with her forever? Or was this temporary? She didn't know these things...but she figured the best thing to do would be to figure out what he was to her right now.

She figured she'd ask him and hope he didn't think it was too strange. She didn't want to admit to him that she had altered the timeline from one where she nearly killed him twice and left significant trauma on him.

"So Zorua..." She started and he looked away from the TV for a moment. "Hmm?" He inquired quizzically.

"What...are you to me?" She asked smiling and he rolled his eyes.

"You're really gonna make me say it?" He said and she nodded.

"Again?" He said and she hesitated for a second. She had made him say it before huh? She must've like to reinforce whatever he was right now...which might be a good thing, change from being a homeless vagrant and delinquent.

She nodded again.

"Okay fine, i'm your...
122332222213123112231132232222131131311.title: A better timeline

choices: "... Just wanted to see if you remembered... cutie~" this might be good...
"... Zorua, can we talk about something?" this had to end, now...
1223322222131231122311322322221311313113.content:
Celebi felt the air leaving her lungs as Zorua spoke that single word.

Zorua was her-

"Hey... ya okay?" he asked, noticing her acting weird. Celebi looked at him.

"Y-Yeah..." she replied, cursing her shaky voice.
"Just need to... go to the bathroom..." she hastily made up an excuse, before picking the fox up and putting on the couch and walking out of the living room.

Celebi went straight into her bathroom and closed the door, locking it before turning her back to it and leaning against it, paws over her mouth.

Zorua was her boyfriend! How did it we even happen!? When did it happen!?

Celebi felt her cheeks flaring up - she wasn't in love with Zorua!... Was she...?

For a moment, the shocked legendary thought about the fight they had... she hated him in that moment... but all her harsh feelings had evaporated when he almost died, started having panic attacks, opened up to her, started acting in a friendlier way...

"Arceus..." the fairy murmured upon discovering that she actually had feelings for the fox!

Where did those even come from!?

Celebi felt sick, how was she going to face the fox again? She wasn't sure of what to do... agree to be Zorua's girlfriend...? Or simply - gently - reject him? Perhaps... should she have explained the whole thing that actually never happened?

... No. That would have sounded too weird, she decided...

But then, what could she do?

She stumbled over her mirror, seeking some answer in her reflection.

And Celebi decided that she had to talk to Zorua, make up an excuse and discover how it happened.

Still shocked, she opened the door and walked out from the bathroom.

Zorua perked up as Celebi returned to the living room.

"Zorua..." she said, walking to the couch and sitting beside the fox, blushing heavily.
"... How did it happen?"

Zorua looked at her.
"What?" he questioned.

Celebi suddenly got an idea and adopted a smirk, which masked her internal storm of emotions.
"How did you become my boyfriend? Say it." she told confidently, Zorua huffing heavily - how many times did that question come up? - as he looked at her.

"... Celi, we've been dating for a week, I remember it... there's no need, really..." he meekly opposed.

But Celebi's look told him that she wasn't going to give up.

"But I want to hear it again... actually, tell me, what happened since the day of that prank?" she asked, he looked at her with confusion.

"... Celi, last time I talked about it, you told me that you didn't want to hear it anymore... it was two days ago..." he replied.

"... I've changed my mind." Celebi hastily responded.

Zorua looked skeptical.

"You're acting weird, girl..." he mused out loud. Celebi internally screamed, feeling like this was going to end with her dropping this charade and telling him why the two of them ended up dating... even though she still wasn't sure about how she felt for the dark-type.

Luckily, Zorua shrugged.

"... You avoided my bucket, remember? I was trying to run, but you showed me that shrinking ability of yours... by shrinking me," he explained.
"Then, you asked if I needed to talk, because you felt like I wasn't who I wanted to show I was... I didn't actually talk, but you insisted and I wasn't in the condition of telling ‘no’ so I... told you about my dad... and you offered me to come living with you, but with your mom around, I had to be this size and pretend to be a doll..."

Celebi nodded in understanding - so her past self made him talk, huh? It made sense, shrinking him probably lead him to open up more easily because he couldn't fight back... she practically forced him to talk...

Maybe a bit brutal, but it lead to him dating her...

Again, was she sure about this...? She didn't know yet.

"Go on Zorua," she said, and he shrugged.

"Seriously Celi..." he complained, but she quickly intercepted him,

"Do it or you're... huh... sleeping on the floor tonight," she hesitated, but it worked anyway, she judged as he sighed.

"Fine... but I don't want to tell it anymore..." he said in annoyance.
"... I accepted to come here, you took great care of me and I..." he blushed.
"... I told you how I felt because you noticed that I was ‘acting weird’..." he sighed deeply, but suddenly approached her.

Much to Celebi's surprise, he started nuzzling her side lovingly.

"You Celi... you said you were giving me a chance..." he said, happily.

Celebi opened her mouth to speak, but he sighed, interrupting her before she even talked.

"... Yeah yeah, I know what happens now... I know what ya wanna hear... well, Celi, thank you... for becoming my girlfriend," he said, embarrassed but evidently happier than she ever saw him.

But then, he suddenly looked up. Celebi was blushing, mouth wide open.

"... Celi, it's only been a week," Zorua repeated,
"Why do you keep asking such questions?"

Celebi stared at him, uncertain.

It was clear, now she either decided to play along and be Zorua's girlfriend - one thing leads to another, who knew, maybe he was really an interesting pokemon - or she explained him how they got here.

"Zorua..." she said upon having taken her final decision.

She picked the dark-type up as she spoke again...
1223322222131231122311322322221311313113.title: Sentimental doubts

choices: "Sorry Zorua...I don't think I feel that way."
"Zorua...I-I..."
Celebi kisses him
1223322222131231122311322322221311313113.content:
She bit her lip. "Zorua...can we talk about something?" She said and he looked at her. Those giant blue pools that were her eyes spoke multiple things to him. Kindness...and doubt.

"Uh...yeah, sure." He said. He wanted to know why she was acting so weird right now. The next thing he knew he was pulled into a hug by the green giantess and he started blushing furiously.

"Zorua, what i'm about to tell you isn't a happy story...please don't be mad. I just ask that you understand, okay?" She said kindly, and slowly. He looked up from her chest to see that she was smiling down at him he nodded, unable to hide his blush.

"Y-yeah...okay." He said and she pulled away from the hug.

"Zorua, where I was just at...before I came in here. I was in the past." She said and he looked at her puzzled.

"The past...you time traveled?" She nodded at this. "The truth is...I time traveled to the day we properly talked...when I guess I shrunk you down for you to tell me about your dad." She said and he looked down. "You guess...?" He was getting confused by this.

"I altered the timeline Zorua. That meeting...was me giving myself a second chance to do things better. I guess that my past self did do things better. A LOT better if I got you crushing on me." She giggled a bit and he just seemed to be lost.

"Zorua...that prank...with the bucket. In our timeline before I altered it you successfully pranked me."

"I did...i'm sorry Celi." He said. "I'm serious, no more pranks." He said and Celebi blinked. Dang...she did REAL good on this go around. Was she in the process of undoing that?

"It's okay Zorua...after that...I shrunk you. But I made you small...very, very small. About the size of a pebble. I terrorized you briefly after knocking you out like that." She said, ashamed. "But then...after that..." She choked up but swallowed the lump in her throat. She noted that Zorua seemed uncomfortable, but was paying full attention. "I shrunk you even more...so, so small that no pokemon could ever see you. Hear you. I stuck you on my friend and said 'good luck surviving' and left you there for a week...it was horrible of me Zorua...I feel so bad just thinking about it...I pulled you out of there after a week but you were half starved, half dead from exhaustion...you had...I think I broke your mind Zorua." She said and his eyes widened.

"W-what are you..."

She kept going.

"After that I grew you back and you retaliated. First to the friend I put you on, then you ran back to your forest and I chased you, only for you to prank me again. We fought Zorua...for real. You bit hard into my paw and I almost...killed you again." She said.

"It was only after that that I tried to make right by you...you slowly opened up, I think you might've even liked me by the end but...the damage I did to your mind...I don't know if it could've been fixed any other way than what I just did...I time traveled and told my past self to try and get through to you before the prank happened...then I came back to this." She finally finished and sighed.

It was done.

Now she awaited his response.

He blinked.

"So...are you my Celebi...or..." He seemed confused more than anything.

"I am, but my memories...are of a different series of events. For what it's worth I truly AM sorry." She said and he nodded.

"You almost killed me twice huh...and then..." He didn't know how to process this.

"Zorua, you're okay. I made sure that you were okay..." She held him closer to her face and to her shock, he licked her cheek, she blushed furiously and almost dropped him.

"Wha-" She was startled and looked to see him blushing too.

"Celebi, whatever happened, or didn't happen...I don't care. I like you, you tried to talk to me when no other pokemon would...you offered me a home...you treated me with kindness about my past. And you took care to undo any damage you might've done to me in another life...or time...or whatever. I love you...and if I have to win you over again, then I will." He said and she just blushed looking at him.
1223322222131231122311322322221311313113.title: The truth of changing time

choices: "Let's read a book together," Celebi suggested
"Looks like the rain stopped... let's go out." Celebi suggested
"... Since they know about you, let's invite our friends," Celebi suggested
1223322222131231122311322322221311313113.content:
Celebi stared in shock.

Those were easily the sweetest words she heard... and coming from Zorua! Never in her whole life she thought that Zorua could be her boyfriend!

But... she wasn't sure about this... did she love him back? Did she not? Why was this so hard? ‘I'm sorry Zorua, I don't know...’

Maybe his Celebi truly loved him, but now she took her place... she...

She was his Celebi...

The fairy looked at Zorua, he was serious. And she made a choice.

She might not have known about the events of the past week and a half, but-

‘Aw, what the hell...’

Zorua, who was still being held in front of Celebi's green face, contemplated what Celebi had told him.

She wasn't the Celebi he knew until this very morning... she had left, and another Celebi took her place, a Celebi that had almost killed him twice, a Celebi that he had hurt... that timeline must've been rough for both of them.

He didn't care. In his timeline, none of those things happened; he loved Celebi, and he wanted his girlfriend back, no matter if he had to win her over again.

But Zorua's musings were interrupted as he found out that there was no need to win her over again.

Celebi, blushing furiously, leaned forward, her lips suddenly touching Zorua, whose cheeks flared up.

Celebi was kissing him, flushing bright red as she did.

She held the kiss for thirty seconds, before pulling off, leaving Zorua blushing but beaming.

His world suddenly felt tight as the fairy hugged him to her chest tightly.

"... I take it you're still my girlfriend?" the fox asked, hopeful.

Celebi nodded, a sweet smile appearing on her face.
"... I was until now, no? Why stop?" she said, embarrassed but evidently happy.

Then, she suddenly got up.

"Come on Zorua, let's go," she said, Zorua looking confused.
"Go... where?" he asked causing Celebi to giggle.

"Out, silly! We have to make up for lost time... I mean, I have to make up for lost time!" she explained, Zorua looking vaguely amused.

"Ehm... Celi..." his paw was pointing to the window, she noted. It was raining outside.

She had completely forgotten.

"O-Oh..." was all she said, before looking back at her relatively new boyfriend dejectedly.

They had been together for a week, he said...

"I know!" Celebi chimed happily as she fluttered to her bedroom.

She gently put down Zorua on it, before leaving the room once again, returning a few minutes later with a bag of chips and a few sandwiches on a plate, which she put on her nightstand.

Then, Celebi did something unexpected - she picked up Zorua and slid under the covers.

She just got back in bed. It was 10 AM...

"... Who are you, what have you done to my Celebi?" Zorua asked playfully.

The green giantess smirked, giving Zorua a gentle kiss before hugging him to her chest, under the covers.

He looked rather cute like that, she had to admit...

"Now Zorua... you mentioned that we've been together for a week, huh? Well... I'm clueless about the whole thing so... mind explaining what we did?" Celebi asked.

Zorua seemed to brighten up.

"Oh, it was awesome Celi!" he chimed.
"We read together..." Celebi froze.

Zorua, READING!?

"... Who are you, what have you done to my Zorua?" she repeated his previous joke.

Zorua merely smiled.
"It was you Celi! I admit that I was skeptical, but after discovering the marvelous world of horror books..."

"Okay, you're my real Zorua," Celebi interrupted, causing the dark-type to snicker.

"... Anyway, we went to Bellossom's..." he recalled, only for Celebi to interrupt again.

"... Bellossom? But-" that Bellossom? The same pokemon that, like her, was a bookworm?

Zorua snickered.
"Yeah... you introduced me to your friends, remember?" he said, before remembering himself that this Celebi was from another timeline and thinking that his question was extremely dumb.

"... Anyway, now you know. Bellossom, Froslass," Froslass was one of the most shy pokemon in the village. Celebi wondered how the two of them were friends at times. She knew for sure that Froslass didn't like Zorua... not after the illusionary fire prank...

"... Lopunny," Zorua continued.

"Lopunny?" Celebi interrupted, sure that she told her past self to NOT call Lopunny.

"Yeah... she wanted to see ya... mostly me though - the prankster reputation... it was a bit awkward," Zorua mused, wondering if a giant bunny almost crushing him to dust upon tripping could be called ‘awkward’.

"... And Cinccino." the chinchilla that hated getting dirty? Her a friend of Zorua, who made her fall into a puddle of mud some time ago? Celebi swore she was gone for a week, claimed that such time was required to clean herself...

"... It was good," Zorua said, adopting a grateful smile.
"You convinced Cinccino and Froslass to forgive me... there's nothing much more to say though. We went on a couple dates, but that's it Celi..." he finished.

Celebi smiled, handing a bit of a sandwich she was eating, along with a chip.

"... At least you didn't forget I love these," Zorua snickered, munching on the chip.

"So... exciting week, huh?" she asked, gently caressing her boyfriend.

She has to admit, he DID look adorable like that... and he had been a true sweetheart since she came back, so... she supposed she could give him a chance... or better, give him another chance...

Zorua smiled, swallowed and nuzzled his girlfriend's chest, glad that she agreed to continue being with him.

"Well... I've told you about what I did... and you've told me about your timeline Celi... so what now?" the dark-type fox asked.

Celebi thought about it.
1223322222131231122311322322221311313113.title: Day in bed

choices: go to the forest. I showed you a few things once, but you don't remember now."
go into the village. I want to see some of the places again."
go see one of our friends. Froslass still seems wary of me..."
1223322222131231122311322322221311313113.content:
"Let's...read together." She said smiling. The legendary levitated a book from the shelf, the one she knew she had been reading in her timeline. It was still there luckily. Zorua looked at her and blinked.

"Can I read mine too?" He asked as he looked towards her desk. A book Celebi didn't recognize sat on it. One with a black binding. She smiled and levitated it over and set it in front of her tiny boyfriend.

She looked at the book. It seemed plain, but it was evidently a horror book. Not her speed but Zorua was...READING. She had to admit that was nice, even if Bellossom was helping out in getting him into books. He started to paw the binding open. It looked like he needed to exert himself doing it though so she reached forward and helped open it.

"What page were you on?" She asked smiling and he grinned.

"362." He said and her eyes widened.

He really was reading. She turned to that page to see a creepy drawing heading a chapter logo. She wasn't gonna read this book she knew.

"Thanks Celi." He said as he crawled up onto the book and started to read.

She opened up her book and started reading herself. Letting the quiet peace take her.

Zorua was so different than the one she had known. Not pranking anyone, a pokemon that seemed fine with being small, a pokemon that loved her...a pokemon that didn't experience that trauma. No cracked mind. Maybe she did good changing the timeline. Her mom told her to be extremely careful with it but...in this case, she couldn't see how any of this was bad.

She reached forward to grab a sandwich and broke off a tiny bit of it, setting it in front of Zorua before she took a bite. He gratefully ate a bit of it as he continued to read.

'A boyfriend huh...and Zorua...' She blushed again.

Her mom told her she didn't care for her dating...and that a lot of boy pokemon may just be looking to her for her power, not who she was.

She didn't think that was Zorua though. Funnily enough, the infamous, dreaded Zorua...seemed to be one of the most genuine boys she had met.

She started to read in earnest now, occasionally grabbing a chip or sandwich. She watched Zorua on occasion as he moved off the book to turn a page and continue, but mostly let herself get engrossed in her book about pirates and a bumbling magicarp.

She didn't realize the hours melting away either. She was getting engrossed, as was Zorua. But she looked out her window as she finished her book to realize that it wasn't raining anymore...and looked at her clock to see that they had been doing this for 5 hours.

"Zorua." She said and he looked at her. He still had a bit to go in his book she noted. "Yeah, what's up Celi?" He said and she pointed to the window.

"Want to go out?" She smiled and he looked at his book.

"Um...yeah, sure!" He grinned as he stepped off, making note of the page he was on before Celebi gently shut it.

"I'll let you pick, where do you want to go?" She said as she picked her boyfriend up. She hugged him to her chest and he nuzzled back, making her blush. She levitated the now empty plate onto her nightstand.

"Let's...
1223322222131231122311322322221311313113.title: Reading together

choices: Later that night...
Later that day...
12233222221312311223113223222213113132.content:
Celebi stared sadly at the small fox she was holding and decided...they'd live with the reality of what had happened, if she undid it who knows where that'd lead or if Zorua would even be calm like he is now.

Celebi was certain things would get better as time passed. She gently pressed Zorua to her cheek in a hug, hoping to comfort him in his episode and that he'd come back on his own.

After a few moments, she heard steady breathing from him, and eventually a sigh.

"I hate these episodes Celi..." He said, voice cracking and she nodded. "I know...don't worry, we'll fix it somehow, okay?" She tried to smile, to reassure him, but she didn't know how to help beyond that.

He realized she was hugging him to her cheek. He leaned himself into it, surprising Celebi. But to him it was soft...and warm...a comforting embrace. Something he needed.

He realized what he was about to say.

"I'll stay with you...I just want to be happy...I don't care about size, status or reputation right now...I just can't take being alone or these episodes...please help..." He said and Celebi pushed him into her cheek more.

"Of course Zorua...don't you worry, we'll sort this out..." She almost felt misty eyed at Zorua's words but she kept it down. She pulled away and smiled down at him. She was a giantess to him. A protector. What she had done to him...it didn't matter right now, all that mattered was being safe, being warm, being secure...he'd take coddling like this.

Zorua laid down in her palms and closed his eyes. Celebi blinked but understood, he was still tired...must've been a rough night, even sleeping how he did. She smiled as she went to turn on the TV, she'd let him rest.
12233222221312311223113223222213113132.title: Being hers

choices: The floor, and it was a carpet floor
One of Celebi's books that was on her bed
Somewhere on Celebi herself.
1223322222133.content:
Celebi knew she shrunk Zorua too much if she having a incredibly difficult time finding Zorua. "Ok, just find the little fox, and grow him to a more manageable size. I'm a mystic pokemon after all, i should be able to find him even if i shrunk him so much." Celebi says to herself as she didn't want to panic herself that she may have doom Zorua to indescribable shrunken size.

Meanwhile, Zorua is freaking out as while covering his ears as the booming sounds of Celebi talking to herself were hurting him. He could only guess that either Celebi either shrunk him on purpose and doing this loud noise on purpose, or, and he hopes this isn't the case, she shrunk him too much and can't find him. Suddenly, his area grew extremely dark. Nervously, he looks up and at first he thought he was looking at the sky. He quickly realizes that it wasn't the sky he was looking at but instead Celebi's pupil when a thunderous boom as well a hurrican of wind knock him on his back when Celebi blink a little.

The fairy pokemon had to move her hand closer to her eye as she struggle to find Zorua. Now very worry she may have took things a little too far, she wanted to find Zorua before something happens to him. She then spots something her hand. "Wait, is that...?" Celebi thought she found Zorua when she spots a nanosize speck, but before she could even finish questioning herself....

*KNOCK* *KNOCK* "Celebi, dinner is almost ready." A loud knocks, created by Celebi's mother, caught Celebi off guard that she almost panic.

"Ah...um, ok mother, will be there soon." Celebi says nervously as she completely forgot to take account of her mother being at home while she was going to punish Zorua. However, Celebi had better things to worry about when she looks back at her hand, expecting to see Zorua. Her heart stop when she looks at the same exact spot where she saw the speck, except it was completely gone. "Uh oh..." Celebi says as she can guess what exactly happened to the speck.

Unfortanly for both Zorua and Celebi, the fairy pokemon was correct of what she feared happened. When Celebi jump a little when her mother knock her door, it was a strong enough movement to not only launch Zorua up, but launch him somewhere in Celebi's room.... as a nanoscopic speck.... with Celebi having no idea where exactly she lost him at. As for Zorua.....


"CELI, THIS IS NOT FUNNY!" Zorua says as he scream and panics while flailing around in the air as he struggle to understand where in his new world he is going. Luckly for Zorua, his flight was about to end, the bad news, it was going to be a very rough landing. In one quick blur, Zorua finally made contact with "ground" while still intact. "Oww...."Zorua struggles to say as he was badly hurt. He had enough strength at the moment to look around and try to figure out where he was. To make things worse for Zorua, he knows where he was...
1223322222133.title: Small accidents tends to happen

choices: She manages to locate Zorua
She still can't see him, even on the book
12233222221332.content:
Zorua took the landing hard lay there, lucidly looking around at a tan plain that extended as far as he could see. "Ugh..." The scent of pages and leather filled his nose and he could tell immediately that he'd landed on one of her books. "Oh no...i'm doomed, aren't I..." He groggily said to himself as he attempted to stand up. Immediately searing pain entered his front left paw and leg and he collapsed into a heap, screaming bloody murder. "My leg...I don't think it's supposed to bend that way...." He muttered weakly before the pain came back for a second go. 'AHHH, AHHH, SOMEBODY PLEASE...ANYBODY...HELP!" He screamed on the verge of tears.

-

Celebi was in a panic. She'd rushed downstairs and told her mom she would be eating in her room before hastily grabbing her plate and running back up. "Okay, okay. I was right here...I flung in this direction, he probably soared at this angle..."Celebi was making wild motions, trying to remember the exact set up that had happened. "Okay, i'll find him, grow him back, and send him on his way. I'd say things are even right now about the feathers and honey."She said nervously. "Calm down Celi, calm down...you're a mystic Pokemon, let's...try and sense him. Yeah!" She exclaimed, psyching herself up before she shut her eyes.

Calmly, slowly she reached out with her senses. 'Zorua. Zorua. Zorua.'

-

Zorua felt a shiver enter his spine in between the excruciating pain. "PLEASE, PLEASE CELEBI"

-

'Please, please Celebi' It was faint, but Celebi felt it coming from her bed, on one of her books! "Got him! Hang on Zorua, i'll get you!"
12233222221332.title: Two different types of panic

choices: Celebi tries to use what healing powers she has to fix him herself
Celebi rushes Zorua to a doctor as fast as she can
Celebi thinks the merciful thing to do would be to put him out of his misery
122332222213321.content:
Zorua was starting to become delirious, and was fading in and out of consciousness in a lucid state, but the vast sky of green followed by an eye the size of the sun didn't escape him. "Celebi..." He slurred, half aware that she was looking for him.

-

Celebi was scrutinizing the tan covered book as intently as she could. She was sure it was this book. Then, almost imperceptive to the naked eye, she saw the tiny black dot on the book. Her heart skipped a beat and she nearly sighed in relief, but caught herself at the risk of blowing him away. "Okay Zorua, i'm gonna grow you a bit now." She said happily as she used her abilities to grow him. Soon he was the size of a dot, then a bug until finally. Celebi had to cover her mouth with her loud gasp when she saw Zorua. Her heart sank and any sour feelings she may have still had towards the prankster for his stunts instantly evaporated. There, at the size of a tiny doll, lay a mangled and half conscious Zorua, whimpering and slurring 'help' over and over. His front left leg was bent at a horrid 90 degree angle and he was laying in a pool of blood from his side. His fur was matted and frayed, he looked absolutely disheveled. She could not even imagine the pain he was in and she was the one that did it. "I...I..." Tears started to well up in Celebi's eyes. "Zorua..." She HAD to fix this but...how?

"I do have some healing abilities but...I don't know if even that would be enough. I could rush him to a doctor, but moving him in this state might not be good for him...not to mention trying to move him if I restored him to full size...even if I could heal him...would he even be able to walk or run again...it might be the kind thing to end his suffe-" Celebi gulped audibly at her own thoughts. No! No! That wasn't something to think about! But she had to do something...
122332222213321.title: Attempting to help

choices: Later that night...
Few days later...
1223322222133211.content:
Celebi contemplates what should do, she was becoming a nervous wreck at the sight of seeing Zorua in a hurtful state that she puts him through. Zorua was losing conscious as his injuries were about to finish him. Tears started to roll down Celebi's face as she knew she had to think fast. Shaking her head, she gently picks Zorua up and gently nestle her head on him as she perform her healing abilities on Zorua.

The healing move she used on Zorua was working, but she can hear Zorua begining to whimper before finally screaming in pain. Celebi wanted to stop, but knows if she does, she could accidently end's Zorua's life. A bright green light shines all over Zorua's body as Celebi heals him as much as she could. Soon enough, the leg that was bent snap back in place, though Zorua made a loud scream that almost made Celebi stop.

"Zorua...I'm sorry, i didn't..." Celebi says, wanting to stop to make Zorua stop screaming, but she's so close. After a another minute, Celebi finishes the healing move, and Zorua seems to be ok, but he seems to collapse into unconsciouness as the sharp pain prove too be to much for him to remain awake. As of how truely heal he was, Celebi won't know until Zorua wakes up. She then collaspes on her knees as she holds Zorua in her hands. She didn't say anything she hugs Zorua close to her chest.

A few hours pass before Zorua started to wake up. At first he panics be a familiar sharp pain hits him a little. He looks at his leg and saw its fix. He then looks around to see that he was on Celebi's bed, more specifically, her pillow. He then spots a note next time him, saying, "I took it too far. I'm Sorry. -Celi." He then see Celebi, still huge to him but isn't a planet like before, resting her head on the side of the bed. He could see that she was asleep, yet her face was very red from all the crying she made earlier.

Zorua didn't know what to think anymore, all he did was move himself closer to Celebi's head and rest his head on hers.
1223322222133211.title: Fixing one's mistake

choices: The next morning...
12233222221332111.content:
Zorua had no idea what to do at this point, Celebi had hurt him...hurt him bad. But she healed him too? He didn't know why he was getting closer to his tormentor/savior either other than the fact that he couldn't do much for himself right now. But seeing everything so...so big intimidated him and he was still feeling a dull ache in his paw. He winced at the memory of pain and scooched himself closer into her head, if only for some mental comfort, and warmth. He felt himself starting to choke up too and tried to drift off to sleep.

He was close to drifting off when he heard Celebi muttering and felt her head moving. She rose, higher and higher into the sky as she stretched up, making Zorua feel smaller than he was. He shrunk back before her eyes hazily focused on him. "...Zorua." She said gently, methodically before she reached a paw for him. Zorua shrunk back even more, not that it would've stopped her if she wanted to grab him, but when she noted this she pulled her paw back and looked down sadly. "I am so, so SO sorry Zorua? Are you in pain still...?" she asked timidly, looking away from him a bit.

"...a little sore." He replied, almost as timid as her. "But...not nearly as bad as it was. T-thank you for finding me...and healing me." He could've chewed her out for putting him in this situation. A part of him wanted to as well...but a combination of seeing her genuine guilt and his own straight up fear of her right now stopped him. "That's good, can I...please check yo-" She started reaching for him again.

"NO!....no...no." He said, almost surprised by his own reaction to it. He couldn't reconcile the fact that every time she had held him something disastrous or excruciating happened to him. He almost felt guilty when he saw Celebi start to tear up before she wiped her eyes and got up.

"...Let me go get you some water." She said gently as she left the room. Zorua knew he had made things more awkward right there...well tough! It was Celebi's fault...right? "...Why should I feel guilty? Because of some dumb prank?...Still, she is trying to make things right I think...UGH, whatever, it doesn't matter, she almost killed me over a dumb prank!...but it was an accident...I don't know." Zorua was talking to himself to fill the awkward silence that she left him in when she went to get the water. Soon she returned and walked around the bed and put the glass of water at the edge of the bed, where Zorua could at least lean his head down to drink. "Here..." She said. He walked forward timidly and started to take his drink, noting that he was staring eye to eye with Celebi...boy her eyes were red and tired...and sad. He looked down only to see him own reflection and how frayed and stressed he looked...as well as the reflection of Celebi in it too. 'Yeah that about figures' he thought bitterly. After he had his fill he looked up at Celebi as she got up to walk away and out of the room. "I'll let you rest up in here, I can take the couch" She said, Zorua shocked by this. He looked around the big room...the big, dark intimidating room, and the intimidating bed he was on with the far too distant fall to the ground... "Celebi...wait..." Zorua started and she stopped.

"I...I really do appreciate what you're doing here...I just...i'm really scared, okay? It's not...I really thought I was going to die, and you wouldn't find me, and-and-" At this he started to tear up, his voice cracking. Any idea of keeping a cool face or a dignified smart tone was gone, and he didn't want Celebi to leave him right now. "I don't want to be alone..." He cried. Celebi turned to look at the tiny dark pokemon. Of all the things she expected from Zorua, this was not one of them. She walked back over to him, setting the glass down on her nightstand and gently picked him up. He didn't struggle or fight this time, but Celebi hugged him to her chest.

"It's okay Zorua...it's okay...i'll stay here." She said gently, and he cried into her chest, letting it out.
12233222221332111.title: Conflicted fears and undignified tears

choices: Celebi grows Zorua back up and lets him go
Celebi decides to keep Zorua tiny until he's fully healed
122332222213321111.content:
Zorua kept crying into Celebi's chest for a good while more, feeling his frustration towards the giantess slide out of his eyes along with his tears.

"It's alright Zorua... Not going anywhere... Is that what you want?" Celebi gently says, keeping him still against her chest.

Before Zorua even knows it, Celebi climbs onto her bed, wrapping a sheet around the small fox and herself.

He gazes up at the giantess, who gives a gentle smile.
"Come on... let's sleep on it... we'll see what to do in the morning..." she says.

One of the paws of the fairy leaves him, and one of her giant fingers moves to his reddened eyes as she gently - and very carefully to not damage Zorua's eyes - wipes his tears.

Soon, Zorua's crying comes to an end. He sniffles, before leaning his head against Celebi's chest.
"There we go... come on, let's sleep now..." she repeats, her paw joining the other as she hugs Zorua again.

The small fox looks up into her eyes. Those blue eyes, once full of mischief, are now red from drowsiness and wet with tears, but regardless full of kindness and pity.

Sniffling again, Zorua closes his own eyes, leaning against the smooth, warm wall that is Celebi's chest.

"Sleep tight Zorua," he hears the fairy saying as she snuggles him deeper into her chest.

Zorua blurted out an incomprehensible answer, before falling unconscious from the lack of energy. However, Celebi managed to understand two words, ‘Thank you’.

The fairy smiles, finally letting her eyes close.

Only after a couple minutes, she too falls asleep, joining the small Zorua in dreamland.

--

"Zorua... Zorua... wake up..." a gentle voice disturbed Zorua's slumber. He ignored it, and kept on sleeping.

"Come on Zorua, wake up..." the voice repeated as something started to shake him gently.

The dark type drowsily opens his eyes.
"W-Wha..." he mutters as he looks up, an indistinct mass of green towering above him.

Slowly, his vision returns, and he notices Celebi staring down at him.

Upon seeing him awake, the fairy gives a smile.
"Good morning, Zorua... Slept well?" she asks softly.

Zorua blinks a few times to rid his eyes from the sleep. That wasn't a dream; Celebi really broke his leg, then fixed it. And he's been really sleeping with the fairy in her bed.

A lingering ache in his leg confirmed that it all hasn't been one big, scary nightmare.

"Yes..." Zorua replies to Celebi's question, looking away as he blushes faintly.

"And... your leg...? How does it feel?" Celebi asks again.

Zorua doesn't reply.

The fairy gently moves her paw over him, picking his injured leg in it, before applying a small pressure on it, causing Zorua to grunt in pain. Celebi instantly lets go.

"Not fully healed yet..." she mutters dejectedly as she recalls she was the one breaking it in the first place, even if it was by accident.

Noticing Zorua staring up at her, the legendary gives a small smile.
"Come on... let's go get something to eat..." she says, gently picking Zorua in both her hands, before getting up from the bed and starting to walk out of the room.

The fairy carries the small dark type into her kitchen.

There was no need to worry about her mother. She was gone to work, and she'll be for the whole day. So, for the time being, Celebi could keep Zorua around.

The legendary gently lets him down on a table, before grabbing a bag of cookies and filling a glass with Oran Berry juice.

She sets everything on the table and sits down in front of Zorua.

--

"Celebi..." Zorua says while munching on a cookie Celebi had provided him.
"What?" Celebi asks while eating her own meal.

"... What are we going to do now...?" Zorua asks in an almost hopeful manner as Celebi moves the glass of juice near him.
"What do you mean?" she asks, while picking him up and moving him upwards to let him drink.

Zorua takes a few sips, before eyeing Celebi again.
"I mean - are you going to restore my size now? Can I... can I go...?" he asks.

Celebi gives him a dejected stare.
"Zorua, your leg is still injured. I can't exactly let you go like this," she responds.

"I'll be fine..." Zorua mumbles in response.

Celebi places a paw to her chin as she ponders what to do.
122332222213321111.title: An important decision

choices: Within a few days, Zorua's leg is improving
Zorua isn't getting any better
1223322222133211112.content:
"No Zorua, I can't let you leave. Not while you're still hurt." Celebi said gently. Zorua for his part looked dejected before she gently started to rub his back. "I promise when you're recovered i'll change you back, this isn't about punishing you anymore, not even close." She said as she started to clean up the meal they had both had.

"And what if it takes days...weeks...months? Wh-what if my leg is just like this now...?" Zorua inquired, scared to hear her answer. Celebi bit her lip, her back turned to him. "Then...we'll cross that bridge when we come to it. Let's just...see how the next few days go, okay?" She said, trying to sound upbeat and optimistic, but she knew that Zorua had touched upon the exact thing she was fearing most right now.

--

"And I win again." Celebi said, claiming Zorua's last black piece on her checkers board. "Of course you do..." Zorua mumbled under his breath. He was laying down lazily, staring across the vast plain that was the checkers board Celebi had been TORTURING and SUBJECTING him to for the last 3 hours! She said this wasn't about punishing him anymore but he was starting to doubt that! "Come on, don't you have anything else we can do? It's a nice day, right, can't we go outside and play?"

"And risk losing you out there?" Celebi said, almost in a lecturing tone.

"It isn't like I can run or get very far, both size and leg kinda prevent that. We could get some sunshine at least!" Zorua said, almost pleading. and Celebi closed her eyes and sighed.

"I'm sorry Zorua, but I don't want to risk your safety right now." She said, she kinda wanted to go outside herself, but she wasn't going to chance anything happening to Zorua, not after everything that had happened.

"What if you grew me a bit, then we could-"

"Why don't I grab a different game, huh?" Celebi cut him off, smiling as she got up and started to pack up the checkers board.

"THAT was an option!?" Zorua said incredulously, making Celebi smirk. She had at least gotten him off the subject. Giving him a small smile she walked off, putting the game away and leaving Zorua alone for a second. He stared longingly at the door he could see to the outside. He was too big to slip under it, and hopelessly, hopelessly too small to dream of opening it on his own. Soon Celebi returned with her next round of tortu-next game.

"Alright Zorua, now it's time for 'Who's that Pokemon?'" Celebi said cheerfully, and he sighed. "Oh yay...."
1223322222133211112.title: Indoor day

choices: It was good news
It was bad news.
12233222221332111122.content:
Days has went by since the day Celebi agree to wait to see if Zorua's leg gets better, amd sadly, it hasn't. Everday, Zorua would try to at least stand, but a sharp pain would always come the second Zorua puts pressure. The constant failure to stand so far is starting to get to Zorua and Celebi.

"Please Zorua, can we at least wait one more day?" Celebi asks as sincerly as she could. She knows that waiting around at a shrunken size is driving Zorua nuts, but she doesn't want to risk making things worse Zorua.

"Celi, we waited for few days already and I'm not improving." Zorua says, soundly like his spirit is breaking. As much Celebi wants to denied or wants to admit it, Zorua's right. They have waited, Celebi even try to heal Zorua as much as she could but with no luck. At this point, shes's fearing the worse. Bitting her lips as she looks outside, she gave in to a option she didn't want to do.

"Let's....let's go see the doctor, Zorua." Celebi says sounding defeated of coming to this option. Even Zorua doesn't want to go, for the doctor could convirm what the two pokemon are fearing about Zorua's leg.

Carefully picking Zorua up and heading to the village, Celebi made a beine towards where the doctor of the village would normally be. Once inside, much to Celebi and Zorua's delight, no pokemon where here today, so they don't have to wait long. Celebi rings a bell that was on the counter.

"Coming~" A cheery female voice could be heard. A Chansey walks in with a nurses hat. "Oh Celebi, how delightful to see you, and quite surprisng as well."

"Hi doctor Chansey..." Celebi says in a nervous tune as she hides Zorua a little.

"Are you ok, you don't look ill or hurt." Chansey says as she examines the fairy.

"Actually its not me that wants to see you." Celebi says as she reveals Zorua, whose still tiny. Chansey gasp as she looks at the tiny fox.

One explanation later...

"I see, so that's what happened." Chansey says, trying to believe the story the best as she could.

"It was accident, I didn't mean to hurt him." Celebi says, holding her arms in guilt.

"Celebi, please stop blaming yourself." Zorua says, after he got change back to normal size for the duration of the examination, not wanting to see Celebi constantly kick herself because of the incident.

"I would agree with Zorua, you also did save him." Chansey says as she examines the leg, trying to lighten Celebi's mood. "And besides, the way you describe the injury, you did a phenomenal job in healing Zorua's leg. Such injuries would normally end differently." The two pokemons couldn't help but feel a cold shiver on their shoulders when they heard Chansey's words.

"I'm afraid to ask what you mean by that." Zorua says, while wincing in pain as Chansey continues to examines the leg.

"Let's not talk about it." Chansey says as she finishes up her examination. "Well I think I examine the leg enough." Chansey says as she delivers the news.
12233222221332111122.title: Time to visit a doctor

choices: "Okay Zorua, fine. We can hang out a bit." Celebi responds
"No deal Zorua." Celebi responds
Before Celebi can reply, she encounters a friend
122332222213321111221.content:
Celebi and Zorua stared at the doctor expectantly, waiting for the answer with anxious expressions. Chansey looks down somewhat glumly.

"Well... it's good news... mostly..." she says. After all, Chansey are known for caring about each and every living being. What she was about to say saddened her.

"... Mostly?!" Zorua exclaims, dreading her answer. Celebi too adopts a look of shock, but remains quiet.

Chansey bites her lip as she rises her head, before nodding meekly.
"The leg will eventually heal for good Zorua... but it'll take quite some time..."

Zorua's ears dropped.

Chansey pats his back.
"Yep..." she repeats, before looking at Celebi.
"Until his leg is healed, take care of him, Celebi," she says.
"Avoid strenuous activities. And bring him here for weekly check ups."

Zorua springs back up, Celebi takes a step back.
"W-Weekly?!" he exclaims.
"Just when am I going to be fine?! How is it going to take?!"

Again, Chansey bites her lip.
"A month or so... maybe two..." she responds.

Zorua dropped onto the doctor's table, limbs spread in resignation.

He had to spend a whole month with Celebi?! Maybe even two?!

"Arceus help..." he mumbles to himself in a dejected manner.

"... O-Okay doctor Chansey, I'll keep Zorua under my care until he's fully healed," Celebi slowly says while gently picking the tiny fox up.

"Anything else we should know?"

Chansey shakes her head.
"Nope. Just be careful," she says, her mouth cracking up in a small smile.

Celebi sighs.
"Thank you doctor... see you next week..." she says as she hugs Zorua to her chest, starting to get out.
"See you~"

--

"Are we heading to your house?" Zorua asked from the fairy's chest.

"Of course. You need rest." she responds.

Zorua huffs.

"What's wrong?"
"You kept me in that house for three. Endless. Days. Playing. Checkers." he recalls his hours of torture... which were in reality Celebi's board games.

"Can't we at least hang out for a bit?"

"No Zorua," Celebi whispers with discretion as a few villagers walk past her.
"You heard the doctor. No strenuous activities."

"... But I won't do anything! I mean, you just carry me around!" he retorts.

Celebi huffs loudly.
"Do you ever stop whining?"

Zorua frowns.
"Hey, you did this to me, okay? You owe me!" he retorts.
"Please..."

Celebi sighs.
122332222213321111221.title: Good news... mostly

choices: "Yeah, i'll take you on the graphic novel offer I guess, nothing better to do."
"Just leave me alone, alright?"
1223322222133211112212.content:
"No deal Zorua, we can't have you doing anything dangerous or reckless. Look, i'm sorry that you don't like being cooped up, and i'm sorry about what I did to you, but if you want to recover then you need to take it easy, that's just all there is to it." Celebi said putting her foot down and Zorua slumped in her grip, defeated. She sighed. "Okay...maybe...I can help you find something else to entertain yourself, that sound good? I know books aren't your speed, but I could get comics, or something for you to watch...I don't know, we'll figure it out later, but for now...rest." Celebi said and Zorua didn't respond. She had to admit she did feel a little bad for him right now, but he needed to know that this was for his own good

-
