Celebi was reading a book from her bed, the small fox curled up sleeping on a pillow next to her, she occasionally looked over smiling a bit. He was pretty adorable like that she had to admit, but all the same she knew that he hated this. "Hey Celebi? Dear, are you here?" It was her mom, coming to the door. The shiny pink Celebi looked at her daughter before sighing. "More books, you could get out you know? It is summer..." She said, looking at her daughter before the tiny figure on the bed caught her eye. "Is that a pokedoll?" She said and Celebi's eyes immediately shot wide open. "Uh...yeah, Braixen got it for me as a gag gift, thought it'd be funny, you know! Hahaha!" Celebi said, rubbing the back of her head before her mom raised an eyebrow. "O...kay. Well anyways, you really should get some sun. You've been cooped up in the house or in your room for days now haven't you?" She said, worried about her before Celebi nodded. "Don't worry, i'll be fine mom, okay? It's not like you want me hanging around certain pokemon anyway." She sighed before shrugging and her mom just gave her an annoyed look. "That's not what i'm talking about...but whatever, just consider what I said, i'm only your mother after all." She said before relenting and heading out. Celebi for her part breathed a sigh of relief but considered her options. She had to keep Zorua safe and on the road to recover...and dodge her mom finding out he was the real deal for the bulk of at least a month. "Cross that road when I come to it..." She muttered as she kept reading her book.

-

Zorua woke from his nap to see his giant protector/captor reading still and he muttered something before she looked over. "Oh...hey Zorua, you up? Did you maybe want to try a game...? Read a book...? I could go to the library, check out some graphic novels or..." She said weakly as he just stared at her.
1223322222133211112212.title: Nice, safe, and bored

choices: Zorua stays in bed
Zorua attempts an escape
12233222221332111122121.content:
Zorua knew that if he spent the next month or two without at least trying to engage with SOMETHING he'd lose his mind. He couldn't just do sleep and only sleep, and board games were...very very boring. "...Sure...i'll try a graphic novel Celebi, I can't do much else right..." He said dejectedly and she gently pet his head with a finger.

"Preference?" She said and he looked down.

"Something...horror?" He said hopeful and internally she wanted to roll her eyes, but she didn't, she just smiled. "Okay, i'll go get something like that from the library, in the meantime...want to try one of my books?" She said pointing to her shelf. He shook his head. "No...i'm okay." He said and she got up from her bed, making the bed quake. God she was so...powerful like this.

"Just hang tight okay? I'll be back..." She went to her door and turned to give him one last smile before she left.

"...This sucks." Zorua murmured as he laid back, he lazily looked around the room to realize...she left the door to her room open.

"...I can't walk very well right now, but..." The idea of escape tempted him. He wouldn't have his size, his leg was still hurt...but he'd have his freedom, right? It had to be better than this.

"But it's far too dangerous...I can't..." He muttered to himself, but the temptation was there.
12233222221332111122121.title: An open door

choices: "A-Alright... this might actually work..." Zorua admits, accepting the offer
"Celi... I really appreciate this, but... I can't forget..." Zorua refuses
122332222213321111221211.content:
Zorua sighed as he decided to simply stay on the bed until Celebi returned. Escaping would mean having to climb down the bed and, with a hurt forepaw, such task was nearly impossible.

Plus, Celebi's mom was still in the house... and, last but not least, he wouldn't have a chance out there, alone and around unaware - or very very aware - pokemon that could crush him.

So, his best shot right now was to just wait until his paw was healed and finally be freed of Celebi... not that he despised her for what she did - she saved his life, he was grateful for that... but he was also very afraid of the green fairy.

Zorua sighed as, letting his legs relax as he lazily laid down, staring at the window longingly... one month confined in that room... no outside world, no pranking, nothing. Just him, Celebi, books...

"I'm back~"

Zorua perked up as he watched a certain green fairy walk inside of the room, closing the door behind her and locking it. She was holding a red book beneath her arm, Zorua noted.

Celebi turned around to give her tiny prisone- guest a smile.

She felt guilty for causing him to suffer... if she never shrunk him down, she would have never broken his paw, and he would be still free... free to pull pranks... maybe it was better like-

Celebi shook her head. She couldn't think that Zorua suffering was good!

"I did it as fast as I could!" she said, masking her internal conflict behind a cheerful smile.

"... I noticed." Zorua said, not quite sure if he should feel relieved of having some company or frightened that such company was Celebi.

The giant fairy gently set the red book in front of him. He didn't even bother to read the title - the Dusknoir painted on the cover told him enough.

"I don't usually read this stuff, so I kinda grabbed the first one I saw..." Celebi admits as she grabs her own book, before opening Zorua's.

She smiled.
"Whenever you need to flip the page, or if you need a better visual, just tell me." she says cheerfully... although unable to shake off the feeling that Zorua wasn't exactly feeling better about the whole thing.

Celebi shrugged, laid belly down next to Zorua and started to read her book, while Zorua simply pretended to watch the figures, thinking.

Celebi... she was trying to make him feel better... she had taken care of him...

But she had also caused him all of this over a dumb prank.

The tiny fox felt conflicted. He didn't know what to do, one part of him wanted to move on, forgive Celebi... The other told him to stay away from the fairy whenever her got his size again.

He couldn't really decide...

"You've been reading that page for fifteen minutes." the fairy interrupted his train of thought.

"Hm?"

Celebi sighed as she closed her book. Gently, she leaned over Zorua and reached out for him.

The fox felt the bed beneath him receding as he was brought up in the air... and then, warmth, pressure, green.

Celebi hugged him.

"Zorua..." the fairy said dejectedly.
"I'm... truly sorry about what happened... I didn't mean this all to happen, it was an accident..." she told.

Zorua remained silent.

"I... I want to make it up to you Zorua... but I don't know how... I'm keeping you this size so I can take care of you, I don't mean you any harm."

Zorua still didn't speak, but gave a sigh as he looked up.

His world suddenly shook as Celebi laid back on the bed, keeping the fox firmly pinned to her chest.

"But Zorua... I'm sorry, but you'll have to stay here for a month, two, whenever your paw heals, you're free to go... but... I don't want you and me to go on like this," she said slowly, fully obtaining his attention.

She smiled meekly.
"So... I say, let's just start over, me and you..." she said, before explaining,
"This... this doesn't undo what you did, and doesn't undo what I did... but I guess your pranks, and my actions, they cancel each other. So..."

Her eyes glowed. Zorua closed his, expecting Celebi to shrink him even more... but nothing happened.

Instead, Celebi psychically lifted a black book from her desk and hovered it over a trash can, before dropping her psychic grip.

Her log book unceremoniously fell on the bottom of the trash can, landing with a thud.

Zorua opened his eyes again, noticing the kind ones of Celebi staring at him.
"You've paid enough. We can forget each other's actions... and this could be actually nice... we could be..." she smiled sweetly.
"... Friends."
122332222213321111221211.title: Celebi - friend or foe?

choices: Later that night...
As the days pass...
1223322222133211112212111.content:
Zorua considered the past few days. The image of Celebi in feathers and berries, the image of her as...a violent goddess before him, the flash of pain when his leg first broke and his desperation, and her immediate remorse after.

And there was him not wanting to be alone right? And her comforting him and holding him on that first night when he slept. After that things had settled into this routine but...she had cared for him, comforted him and reassured him in a moment of emotional weakness right? And she healed him after almost killing him on accident, she was dedicated to making it right.

"Sorry...for pranks...sorry for pranking you...I won't again...anymore to anyone..." He mumbled. "This might...the friend thing...it might work. I want to be friends..." He said, kind of embarrassed by the whole thing, he leaned into her chest, trying to hug her with his tiny body. But even in the boredom, beyond the pain in his leg and the fear in the presence of a being...so much larger than him...a friend sounded nice. He hadn't had one before. He felt a paw lift off of him as she stroked his head a bit.

"I'm glad Zorua...I am. And don't worry about a thing okay? Your forepaw will heal up soon enough, and then you can go home." She said, reassuring him.

'Home huh...' He thought. He didn't really have one...but he didn't want to let her know that.

"Thank you." He finally said before she sat up.

"Now...do you want to read your comic?" She asked and he nodded. "Yeah, I think I do Celebi." He said, giving a small smile.

-

Things seemed to be going smoother now between him and Celebi at least, for after that conversation Zorua thought. He had been enjoying his comic, even if he knew Celebi didn't appreciate the imagery of it. Though he noted Celebi was asking Zorua to tell her more about himself and he didn't want to tell her that sorry story. She had gone to go eat dinner with her mom and he was left there to relax on her bed. He laid back and considered the fact that for at least a month, if not more he had to adjust to this existence. He supposed it could be a whole lot worse...
1223322222133211112212111.title: Friends

choices: "Celebi...can I tell you something...about my dad?"
"...It's nothing to worry about."
12233222221332111122121111.content:
Zorua's thoughts were interrupted as Celebi opened the door and sighed as she shut it. "Sorry about the wait Zorua..." She said as she handed him a small berry. He started to eat it slowly and she smiled down at him. "We didn't really have much of a dinner, but I figured you'd appreciate a berry. My mom just mostly wanted to talk to me about spending more time outdoors or with my friends...though honestly I don't know who she's talking about..." Celebi muttered. Most of her friends were gone for the summer, or busy with other things.

"Hmm." Zorua said in between bites. He really didn't have much of an answer to offer her. She slowly picked up the book she had been reading and opened it to where she left off as he quietly ate.

"Your leg doing okay right now?" Celebi asked for what must have been the millionth time. He turned to look at the giantess. "It's...the same, sore but manageable. Still hurts to move..." He answered for the millionth time. She gave a small smile. "It'll get there." He nodded.

Celebi bit her lip, this was something she had been avoiding asking him but...

"So...there hasn't been any commotion about you being gone Zorua." She said and he nodded. He didn't figure there would be.

"When you're healed and you go home...will anyone ask about you, do you think?" Celebi said and Zorua sighed.

"I doubt it." He said.

"...Zorua? If you don't want to talk about it it's fine but...aside from the pranks...what did you do? What are your parents like?" Zorua closed his eyes. This was coming up sooner than he had expected.
12233222221332111122121111.title: Asking questions

choices: "... you can stay here, Zorua." Cele offered
"... I'll help you finding a home." Celebi offered
122332222213321111221211111.content:
"C-Celi..." Zorua meekly stuttered as he fidgeted on top of her bed, nervous.

He knew she would have asked! He just damn knew!

Celebi seemed to feel his nervousness, but kept quiet, waiting for the little fox to speak.

Zorua sighed.
"I'll... Can I tell ya something?" he asked, and the giant fairy nodded her head.

Zorua sat down, mentally preparing for his speech.

"My parents... parent..." he said.
"I never knew my mom... And I grew up with dad... it was horrible..."

"Well, that's... horrible!" Celebi exclaimed as she laid down, folding her arms under her head as she faced the tiny Zorua.

"No... it wasn't because of my mom... but my father was... He-" Zorua gritted his teeth - just having to talk about him made him seethe.

"... He was a true jerk."

Celebi looked at the tiny fox in confusion.

His father was...?

"Zorua, maybe your dad didn't understand you, or you didn't understand him, or maybe you two were distant, but I don't think-"

"He was Celi!" Zorua interrupted.
"He was a jerk! Constantly telling me to ‘Hurry up and evolve’ because I couldn't hunt like him, steal like him, be like him! I hated him! He made my mom run away!" Zorua shouted, and Celebi looked at the door alarmed, afraid that Zorua's screams might draw her mom's attention.

She looked back at him.
"Keep it down..." she said.

Zorua sighed deeply.

"... He made me run away." Zorua admitted, and Celebi's mouth hung open.

"Wha-What do you mean?" she asked, and he lowered his head, looking at the bed intently.

"... One night... I ended it one night." Zorua recalled, his voice lowering to a whisper.
"He went hunting... after humiliating me again... but he found a surprise when he got back to our cave... I was gone."

Zorua paused to look at Celebi, who was looking in silence, too shocked to talk.

"I ran Celi. Ran, without caring where I was going. Everyplace was better than that cave. I stopped when I reached the woods around the village... and made them my home, my hideout. I became Zorua, the infamous scoundrel of this village!" he suddenly perked up with pride.

However, Celebi didn't listen to the last sentence.

"W-Wait, the woods are your home? So that means-" a sigh from Zorua interrupted her.

She looked down, he was nodding.

"Yup... I'm homeless Celi." he told, having decided that there was no point hiding that.

Celebi stared at the tiny fox for a moment, before reaching out for him.

Her paws grabbed him, and she hugged the dark type fox to her chest.

"Z-Zorua... I had no idea..." she admitted, suddenly feeling ashamed.
"If I only knew sooner... I would have helped you instead of... of this!" she cried, pointing to him. Zorua deducted that she was talking about his diminished size and injured leg.

He huffed.
"Please. Whoever cares about me and the sad story of my family?" he asked rhetorically.

Celebi perked up.
"I do Zorua!" she said, causing him to look at her.
"And tell you what, you don't have to worry about a home." she said.

"Never did... why anyway?" the dark type asked, curious.

"Because..."
122332222213321111221211111.title: Tragic family story

choices: "You're a weirdo Celebi." He says before taking off.
"...Yeah, sure. Fine." He says, at least willing to try it.
12233222221332112.content:
A few days had passed since then and Celebi restored Zorua to his normal height. He did apologize for the prank but Celebi honestly found it hard to be mad at him at all anymore. If anything, for every one time he apologized she apologized ten times over. All the same he said he'd lay off and so far had kept his word. Things had been more or less quiet in the village. While walking through the forest in the same area she had been moving the days prior, head sunk in a book not paying much attention she heard a snore coming from the brush. "What the, who's sleeping out-" She looked to see Zorua curled up in a nap. "Huh...what's he doing out here?" Come to think of it, Celebi didn't recall seeing Zorua really interact with anyone outside of his pranking nature. Probably why no one had seen him much. Actually...where does he even live? Celebi caught herself going down a rabbit hole of thought before a loud snore snapped her out of it.

"Jeez, loud much?"She smirked a bit at him and decided to sit next to him and keep reading. She was curious about him, and wanted to bury the hatchet a bit more with him anyway, so she'd wait for him to wake up. After about an hour, when dusk started to creep in he started murmuring, Celebi shut her book and waited for him to find his senses. "W-Celebi...?" He muttered groggily. "What are you doing out here?" "I could ask you the same thing. Isn't the ground hard to sleep on?" She asked. He avoided her gaze at this. "Ah...you know, i'm used to it by now. Rough and tumble, that's me!" He said, sounding far more chipper than she believed. "Zorua...where do you even live? Thinking on it I don't recall ever seeing your house." He said nothing for a moment before returning with a big toothy grin that looked obviously forced. "Heh, here, there, everywhere! The world is my oyster, no domicile could contain my natural awesome spunk!" "That's not an answer." She said flatly, now sure that Zorua was homeless. "Why don't you go see Wigglytuff? You know he loves putting up young Pokemon without a home." She said before Zorua got defensive. "What? That guy. No way, like I said, no domicile can contain me!...Besides, he wouldn't have me, pulled one to many stunts on him and young Swinub. He's pretty defensive of him...that's my mistake to live with though." He smiled a bit sadly before doing an exaggerated stretch. "But y'know, gotta keep on keeping on, see you around Cele-" "Why don't you come with me?" She said, not believing that she blurted it out. He stopped in his tracks. "Yeah, sure, like your mom would TOTALLY go for a male Pokemon around your age crashing at-" "It isn't like she'd know, because you'd be...well...y'know." She meekly started before putting her book down and putting her hands close together to indicate a small size. "OH no! No nononono! Are you NUTS!? You think i'd agree to THAT crap again!?" Zorua lost his composure at that point and Celebi could hardly blame him, but she kept going. "I wouldn't do the microscopic thing again...or the pebble size...it'd be...like when you woke up after I healed you, y'know. It'd be a roof, and you wouldn't be lonely...and if you don't like it you can back out at any time and i'll change you back" She said. She really was starting to get a better picture of what Zorua really was at this point, and she wanted to help him. Zorua for his part though was completely baffled by the offer. The pillow the other night was nice...and Celebi was nice too but...did he really want to give up his size for a home? He couldn't even believe he was considering this offer after the previous disaster, yet here he was. He looked down at his left paw and kicked some dirt before clicking his tongue.
12233222221332112.title: Awkward understanding and an offer

choices: Things went smoothly for the night
Something unexpected happened
122332222213321122.content:
"I'll...take your offer...." Zorua says as he tries to not look at Celebi, kind of blushing about the idea. Celebi gives a graceful smile as she stands up, "wait, where excatly will i sleep, because you're not exactly the type that plays with doll." Zorua says as he remembers that Celebi is more of a book worm than anything, so she really doesn't have any toys.

"Well i was thinking of giving you a basket to sleep in, but then i realizes that if my mother was to sneak in, she would question it a lot if she sees you. So you're going have to sleep next to me and pretend to be a pokedoll." Celebi says, not exactly comfortable of the idea as it feels a tad bit weird, but its the only option she can think of without her mother suspecting.

"......" Zorua didn't say anything, making Celebi wonder what's he thinking. "One condition." Zorua says abruptly, making Celebi wonder what exactly he wants. "You don't treat me like a poke doll." Celebi was rather confuse as to why Zorua made such a weird request.

"Ok, i will agree but why do you....?" Celebi stop to think of things that other pokemons uses poke dolls for. From playing with them, dressing them to cuddl..... Celebi couldn't help but laugh at the reason she could guess, "are you that embarrass that i might treat you as a poke doll that i will snuggle you in your sleep?"

"No...." Zorua say as he try to think of a excuse.

"Fine fine, don't worry. I'll try to not treat you like a doll." I'm so going to treat him like a doll, Celebi thoughts to herself. Celebi gives off a familiar smile to Zorua that made him kind of nervous.

"I'm doom..." He says quietly to himself.

"Well anyways, are you ready?" Celebi ask as she waits for Zorua's permission. Understandably nervous about being shrunk again, Zorua nods his head. "Ok, stay still." Celebi says as she close her eyes and a green glow forms around Zorua. He watch as the world grew bigger around him till he stop shrinking at the size Celebi promise. Celebi opens her eyes and smiles as she did the shrinking move without going overboard. "Ok, let's head home....but first..." Zorua was wondering what Celebi was up to and quickly got nervous as he can guess what she is going to do. Celebi nuzzles Zorua, and she actually enjoys the feeling. "Wow, never realizes how soft you're fur is." Celebi say.

"Hey you promise." Zorua says as he struggle to push Celebi's face of her.

"I said i would try, and i did try." Celebi says as she continues to nuzzle Zorua. "Ok, now let's go." Celebi says as she heads home with Zorua wrap around her arms. Zorua tries to look up at Celebi without her noticing as he nuzzle a little bit in Celebi's embrace.

"I hope this idea goes well..." Zorua says queitly to himself.
122332222213321122.title: A small start of a nice friendship

choices: "Let's read a book together"
"I've got some board games we can play"
"Let's do something physical...not dangerous of course"
1223322222133211221.content:
Zorua couldn't see the giant fairy's face, but she was certainly smiling with the book under her arm, and the tiny dark pokemon hugged to her chest, she was sure things would work out fine. 'This is...weirdly nice' Zorua thought. He felt warmth and softness all around him from her paws and her belly...almost lulling him back to sleep before she reached her home. "We're here...don't move in case my Mom is home." Celebi said. Zorua concentrated a bit before Celebi looked down to see that Zorua looked...exactly like a stuffed plush pokedoll. Still a Zorua, but definitely lifeless. 'right...his illusions....good thinking Zorua!'She mentally praised him before heading in.

Celebi walked over to the table only to see a note and a small plate of meats, celery, cheeses and crackers on the table. "Had to work early tonight, won't be home until after your bed time. Sorry, I got you your favorite study snack! There's dinner in the fridge if you're still hungry. - Mom" Celebi smiled a bit. Tonight that worked out pretty well at least for her and Zorua. "It's fine, my mom won't be home for a bit Zorua." With that he instantly changed back and sighed a bit before she gently changed her position that he was balancing himself on her two paws. "W-whoa, Celi, what are you-" Her giant head nuzzled his entire body down into her paws. "Dang it Celebi, I know you think this is funny!" He groaned before she removed her head, giving him a stupid grin and she gripped him with one paw and started rubbing at his belly with her free hand. This tickled relentlessly "D-heh-da-hahaha-st-heh-stop ithahaha!" Zorua couldn't help it and soon Celebi was starting to laugh. She stopped and set him on the table. "You're not going to stop messing with me, are you?" He said. "You know, coming from you Zorua, that statement is comical in and of itself...and no, I won't." She smiled before sliding a cracker, meat slice, and cheese slice towards him. "Here, you must be hungry." She said before she herself grabbed a piece of celery and started munching. He was about to answer before his belly groaned and he felt his cheeks flare up, Celebi just gave him a bemused look before he wordlessly tore into the meat slice. He managed to get about 3/4 of the way through it before he started to feel filled up...it'd be easy to eat at this size, that's for sure. he sat back before Celebi set a tiny glass of water down in front of him. "You need to drink too." She said simply as she made herself a meat and cheese cracker sandwich. He had to reach up with his paws to be able to access the water, but he drank hungrily at it too. Man it felt good to have a full belly. Celebi noticed how eager he was and thought to herself 'Geez...how hungry and thirsty was he?' She didn't comment though, if only for his pride.

"Thanks Celebi." He sighed when he was done. "Yeah, uh...no problem Zorua." She said, starting to pack up the plate to put in the fridge. She might eat dinner later, but right now she was focused on the little dark fox pokemon and settling in with him. "So...what are we gonna do?" Zorua asked, curious. Before she smiled back at him, and went back to pick him up.
1223322222133211221.title: Things went smoothly for the night

choices: Celebi putting away her book, ready to go to sleep...
Celebi already asleep... and her mother entering her room...
12233222221332112211.content:
"Simple really," Celebi quietly says as she hovers through her deserted house, holding the tiny Zorua in one paw.

The small fox was doing everything in his power to not look down.

Eventually, Celebi pushes a door open and enters a room Zorua appears to recognize: the fairy's bedroom.

Zorua silently examines his surroundings.

Sure, he's been in Celebi's room a few days ago but, with a nanoscopic size and a broken forepaw, he didn't have much time to think about it.

Celebi's room was nothing out of ordinary. A desk, her bed and, most importantly - books. Books, scattered all over the place.

Nothing out of the ordinary... except that everything was huge compared to Zorua.

"Like it?" Celebi suddenly asks, interrupting his observation.

The fairy gives a giggle.
"I sure hope so, my little guest. Because, we are going to share this room~" she sings cheerfully, causing Zorua to flush red.

"It's... nice..." he mumbled in response while Celebi hovered over her bed, gently placing Zorua down on her pillow.

"So? What do we do now?" Zorua repeats his previous question as he sits down onto the soft, white field beneath him.

In response, Celebi gives him a smile, before floating over her desk, grabbing a book from it.
"I'll let you guess." she says, hovering back to the bed.

Zorua assumes a somewhat worried expression.
"Oh no..."

Celebi giggles.
"Oh yes~"

--

Zorua's suppositions turned out to be quite true.

Now, he has to fight between the embarrassment of sitting onto Celebi's lap while the fairy read her book and the boredom of having to watch her reading in complete silence.

‘Just try, you'll like it’

That was what Celebi told him when she suggested him reading with her. The legendary is currently holding her book in front of him, so that she could read while also allowing Zorua to read as well.

Bored, Zorua made an effort and tried reading a few lines.

And, from what he could understand, Celebi was reading some kind of novel about some guy traveling all over the world, searching for hidden treasures.

"Seriously, is THIS how you spend time alone?" Zorua asks the fairy while looking up.

"Yup," Celebi responds, not even looking down at him.
"You should get used to it. You know, with you living here and all..." she remarks with an hint of cheerfulness.

Not sure about how to respond, Zorua opts to remain quiet instead as his gaze travels back to the book. He tried reading yet again, but it was like his mind refused to memorize any word.

Bored, Zorua gives a small yawn. Then, he finds his vision starting to become blurry, his eyelids heavy, his breath slow...

...

A small, almost imperceptible noise coming from below draws Celebi's attention.

The fairy looks down, noticing that Zorua fell asleep onto her lap.

"Aw... you fell asleep..." she whispers, gently picking up the small fox.

She grins.
"He can't complain if he is clueless~" she sings, pushing her head into his body as she nuzzles him.

While doing so, she wonders how life could change in a matter of days.

When she first shrunk Zorua down to size, the thought of even caressing didn't even enter her mind. And now, there she was, housing the small fox.

Celebi grinned.
"Oh, my little roommate, this is going to be fun~"

--

Zorua eyes open as a noise resounds around.

He drowsily glances around, noticing that he's still in Celebi's room, on her bed...

"This... This isn't... Where am I?" Zorua asks himself, confused upon noticing that he wasn't in the forest anymore.

Memories of earlier penetrate the fox's mind, and he quickly recalls that Celebi was actually letting him stay at her home... he also recalls that she had to shrink him again, and that he'll be staying shrunken for the whole time he spent with Celebi...

"That wasn't a dream..." he mumbles, not knowing if to be relieved or scared.

Then, Zorua hears the noise that woke him up again.

Startled, the tiny fox looked around, only to notice...
12233222221332112211.title: Reading with the fairy

choices: The next morning
During the night...
122332222213321122111.content:
Zorua looked around, noting Celebi busily closing her book, before putting it back on her desk.
"And now bed~" she sang cheerfully while turning around.

Only to notice Zorua, eyes wide open, staring at her.

"Oh... did I wake you up?" she asks.
"No... Kinda?" Zorua replies sheepishly, making Celebi smile.

"Well... I've already eaten dinner. But I suppose you'd be fine if I brought you something to eat?" she asks.

Zorua's stomach growls in that exact moment. He blushes as he eyes her.
"Apparently no." he awkwardly responds.

Celebi laughs a bit as she heads for the door.
"Be right back, you Munchlax~" she says, making Zorua blush even more.

Funny thing. He actually DID pull a prank on Munchlax. He crafted a track of illusionary food on the ground, and he was dumb enough to follow it until he fell into a-

"I'm back~" Celebi interrupts his train of thought as she enters the room again, holding an oran berry.

"I think this'll be enough to fill you up..." she says, gently putting the berry in front of Zorua, whose stomach growls again in agreement.

The small fox starts biting into the berry.

--

Zorua gives a satisfied sigh, his belly filled. He ate three quarters of the berry, which to him was a feast.

Celebi smiles down at him.
"Wow, you sure were hungry!" she exclaims cheerfully, grabbing the remains of the berry and throwing it in her mouth, gulping it down before looking at Zorua again.

She got a smirk on her face.
"Now Zorua..." she says, laying down on her bed while picking the fox in her paw in the process.

The fairy starts snickering.
"Bedtime~" she sings, blushing.

Zorua blushes too.
"But I just woke up!" he protests.
"Not my problem~" Celebi responds, lifting her bedsheets and slowly sliding beneath them, pulling Zorua in a hug.

"Ca-Can't I sleep on your pillow... or better - the floor! Yeah, I'd be definitely fine there..." he says, embarrassed.

Although he couldn't deny - the warmth of the bed and of Celebi herself were quite nice...

Celebi giggles as the lights are psychically switched off.
"Hmm~ nope~" she responds, cuddling Zorua further.

"Good night, little roomie, sleep well." she chimes, leaning down to nuzzle Zorua, whose face is now as red as a red pepper.

"Celebi! You promised!" he shouts.

"In fact, I've tried really hard. Guess I simply couldn't resist~" she responds, before closi her eyes, her head resting against Zorua's small body.

Zorua sighs in embarrassment as he leans his head against Celebi's chest.

This all felt... oddly nice. Her chest was warm, his surroundings soft and the beats of her heart made a soothing rhythm.

Yawning, the small fox closes his eyes, hoping that sleep would come soon to take him away from this embarrassing situation.

The most infamous scoundrel around... cuddled by a fairy like a common toy.

Luckily, sleep DOES come rather quickly as Celebi, the bed and the bedroom fade.

Zorua falls asleep.
122332222213321122111.title: A night with the fairy

choices: Zorua decides to get up and explore
Celebi's door started to open, Celebi' mother is checking in on her daughter
Celebi seems to be doing something in her sleep
1223322222133211221112.content:
Hours has past since the two pokemon has slept, the two seem to be enjoying each others company. However, the moment was kind of interrupted by Zorua once he woke up. He's look around confuse untik he remember that he was sleeping on Celebi. He blush when he saw her sleeping face in front of him.

"Right....Celi..." Zorua says nervously as he digs his face into her chest. The small fox felt weird when he looks around to see Celebi's room is massive again. Just days ago he was practically nothung while almost being getting killed. Now here he is as a small toy size fox in the hands of the girl that shrunk him. He stares back at the sleeping very as he tries to go back to sleep.

Unfortantly, the fox seem to had slept enough that its kind of hard to go back to sleep. He would close his eyes, but he still appears to be awake. Zorua sighs as he figures this might take a while to go to sleep.

After a while....
1223322222133211221112.title: Can't sleep

choices: ... Celebi wide awake, staring straight at him with a smirk...
... Celebi still sleeping, readjusting in her sleep...
12233222221332112211121.content:
Zorua huffed as his eyes opened again. Why was it so hard to go back to sleep? He was a heavy sleeper too!

Sighing, he looked forward at the wall of green he was being pressed against.

The surface of Celebi's chest rose and fell as she inhaled and exhaled, the beats of her heart were the only noise that broke the quietness of the night, although only Zorua was able to hear them because of his diminished size and current position.

However, the tiny dark type soon grew tired of just laying there and decided to wiggle out of the grasp of the fairy. Carefully to not awaken her, he started wiggling to slide out of Celebi's grasp.

Luckily, he managed to shift his location from her grasp to the top of her bed. The fox gave a sigh upon noting that the green fairy was still asleep.

Zorua looked around the dark room. He could do nothing but explore around for a bit, he figured.

He moved to the edge of the bed and looked down - it was quite the fall...

Zorua looked at his own paws and grinned as he grasped the bedsheets, using them to slide down the bed and leap onto the floor unharmed.

Then, Zorua looked around, trying to find something that would catch his interest.

The bookshelf - boring, told his mind.

The closet - he would have to open the doors, impossible at his current size...

The desk... he would have to climb... but maybe there was something worth looking for on the top, he figured as he slowly walked up to the desk.

He looked at the wooden surface, trying to figure how to climb up the big, big desk. Slowly, Zorua approached the wood, standing on his hind legs and leaning against the desk, before gripping the desk with his teeth.

Immediately, the taste of wood assaulted his tongue, the hard surface menacing to shatter his teeth. But Zorua started climbing anyway.

He found the task ahead harder than he anticipated, he discovered: he couldn't breathe properly due having his mouth full of wood, he was starting to feel tired and he couldn't really shake off the thought that he could fall to his death at some point...

But Zorua kept ascending, until finally he was standing on top of the desk.

The dark type gave a triumphant sigh as he panted, before looking around. Being a dark type, he could see through the darkness quite well, and managed to spot the several objects on top of the desk.

A giant pen, a picture of Celebi and her mom and a book.

Zorua looked at the book and moved closer.
"I can't believe I almost died on one of these... if it wasn't for Celebi..." he said lowly, shivering at the thought as he slid a paw over the surprisingly thin, small book... although it was still very large to him.

He looked at the top of the book, curious about what it was about... only to find that this wasn't any book.

‘Diary’ Zorua read.

"Diary? Celebi has a diary?" he asked himself. The fairy's shown him a log book where she had written all of his pranks... but she never mentioned a diary...

Curious, Zorua glanced back at the bed.

Celebi was still asleep. He could explore her most intimate thoughts freely... it was too tempting to let go, the fox thought with a grin. He could read in darkness too, so there was no problem... it wasn't like Celebi was going to know it after all...

Quietly, Zorua tried to lift the boom cover with his paws. Surprisingly enough, he managed to lift it quite easily, flipping to the latest pages.

Curious, the fox started reading a random page,

‘Dear diary,
I did it! I finally managed to fully develop my shrinking ability thanks to the Minimize TM Gardevoir gave me! I'm so excited, I can't wait to test it on something!
Celi.’


"So this was when she created that shrinking ability, huh?" Zorua asked, curious as he flipped to the next page.

‘Dear diary,
That jerk Zorua! He crossed the line! He pulled one of his pranks on me, covered me in Pidove's feathers, honey and who knows what else!... But the little prankster got what he deserved. He was my first test subject for my shrinking ability, it was a success - Zorua wasn't smaller than a pebble! I'm going to make him regret ever starting pranking!
Celi.’


"She used me as a lab rat?!" Zorua exclaimed, shocked.

What if the shrinking didn't work properly?! He could have died!... Well, even when it actually DID work, Zorua could have died anyway...

"She must have written this while I was unconscious..." he mumbled to himself.

Too curious, the dark type flipped another page.

‘Dear diary,
I took Zorua's punishment too far. It was an accident! I was startled, and he flew from my hand... Luckily, I managed to locate him... Blood. His leg was broken, he was suffering... I felt horrible... I was even thinking of ending his suffering!... Luckily, I managed to heal him and fix his leg. Now he's currently asleep... I'll keep him under my care for a few days before sending him back home.
Celi.’


Zorua was pale.

Celebi wanted to put him out of his misery... she wanted to kill him!

"Arceus..." he mumbled, his heart pounding his chest and his mind screaming him to close the diary and get back to bed, catch some sleep and forget whatever he read.

But he didn't listen to his own mind.

His paw moved on its own as he flipped another page.

The next few pages talked about the days he spent under her care, then how she grew him back up and sent him home.

Until his eyes landed on top of the last written page.

Zorua began reading,

‘Dear diary,
something odd happened today. I was reading while taking a stroll in the forest, when I heard someone snoring. It was Zorua! I found him sleeping on the ground... he looked so innocent like that! I waited for him to wake up, asked for an explanation... and it turned out he's homeless! I felt bad, so I offered him the unexpected: to come living with me! He'll have to be tiny though, so that he can avoid mom... thanks to his illusions, he can simply pretend to be a pokedoll! It'll be perfect! I sure hope this works - he's really nice when you know him... and cute when he's at such tiny size... I'd be lying if I said that I didn't grow to like him!
Celi.’


Zorua looked up, feeling dazed.

Celebi... Celebi's grown to like him...? When did she even write this thing...?

"Must have been while I slept..." he figured.

The rest of the pages were comprehensibly blank - the last page was about today.

So Zorua quietly closed the book and yawned, deciding that he had enough...

A noise caught his ears. It came from behind him, Zorua noted.

Slowly, the tiny fox turned around to see...
12233222221332112211121.title: Celebi's secret

choices: "... I think this'll be wonderful Zorua~" Celebi chimed
"... Oh... I-I'm sorry... this was a mistake..." Celebi said
122332222213321122111211.content:
Through the darkness of the room, Celebi's blue eyes shined mischievously, a smirk painted on her face.

She was staring at him.

She saw him reading her diary!

"Celebi..." Zorua attempts to speak, but is suddenly lifted off the desk and floats across the dark room, pulled by a psychic grip.

The fox lands on his original place on the bed, in front of the smirking face of Celebi.

"So... nighttime exploration, huh? Reading a girl's private thoughts isn't exactly nice, Zorua," she playfully scolds.

"Celi, I'm sorry and-"

Celebi rises a paw, interrupting Zorua's apology.

"Tell me - what did you read?" she asks gently, her paw falling back in place.

A thought springs up in Zorua's mind.

"Y-You used me as a lab rat! You wanted to kill me!" he cried, suddenly wishing to get away from the giantess, who simply giggled.
"You asked for it, and I didn't kill you. What else?" she asks.

Zorua thinks for a moment.

"Well... the days you spent taking care of me... the part when you learned to shrink things... you..." he stops to blush. Celebi's smirk widened.
"Y-You've written... you like me... you think I'm cute like this..."

Celebi nodded and started giggling.

"W-Why...? I mean... you wanted to punish me... why did you...?" Zorua asks.

Celebi smiles brightly.

Silently, the fairy psychically lifts her diary from the desk, the object levitating across the room and into her paws.

"Look." she said, flipping through a few pages.

Zorua notices something - one page was torn from the diary.
"... A page's missing..." he points out, and Celebi nods.

Carefully, the green fairy gets up from the bed, causing it to shake beneath Zorua as she walks across the room to reach her desk.

Celebi opens a drawer, grabs something and heads back to the bed, sitting next to Zorua, showing him a folded sheet.

"... The missing page?" he guessed, and Celebi nodded.

"Since you've read my diary already... I suppose you should know all of it now..." she says, unfolding the sheet and placing it in front of Zorua.

The dark fox looks at the fairy giantess, trying to understand if she's angry or not, but in the end decides to do as she asked.

The fox began reading.

‘Dear diary,
there he was, stealing ice cream from poor Pichu. Zorua can be a true jerk at times, he ripped Azurill's favourite doll apart! I've wondered for quite some time now - why does he do all that? I'm sure that Zorua isn't what he appears to be. Under those pranks, that smug smile, I'm sure there's a kind heart somewhere... Maybe, he had a troubled past, I don't know. I only wish I could get to know him better, I'd help him somehow... too bad that can't be. I've avoided his pranks so far, and I fear than any attempt to get closer to him might end poorly... still, I do think that Zorua can be nice... he only needs a little help.
Celi.’


The fox looks up from the page, blushing furiously.

"Zorua~" her voice pierced the silence.

And then, it happened.

A giant pair of lips fell on Zorua's forehead as Celebi kissed him. The fox looked up, she had closed her eyes and a blush spread across her cheeks as she kissed the small dark type for a whole, eternal, wonderful minute.

Zorua didn't know what to feel. He didn't know what to think, his mind was in a state of total confusion. Time seemed to stand still.

Hell and heaven were swirling inside his head while his body burned... but it was a pleasant warmth spreading through his whole body.

"Celi..." he murmured to himself, unable to believe this. The same girl that wanted to punish him, the same girl that almost killed him because of a stupid prank... she wrote an entire page on her diary about him, telling that she actually believed he wasn't a jerk!

Time seemed to unlock as Celebi finally pulled off, blushing furiously, but wearing a smile upon her face.
"Zorua~" she told... before realizing what she just did.

Her eyes shot open as she looked down at the tiny fox, staring at him for a while. Zorua stared right back at her, blushing furiously too.

None of the two embarassed pokemon spoke for a while.

But then, Celebi finally broke the quiet.
122332222213321122111211.title: The missing page

choices: "I... I think... It could work..."
"Celi... I-I... I don't think I feel the same way..."
1223322222133211221112111.content:
She had winked at other guys; she had blown playful kisses; she had hugged countless pokemon.

But she never had feelings for anyone... until now.

This was serious, Celebi just kissed Zorua, a local delinquent known for the cruelty of his pranks!

... But, he apparently stopped with those... she... she had developed feelings for Zorua? Celebi dug deep in her heart... discovering that she actually DID hold feelings for the fox!

Time seemed to stand still as the fairy held Zorua in front of her face; they stared at each other in silence, cheeks flared up, like two blushing Gothita busy in a staring contest.

Zorua didn't know what to think.

Celebi just kissed him, what did that mean? Was she just being playful? Or was she in love with him? He didn't love her!

Or did he...?

He-

Time finally resumed when Celebi's lips shook a bit, before they upturned in a smile.

"Oh, Zorua~" she sang, leaning forward. For the second time in the same night, Zorua found Celebi kissing him.

She pulled back, blushing but smiling brightly.

"This'll be wonderful~" she whispered, careful to not wake the pink Celebi who was her mother in the other room, sleeping.

If her mom knew she had ZORUA as a boyfriend-

"W-What will be wonderful?" Zorua questioned, fidgeting nervously. He knew where this was going, but he wanted to make sure.

Celebi giggled.

"Us, silly!" she beamed.

Zorua inhaled sharply.

"Celi," he started, feeling like his legs had fallen asleep as she held him.
"... I appreciate what you've done for me, I really do, but there's no ‘us’..." seriously, this was his first night here... the scoundrel's charm, he guessed... or the fact that she actually wrote that she thought he was cute like that, tiny and helpless...

For a moment, the fairy blinked, taken aback by Zorua's words, before she smiled again.

"Sure there is, Zorua~," she said cheerfully,
"But we'll talk tomorrow... for now..."

Again, Zorua was pushed into her greedy lips, which smooched him a few times before the giant fairy hugged him to her chest.

"Good night cutie~"

Zorua's world shook, the torn page was blown off the bed by the impact of her body with the bed.

"C-Celi..." Zorua tried to talk, but a sudden wave of warmth fell all around him as Celebi dropped a blanket upon him and onto her body.

The fox was trapped.

He tried to break free, but Celebi's paws were too strong.

And, in a matter of minutes, she was asleep, he could tell by her soft snoring and by her belly rising and falling along with her breath.

All of a sudden, this seemed like a nightmare to Zorua... or, to say the least, a very embarrassing dream.

Celebi was in love with him!

The same girl that shrunk him to this pitiful size, the same girl that almost killed him, the same girl that wanted to kill him... was now admitting that she had feelings for him?

She didn't even need to talk, she had said enough by kissing him...

But what did that even imply?! He didn't love her, he wasn't even sure he could consider her a friend after what she did to him!

But... Celebi had welcomed him into her house with open paws, she had given him a home, and she was probably the only one pokemon that loved him.

His pranks had caused the whole village hate him, Celebi too hated him but now...

Zorua felt the heat around him, but ignored it.

His heart pounded his chest, his head was pulsing; he felt a lingering pain in his head, which was occupied by too many thoughts...

Enough.

To avoid his poor head a pitiful fate, he decided to sleep on it for now. Celebi mentioned they were going to talk in the morning, it was fine to him.

The dark-type closed his eyes, falling asleep almost immediately, sliding into a sweet, dreamless sleep.

--

"Zorua~ wakey wakey~..."

The fox grunted as he turned in his sleep, relegating his consciousness back into the depths of his mind.

"Come on cutie, we have a wonderful day ahead of us~," something started shaking him.

"Mh..." he groaned, readjusting.

But his feeble barrier of sleep was penetrated and shattered by a pair of lips pressing into the side of his body.

His eyes shot open; at the same time, Celebi pulled back, smiling at him.

"Good morning~," she sang cheerfully.

"... Mornin'..."

The fairy started walking, carrying Zorua out of her bedroom and into the kitchen, where meat, eggs and a single glass of juice rested on the table, suggesting what Celebi had been doing while Zorua slept.

The green fairy sat down, placing Zorua on a napkin in front of her.

She cut some meat and eggs with a knife and placed them in front of her soon-to-be boyfriend... because, one way or another, Zorua was going to be hers.

She knew, Zorua had feelings for her somewhere deep inside him... and she wasn't accepting a ‘no’ anyway. She never had a boyfriend - an overprotective mother with time-traveling abilities and enough power to blow away things with a glance wasn't an advantage from this perspective - and she wasn't letting this opportunity go.

Zorua and Celebi ate in silence.

Until, she finally broke it,

"So... about last night..." she started.

Zorua sighed: this was the time.

"Celebi..." he said, pulling away form his meat,
"... Listen, you don't love me, okay? It's just-" her paw rose, interrupting him.

Celebi sighed.

"Zorua, I kissed you, like, six times and you still think I don't have feelings for you? That's extremely dumb... and cute~" she chimed, smiling brightly.

In response to her reassuring smile, Zorua backed up.

"No Celi... you haven't... it's just the start of our friendship, really, it's not love... you won't feel like this anymore in a couple days..." he replied.

Celebi felt offended.

"... Zorua, let me make things clear: I DO like you that way, okay?" she said impatiently.

The tiny fox sighed... why was she so determined?

"... Okay, maybe you have feelings for me," he agreed,
"What I need to know is: why so suddenly?"

Celebi blushed.

"Don't ask me how love works, I won't answer you. I'm clueless." she replied.

Zorua nodded.
"But what about me? I don't know about this Celi..."

That single sentence alone was enough to destroy Celebi's metaphorical castle of dreams and hopes like it was a house of cards, blown away by a gust of wind.

"O-Oh..." she stuttered... she really thought Zorua too had feelings for her, that he was going to jump in her arms in joy, declaring that he loved her back...

She didn't really think past her own feelings... although she should have guessed it: Zorua had been acting like this since last night, but she assumed that he was simply feeling awkward!

Celebi sighed, before smiling again,

"Zorua, trust me, I never thought I could feel like that for you... but... it's like a fire is lit inside me... and you, I'm sure you too have some hidden feelings for me, you just gotta search them..." she spoke, pulling the fox closer with a paw.

She gave him a kiss.

"Believe me Zorua, me and you would make such a cute couple~" she started nuzzling him, before recalling one of her previous thoughts.
"... Also, you don't have a choice. I'm not giving up on this opportunity."

It was Zorua's turn to feel offended - this was no way to treat someone on such delicate subject. Celebi wanted to force him to be her boyfriend? No way, he thought, that wasn't going to happen.

He roughly pulled himself back, glaring at the fairy.

"You think I could ever love you if you force me to do this Celebi?!" he exclaimed, Celebi taken aback by the sheer passion of the sentence.

She stared at the fox for a second, shocked, before smiling,

"Okay Zorua, I'm sorry... it's up to you then..." she started to caress him gently,
"But I tell you, give us a chance... it'll work out amazingly~" she insisted.

Zorua flushed red.

"... And if I refuse?"

"Nothing will happen. Promise."

Zorua looked down, taking a few moments to think.

Did he feel the same way?

"Celi..."
1223322222133211221112111.title: A tiny bit of an one-sided love

choices: "I need to get ready for school... guess you're coming along, cutie~"
"Why don't we head out for a bit? Y'know... getting to know each other?"
12233222221332112211121111.content:
Zorua's words died down in his throat before they could find a way out.

Celebi tilted her head, expectant.

The tiny fox felt his heart rattling his chest. How was he supposed to respond? He wasn't even sure he loved Celebi! Okay, things were going swimmingly so far, but her falling for him at his first night here?

That seemed so surreal...

Then, it hit Zorua.

If he answered ‘no’, Celebi could simply have forgotten about her promise and force him to ‘change his mind’; or worse, she could have simply thrown him out of her house in his current predicament in a fit of anger.

He couldn't risk that... plus, he thought, there was really nothing bad in giving the fairy a chance, no? Things might just turn out to be more pleasing...

"You've been thinking for a while Zorua..." Celebi chimed, not bothering to hide a hint of apprehension in her voice while she nervously played with her own fingers.

But Zorua simply gave her a sympathetic smile.

"Celi..." he mustered the courage to talk,

"I-I think this might actually... work. I c-could give you a... chance?" he offered.

The green time-traveler stared at him in silence, eyes wide like two blue suns to Zorua.

But then, an impossibly big smile spread at supersonic speed on Celebi's visage, whole Zorua found himself being gripped by the fairy.

The fox was hastily brought up to her lips as she greedily started smooching him over and over.

"Oh, thank you thank you thank you!" she exclaimed upon pulling back Zorua from her lips, only to latterly shove him into one of her cheeks as she nuzzled him lovingly.

Never in her whole life (at least, since Zorua showed up) she thought she could love someone like Zorua. Zorua!

But she felt it - her heart beat faster, her mind raced, her body felt like it was on fire. And, from what she knew from her romantic books, this was what love did.

If her mom ever found out though...

Zorua smiled a bit... he had to admit: like that, Celebi looked rather cute... was he starting to see her in a different light? He didn't know.

There had been a sharp turn of events, everything was happening too fast for the fox to process.

First Celebi wanted to punish him, then she invited him to live with her and now she was ultimately in love with him? Things were going too fast...

Celebi released Zorua from her bone-crushing hug and set him back onto the table, wearing a bright smile.

Much to the fox's delight, he was handed a bigger portion of food.

"Thanks..." he muttered as the two resumed eating.

Celebi was obviously able to finish her breakfast without any issues, while Zorua, given the size difference, couldn't even finish half of the meal, which was promptly eaten by his new girlfriend.

Girlfriend.

It felt so weird to use that word in his mind... it felt so weird to have someone that loved him in the village after his cruel pranks.

He turned around, giving Celebi a smile.

She smiled back.

"So, are we going to do something today?" Zorua asked. If this relationship had to be, he had to at least get to know to Celebi a bit more and vice versa.

The fairy smiled at him.
12233222221332112211121111.title: Celebi's most improbable boyfriend

choices: "Lock you inside a cage until you realize the errors of your ways!"
"Always keep you by me, so you can only think of me!"
"Use hypnosis to make you forget your life outside of me!"
12233222221332112211121112.content:
"Celi... I-I... I don't think I feel the same way..." Zorua stammered out, reassured by the fact that Celebi promised nothing would happen if he said no. "I don't know, like at all. It would be better to start as friends, don't you think?"

As Zorua was showing his denial, Celebi's head was going 100 miles per hour at what he said. 'What!? He doesn't like me? It must have been some slut that seduced him!'

While Celebi was thinking these thoughts, Zorua started to notice objects shaking all around him and when he looked up he saw the extremely angry face of Celebi, the fear magnified by the fact that he was the size of a tiny doll in front of the pokemon that had shrunk him in the first place.

"Who is it?" Celebi angrily spouted out, Zorua's fear being palpable in the air

"What do ya mean 'who is it'? I don't even know who or what you're yapping on about."

"Who's the slut that seduced you away from me!"

At this point Celebi was letting out intense amounts of psychic energy, causing everything in the room to lift about a foot with Zorua shivering at the display of power. Zorua took all the effort he could to form an understandable sentence despite the incredible pressure placed on him by the green fairy. "I don't have anyone like that, I swear!"

"You're a Goddamn liar, there's no other reason for you to say no!"

"B-b-but"

"NO BUTS MISTER! I've never liked anyone before now and I'm NOT letting this chance get away!"

"But you promised nothing would happen if I said no!"

"That was a lie of course. I simply couldn't imagine you not saying yes, although now I need to remove the image of all other girls in your head so you're only capable of thinking about ME"

"W-what are you going to do to m-me" Zorua stammered out, currently regretting ever pestering this psychopath.

"Weeeeellllll, I'm going to _________"
12233222221332112211121112.title: The wrong answer...

choices: "I heard you get up last night."
"It's about what we're gonna do today!"
"Why were you out there all alone Zorua? Tell me about yourself."
122332222213321122111212.content:
He saw Celebi adjust herself in her sleep, she was turning over. Zorua sighed in relief before carefully shutting the book behind him. "Jeez..." He muttered. Celebi tried to punish him for a prank, almost killed him, THOUGHT about killing him, healed him, then took him in from his situation and said she was growing to like him. He shook his head, this was a damn roller coaster of emotion. He looked down at the ground from where he had climbed up the desk and wondered how in the hell he was gonna get back to her bed.

"Didn't think that part through did I?" He told himself as he scratched at his ear. "Ah, it'll be fine." He said as he looked at her chair. Not too bad of a fall if he took the landing right. He hopped down to the chair and braced himself. Giving a breath he jumped down from the chair to the floor and took the landing well.

"Sweet...now I just need to get back onto the bed!" He said enthusiastically as he approached it to find that if he jumped he might be able to catch the sheet in his mouth. After a few attempts and a few jumps he managed, though was flailing his paws to get purchase in order to climb. He managed with his front forepaw to grip the bottom of her frame at least, and used it to start climbing.

'Bingo!' He thought as he made progress. He had made his trek, got more insight into Celebi...for better or worse, and she wouldn't be the wiser. After a minute or two of climbing he reached the plateau that was Celebi's bed and slowly made his way towards her. To his surprise her paw reached out and grabbed him, hugging him to her chest once again. He struggled at first, but did find that he could go for a bit of sleep...the more he thought about it. He closed his eyes and let consciousness drift away from him.

-

"...ua....Zorua...up..." He groaned as the voice entered his ears.

"Zorua, wake up!" His eyes snapped open, only to see the giant smiling face of Celebi. "Sleepy head." She said and he turned over before she nudged him. "Nope, we need to talk Zorua." She said and he grunted as he slowly got up, stretched and yawned before turning to look at her.

"About...?" He muttered sleepily.
122332222213321122111212.title: Getting back to bed

choices: ... smirked, "No Zorua... if you stopped pranking, for now you may stay..."
... bit her lip, "Go back to sleep, I'll consider overnight,"
... frowned, "Sorry Zorua, but I'm afraid yes... you'll have to go..."
12233222221332112211122.content:
Zorua was starting to finally slide back into sleeping, but a sound pulled him back out of it, forcing him to open his eyes again.

He yawned in protest as he hazily looked at the source of the sound: the door of Celebi's room was creaking open.

Immediately, his eyes went wide open as he realized there was someone else aside him and Celebi in the house.

Crap, what it was one of those Sneasel that lived around the village?

The door opened completely, and a trembling Zorua watched as... Celebi came into the room.

Though it was not ‘his’ Celebi, it was different: it was a shiny one, had a body of two different shades of pink and green eyes.

For a moment, Zorua wondered who this was.

Then, he remembered the note on the table Celebi read earlier.

So this was...

Celebi's mom silently fluttered closer to the bed. Zorua choked back a gasp - he was uncovered!

Hastily, the dark-type cloaked himself in an illusion, now appearing like a lifeless-yet-very-realistic poke-doll.

He reminded himself to stand still as Celebi's mother reached the bed, staring at her sleeping daughter.

Zorua saw the massive pink pokemon smiling brightly. She adjusted the covers on her daughter and lowered herself, giving Celebi a gentle kiss... before her gaze casually fell onto the poke-doll that was Zorua, who was trying to choke back a laugh.

"And this...?" he heard the elder Celebi whispering.

Instantly, Zorua felt a set of slender pink fingers gripping him.

Celebi's mom scooped him up, narrowing her eyes to take a better look at the object she was holding... it was no object, she discovered, it was furry. And she couldn't see it clearly, whatever it was had black fur.

Since when Celebi had a pet...?

Quietly, the pink Celebi moved to the door, holding Zorua in a paw. She got out of the room, closing the door behind herself.

And, finally, she looked down, discovering a Zorua poke-doll in her paw.

"A poke-doll?" she mouthed, contemplating Zorua. She was sure Celebi never showed any interest towards that kind of things...

But, she had to admit, this thing was pretty realistic; not only it had soft fur like a real Zorua, it seemed to be breathing.

Deciding that it was only a common doll, Celebi's mom felt tempted to just bring it back into her daughter's room... but curiosity was too strong.

Zorua felt a crushing pain in his sides as the pink Celebi's fingers squeezed him, the fairy expecting the ‘doll’ to make a sound.

Which he did,

"OW!"

Startled, Celebi's mom dropped Zorua, who fell towards the floor. The fox dispelled his illusion, his focus broken.

Luckily, he was caught by a psychic grip, which lifted him back up into the paw of Celebi's mom.

He meekly looked up, the Celebi's green eyes were staring at him in shock.

The pink giantess felt all the air leaving her lungs, like someone had punched her in the stomach. This was no doll, this was the real Zorua, tiny and pretending to be a doll!

"... Hi miss..." Zorua broke the awkward silence.

The pink Celebi blinked.

"Z-Zorua? Is that you?" she asked, flabbergasted.

Zorua nodded his head.

As the initial shock subsided, Celebi's mom frowned as she remembered that, tiny or not, a scoundrel was in her house... sleeping in bed with her daughter!

"Zorua, explain me why you are in my house, in bed with my daughter, tiny and pretending to be a doll, and perhaps I won't be angry." she said with all the calm she could muster.

She was tempted to kick Zorua out right now, but violence was never a solution.

Perhaps things weren't what they seemed.

Quietly, she started to flutter into the living room and sat on a chair, setting Zorua down on a coffee table in front of her before she folded her arms, looking at the fox intently.

"Well?" she asked, raising an eyebrow.

Zorua looked down, inhaling deeply. He glanced past the pink Celebi, desperately hoping that the green one would wake up and come to help him.

But nothing happened aside from the fairy clearing her throat impatiently.

The dark-type sighed.

"Miss... I know this all seems weird... and it is, but there's an explanation... y'see, your daughter invited me..." he started.

Celebi's mom nodded, making a mental note to give her daughter an earful for letting a delinquent in their house.

"And were you already like that when she did?" she simply had to ask.

The fox shook his head.

"No... Celebi did this to me, she's got a weird power which... I really can't explain..." he said, the time-traveler staring in shock.

Celebi could shrink things and living beings...? Since when?

She made another mental note, to ask Celebi about it.

"You see miss, I actually don't have anywhere to go and Celebi discovered, told me I could come here but... I had to be this size to... well, to avoid you... guess it didn't work out good..." Zorua awkwardly explained.

The mother of his new friend tilted her head, confused.

"Zorua, no offense, but why Celebi would have let you come in our house?" she asked, starting to doubt everything Zorua said so far.

Zorua looked down.

"We're friends... I believe... you see, something happened between us: I-" Celebi's mom wasn't going to take this well,
"... I pranked your daughter a few days ago..."

Expectedly, the pink Celebi glared.

"How dare you-"

"But she used her power to shrink me to a pathetic size and she..." Zorua inhaled deeply, his leg aching all of a sudden,
"... She hurt me... really bad..."

The facial expression of the pink fairy changed from one of anger to one of surprise.

Her sweet daughter...

"B-But it was an accident!" Zorua justified.
"Celebi healed me and sent me to the forest I live in... and I stopped pranking, you noticed? Anyway, earlier Celebi came to my forest and... she discovered my condition and... asked me if I wanted to go with her and... here we are..."

At this point, Celebi's mom was looking confused, and Zorua was looking dejected.

He meekly looked up, meeting the green gaze of Celebi's mother.

"... I'm going to have to leave, right?" he asked. He knew it was too good to be true.

His words sank into the pink Celebi, who...

no, something else

1223322222133211222.content:
The two pokemon were getting close to Celebi's house. Expecting to see her mother, Celebi was about to head inside when...

"Celebi!" Celebi tenses up a bit when she heard a familiar voice behind her. She turns around, hiding Zorua behind her back as she not one but three pokemons, all who were her friends.

"Glad to meet you out here." Says one of the pokemon, which was a female Braixen, a shiny one at that.

"Braixen, what are you girls doing here?" Celebi says as she feels like she forgot something important that involve these three. Meanwhile, Zorua was nervous as he struggle to keep quiet.

"Don't tell me you forgot the sleepover today." A female Gardevoir, the same one who gave Celebi a minize tm to learn, which Celebi used to make the shrinking ability that she used on Zorua. Celebi couldn't help but feel nervous, but also embarrassed that she forgot that she invited her friends last week.

"Oh...right, i fogot, i was busy....helping with....a classmate from school." Celebi says, trying to think of something.

"Does it involve Zorua?" A female Espurr says. She looks at Celebi and sees that Celebi is hiding something behind her back

"Um... yes, though it was to helping break his habit of his mean pranks." Celebi say, though, she is being truthful on this one.

"That explains why its been rather quiet these last few days at the village." Gardevoir says. "Well, we can discuss this later, shall we come inside?" She ask sincerely.

"Sure." Celebi says as she opens the door and let's her friends inside first. Braixen and Gardevoir enters, Espurr stares at Celebi a little before she enters in any ways. With the girls inside, Zorua finally says something.

"You mean to tell me we have to worry about your mother and your friends now." Zorua says nervously as he has no idea what those girls would do to him if they spot him. To Zorua's credit, he didn't do any harmful pranks to those girls, but it doesn't mean he didn't do any pranks to their friends.

"Sorry, I completely forgot." Celebi says as she wonders how in the worlds she is going to do the sleepover without her friends spotting Zorua.

"Please tell me your house has a spare bed room that your friends uses." Zorua say as he only remembers Celebi's room and that was it during his time recovering.
1223322222133211222.title: Unexpected visitors

choices: One of the girls looking in, right at Zorua
All three of them looking right at Zorua
The door still shut?
12233222221332112222.content:
"No?! oh geez...i'm already regretting this..." Zorua muttered while Celebi brainstormed what to do. She went in the house, still holding Zorua behind her back, trying not to seem suspicious. The other three girls eyes her, Espurr raising especially was eyeing her. "Listen girls, i've um...gotta take care of something real quick in my room! I'll be right down okay? Okay! Great awesome berightback!" Celebi said as she pivoted around them to hide her back from them and backed right into her room before shutting the door.

"...What's her deal?"

"I can only guess."

Celebi waited a second after she shut the door before both her and Zorua let off a simultaneous sigh. "Well...now what? Do I hide in a corner while girl night all night goes on or something?" Zorua said, letting quite a bit of sarcasm slip into his voice. Celebi for her part rolled her eyes. "Relax, we'll think of something...just gotta make sure none of them find you...especially Braixen." Said Celebi.

"What, why her? I never did anything to her."

"Remember about a year ago that ESPECIALLY mean trick you pulled on Buneary..." Celebi said accusingly.

-ABOUT A YEAR AGO-

"No you didn't...you said it...you screamed it...you whimpered it, and now you've cried it...come on, just sing it." He said, trying desperately not to laugh harder. "I-i'm a silly lopsy flopsy that spills and trips alopsy..." She whimpered, and at this Zorua howled with laughter. "Still not singing but maaan is that great." He said.

"And just WHAT is going on here!?"

"Yikes, i'm out!" And with that Zorua took off, never looking back.

-NOW-

"...yeah, in hindsight that one was a harsh one. So that was Braixen huh?"

"Yeah, and she sees Buneary as a little sister so you really got on her bad side there...Zorua...we'll make this right later down the road but for now you really need to be hidden from them-" Celebi saw Zorua was staring behind her, at her closed door. "What's...what are you-" Celebi turned around to see...

choices: "I won't tell..." she says

122332222213321122221.content:
With eyes larger than life, to both Zorua and Celebi, the Espurr gazed at the small, shrunken creature in Celebi's hand. Celebi thought fast.

"E-Espurr, have you seen this microscopic replica of a Pokémon I made?" Celebi explained while Zorua caught on and remained frozen. Not that it required much effort on his part, the giant Espurr's galaxy-wide eyes were enough to creep him out at his regular size.

"Yes," the Espurr replied calmly with a blank stare, "Especially impressive how he has thoughts which I can read because I can and he's actually Zorua who you shrunk down in a mildly frightening bout of sadism and naïveté."

Espurr always had a way with words that made her hard to follow.

"Y-Yes! I used my psychic powers to instill it with a sense of self, and a... Backstory?" Celebi lied while creating a mental block in her own mind to keep the fellow psychic out.

Espurr stared at her.

"It's not any sillier than shrinking someone down, is it?" Celebi laughed nervously while fidgeting around. Zorua remained still even though he felt the cat was out of the bag, hoping Celebi could think of something smarter to say. While he had been silently praying for a savior from this hell, revealing himself to one of Celebi's friends might bring about some unfortunate consequences. Celebi, while strict and a little reckless, did seem set on doing this to teach him a lesson, and he didn't even WANT to know what a creepy Pokémon like Espurr would do with a miniscule little Zorua like himself.

Unable to stop himself he continued staring into those eyes, those endless eyes. And then it hit him. She can read it, SHE CAN READ MY MIND OH NO SHE KNOWS EVERYTHING I THOUGHT

"... I'm not that creepy..." Espurr mumbled to herself in a dejected tone, only audible to the tiny dark-type.

"C-Celebi...!" Zorua gasped helplessly, "D-Don't let her tell Braixen about me...!"

Celebi looked down at him with a dejected expression, thinking she had the situation under decent control. She then looked up at the Espurr who had a smirk on her face.
122332222213321122221.title: The inquisitive stare of an Espurr

choices: Espurr had an idea
Espurr had no ideas
Gardevoir and Braixen are coming in!
1223322222133211222211.content:
"I won't tell. This is far from the first time i've kept someone else's secret to myself out of respect for the fact that they believe they still have any secrets." Espurr said calmly.

"Yeah not creepy at all."

"Zorua!"

"Alright, alright...thank you Espurr." Zorua sighed. At this Espurr started to close the distance between the door and Celebi. Zorua felt awkward. Being around Celebi was one thing at this size, he'd actually trusted her somewhat, but Espurr was an unknown. She gave him a smile, clearly knowing his thoughts.

"I don't blame you for being nervous. I'm just surprised you agreed to being small again, especially after..." Espurr was giving him a blank stare, then her smile gave way to a neutral expression, then a frown before she gasped. She had seen the Zorua's version of events from the other night. Slowly, calmly she reached forward towards him. "H-hey, what are you, Celebi are you gonna-" He was cut off as the giant, gentle paw of the Espurr grabbed his entire front left leg and paw in her grasp. "I-it's still sore from time to time, just be-" Espurr got in real close with her head and Zorua gulped. He felt like those eyes could somehow swallow him whole with the way they stared.

Finally, Espurr, calmly rubbed his leg, and then his back before murmuring. "Good heal job Celi"

"T-thanks...it was my fault though anyway though so-" She was cut off.

"Good job rehabilitating Zorua too, his thoughts, though clearly nervous around me, are a lot less bitter and vindictive than they were before." Espurr smiled.

"Well honestly i'm more nervous about the other two coming in and-"

"Yeah, you don't want Braixen to find you like this. She actually might kill you."Espurr said, deadpan as ever

Zorua gulped.

"Well, Espurr, do you have any ideas to hide him?"

She put her hand to her chin.
1223322222133211222211.title: A confidant?

choices: Zorua remains hidden; Espurr takes him out when everyone is asleep
As the night goes on, Braixen notices something is wrong with Espurr...
12233222221332112222113.content:
Espurr appeared to be deep in thought for a while.

But then, she suddenly flinched, before giving the door an alerted stare.
"Espurr?" Celebi asks.

Espurr turns around in a surprisingly calm manner.
"Braixen and Gardevoir - they're coming here." she says, although very lowly.

This one sentence was more than enough to send both Zorua and Celebi too in a state of alert.
"Wha-" Zorua didn't even have the time to finish as Celebi roughly threw on the bed.

"Celi-" he tried to say, but was interrupted when a pillow was dropped on top of him.
"I'm sorry... Be quiet until later..." the fairy whispers.

Then, Celebi turned around again.

Only to notice Braixen and Gardevoir standing by the door, wearing suspicious expressions upon their faces.

"Heh... girls... what are you doing out there? C-Come on in!" Celebi nervously says, arms extending in a friendly gesture.

Braixen is the first to walk inside.

"I don't know Celebi. You've been acting weird since we all came here..." she speaks.
"True. Just what are you hiding?" Gardevoir asks as she too walks inside Celebi's room.

"M-Me? I'm not hiding anything..." Celebi lies.

While Celebi dealt with Braixen and Gardevoir, Espurr quickly checked Zorua's thoughts.

"Oh no..." she whispered to herself as she understood that Zorua wasn't able to breathe properly. If he spends too much time beneath the pillow, he might end up dying asphyxiated.

Espurr glances across the room, noticing Celebi, Gardevoir and Braixen standing in the middle. It looked like Celebi was having a hard time with defending herself from the accuses...

Espurr quickly notices that Gardevoir and Braixen are turned around, showing her their backs. The small psychic type smiles.

Slowly, she moves over the bed and hops on, before very carefully removing the pillow.

For a moment, light shined as the pillow was lifted from Zorua. But it was soon replaced by the smiling face of Espurr, who slowly got a hold of the small fox, before leaping off the bed.

"Celi, I need to use the bathroom," she says, holding Zorua close to her chest as she rushes out of the room. She smiles at Celebi's last thought.

‘Genius.’

--

Espurr ventures into Celebi's house and into the bathroom, before stepping inside, making sure to lock the door behind herself.

Then, those endless, lilac eyes of hers fix on Zorua.
"You've just dodged a bullet. And by ‘bullet’, I mean ‘angry Braixen trying to exterminate you like an insect’." she says.

Zorua shivers at the statement.

"Alright, I've dodged a bullet... for NOW! Braixen is still in the other room! Where am I gonna hide?" he asks, mostly to himself as he begins pondering where to find a good hideout.

Espurr smiles as she begins petting him with one paw.
"Relax... I think I've got a good hiding place for you," she reassures, causing Zorua to look up at her in curiosity.

Surprisingly, Espurr's cheeks begin to flare up as she gives a nervous giggle.

In the same moment, her ears rose up.
"Try to not speak too loud."

--

Celebi let out a sigh of relief as Braixen and Gardevoir finally looked at each other and shrugged, now almost convinced that the fairy was hiding nothing.

That's when Espurr came back into the room.
"Thanks, Celebi," she says, heading straight for her three friends.

"That was taken care of, by the way," Espurr continued, earning two curious looks and a glare.

"What?" Braixen questions, growing suspicious again.

In response, Espurr closed her eyes and smiled.
"You see, Celebi asked me to help her with some rather difficult homework a few days ago. I couldn't wait anymore to tell her I managed to do it." she stated in a convincingly proud voice.

Celebi's heart resumed beating.
"R-Really? How... how did you?" she played along.

In the same time, as the chat begins to draw Braixen and Gardevoir's, Celebi's travels on Espurr's head as she takes notice of a small lump beneath her right ear...

--
