Zorua couldn't breath properly. Hiding beneath Espurr's ear was pretty similar to hiding beneath the pillow.

The only difference is that this was much more weird.

He was surrounded by darkness and heat, while the ground he was laying on was soft and incredibly warm.

Sure, Zorua had been shrunken before, but he never even considered that he would ever end up hiding in someone's ears. He had quite a few ideas of where he could have ended up, but not the ears.

"I'm starting to regret my decision..." he mumbled.

Immediately, the giantess' body reacted to the wave of sound as she shivered, making Zorua bounce around underneath her ear. He quickly remembers where he is, and decides to keep as quiet as possible.

At least, until the giantess lets him out.

"What's going on with you, Espurr?" Gardevoir asks, her cup of tea stopping in midway between the table and her lips.

Espurr just shook for some reason.

The small psychic type shakes her head.
"Nothing." she responds, wondering if she can really keep Zorua hidden, at least until everyone is gone to sleep.

She checks Zorua's thoughts, discovering that he's thinking about the same thing.

"N-Now girls," Celebi suddenly speaks up in a nervous manner.
"Why don't we all have some fun?"
12233222221332112222113.title: Espurr's weird hiding spot

choices: Braixen grabbed him
Braixen swats at him!
Celebi or Espurr swipe him away before Braixen can get him
122332222213321122221132.content:
Celebi and Espurr did everything in their power to make things seem normal after all of this, and Celebi was quick to grab a board game from a cupboard to bring a sense of normalcy to this all. Eventually, between the girls laughing and gossiping, Celebi and Espurr let themselves relax, hoping that this was just enough to get through the night and leaving Zorua unnoticed.

-

Zorua for his part was feeling bored, hot, and tired. 'This is NOT what I had in mind for a nice place to sleep Celebi' He thought, well aware that Espurr could look in at any time to see his thoughts. He was doing his darnedest not to move too, but it was hard to accomplish whenever the giantess he was resting in so much as fidgeted or moved.

-

The girls at this point were swapping stories and gossip a bit before the subject went to a far more relevant topic than Celebi wanted. "So what exactly DID you do to make Zorua stop his pranks? It isn't like you're the first that's tried." Gardevoir was genuinely curious.

"O-oh, um...he pulled a prank on me a few days ago, he thought it'd be funny to make me look like a pidove with honey, berries and feathers so I uh...'co-erced' him into stopping for good." Celebi said. She hadn't lied, but she opted to keep exacts out of it.

"Hmm, can't say i'm surprised he was stupid enough to try a move like that on you, but what exactly did you do? I haven't seen him for a few days, who knows, maybe you scared him off for good." Braixen said, almost seeming a little content.

"Yeah, heh, it's possible..." Celebi said, wanting desperately to change the subject.

-

That stupid comment irked Zorua a little, but he wasn't gonna give up his position over it. Suddenly a tickle started to catch in his nose. 'Oh no.' Zorua felt it getting stronger.

-

Espurr bit her lip, she knew what was coming 'This is going to end poorly' Was all she thought before

"ACHOO!"

She instantly felt a tickle in her ear that made it hard to sit still or remain comfortable and suddenly all eyes in the room were on her.

"You okay Espurr? That was some sneeze." Celebi said nervously before Braixen looked at her with a look that could only convey 'Seriously?'

"Okay, you two are coming clean right now, just WHAT are you two hiding?"

"I have to agree with Braixen, this whole thing is starting to irk me as well."

"W-well you see girls, it's-"

"W-whoa-" the tiny dark pokemon came tumbling out of Espurr's ear, landing a bit roughly on Celebi's soft floor. He was dazed but unhurt. "Oh jeez...s-sorry Espurr." He said, still a bit dazed.

"Busted."

"Is THAT Zorua!? What the, is that what the secret was? He's tiny..." Braixen contemplated this before she got on her knees and scooted closer to him, she was reaching forward with one of her paws and Zorua had just regained sense enough to see it coming.

"P-please don't..." was all he could squeak out before...
122332222213321122221132.title: It all comes tumbling down

choices: "Alright Zorua. Perhaps I can forgive you..." Braixen says, calming down a bit
"Hmph!" Braixen exclaims. Looks like she's still angry...
1223322222133211222211323.content:
Zorua watches with terror as Braixen's paw comes down to grab - or possibly crush - him. He cowers in fear.

But soon, the unexpected happens - Espurr quickly moves over Zorua, scooping him up and leaping backwards, holding the tiny fox close to her chest.

Braixen blinks a few times, perplexed, before rising to her full height, glaring at Espurr.
"What do you think you're doing?" she asks, angry.
"Hand that pest, Espurr, I'm gonna teach him a lesson,"

Zorua shivers as he watches Braixen approaching Espurr.

But his world shakes when the giantess holding him moves aside, avoiding the bipedal fox.
"Sorry Braixen. I can't give him to you, meaning that you can't burn him to a crisp like you want to." Espurr replies as calm as ever, sending shivers down Zorua's back.

Braixen growls at Espurr. Her paw travels to her tail as she pulls out her wooden stick, which she menacingly points at the small psychic type.

Only to drop the stick an instant later, when Gardevoir suddenly moves forward, her arms sliding beneath Braixen's as she pulls the fox back.
"Braixen, calm down!" Gardevoir says.

"Let me go!" Braixen exclaims while fidgeting in Gardevoir's grasp in an attempt to free herself.

The sight of the giant, angry fox fills Zorua with dread. He briefly wonders what would happen if Braixen manages to free herself...

"Yeah, that'd be bad. She's intentioned to squish you like a bug now." Espurr chimes in a monotone voice, only making the small fox shiver with terror. The giantess' grip tightened.

But Zorua almost has an heart attack when Braixen finally manages to slip out of Gardevoir's grasp and makes a dash towards Espurr, a murderous glare in her eyes.

Zorua lets out a scream of terror as his eyes close, waiting for his fate.

Which never comes.

Opening his eyes again, he notices Braixen standing at mere inches from Espurr.

The giant fox is surrounded by a psychic aura which keeps her still, Celebi and Gardevoir staring at her with somewhat relieved looks.

The small fox looks back, noticing Espurr with glowing eyes and ears risen up.

Zorua's gaze returns onto Braixen, who attempts to break free from psychic.
"Espurr... Cut it..." she mumbles, before a second psychic attack pulls her backwards. Zorua discovers Celebi with glowing eyes.

Gardevoir's eyes start glowing too, and Braixen is forced on her knees, now completely unable to move.
"Girls..."

Celebi sighs in exasperation.
"Braixen, calm down!" she exclaims.

Braixen glares at Celebi.
"CALM DOWN?! Have you forgotten what that pest did to poor Buneary?!" she snarls venomously.

Zorua thinks that this could be a nice moment to apologize. But, before he can speak up, Celebi does it for him,
"No, I didn't! None of us did!" she cries, moving over Espurr, picking the frightened Zorua from her paws.

The fairy stares at the small fox, feeling quite guilty for putting him through so much.

If only she remembered about the sleepover, none of this would have happened. So, this was entirely her fault. And it was up to her to fix it.

"Celebi..." Zorua mutters pleadingly, earning a reassuring smile as the legendary started to pet him.

Celebi's gaze goes back to Braixen.
"Alright, Braixen, Zorua has been a jerk for years," she starts.
"But he paid for all of his pranks!" she continues, recalling the pitiful sight of a nanoscopic Zorua, whimpering on top of a book as blood came out from his broken leg.

"Yeah, the broken leg sure wasn't nice, Zorua." Espurr bluntly reveals.

Both Braixen and Gardevoir gasped at the revelation.
"C-Celebi... y-you..." Braixen started, her rage replaced by stupor.

"It was an accident... Poor Zorua, Celebi was even thinking of putting him out of his misery." Zorua's heart skips a beat as he glares up at Celebi.
"WHAT?!" he exclaims, suddenly wishing to get away from the fairy.

"Hey, have you any idea of how I was feeling at the moment? That would have been the most merciful thing to do back then, Zorua," Celebi responds, looking ashamed.

All the talking in the room suddenly quiets down. And, slowly - very slowly - the three psychic types released Braixen.
"See, Braixen? Didn't he pay the price for what he did already?" Espurr asked while moving closer to Celebi.

Braixen doesn't respond. Her red eyes fix on the smaller fox as she contemplates him. Zorua meekly stared back, waiting for Braixen to say anything.
1223322222133211222211323.title: Celebi or Espurr swipe him away before Braixen ...

choices: The night continues with Zorua included
It's time for bed
They go out to find Buneary
12233222221332112222113231.content:
After an intense stare down, Zorua felt himself tense up more and more before Braixen finally shut her eyes and sighed. "Alright Zorua...maybe I can forgive you...or at least maybe you've had enough." She said, relenting. She calmly starts to approach Celebi, and Zorua scoots back in her palms as Braixen leans in, her head filling his vision. "BUT! Don't do anything like that again!" She said sternly.

"I wasn't gonna..." Zorua muttered, he was serious about giving up the mean tricks.

"AND!...you should apologize to Buneary. To all the pokemon you did tricks to...like that." Braixen said and Zorua instantly tensed up.

"What!? That's..."

"That might be a bit dangerous for him Braixen, considering that you almost just turned him into an ash pile, or paste, or whatever method would've been the quickest and most painful when you got him in your clutches." Espurr responded, deadpan. She was right though, for whatever grudge Braixen held, many more had ones just as bad or worse.

"He dug that hole...but yeah, I see your point...Buneary wouldn't do that though, he should at least apologize to her like that." Braixen relented. Zorua considered that and thought that might at least be harmless. That was a harsher trick on a nicer pokemon he'd pulled, and if it'd get Braixen to make peace with him then yeah, that MIGHT be for the best since the secret of his size was compromised anyway.

"Zorua...?" Celebi was giving him a gentle look, seeming to ask if he'd be okay with going to Buneary like this. He straightened up and was about to speak when...

"He's fine with it."

Zorua deflated a little, his moment robbed. "Yeah, that...i'm okay with apologizing to her...and i'm sorry to you as well for what I did Braixen. It was wrong of me to leave Buneary there like that...to do that to her in the first place, and to have you discover her in that sad state. If I could take it back, I would." At this Braixen looked taken a back, shocked to see Zorua actually acting like this. It was night and day from how she'd known him. She contemplated what she had tried to do in the last few minutes, and contemplated what she'd just heard he'd gone through. Her expression softened and she reached for him in Celebi's hand. He flinched and shut his eyes before he felt a gentle warmth running along his back. He opened his eyes to see Braixen was petting him "I'm sorry too Zorua...you've clearly changed." She said, giving him a small smile. Soon Gardevoir approached as well, also surprised by the change and started to pet him too.

Zorua was feeling incredibly embarrassed and out of place with all of this, but Gardevoir broke the silence. "So if all that happened, why is he still small like this?" She was curious.

Celebi thought how to answer that, she didn't know if she wanted to reveal the whole truth of Zorua's situation, especially since he liked to keep it close to his chest from what she could tell, which is why she was surprised when he broke the silence.

"It was my choice, honestly. I...don't really have anywhere to go at the moment, and Celebi gave me a choice...I chose this." He mumbled out, staring down at Celebi's paws. Gardevoir and Braixen looked shocked once again, then started to piece it all together themselves. "Alright Zorua...friends?" Braixen extended a small finger to him, and he reached up a paw to shake it. Gardevoir and Espurr did the same, each giving him a reassuring smile.
12233222221332112222113231.title: Reconciliation

choices: "I'm curious about you shrinking abilities." Gardevoir says
Braixen has a idea involving Zorua, but pulls the girls outside to discuss it
The girls discuss while Espurr plays with Zorua
122332222213321122221132311.content:
With things seem to have settle down and Zorua not having to worry about the other girls wanting to do any harm, the one of the figures it might be the best time to ask some questions.

"Celebi, does your mother knows about Zorua?" Gardevoir ask as everyone finds a spot to sit down.

"No, I didn't want to let my mom knows about Zorua or his new size." Celebi says.

"That, and we know how your mom is when she sees you next to a boy." Espurr says bluntly. Zorua could see Celebi blushing when she hears that part.

"Wait, what is Celebi's mom is like?" Zorua ask. Even during the time he spent with Celebi and her room, he doesn't remember seeing Celebi's mom at all.

"She's is very..." Espurr was about to say something, most likely in a deadpan way as usual, when Braixen quickly stops her by stuffing a pillow.

"Oh we're going to let you find that out yourself." Braixen says with a sly smile. Zorua was rather confuse while Celebi blushes more.

"Enough of my mom for now, how about we talk about something else." Celebi says, trying to change the subject.

"Ok, well, how about you tell us how you shrunk Zorua, I never heard a move like that. Well, except minimize, but that only works on the pokemon using the move." Braixen states, however, Gardevoir seems to figure it out when Braixen mention minimize.

"Celebi, is that why you ask me about that tm?" Gardevoir asks as she remembered the other day when Celebi ask her about the move.

"Actually no, I wasn't planning to use it on Zorua. I was planning to use it on a small project." Celebi explains. "Though I guess its safe to say it worked a lot when I did try it on Zorua."

Way to much, Zorua thoughts as he remember his experience as a nanoscopic speck while on Celebi's paw. As usual, Espurr read his thought.

"Must has been a interesting experience to see Celebi at such a small size." Espurr says, making Zorua fluster a bit when he forgot about Espurr's mind reading ability.

"Can you please stop reading my mind?" Zorua says while covering his head, thinking that would work. The girls laugh a little, finding the scene adorable. "Hmmm, so what are you girls going to do now by the way?" Zorua says, thinking they might continue the sleepover without him.

"You can join us if you want." Celebi says as the girls agree in the idea. "As for what to do next, anyone got any ideas?" The girls thought a bit.
122332222213321122221132311.title: Continuing the sleepover

choices: "If you think this idea is ok." Celebi says, giving the plan a shot
"No, its too dangerous." Celebi shakes her head.
1223322222133211222211323111.content:
As the group discuss, Gardevoir is the first to speak.

"I am curious about your shrinking abilities, Celebi." Gardevoir says.

"What about them?" Celebi asks as she wonders where Gardevoir is going with this.

"Well, since the night is still young, how about you try it with all of us and we all go on a mini adventure?" Gardevoir says. Hearing this made both Celebi and Zorua nervous.

"No!" Both said in unison.

"Gardevoir, that's a mistake waiting to happen." Celebi says. "Heck, I accidentally went overboard when i shrunk Zorua."

"Actually, you went overboard when try to shrink him more the second time." Espurr says as she remembered from reading Zorua's memories.

"Still the point is that its too risky to shrink everyone that small." Celebi says.

"I'm not saying to shrink us to nothing, just maybe between a inch and a millimeter." Gardevoir explains. "Besides, if you shrink with us, then I'm sure we are more than safe to try the idea out."

"Well, when you say it like that, it doesn't sound too much like a bad idea." Braixen chimes in.

"Well what about my mother, she'll barge in once in a while to check on us." Celebi states.

"Then one of us stays normal size, tricks your mom into leaving, and we can take turns in switching size." Braixen says.

"Sounds like a plan." Gardevoir says, agreeing with Braixen.

"Can i stay out of this, i think i had enough shrinking smaller than a joltik experience for one lifetime." Zorua says as he understandably doesn't want to shrink anymore than he is.

"Actually, it would make more sense for you to shrink with us," Espurr says, "after all, it would be very strange to Celebi's mother to spot a small Zorua in this room."

"It would be more strange to see only one girl in this room that isn't Celebi." Zorua points out.

"Well, Celebi, what do you think?" Gardevoir, whose kind of ignoring the statement that Zorua just said, looks at Celebi, whose also contemplating if this idea is good or bad one.
1223322222133211222211323111.title: Small adventure?

choices: "It's a really, REALLY bad idea Braixen..."
"You're gonna have to ask him...it's not my choice to make."
1223322222133211222211323112.content:
"H-hey girls...can I talk to you all for a sec?" Braixen said, giving a wide smile. "What? Not around me?" Zorua said, a little deflated. "Sorry shrimp, I want to run it by them first." She said, getting up. "SHRIMP!?" Zorua said, feeling insulted. The other girls complied and Celebi gave Zorua an apologetic look. "It'll probably only take a sec." She said as they left him alone in the room, shutting the door so he couldn't follow.

"Shrimp..." He grumbled. "Dumb girls..." He kicked at the floor.

-

"Okay Braixen, what's up?"

"She's about to pitch a bad idea to us."

"ESPURR...You know it isn't fair that you two can block her off and I can't!"

"Sorry Braixen...pitch away." Espurr said, deadpan as ever. Braixen gave her an annoyed look before doing a complete 180 and putting on a bright smile. "Okay, so you know that mean old Mismagius that lives in the village? Right by the park?"

"Yeah..."

"And how she's always taking toys, do dads, and bip bobs from any pokemon that unfortunately has their stuff cross into her yard and never give it back."

"bip bobs?"

"Well, no one has EVER managed to get any of their stuff back. We can't do it, I can't do it, but what if..."

"Here it comes..."

"We send Zorua in! He could do it! Think about it. He's tiny enough to sneak by, he's got illusions on his side, he's a dark type and could slip by that ghost type without much notice, and he's got a conniving, sneaky mind! It's perfect!"

"...Espurr, you're wrong. That isn't a bad idea..."

Braixen had a look of hope that was growing.

"It's a TERRIBLE one! Are you serious!? That would be seriously dangerous for him."

"She's a seriously nasty lady Braixen."

"If she caught him she'd probably add HIM to her collection..."

"Oh come on, if she caught him she'd probably just lecture him and throw him out." Braixen said indignantly.

"I'd give it 50/50 odds on both of those outcomes."

"Think about if he succeeded, in even getting ONE thing away from her and passing on the knowledge of where her stash is! Zorua would be redeemed! The face turn of the century! He'd be a legend, a hero!"

"Okay is this the pitch you're gonna give him, because it might actually work, i'm just going to fall back on this being a terrible idea." Celebi said flatly, crossing her arms.

"SERIOUSLY nasty lady..."

"You're being too protective of him...and underestimating him..."

"You're misplaced and over inflated sense of justice never ceases to amaze, and it's certainly inspirational that you want to pass that onto the recently changed and incredibly emotionally vulnerable Zorua so you can live vicariously through this mission."

"Espurr..." Braixen was flushing red.

"Love ya Braix..."

"Look, I thought this out. We tie a string to him that he can mask with his illusions, okay? And then Espurr stays honed in on his thoughts, and if he starts to panic, sends off a signal of being caught, or is in ANY danger we immediately pull the string and get him out of there! And if he does manage to get some stuff he can tie an extra bit of string to it, in case it's too heavy for him to pull out and we can take over from there, pulling both him and the object out! It's totally safe!"

The room was silent for a few moments before Celebi sighed and spoke up.
1223322222133211222211323112.title: A mission?

choices: Zorua manages to grab something as he is pulled out!
Zorua grabs nothing as he is pulled out!
Mismagius catches Zorua!
12233222221332112222113231122.content:
"You know what? You shouldn't speak to me," Celebi says as she holds her arms out.
"The decision is up to Zorua."

Braixen smirks.
"Is that so? Very well, I'll make sure to convince him..."

--

Zorua sits on the floor of the room, waiting for the four pokemon to return, but at the same time hoping they take as much time as possible.

"Shrimp..." he muttered to himself, feeling offended. Braixen didn't even want him to listen to whatever she had to say to the others.

Weren't they friends now?

His train of thought was interrupted as the door behind him opened up, Celebi and the others entering the room again.

"Just what were you talking about?" Zorua asks as he turns around.
"Girl stuff, huh?"

"More or less," Celebi sighs as she flutters over Zorua, scooping him up in her paws and turning around to face her three friends.

"Listen up, Zorua," Braixen starts, moving a step forward.
"We've came up with an idea that might just improve your reputation,"

Zorua perks up.
"Wha- really?" he asks, curious about what Braixen has in mind.

Braixen nods.
"I bet my stick that you know about that Mismagius lady that lives by the park, the one that claims whatever ends up in her yard as hers," Braixen starts.

"Yes?" Zorua responds. The voice of how much of a jerk that Mismagius is runs through the village, and it didn't escape Zorua, who heard it from quite a few pokemon.

"Well... y'see, you're just the right size to..." Braixen stops to find the right words.

"Sneak inside her yard, steal whatever you can and get out, obviously with our help - it's really a bad idea as well as an egoistical one." Espurr says, earning a glare from Braixen and a dumfounded stare from Zorua.

"You want me to what?!" he shouted.
"If that Mismagius catches me, I'll spend the rest of my days with some lunatic old lady!"

"That's true..." Gardevoir says.

"Aw, come on!" Braixen exclaims, frustrated.
"I lost my first stick in her yard! That Mismagius never gave it back, I had to find a new one! Don't tell me she never stole anything from you all!" she grabs out her stick from her tail and clenches her fist around it.

"I never got anywhere near that house," Celebi says, shrugging.

"And I will never do!" Zorua chimes, backing up onto Celebi's paws.
"I agree, Zorua. It's too dangerous," the fairy says in approval.

Braixen huffs.

"Come on Zorua!... Would your rather stay here and play board games all the time?" Braixen says. Zorua's eyes widen at the perspective.

Braixen smirks. She just hit Zorua's weak spot.

"He's reconsidering."

"Zorua, you-" Celebi doesn't get to finish as the small fox she's holding interrupts.

"... Braixen," he tells.
"Tell me you've got a plan..."

--

"Ow!" Zorua cries as Braixen ties a particularly long string - which Celebi provided - around him. The group had moved outside of the Mismagius' house, and Zorua was getting ready to sneak inside her yard.

Celebi, who is holding him, wears an apprehensive expression.
"Zorua, this is your last chance: if you're not sure, we can go home, and nobody will blame you," she says as if wanting to convince him to rethink.

"I'll be fine..." Zorua mumbles in response, not really sure about this.

Celebi nods.

"Be careful," Gardevoir says, moving closer to Celebi.
"Very careful." Espurr adds.
"EXTREMELY careful." Celebi finishes, bending to let him down.

"And if you run into the old jerk, just think about wanting to get out: Espurr will read your thoughts and we'll pull you out." Braixen says as Zorua starts walking towards the gate that leads to the Mismagius' yard.

"Good luck!" all four pokemon say at unison as he disappears into a thick forest of grass.

--

Zorua wanders around for a moment as he tries to find a way to orient himself through the thick vegetation.

As he wasn't already lost enough, the sky was dark and he was having a hard time seeing where he was going. The rope tied around him, which was left in the hands of the overprotective Celebi, was somewhat a comfort.

He keeps venturing deeper into the tall grass for a while, before it finally came to an end.

Zorua's eyes widen as he gasps in amazement.

There were all sorts of things in the yard!

Balls, toys, evolutionary stones and much, much more. The fox's eyes fix on one object in particular - a stick.

It's nothing more than a normal wooden stick, but he's sure of what that is. Braixen's first stick.

"If only I could grab that..." he wonders, before getting distracted by the door of the mansion opening. A Mismagius comes out, looking rather hostile.

Zorua chokes back a gasp as he focuses. His form his replaced by a patch of grass. As expected, the old lady didn't notice him as she starts hovering around the yard.

"Okay... I'm safe for now. But I can't hold the illusion of I have to move..." he mutters.
"I have to distract her... but how...?" he asks himself, before having an idea. He focuses again.

And, suddenly, a Murkrow materialized from nowhere and started flying around. Its illusionary wings made noise, which drew the Mismagius' attention. The fake Murkrow landed on a tree branch in front of the ghost type, who glared at it.

"Hey! You! Get lost!" she yelled at him. Murkrow didn't move of an inch.
"I'm talking to you! Go away!" Mismagius repeats in a hostile tone.

Zorua takes the opportunity and dispels his first illusion, before sneaking his way past Mismagius, who has her back turned to him.

Sadly, Mismagius lost her patience too soon as she attacked the fake Murkrow with a Shadow Ball. The ball flew past it as the illusionary pokemon fades, leaving a confused Mismagius.

Seeing the scene, Zorua shivers as he hurries to grab the first thing he can.

The old Mismagius turns around in confusion, spotting the tiny fox in the yard.
"Hey you! Don't move!" she yells, starting to float menacingly closer to Zorua, who shivers.

‘Help!’

--

"Busted." Espurr breaks the silence with her monotone voice.
"Pull him out, Celebi."

Celebi gasps, before quickly starting to pull the string to get Zorua out.

--

Zorua feels the rope around him being pulled back as Mismagius approached him.

He was safe!

But... could he go back out there without grabbing anything?

He looked around, before leaping towards the first thing he saw with his mouth open in an attempt to grab it...
12233222221332112222113231122.title: A dangerous operation

choices: "A-Alright Zorua... I forgive you..." Buneary timidly responds
"I-I... Uh..." Buneary responds, uncertain
"A-Are you kidding?!" Buneary responds, now angry at Zorua
122332222213321122221132313.content:
"Look Zorua, I'm glad that you've changed," Braixen chimes.
"Sadly, that doesn't delete what you did to Buneary back then. I'd really appreciate if you apologized to her," she says in a dejected voice.

"We all would," Celebi chimes in, fixing an expectant stare on Zorua.
"Zorua?"

All the attention focused on him, Zorua blushes as he gazes down at Celebi's palms.

"Of course she'll accept your apology Zorua." Espurr speaks up, bringing out the fox's doubts.

Zorua's cheeks flare up even more.
"Stop reading my mind, Espurr!" he cries in annoyance and embarrassment, getting the four pokemon around him to giggle.

"Espurr is right though," Braixen tells in a friendly tone, showing that she no longer holds hard feelings towards Zorua.
"I know Buneary - I'm sure she'll accept your apology... If you find the right words."

Zorua stares at Celebi's paws for a bit more, before perking up.
"Alright, fine," he says.

He just wanted to get it over with. Once he made it up to Buneary, the four would leave him alone... and he would admittedly feel better.

"Let's go."

--

Buneary was doing nothing particularly interesting. She was just napping on the couch of her house.

But her dreams weren't good ones...

--

"Come on, sing it." Zorua snickered as he watched the helpless Buneary, stuck in a pool of sticky syrup.

"Please Zorua... I already did!" she cries in response, tears rolling down her she as she silently prayed for a savior.

"No you didn't," Zorua continued snickering.
"You told it, you screamed it, you whimpered it, and now you've cried it. Now, you only have to sing it." he said.

More tears coming out from her eyes, Buneary mustered up as much courage as possible.
"I-I'm a-a silly lopsy flopsy that s-sp-pills and trips alopsy..." she said, her attempt rendered poor by her tears.

"Still not singing, but man is that great!" Zorua howled with laughter.

Buneary placed her paws over her eyes as she cried, tears and syrup dripping down to the ground.

"Help..." she weakly whimpered.

Sadly, nobody came to help her.

Zorua finally stopped snickering, and looked at the crying Buneary.

"Now come on again, and I'd be better hear you singing it now!" he said with a maniacal laughter.

With a shaky voice, Buneary started over...


--

The bunny pokemon fidgets in her sleep as the nightmare goes on.

But then, it all comes to an end as someone knocks at the door of the house, disturbing her sleep.

A second knock was enough to wake Buneary up. She sits upright, before physically rubbing the sleep out of her eyes.

Whoever was out of the door knocked again.

"Co-Coming..." she mutters, wondering who could it be at such dark hour.

When the bunny reached the door, she opened it, finding Braixen out of it, along with Espurr, Gardevoir and Celebi.

"G-Girls...? What are you doing here...?" she timidly asks.

Braixen smiles at the small bunny.
"You see, we were having a sleepover, and we thought we could pay you a visit," she says, stepping inside, followed by the three other girls.

"How are you doing, Buneary?" Celebi asks while gently caressing the bunny on the head.

"I'm doing fine, thank you," Buneary replies.
"Yes, except for the nightmare about Zorua you just had, which was much more of a painful memory than actually a-"

Espurr is silenced when Braixen slides a paw over her mouth as she notices Buneary's expression.

"Yeah..." she mumbles, cringing at the still fresh memory.

It happened almost a year ago, yet she feels like it happened yesterday. And it still psychologically hurt Buneary.

The bitter thoughts of the bunny don't escape Espurr, who removes Braixen's paw.

"Speaking of Zorua," Gardevoir chimes, earning Buneary's attention.
"We've brought someone else over..." Braixen continues.

"And he would really like to say something..." Celebi chimes in with a smile.

Buneary gazes at all three, before her gaze lands upon Espurr, who steps forward, her ears rising up.

Laying there, onto her furry head, a tiny Zorua, looking pretty nervous.

"H-Hi Buneary... Long time no see..." he salutes with a movement of his paw.

Buneary remains silent for a couple minutes, dumbfounded.

"Z-Zorua!" she then shouts, taking a leap backwards. Even at such minuscule size, he still had the power to scare Buneary. The small fox doesn't know if to feel proud or ashamed.

Buneary makes a dash to hide behind Braixen.
"Now, Buneary, he's harmless!" the fox reassures, patting the smaller pokemon on the head.

"Yeah Buneary. Zorua really changed!" Celebi chimes, picking Zorua from Espurr's head and holding him out for the bunny pokemon, who cowers. Zorua sighs.

"It's not working..." he bitterly says, staring down at Celebi's paws.

Celebi sighs.
"Buneary, we know Zorua was a jerk to you... to everyone actually. But he truly changed," she explains.

"True. And, after all, he couldn't harm you at such size, and in between the four of us," Gardevoir chimes in.

Finally, Buneary stops trembling. Braixen moves behind her, and gently pushes her towards Celebi.
"Plus, he'd really like to say something," she tells.

Zorua and Buneary make eye contact.

Zorua's cheeks flare up with embarrassment.
"B-Buneary... I-I..." he starts, not quite sure of how to tell it. He never really apologized for his pranks. This was a first.

"He's sorry for-"
"I can talk by myself Espurr!" Zorua shouted in frustration, silencing the psychic type.

He looks back at Buneary.
"I... I am sorry for the mean prank I pulled on you. That was admittedly... excessive..." he says, blushing, feeling quite ashamed...

Buneary stared at the tiny fox in silence, a storm of emotions raging within her.

Zorua was apologizing to her, and she's not sure if she should hug him or try to squish him.

But she made up her mind when the last words left Zorua's mouth,
"I-I beg you to forgive me..."

After the dark type's last remark, time seems to stand still as everyone waits for Buneary's answer.
122332222213321122221132313.title: A prankster's apologies

choices: "Okay Zorua...I forgive you..." She said finally
"Zorua...you should go..." She placed him back in Celebi's paws
1223322222133211222211323132.content:
"U-um...I-I don't know..." Buneary said nervously, looking at the tiny dark pokemon in front of her. The nightmares she'd had, the fear she felt every time she saw him in passing, all of it...and he was right here, small as a doll begging her to forgive him? It all seemed...too surreal, far too surreal.

Zorua was standing there, shifting his weight nervously on Celebi's paws. "Buneary...hold out your palms flat please." "H-huh!?"

"Just please do it, I want to show you something."

Espurr gave a knowing smirk. "That's a dumb idea Zorua..." She muttered, with only Braixen being able to hear it. Buneary eyed Zorua and complied. It was then that he made his move and leapt from Celebi's paws to Buneary's.

"EEP!" She had caught him and nearly flung him from shock and surprise. Zorua was doing everything he could to find his footing.

"ZORUA! THAT WAS STUPID!"

Zorua's eyes were as wide as saucers, mouth shut tight, realizing that he almost just fell to the hardwood floor from this height. "...I knew you'd catch me Buneary." He said, clearly shaken.

"Liar"

'Arceus above Espurr, I swear...' He thought, she just smirked at him.

"And I knew that because you're nice Buneary, you're kind and gentle...and I did you wrong. Terribly wrong. I can't undo what I did, I know that..."

"Y-you say i'm n-nice, but you know I could c-crush you like this...or drop you, or-or..." Buneary said, trying to be intimidating.

"You'd probably be justified in doing so, a whole year with me in your head? Still having nightmares? That's...just unfair, and the stinking truth of it is, the bitter truth that I hate is that a week ago I wouldn't have cared if i'd known, I probably would've felt accomplished...i'm terrible aren't I?...Buneary, I can't say that I know what you've gone through for a whole year, I can only tell you that I have truly changed...I had...my own trauma recently. Honestly it has given me the worst nightmares these past few nights."

"Zorua..."

"The pokemon that put me through this...I wanted to blame her, I wanted to hate her, I wanted to...I don't know. I had a lot of thoughts swirling in my head when it happened. But...she's my friend. My best friend. And I realized around that time that I had put a lot of pokemon through their own hells for my amusement. This height is perfect for me really." He smiled bitterly. "Can't do much to ya! Or anyone else." At this he gave a brighter smile.

'Zorua you...' Celebi thought.

"I can't make you forgive me. I can just desperately hope that you will, and if you don't, that you'll at least be able to move on from me." He said, hanging his head.

Buneary looked at the tiny dark pokemon in her hands...'T-this isn't Zorua...it CAN'T be Zorua...' She thought. The same one that did that syrup trap? The same one that made her recite that horrid line. And he was now this...
1223322222133211222211323132.title: To forgive or not?

choices: "Well... Okay!" Buneary chimes, wanting to join the sleepover
"Uhm... Maybe next time..." Buneary responds, disagreeing
12233222221332112222113231321.content:
Buneary looks at the small Zorua in her paws for a bit longer, her cheeks starting to grow red.

Espurr smirks.
"Touching how Buneary can't control her own emotions, and how she's thinking that, even if Zorua deserves to be crushed for what he did, she still wants to for-" the psychic type is silenced by Braixen once again, who eyes her with an annoyed look.
"Let Buneary talk on her own,"

Zorua looks back at Buneary, who sighs.
"A-Alright, Zorua..." she says, shutting her eyes before blurting out,
"I forgive you..."

Silence follows Buneary's statement as everyone in the room smiles, minus Espurr who is still being silenced by Braixen.

"Y-You... You mean it?" Zorua asks, hopeful. Buneary blushes even more as she nods her head, her eyes opening again.

Zorua too starts to blush as he extends one of his tiny legs.
"F-Friends?" he asks.

In response, Buneary pulls him in a hug, taking by surprise Zorua and everyone within the room. The small fox blushes even more, and leans against the bunny's brown fur as he returns the hug.

After the prank he pulled on Buneary, he never even considered that this moment could ever come... and the Zorua of a few days ago wouldn't have wanted it to come.

But those days are now past. Zorua changed.

Finally, Espurr manages to free herself from Braixen's grasp.
"No, Buneary, that's not a dream," she tells, before eyeing Zorua.

"Yeah Zorua, it's weird how you changed within a few days, since Celebi accidentally broke your leg," she says in her usual monotone voice.

Buneary's eyes shut open at the statement as she gasped. Espurr nodded and Celebi blushed furiously while looking at the floor in shame.
"Stop bringing that up!" she yelled in frustration. Espurr smirks.

Buneary eyes the small fox in her paws with disbelief.
"Zorua... your leg..." she whispered, horrified, whatever hard feeling she still held against him fading away instantly, replaced by pity.

Zorua nodded slowly.
"Yes..." he mumbled, cringing at the memory of himself laying on that book with an injured leg. He then looks up, smiling.
"But will you know what? It was a blessing," he says.

"Z-Zorua...?" Celebi asks, not sure of having heard correctly. Braixen, Gardevoir and Espurr's gazes shifted on Zorua.

Espurr smirks.
"Okay Zorua, I will not ruin this speech of yours. Go ahead," she says.

Zorua turns around on Buneary's paws to smile at Celebi.
"It was, Celebi," Zorua repeats.
"It made me realize just how wrong I did to all of you. And it made me change," he continues, Celebi growing more and more dumbfounded as Zorua keeps speaking.

One last words made her mouth drop open,
"Thanks..."

After a moment of silence, Celebi smiles sheepishly, letting a blush spread across her cheeks.
"Well... you're welcome..." she responds, before recalling something the fox said earlier.

The fairy's smile then shrinks into a grin.
"But, back on topic, who is your best friend?" she teases.

Zorua shrinks back on Buneary's paws.
"... Did I say that aloud?" he asks, fidgeting nervously.

"Yes. Yes you did." Gardevoir chimes.

Celebi quickly hovers forward, snatching Zorua from Buneary.

"Zorua... remember what we told about poke-dolls earlier?" she asks, holding the tiny fox close in front of her face. Zorua gulps.

"Poke-dolls?" Braixen asks, while Espurr blushes upon reading Zorua's thoughts.
"Oh, Celebi~"

Celebi smirks.
"Yeah," she says.
"That's. Gonna. Happen. A lot."

Zorua flushes red.
"Celebi... you promised..." he recalls. Celebi giggles.
"I'm sorry, Zorua, but that's one promise I'm not going to keep," she says, making the fox nervous.

Celebi looks around to see her friends' expressions. Braixen and Gardevoir look confused. Espurr is blushing.

"Just what are you talking about...?" Gardevoir asks.

Celebi giggles again.
"Nothing... Nothing," she responds.

Gardevoir eyes her suspiciously.

"Well? What are we all waiting for?" Celebi asks.
"We've got a sleepover, no? Let's go back to my house!" she chimes.
"Of course, Buneary can come too if she wants,"

"Uhm... I don't know..." Buneary responds.

She had to admit, she felt a whole lot more comfortable around Zorua now, she appreciated the way how he changed... but she wasn't so sure she could spend a whole night under the same roof with him.

"You're still slightly uneasy around Zorua - that's perfectly understandable, because this is just new for you and will take time to get used to, like Zorua will take time to stop thinking I'm creepy, which is why he never pulled a prank on me - oh wait, now you think I'm creepy too..." Espurr says dejectedly, before she quiets down.

An awkward silence follows.

"... Come on, Buneary, join us! It'll be fun!" Braixen chimes positively after a while.

Buneary nervously scratches her head.
12233222221332112222113231321.title: Forgiven

choices: As the night draws on...
Time for bed...
122332222213321122221132313211.content:
"Well...Okay!" Buneary said, smiling. "It has been a little while since i've gone out and had fun!" She eagerly walked closer to the group, still eyeing Zorua a bit in Celebi's palms. He fidgeted a bit, and looked away blushing, feeling awkward before he looked back to see her head leaning in much closer to him. He nearly jumped with how startled he was and Buneary just giggled a little.

"Zorua, you're not scary at all! You're adorable!" She said, closing her eyes and smiling, intending it as a compliment. Espurr just grinned. "You should pack it up now Zorua, I don't think anyone is gonna think you're cool at the rate you're going."

"Espurr.stop.doing.that!" Zorua said through clenched teeth.

"No, I think he's cool too...a lot cooler than he ever was before." Buneary said smiling as she pet him a bit. "T-thanks." He said, puffing himself up a bit. "Do you want to hold him for a bit?" Celebi inquired, and Buneary got a sparkle in her eye. "U-um, yes. Yes I do." She said before Zorua was swapped over to the softer paws of the Buneary. He looked up at her face to see her smiling at the tiny pokemon before Braixen intervened. "Well, let's head on back then! Buneary, make sure you don't forget to lock up, okay?" She said to the younger pokemon. "I know Braixen, I won't."

-

Soon the group was walking out in the relatively quiet village. Buneary was holding Zorua close to her chest, mostly to hide him from anyone passing by, partially because she wanted to. "So...I know it might be touchy, but what DID exactly cause you to shrink him in the first place?" Buneary asked Celebi, quietly. "That...he pulled a prank on me a few days ago, and I flew off the handle on him. Believe it or not, I made him much MUCH tinier than he is now, which is how the accident happened..." Celebi still felt uncomfortable about what she had done, blessing in disguise or no.

"Smaller than this? Like a pebble?" Buneary asked. "Well...yes, then smaller." Celebi said.

"Like almost invisible to the naked eye. Boy did that mess with his head."

"Espurr!" Zorua interjected even though it was best to keep quiet. He was tired of Celebi feeling guilty over it, even if he couldn't control his own fears of the whole thing right now.

"No, Zorua, it's-"

"When you grew me back all I heard was about how sorry you were and we don't need that to sour the mood tonight, it's fine." Zorua said flatly, leaning forward a bit. Things were silent for a moment before Buneary spoke. "S-sorry for bringing it up."

"You didn't do anything wrong." Braixen said gently as they approached Celebi's house. "But is Zorua fine with this? What about his parents, don't they-" At this Celebi quickly turned to see Zorua with a completely blank and neutral expression, staring ahead at nothing. "Buneary let's...just focus on some games, okay?"

-

"I still don't know why I have to be the one doing this." Zorua said flatly, being the banker of Pokeopoly. "You're closest to the money, and besides, you need to work on your math skills." Celebi said, smiling at him. "Celebi, i'm stinking small and you make me carry the money to everyone!" He said, exasperated. The rest of them just giggled as Gardevoir gave him her money as he walked over to her. "I also think Espurr is winning because she can somehow influence this all!"

"Don't be mad that you keep landing on my properties, Zorua." She said flatly, with a blank expression. Zorua just grumbled a bit before walking back over to where the money was. "At least we're moving your piece for you." Said Celebi, smiling down at the dark pokemon, he just smiled back a bit. "Yeah...thanks..."
122332222213321122221132313211.title: Buneary joins in

choices: The next morning
During the night, Zorua wakes up...
1223322222133211222211323132112.content:
The night went on between Celebi's board games, snacks and gossipping, until the pokemon started to feel drowsy.

"Checkmate! I win!" Celebi chimes with satisfaction as her queen claimed Zorua's king.

Zorua yawns in response.
"Did you expect otherwise?" he says with resignation. Obviously Celebi would have won.
"Heh, don't be like that! You put up quite a fight, I'm impressed!" Celebi compliments.

"Finally!" Braixen huffs while stretching. She, along with the others, had been watching the match for more than an hour.

"Well... I'd say it's bedtime..." Gardevoir said as she yawned.

"It was a great match if you ask me." Espurr says.
"It wasn't that boring Zorua..."

Zorua sighs.
"You're wondering if chess is some kind of torture disguised as a game, made for people to die of boredom," Espurr smirks, earning a glare from the small fox and a weird expression from Buneary.

"Okay, now you're officially the one scaring me, Espurr," she says.

Celebi rolls her eyes as she packs up the chess board, before putting it away in her closet.
"And bedtime it is," she says, getting up from her desk where she and Zorua have been playing chess while all the others sat around them.

"Me, Espurr and Buneary are going to share the bed," Celebi explains to Zorua, who nods.

It made sense, they were smaller pokemon. Braixen and Gardevoir would never fit in the bed with them.

Celebi disappears into her closet to grab out a few spare sheets and pillows, before turning to Braixen and Gardevoir.
"As for you, you'll have to sleep on the floor, I'm afraid..." she says dejectedly.

Braixen giggles.
"We always do, Celebi," she says, taking the stuff from Celebi's paws, emulated by Gardevoir.

"Wait," Zorua suddenly says, drawing Celebi's attention.
"Where do I sleep?" he asks.

Celebi smiles at first, then she and Espurr start giggling.

"Oh, Zorua - isn't it clear?" the fairy asks, pulling Buneary and Espurr to both her sides. Buneary blushes.

Instantly, Zorua flushes red.
"No. No no no no no no n-" Espurr walks forward and grabs him, cutting him off.
"Yes." she says cheerfully while moving over the bed and leaping onto it.

Buneary leaps onto the bed as well, while Celebi hovers above it as she lifts the blankets and slides beneath them, emulated by her two friends, before pulling them back up.

"Now Zorua," Celebi says, stifling a giggle while snatching the fox from Espurr's grasp.
"Time to introduce you to your new bed~"

Before Zorua could complain, he was pushed against Celebi's chest as she cuddled up to him.
"I told you this was gonna happen~" she sang, snuggling him further, while mixed giggles resounded within the room.

"Espurr?" Gardevoir calls out as she adjusts her improvised bed and lays on it, soon emulated by Braixen.

Espurr's eyes glow as she psychically switches off the lights.

"Night everyone!" Celebi chimes, getting drowsy mutterings as a response. She giggles at one particularly faint ‘good night’.

Soon enough, everyone in the room was asleep. Everyone but Celebi, who still had one thing to do.

"I promised~" she giggles, before leaning down, nuzzling the small Zorua in her arms.
"Sleep tight, my tiny rommate~" she whispers cheerfully, before closing her eyes.

After a while, Celebi too falls asleep, joining the other pokemon in dreamland.
1223322222133211222211323132112.title: Zorua's most awkward bedtime

choices: "I don't really feel like talking about it right now."
"...I guess if you already know some of it I could get it off my chest..."
The door is opening behind them
12233222221332112222113231321122.content:
"Alright, alright, i'll hide like this!" Zorua grinned, doll sized before the 5 girls, Braixen, Espurr, Buneary, Gardevoir, and Celebi.

"Just don't wander too far, alright?" Celebi advised. "We have 15 minutes to find you, and if we can't you win, but come out right at that time." "Sure sure, you worry too much."

"She really does."

"I'M just trying to be safe you two...geez...alright, we're counting to 100. 1...2..."

Zorua dashed off, eager to prove his stuff. "Ah! Perfect!" He grinned, seeing a small knot at the base of a tree, he dashed into it, getting cozy. "Yeah, good luck finding me in here girls..."

"Pathetic." Zorua heard a voice from around him. "Wh-what are you doing here...?" An eye peeked in through the hole. "Look how miserable you are, for a bit there I thought you might amount to something, but I guess I shouldn't have gotten my hopes up, just look at you now." A dark claw reached in and snatched Zorua. There, in front of him, was a Zoruark...his dad.

"You...I got away from you." Zoruark started squeezing the little Zorua, hard. "Hmph...so this is what you're worth huh? This size...no...i'd say it's too big for you. Why don't you go to the OTHER size."

"H-huh?" All of a sudden the world shot up around Zorua, getting bigger and bigger until he was nanoscopic again. "N-no. No please." Zorua whimpered. "MUCH BETTER, I'LL LET YOU REUNITE WITH YOUR FRIENDS! PLAY NICE NOW!" The world around him shook as he found himself sailing down and down until he hit the rough ground. "U-ugh...oh no..." He saw his front left paw, broken and bleeding, he started crying.

"OKAY ZORUA, WE'RE COMING!" The world shook and shook until a green...monolith appeared before him. "ZORUA...ZORUA!?" She called, destroying his ears. "P-please...down here..."

"LET'S GO LOOK OVER HERE!" Even Buneary's small voice rocked him to the core. Soon the quakes started again and he was left alone. "N-no...not like this...not like this..."

"IT'S WHAT YOU'RE WORTH! IT'S WHAT YOU'VE ALWAYS BEEN WORTH!"

-

Zorua's eyes shot open. He wanted to feel for his paw but...he couldn't move. He was surrounded by warmth...and green. "Oh jeez...that's right...ugh, just what I needed...I need some fresh air..." Zorua mumbled, struggling against Celebi's grip. "...seriously?" He muttered, not getting any traction, he kept trying and trying, not even budging her, the most he managed to do was turn, and soon he was staring straight ahead at Espurr's head. Her eyes were wide open. "Gah!...Oh jeez...does she sleep like that?" He muttered, feeling like he was going to have a heart attack.

"...No."

"Gah!"

Espurr put one of her paws to her lips and shushed him. "Everyone is trying to sleep." She whispered. "Also...I wish you'd stop thinking i'm creepy..." She whispered more dejectedly.

"Well sorry, but you kinda nearly gave me a heart attack!" He harshly whispered back. She said nothing and looked around to make sure everyone was sleeping, then she slowly reached for Zorua. "W-what are you...?"

"Well I can't sleep, and you want fresh air. That sounds good to me and I want to talk with you anyway without the others around." Espurr whispered quite frankly as she gently, not to wake Celebi up, undid her paws and took the little dark Pokemon. She crept out of the room and shut the door as quietly as she could as she navigated to Celebi's front door, opening and closing it just as quietly as she did Celebi's bedroom door. Once outside Espurr sat down and set Zorua on her lap.

He was flushing red right about now. And then the thought crossed his mind. "Yes, I do know what you dreamed about." Zorua grumbled a bit in response. "If you don't want to talk about it I won't make you. We can just sit here for a bit." Zorua didn't respond to that and just looked out. It was very early morning, before sunrise but it was clearly around the corner. There was a slight breeze going too, it felt...nice, a bit brisk, but nice Zorua noted. He let his mind drift. "I thought I was over him...then this whole thing gets added to the mix and I get dreams with a fresh remix...what the hell." He mumbled. "You know, I said we don't have to talk about it, but if you want to talk about it we can." Espurr said frankly. "I have a question for you Espurr, you can see inside my thoughts, and tons of other pokemon's too...how long have you known about my old man?" Zorua asked, not thinking of this before.

"...A long time before today."

"Why didn't you-"

"Yes, i'm going to approach the infamous, hot headed, cruel prankster Zorua with his broken home issues and not expect that to end poorly for me." Zorua just smiled bitterly at this. "Also, I didn't like you then."

"HEY!"

"Shh...I like you now...If I didn't we wouldn't be out here." She smiled at him. "I'm serious, I won't push inside your mind for this, do you want to talk about it? If not with me then any of the girls in that room would be more than eager to listen Zorua...believe it or not, i'm not the most popular pokemon around...a lot more pokemon than you think i'm creepy...Braixen, Gardevoir, Celebi, they make friends so easily...with everyone. I always wondered why they included me in everything...Braixen's mind I can at least see, that's just how she is...Celebi and Gardevoir...they could always just block me off so I didn't know for the longest time but...that's just them. They're nice. Even you Zorua, they made friends with you. If you need someone to lend an ear or a shoulder they will, or I will." Espurr started to pet him and he felt himself flushing red again. "Sorry that I keep thinking you're creepy, i'm not...I don't..."

"I know you don't want to hurt my feelings, and you're trying to get over it."

"I thought you said you'd stay out of my head right now." He muttered.

"I didn't need to read your thoughts to figure that out."

Zorua sighed, looking out at the dark early morning again.
12233222221332112222113231321122.title: Espurr and Zorua's issues

choices: Espurr and Zorua get back in bed to sleep
Espurr notices that someone woke up, noticing them missing...
122332222213321122221132313211222.content:
Zorua stares at the darkness in front of him, while Espurr keeps petting him gently.

The little fox starts to grow more and more comfortable around the psychic type, while his opinion of her is reducing.

Espurr isn't really that creepy after all, he decides. She's proven to be sweet and caring, although quite frank when it comes to talk.

Espurr smiles. She's been secretly reading Zorua's thoughts, but decides to keep it for herself.

Then, she reads a new thought. And, like she promised, she hurries to get out of the fox's mind.

"You know, Espurr..." Zorua says as he shifts position on her lap.
"Maybe... Maybe I should tell it. I mean, you already know some of it... Maybe I should just talk about it..."

Espurr smiles.
"You would feel better if you did. And I'm pretty curious about it too. Admittedly, it wouldn't have interested me before- but now we're friends, no? Go right ahead, I'll listen to whatever you've got to say." she says.

Zorua smiles bitterly in gratitude.
"I... I don't know from where to begin..." he admits. The memory of his father still hurt him, much like his memory hurt Buneary.

The memories of that night came to him... he physically shakes thinking about it.

"You can start from where you please. Just pretend I'm clueless," Espurr suggests, manipulating Zorua so that he's facing her.

The small fox nods.
"Alright..." he responds, mentally preparing to tell his tale.
"There's something I've got to say Espurr. I didn't always live here. I used to live elsewhere, with my dad," Zorua explains.

Espurr remains silent, encouraging him to go on.

"M-My father and I had not a normal relationship... he never truly appreciated me, for no apparent reason," he starts.
"I always felt like I didn't live up to his expectations. Whatever I did wasn't enough..."

"Sometimes this kind of things happens in families..." Espurr interjected.
"I know. But he made it pretty clear to me. He was always cold to me, telling him that I was weak because I couldn't hunt like he did. ‘Hurry up and evolve’ was one of his favorite comments..." Zorua bitterly remembers.

Espurr frowns.
"Okay, that's just not nice..." she remarks.

"Yeah. I was constantly crying over his harsh words... but..." Zorua says, closing his eyes and frowning.
"One night, it all came to an end. My father was just finished scolding me, then he went hunting. That night I felt so frustrated that I made up my mind. I ran away." Zorua's eyes open up again as he stares at Espurr dejectedly.

Espurr returns his stare.
"Running from problems won't solve them, Zorua," the giantess says.

"I know. But what else should have I done?" Zorua replies, before sighing.
"I simply ran. I didn't where I was going, I didn't care where I was going. The only thing that mattered was to get as far as possible from him. I only remember that, when I stopped, I found this village." he smiles bitterly.

"And my life drastically changed - I became Zorua, the infamous, sadistic prankster of this forest." he says, grinning, quickly recalling all the pranks he's done.

"Zorua..." Espurr says, but is cut off as Zorua's grin becomes a smile as he sighs.
"And that life came to an end too when Celebi broke my leg after shrinking me too much..." he recalls.
"Y'know, I don't even know why I did all of that. It felt... great. I guess that was because I had the attention that my father never gave me..." he admits.

Espurr stares at him in silence for a while.
"Zorua." she then says.

Zorua suddenly finds himself being lifted as he's pressed into Espurr's chest fur. The giantess just hugged him.

He felt his cheeks flaring up.
"E-Espurr..."

"Forget him. Forget all he's done to you. Your life changed again. You've got a home, you've got friends, you've got a new reputation. What else could you wish for right now?" Espurr says with a sincere smile.

Zorua smiles back.
"I don't know..." he responds, before giving a yawn.
"Oh, you're still tired - so am I," Espurr says, her face returning emotionless as always.

She stands up, still holding Zorua in her hug.
"Let's go back to sleep. I'm sure you'll manage to, now," she says, slowly opening the front door of Celebi's house and walking back inside, closing the door behind herself.

She silently wanders around the dark house, before finally finding Celebi's room. She slowly opens it, before walking inside...
122332222213321122221132313211222.title: Painful memories

choices: Things go fine
Zorua ends up separated from Celebi
A group of bullies are in Zorua's forest intending to get revenge on him
1223322222133211222211323132112221.content:
Espurr silently crept back over to the bed before getting in it and opening Celebi's paws again. "Hey, you don't have to-" His whispers was cut off as the unconscious Celebi snuggled him to her chest, smiling a bit more. Espurr just giggled at this. "She must have missed you." She whispered as she laid back down to fall asleep.

Zorua just had a wry smile, but she couldn't see it since he was facing Celebi. 'I guess it could be worse...yeah...a lot worse' He thought as he drifted off to sleep again.

-

"...Up...Zorua..."

He groaned, not wanting to move.

"Zorua, come on, wake up." His eyes slowly opened as he saw the faces of all 5 of the girls towering over him. He shut his eyes again. "Just let me sleep a bit more." Buneary giggled at this and Celebi just huffed. "No one ever accomplished anything by staying in bed all day Zorua. Besides, don't you want to say goodbye?"

"What do you mean goodbye? Are you kicking me out already?" He mumbled half asleep, Celebi just rolled her eyes as Braixen laughed. "The sleepover is over Zorua, we're taking off." She said to the tiny pokemon. He sat up a bit before stretching "Oh...right." He said, almost a bit sad. "Yeah, I guess it would end huh?"

"You're surprisingly sad Zorua." Espurr said, monotone. He gave her a smile. "Yeah, I am a bit honestly. Though i'm sure i'll see you all around!" He said flashing a grin. "Definitely."

"Thanks for having us over Celebi, it was a blast. Alright Buneary, come on, i'll take you on home."

"Okay Braixen...um, thanks for inviting me Celebi...and i'm happy to say I want to see you again too Zorua." Buneary said as and Braixen exited the room.

"Thank you for coming, you're welcome back anytime Buneary!" Celebi said happily.

"I'll be heading out now as well, I have to help my sister with a few things today. You two take care, thanks for having us over." And with that Gardevoir left as well, leaving Celebi, Espurr and Zorua. Espurr fixed Zorua with a glance. He felt uneasy for a second, hoping he wouldn't tell Celebi anything. She simply smiled and nodded at him and nodded at Celebi. "I'll be taking off too. Be a good boy Zorua." She said, deadpan as ever. He scoffed at this. "I'm not gonna pull anything." He said, looking away. She simply walked away, still faced as ever.

"And then there were two..." Zorua said as he laid back down.

"Yeah, I don't think so lazy bones." Said Celebi as she picked him up. "Aw, come on..."

"Come on is right, you and I are heading out for a bit."

-

"Alright Celebi...I get that you're taking care of me."

"Mm-hmm."

"I get that I have to be this size to sneak by your mom."

"Uh-huh."

"What I don't get...is why you need the poke-doll clothes!?"

Celebi just smirked. "She's gonna find you you know, and I want it to be convincing that you're a poke-doll."

"My tail that's why you're doing this! YOU just want to mess with me!"

"We'll settle on 50/50 on that reasoning, now do you want the little sailor outfit, or the tuxedo?"

Zorua just fixed her with an annoyed glare. "Alright, sailor outfit it is!" She said happily as she went to the register.

"This is cruel, cold, and calculated torment Celebi." He said. "Oh hush, if you don't want to be discovered you should probably be quiet and stop being a baby." He knew she was right about the quiet part and he so desperately wanted to grunt in frustration. She rolled her eyes and said. "After this we'll go to your forest for a bit, alright? You can at least get a bit of exercise and not be cooped up. Does that sound good?" Zorua perked up at this.

"...deal." He whispered as she sighed. 'He's such a whiner.' Oh well, she smirked, it'll certainly be fun to play 'dress up' with him.

-

"You could restore me out here you know."

"Could, but won't. Just don't wander too far alright." Celebi said as she sat on a log, reading a book. "Yeah yeah, not like I could. I'll be around, alright?"

"And holler if anything happens." Celebi said, but he had already bolted. She sighed. "I hope he's safe...well he's made it HIS forest, he at least knows it better than anyone."
1223322222133211222211323132112221.title: End of the sleepover and a forest romp

choices: Celebi opts to let them go and get Zorua home
Celebi intends a show of power, to intimidate them out of doing this again
Celebi wants retribution
12233222221332112222113231321122213.content:
"Where is that freaking guy!?" A voice caught Celebi's ear. "Oh no...what are those two doing out here?" She thought, slightly worried. She peaked through some bushes to see a Graveler and Carnivine walking through, looking for something.

"Heh, don't worry Grav, we'll find him...and then it's payback time!" Carnivine shoke a bit with excitement. "Damn right it is...punk scaring us off...trying to ruin our rep...he'll get his." The Graveler muttered in excitement and Celebi instantly shot off like a bullet to find Zorua.

"Zorua! we have to go, now!" She said as she searched in her area and around, avoiding the attention of the other two pokemon. Those two were nasty with a capital N. If Zorua was infamous in his forest then they were infamous in the village itself, constantly stealing from younger or weaker pokemon, defacing property, and generally being public nuisance's and if they found Zorua in his state...she shivered a bit. 'No, i'll find him and we'll take off and that'll be-'

"Hey, I just saw something moving Grav, heh, it looked really tiny though."

"And why should I care?"

"Because it looked, heh heh, like Zorua."

Celebi's heart skipped a beat as she heard that in the distance and she flew as fast as she could towards them only to find...Zorua being dangled by a paw from one of Graveler's hands. "O-ow...look, if this is about last week i'm sorry for scaring ya off like that. You kinda woke me up an-"

"Shut up! I don't know what happened to you to make ya so tiny, but we're gonna-"

"Give.Him.To.Me.Now." Celebi arrived on the scene and drew their attention to her. She had a fierce look in her eyes. "Celebi...the bookworm? Did you do this to him? HAHAHA! Nice! Well we'll be taking care of him from here, why don't you go find a nice little book to read girlie." Graveler said as he started to twirl Zorua around by his paw, causing him to yelp. Celebi's glare only narrowed.

"I will give you exactly one chance to hand him over before I TAKE him back." She said, coldly calm.

"H-heh, maybe we should listen to her Grav...I don't want to tangle with a mystic." Graveler just narrowed his eyes. "Oh please, she won't do anything, it's a bluff! No way i'm giving up this perfect catch, I got plenty to do with little Zorua here." He grinned as he squeezed the little dark pokemon's paw a bit.

The ground shook a bit as a psychic aura surrounded a tree and it started to life from the ground. Celebi was livid, Graveler gritted his teeth and glared back at her. "Alright, fine ya nerd! Let me confer with my bud here, don't go off the handle!" Graveler said as the shaking stopped and Celebi silently returned his glare. Zorua was looking like he was hurting and dazed pretty bad and she wanted to get him out of there as soon as possible. Graveler and Carnivine huddled a bit, whispering among themselves before they started giggling.

"Alright girlie, you can have him. You got off light Zorua...if I were you i'd stick to your girlfriend...like...glue!" Graveler said as he tossed him into the air and Carnivine used a vine whip to smack him right into Celebi's direction, causing him to yipe in pain again.

"ZORUA!" Celebi panicked as she flew forward to catch him. The other two were running away now, laughing. "Nice shot Carn!"

"Heh, thanks!"

Celebi gritted her teeth, looking at Zorua, he had a large welt on his side where he was hit with the vine, and his paw looked pretty rough too. "N-nothing's broken Celi, i'll be fine, okay? T-they aren't worth it, remember when you went overboard with me?" Zorua said, trying to sway Celebi from doing anything. "That's different! You don't know how bad those two are Zorua, they're worse than you ever were!" She said harshly, making Zorua wince. "Celebi, let's just go home, okay?" He said.
12233222221332112222113231321122213.title: Caught by punks

choices: "That's it, you two take care...i'll go get the girls, we'll get those two."
"Come on, I have some stuff that may at least help the pain at my place."
"Okay, we're going to Buneary's, clear the air and let you rest."
122332222213321122221132313211222131.content:
Celebi looked from the two pokemon getting further and further away in the distance to Zorua in her paws. 'Tch...those two...another time' She thought. This was not over, but she relented, partially because of Zorua's condition, and his request as well, she gently touched his welt and he winced causing her to back off, she then checked his paw only for him to yelp a little too. Not broken, but possibly a sprain or twisted. "I can heal you Zorua..." She said before he shook his head. "Doesn't that take a whole lot out of you? You've already done that for me once recently, this will heal naturally..." He said and she bit her lip. "But Zorua..."

He looked at his own paw. "It'll be fine, I just need to avoid running for a bit right? Shouldn't be too hard for me to do." Celebi silently nodded as she grabbed the bag with the pokedoll clothes in it and looked inside, she had some paper lining in there with the clothes so he could rest up in there. "I'm putting you in my bag while we head back through the village, okay?" She said gently as she lowered him in, he said nothing and instead just leaned down against the paper. It felt odd to lay on, but it was at least a relief to rest against something. "Thanks" he muttered before she nodded and lifted the bag up, and the gentle sway of it started to lull him.

After a few minutes of this Zorua thought he'd nod off before he heard a familiar voice. "Oh, Celi! What's up? Funny seeing you so soon!"

Braixen was enthusiastically waving towards the little green pokemon cradling a book with the small bag slung under her shoulder. Braixen, with a hop in her step got closer. "So, what are you doing out and about, where's the squirt?" She grinned and Celebi looked down before saying. "Let's go somewhere quiet, okay?" Braixen noted her serious expression and her face changed to match. "Um...sure." She said nodding as Celebi led her to a small secluded alley way

-

"They did WHAT!? THOSE! THOSE-"

"It's just what it is Braixen, you'd have done it to me too last night." Zorua stated simply from Braixen's paws, still trying to get it off of them being attacked. Braixen flushed red and hung her head before she looked back fiercely. "That's different! Those two are always jerks! You must've been on some jerk wavelength with them at one time right? I bet you didn't even do anything to them!"

"Actually I did....last week." Zorua nodded and looked down. Celebi reached over to pet his back and said gently. "So what was it then...? I don't think I have it in my book on you." She said and Zorua gulped. "Yeah, okay, i'll tell you..." He murmured.

-LAST WEEK-

"Heh, nice get Grav, c-can I have one?" Said Carnivine, as he looked to his larger friend who had a bag of chocolate bon-bons. "Hmph...maybe when we sit down, if there's any left." He said as he ate another one and Carnivine grinned. "Somewhere to sit huh? What about over-"

*CRUNCH*

They both stopped as they heard something from the brush. "Huh? What's-"

*CRUNCH*

"...check it out Carn." Graveller said simply, not wanting to be bothered to look. "Um...heh, sure thing Grav!" He said as he went to look in the brush, and there, looking back at him...was a startled looking Zorua with a bag of potato chips, mid chew. He tilted his head as he looked at the Carnivine, and the Carnivine eyes his bag of chips. "Heh, hey Grav, we have more food over here! This is that weirdo Zorua's forest right? He's over here lazily munching on some chips!" Soon the Graveller entered the brush and smirked at the small dark pokemon. "So...this is your forest huh? Well runt, your forest is in MY village, now I don't know you and you don't know me so i'll go easy on ya and assume you don't know about my toll, hand over the chips and we'll consider things even!" He said as he loomed over Zorua. Zorua looked unimpressed and uninterested until he saw the bon bon bag and grinned before putting on a look of fake fear.

"Oh~ I see, SO sorry about that. I'll ABSOLUTELY make this right this moment!" Zorua said as he stood up and picked the bag up in his mouth, approaching the bigger pokemon slowly. Graveller smirked holding his hand out. "That's right, hand it over and we'll be on our w-" At this Zorua made his move as he dashed to Graveller's side and got the bon bon bag in his mouth as well. "Mater Mhumpsh!" Zorua managed to get out with his mouth full of both bags he dashed off.

"GRR! YOU'RE DEAD CHUMP!" Graveller yelled as he chased after him, Carnivine following close behind, they were running up a hill only to find...a boulder was chasing them down. "D-did he roll a boulder down towards us!?" Carnivine squeaked out as he turned around to run in the opposite direction, Graveller screamed as well and turned tail. "Come on, we're out of here!" Them unaware of the laughing Zorua at the top of the hill sitting with the two bags. "It's a fake you losers~" He said smugly as he eyed his prize with glee and he put a bon bon in his mouth. "MMM, so good!" He squealed with joy.

-NOW-

"So wait, they threatened you an-wait a minute, what day was this?" Braixen said, as if she realized something. "I dunno, it was like a week ago...I don't keep time well." He shrugged before she thought something. "Those two jerks filched a bag of bon bons I gave to Buneary for her birthday last week."

"What, were those the-!? Braixen, I am so sorry, I gotta-" Zorua was panicked for a bit before she gently pet him. "How were you to know? It's not your fault, and I replaced them later...still, THAT'S all you did to them, and they did that to you, that's-"

"They were gonna do worse, they only didn't because I got there in time, Zorua, they were probably going to maim you or..."

Things went silent before Braixen handed Zorua gently back to Celebi and cleared her throat.
122332222213321122221132313211222131.title: Familiar face and a meeting of the jerks

choices: "You've change a lot." Gardevoir says with s sincere smile
"Celebi or Espurr?" Gardevoir ask with a smirk.
1223322222133211222211323132112222.content:
As the small psychic pokemon opens the door as quietly as she could, Espurr notices on of the sleeping makeshift sleeping bags were empty, Gardevoir. Before she could wonder, a small noise could be heard in Celebi's kitchen.

"Whose exactly up at this time?" Zorua ask as he didn't saw that Gardevoir's missing from the room. Espurr quietlys heads to were kitchen and there she sees's Gardevoir making herself a snack. Trying to be quiet as the pokemon were, Gardevoir knew she has eyes watching her.

"I take it you two can't sleep?" Gardevoir says, not even looking at the corner where Espurr and Zorua were at as she appears to be munching on a sandwhich. Both pokemon squeal a bit as they weren't expecting for her to easily spot them.

"Sorry, Zorua wanted to...." Espurr was going to mention what Zorua has told her about his father, but knew to stop herself to before she harms the friendship that they made already, "...discuss some stuff with me." Zorua smiles as he was glad that Espurr kept what he said to himself as he's not ready to discuss his relationship with his father with everyone just yet.

"Keeping it a secret this time, now I'm a little curious." Gardevoir says with a smirk as she knows Espurr's habit of blurting out things pokemon wanted to keep to themself. Even Espurr gave a nervous smile as she doesn't even need to read Gardevoir's mind to know she's thinking the same thing of her bad habit. "Well, I won't ask what it is, but if you're not too tire Zorua, can i talk to you a bit?"

Zorua was surprise that Gardevoir would want to tall to him. What exactly she wants to talk about, he thought

"What do you want to talk about with him?" Espurr asks, not looking down to see Zorua giving her a look as he can't tell if she's reading his mind or not.

"Oh, don't worry about it Espurr, i just want to discuss something with him." Gardevoir says as she levitates Zorua to her. Epsurr and especially Zorua were caught off guard that they didn't know that Zorua was being levitated towards Zorua until he was on the table. "You must be tired Espurr, you go back to sleep."


Espurr stares at Gardevoir as she wonders what exactly the tall pokemon is going to discuss. "....ok, good night." Espurr says as she disappears behind the corner.

"You're still here." Gardevoir says as she knows the nosey pokemon very well. What she doesn't see is Espurr pouting a bit as she knows Gardevoir won't talk unless she leaves. Feeling a little dejected of not being able to hear the two pokemon talk, she just heads back to bed.

"....nice to see that you gotten use to Espurr's antics." Gardevoir says as she waited to make sure Espurr has gone to bed.

"You mean her constantly reading my mind? I won't say I have gotten use to her doing that, but she's been very nice that i won't chew her out.... just get annoyed when she does it in front of my face." Zorua says as he hears Gardevoir giggling a bit.

"Yeah, its pretty much that habit why other pokemons usually steer clear from Espurr. The other girls and I don't mind it too much, especially since Celebi and I know how to block her out. But its nice to see someone is willing to discuss things with her." Gardevoir says as she takes a bit from the side of the sandwhich she has bitten yet and offers it to Zorua.

"Thanks." Zorua says as he does feel a little hunrgy and begans to munch on it. He then remembers Gardevoir wanting to discuss something. "So what exactly you want to talk about that you didn't want to discuss it in front of Espurr."

Gardevoir smiles as she takes another bite of her sandwich before saying what she wanted to say.
1223322222133211222211323132112222.title: Getting to know another

choices: "Celebi!"
"Espurr!"
"Braixen!" Wait what!?
12233222221332112222113231321122222.content:
"..W-what?" Zorua gulped. Gardevoir just smirked a bit more and leaned in close to the little dark pokemon, whispering this time. "Celebi...or Espurr?" She said, with a cat like grin. Zorua wanted to be anywhere but where he was at the moment and was about to turn tail when Gardevoir folded her arms around him, essentially sealing any exit he had. She giggled.

"It's just a simple question Zorua, though your reaction makes me think that you DO know exactly what i'm asking, AND you have an answer."

"..." Zorua opted for silence. 'I'm safe, she can't get into my noggin like Espurr. I can totally wait her out.' Gardevoir just pouted. "Oh come on, it isn't like i'll say anything. Not that it would matter anyway, Espurr will find out sooner or later." Gardevoir left that statement to linger with a smirk and Zorua's eyes became pinpricks. "You know I AM happy for Espurr, she hasn't made many friends, especially ones that are boys. They don't care for her and honestly she's quite picky, and she may show it weird but she's taken a real SHINE to you." Gardevoir teased. Zorua felt his face flushing.

"Celebi on the other hand has the opposite issue, she's so popular and sweet, boys are tripping over themselves to get with her, but she can be a bit oblivious and picky herself and her mom is QUITE overprotective." Gardevoir continued and Zorua at this point was burying his head in his paws.

"Is this REALLY necessary!?" He asked. "Come on, satiate my curiousity, I want to know." She leaned her head in close, and Zorua flushed redder than he ever has. Why the heck was this going on!? And now that Zorua's mind was on it he couldn't help but deny that he too had taken a shine to one of them.

He gulped. "PROMISE you won't tell."
