Gardevoir closed her eyes and put a hand to her chest. "Promise." She said.

F-fine, yeah...I do like one of the girls..." He muttered. He shut his eyes. "Yeah! I like..."
12233222221332112222113231321122222.title: Which one, which one?

choices: A pair of big, blue eyes. Celebi was listening!
A bushy, orange tail. Braixen was listening!
...Nothing?
122332222213321122221132313211222221.content:
"I like Celebi!" Zorua exclaimed, feeling his cheeks burning hot as he shut his eyes.

It was true.

Celebi had meant to punish him days ago. But when she took things too far, she went from mischievous to kind in a matter of seconds.

The fairy had saved him from death, fixed his leg, gave him a new life and a new home, along with restoring his reputation and letting him make some friends.

Celebi was literally the best thing that happened to him since he came to the village.

Zorua slowly opens his eyes again, noticing Gardevoir smirking down at him.
"Celebi, huh?" she says as she starts giggling.
"That's... understandable though. She's done much for you..." she remarks.

"That's right... that's why... I really like her..." Zorua sheepishly blurts out, blushing even more as he gazes away.

Gardevoir giggles again.
"You know, seeing the sadistic prankster that was Zorua blushing - that's ado-" Gardevoir stops in the middle of her own sentence, her smile changing into a focused expression.

"... Espurr." she says, sensing the smaller psychic type outside of the door.

Which slowly opens, letting Espurr come in, her face contorted into a dejected look.

"E-Espurr..." Zorua stutters.

Was she reading his thoughts the whole time?!

"... Yes." she says, looking straight at the little dark type, those big, endless, lilac eyes of hers staring into his soul.

"I thought you said you would have left us alone..." Gardevoir scolds, annoyed.
"In fact - I was reading Zorua's thoughts from Celebi's room." Espurr quietly responds.
"That's not what I meant by ‘alone’"

Espurr doesn't respond, her gaze fixed on Zorua, who shrinks back in Gardevoir's grip.

Arceus, was this situation embarrassing. Gardevoir and Zorua have been talking about who Zorua liked the most, Celebi or Espurr, who, according to what Gardevoir said, took a shine to the small fox.

And now, there she was, revealing that she was actually reading his mind for the whole time. She knew about Zorua's confession. She knew Zorua liked Celebi.

"... Don't be sorry for me, Zorua," Espurr speaks up in her monotone, quiet voice. She slowly moves over Gardevoir, gently picking Zorua from her, holding him in front of her face.

"I can't change the way you feel, and if you like Celebi more than me, who am I to judge? Although you finally stopped thinking I'm creepy, which I appreciate a lot - oh, don't worry, I won't tell Celebi about it, because she might just crush you in a fit of affection - not to mention what would happen if her mother found out about you..." Espurr says, hard to follow as usual.

"Espurr... I didn't really get the gist..." Zorua responds.

The psychic type smiles.
"Still friends. Won't tell." she clarifies, closing her eyes and pulling Zorua in a hug.

The fox's cheeks begin to flare up. Regardless, he smiles brightly as he hugs Espurr back.

"Aw..." Gardevoir chimes as she watches the scene, thinking it's adorable. Espurr moves Zorua upwards, starting to rub him against her cheek as she happily nuzzles him.

But Espurr abruptly stops. Her eyes open up, and she fixes them on the door.

It's ajar.

Gardevoir and Zorua's eyes widened as they noticed it too. And there, in the darkness of the kitchen, they managed to notice...
122332222213321122221132313211222221.title: Zorua's awkward confession

choices: ... smiling brightly, "Okay Zorua, you have a chance!"
... smiling dejectedly, "I'm sorry Zorua... I don't think it'd work..."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211.content:
There, in the darkness of the kitchen, the trio noticed a pair of large blue eyes peering inside. And the only ones with blue eyes in that house were Zorua himself and...

Noticing that she was discovered, Celebi quietly opens the door and comes inside the kitchen, blushing while looking at Zorua intently.

"... I woke up... you three were missing..." she mumbles to herself, only Zorua able to hear her.

Espurr noticed that she could actually read Celebi's mind - she was far too shocked to even think of blocking her off.

The fairy's mind was racing.

"... You were listening..." Espurr points out, while Gardevoir's eyes start sparkling with excitement as she eyes Zorua, who blushes.

He eyes Celebi with embarrassment, noticing her staring back at him with the same blush, waiting for him to say anything.

"Celebi..." he mumbles, before hastily formulating an excuse.
"This... this is a dream Celebi... you're still sleeping." he meekly attempts.

Celebi stares at him.
"... No. I'm wide awake. D'you know how dumb that sounds?" she remarks.

Zorua shrugs.
"Had to try." he responds.

Celebi just stares at him. Then, her feet lift off the ground as she flies towards the small dark type, scooping him up before turning around to face Espurr and Gardevoir.

"... One minute." she says, making sure to block Espurr off before flying out of the front door, closing it behind herself.

Then, the fairy sat down, looking at the small dark type in her paws.

The same dark type who she accidentally hurt days ago. The same dark who said she was her best friend. The same dark type who just confessed his feelings towards her.

Zorua stared at the fairy, blushing furiously.
"Celebi-" was all he could say, before the fairy hugged him to her chest tightly... too tightly.

Zorua soon found himself running out of breath as the fairy squeezed the air out of his lungs.

Celebi started fidgeting in excitement as she hugged him. Then, she looked down at him, smirking.
"Say it."

Zorua blushes while struggling in her grip, wishing that he could just disappear right there and then. In response, Celebi hugs harder.
"Say it!" she repeats.

Zorua sighs, resigned to the hard reality. Celebi heard it all.
"I... I like you." he admits, blushing.

Celebi laughs gleefully.

"I... You've done so much for me... it was inevitable..." he says.

Celebi smiles brightly.
"Zorua." she says with a beaming smile.

The small fox looks up at her.

Only to suddenly find her face over his, her lips touching his forehead.

At this point, Zorua believed that he could melt at any moment. He felt like he was on fire as Celebi kissed him for good thirty seconds, before pulling off.

"That's. So. Cute!"

The dark type shrank back on her paws.
"S-So... Celebi?" he asked, waiting for any kind of response that would finally put an end to this torment... although he definitely would have preferred if Celebi accepted his feelings for her.

The fairy blushed furiously, understanding that now she had to respond to Zorua.

All of sudden, she felt confused. Zorua had feelings for her, but did she have feelings for him? Sure, since he changed she took a liking to him, but could be that even considered a crush... or even love?

What if his nature came back? Would she still like him then?

Plus, if her mother found out about this situation, she'd be dead.

...

Her mind flashes with images of herself with the tiny Zorua sleeping on her pillow.

Then the days he spent under her care.

Then herself offering him to live with her.

Then her cuddling him.

Zorua admitting his feelings for her.

And last, herself kissing him just a few minutes ago.

All those things... would she have done them if she didn't like him back...? Perhaps, she could really give the tiny fox a chance... a chance to be with her...

Zorua looked at the green fairy, his heart beating rather slowly as he waited for her response.

Finally, having thought long enough, Celebi looked back at him...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211.title: An awkward moment between a fox and a fairy

choices: "Let's enjoy the morning together then."
"Time to wake up the others."
"Back to sleep Zorua~" She said as she reached for him.
12233222221332112222113231321122222111.content:
Sure, guys at the school had said they liked her, or asked her out a few times. She never really went for it though, her mom would flip if she had ever found out and...Celebi never really liked anyone that way. Zorua though...DID she like him? She had to admit that she had taken a shine to him that she never would have expected, but...well, maybe she could give him a chance. He was living with her after all. Yeah!

She smiled back at him before nodding. "I'll give you a chance Zorua!" She said before he felt his heart skip a beat. "R-really!?" He asked, almost ready to do a flip in her paws before she nodded again and held him up to her face. "Really." She smiled before pecking him on the forehead again.

"Hehe..." He was on cloud 9 right now, but suddenly she stood up hugging him again and yawning. "But right now, we need to get back to bed. So do you two." She said to the not as discreet as they'd hoped pair of eyes from the doorway. They peaked out a bit more with Gardevoir giving a thumbs up with sparkles in her eyes. Celebi rolled her eyes. "Alright, let's go." She started for the door, with the group heading back to her room to see Buneary sound asleep and hearing Braixen snoring. Celebi and Espurr climbed into bed before Zorua found himself being hugged hard to Celebi's cheek, he struggled a bit before she giggled. "You can't fight it~" She said as she shut her eyes, nodding off and Espurr had done the same, Gardevoir was sitting up from the floor though and looking at Celebi and Zorua before she smiled and laid back down herself.

Zorua tried a bit more, but it was in vain he realized so he opted to just shut his eyes and let sleep take him.

-

When Zorua woke up he found he was actually the first up, he looked around to see cracks of sunlight creeping into Celebi's room from her window. "Wow, not usually an early riser..." He thought, but he realized his paw had fallen asleep. He tried to move it but found himself pinned and all he got in response was Celebi smacking her lips and sighing before...nothing. He sighed. "This can't go on." He thought before he nudged as hard as he could muster into her cheek before she hazily opened her eyes and yawned. "Oh...Zorua..." She said sleepily as he felt her grip loosen and he landed on her pillow. He stood up, shaking his paw to get blood circulating in it again and sighed. She was smiling sleepily at him before she looked around. "Oh, we're the first up..."
12233222221332112222113231321122222111.title: With Celebi

choices: "We're haging out for a while." she responded
"I've got a few books to read," she giggled, "Guess you're joining me."
122332222213321122221132313211222221113.content:
"Yeah... we're the first up..." Zorua confirmed while busily shaking his front paw, desperately trying to wake it up.

Celebi smiled, one of her paws extending as she reached for him. Looking down at his own paw, Zorua didn't notice.

Just when he managed to regain a bit of sensibility in his paw, he was grabbed by the giant fairy, who dragged him closer.
"Well~ Back to sleep zorua~" she drowsily muttered as she yawned again.

"N-No, wait! I just woke-" he was cut off by a giggle.
"Don't care." Celebi simply stated while moving the small Zorua back to her cheek.

"W-Wait! At least not there!" he complained, waving his paws.

Celebi stopped to smile down at him.
"Mhh~" she merrily chirped as she got another idea.
"Okay Zorua. I've got a better place for you."

Before the fox got the chance to question her, she lowered him towards her chest and snuggled him to her, pinning him down.

Zorua blushed, finding himself nestled in between Celebi's paws and her chest.
"See you later~" the fairy sang while leaning down, pecking the small fox.

He sighed in resignation. He accepted that all when he confessed his feelings to Celebi, he guessed.

The green pokemon rested her head against Zorua's whole body.
"Much better~" she said, yawning again before her eyes closed.

Zorua sighed as he hugged back.

Soon, Celebi started snoozing, before falling into deep sleep again, lovingly cuddling Zorua.

The small fox repeatedly tried to shake off the blush from his face, but his attempts turned out to be for naught. So, giving up to the situation, Zorua closed his eyes and leaned his head against the fairy's chest.

At this point, sleep was the only thing that could bring him away from that embarassing situation.

Luckily, Zorua DID fall asleep rather quickly as he joined Celebi, and everyone else inside of the room in dreamland.

--

"Rise and shine Zorua!"

Zorua's sleep was bothered by a cheery voice, which he promptly ignored to keep on sleeping.

"Wake up Zorua!"

He groaned in his sleep as he rolled on his side.

"He's adorably stubborn~" someone else chimed. Someone snickered.

"Hehe, I wonder what happens if I pull this~"
"Brai-"

Zorua felt something pulling his tail and woke up instantly, his hind legs rising and kicking whatever dared to interrupt his sleep.

"What's the big-" he said irritably as he turned around, noticing five giantesses staring down at him, Braixen snickering to herself.

"About time you little sleepyhead~" Celebi sang cheerfully as she scooped him up, hugging him.

Zorua blushed, but let the fairy hug him. Gardevoir looked at him with sparkling eyes.

"... So? What's going on?" the tiny fox asked, before yawning.

"It's over, squirt... the sleepover I mean," Braixen chimed in.
"And it's time for us to leave..." Espurr said, smirking at him.

"And you two are going to be all alone~"

Zorua blushed along with Celebi.

Buneary hopped in front of Celebi, grabbing Zorua from her and hugging him to her chest.
"Bye Zorua~" she sang, now fully comfortable around the dark fox.

The bunny pokemon then handed him back to Celebi. Only for him to be snatched by Gardevoir.
"See you around Zorua~" she said with a smile, before Espurr leaped up and snatched him.

The psychic type turned around.
"See you soon." she said, giving a small smile. Then, with discretion, Espurr pecked his cheek with an imperceptible movement, making him blush.
"And good luck to you both."

A blushing Zorua was handed back to Celebi.

"Bye squirt. And thanks for having us over Celebi," Braixen said while grabbing Buneary by her paw.

The four girls then headed out of the bedroom, Celebi following with a smile until they arrived to the front door and exited.

Celebi quietly closed the door, before turning her attention to Zorua, who was scratching his ears with his hind leg.
"And now that's settled... see you later..." he said, laying down on Celebi's paws and closing his eyes.

He heard a quiet giggle, and soon felt a pair of large lips pressing against his cheek, causing him to perk up again.

"Don't even think about it - today we're spending time together, whether you want it or not~" she said, beaming.

Zorua huffed.
"Yeah yeah, fine," he responded while standing on all fours again.
"What do you have in mind?"
122332222213321122221132313211222221113.title: Returning to sleep

choices: "Okay Zorua, let's play" Celebi responds
"Go ahead... I'll join you later." Celebi responds
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"Knowing your opinion about books..." Celebi starts.
"Next idea please." Zorua interrupts.

Celebi rolls her eyes.
"... I think hanging out together would be a great idea," she says.

Zorua ponders the suggestion for less than a second.
"Sounds good!" he says, causing the fairy to giggle.

"Okay then!" Celebi chimes as she walks back into her room, grabbing a book.
"I'm still bringing one though." she says.

Then, the fairy moved to the front door and exited the house, locking the door behind herself.

Sunshine hit both her and her tiny roomie/boyfriend.

Zorua stretches on her paw.
"Man... what a great day..." he says, yawning.
"So? What's the plan?" he then asks.

Celebi smiles.
"Well, first we go shopping - I bet you'll look lovely with pokedoll clothes~" she says, earning a glare from Zorua.

"... I'm not getting anywhere near pokedoll clothes." he firmly states, stomping a paw for good measure, only causing Celebi to think how adorable he looked when disappointed.

"That's debatable~" Celebi sang.
"... We'll also get some snacks, before heading somewhere quiet. That way, I get to read in peace and you get to exercise. Sounds good?" she explains.

"... Aside from the pokedoll clothes part, yes." Zorua responds as Celebi starts to walk away from her home.

"We'll see about that~"

--

"I said-"

"Keep quiet you whiner! And stand still!" Celebi giggles to a struggling Zorua as she tries to tie a tiny blue bow around his neck. She's been doing this for several minutes already and Zorua showed no signs of wanting to give up and let her tie the small bow.

"No! I don't want it!" Zorua snaps back, desperately trying to avoid the giant fairy's paws.

Celebi giggles.
"You're just making things harder - we don't want someone hearing you, do we?" she says, quickly glancing back at the other clients in the shop. Luckily, Zorua is tiny enough and she's pretty much whispering so that no one can possibly hear them.

"You'll have to knock me out." Zorua coldly replies while avoiding the blue piece of fabric again.

"You're supposed to be a lifeless pokedoll, remember?" Celebi responds.
"Seriously, if you have to avoid my mother, you have to look like a pokedoll - and trust me, mom is way more suspicious than I'll ever be."

Zorua huffs.
"You have a real problem, lady!" he cries.
"So do you, and you've got to deal with it." Celebi responds, right before getting an idea.

An impossibly big smile forms on her face as she looks down at Zorua.

Then, without warning, she lowers her head, her lips touching Zorua's fur, sending him into a state of deep embarrassment.

The small fox's eyes shrink as he collapses on his side.

And Celebi is quick to tie the bow around his neck, before she rises to her full height again, staring at Zorua with a paw over her mouth.

"You're adorable with that!" she comments, picking him up.

Zorua recovers a bit and blushes in humiliation. He sighs in defeat.

Celebi giggles again, her free paw gently removing the bow.
"We're definitely coming back later on~" she sings.
"In the meantime, I'll take this~"

Zorua sighs.

--

"Seriously, I'm going to burn that thing." Zorua says from Celebi's chest as she walks towards an unknown destination, a bag with the bow she bought, another one with snacks and a book floating behind her.

Celebi giggles.
"Whine whine whine. That's all you do." she remarks teasingly.

"Only around you."

Celebi rolls her eyes.
"Yeah, whatever you say. I bet our next destination will cheer you up~" she says.

Zorua perks up as he notices where she is headed.

His forest.

Celebi leaves the village and makes her way into the forest, quietly sitting on a log, her bags landing on the ground.

She looks at Zorua and gently lets him down on the ground.
"Nobody ever comes here..." she remarks.

Zorua snickers.
"Do you blame 'em? I'm the worst scoundrel around!" he proudly states while striking a pose.

Celebi laughs.
"The worst scoundrel around, who is now a cute little whiner in my hands~" she says playfully, blowing Zorua a kiss.

He blushes.
"... Right..."

"Now, you do whatever you want while I read. Just... Don't wander off too far." she warns, setting the book on her lap and opening it, ready to read.

"Wait!" Zorua complains.
"Why don't we play together? It's a nice day, do you really want to waste it on with a book?" he asks.

Celebi looks at him, offended by the statement.
"I'll have you know that books are the best source of entertainment you'll ever find!" she responds, tapping her book with a paw.

"I doubt that." Zorua says with a shrug.
"Come on - let's play! We've got a moment alone, do you want to let it go?" he asks.

"Hmm." Celebi responds. The last statement hit her - it was true. If the two of them have to bond, what better moment than this?

The fairy sighs.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: An outdoor day

choices: Celebi wins
Zorua wins
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"Alright, fine Zorua, we can play, what did you have in mind?" She said as she set her book down on the log beside her. The tiny pokemon just grinned up at her. "I want a rematch!" Celebi looked perplexed for a second before realization struck her.

"Oh, when I caught and shrunk you." She said simply and he looked determined as he nodded. "That's right! You're the only black mark on my record! I've evaded everyone else successfully but you! I demand a rematch!" He said as she looked up at the sky, thinking.

"...Okay Zorua, you're on." She said as she got a grin on her face. Her eyes began to glow as Zorua found the world around him shrinking. He grew up and up until soon enough he was his standard height, looking at a smiling Zorua. He grinned. "That's more like it! Alright! No way you're gonna beat me this time!" He said as he got ready to take off before a psychic grip stopped him. "Seeing as how I can do this to you, let's make things a bit more...even. And interesting." She said as she got in his face, him unable to move. She smiled as she pecked him on the cheek and he noted that it wasn't quite the same experience as when her lips took up his whole cheek. "Now...I'll try to pursue you, i'll use everything I can except for out and out psychically gripping you like this, and I have to tag you to win!" She said and he nodded. "In return, no illusions." He hesitated slightly, but eventually nodded. "Okay, deal, I still know this forest like the back of my paw Celebi!" He said. "Oh, if you're so sure then I wonder if you'd want to bet on it?" She said as she got an oddly devious grin.

"Um...what did you have in mind?" He said as she circled him. "What would you say to if you win i'll buy you something that you want...within reason of course." She said and he immediately got excited at this prospect. "Alright! Yes! hickory potato chips and lime soda pop!" He said nodding. Those were his favorite snacks to score from passing pokemon, by a landslide. Celebi gave him an odd look. "Really? That stuff is junk Zorua." She said and he looked taken aback. "Well with how many sweets you get can you really throw shade at me for that?" He said as she just shrugged. "Okay, fine, sure. If you win i'll get a bag of hickory chips and a bottle of lime soda pop. That stuff would certainly last you a while at such a tiny size." She said, encouraging him further with this offer. He nodded at this. This was sounding better and better by the minute except..."Okay Celebi, what happens if YOU win?" He asked with trepidation and her devious grin returned. "Simple my dear little Zorua~" She said as she hovered over to her bag and pulled out the tiny blue bow. "You wear this, whenever I want, no whining about it, AND I get to pick another pokedoll item to accessorize you with, also with no whining~" His eyes widened and his pupils shrunk to pinpricks.

"Well Zorua? Interested?" She asked and he started to shake his head before she said it. "So the undefeated fearsome Zorua will admit defeat in his own forest then?" And he stopped shaking his head. He gave her a weary look before he nodded his head. "Okay Celebi, i'll show you why this is MY forest." He said with a grin and her psychic grip on him released. "If I lose sight of you and give up on finding you, or give up on chasing you, then you win. If I tag you, then I win. Got it?" He nodded and she nodded back. "I'll give you a 5 second head start Zorua."

And at that he took off, her counting down before she pursued him as well.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: The rematch

choices: "We are heading home now." Celebi responds
"I played your game... Now you've got to play mine!" Celebi responds
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"Five."

Celebi's wings start flapping as she takes flight and starts chasing Zorua.

The fox quickly glances backwards, noticing Celebi flying in his direction.
"Hey - no fair!" he shouts while running.
"‘I'll everything I can except psychic gripping’" Celebi recalls, smiling deviously.
"That means I can also shrink you again." she adds.

Zorua grits his teeth... before his expression rises into a grin. Everything but illusions...

Celebi hears Zorua snickering as he runs in front of her. She doesn't let him of her sight.

But, just as she attempts to shrink him again, she discovers him stopping on his tracks and rising himself on his hind legs, before slamming his forelegs on the ground.

For a moment, a circle of darkness forms around the fox, before a dark wave spreads across the forest.

Startled, Celebi floats back, waiting until the Night Daze fades.

And she takes notice that Zorua is gone. She huffs, thinking that Zorua just cheated... before remembering that his only restriction was him not using illusions.

The fairy sighs.

--

Zorua snickered.

He had already won.

He runs deeper into the forest.

Of course, as a prankster, Zorua had others chasing him down into his forests, and quite a few pokemon didn't give up easily.

But no one ever got him.

The forest was, in fact, full of traps Zorua himself put up. But Celebi... it wasn't the case, he decided. So he simply decided to hide.

He snickers again. He has a good advantage on Celebi now, so he jumps into one particular bush in front of a rather large tree.

Hidden from Celebi's eyesight by the bush, Zorua eyes the small hole in front of him with glee.

Unbeknownst to Celebi - and to everyone but him - that hole leads to a small, underground cave he found long ago. That place is where he keeps all his treasures.

All his precious 'tools' - whoopie cushions, balloons he'd fill with water or paint to throw at other pokemon, food...

Zorua snickers again. There's no way Celebi would ever find him there. So, without second thinking, the fox jumps into the hole.

--

Celebi kept searching Zorua for a while more.

She lost sight of him when he used Night Daze, and she wasn't able to find him anywhere!

"No wonder I'm the only one who ever got him..." she sighs.
"Even though I kinda blew him up back then..." she adds, now fully believing about Zorua's evading skills and starting to think that she caught him by pure luck the last time.

Seriously, it was like he was gone!

Celebi sighed again as she sat in front of a large tree. She looked around dejectedly, before saying,
"Okay Zorua! I give up! You win!"

Immediately after, a bush next to her started rustling, before a snickering Zorua jumped out of it and looking at her.

"Told ya, Celi!"

--

"I could give you a rematch y'know..." Zorua merrily says from Celebi's lap while munching on a few hickory chips.

The fairy looks away from her book to glare down at him.

Zorua stops before grabbing another bite to look up at the frowning time traveler.
"Hey! Hiding was something I could do!" he remarks.

"Not underground!" Celebi snaps back.

"You didn't mention that." Zorua says with a shrug, before resuming eating.

Celebi sighs, her expression softening as she closes her book.
"Fine." she says while closing the bag of chips she bought Zorua along with the bottle of lime soda pop.

"Hey!"

"You'll get a stomachache if you eat too much." she says putting the chips and the soda away, before grabbing a hold of Zorua himself and standing up.
"And we gotta move anyway."

"Why? What now?" the dark type asks.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Winning a bet

choices: The rest of the day goes uninterrupted
Celebi's mom wants to come in and talk with her daughter
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"We're heading back home Zorua." She said as she got her bags up under her arm and held Zorua to her chest, levitating her book with her. "What...we weren't out here all that long..." He said as she looked at him. "Define that because by my measure we were out of the house for hours." She said.

"Well...you had to do shopping, and then the part where I totally beat you in a chase so you had to go do more shopping, then-" She glared down at the tiny boastful dark pokemon in her grip

"Yeah, i'm buying you that second accessory." She stated simply, allowing a playful smile to take her face.

"WHAT!? That wasn't the-"

"Oh, you can whine all you want about it, feel free, that was the big part of the bet." She grinned as he huffed from her chest as they made their way home. "That bow looks so cute on you~" She teased as he started to blush red. She'd at least nipped his gloating in the bud.

-

"Seriously Zorua, this is for your own good!" She stated as he kept evading the giantess fairy on her bed. "I ain't wearing it!" she had been trying to get him for a few minutes the standard way, but he'd dodge her as she came down with her paw and the bow. "You're not even TRYING to fool my mom!" She said and Zorua huffed. "This isn't about that! This is about you wanting to accessorize me!" He dodged again at the incoming paw and she glared at him. "This is about trying to keep you hidden!...Well, it's about both, and I know you hate this but you've left me no choice!" She said as he felt a psychic force immobilize him. "Cheater...." He got out as she gently tied the bow around his neck, releasing him from her grip. She sighed in relief as he pawed at it, unable to get it off on his own. She giggled. "That's adorable~" She pecked him on the cheek as he glowered up at her, blushing. "This is cruelty." He said and she rolled her eyes. "Just deal, okay?" She said as she gave him a hickory chip to hopefully shut him up. He took the bait happily and started munching at it as she laid back on her bed and opened up her book. "You know Zorua, you could read with me?" She said and he looked up from his chip to shake his head. "No way!" She rolled her eyes again.

"You're gonna find being around me isn't as entertaining as you'd hope then, because this is how I spend my free time." She said, not looking away from her book to see him shake his head again. Zorua did ponder this for a second. "Eh, i'll be fine." He made his way over to her head on her pillow, dragging his chip with his teeth and he settled down next to her, eyeing her reading her book a bit before happily returning to his chip.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Heading back

choices: Zorua holds his illusion until Celebi's mother leaves...
Zorua suddenly sneezes!
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Silence had fallen between the fox and the fairy as she just kept reading while he kept on eating his beloved, giant hickory chip.

A nice atmosphere had formed around them, and Celebi occasionally looked away from her book to look sideways, smiling at Zorua.

"That bow is adorable on you~" she commented at some point. Zorua huffed.
"Just go to sleep tonight. Then Arceus knows what I'm going to do to this bow." he replied.

Celebi looks away from the book to grin.
"I'll tell you - absolutely nothing." she says playfully.
"Because, whatever you do to that bow, I'm going to do the same to you~"

"... Over a stupid piece of fabric?" Zorua asks, imagining himself being thorn apart by the fairy and shivering.

"Over a stupid piece of fabric that makes you look adorable~" she giggles, pulling Zorua away from his chip and nuzzling him into her cheek.

Zorua blushes, but lets Celebi nuzzle him anyway. The closeness to her makes him feel good, she's the pokemon he has a crush on...

"Celebi..." he mumbles while smiling.

Sadly, the moment is rudely interrupted by a knock at the door.
"Celebi? Are you there honey?" a voice called from outside.

Celebi abruptly lets go of Zorua, letting him fall back onto her pillow.

"Mom..." he heard her mumbling while looking at him in alert. Zorua got the gist, and his eyes glowed as a quite realistic pokedoll took his place.

All while the door slowly opened, letting a shiny Celebi hover inside of the room.

Her green gaze fixed on her daughter, who smiled.
"Hi mom," Celebi said, distractedly eyeing her book.
"You're back early."

The older Celebi sighs.
"And you're still in here. Reading. In such a wonderful day." she says disappointedly.
"You had a sleepover with your friends, right? Why didn't you hang out with them for a bit? You could've enjoyed some sunshine... That's really important at your age." she lectures.

Celebi closes her book and sighs.
"But I did go out with them, mom!" she retorts, half laying. If her mother found out that she's dating the pokemon who has all the hatred of the village on himself...

The pink Celebi sighs, before noting something next to Celebi.

"Is that a pokedoll?" she asks while floating closer to the bed to take a better look at the fake pokedoll that is Zorua.

Celebi bites her lip.
"Y-Yeah! I bought it earlier. Along with the bow - isn't that adorable?" she asks, grinning at Zorua, who chokes back a growl while fighting the urge to back away from the inquisitive gaze of Celebi's mother.

However, he finds, his attempts are useless as the pink Celebi moves forward, snatching the fake doll up, holding Zorua in front of her face.

"Hm. I guess it is pretty... but why a Zorua?" she asked.
"And by the way, this doll is well made. This almost seems like real fur..." she added with a smile.

Celebi smiled nervously and nodded her head.
"Y-Yeah! Incredibile, right? Espurr was almost about to get hi - er - it! I couldn't let her!" she responds.

"You could have let her have it..." the pink Celebi says.

Zorua kept himself from gulping as he watched the pink giantess holding him, believing him a mere, lifeless doll.

‘Illusion, don't fail me now...’ he thought.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Mother, daughter and the secret guest...

choices: Zorua decides to spend the day normal sized doing his own thing
Zorua decides to just stay in Celebi's house for the day tomorrow
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"Well, I suppose it isn't a terribly big deal." She finished as she set Zorua back down before looking at her daughter. "Listen, I have the day off tomorrow, why don't we have a mother daughter day honey? It's been a while, right? We can go out, make a day of it." And the younger Celebi looked at her mother. She smiled. It really had been a long time since she had last spent the day with her mom, and that did sound really tempting. Her mind briefly flitted over to Zorua though as she considered this, but ultimately it was too good to pass up.

"Yes! i'd love to mom!" and the older Celebi smiled. "Great, and you can even bring your little Zorua if you want." She said as she got up from her daugter's bed. "Mom, i'm not so little that I need to take a doll with me in public." She defended and the older Celebi just giggled. "I'm gonna go start dinner, alright? Think of some places you want to go." She said as she exited the room. A few seconds after the door was shut Zorua dispelled the illusion and let himself breathe a sigh of relief before fixing his gaze on the green giantess who was looking at him.

"...A day out with mom? I hope you don't take her on that offer to take me, because I CAN'T do that for an entire day." And Celebi looked at him apologetically. "I know that, I can leave you here or...I don't know, maybe grow you back and have you do your own thing for the day." She said before finishing. "And I don't mean pranks." And Zorua rolled his eyes. "Try trusting me a little, I won't do that, but seriously, your mom scared the absolute crap out of me when she picked me up!" He said and she nodded. "Me too, see, the bow was a GOOD idea Zorua." And he looked down. "I'm only wearing it because you're not giving me a choice here..." and he went to return to his chip before Celebi picked it up. "HEY!"

"Don't spoil supper, it'll be ready soon she said." Celebi lectured as he jumped for the chip. "The supper for you and her! She's not cooking for me!"

"I'm giving you some of my portion, it isn't like it'll be enough for me to notice a difference anyway." Celebi said, in a matter of fact manner as Zorua gave up on trying to get the chip and simply sat looking at it longingly. "Don't be dramatic either." She said as she put it in the bag and went to put it and his soda in her closet.

"Anyways, i'm gonna give you the option to go with us if you want anyway, I know it might be hard to keep the illusion up but..."

"What, and see some chick flick, or watch you and your mom get beautified at some salon, or something along those lines? Pass." And she shrugged before putting her book away as well. "Well, figured i'd offer..."She muttered. "So what do you want to do then? I can leave you a book if you stay here..." She said and Zorua just gave her a sideways look before answering.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: A day in or a day out

choices: Zorua decides to take a stroll in his forest
Zorua decides to go find one of the other girls
Maybe... one little innocent prank?
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"I suppose I could stay here... if you leave me the chips and the soda." Zorua says, grinning at the thought of himself feasting while alone in the house.

However, Celebi had a different opinion about it.
"To find you whimpering while holding your belly when I get back? Forget it." she says.

Zorua huffs.
"Fine. Then grow me back and leave me on my own..." he says.

"Okay." Celebi agrees.
"But no pranks, no troubles and we meet in your forest tomorrow in the evening."

Zorua snickers.
"What if I do prank someone...?" he says teasingly.

"I'm gonna strangle you with that bow." Celebi says, smirking. However, against her expectations, Zorua simply grins.
"Better than wearing it."

"Then I'm going to make you wear it for a year." Celebi giggles.

The fox pales.
"Yes ma'am, er, miss! No pranks!"

"Honey~ Dinner!" Celebi's mother calls.

Celebi gets up from the bed, before lowering herself to peck Zorua's cheek.
"Later~" she says as she heads out of the room, leaving a blushing Zorua behind.

He sighed.
"Of all the girls... why her?" he asked himself as he let a smile spread on his face.

--

"Celebi, I don't follow." Zorua mumbled with his mouth full of a piece of meat Celebi brought him.

Since the fairy came back into the room, she's been gushing about the day she's going to have with her mom.

"Oh, we're going shopping, then we'll eat outside - oh I'll buy you so many cute things~" she chimed in excitement. Zorua snorted.
"Oh, and I'm so not going to wear any of those~" he said, emulating the fairy's voice.

"We'll see~"

Zorua sighed as he finished his meat.

"Seriously Celebi..." he starts, but Celebi interrupts by picking him up and hugging him tight.

He smiled a little.
"Celi... how do you think this it going so far... us I mean..." he asks, blushing, causing Celebi to blush as well.

Nonetheless, she smiles too.
"Wonderfully~" she sincerely says, pecking the fox on the head.

He snickered.

"Come on... let's play something and then bed." the fairy says, reaching into her closet to pull out a chess board.

Zorua's smile dropped.

--

"Checkmate!" Celebi exclaims while gently tapping Zorua's king with her queen, making it fall off the board.

"I win!"

Zorua sighs.
"Of course you win..." he meekly says, bored out of his skull.

Celebi grins.
"Quite frankly... I expected more from someone with your wit."

Zorua perked up.
"Really? Where are the playing cards, exactly?" he asked, causing Celebi to giggle.

"I'm not going to test your ability with those - I believe you." she says.
"And it's bedtime anyway."

Zorua watched the fairy getting up from her desk, putting the chess board and the pawns in her closet, before going back to the desk and picking Zorua up.

Then, Celebi heads for the bed and slides under the bedsheets, the lights psychically switched off.

"Good night, roomie~" she says, pecking Zorua.
"Sleep tight."

"... You too." the dark type responds, blushing.

Celebi then proceeded to hug him to her chest, before closing her eyes.

Zorua emulated her.

Thankfully, tired from the day he had, he drifted off almost immediately.

--

"... Up Zorua..."

The fox kept snoring.

"Wake up sleepyhead! I'm leaving!"

The statement made Zorua open his eyes... only to find himself staring at Celebi straight in the eye.

He looked around, finding himself normal sized and onto her bed.

"Morning sleepyhead, I'm leaving." Celebi said with excitement as she hugged him.

He yawned.
"Right..." he told, returning the hug.

Celebi pulled back.
"Remember - no pranks and we meet up in the forest tonight." she recalls.

"Honey~"

"Coming, mom!" she exclaims, before turning back to Zorua and pecking his forehead. Zorua blushes, but risks returning the kiss by pecking the fairy's cheek.

Celebi blushes as well as her eyes shrink. She stares at the void for a moment.
"... Thank the fact you aren't tiny. Thank me you aren't tiny." she blurts out before smiling.

"But we'll deal about this later~ see you tonight - and lock the door when you get out." she says, before hurrying outside. Soon, Zorua hears an overexcited giggle and the sound of a door closing in distance.

The fox yawns again, before looking at the window, noticing sunshine seeping in.

He smiled.
'"At least it's a nice day..." he mumbled, before walking to the front door and opening it, before exiting and closing the door like Celebi asked.

He looked around dazedly. Celebi and her mom were already gone, so the pink Celebi didn't notice him coming out from her house.

Good.

He smiled as he yawns again.

"Great. What do I do for the whole day now?" he asked himself, before pondering his choices.

He could go to his forest, exercise in such a good day... and eat something while he's at it.

Or... he could go find one of the other girls, spend the day with them... well, maybe not Gardevoir. He already knows - she'd keep asking things about him and Celebi for the whole day long.

Zorua yawns again as he starts walking, having taken a decision.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Celebi and Zorua's day off

choices: "Not today Zorua, i'm a bit busy and honesty you shouldn't be here."
"Sure, i'm good to hang out for a bit if you want I guess."
"Well i'm heading over to Buneary's, you're welcome too I suppose."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"Hmm...well, maybe i'll go find Espurr...or Braixen or Buneary. I don't think anyone else would want to hang out with a guy like me." He said to himself as he started towards the village. It wasn't often that he came here properly and it almost always ended with people giving him fearful or hateful looks. He figured it wouldn't be any different now but no one actually tried to DO anything to him when he went there, so he figured he'd be safe.

Sure enough, as he walked down the path whistling he got a lot of nasty looks from pokemon. He allowed a small grin to play across his muzzle. He wouldn't do anything, but it was better to be feared right now in his mind, no one would mess with him. As he passed various shops he did let himself look around at things. He normally had a goal in mind or someone he wanted to get when he came here, at this point...he was just kinda wandering, seeing if he'd find one of his other friends around.

"You've got some nerve!" He turned to look at the source of the voice, giving a bored look to the Wigglytuff that said that. He was with Swinub who was hiding behind Wigglytuff. "Oh...yeah, hey. I'm not going to do anything here so relax." Zorua turned around to walk away. "Don't you ignore me! You're not welcome here, so why don't you scram! In case you couldn't tell people don't enjoy your presence!" Wigglytuff said to the indifferent dark type as he looked at all the villagers looking at him.

"Yeah, I noticed you old fart, I just don't care. Like I said, i'm not here to pull a prank or steal anything, just wandering around." Zorua said, continuing his walk as Wigglytuff just growled at him. "Yeah, well hurry it up and finish wandering, the sooner you leave the better." And Zorua ignored him as he continued on. The older pokemon looked at the Swinub hiding behind him. "Don't worry, I won't let him do anything to you." He said gently, patting Swinub's head.

Zorua rounded a corner, muttering less than kind things about Wigglytuff when he saw a familiar shiny purple pokemon ahead of him with her back turned to him. "Braixen! Yo!" He said as he approached her. She turned around, with a shocked look on her face. "Zorua!? What are you doing here? At normal size too...without Celebi?" He shrugged. "She's having a day with her mom and I didn't want to be bored cooped up in her house, so she let me loose." He grinned and she glared at him. "No pranks?" He put a paw on his chest, doing his best to look serious. "No pranks." He said and she looked at him suspiciously. "For real, no pranks." He said, in a more informal tone. "Well...I suppose i'll take you at your word for that, but why are you even here?" She asked and he blinked at her. "Just looking around, seeing if i'd find you, Buneary or Espurr." Braixen looked at him and he grinned back. "So you wanna hang out then Braixen? It'll be fun!" Her look softened a bit at this statement.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: To the village

choices: At Buneary's house...
Later, in the evening...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Braixen looks at Zorua for a bit, trying to spot any hint of malice in his expression - something not really difficult - but he seems sincere...

"Okay I guess," she responds with a shrug.
"I wasn't doing anything anyway."

Zorua snickers.
"Great! What do we do then?" he says, starting to walk, the taller fox walking alongside him.

"Let's just walk around." she simply replies.

The duo quietly walks down the streets of the village, occasionally stopping to look at things in shops.

"So," Zorua started at some point.
"How's Buneary? Last time, she did seem a lot more comfortable around me..."

Braixen smiles a little.
"Trust me, she is. When I brought her home yesterday, she did nothing but gush about you for the whole trip!" Braixen reveals.
"You really made it up to her for that prank of yours..."

Zorua sighs.
"Admittedly, it was a bit too harsh..." he replies, looking convincingly ashamed.
"But I made it up to her... and to you too... right?"

Braixen giggles.
"Of course - d'you really think I'd be here if you didn't?" she asks.

"Er... no."

The fire type snickers.
"You've changed a lot Zorua. There's no denying that. Since Celebi... you already know... you became quite nice to be around with." she says.

Zorua blushes, but smiles.

"Speaking of, how are things going with Celebi?... Did her mother find out about you?!" Braixen asks, suddenly looking worried.

"... No?"

The fire type sighs.
"Good. Because that would be bad - like REALLY bad. Celebi's mom is overprotective with her... and I frankly think that she highly disapproves you." she bluntly says.

Zorua shrugs.
"No no... although she WAS very close to discovering me..." he recalls himself grasped in three, slender pink fingers while being held in front of the green eyes of Celebi's mother.

He shakes his head.
"Overprotective mom aside... things are going swimmingly between me and Celebi... aside from books, chess and her intending to turn me into a real doll..." he sheepishly admits.

Braixen puts a paw to her forehead as she laughs. Zorua shoots a frustrated stare.
"Lemme guess - pokedoll clothes?" she asks.

The smaller fox nods meekly and Braixen laughs harder, Zorua lowering his head in humiliation as they keep walking.

"You again?" a voice interrupted Braixen's laughter and caused Zorua to perk up, noticing Wigglytuff glaring down at him like he usually did whenever he passed.

He was still with Swinub, Zorua noted, and the ice type was yet again hiding behind the large bunny.

"Why can't you simply get lost? You're not wanted here!" he exclaims quite rudely.

Zorua remains indifferent.
"And why can't you simply shut up and stay away from me?" he snaps back, before looking at Swinub.
"And dude, quit hiding - I won't do anything to ya!"

His words only had the effect of causing Swinub to hide completely behind Wigglytuff.

The dark type finds that he can't really blame him. After all, he did lure him into following an illusionary track of food, before making him fall into a pit he dug, only to forget about him later and luring Munchlax into the same trap with the exact same trick.

As a result, Swinub found a not-so-lightweight pokemon falling straight on him, almost crushing him. That was totally unintentional... but also the best prank Zorua pulled so far, he figures with a snicker.

His grin only causes Wigglytuff to step towards Zorua menacingly; the fox grinned, his eyes glowing as he gets ready to craft an illusion to scare the pink bunny off.

Right before Braixen stepped in between Zorua and Wigglytuff.
"... What's your problem?" she asks, glaring.
"He did nothing so far, so you have no right to send him away! Don't like his presence? Avoid him and shut up!"

Wigglytuff growls.
"Didn't you hate him Braixen? Since when you are friends?" he asks.

"Mind your own business Wigglytuff. And leave us alone." she coldly says, before kneeling to scoop Zorua up, one paw traveling to his hind legs while the other wraps around his chest as she walks past the pink bunny, leaving a confused Wigglytuff, Swinub and several other pokemon behind.

--

"I could have handled him," Zorua says from Braixen's grasp.
"But... thanks. He was getting pretty damn annoying."

The shiny fox snickers as she hugs him closer.
"Anytime."

"... So? What now?" Zorua asked while leaping down onto the ground and looking up at his friend.

"Well... why don't we go to Buneary's place? I mean, before we draw other unwanted attention." she suggests.

Zorua shrugged. He really had nothing better to do at the moment.

"Fine I guess. I'll only meet Celebi in the evening, so pretty much anything is fine." he responded.

Braixen giggled.
"Follow me then." she said, leading the way to Buneary's house, Zorua following her in silence.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Foxes, hanging out

choices: "Oh, I wouldn't miss this for the world."
"I'm gonna pass tonight, but i'll be in touch, later Celi, squirt."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
The two pokemon made their way to Buneary's, avoiding other pokemon where they could, if only to not start anything. "Seriously, Swinub doesn't need to be afraid of me..." Zorua muttered and Braixen gave him a sympathetic look. "It's hard to blame the little guy after what you did to him...hell, I can see where Wigglytuff is coming from too, despite the way he went about it." She said and Zorua sighed. "Yeah...I know...but I ain't gonna do anything!" He said indignantly and she just smiled. "I know, give it time Zorua." She said as they approached Buneary's door and knocked.

"I've got it mom!" They heard from the other end as the door opened to show the younger bunny pokemon standing there. "Oh Braixen!...and Zorua? Hi you two!" She said excitedly as she went to hug Braixen, then Zorua. The dark fox pokemon blushed as she did. "Yeah uh...hey, Buneary, how's it going...?" He asked awkwardly and she smiled at him. "Great! Mom, can some friends come in for a bit?" She asked and a voice called out from another room. "Sure honey, just not for too long, okay?" And Buneary nodded. "Come in you two!"

-

"That's so cute Zorua!" Buneary giggled as Braixen grinned, them sitting in a circle on Buneary's bedroom floor, a small plate of rice crackers in front of them. "No it isn't! That bow is itchy, evil, and must be destroyed! She's planning to buy even MORE stuff today!" Zorua said in a far more passionate voice than necessary as he reached for a cracker and Braixen started laughing. "Oh, hey Buneary, don't you have some pokedolls and pokedoll accessories?" Braixen grinned as Zorua narrowed his eyes at her. "Braixen, what are you suggesting?" He said, before taking a bite, and Buneary's eyes lit up.

"Zorua! Why don't you come over when you're small again with Celebi! I'd love to play with you!" She said, either completely missing Zorua's feelings on this or blatantly ignoring them. He audibly gulped down his cracker as Braixen said. "Don't worry Buneary, i'll let Celi know you want to do that." She grinned at the dark fox who was glaring at her now and started laughing again. Buneary looked incredibly excited though.

"You and Celebi are monsters...MONSTERS!" Zorua said in mock horror and Braixen rolled her eyes. "You're way too dramatic Zorua." Braixen said, reaching for a cracker herself as an older Lopunny came to the door. "What's all the noise going on in here? oh, Braixen!...and...is that Zorua!?" She said, immediately going into mom mode as she approached him with a glare. "No! No! It's cool ma'am, he's way different now!" Braixen said as the older pokemon entered the room. "I still remember what you did to my daughter." The Lopunny said, narrowing her eyes and Zorua bowed his head. "I'm very sorry about that ma'am, I would never dream of doing that now."

"It's true mom! Zorua is nice!" Buneary insisted and the older Lopunny looked at him. "...I'll trust you're judgement Braixen. If you mess with my girls again though...but fine, fine. Next time, tell me who's over Buneary." She concluded as she went to exit the room. "Yes mom." And Zorua sighed. "That went better than I would've expected...wait, mess with her girls? I've only messed with Buneary." Zorua said and Braixen shrugged. "She was probably talking about me, her and my mom are old friends, she's known me since I was a baby Fennekin." Braixen said, finishing her cracker. "Still though, i'd take her at her word, she is not someone to trifle with." And Zorua nodded. "I've got it..."

"Besides, when Celebi brings you over for a dress up session, then you need to be doubly careful at your size." Braixen said in a mock serious voice making Buneary giggle.

"OKAY, THAT'S ENOUGH OF THAT!" And both girls burst out laughing.

-

It was starting to get dark as Braixen and Zorua both walked through the forest, Braixen leaning her head against the back of her paws. "So ready to go back to the world of giant pokemon?" She said grinning as he grinned back. "I'm ready for my chips and soda!" and she looked unimpressed by this. "You're surprisingly easy to tame considering your rep." And he shrugged. "Hey, I like what I like." Soon they found Celebi waiting on a log with a few bags. "Oh, Zorua! It was amazing, my mom and I went to this fancy breakfast, and then we went shopping, and saw a movie together, and then we got pedicures, and-oh, Braixen! Hey!" And the larger purple fox grinned. "Get any new accessories for him?" And Zorua narrowed her eyes as Celebi pulled a tiny top hat out of a bag that wrapped around the head of a doll causing Braixen to start laughing.

"OH COME ON!" Celebi just laughed as her eyes started to glow and Zorua soon found the world around him getting bigger, Braixen's and Celebi's laughter getting louder and more powerful to him.

"Now come on Zorua, why don't you try it on~" Celebi said as she got up to gently pick him up. "Oh, Braixen, you want to hang out with us for a bit?" Celebi asked as Braixen looked.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Chilling

choices: Celebi and Zorua get home
One of the villagers spots the tiny Zorua...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Braixen smiled mischievously at the now tiny Zorua.
"Sure!" she responded to Celebi's offer.
"I've got to head home. I guess we can walk together..." she explained, before flashing Zorua a smirk.
"And I wouldn't miss dress up for no reason."

Celebi giggled as she bent to pick the dark fox up, holding the tiny top hat near him.
"I hate you both!" he exclaimed.

"No you don't~ now, try this on~" Celebi said, starting to move the hat to his head.

Zorua fidgeted in her grasp.
"No! NO!" he cried as the giantess places the hat on his head.

Immediately, giggles erupted around him as he looked down, defeated and humiliated.

"Aw - that's adorable!" Braixen chimed.
"Wait to see him with the bow on~" Celebi responded, making the tiny fox blush.

"... You two are evil."

Braixen snickered.
"Says the prankster who psychologically traumatized Buneary and Swinub."

Even though the situation, Zorua looked up at the purple fox, snickering.

"... Well! Let's head home now!" Celebi said before Zorua could say something he would later regret.

The fairy psychically picks her bags, which start floating behind her before she starts walking.

Braixen snickered once more as she followed.

--

"Sounds awesome." Braixen commented as Celebi told her about the day she and her mother had.

Celebi nodded with excitement.
"Yeah! It WAS awesome! Oh, we went shopping - there were so many cute things for Zorua here~" she said as she eyed the tiny fox, who snorted.
"I was actually tempted to buy gloves to match the hat..." she continued teasingly, causing Zorua to sigh.

"Why didn't you?" Braixen laughs.

"Stop. That..." Zorua said, already humiliated because he had to wear the hat on the way back home.

Celebi giggled.
"Oh Zorua~" sang, digging a paw in one of the bags to pull out a new bottle of soda.

Zorua blinked.

"... I can't decide if you're the best thing that ever happened to me or the worst." he said, causing both girls to giggle.

"And you?" Celebi asked while putting the bottle away.
"What did you two do? Why were you together in the first place?"

Zorua shrugs.
"I decided to go find her or Buneary or Espurr to hang out." he simply responded.

"Nothing too exciting... except the part with Wigglytuff..." Braixen recalls.

Celebi looks bemused.
"Why? What happened with Wigglytuff?" she asks, before her eyes widen as she looks down at Zorua in her arms.
"... Did you pull one of your pranks?" she asked.

"No no." the dark type quickly defended.

"That's true," Braixen chimed in seeing Celebi's mistrustful look.

"I was just wandering around, and he told me to get lost... quite rudely." Zorua explains.

Celebi looks at both him and Braixen, before nodding.
"Okay, what you did to Swinub was wrong, but him... what a jerk..." she said, gently caressing Zorua.

He grinned.

Braixen suddenly stopped.
"Here, I gotta head home now," she said, pointing to a house in distance.

She smiled warmly at her two friends.
"See ya later Celebi, squirt." she said, starting to walk towards her own house.

"Bye Braix~" Celebi responded, before looking down at Zorua, who was trying to get rid of the hat.
"... Can I take this off? It's itchy!" he complains.

"Hmm~ nope~" Celebi responded with a giggle, causing Zorua to sigh.
"Come on Zorua, let's hear home too." she said cheerfully while hugging the fox to her chest and starting to walk.

He sighed, each step she took shook his world. Plus, he needed to scratch his head, badly - that cursed top hat itched as hell!

But he kept quiet, and Celebi continued to walk in direction of her house in silence, humming to herself, quite certainly still excited about the day she spent with her mom.

Eventually...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Chatting on the way home

choices: "Look, is there anyway I can make it up to you Azurill?" He said genuinely
"So is this blackmail or what?" Zorua said deadpan
"Just buzz off Azurill." Zorua said annoyed
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Little Azurill was walking along the path on his own, whistling a tune when he saw Celebi passing by him with a few bags levitating behind her. Nothing out of the ordinary, but he saw something that caught his eye. A moving pokedoll that she was hugging?...wait, was that a Zorua doll? "Celebi, this hat seriously itches something fierce!" He heard from her chest.

Azurill couldn't contain his curiosity and he turned around to follow. Celebi seemed to not notice however as he tailed them quietly and the two pokemon were caught up in their own world. Celebi thinking about her day, and Zorua thinking of how to dispose of the hat and the bow. "So what'd you and Braixen do aside from the Wigglytuff thing?" Celebi asked, getting Zorua's attention again. "Went to Buneary's where they proceeded to mock me about the thing you're doing to me right now." He shrugged and Celebi rolled her eyes. "So dramatic, maybe you don't want the soda."

"...no, I do." He said as he stopped itching at the hat, making Celebi giggle.

"Is that the real Zorua?" Celebi heard the voice and Zorua's eyes immediately widened as he cast an illusion to make himself look like a doll. Celebi slowly turned around to see Azurill standing there, looking curious. "Um...hi Azurill, no, it's just a pokedoll...hehe, pretty cute, right?" She said, hoping to fool the younger pokemon but he looked unimpressed. "I heard you talking to him."

"O-oh, well I was just having fun, you know how some pokemon talk to their dolls." She said, smiling, hoping he'd buy it.

"He talked too." Azurill stated simply as Celebi started sweating. "Are you sure? That doesn't sound right..." Celebi said as Zorua sighed and dropped the illusion.

"Celebi you won't maintain the lie, yes, hi Azurill, it's me." Zorua said from her chest and Azurill immediately glared at him. "Hmph, thought so. I don't know what's going on here, but I will say that position suits you Zorua, a tiny little pokedoll after what you did to mine."

Zorua rolled his eyes and Celebi hugged him a bit tighter. "Yeah, yeah, your doll. Look, sorry about that. Wasn't cool of me. But those days are done and I can assure that you don't need to worry about me anymore." He stated and Azurill glared harder.

"That TOTALLY undoes what you did to me and others, doesn't it? That doll was a gift from my mom...one of the few things I had to remember her by. Imagine what'd happen if word of what size you are got out? What'd happen then?" His voice raw and threat clear.

"AZURILL!"

"Oh yeah, they'll believe that, even if they do, good luck getting to me behind the girl holding me now." Zorua said, hardly sympathetic at the veiled threat

"ZORUA!"

Azurill and Zorua were glaring daggers at each other and Celebi desperately wanted to leave. An awkward silence hung as Celebi bit her lip, thinking of just turning around and leaving or trying to talk down Azurill...eventually it was Zorua who broke the silence.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Azurill discovers

choices: "...why don't I see how smart that mouth of yours is now?" Celebi intoned.
"...what do you think we should do with him, Zorua?" Celebi inquired.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"So is this blackmail or what?" Zorua inquired to the blue menace facing him and his girlfriend down.

"That seems like such an ugly word, "blackmail"." Azurill smugly replied, netting irritated glares from the couple.

"I don't think you understand quite what's going on here," Celebi spat. Normally she'd be content to let people who slighted her off with a warning, but most other people hadn't either threatened her boyfriend (mostly because she had never had one) or attempted to blackmail her. Now someone had the gall to do both, and she was not having any of it. "You'd better leave us alone, or else."

"Or else what, missy? You gonna have your little doll come to defend you?"

'What is she up to?' thought a befuddled Zorua.

Just then, Celebi's eyes began to glow an extremely vivid blue. "Funny you should mention little dolls, Azurill. You probably haven't figured out who shrunk Zorua, have you?" At this the opposing Pokemon attempted to back away in fear, having put two and two together. Unfortunately for him, Celebi had already prepared a ball of energy, which was promptly flung right at the cowardly Azurill. Right before the couple's eyes, he began to shrink down, finally stopping at about the size of a doll to the already doll-sized Zorua, barely coming up past the peak of Celebi's feet.

"Now then..." she began.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: The Pinnacle of Intelligence

choices: "Fine... If you know what's best for you, you'll keep quiet. Now, get lost."
"No chance Azurill... we're keeping you!"
"Hmm... I don't know... Zorua?"
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Azurill gulped as he stared up at the gigantic couple in front of his eyes.

"Now then, Azurill," Celebi intoned, wearing a smirk upon her face.

Zorua rushed to the edge of his girlfriend's paw, eager to see what type of torture she had in mind for the extremely tiny mouse.

He grinned down at the blue ball, who looked like he was on the verge of tears.

"... Why don't I see how smart that mouth of yours is now?" Celebi intoned, smirking, as she patiently waited to enjoy the show of Azurill pleading for his life like a coward.

Funny how things work... even a child can dare to challenge a legendary, but when put in a situation of clear disadvantage, the first thing they do is begging, hoping for mercy and, most times, not receiving it.

As for Celebi, she didn't exactly know what she wanted now... she was still quite new at these 'shrinking', 'kidnapping' and 'punishing' things... she actually did it only once, with Zorua... and that didn't work out good...

However, Zorua wasn't even close to blackmail her, all he did was pull a prank... and she went overboard with his punishment.

But Azurill... Azurill had crossed a line. And she was going to enjoy teaching him some manners.

The blue mouse started trembling, stammering incomprehensible words.

"W-What w-w-was t-that? I-I'm sorry... c-can't hear you..." Celebi said, before starting to snicker. On top of her paws, Zorua felt elated as he saw the blue fairy type starting to cry in fear, frustration and humiliation.

However...

"Celi... stop."

Celebi looked at her tiny boyfriend, not sure she heard correctly.

Azurill too looked up. Zorua was saving his life...?

"... Why should I, Zorua? This blue jerk-" Zorua quickly interrupted.
"Halt! You're misunderstanding me girl... I mean, not here." he said, his grin returning.

"What's that supposed to mean?"

Zorua started snickering.
"Celi... we're still in public... this kind of things requires privacy. If someone sees us like this, it'd be over." he explained.

Azurill felt his heart stopping - Zorua wasn't saving him at all!

He had to do something, anything that might have pulled him out of this situation...

And so, Azurill did the only thing he could think off. He jumped on top of his tail and started bouncing away from the gigantic Celebi and the less-gigantic-but-still-quite-big Zorua.

Sadly, he didn't get too far.

A psychic force surrounded him and lifted him up. Azurill struggled as Celebi got closer, shaking her head.

"Nice try Azurill... now Zorua, were we saying? Right, a secluded place - your forest I must assume?" she asked to her boyfriend, who nodded.

Before Azurill could even think about speaking, he was roughly thrown into one of Celebi's bags, which were still floating behind her.

Azurill landed in an uncomfortable position in between a few of the new books she bought.

Then, the dark bag started moving, following Celebi as she walked in direction of the forest that was her boyfriend's home.

--

Azurill was roughly thrown out of the bag he was in and landed on the grass, which broke the fall along with the mouse's slick, rubbery body. Regardless, he felt a lot of pain.

The blue mouse stood up, noticing Celebi sitting on a stump, setting Zorua on her lap and her bags on the ground around her.

The green fairy smirked at her blue victim, Zorua snickered seeing him frightened.

"Azurill Azurill Azurill... that wasn't very smart of you, was it?" Celebi teased, starting to caress Zorua on her lap.
"Now, would you like to start begging, or can we skip that part and start playing with you? Oh, I have so many ideas~ and I bet my wings Zorua has too~" she chimed.

"Damn! I owe you!" Zorua said, before the couple started laughing, almost deafening the poor Azurill, who sank in an ocean of desperation and fear.

"P-Please... I want to go home..." he stuttered, Zorua barely able to hear him, Celebi not having heard him at all.

"Going around, threatening a legendary and her boyfriend and then be wants to go home... ain't that sad?" Zorua snickered.
"Sadder the fact that I'm not sending him home... not until I've heard an apology. Then, we'll see." Celebi said, grabbing her head in a paw and looking at Azurill intently.

The blue mouse gulped - he had to pick his words wisely.

"Celebi... I am truly sorry for trying to blackmail you and Zorua... I should have thought better about it, and I... I-" Azurill started crying once again, humiliated.
"... I want to go home."

"Aw, ain't that cute Celebi? Kid's crying." the dark type sitting on Celebi's lap snickered.
"So cute that I'm thinking he could be our pet or something~" Celebi responded teasingly... before thinking that it wasn't a bad idea.

Azurill looked at the couple, his heart skipped a beat.

"What?!" he shouted, trying to fight off the image of such terrible scenario.

Celebi and Zorua were utterly crazy! They couldn't keep him as a pet, they couldn't simply kidnap him and get away with it!

"Shut up, you deserve every last bit of what we're going to do with you Azurill. You should've thought better." the green giantess in front of him spoke in a solemn voice.

Again, Azurill felt his own warm tears rolling down his cheeks.

He exhaled heavily.

"Guys... I did wrong trying to blackmail you, okay? I-I just wanted a revenge... Zorua was a jerk to me, he destroyed my mom's last gift! But... now I'm truly sorry for what I've done... I... shouldn't have tried to threaten Celebi too, she had nothing to do with that all..." he told, sniffling, before looking at the couple of giants in front of him.

Both remained silent. Zorua was smirking, Celebi seemed uninterested. A child's tears usually have to power to melt the hearts of those witnessing them, but in this case they didn't work.

"Celi... Zorua... Please, grow me back... I promise I won't tell anybody about Zorua! Please!" the blue mouse continued.

Celebi looked at him half-heartedly.

And then, she spoke.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Fairies can be mischievous sometimes

choices: They make it home fine
They run into a pokemon they know
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"Okay...fine, if you know what's best for you you'll keep your mouth shut though." She said as Azurill felt a growing sensation as he was normal again. He looked down at the ground, he still looked scared before he looked Celebi in they eye. Zorua for his part looked disappointed.

"T-thank you! Sorry again! I-i'll forget I ever saw either of you!" He ran away as fast as his little legs could carry him, back to the village and Zorua sighed.

"Laaame, you let him go! After he threatened us!"

"I'm not heartless Zorua, he's a little kid that you started things with. I won't ruin his life over a snap decision...if he tries anything with us though..." She said and Zorua sighed.

"We could've at least had fun with him first..."

"Oh? I thought you weren't going to prank and torment anymore." Celebi said teasingly.

"Only pokemon that don't have it coming to them."

"Again, little kid, you tormented first...we'll see what happens. For now...let's go home."

"I thought you said he deserved it?" Zorua said mischieviously

"That was only for added effect, it worked to get him to apologize and run off in fear right? Think about things from other pokemon's perspectives Zorua...not just ours."

They walked through the village, or more Celebi walked carrying the tiny Zorua as they started for her house.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Not a psycho

choices: The group eventually parts and they go home
Just Zorua's luck - someone else spots the tiny fox..
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
The green fairy kept walking across the village. She was in no rush, she decided as she hugged an illusionary pokedoll that masked the real Zorua.

Celebi needed to relax - she was determined to not let the thought of Azurill ruin the wonderful day she had with her mom.

She smiled.

There'd be plenty of ways to relax once she got home... and one of those was dressing up Zorua as a doll. Like the doll he was pretending to be.

"Seriously, why did you let the kid go? He deserved a lesson... or a couple lessons." Zorua broke the silence, causing Celebi to sigh.
"Yeah, go ahead, traumatize him like you did with Swinub - and if you so much think about pulling my wings again, Gardevoir, I won't envy you for what I'm going to do to you." Celebi said as she stopped and turned around to see, in fact, Gardevoir, blushing but grinning.

"Oh... so you sensed me..." she awkwardly stated, making Celebi smirk in satisfaction.

"... Anyway, hi you two~" Gardevoir said cheerfully.
"Hi Gard." Zorua chimed, sliding out of his girlfriend's hug and leaping on top of her fist, holding out a paw as he greeted her.

"How are you two~?"

"We're fine, thank y-" Celebi was cut off.

"That's not what I meant - how is it going between you two? Everything. I need to know EVERYTHING." Gardevoir firmly stated.

"RUN!" Zorua shouted from Celebi's chest.

While not doing what Zorua said, Celebi took a few steps back, wanting to avoid talking about it. Gardevoir got a bit... excited when it came to talking about this kind of things.

"Ehm... can we talk another time...? I've got these bags that I'd like to put down and I'm honestly quite tired and-" Celebi saw the look on her friend's face and sighed.
"... You're not going to leave us until we talk, huh?" she meekly stated, and Gardevoir smirked.

"Have you got money? I know a nice place~" she sang, starting to walk away.
"B-But... what about these bags? And mom? I need to head home! Can't we just make it qui-"
"Everything Celi. I need to know every little detail." Gardevoir interrupted, not stopping her walk.

Celebi sighed and as she hugged Zorua to her chest and followed.

"She's obsessed... but also easily my best friend..." Zorua grinned, remembering about the other night. He also remembered a certain creepy psychic type that-
"... She and Espurr."

Celebi felt the sting of jealousy.

Zorua said that his best friend was not one female pokemon in presence of his girlfriend (and that might as well be considered as a deadly sin) but two!

"Hey! What about me?" she asked, looking down while following Gardevoir.

Zorua snickered.
"Celi, we're on a different level... I mean..." he started nuzzling her chest.

The fox felt the paws around him hugging with more strength as Celebi looked up, smiling... and noticed that Gardevoir was speeding up.
"H-Hey! Wait for me!" the fairy exclaimed as she started fluttering behind her friend.

"... Where are we heading anyway?" Celebi asked upon finally catching up. In response, Gardevoir stopped and pointed to a fancy cafe.

"Oh..." Celebi said, feeling like she wasn't going to have so much money left when she got home.

--

"Seriously you two..." Celebi said in embarrassment as she walked down the road with Zorua in her grip and Gardevoir behind her.

"What's wrong?" Zorua casually asked, feeling stuffed, but extremely satisfied. He didn't get to have a full belly like now back in the forest... save for when he stole snack from passing pokemon.

"What's wrong Zorua?! You kept eating and let me do all the talking!" Celebi responded, before looking at Gardevoir.
"And you kept asking inappropriate questions!"

Gardevoir simply giggled.
"Relax Celi... we're supposed to have fun~"

"No, I'm supposed to be home... mom is going to be angry..." Celebi meekly stated. The thought of her mom angry scared her... she could ask all sorts of questions, why she didn't tell her, if she was with male pokemon, why she carried a doll that was supposed to be in her room along...

Celebi paled - what if her mom discovered Zorua? She would throw him out! She would hunt him down! She would time travel to prevent even the birth of-

Celebi shook her head.

No more sci-fi books for a while...

Gardevoir giggled.
"We can walk together then... I gotta head home too." she said cheerfully as she walked alongside Celebi.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Out with a romance-obsessed friend

choices: "Swinub...sorry." She shrinks him down.
"Swinub, we need to talk, okay?" She pulls him aside
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Swinub was out and about looking for Azurill, it had been a while since he had seen his best friend...they were supposed to meet up and head home together when he heard the voice...he gulped as he steeled himself, he'd just walk past him and be on his way right? He could do it...he psyched himself up as he kept going and rounded a corner right as Celebi and Gardevoir were about to turn it, bumping right into Gardevoir.

"AAH! Oh, um...hi, sorry, hi..." Swinub mumbled as he fumbled around, knocked on his back, Zorua for his part put up his illusion to make himself seem like a pokedoll as Gardevoir helped the younger pokemon up.

"...Sorry..." He mumbled as he looked down and Gardevoir smiled at him.

"It's no big deal, I think you got knocked around more than I did." She said and Celebi looked at him. Had Swinub heard Zorua? They had just been talking as he rounded that corner, right?

"Thank you..." He mumbled as he tried to hurry past them, but Celebi gently stood in his way, smiling.

"Hey Swinub...you seem to be in a rush, are you okay?" She asked gently, she just wanted to confirm that he didn't know...once she did that she'd let him go.

Swinub then started to think though, he had heard the voice...the voice that gives him nightmares...he shook his head.

"I-I-i'm f-f-fine miss..." He stuttered out, wanting to leave. "I-I-" He shivered and Celebi frowned a bit.

There was a good chance he heard something.

Zorua for his part was playing the part until he felt a tickle in his nose, Gardevoir looked nervously between Celebi and Swinub before...

"ACHOO!" Celebi winced as the illusion dropped and Swinub was staring right at the tiny Zorua.

For his part he just stared back with a sheepish expression.

"Uh...hey..." He said and Swinub went to run away.

"IT'S ZORUA! AAAH! HELP!" He screamed as he ran away, before a psychic force stopped him in his tracks and he was pulled back.

"No way HE won't blab..." Zorua said looking at him, though there was a hint of pity with this one.

Celebi looked at the flailing pokemon in her psychic grasp and looked to Gardevoir.

She was biting her lip. "What are you gonna do Celi?" She asked tentatively. Swinub was levitated in front of Celebi's face. He looked absolutely spooked by all of this.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Swinub sees

choices: Swinub stands still and listens to Zorua
Swinub attempts to run in fear!
"Swinub! Where are you?" someone interrupted... Azurill?
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"... Swinub, we need to talk, okay?" Celebi told to the younger pokemon, who helplessly flailed in midair, desperately trying to free himself from the psychic grip of the legendary.

"Things keep getting better..." Zorua sarcastically said from his perch behind Celebi's paws.

She sighed.
"Guess whose fault this is..." she scolded. Zorua shrugged.
"That's price you pay when you're a scoundrel." he said nonchalantly, acting like this situation was no big deal.

He then eyed Swinub, who looked at him with terror.

"... Let's go somewhere private, shall we? Before someone sees us like this and freaks out." he told.

"Agreed." Gardevoir said. Celebi didn't share the same opinion.
"... I'm sick of going to your forest and the way back."
