Zorua looked up.

"... I've got an idea."

--

The trio walked down the road.

Zorua was back to normal... and was working quite hard to carry an unmoving Swinub on his back while maintaining an illusion to make him invisible.

Both Gardevoir and Celebi held him still with psychic as they made their way into a dark alley.

Once they got there, Swinub was lifted off Zorua's back.

The fox stretched - did psychic make things heavier than they already were? Because it seemed so, he could tell from his sore back.

With a quick gleam of his eyes, Swinub was visible. The young pokemon was shaking, not able to flail anymore.

Celebi took a deep breath - when was this going to stop? She was sick of kidnapping and possibly shrinking other pokemon. It already happened with Azurill, how many other pokemon had to shrink tonight before she could finally go home and hit the hay? Wigglytuff, perhaps? The bunny was going to find out about this whole thing and she was going to have to shrink him too?

She hoped not.

Sighing in exasperation, Celebi watched as Zorua approached Swinub.

"Kid... what you saw before... you didn't see." he said firmly.

Swinub kept trying to free himself.

"... Y'see, Swinub, if you so much think of blabbering - d'you know what this nice lady here is going to do?" he said, repeating one of Celebi's lines while motioning for Celebi herself, who bit her lip.

Zorua was scaring Swinub into not talking.

The dark type fox sighed, tired from this hellish day.

Wigglytuff menacing him, Buneary and Braixen teasing him, Azurill attempting to blackmail him and now this?

Just what did he do to deserve all this...?... Right, countless pranks that hurt everyone in the village.

"... Zorua, maybe this is not the right approach." Celebi chimed in, before looking at the swine.
"Swinub... now me and Gardevoir are going to let you go... but, before you do anything, I just want to tell you this - Zorua here changed, okay? He's not who you think he is anymore..." she said, and Zorua turned his head.

He knew, each time Celebi repeated those words, his reputation received hard hits.

But... he was reformed, no? He shouldn't care... why was this so humiliating? He sure hoped that she didn't bring up the ‘broken leg’ story...

He snapped back to attention as he noticed Celebi staring at him.
"... And I'm sure he'd like to apologize to you."

Zorua snorted in disapproval.

Celebi glared at him, turned her back to Swinub as she moved to her boyfriend, wrapped an arm around his shoulders and lowered her head.

"... Gardevoir hold him; Swinub, hold on a sec, okay?" she said, before turning to Zorua.

"Before you say it, no. I'm not going to apologize... it was so damn fun!" he whispered, before snickering.

Celebi glared at him.

"... Yes Zorua, you've got to apologize... otherwise, he'll rat us out. And you don't want that, do you?" Celebi methodically said.
"... I don't want my reputation to be destroyed either. Look at this - kids fear me!" he snickered again, causing Celebi to sigh.
"So what am I supposed to do? Shrink him because of your egoistical motivation?" she asked in a lecturing tone.

Zorua nodded with a grin.

Celebi sighed.
"Zorua..."
"No Celi, I don't want to apologize... just scare him into not talking and that's it, just leave me-"
"Did I mention that you get to do whatever you want to one of the two accessories I got you if you do apologize?" Celebi interrupted, smirking.

Zorua looked at her, she smirked.

She won, and she knew it.

The fox let out a long sigh.
"My hate for you is matched only by my love for you." he stated.
"Fine."

Celebi beamed, and pecked his cheek, which flared up.

Zorua snickered.
"But I want to do whatever I want with both accessories... that bow must be shredded, that hat burned." he said.

Celebi giggled.
"Don't push it." she said, pulling back and turning around... noticing that Swinub, without her own psychic, resumed flailing in midair while Gardevoir nervously tried to calm him down.

"Guys... help..." she said, not knowing what to do - she never had to deal with a traumatized kid before! Sure, her younger sister Kirlia had her own fair share of fears when they were young, but she never was that desperate.

"... Kid, I've got something to say. Listen up." Zorua said, glancing at Gardevoir.

The flailing swine was let go of.

Swinub...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Swinub's demons

choices: Celebi groans as she shrinks them both
Celebi lets them both go
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
“Swinub? You around?” They heard the voice and Celebi’s eyes widened and Zorua sighed. Great...

They saw him clear a brush looking around before Azurill’s eyes landed on Swinub...and Celebi...and Gardevoir...then Zorua. He gasped and fell back before Zorua steeled his gaze.

“I-I-” He was petrified seeing them again so soon, and with his best friend.

“Azurill, shut up, we’re dealing with Swinub then you can-“

“Apologize Zorua, then we’ll leave. You just need to keep you mouth shut, remember Azurill.” She said with a cold voice.

“A-Azurill...what’s going on...I’m s-s-scared...they won’t let me go...”

“Swinub, look I’m trying to say that I’m sorry okay...about the pit...and-and-“ he couldn’t keep a straight face, the Munchlax falling on him and Swinub’s squeal when it happened. He started laughing.

“Oh man though, look, I didn’t PLAN the Munchlax falling on you but sorry for that too I suppose!” Gardevoir was doing her best to reign in Swinub from running but it was getting harder, and Zorua’s laughter was making it worse.

“He’s had night terrors because of that you know! And you’re still laughing about it!” Azurill forgot himself as he glared at the laughing fox before he remembered his situation and gulped as the fox turned to him. “Oh? Night terrors huh? I suppose that’s excessive...maybe his friend should join him in having those...” He mildly threatened as Azurill backed away.

“I can’t hold him anymore!” They heard as Swinub made a break for it but both he and Azurill were pinned by Celebi’s psychic as she sighed, looking at the two fearful Pokémon.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Botched apology

choices: With Celebi, Zorua and Azurill...
With Gardevoir and Swinub...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
A loud groan.

Azurill and Swinub found the world around themselves slowly growing.
"N-No! N-Not a-again!" Azurill cried in panic.
"W-What's g-going on...?" Swinub cried in alert.

Before their eyes, Celebi, Zorua and Gardevoir grew to gigantic sizes... well, it was the exact opposite, they shrunk down to minuscule sizes.

Azurill couldn't believe it was happening again, and in the same night!

Soon, the shrinking came to an end. The blue mouse looked at himself and Swinub.

When he was first shrunk down, he was doll-sized to a doll-sized Zorua; now, he was doll-sized to a normal Zorua.

Speaking of the giant, he was walking towards them, alongside Celebi and Gardevoir. Seeing the now giant fox approaching, Swinub attempted to run, but he was still held by Celebi's psychic.

"Great. Just great." Celebi said, her open palm connecting with her face.

"... What do we do now? I mean, now they'll both tell about this, no?" Gardevoir said, lowering herself to grab a hold of the two shrunken pokemon and holding up to chest level.

"Oh... I'm sure Azurill won't talk... right?" Zorua said, looking the blue mouse, who meekly nodded.

"... Yet, Swinub is going to snitch..." Gardevoir mused and the swine in her left hand started shaking.

"Dude, quit it - I ain't gonna do anything to ya!" Zorua said, uselessly attempting to calm him.

Celebi sighed loudly, expressing all her exasperation.

She had the perfect day... why fate seemed so persistent in wanting to ruin it? All she wanted right now was to head home with her boyfriend, get something in her stomach and go to sleep.

"... He needs time to calm down Gard." she said.

An idea sprang up in her mind.

"Gardevoir, why don't you take them? Talk to them and tomorrow they're free to go... on a certain condition." the legendary fairy spoke, looking at Azurill, who gave a silent response and nodded.

However, Gardevoir didn't agree.

"... I can't take them, Celi... My sister and I sleep in the same bedroom... there's no way she won't see these two." she said, nervously rubbing the back of her head.

"We can't take them either. These two and Zorua under the same roof with my mom inside? No deal." Celebi said.

Trapped by the paws of Gardevoir, Azurill and Swinub could only watch the giants talk about their fate, like it was no big deal! Seriously, they were almost like kids trying to decide who took the best toys... only they were doing the opposite.

"Swinub..." Azurill whispered, fighting back tears. Swinub looked at him.
"A-Azurill, they're gonna kill us, aren't they?" he asked with terror, causing Azurill to shiver.
"... I don't know Swinub... I don't know..."

Zorua stared at the two girls in front of him, before he had an idea.

"... Why don't you two take one each? That way, the risk of being discovered is lessened, no?" he reasoned, causing Celebi to look at him.

"... You're right. But..."

"Kirlia would notice..." Gardevoir interrupted. Zorua looked at her.
"... Can she keep a secret?" he asked.

Gardevoir gave a sigh.
"Yes..." she said, before gazing up.
"... Maybe?" she offered.

"... Whatever. Take one of these two, hide him well and tomorrow they can go back home, telling that they were invited to a sleepover that had absolutely nothing to do with shrinking... right you two?" Zorua asked. Celebi looked at her boyfriend - his mind never ceased to amaze her. Why use it to prank, she thought, what a waste of intellect. Uxie would be disappointed.

Swinub didn't respond to Zorua's words.

Azurill nodded. He knew what was going to happen if he didn't agree - they were talking about keeping him as a pet earlier... so why couldn't they do the same to Swinub too?

Seriously, the two kids were reduced to living dolls in the hands of these three giant teens. Either they did like they said, or they became pets.

Gardevoir sighed in exasperation.
"Alright. Let's just get this over with." she said, handing Azurill to Celebi and keeping Swinub in her paws. He flailed weakly, scared.
"I'll have a word with him." she said.

Zorua snickered.
"And I'll have fun with him." he said, grinning at Azurill, who shivered.

Celebi sighed.

The trio and the tinies walked out of the dark alley

"See you tomorrow." Gardevoir saluted as she walked towards her house.
"See ya." Zorua responded.
"Bye Gard." Celebi said as she and Zorua walked towards their own house.

Azurill glanced at Gardevoir one last time before she and his best friend disappeared behind a corner.

--

"Hi sis~ where have you been~?"

Gardevoir didn't respond and walked towards her room, keeping Swinub pinned against her chest. It was hard to keep him still, and her sister was pirouetting behind her.

The older psychic type sighed.
"Kirlia... dad is still working?" she asked. The younger sister nodded cheerfully.

"... Did you eat already?"

"Nope~ waiting for you~" she sang. Gardevoir smiled.
"Okay then... let me take care of something and I'll start dinner." she said, walking inside the room they shared and closing it behind herself.

She finally pulled Swinub back and looked at him, her crimson eyes piercing his soul.
"... Swinub dear, I'm going to hide you now... I beg you, don't try to run, because then I'll have to tell Celebi..." she said, moving towards her bed and sliding the swine under her pillow, making sure he could breath.

"... I'll bring you something to eat later, then we'll have to talk. Be good until then please." she said as she walked towards the door again.

Once she disappeared outside, Swinub let out a cry of fear.

--

Her mom wasn't angry, but it was only a matter of time, Celebi noted as she stood in front of the pink Celebi, hoping that the invisible Zorua and Azurill were already in her room.

"... Where have you been, missy? You said that you had to take care of something before coming home... it's been three hours." the elder time traveler scolded.

Celebi finally put her bags down.

All of a sudden, she was glad that Gardevoir dragged her to that cafe.

"I had to meet up with Gardevoir, she wanted to show me a cool place... I lost the track of time mom, sorry," she partially lied.

Her mother sighed.
"... Fine. Dinner will be ready soon." she said, walking into the living room.

Celebi sighed too - danger subsided.

She walked into her room exhausted.

Now, she only prayed that Zorua wasn't toying with Azurill already.

The last thing she wanted was her mother hearing a technically kidnapped shrunken kid crying in her room because of an infamous scoundrel that was actually her boyfriend.

That'd be a lot to explain.

She entered her room, noticing Zorua snickering down at a cornered Azurill, who was shaking like a leaf.

Celebi sighed - she knew Zorua didn't want to hurt him, but he didn't have to torment him either.

Quickly, Celebi focused on her boyfriend, who soon found himself shrinking down, until he was slightly bigger than Azurill.

"Hey! Warn me the next time!" he complained as Celebi walked over the two tiny pokemon and scooped the dark type up, before climbing on her bed and hugging him.

Celebi let out a loud sigh as she started caressing him.

She looked at him with hazy eyes.

"... What have we gotten ourselves into?"
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Best friends gotta split sometimes

choices: Kirlia finds Swinub
She successfully hides Swinub
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Swinub was under the pillow, scared out of his wits. He had rounded a corner and ran into these teenagers, including Zorua who was small...then they made him small, as well as Azurill and took him away...he gulped.

Azurill was with Zorua now...he wanted to cry but he dared not, he didn't want to anger the giantess that was keeping him...he allowed himself a shiver though as he sat there, waiting for her to come back.

-

Gardevoir had made something quick for Kirlia, she herself wasn't too hungry since she had eaten earlier and Kirlia was pouting a bit.

"You already ate~" She said and Gardevoir sighed before smiling at her little sister.

"Sorry, I ran into Celebi and one thing led to another...but i'm making your favorite, okay?" It was a simple recipe really, mac & cheese with a bit of meat. Kirlia loved it and it was the perfect comfort food.

...something she'd try to use to calm Swinub too, if she could just make sure that he understood they meant no harm and needed to keep Zorua a secret while keeping HIM a secret from Kirlia then things would be fine right? Though Swinub seemed scared of his own shadow because of what Zorua had done to him...and Zorua didn't help in trying to calm Swinub down. No they gave him to her. She smiled a bit.

She had a little sister, right? She could calm him down.

-

Gardevoir left Kirlia to her dinner as she snuck a few noodles and chunks of meat onto a napkin and went back to her room to see that Swinub was still cowering under her pillow. He looked ready to cry.

"Hey Swinub...I brought you food..." She said gently as she put the napkin down outside of the pillow.

He stayed there cowering.

"I just want to talk, okay? I promise that i'm not going to hurt you. If you cooperate then you and Azurill can go home tomorrow morning...I just need to explain to you what's going on." She said, hoping the younger pokemon would understand.

She saw that slowly, tentatively he came out and sniffed at the food. He slowly started to munch into it as she smiled.

"Hungry huh? That's fine, go ahead and eat and then we'll talk, alright?" She said gently as he tried to avert his gaze from the giantess. She was huge...too huge. Impossibly huge and he didn't want to be here. But the mac & cheese...was good. He didn't deny that.

He sniffled a bit as he ate, he didn't want to cry...she wouldn't like that right?

As he ate though a few silent tears leaked out, something Gardevoir noticed.

The poor kid was really scared out of his mind.

She heard a knock.

"Sis, i'm done, can I come in~"

Gardevoir bit her lip.

"Hey uh...sis, can you maybe do the dishes for me?" Gardevoir said and she heard a huff from outside the door.

"...Fine" She heard, her sister was pouty, but at least she listened.

Swinub for his part had finished eating too it seemed. He had eaten most of a noodle and some of the meat...Gardevoir quickly deposited the rest of it into her mouth and swallowed before turning her attention to him again.

"About what's going on Swinub..."

"I just want to go home..." Swinub muttered out and Gardevoir's expression softened.

"You will, we just need to make sure that you don't tell other pokemon about Zorua and Celebi...it could really hurt them." Gardevoir said and Swinub looked at her.

"What do you mean...? Zorua is..."

"Look, I know what Zorua did to you...and it was wrong. He knows it was wrong even if that's hard to see right now with him...he's gone through a lot himself lately and I promise you that he means no harm to you or any other pokemon right now. He's staying with Celebi due to...unfortunate circumstances bringing them together but they're both happy. You and Azurill know about him and Celebi's power and if word got out it'd be bad for them...it could even end up hurting them. We don't want that to happen." Gardevoir said and Swinub took in this information.

"You...I know you have reasons to hate Zorua, to fear him, and it's not your fault...but all the same we need to protect him...please understand that. If you do then we'll happily let you go and we promise not to disturb you, Zorua will not harm you anymore, you just need to understand and keep our secret." She said gently and he looked down.

"I-I still have nightmares about him..." He said. That Munchlax landing on him...the laughter...the pain...the surprise and harshness of being trapped in that pit for hours. He sniffled a bit.

And now he was tiny with some teenager who was protecting him.

He felt a gentle force on his back as Gardevoir pet him.

"It'll be okay Swinub...alright? Tonight, just rest and avoid my sister...i'll leave you somewhere hidden and comfortable away from her and tomorrow you and Azurill can go home." She said gently as he seemed to calm down a little bit.

"O-okay...I won't say anything about what happened...i-if it meant Zorua won't hurt me anymore..." Swinub said and Gardevoir sighed.

Good, she'd gotten through to him.

Kirlia knocked on the door.

"Okay sis, i'm done, coming in now~" She said and Gardevoir slightly panicked as she gently picked Swinub up.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Calming him down.

choices: In the morning
That night
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
The door opened as Gardevoir thought fast to hide Swinub, but she didn't have many available options off the top of her head, as her sister came into view she quickly put her paws behind her back, still holding Swinub.

For his part he felt fast motion as she did this, and it spooked him a bit but he dared not utter a sound.

"Hey Kirlia, thanks for doing that." Gardevoir said with a smile as Kirlia looked at her, slightly suspicious.

"You're being weird tonight sis~" She said, before smiling and coming into the room, shutting the door behind her.

Gardevoir fidgeted. She had no idea what to do at this point to keep Swinub hidden from her sister, she felt caught.

"Hey uh...Kirlia, can you go get me a glass of water?" She asked, slightly nervously as Kirlia eyed her.

"Hmm...nope~" She said, now she was suspicious. "What's behind your back~" She asked as she started to do a pirouette in the room and Gardevoir gulped before smiling at Kirlia.

"I don't know what you mean."

Swinub was getting nervous now...he didn't want another giant to know about him, seeing the giant teenagers was enough to make him terrified as is. He started shaking and Gardevoir felt it and tightened her grip a little.

That was her fatal mistake.

She squeezed a bit harder than intended and Swinub let out a loud yelp of pain as Gardevoir's eyes widened and Kirlia looked at her.

Gardevoir quickly pulled Swinub in front of her face to check him over, she hoped she hadn't done anything too bad...Swinub was shivering and sniffling as she checked him, but he seemed okay. She sighed with relief only to look up to see...Kirlia was right there too.

"Wow, is that Swinub~" She said as she reached a paw forward to poke him. Swinub seemed to shrink a bit in Gardevoir's grasp as he felt a gentle poke from Kirlia. He whimpered and Gardevoir sighed.

"Yes, it's Swinub..." She said defeated and Kirlia looked from him to Gardevoir. "Why is he so small~" She asked and Gardevoir bit her lip.

"If I tell you, you need to keep it a secret...from everyone."

"I will~" She said.

"...Go get some water first please, i'm thirsty and i'm sure Swinub is too, okay?" She said gently as Kirlia left the room quickly, wanting to hear what was going on.

"...Are you alright dear? I'm sorry about that...truly." Gardevoir said in a gentle tone to the shivering pokemon. He was so overwhelmed right now.

"I-is she going to be shrunken down too?" He asked timidly.

"Pardon?" She was confused.

"It's just...i'm sorry that she found out about me...you said you'd tell Celebi if it happened...I just don't want her to be shrunk down too..." Gardevoir looked at him with a gentle expression.

"She's my little sister, I wouldn't let Celebi do that to her...and you getting found...that was my fault, not yours. Celebi won't punish you for it, in fact...i'm sorry about this whole mess honestly...you don't deserve this." She said as she stroked him a little and he seemed to settle.

"When she comes back with water, i'll explain the situation, then put you both to bed. In the morning we'll send you on your way." She said and Swinub looked up.

"And Azurill?" He asked and she smiled.

"And Azurill."

Kirlia came back with the water and looked to her sister, then Swinub.

"So what happened~" She asked and Gardevoir sighed before going into it. Celebi's power, Zorua, and Swinub and Azurill finding them. Kirlia listened with intent and smiled as the story went on.

"Celebi has a boyfriend~"

"I know!" Gardevoir said enthusiastically as they both giggled. But Gardevoir shook her head. This was not the time for that!

"Listen, Zorua still has a lot of enemies...unfortunately, Azurill and Swinub both have legitimate cause to hold a grudge and though I know Swinub wouldn't act on it...he was having a meltdown just seeing the whole thing and the tiny Zorua. Celebi shrunk him and...I calmed him down, right Swinub?" She said and Swinub looked down before nodding.

"I just want to go home...if Zorua doesn't bug me then i'm happy..." He said and Kirlia looked at him.

"Seems like rotten luck Swinub...you're always so quiet when I see you but...you helped me with that school assignment once Swinub, remember...I never thanked you for that~" She said as she reached out again. Swinub winced but felt a gentle touch stroke him. He calmed down a bit before Kirlia looked at her sister.

"Can I hold him for the night~ I'm sure he'd be comfortable in bed with me~" She said and Gardevoir smiled. "Shouldn't you ask him that?" She said and Kirlia looked at Swinub...her giant face very close, it intimidated him, despite her gentle smile.

"Swinub...can I hold you for the night? I'll be gentle~" She asked and slowly, he nodded.

"S-sure...just d-don't hurt me..." He said and she nodded.

"Be very VERY careful...he's fragile and you don't want to make him uncomfortable." She said and Kirlia nodded. "I won't hurt him...I won't hurt you Swinub~" She said as he was exchanged from teen to the pokemon his age.

She crawled into bed with him as Gardevoir sighed.

"Been a while since i've gotten you in bed ON time. Dad'll be shocked."

Kirlia giggled at this but didn't respond vocally. Swinub felt himself pressed to a warm surface. It soothed him, he had to admit...

"Have a good night you two...i'll bring you as well Kirlia, when we visit Celebi."

And with that Gardevoir left the two to go to bed.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Swinub and Kirlia

choices: "... Okay... let's just keep quiet." Azurill responded, convinced
"Hmm..." Azurill pondered, unsure
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
For the first time after quite some time, Swinub slept without Zorua-related nightmares, didn't wake up screaming in the middle of the night, covered in sweat and with a heart full of fear.

No.

He was reassured. Not only that though; the softness of Kirlia's bed and of Kirlia herself, the beats of her heart, her stomach gurgling softly, her chest rising up and falling down along with her rhythmic breathing... he fell asleep in no time.

And he slept peacefully throughout the night, like kids of his age should.

Several hours later, the same Swinub was still asleep on a deserted bed while Kirlia and Gardevoir walked inside the room, the second holding a plate of food for breakfast.

Obviously, most of it was for the two girls.

Taking care of a shrunken kid has its advantages, Gardevoir thought as she watched her younger sister gently shaking Swinub to wake him up.

The small swine woke up because of the gentle rocking and looked at the two girls.

"Good morning Swinub! Slept well?" Kirlia said cheerfully, almost deafening the poor kid. Gardevoir sighed - why was her sister always so annoyingly loud? - as she gently set the plate in front of Swinub.

Nothing more than two eggs and two sausages. A bite or two of those was a feast to Swinub.

Gardevoir cut a piece of sausage and gave it to Swinub, who hungrily started to eat.
"Let's be quick," Gardevoir said.

"Because after this we're going to see Celi and her boyfriend~ and Azurill." Kirlia chimed.

Azurill.

Gardevoir's mind traveled to the blue mouse.

Had he behaved throughout his stay at Celebi's house?

She sure hoped so.

--

The knocking was getting insistent, but Celebi kept on sleeping.

It was absolutely unusual of her - she was always up by 7 AM. She had an horrible night, nightmares kept haunting her, forcing her to wake up with her heart pounding her chest several times.

For the first time, she could tell that she envied Zorua, who kept sleeping soundly during the whole night.

The fairy rolled over in her sleep, hugging Zorua more tightly. The knocking didn't cease yet.

"Mooom... door..." she whispered.

No response. Her mother was obviously off to work.

"Zorua... door..." she tried again.

Again, no response. Zorua was still asleep and hopelessly too small to get the door anyway.

That only left one alternative before she had to go get the door.

"Azurill..." that name seemed to switch on her brain.
"Azurill... Azurill..." Celebi's eyes shot wide open and looked across the room.

Azurill was still asleep in his jar, wrapped up in cotton wool she gave him. She swore she saw tears beneath his eyes.

Another knock.

Celebi quickly got up from bed, letting go of Zorua in the process, and stumbled out of the room to open her front door, hazily eyeing Gardevoir, Kirlia and Swinub who was sitting on top of the younger sister's paws.

"Morning Celi~" Kirlia chimed, getting a drowsy yawn in response.

"Gard... did you talk to him...?" the fairy asked, before her sleepy mind finally processed the fact that Kirlia was holding Swinub.

She paled and eyed Gardevoir, who smiled.

"Our little secret... right sis?" she said, Kirlia nodding cheerfully.

Celebi sighed, her mouth producing a few inarticulate sounds, before finally managing to speak properly.

"... Come in."

--

"... So ya won't talk, huh?" Zorua drowsily asked the two small kids on the table in front of him.

He felt sleepy, Celebi had thrown him out of bed five minutes ago. Literally.

She had grown him to his size and pushed him onto the floor.

Maybe for the first time after the ‘Munchlax accident’, Swinub met his gaze.

"No." he told. Zorua nodded, his gaze shifted on Azurill.
"And ya, kid?" he asked.

"No..." Azurill replied dejectedly. His awakening was much more rough than Zorua's - he woke up when his head hit the glass of his jar and found that the fox was shaking it with a smirk on his face.

Celebi smiled.
"Okay you two..." she said, her eyes glowing with psychic energy.

The two kids were engulfed in it and grew up to their original sizes.

The table trembled menacingly under Swinub's weight and Azurill quickly jumped off the wooden surface that had been his perch.

Swinub too jumped down. Both best friends looked at the four pokemon in front of them.

"Now you two, you're free to go... but remember, one wrong word and... I think I've made it clear. Go." Celebi told.

She didn't have to repeat twice - the two kids ran out of the room.

Soon, the four pokemon heard the front door slamming close.

Azurill and Swinub were gone.

--

"Seriously, what do we do?" Azurill asked at some point as the two walked in direction of Wigglytuff's house, the house they resided in.

"What do you mean?"

"Dude, this was crazy! We've got to do something..." Azurill said, shivering at the memory of being tiny.

Swinub stopped and looked at him.
"... W-We can't talk Azurill... Celebi would shrink us and make us pets..." he mused.
"... A-And I actually had a great time with Gardevoir and Kirlia... they were nice..."

Azurill sighed.
"Happy for you... Celebi kept reading and Zorua kept snickering whenever he looked at me..." he revealed.
"No, seriously, we should tell... we..." the blue mouse went quiet.

"We shouldn't talk Azurill... t-they let us go because we told that we won't talk.... otherwise..." Swinub said to his best friend.
"... Don't you think that that Wigglytuff could handle them?" Azurill pondered.

Swinub looked at him, emitting a low sigh.
"They'd shrink him too... seriously Azurill, l-let's just keep quiet... w-we s-saw nothing, w-we heard nothing, w-we were invited to a sleepover, that was why we didn't go back home... it's better if we don't talk... Zorua won't hurt us anymore... they promised..."

Azurill looked at his best friend, partially convinced.

Yet...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Back to normal

choices: “I’d prefer to spend time alone with him Gard.”
“Why don’t we go see the other girls?”
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
“Them getting away with treating us like that...it doesn’t sit right but...fine. I’m ready to just stay inside and not see those pokemon for a loooong time. I guess no Zorua to pester us is a win for us anyway. Let’s not talk.”

Azurill figured it’d probably bite him in the butt if he talked...

“That jar sucked...” He complained and Swinub looked at him.

“...Kirlia held me to her chest in her bed for sleeping. It felt nice...” He said and Azurill sighed.

“Don’t tempt me to smack you man...”

-

“I just can’t believe it~” Kirlia was riding the normal sized Zorua who seemed to be grumbling while Celebi and Gardevoir giggled. They had decided to spend the day out and about and Zorua insisted on being normal to prevent ‘incidents’

He was considering giving this annoying kid a ride to be an ‘incident’ too.

“You know, you can take her home anytime Gard, don’t feel like you have to hang around.” Zorua said and Celebi rolled her eyes.

“Don’t be rude Zorua, they helped us, right?”

“It was really no trouble, except for Kirlia’s nosiness and finding him.”

Kirlia giggled at this.

“You should consider apologizing for real Zorua, Swinub is a good kid.”

This time Zorua rolled his eyes. “If he doesn’t talk then I consider us avoiding each other to be a fine apology in a way. He has assurance that I won’t torment him and I doubt he wants to see me again.”

“I want to see him again~” Kirlia said. “He was fun to cuddle with~”

Celebi grinned.

“Aw, that’s adorable~”

“Oh don’t you start!”

Though Zorua snickered. The kid that threatened him was miserable last night but the one he actually felt a BIT bad for it sounds like was fine and comfy. That’s some kinda justice.

“So what’s the plan today anyway? I’m not playing ponyta all day for your sister Gard.”

“Kirlia, go ahead and get off of him.”

Zorua felt lighter as the kid got off and he sighed in relief.

Celebi spoke.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Keeping quiet and Zorua’s passenger

choices: "Azurill, darn it why won't you listen to me!?"
"Maybe you're right Azurill..."
"I knew it!" Zorua drops an illusion, he was tailing them
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"Hmm...I dunno man, do you really want them to get away with this?" Azurill said and Swinub looked to his friend, stopping in his tracks as Azurill did too.

"I-it isn't a-about them getting a-away with this...it's about w-what we c-can do to protect o-ourselves..." Swinub retorted and Azurill looked unimpressed.

"Come on man, be brave, this might be our chance to get Zorua finally!" Azurill said and Swinub shook his head.

"N-no...h-he isn't out in the open anymore, he won't h-hurt us or anyone else, r-right?" Swinub said and Azurill rolled his eyes.

"We don't know that, we just know he's staying with Celebi, out of the forest! If we let pokemon know that, he'll be theirs to nab! No tricks or traps in the forest to hide in!" Azurill exclaimed and Swinub still seemed unsure.

"I-I just think w-we should go h-home and watch TV....Celebi is p-protecting him, and both of the C-Celebi's are the most powerful pokemon in the v-village...s-she showed what she c-can do to us Azurill...b-be smart..." Swinub said and Azurill glared.

"I AM smart, you're being a coward, as usual! I'm gonna make sure Zorua doesn't bother any pokemon ever again by letting pokemon know EXACTLY what's going on! Are you with me or not Swinub!?" Azurill was getting annoyed at this point.

Swinub sighed and was about to open his mouth...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Azurill's proclamation

choices: "If you can convince him, it'd be great," Celebi said as she handed Azurill
"Sorry Swinub... we'll deal with him," Celebi said as she and Zorua walked away
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"You know what?" Azurill said, throwing Swinub's words back down his throat.
"I'm doing it! Zorua won't bother anyone anymore!" he practically shouted that.

In determination, he sped up... before something stepped on his tail, which extended as long as it could before it snapped back in place, causing Azurill to fall on his behind.

There's an old say, ‘Careful what you wish for, you never know who might be listening’; and, while this wasn't exactly the case, someone had been listening to Azurill from the metaphorical shadows of his illusion.

Like appearing from hell itself, Zorua dispelled an illusion, snickering, paw holding Azurill's tail down.

"I knew it!" he exclaimed triumphantly.

Azurill started shaking, Swinub remained oddly calm and just reared back a bit.

Zorua's muzzle was pushed against Azurill.

"Y'know, I don't care what they say, I'm not an idiot. Nor I'm stupid. And technically I'm not a jerk anymore, buuut..." he snickered,
"I could make an exception."

"Zorua!"

A green pokemon both Azurill and Swinub learned to fear flew closer, staring at her boyfriend with confusion. Gardevoir and Kirlia were gone.

But Celebi's stare became a frown, which was for Zorua.

"Zorua, are you bothering them again?" she asked, annoyed.

"What do you think I'm doing?"

"I don't know! You just bolted off all of a sudden!"

"And I did good!" at this point, Zorua turned to look at his ’prey’, who stared back at him with a look that screamed ‘please’.

"Y'see, this blue blabbermouth was thinking about snitching again, I heard those words from his mouth!"

Celebi took a moment to repeat the words she heard.

Then, her glare darted from Zorua to Azurill.

"You didn't learn your lesson last night, did you? And I even let you go... we didn't lay a finger on you, and that's the thanks we get?" Celebi asked. She was tired of shrinking and kidnapping kids.

Shrinking and kidnapping Zorua was another deal, he had no one. But these two... someone was surely gonna search for them.

She wanted to try and talk to Azurill this time... but if he didn't want to listen, she had no other option.

"T-Thanks?" Azurill parroted back, dumbfounded.
"You shrunk me! You shrunk Swinub!"

"For the same reason we are doing this now kid. Oh, and Celi, you didn't hear the best part!" Zorua looked at Swinub, who instinctively started shaking.

"This blue ball called that good kid Swinub a coward just because he didn't want to talk, just because he was being reasonable!" he said.

Praising didn't make Swinub stop shaking.

"Hmm. I see." Celebi chimed, again looking at Azurill, reconsidering.
"And now what? I threaten to shrink you, you promise to not talk and I let you go so you'll have another chance to rat us out?" she lectured.

Her eyes shut.

"Zorua, I'm tired of shrinking kids." she said, exasperated.

"D'you prefer the alternative?" the fox questioned, and Celebi opened her eyes.

"No."

And for the poor Azurill, those words sealed his fate.

Again, that familiar glow returned to Celebi's eyes; the same gleam enveloped Azurill while Zorua let go, watching as the kid shrunk to a doll, then to an insect.

Instantly, the blue mouse was gripped by psychic, before Celebi looked at Swinub, who had been quiet throughout the whole process.

"What about him?"

Swinub took a step back, ready to run. But Zorua wore a friendly grin on his face as he stepped closer.

He raised a paw, and the swine immediately stopped in place.

But Zorua did nothing aside from patting his back.

"This one is a good kid, I already said it. He's free to go," the fox declared, grinning at Swinub,
"As long as he keeps in mind that he saw none of this, or what we did last night."

Celebi stared at the brown pokemon for a few, eternal moments, before her eyes finally stopped glowing as she nodded.

"We'll be taking Azurill for now, Swinub. We'll give him back, don't talk, okay?" she said, feeling much like Zorua in his days as a prankster.

"And if they ask, you come up with an excuse, right?" Zorua continued, feeling much like himself in his days as a prankster.

Swinub nodded timidly. Azurill whimpered.

"T-Traitor!" he shouted furiously, even though he was crying.

Snickering, Zorua turned around and started walking away, Celebi following and Azurill floating behind them.

Swinub watched his best friend floating away from him... and for once, he decided to be brave.

"Wait."

Zorua stopped.

"Hm?" he looked as Swinub walked towards him.

"I want him."

Zorua, Azurill and Celebi reacted after several seconds,

"What?"

"I'll bring him home, hide him, make s-sure to convince him to not talk... but please, let him come with me... I'll bring him back when I'm sure he won't talk..." he begged.

Zorua started snickering while his gaze went from Swinub to Azurill.

"What a great friend kid!" he chimed.

He looked at Celebi, who was looking deep in thought, considering the proposal.

"Hmm..."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Azurill goes back to square one

choices: Zorua and Celebi dump Azurill in the jar at home and ignore him for now
Zorua and Celebi are intent to teach Azurill a lesson
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"Sorry Swinub...having him in the same house as all those other kids with you...it's too risky. We'll deal with him." Swinub looked sad but Zorua sighed.

"He'll be fine Swinub...he just needs to get it in his head that he can't blab about us...I won't hurt him." Zorua said but then grinned. "Well...nothing too bad..." Swinub and Azurill both gulped but the insect sized pokemon could do nothing but look on at the titans discussing his fate.

"S-Swinub, don't let them do this!" Azurill pleaded but Swinub shook his head.

"A-Azurill...I tried to tell you...please, whatever happens, do what they say...I'll make an excuse, then when it's all over we can forget..." Swinub said to his tiny friend and Celebi smiled.

"Don't fret Swinub, I really appreciate you handling this the way you are...we'll do what we can to...not be too hard." Celebi's smile faltered a bit at the end. She had to admit, her patience with Azurill was reaching its absolute limit...and she could only imagine what Zorua had in store for the brat.

She didn't know if she'd stop him short of anything fatal, he needed to learn his lesson.

"Take care kid! Oh, and for real, sorry about the pit thing...won't happen again!" Zorua flashed a grin, and soon the three pokemon were on their way away from Swinub.

"Please...be okay Azurill..." Swinub said as he continued on his path.

-

"P-please, if you let me go I-"

"Shut up." Zorua said it coldly, the voice was loud for the insect sized pokemon, he had to wince with how close he was to Zorua's head.

"Celebi, i'll carry him myself." Zorua said, Celebi giving him an odd look before...in one quick flash Azurill found his environment had changed as Zorua snapped him into his mouth real quick.

"Zorua!" Celebi said shocked but Zorua just gave her a look.

"I won't swallow...but i'm done playing nice with him." Zorua stated, now the loud words giving Azurill a headache, as he was damp in Zorua's saliva. He looked around at canines bigger than him and whimpered...

"Why me?" He said quietly.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Back in their grasp

choices: "... He'll make a fine pet/toy."
Celebi is having second thoughts...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"Hmm... I don't know... Zorua?" Celebi said, looking down at the tiny fox sitting on top of her lap.
"What do we do with him? Do we send him home?" she asked, slowly caressing him with a paw.

Zorua looked amused - Azurill's life was in his paws, huh?

"I don't know either Celi... I mean, wouldn't want him to think that he can threaten us anytime he wants..." Zorua said, smirking down at the blue mouse, who started shivering.

He was sure, Zorua wasn't going to let him go... nor make things easy for him... heck, maybe he was going to kill him...

"Plus..." Zorua continued,
"He knows way too much now... how do we know he won't rat us out?"

"... I won't! I promise I won't tell about you, just let me go!" Azurill shouted in desperation, trying to convince Zorua to let him go.

And if not him, at least Celebi... she was far more kind than Zorua, no matter how much he changed since the accident.

The green fairy looked at the small mouse, thinking.

"Hmm... Zorua is got a point Azurill... how do we know you won't snitch?" she said.

"I swear I won't tell anybody about Zorua... or your powers... just let me go, please!" the blue fairy type yelled again, tears rolling down his cheeks.

Zorua snickered.
"Sorry kid... y'see, I can't simply trust you like this... Plus, your apologies aren't so sincere, are they? An apology coming from a coward is worthless." he said.

Azurill whimpered, each word Zorua spoke hitting him like he was repeatedly slapping him across the face.

Azurill dropped onto the ground and started crying loudly.

Celebi looked at him... and finally her heart seemed to open up a bit for the first time since the mouse threatened them.

"Zorua..." she whispered, snatching the dark type up and bringing him to her face.
"Zorua... I think this is a bit much... I think he won't bother us anymore, can't we just send him home?" she asked.

Zorua's smirk faded.

"No way Celi! That mouse tried to blackmail us, he wanted to rat me out! What would happen if someone discovers me like this? I'll tell ya, they'd hunt me down!" he shouted, before adopting a sad expression.
"Celi... that also means that we would probably lose each other... do you want that?" he asked.

Celebi blinked, the fox's words sinking in her mind.

"But... he said he won't talk..." she meekly opposed. Zorua huffed.
"And you believe him?" he asked.

Celebi couldn't argue - the possibility of Azurill talking about them was pretty big.

And what Zorua said was true.

If someone knew about Zorua and his relationship with her, word of it would have spread... and it would have eventually reached her mom.

If it did, Zorua was going to be thrown out of her house, she would lose him and her mother was probably going to keep her cooped up in the house.

She couldn't risk none of those things - she liked Zorua far too much to let him out of her life... and quite frankly, she didn't want to be confined in the house, she had a life to live.

...

But... Azurill was a child, far younger than Celebi and Zorua... he too had his life to live.

Depriving him of that seemed quite irresponsible... but Celebi couldn't be sure that he wasn't going to talk.

Either she gave up Azurill and kept Zorua, or she gave up Zorua and sent Azurill home.

Azurill or Zorua? A little kid or her beloved boyfriend?

...

The choice seemed pretty obvious.

Celebi shook her head and looked at Azurill.

"Azurill... we debated long enough and we've come to a conclusion... we can't let you go." she said, causing the mouse to cry and Zorua to snicker.

"B-But I... I-I promise I'm not going to talk! I want to go back home!... You wanted me to beg, right? You won - I beg you! Just grow me back and let me go, p-p-please!" Azurill cried, unable to bear the situation anymore.

All he wanted was to go home...

However, Celebi shook her head, suddenly returning cold.

"You should've thought better Azurill." she said, before her gaze shifted and landed down upon Zorua.
"And you Zorua... what do we do with him now? Any suggestions?" she asked.

Zorua opened his mouth to speak.

"Nothing lethal... he's just a kid." Celebi intercepted. This was the least she could do to feel less guilty - make sure Azurill remained alive. She had to make sure to keep an eye on him too.

Zorua sighed.

So, he couldn't eat Azurill.

"... Let's leave him here like this?" he asked.

On the ground, Azurill's heart skipped a beat. Luckily, Celebi opposed.
"That counts as lethal..." she said.

Zorua huffed - how could he come up with something fun and at the same time not lethal to do with Azurill now?

The kid attempted to blackmail them.

"You're protecting him." he said to Celebi, who nodded in confirm.
"Little kid... stays alive... Pick something." she said.

Zorua sighed again.

"... Why don't you pick instead?" Zorua asked.

Celebi looked at him, a bit surprised that Zorua was letting the chance of picking Azurill's fate so easily.

She pondered about it for a few moments.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Azurill's sentence

choices: Zorua relents
Zorua keeps tormenting him
Celebi comes over
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"He'll make a fine pet." Celebi said as Azurill squeaked and tried to run, only to find himself pinned by a psychic force.

"No no no! I don't want to be a pet! Please, i'm sorry!" He cried. Celebi bit her lip...she did feel a bit bad for Azurill, but there was no way that she could risk being found out now.

"Too late kid, you're ours to toy with!" Zorua said with glee as Azurill was lifted up by the psychic force and brought forward to the giant Zorua.

"Handle him Zorua - gently." She said and Zorua nodded grinning as Zorua opened his mouth. Azurill started crying again and Zorua rolled his eyes.

"I'm not going to chew or swallow so just shut up and get in." He opened it again and Azurill was placed in the mouth.

He whimpered as he sat on Zorua's tongue and found it humid and dark, he was more scared than he'd ever been.

"mommy..." He muttered as her started sniffling.

-

"He's kinda boring." Zorua said as Azurill sat glumly in the jar he'd been placed in. Zorua had been looking at him, Azurill wasn't doing anything but sitting on his tail. Celebi for her part was reading a book.

"What if I..." Zorua grinned as he spun the jar around. Azurill was dizzy as he bounced around the jar, trying not to hit the glass too hard, using his tail to guard himself.

Zorua stopped and looked at him, grinning.

Azurill fell onto his back and rolled over, trying to avoid Zorua's gaze.

"Oh no, I want you looking at me." Zorua spun the jar again, and the same thing happened.

Azurill was breathing heavy now as he laid there, looking at Zorua. He whimpered and shivered as he backed up to the end of the jar on the other size at Zorua's sadistic smile.

"Please...just leave me alone..." Azurill whimpered.

"Oh...leave you alone..." Zorua mocked in the same tone as Azurill looked down.

"Why are you so mean Zorua?" Azurill asked in the same sad tone and Zorua grinned.

"Shouldn't have threatened me." He said and Azurill sniffled.

"Sorry...I just wanted to get you back for what you did to me...it was wrong...I just want to see my mommy again..." Azurill started crying and Zorua looked at him.

"Well you should've thought of that before-" Zorua stopped, wait, his mom was the one that was dead right? He was with Wigglytuff because of that.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: A pet

choices: "O-Okay... I'll do it..." Azurill meekly stated
"N-No way! Y-You can't do that!" Azurill fiercely opposed
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Celebi sighed and looked away from her book to glance at her desk, where Azurill and Zorua were still talking... and from Zorua's questions, she quickly understood the subject of their chat: Azurill's deceased mother.

Celebi bit her lip - if this kept going, Azurill could start crying at any moment... and the fairy didn't want her mom to hear him and enter the room all of a sudden, discovering her with a former scoundrel and a kidnapped child... even if she wasn't going to be a problem now.

Introducing Zorua and Azurill into the house was easier than expected - her mom was watching TV... but fell asleep on the couch, in front of the screen. Apparently, the mother-daughter day they had left her tired. And Celebi could freely sneak inside her room and place Azurill in the jar.

Still, the pink Celebi could wake up if she heard Azurill crying...
something Celebi herself had to keep from happening.

So, the fairy shut her book and got up, walking closer to her desk.

"Seriously, a doll as a last gift? That's-"

"Awfully nice - Zorua quit it." she said, scooping up her tiny boyfriend into her paws.

"Just asking questions." he responded.

"That's a delicate subject. And you Azurill..." Celebi said, pulling back her chair and sitting down, placing Zorua next to the jar.

"... I understand this is hard, okay? But for now, you're remaining this size and you'll be stuck with us... this until I'm completely sure you won't talk. If you try anything against us though..." Celebi gave him a solemn look, which gave Azurill a quite accurate idea of what the consequences would be if he disobeyed.

Alright, he had thought about ratting the couple out... but they had no reason to believe it! And now, he had been promising to keep quiet for a while, why couldn't the two simply believe him?

"W-When will I go h-home...?" he meekly asked.

"I've told it Azurill... whenever I'm sure you won't talk. That might take a while... so I'd recommend you try to adjust." Celebi said.

"Ya heard that? Get ready for fun!" Zorua chimed in, snickering.

Celebi shook her head - the fox wasn't being of any help.

"So, Azurill... you'll need to cooperate. Be a good pet, and I'm letting you go." she said.

"B-But... I-I don't want to be a pet! You can't do this to me!" Azurill shouted, causing Celebi to frown.

"Oh... you made a mistake kid..." Zorua said.

Celebi grabbed the jar, placing it near her face.
"Listen here, the sooner you decide to cooperate, the sooner I'm giving you back your size... otherwise, welcome to your new life as our pet." she menaced.

Azurill gulped. Zorua lost his smirk.

Never in the... two days of dating Celebi he had seen her so angry, not even when she lost the bet and had to buy him things.

As for the blue mouse inside the jar, he stared in fear, not quite knowing how to reply.

A deafening silence fell among the three pokemon as Celebi kept glaring at the jar.

From Azurill's point of view, and from Zorua's too, she looked like an angry goddess/giantess.

Sadly, the moment was spoiled by a knock at the door.

"Honey... dinner!" her mom called, apparently having woken up from her nap.

Celebi sighed, and put the jar back on the bed.

"I'm giving you some time to decide Azurill... and you better make a good choice. Watch him Zorua." she told, and Zorua put a paw to his forehead as he made a mock salute.

Celebi smiled at him, and lowered herself to peck his cheek, before leaving the room.

Only Azurill and Zorua remained inside.

The fox snickered.
"Well... need something to do until she comes back..." he said, and turned around.
"Have you seen her kid? You got her angry... If I were you, I'd choose carefully..." he said, placing a paw on the jar.

Before Azurill could actually reply, the jar started spinning again.

--

The door of the room opened.

"I'm back." Celebi announced, closing the door again and walking to the desk, placing a piece of meat in front of Zorua, who greedily started eating.

Celebi caressed him on the head, before holding a berry in front of Azurill's jar.

It was gigantic.

Azurill's stomach growled in hunger.

"Before I give you this, Azurill, have you decided? Will you be a good pet?" Celebi asked.

Azurill started whimpering - he didn't want to be a pet, but he was sure that Celebi wasn't going to feed him if he refused.

What could he do?
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Submit or oppose?

choices: In the morning...
Something happens that night
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
“I-if I’m your pet for a little bit y-you’ll let me go?” He asked, sniffling a little.

“It depends on you Azurill. When I’m sure you won’t talk yes, I’ll let you go, but that requires your cooperation.” She said simply. There wasn’t a hint of emotion in the stat meant, she was saying the facts. Zorua grinned from his meat and Azurill looked down. What choice did he have.

“O-okay, I’ll be your p-p-pet...” He said, Celebi smiles at this and Zorua laughed. “What a wimp!” The berry was dropped with a crash. It was bigger than Azurill. A ripped up hankie and bit of cotton fluff were dropped in too. For bed Azurill figured.

“I promise that if you cooperate, keep quiet, don’t antagonize us and don’t get my mom’s attention then this will end fine for you. For all of us.” She said gently.

But then laid the law down again. “But if you try anything or cross us...you’ll regret it for the rest of your life. Got it?” Azurill gulped and nodded.

“Better stay in line runt.” Zorua said and Celebi sighed.

“Zorua, try not to torment him too much. It’d be better for both of us if you tried to make peace with him too.” She said.

“Pffft” He snorted before seeing Celebi give him a sideways look.

“I’ll think about it.” He finished, returning to his meat. Celebi walked away, leaving Azurill to his berry as Zorua grinned at the jar, making Azurill shake.

-

They were finally in bed...Azurill stared out. It was hopeless to try and escape. He sniffles as he laid down, trying to find comfort in his cotton as silent tears soaked it.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Cooperating

choices: "You're gonna learn obedience to your current owners."
"We're gonna play a game when Celebi comes back."
"I dunno, we're kinda waiting for Celebi right now."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Celebi opened her eyes, groaning as she looked down to see the tiny dark fox resting against her chest. She smiled as she looked at her window. Morning was creeping in and she blinked as she gently nudged Zorua.

"Hey, time to wake up." She said as he groaned.

"Just let me sleep in today..." He said and she giggled.

"You should know by now, that won't happen~" She chimed as he sighed and stretched, yawning.

"Fine...i'm up..." He said sleepily as she picked him up.

Slowly she remembered the third pokemon in the room. The incredibly tiny child she was keeping as their pet for now.

Zorua's eyes fell on the jar as he grinned.

"Zorua, remember...let's try not to make things hell for him." Celebi said, as if reading his mind.

"Relax...i'm just gonna have a bit of fun with him." Zorua said and Celebi rolled her eyes as she went over to the desk and set Zorua on it.

Even to Zorua, Azurill was a puny pokemon. Celebi started to walk away.

"I'm gonna wash up, wake him up please...and don't start anything this early." Celebi said as she left the room and Zorua looked at the sleeping blue ball on his bit of cotton.

"Hey, runt. Up and at 'em." Zorua said as he nudged the jar.

The blue ball seemed to stir a bit but fell back into his cotton.

Zorua grinned. If he had to be up right now...

"I said...up and at 'em!" Zorua said happily as he spun the jar, making Azurill fall off of his cotton onto the harsh bottom of the jar.

He stood up sleepily only to see the giant menacing face of Zorua taking up his vision.

Azurill started quaking as Zorua rolled his eyes. "Coward." Zorua said as he leaned up to tilt the jar onto its side, rocking Azurill's world as he now had access to the opening.

"Come out, it's time to start the day." Zorua said and Azurill didn't move.

"Kid...do you really want to test us this early in the day?" Zorua threatened and slowly...Azurill walked out of the jar as he hopped down onto the desk.

"W-what are you going to do to me..." Azurill said, scared and Zorua sighed.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: The first morning for Azurill the pet

choices: Zorua wins
Azurill wins
Something happens to interrupt the game
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Zorua's sigh turned into a grin as he looked at the tiny pokemon.

"We're gonna play a game Azurill...with stakes." He leaned closer to the blue pokemon who wanted to run and started to shake even more. Zorua dropped the grin and looked unimpressed.

"Relax, you won't be harmed, alright? Jeez..." Zorua rolled his eyes and Azurill gulped.

"Y-you scare me, okay?" Azurill said and Zorua grinned at this.

"As it should be, feel bad about trying to threaten me now?" Azurill looked down and Zorua put his paw over Azurill. Azurill closed his eyes but the paw never descended.

"I'm not going to do anything...just remember though. I can if I want to. Got it?" Zorua said and Azurill nodded.

Zorua removed the paw from about him and laid down.

"Now we wait for Celebi." He muttered.

Azurill gulped.

"W-what kind of game are we playing..." He asked and Zorua looked at him.

"Wouldn't you like to know?" He said, and they sat in silence waiting.

-

Celebi stood over Zorua and Azurill in the forest as she looked at them.

"Are you sure this is a good idea Zorua?" She asked and he nodded. "Yeah, I KNOW it is! I'm ready to have fun!" He said and Azurill avoided looking at the giants.

What happened next shocked Azurill as he felt himself growing. He grew until...Zorua was of normal scale to him. Zorua was still a little bigger than him of course, but no longer a giant.

"Wh-wha..."

"Don't get used to it, it's the only way to do this fairly." Zorua said and he looked at Zorua's eyes...they still scared him.

"Here's the deal brat...this is MY forest. And I want to do some predator and prey...i'll give you a headstart. Avoid me for an hour. If you win, you can keep this size." Azurill looked hopeful.

Zorua went in for the kill.

"If you LOSE though...we're making you even smaller than you just were."

Azurill gasped.

"B-but...i'll be invisible!" He said and Zorua grinned.

"No you won't, i'll make sure you're still visible...as for being able to hear you though..." Celebi said and Azurill started whimpering.

"If you lose the size will only be for the rest of the day, i'll grow you to what I had you before tomorrow." She reassured and Zorua rolled his eyes.

"You're being too nice." He said.

"So kid...with that...run." Zorua said and Azurill turned around and took off, away from the fox.

Zorua grinned and after a minute, started to pursue him.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Predator and prey

choices: Graveler walks away with both uninterrupted
Celebi finds them and intervenes
Graveler unwittingly releases Azurill
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Azurill ran, ran for all he was worth. Through brush, through grass, hopping over small rocks as he attempted to stay as far away as possible from his tormentors. Particularly the fox that would be pursuing him any second. He dashed as fast as his little legs would carry him, panting as he did, barely paying attention to what was in front of him as he dreaded what would come up behind him at any second now.

-

Graveler grumbled as he traversed the forest. He wasn't going to let Zorua get away with what he had done to him recently...though he had been in this forest a few times recently looking for him, with no luck.

He knew Zorua was still around, he had been in the village a few times, though annoyingly with other pokemon. No, Graveler intended to settle his score away from public, so he could wail on the little dark fox to his heart's content. He grinned, today would be the day he found him.

-

Zorua for his part intended to draw this out, he was tailing Azurill pretty handily, he knew this game was his, but he wanted to tease it out. He had masked himself with illusions as he grinned. Azurill was going to regret ever having tried to mess with him and Celebi, even if the green fairy wanted to go easy on the kid, he'd make certain that whenever they decided Azurill had enough he'd be far too scared to say anything.

-

Azurill didn't see the stone titan who was dawdling around as he looked around for Zorua before he crashed into his foot. His stone foot. Azurill groaned as he fell onto his butt and Graveler casually looked down before looking confused.

"Huh...?" Graveler said as he looked closer to see...a tiny pokemon?...Azurill, that kid from the village? Graveler seemed confused before he reached for the blue mouse.

Zorua for his part was seeing all of this and his eyes widened. "Crap!" He said. If Graveler found out about him...Azurill for his part seemed to regain his senses and he turned around to run from the stone pokemon...only to run right into the invisible Zorua, knocking them both on their butts, and breaking Zorua's concentration on his illusion.

"Damn it brat! Watch where you're-" Zorua cut himself off as he looked at Graveler, then looked to the knocked down Azurill. He needed to get out of-

Stone fingers gripped him as he felt himself lifted up. He saw the same happen to Azurill.

Graveler's confused expression soon turned to a wicked grin.

"Well Zorua, you're even more of a runt than I remember...looks like I got what I came for...i'm gonna teach you what happens when you mess with me." Zorua struggled only to be squeezed and the pain was intense. He winced as Graveler turned to his other catch.

"Guess i'll bring you both with me." He said as Zorua had an idea...if he could get Azurill to be let go, he could get Celebi and fix this!...if the kid even would at this point. It was pretty much his only shot though.

"Hey Graveler, fine, take me, but let the kid go...you ain't got anything against him, right?" Zorua said and the rock pokemon looked at him.

"Hmm...you ARE right, but at the same time, I could make something useful of a tiny pokemon i'm sure...and you won't last long after what I do to you."

"Come on, he's just a kid, have a heart..."

'And hopefully no brain'

Graveler scrutinized the tiny Zorua before looking at the shivering tiny Azurill in his other hand.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Graveler's catch

choices: "Fine...i'll help you."
"No deal Zorua."
Before he could speak, Graveler returned
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Graveler grinned as he turned around and began to walk away, towards leaving the forest a different way than Celebi, Zorua and Azurill entered it.

"I'm gonna keep you both, and when i've finished you off Zorua...the kid'll be mine to do with as I please. Maybe I can make money off of a tiny freak like him, who knows." Graveler grinned as Zorua struggled and Azurill cried. Zorua tried to shout but Graveler squeezed him and made the air rush from his lungs, inadvertently silencing him as he felt his world go dim. Graveler chuckled as he looked at the limp pokemon in his hand.

This was going to be fun.

-

The trip to Graveler's hideout was uneventful as he looked at his two prizes with a wicked grin. His simple little wooden shack in the abandoned field...yeah, he'd have his privacy to do with as he pleased there. He looked at the unconscious Zorua and deposited him on a simple table in the shack. He did the same with Azurill before slamming a milk crate down over the both of them, looking with a grin at the two trapped pokemon through the holes.

"You can stay there and await the show runt, when i'm back and Zorua's awake...you'll have a front row seat to what I do to him...then we'll figure out what to do with you." Graveler snickered as he got up. He had a few things he needed to get first, then he'd have his fun with them.

He'd finish Zorua off, teaching everyone not to mess with him.

-

Celebi sat on her log, bored. It had been a while since Zorua and Azurill took off and she leaned back. She should've brought a book...she didn't know how long exactly it had been but it had to be approaching an hour at least...maybe longer.

"I should probably go looking for them..." She muttered as she got up from her log.

She at least hoped nothing had happened.

-

Zorua woke up with a groan as he looked around. He was on a hard wooden surface...a table, above him...holes through a blue plastic surface, those same holes surrounding him. He was too big to squeeze through him. It was essentially a cage. His gaze fell on the shivering blue pokemon in a corner. Azurill. Suddenly he remembered what was going on.

"Kid, what happened since I was knocked out?" Zorua asked and Azurill still shivered as he looked at him. Zorua sighed but Azurill responded.

"G-graveler took us to his...little hideout place in that field we all avoid in the village...he went to get stuff and...he's going to kill you." Azurill whimpered and Zorua nodded.

He needed to escape, and get back to Celebi.

"Alright...looks like I need a plan." Zorua muttered. He looked at the tiny blue pokemon. His body might be just small enough to squeeze through if not for his larger tail...but something dawned on him.

"Azurill...your tail...it squishes in right? It can be narrow..." Zorua said and Azurill looked at him. "It hurts a bit when that happens...but yeah..." Zorua grinned. He looked around outside the box. If Azurill got out he could...hmm...

The milk crate was near the edge of the table...a knife was also there...it could be heavy, but Azurill should be able to move it, and if wedged under the milk crate, they may have just enough strength to lift it enough for Zorua to squeeze under.

Zorua smiled. This could work.

"Okay kid...I have a plan to get us out and it involves you squeezing through this hole and getting that knife to me." He gestured to the knife on the table and Azurill looked at it. What happened next shocked Zorua, though it really shouldn't have.

"Why should I?" Azurill said and Zorua looked at him, surprised.

"...What do you mean? You want to stick around, be Graveler's to toy with?" He said and Azurill looked at him firmly.

"It isn't any different than being your toy Zorua. If I did this i'd be risking my life for you, if Graveler came back in the middle of this...i'd be dead too." Azurill said and Zorua growled.

"Kid..." He said threateningly and Azurill glared.

"You and Graveler both...you're the same...tormenting smaller pokemon, weaker pokemon...maybe you don't deserve to die, but I won't help you." Azurill said and Zorua looked out the milk crate.

"You really think i'm the same as Graveler!?" Zorua said and Azurill looked at him.

"You don't understand, do you Zorua? Do you know what you took from me? Have any idea of the significance...it stung walking home without that doll Zorua...it was all I had from my mom, and you did that...and not once, in all of this, did you ever really apologize for it. Why should you have to, you were in the position of power...but now you want me to help you...no."

Zorua looked at the blue mouse. He needed to change tactics.

"Help me Azurill...and I promise, no more torment, no more games. We'll be nice to you until we're sure you won't talk and let you go. And...okay...i'm sorry about your doll...I shouldn't have done that, it was wrong of me. I've done a lot of wrong, stupid things and believe me if you want to but...I do want to try and be better than I was." Zorua said and Azurill still looked unmoved.

"You told me, an apology or plea means nothing coming from a coward who is trying to do it to save his own skin."

Zorua was about to go off before Azurill spoke.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: At Graveler's hideout

choices: They get away clean
Graveler gets one of them
Graveler gets both of them
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"Fine...i'll help you." Azurill said. "I don't want to stay with him...at least with you Celebi won't let you hurt me...and I have a chance to go home." Azurill said bitterly.

"I swear kid, we get out of this and I won't torment you...then when we grow you back we can go our separate ways."

Zorua said. Azurill looked down.

'When I get back to Celi though...Graveler, you're gonna regret this.'

"Fine fine...yeah, I can get the knife if I squeeze through...what do you plan to do with it?" Azurill asked and Zorua grinned.

"Leave that part to me kid, just get the knife." Zorua said and Azurill nodded as he went to one of the square holes of the milk crate. He squeezed his body through, tucking his gut in...that was the easy part. He looked at his tail. This had happened a few times and no time was it pleasant but...he started to go forward and his tail caught on the hole, he winced as he squeezed it through...less easy to tuck it in than his gut.

He sighed...he was out.

"Awesome...now bring me the knife." Zorua said as the little pokemon approached it. He gulped...why did Graveler have a...he shook his head. He didn't want to think about it, he just wanted out of this. Even Celebi's warmly lit room was preferable to this. He started to push the knife...it was heavy, and slow going at first, and he was careful to avoid the blade part, but he slowly got it over to the milk crate.

"Okay Azurill...good good...now carefully try to tuck the blade part as much as you can under the crate, in the lower gap. It might be hard, but I know you can do it." Zorua encouraged.

If he could get it under and they combined their strength, they should have the leverage to lift the crate just enough...

Azurill nodded as he started to move it again. At this point he was sweating...but he worked through it. If they both got out of this...even if Zorua wasn't the nicest pokemon, Celebi might at least take pity on him finally.

After a minute or so Azurill got the blade a bit under the crate, Zorua able to get to the blade part now. He grinned. 'Almost free.' Zorua stepped forward and very careful to avoid the sharp edge, got his two front paws under the blade as he started to push up.

Grunting, he told Azurill the next step. "Okay, I need you to tuck your tail under the crate when I get enough leverage up." He said and Azurill's eyes widened.

"WHAT!?" He cried and Zorua, not looking away from his job tried to elaborate.

"Just for a sec while I crawl out. I'll say when."

Azurill blinked but nodded.

"Can't believe i'm doing this..." Azurill muttered.

'You'll be glad you did kid.' Zorua thought. He didn't know if Azurill believed him, but he was at least serious about laying off of him. He had another pokemon that he very much wanted to settle a score with right now. When he felt his legs and front paws going to jelly, he looked to see just enough of a gap...

"NOW!" Zorua shouted and Azurill put his tail under the crate and closed his eyes. Zorua let go of the knife and the crate held up for a second, enough for him to book out from under it as Azurill's tail held it up for a sec. When Zorua was through Azurill pulled his tail back to him whimpering as the crate fell with a thud.

"Ow..." Azurill said as he looked at his tail, then to the grinning Zorua.

"Okay kid...all we gotta do is jump from the table and we're home free. Moron doesn't have a door on this shed..." Zorua snickered.

Oh, he would be returning in an hour or so though...with his legendary girlfriend too.

Azurill looked down.

"It's quite the drop Zorua..." He muttered and Zorua nodded.

"See that cushion?" Zorua motioned to a pillow in the corner.

"If you hop down and land on your tail, then-"

"My poor tail..." Azurill said and Zorua rolled his eyes.

"Last time, I promise...if you can push the cushion-"

"It looks heavy..." Azurill whined and Zorua huffed.

"Come on dude, it's the home stretch!" Zorua said and Azurill slowly nodded.

"...fine...I want to rest after we get back to Celebi..." Azurill said and Zorua nodded.

"You can sleep on a pillow, with you no smaller than you are right now when we get out of this." Zorua promised and Azurill nodded.

With that he jumped down and landed on his tail, wincing. He looked to the cushion and, trying to dig his feet into the hard ground, started pushing it. He grunted, sweating bullets as he did but it slowly moved towards the table. Zorua laughed as it came close.

"Alright kid! Ya did good! We're out of here!" With that Zorua jumped down and landed on the cushion and they both ran out the door, moving through the weeds to see...Graveler coming back...and he was looking right at them.

"...Oh no you two don't! You're both DEAD!" Graveler said, confused and mad to see them both out. He was NOT giving up this opportunity to get rid of Zorua.

"Run! Run now!" And with that Zorua and Azurill both made their way into the weeds, hoping to evade and get away from the stone pokemon...and from here, get back to the forest.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Alliance and breaking out

choices: It was a fuming Celebi with the still tiny Azurill and Zorua...
It was a seething Celebi with normal-sized Zorua and Azurill
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Fear seeping in his heart, Azurill ran behind Zorua.

In an attempt to catch them, Graveler slammed his hand where Zorua was, but the fox and the mouse avoided the giant hand.

Out of nowhere, water entered the shed. Graveler screamed as he was hit by a tidal wave, gasping for air, caught in a whirlpool of illusionary water.

Zorua snickered.

"This way kid!" he shouted, leading the way out of the shed. He didn't have to tell twice, Azurill followed.

As he exited the shed, the illusionary water started to wane. And Graveler growled, realizing that Zorua had tricked him... again!

In a last attempt to stop the two tiny pokemon, the stone titan hastily grabbed his knife and threw it in their direction, with such strength that it... barely missed Zorua and hit the ground.

The stone pokemon exited the shed and looked around. Zorua and Azurill were gone, probably the tricky fox had masked them both with an illusion.

Graveler shouted furiously.

Then, out of nowhere, a snicker he recognized,

"Catch us now moron!"

Graveler snarled.

Behind the safety of his illusion, Zorua snickered as he ran, Azurill following.

--

It took at least an hour and a half for Zorua and Azurill to make their way back to the fox's forest.

The dark-type grinned.

"Honey, I'm home!" he shouted playfully, awash with relief as he dispelled his illusion, making himself and the still uncomfortable Azurill visible again.

He didn't have to repeat it: a few plants started shaking as a green and blue pokemon he didn't recognize came out... Zorua choked back a laugh.

His girlfriend was staring daggers at him, her head covered by a bucket of blue paint, which stained her body.

"... Do you think this is funny, Zorua?" she said with a cold calm, recalling how similar this was to the first prank Zorua pulled on her... and it had been HARD to remove the feathers, berries and honey.
"I thought you were done with pranks..."

Zorua laughed nervously.

"I am... that was one of my traps y'know... should've told ya about those..." he stated meekly.

Celebi smirked.

"Is that so?" Zorua flew in her paw, the other removed the bucket from her head.

Much to Zorua's horror - and Azurill's secret amusement - she held him over the bucket. Her intentions were clear.

"GRAVELERTRIEDTOKILLME!" Zorua shouted, clinging to Celebi's paw.

The other, he noted, suddenly let go of the bucket, which ungracefully fell on the ground with a thud.

"Wha...?" the legendary whispered breathlessly.

Zorua nodded.

"Graveler tried to kill me..." he repeated,
"And wanted to use Azurill after my demise... but Azurill helped me, so no more games with his size!" he stated.

Celebi didn't pay attention to the last sentence, too focused on what Zorua said.

A thousand questions formed in her mind,

When?

How?

Why?

The legendary closed her eyes, sighing deeply.

"Azurill... you'll be rewarded in due time," she said gently, before opening her eyes, adopting a murderous glare.

"As for that jerk..."

--

Graveler sat in his shed, fuming.

The two runts had managed to escape... he still couldn't believe it.

And Zorua tricked him again.

He snarled, but decided that stealing some sweets from Pichu could cheer him up, the mouse always had some.

But, as he approached the door-less opening of his shed, Graveler noticed something... or rather someone, coming to ‘visit’ him...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Zorua and Azurill's great escape

choices: Zorua disposes of Graveler
Zorua pushed for the toy idea, and Graveler becomes smaller
Zorua leaves Graveler trapped under the milk crate
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Graveler saw a pokemon approaching...holding the two runts in her paws. Zorua and Azurill were being carried by that bookworm Celebi...what was she doing here. Zorua looked...satisfied with himself, Azurill looked more worn out than anything, and Celebi looked absolutely furious. It was when Graveler could see her eyes that he felt a grip as he was picked up and flung to the back of his shed, almost through the wall.

"Ow..." He muttered as he tried to get up, only for the same uncompromising force to lift him again and throw him THROUGH the wall, into the ugly, dirty field.

"My shed!" He cried as he landed roughly again. He tried to get up, but a psychic force kept him pinned.

Celebi for her part fluttered through the opening that she had just created with Graveler's body, she landed near him, still glaring daggers and Zorua snickered.

"I'm back~" He sung as he grinned maliciously. Celebi set him down and slowly, Zorua regained his height. Azurill looked at the now giant once again Zorua...though at least this time Azurill was more than a dot. Zorua didn't give Azurill a look or anything though, his attention was focused on the idiot before him.

"So you wanted to kill me eh? And then do...whatever you wanted to my pet." Zorua stated, as he circled Graveler.

"Well Graveler...you don't know how deep of a grave you dug for yourself, do you?" He stated as Celebi, still glaring at Graveler, released the psychic force pinning him and he slowly sat up.
