He attempted to lunge for Zorua...only for Zorua to leap back, having prepared for this and Graveler landed flat on his face.

"You...you all are gonna pay for this! I'm still gonna kill you Zorua, right here! Rough you up too for this Celebi, just you wait! And Azurill, you're still tiny! I'm gonna crush you like a grape!" He roared and Zorua's eyes widened.

"You...are the biggest idiot I have ever met..." He said in awe as he looked to the trembling Celebi.

"Graveler...you attempted to kill my boyfriend...and once again threatened to kill him, as well as a child in front of me...and you want to beat me up? You have no idea how out of your depth you are but I will enlighten you." Celebi coldly seethed as she set Azurill on Zorua's back before preparing to shrink Graveler.

"Relax, pet." Zorua said and Azurill sighed. He was still doing this pet thing but...Azurill found that right now, he didn't care. Tiny, normal, whatever...he needed rest.

"Can I take a nap now..." He asked tired and Zorua looked to see the tiny blue pokemon laying against his fur.

"Uh...yeah kid, go for it." Zorua said, feeling a bit awkward...yeah, Azurill would get better treatment.

His eyes landed on the pokemon who'd receive his torment as Graveler found the world around him growing...larger and larger until he was doll sized.

"Wh-now i'm a runt!" Graveler cried as he looked at the giants. Zorua and Celebi towered above him, high into the sky.

"You know, I almost want to stick you under the milk crate to see if someone as dense as you can get out, but...actually that isn't a bad idea." Zorua grinned, his voice now powerful and echoing to the tiny rock. Graveler attempted to run but a psychic force pinned him.

"I suppose I could make YOU a pet too...or a toy...to be honest Azurill won't be ours forever and I could use a permanent one." Zorua's grin widened.

"I don't want that creep in my house Zorua." Celebi said coldly as she looked over to see...the sleeping Azurill on Zorua's back.

She let herself smile for one brief second before returning her attention to Graveler.

"Do you want me to finish him off then?" Zorua asked and Celebi looked at the rock pokemon, glaring daggers.

"That's YOUR call." She said and Graveler gulped.

"P-please don't kill me...it was a joke! Yeah, I was never gonna kill ya! Never!" Graveler pleaded and Zorua scoffed at that.

"That's a weak attempt Graveler...real weak."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Returning visit

choices: It's an uneventful trek home
A pokemon stops them on the way
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"...Celi, I get that you don't want a creep like this in your house...but we're going to give up the runt on my back at some point soon...and well, what can I say? I like an outlet to vent my frustrations." Zorua grinned down at the pokemon.

"And he doesn't want to die...i'm feeling merciful."

Celebi frowned.

"He'd for sure get the attention of my mom, forget threatening to keep him in line, I know his sort."

Graveler began pleading.

"P-please, just let me go...grow me back, i'll turn over a new leaf, I swear it!" Graveler said and Zorua rolled his eyes.

"You were dumb enough to threaten me, dumb enough to threaten Celebi, a legendary, and stated your intent to kill me multiple times. You see the tiny pokemon on my back, the one you threatened with me? He threatened us too...and this is the price he's paying. Still paying even after he reluctantly helped me...but you...oh you're in deeper crap than even him. You've got one way out of here, and that's become my plaything." Zorua rumbled with a chuckle and Graveler attempted once again to break the psychic hold on him.

"No! Let me go! This won't stand!" Graveler cried as Zorua looked to Celebi.

"He's quite loud and obnoxious...what if he were too small for us to hear him? Or at least too small for you and your mom to hear him. My hearing is a bit sharper than yours."

"That'd...be even smaller than I made Azurill yesterday...as small as we threatened him with this morning."

Zorua grinned.

"I know~" Zorua said and Celebi put a paw to her chin in thought.

"...fine. I at least feel a lot less guilty about this one." Celebi glared down at the rock on the ground who heard all of this.

"S-s-smaller...?" He whimpered and Zorua snickered.

"You're going to be the smallest, weakest pokemon in the whole world...I think that's fitting for you Graveler." Zorua said as a familiar feeling enveloped the rock pokemon. He roared as the world got bigger yet...bigger and bigger, bigger still and bigger still until...He looked forward to see a black wall. A black furred wall...Zorua's paw. A deep rumble emanated all around him as the ground quaked, but the paw wasn't moving...it was a simple chuckle from the titan before him.

"I can barely still see you...but don't worry, I CAN see you." The words pounded against Graveler, a veritable attack on his senses as a psychic energy gripped him and lifted him up and up and up to the eyes of Zorua and Celebi...those eyes full of hate...those eyes that were the size of lakes.

"Get used to this Graveler...you won't be getting any bigger than this." Zorua rumbled as Graveler winced at the sheer power of this...this...impossibility.

"Please! I've learned my lesson! I don't want to be this small!" Graveler said and Celebi looked to Zorua.

"You're right, I heard a tiny amount of squeaks but I can't make it out." She said, her feminine voice also a deep rumble on the tiny pokemon.

"Oh, I heard it...and it's nothing new. Pleading for mercy." Zorua said.

Celebi nodded before she produced the jar she had been using for Azurill. Graveler found himself falling, until he landed on a piece of cotton the size of a sports field.

"Better rest up while you can Graveler...Zorua'll put you through your paces soon enough." She said as she returned her attention to Zorua and the sleeping Azurill.

"...What'll we do with him?" Celebi asked and Zorua looked up in thought.

"He helped me...but it was with reluctance. He could've abandoned me at multiple points in our escape attempt but didn't, i'll give him credit...he doesn't think highly of me though, and quite frankly i'm still sore at him for the threat and some of the things he said."

Celebi nodded.

"So we won't be letting him go anytime soon then." She sighed and Zorua looked at her.

"Well...I am serious about laying off of him now at least...and he's earned his rest that he's taking now...i'd rather just keep him a little while longer, I don't like the idea of being compared to Graveler...and at the very least we need to make sure he won't talk. So...yeah, I don't want to let him go yet."

"...For now, let's go home. I've got a book to read and i'm tired too." Celebi stated as she held the jar with the tiny Graveler in it and Zorua walked home with the less tiny Azurill sleeping on his back.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: A pet rock

choices: With Celebi and Azurill
With Zorua and Graveler
With all 4 of them
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
The walk was relatively quiet...save for the angry, barely audible squeaks from the jar. Zorua grinned maliciously at the jar, savoring the anger, despair and terror of the tiny jerk trapped within. Graveler was definitely going to kill him, full malicious intent intact. The kid on his back may have lacked the foresight of what his actions might cause but Graveler? Oh he had full intent, and Zorua planned to make him pay.

Celebi for her part also felt less sympathy for the rock. For as much of a jerk as Zorua had been in the past, he didn't outright rough up kids or beat up pokemon. His pranks had been bad, and he'd certainly caused his fair share of trouble for people to enter his forest...and there WAS the Swinub incident, though Zorua swore up and down that was an accident at least. No...eventually she'd release Azurill, and she intended to try to smooth things over with him tonight. But Graveler? She never wanted to hear him again, and at the size he was at now, she'd never have to.

He was Zorua's to do with as he pleased.

Soon they had reached Celebi's house as Zorua let out a yawn.

"Man...i'm beat." He said and she looked at him with concern.

"You alright?" She asked and he nodded. "That dumb pebble put us through the ringer...the trek back to the forest was also long." He looked back at the tiny sleeping kid on his back.

"You gonna try and befriend him?" Celebi asked and Zorua shrugged.

"Pets are kinda friends...well, in some cases." He glared at the jar. "Get ready for hell Graveler." He said and the tiny rock pokemon gulped at the titan looking at him.

Zorua looked away though to the tiny blue mouse.

"Anyway...I dunno, like I said, things are still rocky...he said a dumb thing and I think he still doesn't like me...but like I said, he could've ditched me at a few points...but didn't. And I like to think that two pokemon working together like we did, having each other in a harrowing situation...maybe it makes a bond." He said with a grin.

"Either way...we'll see what happens when he wakes up. I at least want to make sure we don't hate each other." Zorua said and Celebi sighed with relief. The ordeal they had gone through was lamentable, but at least Zorua was open to making peace now. Azurill just needed to be open to it too.

"Well, Zorua I need to shrink you down." She smiled as they stood outside her house and a familiar feeling overtook him. He looked at his towering girlfriend before realizing something. He looked at his back to see the...still as tiny to him Azurill.

"You shrunk him again?" Zorua questioned and Celebi nodded. "It's easier to hide him...my mom has noticed you you know, doll act or not...if Azurill is that small it's just less of a hassle...and he is technically your pet right now too." She said and Zorua looked down.

"I kinda promised he wouldn't be smaller..." He mumbled and Celebi smiled.

"It'll be fine...i'll deal with Azurill when he wakes up, okay? I still owe him something, like I promised. Not freedom...but a kindness at least." She said smiling and Zorua grinned.

"In that case...leave me with my new toy." He said looking to the jar in Celebi's grasp as Celebi levitated Zorua into her paws, still holding the jar with the tiny Graveler.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Back to home

choices: Later that evening, with all 4 of them
A few days later...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Celebi walked into her house, holding the small Zorua, even smaller Azurill, and yet smaller still Graveler, who was still throwing a tantrum in the glass, making Zorua grin. He could hear Graveler even better now that he was smaller, and he intended to break Graveler's spirit entirely. He would regret what he had done.

Celebi looked towards her clock and nodded to herself. "Mom still won't be home for a few hours yet..." She mumbled as she went towards her room and gently set Zorua down on the bed, who was doing his best to balance Azurill on his back, who had somehow slept through all of the moving around. She then set the jar down next to Zorua before she sat down, rocking both Zorua and the jar.

"...Zorua, i'm going to talk with Azurill, okay? It may be a bit. Do you want anything?" Zorua got a wicked grin on his face.

"Just leave me with the pebble...i'll entertain myself." Zorua said maliciously as he eyed the jar. Even doll sized he was a veritable titan to Graveler...on the scale of a god. The crushing reality was setting in finally as Graveler whimpered. He was helpless in a world far too big and scary for him. Even tiny little Pichu...could crush him without so much as a hint of effort. The world shook again as Celebi got up from the bed, levitating the tiny Azurill and a book with her.

-

The first thing Azurill noticed was how sore his tail felt. He groaned as he sat up, he was on a soft surface...he looked around to see that he was in a large room and on a green surface...still shrunk. He looked at his tail to see it bruised. "Stupid milk crate..." He said as he heard a boom and looked up to see a gigantic book shutting, the source of the boom he saw, and that's when it occurred to him...seeing Celebi as big as she was. He was smaller than a doll, he was at the size he was this morning. Celebi took up his vision as she gently smiled at him.

"You're up finally..." She said, a boom on his tiny ears as he looked up. "Zorua said...I thought...I wouldn't be this small again." He said and she didn't lose the smile. "Zorua did say that but...it's just easier to hide you at this size, and all the same you are still his pet too right now, it makes sense to have you smaller." She said and he looked sad at this.

"...How much longer?" He asked and she lifted him to her face, he had been resting on her leg he saw, as she was sitting in a chair in...most likely her living room.

"I don't know yet, it depends on how things go for the next little while. After today? We'll more than likely send you on your way sooner than later. I wanted to talk to you though...just us." Celebi said and Azurill shivered.

The image of her from last night entered his mind...her anger was palpable at the time. Being so close to her eyes Celebi did note his fear. She lowered her voice a bit, making sure to be quiet to not hurt his ears.

"Azurill, I don't want you to be afraid of me, or Zorua...I want to clear a few things up, both how I feel, how Zorua feels...and how you feel too." She said and he slowly nodded. She smiled at this.

"First off...Zorua and I do agree, we won't toy with you. That harsh game we were going to play today...we won't do that. And I won't stick you back in the jar with the cotton and just feed you berries. We'll...get better accommodations for your stay, though you are still ours right now, so I still need you to listen to both of us." She said, a little sternly towards the end.

"Second...I want to air out any tensions that there may be. You threatened us yesterday, that was a bad move Azurill...but you're a kid, and I know kids do...stupid things sometimes. I want you to have more forethought in the future, there are consequences for your actions...but I also realize why you feel the way you feel about Zorua and I want you to know he truly isn't a bad pokemon...he's just done some bad things. Things he does regret, even if he has a hard time voicing that." She said gently.

"He wants to make peace with you...for real. And I want you to do that as well. I know he took something precious from you, but I promise...he has atoned for his actions, more than atoned after what I did to him..." Celebi still felt that twinge of guilt from the first night she had him. Azurill just took this all in and sighed.

"I don't know...today when we worked together...I guess I did find myself enjoying his presence a little..."

"Zorua said you hesitated to help him at first...but he also said that you could've ditched him and didn't."

Azurill nodded and looked at the veritable green goddess.

"He helped me too...he had the plan and masked us with illusions at the home stretch. The run to the forest was exhausting but...his energy, his enthusiasm at escaping...it kinda caught me too." Azurill did smile briefly at this but then frowned.

"Zorua though...maybe...he had his reasons, maybe he's not as bad as he appears on the surface, but he has hurt me...a lot of other pokemon too. Not like Graveler I guess, but still...lots of pokemon have good reason to hate him Celebi, you know that, right? We don't feel this way for nothing..." He said and she bit her lip.

"...I do realize that, yes. And I want to protect him in spite of that Azurill, I need you to understand that too...I WILL protect him. It's why I need to make sure you won't talk before I let you go." She said and he sighed. The threat was still clear as day. She just smiled gently at him though. She would reward his efforts today.

"For now, just consider these things and..." He found himself set back in her lap as a chunk of chocolate dropped down in front of him. Not much bigger than a crumb in reality he imagined but it was half of his size. A TV flickered to life in front of him too...on some sort of action cartoon he noted. He looked up to see Celebi smiling.

"Go ahead and relax for a bit, i'm going to keep reading." She said as Azurill took this all in.

He'd need to consider a few things...but he, more than anything, still just wanted to go home. The chocolate helped ease his mind for now at least...peace with Zorua? True peace with him?...maybe.

"Hey Celebi, what happened to Graveler?" He asked as he bit into the chocolate and she looked from her book.

"He's...Zorua's to do with as he pleases." She said and Azurill shivered at this. "He's even smaller than you." Azurill found it hard to feel sorry for him...all he knows is that it could've been him instead of Graveler...he was at least thankful that they wanted to take mercy on him now.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Azurill's downtime

choices: Azurill is willing to talk things over
Azurill is still hesitant
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
The afternoon passed without much fuss as Celebi quietly read and Azurill watched TV...eating a bit of chocolate on occasion, though he was more or less just enjoying not having to be active or being actively tormented by the titanic teens. Celebi, though still letting him know that he wasn't entirely off the hook, did seem to want to extend an olive branch to him and have him make peace...she also made him curious about what she had done to Zorua to make him 'atone'...he didn't know if he should ask about that though. At least not her, maybe he'd talk to Zorua about it. If Zorua was serious about being nicer...

After about an hour of TV and Azurill nibbling at chocolate on occasion Celebi smiled as she turned off the TV and turned her attention to Azurill, closing her book. She gently took the remaining chocolate and popped it into her mouth. "You don't need to eat too much...might give you a stomach ache." She said smiling down at him. He didn't say anything, but he did give her a nod. He didn't know if she could see it at how tiny he was though. Soon he found himself in her expansive paw as she went back to her room to see...Zorua rolling Graveler around beneath his paw, snickering. Or she assumed that was what she saw, Graveler was almost impossible for her to see honestly. Azurill looked, at the towering figure of Zorua, and...the tiny form of Graveler beneath his paw. Graveler WAS tinier than him...he must've been to Azurill, what Azurill was to Zorua...and Zorua was to Celebi. The whole thing made his head spin.

Zorua looked up, grinning at Celebi as she gently smiled down at him. "Hey there~" She said in a sing song voice as Azurill found himself set on the bed and Zorua was lifted up as Celebi nuzzled him and kissed him.

"Hey hey!" He said, snickering, as he nuzzled her muzzle as best he could, and Azurill took in the giants...his eyes drifted to the tiny Graveler, dazed on the bed as he looked to Azurill.

"You gotta help me kid! We gotta...!"

"Gotta what Graveler...we're powerless right now...and frankly, I wouldn't help you if I could." Azurill quietly said as Zorua turned his attention to the two tiny pokemon.

"Kid's picked up on it by now pebble, you need to get with the program. You're NOT leaving." He said maliciously as he found himself placed back on the bed. Azurill looked up at the giant...he still feared him he found, even after today...though Zorua did let him rest on his back too, that was nice...

Zorua however, went over to Graveler and...simply blew on him, the gale force enough to send Graveler flying across the bed where he landed with a thud on the other end of the sheets.

"I don't even need to TOUCH you to raise hell! And i'm the size of a doll! That's how pathetic you are Graveler!" Zorua boomed as Azurill whimpered, the words rang in his ears too, and Zorua didn't tone down his voice at all. Even if he wasn't as small as Graveler, Zorua was still quite the monument of power to him right now...it was then that he turned his attention to the tiny blue pokemon near his paws...the giant blue eyes piercing Azurill's attention. Zorua's malicious smile didn't falter as he took in the quaking blue mouse.

"You're right to be scared Azurill...don't forget why you're here..." With a boom Zorua laid in front of him, and a paw came down. Azurill shut his eyes, but found that what happened he didn't expect...Zorua put his paw behind Azurill and used it to bring him into his chest...was Zorua...hugging him? Warmth and dark fur surrounded him.

"You're still our pet...but a promise is a promise, I won't torment you...we need to reach an understanding, and that first means talking this over...you threatened me...threatened my girlfriend...and compared me to Graveler...I destroyed the last gift from your mom...mocked you for it...and tormented you in the past day to the point of reinforcing how you feel about me. The pebble put us through hell, but we came out of that together, with teamwork. No more crap, no more fake apologies on either side...let's talk." Zorua's voice reverberated through Azurill's being, him being very close to his voice box, but the words were gentle. He was starting to feel misty eyed...

Celebi for her part was smiling at the sight...Zorua was finally opening up...this was HER Zorua, the one she knew was in there, and hopefully Azurill would see that too.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: The offer to make peace.

choices: "Few days...probably."
"You've still got a while yet Azurill."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"Okay...okay...let's talk." Azurill mumbled into the fur as he tried to regain his composure. He didn't need to start crying right now, he didn't know how that would even register to the titans.

He felt the paw pulling away and he hopped back from Zorua's chest, looking at the giant with a bit of a more carefree smile than the malicious one he wore a little while ago, and Zorua started the conversation.

"Here's the deal runt...look, I didn't know that your doll was THAT important, and i'll admit that I still can't entirely wrap my head around it...but it clearly did mean a good deal to you and I shouldn't have destroyed it. I shouldn't have done a lot of things and I do know that now. Celebi has more or less set me straight and maybe one day i'll tell ya more about...my own sorry past before knowing any of you...so...genuinely speaking, I shouldn't have destroyed your doll, and I shouldn't have taken pleasure in your terror recently, despite some of the things you've said." Zorua said, finishing.

Azurill took this in, he still definitely feared the dark fox who loomed above him, and he was still wrestling with his feelings on him in terms of being a good or bad pokemon...but Azurill needed to find the words, he needed to find a way to move on with Zorua, not just for getting out of here, but for trying to find genuine peace.

"Zorua...look, I still miss her, okay? And...when you destroyed that doll it felt like you tore that one last bit more of her away from me...it hurt, it hurt really bad but...you didn't know, and I guess...you've paid your price too, according to Celebi, and today you and I helped each other...I said some nasty things, I tried to threaten your life yesterday...i've bad mouthed you at every opportunity and to be frank I still don't know if I regret that...but as you are now, maybe you are trying to be better, maybe I should try to recognize that, and maybe you weren't as bad as I pegged you initially...you aren't as bad as Graveler at least, and I don't think you'll hurt anyone that doesn't deserve it now. I think I can try to stop hating you at least..."

Azurill thought he had found a good way to voice how he felt and Zorua nodded at this, that was probably the truth of the matter. Azurill was recognizing that Zorua was trying to change but couldn't disassociate his previous deeds from how he felt about the pokemon entirely. But he'd try, and it was a start.

"...Okay." Zorua stated before sighing.

"Well that's done, now...to business." He smirked as he eyed the rock at the edge of the bed, looking at the impossible drop before him, no way he could survive the fall from the bed, even with as sturdy as he was. Booms brought him back to reality, as both Azurill and Zorua loomed over him.

"You were going to hurt me Graveler...you were going to keep me and make a profit off of me..." Azurill muttered and Graveler gulped.

"O-open your eyes kid...Zorua is d-doing the same thing!" Azurill shook his head at this.

"He's keeping me for...a few reasons. But profit isn't one of them, and he won't hurt me anymore. You...are rotten to the core though, you've beaten me up, you've beaten my best friend up, and you've beaten up many more pokemon...no more. You can't hurt anyone anymore."

Azurill raised his tail over Graveler who shut his eyes.

The tail never descended though and he opened his eyes to see Azurill glaring.

"I won't hurt you...you're Zorua's to decide what to do with." Azurill said and the dark fox grinned.

"I WILL hurt you Graveler...but later, it's time for you to go back to your home~" Zorua boomed as Zorua went over to the center of the bed to get the jar.

Graveler was roughly scraped into the jar by Zorua's paw and his world shook as once again the jar was upright and he was looking around his glass prison and up at the impossibly high opening where the sun that was Zorua's eye hung.

"Rest while you can, MAYBE i'll feed you." The glass shook as Zorua pushed the jar away from him and Celebi nodded and put the jar on her nightstand before turning her attention to her boyfriend.

"Well done Zorua...you too Azurill." She smiled as she lifted Zorua up and nuzzled him. Azurill's world shook as she laid back on her bed with Zorua yawning.

"I'm bushed..." He said and Celebi giggled. "It's early." She said and he shrugged. "You go through what we went through and say you aren't beat...hey runt, are you still tired?" He called out to the tiny blue mouse who stared at the massive couple. He nodded a bit.

"I am...today was exhausting..." He mumbled and Zorua grinned.

"Get over here pet." Zorua commanded and Azurill slowly hopped over.

To his surprised, as Celebi cuddled Zorua, Azurill was lifted by a psychic force...towards Zorua's paws.

Zorua held Azurill to his chest, which itself was pretty warm.

"I'm taking a nap, you're welcome to as well." Zorua said and Azurill found himself falling asleep again.

"Zorua...how much longer will I be your pet..." He asked as he started to doze off, and the last thing he heard before falling asleep was...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: The start to making peace

choices: "You wanted to kill me, huh? Guess what happens now..."
"Hey kid, want a chance to make things right? How creative can ya be?"
"Bye bye, speck!" Celebi, Azurill and Zorua left Graveler alone and shrunken
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"... And... no." Graveler said with a maniacal grin while Zorua paled.
"I'll need him... when I'm done with you!"

The stone fingers squeezed Zorua once more.

The dark-type cried in pain... as loudly as he could.

--

Sitting on a log, legs crossed and a book in her arms, Celebi read peacefully, having momentarily forgotten about Zorua and Azurill.

But her peace was interrupted as a faint scream echoed around... Celebi's heart sank.

That was Zorua. Her Zorua.

Without thinking, Celebi abandoned her book and flew into the depths of her boyfriend's forest, heart pounding her chest.

That was no normal scream. Someone screams like that only when their life is threatened.

Another scream rung, along with a cry of fear... Azurill.

Celebi flew past a few plants... and found herself staring at the gruesome scene of Graveler, squeezing her beloved boyfriend, Azurill staring at him terrorized from his other hand.

Instantly, Celebi felt hatred rising, an angry snarl coming out of her mouth.

"GRAVELER!"

The stone pokemon looked away from Zorua for a single moment... a green sphere of energy collided with his face, causing a small explosion and sending him flying backwards, leaving Azurill and a half-dead Zorua hovering in mid-air.

The legendary caught the two shrunken pokemon with psychic.

Zorua was shot across the air and into her arms, while Azurill remained floating in the air.

Celebi looked at her tiny boyfriend, feeling tears in her eyes.

"Zorua, tell me you're fine... please..." she sobbed.

The dark-type meekly opened his eyes, smiling at Celebi.

"... I am now." he whispered, leaning into Celebi's chest. The fairy made a mental note to kiss Zorua for that comment in a second moment.

Again, Celebi glared murderously as she stared at Graveler, who was laying flat at the foot of a tree.

Celebi's whole body shook with anger. A beast was awakened inside her, the desire of revenge.

Azurill had just threatened Zorua without doing anything concrete... but Graveler had actually hurt him. And, knowing the type, Celebi wasn't going to have a boyfriend anymore when he was done with him...

The stone pokemon slowly recovered, eyeing the seething legendary with blurry eyes.

"... What the hell is gotten into you Celebi!? Why are you protecting Zorua!? That runt deserves to-" Graveler couldn't finish, Celebi snarled at the word ‘runt’.

"You-" Graveler was lifted by a telekinetic force. Celebi's hand left Zorua, and it rose, hovering in mid-air.
"Are-" he was slammed face-down into the ground.
"Just-" he was slammed into a tree.
"A PIECE OF-" Graveler spun in the air, before being thrown upwards.

Celebi's paw traveled downwards, so fast that she felt the air tickling her palm; at the same moment, Graveler was slammed into the ground again, a huge crater forming under him, a cloud of dust rising.

Celebi inhaled sharply; Zorua stared at the scene with a grin - he didn't want to admit, but that side of Celebi excited him. Azurill stared at the green giantess, terrified.

Was she going to do the same to him now...?

Anymore thoughts they were going to formulate were interrupted as Graveler started to get back on his feet, dazed, hurt, humiliated.

He was beaten by a girl... well, a legendary, but a girl anyway.

He glared at Celebi.

"You-" he couldn't finish, Celebi raised a paw.

"Get lost Graveler. If you ever meet my gaze again, or Zorua's, you're dead." she said coldly.

Graveler stared at her, then at Zorua.

He started laughing as he began stumbling away, his legs shaky.

"Oh yeah... I'll get lost alright..." he snickered, before glancing back.
"But the village... they'll be so happy when I tell them about-"

A flash of green light, an explosion and a cloud of smoke and dust.

When it cleared, Graveler was laying face-down on the ground, unmoving.

Celebi seethed again. Before her eyes, the stone pokemon began shrinking down, until he was the size of a pebble.

"... I take it back. You're not going anywhere." she said, picking the third shrunken pokemon up with psychic - the mere idea of touching him disgusted her.

From her paws, Zorua snickered.

Revenge was going to be sweet.

--

"WAKE UP!"

Graveler felt pain and screamed as he opened his eyes... he was still in the forest, with Celebi, Azurill and Zorua...

But things changed slightly.

Zorua was no longer shrunken, he was a veritable mountain... and Graveler himself was smaller than even Azurill was.

He couldn't see much more, because Zorua's now huge paw was applying pressure on him, causing him to whimper, his stone body feeling like it was going to shatter.

"My boyfriend Graveler! You wanted to kill my boyfriend and use a kid as a toy!" Celebi shouted.

Azurill trembled.

Zorua snickered.
"We have our reasons... but you don't. And now you're going to pay... oh, yes! You're so going to pay!" he shouted, before grinning at the stone pokemon.

Graveler gulped as Zorua spoke again,
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Sweet revenge

choices: Zorua finishes Graveler off
Zorua opts to keep Graveler as his personal toy
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Azurill watched from his grip in psychic terrified. Graveler wasn't a pokemon he liked at all, and he didn't want to be in his grasp either. If asked...he might even prefer Zorua to Graveler if not for the fact that what Zorua took from him was much more personal than all the things Graveler took from him...or the many threats the stone pokemon gave to all the kids in the village.

He didn't have sympathy for the stone pokemon...but the overwhelming power these two pokemon had...and he was witnessing it again. He closed his eyes.

Zorua looked at the pebble that he could easily crush with just a little more pressure...he grinned.

"You wanted to kill me, huh? Guess what happens now..." Zorua said and the rock pokemon's eyes widened as he struggled, a feeble effort before the unmoving might of Zorua's simple paw.

"DON'T KILL ME! ANYTHING! I'LL DO ANYTHING!" Graveler cried and Zorua grinned some more.

"Oh, I bet you were looking forward to hearing those words from me..." He said wickedly as he slightly increased the pressure on his paw, being rewarded with a scream from Graveler.

Celebi looked at the scene before her.

"Whatever you do Zorua, is your choice...I won't stop you." She said coldly and Zorua grinned and Azurill shivered.

"D-don't kill him at least..." Azurill said quietly and Zorua's gaze fell on the tiny blue mouse, still doll sized.

"Y'know kid...the size Graveler is now...you were gonna be smaller than that when I caught you." Azurill's eyes widened as Zorua grinned a malicious grin at the kid...before it slightly softened.

"But a pokemon came along that I have a bigger grudge with...and I never technically won our game so...i'm fine with you staying this size for now, just be quiet and relax pet." He said and Azurill gulped.

He couldn't tell if Zorua was trying to be nice to him or not with that...though he still called him pet, it was the closest he had heard Zorua get to saying he'd give Azurill mercy.

Celebi smiled a little. Maybe this could get the two moving towards making peace...then she could let Azurill go without worry.

Though they still had one obnoxious pokemon to deal with.

"My pet doesn't want me to kill you...as much as I torment him, you're a bit more fun. No...I don't want you as a pet, if I were to let you live you'd be my toy. My stress ball so to speak." And Zorua rolled the rock pokemon around beneath his paw, making him dizzy as well as hurting Graveler.

"I just don't know." He said teasingly as Graveler awaited judgement.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Graveler's fate

choices: "I think you've found yourself a real pokedoll Celebi..." Zorua says
"Just let him go... AT that size!" Zorua says
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"... Say, Zorua," Celebi started, her mouth becoming a smirk as she eyes the almost invisible Azurill on the ground.
"What do you think we should do with this little blabbermouth?"

The moment those words left Celebi's mouth, two things happened: Azurill paled and Zorua grinned from his perch behind the fairy's paws.

The blue pokemon was tinier than the fox... and he sure wouldn't be merciful. He WAS the most infamous pokemon around and, although he mentioned that he was done with pranks, Azurill was sure that Zorua's nature didn't die down like he told.

Zorua snickers loudly, sending shivers down the extremely tiny pokemon's spine.

"Y'know Celebi... I'm getting quite hungry..." he said with a maniacal lick of his lips. Azurill felt his heart stopping.

However, Celebi glared at Zorua.
"... Nothing lethal, please..." she said.

"Aw, come on!" he responded.

Azurill watched the couple arguing and decided to take the moment and shy away. Shrunken or not, he didn't care. It was certainly better than facing whatever Zorua had planned for him.

He turned around and started bouncing on his tail as he tried to get away from the giant couple... but he was suddenly held down by a psychic force.

"Oh no, you're not getting anywhere," Celebi sternly told, noticing the fairy type attempting to flee.

Then, once she made sure the tiny blue pokemon couldn't move, she gazed back at Zorua.
"Seriously, we've got to teach him a lesson, no doubt about it, but we shan't actually harm him... remember what happened to you?" Celebi whispers... although, with his reduced size, Azurill could hear her anyway.

What had happened to Zorua...? Were they going to do the same to him?

"... I didn't threaten you back then, Celi..." he heard Zorua replying.

"Still... we won't actually hurt him, okay?" she asked.

Zorua turned around to look at the helpless fairy type far below.
"No deal." he said without looking back at his girlfriend.
"If he told about my size, pokemon wouldn't reason like that... they'd be actually eager to harm ME!" he said.

His logic was valid. However...

"... And you'd have me and the others fighting to protect you!" Celebi interjected.

Zorua huffed. And Celebi decided to change her approach.
"Zorua." she said, the bottle of soda levitating out of one of her bags.
"You still want this, no?" she said with a smirk, knowing that Zorua wasn't going to give up on his soda.

The dark type looked at her, before snorting.

Azurill looked in horror. His life and well being over a bottle of soda?!

Zorua sighed.
"Okay... fine..." he murmured. Celebi smiled in satisfaction, the bottle floating back into the bag as she lowered her head into her paws to peck Zorua's forehead.

He blushed... before grinning again while looking down at Azurill, who shot a fearful look.

"Still, I DO get to decide what we're going to do with him..." the fox remarked, before snickering again.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Decisions, decisions

choices: Follow Celebi and Zorua
Follow Buneary and Azurill
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Zorua was looking at the tiny Azurill on the ground. Celebi couldn't see his face, but he looked on the verge of tears. He rolled his eyes, he was going to get Zorua killed himself! But...Zorua supposed he was the reason Azurill hated him. Ugh, no way was he walking away from this though, it was way too dangerous. "Y'know, he could be YOUR pokedoll instead of me!" Zorua said, hoping to kill two birds with one stone.

"No deal, the bow and top hat stay on you." He glared up.

He contemplated just having Azurill left there, but that would almost be the same as killing him he supposed. That's when he got an idea. He wasn't sure if it was merciful or cruel, but all he knew...it was damn funny. He started cackling.

"Give him to Buneary then, that'll sort itself out right quick." He said giggling and Azurill looked up and wanted to run, but he was still pinned by the psychic force. His life as a doll? That was humiliating! And for Buneary...? He looked up at Zorua's smirk and found himself growing a bit until he was around Zorua's height.

"Your fate is sealed Azurill! And that fate is frilly dresses!" He grinned and Celebi rolled her eyes. "Azurill...we can't let you go, but this isn't as bad as you probably think it is." She said as she reached down to grab him. He went to run, but didn't get far and soon he was in her arms next to Zorua. Azurill shot him a glare while Zorua grinned.

"This is what you deserve~"

"Coming from you, that's rich."

Celebi looked at the two bicker and opted to ignore it. Azurill was one of Zorua's victims she supposed, but he had also just tried to leverage that for blackmail so it was hard to feel too bad for him. This outcome was at the very least accommodating, and maybe a way for the two to sort their differences since they'd probably see each other from time to time. She changed her path to Buneary's house and started walking down that path before she reached her destination. "Zorua." She said and he put up an illusion over himself and Azurill to look like real pokedolls. "And Azurill, a peep out of you for attention from anyone other than Buneary right now and you'll be a speck on your own, got it?" Celebi threatened and he shut his mouth hard. "I've got it mom!" They heard after she knocked on the door. "Remember what we talked about today honey." They also heard as the door was answered. "Oh, Celebi! And is that...Zorua and an Azurill pokedoll?" She said, her eyes lighting up.

"Buneary, want to step out for a sec?" She said and she turned back. "I'm just going to talk to Celebi for a second mom! I'll be right back!"

"Only for a minute Buneary!" She heard and nodded, shutting the door, Celebi was smiling, Zorua dropped the illusion on only himself and started snickering. "That top hat is so cute Zorua!" She squealed and he stopped snickering for a moment to shake his head...but then got himself thinking about the other situation and laughed again. "So Buneary...how do you feel about Azurill?" He asked and Buneary shrugged. "He's...okay, kinda quiet I guess, I had him in a few classes. Why?" And Zorua stopped laughing. "...That's boring, I was hoping you hated him." He said and dropped the illusion to reveal a very scared looking Azurill.

"Is that...the real Azurill?" She asked and Celebi nodded. "He found out about Zorua...and he was going to tell other pokemon about it, so we kinda did this. We figured maybe you could keep him for right now? I know you like pokedolls." Azurill was looking down at the ground as opposed to the giant bunny pokemon in front of him. 'Why her?' He thought, fighting a blush and she just shrugged. "Sure, I can take care of him! Leave it to me!" She said as Celebi went to hand Azurill to Buneary, while Zorua just laughed. "Enjoy hell, blue ball!" He said as Celebi looked unimpressed by this and nodded to the younger pokemon. "I need to go, thank you Buneary, and Azurill...try to adjust, because this is your life now." She said, both to reinforce this and try to get it in his mind to adjust. Soon enough they went their separate ways.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: A new pokedoll

choices: "Oh! I know! Let's take a warm bath... together!" Celebi suggested
"Let's play something Celi!" Zorua suggested
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"... Well... that was quick." Zorua commented from Celebi's chest.
"Now, back to important things - can I take this off?" he asked, desperately trying to remove the hat from his head.

Celebi sighed.
"We just handed Azurill to Buneary like he was a doll - don't act like it was no big deal." she scolds as she heads to her house.

Zorua shrugs, before snickering.
"Would have preferred if he snitched? Just imagine what would have happened if you suddenly woke up tomorrow morning to find a crowd of angry pokemon out of your front door..." he said.

Celebi remained silent.

"Or worse... Imagine what would have happened if he told your mom..."

At this point, Celebi seemed to cheer up a bit a she giggled.
"At that point we might be considered Romeo and Juliet... because we'd both be dead..." she commented with a giggle.

"... Celi, that's creepy."

The fairy sighed as she finally reached her destination.

She told her mom that she had to meet up with a friend in the forest... and that actually turned out to be true.

However, she recalls, Zorua was supposed to be a lifeless doll in her room...

"Zorua..." she said, and he crafted an illusion that made him disappear from eyesight.
"Good boy." she said, and he felt a pair of lips smooching his invisible head.

He blushed as Celebi entered her house.

--

"So? Who did you meet up with... in the forest?" Celebi's mom asks, putting a plate of meat and veggies in front of her daughter on the table.

"Oh..." Celebi said.
"... Buneary." she spoke the first name that sprang up.

The pink Celebi looks at her daughter.
"Yeah, but... why in the forest?" she asked, before assuming a stern look.
"Honey, you do know who lives there, don't you?" she asks, clearly referring to the invisible fox currently sitting on Celebi's lap.

Celebi rolled her eyes.
"Yeah yeah, Zorua... last time I met him, he was quite nice though... he changed a lot." she praises, one of her paws traveling down to her lap as she scratches his head.

The older time traveler looks at Celebi with a weird look.
"... Please, honey, tell me you're not going out with him... If he changed, I appreciate that, but still..."

Celebi blushes as she almost chokes on her piece of meat.
"MOM! There's no way I could go out with Zorua!" she cries, mentally apologizing to her tiny boyfriend.

The pink Celebi giggles.
"Just making sure."

--

Celebi sighed in exasperation as she closed her book and her eyes, letting her arms fall onto the bed.

"Mhmm?" Zorua inquired from beside her, his mouth full of a hickory chip.

"I... I can't stop thinking about Azurill, Zorua..." she admitted, her paws moving to him as she pulled him in a hug.

Zorua swallowed and grinned.
"Just forget about that lose-" Celebi glared at him.
"... freaking blabberm-" her eyes narrowed.
"... Azurill."

Celebi sighed as she closed her eyes again.
"I know I should... but what if he actually manages to contact someone? What if he talks to Buneary's mom?"

"... Then, you shrink him to a speck, no?" Zorua inquired.

"I dunno..." Celebi admitted.

The tiny dark type stared at her flabbergasted - he never heard those words coming from her! She was Celebi, the smartest girl in school, probably in the whole village!

She sighed in frustration.
"I mean, Buneary's mom knows mine... and if she comes talking to her..." she shakes her head, trying to rid it of all the possible disastrous scenarios that her choice might bring.

"Should've let me eat him..." Zorua comments with a grin.

Even though the situation, Celebi discovers herself giggling.

"See? Your mood is improving already!" the dark type chimed.
"Look, Azurill is now probably being dressed up by Buneary - whatever he's wearing, I hope it's pink - we won't have to worry about him! Buneary won't let him talk! And he knows what will happen if he does, right?" Zorua asked.

Celebi opened her eyes as she smiled at the tiny fox. She leaned down, gently pecking him.
"... You're right Zorua." she murmurs gratefully as she snuggles him further.

He grinned.

But she sighed again.
"Though I really need something to relax right now..." she remarks, before grunting.
"I had the perfect day... and Azurill had to spoil it..."

Zorua stared at his girlfriend in silence for a bit, before grinning again.
"Look, is there anyway I can help you relax?" he asked, eager to help Celebi out.

She smiled at him.
"Perhaps there is..." she commented.

Zorua's tail started wagging.
"And that is...?" he asked.

Celebi giggled.
"I said ‘perhaps’, meaning that I don't know." she admitted. Zorua face-pawed.

"Let's just think for a bit... we'll come up with something..." Celebi said as she went quiet, Zorua emulating her.

After a minute of thinking...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Seeking a way to forget

choices: Celebi sighed, "Okay Zorua, let's go watch TV"
Celebi yawned, "Let's just go to bed Zorua..."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"... Wha...?" Zorua couldn't finish as Celebi tightened her grip on him and got up from her bed, beaming down at her boyfriend.

"You heard me." she chirped as she started to move, heading to the door of her room.
"C-Celi! That's awkward...!" he complained, pointlessly struggling to get free from the fairy's grip.

Celebi just giggled.
"Nope. It's adorable." she retorted as she peeped out of the door to see if her mom was around.
"Oh and... Zorua?"

He sighed as a pokedoll of him appeared on top of the bed.

The fairy smiled, before looking out of her bedroom. No trace of the pink Celebi.

She quietly moved through her house until she reached the bathroom. She stepped inside, closing the door behind herself and locking it, before turning her attention to the bathtub.

She sets Zorua onto the sink and moves towards the tub, turning on warm water. The fairy leans back against the sink and smiles down at Zorua.

"... Do we really need to do this...?" he asked, blushing. She nodded with glee.
"I need to relax, remember?" she recalled.

"..." before Zorua could even speak, Celebi interrupted.
"You promised to help me, and that's exactly what you're going to do~" she said, removing the bow and the top hat from his body.

The dark fox sighed as he watched the tub getting filled with steaming water. He could only imagine how hot it was going to be in that tub...

As the water filled half of the tub, Celebi turned it off, gently sliding a paw into the water. Only to immediately retreat it.
"That's hot!" she exclaimed.

Then, gently, she slid her whole body into the steaming water, only her head remaining afloat. Celebi sighs.
"Man... that's what I meant by ‘relax’..." she sighed softly.

Zorua simply watched her from the sink, and she looked at him with her eyes half lidded.
"Mh~" she moaned.
"Get in this tub~"

Zorua backed up slightly on his perch on the sink.
"I'll pass... I'll just watch you." he said, finding the situation pretty awkward. There he was, sitting in a bathroom, watching a girl bathing. He could be easily mistaken for some pervert... he just imagined if he was in that tub with Celebi.

However, he discovered that Celebi wasn't giving him a choice.

A psychic force gripped him, and he found himself getting dragged across the bathroom. He uselessly tried to resist the fairy's mind power with his type advantage, but it was for naught.

He was dropped into the hot water of the tub. He emerged, spluttering water from his mouth as he tried to stay afloat.

Two strong hands gripped his body underwater, and he found himself being dragged towards the fairy, who hugged him, his head brushing against her chin.

"Mh~ better~"

Zorua sighed, feeling like he was on fire. However, it felt strangely nice to be in that tub with Celebi. She was right after all.

"Isn't this nice?" the fairy chimed, her lower body coming afloat as she floated on her back, setting Zorua down on her stomach.

It was like he was in the middle of the sea, on a small island. On a bouncy soft island of pure, endless green.

"Actually... it is pretty relaxing... once you get used to it..." he had to admit with a small smile, causing Celebi to giggle.

"See?"

"Although I do think this extremely awkward." he added.

Celebi splashed him with water.

"Hey!" Zorua complained playfully, before he formulated a devious plan. His eyes glowed, and the water around Celebi suddenly rose up and fell back, onto her.

Celebi gave a startled cry, before she realized that the tidal wave was an illusion. She looked at the snickering Zorua.
"... Why you little-" she said with a smirk as she grabbed him.

Sadly, her revenge was interrupted by a knock at the door.

"Celebi? Are you in there honey?" the voice of her mom said from outside.

"... Yes, mom! I'm bathing!"

A moment of silence.

"Okay honey. Be quick." the pink Celebi said from outside.

Celebi looked at the door for a moment, before looking back at Zorua. He looked back at her dejectedly.

She offered e smile.
"Don't worry... we're definitely doing this more often..." she said, her smile becoming a grin.
"In the meantime..."

And she firmly pushed him underwater, smirking as she watched himself struggling to surface.

--

The bath lasted for a while. But, eventually, Celebi started to get up, making Zorua tumble into the water.

The fairy started to stretch, before picking Zorua out of the water and and stepping out of the tub, gently letting the fox on the sink again.

Water was dripping from her body as she went to pick a towel, wrapping it around her form, while Zorua shook himself dry, splashing water everywhere.

"Still complaining about bathing together~?" Celebi sang, wrapping a towel around her head too.

Zorua stretched.
"Definitely not." he said with a grin as he watched Celebi drying herself up.

Once she was dry, Celebi smirked at the small fox on the sink. And, before he could wonder, what she was up to, he discovered that he couldn't move.

Celebi got closer, reaching for the bow and top hat she left on the sink.

Zorua glared.
"I hate you."

Celebi grinned as she started to dress her boyfriend up.
"No you don't."

--

"So? What now?" Zorua asked as the fairy climbed on top of her bed and laying down.

The fox snickered.
"By the way, still thinking about Azurill?" he inquired. Celebi smiled at him.
"Nope~"

He laughed.
"So? What do we do now?" Zorua repeated his previous question. Celebi shrugged.
"Bedtime Zorua." she simply responded.

The dark type stared at the fairy dejectedly.
"Aw, come on Celi, can't we do something? It's still early..." he complained.

Celebi opened her mouth to speak.

"No books." he interjected. She tried again.
"And no board games."

Celebi's mouth closed and she sighed. She thought for a minute.

"... Well... there's TV in the other room... we could watch something..." she said. Zorua grinned.
"Cool! Let's do that!" he chimed, tail wagging.

Celebi looked at him.
"I dunno... mom could be still around..." she pondered.

"I'll just use an illusion, no?" he reassured.

Celebi thought for a bit more.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Hot bath remedy

choices: Azurill tries to make the best of his situation
Azurill isn't planning on making peace
Azurill is planning an escape
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Buneary carried the tiny Azurill back into her house. "I'm back mom, she just wanted to give me a pokedoll!" Buneary said as Lopunny looked around the corner of the kitchen to see her daughter. "Oh, that was nice of her, did you say thank you? Oh, an Azurill!" She said, smiling at her. Azurill thought about signaling her, but remembered Celebi's warning and opted to not, he remained in a motionless smile, silent, doing his best to stay still as Buneary told her mom she was going to her room.

His world shook once more as Buneary carried him to her room and shut the door. "So...Azurill...let me set you on the bed, I want to try something with you!" She said excitedly as she did that and went over to her toy chest. She grabbed her own tiny little top hat that she had and a small set of gloves to go with it. Smiling she turned around to see...Azurill curled up into a ball, hugging his tail on her bed. "All I was doing was going to buy sweets with money Wigglytuff gave me...I just happened to see them...why didn't I keep walking..." He was muttering to himself, almost on the verge of tears. Buneary's face loomed in suddenly and he looked surprised as he rolled over onto his other side, away from her. "Leave me alone okay? I won't tell anyone about stupid Zorua so just let me sit here." He said as she moved to the other side of the bed to look at him. "What exactly happened anyway?" She said sympathetically as she climbed onto her small bed with him, causing a quake for him practically as he held firm to his tail. "That dumb Zorua...I just happened to see him like he is talking to Celebi and I confronted them about it. I was going to tell others about him I guess...it's what he deserves right? But Celebi shrunk me down..." He said and Buneary nodded. "Well you can't go telling others about him, so many pokemon would want to hurt him..." She said and he glared at her. "He deserves it! You know what he's done to me! To you! To tons of other pokemon!" And she looked down at him sympathetically, setting the top hat and gloves in her lap as she went to pick him up.

She held him to her face, him struggling a bit and trying to look away from her. "Zorua has changed Azurill, he really has." She said, hoping to calm him down. "He was going to eat me until Celebi intervened and she only stopped him because of a bottle of soda." He said and she bit her lip. "He's...still new to being good?" She offered. "Forget it, it doesn't matter anyway, the jerk is in Celebi's good graces and i'm here. Just leave me alone." He said struggling and she set him down, only for him to hop away from her to the corner of the bed and curl up again. She remembered that he used to bring a pokedoll of Azumarill to school with him, and one day he didn't bring it and sat on the playground crying sitting on his ball. "Azurill...that pokedoll of yours that he destroyed...that's why you hate him right?" She said gently. "It was the last thing...it was..." He was mumbling and she heard sniffling before he went quiet. He wasn't answering anymore. She got up. "You stay with Wigglytuff right? And he was going to let you get something sweet?...I'll be right back, okay?" She said and left him in his corner to go grab a cookie.

She was back within a few minutes to see he hadn't moved. Carefully she tore off a bit of it, trying to make sure a bit with a chocolate chip was on the tiny torn off part and she set it next to Azurill. "Here, maybe this'll cheer you up." She said as she bit into hers. He didn't move. "You know...this won't be so bad...you'll see. You and I can have fun together, we can play games, and you'll make friends with Braixen too! Who knows maybe...you and Zorua can...I don't know." She mumbled. He still wasn't responding. "Wigglytuff is going to wonder you know...he's gonna look for me." He said and Buneary looked down at him. "Maybe...try and have that cookie, okay? It might help." She said and he looked at it, uncurling himself.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Buneary's new doll, friend, or burden?

choices: Buneary remains asleep... Azurill leaves...
Buneary suddenly wakes up and notices Azurill leaving...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Azurill looked at the large piece of cookie in front of him, but said nothing as he turned around again, hugging the ball that was his tail, rejecting Buneary's meek attempt to make him feel better.

Buneary stared at the tiny blue pokemon dejectedly.

"Come on Azurill... eat up, you'll feel better..." she encouraged.

He didn't respond, but turned around, staring down at the floor.

"Zorua has changed... I'm sure he wasn't serious about eating you..." she tries. Azurill still doesn't respond, his eyes fixed on the floor for some reason.

Not a great fall... if he landed on his tail...

The fairy type glanced around the room, noting that the toy chest where she grabbed the top hat and gloves from was positioned right in front of the window.

He looked through the glass, noticing that Buneary's bedroom was on the ground floor of the house, he could tell from seeing other pokemon quietly walking in the streets of the village.

Adrenaline started running through his veins.

He had a chance! He had a chance to run from this hell, get Wigglytuff and have his revenge on Zorua! Celebi though... he only cared about getting his size back from her. His true objective was Zorua. The tiny fox had to pay.

For tearing his pokedoll apart.

For wanting to eat him.

For suggesting Celebi to give him to Buneary as a doll.

"... Azurill?" Buneary's voice interrupted his train of thought. He looked at her, noticing her staring back at him with a concerned look.
"Come on... just eat that cookie..." she offered again.

Azurill pushes it away with his tail, before turning around.
"I don't want it." he simply stated, deciding to wait for the proper moment before trying to flee.

Buneary sighed as she removed the cookie from her bed and placing it on a nightstand.
"I'll leave it there if you want it." she meekly said, before smiling a little.

"You know Azurill... maybe a good night sleep will make you feel better about this whole thing... yeah! I'm sure it'll work!" she gently said, pulling back the sheets of her bed and grabbing a hold of the small blue pokemon.

She gently laid down, setting Azurill down on her pillow, before hopping to a switch and turning off the lights before skipping back to her bed.
"It was bedtime for me anyway..." she mumbled, climbing onto the bed and pulling the blanket up to her neck.

Buneary then smiled gently at Azurill.
"Good night Azurill... Just try to not think about it anymore, you'll feel better about it... and call if you need anything..." the bunny offered as she gently caressed her tiny guest.

She even considered cuddling him... before deciding that'd be awkward and shifting on her side, her furry ears gently caressing Azurill's body while providing a comforting warmth.

The blue pokemon sighed and waited.

He waited for an inordinate amount of time, before he finally heard Buneary snoring softly.

Only then, he decided to make his move.

He quietly got free from the blanket and bounced to the edge of the bed.

"Arceus help..." he whispered as he leaped down from the bed, the sudden acceleration choking his incoming scream of terror back.

Mercifully, he landed on his tail like he expected - or hoped. He sighed in relief, before starting to bounce over the toy chest in front of the window.

It wasn't that big, he noted as he proceeded to make a few leaps, before finally gaining enough height to land on top of the toy chest, finding himself in front of the window.

Moonlight peered inside from the glass as he bounced over the window, wondering how to open it...

Then, casually looking down, he noticed that it was slightly ajar.

Dumb luck, he guessed as he moved to the tiny opening and trying to open it with his tiny arms.

Obviously, it didn't work as his arms were hopelessly too small to lift the humongous window. He ended up being thrown backwards.

But Azurill didn't give up. He moved towards the opening again, before placing his tail in between it and the window, before trying to lift it up a bit.

And it seemed to work as the window lifted a tiny bit... just enough for him to squeeze himself through.

With a last fit of reluctance, Azurill looked back at Buneary.

Almost like she was sensing his plans in her sleep, the bunny started fidgeting...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Azurill's great escape

choices: Buneary decides to try and calm Azurill down, still being nice
Niceties are over, Buneary is keeping him locked up and not much more
She puts him in her toy chest, she'll think on it overnight
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
A pit in Azurill's stomach grew as he noticed Buneary waking up. She looked at the pillow he was supposed to be on, and slowly her eyes drifted to the window where he was, his tail still in the window. "Azurill!" She said, suddenly alert and awake and he tried to squeeze himself through the window. His body was caught though and he found that the window was slowly sliding down on him. "Gagh!" The air was immediately expelled from his lungs as he felt a great force lifted off of him as Buneary reached the window and lifted it up like it wasn't a big deal.

"Azurill that was a bad choice." She stated simply as she picked him up, him now sore from the window. She set him back on the pillow before moving her toy chest and shutting her window, making sure it was shut completely. She then glared at the smaller pokemon on the pillow...he gulped. "So what was your grand plan then? Go out there on your own at your size, get squished? Maybe eaten? On your quest to get back at Zorua or get back to normal?" She said accusingly, he glared down at the pillow, saying nothing. "On top of that you managed to hurt yourself in this grand plan too. Do you know how precarious your position is right now?"

"It doesn't matter...all that matters is getting back to normal and making sure Zorua gets what he deserves." He muttered, and she just glared back. "Azurill, you're not going anywhere, and there are two ways we can go forward. We can either be friends, or you can be a prisoner. You seem focused on being the second choice."

"Because I already AM the second choice!" He snapped back. "I'm not here by choice! I'm here because you're all sticking up for one of the most vile pokemon around!" At this point there were tears in his eyes. "Y-you all think he's going to change? To be better? After what he's done? That's ridiculous!" He stammered out and Buneary went back over to the bed to pick him up. She was conflicted on what to do with him...he had his reasons, she knew that, but what he did was dumb, reckless, and for the sake of spite against one of her friends. But said friend...had given Azurill ample reason to feel the way he felt. She was conflicted. Did Azurill deserve this? She doubted it, but he was spurning her at every chance she tried to give and it was getting on her nerves.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Failed escape

choices: Azurill has calmed down
Azurill is still having none of it
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"Azurill...you need time to get to know the new him. And time you'll get...i'm going to need to be more careful with you in the future, but you need to realize that i'm not your enemy...if you'll give them a chance, Zorua and Celebi don't need to be either." Buneary said gently as she hugged him. He blushed...he wasn't going to let her know how he felt about her, he needed to get out of here. Still hugging him, she crawled back into bed and covered herself up, not letting him go. "You're not getting away from me, you'll sleep like this." She said gently and he struggled, her not letting him go. Eventually he stopped trying to struggle as he was too tired to continue. Was this his life? Unable to even move her paws even a bit. He sulked a bit in her grip as she smiled at him.

"Just sleep Azurill, i'm not going to give up on this. In the morning, maybe we can play something."

"I don't want to play anything..." He muttered as he found it harder to keep his eyes open. Pinned as he was, it was warm and comfortable...it reminded him of days from years ago, vaguely buried in his mind. 'mom...' he thought as he found it harder and harder to stay conscious. 'Wigglytuff...Zorua...' the names flickered like tiny dimming lights in his head as everything became a blur. Buneary noted that he had relaxed quite a bit in her grip and she saw that he was asleep. 'You'll come around Azurill...but I need to make sure you don't try anything in the meantime.' She thought as she too closed her eyes, drifting off.

-

Azurill awoke slowly, noting that he was surrounded by warmth in an alien environment. "Wha-?" He said blurrily until the memories came back to him and his eyes narrowed. That's right! That jerk Zorua and his friend shrunk him down and gave him to...Buneary. He blinked as he stopped narrowing his eyes, pondering a few things, as well as his escape attempt. "Hmm..."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Gonna keep trying

choices: "Just came over to hang out."
"I dunno, there's a commotion in the village, have you seen Azurill?"
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Azurill let out a shaky sigh. He didn't like his situation, not one bit, and he had no intention of spending the rest of his life like this, but his options to get out of it were limited. It was essentially escape, which would be next to impossible now, or make peace with Zorua and his friends, which made his blood boil. For now though...he'd at least try to make peace with Buneary. He didn't want to make his stay more miserable than it had to be he supposed. He tried to squirm out of her grip to find that he was held tight. He just had to wait for her to wake up.

A few minutes passed and he heard her stirring from above. She slowly opened her eyes and was about to go to stretch her arms before she remembered the little pokemon she was holding. "Azurill." She groggily said before he felt her shifting and he was just standing on her bed as she set him down to stretch up. Man...she was huge...no, he was just small. He mentally cringed. 'I don't like this...' but he pushed it down. He had to deal with this for now. She gave him her full attention now and gently lowered her head down to him, making him bounce back a bit. "Are you still hurt?" She asked, and he did feel a bit sore...but nothing too bad he supposed. "I'll be fine." He muttered. "Still wanting to escape?" She asked. He considered his options before he shakily said. "I don't intend to spend the rest of my life like this...but I won't try to escape again..." He muttered. She considered this before nodding. "Okay." She gently reached out a hand to pet his head. "Let's try and make today a good day." And she heard a call. "Buneary, breakfast!" And she got up off the bed. "Coming mom!" Before she looked back. "Just stay there and i'll bring you back some food." She said and he nodded. He was hungry he had to admit...

-

Azurill was mindlessly bouncing on his ball tail, bored. He couldn't open the window, and he couldn't even get to it now that she moved her toy chest away from it. He heard someone approaching the door before it opened to see Buneary again, smiling at him. "You're still there." She said happily and he shrugged. "Where would I go? I can't get out." He stated simply and she smiled. "I suppose that's true. Here...I brought you some food." She said as she uncupped her paw to show him...scraps of a sausage and egg. He had to admit...it did smell good. He reached out for the sausage bit and took it in his stubby paws and started to munch on it. She gently set the egg down next to him as she went to her toy chest, waiting for him to finish. He hungrily munched on the egg once he finished the sausage, just glad to fill his belly before he finished up and sat back on his tail, sighing. Buneary giggled a bit at the sight. "So Azurill, I was thinking...let's try something." She said as she pulled the top hat and gloves out. Azurill looked confused for a second before becoming filled with dread and turning away from her to try and bounce away with his tail. "NO!" He yelled as he bounced away only for a paw to come down in his path. "It won't be so bad~" She said and he couldn't stop himself from bouncing into her paw as she gently stopped him and picked him up, to put the top hat on him. "Hmm..." She looked at his stubby paws. The gloves may not work. "Oh well, the hat is cute at least." She said and he tried to shake it off, but she had secured it around his head. He started to bounce in her paws trying to reach it with her paws, but he couldn't get to it.

He groaned. "I just want to go home..." He said as he started to sulk in her paws and she looked at him a bit sadly before taking the hat off. "Okay Azurill, we won't do this for now." She said, gently setting him on the bed...she needed to find something to get his mind off of it, before she heard her mom again. "Hey Buneary, Braixen is here and wondering if she can talk to you." Buneary perked up, Braixen might be able to cheer Azurill up, she can cheer anyone up! "Yeah, of course!" Buneary responded, and soon the door opened to reveal Braixen. "Hey, Buneary, how's it going?" She said cheerfully and Buneary nodded. "Great! So what's up?" Buneary asked
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: reluctant peace

choices: Azurill still in the room
Azurill... gone...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"Nothing important," Braixen simply responded, before grinning at Buneary.
"Say, Bun, d'you wanna hang out?" she asked.

Buneary smiled.
"Sure! It'll be fun!" she said, before remembering about Azurill in the other room.
"... Just a moment to... uh... put my doll away." she told as she walked into her room.

Buneary's gaze traveled across the room as she spotted the tiny Azurill on the floor. She quietly moved to him and picked him up.
"Listen Azurill... I've got to hang out with Braixen... I can't risk bringing you along though. So, you'll have to stay in here..." she said.

Azurill tensed up.
"Wait! Don't leave me in here, what I'm going to do alone?" he asked.
"... You be as quiet as possible." Buneary warned.

"Buneary?"

Buneary glanced at the door, before looking back at Azurill.
"See you later. And be good." she whispered, putting the blue pokemon on top of the bed before leaving the room, making sure to close the door.

Azurill sighed in frustration.

Was this going to be his life from now on...?

Before the front door closed, he hears Buneary again,
"See you later mom!"

The response came quickly,
"Yes sweetie~"

Then, the house went completely quiet.

--

"So? Where are we headed?" Buneary asked, skipping alongside Braixen.

The vixen grinned.
"I want to call Celebi and - heh - squirt... I bet he DOES look adorable with the hat... and Celebi mentioned a bow~" Braixen told cheerfully, snickering at the thought of being able to tease Zorua all day long.

Buneary smiled. Zorua was definitely nice now, she enjoyed his company... and he was the reason of Azurill's shrinking.

Buneary quickly recalls that Azurill intended to blackmail him... so, she should tell Celebi about Azurill's failed escape and how it was going between her and him... in private of course.

Braixen didn't know about Azurill, and she had to remain in the dark. Buneary wasn't sure she'd like the news...

Finally, the duo reached their destination. Braixen grinned a she knocked at the door.

No reply.

Braixen knocked again, receiving the same response: silence.

"Maybe they're not inside..." Buneary said.
"I don't think so. Celebi didn't mention she had something to do..." Braixen suddenly grinned.
"But maybe she went out to buy pokedoll clothes~"

--

Little did Braixen and Buneary know that Celebi was in reality still asleep, Zorua cuddled to her as usual.

That was unusual of her - she always was an early bird.

However, the knocks at the door caused her to murmur in her sleep.

"... Mooom... go get the door..." she said, rolling over her side.

Whoever was at the door kept knocking.

"... Zorua... go get the door..."

The knocking still didn't quit.

With an annoyed sigh, Celebi let go of Zorua as she got up, hazily moving through her house to reach the front door.

The fairy rubbed her eyes, before yawning and opening the door, finding Braixen and Buneary waiting outside.

"... Oh... Braixen, Buneary..." she told, yawning.

Braixen looked surprised.
"You just woke up?!" she asked, recalling that at such hour Celebi was usually up and perhaps reading.

Celebi nodded, yawning again.
"Zorua and I went to sleep quite late... he got obsessed with TV..." she smiled.
"I guess that sleeping with a sleepyhead is contagious..."

Buneary giggled, Braixen rolled her eyes.
"... Yeah. Anyway, you two wanna hang out?" she asked, grinning.

Celebi smiled.
"Sure... let me wake roomie up~" she said, walking into the house.

Braixen and Buneary heard her talking.

Shortly after, they heard screaming mixed with giggling.

Then, Celebi came back. Holding an annoyed-looking Zorua, who was wearing a bow and a top hat.

"Hi Zorua~ good morning~" Buneary sang. He mumbled something incomprehensible in response.

"Hi Zorua... nice bow~" Braixen snickered.

Zorua glared at her.

--

Azurill sighed as he bounced around, bored.

Most likely, Buneary was punishing him for his attempt to escape by leaving him in a closed room. Alone.

Well... at least he was able to jump off the bed again and could move around the room.

Celebi's words kept floating in his mind.

‘Try to adjust... this is your life now.’

He sighed again. Was this really going to be his life now? A mere doll in Buneary's paws, unable to call for help because of the threat of being shrunk even further and left by himself?

"This is all my fault... why didn't I ignore Zorua when I saw him tiny...?" he said, bouncing to the window and staring at it longingly.

Without the toy chest, he had no hope to reach it.

He was trapped for good.

Not looking at the door, he didn't notice it opening slowly. But he luckily heard it, and he was quick to drop to the ground, smiling.

It was Buneary's mom, Lopunny.

She quietly walked in the room, setting a basket with clean sheets on the bed, before casually gazing at the 'pokedoll' on the ground.

She sighed.

"When will that girl learn to put her toys away...?" she mumbled, before kneeling to pick Azurill up and putting him on the bed, before starting to replace the bedsheets with the clean ones.

For a moment, Azurill pondered asking for help... but he quickly recalled that he'd better shut up if he didn't want to be a speck on the ground in a giant world.

Azurill choked back a sigh as he just laid there motionless, faking his best smile as he watched Buneary's mom.

--

"Say Buneary, how's-" Zorua stopped to look at Braixen, who returned his gaze.
"... Your mother. How is she?" he awkwardly asked.

They stopped in a secluded area after walking for a while, and Zorua caught the moment to ask.

Buneary looked at him, understanding what Zorua meant.
"Oh... she's fine." she replied, before looking at Celebi.

"... Celi, can I tell you something?" Buneary asked.

"Oh, sure. What is it?" Celebi said, pretty much expecting what Buneary was going to say.

Buneary remained silent.

Celebi nodded slightly as she handed Zorua to Braixen and went to the bunny, lowering her head against hers.

"So? What do you want to tell me?... Is it about Azurill?" the fairy asked.

Buneary nodded.
"He tried to escape... and he got injured when he did." Buneary admitted.

Celebi frowned.

"Hmm." she told.
"Next time It happens, just tell me... I'll make sure that he won't try funny things again."

Buneary nodded, before the two looked back at Braixen and Zorua

"I'm. NOT. Cute!" the dark type cried in annoyance.

Celebi smiled as she snatched him from Braixen and nuzzled him.
"Yes you are~" she chimed in whatever conversation they were having.

Buneary giggled; Zorua sighed.

--

"Mom! I'm home!" Buneary exclaimed upon saying goodbye to Braixen.

"Oh... hi honey... how did it go?" Lopunny distractedly asked from another room.

"... There wasn't Zorua too, right?" the older bunny asked, peeking from her own bedroom.

Buneary shook her head as she moved up into her room, finding...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Azurill's indoor day

choices: “Well fine! If you don’t want to talk I don’t either!”
“Please Azurill, talk to me...”
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
As Buneary entered her room, she noted something...she couldn’t see Azurill. Her heart skipped a beat. Did he manage to escape? She looked under her bed and all around, but then she saw him out of the corner of her eye...sulking in her closet. “Oh, there you are~ I was worried you had tried to escape!” She approached the closet, he said nothing and sunk back into it. She noted this, but said nothing and instead stopped going towards the closet. “Um...are you hungry? I could go get you something if you are...” She said, her mood a bit less cheery after seeing him.

No response

Buneary bit her lip. “This doesn’t have to be so bad Azurill...if you’d give me a chance maybe you’d have fun!” She said, trying to get some cheer back.

No response

“Okay, I’m pulling you out of the closet.” She finally said and she went to grab him, he tried to shrink back but he couldn’t elude the giantess. She gently picked him up and she noted he didn’t struggle. “Now then, let’s-” She cut herself off when she saw his face. His eyes were red and puffy she noted, but other than that...he was giving a motionless smile, unmoving. “Azurill, you don’t need to do this around me...” She said, but he didn’t budge.

‘None of you want to see it from my perspective, was I supposed to magically know Zorua was apparently reformed?
