"Alright, I'm putting an end to this," Zorua muttered as he leaned in closer, barely even seeing the small speck that was the loathsome Wigglytuff, "Look, stop embarassing yourself. Let it be and don't worry about Igglybuff, we'll take care of her."

"Stay the hell away from my daughter, you little creep!" Wigglytuff shouted defiantly as his fingers lit up, instantly draining him of all his powers. He toppled over from the shock and gasped for air. This was...

He looked over at Azurill. The others were regular-sized, but the blue Pokémon was way too small, there was no way he'd survive.

"Azurill... Hurry..." Wigglytuff struggled to beckon him over, "Come here... Or die..."

"What, trying to make your lie a reality?" Azurill huffed dejectedly. Above him, Celebi's mom suddenly twitched and turned her head up. Her expression became one of absolute panic as she suddenly leaned down towards the two shrunken Pokémon.

"WHAT DID YOU DO?!" she screamed with such ferocity that both Azurill and Wigglytuff were blown away by the sheer force of it. Tumbling through the air with his light body, Wigglytuff could hear another roar approaching. Apparently his size had done nothing to dminish the size of this attack. Since floating came natural to balloon Pokémon and he wasn't really in the shape to walk anymore, he twisted his body and managed to slam straight into the panicked Azurill. Mustering up the last of his powers, he used Protect.

"Mom?!" Celebi asked with a frightened voice as the pink Celebi hugged both her and Zorua close to herself, erecting a Barrier around them. Meoletta simply stared up, suddenly wishing she had at least one protective ability in her moveset, because something very large and very loud was approaching from above.

The entire neighborhood was in complete chaos as several purple Draco Meteors suddenly crashed down on Celebi's house, turning the roof into splinters and ending with a giant explosion that sent rubble flying in every direction.

Slowly opening his eyes and feeling the ringing in his ears, Wigglytuff surveyed the area of his destruction...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Lilliputian strength

choices: ... Celebi's mom, glaring daggers at the pink speck...
... a legendary, smirking down at the tiny Wigglytuff...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
The legendary put a paw to her head with an amused expression as she tried to locate the area from where that large amount of rage was coming. She found that the rage changed - now it was fear.

Nonetheless, she could still sense it, savor it.

Whoever was feeling such strong emotions, she had to find.

She smiled - the emotions were coming from a very far area. Though she could still get there very soon.

The legendary hovered in the air, before taking flight, heading for the source of such intense emotions.

She was excited.

--

Dust fell from the ceiling along with pieces of the ceiling itself... almost nothing was left of it but a giant hole caused by several meteors falling at supersonic speed and destroying almost the whole mansion.

On top of Azurill, Wigglytuff laid exhausted from the struggle.

The green barrier he put up faded as he stood up, Azurill trembling beneath him.

"Is it over?" he asked shakily.

A cloud of dust and smoke cleared.

Celebi, Zorua, Meloetta and the mother of Zorua's girlfriend were knocked out and laying unconscious on the floor.

Even three legendaries couldn't resist the sheer force of such powerful attack, the barrier that Celebi's mom had put up had most probably shattered like glass when the meteors made contact with it.

It was ironic in a sense... a barrier made from a tiny dot turned out to be more durable than the one made from a full-sized legendary.

Azurill began to stand up, using his own tail to help himself up, Wigglytuff falling from his stomach and hitting the ground, face first.

A muffled cry came from him, though it went totally unheard.

Azurill looked around... he felt sick.

His new home, destroyed; His new friend Meloetta, unconscious; his beloved friends unconscious too.

The blue mouse angrily looked at Wigglytuff, who slowly got up.

"What have you done?!" he shouted as the pink rabbit stood up and looked at the blue mountain in front of him, giving an annoyed look.
"That's the thanks I get for saving you?" he asked.

Azurill snarled.

"You. Wanted. Me. Dead!" he seethed.
"Tell me why shouldn't I crush you like the bug you are right now!"

Wigglytuff growled, but carefully picked his words. A wrong flip of his tongue and Azurill would crush him to paste.
"Because I'm saving ya kid! We need to get away before they wake up!" he told.

Azurill gritted his teeth in anger.
"There's no way I'm sticking with you again! You lied to me for years, you hurt my friends and destroyed my house!" he snapped, before turning around.
"Leave." he coldly added as he started to make his way to his unconscious friends.

Wigglytuff watched Azurill walk up to Meloetta as he gently nudged her side.
"Meloetta... Zorua... Guys, wake up!" he cried.

Wigglytuff jumped up in alert - he couldn't risk the mouse waking the giants up! Any chance of escaping would evaporate like water in a hot day!

"Damn it kid... ya leave me no other choice..." he said, his eyes glowing as he performed psychic.

Azurill was quickly incapacitated and started hovering in midair, held by a psychic force.

"Hey!... what are you..." the mouse cried in surprise as the pink dot that once was Wigglytuff started moving towards a hole in the wall, dragging the mouse along.

Not even Azurill, the kid that had called him a bug, not even him deserve a fate such as dying by the hand of giants... plus, he told himself, Azurill would work quite well as a hostage, in case one of said giants woke up and tried to stop him.

Azurill noted his pink captor moving towards the damaged hole... he wanted to flee... dragging him along!

"No! Lemme go... Guys!" he cried as Wigglytuff started picking up his pace, a screaming mouse floating behind him, unable to move.

A small breeze blew inside the quiet house as Wigglytuff finally reached the hole. He waited for a few debris to fall to avoid being crushed, before he made his way out, Azurill floating behind him.

The pink dot found himself in a thick forest made of blades of grass as he started venturing outside the house's yard, briefly looking back at the place that almost caused his death...

The windows were shattered, the roof destroyed and he was quite certain that something was on fire in there.

But it didn't matter - he was safe.

Sighing in relief, the pink rabbit started moving again... but could only take the amount of three steps before he felt himself unable to move any longer.

He desperately tried to move, but he was completely unable to make a move.

"H-Hey... what's going on...?" he cried as he dropped his psychic grip on Azurill.

He looked at him... Azurill was staring in silence at someone behind the rabbit...

Wigglytuff tried to turn around, but couldn't move.

"Going somewhere?" a powerful voice intoned, sending shivers down his spine.

Then, Wigglytuff's feet left the solid ground as he started floating in midair... and soon, the bunny was psychically manipulated so that he was facing his captor.

His mouth hung open - it was...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Attempting to flee

choices: The older Celebi finishes Wigglytuff
“Please wait!” A new legendary says, approaching
“Mom...?” A dazed Celebi says, approaching
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
The giant pink face of Celebi’s mother took up his entire field of vision. He couldn’t believe it, one of them woke up!

“You’re through Wigglytuff! That stunt was the final nail in your coffin. You could’ve quietly gone to prison to atone, but you destroyed that chance. Azurill and I fought on behalf of you saying goodbye to your daughter but you spat in the face of that opportunity too. You could’ve quietly accepted your fate but-”

She was cut off as she noticed the small blue mouse that had been on the ground was floating again, held up to her eye level by the speck...choking. He couldn’t breathe...Wigglytuff was psychically choking him.

“He’s my hostage. You’re gonna let me go if you don’t want me to-”

He didn’t get the chance to finish as he felt a stranglehold on his own throat. He reached for his throat as he floated, struggling to breathe. He felt dizzy and couldn’t maintain his hold on Azurill any longer.

The small blue mouse was trying desperately to get air as he floated there, his eyes shut tight, when he felt the hold on him stop. He started gasping and choking for air as he felt himself fall. His fall was stopped by a soft surface and he found himself pressed against a warm soft surface. He opened his eyes, still choking to see a wall of pink. The older Celebi.

“Thank you....” He choked out. She didn’t say anything, nor did she take her gaze off of the speck before her as she glared death at it. The giantess merely hugged him tighter to her chest.

Wigglytuff was trying desperately to breathe as slowly, he floated closer and closer to her face. “My daughter...you attacked my daughter Wigglytuff. And attempted to hurt a child in front of me after attempting to kill him earlier today...you’re going to face my wrath personally now!”!She spat with venom. She was a vengeful goddess before the speck.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: A mother’s wrath

choices: "Let him go with Mesprit... just let him live..." Azurill said pitifully
"I think ma'am should do what she must..." Azurill said mercilessly
"I don't know... he's jerk, but he has a family..." Azurill said, uncertain
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"Please wait!"

Celebi's mother gazed away from Wigglytuff, who was being choked slowly.

The pink Celebi noted another pokemon descending from the skies... her eyes widened as the legendary flew down to the same level as her.

Mesprit.

"Hi!" the newcomer greeted cheerfully.
"My name is Mesprit! And that pokemon over there you're trying to choke..." she pointed to the pink speck floating in midair.

The time traveler's grip had lessened, though it was still there.

The pink Celebi looked at the rabbit angrily.
"Yeah... he did that miss..." she pointed to the destroyed mansion behind there, before her finger landed on top of the still startled Azurill's head.
"And this... he attempted to kill this poor child..." she said softly, the blue mouse still gasping for air.

Mesprit stared with an amused look - the kid was feeling strong emotions too! - before she turned her head to Wigglytuff, playfully shaking it.
"I wonder how such a tiny pokemon could be such a troublemaker..." she said, one of her tails rising and swinging back and forth, its tip gently but repeatedly slapping Wigglytuff across the face.

"Here, let me fix this~"

Azurill, who had finally stopped coughing, felt his fear waning and felt oddly serene.

He looked at Mesprit with curiosity. The new giantess smiled at him.

"Thanks miss..."

Mesprit giggled.
"You're welcome, sweetheart... but you are probably wondering why I am here, right? I feel your curiosity~" she asked, turning her head to Wigglytuff once more.

Celebi's mom nodded as Mesprit began to explain,
"... I felt his intense emotions... It was an incredible rage! Rage, hatred, I doubted someone could feel something like that! And now, it's fear... he's terrorized to massive levels~ oh, wait, now he's creeped out, by me I must assume..."

Still psychically held by the time traveler, Wigglytuff stared at the newcomer.

Just who the hell was this...?

Mesprit smiled.

Celebi's mom nodded a few times.
"Okay... so, why are you here? I doubt you've came from..."

"Far. Very far... that should give you an idea how strong his rage was~"

"... Yeah... I don't believe you've came here just to see me choking him... what's..."

"The real purpose behind my visit? Simple really... I'd like to have him instead of you killing him. He won't be bothering you anymore... oh, now he's hopeful." Mesprit explained, and the pink pokemon in front of her looked confused as did Azurill.

"Miss, he's a true monster..." the blue mouse timidly said.

"It's undeniable sweetheart... I mean, he did that... I'm still wondering how..." Mesprit said, pointing to the destroyed house.

Celebi's mom stared at the pink dot in front of her murderously. He looked exhausted, he had been trying to get free from the psychic grasp of the pink giantess... however, she was holding him quite firmly.

The time traveler gave a quick squeeze, causing him to cry in pain.

"... There's three more pokemon in the house. They're unconscious... my daughter... he almost killed my daughter..."

Mesprit shook her head.
"This keeps getting worse for you, huh?" she asked, briefly floating around the pink dot.

Wigglytuff kept trying to slide out of the psychic grip on his neck.
"I'm s-sorry..." he stuttered, trying to use the least amount of oxygen left in his lungs.

Mesprit giggled.
"No you aren't... you're just scared for your life... but nice try~" she revealed, still savoring all of his emotions.

Fear, hope, repressed anger...

"Let... Let me go... with m-miss h-here..." he pleaded, feeling like he was about to pass out.

"You don't have a say in the matter!" Celebi's mom shouted.

"Yet... please, miss, give him to me... I'll make extra sure to punish him for all of his crimes before I start having some actual fun with him..." Mesprit said as she eyed her desired prize.

Wigglytuff stared at the pink and blue goddess... she wanted to use him as a toy...

But it was better than being killed in these dire circumstances, he thought, shrunk to a microscopic height, by the hand of a fairy...

Celebi's mom closed her eyes, in an attempt to decide what to do with the pink rabbit... she wanted to kill him for all his crimes... but then, what would she teach to her daughter? Killing solves problems? She usually tried to teach Celebi the opposite thing.

But then, as friendly as this expectant legendary was, she was a total unknown pokemon. Why should she just give Wigglytuff to her...?

Celebi's mom opened her eyes.

"It's..." she sighed.
"... Not up to me."

Wigglytuff stared at her.

What...? She was trying to kill him and now it wasn't up to her?!

"Confusion~ Anger again~"

"Azurill..." the blue mouse looked at the pokemon hugging him questioningly.
"You deserve to pick his fate... because of him, you're legally dead, and you were about to be dead for real always because of him... so, you more than anyone, even more than Zorua, deserve to pick a proper fate." she said firmly.

Azurill looked at his former legal guardian. Celebi's mom was letting him decide which fate Wigglytuff was going to face... but then again, the rabbit saved him from that Draco Meteor, no? He could be merciful with the rabbit...

... Who attempted to use him as a hostage when Celebi's mom stopped him.

"Azurill..." Wigglytuff meekly tried, still hovering in midair. It wouldn't be long before he passed out from the lack of air.
"Remember... all the great times we had together..."

The mind of the young mouse flashed with memories. They came in couples, good memory, bad memory.

Wigglytuff buying him ice cream... him trying to kill him in the library.

Wigglytuff complimenting him on a trick... him trying to choke him.

Wigglytuff hugging him... him destroying his new house and almost killing all the pokemon he loved the most.

Azurill thought long and hard, but in the end gave his response.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Fateful night

choices: Wigglytuff remains hidden until Zorua is gone and flees...
Zorua manages to find Wigglytuff...
Wigglytuff falls in a hole and into Zorua's cave...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"I... I don't know... Wigglytuff is a jerk... but he has a family..." Azurill said glumly as he looked at the pink dot in levitating in midair.

"... Azurill, dear, either he goes with Mesprit or I..." Celebi's mom stopped to glare at the startled Wigglytuff, before resuming.
"We can't let him go, sweetheart... I know, he has a family, but we'll take care of them..." the pink fairy said.

Azurill nodded.

"Still... I don't know..." he said.

"Oh, please, lemme have him~ please please please~" Mesprit pleaded.

Azurill didn't respond.

As for Wigglytuff, he stared at the three giants in front of him, discussing his fate like it was no big deal.

They couldn't. They couldn't simply treat him like a toy, they couldn't kill him like nothing was, they couldn't let a brat decide his fate!

He wasn't going to have any of that. The grip of the pink Celebi had weakened enough for him to breathe... and move slightly.

Quietly, he started wagging his finger, much like he had earlier. Azurill suddenly looked at him... his eyes locked on the wagging finger.

Wigglytuff smirked at him. Azurill looked alerted.

"Ma'am-" the blue mouse couldn't finish.

A bright light was released from the pink speck as Metronome picked Flash.

Blinded, Celebi's mom, Azurill and Mesprit covered their eyes. The pink Celebi released her psychic grip on the pink rabbit, who landed on the ground... his rubbery body broke his fall as he hastily got up and started running.

Anything was better than facing these crazy pokemon.

Celebi's mom opened her eyes and snarled, while Mesprit giggled.
"Oh~ Fun~" she chimed, savoring the adrenaline coming from the running rabbit.
"I'M GOING TO EXTERMINATE HIM LIKE THE BUG HE IS!" the elder Celebi shouted.

"... Mom...?"

She turned to see Celebi, Zorua and Meloetta walking close to the trio, looking extremely dazed.

Zorua looked at Azurill.
"Kid... what's going on...?" he asked, his mind trying to process the past hour. He looked at Mesprit.
"... Who's that?"

"Mesprit~"

"Wigglytuff escaped!" Azurill blurted out. Zorua's eyes widened as he looked around.
"Bug...!" he exclaimed, immediately darting away, chasing the pink dot.

The group behind him looked at him running in the night for a moment, before they all snarled - giggled in Mesprit's case - as they followed the dark type fox. Azurill was quickly handed to Meloetta as she flew up, hugged the mouse to her chest and started chasing the one pokemon that destroyed her house and almost killed her beloved Azurill... she was going to make Wigglytuff pay...

"My house! Azurill!" she said, seething.
"My daughter!" Celebi's mom added.
"Get him Zorua!" Celebi screamed, and Zorua sped up.
"This is so fun~ your emotions are so..." Mesprit moaned, savoring the rage emanating from the crowd as she too followed Zorua.

As for Wigglytuff, he kept running through a forest made of blades of grass. He had to reach the actual forest... maybe this size worked to his advantage after all, the angry giants couldn't find him easily. In the forest, he'd have plenty of places to hide, and then he would have to just reach the village, get someone's help...

He glanced back - Zorua was on his tracks... he forgot he could see in darkness too!

"Damn it!" Wigglytuff cried, speeding up while cursing his overgrown stomach... maybe he should have eaten more carrots for real...

Why was he thinking about that now?! He needed to get away!

Zorua chased after the pink dot - he was sure he saw the grass moving as the extremely tiny bunny passed.

At some point, Zorua leaped in the air and landed... finding he missed his target. And the grass had stopped shaking. The dark type fox sighed - where that pink rabbit was...?

While searching for Wigglytuff, Zorua casually glanced to the side... and saw Espurr's mansion. The lights inside were on... Espurr was a mind reader...

He grinned.
"Ya hear me, Wigglytuff? You're doomed!" he shouted at top of his lungs as he quickly shifted his location from the grass to Espurr's front door.

Behind him, the other pokemon finally managed to catch up. Many of them wondered what Zorua was up to, but Celebi smiled - it was a good plan!

Zorua knocked at the door impatiently, waiting.

"Coming..." the voice of his probably best friend rang, deadpan as always.

The door opened, revealing a small psychic type. Espurr.

She looked at Zorua, then at the group behind him.

And, reading the mind of the dark type, she gently stepped outside, closing the door.

"Thanks Espurr."

--

"... He wants to get to the village... get help from someone..." Espurr revealed, picking up on Wigglytuff's thoughts.

"... That doesn't help dear, where is he?" Celebi's mom asked.

Espurr focused. Then, she turned to Zorua.

"Your forest..."

Before Espurr was done speaking, Zorua darted off in direction of his forest, grinning.

"Find him Zorua!" his girlfriend encouraged from behind.

The fox snickered, needing no further encouragement - Wigglytuff was doomed, he knew each and every inch of that forest. One quick noise, and it was going to be the end for extremely tiny rabbit.

At the same time, the pink tiny rabbit finally reached his destination.

Zorua's forest.

He was sweating, panting... but he was close to getting help.

The tiny bunny hid in a bush to rest.

Now the giants he left behind had no chance of finding him...

"Ya hear me bug? You've dug your grave! I'm going to find you!" Zorua's voice rang, followed by a devilish snicker.

Wigglytuff gritted his teeth as he felt the ground beneath him quake as Zorua moved to find him. He had no chance of finding the little bunny. There were to many places to check.

But little did Wigglytuff know that Zorua knew his forest like his fur...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Escaping fate

choices: "End of the line Wigglytuff."
"Fine...you're going to be my pet for the rest of your life."
"The others will decide with me what your fate is."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Wigglytuff closed his eyes as the tremors and quakes of Zorua's footsteps surrounded him. A terrible beast...that's what he was. Wigglytuff felt his heart pound and he gulped as he huddled down to the bush.

But that meant he was beneath notice right? Safe from his gaze...he had to be. He was breathing erratically, he knew that.

Zorua for his part was having a tough time locating the speck of a pokemon, but he wasn't about to let the little piece of scum escape. He had done far too much to earn the ire of him and his friends and they were counting on him to find Wigglytuff.

Though Zorua said nothing of bringing him back to them. He grinned, Wigglytuff was his prey...this was his forest. And Wigglytuff would pay dearly for thinking it would give him sanctuary against its master.

Zorua made all the bushes in the vicinity start dancing as an illusion, something simple to rile the bunny up and...

"AAH!" It was a small, tiny squeak to Zorua, barely discernible with the wind if he hadn't been listening for it, but he looked towards one of the dancing bushes with malice as he ceased the illusion.

Wigglytuff felt the tremors grow stronger and stronger until they were close. He whimpered, he couldn't believe he had screamed like that, he couldn't help it.

The voice spoke, dangerously close, a whisper to Zorua and a threat to him.

"Come out now or i'll destroy the bush with you in it speck." The voice intoned and slowly he came out. He saw the legs, rising higher and higher into the air of this great titan. This...this...impossibility. He whimpered and looked down.

"I'm sorry..." He said and Zorua rolled his eyes as he lowered his face as much as possible to Wigglytuff, who had to fight the urge to flee.

"You're not. But you will be." He said. Zorua took one of his paws, and with a claw, casually dug a small circle in the ground around the speck.

Wiggletuff fell to the ground from all the movement and a cacophony of sound as the giant beast dug the ground around him, trapping him on a bit of ground, his island that was cut off by a deep abyss he couldn't traverse on his own.

"I made that with my one little claw Wigglytuff...bet you can't get over it. That's how pathetic you are...you want to try and go get help? You don't get it. There's only one pokemon that can ever make you normal again and she never would. Never again. You had that chance briefly when Celebi's mom found you but like the idiot you are you squandered it...I can barely hear you...me, with my amazing hearing, and I need to TRY to hear you. Azurill is puny too but i'd imagine even he struggles to hear you now...if I blew on you, just a bit you'd go flying to parts unknown. If I screamed at the top of my lungs I wonder...would you even survive? I bet your ear drums wouldn't..." Zorua chuckled, a deep rumble to Wigglytuff as each word crushed his hopes.

"P-please...Zorua...don't k-kill me..." He begged and Zorua raised an eyebrow.

"I should you know...it would be so easy...and we both know that we hate each other." Zorua said.

"B-but Azurill wanted me to live right...h-he's your f-friend right?" Wigglytuff tried.

"Yeah, he is...and you tried to kill him. I'd also like to let you in on something." Zorua leaned in.

"I was shrunk by Celebi for a prank...she almost killed me from it...imagine how different things would be if she had for you? Oh, just what could've been...Azurill...loathe that I am to admit now, I almost snacked on when we first shrunk him, Celebi stopped me...but out here...well neither of them are here, are they? It's you and me, no one to stop me from punishing you..." Zorua intoned

"You attacked me, my girlfriend, and her mom, and a friend. You destroyed said friend's house...and that was in the last hour or so."

"PLEASE! I'LL DO ANYTHING! JUST DON'T KILL ME!" Wigglytuff was crying now and pleading for his life.

"You have no dignity...seriously bug..."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Found

choices: "Zorua, let her have Wigglytuff," Celebi's mom made one last attempt
"Why don't you join us too lady?" Celebi's mom asked Mesprit
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"... What a cowardly bug... you don't deserve life..." Zorua snickered, and Wigglytuff gulped as he tried to back up... but he ended on the edge of the minuscule circle in the ground... which was a humongous pillar to him.

Zorua moved his muzzle closer to the pink dot.

"But... ya know, I'm feeling generous... that's why I'm letting you live..." he said with a grin. Wigglytuff felt slightly relieved, but he knew there was something behind Zorua's generosity.

In fact...

"You're living... as my pet! Forever!" he cried.

Wigglytuff's eyes shrunk as the booming words sank into his mind.

But he didn't have much time to think about as Zorua lowered his muzzle, opening his mouth wide.

Wigglytuff's world became dark and hot as the lips of the fox scooped him up and took him inside before sealing the rabbit in complete darkness.

"H-Hey! Let me out!" he screamed, his voice echoing inside the slippery cavern.

Zorua snickered, a deafening sound raining onto Wigglytuff, who dropped onto the slick tongue, holding his ears in pain.
"Shut up bug." Zorua said.

The fox then started walking, each step he took sending vibrations inside Wigglytuff's prison and rocking the tiny rabbit back and forth within the hot confines of the giant mouth.

Big drops of saliva fell from Zorua's palate and onto the scared bunny as he was thrown around like a rag doll, the giant tongue beneath him tasting him and menacing to throw Wigglytuff on one of the razor sharp fangs that were bigger than him.

One wrong throw forward, and Wigglytuff would end up impaled; backwards, and he would end up falling down to his fate, melting slowly inside of a death chamber that was the stomach of the fox.

That must've been what hell is like, Wigglytuff sourly thought as he tried desperately to remain in the middle of the mouth as Zorua walked towards an unknown destination.

The fox snickered again as he felt his tiny 'passenger' being thrown around in his mouth. He felt slightly disappointed - Wigglytuff was so tiny that he couldn't taste him. But that was only another reason to keep him as a pet, he thought as he went back to his friends.

The group of pokemon Zorua left behind was waiting for him, everyone was quite anxious... save for the excited Mesprit and the deadpan Espurr.

Finally, they noticed the dark type stepping out from the thick forest and walked towards them, grinning.

Celebi darted forward, wrapping her arms around his neck, causing Wigglytuff to flip onto his face on the giant red tongue and swallow a mouthful of saliva that was not his.

Disgusted, the pink rabbit sat up and stood still as he spat out Zorua's own saliva from his mouth.

He heard voices from outside, muffled but still very audible to him,

"Did you find him?" was Celebi's mom.

Suddenly, Wigglytuff found himself repeatedly hitting the giant's palate and tongue as he purposefully nodded his head.

"... Where is he?" Meloetta asked.
"You haven't killed him, have you?" Azurill chimed.
"Sure hope not... I wanted him~" this was that lunatic emotion-sensing newcomer, Mesprit.

This time, Wigglytuff's world shook sideways as he was carelessly thrown against the fleshy cheeks of the giant he was in, before being ultimately thrown against one of his teeth and hitting his head against it.

"No... he didn't... Wigglytuff is..." Espurr was stopped by a movement of Zorua's paw. She smirked as she quieted down.

The pink rabbit trapped in Zorua's mouth loooked at the sharp tip of the canine, grateful that he didn't hit that...

Right now, he was hopeless. Exhausted, beaten, scared, Wigglytuff could only stand still and hope Zorua released him soon...

His prayers seemed to be answered... in the wrong way. Zorua suddenly tilted his head, and the tiny rabbit found himself sliding towards his throat.

He let out a scream of terror... before cold hair hit him, while his butt hit the hard, cold ground as Zorua unceremoniously spat him out.

With a weak, almost inaudible cry, Wigglytuff slid in the middle of a circle formed by all of his captors, aided by the copious saliva sticking to his body.

He stared at them all, everyone but Mesprit and Zorua was glaring at him. Both exceptions were grinning down at him.

"Great work Zorua." Celebi's mom complimented.

"Thanks ma'am."

"So? What do we do with this bug now?" Meloetta asked while Azurill glowered at his former care-taker from his perch behind her paws.

Mesprit started giggling - she was savoring so many emotions tonight!

"I do recall that he was coming with me... or miss was going to kill him..." she remembered, Wigglytuff shivering at the second suggestion.
"Please, can I have him?" Mesprit asked.

Zorua started snickering.
"Lady... none of those two things is possible... because Wigglytuff here is my pet!" he revealed, before looking at Celebi.
"... Our pet."

Celebi smiled and hugged her boyfriend.

"Zorua... Mesprit really wants him..." Celebi's mom said. Zorua looked at her.
"But ma'am - I caught him! It's fair that I get to decide his fate!" he exclaimed.

Celebi's mom discovered that she couldn't argue with that and slowly nodded her head.

"Aw! That's not fair - hey, you two are so in love, that's so cute~ - but I still want him!" Mesprit whined.

While Mesprit complained, Celebi's mom talked to Meloetta,

"Say, now you and Azurill have no place to stay, right?" she asked, and Meloetta nodded.
"Until I have my house repaired... why?" she asked.

The pink fairy in front of her smiled.
"Because you're free to stay with us in the meantime."

Meloetta gave a smile as she looked down at Azurill.
"Azurill dear, what do you say? Want to go stay with miss, Celebi and Zorua for some time?" she asked gently.

Azurill didn't even blink.
"Yes!" he chimed, excited by the idea of living under the same roof with Meloetta and his new friends.

Meloetta smiled even more as she looked back at the mother of Zorua's girlfriend.
"Deal~"

The elder time traveler smiled.

"Glad to see you happy sweetheart - aw, fine... you keep him..." Mesprit said, her momentary smile fading as she looked at Zorua and Celebi with a dejected expression on her face.

Zorua shrugged.
"Sorry lady..." he said, somewhat glad that the argument was over.

Celebi's mom looked at Mesprit and seemed to ponder something.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Life as a pet

choices: "... You can stay with us."
"... You must go, I'm afraid... but feel free to come back anytime!"
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Celebi's mom smiled.

"Lady?" Mesprit looked at her with a bored look.

Seriously, it was ages since she had found someone with such intense emotions... and that someone couldn't be hers to play with. This sucked.

However, the elder Celebi was... hopeful?

Mesprit perked up.

"Why don't you join us too?" the pink fairy asked.
"It'll be fun... we just need to accommodate Meloetta and Azurill, order something to eat..." she looked at her daughter and Zorua with a suspicious look.
"... Ask these two a few questions..."

"Which I will answer to with glee, ma'am." Zorua remarked, earning a smile from his girlfriend.

"NO! No! No! N-" Wigglytuff's protest was reduced to silence by Zorua's paw, which pushed him belly-down onto the ground.
"Shut up ya."

Mesprit looked at the group, then at the microscopic pink dot on the ground - he was feeling humiliated, scared...

The pink headed pokemon smiled brightly as she looked at Celebi's mom.

"Miss... I'll be happy to follow you." she said, causing the older Celebi to smile as well.

"Great."

Wigglytuff sat up, looking horrified. This lunatic legendary was going to toy with him, alongside Zorua and Celebi! Before he could further protest, the bunny was psychically gripped by Celebi and lifted off the ground.

"Ready to go back in the jar pet?" the green fairy snickered as she psychically shook the still saliva-covered rabbit, causing him to feel quite dizzy.

Zorua snickered.
"And here's the answer to my ‘Why her’ questions." he said, earning a peck from his girlfriend.

The elder Celebi smiled and shook her head, before turning to the quiet Espurr.
"And you, Espurr dear? Do you want to come with us?" she asked.

The small psychic type shook her head.
"I need to stay... dad is coming home tonight." she said.
"Another time, maybe,"

Celebi's mother smiled in approval as Espurr moved to Zorua and hugged him... before glancing at Mesprit, picking up on her thoughts. Sadly, she couldn't interrupt in time,

"Oh~ you too~"

Espurr's cheeks flared up as she broke the hug, hugged Celebi and hurried to her house.
"Bye everyone." she quickly said as she entered the mansion, shutting the door.

Having heard Gardevoir, Espurr and Zorua talking about it, Celebi giggled, already knowing about Espurr's crush on Zorua.

But Celebi's mom looked at Zorua, frowning.
"Zorua...?" she asked.

Zorua blushed.
"... She had... a crush on me I believe, but I... already liked someone else." he replied sincerely, and Celebi hugged him.

Her mom smiled again as she floated forward, leading the way to her house, the group following.

--

"So, you two take the guest room," Celebi's mother said to Meloetta and Azurill, opening a door to reveal a simple room.

Zorua looked at Celebi.
"Hey - where was that when we did the sleepover?" he asked, recalling the first night with Celebi.

The green fairy giggled awkwardly.
"Hehe, they always sleep in my room... they would have suspected something..." she explained, before floating to her room, a quiet Wigglytuff floating behind her.

"Mesprit, you take Celebi's room," the elder fairy continued, pointing the door of her daughter's room, before looking at said daughter, who came out of her room, psychically holding the jar that was Wigglytuff's new home.

"Honey, the couch... Zorua." she said, her gaze traveling to her daughter's boyfriend.

The black fox looked down.
"I must go, right?" he asked dejectedly.

The pink Celebi smiled.
"Not until you've answered me... then, we'll see... you've already been here for quite some time, huh?" she asked, recalling the tiny pokedoll on Celebi's bed.

Zorua meekly nodded.

"These two are so cute~" Mesprit remarked.

"Agreed~" Meloetta chimed while Azurill laughed from her chest.

Then, Mesprit and Meloetta went to the rooms they were assigned to, while Celebi's mom sighed as she looked at the couple in front of her.
"I'm ordering something... we'll talk while we wait for dinner." she said, before floating off too.

Zorua looked at his girlfriend.
"So? What do we do in the meantime?" he asked, hoping Celebi wasn't going to pull out a book.

Celebi smirked, and held the jar containing Wigglytuff up.

Zorua grinned.

Wigglytuff gulped. At this point prison, or death, or Mesprit, would be better alternatives.

--

"Okay you two..."

Celebi, her mother and boyfriend sat at the table, Wigglytuff placed in the middle.

Zorua looked calm, but determined.

He answered good, he kept his house and girlfriend; he answered bad, he was going to be thrown out... but Celebi.

He couldn't lose Celebi.

"So..."

"Yes... Zorua is my boyfriend, mom." Celebi interrupted. Her mother looked at her.
"I think you two made that clear... but dear, you know how I feel about this kind of things... plus, you didn't tell me." she lectured.

"... Would you have approved it? And if not, would you have believed that under his pranks and behavior he's a true sweetheart and friend? He's an example of smart, funny and cute mom." Celebi complimented, and Zorua flushed red.

"Hm..." the pink Celebi mumbled, before signing.
"... Okay. Now... how long have you two been together?"

Zorua shrugged, acting nonchalant, but feeling like his heart was going to explode from the anxiety.
"A week... maybe two..." he replied.

"And have you always been here... tiny and all?"

Zorua nodded meekly.
"Yes... you see ma'am, I haven't actually got somewhere to stay... Celebi did me a favor." he answered, smiling gratefully at his girlfriend.

"You're homeless..." Celebi's mom said, pitiful.

Two points in favor of the couple.

But she had one final question, the most important one

"Okay Zorua... now, regarding Espurr's behavior, I necessarily need to ask... do you like my daughter and my daughter alone?" she asked, looking at Zorua intently, seeking for any hint of agitation in his eyes.

If there was any, the answer was clear.

"Mom!" Celebi's protested, but her mother remained firm.

Zorua blushed, but looked at the elder Celebi firmly.

"Ma'am... Espurr is my friend... my best friend probably, but Celebi and I are on a different level... I like her, nothing could change my feelings for her..."

"I could~"

Zorua made a startled leap and looked to the side to see a smirking Mesprit.

"... Don't do that no more..." he said, his heart beating faster.

Celebi's mom mentally repeated the words of the fox a few times... and smiled.

She looked at her daughter and her boyfriend.

"Okay you two, I've heard enough. Honey..." Celebi and Zorua tensed up.
"... You two may stay together."

A loud cheer echoed in the house. Inside the guest room, Meloetta smiled as she petted Azurill.

Celebi and Zorua locked themselves in a hug.

"Aw~" Mesprit chimed.

The elder fairy smiled too. Inside his jar, Wigglytuff snorted - that scoundrel got a home while he had to be confined in a jar for the rest of his days.

Celebi's mom looked at the fox.

"And, Zorua, about you living here..."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Accomodations and proper introductions

choices: Zorua talks to Azurill
Zorua and Celebi talk to Azurill
Zorua, Celebi and Celebi's mom talk to Azurill
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"It's fine for you to stay here..." She said with a sigh before smiling.

He grinned and Celebi smiled. "Oh thank you mom."

Zorua bowed his head. "Thank you ma'am." He said, putting on a more earnest smile.

"Oh don't thank me yet young man, we need to go over a few things yet." She said and he nodded. Celebi's mom looked around. "Alone." She intoned, making Mesprit leave with a smirk and Meloetta shut the guest room door.

"There will be no funny business. None whatsoever. Do that and you're out. I know how kids your age think. That goes for you as well missy." She said sternly and they both nodded.

"You'll also be helping around the house Zorua. Chores and such." His jaw dropped in horror as both of the Celebi's grinned at him.

"...Okay." He said, with a bit of hesitation. "But what if i'm tiny when you need something done..." He said with hope and the older Celebi gave him a serene smile. "You'll just have to put more effort into it then, won't you dear?" She said and he gulped.

Celebi for her part giggled at this.

"I do have one other thing to discuss with you two." She said as she leaned in. Wigglytuff for his part was trying to ignore these titans and their discussion, but his interest was piqued. "We need to discuss the matter of a certain tiny pokemon in this house...and what he wants." Wigglytuff's hopes soared, but were quickly dashed. "Not talking about you, bug." She looked at the jar with a colossal eye.

She baited him like that on purpose...

"If you have an ounce of decency in your black heart i'd like to extend to it that your daughter will be taken care of to the best of my ability. I'll try to see to it that all of your kids are happy..." Wigglytuff glared, but knew that if he tried something he was dead.

She turned back to Zorua and Celebi.

"All of his kids means Azurill too." She said and Celebi nodded, Zorua looked confused. "What do you mean? Azurill is fine ma'am, he's with Meloetta and seems very happy." The older Celebi folded her arms.

"Zorua...Celebi, you as well. He was kept tiny so you two could keep your relationship secret, right?" She said in a tone of disapproval.

Celebi averted her eyes but Zorua met the older Celebi's gaze head on.

"That's half of it, yes, though the other half has to do with the fact that his own father figure had forsaken him at that point. I've been there ma'am, and I didn't want to leave Azurill out to dry at that point, or send him back to this..." He slammed his paw on the jar, making Wigglytuff quiver. "Piece of-"

"I understand your point Zorua, I do, but all the same you would've kept him cooped up all his life like a pet...same that you're doing to Wigglytuff."

"Azurill's situation is different...at first it was...rocky and I intended him to be a doll to another pokemon but...he ain't a pet, even at that size, i've got his back, right Celi?" He said and she looked at him before nodding and looking back at her mom.

"He's...fine, right mom? If we grow him back then that'll lead to questions, and..."

"And why does that matter? I know about Zorua, Wigglytuff, and Azurill now. Any questions that get asked won't damage you Zorua." He looked down.

"They might take him away though right...put him somewhere else?" He asked and Celebi's mom looked at him.

"It's about what's best for the kids, Zorua, and what's best for him. You need to know-"

"How about we ask him then? What he wants." Celebi said and both the pokemon looked at her.

"No offense mom, but i'm the only one that can...grow him back right? I agree with you that we should consider his side of things...not just ours. But he might be happier as he is now, right?"

There was a knock at the door.

"...We'll talk more about it after dinner."

-

Wigglytuff looked glumly at the giant bit of lettuce in front of him. The other pokemon, the titans were having pizza and they gave him...this. He wanted to cry but forced back the tears.

"You're gonna lose the flab, bug." Zorua said to the jar wickedly, taunting the tiny Wigglytuff with pizza, making his mouth water.

Wigglytuff sat down, defeated as he watched them all have their fun.

"Say Azurill..." Zorua said to the tiny pokemon sitting in Meloetta's lap, giving him a noogie with a paw pad.

"Hey, quit it!" Azurill said and Zorua chuckled.

"After this, we need to talk to you...alone, if that's okay Meloetta?" He looked to the older pokemon who smiled.

"That's fine~"

Zorua nodded...he wasn't looking forward to this.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Staying and conditions

choices: "I-I... I want to stay with Meloetta... with you... like this..." Azurill said
"I... I want to go back to being normal... with the others..." Azurill said
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"Okay kid," Zorua said as he sat on top of Celebi's bed, gently lowering his head so that Azurill could leap onto the bed beside the giant fox; the door of the room had been conveniently locked so that the two could talk in private.

"Why so secretive?" Azurill asked, before starting to laugh.
"Tormenting Wigglytuff with pizza - that was hilarious!"

Zorua struggled to keep a serious expression.
"Kid... quit it, this is se... this is serious..." Zorua gave in and started snickering.
"It was so damn fun!"

Both pokemon laughed for a while, the bed shook beneath Azurill as Zorua laid flat on it, his laughter assaulting his ears. He stood still for a moment, dizzy, before resuming laughing.

Just one of the many, many disadvantages of being tiny, he thought.

"N-No..." Zorua got caught in another fit of laughter, before he started to shake his head.
"N-No, seriously..." he cleared his throat as he looked at the blue mouse, adopting the best serious expression he could make with the thought of a nearly-crying Wigglytuff in his head.

Too bad he didn't have a camera.

"We need to talk kid." he said. Azurill nodded cheerfully and leaped on top of his own tail as he sat on it. Zorua felt the sting of jealousy as he recalled the mouse floating on his own tail in the pool... he shook his head once again. There'd be time for jealousy later, he decided.

"What do you want to talk about, Zorua?" Azurill asked. His ears rang as Zorua sighed - something similar to a plane soaring right above the small mouse.

The giant fox looked at him.
"Y'see..."

--

"Quit... Stop i-"

Wigglytuff's protest was reduced to silence, nausea assaulting him as the jar he was in was psychically flipped upside down by a snickering Mesprit.

Celebi giggled, sitting on the couch beside the pink headed legendary, watching her toying with Wigglytuff; Meloetta had gone into the guest room again while her mother was cleaning the kitchen.

"Why are you worried? And happy - that's a weird mix... which I sure don't mind~" Mesprit broke the silence, causing the fairy to look at her.

Celebi sighed.
"It's about Azurill..." she admitted.

"What about that little sweetheart - oh, don't feel relieved just yet you~" she said, and the jar was thrown up in the air at high speed, before descending again while being flipped over and over, causing its tiny occupant to feel extremely dizzy as well as sick.

"I'm going to..." he put a paw to his mouth, keeping himself from throwing up.

"That's right, don't... you're going to clean it up otherwise." Celebi said with disgust while Mesprit laughed, savoring the emotions.

"... Anyway, I was saying, what about Azurill?" the pixie repeated.

"It's about... what he decides to do, if to return to normal or stay like that..." Celebi explained.
"He's quite happy right now - I can tell... oh, he's confused now." Mesprit told, sensing the emotions of the blue mouse.

Celebi clasped her paws together.

Just what were Zorua and Azurill doing in that room?

Mesprit giggled.
"Don't worry about them... they're fine... in the meantime..."

The jar containing Wigglytuff started spinning around, the bunny thrown back and forth within, hitting the glass walls.

Celebi smiled.

--

Mesprit's infallible abilities proved to be worthy of that adjective.

Azurill looked at Zorua in confusion, surprised by the fox's statement.
"What do you mean, ‘Are you truly happy like that’? Of course I am Zorua... sure, there's a couple disadvantages, but in the end I've got you, Celebi, Meloetta... so yes, I am quite happy like this." Azurill told.

Zorua snickered.
"You've got me, huh? Funny... you wouldn't have told that a week ago..." he said, causing Azurill to smile.
"Glad we've given each other a chance." he said, bouncing on top of the fox's head with his spring-like tail.

From his angulation, Azurill couldn't see his expression, but Zorua had returned serious.

"Azurill..." he told.
"Kid, listen here... you still like your friends... the other kids I mean...?"

Azurill looked perplexed.
"I... of course... Igglybuff, Swinub, Magby... I miss them..." he stated with a sudden hint of sadness.

"Hm..." Zorua sighed.
"Listen... you have a choice kid..."

Azurill looked at him, more confused than ever.

"Kid, you can either stay like that, tiny and with Meloetta..." Zorua explained.

"Meloetta..." Azurill murmured as he recalled all the beautiful moments he spent with the green headed pokemon already... and in just a few days!

"Yeah, that... or you can go back to your friends kid, normal-sized..." Zorua continued.

Azurill perked up.

"R-Really? Can I see them again?" he asked, hopeful.

Wigglytuff was technically gone... but still, he and the other kids were a family... he missed them all...

Zorua sighed. This was going to destroy Azurill.

"There's the catch though... If you see your friends, you'd be publicly alive again... and that would mean one thing: orphanage." he bluntly said.

As expected, Azurill looked horrified. Zorua felt him tumbling down his head and onto his nose.

Azurill looked up in the icy eyes of his giant friend - he was giving him a dejected look.

He couldn't believe it - he could lose Meloetta! Not only, he'd lose Zorua, Celebi, Braixen, Buneary, all his new friends!

"Take your time kid... choose carefully." Zorua warned, apparently reasoning on the same line of thinking.

Azurill whimpered.

His beloved family... or his beloved new friends?
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Friends or family?

choices: They rejoin the others
They talk for a bit longer
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Azurill looked into the giant eyes of his friend and looked away before hopping off back onto the bed.

"Normal sized again huh? It sounds too good to be true..." He started and Zorua kept looking dejected before Azurill met his gaze head on, the little mouse looked...conflicted.

"Can you keep a secret?" He asked and Zorua's look became confused.

"Depends. Is it juicy?" He asked, making a light joke before Azurill looked down.

"Meloetta...reminds me of my mom. I was thinking of calling her mom." Zorua lowered his head to try and meet Azurill's gaze.

"You and her really hit it off huh?" He said gently and Azurill nodded.

"...This isn't an easy choice, I know. Normal size, your friends again..."

"Zorua, I want to be an author!" Azurill looked determined and Zorua looked puzzled, what did that have to do with anything?

"Um...okay kid? So to do that you'd need to be normal sized..." Azurill shook his head.

"With the power of technology I don't! I can write on a computer with a keyboard! And-and use e-mail and a pen name to keep my secret!" He nodded. Zorua didn't know if it was the naivety that came with being a kid or him trying to genuinely think things through.

"I do miss them you know...Magby...Igglybuff...Swinub was my best friend...we bonded over our mutual hate of you." Azurill said sadly.

"Aw, that's sweet." Zorua said in a sardonic tone and Azurill nodded, smiling a bit.

"An orphanage huh..."

"It isn't ideal, but don't worry...Celebi's mom will see every step of the process through. She's...a very caring pokemon from what I can tell."

"Zorua...I know he might deserve it...but thanks for not killing Wigglytuff..." He said solemnly and Zorua moved his head away a bit.

"I need a victim to torment for my leisure, he'll do juuuust fine for that...but yeah, he'll live. You were his for a few years right?"

"I know he's a scumbag...horrid pokemon, bad dad but...I can't help but care about his well being...just a little." Zorua smiled. He wondered if he cared about his dad? He was sure if he were in Azurill's situation and Zoroark in Wigglytuff's he'd crush the bastard.

"I want to stay with Meloetta. I want to see Braixen and Buneary more. I want to hang out with you and Celebi and introduce her to the wonders of eldritch horror." Azurill said seriously and Zorua laughed.

"You'll be puny y'know. Not able to do much on your own." Zorua grinned and Azurill looked back.

"It has it's disadvantages. I'm easy to hurt, i'm not strong, you're all very loud, but don't underestimate me. I can get by just fine with a bit of help." Azurill nodded to himself. He seemed self assured...this was not something he expected to see from the tiny pokemon.

"I don't...want to leave this. This is maybe the happiest i've been since..." Azurill started sniffling before he swallowed a lump in his throat and shook his head.

"...I won't tell Meloetta how you feel. My friend Espurr, that's a different story."

"She was creepy..." Azurill said and Zorua grinned.

"She means well, you'll get used to her in time. You live right next to her." Azurill nodded.

"If you say so...I want to make sure though...my friends, they'll be taken care of? Igglybuff...she's going to be inconsolable for a while. That's because of-"

"Wigglytuff did it to himself...but it doesn't change what she'll go through, I know. Celebi and her mom will help her, I promise."

"Zorua...thanks for all of this..."

"Thanks for suggesting shrinking you, threatening you, taunting you, destroying your doll? Yeah no prob." Zorua grinned.

Azurill laughed. "You know what I meant."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Staying tiny

choices: "Hmm... should have an extra pillow..." Celebi said - Zorua remains his size
"We wouldn't fit together on this couch... unless~" Celebi said, shrinking Zorua
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"Come on, kid, let's go back to the others... don't want to let Mesprit knock Wigglytuff out before I get to have fun too!" Zorua snickered at some point.

Azurill nodded cheerfully as his giant friend jumped off the bed, emulated by the blue mouse, who landed on his tail beside the fox.

"Damn your tail kid..." Zorua remarked, eliciting a laugh from the tiny fairy type as both moved towards the door. Zorua unlocked and opened it as the two made their way back into Celebi's living room.

--

"Now he's angry~"

Wigglytuff started flailing in midair, shouting horrible words to the five pokemon in front of him. Zorua snickered, while Meloetta covered Azurill's ears with her paws.

The once large rabbit was out of his jar and floating in front of the five, his emotions being manipulated by Mesprit much to everyone's amusement.

Someone would pity the situation the pink bunny was in... but regarding what he had done in the past, he deserved every last bit of it.

"Now he's sad~"

Wigglytuff's limbs went limp as he suddenly started crying unwillingly, his emotions modified by Mesprit. He couldn't fight it, he had to resign himself to being a toy for the pink headed giantess and her newly made friends.

"Please... I just want to go home..." he cried while looking at Celebi, who smirked.

It was certainly entertaining to see the pokemon that had called her and her boyfriend pathetic crying.

"Now he's nothing!"

Instantly, Wigglytuff wore a calm look, feeling empty. He couldn't feel any emotions at all, he discovered...

"That's so cool!" Zorua snickered.

Mesprit giggled.

"Seriously, I still can't believe he was my actual father for years... he threw me away like an old toy..." Azurill said, glaring daggers at the pink bunny, who didn't react, not caring about the situation he was in anymore.

"Don't worry dear... now the only harm he can do is to himself whenever he tries to escape the jar." Meloetta said, glaring at the pink dot too... although he was slightly bigger than he had been.

Celebi had grown him just a little bit to allow herself and the others to at least see him properly... plus, she explained to a complaining Zorua, Wigglytuff was way more durable while not in a microscopic size.

"Yeah... but now we gotta take care of his kids..." the green fairy chimed, pondering how they were going to take care of at least four kids... Magby, Swinub, Igglybuff, Pichu...

"Yeah... his daughter isn't going to be pleased when we tell her that daddy dearest won't return home..." Zorua mused.

"Please... I'm sorry for everything I did... but leave my daughter alone..." Wigglytuff meekly said, suddenly feeling sorrowful.

"Hey, you say that Igglybuff would be destroyed by the news, huh? I could help her get over with the loss of daddy..." Mesprit offered, letting go of Wigglytuff's emotions to savor the repressed storm of emotions.

At once, the minuscule rabbit gritted his teeth - this lunatic wanted to what?!

"Stay away from my daughter you creeps! Especially you!" he snarled angrily, eyeing Mesprit, who looked amused - again, that wonderful wave of rage she couldn't get enough of...
"You kidnapped me! If I ever find a way to grow myself back you're all dead!"

The second those words left his mouth, he felt a second, stronger psychic force gripping him.
"Now, is that anyway to talk you bug?"

Wigglytuff was slammed into the hard floor and whimpered in pain.

Celebi's mom emerged from the kitchen, looking exhausted.

"... Zorua, your pet will have to learn to behave." she said, half serious, half playful, causing the fox to snicker along with the others.

Celebi's mom yawned.
"I'm going to bed now... tomorrow I've got a day off from work, we'll see how to accommodate the other kids as well..." she mumbled drowsily.
"Good night you all..."

With that, Celebi's mother hovered inside of her room, closing the door.

Soon enough, the group heard the sound of the pink fairy literally collapsing on her bed.

"Must've been tired..." Zorua mumbled, before Azurill yawned too. Meloetta smiled, gently picking him from her lap.
"We're off to bed too..." she gently said. The blue mouse in her circular paws nodded as the giantess floated inside the guest room, shutting the door.

Only Zorua, Celebi and Mesprit were left on the couch, a whimpering Wigglytuff laying face down on the floor.

Mesprit leaned back and smiled while looking at the couple.
"You know... quite glad I came here... you all feel such strong emotions~" she chimed, before starting to stretch.
"And things are quite fun here... I don't know, I might consider sticking around for a bit..." she said, giggling as she felt Wigglytuff's horror.

Celebi and Zorua smiled.
"We'd like that." the fox said.
"You're fun to be around." the fairy added.

Mesprit smiled, before getting up.

"We'll see... good night, lovebirds~" she said cheerfully as she floated into Celebi's bedroom, leaving the couple onto the couch, blushing.

"Ngh... finally that creep is gone... don't let her stick around..." Wigglytuff murmured as he stood up, feeling sore.

Zorua grinned at him while Celebi picked him with psychic.
"Don't think you understood... you can't make any choice Wigglytuff. You lost that right when you tried to murder Azurill." he explained.

Wigglytuff huffed.
"Why? Didn't you all try to kill me at some point? Plus, Zorua, I saved Azurill!" he retorted.

"Yeah, after destroying his new house, knocking out his new mo-" Zorua abruptly stopped to prevent the world ‘mom’ from escaping... he promised to keep it a secret.

"... Monolithic friends... and attempting on his life... plus, you tried to get away like the coward you are." he finished.
"And the only thing Zorua could be blamed for were his pranks... he never attempted to kill someone like you bug." Celebi chimed.

"Yeah whatever... Tell that to that hole in the ground you led me into... I could've died asphyxiated down there..." Wigglytuff retorted. Celebi discovered that she couldn't argue with that.

The tiny bunny was floated back into his jar, the top sealing its only opening as Wigglytuff laid on the glass floor of his prison.

Celebi yawned.

"Bedtime for us too Zorua..." she said, getting up and floating to her room, knocking at the door and entering, returning with a pillow and a blanket, the door of her room closing again but its current occupant.

"Can't believe your mom gave Mesprit our room... how do we sleep on the couch?" Zorua mused.

Celebi merely grinned as she put down the items she was holding, before looking at her boyfriend and crafting a ball of cyan energy in between her paws.

"Ready?" she asked.

However, Zorua seemed to be thinking.

"Celi... how about I stay big for tonight?"

Celebi tilted her head in confusion.

"Yeah... your mom knows about us, approves us... why don't we try... cuddling... with me normal-sized?" he suggested.

Celebi blushed, but smiled.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: How to spend the night?

choices: "I'm going to head out to deal with Wigglytuff's kids."
"We're going to head out to deal with Wigglytuff's kids."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"I'll go grab an extra pillow...couch might be cramped." She said and Zorua smiled.

"Should be fine." He grinned and Celebi shook her head, blushing.

"We'll...i'll go get the pillow." She seemed flustered and Zorua laughed, this was working out great.

His gaze traveled to Wigglytuff in the jar and he grinned.

"How must it feel to lose everything like that I wonder? Azurill has even replaced you in his head with someone else..." Wigglytuff knew what Zorua was talking about. Azurill even told him when he talked with him at his size that one last time. Wigglytuff seemed to sulk against his jar.

He wasn't going to respond to Zorua.

"Hmm. Don't worry, you still have me after all Wigglytuff, and all the fun games i'll play with my new pet. Look forward to it." He said as Celebi came back with the pillow.

"Our new pet." She corrected and he smiled. "Shouldn't have tried to kill us Wigglytuff, you might've gotten off lighter." She handed Zorua the pillow before opening his jar and dropping a hankie in.

"Really? That's too nice." Zorua said and she shrugged before they got on the couch together, watching Wigglytuff wrap himself up in the hankie and turn away from them.

"That Mesprit chick is weird..." Zorua muttered as Celebi giggled.

"She seems nice...besides, I doubt she'll be here for that long, it might help to have her around for the kids to transition at least...make it smoother."

Zorua grunted.

"Real world has real pain, they shouldn't be that sheltered from it."

"Oh? Wonderful insight Zorua...but i'm afraid that we don't need more questions than necessary leading to Wigglytuff and Azurill...and you."

"I'm a little shocked the kid decided to stay with us..."

"...I am too. But it'll be good right? At least for a while...Meloetta will take care of him, we'll have each other..."

"And we have our new pet." Zorua grinned. "Sleep tight bug~"

They didn't see Wigglytuff's tears as he looked out the jar at the world beyond him now. Too big and treacherous for him to navigate ever again.

-

"Kids, morning." Zorua groaned from his sleep as the voice of Celebi's mom greeted him, he felt another being close to him stir as well as she sat up, forcing him to move up as well.

"Wow, it's easier to get you up when you're normal sized." Celebi remarked and he blearily looked at her before yawning. Celebi rolled her eyes at this.

"What's up mom?" Celebi turned her attention to her mom who smiled. "Wash up, i'm making breakfast, then..."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Normal sized on the couch

choices: The group goes out to investigate on Wigglytuff's partner
They decide to interrogate Wigglytuff first
Celebi's mom returns
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"... I'm going to head out to deal with those poor kids this bug..." Celebi's mom glared at the jar.
"... Took care of. Or at least, pretended to." she said.

Wigglytuff cringed in his sleep, like the mere presence of the pink fairy bothered his slumber.

The sight made Zorua snicker.

Beside him, Celebi stretched, while her mom left the living room and went into the kitchen, leaving the couple alone for a moment.

Celebi looked at her boyfriend, finding that he laid back down and closed his eyes again. The fairy sighed before smiling and wrapping her arms around him.
"Mornin’..." she chimed while he opened his eyes.

"... You're not letting me go back to sleep, are ya? I slept on the ground back in the forest, but I slept in." he said, causing Celebi to smirk.
"Wanna go back?" she asked, causing Zorua to look at her. If she was anyone else, he would have laughed in her face.

"No thank you! I'm fine here sweetheart." he hastily replied. Celebi giggled and pecked his cheek, before getting up from the couch.

"Come on Zorua, let's go eat." she said. The dark-type nodded as he jumped off the couch that had been his and Celebi's bed for the night and followed her.

--

"Okay you two, I'm heading out... and remember," Celebi's mom looked at the two.
"No funny business." she repeated once more. She had to make sure Zorua - and Celebi, who, she learned, was quite mischievous - had that rule in their minds all the time.

"Mom!" Celebi shouted with a blush spread across her face - when was her mom going to understand she wasn't a little kid anymore?

"Again ma'am... wouldn't dream of it." Zorua chimed, blushing as well.

The pink Celebi nodded, before smiling and fluttering to the front door.

Celebi and Zorua watched her getting out of the house, before her form disappeared behind the closed door.

Celebi sighed dejectedly.
"Hope she can find a way to help those kids..." she whispered. Zorua looked at her sympathetically.
"Of course Celi... I mean, come on, your mom will deal with them just fine." he said encouragingly as he sat down at the kitchen table.

Several plates of meat and eggs were waiting on the table, along with several glasses of juice.

Zorua questioned about it.

"We have guests Zorua..." she simply responded.
"Speaking of, go wake them up, mom doesn't like when food goes to waste..." she added.

"There's no need to~"

"Ah!" Zorua leaped on his chair as a certain pink-headed pokemon appeared in between him and Celebi.

"Mornin’!" Mesprit chimed cheerfully.

"Stop!" Zorua cried, causing Celebi to giggle.
"Stop doin’ that!"

Mesprit snickered - she loved toying with Zorua as much as she loved toying with Wigglytuff.

"She's right anyway," another voice said as Meloetta appeared in the kitchen, holding a drowsy Azurill.
"Morning everyone~"

"Mornin’..." Azurill said, before opening his mouth and letting out an exaggerated yawn to empathize that he didn't approve his lack of sleep.

The group sat at the table and started eating.

"Zorua, feed Wigglytuff." Celebi said at some point, her boyfriend raising his head, cheeks stuffed and mouth full of meat.

"Mh-hmm..." he replied, sounding much like a Grumpig.

"Manners Zorua... don't speak with your mouth full..." Celebi sighed.

Zorua shrugged, and gulped loudly before looking at his girlfriend.
"He's probably still asleep... let him, because later I'm going to..." Zorua stopped upon noticing the look on Celebi's face.
"... Fine." he said, using a claw to cut a small slice of meat and leaped off his chair, balancing on three legs to carry it to the living room where Wigglytuff's jar was.

The fox stood on his hind legs as he leaned against the coffee table, using his free paw to shake the jar.
"Breakfast bug!" he snickered as Wigglytuff's world was rocked back and forth by his paw.

The large but minuscule rabbit was rudely awoken as his head hit the glass of the jar.

"Argh! Igglybuff quit it!" he exclaimed, evidently still half asleep.
"If you weren't such a monster, I would daddy!" Zorua cried, emulating Igglybuff's voice the best he could.

The pink rabbit finally seemed to fully regain his consciousness as she glared at Zorua.

"The hell do you want?!" he cried in annoyance, his voice echoing around his glass prison. In response, Zorua held the meat in front of the jar.

Wigglytuff just seemed to realize how empty his stomach was. He ran up to the glass wall and pushed himself into it, maybe hoping to somehow go through the glass. Which, of course, was impossible.

Even the scariest legendary would be powerless in such pitiful size.

Zorua snickered.
"Eat up bug." he said, opening the jar and unceremoniously dropping the meat inside.

The dark-type looked as Wigglytuff started eating his meat, mentally repeating why the rabbit deserved this all...

His eyes widened as he recalled something.

"Wait a minute..."

--
"You took your time Zorua..."

"Why so worried?"

In an instant, the attention of the four pokemon sitting at the table was focused on him.

Zorua sighed as he sat down.

"What's up Zorua?" Celebi asked.

"You do look gloomy~" Meloetta chimed cheerfully. Only Azurill remained quiet, but he was wearing a concerned look.

"... I was just thinking." Zorua explained.

"About?" Azurill finally spoke.

"Oh, naïve curiosity~ that can be lethal you know~" Mesprit chimed, earning a frightened expression from Azurill - seriously, as nice at this lady was, there was no denying that she was lunatic... or at least obsessed with emotions.

Zorua sighed.

"Go ahead Zorua." Celebi told, placing a piece of meat in her mouth.

"... I remembered it now." Zorua said.
"When I discovered that Wigglytuff faked Azurill's death... well, he was actually talking to someone about it... apparently, that someone was the one putting Azurill's fake body in the forest... Wigglytuff had a partner, and they're still out there..." he explained.

At once, Celebi let go of her fork, Meloetta gasped and Azurill trembled. Mesprit looked amused.

"Wha...?" Celebi asked incredulously. Zorua nodded.

"A-Are you sure Zorua?" Meloetta asked.

"Yes... and if whoever it is discovers that Wigglytuff is here, we might find a murderous pokemon out of the door someday..." the fox mused, comprehensibly scared by the thought.

Azurill shivered.

"I can't believe it..." Celebi said, grabbing her head in her paws in an exasperated manner. Azurill had ‘died’ days ago, they had dealt with Wigglytuff and now it came out that he had a partner? Damn...

"Well... why don't we go find this... partner?" Mesprit calmly chimed, looking at Celebi.
"Your mom is out and there's nothing better to do... until she returns, in which point auntie Mesprit will have to deal with a few sad kids~" she giggled.

"... You're right. Whoever it is, they don't know about Wigglytuff, but they might find out soon... unless we find them first." the experienced Meloetta mused.

"Can I come too?" Azurill timidly asked, earning a weird look from Meloetta.
"... Normal-sized?"

Celebi sighed.
"Let him Meloetta... now, where could this partner be right now?" she wondered, looking at Zorua.

The fox raised an eyebrow.
"Celi, the fake Azurill was found in my forest... we could find something they left behind there... or we could find them straightaway. Trust me, I know every single blade of grass of that forest, I'm going to notice if something is wrong." he stated.

"I dunno," those weren't words that Celebi spoke often.
"Why don't we interrogate Wigglytuff?"

"... And you expect he's going to talk?" Zorua asked.

Everyone at the table nodded. After all, Wigglytuff was speck-sized and terrified by the giants... but he could try to slip away with Metronome again.

And Celebi surely didn't want her house to be destroyed by a speck... that'd be hard to explain.

"Hm..." Zorua pondered.

"Oh, Uxie would just love to be here right now." Mesprit mused out loud at some point, feeling the curiosity rising around her as everyone looked at her. She giggled.

"Anyway, what do we do?"
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: A mystery

choices: Celebi shrinks Wigglytuff further
Wigglytuff makes his offer for not being a pet anymore
Wigglytuff cracks and gives the info
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
The group of pokemon went to Wigglytuff's jar and, though hard to see, he seemed to be laying down next to the chunk of meat patting his belly.

"Fatty." Zorua remarked as Wigglytuff glared at his 'owner' before noting the entire entourage of pokemon. Meloetta and Celebi glaring, Azurill averting his gaze, Mesprit and Zorua grinning.

Zorua's monolithic paw reached forward for the jar, making Wigglytuff wince in fear. What was he gonna do?

Wigglytuff's entire existence rumbled as the titan's paw touched the top of the jar and scooted it forward to Zorua's face.

"You've got some things to tell us. If you do, i'll give you a day off today from torment...maybe even give you dessert...if not." The entire jar rumbled as he lightly shook it. Making Wigglytuff fly to and fro within the chaos.

"J-just leave me alone, alright!?" Wigglytuff cried as Zorua chuckled.

"I realized something bug...when I found out you faked Azurill's death...I had tailed you to your house you know. You were on the phone with another pokemon, planted the body...who was it and where are they?" Zorua intoned. Wigglytuff looked to all the gods looking at him again and he laughed...he actually laughed in their faces?

"Hmm, was wondering when you'd figure THAT out...i'll bet that your mommy won't find the kids Celebi, when she gets to my house." Wigglytuff said smugly.

The other pokemon had a hard time hearing him, but Zorua and Azurill heard him fine.

"What!? Are my friends in trouble!?" Azurill yelled making Meloetta and Celebi look at him in shock.

"Hmm...an unexpected feeling of vindication from Wigglytuff and a sense of dread from Azurill..." Mesprit said as Celebi sighed.

"Please stop that...but what is going on Zorua?" Celebi asked as the fox glared at the jar with the smug looking Wigglytuff.

"Do you forget your place insect? I could crush you, eat you, it wouldn't take any effort, you're nothing but my-"

"Only source of information to finding those kids. Do it, isn't like this glass jar gives me much of a life. I'll take that information to my grave." Wigglytuff said. He wasn't going to give it up so easily.

Zorua growled.

"Celebi, shrink him more." He said.

"But will you even be able to talk to him if I do?" Celebi asked and Zorua nodded.

Wigglytuff heard this and his eyes widened. Did he want to become even smaller!?

He braced himself, no! If they wanted this information the only way they'd get it is letting him go! To prison if it had to be, it was at least better than this.

But if Wigglytuff tipped his hand too early then they'd know he was intimidated by the threat of being smaller, he'd take it for as long as needed. If he died...then so be it. He'd be free from this hell.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Wigglytuff's gambit

choices: "Zoroark!" Wigglytuff revealed, "What?!" Zorua exclaimed.
"Weavile!" Wigglytuff revealed
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Freed from this hell, only to go to the actual one.

Wigglytuff didn't care. If they wanted the information, they had to let him go.
"Want me to talk, y'all? Grow me back and let me go." he said, glare fixed on his face as he hid the fact the perspective of being shrunken even further was utterly frightening.
"I'll go to prison alright... you'll find my partner and they'll come with me... but it's way better than this... and if you kill me, be sure that all the kids are going to suffer the same fate... my daughter included..." Wigglytuff told confidently.

Although he had to admit, the mental image of his dead daughter Igglybuff destroyed him.

And sadly, the little feeling of dejection and the great internal fear couldn't escape a certain pokemon.

"Oh, someone's afraid..." Mesprit pointed out as she smirked at Wigglytuff, whose heart skipped a beat.

Crap.

"Celi? Our pet here needs some support..." Zorua snickered while the sky above Wigglytuff was covered by the immense green fairy.

Celebi smirked as she placed her head extremely near to the jar, eyes glowing menacingly.

"Last chance Wigglytuff. Are you going to talk? Or are you not? If you do, we are going to take care of your daughter... otherwise..."

Celebi couldn't finish.

The front door opened behind the group, a pink fairy fluttering inside the house.

"... You won't believe this, the kids weren't home. I even bought some sweets for them, you know, trying to sugar-coat it... literally... but they weren't there..." Celebi's mom said as she got inside, telekinetically holding a box and wearing a dejected look upon her face.

Which changed into curiosity as she saw everyone around Wigglytuff's jar.

"... Let me guess, I missed something..." she said, placing the box on the coffee table and joining the others as they encircled the jar, Celebi's face still pressed against Wigglytuff's glass prison.

"... So, Wigglytuff?" Celebi asked.

"If I were you, I'd talk." Meloetta chimed in, knowing her friend.
"I agree - she's serious bug." Zorua continued, knowing that Celebi wasn't going to hesitate to pull the metaphorical trigger and shrink Wigglytuff until his only company could be an atom.

As for Wigglytuff, he was now officially afraid.

The gods above him weren't kidding, he could tell... and this time, he had no chance of escaping... maybe...

In the blink of an eye, the tiny rabbit raised his finger and started wagging it back and forth.

Before Celebi could think of shrink him, before Zorua could shake the jar to stop him, before Celebi's mom and Meloetta could try to hold him still with their psychic powers... Wigglytuff did absolutely nothing. Looking better, they actually saw him flailing weakly.

Turned out that Metronome had picked the most useless move among them all - Splash.

Wigglytuff looked at his finger, disbelieved, before he found himself being pinned down by a strong invisible force coming from Meloetta and Celebi's mom, while Celebi herself was holding a cyan ball in between her paws.

"Nice try." she sarcastically remarked, placing the cyan planet of energy in front of the jar, projecting a sinister shadow across the room as the light went through the glass.

"So? Are we talking now?"

Azurill perked up.

"Wigglytuff... it's for Igglybuff... do you really want her dead?" he asked, hoping to find at least some decency left in him.

Wigglytuff looked conflicted - and utterly terrified, though mostly conflicted - as he pondered what should he do.

He revealed who his partner was, he went straight back to being a pet while his partner went straight to prison... or worse, they joined him in being a pet to these gods.

This was the only leverage he had left... however, if he didn't talk, Celebi was going to shrink him even further.

"So Wigglytuff? Last time I'm asking..." Zorua chimed.

Wigglytuff let out a cry of fear.

"Okay okay, I'll talk!" he shakily shouted, still held down by psychic. A life as a pet was way better than a life as a speck.

"M-My partner is..."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Secret revealed

choices: The next morning
Celebi wakes up overnight, waking Zorua as well
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"You know... today I never got to have you tiny and cute in my hands at all~" Celebi said.
"Plus... we would never fit on this couch together... unless~"

Before Zorua could have a chance respond, the fairy pushed the cyan ball forward. The dark type sighed as the ball penetrated his body, which glowed briefly as he began to shrink down to size.

The world around Zorua grew, and he soon found himself having to crane his neck to look up at his now towering girlfriend.

The shrinking ended, and Zorua discovered that, once again, he couldn't be bigger than a tiny doll to Celebi... though he was way bigger than Wigglytuff.

Celebi smiled.

"I'll never get tired of doing this~" she chimed, bending to pick up her tiny boyfriend, who smirked.
