"And I'll never get tired of you carrying me around, kissing me, buying me stuff..." he retorted as his girlfriend walked up to the light switch and turned off the lights.

"Dressing you up as a doll~" Celebi interrupted the fox's monologue as she laid on the couch, wrapping the blanket around herself and Zorua.

The fox snickered while he was placed on his own bed - Celebi's chest.

"That's three-on-one sweetheart, it's no match." he said, causing Celebi to giggle.

Inside his solitary jar, Wigglytuff watched Zorua, envying him.

That scoundrel was in Celebi's graces while he had to sleep on the cold glass of this stupid jar.

Sure, he had his own fair share of crimes, but he never actually harmed anyone before today... tried to harm, because he was totally overpowered by Meloetta, slammed here and there by Celebi's mom and knocked out by Zorua.

Zorua!

The fox seemed to sense Wigglytuff's nasty thoughts. His ice-blue eyes pierced the darkness of the living room as she shot the jar a mischievous look.

"Someone's jealous Celi~" he snickered.

Celebi too looked at the jar, narrowing her eyes to see Wigglytuff in darkness.

The green fairy started giggling.
"What's up pet? Jealous~?" she asked teasingly.

The tiny bunny didn't respond.

"Perhaps the jar is too hard for him..." Zorua said, before snickering.
"... Or too soft... ya got tacks?"

"Meh... you know, I'm happy tonight, so I shall do something for our tiny pet..." she said.

Wigglytuff's interest was stimulated by the sentence.

He looked through the glass of his jar to see the giant Celebi getting up from the couch, gently setting a complaining Zorua down on it, before moving into darkness, reappearing shortly after in front of the table the jar was on.

Wigglytuff noted the top being removed, something was dropped inside and landed straight on top of Wigglytuff... it was soft, and lightweight...

A piece of cloth of some sort.

"And sleep tight pet." Celebi said, sealing the jar once again.

Wigglytuff wrapped himself up in the cloth as he laid back down.

"Thanks... psycho..." he murmured. Luckily for him, Celebi didn't hear that.

Otherwise, Wigglytuff wouldn't have lived to see another dawn.

The fairy laid back on the couch where Zorua was waiting.

The blanket was once again wrapped around the two as Celebi grabbed the fox and cuddled him to her chest as usual.

"Y'know, that was too nice regarding what he did..." Zorua said, and Celebi giggled.
"A little bit of decency won't hurt, Zorua... If he's gonna be our pet, we need to make sure he lasts as long as he can." Celebi said.

Inside his jar, Wigglytuff shivered - this was an open declaration: they didn't care one bit about his life.

Zorua snickered.
"Maybe you're right... like always." he told.

Celebi rolled on her side, trapping the fox in between her chest, paws and one of the couch cushions.

She smiled at him.

"You know cutie... I'm so happy mom allowed us to stay together~" she sang, and Zorua smiled.

However, Celebi's next sentence made him wear a perplexed expression,

"And I think we're ready... to move on to the next level."

"... Celi, your mother told ‘no funny business’..." he reminded her, and she blushed, but giggled.

"I'm not talking about that... yet~" she chimed.
"No Zorua... I'm talking about this~"

The shrunken dark type wanted to ask what she meant, but he discovered that it was pretty hard to speak with Celebi's mouth glued to his.

His heart skipped several beats and his eyes widened, a blush spreading across his cheeks as Celebi kissed him.

He felt like he was on fire, his body slowly consumed by a wave of heat... a pleasing wave of heat.

The only thing he could think about right now was one and one only: Celebi.

For a moment, his mind flashed with images of their relationship so far: the sleepover at her house, the first day together, shrinking Azurill, learning about Wigglytuff, having him as a pet...

Before this all, he had thought Celebi was nothing more than a boring bookworm... but, he discovered, things were quite fun when he was around her... and he was dating her from just a week!

And finally, Celebi pulled off, blushing, but smiling merrily.

"Wow... never thought I'd give my first kiss to you~" she giggled, before laying down and cuddling Zorua again.

"Good night, cutie~"

Zorua stared at her for a good while... before closing his eyes in shock, praying that sleep would take him away from this embarrassing situation.

His prayers were answered.

Zorua fell asleep.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: The next level of a relationship

choices: "Okay Zorua... I want to know what being tiny is like!" Celebi said excitedly
"Nope... I'll stick to my size, thank you..." Celebi said
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
A door opened inside the quiet house as a pink fairy slowly walked out of her room, looking absolutely tired. She didn't catch much sleep - she had too many things to think about. Azurill tiny, her daughter dating Zorua, Wigglytuff's dark side, Mesprit, Meloetta and Azurill in her house, kids needing to be taken care of...

She yawned, trying to physically force the sleep out of her eyes by rubbing them.

The mother of Zorua's girlfriend quickly made coffee, and sat down at her table with a steaming cup. She desperately needed that today.

She took a long sip, before drowsily glancing around, noticing a jar on the table. Inside, Wigglytuff slept, wrapped up in a piece of cloth.

Celebi's mom huffed.
"I was hoping you were just a nightmare..." she murmured to herself with high disdain in her voice, before her gaze landed on the couch.

There, Celebi slept, buried under the blanket, only the tip of her green head emerging from it.

Her mom looked at her.

If Wigglytuff wasn't a dream, so Zorua too was really there... but he was missing... Speaking of, where did he actually sleep? With Celebi?... That seemed fine to the older time traveler - it didn't count as ‘funny business’ - but just where was he...?

Celebi's mom causally looked at Wigglytuff's jar... she quickly pieced it together and giggled.

Zorua was there on the couch with Celebi... but doll-sized! Looking closer, the pink fairy could actually see a small lump where Celebi's chest was under the covers.

The elder time traveler took another sip from her cup, watching her daughter sleep, cuddling Zorua like he was a common doll.

The two made quite an odd couple... Celebi was sweet, and a bookworm... probably mischievous at times, but not that much; Zorua was rough, a scoundrel that pranked others for his own amusement.

The pink took yet another sip.

The two had told her Zorua changed... and that was why they were together on the couch right now. Celebi's mom took her last sip of coffee.

Her daughter was happy... that was all that mattered. And, if Zorua truly changed, both had her blessings. The only thing a mother really wants is to see their child truly happy.

The pink Celebi smiled as she got up.

"Well... let's wake these two lovebirds up."

Quietly, she moved to the couch.

"Honey wake up~" she started. Celebi didn't move.
"Honey~" the pink fairy started gently shaking the green one, who let out a cry of annoyance as she tried to cling to the remains of whatever dream she was having.

"Honey!"

The blanket was removed from the sleeping Celebi, revealing the green fairy, Zorua cuddled to her chest. Her dark eyelids opened slightly as she drowsily looked at her mom, muttering incomprehensible words of disapproval.

"Good morning honey~ slept well~?" her mom teased, obviously referring to the tiny fox in her paws.

"Moooom..."

"Breakfast will be ready in no time, get up. I need to go out in a short while, I'll deal with Wigglytuff's kids... there ought to be a solution to this situation..." the elder Celebi said, walking away from her daughter, who sighed in annoyance.

Celebi yawned, before distractedly eyeing Zorua.

If she had to suffer the lack of sleep, he had to suffer the lack of sleep.

"Zorua wake up." she said, obviously getting no response from the heavy sleeper that was her boyfriend.

Celebi giggled and moved a paw to his backside, grabbing his tail in two fingers and pulling...

"OW!"

Zorua got back on his legs and stared daggers at Celebi, who snickered.

"Why?!" he cried in annoyance.

Celebi stifled a giggle and gently jabbed his chest with a finger.
"If I don't sleep, you don't sleep." she said playfully.

"Y-You... you monster!"

Celebi smirked, and leaned forward to peck her boyfriend on the forehead.

"What was that?" she asked.

"... You green kiss-abusing fiend..." Zorua offered.

Once again, Celebi leaned forward, touching his face with hers and slowly raising her head, forcing Zorua to do so too. Then, she placed her lips on Zorua's.

Instantly, his cheeks flared up, but Celebi quickly pulled away.

Zorua sighed, but smiled.

"... You blessing."

"Honey... breakfast!" her mom announced from the kitchen.

Celebi smiled and got up.

--

"Hey!... Whaddya want?!" Wigglytuff asked as his jar was kicked by Zorua.

"If I gotta suffer because of her, you gotta suffer because of me!" the fox said, snickering.
"And me~" Celebi added cheerfully.

Wigglytuff growled drowsily, before letting himself fall on his back on the glass floor.

Celebi and Zorua were sitting out of the fairy's house. Her mom left a short while ago.

"Say Zorua... what do we do today?" she asked her boyfriend.

"... Aside from playing with this-" he kicked the jar again, causing it to vibrate and Wigglytuff to snarl.

Celebi giggled as she reached out for the tiny fox. Zorua found himself hugged to her chest.

"Yeah... what could we do today?... D'you want to be big again?" she asked.

Zorua was about to reply, but his words died down when he got an idea.

"CELI!" he shouted, startling the fairy.
"Let's switch roles!"

She looked at him, perplexed.

Zorua snickered.
"For once... why don't you grow me and shrink yourself instead? I can carry you around like you do with me! It'll be fun!" he suggested, tail wagging in excitement.

Celebi looked taken aback.

"... What?" she asked, not sure if to laugh at the suggestion or actually consider it.

"Yes! Celi, there's quite a few advantages being this size... and you never tried it! Why don't you?" Zorua asked.

Celebi pondered an answer... Zorua seemed sincerely excited, and she too wondered how being tiny would be... but she never actually tried shrinking herself - she didn't know what effects that could have...

"Try it..." Zorua insisted.

Celebi looked at the dark type in her paws again and have her answer.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Zorua's small suggestion

choices: Her five friends, wanting to hang out
A bunch of familiar kids, searching for Wigglytuff
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"Mom...?"

That single word echoed in the head of the pink Celebi, who instantly turned around to face her green daughter, who stared at her.

The younger Celebi had a few bruises, but nothing important. Her mother's shield was enough to reduce the force of the Draco Meteor.

Celebi stared at her mom, at the small Azurill in her paws and, behind them, at a choking Wigglytuff floating in midair.

The green fairy seethed.

"... It must be me, mom. Let me." she spat murderously, her mother looking at her in shock.

Her sweet daughter... she hoped she'd never heard those words from her.

"Honey," she started,
"Don't get your paws dirty with blood. I'll finish this-" she glared back at Wigglytuff,
"... Pest off and-"

Celebi's mom interrupted herself when her daughter shouted angrily,

"ZORUA!" she yelled, her paw darting behind her as she pointed to the partly destroyed house where Meloetta resided.
"There's Zorua in there! He's still knocked out, he's bleeding!" despite the murderous glare she was wearing, Celebi felt tears in her eyes, tears of hatred.

Her mother stared at her in silence, remembering what she had learned earlier: Zorua had been, and still was, her daughter's boyfriend.

And, while still wanting to get a couple clarifications, Zorua had fought to save Azurill... she guessed that he had truly changed.

"... He's all yours, honey," she relented; Celebi needed to hear nothing more.

For a moment, the psychic grip on Wigglytuff loosened a bit, before it was replaced by another as his world shifted from pink to green.

"You..." Celebi cried venomously, making the tiny rabbit shiver in fear.

"Destroying a house, almost killing a kid, I don't care anymore! You almost killed Zorua! YOU WON'T GET OUT OF THIS ALIVE!" the fairy screamed, destroying both Wigglytuff's long ears.

He whispered.

"P-Plea-"

Celebi's eyes glowed cyan as she eyed her target. Her mind shouted a forceful command, ‘Shrink!’ and Wigglytuff started shrinking.

He couldn't move, held by psychic, and Celebi became first a planet, then a galaxy, then a goddess, then... nothing more.

Celebi's psychic grip came to an end on its own, its target disappeared.

Wigglytuff was gone.

--

"Aw!"

The legendary Mesprit stopped in mid-air, frowning in disappointment and folding her arms.

She had felt a strong fear, she was delighted by it, but then it simply disappeared.

Whoever was feeling it was no longer alive.

She shrugged as she turned around, starting to fly back from where she came.

At least, she had an excuse to leave, even if for a couple of minutes.

Annoyed, she wondered when it would be the next time she'd finally meet someone with such intense emotions.

--

A few good words and a bandaged head can work miracles.

Two days after Wigglytuff's disappearance, Zorua, laying in bed next to a reading Celebi, knew that.

Not only Celebi's mom allowed him to keep dating her daughter, he also was permitted to keep living with her!... On a certain condition: he had to remain tiny in the house - much to his girlfriend's delight - to avoid him and her getting involved in ‘weird business’ - much to his girlfriend's annoyance.

The fox couldn't be happier right now... if it wasn't for the fact that Wigglytuff's Draco Meteor hit him straight on the head and he didn't have a chance to finish the rabbit off.

After the events that had occurred two days ago, the group decided to not talk about it.

The Meloetta whose house was destroyed gladly took the offer to stay with her friend Celebi - much to Azurill's happiness - while her house was repaired.

Sadly, Wigglytuff's disappearance and the fact that Zorua, Celebi or the other inhabitants of said pokemon's house were supposed to keep it a secret meant one thing: the kids he had left were alone.

Celebi's mom was still trying to find a way to take care of them.

Aside from that single inconvenience, all was fine.

Currently, Meloetta and Azurill were out, while Celebi and her boyfriend rested on their bed, the first reading and the other laying beside her. The mother of the fairy was at work.

"Still can't believe what had been going on these days..." Zorua mused at some point, scratching his head - the bandage was itchy.

"Me neither," Celebi responded, turning the page. She looked at her tiny boyfriend, smiling,
"But at least mom allowed us to stay together... that's something I wasn't expecting... not after-"

"I appeared in your room after Wigglytuff told her that you and me wanted to keep him as a pet?" Zorua finished, his girlfriend nodding.

"Yep. Oh, and Zorua..." the book was suddenly closed as Celebi eyed the fox with a smirk,
"We've got some privacy..."

Instantly, Zorua sprang up, tail wagging as Celebi's lips approached him...

Sadly, the moment was ruined when someone knocked at the front door.

"Damn!" Zorua complained.

Celebi smiled, kissed him anyway and got up.

"Coming!" Zorua heard her saying from the hallway.

Celebi reached door and opened it, finding...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: The rage of a time-traveler

choices: Celebi keeps her cool
Celebi lets Espurr have it
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
At the door was...Braixen, Gardevoir, Buneary, Espurr and...Kirlia?

Celebi had a confused smile but Gardevoir sighed. "She's with me today, and yes...she can keep a secret." Gardevoir had a weary smile and Celebi giggled.

"It's fine, come in!" Celebi said enthusiastically to the group, as the entered and Zorua looked up from the couch to see all his friends...and Gardevoir's sister?

"Oh my...you were right Gard, he's so cute~" Kirlia said, the giant child approaching Zorua.

"Um, hey, yeah nice t-" Zorua was cut off as the paws of Kirlia reached down and picked him up, bringing him to her smiling face, he smiled nervously while Gardevoir just sighed.

"Kirlia, he's not a toy. Don't just grab him like that." She said while Braixen and Buneary laughed at this. Espurr though seemed...to be looking between Zorua and Celebi with some amount of trepidation. Celebi noticed this and noted that she did have a mental block on.

She must've read Zorua's thoughts, Celebi smiled at the scene before her as Zorua was being held by the little girl but she knew that she had an unpleasant discussion before her.

Espurr knew.

"Let me go get us some drinks." Celebi said as she went into the kitchen.

"I'll help." Espurr said with a smile as she followed, leaving the group of girls and tiny Zorua in the living room.

-

"Tea sound good Espurr? I was thinking we could brew it." Celebi said with a smile but Espurr had a worried expression.

"Are you okay Celi?" She asked with concern and Celebi looked at her with a smile.

"Of course I am! Things are great right now." She said as she got out a tea kettle, some teabags, and china to use.

"Celi...I know what you did...Zorua thought it and..."

"Espurr...it's fine, trust me. He had it coming to him, he tried to kill all of us! Even the pokemon he used to call his own!" Celebi said and Espurr looked down into the empty cup she was holding for a second before meeting Celebi's gaze, with a far more timid look than Celebi was used to.

"...How does Azurill feel about it?" She asked and Celebi took a sharp inhale.

"He's fine...he has feelings to work through, but he'd managing, Meloetta is helping him in that regard...and my mom is definitely doing what she can to help the other kids too."

"...And you? Are you okay?" Espurr asked quietly, for a second time.

"Espurr, i'll keep saying it, i'm fine!" Celebi insisted but Espurr didn't relent.

"Celebi, you've done...something that you can't take back. And i'm just worried that-"

"I said i'm fine!" Celebi sounded a bit forceful this time.

"...Okay Celi, i'm just worried about you. About you and Zorua..." Celebi's eye twitched a bit. Her and Zorua...of course, Espurr still had feelings for Zorua. Well Espurr should back off, Celebi had it under control as far as she was concerned. She was fully committed to the actions she had taken with Wigglytuff and didn't regret it one bit. But Espurr had to make one comment, it was innocuous, but Celebi internalized it and didn't know how to take it.

"To shrink...into oblivion...it must be a terrible way to go." Espurr said solemnly.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Friction

choices: Zorua failed to make it and Espurr was shrunk...
Zorua jumped in front of Espurr, letting the ball hit him!
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
After her last remark, Espurr watched as Celebi put an empty tea cup down without looking at her; Espurr couldn't read her friend's thoughts, but she swore she saw the time-traveling fairy trembling.

Then, slowly, Celebi turned her head to look at the small psychic-type. Espurr reared back: the fairy was carrying a definitely hostile gaze.

"Okay, you know what? Zorua is fine, I am fine, everyone is fine without Wigglytuff!" she exclaimed, causing Espurr to shiver. After all, not only Celebi was bigger than her, but she had time-traveling powers, shrinking abilities and could destroy the entire neighborhood - if not the entire village - if she only wanted to.

"His kids aren't..." Espurr timidly pointed out, feeling like something out of her reach was coming at her.

"Mom is taking care of them!" Celebi repeated.

Said green pokemon was breathing heavily, barely containing her rising anger. She hovered in mid-air and fluttered forward in a menacing manner, towering above Espurr,

"... You say that I've done something that I can't take back?" she recalled, the scared psychic-type nodding slowly.

"Well, Espurr, if I ever regret my choice - and I won't - I can, oh I don't know, travel back in time? Have you forgotten that?"

For the third time since her seventh birthday, Espurr was speechless. Celebi was right, but it didn't matter.

That would be considered as an abuse of her power, but Espurr didn't dare to point it out. Celebi was seething, any wrong word might end with the psychic-type suffering the same fate as Wigglytuff.

"Now, are we done talking about what I did? Because I'd like to talk about something now." Celebi continued with a calmer but colder tone.

"If you're talking about Zorua..."

"I noticed the way you look at him whenever you see him!" the fairy stated, before glaring at Espurr.
"He's mine."

This time, Espurr stood her ground,

"And I haven't got the slightest intention of ‘stealing’ him Celi! You're just being jealous and extremely possessive," she exclaimed, before looking at the door, picking up on the thoughts of the pokemon they left behind.

They heard her and Celebi screaming, they were heading to the kitchen.

Espurr didn't care.

"Okay, I did have feelings for him, maybe I still feel that way, but I wouldn't even dream of trying anything Celi! Zorua loves you, I can't do anything about it, can I?" she said.

Just then, the five pokemon that were supposed to be in the other room stepped in the kitchen, Zorua blushing furiously while eyeing Espurr.

"Espurr..."

"Alright, what's going on?" Braixen bravely stepped forward, paws on her hips.

Celebi looked at her,

"You stay out of this." she hissed, Braixen's confidence waning as she instinctively took a step back.

The time-traveler looked back at Espurr,

"You should listen to him, how he talks about his ‘best friend’!" she continued.

"I said that just once or twice!" Zorua chimed in, held by Kirlia, whose cheerful smile was completely gone.

Celebi didn't appear to have heard him.

Gardevoir, who had been staring at her two friends arguing, gently picked Zorua from her sister, before pushing her and Buneary out of the door, locking it. This wasn't a thing kids were supposed to watch.

"This won't end good, will it?" the tiny dark-type mused from the paws of Gardevoir, who nodded with a serious expression on her face.

Espurr didn't know what to think anymore.

"Best friends, Celi, that's what me and Zorua are, but nothing more! Just calm down!" she shouted.

Celebi didn't reply.

Instead, a cyan sphere quickly formed in her paws, and she shot it towards Espurr.

"NO!" Braixen, Gardevoir and Zorua shouted at unison.

For a moment, Zorua saw Espurr shrinking, before realizing that the vision came from his mind;

Espurr was still there, shielded by a Light Screen.

The barrier disappeared, and Espurr's ears rose, her eyes glowed; Celebi was enveloped by psychic and was brought to her knees.

The fairy struggled to get free, but a second psychic force came down on her, forcing her to lay belly-down on the floor.

The attack came from Gardevoir.

"Celi, calm down!" Braixen shouted, stepping in between the immobilized Celebi and Espurr.

Celebi closed her eyes and gritted her teeth.

"Celi, Espurr doesn't-" Zorua wanted to try and make his girlfriend reason, but he was cut off as the time-traveler got free from the psychic grip of her friends using her own psychic, with such strength that it made the three normal-sized pokemon in the room take several steps back; Zorua was sent flying from Gardevoir's paws, but was luckily caught by Braixen before he became paste into a wall.

"Thank ya..." he dizzily muttered, before focusing on his girlfriend and Espurr again.

Snarling, Celebi charged up another cyan ball and shot it at Espurr, who promptly countered by picking the kitchen table with psychic like it was a dollhouse accessory and throwing it against the ball, which shrunk the table until it really was a dollhouse accessory.

The small psychic-type formed a Shadow Ball and shot it at Celebi, who dodged as the attack exploded upon making contact with the floor.

"Okay you two, sto-" Gardevoir tried to step in, but was blown away like a rag doll by the combined force of her friends' psychic attacks, landing on her bottom onto the floor.

"Ow..."

Braixen stepped back again, holding Zorua against her chest, the message clear: ‘Stay out of this!’

The moment Gardevoir was sent back, Celebi picked Espurr up with psychic and threw her into a wall; the psychic-type failed to stop herself and hit the hard surface, falling down.

Celebi fluttered over her, the shrinking cyan sphere ready to do what it had to.

Espurr closed her eyes.

"Celi..." Braixen mumbled, failing to notice Zorua crawling out of her grasp.

The fox did something unexpected - he jumped.

The purple vixen gasped as she saw Zorua falling down, but he luckily landed on all fours, unharmed, and started running towards his girlfriend at full speed.

But it was too late: Celebi had sent the cyan sphere floating down to Espurr.

At this point, only one thing could avoid her being shrunk; only one thing could put an end to this senseless fight.

Zorua only hoped he made it in time.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Battle of psychics

choices: "...Zorua...what have I done..." Celebi was crying
"Good riddance..." Celebi said bitterly
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Zorua hoped that he'd manage to get there in time, but he found as he leapt for the ball, it was going far too fast to intercept. It hit Espurr dead on and sure enough, she shrunk down. The seething green fairy watched as her good friend shrunk to doll size, but Zorua could only watch as it didn't stop there...the cat was shrinking below him, down and down she went until she was the size of an insect.

"Any smart comments now?!" Celebi seethed, a boom to the tiny Espurr as she looked up with fear at the goddess that was Celebi, it was then that another goddess stepped forward, her steps a cacophony of sound to Espurr who was shivering.

"I just wanted to see if you were okay..." Espurr cried as...

*SLAP*

The sound echoed all around the room, as Braixen smacked Celebi across the cheek. She didn't care if the fairy outmatched any of them in terms of power, she didn't care if she was about to become the next victim of Celebi's shrinking, her friend was on a power trip and just abused her power on her other friend.

Espurr shivered as a titanic pokemon blocked her view of everything. Zorua was shielding her right now, he had landed and found her, and wasn't intending for anything else to happen to her.

"Celebi..." Braixen seethed. "Espurr...you shrunk Espurr...your friend for years and years..."

Celebi met her gaze, glaring.

"I did." She said coldly. "The way she looks at Zorua...poking into our bus-"

*SLAP*

This time Gardevoir had stepped forward. Celebi rubbed her cheek growling.

"Do you two want to be next!?" She said and Gardevoir just glared.

"...we're leaving." Braixen said as she went over to where Zorua was...he moved and Espurr looked up at her towering friends, shivering. Braixen and Gardevoir had never seen Espurr so scared. She was crying too. The amount of betrayal she felt from Celebi was immeasurable...she had always had a hard time making friends, and one of her best friends accused her of trying to steal her boyfriend then shrunk her down...she was only worried for them...

"Shh...it's okay, we've got you." Braixen reassured, Espurr could see her thoughts, the pity that the purple fox had for her right now...Espurr covered her eyes as the paws descended, and very gently picked up the bug sized pokemon, cradling her in her paws.

Braixen and Gardevoir fixed Celebi with a glare.

"You can time travel? If I were you, i'd consider what you've done today, reflect on it...then NOT undo it with time travel. We'll be waiting for you to apologize and give Espurr her height back, then we MIGHT forgive you. Until then, bye Zorua...try not to let her rotten attitude get to you." Gardevoir said as she opened the door.

"Kirlia, Buneary, we're leaving...Espurr, don't worry...we'll take care of you until we can fix this." Braixen said gently and soon Zorua and Celebi were left alone.

"Celi..." Zorua mumbled...he was disappointed in Celebi, disappointed in what she'd done to her friends, and somewhat scared of how possessive she was.

It was after five minutes of silence of the two sitting on the kitchen floor that Celebi finally spoke.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: A shrunken cat over a harsh spat

choices: "Please... I'll do anything... I can't lose you too..." Celebi was crying
"Y-You... you can't leave," Celebi said, wearing a solemn look
"Alright, fine! I don't need you either!" Celebi shouted, angry
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"Good riddance..." Celebi murmured bitterly.

Zorua heard her, his eyes widened.

"Trying to steal my precious-"

"She wasn't."

Celebi looked back at her boyfriend, he was staring at her with an indecipherable expression.

"Celi..." he started,
"Espurr wasn't trying to do anything. It was... hasty of you to shrink her and I'm afraid that... you're on the wrong side of this."

Celebi huffed.

"... I did it for you, Zorua, for us! Espurr-"

"I don't know what she was up to, but quite certainly she didn't want to try anything with me." the fox interrupted,
"And I can't believe that after this, all you say is ‘Good riddance’... this is not my Celebi..."

"Don't lecture me. That's the last thing I need right now." Celebi responded. Zorua didn't respond.

Celebi sighed.

"I'm sorry Zorua, it's just I'm... I was angry, I didn't mean to take out my frustration on you..." she apologized, reaching out for the fox.

But he leaped backwards, avoiding his girlfriend's paw.

The fairy looked at him questioningly.

"... You don't have to apologize to me," he said quietly,
"But to Espurr, and the others too... give that poor girl her size back..."

The time-traveler adopted a solemn look.

"To use your own words Zorua, that ain't gonna happen," she bitterly responded feeling her cheeks stinging where Gardevoir and Braixen slapped her.

Another reason to hate her former friends. Her face was probably going to suffer several other slaps when her mom got back and learned what happened, but she didn't care.

Zorua looked at the pokemon in front of him, not recognizing her anymore. He wondered where his Celebi went, the cheerful Celebi she was not even an hour ago.

She probably needed comprehension, but he wasn't the one that could give it to her. Her actions were unjustified.

In a fit of sadness, Zorua made a choice that shattered his heart, and throat was going to shatter Celebi's heart as well.

"Celi..." he started after a while of silence, after having taken a sharp inhale,
"I think... we should take a break..."

While not shattering, Celebi's heart sank completely.

"Wh-What do you mean, Zorua?" she suttered, her sunken heart pounding her chest from within.

Zorua took a few steps forward, where his girlfriend was sitting.

"I... I don't know..." he said sadly.
"I'm just saying that maybe... you should think about what you did... I should think about us... alone..."

Celebi blinked.

Zorua was leaving her. She never dreaded this moment so far, but not there he was, breaking up with her.

"Zorua..." she mumbled breathlessly as Zorua started walking, towards the open door of the kitchen.

He didn't even look back. If he did, Celebi would have noticed the tears rolling down his cheeks.

"... Zorua don't be stupid! Where will you go at that size?" Celebi asked, concerned, heartbroken.

Immediately, she regretted all that had happened in the morning: it all lead to Zorua, her beloved Zorua, deciding to break up with her.

The tiny dark-type stopped, without turning back.

"I'll..." he thought for a moment.

Where could he go? His forest was out of question, he needed someone to watch over him... because he was sure, asking Celebi to give him back his size now would be a waste of time.

Then, his mind traveled to a certain group.

"... I'm sure they'll watch over me too..." he said, content to have an excuse to see Espurr too.

If Celebi's heart hadn't already sunken, it would have right now.

So Zorua was going to them.

The pokemon she had called friends for years, the pokemon that betrayed her... now she seriously started to feel sorry, doubting it could be considered betrayal. Still, she had her reasons...

The fairy watched as the tiny fox walked away, head and tail lowered, tears dropping from his eyes and falling down his face.

Celebi watched him in silence for a moment, her mind on the edge of a cliff, threatening to fall down, sinking into a sea of madness.

"Zorua."

The fox stopped for a moment and finally turned around.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Zorua's decision

choices: "I-I know...I need to go see them..." She sniffled.
"I-I don't want to see them right now..." Celebi sniffled.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"No Zorua...please don't leave...i'll do anything...I can't lose you too..." Celebi sniffled, then started crying. Zorua looked at her and sighed.

"Celi...I love you, I do...and I know you love me...but you need to think about what you've done to your friends...even if you don't consider them that anymore." Zorua said solemnly as he kept walking.

Celebi was crying and remembered the first time she met Espurr...the solemn little cat, alone at a table at school...Celebi sat with her...Espurr tried to ignore her but Celebi's cheery attitude didn't let her.

She had gotten a smile out of the odd purple cat, and soon Espurr started to seek her out...they got to know each other.

...what had she done?

"Zorua...please don't leave..." Celebi whimpered. "Don't leave me alone..."

If her mom came back...Meloetta, Azurill...all of them. What would they say to what she had done? She rubbed her cheek where she was slapped and watched as the tiny dark fox still kept walking.

Zorua didn't want to leave her...but she needed to realize that she wasn't being herself. She wasn't being the good ol' Celebi that he knew. Was Espurr right to worry about her?

He didn't know, but he kept walking.

"I..." Celebi was full on bawling at this point, and psychically she yanked on Zorua's tale.

"If you think you can keep me here y-" Zorua started but he took a look at Celebi rubbing her own eyes, tears leaking.

"I don't w-want you to leave me t-too..." Celebi hicced, and Zorua looked at his giant girlfriend with pity...former girlfriend possibly.

"Do you know why I am?" Zorua asked solemnly and Celebi nodded.

"I-I s-shouldn't have done that...I k-know, and now they hate me...and you hate me..." Celebi whimpered and Zorua sighed.

"They might hate you...but I doubt it. You should make this right Celebi. You need to go and apologize to all of them. Espurr especially. And you need to grow her back." Zorua said firmly and Celebi looked down.

-

Espurr was crying into the cushion that Braixen had set her on. She didn't want to see the world right now, as it was, big and frightening, she didn't want to read the minds of her friends, only thinking of how mad they were at Celebi and how they pitied Espurr right now, she didn't want to think of how her oldest friend...the one that had gotten her out of her shell...shrunk and threw her away, over her genuine concern for her friend.

Braixen and Gardevoir were looming over Espurr with sympathy...they had taken Buneary and Kirlia home, hoping that the two could take care of themselves...

"Espurr..." Gardevoir said it quietly, and as gently as possible...but it was still so, so loud on Espurr's poor ears. "Celebi will realize what she's done...she'll come and grow you...say sorry...right?" She was trying to be optimistic.

Braixen had her arms crossed. She wasn't so sure that would happen. She only hoped.

-

"Well Celebi...?" Zorua inquired at the silent green fairy.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Overwhelming sadness

choices: Espurr runs forward into the hug
Espurr just stands there "I won't hug you. Not after this." feeling betrayed
Espurr runs out of the room and doesn't look back
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Celebi nodded, sniffling. "Yeah...I-I know...I need to go see them..." She said, before rubbing her eyes one last time and standing up. She looked at Zorua, he had been crying a bit too. She smiled weakly at him and he found himself growing up, to full size.

"...Let's go, okay?" Celebi said and Zorua nodded, as the two left the house though...they had to wonder where the group had gone. They might've gone to Braixen's, Buneary's, or Gardevoir's house. They doubted that they went to Espurr's home...they were probably doing everything in their power to make Espurr feel better and seeing her house at her size might not be something she needed.

Celebi bit her lip and opted for Buneary's home...she figured that or Braixen's would probably be the likely choice.

"...I know this is gonna be hard for you to do Celi, but it's the right thing to do...and you know it." Zorua said, he had been in these shoes, needing to apologize like this...to pokemon he had hurt. Celebi nodded.

"I know." She said firmly. She had come to her senses, and what she had done...she didn't even know if Espurr would forgive her. For all intents and purposes she'd be within her rights to avoid Celebi for the foreseeable future.

They made for Buneary's house, awkward silence following the two as Celebi hung her head. She knocked on the door and was greeted by the little brown Buneary.

"O-oh...Celebi and Zorua..." She sounded nervous, instinctively she half shut the door and peeped out.

Buneary was frightened right now...of her...Celebi's heart sank.

"I-is Espurr....here?" She asked and Buneary slammed the door shut.

"No she isn't...they went t-to Braixen's...I was t-told to tell you that if you came by and I did." Buneary said from the other end of the door.

Celebi frowned.

"If you want to come and play with Azurill sometime, you're welcome to anytime." Celebi tried to sound bright as she said it, but she got no response. She hung her head and trudged back onto the path. Zorua watched all of this in silence.

He felt bad for Celebi, his heart ached for her...but he couldn't deny that all of this...wasn't unearned either. He had been here.

"Give Buneary time...she'll come back around." He tried to encourage. Celebi silently nodded, but seemed wholly unconvinced.

They made their walk through the village, in silence. Some pokemon looked at the two sad teens, but most went about their business...though it was odd seeing Celebi like that and Zorua at all without causing mayhem.

Eventually they came upon it. Braixen's house.

Celebi gulped and Zorua nodded.

"Go on..." He encouraged gently and she took a deep breath and knocked.

Gardevoir was the one to answer. Her lips were thin and her visible eye narrowed.

"Celebi." It was curt, and pointed.

All Celebi did was nod.

"I'm sorry...I really am..." She mumbled and Gardevoir said nothing, she crossed her arms.

"I'm not the one you need to say that to the most. She's inside...sleeping after having bawled her tiny eyes out." Gardevoir's words sounded ice cold as Celebi winced and Zorua sighed.

This WAS going to be tough.

Gardevoir led the two inside, into Braixen's guest room, where on a pillow on the guest bed was the little spot of purple, curled up and taking a nap. Braixen was sitting in a chair near the bed, her arms crossed as well as she glared at Celebi. She stood up and led the group silently out of the room before shutting the door as quietly as possible.

"You're gonna wait for her to wake up before you even get the privilege to speak to her. Got it?" Braixen growled and Celebi's mouth hung open, but she nodded, shutting her eyes. She really did have a long way to go after what she did.

"Good." Braixen said, and then led the group into the living room where they all sat. Zorua broke the silence.

"She...really is sorry you kn-"

"Zorua, I appreciate it, but they don't need you to say it...right?" Celebi interrupted and Braixen and Gardevoir nodded.

"...Why green? Why'd you do it?" Braixen asked, in a far gentler tone and Celebi had shaky breaths.

"I...I'm the one behind Wigglytuff's disappearance..." Celebi was gonna tell the whole story, she had to, come what be. If she could get across how she felt then maybe...they'd forgive her.

"He had done some truly heinous things...you know that Braixen...but when Zorua and I decided to prank him...things escalated quickly and...he tried to kill us. All of us, multiple times. He tried to kill his own kid...me...my mom...Zorua...and he almost succeeded...he destroyed my friend's house with a draco meteor...when all was said and done...I shrunk him into oblivion, so small that he no longer exists...at least not in our reality. Essentially...I killed him." Celebi said. Gardevoir gasped at this and Braixen shut her eyes, taking this in.

"He had it coming...if you'd have been there you'd have known. Even Celebi's mom was on the brink of finishing him off..." Zorua said and Celebi nodded before she continued.

"Espurr caught onto this through Zorua's thoughts and earlier today...confronted me about it. I had been feeling slightly hostile towards her for a little bit now, subconsciously...I only realize that now, slightly worried that she'd...try to steal Zorua from me..."

"She'd never!" Gardevoir seethed and Celebi nodded.

"...I know Gard, it was irrational...but her right there, confronting me about Wigglytuff...I think she was just trying to see if k-...killing a pokemon had affected me in a bad way...trying to see if I was okay...if it was the right thing to do too, by everyone involved and...I snapped on her." Celebi said.

"It kept escalating until you all saw what happened." She finished then bowed her head. "I am so, so, SO sorry girls..." There were tears again as Gardevoir and Braixen took all of this in.

"Celebi, again, the one you need to apologize too is in the next room. Until then i'd recommend you just reflect on it. You broke Espurr's heart, and you broke her trust. Earning that back might be harder than you think it'll be, and quite frankly, i'm not ready to forgive you until Espurr's ready to forgive you." Braixen said, as she got up. "I'll be waiting for Espurr to wake up, i'll talk with her and bring her out when she's ready. And not a moment sooner, you're welcome to wait here." And with that she left the three other pokemon in the room.

"...Kirlia handling the house by herself?" Celebi tried to break even a small amount of the awkwardness and Gardevoir looked at her, maybe to throw her a bone she responded with a smile.

"As well as can be expected I hope." She giggled a bit and Celebi did a little too, but then it fell to silence once more. Celebi looked to Zorua, he really was letting her do all the talking for the most part. He smiled to her as she looked over. He was on her side at least...but she felt that should Espurr not forgive her, even Zorua wouldn't blame Espurr for it.

About an hour and a half passed, agonizingly slow as Celebi rehearsed what she'd say to Espurr when the opportunity arose. First she'd say her piece, then grow Espurr and allow her to respond.

She was counting the seconds before, though it was quiet, the sound of a door opening was like a gunshot signaling Celebi to mentally prepare herself.

"If you don't want to see her it's okay..." Braixen said gently, but a tiny, tiny voice responded.

"It's okay Braixen...thank you..." It was definitely Espurr's, but gone was the deadpan, almost playful tone. Her voice was raw.

Braixen walked into Celebi's vision, cradling the small spot of purple in her white paws...it was her, Espurr.

Espurr looked up at the looming face of Celebi, she had clearly been crying too...and she looked like a mix of worried and guilty. "Espurr..." She whimpered the name, but it was still loud on Espurr's ears...like everything was.

"I..." The speech she had planned eluded her, all of it in the face of what she'd done to her friend. The normally calm, cool looking Espurr, deadpan and ready to lend a firm ear as well as mess with her friends with playful mind reading...this wasn't her.

Espurr had clearly been crying too, her eyes, though tiny, were still quite readable and the normally imperceptible pools were full of her emotion. Scared, tired, hurt, sad.

Celebi bowed her head to the bug sized pokemon. "I am so, so sorry Espurr. What I did to you was wrong. So wrong...I thought that...even if you had a crush on Zorua once, that you'd try to steal him from me...you, my friend...and I took out my frustrations and lingering ill will towards Wigglytuff on you...I...am overwhelmingly guilty over what I did to you, and I want to time travel to this morning to take it back but...i'll face you for what i've done...please forgive me..." Celebi whimpered and soon Espurr found herself growing, out of Braixen's paws and soon enough able to look Celebi in the eye. Celebi stretched her arms out, tears running down her cheeks.

"Please forgive me..." Celebi whimpered as she motioned for Espurr...she wanted to hug her. Wanted Espurr to feel comforted and for herself to be comforted as well.

Espurr looked at her, her mouth open. Celebi wanted a HUG from her, after all that she had done today!? Espurr was still feeling hurt, betrayed by the green fairy she thought had been her friend but...Espurr made her decision.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: A painful apology

choices: "Wha...? - of course not!"
"I... don't know. I need to think."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"Hi! I'm Celebi, and you?"

The psychic-type feline looked up from her lunch, eyeing the unknown green pokemon in front of her with indifference.

"... Espurr." she politely responded, hoping this ‘Celebi’ was simply going away on her own.

All the pokemon did after all.

"Nice to meet you!"

Espurr looked at Celebi suspiciously. What did this new girl want?

She picked up on her thoughts, she didn't have any malicious intent: just friendly thoughts.

"Yeah... nice to meet you too..." she replied, smiling.


--

Before the eyes of three surprised pokemon, Espurr jumped forward, letting Celebi envelope her in a hug, her own paws wrapping around her first friend.

Tears ran down both pokemon's faces.

No one dared to speak as the two crying pokemon hugged each other, reconciled.

Then, Espurr broke the silence with a mere whisper,

"Never again Celi..."

Celebi nodded, her own tears sliding onto her friend.

"Never." she assured, hugging more tightly.

Gardevoir couldn't resist any longer.

"G-Girls!" crying, she rushed over the two psychic-types, closing both of them in a hug. Something rendered easy thanks to her long arms.

Zorua smiled. He didn't need to be as smart as Celebi to understand that she and Espurr made peace.

The other fox in the room understood that too, but stood there, arms folded and a neutral stare on her face.

Until Espurr looked at her.

"Yeah, you d-don't like sentimentalism t-too much, do you Braix?" she stuttered, smirking even when she was still crying.

Braixen stopped her facade: her arms unfolded, tears started sliding down her face as well.

"S-Shut up you creep..."

With that, Braixen too joined in the group hug. She looked at Celebi.

"Don't y-you dare doing that again..." she said shakily, the fairy biting her lip.
"I'd rather committing suicide... I'm sorry..." she apologized again.

Celebi inhaled sharply.

"I should've thought better, I was so blinded by jealousy that I... lost it..."

"It doesn't matter anymore..." Gardevoir sobbed.

"B-But... Buneary..." Celebi recalled the bunny closing the door in her face.

Braixen promptly chimed in,

"I'll talk to her," she pulled her friends closer.

"Kirlia..."

"I'll talk to her," Gardevoir assured.

Zorua climbed on top of Braixen's couch, smiling as all his problems seemed to have faded. All his problems but one: Celebi.

His smile faded, replaced by a serious expression. Celebi was sweet, loving, maybe a bit mischievous... and a total wild card. Regardless, the dark-type still loved her... but felt like he had to pick his next move carefully.

Was he ready to forgive Celebi too, to return being her boyfriend?

Espurr rubbed herself into the green fairy... before discovering that she didn't have a psychic block, and she could freely read her thoughts. Perhaps the fairy didn't even notice or care right now.

Along with memories of the past years they had spent together as friends, Espurr saw saw the tiny Zorua literally breaking up with his girlfriend.

She looked at the fox, who dropped his smile, realizing what was going on.

He nodded his head.

"Is this... you two broke up?" Espurr indelicately asked, causing Celebi to shut her eyes open, Gardevoir to gasp and Braixen to glance at the dark-type fox, shocked.

"W-Wha...?"

"Zorua! Y-You..." Gardevoir chimed, recalling the night Zorua had confessed his feelings for the fairy; she had helped him, she couldn't believe he was breaking up with her!... But she also couldn't blame him, she discovered...

Celebi looked at the dark-type fox's chest, not finding the courage to look at him in the eye. She could definitely feel his blue gaze fixed straight on her. She had totally forgotten about the reason that made her realize her mistake: Zorua was leaving her.

"Celi..." he mumbled, unsure.

All of his friends let go of Celebi, who fluttered in front of the fox wordlessly.

Well, she DID speak one word though,

"Please..."

Zorua looked away, feeling the gazes of his friends and girlfriend on him.

"Zorua... you still want to break up?" Celebi insisted, tears rolling down her cheeks again. Those weren't normal tears though, those were tears coming from a broken heart.

Zorua looked at his girlfriend; this time, he had an answer.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Celebi's last problem

choices: "Yeah...fine..."
"...I'm still against it."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"Wha...? No, of course not!" He said before he rubbed the back of his head with a forepaw.

"I only did that because you were being a jerk...but you've come to your senses now. I think at least." He said and Celebi smiled, rubbing the tears from her eyes. "Good." She smiled before she pulled him into a hug.

"H-hey...we don't need to get sentimental about it..." He muttered, blushing like mad.

Gardevoir looked on smiling, and Braixen grinned. Celebi wanted to see Espurr though...the girl that had a crush on Zorua herself...the girl that she unjustly hurt and threatened in more ways than one...the girl that was her friend. An immense wave of guilt hit Celebi again before she heard it.

"It's okay Celi, i've always been okay with it...stop thinking about me when it comes to you and Zorua, alright?" Espurr said. Celebi still hadn't put the mental block up. Zorua hugged tighter into Celebi and Celebi nodded.

"Thank you...everyone." She said, before eventually the hug broke. Celebi sighed. "We have GOT to do something tonight...make up for...what i've done." She said and Braixen grinned wider.

"Sleepover then?" She said and Celebi nodded. "Sweet! Where?" Braixen asked.

"My place is out. No way my parents would go for it..." Gardevoir said and Braixen rubbed the back of her head. "I doubt my mom'll be open to it either...she likes this stuff ran by her earlier than this..."

Celebi looked down. "I doubt my house is open with Meloetta and Azurill staying there right now..."

Espurr looked at all of them and sighed. "My dad's out of town again...it should be fine if we aren't messy." She said, smiling. "Espurr..." Celebi looked at her friend again and Espurr shrugged. "It's fine, it's fine...but on one condition." She said and Celebi looked at her. Espurr had her deadpan look...but there was a glint in her eye.

"Braixen." She got the attention of the purple fox.

"Uh...yeah?" She said.

"That movie no one else knows about except you and me, though I never brought it up...the one you have stashed...i'd like us all to watch it together." She said and Braixen's eyes widened. Her eyes drifted to Celebi, then back to Espurr.

"...To be honest Celi, this is absolutely justified payback." Braixen said, her eyes still wide. Celebi was confused...and growing nervous.

"...Uh...what is this?" She asked and Gardevoir eyed Braixen walking off. Espurr was smiling, smiling wide...and it was unsettling.

"Espurr...what are you doing...?" Gardevoir asked and Espurr started giggling, Zorua eyed her too...that glint in her eye...was Espurr taking after him? He grinned a bit too, he couldn't help but find it contagious.

Soon enough Braixen came back.

"Read the title, please." Espurr said and Braixen rubbed the back of her head.

"Uh...yeah 'The lake of Carvanha and the spirit of the Dusk: Uncut edition' this was the cut deemed too gruesome for theaters and was banned in a few providences for content...to be honest, even a few scenes unsettled me...no one knows that I have this but I should've figured you'd know Espurr..." Braixen said, her eyes fell on Celebi...who had gone white as a sheet.

"Espurr...please no..." Celebi said and Zorua was looking like a kid in a candy store.

"Espurr...please yes..." He said and Celebi eyed all of them. Gardevoir just shrugged, Braixen too just scratched the back of her head...and Espurr was smiling. There would be no mercy.

Celebi sighed...if it'd put her actions to rest, then she'd take her lumps. "Okay...we can watch it later tonight..." She said, almost a squeak. Espurr smiled gentler. "It'll be fine Celi...it's just a movie."

"Yeah..." Celebi said, she knew she'd get at least one solid night of nightmares...but it'd make Zorua happy too, and Espurr had more than the right to get a little revenge. This was mild compared to what she'd done.

"So...should we invite any others? Maybe smooth things over with Buneary and Kirlia, invite Azurill as we-"

"Absolutely not!"
"Yes."
"Not having them watch this movie!"
"I'm for it!"

Everyone spoke over each other at this...then Celebi spoke again.

"This movie is WAY too graphic for little kids! Are you NUTS!?" Celebi asked and Braixen eyed her. "Nuts would go to the pokemon that just-"

"I realize i'll be hearing about this for a while from you girls, and I realize you aren't wrong either, but there's no WAY i'd feel comfortable putting Kirlia, Azurill or Buneary in front of that screen!"

"...they don't need to watch the movie, but i'd like to discuss something with Azurill." Espurr said calmly. Celebi looked at her...then it clicked. Despite all of this, Espurr was still wanting to talk more about what had happened.

At first Celebi was apprehensive, but she realized that was just Espurr's innate nature. If she wanted to help a pokemon...she would at any cost.

Zorua was silent too, Espurr had talked with him that one night...about his past and his father, the mind reading thing...it let her find answers the pokemon didn't want to give, but she tried to help her friends with it too.

"...i'm for them coming Celi, I GUESS they don't need to watch the movie." He said.

Gardevoir looked around the room. "If Kirlia doesn't watch the movie...fine. I guess I owe her for dumping her back at home like this anyway."

All eyes fell on Celebi.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Making plans

choices: "... Just leave me alone... I don't wanna talk about it." Azurill replied
"O-Okay... Let's talk..." Azurill replied
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"... I swear that if Meloetta tells mom Azurill has nightmares, I'll shrink ALL of you..." Celebi relented with a sigh.

She did deserve Espurr's payback, but why involve kids?

"Meh... you'll all get used to it." Zorua chimed, nuzzling his girlfriend.

Braixen smiled.
"Okay then! I'll go get Buneary; Gard, go get Kirlia; Celi, get Azurill and we'll all meet up at Espurr's... Celi..." Braixen smirked at the uncomfortable Celebi.
"I don't envy you."

The time-traveling fairy gulped.

--

"W-With Celebi Braixen...?" Buneary stepped back, terrorized.

"Oh, chill out sweetie, Celi came to her senses, it'll be fine... maybe not after the movie though..." Braixen mused.

Buneary looked skeptical.

The purple vixen sighed.

"Relax Bun, we'll be fine... Celebi's had her fair share of troubles today too..." she recalled.

"What do you mean?

--

"Zorua wanted to break up with Celebi?!"

"I know!" Gardevoir exclaimed, scandalized.

Kirlia blinked - according to what her older sister said, Celebi and Zorua were practically stuck like glue!

"Luckily, it made Celebi snap back to being herself... are you coming or not?" Gardevoir remembered the point of the situation

"YOU KIDDING?! Of course! I need to know everything!" Kirlia exclaimed.

--

"Cool! I'm in!" Azurill exclaimed, excited. His first invitation to a sleepover!

Meloetta, on the other hand, looked skeptical.

"... Celi, are you sure? You mentioned a movie... what kind of movie?" she asked apprehensively.

Zorua grinned, his tail wagging.

"... Maybe a tiny little bit unadapted," the time-traveler lied.
"But he doesn't need to watch it... Espurr wants to talk to him..." this one part was true.

Meloetta hugged Azurill, now frowning.

But the blue mouse turned to face her,

"Please Meloetta!" he chimed.

The green-headed pokemon sighed.

"Fine."

--

Electabuzz stared at his reflection in the lake, sure he heard something... but his randomly necklace fell into the water.

"Damn it..." he mumbled, reaching to grab it.

A sharp pain spread throughout his body as he pulled out his paw, screaming, noticing that his hand wasn't there anymore.

He screamed, but couldn't make anymore sounds when a blue and orange piranha jumped out of the water, biting Electabuzz's at the neck.

The electric-type was already dead before he fell into the water.

"Electabuzz!" the Scizor rushed to the lake, finding the electric-type swimming into the lake, the sunset crafting a yellowish-orange shade on the water... oddly, the water around Electabuzz seemed red, and he wasn't really moving.

"Dude, come out!" Scizor cried in alert, reaching into the lake to pull out his friend... whose lower body was completely gone, bitten off.

Scizor screamed as he let go of his deceased friend.

His heart beating like a drum, Scizor scrambled to his feet and turned to run, but a dark grey pokemon appeared.

Dusknoir.

Scizor couldn't even scream: the ghost that guarded the lake grabbed a hold of his neck and lifted the bug-type off the ground. Scizor flailed in mid-air, but was unable to free himself.

Eventually, the bug/steel-type went limp, strangled.

Dusknoir mercilessly threw his lifeless body into the lake; Scizor hit Electabuzz, both pokemon sank into the water, which soon became bloody red...


--

"Ain't this great Zorua?!" Braixen shouted to overwhelm the screams that reigned into the room, most of which belonged to Celebi. The vixen struggled to keep the frightened brown bunny on her lap still.

The purple vixen looked at the black fox, taking notice that he was back to his original height, Celebi was burying her head into his fur and he had a leg wrapped around her.

"She grew me so she could of this," Zorua responded with a grin in response to Braixen's questioning look.
"And yes, that's awesome!"

From his fur came a muffled whimper,

"I hate you Zorua..."

Gardevoir was covering her younger sister's eyes with a paw, covering her own eyes with the other

Espurr was watching, visibly shaken by the gruesome scene... the tiny Azurill was watching with interest.

He seemed comprehensibly scared, but amused all the same.

Espurr saw an opportunity.

"Hey, Azurill," she started, gently picking the mouse with psychic.

Azurill shook, startled, before looking at the psychic-type,

"Hmm?... Oh, Espurr... what?" he asked, tranquilized.

Espurr floated him to her paws, and looked away for a moment; she had to pick the right words, or Azurill wasn't going to talk to her about it... although she could have simply read his mind.

But she decided against it.

"... I'd like to ask you something," Espurr said, setting the mouse on her lap.

Azurill looked confused, but nodded,

"What?" he said, wondering what Espurr wanted in the middle of such frightening... and so-extremely-cool movie.

Espurr blinked, deadpan,

"Wigglytuff. How do you feel about his..." she stopped, sure that Azurill didn't need her to finish the sentence to get the gist.

The mouse's eyes widened.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Terrific movie night

choices: Later that evening, with games...
Getting nearer to bedtime...
In the morning...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Azurill looked at the giantess holding him, her eyes indiscernible pools as they gazed at him. Azurill hadn't interacted with Espurr before this, but he knew about her...and knew she was a mind reader.

"...O-okay...let's talk...after the movie..." He said as he looked back to see a very gory shot, his eyes widened more, but he couldn't look away.

"AAAHHH!"

-

"I'm gonna have nightmares for weeks! How could you actually show us that!?" Celebi said as Zorua grinned. "I loved it..."

"...I feel sick..." Buneary said and Braixen was giving her some water. "Relax bun, it was only a movie." She said and Buneary nodded.

Kirlia was smiling. "I didn't mind the parts I saw." She said and Gardevoir sighed. "It wasn't much of it Kirlia."

"Where's Espurr, I need t-" They looked around. Espurr had taken the opportunity to leave and go to a quiet part of her manor with Azurill. Where they wouldn't be disturbed...she knew some of the things Azurill was feeling, and being away from Celebi and Zorua was the best thing right now for him to talk.

She was in her attic...it had been a long while since she'd been here...she looked at the portrait across from her, of her dad, herself as an infant and...her mom.

"Um...ms. Espurr?" She heard from her paws and she looked down. She had a deadpan look. "...you don't need to call me ms." She said and Azurill nodded. She sat down on a dusty sofa and set the mouse down on her lap.

"...How much do y-you already know about it all?" Azurill asked and Espurr looked down. "I know what Wigglytuff tried to do, what he did do, and what Celebi did to him. I know how Zorua feels about it, I know Celebi is happy she did it...and I know you've got complicated feelings on all of it." She said and Azurill looked down.

"...Go on, I won't tell any of them how you feel." She urged and he sighed. "Wigglytuff...was a bad pokemon. I'm convinced of that. The deplorable things he did...all of it. But...for a time I loved him, he took me in after mom died and...I grew to see him as a dad, and grew to see the other kids he cared for as my best friends and siblings...then this all happened and..." He sighed.

"I know in there...somewhere deep there was a single kernel of good...there had to be. Maybe he was a good pokemon...once. And...I wished for him to repent. I didn't want it to end like that. I'm sad for him...i'm sad for Igglybuff, for Swinub...for all of them. I can't argue that he earned his fate, and I won't argue that...but whenever the topic comes up in the house i'm in...how am I supposed to say how I feel to them? He tried to kill me...kill all of us, and he destroyed Meloetta's home...hurt her. I can't forgive that. But I can't get rid of the feelings I have too..." He said, he was looking at the lap he was sitting on and starting to feel misty eyed. He shook his head.

Espurr patted his head and spoke quietly.

"It's okay to feel that way Azurill, and i'm sure everyone in that house would understand too if you told them...well, Zorua might not comprehend it well...but Meloetta...Celebi's mom..." She stopped short of saying Celebi herself.

She had a lot of feelings to work through herself when it came to Celebi.

"Mmm. I don't know..." Azurill said and Espurr sighed.

"You know...when I was your age...I lost my mom. She killed herself..." Azurill looked shocked by this.

"I didn't know if I mourned for her, hated her for it, still loved her, or if I had had done something wrong...hated dad for trying to cushion me from it all and avoiding it...sometimes we grapple with feelings alone, not wanting to put others on the spot or make them look at you funny...but things are never as simple as getting over something sad or being happy or...any of it. Thoughts, emotions...they're complex things, and if you need help sorting through them, there are pokemon that care about you...the kids Wigglytuff looked after...they don't know you're alive. They're not only mourning Wigglytuff, but you as well...though it was his fault. And if Igglybuff learned the truth of her father, how would she feel? I know this is a lot to sort through...and I know it's all been on your mind for days." She said. Azurill started sniffling now.

"It's okay...I want to help." She said and Azurill started to cry full on.

"I just want things to be okay for them...for all of them...but I don't know how that can happen." Espurr grabbed the little mouse in her paws and hugged him to her chest.

"...I think you should talk with Celebi's mom about it. She's the one that wants to address the kids, and I think talking with her and Meloetta will quell your concerns more than you realize...until then, enjoy the evening, okay?" She said as she got up, holding Azurill. She was going to keep this to herself, Celebi was convinced of how she felt about all of this and she wasn't going to push that button again, resolved Zorua tensions or no.

Though she did need to hash things out with the fairy one on one in the near future, for now, she'd enjoy the whining from her about the movie.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Mixed emotions

choices: Celebi undoes the mistake with time travel
Celebi tries to visit Espurr to patch things over
Celebi just lets time pass and see if Espurr will come on her own
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Espurr stared at Celebi with an expression that no one in the room had seen from her, nor was it one that no one could blame her for. Fear. Fear was clearly written on Espurr's face, and she turned and wordlessly ran. Ran from the room and rounded a corner.

A door could be heard opening, then slamming shut. Celebi dropped her arms and looked down. "Celebi...you should go home." Braixen said simply and Gardevoir looked from Braixen to Celebi. "Are we not gonna try to..." The words died in Gardevoir's throat though as she looked down.

"...If this can be fixed, it won't be right now. Celebi...you screwed up. You hurt our friend...your friend. If you want to undo it with time travel I suppose that's an option, but i'd say give Espurr time...at the very least, we'll talk to her...until then..." Braixen eyed Zorua who nodded.

"I'll stick with Celi." He said as he looked at her, her eyes met his and he nodded.

"Yeah, we're still together Celi." He said and she gave a weak smile before sniffling and wiping some tears from her eyes.

"Girls I...I really am sorry..." She mumbled and Gardevoir nodded.

"We know, but it doesn't undo what you did to her. Espurr was scared, she was crying, and she was hurt. You threw her good intentions back in her face...it'll take time, and effort for you to gain Espurr's trust again...whether the time and effort be you facing forward, or going backwards."

"I don't think you should undo it personally, but I can't stop you." Braixen said and Zorua finally decided to join in.

"I think we should just give her space right now, let her come to us on her own Celi, don't undo it." He said. Celebi didn't say anything but she did start for the door.

"...Let's go Zorua." She said, a bit sad.

"...Celi...i'm serious though, figure this out with Espurr, until then...I can't forgive you." Braixen said firmly. Celebi nodded.

"...That's fine." She said as she kept going, and Gardevoir and Braixen watched her leave.

-

The walk was silent aside from Celebi, sniffling at times...but Zorua broke the silence.

"Listen Celi...i'm not breaking up with you...but i'm still worried about you. You're...fine, right?" He said, looking at her and she nodded.

"Yeah..." She was thinking of the times she and Espurr had hung out, talked...the times Espurr had helped her through issues in her own way...the times that Celebi tried to get her to open up about her issues.

She had really messed something special up, and she didn't know if she could get it back, and if she could, if it would be like it was before.

Celebi considered her options
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Espurr's fear and Celebi's dilemma

choices: ... smiled, "Go in: she wants to talk to you alone."
... bit his lip, "I think... I think we should go for now..."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Celebi looked up.

"Come on Zorua, let's go visit Espurr... we need to talk..."

Zorua perked up, eyebrow raised,

"... ‘We’?" he asked.

Celebi nodded,

"Yes Zorua, we. You gotta help me." she stated. Her boyfriend, who had ultimately chosen to don't shatter their relationship, seemed hesitant: this was Celebi's mistake, and it was up to her to fix it.

"... You're not going to help me, are you?" the time-traveling fairy fluttering beside him asked.

Zorua stopped.

"Celi I love you, and I wish I could help you but... this is sorta your mistake. You need to talk to Espurr, not me... If she's ready to see you." he said.

Celebi hung her head and sighed: a sigh coming from a shattered heart.

"I know..." she sobbed, before looking up at Zorua again,
"Please Zorua... I'm not feeling well..." she whimpered as her feet touched the ground.

Zorua smiled.

"Now that's something I can do for you," he said, his back arching up.

His girlfriend gave a weak smile as she climbed onto him, laid belly-down on the black fur and wrapped her arms around Zorua's neck, her feet hanging from the sides of the fox.

All that done, Zorua started walking with his passenger on his back. He walked very slowly: knowing Espurr, she was still halfway there with her heart in her throat.

--

"Go on."

Celebi swallowed, before placing her fist on the door as she started knocking.

She didn't know why she was knocking, given how Espurr could read minds and certainly already knew who it was.

As a matter of fact, there was no answer.

"Espurr..." the fairy called shakily.

Again, she received no response.

She called out for her former friend one last time, but she got the same response as earlier: silence.

Tears rolling down her eyes, Celebi looked at Zorua.

"... Le-Let's go..." she mumbled, starting to flutter away, her heart sunken.

Zorua didn't move.

Celebi's heart sank even deeper into her chest. Was Zorua reconsidering about not leaving her?

"... Zorua..."

The time-traveler watched as her boyfriend stepped forward and knocked at the door.

"Espurr! It's me, Zorua! Can I come i-" the door suddenly opened, and Zorua was literally dragged inside by a psychic grip, before the door was hastily slammed again.

Celebi blinked, before sighing deeply as she sat down next to Espurr's door, placing her arms on her knees and her head in her arms.

Then, she started crying.

--

Zorua looked around the large mansion with awe: he had never seen it from the inside.

In front of him, Espurr stood in silence, her wide eyes still wet with tears and her small body still shaken by sobs.

The gaze of the dark-type fox ultimately fell on her.

"Espurr-"

"No." she interrupted before Zorua even spoke.

All the words of the fox evaporated in a sigh of annoyance.

Damn mind-reading.

"I know how you're feeling Espurr," he started.

"I don't think you do." the psychic-type interrupted again.

Zorua felt offended.

"Sweetheart, I've been through worse with Celi... I was smaller than you were earlier... it still hurts," he rose the paw that was once broken when he was reduced to a nanoscopic size.

Espurr looked down: if there was someone that could comprehend her, that was Zorua.

"... My best friend did that to me... I felt so helpless... I was only trying to help..." she finally started to open up.

"But, please, let's sit down... I'll make tea..." she said, gesturing for a rather large couch.

Before Zorua could respond he was fine like this, or that he didn't particularly like tea, Espurr had disappeared in her kitchen; she came back into the living room several minutes later, holding a steaming cup and another one full of dark liquid that Zorua identified as soda.

He thanked Espurr, and took a sip, before signing.

"Look, when Celebi did that to me, she was incredibly sorry: she had almost killed me. She... healed me, took care of me and... you know how things went." Zorua said,
"What I'm trying to say is: Celi is really sorry."

Espurr sobbed.

"She wasn't before you threatened her to break up, was she?" she pointed out upon reading Zorua's mind.

The fox nodded.

"She was... that wasn't the Celi in know and love. She was scary, I had to do something..." Zorua admitted.

"It worked..." Espurr bitterly said, taking a sip of her tea; the hot liquid noisily slid down her throat and into her empty stomach.

Zorua nodded.

Espurr slowly put her cup down.

"Zorua, tell me something," she said,
"How do you feel about Wigglytuff's literal disappearance?" she changed subject.

For the first time today, Zorua snickered.

"I regret not finishing him off personally. Other than that - and this whole mess - I'm fine."

Espurr pointed to his bandaged head.

"It's itchy, but I don't feel so much pain anymore... will probably take this thing off in a few days..." he responded, but Espurr wasn't listening anymore.

She had moved forward, closer to the fox.

"Uhm, Es-" the smaller psychic-type grabbed his head in her paws.

"You tried to save me... from Celebi..." she recalled. The fox blushed.

"Um, yeah!... Remember when you hid me from Braixen?" he recalled, but Espurr didn't reply.

And Zorua's cheeks began to burn as the psychic-type feline pushed her lips on one of them.

After thirty seconds, Espurr pulled off, shoving her head against Zorua's as she hugged him.

"Thank you." she said.

Zorua snickered sheepishly - if Celebi was seeing any of this, he was dead.

"Nothing..." he replied - if Celebi was seeing any of this, Espurr was dead.

Thinking about his girlfriend, Zorua smiled,

"So? Want to talk to that girlfriend of mine out there?"

--

Celebi sat next to the door, seeking any kind of comfort in burying her head in her paws.

With little success.

But then, the door beside her opened.

She looked up as her boyfriend came out with a neutral expression.

"S-So?"

Celebi watched as Zorua...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: A visit with unexpected results

choices: Celebi opts to try and deliver the cake alone
Celebi sends Zorua with the cake
Both of them go to try and deliver the cake
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Zorua bit his lip and looked down. "I think...we should go for now..." He remembered the last few moments in there.

-

"Zorua...I don't want to see or talk to Celebi right now. Quite frankly...I don't even know if I know her right now. I always knew her power, but even when she put up mental blocks I never once thought she would do something like this...then I look in your mind and see the things she said after she shrunk me...her lack of remorse...throwing me away like that until you threatened to break up with her...I need time to think Zorua, I don't want to talk to her or...quite frankly, anyone really right now...if anything, you should go to her...thank you for listening though." Espurr said as she nodded to the entrance and Zorua looked at her sadly.

"Are you sure?" He said and she nodded, sitting in her quiet, empty mansion. Zorua walked out.

-

Celebi looked at the mansion, as if hurt and started to walk away.

"Espurr..." She mumbled.

She was going to go home...but she went into the village, she had some things to buy.

-

"A cake?" Zorua said as he watched her from his perch on Celebi's kitchen table. It was the next day, and once again Zorua and Celebi had the house to themselves. Celebi smiled at her diminutive boyfriend. "Espurr's favorite. Bittersweet chocolate cake. I can't just leave it be Zorua, but I understand why Espurr feels the way she does...but I have to keep trying!" She said. She felt much better about this stuff today and Zorua eyed her wearily.

"Are you sure this'll work? Espurr seemed like she just wanted peace and solitude when I talked to her." He said.

"If I let Espurr have solitude...she'll never come out. It's her nature unfortunately...if she retreats into her shell she'll stay there..." Celebi said.

"...Alright then." He walked over to the dark chocolate and snuck a bite...only to make an disgusted face.

"So bitter!" He said and Celebi chuckled and pecked him on the cheek. "Well...I won't lie, I was kinda hoping you'd do that. Yeah, Espurr likes it like this though." Celebi said and Zorua just looked at the giantess.

"Do you bake often?" He asked and she looked proud for a moment.

"I'm one of the best in my home ec class!" She said and Zorua looked unimpressed.

"Look...I made this for Espurr before on her birthday and she adored it, once she gets this i'll get her to open up, and not be scared of me or mad at me or..." Celebi trailed off at this, but shook her head. She couldn't get dejected, this was her fault and she was gonna pull Espurr out of her funk.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: A baked apology

choices: "... Okay fine. I'll talk to Celebi..." Espurr said
"I still don't think I want to talk to her... but thanks anyway." Espurr said
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Celebi smiled as she grabbed a hold of the cake she made, before she she gazed at Zorua.

"Okay Zorua, now that this thing is ready, you've got to deliver it." she said.

Zorua looked up,
"Why me?" he complained,
"It's your mistake, you should deliver it!"

Celebi giggled. A small package and some wrapping paper psychically flew into the kitchen as the fairy prepared her gift for her former friend.

The cake that was supposed to be delivered to Espurr was put down again as the fairy grabbed Zorua instead.

"Because I'm sure that my sweet little Zorua would do that and more for me." she replied with a honey-sweet voice.

Zorua didn't fell for it.

"... Okay, one: I'm too small to carry that thing; two: you should really give that to Espurr yourself Celi..." he mused.

His girlfriend smiled.

"Oh, don't worry about your size, I'll restore it... and you're the only one allowed in Espurr's house right now." Celebi said, recalling a very indignant Gardevoir calling her yesterday, telling that she and Braixen had tried to see Espurr, but she didn't even open the door.

"Someone will think I stole it... I just know..." Zorua huffed.

"And you tell them the truth," Celebi replied as her boyfriend started growing, until he was back at his original size, slightly bigger than her.

"Mom knows about us anyway." she finished by pecking Zorua on the cheek and setting the plate with the cake down on his back.

Zorua sighed.

"If this cake falls, it's not my problem. Okay?" he had to make sure there weren't going to be any unwanted consequences.

Celebi smiled.
