"Don't worry, I'll make another. Now go." she pecked Zorua again and psychically opened the front door.

The dark-type fox inhaled sharply as he walked out of the kitchen, reached the door and left the house.

Celebi's gaze followed him.

She hoped Espurr was going to forgive her... but, even if she didn't, she still had Zorua. That was a good consolation.

--

Zorua walked through the village, whistling while desperately trying keep the cake on his back in place.

The fox rounded a corner, waved a paw in Lopunny's direction, received a neutral stare from the same Lopunny - for some reason, her daughter kept gushing about him - and kept going.

The fox walked, pokemon shooting irritated glares, fearful looks or even curious looks in direction of the package on his back, but they left him alone.

Aside from one pokemon.

"Stop right there ya!"

The voice came from behind Zorua. He stopped, a smirk on his face.

He knew that voice.

He turned around, finding Graveler standing behind him.

"What's in the package?" he asked.

"None of your business." Zorua replied.

But Graveler didn't relent,
"Is that cake I smell?" he asked again, grinning at the thought of a good snack before lunch.
"Well well well, looks like someone stole from the pastry shop again... I thought Slurpuff said she didn't want to see you anymore..." the rock said.

Zorua snickered at the memory - that cake was delicious.

"I didn't stole it you moron. My girlfriend did this. Though I doubt I need to give you any explanations." he responded.

Graveler growled, but then smirked.

"‘Moron’? My Zorua, such bad words... but let's say that I'm going to forget you said anything... if you give me that cake. I'm sure your girlfriend, whoever that is, would be pleased if you ‘shared’ it..." he said, figuring that whoever Zorua's girlfriend was - if she really existed, and he doubted it - wouldn't complain if she didn't want to be beaten up.

The rock pokemon was merrily unaware of who Zorua's girlfriend was and, quite frankly, he was unaware of what the mind of a prankster can do.

"Like hell I'm giving it to you." Zorua responded, while mentally formulating a plan: taking on Graveler up close would be suicide... but using his trickery...

Zorua snickered as the rock took a step forward,

"Maybe I need to rephrase that..."

Espurr's house was after his forest... Graveler had no chance...

"I changed my mind," Zorua said, grinning maniacally.
"Take it."

An illusionary cake was flung at Graveler, who got hit in the face.

He opened his eyes and growled, discovering Zorua running like hell.

"Catch me if you can, rock-head!" he shouted, his cry followed by his characteristic snicker.

Graveler growled again as he started running behind the fox, who struggled to balance the plate on his back.

The rock chased the dark-type throughout the whole village, both earning curious looks from the villagers, although no one dared to step in. Both of them were jerks, they didn't want to get in whatever they were doing.

But Zorua was hopelessly too agile for Graveler to catch up in time before the fox disappeared into his forest.

Panting, the heavy rock pokemon made his way into the woods as well.

"Come out and fight like a man! You're dead!" he called out, walking through the forest.

But Zorua was nowhere to be seen. The other way around, the fox saw Graveler perfectly, hidden by countless plants, Espurr's cake safely resting on his back.

He purposefully made some of the bushes around Graveler shake with an illusion, the rock followed the shaking bushes... and suddenly felt the ground beneath his feet receding as he sank into it, falling into a pit Zorua himself dug.

Snickering, the fox walked out of his hiding spot and made his way to the edge of the pit, where Graveler was shouting horrible words.

"Ever considered losing weight?" he laughed.

"When I get back up there, you're dead Zorua. DEAD!" the rock seethed.

In response, Zorua raised one of his paws in a poor imitation of a hideous gesture.

Right before a rock was thrown at him. Zorua tilted his head, the rock barely missing him. He frowned.

"Hey, I was thinking... you'll be in there for quite a while... I'll get ya something to drink buddy." he said, disappearing from Graveler's eyesight, returning a minute later with a bucket, which was thrown at the rock-type, splashing him with green paint.

Graveler growled again as Zorua howled with laughter.

"Whoops! Wrong bucket! Hahaha!" Zorua laughed, before turning around.
"I have something to do right now. But don't worry! I'll find some time to come and mess with ya some more!" he said, walking away.

"GET BACK HERE ZORUA!" Graveler shouted, but the tricky fox ignored him as he made his way out of his woods, the echo of Graveler's screams following him.

--

Zorua anxiously knocked at the door of Espurr's mansion.

His response was a minute of silence, before Espurr opened the door.

Celebi was right, he thought.

"Hi Zorua..." the psychic-type greeted, looking deadpan as always.

Perhaps she was back to her normal self, but she probably still didn't want to see anyone.

However, Zorua beamed.

"Hi Espurr! I'm here to give you this..." he turned around to show Espurr the package Celebi made. The psychic-type feline stared at it, surprised.

"Made with love and humble apologies from Celebi!" Zorua mentioned happily, turning around again to grin at his friend.

Espurr remained silent for a moment, before taking the package from Zorua's back and opening it. Her eyes widened... even more.

Celebi made her that cake, was probably trying to win her over again with that... but it was a symbolic gift: it was the cake Celebi herself had made for her on her last birthday, and she loved it. Not only because it was good, but also because her best friend had made it.

The cake was psychically lifted from her paws and flew inside her mansion, landing on a table, before Espurr faced Zorua again, reading the thoughts behind his grin. He knew what was going on, but he didn't mind.

The psychic-type looked surprised for a moment - Graveler-related memories - before she read Zorua's thoughts of hope.

Hope that she was going to give his girlfriend a second chance.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: A tough delivery

choices: Celebi heads home
Celebi runs into someone on the way home
Celebi...time travels
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"...Okay...i'll talk to her." Espurr said finally. She herself had had time to reflect on things, and she was still wary of Celebi, but at the very least she did seem remorseful. Zorua sighed with relief.

"Good good..." He said before grinning. "So are you gonna eat your cake or what?" He asked and Espurr smiled a bit. "I will in due time...tell Celebi to come over tonight, just her, okay?" Espurr said and Zorua nodded.

"Will do...I promise Espurr, she's not the pokemon we saw yesterday." He truly believed that.

Espurr didn't entirely believe it though, but all the same...it wasn't something she'd ignore.

-

Zorua made his way back to the village, whistling. He took extra care to stop and visit Graveler, kicking a pine cone into his pit nonchalantly, earning some swears and threats before heading home.

Celebi was in her room, as Meloetta and Azurill had come back.

"Heya you two!" Zorua saluted and Meloetta smiled and waved. Azurill was in her grasp and smiling before Zorua made his way to Celebi's room.

"Alright I-" A familiar feeling overtook him as the world around him grew larger. He sighed.

"So Zorua? How'd it go?" Celebi asked nervously as he was levitated into her grasp on her bed.

"Well...I was interrupted by Graveler, the idiot rock, and he tried to snatch the cake..."

Celebi bit her lip but Zorua grinned.

"I dumped him in one of my pits and delivered the cake safe and sound." He said and Celebi smiled and pecked Zorua on the cheek.

"Thank you..." She said and he blushed, nodding.

"She wants to see you tonight...just you and her..." He said and her heart soared, she was beaming.

"You're not out of trouble yet Celebi...don't...y'know." He said and she nodded.

"No matter what happens, I won't raise a finger to harm her...I can't believe I did yesterday..." She said and Zorua sighed. "Then there's something else you should know." He said...he couldn't keep this from Celebi in good consciousness, despite what repercussions it may have. "Espurr...kissed me on the cheek yesterday." He said and Celebi's eyes widened. "She what!?" Celebi nearly shouted, making Zorua wince. "It was a sign of gratitude...look, I believe her, she doesn't want to steal me from you, despite her feelings, and even if she did I wouldn't ever go for it...I wanted to clear the air. If you bring this part up to her, please don't do anything rash again!" Celebi looked at her tiny boyfriend, then took a deep breath and closed her eyes.

Eventually she opened them and smiled. "Okay...I think I understand." She said as she got up.

"I'm gonna go visit Espurr then...keep Meloetta and Azurill company in the meantime." She said as she fluttered out the door.

"Yeah yeah..." He said, but he smiled watching her leave.

This would hopefully patch it all up.

-

Celebi made her way through the forest, and as she did she passed the pit with Graveler. He asked for her help to get out as he was covered in drying green paint and she just smiled at him before psychically dropping a Beedrill nest onto his head from a tree. Hearing approaching buzzing Celebi continued on her path, disregarding the yelps and buzzing behind her.

She approached the mansion, putting up a mental block and sighing. She'd need to address the kiss on the cheek as well as her attitude towards Espurr. Put it all on the table, and then discuss it. No shrinking, no psychic battles...two pokemon hopefully reconciling a friendship, that's what this was.

The door opened to reveal Espurr, who was looking more or less normal.

"Come in." She said in her deadpan voice and Celebi smiled.

"Espurr I-"

"At the table." Espurr simply said as she led Celebi into the home.

It was silence as they made their way to the dining room, and at a small table Espurr had set up was a small dinner of soup, salad and breadsticks, with the cake at a side table for desert.

"Wow..." Celebi said as Espurr sat at the table and Celebi followed.

"We'll eat, and discuss these things..." Espurr mumbled, she was clearly still nervous, but Celebi wanted to ease tensions. "Been a while since I had a dinner with you like this...it's nice." She said. Espurr gave a slight smile. "Yeah..." She said, almost wistfully, but soon she was back at her default. Celebi sat and looked at her plate and bowl before Espurr nodded. Celebi sipped at her soup, it was nice and Espurr sipped it as well. Celebi put the spoon down and started.

"Look, about yesterday...I was out of line...I know that, and..."

"I'd like to discuss something else first Celebi...Wigglytuff..." Espurr said and Celebi nearly spat the sip of soup out of her mouth. Still!?

"Let me speak first...Igglybuff. I want you to comprehend her...think of her for a moment right now in silence. Then speak." Espurr said simply and Celebi calmed herself down.

A nice kid, a little spoiled, but innocent. Loved her foster siblings...loved her dad. Smiled a lot. Celebi sat in silence.

"It's not an easy thing to lose a parent, despite their true nature Celi...that's what I was trying to make you understand..." Espurr said solemnly and Celebi nodded. "We tried to make him understand that too...my mom...Azurill...both of them pushed for it...it isn't like...I intended to kill a pokemon when it started, it just..."

"Escalated?" Espurr said, much like the situation yesterday had.

Celebi nodded.

"Celebi...i'm worried that you're going to lose yourself the more you use that power...and what you did to me just makes me double down on that thought..." Celebi was about to open her mouth when Espurr said something that shocked her. "I kissed Zorua yesterday. On the cheek, for gratitude for what he had done for me...i'm sorry." She said and Celebi sighed. She had already known that, but the mental block kept Espurr from gleaming that. Celebi closed her eyes.

"I know, Zorua told me." She said and Espurr seemed surprised before nodding. "Do you want to dispose of me?" She asked and Celebi shook her head.

"I wasn't in my right mind yesterday, I-I won't do that ever again, I need you to know that..." Celebi said.

"Celebi...I thought the world of you you know...I was jealous...not of your power or anything like that, you never desired to bring attention to that...but of your kindness, your optimism, your silly naivete that seemed to make the room light up...I think you're losing that..." Espurr said and Celebi quietly took a bite of her salad.

"I'm not any different than the pokemon you knew...i'm not..." She said. Espurr looked at her.

"You've shrunk 4 pokemon...a delinquent that's more or less reformed, a small child with his own share of problems, a depraved soul who still had a family, and myself. You had options beyond shrinking to deal with all 4 but opted for the shrinking one. It has altered lived irrevocably and ended a life. Please say you understand why i'm doing this?" Espurr urged and Celebi put her fork down.

"What do you want me to do? I just wanted to reconcile our friendship..." Celebi said, she didn't know if she was annoyed or not...once again, but she reigned it in. She wouldn't direct it at Espurr, she'd hear her out.

"I want you...to be the kind, considerate Celebi I grew to love, and not someone that would harm without considering the consequences...my heart goes out to Igglybuff and all of her siblings...in a way that I truly don't think you understand." She said, her voice cracking a little and Celebi realized what she was talking about.

Celebi's dad was merely divorced from her mom, and she still saw him a lot. Espurr's mom had...

Celebi looked down as she remembered that...was she doing that to Igglybuff? To all of those kids? Wigglytuff deserved it! But if he had gone to jail...

Something inside Celebi clicked.

"Espurr...I am so, so sorry..." She said, tears almost welling up. Espurr smiled, she had gotten through to her. "I won't...I won't use the power on a pokemon unwilling ever again..." She said and Espurr nodded, tears rolling down her cheeks. "Good...then let's finish dinner, and have some cake..." She said and Celebi looked up, tears rolling down her cheeks too.

The rest of the evening went fine, Celebi reconciled the fact that she'd shrunk Espurr, and Espurr said she wouldn't intrude on Zorua. Both of them finally hugged and it was dark by the time Celebi left.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Understanding the weight of it

choices: yes
no
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content: Before we continue...Before Zorua leaves, does Celebi in her anger shrink Zorua to the same size Espurr currently is?
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: "Alright, fine! I don't need you either...

choices: Wigglytuff is helplessly eaten by Zorua...
"Hold on," a voice spoke as another legendary appeared
"Wait Zorua - don't! I've got another idea!" Celebi suddenly chimed
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
The legendary managed to locate the source of the incredible amount of rage she sensed and wore an amused look upon her face as she lifted herself off the ground to fly.

She simply had to see whoever could have mustered up so much rage and for what reason.

--

A cloud of smoke cleared. Pretty much everything in Meloetta's house was destroyed, Wigglytuff noted.

Azurill's eyes fell on the unconscious owner of the mansion, who was laying flat on the ground, completely covered in dust and small debris. She looked fine... except for the fact the she was fainted...

"Meloetta!" Azurill cried as he tried to move towards the giantess, his massive tail knocking Wigglytuff over as the blue mouse moved up to the unconscious giantess.

"Ow..." the pink rabbit whimpered as he stood up, feeling pain in his whole body.

That Draco Meteor had drained most of his energies... but at least, it had the desired effect...

Wigglytuff was forced to reconsider as two massive shadows eclipsed his incredibly tiny body.

Celebi and her mother - both wearing murderous glares upon their faces. A third giant rose behind them.

"Oh, you're so going to pay for this one dirty trick, you bug," Zorua said as he looked around the partly destroyed house, noting the unconscious Meloetta, the crying Azurill and both the raging Celebi.

"You..." Celebi spat venomously, her eyes glowing as she psychically gripped the throat of Wigglytuff, lifting him off the ground.

"I'm going to shrink you so much that you'll disappear from existence itself!" she threatened, causing the terrorized rabbit to gulp.

However, Celebi's mother didn't share her daughter's opinion. No, she had much greater plans for the tiny rabbit who just attempted to annihilate her and her daughter, along with Zorua, Azurill and Meloetta.

For that, Wigglytuff didn't deserve jail... he deserved hell. And only one pokemon in the destroyed house could give him that.

"Wigglytuff... have you got an idea of what you just did?! You insulted my daughter and menaced Zorua for no reason... and that's only the tip of the iceberg! You faked the death of one of your kids, broke in a house, attempted to murder said kid! Not to mention that you destroyed this house! No jail sentence will ever be enough to repay this all... and, despite what I try to teach my daughter, your crimes can't be forgiven... and I know a proper fate for you," she said, each word she spoke falling hard on Wigglytuff's soul... if he had one.

Held in midair by psychic, he could only watch as the pink time traveler turned around to look at Zorua.

"Zorua dear... you more than anyone in here deserve to decide the fate of this worthless bug... anything you wish for, do it." she said.

Zorua looked at the floating pink dot... and started snickering.

"With pleasure ma'am..." he said as he got closer, Celebi stepping aside to let him place his gigantic muzzle in front of the terrified rabbit.
"Hey bu-"

"Ow... my head..." Meloetta whimpered as she finally regained consciousness and sat upright, looking around dazedly, noticing the damaged that the Draco Meteor caused to her home.

She took notice of a familiar blue mouse standing beside her too. He was crying.

The giantess quietly picked him up and hugged him to her chest, before looking where the trio was standing, a minuscule pink speck floating in midair, almost invisible to the naked eye.

Meloetta glared.
"... Pick a proper fate, Zorua." she encouraged.

Zorua snickered.
"Ya heard the ladies?" he asked Wigglytuff, his words menacing to break the rabbit's eardrums due the closeness of the fox and his much bigger size.

"... Wigglytuff, d'you remember earlier, when I suggested Celebi to keep you as our pet? I did mention ‘I'm getting hungry’..." Zorua recalled, and Wigglytuff went pale like death.

Like the death he was probably going to face...

"Guess what bug... I'm hungry!"

Dark Wigglytuff's world became as Zorua leaned forward, his lips parting briefly before closing around the pink dot.

Heat. Darkness. Razor-sharp teeth. And a dreadful abyss of death.

Those were the things Wigglytuff noted as a giant red muscle started throwing him back and forth inside the confines of Zorua's mouth as the fox tasted the small rabbit... although it resulted pretty hard for him to do so, he discovered, due how small Wigglytuff was.

From the confines of his hot entrapment, Wigglytuff whimpered... it was over. Zorua would swallow with no doubt, and he was going to meet the fox's stomach up close...

"Please... I saved Azurill!" he cried, his body hit with huge drops of saliva.

"... You also attempted to kill him, so you two are even! But you also destroyed this house, and that can't go unpunished I'm afraid... or pleased to say!" Zorua snickered, showing his tiny prisoner each time his mouth opened.

As for the rabbit, he was forced to hold his ears, Zorua's words comparable to explosions as he was just on the edge of his vocal chords.

The dark fox savored the moment - and his prey - as long as he could, before grinning as he started to tilt his head backwards...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: The anger of the giants

choices: Follow Zorua and company
Follow Wigglytuff and Mesprit
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"Please, hold on. Don't swallow him just yet." They heard a foreign voice approach as slowly, a pokemon they didn't recognize floated down...it was Mesprit. "Please, that tiny pokemon in your mouth...I felt a sublime amount of rage coming from him. Absolutely intense...right now, it's an absolutely palpable fear!" She said excitedly and Zorua looked amused.

"As it should be." He said, raining hell and noise upon Wigglytuff with every syllable. "He's earned this fate lady, and I need to see to it that it's carried out." He grinned, about to swallow before Mesprit stopped him again.

"It seems to me that..." She looked around the destroyed house. "...A lot has happened here, and I can tell you I have no context for..." She looked at the tiny crying Azurill being hugged and petted by Meloetta. "Any of it. But all the same, it has been a long LONG time since I felt a pokemon with such intense emotion. You're done with him? Want to punish him?...I guess that would be fair buuuut." Mesprit smiled and held out her paw.

"Can I have him? Please?" She said and both Celebi's looked at her shocked.

"Ma'am, you don't want him, he's nothing but trouble. He's a...a..."

"Scoundrel?" Mesprit offered, making Zorua chuckle a bit, a raging torrent of sound to the speck drenched in a lake of saliva.

"Oh, what could a tiny speck do to me? Well, aside from that metronome, but if he tried it i'd just crush him in a second." The Mesprit said nonchalantly and Zorua couldn't help but chuckle at this as well.

"Y'know what...I don't know you lady and I don't care, but if you want the maggot then you can have him, I can't taste him anyway." Wigglytuff felt a torrent of wind as he was spat out at a catastrophic speed before anticlimactically stopping in the air, being held by Mesprit's psychic force.

"Oh boy...a new toy~" She said with joy as Wigglytuff whimpered at the new goddess before him, her voice just as powerful as the other gods in the room. This was the end for him.

'Make peace with yourself Wigglytuff'

Azurill's words echoed in his mind as he felt the fringes of his sanity fading, and he started laughing, and laughing and laughing. And crying. And laughing. And crying. And crying. Mesprit just smirked.

"This will be a fun toy." She said, savoring his emotions as she levitated away from the scene, with the broken Wigglytuff in tow.

"...This is a disaster. I hope that little pink bunny gets tormented as much as possible. That last emotional break from him give me hope." Zorua said as he looked around the mansion, he noted that Meloetta was humming something and Azurill had stopped crying.

"What's up..." He said, but started to feel a bit drowsy.

"Dear, you don't want to listen to me right now~" Meloetta said. "Though I just finished~" And she craddled the tiny sleeping Azurill in her paws. "He needed it~" She said gently and Zorua nodded, before looking around.

"Young lady, i'm terribly sorry about all of this." The voice of Celebi's mother echoed behind her. "Oh...it isn't your fault~ Not in the least...everything here can be repaired~"

"Can you...afford it?" She asked and Meloetta tilted her head before smiling. "Oh, yes I can~ 10 times over in fact~" She giggled and Zorua's jaw dropped.

Celebi for her part didn't look surprised.

"Okay, just WHAT do you do?" He asked and both Meloetta and Celebi looked at him smiling. "Secret~" Meloetta winked and Zorua looked down.

"...Make sure the pool is fixed...for his sake." He said seriously and Celebi giggled. "You just want to swim again."

"Well...if you need a place to stay until repairs are finished, you and Azurill are more than welcome in our home...i'd like to talk with the kid anyways...about what to do with him going forward." Celebi's mother looked at the sleeping child.

"He's sticking with us...isn't he?" Zorua said and she turned to him.

"It'll be hard for him to go back...he's legally dead. That creates some obstacles...for all of us. But Wigglytuff is gone, and we're going to need to confront that too. He had children under his charge, and we need to take responsibility in that regard. Azurill...has some tough decisions to make. And they need to be respected. I'll also be talking with you two at length about what exactly has been going on." She eyed her daughter and Zorua at this and Celebi nodded.

"What he decides...i'll help him with. If he wants to be normal again...I won't stop him." She said. "But he seems happy now." Zorua said looking at him.

Meloetta for her part bit her lip and gently patted his head as he slept, he seemed to appreciate it, even unconscious.

"I have some calls to make, get arrangements for repairs, i'd be more than happy to stay with you three for the time being though~" Meloetta smiled again and spoke in her normal melodious voice.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Mesprit's toy and picking up the pieces

choices: "I suppose you can stay here."
"I'll have to consider it."
"We'll figure out another home for you, same as the kids."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
The group made their way from the semi destroyed mansion, as they walked away, they noted Espurr's mansion on the way to Celebi's and wondered if they should stop there, but figured it best to not.

"When we get to the village proper Zorua..." Celebi started but he cut her off and nodded.

"I'll put an illusion on the kid to make him seem like a pokedoll." He said simply, talking about the sleeping Azurill that was being carried by Meloetta.

"When we get there we also need to talk about what you two have been doing as well together - while Meloetta gets acquainted with the guest room and Azurill sleeps." Celebi's mother said as they walked through the forest.

"I know..." Celebi said looking down.

"Understood ma'am." Zorua said, not looking back at her as he lead the way through the darkness. It was a surreal experience to him honestly, he didn't doubt that a few weeks ago, none of the pokemon in his company would want to meet him out here...in his forest.

"Sure you don't want one of us to carry that?" Zorua nodded to Meloetta, as in her arms, held to her chest was both the sleeping Azurill and an Azumarill pokedoll.

"I'm afraid not, even asleep he likes the pokedoll~" She said and Zorua nodded.

"Okay...so...for real though, I know I threatened specky with it, but I AM hungry." He said and Celebi allowed herself a smile.

"I think all of us are a little hungry Zorua...and tired i'm sure too. It's getting very late..." She said. It was true, the sun had to have set at least an hour ago.

"I'll order us something..." The tired voice of Celebi's mother cut through the night and Zorua grinned.

"Pizza!" He said in an excited tone. "All meat!"

Celebi rolled her eyes. "Don't be selfish...a pizza sounds good though." She said and Celebi's mother nodded.

"I'll order...probably that." She relented and Zorua whistled a bit.

"Please dear, I know you're excited but he's sleeping~" Meloetta asked politely.

"...We need to discuss the matter of what he'll do la-"

"I know I know, but that's later right? For now...let's just worry about one thing at a time. Getting us all fed...rested...and having our nice chat about us" Zorua teased, he was changing the subject, and Celebi was certain he was going to prolong dealing with asking Azurill if he wanted to be normal and leave them for as long as possible.

-

"I know it isn't a mansion, but..." Celebi's mother was showing Meloetta the guest room. A simple room with a two person bed, which currently occupied a tiny sleeping Azurill and his doll, a desk with a lamp, and a small closet.

"It's wonderful~ Thank you very much for having us~" Meloetta bowed her head to the older Celebi who just rubbed a paw to the side of her head.

"Oh, it's really no trouble. Sorry again about what happened earlier...I need to go make some phone calls. Ordering the food and I need to let my boss i'll be out tomorrow...I don't really want to leave things alone right now. Then...I need to talk to them." She looked behind her to see Celebi and Zorua on the couch in the living room, with him listing off various pizza toppings as Celebi rolled her eyes.

"If you or Azurill have any questions, myself or Celebi are happy to answer or assist." She said as she went to make her calls.

"Will you wake him for the food?" Celebi's mom asked and Meloetta looked back.

"I'd rather him sleep through the night, but he does need to eat...I probably will~" She said looking a slight bit concerned for the child...she didn't want to admit it but...she hoped Azurill would stay with her. Tiny or not.

-

"We've got some time before the food is here...now...explain it." Celebi and Zorua looked at the pink Celebi in front of them, her arms folded and tone stern.

"Well ma'am...i've uh...been staying here...for a bit now. The shrinking ability your daughter has...she's..." He found himself somewhat at a loss for words, it was difficult to explain.

"Mom, Zorua's my boyfriend." She just decided to rip that band-aid off. "He's homeless, didn't have anywhere to go and he was the first pokemon I shrunk after he pranked me. We...went through a lot when I did that, and I wanted to make things right with him. I offered him the chance to stay with me under your radar shrunken down and we grew attached from there." Celebi bowed her head.

"I'm sorry mom, I know how you feel about me dating but...he's a good guy, beneath the bluster and ego...he's a real sweetheart." She said and Zorua blushed.

The older Celebi sighed. "This has been one large mess missy...and the two pokemon in the next room got wrapped up in your shenanigans as well...then there's the matter of Wigglytuff..." She sighed again. "At least...he can't hurt anyone anymore though, and we have your shenanigans to thank for that too I suppose." Her look softened. "You're really homeless Zorua..."

"It's a sorry story ma'am."

"Tell it to us sometime...you might feel better." She said and Zorua chuckled slightly.

"That sounds exactly like something a friend told me..." He had told Espurr that night...it felt like a lifetime ago now, the time he spent with his dad.

"As for the living accommodations you have now..."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Recuperating

choices: Tiny and adorable - Celebi shrinks Zorua
No need to hide anymore - Celebi keeps Zorua normal-sized
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"Well Zorua... I suppose you can stay here after all..." Celebi's mom said.

The dark fox grinned while Celebi smiled.

"But I don't want to see or hear anything weird coming from you two... am I clear?" the pink fairy asked.

Celebi and Zorua blushed.
"Mom!" the green fairy screamed, and the pink one looked at the door of the other room, before looking back at the couple.
"Quiet!" she exclaimed, and Celebi sighed.

"We... wouldn't dream of it ma'am." Zorua stated.

‘Not yet~’

Celebi's mom nodded.
"Good." she said, before getting up. Celebi did too.
"We'll be in my room until they deliver dinner mom." she said, motioning for Zorua to follow.

The dark type smiled at the mother of his girlfriend in gratitude, before leaping off his chair and following Celebi inside her room.

Only when she heard the door closing, Celebi's mom smiled brightly.
"My little girl's grown up so fast... and now she's in love..." she said, wiping a tear from her eyes.

--

The couple sat on the bed, cuddling.

"I'm so happy Zorua!" Celebi squealed in excitement as she buried her head into Zorua's fur. The fox grinned.
"Same here."

Happy was an approximation. Both pokemon were on cloud nine. Not only Celebi's mom approved their relationship - she was letting Zorua stay in the house too!

Life seemed to have improved for the fox.

He got a house, friends, girlfriend and Wigglytuff was gone, in the hands of some legendary, getting toyed with.

...

Although, one more thing lingered in Zorua's mind.

"Celi..." he called.
"Hm~?"

"Listen, I've got something to tell..." Celebi removed her head from Zorua's fur... he was looking at her, his eyes staring straight into hers as he wore a serious expression.

Celebi got that something was wrong.

"... Yes?" she asked, concerned.

Zorua looked away for a moment.
"Y'see-" a knock at the door interrupted him.

A brief conversation followed, before the duo heard the front door closing.

Then, someone knocked at the door of Celebi's room.
"Kids! Dinner!" her mom called. The green fairy looked at Zorua, who shook his head.

"Later." he said as he jumped off the bed and onto the floor.

Celebi nodded, wondering what was up with him as she fluttered to the door and opened it.

Then, the couple headed to the kitchen.

--

"So... that Mesprit lady brought Wigglytuff away..." Azurill said, munching on his pizza. Meloetta had woken him up for dinner like she said... much to Azurill's annoyance.

Whoever fell victim of Meloetta's songs usually slept for a good while afterwards.

Zorua snickered.
"Yep~ Hope she's using him as a toy like she promised... Hey, have you seen him when they left? That bunny totally lost it!" he remarked, merrily thinking of all the fun - horrible - things Mesprit was doing to the rabbit at the moment.

"D'you think we'll see her again? She seemed nice..." Celebi wondered, gulping down the remains of a slice of pizza.
"Mischievous~" Meloetta added with a smile.

Celebi's mom smiled.

"I'm sure we'll see her again... Hopefully, in better circumstances..." she said.

Celebi giggled... before her gaze casually traveled to Zorua.

He was looking down at his pizza, looking at it with that serious expression she saw earlier.

She bit her lip.

Just what did he want to tell? Why was he acting weird?

Celebi couldn't help but smile.

Whatever was bothering Zorua... she wasn't going to let him sleep until he told her.

--

The five pokemon retreated inside of their respective rooms.

But Zorua looked surprised when Celebi slammed the door of her room close and locked it, before turning around to smirk at her boyfriend.

"Now, you either tell me what's going on or you're not going to sleep Zorua." she playfully threatened.

For a moment, Zorua changed back to his usual self.
"Trust me - I can sleep in every circumstance." he snickered, leaping on top of he bed, Celebi sitting beside him.

Zorua's grin dropped.

"... Anyway, I was thinking... your mom knows about us now, no?" he said. Celebi nodded.
"What about it?" she asked, adopting a serious look.

Zorua looked at her and sighed.
"Well... then, there's no need for me to... to stay doll-sized again, no? I mean, I don't have to hide any longer..." he asked.

Celebi stared at him.

And then, she started laughing.

"Hey! I'm serious!" Zorua scolded, but Celebi ignored him.

"Zorua, that was bothering you?" she kept laughing and Zorua assumed and indignant look.

Celebi finally stopped and smiled.

"Zorua, It's totally up to you... although I must say, I love having you tiny and helpless in my paws like a doll... a cute little doll which I can dress up~" she giggled.
"I'm still throwing off all the doll clothes you buy me." he said.

In response, Celebi smirked and pointed to the green bow on top of her nightstand.

Zorua blushed, defeated.

"... Anyway, I don't know... so that's... that's why... you pick..." he said.

Celebi smiled.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Staying... but how?

choices: "Azurill...it's about what you want to do from here on out."
"Would you like to go out with us into the village? A day to relax."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"I won't lie Zorua...you're just too adorable when you're tiny~" She said merrily as he sighed. So doll sized it was right? He didn't mind it he supposed, and it wasn't permanent either.

He felt the familiar sensation of the world growing as he was shrunk down and soon his girlfriend was a giant to him once more. It had been a little bit since he had been this small. She picked him up and pecked his cheek, the familiar feeling of it taking up his entire cheek like this.

"Hey you~" And the familiar loudness of her voice at this size as well. He smiled back.

"Yeah, hey." He said. It was settled at least, and he didn't need to worry about it. For the time being...this size was fine.

"Tomorrow will be a better day." She said as he felt tremors around him, her moving to her bed.

"Tonight we rest, g'night Zorua~" The lights psychically flicked off and he felt the warmth of her lips one more time before he was pulled to her chest. Warmth surrounding him as he let one final thought enter his mind.

'This is the best thing that ever happened to me...'

-

"Azurill dear, time to go back to bed~" He heard the giant voice of his care taker, friend and...he didn't know if he wanted to call her mom...to her at least. It was uncomfortable to think about when his real mom was...was...he shook his head as he stopped staring out the window.

"Okay!" He said as the giantess came over and gently picked him up from the nightstand and placed him on the bed.

"Tomorrow I need to make phone calls to repair my house~" She said merrily as she got into bed and placed him on the pillow next to her. He was looking at her giant smiling face. He himself moved off of the pillow and nuzzled against her chest.

"...Okay~" She said, getting the message as she gently wrapped a paw around him. He didn't see her face but she frowned slightly.

"Do you...like staying with me~" She asked.

"Yes, I do Meloetta...you're...you're a great pokemon." He said. He was unsure of calling it to her. He couldn't yet.

"And being small~"

"It's not so bad when you get used to it, really." He said. He was familiar with the loudness of everyone and just how big they were, and the fact that traversal was a real chore, though his tail granted him opportunities to get places pokemon would probably think he couldn't get to at least.

"...Do you want me to sing again~" She asked.

"No...I can sleep on my own. Thank you though, Meloetta." He nuzzled into her warmth and closed his eyes.

"Goodnight Azurill~"

-

The older Celebi sighed as she was in the kitchen cleaning up, everyone else had already gone to bed and she wore a tired expression. "What a day..." She muttered, she had taken the next few days off. In that time she needed to figure out how to deal with Azurill, the other kids Wigglytuff had, discuss how long Meloetta would be staying under her roof, and smooth over Wigglytuff's disappearance from the village.

It was going to be a long few days...maybe tomorrow they should...do something to wash the taste of today out of their mouths though. She thought about that. Before finishing up her work and going to her room. She needed sleep.

-

"Azurill, wake up~" The melodious voice stirred the tiny pokemon as he noted that Meloetta and both Celebi's were smiling at him. No Zorua?

"Hey guy..." The drowsy voice of Zorua...at a normal volume caught his attention as he saw the, to him, normal sized Zorua standing on the bed too. Looking absolutely tired.

"It's a bit early to get out of bed...but they won't let us sleep." He said and Celebi smiled.

"We'll make you an early bird yet." She said and Meloetta giggled.

"Come on Azurill, we need to talk about something~"

Azurill nodded. "What are we doing?"

The older Celebi spoke.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: End of the day and the dawn of a new one

choices: "Like we decided earlier, leave him like that and throw him somewhere!"
"He kept me for many years... now I'm going to keep him, as a pet!"
"Let's send him to the other kids... like that!"
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"Wait Zorua! I've got an idea!" Celebi suddenly chimed, causing her boyfriend to get his head back into place.

"What?" he snorted, a tidal wave of saliva raining down on the half deafened Wigglytuff.

"I-"

Before Celebi could speak, a grey pokemon came inside the destroyed mansion, gazing at both Celebi and Zorua.

"... Espurr!" Zorua chimed, with something between a smile and a surprised expression on his face.

The small psychic-type, whose face was completely red from her run, bent her knees and placed her paws on them.

"Gu-Guys..." she panted, swallowing after a deep breath.
"I... heard... an explosion. I saw... the Meteors... from my window, and I... came here... as fast as I... could. Are you... ok-okay?"

"We're fine." Zorua stated with a frown on his face.
"It was because of this bug-"

The lake of spittle Wigglytuff was soaking in suddenly became a planet and, him in the middle of it, was shot out of the galaxy of Zorua's mouth.

The immense glob of saliva broke his fall to the ground before exploding into a thousand droplets.

"... The Draco Meteor was his. He tried to kill Azurill, but we stopped him; Celebi shrunk him, but-"

"Zorua, I read your mind, I precisely know all that had been going on..." Espurr chimed, having regained enough breath to speak properly.

Celebi hastily put up a mental block.

"... Are you all alright?" the lilac-eyed psychic-type asked again as her gaze went from the shaken Celebi to the irritated Zorua to the murderous mother of Celebi, from the angry Meloetta to the startled Azurill.

Azurill.

"... You all want revenge, don't you?" Espurr chimed,
"But from what I'm picking up in Azurill's thoughts, he's the one that suffered the most because of Wigglytuff,"

A minuscule tingle of guilt formed on the bottom of Wigglytuff, but it was quickly replaced by fear as Espurr spoke again,

"Why don't you let him put an end to this? He more than anyone deserves it."

Celebi's mom stepped in,

"Dear, Azurill's just a little kid, he would never-"

"That's exactly what I mean, miss," Espurr interrupted,
"I know, killing him would put an end to this, but it would be excessive, even for Wigglytuff. But if he becomes a pet instead..."

"I was about to say the same thing," Celebi chimed in,
"We would solve this whole problem without murdering anyone. Azurill,"

The green fairy turned to face the blue mouse held by Meloetta.

He gulped.

"I... I don't know... why don't you let Zorua eat him? Do anything you want, I don't care! I don't want to see him again!" he exclaimed, and Meloetta hugged harder.

"Think, Azurill. He might be a monster, but he still took care of you, no? I don't think we should kill him either." the green-headed pokemon chimed.

Wigglytuff gulped, these giants were discussing his fate like a bunch of kids deciding deciding how to get rid of a broken toy.

If only he could have used Metronome again...

The rabbit tried to move his finger, but he found that he couldn't move at all.

His gaze darted across the room, until he discovered Espurr with glowing eyes.

"Nice try... but your last attempt to get free has fail- I'm not creepy." she said, reading the thoughts of the tiny rabbit.

"Ha! Nice try!" Zorua chimed, placing a paw on Epsurr's shoulder, causing the psychic-type to blush vaguely and Celebi to bite her lip.

"Now kid, about this bug... what do we do with him?" Zorua continued.

Azurill looked down.

"... I dunno." he replied with a faint voice, thing empathized by the fact that he was still incredibly tiny,
"He can't go unpunished, that's for sure, but if we don't kill him either, then I don't know what to do with him..."

Silence fell in the destroyed house.

"Maybe we could-" Celebi was silenced by her mother shaking her head and glancing at Azurill.

Time seemed to stand still as everyone, even Wigglytuff himself, waited for Azurill's sentence.

Ultimately, the blue mouse held in Meloetta's paws rose his head and spoke,
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Espurr's advice

choices: Follow Zorua, Espurr, and Celebi
Follow Meloetta, Azurill, Wigglytuff, and Celebi's mom
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Azurill looked to the tiny Wigglytuff with a mixture of disdain, pity and sadness before he spoke. "Give him to the other kids...I think that's what's best." Azurill said, before he got looks from the giants around him.

"Is that wise?" Celebi asked before Espurr spoke up.

"It isn't like he can do much beyond that metronome...and that could just as easily backfire on him. The kids'll need help adjusting for sure, and you'll need to come clean about a lot of things, including Azurill's well being, but it ultimately works out for Igglybuff, the kids, and keeps Wigglytuff alive, no matter how pathetic."

Wigglytuff couldn't believe what he was hearing, he was going to be the pet of his daughter, and the kids he raised!? That was-

"It's the best you could hope for Wigglytuff, i'd advise you to take this mercy and not throw it away." Espurr said and he gulped at the giantess and her words.

"We need to make sure they don't talk though...even considering that they'll be probably taken away to somewhere else." Zorua mused and Celebi's mother spoke up.

"I'll try to smooth things over, i'm sure we can explain things in a delicate enough way that they'll understand. Azurill, Meloetta, i'll ask you to come with us as well." She was smiling to the two pokemon and Meloetta nodded. "Of course."

Azurill looked down, he was going to see his friends again...at least there was that.

"...Yeah." He said before smiling back.

The older Celebi regarded the teenagers. "You can come if you want to as well, it's up to you sweetie." And Celebi shrugged before Zorua shook his head.

"Nah, i'm spent." He said and Celebi looked to him.

"...We'll be fine mom, though Meloetta, Azurill...where will you stay?"

Meloetta was about to speak before her mom interjected again.

"You may stay at our place for the time being, if you'd like." She said with a smile and Meloetta bowed.

"That would be wonderful ma'am."

And with that Wigglytuff found himself grabbed by a psychic aura as he was lifted away from the ground, away from the only pokemon that could grow him, and on his way to his new fate.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Wigglytuff's on his way

choices: Celebi agreed to stay for the night
Celebi disagreed, she and Zorua had things to take care of
Right then, the trio heard screaming, something was going on in the village
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Mesprit stopped in mid-air, two yellow eyes sparkling in the darkness of the night as she folded her arms, adopting a disappointed look.

The immense rage had subsided a while ago now, and she wasn't able to keep track of it anymore as it was lost between thousands of other emotions.

The legendary sighed, she came this far for nothing.

Now what?

--

While Wigglytuff was helplessly dragged to his fate by those three giants that were his captors, Celebi, Zorua and Espurr remained in the smoking debris that once was Meloetta's house, now completely destroyed by the purple meteor that still lingered inside, in deep craters they created on the floor.

"Great. Just great." Celebi sarcastically stated as a hand found its way to her face.

She felt an annoying ache in her head, caused either by all the screaming or by the abuse of her size-changing ability today.

To ease things, she removed the psychic shield from her mind, allowing it to be read by Espurr.

But the psychic-type remained quiet.

"Now what?" Zorua spoke instead as he looked around the destroyed house, his gaze going from the shattered windows to the smashed ceiling, from the several expensive objects that caught fire to a completely destroyed staircase.

"Damn Wigglytuff... wreck a place like this... I hope those kids eat him!" Zorua commented with a frown, causing his girlfriend to giggle lowly.

"I don't think staying here will repair anything," Espurr finally spoke as she looked at the couple in front of her, noting how much bigger they were than her. It was ironic in a sense, since Zorua spent most of his time doll-sized.

"Let's go to my place, some tea might calm your nerves, and I'll arrange something for your headache too Celi," she offered, deadpan.

But her expression was all but deadpan when, with a vague blush across her cheeks, she jumped on Zorua's back.

The fox blushed too, but didn't oppose, now used to pokemon riding him like he was a Ponyta; plus, it was Espurr, his best-

A second weight dropped on him, behind Espurr; it didn't take long to realize that Celebi had gotten on his back too.

"Let's go!" she squeaked in a high-pitched voice and in way-too-impatient manner that made Espurr smirk as she savored the jealous thoughts of Celebi.

Zorua grunted.

"You two are heavy!" he exclaimed; his declaration was followed by a slender green paw slapping the back of his head, before some of the weight was lifted; he noted his girlfriend fluttering away from the destroyed area at supersonic speed.

"Rude!"

"Celi?" the shock increased when Espurr climbed down as well and began walking towards her house.

"Girls? Come on, did I say something wrong? What's the matter?" he uselessly asked, receiving no response from the two leaving girls.

Sighing, he hurried behind the two.

‘Girls.’

--

It took a while and several sips from a steaming cup of tea for Celebi to calm down after Zorua's statement, which could easily be compared to a deadly sin.

But in the end, Espurr and the fairy left the subject behind to focus on what was currently happening.

"Seriously-" Celebi paused to swallow a couple of tablets Espurr gave her; she shivered slightly, before laying down on her friend's couch.

"... What do you think will happen now?"

"I dunno..."

"Your mom and Meloetta will probably try to convince the kids to keep quiet about their..." Espurr trailed off.

"... Daddy dearest. That son of a-" Zorua chimed, but was interrupted by a glare on Celebi's face.

Meekly, he moved beside her and sat down, cuddling himself to her; she gladly accepted the physical contact by wrapping her arms around to fox, brushing herself against him.

Espurr's cup trembled in her paws at the sight, but she remained calm.

"The kids will either agree and keep the promise or will follow Wigglytuff's orders. One of the two." she resumed with a hint of worry, before glancing at Celebi,
"But yeah, if they do, you can undo it and change Wigglytuff's fate, make him Azurill's pet instead."

Celebi was reminded that her psychic block wasn't there and she hastily put it back up, keeping Espurr's mind out of hers.

"Well, that's a good idea..." Zorua agreed quietly, causing Espurr to smirk.

"You're just bitter because you loved that house. Sure, you're glad that everyone survived that cataclysm, but it was still a great house, huh?"

Celebi looked at the blushing Zorua, unwrapping her arms from him.
"Me, my mom, your friend and mine are fine Zorua, thank you for caring." she remarked sarcastically,
"God, you have the priorities of a spoiled child..."

"Isn't that why we're together right now?" Zorua mused, nudging the fairy, who responded by hugging the fox again.

Espurr put her empty cup with a bit more strength that she intended.

"I was thinking," she said, the hint of a smile on her face,
"Why don't you two stay here for the night? Y'know, a sleepover. I have quite a few movies we can watch, and dad isn't coming home and - your mom discovered about you two and wants to confront you."

Celebi, who opened her mouth to speak, closed it and nodded: Espurr must have read Zorua's mind, since hers was blocked.

"Yeah... after tonight, I doubt she'll kick Zorua out, but we can't be sure... plus, Meloetta and Azurill are staying with us now, they need to be taken care of as well," Celebi recalled the words of her mother and forcefully swallowed a lump in her throat: the thought that she could lose Zorua tonight tied itself around her stomach tightly, like a knot, and it squeezed pretty hard, like an Ekans with a particularly chubby Rattata.

Espurr smiled, comprehensive.

"I understand," she said as Zorua began looking anxious too,
"But if you were you, I'd let things calm down a bit first."

"She's right..." Zorua agreed, causing his girlfriend to sigh.

Celebi pondered her next choice.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: A tranquil night?

choices: The next morning...
During the night...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Celebi knew she and Zorua had business to take care of back home, but she decided that her friend and boyfriend had a point.

She knew that her mom was probably going to be furious if she delayed the impeding confrontation that awaited both her and the fox, but at the same time the elder time-traveler was surely enough exhausted and stressed after the events of the night.

So, Celebi decided that the best thing to do was to spend the night at Espurr's. A sleepover sounded good anyway.

The fairy allowed herself to smile.

"Sure guys," she agreed,
"It'll be fun. "

Zorua grinned.

"Great!" he chimed, sliding a paw towards his girlfriend, who accepted the physical contact with a vague blush on her cheeks.

Espurr offered a somber smile.

"I'll get everything ready then," she said, hopping off the couch and heading to her kitchen.

"I'll help." Celebi decided as she followed her friend, leaving Zorua alone on the couch.

The fox watched his friend and his beloved girlfriend leaving the room and sighed, hoping this wasn't the last bit of fun he and Celebi had together before confronting her mother.

In the kitchen, reading his thoughts, a certain psychic-type smiled.

That uncaring, cold and sadistic fox that once was Zorua had changed a lot.

--

Huddled in a nice, warm blanket, the trio sat on Espurr's couch, watching a movie, though no one was really paying attention to it.

Zorua and Celebi had too much in their heads to pay the screen any attention while Espurr... well, Espurr's mind was full of the theirs as read their thoughts.

She discovered that the two were both thinking about what happened earlier at Meloetta's house, but not only that: both were also thinking about a certain pink Celebi, who was probably going to be upset when they returned home the next morning.

And Celebi's upset mom surely couldn't be a good start to explain everything that had been going on between her daughter and her daughter's boyfriend.

Espurr adopted a sympathetic smile.

"You two are wondering if your mom is gonna let Zorua stay at your place... and if she is gonna let you two keep seeing each other." she pointed out, causing Celebi to sigh and Zorua to blush.

"Um... yeah," the fox replied,
"Kind of."

"I don't think mom will kick him out if we can give her a good explanation, " the fairy spoke, kicking her legs nervously while glancing at both her boyfriend and Espurr,
"I mean, Zorua helped stopping Wigglytuff. Thing is, we've lied to her. And well... she doesn't like being lied to."

At the mention, one of the time-traveler petite paws grabbed Zorua's rougher one in a quite strong grip.

The fox remained silent, though Espurr needed no words.

"Yeah, being kicked out would be quite unpleasant. You've come so far, Zorua, became a better pokemon, so different from the one you were before.
You matured in both heart and mind, and all in just a few weeks. I must admit I am truly impressed." she said, blushing furiously but smiling brightly.

Zorua too blushed furiously.

"... Thanks, I've had a lot of help." he replied, looking in between the two girls, who both embraced him.

The fox's blush became more intense, but the sensation he felt was rather nice.

It was sad that it probably wasn't going to last long though.

--

The night went on, movie after movie, until the three occupants of Espurr's house didn't declare their intention to go to sleep.

So, after having shut the TV off, Espurr led her guests to her bedroom, which left Zorua speechless as it was far, far bigger than the small bedroom he used to share with his girlfriend, and it was surely far, far better than the cold hard ground he used to call 'bed' back in the woods where he previously lived.

A single glance at the bed was enough to make it feel embarrassed. If Espurr's sleepovers were similar to Celebi's, that meant the two girls were going to share the bed.

Zorua flushed red.

Of course, he had already shared a bed with both, but that was before Celebi became his actual girlfriend... and when he was doll-sized.

"Um... perhaps I should take the couch..." he pointed out, starting to retreat back from where the trio came from... only to halt when a ball of shrinking energy was shot straight into his body, diminishing him to only a couple inches. His small body was hastily picked up by a smiling Celebi,

"Dream on, cutie~" she sang, pecking her diminutive boyfriend. Espurr watched the scene in silence, smiling a bit. Both her friends were lucky to have each other, she felt happy for them... though she was sure she would have felt happier if Zorua-

The psychic-type discarded such line of thinking.

"It's quite late. Let's go to bed." she chimed instead, pulling back the blankets of the huge bed with Psychic.

Both giantesses slid into the bed, Celebi hugging the tiny Zorua to her chest.

"Goodnight, you two~" the fairy chimed while the lights were turned off by the same Psychic from before.

She received drowsy replies.

As for Zorua, he leaned into his girlfriend's chest, hugging back. If this truly was going to be his last night with her, he was going to enjoy it.

The fox let the warmth envelop him like a second blanket and relaxed.

Soon, he, along with the two giantesses, was asleep.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Night at Espurr's

choices: "Yeah, you can stay...just no funny business." She said.
"I'm sorry, but...the answer is no." She said.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"..ua...Zorua..." The voice was invading Zorua's senses as he furrowed his brow and grumbled. "Go away...let me sleep." He mumbled, it was then that the ground beneath him left as he soared into the air, landing on a pillow as Celebi gently tossed him into it. Zorua for his part tumbled down off of it and onto the sheets on his back, his eyes now open as he looked into the deadpan face of Espurr and the smiling face of Celebi.

"Keep doing this and i'll get more creative ways to wake you up." Celebi said and he sighed before rolling over onto his paws and stretching out, yawning as he did so. "Fine fine, i'm up okay? Yeesh." He said as he rubbed at his chin with a paw. Celebi picked him up again and pecked him on the cheek, making him blush. "Good, because we've got a monumental task ahead of us." Celebi said as she sighed. "Convincing my mom to let you stick around as my boyfriend." Celebi said and Zorua himself looked a little down before he flashed his colossal girlfriend a grin. "Ah, I got this! I just gotta work my charms on her. Plus, I bet Meloetta and Azurill will vouch for me." He said before Celebi giggled a bit at her boyfriend's confidence and bravado. "I'm sure, though that isn't what i'm worried about..."

Espurr watched the conversation in silence before she offered a small smile. "Don't worry Celebi, i'm sure that the events of yesterday did a lot to convince your mom of Zorua's character. If she made an exception at this point, i'm sure it'd be for him." Espurr said, doing her best to encourage the two. Celebi nodded as she leaned over to hug her friend. "Thanks Espurr, and thanks for having us over last night." She said, as Zorua found himself pinned in the hug between the two pokemon, feeling a bit of pressure. "G-girls, this is sweet and all, but..." Zorua felt his voice cracking as Celebi pulled away, and he tumbled onto the sheets beneath him, making Celebi giggle. "Come on Zorua, we'd better get going." Celebi said as she picked up her boyfriend and made her way out the door.

-

Celebi had restored Zorua as they made their way back to the village, her riding on his back as they passed by the ruins of Meloetta's mansion. "I hope those kids make that rabbit's life a living hell...and if he tries anything..." Zorua seethed as Celebi rolled her eyes at him. "Relax, it should be taken care of, anymore stunts from him and i'll shrink him into oblivion. Right now, we just need to focus on the task ahead of us." Celebi said as she wrapped her arms around his neck, making him blush fiercely. "Y-yeah...I just want Meloetta and Azurill to get their house back."

"So you can use their stuff?" Celebi said, half teasing half scolding.

"That's not...the only reason." Zorua defended as they walked to the village, enjoying the peace of the morning as they went on. When they finally entered the village Zorua felt eyes on him, and especially on Celebi in shock of what they were witnessing. Zorua didn't care though, at this point he wasn't too stressed about his reputation among the villagers, he'd repair it in time, especially now that a certain stupid rabbit wouldn't be saying anything anymore. He needed to focus on the conversation ahead of him.

"Oh, Zorua! Celebi!" A familiar voice chimed to Zorua's side as he saw Buneary hop over to the two. She looked cheery as she regarded Zorua and Celebi.

"Hey Buneary, how's it goin'?" Zorua asked with a carefree grin as Celebi smiled warmly at the bunny pokemon.

"Oh, it's going well, my mom gave me some money for sweets, so I was gonna get some then go see if I could spend time with Azurill, Meloetta would be fine with that, right?" She said before Celebi blinked and Zorua frowned slightly.

"Uh, kid, you should come with us...we can explain on the way." Zorua said as Buneary looked confused but complied.

-

Celebi opened the door to her house, quietly and nervously, anticipating what was to come, she noted the light on in the kitchen, and thought she heard chatter. The three pokemon entered the house, Celebi leading as they went in to find that the older Celebi and Meloetta were sitting at a table as Azurill sat on his tail on the table, all three chatting as the older Celebi and Meloetta sipped at some coffee. "Hey mom..." Celebi said with a smile. The older Celebi looked to her daughter with a warm smile. "Hello dear, I assume you stayed over at Espurr's last night?" She said and Celebi nodded. Zorua and Buneary entered the kitchen as well at this point, Zorua looking incredibly nervous. "And Zorua, just the pokemon I wanted to talk to." The older Celebi said as she sipped her coffee.

"Hi Ms. Celebi, Ms. Meloetta, Azurill!" Buneary chimed in, smiling. And Meloetta giggled. "Hello dear."

"Hey Buneary! And Zorua and Celebi!" Azurill said, as Buneary went to pick him up, Zorua rolled his eyes. "Can see who the favorite is..." He said as his gaze met the older Celebi's, a bit nervously.

"Meloetta, Buneary, Azurill, may I have a moment alone with my daughter and Zorua please?" She asked, her voice composed and friendly, though the statement was more or less a command. Meloetta got up from the table as she and Buneary exited the room, Azurill in tow.

"So uh...how'd the other thing go?" Zorua asked as the pink Celebi sighed. "With Wigglytuff? That was quite the charged discussion with those kids, and a lot of them didn't quite believe it, though Azurill being there seemed to convince them to an extent that he was keeping things from them. As for Azurill, you can grow him back anytime dear."

"I will later on today most likely...but that isn't what you wanted to discuss, was it?" Celebi said nervously as her mother looked at her with a neutral expression.

"No, it wasn't. Zorua...you've certainly changed quite a bit young man." She said, paw around her mug of coffee. "Though I don't approve of how you hid this...and how the situation spiraled out of control." She said regarding both of them.

"Ma'am, I know that i've made my share of mistakes, but I promise ya i'm genuine, I love your daughter and i'm on the straight and narrow." Zorua said, Celebi blushed at this.

"Please mom...I promise no more secrets, but he has nowhere to go...let him stay with us, please..." Celebi pleaded.

The older Celebi sighed. "Yeah I knew that was coming...believe me, Azurill has been doing his darndest to convince me too." She said as Zorua grinned a bit.

It was then that the older Celebi spoke.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Convincing Celebi's Mom

choices: ... Celebi's mom!
... Meloetta!!
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Azurill uselessly attempted to run away, before realizing that he had nowhere to run. His perch was too high for him to jump to the floor without getting injured; however, if Wigglytuff got him, his 'injury' would be impossible to fix, given how openly the pink, overgrown rabbit stated his intentions.

Said pink pokemon approached the table calmly - there was no rush. He would be quick, just press his paw on Azurill's respiration sources until the kid choked, in which point he was free to leave and carry on.

"Oh, Azurill, stop running and come to me. In a minute, it will be all over. I promise you won't feel a thing." Wigglytuff said like a psychopath.

Azurill could do nothing but back away in fear, until he reached the edge of the table, where his hopes were shattered like glass.

It was truly over then? Now that he got to be happy again...?

Azurill let a tear roll down his cheek; Wigglytuff approached him, his shadow completely obscuring the young pokemon.

"Now kid, say good-"

A loud crash made Wigglytuff trail off.

"... Night?"

The pink pokemon turned around, hearing noises in the other room. Voices, too. Voices tremendously familiar.

'Not now, damn it!'

Azurill had apparently noticed the noise too, and his heart began swelling with hope. Was he safe?

"This way Zorua, I sense them!"

Azurill's eyes widened. Celebi! And Zorua! His friends!

And surely enough, two figures familiar to both Wigglytuff and Azurill made their appearance on the doorway.

Immediately, Celebi and Zorua's eyes locked with the scene in front of them: a startled Azurill with a clearly nervous Wigglytuff dangerously near the former.

"You!" the legendary hissed,
"Get away from him this instant, you monster!"

Wigglytuff gritted his teeth, thinking.

The couple in front of him was way younger and surely less experienced than him in battle, and he had his own fair share of battles in his day; but they still outnumbered him and one possessed a great power while the other could trap him in an illusion to incapacitate him.

There was no way out. Unless...

"Celebi and Zorua. It looks like I'm done, am I not?" he sarcastically said while raising his hands and walking closer to the couple, having apparently surrendered,
"But what do you plan to do? Send me to jail? No, that's ridiculous, you have no proof, except for Azurill over there, who I'm sure you wouldn't want to show around at such small stature," Wigglytuff continued.

Celebi frowned, feeling her hatred for the rabbit rising to extreme levels. He was right.

"Then you're going straight back to the jar." she growled. Zorua remained silent, examining his opponent.

There was something wrong, he gave up too easily...

Wigglytuff offered a polite giggle.

"Alright." he agreed, walking past the couple,
"I'm sure you will want me to lead the way, so I don't..." Wigglytuff trailed off as a grin crawled across his face, though Celebi and Zorua couldn't see it because he was giving his back to them,
"... Try anything funny."

In the blink of an eye, Wigglytuff turned around and rose his paw, only for it to glow as he performed Brick Break and brought it down... right against an azure shield crafted by Celebi.

"Seriously? That's a cliché, Wigglytuff." Celebi nearly laughed, before her eyes glowed as she got ready to shrink the menace in front of her; however Wigglytuff only smirked more.

Them, despite his age, he made a swift leap in the air and jumped past Celebi's protect, landing right behind her. And behind Zorua who, taken aback, could only watch as the paw of the pink rabbit came down straight on his head, hitting him square in between the eyes and knocking him unconscious.

"Zorua!" Celebi screamed as she saw her boyfriend falling flat to the floor, his body limp; on the table, Azurill was horrified.

Rage filled the green fairy entirely as she looked at Wigglytuff with a hateful expression.

"You will pay for this!" she growled, before whizzing towards Wigglytuff with as much speed as her wings could offer, wishing nothing more than to grab a hold of his neck.

However, the rabbit was prepared and stepped to the side, avoiding the green bullet of a fairy, before driving his elbow straight into her back, causing Celebi to drop to the floor with a loud thud.

And for Wigglytuff, the time came to finish things up.

He shot Azurill a murderous stare, right before moving a step towards him. Then another. Then another.

Each step Wigglytuff took, Azurill took one as well, only backwards, mentally invoking for his green haired savior.

A savior came indeed, though it was covered in black and red fur.

An illusion faded and Zorua roared as he threw himself at Wigglytuff, tackling him to the floor.

The pink pokemon grunted as he rolled on his back with the fox on top of his white stomach.

"Why won't you brat just stay out of-" Wigglytuff was interrupted when an invisible force pulled him back; looking up, he discovered Celebi, still on the floor, pulling him along with Zorua towards her.

The dark-type fox jumped off his belly while he began struggling to get free.

"Let go!" he cried, before he growled in pain: Zorua had driven his fangs deep into his shoulder.

Celebi stood back and flew forward, driving a knee right into the opponent's face.

"You brats just don't know when to let go, do you!?" the stubborn Wigglytuff roared, suddenly emitting a powerful psychic wave to push back Celebi's own psychic.

He managed to get free, and tried to prepare an attack, but his two opponents were faster.

A Shadow Ball and an Energy Ball hit him from both sides, causing thunderous explosion that was heard in the whole house.

And, albeit he had proved to be incredibly thick-skinned, Wigglytuff couldn't withstand the combination and fainted, leaving both Celebi and Zorua panting to catch their breaths.

Upon nothing the bunny was unconscious, both looked at each other and spoke at unison,

"I thought you were knocked out!" they exclaimed, before donning two smirks,
"It'll take more than just one hit to knock me out."

Both pokemon hugged each other.

"... You okay, kid?" Zorua called from Celebi arms, remembering the reason of this s whole mess.

On the library table, Azurill gave a shaky nod.

"Y-Yes... I think..." he stuttered, startled but unharmed.

Celebi called upon her psychic powers and gripped the mouse to levitate him towards her and her boyfriend, letting him sit on her palm.

"Thanks you guys." he said with a sigh of relief. Zorua smiled.
"Don't even mention that." Celebi said with an awkward smile.

How different this was from their first meeting, she mused. But now, that was all in the past.

After Celebi's statement, silence fell into the room and nothing was said or done for a few minutes; but then, the silence was broken by a sudden noise.

All three pokemon turned to the doorway.

It was...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: The battle for Azurill

choices: And life continues
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"It's simple...she wanted to see the long range effects of her ability on a living pokemon. Dunno why she asked me but...I kinda agreed to it to get away from the kids for a bit." He scratched at his head and laughed and the older Celebi looked at him perplexed.

"Is this true Celebi?" She asked and the younger pokemon looked confused.

"Oh um...yeah, Wigglytuff agreed to it when I asked, it...surprised me." She said bewildered and the older Celebi looked between the two.

Zorua was still masking himself and couldn't believe they weren't being ratted out.

"Though i've been here long enough...i'll get out of your way, Celebi, ma'am. I'll happily see you out and about in the village, giving you both a smile day in and out!" He said and Zorua gritted his teeth.

If he disappeared...Celebi's mom might suspect now. The scumbag was getting away. He was sure he saw Wigglytuff shoot him a smirk too.

"Celebi, can I discuss something with just you, about the experiment?" He said and both of them looked suspicious. "It's harmless ma'am." He said and she shrugged. "Whatever you say."

-

"You...you-"

"You didn't rat us out? You're a piece of work? You called us pathetic? Will it be the question, the insult, or the petty self righteousness." Wigglytuff stated as they both stood outside her house.

"If you're wondering by the way...you win, I won't talk about you two. Frankly, the less of Zorua out in the open and the more of him in there the better, though I must say YOU surprise me. I always thought you were a sweet girl." Wigglytuff said and Celebi seemed taken aback.

"As if someone like you can judge me! You have your miserable life! Get back to the kids you don't care about!" She seethed and he looked at her and blinked.

"You really think I don't care about them? At all? Or my own daughter?...the one you almost made an orphan?" He said and she glared.

"Don't try and spin this! You-"

"Azurill right? Yeah...i'm a scumbag in that regard. And if any of them had vanished save for Igglybuff i'd probably have done the same thing. Of course I missed the blue boy...crybaby that he can be at times. And part of the reason I don't care for Zorua is because of him messing with them. But...i'm greedy. I admit it." He said, then grinned. "All that money."

"You-you-"

"Azurill seems happy enough...comfortable. You can believe what you want to believe but i'm glad for that. Truly."

"He doesn't have a life anymore thanks to you!" Celebi seethed and Wigglytuff looked at her.

"You're some piece of work kid. I don't take that blame alone, do I? No Celebi...I didn't shrink him, or kidnap him." He said and Celebi was taken aback.

"He threatened us!"

"Oh, a small child threatened you and the pokemon that bullied him? Surely you made the right choice then?" Celebi didn't have an immediate response.

"So why'd you shrink me? Was it my atrocious deeds? I figure that's why the prank happened. But you're fixated on me calling you pathetic, aren't you? Is that the part that broke the camel's back? Where you'd exact DIVINE justice on me and be the moral victor? I'm sure Igglybuff would love that story. Or Swinub...Cleffa too." He said as he turned to walk away.

"Arrogant, petty...yeah, a match made in hell you two. I'll see you there...all three of us. I'd recommend not touching me by the way...your mom might suspect, right?" He said as he walked away and Celebi was left standing there.

"This doesn't change anything! I hate you!" Celebi yelled and Wigglytuff waved, not turning back. "I'll be telling the kids I was helping a kind young lady with an experiment. I can lie pretty well." And the pink bunny walked away as the night started to take hold.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Slipping away

choices: "Thank you Zorua... I'll deal with this bug, don't worry!"
"Hm, you might want to stick around... I'm gonna need your help after all..."
"Zorua... maybe this is a bit excessive..."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Zorua eyed Wigglytuff, trapped inside his jar, grinning maniacally.

"I know." he stated with a dark tone in his voice as he stood up, covering Wigglytuff's sky as he towered above the jar menacingly.

Celebi stared at her boyfriend with amusement: whatever Zorua was going to decide, she wasn't going to regret it.

"You know Wigglytuff, I'm feeling quite generous today... after all, I'm one that can understand your situation, so I won't hurt ya..." Zorua said, his face adopting a friendly grin.

Wigglytuff felt the air return to his lungs; Celebi's eyes widened.

"What?"

"Really?"

Zorua snickered as his face contorted into a sadistic look, the same look the old Zorua used to wear all the time.

"Hold on." he said, stomping his paw on the ground, making the jar and its captive shake.
"I'm not going to hurt ya. But a friend of mine." he continued.

Celebi shot a questioning look; curiosity was added to Wigglytuff's terror.

Zorua snickered.

"Braixen." he said theatrically, raising his head a bit. Wigglytuff gulped, weakly leaning against his glass prison.

To anyone, he would have looked so pathetic to be pitiful, but not to Zorua.

"Braixen, Zorua? Why her?" Celebi asked, confused, before she adopted a smirk, which was directed to Wigglytuff,
"Why not deal with this little one ourselves? How many ways can me and you find to make him pay for his crimes?"

Zorua snickered again as he regarded his girlfriend.

"Oh, trust me Celi, I'd love it more than anything else-" the fairy cocked her head,
"... Aside from you, of course!" Zorua quickly added, before gazing back at the tiny, pink rabbit trapped inside the glass jar.

"But Braixen - oh, she's going to love ya... after all, she knows about what you did with Azurill..." Zorua said, before pausing to erupt into laughter,
"Not to mention that you bothered me and her when we were hanging out..."

Celebi contemplated what Zorua had just said and smiled.

"Hmm... I gotta admit, I see your point." she mused, standing up, shooting the jar a smirk.

Wigglytuff backed up until his back was pressed against the other side of the jar. Braixen would have killed him!

"No! No! Not Braixen! Anything but not Braixen!" he shouted.

"Oh, hush, I'm doing ya a favor... y'see, Braixen doesn't have it in her to kill..." Zorua lowered his muzzle to the jar, showing his white, razor-sharp fangs to Wigglytuff, who could swear he saw them shining sinisterly.

"I do." Zorua finished with a snicker as he pulled back.

"Wow Zorua... now you're officially scaring me... not sure if I like that or not."

The dark-type snickered.

"Old habits die hard." he replied, looking at the tiny balloon pokemon intently.
"So, which'll it be? Either Braixen..." he tapped his paw impatiently,
"... Or us. And while Celebi might not want to kill you, I cannot assure I won't on accident... or very, very purposefully."

"Me neither." Celebi chimed in, earning a grin from her boyfriend.

Wigglytuff fell on his rear end, shaking.

"Ca-Can't you... can't you just let me go?" he tried, doing his best to sound convincing. Kids were easy to manipulate with the right words after all,
"I promise I'm not going to tell anyone about what happened between us."

Zorua, whose good hearing allowed him to hear Wigglytuff, snickered.
"Nice try. No deal."

And, while Celebi questioned about Wigglytuff's words, the tiny rabbit looked down, resigned.

They took his size, he wasn't going to let them take his life.

"... B-Braixen..." he hesitated, before closing his eyes and clenching his fists, stating loud and clear,
"Braixen!"

Zorua laughed.

"Ya heard the bug, Celi? He wants to go to Braixen's... aw, you broke my heart bug." he stated, pushing the jar where Wigglytuff was contained, eliciting a grumble from the overgrown-yet-tiny rabbit.

Celebi giggled,and the jar started hovering in front of the couple of giants.

"Very well... let's head to Braixen's."

--

"Comin'!"

The door opened, and Braixen eyed Zorua and Celebi.

A grin took place across her cheeks.

"Hey you two! How you doin'?" she asked cheerfully.
