"We're fine," Celebi stated happily.

"Well, what are you waiting for? Come in! Mom is not home anyway." the purple vixen offered stepping aside to let the couple inside.

While a snickering Zorua walked inside, Braixen took notice of a jar resting on his back.

"... What's with the jar?" she asked as she closed the door.

"This? Oh, Braix, remember when we hung out days ago?" Zorua asked back.

"When Celebi was with her mom and Wigglytuff threatened us? Yeah, why?"

Celebi giggled as she climbed on Braixen's couch; inside his jar, Wigglytuff gulped - the memory was still very fresh in Braixen's mind.

Zorua smirked, arching up his back to show the jar.

"You see, I've had so much fun with you and Buneary-"

"Really? I thought you were annoyed because we kept teasing you for the bow." Braixen interrupted as she snickered, sitting down next to Celebi.

Zorua ignored the comment.

"... That I wanted to bring ya a little present."

Braixen looked at Zorua in confusion. After all, all she saw was an empty jar.

"A present? Are you giving me that empty jar?" she asked.

"Nope! You'll have to look inside!" Zorua said cheerfully.

Curious, Braixen left the couch to Celebi, who was looking at Zorua with a grin.

The shiny vixen grabbed the jar from Zorua's back and examined it carefully.

And there, in the glass, she spotted something pink and extremely tiny. If it wasn't for the long ears, she wouldn't have recognized who it was.

"... Wigglytuff," she looked at Celebi incredulously; the fairy nodded.

"This bug," Zorua proceeded to explain,
"Not only threatened me and you, not only he faked Azurill's death - oh no. He called me, you, Celebi and Buneary ‘pathetic’," Braixen glared at the jar at this.

She was notoriously very protective of Buneary. And of her friends, too.

"We thought it would have been fair to punish him. And here we are!" Zorua concluded.

Braixen looked up.

"No... it would be fair if Azurill punished him, not me or you," Braixen countered.

Zorua sighed.

"That's what I thought, too," he admitted.

"But Azurill didn't want to because Wigglytuff still has a family..." Celebi chimed in.

Braixen looked at the jar again.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: From Fox to Fox

choices: Follow Braixen and Wigglytuff
Follow Celebi and Zorua
Follow Meloetta and Azurill
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Braixen took a moment to contemplate the jar in her paw, and the insect sized pokemon with it before she shrugged. “Sure, I’ll deal with the bug, don’t you worry. Thanks Zorua.” Braixen smiled and Zorua grinned.

“Enjoy your new life Wigglytuff! This is the end of the road for you!”

Wigglytuff for his part was cowering, looking up at the purple fox that was to be his owner.

“We’ll see you around Braixen...let us know if you need any help or if he tries anything.” Celebi glared at the jar as she said this and Zorua laughed.

“As if he could...enjoy your pathetic existence bug, see you around Braixen!” And with that, Zorua and Celebi departed and Braixen went inside.

Wigglytuff took in the enormous house as his world shook with each step, Braixen was looking at him with a serious expression of contemplation as she went to her room.

“B-Braixen...y-you’ve always been a g-good kid...you’ve gotta tell someone about me, please! H-hel-”

His words were cut off as his world spun, Braixen simply spinning the jar in her paw.

“Wigglytuff, don’t make things worse for yourself by begging for mercy. I’ll keep you alive, fed. It’s more than you deserve, but I won’t kill you, be grateful and shut up.” Braixen intoned harshly and Wigglytuff shut up, whimpering.

A slice of pepperoni was dropped in the jar and Wigglytuff, on the verge of tears, approached the slice of meat, as large as a large backyard to him. After this, some drops of water the size of Wigglytuff were dropped in as well, forming a drinking source.

Braixen sighed, Azurill was right on the money, Wigglytuff had a family...she was sure the kid was also wrestling with his own conflicted feelings on this depraved bunny...but there was no going back at this point. Wigglytuff was this for life, and Braixen would deal with him for now. She tucked the jar into a drawer of hers, causing Wigglytuff’s world to shake once more, and as she shut the drawer, he was left in darkness with his food and water.

-

“Welp, that’s that. No more Wigglytuff, now what?” Zorua grinned as Celebi floated beside him, paw on her chin as they walked towards the village.

“Well...I was gonna do some shopping...we also need to consider the fallout of this too. I’m sure some of those kids will be inconsolable.” Celebi said and Zorua waved a paw.

“They’ll be better off in the long run without that creep...they just don’t realize it. Don’t worry, they’ll get help from pokemon better at that stuff than us!” Zorua said. Celebi nodded, a little reassured, though it was still on her mind.

“Well, shopping at least will be fun! I’m gonna get a new book!” Celebi said with a smile and Zorua grinned, his mind wandering to what Azurill had been reading.

“Me too.” Zorua said, but then a voice Celebi recognized from school stopped them.

“Celebi and...Zorua?” The voice said as Celebi turned to greet the pokemon.

-

Azurill was sitting on his tail, thinking, looking at his doll as he closed his eyes.

“Stupid Wigglytuff...why couldn’t you just leave it all be...I’d have come home...” He considered when he had jumped the gun trying to get an edge on Zorua...if he hadn’t done that...but what was done was done and in the end, though hopelessly small, fragile and weak, he could make peace with his existence...with Meloetta.

But then Wigglytuff had to get involved further and now all of his friends would suffer even more.

“Azurill, dear...I’m coming in...” Even in the world of giant voices, her voice never hurt or rang in his ears...it soothed him, and soon he saw the smiling face of his caretaker.

“Oh...are you done reading?” She asked as she approached him.

“Yes...thank you M-” Azurill almost said it, almost called her mom...maybe one day he would...but for now, he’d consider it.

“Meloetta” He finished with a smile, and she approached, taking the small child in her paws.

“Let’s go get some food then, okay Azurill.” She said as she left the room with the child she was quickly starting to consider hers.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: The day continues

choices: Wigglytuff keeps his word
Wigglytuff tries to go after them
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Celebi looked at the mouse on Zorua's head and sighed. "We'll...talk to him, i'll consider it depending on how he responds." She finally said and the blue mouse nodded.

"Okay." And Zorua shook his head, jostling the little mouse. "I'm telling you both that he's gonna spill the beans the first chance he gets! A pokemon like him-"

"Cares about self preservation above all else. A show of power and he'll keep quiet...I promise Zorua." Azurill said and Zorua just grumbled.

"Well let's go get the little worm and see what he has to say then..." Zorua said as they exited the room.

-

"Just bring him back safely, okay~" Meloetta said waving and Azurill waved his tail back smiling. "A day and they're already attached huh..." Zorua said as Celebi carried the jar away. "I'll be honest...she's way better at this than you Wigglytuff..." Azurill said mockingly to the jar as they went further into the forest. "Not that I doubt you care." He finished bitterly and the little bunny was frantically looking around as the world shook around them.

Soon they were in a clearing and Celebi opened the jar, depositing the tiny bunny to the grass and growing him to his full height.

"Yo-" He was slammed to the ground with an immense psychic force and then slammed into a tree behind him before he was slammed to the ground hard again. He groaned trying to get up only to find himself slammed to the ground once again.

"You will listen. You will not speak. When I need you to respond you will only shake your head or nod your head. A peep and I shrink and crush you. A scream and Zorua decides your fate." Celebi intoned with an air of seriousness that Zorua had seldom seen from her. Even Azurill was shaking a bit. Wigglytuff hesitantly nodded.

"Azurill wants to send you back home. Not for your sake, but for the sake of your kids. Zorua and I are hesitant but i'm willing to allow it on a few conditions." She intoned once again.

"You will take all the money you got off of Azurill's 'death'...and you will spend it on the kids and their needs. Not a cent on yourself. Anything you bought with his money already. Return. If you can't. Destroy it. That is my first condition. Nod if you agree to it." She said and his jaw hung open for a second. But he had bought a nice new TV! And...and...

Slowly he nodded.

"Good. And if you attempt to cheat me on this know...I can find out." She threatened and he gulped.

"My second condition. You will not hound any of us in public. You will not speak to us. You will not speak of us. To any pokemon. Do and you will regret every miserable, short lived second you have left. You will not speak of Zorua. You will not speak of me. You will not speak of Azurill. Or Braixen. Or Buneary. If asked you will attempt to change the subject as i'm sure you have in the past few days in regards to Azurill. Nod if you agree."

He emphatically nodded.

"You may speak for this last one. Apologize. Apologize to Zorua. NOW! You hounded him when it never called for it and refused to acknowledge him after he attempted to better himself!"

"Z-zorua...i'm sorry for saying all those things about you...I-I'm sorry for calling you pathetic...i'm sorry for thinking ill of you...I won't do it again..." He said, groveling.

"I don't forgive you but whatever."

"Apologize to me." She narrowed her eyes.

"Celebi...sorry for calling you pathetic...sorry for impeding your path yesterday and hounding you in public with Zorua...I won't bother you again..."

"Now...apologize to Azurill. Realize that HE was going to come back to you after a few days, he made his peace with Zorua willingly...and when I was going to give him his life back you snatched it for gain. He still asked us to give you your life back despite this. Apologize to him." She spat.

"A-Azurill..." He looked at the tiny pokemon perched on Zorua's head.

"I-i'm sorry...for faking your death...for not trying to look for you...for-"

"I don't know if I hate you Wigglytuff...you raised me after...after mom died...you fed and clothed me...even if it was all in hopes to gain something from me in the end, you still did that and you still do that for kids...but i'll never forgive you, and I never want to see you again. Please leave." Azurill said glaring.

Wigglytuff slowly crawled to his feet only to be slammed back down again by a psychic force. "You didn't say thank you yet." She intoned and he had tears in his eyes.

"T-thank you..."

"For?"

"For letting me go..."

"Who's pathetic?"

"...Me..." He squeaked and the psychic force was released.

"Get out of my sight." She said and he started running away frantically.

"...This is gonna bite us, i'm telling you."

"If it does we'll shrink him down. Besides, do you think he wants to admit what he did to Azurill?" She said and he shrugged. "...I hope you're right. Well now that that's over for now...I want to go swimming, what do you say bud?" He asked with a grin, not seeing the sulking Azurill on his head. Celebi leaned in.

"You okay?" She asked gently and he slowly shook his head.

"You were thinking of them doing that, right?" She said gently and he slowly nodded.

"...let's get you back to Meloetta, okay?" She said picking him up from Zorua's head and Zorua looked at him, he really did look down.

"...Wanna go swimming bud?" He asked and Azurill didn't respond.

"...Another time then." And they made their way back to Meloetta's.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Catch and release

choices: They spend the next day with each other
They go to talk with Azurill, Buneary, and possibly Braixen
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Zorua was unsure if this was revenge for the movie earlier today or if Celebi genuinely enjoyed this schlock, but here he was, sitting in her lap as she was enraptured with this...this...

“Say you’ll never leave me...” The Glaceon said as she leaned into the Houndoom to nuzzle him

Celebi was leaning forward and Zorua could swear there were sparkles in her eyes.

“You’ve changed me Glaceon, I would never think of it.” He said leaning into her.

“Isn’t it beautiful Zorua...” She said wistfully as he looked at the screen unimpressed. “That Houndoom is a crappy actor.” He said in a matter of fact tone, earning a glare from Celebi

“Better than that Jynx...” She muttered as she noticed the credits rolling. “Aww...it’s over...” She muttered as she felt Zorua stretching in her lap. “Thank Arceus!” He said as he let out a yawn. “What now? Gonna subject Braixen to it?” He said as she giggled.

“I already did when it was in theaters~” She said as Zorua looked at her. “You’ve already SEEN this!?” And she smiled. “It’s one of my favorites~” He groaned. “Though I still owe Buneary and...Azurill...” She got quiet as Zorua considered this. “Haven’t we done enough to the kid? Don’t subject him to this!” He said in a light tone as Celebi didn’t respond.

“Look, I know it’ll...be a rough transition, but he’ll adjust in time, I just know it!” Zorua said. “He just lost his life, size and family Zorua...and he thinks it’s all our fault...”

“Buneary will set the record straight! It may...take a bit for him to believe us, but he will!” Zorua said enthusiastically. “He’s better off away from Wigglytuff, tiny or not.”

“Wigglytuff might be a scumbag, but he was still family to him...” Celebi said.

‘No family is better than being family to a scumbag...’ Zorua thought bitterly, but didn’t say it. “Ah, we’ll be his family! It’ll be fine! Buneary can be the sibling and best friend that’s a girl! Braixen can be the cool older sister! And I’ll be the best bud older brother!” He said grinning.

“Oh? Braixen is the ‘cool’ older sister? What am I then?” She asked amused.

“The overbearing older sister that never lets him do anything fun!” He started laughing before he felt something on his head. “Huh?” He looked up to see...a frilly pink hat. “I debated getting it, but I think you earned it~” She said playfully. “Take it off!” He yelled, making her laugh. “He’s gonna like me the best She said as Zorua looked at her with an annoyed look, her expression softened. “He said he’ll miss school but...I can teach him things, in case...one day he can go back into the world...” She said gently.

“...The boring older sister then.” He said and she glared. “You’re sleeping with the hat.” She said, picking him up to take him to bed. As if reading her thoughts Zorua said. “He’ll come around...you’ll see.”
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: With Celebi and Zorua

choices: "Let's go get some breakfast while we plan our day," Celebi responded
"Oh, you'll see~ I know the perfect place~" Celebi vaguely responded
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"You're right... let's just hope Buneary manages to comfort him... let's just hope he believes her..." Celebi said as she climbed on top of her bed, holding Zorua close to her chest.

Her paws tightened their grip as she smiled.
"Good night Zorua..." she said, leaning forward to peck the fox.
"Yeah, good night... boring sis..."

Celebi sighed.
"Okay, one, brothers and sisters don't date each other... two, another word and you're keeping the hat for the whole day tomorrow." she said.

"Challenge accepted." Zorua snickered, making Celebi look at him, bemused.
"So be it, then." she said, before closing her eyes, smiling.

Zorua snickered again.
"Yeah... good luck with that..." he whispered as he removed the frilly hat from his head and looked around.

He aimed straight for the open window and threw it. The pink hat flew straight out of the window much to Zorua's delight.

Then, Celebi opened her eyes and wore a smile.
"Zorua... the hat?" she asked, immediately noticing the lack of the pink object on his head.

He snickered.
"Somewhere out there~"

Celebi inhaled deeply.
"You know I'll just keep buying pokedoll clothes, right? They're the cheapest things you find in this village." she said.

"And I'll simply keep throwing them away until you give up."

"I'll never give up, know it... anyway, I was thinking: why don't we go out together again tomorrow... y'know, like a few days ago..." the fairy suggested.

Zorua smiled.

"Sounds... great." he replied.
"Where are we going?"

Celebi shrugged gently.
"I don't know, we'll see... in the meantime, sleep tight..." she yawned as her eyes closed... before opening up a bit again.

She smiled.
"You missed a piece..." she pointed to the green bow, still tied around the fox's neck.

He looked at it, before looking back at the fairy, blushing.
"I... uh... like the color?" he meekly said, realizing how wrong that sentence was - Celebi was entirely green.

A second later, Zorua was pulled up by the fairy's hands as she pecked him.

--

"Oh, Zorua~ wakey wakey~"

The dark type lazily opened his eyes and groaned as the wonderful... or annoying voice of Celebi disturbed his slumber, causing him to wake up.

"Why won't you simply let me sleep...?" he asked in annoyance as he yawned deeply, his hind leg scratching his left ear.

The giantess gently picked him up to kiss his cheek. He responded by nuzzling her face affectionately.

"Because today it's going to be just me and you~" Celebi said cheerfully as she adjusted the bow on his neck and smiled, giving him another gentle kiss.

He merely smiled as she carried him out of her room and of the house.

She closed the front door, before inhaling the morning breeze, while Zorua stretched on her paw.
"Looks like a nice day..." he murmurs happily.

Celebi nods.
"Yup~ we'll have so much fun~" she remarks with a smile as she starts walking in a random direction.

"... Where are we heading?" Zorua asked, disappearing behind his pokedoll illusion.

Celebi smiled brightly.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: The second date

choices: A pokemon they recognize comes up to them
No one interrupts them
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"Come on, let's go get something to eat, i'm sure that works for you." She said, as he seemed to nuzzle himself into her chest. "Works for me just fine. Wake me when we get there..." He was jostled after this statement as she smiled at him. "Yeah, nice try. You need to learn to greet the morning properly Zorua...and not the afternoon." She said as he yawned. "Fine fine...but where are we going?"

"Oh, just a small little diner. My mom and I used to eat there a lot!"

-

Celebi was sitting at a table, holding a menu up carefully to mask the tiny dark pokemon who was perusing it. "So...do I pick or you pick?" He asked and Celebi whispered. "We both pick, just keep it down, alright?" She said and he shrugged. "You're the one who brought me out in public like this...besides, we need to figure out what we're doing right? Stop being nervous, nothing's gonna happen..." He said quietly. "I was thinking...the all meat platter..." He said eyeing it and Celebi rolled her eyes. "Of course you were...well, that's a bit...much for me, both in cost and the meal itself..." She said as she eyed something else. "This looks good...it comes with some sausage if you want that too." She said as she eyed a simple two egg breakfast and he eyed it. "Kinda bland isn't it?"

"There's a reason a lot of people go with it." She said as she signaled the Lickitung who was taking orders that she was ready. After ordering and handing back the menu she moved Zorua to her lap to wait for the food. "So what are we going to do today...?" He asked as she thought, she was about to speak.

"No pokedoll clothes."

She shut her mouth briefly before opening it again.

"No book stores."

She got an annoyed look before opening her mouth once again.

"No romance movies."

"Okay Zorua, what do YOU want to do?" He shrugged. "I dunno, go watch a show, head to my forest, relax at the park. I'm good with that kinda stuff." He said grinning.

"There is a magic show we could go to...supposed to be pretty good..." She said thinking back and Zorua thought. "They got illusions? I'm curious to see how they stack up to me." He said grinning as Celebi smiled. "You just want to see if you can do what they can~" She said teasingly, and he flushed red. "I'm the best there is at what I do!" He boasted and she giggled. "Sure, let's go to that together then~" She said as their breakfast was delivered.

-

"That was pretty dang good, you weren't kidding." Zorua said as they sat on a bench near where they just ate. "Seriously, keep it down..." She said and he shrugged behind his illusion. "It's early...no one is really out yet and we need to communicate somehow. I'm being quiet. You're being paranoid." He said and she sighed. "Can you blame me, af-"

"Nuh-uh, not today. Today is you and me." Zorua said and she smiled. "You're right~" She said nuzzling him. "Come on, let's go get tickets to that thing." She said cheerfully, standing up.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Breakfast and planning

choices: "Okay! We can hang out all together!" Celebi responded
"Sorry Gard... It's just me and Zorua today~" Celebi responded
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"Seriously, why pay for two tickets? I'm a doll Celi, dolls don't need tickets." Zorua said from his girlfriend's chest as she walked in the park, where pokemon where setting up the magic show, a rather crowd sitting in front of a stage.

Celebi let out a sound that seemed a mix between a stifled giggle and a sigh.
"Morality, Zorua. Ever heard of it?"

Behind his Illusion, Zorua huffed.
"Sweetheart, are you talking to the pokemon who stole countless things whenever he needed them?" he asked with a grin.

Celebi stared at him.
"Yeah... because you WON'T steal no more, right?" she asked as she walked up to the crowd, her voice reducing to a whisper.

Zorua snickered.
"As long as you keep buying me things~"

The remark made Celebi giggle as well as she pecked his cheek, took a seat and gently placed Zorua on her lap.

"Celi!"

The fairy felt something jabbing between her wings and made a startled leap, throwing Zorua off her lap.

He landed on the ground with a thud and grunted in pain.
"Ow..." he said, his illusion dropped. Luckily, the grass had broken his fall... a little.

Celebi hastily bent as she scooped him up, before turning around, holding the small fox behind her back.

Luckily, there was no need to.

"Hey, no need to hide the little guy around me~" Gardevoir giggled, causing Celebi to glare up.
"Gardevoir I was having a heart attack!" she screamed.

Gardevoir giggled again.
"Hi there Zorua~" she said to the fox, who rubbed his sore paw.
"... Don't do it again..." he said.

"Are you here to see the magic show too?" Gardevoir asked after giving Zorua a teasing smile.

"Yeah..." Celebi responded, and Gardevoir huffed.
"Yeah... I'm here because mom told me I had to bring my sister..." she said, pointing to a Kirlia sitting a few seats from Celebi, cheerfully waving her paw to greet the fairy, who awkwardly waved back, keeping Zorua pinned against her stomach.

Gardevoir smiled brightly.
"Hey, why don't we hang out together after the-" she couldn't finish as a Mr. Mime stepped on the stage, greeted by cheerful applause.

"We'll talk later." Celebi said as she sat back down.

Gardevoir nodded, and went back to her seat.

--

"I could do better."

The cheering crowd watched the Mr. Mime and Mime Jr. leave the stage after their magic show.

The crowd of pokemon started to disperse, Celebi and Zorua along with them.

Celebi giggled.
"Zorua, those weren't illusions, I swear I saw Mime Jr. disappearing for real!" she exclaimed.

Zorua rolled his eyes, looking unimpressed.
"Seriously Celi, some of those tricks were quite predictable... except the one where Mr. Mime breathed fire! That was so cool!" he snickered.

Celebi smiled.

"Celi!"

Again, Celebi was jabbed in between her wings. Started, she made a leap... this time, she was holding Zorua tightly so that he couldn't fall.

Celebi's feet never touched the ground again as she flew up and turned around in midair, while Zorua masked himself with an illusion.

Gardevoir and Kirlia were smiling at the fairy and her ‘quite realistic pokedoll’.

"Stop. Doing. That." she cried in annoyance, making Kirlia giggle.

"Hi Celi~ aren't you too big for dolls~?" she sang cheerfully. Celebi blushed, while Gardevoir shook her head.

"Sis... go home. Tell mom I'll be back in a while." Gardevoir said as Kirlia walked forward and smiled.
"Okay!" she said, before waving Celebi goodbye and making a pirouette.

Then, Kirlia started walking away.

"... Adorable kid." Zorua commented as he dropped his illusion.
"Agreed~"

Gardevoir nodded, before giving the couple a smile.
"Yeah... but back to business~ why don't we hang out together? I've really got nothing to do right now... It'll be fun!" she suggested.

Zorua looked at Celebi dejectedly.
"But..." he meekly told.

Today was supposed to be only him and her...

Celebi giggled as she gave her response.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Encounter at the show

choices: "Let's go see some other shops!" Celebi answered
"Hmm, I dunno. Why don't you pick?" Celebi answered
Celebi couldn't respond - someone noticed Zorua talking and approached!
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"Forgive me Gard, but it's just us two today~" the fairy chimed, empathizing her thoughts by nuzzling the fox resting on her palms, who gladly accepted the attention he was receiving.

Zorua had never looked so harmless, Gardevoir noted, the smile on his face was a far cry from the devious grin he used to carry back in his days as a prankster (which were in reality not even one week ago).

And for that reason, the psychic/fairy-type couldn't be mad at Celebi for refusing her suggestion.

"It's okay you two," she said with a bright smile, a paw rose in a salute,
"I understand. Have fun~"

Celebi removed her head from Zorua - much to the fox's disappointment - and shot a grateful stare.

"See you around, Gard," she chimed happily,
"See ya girl." Zorua said as Gardevoir started walking in the same direction her sister took earlier.

She rounded a corner and disappeared.

The smiling Celebi looked down at her boyfriend, who smiled back, nuzzling into her chest.

"So? What do we do now?" he asked, pulling back. Only to be shoved straight back into the bosom he was nuzzling as the fairy hugged him.

"Any suggestions?" she asked cheerfully as she started fluttering in a random direction.

Zorua cloaked himself in his illusion, once again appearing like a doll, the same doll pokemon saw Celebi with more and more often.

Regarding what happened with Azurill, Zorua's voice was quickly reduced to a whisper.

"Let's go to my forest," he suggested.

Celebi shook her head, emulating the fox as she whispered back,
"Zorua, we've already been there a few days ago... quite frankly, it was a bit boring." she bluntly said.

Zorua snickered.

"You're just saying that because I beat you and you had to buy me stuff... and you couldn't buy other accessories." he recalled, his mouth watering at the thought of the chips and soda still closed in Celebi's closet.

The fairy blushed.

"That's not true!" she snapped, in a voice that made Zorua realize that it was totally true.

He snickered again. Celebi looked down at him, before she snickered too.

"... But you gave me an idea, my little sweetie~" she said cheerfully, fluttering to an unknown destination.

Zorua wondered what she was up to, but got an answer when he saw the place he grew to hate, worse than the book store and the movie theater when Celebi dragged him to watch romance: the doll shop.

"Stay away from there." he said, his voice sounding cold.

Celebi giggled.

"Nope~ you already have a bow... I only need to find you some cute gloves and replace the hat~" Celebi chimed.

"You don't dare or I drop my illusion in front of everyone." he threatened.

"Heh, like someone is going to notice you in there, between countless other dolls," Celebi pointed out.

Zorua smirked.
"Yeah, but how many dolls can actually talk?"

"Zorua, if someone finds about, it'd be your mistake: they'd hunt you down, not me." Celebi chimed happily. Outsmarting Zorua was something she loved.

Sadly, this wasn't one of those times.

"Really?" Zorua intoned,
"I don't think so... if they kill me, who'll be your boyfriend?"

As those words left the fox, Celebi stopped.

"Hm."

A paw slid over Zorua's muzzle, silencing him as the cheerful fairy made her way into the shop, an unwilling Zorua struggling in her grip.

--

"Seriously, you're going to ruin my reputation for good." Zorua said as he stared at the black gloves that contrasted with the colorful hat on his head and with the green bow tied around his neck.

His girlfriend was fluttering out of the shop and back into the village.

"Oh, shut up, the gloves match your fur, they're hardly noticeable. Plus..." Celebi lowered herself to peck the fox.
"You're incredibly cute like that~"

Zorua huffed in annoyance.

"You'll have to lower your guard at some point, and when you do, you're going to regret you did." he said.

"We'll see... this game is starting to become fun~" Zorua snickered at that.
"Oh, we'll see how fun it'll be for me when you have no money left..."

"It'll be fun for me... because I couldn't buy you stuff anymore..." the fairy countered.

Zorua sighed, defeated.

To avoid further verbal beatings, he decided to change subject,

"So? Where are we going now?" he asked.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Alone together

choices: "Okay! Won't tell!" Smoochum cheerily said, convinced
"Hmm..." Smoochum hesitated... Celebi may have to use drastic measures
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Smoochum didn't respond as she eyed the lifeless doll in the paws of Celebi... apparently lifeless doll that resembled a Zorua.

She was pretty sure she had seen that doll a second before, and it looked like the real Zorua.

Celebi laughed nervously.
"Hehehe, like it? I bought it now - isn't it cute~?" She asked with methodical cheerfulness as she nuzzled her actual boyfriend, who did his best to keep up his illusion.

However, Smoochum didn't look like someone who bought it.
"Is that... Is that Zorua?" she asked as she stepped back.

She had never been an actual victim of the fox, but Wigglytuff and the other kids gave her an accurate idea of how evil he was, so there was no way she was getting closer than that.

Celebi giggled.
"Yes! It's a pokedoll of Zorua! Isn't it cute?" She repeated, feeling like the cat was out of the bag and hating every second of this situation.

Smoochum looked perplexed.

"Hmm... can I see it?" she asked, not really waiting for an answer as she stepped forward, her eyes fixing on the realistic pokedoll... it seemed really like a pokedoll.

She timidly extended a paw, gently touching what seemed real fur.

Behind his Illusion, Zorua grinned. Smoochum was examining the really well made pokedoll... soon, she'd be convinced that he was really a-

"OW!" Zorua made a leap on Celebi's paws as he felt a paw pulling the red tuft on his head.

Celebi floated back as Zorua landed on her paws... noting that the illusion wasn't there any longer. Smoochum was staring straight at him, eyes wide open.

"H-Hi Smoochum..." he meekly said, fully aware of what was coming.

She would either freak out or get mad, attempt to blackmail him and Celebi, being shrunk... the same as Azurill.

However, all the young pokemon did was just stand still and look at him.

"Z-Zorua?" she stuttered, taking another step back.

Celebi bit her lip as she watched her boyfriend nodding slowly.
"Zorua..." she whispered, pretty much knowing what was going to happen... and she really didn't want to shrink another one of Wigglytuff's kids. Azurill was enough.

Zorua sighed.
"There's no denying it now, Celebi..." Zorua meekly said, before looking at the pink pokemon in front of him.

"... But you," he told, wearing his most intimidating gaze... which seemed to work as Smoochum looked like in terror.
"You're not going to tell anybody, are ya?" he sighed, before continuing,

"Before answering, think... I mean, c'mon, I never did anything to ya, did I?" he told in an attempt to convince Smoochum to keep her mouth shut... otherwise, Celebi would have to adopt drastic measures to make sure she didn't snitch.

"There was nothing about her in my log book..." Celebi said, earning a grateful smile from her boyfriend.

Smoochum looked perplexed.
"... Well... no... but you did... you hurt my friends..." she timidly recalled, feeling conflicted. She was used to being nice to everyone... but Zorua... she wanted to talk about him to Wigglytuff... get a small revenge on him.

Zorua put a paw to his chest.
"Kid, I swear that was the old me. I'm reformed now... sorry for what I did to your friends..." he said, before smiling methodically.
"But... we can be friends too... if ya keep quiet..."

Celebi couldn't help but admire the small Zorua in her paws, feeling proud of him. Even at such tiny size, he had the situation under control.
‘Maybe I made a wise choice picking him...’ the fairy thought to herself as she smiled sweetly.

The fox was cute, funny and smart... his and her personalities matched perfectly... only, he was a scoundrel and she a bookworm.

‘Perhaps I can reconsider about the bow...’ she thought with a giggle, before focusing on the two talking pokemon again.

Smoochum still looked at him, seemingly conflicted. He was smiling at her.
"I... I don't know Zorua... you... you are..."

"WERE an infamous ruffian, yes. But today, I'm a completely different pokemon!" he chimed, before extending a paw.

"What do you say, Smoochum? Just keep quiet about me and we can be..." he flashed a grin.
"... Friends."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Handling a dire situation quite well

choices: "Well Azurill... you did deserve it a bit..." Braixen says
"... Let's go talk to Celebi." Braixen says
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"Something's happening out there, Bun," Braixen responded, her cheerful attitude waning as she wears a somewhat worried expression.

Buneary looks at the fox with a confused stare.
"Why? What's happening?" she asked.

Braixen scratches her head.
"From what I've heard, it's Azurill. He's missing..." she explains. Buneary pales.

Of course. She had to figure it out sooner - Wigglytuff would have gone crazy not seeing Azurill returning.

"You should see Wigglytuff's face - he's gone crazy ... " Braixen says, almost like reading the bunny's mind. Surprisingly, Braixen snickered.
"I've got nothing against Azurill, but... after what Wigglytuff did to me and Zorua, it almost feels like revenge to see him like that..." she admits with a cheerful voice.

Buneary remains silent. How to tell Braixen that the missing pokemon was sitting in the other room? She would immediately tell her mom, who would tell Celebi's mom, who would discover about Celebi's shrinking powers... and Zorua...

That'd be disastrous. Word of Zorua's current size would spread at light speed, and everyone in the village would hunt him down...

Noticing Buneary silent, Braixen wore a curious expression.
"Buneary? Are you feeling fine?" she asked.

Buneary looks at the fox, nodding quietly.
"Yeah... poor Azurill..." she said glumly, before sighing.

"Braix... there's something I need to tell you." she admits. The fox tilts her head.
"Okay? What is it?" she asks.

"First, promise you won't tell anyone."

Braixen looks confused, but nods her head in curiosity.

"I may know where Azurill is..." Buneary revealed.

--

Azurill was still locked up into Buneary's bedroom, when the door opened, letting the bunny come back.

He was about to snort, but quickly hold his breath as he noticed another pokemon entering alongside Buneary: Braixen.

He quickly smiled and dropped on the ground, pretending to be a pokedoll like Celebi instructed - with clear consequences if he didn't.

Buneary sighed.
"It's okay Azurill, I told her..." Buneary says, while Braixen walks over the blue pokemon and scoops him up.

"... Yep. It is you, Azurill." she says, making him drop his smile and sigh.

"Please... help..." he meekly mutters.

Braixen glances at Buneary.

"Buneary? Why is Azurill tiny and inside of your bedroom?" she asked calmly.

Buneary shrugs.
"Celebi brought him to me last night... he discovered Zorua and attempted to blackmail him by telling others about his size, so Celebi shrunk him... If I got it right..." she explains.

Braixen stares at her, mouth wide open, before staring at Azurill.
"... Is that true? You attempted to blackmail Zorua?" she asks, somewhat indignant... she and Zorua WERE friends after all.

Azurill timidly nodded as Buneary closed the door to prevent her mom to see something she would regret.

"Braixen, he is a jerk! He's always been! Why shouldn't I have done that? Above all, why is Celebi protecting him?" he asked.

Braixen sighs.
"She's overprotective about ‘roomie’..." she responds, letting Azurill sit on her palm.

"... She shrunk me. Gave me to Buneary like a doll... that idiot Zorua suggested it..." he recalls.

Azurill looked at Braixen, who stared back at him.

"You shouldn't have tried to threaten Zorua. He changed now, and Celebi can be quite protective of him... no doubt why she shrunk you..." she lectured.

"That's right... I've forgiven him for that syrup trap... he's so nice now... and cute~" Buneary chimed in, earning a glare from Azurill.
"... Though you are pretty cute yourself at that size Azurill~"

The blue pokemon sighed.
"Braixen, Buneary, someone like Zorua can't change! He wanted to EAT me!" Azurill exclaimed in exasperation.

Braixen looked like the statement took her aback. But she quickly responded to Azurill's words...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Missing

choices: "...out to Zorua's woods?"
"...over to see Celebi?"
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"And while that may be true, there's also your implicit threat of a mob that wants Zorua's blood. He's making death threats because you're making death threats. These days, he's only truly vitriolic to people who truly deserve it," Braxien conferred. "If you're disrespectful to others, you're gonna get disrespect in return."

Azurill didn't have much of a comeback to that. Yeah, Zorua was the town jerk, but there was also the fact that lately nobody had been telling horror stories of what happened when they went into his woods, as well as the fact that quite a few of his prank victims, including one young and impressionable Buneary, were vouching for his having changed. Azurill wanted to believe he was still a menace, something he could get the villagers to rally behind, but lately his most malicious act, aside from the death threat, was complaining about being forced into wearing doll clothes (a complaint he could most definitely relate to).

"...Azurill?" Buneary attempted to snap him out of his thoughts.

"What?" he replied exasperatedly.

"Why are you still so grumpy? Is it just because of Zorua?"

No reply.

Braxien had been thinking for a bit, and figured that Azurill wanted to get out of Buneary's house, and possibly see Zorua. Fortunately, at his diminished size, seeing Zorua wouldn't lead to an attempted assault on Zorua, especially with 2 or 3 giantesses watching him. With this in mind, Braxien finally spoke up and asked, "Buneary, why don't we take Azurill..."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: An Argument Invalidated

choices: "Okay Zorua, here we are," it was Celebi and Zorua, hanging out
"Azurill! Are you here?" it was Wigglytuff, searching for Azurill
"He must be here..." it was one of the villagers, seeking for Zorua
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Buneary looked skeptical.

"But why?" she asked, wondering why Braixen made such suggestion.

"Because it might just help Azurill here to feel better about Zorua. Come on," the purple vixen explained, grabbing a paw of Buneary, who hugged the blue mouse to her chest.

"T-To Zorua's forest? N-No! Wigglytuff told us to stay away from there!" he opposed.

"Because of Zorua, I assume. But since he's probably being dressed up by Celebi right now, his forest is deserted." Braixen countered with a snicker as she walked out of Buneary's bedroom.

Buneary sighed, resigned to the fact that Braixen wasn't going to relent.

"Mom! I'm going with Braixen!" she called.

"Okay sweetie, have fu- wait..." Lopunny came out of another room, eyeing Braixen, Buneary and the smiling Azurill doll suspiciously.

"You aren't going out with Zorua, are you Braixen?" she asked.

Braixen internally sighed.

"No Lopunny, he's... busy," she snickered on the inside,
"... But seriously, he's a good guy after all, I saw him apologize to Buneary... right Bun?" she smiled.

Buneary blushed and nodded cheerfully.

Lopunny placed her paws on her hips, but then sighed.

"Watch out for him..." she warned, before smiling,
"Have fun."

Braixen smiled and waved her paw as she and Buneary walked out of the house.

Buneary wondered what Braixen had in mind.

--

"Here we are."

Azurill shivered in Buneary's grip as the trio approached Zorua's woods, easily one of the places the mouse dreaded the most.

The place where Zorua destroyed his precious doll, the last gift from his mom.

He remembered every moment of it, the fox ripping the doll apart she he cried and begged for him to stop, powerless against the older pokemon.

But he had been more powerful than the fox, Azurill thought, for one single, meaningful moment, which was used in the worst way possible and led to Celebi shrinking him to a doll.

Something that Braixen and Buneary seemed to approve.

The group walked deeper into the woods, when Braixen stopped her two companions,

"Wait." she said, looking at a subtle piece of string, tied to a root and to a metal bucket, which was hanging from a tree branch, well hidden by the leaves.

"Dude knows how to keep unwanted visitors from finding him..." she mused as she took out her wooden staff, a wave of fire erupting from it as it burned the string: the bucket fell from the branch, splashing yellow paint around.

"Guess he has a lot of pokemon hunting him down." Buneary chimed.

"Had." Braixen corrected,
"And yes."

"Can't really figure out why..." Azurill sarcastically replied as he looked around with dread, maybe expecting Zorua to jump out at any moment, dooming him to the same fate his doll suffered... it made sense, since he was technically Buneary's doll now.

Braixen sighed and turned around to look at the blue mouse.

"Now Azurill, this is where Zorua destroyed your doll, right?" she asked.

Azurill sourly nodded; Buneary did too.

"Yeah... you always had that, one day you simply didn't... and you were crying..." she recalled.

To be honest, Azurill felt the need to cry now as well.

"Azurill, here is where countless other pokemon suffered the cruel pranks of the sadistic Zorua we knew back then. But I need you to understand that none of those pranks, as horrible as they could be, was ever even close to kill someone; if you told someone about Zorua's current situation, they'd kill him for sure. Tell ya what, I was this close..." Braixen placed two fingers extremely close together.

"... To killing him the first time I discovered him like that." she admitted, causing Buneary to gasp.

"Braixen!"

The vixen blushed.
"After what he did to you, I wanted to give him a piece of my mind. But Celi, Espurr and Gardevoir, my friends stopped me, they made me understand that Zorua is no longer who he was." she explained.

Azurill gulped, uncomfortable.

"What do I even have to do with this all?" he asked.

Braixen sighed.

"I... we're trying to do the same with you Azurill. We're your friends, and we need to stop you from trying to kill Zorua, like they did with me that night." Braixen said.

She then looked at Buneary, who was still processing th fact Braixen tried to kill Zorua.

"Bun, do you remember when Zorua apologized to you?" she asked.

Buneary nodded.

"Yeah! I was scared, but then he jumped in my paws... literally! He was so cute!" she exclaimed, blushing at the memory.

Braixen smiled gently.

"Exactly. Now Azurill, I'm sure we'll convince Zorua to apologize to you too... in exchange, you'll keep your mouth shut about him. And, of course, you'll have to apologize too." she continued, her gaze shifting on Azurill.

"Me? Apologize to Zorua?" the mouse asked, incredulous.

How could Braixen even ask something like that?

"... I actually did nothing aside from..." he didn't finish, but Braixen got the gist.

"Would you have snitched if Celebi didn't shrink you?" she retorted, now wearing a stern look on her face.

Azurill discovered that he had nothing to respond with. For some reason, lying didn't seem an option: Braixen seemed to read his mind.

So he meekly quieted down.

Braixen softened.

"I suggest you think about it Azurill while we go to Celebi's, Azurill," she said.

Azurill perked up.

"T-To Celebi's?" he asked,
"R-Right now?"

Buneary looked at Braixen, who nodded solemnly.

"Yes Azurill, the sooner we solve this thing, the sooner you'll get your size and life back," she said,
"And keep in mind, Celebi won't give you back your size if you don't apologize to Zorua and her."

Without waiting for an answer, Braixen grabbed Buneary's paw.

She started walking, but soon stopped.

The big ears of the fox, the long ears of the bunny and the reduced ears of the mouse detected an irregular sound in the forest: someone was talking.

Braixen placed a paw over her mouth, silently telling her two companions to be quiet as she listened carefully.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: A stroll into the lion's den

choices: Azurill apologized. He wanted his size back!
Azurill turned his head. He wasn't losing his dignity!
"You know what? I don't care about apologies." Zorua interjected
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"Okay cutie, here we are," it was Celebi's voice... cutie...?

Braixen listened carefully.

"Grow me back, Celi... there's something I wanna show you." another voice responded.

Zorua.

Soon enough, Braixen saw a cyan light seeping through the plants as Celebi obeyed.

"Hey, it's Celebi and Zorua! Let's-" Braixen stopped her,

"Wait, I wanna know something..." she said, peeking through a bush to see Celebi sitting on a log, alone.

Azurill didn't dare to speak, his vocal chords paralyzed by fear.

Soon, Zorua returned, carrying something in his mouth.

He offered a bag to Celebi, who smiled.
"Bon-Bons? Zorua, that's so cu- wait, where does this bag come from?" she asked, causing Zorua to snicker.

"Stolen. From Graveler... I ate half of it though... and he ate some too..." he explained.

"Oh, no problem." Celebi giggled after a moment of hesitation.

Braixen perked up, and so did Buneary.

"... At least that jerk didn't get to eat all of them..." Braixen chimed bitterly, watching as her two friends ate some of the sweets, swallowed, kissed...

...

Kissed?!

That's right, the two were kissing! Braixen's eyes widened as she saw Zorua and Celebi breaking the kiss, smiling, before the fox gently pushed Celebi on her back onto the log.

The fairy playfully struggled under Zorua, her arms wrapped around his neck as he started nuzzling her, while her lips landed on his face... several times...

Braixen couldn't believe her eyes.

Zorua and Celebi...

"They're... together!" Buneary excitedly stated, smiling brightly,
"How cute!"

Azurill already knew about them, so it wasn't that big of a shock... but seeing the two lovebirds like that...

But Braixen didn't share her opinion.

"What are you doing?!" she screamed as she stepped out of the bushes, causing Celebi and Zorua to break immediately to look in her direction.

It was like a wave of heat came down into the forest, causing everyone's cheeks to flare up with embarrassment.

"... Y-You weren't supposed to see that..." Celebi stated as Zorua moved off her to let her sit upright.

The dark-type stared at Braixen.

"... ‘What are you doing?’, I should be asking that, you know," he said,
"This is kinda where I live..."

"That's not what I meant!"

Celebi huffed.

"Braix, Zorua is my boyfriend, it's normal we kiss..." she said,
"... Thinking we are alone." Zorua finished, annoyed.

Braixen stared in shock... so it was true! Her friend and Zorua were a couple!

"What? When? Why?" Braixen ran up to them.

The couple sighed.

--

It took a while for Celebi and Zorua to explain everything about their relationship to Braixen, who wasn't giving any signs of wanting to relent on the subject.

"I can't believe it..." Braixen finally marked the end of her awkward questions, while Celebi and Zorua exchanged perplexed looks.

"That's so cute you two!" Buneary chimed,
"Aren't they cute, Azurill?"

Zorua froze; Celebi's heart sank.

Instantly, the two gazed at Azurill, seemingly noticing he was there just now.

Celebi eyed Braixen nervously, Buneary had just carelessly revealed that she wasn't holding a very realistic Azurill doll, but the real shrunken Azurill...

"Chill out, I already know," the purple vixen revealed.

Celebi blinked, before gazing at the blue mouse sternly, causing Zorua to snicker. What came next was going to be fun.

"... May I ask you what are you all doing here?" Celebi asked after a while of just glaring at Azurill.

Braixen perked up.

"That's right! We wanted to see you... because Azurill had something to say after I... me and Buneary I mean, made him understand that Zorua is no longer a prankster nor a jerk, and that he was wrong trying to blackmail you." she explained.

Celebi stared at her, before she nodded her head.

She stared at Azurill again, who avoided her gaze. He didn't have any time to think about it!

"Very well Azurill," Celebi said,
"Let's hear what you've got to say."

The blue mouse in Buneary's grasp gulped.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: An awkward meeting

choices: "No, we'll talk now..."
"That might be for the best...we'll consider a solution to all this."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"You know what? I don't care about apologies." Zorua shrugged, making everyone turn their attention to him. "Fact is, I said he was Buneary's doll period, so that he shall remain. It isn't like any apology would be genuine anyway." Zorua grinned down at the tiny blue mouse who looked dejected.

Braixen crossed her arms and looked at the dark fox. "Zorua, that ain't fair." She said. "Whatever bad blood you had with Buneary or me was resolved with talk and apologies, you shouldn't deny him that." She said and Zorua rolled his eyes.

"He threatened ME first!" He said.

"After you had pulled your shenanigans on him, what he did was wrong Zorua, but you were wrong too!" Both foxes glared at each other as Buneary and Azurill meekly watched. Celebi interjected though.

"Don't start fighting...we don't need that. Look...Braixen, fact of the matter is, Azurill is still a danger to us if we were to restore him. There's no telling if he'd talk or not." Celebi stated and Braixen looked at her.

"So are you gonna condemn a kid his whole life over a mistake?" She asked quietly and Celebi looked away. "I...don't know...give us time to talk...and think."

"There isn't much time, there's a search party out for Azurill." This made Celebi's eyes widen and Zorua looked from Braixen to Celebi. "There's a decent chance they might catch onto something here..."

"Hmm...whatever, they won't find him, he's just with Buneary, and if he tries anything then he'll be shrunk to nothing, hell if we did that now there'd be no issue there." He said and Azurill looked down at Buneary's palms.

Braixen glared back.

"Y'know, I was trying to convince Azurill you weren't a jerk anymore, but you're being one now." She said and he scoffed. "Again, he threatened me first."

"This is going nowhere...why don't we just go home for now Braixen...Azurill...give Celebi and Zorua time to think about it...and maybe talk later..." Buneary was trying to defuse the situation, and the little blue mouse in her paws was quaking, she hugged him to her chest a little, trying to reassure him.

Celebi sighed.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Not open to discussion

choices: Zorua safely led the group to his cave...
Someone found them!
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"No, we'll talk now," Celebi stated solemnly.
"And y'all better be convincing." Zorua said.

Braixen huffed.

"Okay, let's talk, but there's nothing to say." she said, crossing her arms,
"Kid here wants to apologize, but Zorua won't let him Celi!"

Azurill felt offended. All these giants were calling the shots, and he wasn't having any say in the matter.

"I never said that!" he shouted, drawing the attention of the giant and the three giantesses. His voice echoed through the clearing.

Buneary looked down.

"A-Azurill..." she stuttered, but she interrupted herself.

Braixen shot an incredulous look in direction of the mouse.

Even after all she said, he was still unwilling to apologize?!

"Azurill, you don't know what you're saying..." she said softly, while nervously glancing at Celebi.

Any wrong word would result in the fairy shooting that familiar cyan sphere, shrinking Azurill even further.

But Azurill didn't care.

"No Braixen, I know perfectly what I'm saying! I won't apologize to Zorua, not after he took the last gift from my mom from me! Not after what he did to Swinub! Not after what he did to everyone in the village! HE'S NOTHING BUT A WORTHLESS-"

Braixen rushed towards Buneary, shoving her paws over Azurill's mouth.

Zorua wore a grin on his face: he knew what was happening if the words left Azurill; his girlfriend eyed the mouse with a glare glued to her face as she waited. Waited the moment Azurill dared to insult Zorua, her beloved Zorua.

Braixen was looking pretty agitated.

"Think about it, kid! Do you really want to live your life as a speck on the ground?" she whispered.

Azurill remained silent, mostly because Braixen had he paws pressed against his mouth.

However, Celebi didn't give him any time to think of what he had said.

"Good idea Braix." she said, getting up from the log and fluttering over the trio.

"This thing is taking too long. Zorua..." she looked at the fox, who was still on the log, observing the scene.

"... Apologize for his doll, for Swinub and whatever... Azurill, you'll then apologize for blackmailing me and Zorua, and for insulting him... If you want. If you don't... you're free to live out your life like that." she seethed.

Zorua jumped off the log.

"Celebi, his mistake is far worse than mine. And I still don't care about apologies, but if you want to give him that chance to go normal again, it's fine with me. But he'll have to apologize first." he declared.

Celebi stared at him, Braixen couldn't find any words to counter that. Buneary remained quiet, and all the gazes traveled to Azurill.

The mouse remained silent for a couple moments.

"... Do what you must. I won't apologize." he said, glaring daggers at Zorua for what was going to be the last time in his life.

Braixen placed her paws over her own muzzle, Buneary hugged the mouse tightly, but she found him sliding out of her grasp, held by psychic.

"You asked for it."

Roughly, the young mouse was placed on the ground between the two couples of giants as Celebi formed the dreaded Shrinking Ball.

Azurill looked at it, terrified.

He had done it, he defied Celebi and Zorua, and now he was going to pay for his defiance.

His whole - short - life flashed before his eyes. He didn't want to die as a nanoscopic bug on the ground!

Time seemed to stand still.

"Goodbye." Celebi said.

Azurill's heart traveled to his throat, literally pushing out a scream,

"WAIT!"

--

Surrounded by his kids and by several other pokemon, Wigglytuff stepped out of the village, where the forest began.

"S-Sure we-we'll find him there?" Swinub stuttered dejectedly, hoping his best friend was really in the forest.

It was the only place the search party didn't check yet.

"Let's hope, Swinub." Wigglytuff sighed, before he gritted his teeth.
"... Hope that Zorua isn't involved with him."

--

Celebi lowered her paws.

"What?" she asked, annoyed, somewhat expecting what was going to happen.

In some of her books, the situation came to this, but she never really expected to find herself living this kind of experience: being the executioner.

Azurill started crying, tears rolling down his cheeks and body shaken by sobs.

"I-I-I'm s-so-sorry! I d-didn't mean t-to t-threaten you! I-I d-didn't mean to i-insult Zorua!" he cried, before looking down, fully erupting in tears.

Azurill..." Buneary murmured, while Braixen remained quiet; Zorua started snickering as he watched the blue pokemon that once was a threat humiliating himself in front of his eyes.

Celebi shot a cold stare, before the ball disappeared in her paws.

"Whatever." she looked back,
"Zorua."

Time stopped once again as Azurill and Zorua made eye contact, everyone's eyes focused on the two.

Then, Zorua started laughing in the face of the mouse, before he opened his mouth to reply,

"N-"

"Azurill! Are you here?"

Everyone looked back.

"Smoochum..." Azurill exclaimed with hope... hope that faded as Braixen finally regained the ability to speak,

"Crap, they're here!... We need to hide!" she whispered in alert. They couldn't risk Wigglytuff and the others finding Azurill with them!

That was when Zorua took the lead.

"Follow me. I know a place where they won't find us... we'll talk there." he said, grinning at Azurill as he started running. He moved up to the shrunken mouse, his muzzle sliding under his body as he threw him in the air.

Azurill landed on top of the head of his dreaded nemesis as he started running again.

Braixen and Buneary looked at Celebi, but she was already fluttering behind her boyfriend and his passenger.

With a sigh, the purple vixen grabbed Buneary's paw and started running behind the trio.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: The search in the house of the Devil

choices: "I'm out of here." Zorua finally said
"She ain't gonna find him without my eyes, i'll help." Zorua finally said
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Navigating through the forest, the group of 5 evaded Wigglytuff's search party.

Zorua grinned, no one would find him if he didn't want them to, not here. He had thrown an illusion on everyone just in case though, and navigated to his cave, where he threw up another easy illusion making the entrance seem like solid rock. The group sat in silence...

Azurill was in the giant's head, trembling as he looked around, he whimpered a bit, making Zorua roll his eyes as he rolled the little brat off of his head.

"Now, about what I was about to say." He said, leaning down, blasting Azurill with his hot breath, a grin on his face.

"No deal Azurill, I don't care about your apology...you threatened me." Zorua said, as he blew on Azurill, making the mouse tumble down.

"Zorua..." Braixen started but Celebi stopped her with a paw.

Azurill took a deep breath...

"So i'm like this no matter what then?" Azurill said, as tears welled up

Zorua laughed. "That's right kid, should've considered the consequences of threatening me and a legendary."

"Zorua...fine. I can't do anything more." The tears fell freely. "I guess i'm this size f-f-forever, but you know what? I don't care what any of them say...all you did was prove to me that you're as rotten as I always thought! Maybe you won't destroy another child's beloved possession again. Maybe you won't scar another child for life again. Maybe you'll be content in the care and protection of a pokemon that places you above right and wrong, but it doesn't change anything. You're you...a jerk. If i'm to be shrunk to nothing, or be in the care of this group, then I don't care about it anymore!" With that, Azurill bolted, off into the darkness of the cave.

"Celebi, stop him!" Braixen yelled and she went to pin him with psychic, but with how dark the cave was and how small Azurill was with how quick he ran off he was gone in the darkness.

Zorua grinned.

"Let him go, he'll starve or be food for some hungr-"

Zorua felt a slap across his face, it was harder than he anticipated. He expected it to be Braixen, but when he looked back he saw something he didn't expect. The pouty, crying face of Buneary.

She too was letting the tears fall freely.

"Y-you should've at least tried to make peace..." She stuttered out and he looked the most defensive he had since this whole thing began.

"B-buneary...he threatened me..." Zorua stuttered out and she closed her eyes.

"I-I k-know he did, but we're trying to make him realize that was wrong, and all you're doing is making him feel like you're the jerk he thinks you are! The jerk you were!" Buneary then glared at Celebi.

"And you're not helping things either, always taking his side even when he's being wrong!" Celebi's eyes widened at this too.

Braixen's mouth was hanging open, she didn't expect this outburst from Buneary.

The bunny went into the cave.

"I'm going to find him, and try to calm him down, then i'm taking him home. I'll take care of him, because none of you care." Buneary said as she disappeared into the darkness.

Zorua, Braixen and Celebi sat there in silence.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Buneary's outburst

choices: He stays in the hole
He comes out
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Zorua looked at Celebi, who was staring at the cave floor and Braixen who seemed to be about to follow Buneary before Zorua sighed.

"I'll go get Buneary." He said as he got up and Braixen looked at him with an uneasy glance.

"AND Azurill, i'll get him too. She isn't going to find him in this darkness easily, my eyes can help with that." Zorua said as Braixen nodded.

"Then what?" Braixen said, her tone sharp and Zorua looked at the cave floor, then to Celebi.

"I don't know...okay? The kid hates me and threatened me..." Zorua said but Braixen folded her arms.

"And that doesn't absolve you of what you did Zorua. Maybe you should consider that mending bridges involves both parties reaching an understanding. I heard an apology from Azurill eventually." Braixen said and Zorua scoffed.

"No way that was sincere!" He said.

Braixen was silent at this as she looked to Celebi.

"I also agree with Buneary, you didn't help one bit. I expected better of you." And Celebi clenched her fists but said nothing.

Zorua silently went into the darkness, after the two young pokemon, still unsure of how he'd deal with this situation. He wasn't about to lose a friend of his over this...but freeing Azurill carried risks! The kid hated his guts. At the very least he'd at least send him home with Buneary, safe enough...maybe talk with him.

As he walked forward he heard Buneary.

"Azurill? Come out please, you can't stay here on your own, it's too dangerous for you..." He heard her say gently. He eventually saw her pawing around in the darkness and sighed.

"Buneary..."

She looked in his direction with a glare, but couldn't see him very well.

"Go away Zorua! You're not helping!" She said and he looked at her with a sad expression.

"You can't see him like this, but I can find him...let me help, alright?" Zorua said as he looked around at the ground.

Buneary said nothing as she resumed her search.

"Azurill...if you can hear me, we mean no harm...please come out." She said.

"Kid, you're gonna die if you stay here, don't be dumb." Zorua said as he looked and saw a little blue ball on the ground, Azurill's tail. It was moving away from them as he dived into a tiny hole.

"Azurill, I saw that!" Zorua said as he approached the hole and looked in with an eye. He saw the quaking little blue mouse, trying his best to stay still and quiet.

"Azurill, get out of there." He said, but he felt a shove as he was pushed away and Buneary looked in the hole.

"Azurill, please come out..." She said gently and Azurill shook his head.

"G-go away Buneary...i'm staying here!" Azurill said

Zorua got up from his shove and looked over at the hole and the bunny

"Tch...look Azurill, come out and we'll talk later...for real, okay?" Zorua finally said and Buneary looked to Zorua with hope in her eyes.

"F-fat chance you will, you just want me out of your cave and under your paw." Azurill said and Zorua sighed.

"Look...I know you hate me, and I know you have...decent enough reason to too, but if you stay here then you'll legitimately be in danger. If you come out now, go home with Buneary then we'll discuss this stuff later tonight or tomorrow okay? But we need to get out of here, away from the search party." Zorua said.

"Azurill...even if Zorua doesn't intend to make peace I still want to help you, okay? If you don't trust him, then trust me please..." Buneary said.

Azurill made his choice.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Searching in the dark

choices: He wakes up with Buneary and Braixen
He wakes up with Zorua and Celebi
He wakes up with all four of them
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"F-fine...i'll come out..." Azurill said, ready to at least go home with Buneary...it would be better that the cave at least...even if tiny...

Though what Azurill didn't know was what was behind him...a ticked off Weedle saw the tiny intruder in its home...it was much, much smaller than the Weedle, but it was still in ITS den, and it was not pleased with that. As Azurill stepped forward to leave the hole he felt a very, very sharp and intense pain in his back...he stumbled forward out of the hole, dazed, crying and yelping...with bleary eyes he saw moving shadows, giant moving shadows as he fell forward and landed on his face.

Buneary and Zorua's eyes widened, seeing him in the darkness of the cave...with a wound on his back...purple was oozing out of it, as well as blood.

The Weedle, proud of itself, went back further into its den to rest, sure that the intruder wouldn't bug him again.

"gmh...ugh....aaahh....AAAHHHH!" Azurill was slurring before he started screaming, his entire body felt like it was flaring up, hot hot hot...his head felt like it would crack open from the pain...he couldn't see clearly. The pain was intense, more intense than anything he'd ever experienced.

"Buneary, get Celebi, NOW!" Zorua barked.

Crap, of course it was a Weedle den...Zorua was used to the little buggers, he'd been stung a few times too, and it generally hurt, though he could suck the venom out and be fine.

But Azurill was tiny, tinier than tiny right now, that amount of venom in him could be fatal, not to mention painful on a whole other level.

'stupid...stupid Azurill...stupid me...damn it...' Zorua thought as he gently lowered his muzzle to the tiny pokemon. "Azurill...i'm gonna try to suck the venom out, okay?" He said as he lowered his lips to Azurill's back, he gently tried to get a certain angle so he could get the venom out of the tiny round pokemon, but it proved difficult with the size difference.

He got some of it out at least, and spat it out, still tasted terrible...

It was then that he heard pokemon behind him...Buneary, Braixen and Celebi.

"Celi, shrink me." Zorua said simply and Celebi went to open her mouth to say something, but then shut it and shrunk Zorua...soon Azurill looked normal size to him, and Zorua had a much easier time sucking out the venom...though now there was much, much more than he was used to ever sucking out.

"AAAHHH....aaahhhh..." Azurill was looking purple and his body was burning up in heat.

"Damn it kid, stay awake!" Zorua yelled, as he tried sucking faster.

"Is there anything...we can..." Braixen started, but shut up as Zorua kept going.

"If you've got some medicine to help with poison or pain or...something like that...probably go get it, just avoid the search party." Zorua said.

Braixen nodded.

"Come on Buneary..." Braixen coaxed and Buneary looked from the fox to Celebi, to the tiny fox.

"Should we leave Azurill with them..." She started but Celebi smiled at her.

"Things'll be fine...meet us at my house, okay?" Celebi said gently and the bunny nodded.

"Just...be nice..."

"We will, we will." Zorua said as he continued working.

The two girls left, leaving only Celebi and Zorua with the tiny poisoned pokemon.

Zorua kept working in silence as Celebi considered the path forward.

Was she being unfair to Azurill? Well he needed to accept that she wouldn't let anything happen to Zorua!

...But he did seem willing to make peace.

"Zorua, I..."

"We'll settle things with him later...i'll say this, it ain't gonna be today. He won't be coherent enough to discuss things...for at least a little while."

Azurill was fading in and out of being conscious, not sure if dreaming or awake...he could blearily understand the conversations around him.

soon he found himself lifted from the ground...floating until he was set on something soft.

"...what's going..."

He tried to say it, but his strength faded, and soon he fell unconscious completely.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: A Weedle sting

choices: They go to see Zorua and Celebi in the morning
They take the next day to relax
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"Guh..." Azurill's world was still dark, but consciousness returned to him...and with it, a dull, dull headache and serious body shakes.

"He's awake!" A familiar voice, loud with the usual tone of the giants that inhabit his world right now.

"I'll go get the medicine." Another familiar voice...older, more sure.

Azurill's eyes came open, and blurry images came to him...the blur faded as large shadows moved around and soon, clarity was before him...the giantess bunny he'd been staying with, Buneary.

"Buneary..." Azurill said, his voice hoarse and his senses hazy before he started coughing, it was violent...and getting worse. Buneary looked at him sadly before producing a very tiny empty cup...still larger than Azurill, but she tried to angle it for him to look in it.

"If you need to use it..." She said before she winced and heard Azurill start to regurgitate the contents of his stomach.

She bit her lip and didn't look...but soon the sounds from Azurill reduced to heavy breathing...then somewhat normal breathing...then a few groans until Braixen returned with a glass of her own.

"Azurill, you need to drink this." She said gently as she came over, noting the cup Buneary was holding but saying nothing.

"It'll help what you're going through." She smiled as she got closer and was soon looming over the tiny blue mouse...she picked him up between two fingers in her free paw and held him close the the glass in her other paw for him to drink. It was a red liquid...Azurill, still somewhat confused by what was going on took a sip...then grimaced and coughed.

"This is gross!" He said and Buneary and Braixen both looked at him.

"It's medicine Azurill, and you need it right now...your tiny body needs all the help it can get to get back to normal, and this'll give you the strength to fight whatever poison is still in you." Braixen said firmly. "You're lucky it was a Weedle...their stings are painful, but generally harmless in the long run...but considering your size...if it had been another poison type..." Braixen shuddered to think of what could've happened

Azurill started to piece together the events of the past few hours...that's right, he had been stung and...Zorua saved him, right? After everything that had happened between the two of them. But it was Zorua's fault all this happened! If he'd just taken the apology...

Azurill glared but kept drinking the bitter medicine for a bit longer before Braixen pulled him away.

"That should be enough for now. But you'll need to take more later, it should help for pain too." Braixen said as Azurill shivered in her palm. He was so cold...he looked at the teenage giantess, her face filling his entire vision

"Hmm...you still look a bit pale." Braixen frowned, before gently handing him back to Buneary who hugged him to her chest. Azurill let it happen...he couldn't fight it anyhow, and her body was so warm.

"For now, you need to rest Azurill, we're at my place right now...Buneary and you are staying the night."

"What about-"

"Celebi and Zorua? They're at Celebi's...right now, they need to consider what to do too. I let them have an earful, and they do plan to discuss things in a more fair sense with you later on...but that means meeting them halfway, you need to make genuine peace with Zorua, apologize for your mistakes, and then hopefully befriend them...Zorua saved your life, whatever bitter feelings you may have, remember that." Braixen said.

"For now though, just relax with us, okay? You need to rest lots..." Buneary said, hugging him a little tighter.

"The search party should hopefully not ramp up for you over the next few days...within that time we'll figure it out...but you're taking it easy for the time being." With that, Azurill's world moved as both giantess pokemon left the room they were in, and went to a dark entertainment room.

Azurill felt his world shift as soon he was sitting in Buneary's lap who sat on the couch. Azurill shivered before a soft paw wrapped around his form, softly pinning him to her lap a bit, but keeping him warm. He tried to look up to the looming, smiling face of Buneary as Braixen turned on the TV in front of them and Azurill's world lit up to some sort of action movie.

"I'll go get a bit of food...something to get you some energy, alright little guy?" Braixen smiled gently as she got up, leaving the two young pokemon to the movie.

Soon enough, Azurill was feeling a bit more like himself...though still with a hell of a headache...and soon after that, he was in a bed with two pokemon far far larger than he, cuddled to warm brown fur as he got drowsy...the morning would hopefully be better than today was...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Waking and recovering

choices: large grin
gentle smile
disapproving frown
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Azurill groaned as he got up, looking around to see he was on a vast bed alone...and he looked to see a giant brown bunny smiling in a chair, reading a book before her attention went to him.

"You're up!" She said cheerfully as Azurill nodded. Soon she went over to the side of the bed, and looming over Azurill, gently picked him up.

"Feeling any better?" She asked as she help him to her face, her curious and concerned eyes practically taking his whole vision. "A bit...I think." Azurill said, as he shook his head, a dull ache in his head.

"...well, Braixen said when you woke up to have you take more medicine." Buneary said and Azurill groaned as he was taken over to a glass on a table and held over it, the bitter red pool of liquid below him.

"Come on, the sooner you take it the better you'll feel...it'll help your body recover." Buneary said as Azurill started to drink it, a grimace on his face as he did. After a few large gulps Buneary lifted him from it and put him over some water, something to help at least get the taste out of his mouth.

He took some greedy gulps of that and with a sigh was once again free to move in Buneary's paws. She was smiling at him warmly. "Good, don't worry Azurill, this'll all be resolved soon." Azurill blushed as he looked at her, then averted his eyes. "I hope so, I really do." He said as she carried him to the living room.

"Where is Braixen anyway?" Azurill asked as Buneary sat on the couch. "She went to do some shopping, then to talk to Celebi and Zorua about a good time to talk with you." Azurill's hopes soared as Buneary smiled sadly.

"It won't be today Azurill, you need to rest, and Celebi has plans with her mom. But soon, Braixen is making sure of that...and when you become friends with Zorua and Celebi, they'll let you go!" Buneary said as Azurill looked down.

"Right...friends..." He said bitterly. His feelings on those two were conflicted. Celebi, as far as he could tell, didn't care one way or the other about what happened to him, and Zorua had had no intention of giving Azurill the chance to plea for his case.

But Zorua did save his life...and promise him a genuine shot at trying to make amends. Azurill had some soul searching to do before that happened though.

"Maybe it's better that it isn't today...I don't know if i'm ready to talk to them I guess..." Azurill said and Buneary looked at him.

"I know that you're sore about...some of the things that happened, you did some things you shouldn't have done...but they did some things they shouldn't have done too. Things'll work out though...you just gotta be willing to talk, right?" Buneary tried to encourage and Azurill smiled at this.

"Well...when it happens I guess i'll try..." And with that, the door opened and Braixen walked in with some bags of groceries.

"Whew...i'm back...did he take the medicine?" Braixen asked, looking at the two kids on her couch.

"Yeah, I took it..." Azurill said and Braixen grinned.

"Good!" She said as she went past the couch and around the corner to drop the bags in the kitchen.

"I'm gonna cook some food, alright? Feel free to throw whatever on the TV, just nothing too graphic without me around, okay?" Her voice called from the kitchen before Azurill thought of something. It had been on his mind this whole time, and he needed to talk to SOME pokemon about it.

"Um, Braixen, can I talk to you alone for a sec?" Her giant purple head appeared from the corner as Buneary looked down at her companion.

Azurill was looking down at her lap before a shadow was cast over him, Braixen had come over.

"Sure kid, hop on." She said, and a paw was lowered, Azurill jumped on.

-

"If you're wondering about the meet up, it'll be the day after tomorrow. We'll come up with a cover story for your disappearance too...if things go well enough that you get let go at least." Braixen said and Azurill shook his head.

"That's good...I guess...I just, this is something else..." Azurill took a breath as he thought this over...this was something he'd had going on since school, and these past few days had only made it worse...Buneary being with him almost at all times...and her coming to his aid yesterday...being the one that cared...

He sighed.

"What's up Azurill? Go ahead, tell me." Braixen said and Azurill looked up.

"You promise not to be mad?" He asked and she smiled.

"I won't be mad."

"And to keep it a secret?" He asked and she rolled her eyes, but still smiled. "Don't worry, I won't tell." She said and he sighed.

He was silent for 20 seconds...

"Well are you gonn-"

"IhaveacrushonBuneary!" Azurill blurted out with his eyes closed, Braixen blinked.

"I uh...I like her...i've liked her since school and these past few days have...made me like her more...even if she's a towering giant to me now..." He said and Braixen looked at Azurill with a...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: A recovery day and Azurill's confession

choices: Azurill remains quiet
Azurill tries to tell Buneary how he feels
Meanwhile, with Zorua and Celebi...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Braixen was giving Azurill a gentle smile.
