"That's cute Azurill...it really is." She said and he sighed, shivering a bit in her palm, partially from the venom that was still working its way through his system.

"But why tell me?" Braixen asked and Azurill sighed. "I just...needed to get it off of my chest I guess." He muttered, averting his gaze from the giant teen. "Why not tell her?"

"Because...there's a lot at stake here I guess. What if I don't get grown back? At that point i'm with Buneary for keeps more likely than not and...if she doesn't feel that way, or thinks i'm a creep, or...a jerk or something like that she could dispose of me just like that..." Azurill said.

Braixen frowned at this.

"Look, i've had my fair share of experience with this kind of stuff, and I know Buneary...she wouldn't do that to you, and regardless I think things'll work out with your size in the end anyway."

'I hope so at least...' Braixen thought.

"Trust me, getting it off your chest with her is a good idea...you've had this since school you said?" Braixen said and Azurill nodded.

"I figured Zorua or Celebi must've somehow known when they gave me to her, trying to mess with me somehow...but now I think it was probably just a coincidence that it worked out like that...either way, I just...don't know if I can bring myself to tell her."

Braixen sighed and leaned back against her counter, still holding the tiny blue mouse in one paw.

"Look, i'm gonna give you back to her and start cooking something...I think you should tell her personally, and if anything it might even help your chances when you talk to Zorua and Celebi if you and Buneary are compatible like that. It'll be harder for them to brush you off again at least."

"That almost seems devious..." Azurill muttered. Braixen shrugged.

"Not really, if you feel that way for real it isn't, and I guarantee Buneary would find the whole thing adorable, i'm pretty sure she's taken a shine to you too." Braixen said as Azurill's world shook when the giantess started moving again.

"We're done bun, watch him for me while I cook, alright?" Braixen said, handing Azurill to the brown bunny pokemon as he felt himself being pressed to a warm surface...Buneary's stomach.

"I've got him, don't you worry!" Buneary said cheerfully, her voice reverberating through Azurill, he looked up to her far off face. She smiled down at him.

'Man...should I do this?' He thought.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Braixen's suggestion

choices: "He's at Celebi's!"
"I don't know!"
"I won't tell you!" She pulls out her stick
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"He must be here...that ass." It was Graveler, mumbling to himself, angry. Braixen rolled her eyes and both Buneary and Azurill whimpered. That jerk...always tormenting weaker pokemon and stealing from them. At least Zorua never got physical and kept his activities to his forest more or less.

"Today's the day, i'm gonna kill that stupid fox!" Graveler roared to himself as he kicked a tree, making it shake. The rock pokemon was also damn strong...Braixen wasn't sure she could take him on her own...if one of her more psychic friends were here...she shook her head. She wasn't even confronting Graveler, she was hiding and intended to pass him by.

Buneary and Azurill looked absolutely frightened though. Past encounters with Graveler had definitely affected them, and seeing Graveler as a giant didn't help Azurill either.

Braixen motioned for them to leave, when Graveler appeared on their path. Her eyes widened as Graveler looked at the group, confused. "Braixen? Buneary? Why are you two here?" He asked before he remembered something.

"You was in the village with him yesterday Braixen....pokemon saw you..." Graveler said before he grinned. "Well well well, I need to ask you something." He approached menacingly. "Buneary, run!" Braixen said as they turned tail. Graveler simply grinned as he picked up a giant rock beside him, and threw it in their path. It knocked Braixen and Buneary off of their feet, and made Azurill yelp at his world going topsy turvy.

Graveler walked over and picked Buneary up roughly by her ears, making her yelp as he looked her over, and saw Azurill. "Nice doll, think i'll borrow it." He said as with a free hand he took Azurill between two fingers, he yelped in pain, nearly making Graveler drop him.

"L-leave him alone..." Buneary said, clearly frightened as Graveler looked him over and a realization dawned on him. "This...is Azurill?" He grinned as he started squeezing harder, making Azurill yell in pain again. "Stop it! You're hurting him!" But all Buneary got was shaken around by her ears as another free hand clamped over her mouth, making her quiet. Braixen stood up as Graveler tormented the kids.

"Graveler...you're gonna regret doing this..." She seethed, as he just grinned at her.

"I'll let 'em go...once you tell me where Zorua is..." He said as he rolled Azurill around his fingers, he was screaming, but he himself didn't talk. If he ratted them out, he'd never get his size back...

Braixen considered this...he could gather pokemon...go after Zorua...but this was Graveler, he was hated and dumb and overly confident in his own strength...he'd go after Celebi on his own for sure. She could handle him, but it'd be a betrayal.

But Buneary...he was threatening her Buneary! And Azurill as well...if she played ignorance, maybe he'd relent? Doubtful...

And was defiance even an option? She could try and take him.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Graveler's crusade

choices: "Oh, sure! She's asleep, but I'll wake her up!"  Celebi's mom replied
"I'm sorry dear, she's not home."  Celebi's mom replied
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"I won't tell you!" Braixen snarled, her paw traveling to her tail as she took out her stick.

Graveler snickered as he looked at Azurill, who was still in his grip.

"Well then... you can say goodbye to this runt... and if you don't talk, this other friend of yours-" Buneary was dragged closer to him, pulled by her ear.

Braixen seethed.

"... Will say bye-bye too. And now Azurill-" Graveler was interrupted as a flow of water coming from Azurill's mouth hit him in the eye.

Blinded, the rock-type let go of the mouse to bring a hand to his injured eye.

Big mistake.

Almost immediately, fire erupted from Braixen's stick and hit Graveler in his other eye.

Normally, fire was weak against rock, but hitting a weak spot like one's eyes could cause great and possibly irreversible damage.

Graveler growled, his other hand letting go of Buneary as he brought it to his eye as well.

The bunny got up and bounced in the air, before performing Jump Kick on the blinded Graveler, who screamed in pain.

The rock-type stumbled back, opening the eye that was hit by Water Gun - Braixen doubted he was opening the one she hit with Flamethrower ever again.

"That's it! You're all DEAD! And when I find Zorua, he'll join you!" the rock-type fumed as he charged Braixen.

The vixen shielded herself with her paws and stumbled back as Graveler hit her, before another Water Gun hit him in the back.

Azurill didn't know why he was even doing this, but figured he had more chances to regain his original height if he helped.

Sadly, his attacks was far, far too weak in his current state, and Graveler turned back, staring daggers at him.

He stomped his stone foot down, knocking Azurill on his behind from the earthquake that was caused by the rock-type, who grinned evilly, moving a step towards the helpless mouse.

Luckily, Graveler didn't get to touch Azurill: Buneary stepped forward, one of her ears extending as it hit the rock in the face, soon emulated by the other.

The rock-type initially snarled, but he found himself unable to retaliate... in fact, he found that all he could do right now was stumble around. He felt sick and confused.

If he was lucid, he would have realized that Buneary used Dizzy Punch to incapacitate him. It wasn't enough to hurt him, but it did manage to confuse him.

Before Graveler had a chance to snap back to reality, he was hit by another Flamethrower and stepped back, trying to process what hit him.

But, confused and helpless, he didn't notice where he was going; Braixen did though.

The grass behind the rock-type wasn't grass at all.

The leg of the vixen raised as she kicked Graveler, who took another step back... and the ground beneath his feet suddenly sank.

He too sank along with the green sheet into a deep, tight hole that was one of Zorua's traps.

The impact caused by the rock hitting the bottom of the hole made the ground quake beneath Braixen, Buneary and Azurill.

Braixen sighed deeply as her legs gave up; she slid down on the ground, losing her stick in the meantime.

"I never thought I'd say this but... I owe you, Zorua," she said, awash with relief.

On the bottom of the hole, Graveler just came to his senses,

"Hey! Lemme outta here!"

Braixen glared at the pit that held the rock-type prisoner.

"I don't think so you moron... have fun climbing out..." she hissed, causing Graveler to snarl in his cruel-but-totally-deserved confinement.

Braixen's gaze softened as she looked at her two companions,

"Good job you two... Azurill," she said, picking up the mouse,
"That was pretty brave of you... this might just help you get your size back," she praised, gently caressing the blue mouse, who blushed.

Braixen stood up.

"Now, what do you say if we go find..." she stopped, looking at the hole Graveler was in.

He didn't have to discover where Zorua was... although that'd be the last of his mistakes.

Knocking at Celebi's door, demanding to hurt Zorua... Graveler probably wasn't going to get out of the house alive.

The fairy was notoriously overprotective with Zorua.

Little did Braixen know what there actually was between her friends...

--

The door opened, and a pink Celebi came into view, smiling.

Apparently, she had another day off today.

Azurill instantly smiled, pretending to be a doll again.

"Oh, Braixen, Buneary... hello there!" Celebi's mom greeted cheerfully.

"Hi miss..." Braixen replied.

The pink time-traveler dropped her smile: something was wrong.

"Hey, what happened? You look... upset." she pointed out, concerned for her daughter's friends.

"Graveler..." Buneary timidly said, causing Celebi's mom to frown.

"Oh, did he bother you? I'll have to talk with him next time I see him... and with his dad." she stated solemnly.

Braixen sighed.

"Miss? Is Celebi inside? We'd like to... hang out with her," she lied.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: A rock-hard fight

choices: "I...I'll talk to you alone kid."
"Get out of here Azurill...I don't want to talk to you."
Zorua was silent, he couldn't think of what to say
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"Sure, she's sleeping in, but i'll go wake her up! It's a little late in the morning as is." Celebi's mom smiled as she let them in and they sat on the couch. The older time traveler disappeared down the hall as Buneary sighed and felt at her ears...still sore. Azurill for his part was hurting pretty bad too, and honestly was starting to bruise around where he was squeezed.

"How are we gonna do this around her mom..." Braixen mumbled and Buneary looked at her wondering that herself.

"Please don't let her shrink me more..." Azurill mumbled, and Buneary started stroking him, trying to reassure him.

"I know mom I know..." The somewhat sleepy voice of Celebi pierced the room, as she hovered out and looked at the two...three pokemon there. Braixen knew...Celebi's mouth became a thin line briefly before smiling.

"Come on you two, come to my room!" She said as Celebi's mom smiled at them all. "If any of you need anything i'll be out here." She said as the pokemon thanked her, then shut themselves in Celebi's room.

-

"Azurill, did you reveal yourself to Braixen?" Celebi asked in a lecturing tone and he gulped before Buneary intervened. "No, I showed him to her...when she said that there was a search party out for Azurill." She muttered, making Celebi's eyes widen. There was a search party already? "There's a few things going on Celi. I tried to talk to him, make him reflect on what he did in Zorua's forest."

"You went to my forest?" Zorua asked from his perch on the bed, making Braixen nod.

"Yeah...I wanted to show him that his threat wasn't idle with all of your traps...and convince him to apologize when we ran into a pokemon hunting you down Zorua...Graveler seems determined to find you right now." She said, making Zorua yawn.

"Whatever, he won't find me." He said bored as Braixen sighed.

"But now Graveler knows about Azurill too..." She said making Celebi groan.

"Azurill, I said i'd shrink you more if you got attention..." Celebi said as her eyes started glowing, Azurill shut his eyes before Braixen roughly grabbed Celebi.

"Again, not his fault! He tried to threaten Buneary and myself to get Zorua's location, he snatched Azurill thinking he was a doll and started squeezing him! Even then, none of us said a word about you...we eventually dumped him in a pit, with Azurill's help, so hear us out!" Braixen said and Celebi's eyes stopped glowing. She sighed.

"...Okay." She turned her attention to the cowering blue mouse in Buneary's grasp, his eyes clamped shut. Zorua looked at him and rolled his eyes but Celebi approached and gently patted his head. "It's fine Azurill, I won't shrink you again." She soothed and he opened his eyes, he looked up at her and she was smiling.

"Celebi...let him and Zorua talk things over, maybe we can resolve this now..." Braixen said.

Soon enough Azurill and Zorua were facing each other on the bed.

"Zorua..." Azurill started and Zorua looked unimpressed by the child in front of him. He expected a fake apology, or more dumb words, any of that. He didn't expect what he got.

Azurill had thought of something, something that would make a lot of things make sense to him.

"Zorua...did something bad happen to you too?" Azurill asked, making Zorua blink.

"...what?" He said, confused and Azurill looked down.

"When my mom died...I lashed out at lots of pokemon until Wigglytuff came along...even now, I still lash out...and I said some dumb things to you...did...something happen to you too? You...don't do what Graveler does, he likes to steal and prove his strength but...you just prank pokemon alone in the forest...laugh at us...try to make us miserable...but maybe there's a reason?" He asked, no malice in his voice and Zorua's jaw dropped.

Braixen, Buneary and Celebi all watched this and were shocked by this turn too.

Zorua closed his mouth and looked at the blue mouse in front of him.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: An unexpected question

choices: "Y-Yeah, whatever... let's make peace, Zorua." Azurill finally said
"I... I can't make peace with him, I simply can't!" Azurill screamed
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"C-Celebi?" Buneary parroted back, confused, knowing that that sentence meant taking Azurill to see Zorua as well.

"Yeah," Braixen nodded, grabbing Buneary's paw,
"The sooner we solve this thing, the sooner we'll stop worrying about people out there finding him and, as a consequence, finding out about Zorua."

The bunny nodded as she silently followed the vixen out of her room, squeezing the silent Azurill against her chest.

"Mom! I'm going out with Braixen!" she called, almost immediately receiving a response,
"Okay sweetie! Be careful!"

With that, the trio exited the house and started walking, headed to Celebi's house.

--

"We need to talk Azurill,"

Hidden from the search party behind Buneary's paws, Azurill peeked out.

"What?" he asked as loudly as he could, hoping that someone would hear him and put an end to this nightmare.

No such luck.

"It's about Zorua." Braixen sighed,
"If you want your size back, you'll have to apologize, promise to not talk and then keep that promise."

"What?!" Azurill shouted that, but still didn't get even a glance. Anyway, for good measure, Buneary pushed her paws against his mouth, silencing him.

"Keep it down..."

The paws were removed from the blue mouse.

"Braixen, I can't do that! Even if I pretend to have never seen Zorua yesterday, Celebi shrunk me! I need to tell!" he said shakily,
"Jerk deserves anything they're going to do him..." he added, smirking at the thought of Zorua suffering.

Braixen halted, looking at Azurill sternly.

"You'll never have a chance to talk Azurill: either you promise to keep quiet or Celebi will leave you in that state forever... or worse. I recall her reducing Zorua almost to nothing before she broke his leg." she said, causing Azurill's jaw to hang open and Buneary to shiver.

"Zorua..." she said dejectedly.

Braixen resumed walking, suddenly looking ashamed.

"I'll tell you one more. Buneary, remember when Zorua apologized to you?" the brown/cream pokemon nodded, blushing and smiling brightly.

"Well... like fifteen minutes before that, I almost murdered Zorua for that prank he pulled on you." the purple vixen revealed while Buneary's smile changed into a horrified expression.

"Yep. I was like you Azurill, I was angry, I was making death threats... but my friends stopped me from doing something I would have regretted. They made me realize that Zorua wasn't that bad after all. These days, he's being mischievous, sarcastic, but not the sadistic prankster he was back then." Braixen continued.

Azurill looked down.

"... Why are you telling me this?"

Braixen smiled.

"We are your friends, Azurill," she said, her paw reaching to pet the mouse on the head,

Buneary smiled too.

"And we'll stop you from doing something you would regret."

--

Inside Celebi's house all was quiet.

The pink time-traveler that was her mom was gone to work, while she was (surprisingly) still asleep, Zorua pinned against her chest as usual.

The reason of such unusual occurrence was one: she had horrible nightmares; an angry crowd had showed up at her house, had snatched Zorua from her.

Wigglytuff and Graveler - who hated the fox - tore the poor dark-type apart, all while her own mother shouted in approval, forcing her to watch as Zorua's corpse was stomped into dust by the crowd.

Celebi had screamed so much that, in her dreams, she had fainted. And in those moments, she had woken up, almost crying, each time repeating herself that all was fine, that Zorua wasn't going to be killed.

And when someone knocked at the door, she didn't wake up.

Sadly, the knocking continued, until she finally woke up, was forced to drop Zorua on her bed and get up.

She hazily moved through her own, yawning, trying to rid her mind of the gruesome scenes she witnessed in her dreams.

"Not my Zorua... they won't get him..." she murmured, still half asleep.

She found her front door by bumping into it and quietly opened.

She rubbed her eyes as an indistinct mass of purple, brown and blue came into her view, soon assuming the various shapes of a vixen, then a bunny and in the end a small mouse.

"Oh... Braixen... Buneary... Azurill..." she greeted, yawning drowsily.

"Hi Celi," Braixen said,

"What happened? You look weird..." Buneary pointed out.

"I'm sorry... I'm still asleep..." she tried to smile, but she grimaced as she finally started to regain some lucidity and noticed Azurill, staring at her with fear.

And she even greeted him.

Her gaze nervously went from Azurill to Braixen, who smiled, comprehensive.

"I already know. We're here because Azurill would like to tell Zorua a few words," the vixen explained.

Celebi stared at the mouse intently.

"... This way, he's in my room. Wait until he wakes up... I need to wash my face..." she yawned once more as she walked towards her bathroom, closing the door, while Braixen led Buneary and Azurill to Celebi's room.

It was dark in her room, so dark the the trio didn't initially spot the black pokemon sleeping in Celebi's bed.

After a few moments, Zorua started to stir, feeling like he was being watched.

The fox opened his eyes, his blue gaze piercing the darkness as it landed on Buneary, Braixen and Azurill.

On Azuri-

"You." he said after a moment,
"What are you doing here? Where's Celebi?" he asked, annoyed by Azurill's presence... and because the three had woken him up.

"Bathroom, she's washing herself. Good morning, by the way," Braixen chimed in response.

Zorua snorted.

"Good morning Zorua~" Buneary said cheerfully.

"We're here because Azurill wanted to tell you something," Braixen continued while Zorua gazed at the blue mouse.

Braixen did too.

"Right, Azurill?"
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: A story and a meeting

choices: "Azurill...I think is trying to make peace."
"He's just trying to weasel out of his fate."
"Azurill apologized...sounded real, but i'm not sure yet..."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"U-um...I..." Azurill was looking for the words. A lot of information was dumped on him recently. Apparently Zorua had suffered under Celebi...and it had somewhat made him reconsider his position?

"Zorua..." Azurill was set on the bed at this point by the giantess bunny pokemon, and her and the giantess fox were watching him.

Zorua looked at the blue mouse intently, but also a bit confused. Azurill closed his eyes and took a deep breath.

"Whatever! Let's make peace!" He almost had to force the words out, but he had done it, he opened his eyes, taking a deep breath again only to see Zorua looking at him confused.

"...huh?" Zorua eventually said and at this Buneary chimed in.

"He wants to make peace with you Zorua, like you did with me and Braixen, right?" She said hopeful and Zorua let his gaze go from the giant child to Azurill.

"Hmm...really?" Zorua didn't seem convinced. He was sure the blue mouse was just trying to get out of his situation, he didn't mean a lick of it...at least Zorua couldn't be sure without more talking and proof.

"And what brought this on all of a sudden? You don't want to be a wittle bitty doll?" Zorua said, half mocking, but definitely pushing the question.

Braixen folded her arms, but left it be. If Azurill wanted out of his situation, he needed to be genuine. She was wondering what was taking her friend with washing up though...

Azurill looked the fox in the eye, his lip quivering.

"O-okay, I admit that's part of my motivation...a lot of it...but...m-maybe you've changed and...gone through your own ordeals too." Azurill started.

"I...heard about your leg...and you being really really small...and that you tried to make amends with other pokemon...maybe I was too hasty yesterday, okay? I shouldn't have threatened you...or Celebi..." Azurill finished. The three pokemon in the room were silent, and at this moment, Celebi entered the room.

"Okay, now what is going on here? Why is Azurill here?" Celebi asked, looking intently at the shrunken mouse...she was frightening with her height and look, he shivered a bit at this. Braixen just gave Celebi a grin.

"Relax Celi, we're trying to resolve this whole mess, right?" She looked to Buneary who nodded, who looked to Azurill...who also nodded, though still shaky.

Celebi folded her arms and looked to Zorua.

Zorua spoke.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Azurill's attempt at peace

choices: Zorua attempts to broach peace
Azurill attempts to broach peace
They start bickering
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Braixen was about to lay into Azurill about how his threat may have warranted Zorua's threat to eat him, but she recalled something from the other night.

"What do you think you're doing? Hand over that pest, Espurr, I'm gonna teach him a lesson!"

"CALM DOWN?! Have you forgotten what that pest did to poor Buneary?!"

Then there was Buneary's reaction to him at his size...fear, then hesitation before forgiving him. Azurill ran headlong into a situation he knew nothing about and opened his mouth in a way he shouldn't have, but...would she have done any different? He was also a little kid, around Buneary's age, and he probably wasn't thinking things through. Her expression softened. "Azurill, you have your reasons for hating Zorua, I know that...I did too, as did Buneary, he HAS changed, and...maybe you can't see that yet, but we're gonna resolve this situation. You need to put in effort too though, because like it or not, you HAVE to make peace with him." She said, getting stern on that last bit.

"Why should I make peace..." Azurill said and Braixen did have a retort on stand-by. "Because it's the only way you'll get your size and get to go home."

"Tch."

Braixen then turned her attention to Buneary. "We need to go to Celebi's."

"Alright, are we going to make Azurill and Zorua friends then?" Buneary asked hopefully and Braixen grinned.

"Yeah, after I give them an earful."

-

They exited the house to see pokemon wandering about, some going about their business, a few others helping Wigglytuff look for Azurill...all the kids that stayed with Wigglytuff were there too, Swinub, his actual daughter Igglybuff, Cleffa, and Magby. Braixen thought quick and stashed Azurill in her tail. "Be quiet, go with me on this okay? It's the only way you'll get big again." She didn't hear a peep from her tail so she hoped that was a sign he got the message.

"Have either of you seen Azurill?" Swinub asked them, approaching them. "Um...no...sorry Swinub." Braixen scratched at the back of her head, noting that he immediately looked dejected. "Well...if you see him please let us know...okay?" He turned around, only to stop the next passing pokemon to ask the same thing.

"Jeez...this is a mess and a half Celi..." Braixen muttered and Buneary just nodded.

-

The walk itself was uneventful for Braixen and Buneary, but Azurill was having a heck of a time trying to keep his senses in her tail. if being carried shook his world then this was a flat out earthquake. After a while it stopped though as they reached their destination. Braixen knocked on the door and soon enough it was answered by a smiling Celebi. "Oh, Braixen, hey! And...Buneary..." She hesitated on this last one. Braixen was giving her a serious look. "You know?" Celebi said and she nodded. "Yeah, Buneary told me, though you should be more worried about the fact that the entire village knows he's missing, and half of them are helping Wigglytuff search for him." and Celebi scratched her head. "Well...what was I supposed to do? He threatened Zorua! He would've told if I let him go!" Celebi said as the two other pokemon stepped inside. "Is your mom home?" Braixen asked and Celebi shook her head. "Just Zorua and I..."

"Cool, then we can all talk openly." She said as she reached in her tail to pull out the flailing Azurill. "Okay, first round. Azurill, apologize to Celebi for threatening Zorua and her by proxy." Azurill looked down at the ground. "Sorry Celebi..." He muttered defeated and she looked taken aback. "Okay..." She said, not sure how to respond. "Okay, cool. Go get Zorua Celebi." Braixen said, in total control of the situation despite being weaker than Celebi. She nodded as she went to go get Zorua.

She brought him back about 30 seconds later. "Oh, it's Braixen, Buneary, and the blue blabbermouth!" Zorua said snickering as Braixen looked at him. "I'd take the situation more seriously Zorua since there's already a search party out for Azurill." She said and Zorua looked unimpressed. "They won't find him."

"THAT'S NOT THE-Okay, anyways...Azurill, apologize to Zorua for threatening him and trying to blackmail him." Braixen was about to tear into him, but caught herself.

Azurill looked shocked at this. "No."

"Just do it Azurill."

"No!"

"Azurill..."

"NO! HIM!? ME APOLOGIZE TO HIM!? AFTER HE DESTROYED THE LAST THING MY MOM EVER GAVE ME BEFORE SHE DIED AND LAUGHED IN MY FACE ABOUT IT! AFTER HE HURT MY FRIEND SWINUB AND TRAUMATIZED HIM!? AFTER HIS ATTEMPT TO EAT ME YESTERDAY!? I WILL NEVER APOLOGIZE TO HIM!"

The outburst caught everyone in the room off guard, and tears were running down Azurill's face at this. Celebi scratched the back of her head looking down at the floor, Buneary was shivering a bit from the outburst, and Zorua was just looking at Azurill wide eyed. Braixen recovered quickly and sighed. "Okay, this is going to take time...maybe you should apologize first Zorua..." She said and he just stuck up his nose. "Why? He's the one that threatened my life last night FIRST! Over a doll and some pranks!" He said and Braixen wanted to smack her head. "Okay, change of tactics, Buneary, hold Azurill. I'm going to talk to these two alone." She said handing him off to her as Buneary was petting the crying pokemon, trying to soothe him as Braixen and Celebi stepped out of the room, carrying the tiny Zorua.

-

"Zorua, he's a little kid who lost his mom and you are the object of his ire, by your own paw too. Of course he was going to do something stupid when he saw you like that!" Braixen scolded and he just stuck up his nose. "I'll apologize when he does." He said and Braixen grunted in frustration. "There are 3 ways out of this situation safely, I will outline them.very.carefully." She emphasized. "The first one, is you make peace enough that he won't BLAB about you and we all go our merry separate way. That's the ideal" She said. "The second is that Celebi grows you both back, and we deny anything he says."

"That would mean giving up my roomie..." Celebi said dejectedly and Zorua shook his head.

"The third is you dispose of Azurill. I won't be friends with any pokemon that would hurt a child though so be wary of that."

"I would never!" Celebi said before Zorua could respond, he sighed and said. "That's not an option."

"Then the first one it is...i'm going to call over Espurr, she'll be able to read his mind to tell when he won't rat out our secret." Celebi thought a second before nodding. "Okay." She said. "And as for you Celebi...you need to think things through better, or did you forget that I also threatened Zorua when I first discovered him? Did you not shrink me down because others were around or because I was your friend? Maybe it's because you weren't as close to Zorua as you are now?" Braixen said in a lecturing tone, Celebi looked down at the ground. "I'll apologize too..." She muttered and Braixen nodded. "First thing's first though...we need to let these two hash it out on their own." Braixen said.

"What!?" Zorua said. "Don't leave me alone wi-"

"It's for the best Zorua." Celebi sighed as he muttered something.

-

The two pokemon were glaring each other down. They'd been boxed into a small part of Celebi's room with her books and some small furniture and they had no way of leaving. They had left the room and shut the door, and weren't allowed out until Espurr okayed it. They had already been glaring for 15 minutes like this until eventually...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: A muddled situation

choices: Zorua retells the first time Celebi shrunk him, and what she did to him.
Some of the girls come back in before Zorua can relay that story.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Two individuals who both want to stick to their guns can make for a combative atmosphere, much like the two tiny Pokemon were doing now. Fortunately for the atmosphere, Zorua eventually decided that a grumpy staredown wasn't going to bring in any results, so he finally attempted to start a discussion with the moody young Azurill. Clearing his throat, he looked up to notice the other occupant of the area was still looking at him, although he seemed a bit less moody and a bit more exasperated now.

"So, uh..." Zorua began, before getting cut off.

"I don't wanna hear it, pal. You're the reason we're in this at all."

"Okay, so that means I have to fix it then, right? And I can't do that if you aren't even gonna listen to me."

"Why should I?! You took the last thing I had to remember my mother by, trashed it without a care in the world, and harassed my closest friend!"

"Well first, the reason you should listen to me is because we're probably never getting out of this box otherwise. Second..." Zorua began to choke up a little bit, "I'm sorry about the doll... and your mother. If I'd known that toy was a gift from your late mom..." Zorua looked away ashamedly, but Azurill didn't seem to care.

"And what about young Swinub, I haven't seen you go out and apologize to him!"

Zorua was beginning to get a bit more aggressive in voice, but not demeanor. "Well, as much as I'd like to now, people like you and Wigglytuff are still constantly giving me a hard time every time I happen to be in the general vicinity of anyone. It's hard to go out and apologize to people when your presence causes a constant one-sided shouting match and everyone treats you like an outcast."

"Well, you wouldn't be an outcast if you hadn't spent all your time pranking people, now would you?"

"Yeah, but I'm past all that now-"

"So explain why you threatened to eat me, then."

"Was just that, a threat. Celebi's keeping me straight these days."

"And just what is that supposed to mean?"

"Her and I are a couple now, and she wouldn't want to have a murderer be her boyfriend. It'd be a bad example, after all."

"Hmph."

"Hey, count yourself lucky that you aren't dead, buddy. Celebi can be... a bit extreme sometimes."

"Whaddaya mean by that?"

Now Zorua had the mouse's attention. Let's just see if he can keep it.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Young Prankster Gives Mouse an Earful, Story at 11

choices: "Let's make ‘peace’. I won't tell about you; you quit with pranks." Azurill says
"No way! I will never make peace to you!"  Azurill says
Azurill attacks Zorua!
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Finally, after fifteen long, interminable minutes of glaring at Azurill, the blue pokemon broke the silence with a long sigh of exasperation.

"This is all your fault." he said coldly.

Zorua blinked.
"Mine?! You attempted to blackmail me!" he yelled.

"You destroyed my doll! Traumatized Swinub!" Azurill retorted.

Zorua sighed.
"Look." he said.
"Let's just make peace. That way, we can get this over with." he held out a paw.

Azurill stared at the paw being offered, before glaring at Zorua again. He said a single word,
"No."

Zorua tensed up.
"No? Why no-" he paused to inhale sharply as he realized his mistake.
"Okay... Azurill, I am truly sorry about destroying the last gift from your mother and laughing about it, for traumatizing Swinub and for wanting to eat you and all that stuff... wish I could just take it all back... Friends?" he said in a monotone voice, like he already did this all countless times.

Now, Zorua pretty much expected Azurill to accept... he was a child, no? Children can be pretty forgiving, he thought.

However, Azurill kept glaring in silence.

Then, like he was pronouncing a death sentence, he repeated himself.

"No."

--

"What's going on in there?" Braixen asked from outside the door.

Espurr didn't even blink.
"Zorua is trying... but Azurill doesn't want to forgive him... and Zorua himself isn't being completely sincere with his apologies - he pretty much wants to get this over with." she explained.

Braixen sighed along with Buneary. Celebi rubbed her head.
"... Can I talk to Zorua for a moment? I'll try to convince him to be honest..."

Braixen shook her head.
"Let them sort this out by themselves." she said.

Celebi nodded.

"Hey, I know it isn't the right moment, but..." Espurr smirked while looking at Celebi.
"How is it going?" she vaguely said.

At the same time, Celebi blushed while both Braixen and Buneary looked at her.

"What are you talking about...?" Braixen asked, forgetting the situation for a moment.

Celebi shook her head before looking at Espurr.
"Focus on those two Espurr."

The psychic type smirked.

--

"Why not?"

Zorua mustered all his calm, before speaking again.

"... You don't get it, do ya?" he said to the glaring Azurill.
"This works to our advantage. Just accept my apologies, let's make peace, and then you get your size back, you get out of this house and keep your mouth sealed, and I get to live in peace!"

Azurill gritted his teeth.
"You don't deserve peace!" he shouted, before shaking his head.
"This isn't about the doll, Swinub, or everyone. It's about you Zorua! You're a jerk! Everyone hates you! Why should I accept your apology?"

Zorua felt offended.
"You're saying that everyone hates me? D'you think I'd be here right now if Celebi hated me? If she did, she'd just have let me die instead of saving me when she broke my leg!" he recalled.

That story had the power of making everyone sympathize with his situation.

Azurill looked shocked for a moment.

Celebi did what...?

Zorua sighed.
"No more pranks... I quitted with those... I think..." he said, holding out his paw again.
"Let's just make peace and you can rejoin your beloved Wigglytuff."

The blue pokemon shakes his head.
"Why did Celebi heal you? You wouldn't be here now if she didn't..." he said, still hostile.

--

"Okay, now Azurill is being a jerk." Espurr revealed with a frown, slightly offended by the blue pokemon's words.

Lies.

Not everyone hated Zorua. Proof was that he befriended even with Braixen, who hated him not three days ago. He even made her, Espurr, have a crush on him... although he already had feelings for Celebi.

But she accepted that and encouraged their relationship.

"How come?" Celebi asked.

"He said that everyone hates him... he just told you shouldn't have healed his broken leg back then... he literally just told him that he should have died."

Buneary gasped, Braixen sighed and Celebi frowned.

"Seriously, are we sure Zorua is the jerk in there?"

Espurr remained silent for a moment, glued to both tiny pokemon's minds.

Then, she slowly turned her head and gave the group a weird look.

"Things just got rough."

--

"I'm just trying to be nice!" Zorua seethed.

Azurill's hate was comprehensible, but still Zorua was apologizing to him. Regardless, Azurill kept barraging him with not-so-nice words.

"I don't care! Drop this charade Zorua! You're not nice, you never were nice, you'll never be nice!" Azurill retorted, earning a glare from the dark type fox.

Zorua growled, moving a menacing step towards the blue pokemon... only to stop immediately after to give an exasperated sigh.

"I said I'm done with pranks. I'm... sorry for your doll, sorry for laughing at you, sorry for this whole situation..." he said, sounding exhausted.

Azurill stared at him skeptically.
"You're done with pranks? How can I believe that?" he inquired.

Zorua placed a paw over his chest.
"I swear." he said, before the paw fell, stopping in midair as he held it out.

Azurill looked at it reluctantly. He pondered making peace to Zorua and get it over with... he seemed sincere... but what if it was a trick? To convince him to not tell about him? The mere thought made Azurill seethe...

"Let's just make peace." Zorua said, interrupting his train of thought.

Azurill stared at him in silence for a moment.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Burying the hatchet... trying to...

choices: "Sorry...I didn't know..." Azurill said sincerely
"I just...I don't know..." Azurill said conflicted
"I don't care! I won't make peace!" Azurill said seething
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"No way! I will never make peace with you! You'll never change! I don't care what you say!" Azurill said and Zorua wanted to scream in frustration. Was this kid thick? He was being given the golden ticket out of this and he kept throwing it aside to reinforce his hatred! He had an idea...this was the last thing he had, if this didn't work...then he didn't know what else to say.

-

"Hmm." Espurr said, interested.

"What's going on in there Espurr?" Celebi asked as Espurr shook her head.

"Zorua is either about to succeed, or fail spectacularly in convincing Azurill." She said, only she knew what Zorua was about to say...

-

"Okay Azurill, you want to get real about this? Let's do that then. You're a selfish, entitled brat who can't see past his own biases." Zorua stated, briefly shocking Azurill before he went to retort. "Why yo-"

"No, shut it. Let me talk you little crap, you miss your mom? I sympathize, I do. Wish I knew mine, maybe none of this would be happening if I did." Zorua said glaring and Azurill shut his mouth.

"You have a nice little family now? With Wigglytuff and his adopted kids? You have fond memories of your mother? The kind you'll cherish forever? Let me tell you something Azurill, you're damn lucky and don't understand what you have, what you can go back to if you leave here. I'll tell you how I grew up! I grew up with daddy dearest." Zorua paused to see Azurill was listening still.

"I...didn't have it good Azurill, it was constant belittling, sometimes he physically took out his frustrations. I was useless in his eyes, a burden, couldn't help him hunt, couldn't help him steal, when I said he was being mean he called it whining, there were times where he wouldn't feel me for a few days, called it an 'incentive' to evolve and make myself useful to him. I got fed up one day, I ran. I ran and ran, crying the whole way until I ended up here. Know what I saw? Happy families, smiling families. And something in me...oh, it tore up Azurill, I was seething...so I shared a little bit of myself with you all! Gave you a taste of that bitterness I carried. You're clearly still savoring the taste, aren't you?" Azurill seemed stunned by all of this, but Zorua kept going.

"Yeah, that's right, still so intent on this grudge. Swinub, yeah, he didn't deserve what I did to him, I acknowledge that. Buneary, i'm sorry to her too. She's a sweet girl that clearly didn't deserve that. To you? I don't know...maybe a slap in the face is what you need, get with the program! I shouldn't have torn up your doll, I shouldn't have laughed about it, but if you aren't careful you're going to grow up spiteful, bitter, alone...and tiny. As for me...I got a little taste of what YOU had, and...I liked it, I don't intend to go back, I don't want to go back, so no, I won't be pranking anymore, regardless of what you think." Zorua said, finally finished.

There was an air of silence as Azurill looked at the ground, processing this information.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Last ditch effort

choices: “Maybe you should take Azuril home”
“Maybe a group activity would help clear tensions”
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
“I don’t know...” Azurill finally said, as he sat back on his tail looking at the floor. “You don’t know?” Zorua said as he went to sit next to the younger pokemon. “Don’t know what, if you hate me? Want to rat me out? What you want for lunch?” Zorua offered and Azurill clenched his eyes shut. “I don’t know! Maybe you...maybe you had your reasons...or problems...but it doesn’t undo what you did! It doesn’t...but maybe you’re different now but...I just...don’t know...” Azurill finally finished and Zorua sighed. “If you stay bitter forever you won’t be happy, it can’t be fun for you can it? Take it from a guy with experience...” Azurill said nothing as he looked at the ground

-

“They’re done. They’ve reached a conclusion.” Espurr said simply.

“Well? Is it peace?” Espurr shook her head.

“It’s not...not peace, it’s a stalemate, Azurill is conflicted.”

“Will he tell others about Zorua?” Braixen asked, folding her arms and Espurr shrugged.

“Not even Azurill knows.” She said simply as Celebi sighed. “I can’t grow him back then...” She said. Braixen wanted to say something, but a look from Celebi stopped her.

“So now what?” Buneary asked as Celebi responded.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Unsure of what to do

choices: Buneary and Braixen take Azurill away...
"W-Wait! I want to say something!" Azurill shouts before they can leave
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"I don't care about your own family! You shouldn't have taken out your frustration on me... on the village! That was your problem, pal, you could have asked for help... instead, you got on everyone's bad side." Azurill told, seething.
"I won't make peace!"

Zorua looked at him in silence, before shrugging.
"Suit yourself you brat... enjoy your new life as a doll... if Celebi doesn't come up with something else..." he said, before looking around the trap made with Celebi's books.

He moved towards one frontal book, and turned around.
"I'm outta here." Zorua's hind legs rose in the air as he kicked the book behind him as hard as he could, making it fall down, freeing the two tiny pokemon.

--

"... They're done." Espurr reveals, deadpan.

Buneary smiles.
"Did they make peace?" she asks.

Espurr shakes her head no.

Braixen steps back.
"What? Why?" she inquired. Espurr turned around.
"Azurill... didn't accept. And Zorua - he got tired and refused to go on."she quietly tells.

Celebi sighs.
"Azurill is stubborn... he just refuses to see reality: Zorua changed. His hatred blinds him..." she says, before frowning.
"... But Zorua... he was being honest... right Espurr?"

The psychic type nodded.

"Then, he did what he had to," Celebi declared, moving towards the door.
"As for Azurill... I'm not restoring his size for now. I'll still leave him with Buneary until he decides to apologize and make peace."

Celebi starts to open the door.

However, Braixen grabbed her arm and pulled her back.
"Celi-" she tried, trying to maintain her control over the situation, but a glance at Celebi's face told her that she wasn't going to hear more.

So, reluctantly, she let go.

Celebi opened the door.

--

The door opened, allowing four girls to come inside the room.

Zorua smiled.
"Espurr!" he chimed, running towards the psychic type, who picked him up and hugged him, smiling.
"Yep, nice to see you too Zorua..." she said happily.

Buneary smiled as she watched the two hugging.

But Celebi went straight where Azurill was. She towered above him.

"Azurill." she calmly said.
"Know that we were listening. We know what you two said. And I'm highly disappointed in you."

He trembled as he cowered in the shadow of Celebi.
"Celi-" he meekly tries, but she interrupted.

"Save it. You just refuse to understand that Zorua really stopped pranking - the four girls in this room are ready to confirm what I'm saying." she told, glancing backwards.

"True." Braixen said, folding her arms.

"True." Buneary said, nodding quietly.

"True." Espurr said, nuzzling Zorua, who blushed.

Celebi gazed back at the blue speck on the ground.
"Not enough, Azurill? I can call Gardevoir over, have her tell the same exact thing." she said, before sighing.

"And I'm sorry to say that I'm not restoring your size. Not until you change your mind. Wigglytuff will have to wait - you brought this on yourself." she said, bending to scoop Azurill up and handing him to Buneary, who hugged him.

Azurill trembled lightly, not wanting to be Buneary's doll for the rest of his days... but not wanting to apologize to Zorua at the same time.

"Why? Why are you all sticking up for that jerk?!" he cried, tears forming in his eyes.

Espurr turned around, fixing her eyes on him.
"Because Zorua is not a jerk anymore Azurill." she quietly says, Zorua grinning from her chest.
"And the sooner you realize it the sooner- stop thinking I'm creepy." she said sternly.

Azurill trembled as he sighed in resignation.

Afterwards, he went quiet.

"Take him home Buneary." Celebi instructed.

Buneary nodded silently.

"I'll come with you." Braixen stated, moving up beside the bunny as the two started to walk out...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: End of the argument

choices: ... sighed, "Alright, I'll do it... only for ya Celi..."
... turned his head, "No deal... he brought that on himself."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"W-Wait!" Azurill shouted in fear as the giant bunny and fox carried him to the door.

Hearing her tiny passenger screaming, along with feeling him struggle in her grip, Buneary stopped to look down at him.

He was crying.

"A-Azurill...?" the bunny asked, concerned.

Espurr smirked.
"Hmm..." she said, fully knowing what Azurill was up to.

The blue pokemon sniffled in Buneary's paws.
"I... I-I want to say something..." he told, trying his best to fight back tears. He didn't want to cry, not in front of Zorua.

But... said fox, he noted, was watching him bemused, not snickering like he has expected.

"... What is it?" Braixen asked as she knelt to look at Azurill. He sniffled again.

"I-I don't want to live my life as a doll..." he whimpered.

A child's tears have the extraordinary power to melt everyone's hearts.

However, Celebi - the sweet, caring Celebi - remained quite cold. She looked at Zorua.
"... Should have thought before blackmailing us, Azurill. Now, go with Buneary, think about it and, when you're ready to apologize to Zorua, I'll be glad to restore your size." she said, sticking up for her roomie and boyfriend.

Azurill looked even more depressed.

"Well... I... I t-think... Z-Zorua told me t-things... Maybe he isn't what he looks like, really..." he said, before sighing as he looked at Zorua in Espurr's paws.

The dark type looked unimpressed.

"What I'm trying to say... is that... is that I won't tell anyone about him... and I'm... I'm willing to make peace..." he slowly admitted, finding the situation extremely humiliating.

Forced to apologize to Zorua to have his size and life back... and having to keep his mouth shut in order to not fall into this situation again.

Everyone stared at him.

"Azurill..." Buneary said with a smile, emulated by Braixen.

Celebi too smiled.
"Finally." she said, moving to gently caress the blue pokemon on top of the head while trying to wipe his tears with her free paw.

"Now, that wasn't so hard, was it?" she said, before looking at Zorua.

"Come on, Zorua, you two make peace and we can possibly save the rest of the day~" she said.

Zorua looked at Azurill, who stared back at him, silence falling into the room.

Then, Zorua started snickering. First, it was nothing more than a low giggle, but it gradually raised tone until it sounded much like an evil laughter.

Zorua was literally howling with laughter.

"Z-Zorua...?" Celebi said, taken aback.

"Zorua..." Espurr whispered as she looked into his mind. She knew what he wanted to do... and she really couldn't do anything about it. The fox in her arms had all the right...

Eventually, Zorua's laughter died down as he grinned at the still crying Azurill.

"No."

Silence.

That word struck everyone inside of the room, it echoed in Azurill's mind like it was the voice of Giratina, ‘No’.

"Zorua-" Braixen said, attempting to give him a stern gaze. But he looked at her, an evil grin painted on his face.

Braixen's stern gaze evaporated as she took a step back. Even at that size, Zorua scared her.

"... Why not, Zorua?" Celebi chimed in.

He laughed again.
"Simple really." he responded, before looking at Azurill.
"He deserves all that. I tried countless times to apologize today, you all know I did. And yet, he refused! But now, the threat of being a doll in Buneary's paws scares him into apologizing! That's priceless!" he told with a snicker.

He then stopped laughing.
"How could I accept an apology coming from such coward? That's pathetic, Azurill. And my response is ‘no’." he said.

Azurill closed his eyes. It was over. Zorua just pronounced his death sentence... a toy in the paws of a bunny for the rest of his life.

Celebi bit her lip as she went to pick Zorua from Espurr.
"Zorua..." she whispered.
"Trust me, you have all the right to be acting like this... but he's only a child, and we're four goddesses to him... you're even bigger than he is."

Zorua raises an eyebrow.
"And?"

"Just say you'll accept his apology and let him go... he won't tell about you... if he does, I'll personally make sure that he'll live to regret it." Celebi promised.

Zorua looked at her for a minute.
"Hmm." he contemplated the choices. Accepting would mean letting Azurill grow back again, meaning he'd have the chance to just go out there and tell everything to Wigglytuff.

Nobody in the room could predict Azurill's first move when he was big again... IF he was big again.

"... That's a possibility..." Espurr admitted while looking at him, deep in thought.

Zorua ignored her mind in his.

On the other hand, keeping Azurill tiny would mean that the girls would attempt to make him forgive him who knows how many other times... and all he really wanted now was to get rid of Azurill forever... plus, Celebi would be pleased if he accepted to forgive the cowardly blue pokemon.

And a pleased Celebi would mean chips, soda and a LOT of attention.

Zorua smiled at the thought.

"... So?" Braixen asked, looking at the dark type.

Zorua...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Submitting

choices: He’s stopped by a psychic force in time
Azurill hits the ground, but survives
Azurill...hits the ground...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Those words rung through Azurill’s ears. This was it, he heard the girls challenging Zorua but he wasn’t hearing them, he was dwelling in his own mind on what he had before him. A life as a doll. Was that a life...? Humiliated, the ultimate humiliation by Zorua. He supposed maybe he should’ve thought about it...was Zorua different? Should he have apologized and accepted Zorua’s? It didn’t matter, he had acted too late. His body felt numb and time seemed to slow. Never see Wigglytuff again? Would they ever find out about him? No closure...no more games with Swinub, or Igglybuff, or any of them...

He thought back to Zorua’s words. A coward, right? Was he that? Did he go wrong somewhere? Finding Zorua? Threatening him? Throwing it all back in his face? And now Zorua wanted nothing to do with restoring him and it was ultimately his final say. There was no going back for him now...he was standing on Buneary’s paws, but they were all paying attention to Zorua, not him...the thought crossed his mind. It had a few times before...only after his mom died but before he met Wigglytuff...to see her again.

‘Coward? That’s right, maybe I am...but if I’m brave once...for one moment...I can see mom again.’ He thought as he looked over the edge of Buneary’s paws, noting it was a long drop...to a hardwood floor. He just needed to go head first.

Espurr’s eyes widened as her attention snapped to Azurill. “Buneary, stop him!” She said, but it was too late and Azurill made his jump all too quick for the room to process.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: The edge

choices: Azurill wakes up later, feeling better
Azurill wakes up later, still desperate
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Everyone in the room screamed, except Zorua who looked in shock as Azurill leaped off his perch, head first.

He just attempted suicide.

Azurill felt nothing, only the void. Tears slid out of his eyes as he fell towards the hard ground. For a moment though, he felt in peace.

No more Zorua, no more life as a doll. Just a quick pain, and he would be in the warm embrace of his mother.

He heard screams around him, but he ignored them. It was over. All over. His problems, his pain, his-

Azurill opened his eyes feeling the air stopping. It took him a few moments to realize that he stopped falling.

He looked around, discovering himself floating in midair, the faces of the four giantesses and Zorua staring at him with shock.

Espurr had her ears risen and her eyes glowing. She broke his fall... his only chance to rejoin his mom...

"Ngh... lemme go!" he cried, trying to struggle against the psychic force keeping him, tears resuming streaming down his cheeks. He tried his best to break free... fall down, break his head.

Then, it would be the end.

Sadly, his plans are shattered as Braixen steps forward, scooping the young pokemon in her paws. The psychic grip released Azurill.

"ARE YOU OUT OF YOUR MIND?!" the giantess cried. Azurill ignored her, and noted that he was free from the psychic force.

"Mom!" he shouted as he tried to jump off Braixen's paws. Even better, she was taller than Buneary, he'd be dead for sure.

However, Braixen gripped him firmly.

"Azurill stop!" Celebi said in alert, inadvertently squeezing Zorua in her hands as she watched the tiny pokemon struggle in Braixen's grip.

He ignored her and kept crying incoherently while he struggled to get free.

"Mom... help... I want to see my mom..." he cried, warm tears hitting Braixen's paws.

"... He's delirious. He's in a state of desperation, and wants to try to commit suicide again..." Espurr said.

"Azurill..." Buneary whimpered, tears rolling down her cheeks.

Only one remained silent, and it was Zorua.

Celebi looked at him.
"Zorua..." she whispered, poking him. He turned around, expecting an angry face, a disappointed face...

But instead, he found a pitiful face.

"Zorua..." Celebi repeated as she lowered her head in her paws.

He instinctively backed up.
"Don't ya try to blame me, I had no-" Celebi's finger covered his mouth.

"I know I know... you had good reasons, you couldn't know and I'm not blaming you," she quietly said, her finger leaving Zorua's mouth as she gently caressed him on the head.
"But... just tell him you accept his apologies... or he might attempt suicide again..."

Zorua looked down.

"Zorua... we weren't going to kill him, remember?" the fairy gently recalled, not a hint of rage or lecture in her voice.

Zorua sighed and perked up.

"We'll see about that..." he told, causing Celebi to smile a little.
"In the meantime..." he turned to see Azurill still squirming to get free from Braixen's paws.

And she looked like she was having a hard time at keeping the agitated pokemon under her control.

Espurr turned to face Zorua, reading his thoughts.

"... That might actually work." she said with a nod as she picked the small fox from Celebi and put him onto Braixen's closed fists.

The larger fox started at him confused, but he ignored her and walked to the struggling mouse.

"Azurill." he said, grabbing the crying pokemon with his paws and forcing him to look in his eyes. Azurill struggled, but Zorua's eyes glowed.

And Azurill suddenly found the room, the giantesses and Zorua disappearing around him as he discovered himself falling into a dark pit.

He didn't oppose.

‘Mom...’

He hit an illusionary surface. Darkness claimed the fairy type, and he fell into a dreamless slumber.

Zorua sighed as he watched Azurill's eyes closing.

Braixen looked at him, shocked.
"Did you just...?" she asked.

"Zorua..."

Zorua sighed.
"No." he responded.
"He'll just sleep for a while... hopefully, he'll wake up without suicidal thoughts."

Celebi sighed in relief as she picked both tinies from Braixen.

She moved to the bed, gently placing Azurill under the bedsheets, before looking at Zorua.

"Good work Zorua." she said, pecking him.

He blushed, while Braixen stared at the two in shock.

"Let's just hope he feels better when he wakes up..." Celebi said.
"Let's just hope he DOES wake up..." Espurr said.

Braixen sighed.

"I'm sure he'll be fine..." she said dejectedly, thinking that it was entirely her fault. If only she hadn't suggested that Zorua and Azurill made peace, none of this would have happened.

She shakes off the thought, deciding to focus on something else.

She looks at Celebi and Zorua.
"In the meantime..." she moved a step towards them.
"You two... together?!"

"That's so cute~!"

Zorua sighed.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Failed attempt

choices: "I can't...I can't tell..." Azurill said, far more afraid than Zorua expected.
"If you promise..." Azurill said, hesitantly.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Azurill started stirring, again, his surroundings somewhat dark...it must've been night, there was light from a window pouring in he noted and...his surroundings seemed distorted, as if through a filter. "W-what...?" He muttered blearily as his senses returned and he remembered what was going on. "Did I...that's right..." He muttered. He failed...he wouldn't fail again though. He saw he was near the edge of a table and was about to run off when a force stopped him, it felt like a wall. "Oof! What the heck?" He muttered as he looked around, then up and realized what had happened.

He was in a cup...and looking at his surroundings that also meant...he was smaller than he had been. "You know, you have serious issues." A familiar voice rang out, louder than he was used to. He turned around to see Zorua peering at him from outside of the glass, much larger than he was now. Azurill started whimpering. "Jeez, relax...i'm not going to eat you." Zorua said and Azurill seemed to process something. "Actually...you should...please do Zorua...or let me out of this glass...so I can..." Azurill felt motion as he was spun around and around before landing on his butt, dazed. Zorua had spun the glass a few times. "You will stop suggesting that right now or i'll keep spinning this glass." Zorua said, before he sighed. "You are a seriously demented brat, you know, when I say you have issues, I mean you HAVE them, and they ain't me." Azurill glared up at the giant to him fox who looked back before sitting down, leaning his head against the glass.

"Why are you even here..." Azurill said, bitterly. "Simple, I said i'd be the one there when you woke up so I could say we'll grow you back." Was all he said and Azurill's interest seemed piqued. "Buuut, I haven't decided if i'm going to go with that or not." Zorua said and Azurill started bouncing up and down. "Why you-"

"Listen here Azurill, I did give you every opportunity you know, and you threw them back in my face, then when the prospect of reality started to hit you suddenly own up, AND THEN you try and off yourself when it seems you have no other alternative. Spineless." Zorua said and Azurill looked down. "That being said...I spilled my guts out for you about my dad...so fair's fair." Zorua said as he leaned closer to the glass.

"Tell me about her, your mom." He said and Azurill looked at him before shaking his head. "I...I don't want to." He said shakily as Zorua put a paw on the glass. "I'll spin you again, don't think that I won't." And Azurill gulped. "Okay...okay...fine...she...I don't know where to start...she was...always there you know? Always wanting to play with me, teach me things, smile, make me sweets. We weren't super...rich or anything, so she couldn't buy me toys. She made them for me though...when I got hurt or sick she never left my side...she was...she was..." Azurill had tears in his eyes now and Zorua sighed. "Good mom, huh?" And Azurill nodded. "Can I ask what happened?"

Azurill sat down and curled up with his ball. "She...she got a call one night, urgent...she didn't say what or why...she only told me she'd be right back and she put me to bed...I woke up alone. In an empty house. I found out later that they found her body in the forest...later Wigglytuff told me a feral beast had gotten her." He sniffled.

"It wasn't long after that that Wigglytuff took me in...he's..." And all of a sudden Azurill shut his mouth.

"...he's?" Zorua said, making a note of this.

"Nothing...nevermind." Azurill said. "Look, I told you, will you please grow me back now?" He said.

"First, tell me about what you were about to say there Azurill." Zorua said, and Azurill shook his head. "Please, I can't okay...I can't..." He said. Now Zorua was DEFINITELY curious.

"You know about me being doll sized right? And you won't tell if we grow you back? Tell me this thing and I won't tell, that way we both have something on each other. It's mutually assured destruction, right?" Zorua said, offering him to grow back if he told.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Pressing

choices: To get to Wigglytuff's now!"
To get the other girls, we need to talk!"
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Azurill sighed before continuing. "You...you have to promise you won't tell Zorua...please..." Azurill said.

"Only if you don't tell about me." Zorua stated simply, as he now needed to know this.

"Wigglytuff...is nice...he always wants us to do our best but...he warns us of dangers, calls himself 'old school' when it comes to parenting...he will send us on errands you know, or have us do standard chores and the like...but some nights he...talks to some weird pokemon outside. It isn't something we're supposed to participate in, but when he comes back every time, the next day he'll either keep us from school, or playing, or what have you to do a 'bonding' day with him...he never brings Igglybuff, but...the rest of us go with him, to either some sort of museum, or warehouse, and do various things, take pictures, make stuff as he instructs, just...I dunno, weird stuff. He says that we must never EVER tell anyone about this stuff, or...the beast that got our parents might get us..." Azurill looked down at the ground, at this Zorua's eyes shot open.

No way.

No freaking way...

"Azurill...that beast, does he..."

"Wigglytuff says it stays in your forest at night...you know about it don't you?" Azurill asked, genuinely believing what he was asking. Zorua's mouth was hanging open at this point.

"He sends us to your forest during the day sometimes...never Igglybuff, but it's always to grab something, or pick something...that's when I encountered you...and you...my doll..." At this Azurill got a glare again but Zorua was simply processing the things he was hearing too much to notice.

"H-how often does Wigglytuff talk about me...?" Zorua asked, he was close to something he felt...very close.

"A lot...he hates you, we all do Zorua, he's told us about some of the stuff you've done that even none of these girls know about, that's why I don't get it...why you're even putting up this act..." Azurill said glaring and Zorua got up, before he ran away from the glass. So...his reputation was worse than he thought because of..."CELEBI!" His voice rang out, nearly deafening Azurill with how tiny he was. "WE NEED TO TALK NOW!" And soon Celebi began stirring from her bed. "W-wha? Oh...is Azurill awake...?" She asked blearily as she approached the table, she was a veritable mountain to Azurill, he started shivering. "Zorua...you promised..." He muttered, though Celebi couldn't hear him, Zorua could.

"Listen, you CAN'T grow him back! Not right now!" Zorua said and Azurill started crying again. "Liar! Traitor!" He screamed. "Kid, i'm saving your freaking skin and believe it or not you're going to not only apologize to me, but THANK me later!" Zorua said, as Celebi picked him up.

"Zorua, what is going on?" She asked.

"I'll explain on the way, but we need...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Unraveling thread

choices: "We know enough! Let's go find Wigglytuff!" he said
"We need to know more... we've got to confront Azurill." he said
Suddenly, a noise draws the group's attention...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Celebi looked at Zorua dazedly.

"... Zorua, I don't doubt that what you have to say is very important..." she paused to yawn.
"But it's kinda the middle of the night, and honestly I'm still sleepy... the others are most likely sleeping..."

Zorua glanced back at the cup to see the terrified Azurill. He gazed back at Celebi.
"No Celebi, we gotta go NOW!... And grow me back while you're at it." he said.

Celebi yawned again, but bent to put Zorua on the ground, her eyes glowing. And, through the thick glass, Azurill saw Zorua growing to the size of a mountain to him.

"... Let's go Celi." he said, running to the door.

Celebi hazily followed.
"... But Zorua... what about mom...?" she asked. If the pink Celebi checked into the room - and she did that often - she would find her daughter missing and a trapped pokemon who was missing from the village.

Zorua bit his lip as his eyes glowed. An illusionary sleeping Celebi appeared in the bed; at the same time, the cup holding Azurill prisoner disappeared along with its captive.

Celebi looked around, before nodding and opening the door.

She turned one last time to look at the invisible cup.

"Azurill... be quiet." she told.
"Do it, trust me." Zorua added.

Azurill whimpered.
"Why should I trust you...?" he asked.

Zorua sighed.
"You told me about Wigglytuff, no? If you want to live to see another day, you have to trust me." he told, earning a confused stare from a now fully awakened Celebi.

With those words, the two titans left the room, leaving Azurill trapped in darkness.

--

"So?" Celebi asked, the pale moonlight hitting her and Zorua as they ran through the quiet village.
"What was that all about...?"

"It was-" Zorua stopped in mid sentence as he caught a glimpse of something pink and white.

Wigglytuff.

He rushed behind a house, followed by a very confused Celebi. Zorua slowly peered at the bunny from his hiding spot.

He was talking to someone, he noted, though from his angulation, Zorua couldn't see who he was talking to. To worsen things, Wigglytuff and whoever he was talking to were whispering, so Zorua and Celebi had no chance of hearing what they were saying.

To Celebi, that all was very confusing; to Zorua, it was a confirm.

Just like Azurill said!

"Zorua..." Celebi whispered from behind him, intending to ask why the heck they were spying on Wigglytuff... although very curious to know why said pokemon was up at such dark hour.

Zorua ignored her as one of his ears peeked out from behind the house.

He only managed to catch a single sentence,

"... I've told the kids inside the the beast might have gotten poor Azurill too..."

Zorua gritted his teeth as he saw Wigglytuff opening the door of his house and disappearing inside.

End of the chat, Zorua guessed.

He felt something poking his back, and discovered Celebi staring at him with confusion.

"Zorua... will you explain why we're here in the middle of the night, spying on Wigglytuff?" she asked.

Zorua sighed.
"It's about something I managed to get from Azurill..." he recalled, before remembering about it.

‘... the beast that got our parents... get us...’

"Celi, Azurill told that Wigglytuff hates me... that's comprehensible, but he actually lies to his kids about what I do. He make them hate me too." Zorua said, Celebi's eyes widening.

"Wha...?"

"But that's not all. His adopted kids - before I came here, their parents were still alive?" Zorua asked.

Celebi thought for a moment.

"... Yeah. I can remember Azurill walking around with his mom, Smoochum and Jynx and quite a few other... why?" she asked.

"They're all dead, right?"

Celebi nodded sadly.
"Yes..." she mumbled, before thinking of something.
"Funny. They were all found-"

"In my forest!"

Celebi looked even more confused.
"How'd you-"

"Wigglytuff told the kids that their parents were killed by a beast in my forest... Azurill told me that. I think think that the deaths of those kids' parents aren't simple accidents... this is homicide!" Zorua exclaimed.

Celebi didn't say another word.

She grabbed Zorua, her feet lifting from the ground as she floated to Braixen's house.

--

"Zorua, that's crazy!" Braixen shouted as he got up from the log she was sitting on.

Celebi and Zorua called all the girls but Buneary, and they moved into Zorua's forest. There, they could talk freely, without anyone listening.

"... No. He's being honest, Azurill told him those things." Espurr chimed, reading his thoughts.

"See? Wigglytuff is filling those kids' minds with lies!" Zorua exclaimed.
"Will you know what? He told everybody about things I apparently do... I expect a crowd of angry pokemon coming here someday, because Wigglytuff revealed the kids that the beast that killed their parents... it's me." he told.

"... But... that makes no sense at all! You were a prankster, alright, but you never pushed it to that point!" Gardevoir said.

Celebi nodded.
"They'll not get you without proofs, Zorua..."

"He'll come up with some convincing ones! It won't be hard to convince the village of how I murdered pokemon ‘because of some dumb tricks’, right?"

"Well... that's not entirely wrong..." Braixen admitted.

Zorua nodded firmly... before the sight of Braixen remembered him something.

Buneary.

She was still a kid herself...

Zorua's eyes widened.

NOT Buneary, he thought.

"Braixen..." he started, getting the vixen's attention.
"... Lopunny is in danger too, you're right Zorua, someday she'll get a call in the middle of the night like happened with the others and they'll find her corpse in this forest... shortly after, Wigglytuff will adopt Buneary too..." Espurr revealed his thoughts.

Zorua sighed.
"That..."

Braixen looked shocked, but then snarled.
"HE ONLY HAS TO TRY! I'LL ROAST THAT PINK-"

"Braixen, calm down!" Celebi interjected, before looking Zorua.

"Zorua... If this all is true like Azurill said... we need to something... one of us must surveil Buneary's house!" Celebi said.

"I'm doing it!" Braixen said, fire in her eyes.
"Me too!" Gardevoir chimed with determination.

Celebi nodded.
"Okay... As for us... what do we do Zorua? Do we go to find Wigglytuff straightaway?" she asked his opinion.

Zorua pondered about it for a second.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Danger

choices: "What, but that's...I DON'T BELIEVE YOU!"
"Are you...serious...?"
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"We should know more, right...why is he doing this? Maybe...let's go talk to Azurill again." He said, and Celebi bit her lip. "Is that...a good idea? You do realize what might happen if you try and explain this to him..." She said and Zorua thought for a second. "Look...if we can get something more from him, that may be all we need to come forward about this, it'll keep everyone safe and might finally restore my rep...it's also worth noting that..."

"The kids..." Zorua nodded. "I have no doubt that they all hate my guts, maybe to the extent that Azurill does, they were given a nice little target and scapegoat so they don't have to think about Wigglytuff too hard...that's what I can gather...but why?"

"And if he goes nuts on this?"

"I'll knock him out again and we confront the pink punk ourselves, as it stands...I just need a little bit more to figure this out, besides, Espurr will be there, she can get in his head." Celebi thought for a second, but then nodded. "Okay, fine."

-

Azurill was sitting glumly on his tail in the glass. These last few years...what was going on with everything? Zorua had promised to grow him back, but then immediately turned on him when he got the info he wanted, and even told Celebi..."Why was I stupid enough to say anything?" He asked himself. It didn't matter, he was determined, he was either getting his size back or seeing his mom again, those were his options. The door was opening and not two...but three pokemon were coming in quietly. "Huh?" Azurill felt his world shake as the glass was levitated by a psychic force and quietly carried away from the table, the three pokemon were going back outside.

-

"Can you see what he's doing?" Celebi asked, it was dark and Azurill was far tinier than previously, so she was relying on Zorua's sight in the dark on this. "He's shaking like a leaf." He said. She nodded. "His thoughts?"

"Disheveled mess of fear, anxiety, confusion, and animosity." Espurr stated frankly. "So nothing new...okay, can you hear him Zorua?"

"Mm...just barely, but yes." Zorua said, making out his whimpers. He wouldn't be able to get anyone's attention but the 3 pokemon there this way, but to him...they were titans among titans, and he was scared stiff of them. Their voices pierced through him as well, larger than life. "J-just do whatever you're going to do with me! None of it matters anymore..." Azurill said and Zorua looked at him before relaying what he had said to the other two.

"Azurill, we aren't going to hurt you, we just want some answers." Celebi gently said and Espurr nodded. "The night that your mom disappeared...do you remember if she talked to anyone else that day?" And Azurill started shaking. "I don't...I don't know..." He said and Zorua relayed it, Espurr confirming his thoughts. She sighed.

"What happens with Wigglytuff, do you know what he does after a bonding day?" And Azurill winced when he heard this. Zorua had told everything...Azurill's life was over.

"Azurill, no one is going to hurt you, just please tell us." Espurr urged gently.

"He...he buys Igglybuff a new toy and each of us something sweet, he's always very happy...I don't know...I guess sometimes he buys something really expensive, but that isn't for us or anything..." Azurill said, Zorua nodding. He had figured it was something like that, he relayed the words.

"Profit...he's profiting on the kids." Espurr said and Azurill looked up.

"What are you talking about?" And Zorua relayed it, with Celebi looking at him sadly.

"Azurill...you're not going to like these words...and i'm sorry that you're finding out like this but..." She started to tell Azurill what was going on, what Wigglytuff was really doing, and what had happened to his mom, as well as the other kids parents. Whenever Wigglytuff was done with a kid they figured, or when they maybe snooped where they shouldn't, he replaced them with another, after another incident. Zorua coming along was a boon, and Wigglytuff intended to use him as a scapegoat and smokescreen all in one. Azurill fell right into Wigglytuff's clutches after he had killed his mom...or his partner had.

Azurill was staring at the three titans before him, and tears started to pour down, harder than before. "Kid's crying..." Celebi nodded.

"His mind is..." But Espurr was cut off by Zorua. "He just said..."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: The truth

choices: "... It's Buneary! She's gone!"
"... It's Lopunny! She exited the house!"
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
On the bottom of his glass entrapment, Azurill kept crying upon hearing the shocking news: Wigglytuff... the nice Wigglytuff... sure, he was a bit weird at times, but HE murdered his mother...?

"... A-Are you serious...?" he timidly asked, not wanting to believe it.

Celebi nodded her head in a sad manner.
"We are, Azurill..." she said.
"Wigglytuff lied to you and the other kids... used Zorua to mask his actions and telling you all things that he didn't actually do..."

"Name one Azurill. Name one thing he told you I did." Zorua said.

Azurill trembled.

"Just one."

"H-He t-told us... he saw you burning the remains of my pokedoll... he saw you dancing on the ashes..." he meekly told.

"... Zorua?"

"I didn't." Zorua defended.
"Though it's funny - I would gladly do that to the bow in the house..." he pondered.

Celebi sighed.
"No Zorua, you're keeping tha- it's not the moment to talk about it!" she scolded.

Azurill trembled. Before his eyes flashed images of Wigglytuff... then, his mother.

For a moment, he heard her voice in his ears,
‘Don't go back to him, my sweet child, trust them...’

"Mom..." Azurill sniffled.

"You're convinced..." Espurr revealed as she read the young pokemon's mind.

All of sudden, Azurill panicked as he looked at the three titans pleadingly.
"... Don't give me back to Wigglytuff! I don't want to stay with him! I'll remain this size, I'll be Buneary's doll, just don't give me to Wigglytuff." he cried in fear.

"Azurill... we wouldn't dream of it." Celebi said gently. Zorua grinned.

"First... say it." he told. Azurill sighed.
"I... I-I'm truly sorry for thinking you were evil... maybe you truly changed Zorua... Please, accept my apologies." he told.

Zorua snickered.
"Fine..." he told.
"Just... no more thinking about ending your own life."
