Azurill quietly nodded.
"... Grow me back." he then said. Sadness was over. He was thirsty for revenge.

Wigglytuff murdered his mother... and he was going to get what he deserved. He would tell the others... Igglybuff too... they had to run from him. The couldn't possibly handle Wigglytuff, but someone else could... Celebi, Zorua and the others could for sure...

"... Azurill-" Celebi was interrupted as Gardevoir and Braixen came into eyesight. They were running.
"CELI!" Braixen cried as she and Gardevoir stopped in front of the trio, panting.

"What?!" Celebi asked in alert, remembering that Braixen and Gardevoir were watching Buneary's house.

Them running like that could only mean that something happened...

"... Arceus..." Espurr told, reading Braixen's mind and shivering.

"Buneary! How is she? What happened?!" Zorua cried in alert as she watched the two pokemon struggling to regain their breaths.

"It's... It's..." Braixen kept panting, unable to speak properly.

She swallowed, giving the three pokemon in front of her a desperate look.
"It's...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Accepting truth

choices: Weavile slashes through Lopunny successfully
Weavile is stopped mid air by a psychic force
Weavile slashes Lopunny...but is too tiny to hurt her by the time she does
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"Lopunny left the house! She seemed to be in a hurry! We tried signaling her but..." Braixen said and Celebi's eyes widened. "We're moving!" She said as all the pokemon started moving, the glass levitating with them.

"But what about-" Azurill was cut off as the ride got bumpy when Braixen ended up holding the glass and held it to her chest as she started to run hard. They needed to get to the forest.

-

"It'll be done." The pokemon said as she hung up the phone, sitting in a tree. "Been a while since i've had to do this dirty part of the job..." She grinned a bit, she did enjoy it. She looked at her claws and waited for her target to show up. This would be fun...she heard something rustling. 'Ah...she's approaching...'

-

The group was in the forest at this point, navigating through, trying to call out for Lopunny. "This is bad. Bad bad bad! They WON'T hurt Lopunny! They won't!" Braixen seethed, unaware or uncaring of the ride Azurill was going through. He had long stopped trying to make sense of his world, with movement, chaos and noise being the bulk of it. But he wasn't going to complain right now...he had a few missions, get his friends away from Wigglytuff, make sure he never hurts any other kid or parent again, and...make sure that he got his. He knew even if he were normal sized...he'd be too weak to do it, much less the size of a bug as he was now. This group of pokemon he was with though...they seemed able. One of them was stupidly powerful and the others weren't slouches either...right?

-

Lopunny was walking through the forest. That phone call...she couldn't place the voice but.

"We need to talk over something with you Lopunny...If you aren't in the forest by this time, well...we'll take 'care' of your daughter. And don't try to contact officer Wobbuffet"

She shook her head. No way would she let anything happen to her! She heard a rustling from above and looked up, unable to make out the pokemon up there, but one was clearly up there. Her claws gleamed in the moonlight.

"Hello there, you came Lopunny...let me introduce myself, i'm Weavile...and you...made the wrong choice. Don't worry though, we will still take care of your daughter...this should help smooth out Azurill's disappearance as well!" She yelled as she leaped from the tree, ready to slash through Lopunny, the older bunny turned to run, but she wouldn't get away in time...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Attempting to replace

choices: "...return to the village now and perform a citizen's arrest on Wigglytuff."
"...stall by having Weavile tell Wigglytuff Lopunny was killed without a hitch."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Lopunny seemed to be getting a lot bigger as Weavile approached, but she didn't pay it any mind, as things tend to get larger when you get closer to them. However, once Weavile actually made it to Lopunny's chest and attempted to slash it, she realized that it wasn't just a change of perspective making Lopunny appear larger. She was smaller than even Azurill had been, but not quite to the point of Zorua on one of Celebi's bad days. Espurr and Gardevoir were quick on the draw, both concentrating their psychic powers on telekinetically lifting the murderous Weavile. Gardevoir shifted her power to Azurill and lifted him out of the cup, which was quickly made the new home of Weavile.

"Celebi? Mind fixing our little friend here?" Gardevoir inquired. A ball of energy came from the green girl and Azurill was back to normal. He had done well, they needed that cup, and keeping him small would be an inconvenience to everyone involved.

"Let me out of here, or I'm taking all of you down!" Weavile ranted.

"It's 7-on-1 with 3 psychics and you're not even bigger than a berry. I'd be quiet unless you want to be the next person who dies in this forest." Celebi said, giving the trapped Weavile her most deathly glare. It seemed to have worked wonders, as Weavile decided to start brooding instead.

"Anyone mind explaining to me what's going on, and why you had Azurill shrunken like that?" Buneary's mother questioned, understandably confused by everything going on.

"It's a long story, and one we quite frankly don't have time to tell right now! Wigglytuff is probably expecting a briefing from our tiny captive at any moment now! If we can't catch him or stall him from leaving, who knows what he'd do!" Zorua explained.

"Okay then. I'll be expecting an explanation later, but what are we going to do now?" Lopunny just accepted what was going on. After all, she had just been saved from a gruesome death by the group before her, so clearly they knew something she didn't.

"Yeah, you have a plan, Zorua?" Gardevoir continued the question chain.

"Don't worry, I do." Looking towards the cup with Weavile, he motioned towards Espurr to put some distance between the cup and the crew, so she couldn't hear their discussion, but not so much that they couldn't see the Weavile in her prison. "Okay, so we're gonna..."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: A Menace Contained

choices: Zorua would stay behind
Zorua would go with them as Eevee
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"Okay, so we're gonna return to the village now and perform a citizen's arrest on Wigglytuff." Zorua said.

"That could work." Celebi said. "We have Weavile with us as evidence."

"Except for one thing." Lopunny said not knowing what was going on, but deciding to help them.

"What's that?" Celebi asked.

"The fact that at this size Wigglytuff could claim she is just an illusion of Zorua's." Lopunny said.

"So I either have to remain here, or..."Zorua said before Espurr broke her near emotionles personality by laughing out loud while Zorua blished, and the others looked on confused.

"What's with her?" Braixen asked.

Zorua sighed before speaking. "She read my mind for what I was about to say. When I ran away I didn't want my dad to find me, and he can easily see through my illusions, so I had to get help from a pokemon witch that I'm pretty sure took far to much pleasure. Any way she used her magic to make it so that I have a single illusion that if I wear a flower in my hair becomes true until I remove it. Any flower will do, though I lost the one I was using before when I got here and decided to return to normal, but there are some on the edge of the forest While in that form it is a complete physical form I literally become that pokemon, both in body, and powers/abilities and lose all abilities with illusions, and any illusions I already had active are negated. Unfortunately that form is highly embarrasing, hence why Espurr is laughing, and it only works on that specific form, no others."

"What form is it?" Celebi asked.

Zorua sighed before saying "The female Eevee from the Eevee Song commercial."

This caused all of the others to start laughing.

"Really?" Celebi asked after everyone calmed down.

"Yeah." Zorua sighed, knowing this would happen, even though it's been years since that commercial stopped. "I needed money, and couldn't use my illusions without risking him finding me."

After a few moments the group decided that...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: "...return to the village now and perform a...

choices: "No, we should turn them in."
"You know what?...Go ahead."
Wigglytuff has another ace up his sleeve
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"Fine, fine...i'll go as the Eevee...we have his partner, right? And he's gotta be expecting contact from her...all we need to do is move in on him right now in his moment of vulnerability, and he's done." He smirked.

"I just can't believe it...Wigglytuff..." Lopunny exclaimed. "But he's..."

"He's not what you think...he wasn't what any of us thought..." Braixen said.

"...I kinda thought he was a jerk the whole time." Zorua offered, though Espurr was in thought. 'How did I not know about this...' She didn't recall ever reading something like this in Wigglytuff's thoughts, but she wasn't in there often she supposed. Azurill was looking at the ground, he didn't know what to believe anymore.

"You alright kid?" Braixen asked, getting his attention. He nodded. "I want to help my friends..." And Zorua grinned. "Fine, blue ball, I do have something in mind...you need to lure Wigglytuff out."

"W-what?" He shrunk back. "If you come back, he'll lower his guard, or at least be confused enough to not realize what's gonna hit him." Zorua stated.

"Are you sure that's a good idea, what if Wigglytuff attacks on sight?" Gardevoir offered, and Celebi nodded. "It is risky..." She looked at Azurill, but he meekly nodded. "Okay Zorua...i'll go for it." He said and the dark type grinned. "Alright then squirt!"

"Hey!" Braixen said, feeling robbed.

Zorua picked up a flower...this was going to suck.

-

Wigglytuff had long put the other kids to bed, but he was sitting at his table, waiting on a call, a knock...anything to signal that the job was done clean, he sighed. "This whole thing is always stressful when I need to replace a worker..." He muttered as he got up to get a drink. He needed to take the edge off, but he got a knock on the door. Immediately he put his bottle down and went to the door, fiddling with the lock. "Ah, finally yo-" He stopped as he saw the small shivering blue pokemon outside. "...Azurill?" He said, surprised to see the kid. "Oh my, you-you're okay!" He said happily. 'So i'll have an extra kid then? I'll make it work I guess...' He thought as he went to hug the small water type, who slightly hesitated, but went with the hug. "What happened?" He asked, Azurill started crying.

"Zorua, he kept me in his forest with him! He wouldn't let me go, he just laughed and laughed at me! And-And..." Wigglytuff nodded, he could work with this! "There there Azurill, you're home...come on, let me put you to bed and..." Azurill turned to point out an Eevee. "She helped me find my way home..." He said and the Eevee grimaced before smiling and waving. "Well, let me say thank you..." Wigglytuff broke the hug to go and greet the Eevee, but...he felt stiff all of a sudden, he couldn't move. Azurill looked at Wigglytuff, his face contorted with hate. "And you killed my mom..." He seethed as Wigglytuff flew out of the house and landed on the grass, surrounded by the angry group of pokemon, though Wigglytuff didn't seem phased. "Hmm...oh my oh my oh my, you told~" He said as he looked at Azurill. "You told about what you do and they pieced it together~" He started laughing earning glares. "Oh, you've caught me, oh no, it's not like...I don't know psychic myself..." He said and suddenly the grip on him was released as Azurill came flying to him. "Now now, who has the upper hand now...I believe i'll be needing this brat to make my exit, won't I?" He said as he held the screaming Azurill. "Any sudden moves and...well...do I even need to say it?" He grinned. The group looked stunned and Espurr realized something. "He can block me!" She said, stunned by this, and Wigglytuff just grinned. "When I want, yeah...I may be normal-fairy, but it isn't out of my reach to get psychic abilities!" He said as he slowly edged away from the group.

"I assume you took care of Weavile right? I'll be expecting her back if you want the brat, then we'll be on our merry way~" He said as he noticed something...his world was getting bigger, in fact...the only thing not getting bigger was Azurill, who was starting to comprehend what was happening. "You've lost..." Azurill said as Wigglytuff was surprised by everything happening, he went to make a lethal blow to Azurill, but the little blue pokemon went flying out of his grasp. "Lopunny...can you hold onto him please?" Celebi asked as she gently set him down in her hands, doll sized again. "Um...yeah...were you?" She asked and he looked down. "I was the doll Buneary brought home, yes..." He stated, and started shivering, did Wigglytuff almost...? He felt a gentle force on his back as Lopunny started petting him. "You've been through a lot, haven't you?" She said gently and he just nodded, starting to get misty eyed.

But where he had stopped shrinking, Wigglytuff kept going, down and down until he was as small as Weavile, and he found himself deposited into the cup. "Great...now what!?" Weavile huffed and Wigglytuff put a paw to his chin. "This is a problem..." He started but was cut off as he looked up to see a titanic Eevee grinning. "I can eat them, right...?" she said and Celebi looked at her.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Confrontation

choices: Eevee enjoys herself and makes the change permanent
Eevee didn't enjoy herself and changes back
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"Great." Eevee said as she scooped up the cup and poured Wigglytuff and Weavile into her mouth.

"No, no no!!!" "This can't be happening!" Wigglytuff and Weavile cried as they fell onto Eevee's tongue as her mouth closed, while everyone else looked away, knowing that with what they did it is justified but not wanting to see it.

There was a small muffled screaming from her mouth as she tossed the two around her mouth, tasting them with her tongue before swallowing them with a gulp.

"Well. That takes care of that." Eevee said. "Now I just have to wait for them to digest before changing back. But what do we do until then?"

"How about we have a girls day?" Celebi asked with a smirk. "We could even find some doll sized clothes for your current form."

"No, no, that's quite alright." Eevee said backing up. "I will be changing back as soon as I can, so theres no need."

"Aw, but you would look so cute." Braixen said causing Eevee to pale before trying to flee, only for Celebi to shrink her back to doll sized, and float her back to her arms.

"But first, Are you sure you want to change back?" Lopunny asked. "As Zorua you are hated, and despised, and even with this it will take awhile for that to change everyones opinion of you, but as Eevee, you would not be hated. No one would know who you were, and so you would have a fresh start. plus you said it was to run away from your father, and your reputation is spreading to other villages which could let him track you.

"I...I don't know." Eevee said, that point about her father and the village hitting hard. "Even if I do, I would still need to be Celebi's doll."

"You like having her take care of you though. Espurr said. "She gives you a true home, even you do have to pretend to be a doll. You are scared Celebi won't like you the same way though"

"Please stop reading my mind." Eevee said.

"No matter what, my feelings won't change." Celebi said giggling while kissing her head as she blushed.

"Can it even become permanent though" Azurill asked. "What if the flower comes off?"

"If she eats the flower it will become permanent." Espurr said.

"Again, please stop reading my mind." Eevee said.

"It's a big decision though so why don't you decide during our outing." Gardevoir said.

"Yeah that's a good idea." Eevee said shaking her head as the went to pick up Buneary and head for the day out...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: "You know what?...Go ahead."

choices: Mini sized Sleepover
Head home
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
At the end of the day everyone met back up at Buneary, and Lopunny's house, with their purchases.

"We got quite a bit." Zorua, still in Eevee form said looking at what everyone had.

Lopunny had gotten a pie for dessert, and a TM for Protect, just incase something similar to Weavile happens again. Buneary got a bow, and several doll clothes for Azurill. Azurill got a doll sized pool, and bed, Braixen got a video of the Eevee Song commercial to tease Zorua/Eevee with. Espurr and Celebi got several new books. Gardevoir managed to find a mega stone for herself, which made her happy, and Zorua/Eevee managed to avoid getting any doll clothes, and did get a tiny sphere that has a small door that can only be gotten into if she shrunk even further. With the entire sphere being the size of Weavile/Wigglytuff at the end, and inside is an entire house. the sphere being a small model for a house that was thrown away, and Celebi shrunk it down to that size, for doll sized Eevee/Zorua to carry as a held item, so she would always have a home, with her, and if she wants alone time, she just needs to get Celebi to shrink her small enough to fit in the door, and leave it somewhere the small size won't be in the way or seen for complete privacy. And if something does happen to it, it is sturdy, and self contained enough that even being swallowed won't hurt anyone inside.

"Hey Celebi?" Eevee asked, getting her attention. "Why were you so affectionate today?"

"You're an Eevee." Celebi said with a smile. "If I was affectionate to you when you were pretending to be a Zorua doll that could cause problems because of you're reputation and how it would show to everyone that I like you that way, while with you pretending to be an Eevee doll, I can be as affectionate in public as I want, and noone will realize we're together, so our secret is safe."

"Oh." Eevee said.

"Hey Zorua?" Lopunny asked. "Have you decided whether or not you will remain an Eevee?"

Eevee lowered her head thinking, before saying. "I had fun today as an Eevee, and the points you made were true, plus Celebi still likes me anyway, so yes. I will."

With that Eevee took off the flower in her hair and ate it, causing her to glow as Zorua became Eevee permanently.

"So now what?" Eevee asked.

"It's getting late." Espurr said. "And all of Wigglytuff's children were taken care of by others already, so we could just head home.

"Or..." Eevee said looking at the Mini home. "We could find somewhere to put my new Mini home, shrink down, and have a slumber party in it. Though we would have to be careful where we put it since it is the size those two were at the end, and we would therefore be much smaller."

After thinking the others decided...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Eevee enjoys herself and makes the change perma...

choices: "You're going in jail, Wigglytuff." Celebi said
"You're going to live your life... as a speck on the ground!" Celebi said
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"We'll have to trick the old jerk..." Zorua mumbled, looking at the tiny Weavile inside of her glass prison. She was still pounding on the glass walls with her claws.

Zorua smirked.
"We're going to have her tell Wigglytuff that Lopunny was taken care of..." he explained, looking at a still startled Lopunny.

"Ma'am, you'll have to play along..."

Lopunny tilted her head, her long ears falling on a side.
"Why should I trust you, Zorua?" she said as calmly as she could.
"That Weavile tried to kill me in YOUR woods... who tells me that it isn't you who told her to?"

"Your daughter. Braixen. Yesterday." he recalled.

Lopunny looked bemused for a moment, before sighing. She trusted her daughter, and she trusted Braixen.

"Okay..." she said.

"... But Zorua... if Weavile has to tell Wigglytuff she killed Lopunny... we'll have to grow her again..." Celebi reasoned.

"Espurr and Gardevoir will keep her still with psychic." Zorua explained, formulating a plan.
"Yeah... you grow her, she calls Wigglytuff and tells him to come over to see the job done. Leave the rest to me." he said, before looking at Azurill.

He got closer, grinning.
"Kid, I killed your doll. Now, wanna get some payback on the pokemon that killed your mom?" he asked.

--

Wigglytuff snickered to himself as he walked in direction of the forest. He had a reason to be happy.

‘It's done. You should've seen her - she didn't even put up a fight. Pathetic. Get over here, see it yourself...’

His partner Weavile had done another job. She always did her job.

Silently, he walked out of the village and ventured into the forest.

"Weavile." he called out.

No reply.

The big bunny walked deeper into the forest, until he ran into a gruesome scene... that made him smile.

Weavile. Sitting next to the corpse of Lopunny, a big bleeding hole where once was her heart.

Weavile snickered seeing him.
"You came..." she said.

"And you got another job done." Wigglytuff responded.
"Now... who will take care of poor Buneary? Oh wait - I will."

At that, Weavile started snickering.

"About that... kid discovered me... I had no choice." she said, pointing to something on the ground.

A cream colored thing that looked much like a tail.

Buneary's tail.

Wigglytuff frowned.
"You could've just knocked her out! You didn't have to kill her!" he scolded like it was no big deal.

Weavile snickered.
"Yeah yeah... I found something else around here..." she pointed over a blue ball on the ground.

Wigglytuff felt the air leaving his lungs.

Azurill's tail.

"Him too?! What's gotten into you?!" he cried, moving forward menacingly.

Weavile looked up and started snickering as she got to her her feet and moved a step forward.

Then, before Wigglytuff's incredulous eyes, Weavile disappeared, revealing a snickering Zorua where the ice type once was.

"Hi Wigglytuff."

Wigglytuff stared at him surprised.
"YOU!" he hissed.

Zorua grinned.
"Me. Your precious scapegoat." he responded.

Wigglytuff growled.
"What have you done to them...? Buneary, Azurill, Weavile?" he asked, not caring about Lopunny. He wanted her dead in the first place.

Zorua snickered evilly.
"Just the ultimate prank!" he exclaimed in elation.

Wigglytuff snarled.
"You. Killed. My. Kids." he said.
"You're dead!"

He tried to move towards Zorua, but a ring of fire erupted around the fox, scaring Wigglytuff and causing him to fall on his butt.

"And guess who's the next victim~" Zorua cheered as a tall figure emerged from behind the fox.

"Wigglytuff." he snickered.
"Meet daddy."

The figure, which turned out to be a Zoroark, roared, making Wigglytuff scramble back to his feet as he tried to run.

However, Zoroark dashed towards him, his claws hitting him in the stomach and making him fly back into a tree.

Wigglytuff whimpered as he opened his eyes, noting something odd. Zoroark was gone. Lopunny's corpse was gone.

Instead, in front of him, were Celebi, Braixen, Gardevoir, Espurr, Azurill and a very much alive Lopunny, who was shaking her fist.
"Stay away from my daughter." she hissed.

"Good job,a ma'am." Zorua complimented.

Confused, Wigglytuff noticed Azurill bouncing closer.

"Azurill... you're alive... I'm so happy..." he meekly tried.

Azurill remained silent, cold.

"... I-I-It's not what it looks like! I-I love you kids! You're my fam-"

"Save it, you monster!" Azurill hisses, tears coming from his eyes.
"You killed my mom! The only family I ever had! And you tried to trick me - everyone - into believing that it was Zorua!" he shouts.

Wigglytuff seemed to shrink more and more with each word that Azurill said.

He began stammering, but he felt something pushing into his stomach.

Braixen had moved forward, pointing her sick in his stomach.
"Not a word more." she stated.

Celebi moved closer.
"We know everything, Wigglytuff," she said, holding a cup.

Wigglytuff felt sick. Inside of the cup was an extremely tiny Weavile.

His attention turned back to Celebi, who glared daggers.
"You killed those kids' parents, used Zorua as a scapegoat, did weird things with the kids..." she named all of his sins.

But Celebi concluded the speech with a single sentence,
"But just guess what it's going to happen to YOU now..."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Busted

choices: "I'm gonna go with them...but i'll never forget what you did for me..."
"I-I want to stay!"
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"W-what?" Wigglytuff said as the world around him grew...and grew...and grew farther away from him. The pokemon became giants unto titans until mountains until...he was a speck. He looked around in fear. What was going on!?

"DON'T WORRY, YOU WON'T BE ALONE!" A powerful voice intoned as the Weavile was deposited next to him, she was a veritable giant too! But soon enough she shrank down to his size as well. "P-please don't do this to us! Please!" He shouted, but his cries fell on deaf ears. Soon the world shook around the two pokemon as they were left alone, in the middle of the night with the sounds of the many night creatures to haunt them for the rest of their days.

-

A few days had passed as Wigglytuff's disappearance became known. The group swore silence on what had happened, but after an investigation into Wigglytuff's home and financials, as well as documentation of his long standing operation, one thing became clear...he was not the beloved neighbor many had come to know him as. The kids were informed of the disappearance as well and what had happened, for many of them...it seemed like a walking dream. But to find out what happened to their parents...

"So...this is it then..." Zorua said as he walked the village, things were easier for him now, no one bugged him as he walked the village. He still got weary looks from time to time, but he didn't do anything and people left him to his business. He was walking...with Azurill.

"Yeah..." He nodded and Zorua nodded too. "Y'know...you DID say you'd be happy to spend the rest of your days as Buneary's doll." He grinned and Azurill stopped in his tracks. "That was...when it was my only option..."

"I'm not kidding kid, that offer is open and isn't bad." Zorua said and Azurill blinked. "The other kids are going to an orphanage in a village far away right? You're set to join them but...Lopunny and Buneary know about it all you know...what happened...they could keep you safe...I know she isn't your mom but...Lopunny isn't bad, and Buneary would be glad to have a friend in you...they can't afford two full mouths to feed is the thing, that's why...the doll thing." He said and Azurill looked down. "I did hate you...but now...I just...want to see what it'd be like to be your friend...and with the others too..." Azurill said.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: End of Wigglytuff

choices: Celebi, ready to invite the pair in and see what they want.
Celebi's mom, who's being just a little bit cautious in regards to Zorua.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Part of Azurill wanted to leave the village and head to the new orphanage with his old friends. However, a much larger part of him wanted to stay with his new companions, the people he knew wouldn't leave as a result of being adopted. Sure, Zorua had been kind of rude before, but Azurill was now aware that his former perception of the prankster was exaggerated due to being based on a series of massive lies, and his time with the girls had led a reform into a much more friendly, if occasionally mischievous, Zorua. All the other girls were equally pleasant to be around: Celebi, Braxien, Espurr, Gardevoir... and Buneary... Being able to live in the village with the gang would be worth living life smaller, especially since he no longer had to pretend to be a doll around Buneary's mom.

"I-I want to stay!" Azurill suddenly shouted, catching Zorua off guard. "I wanna stay here with you guys!"

"That's what I like to hear, bud! Now let's head over to Buneary's and make sure it's all fine with them."

-

"You... you wanna shrink back down and stay with us?" the young daughter questioned, understandably a bit confused by Azurill's sudden willingness to be shrunken compared to his feelings on the matter a few days back.

"Yeah... if it's alright with you, miss," Azurill said to the older rabbit girl.

"Of course. It'd be nice for Buneary to always have a friend around, no matter what size he is," Lopunny replied, bringing a smile to the blue bunny's face.

"Why don't I go and get Celebi real quick?" Zorua said, leaving the 3 in the room as he departed.

Strolling across the village, the reformed prankster saw Gardevoir, seemingly lost in thought. He wanted her to come along to Celebi's, as he wasn't sure if her mom was home, or how she would respond to him knocking on her door if she was. With Gardevoir around, he could easily play the "friend of a friend" card to avoid making things awkward.

"Hey Gard', you busy?" Zorua asked, snapping the green-haired girl from her trance.

"Oh! Um, not in particular, why?" she confusedly asked.

"I just want an escort to Celebi's house. You know how her mom is and all that, don't ya?"

"Yeah, I get it. Let's go."

-

After a few minutes, the duo reached the time-travelers' home. After having Gardevoir knock on the door, they were greeted by...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: A New, Permanent Addition to Zorua's Friendgroup

choices: "Fine, okay, fine, i'll shrink him down!"
"I don't think we should do it..."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Celebi answered the door, seeing her friend and...boyfriend standing there. "Oh...hey you two. How's it going?" She asked, giving them a small smile. "Great, actually! Was coming over to...run something by ya, I had an awesome idea and I even got everyone on board for it!" Zorua said and Celebi gave him a sideways look. "Awesome huh?" She said amused, and he nodded, Gardevoir nodded too. "He told me what the idea was too, and as an avid supporter of love, I must say I agree!" Gardevoir said enthusiastically.

-

"Hmm...kids are fickle." Celebi said after hearing the idea, unsure of it. "Oh come on! He said yes the other night and he said yes today!" Zorua said as Celebi looked at him. "He's saying that now because he's gonna miss us Zorua, and that's fine, i'm happy that you'll miss him too, but..." Celebi started before Zorua held up a paw.

"This is actually more than that, look, I talked to that kid when we put him in the glass, he told me some stuff...he hasn't had a real parental figure since his mom...sending him to an orphanage again..."

"Zorua, all of those kids are going through that right now, it's a sad situation but..." She started but was trailing off, thinking about it.

"But Azurill has an opportunity for instant adoption in a way...Lopunny is fine with adopting him on every level except for the part where she can't afford to support two kids...not two full sized kids. I talked to her one on one about this yesterday, told her what he went through. I'm telling you Celebi, this would be good for everyone..."

"And what about when school starts up again?" Celebi said and Zorua shrugged. "Grow him back for class?" He said and she sighed.

"Come on Celi, it isn't THAT different than what you're doing with Zorua, only difference is that Azurill won't have you on stand by all the time...and think of how cute Azurill and Buneary-"

"Yeah, I know how you feel Gardevoir..." She muttered.

"Celebi...he wants this, how many times will you make me say it? He can even be out in the open at their house..." Both Zorua and Gardevoir were giving her the sad eyes. She groaned.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Convincing Celebi

choices: "...go out and do something together. You can come too, Gardevoir."
"...have a night in at home with just us."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Celebi had been believing her rhetoric at first, but as the duo in front of her had given her valid reasons to shrink Azurill and not-so-valid sad eyes, her patience had worn down to the point that she was throwing in the metaphorical towel.

"Fine, okay, fine, I'll shrink him down!" she exasperatedly exclaimed. Gardevoir excitedly clapped at this while Zorua tried to bring Celebi back down to reasonableness.

"I don't see why you're so grumpy about it, Celi. Everyone's fine with it, even Azurill! And it's not like this is going to hurt anyone."

Celebi sighed at this. It was true that she's been staunchly defending not shrinking Azuill, but the more she thought about it, the more she realized there was no point not to do it.

"Come on, you two, let's go!" Gardevoir, still excited, led the way out of Celebi's house and through the village.

'I wonder why she seemed so opposed to this', Zorua mentally mused to himself.

'Yeah, it does seem odd that she didn't want to shrink Azurill,' Gardevoir mentally chimed in.

'Hey, what are you doing in my head?'

'Telepathy is a given when it comes to psychics, Zorua. And since we're both wondering the same thing, I figured I'd just reach out for a little mental conversation, Gardevoir replied.

'What about Celi?'

'She can't read this discussion. Probably doesn't even know we're having it!' Zorua cast a glance at his green girlfriend, who, true to Gardevoir's words, looked completely oblivious to the psychic chat her compatriots were having.

'I don't suppose she's thinking about why she didn't want to shrink Azurill?'

'I think she probably just doesn't want to be held accountable if anything happens to the little guy. There don't seem to be any other reasons as far as she's openly thinking about.'

'Hmm...'

'Indeed.'

-

"That's probably Zorua with Celebi, kids," Lopunny informed her daughter and newly-adopted Azurill as she got up to answer the door. True to her words, they both were waiting on her doorstep, along with Gardevoir. Lopunny quickly opened the door and welcomed them in.

"I'm so glad that you're willing to do this, Celebi. Azurill has been so excited to start living with us... although he seems a bit embarrassed to be around Buneary." Zorua and Gardevoir both smirked at this, the former due to his knowing very well how it feels to be treated as a doll, and the latter due to being happy to help form another cute couple.

"Just point me towards Azurill and I'll be done in a minute, miss."

"Over in the living room."

The quartet walked into the living room, where Azurill was currently sitting on the couch next to Buneary.

"You ready, bud?"

"Y-yeah." Azuril moved to the floor, and Celebi focused her energy on forming a cyan ball that looked familiar to everyone. She then gently released it, and it slowly went across the living room and entered Azurill's body. The mouse began to shrink down once more, stopping at the size of a doll. Buneary gently got off of the couch and lifted him into a hug as Gardevoir began to clap excitedly again, sparkles in her eyes.

"If you ever need him back to normal size again, just come and get me," Celebi told the family, before turning and walking towards the door with Zorua and Gardevoir.

As the trio reentered the village, Zorua noticed there was still some time left in the day. Wanting to do something before night fell and he was back to sleeping as a doll, he asked his girlfriend, "so uh, now what, Celi?"

"Personally, I was thinking we could..."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Azurill's New Living Accomodations

choices: Celebi shrinks Zorua for the night
Suddenly, there was a knock at the door, "Celebi, are you in there?"... Her mom!
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"... Let's just stick around for a while... we could just take a walk around, go somewhere to eat before heading home." Celebi suggested.

Zorua's eyes lit up.
"Really?" he asked, and Celebi turned around to give him a smirk.
"... You were out all day long, left me alone for a whole day... and now, you're coming with me, wherever I want, no complaining about it." she responded.

Zorua grinned. He liked that side of Celebi.
"That's what you think, miss." he simply responded.

The fairy knelt and neared her head to his, making full eye contact.
"Really?" she asked with a smirk.
"Really." he responded with the same smirk.

Gardevoir watched in silence as the couple in front of her stared at each other in defiance for a while... before Celebi closed her eyes and gave Zorua a peck on his cheek.

"Aw!"

Zorua laughed as he blushed.
"Okay, fine." he gave in, and Celebi wrapped her arms around his neck as she hugged him.

Zorua hugged back, enjoying the embrace as long as he could before they broke it.

"Let's go~" Celebi sang, grabbing Zorua's paw and starting to walk in a random direction, the dark fox following.

Gardevoir remained behind for a moment.

She watched the two walking together and giggled.

"So cute~" she commented as she followed.

--

"Forget it."

Celebi held two pairs of blue doll shoes in front of the dark type, who stared at them venomously. He had opted to wait outside, but the fairy had literally dragged him inside the pokedoll shop.

"But you'd look so cute with these~" the fairy chimed.
"And I'd tear 'em apart the second you put them on me~" Zorua snapped back, emulating Celebi's voice.

The fairy wore a pleading look, one that oddly didn't manage to melt Zorua's heart.

"I'm not going to wear them." he firmly said, eliciting a giggle from Gardevoir behind him.

Celebi groaned... before a smirk appeared on her face.
"Oh really, my dear little Zorua?" she asked, eyes glowing.

Zorua simply snickered.
"NICE CHOICE CELI!" he shouted, causing many other pokemon in the store to look at the trio.

Celebi's eyes instantly stopped glowing as she sighed, putting the doll shoes down and murmured incomprehensible words.

Gardevoir giggled.
"You two match perfectly. You're both smart, funny, cute~"
"Wait, what?"
"Nothing~"

"Gard, you're weird." Zorua commented, before starting to walk out of the store.
"Uh, Celi? Can we go eat, like right now?" he asked, his stomach growling in approval.

Celebi giggled.
"Of course. Let's go~" she said, walking up beside Zorua as the trio started to walk out.

"We're coming back tomorrow anyway~"

Zorua sighed.

--

"Well, that was what I call dinner!" Zorua cheerfully exclaimed as he and the two girls walked down the road as they exited from a small diner.

It was nighttime, and the three were heading to their respective homes.

"You seem quite happy..." Gardevoir noted with a smile, before she yawned.
"But I gotta agree. That was good." she said, rubbing her belly.

Zorua grinned.

"Seriously you two..." Celebi sighed.
"Zorua, you ate like a Snorlax... and pokemon kept glaring daggers at you!"

The fox shrugged as he snickered.
"Why should I care exactly?" he asked ironically, causing the two pokemon to giggle.

At some point, Gardevoir stopped in front of what Zorua assumed was her house. The lights were on, suggesting that her mom and sister were awake.

"I'm going home... thanks for letting me come too, Celi." she said, and Celebi waved a paw dismissively.
"Bye you two... have a nice evening... alone~" she chimed, making the couple blush as she walked up to her front door.

"... Bye Gard." Zorua awkwardly said.
"See you around."

Gardevoir smiled, before she opened the door and disappeared inside her house. The duo could hear her call out for her mother, and the cheerful greeting of her sister.

Celebi and Zorua looked at each other... before Celebi got a smirk, and suddenly climbed on top of Zorua's back.

His cheeks flared up.
"What are you doing?" he asked the giggling fairy.

"I usually carry you around Zorua... and now, you're carrying me home!" Celebi said cheerfully.

"... What am I, a Ponyta?" he asked.

Celebi smiled, and leaned forward, wrapping her long arms around Zorua's neck as she pecked his cheek, the black fur covering the red shade beneath.

"... Damn your kisses..." he said with a sigh as he started walking with the fairy clinging to his neck as he headed to the house they shared... with Celebi's oblivious mother.

Luckily, the pink time traveler worked until it was late in the night, so there was no problem...

Soon, Zorua stopped in front of Celebi's house.

The fairy gave him another peck before climbing down his back and opened the door.

Her eyes glowed blue.
"Ready, Zorua~?" she asked, ready to have her miniature boyfriend back in her paws.

But the fox shook his head.

Celebi's eyes stopped glowing as she offered a confused look, suggesting that she was waiting for an explanation.

"I was thinking... your mom won't come back until we're asleep, no?" he asked, making Celebi nod.

"Well... can I stay this size for now? Until we go to sleep?" he asked while Celebi closed the front door.

She smiled.
"Of course!" she said, the dark fox snickering as he followed her in her bedroom. She closed the door, while he hopped on the bed, watching Celebi grab a book and hovering over the bed, letting herself fall on it.

She smiled, and moved closer to Zorua, snuggling up to him.

He grinned as he adjusted his position, so that his girlfriend's head was leaning against his furry side as he sat on the bed.

Celebi giggled.
"Don't know if you work better as a boyfriend or a pillow~ perhaps I should consider sleeping on you tonight~" she said cheerfully as she opened her book.

"... Please don't..." Zorua said, shaking his head to rid it from the thought of him being crushed under the fairy's head.

She smiled teasingly.

Silence fell in between the two as Celebi kept reading, occasionally looking away from her book to smile at the fox, while Zorua simply enjoyed her company.

After a while...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: The prankster, the bookworm and the romance-lover

choices: Zorua and Celebi sleep in, waking up closer to noon.
Celebi gets up bright and early, and makes Zorua do so too.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
The relaxed couple suddenly sprang up, alert. Why was Celebi's mom home so early? They didn't really have time to ponder this, as Celebi and Zorua both figured she was about to come into the room. The young time traveler cast a glance and a nod at her boyfriend who was laying atop the pillow, and he nodded back and cast an illusion of a pillow that didn't have a Zorua sitting on it.

"Uh, yeah mom! What's up?" Celebi called back.

"Work got out a bit early, and I just wanted to talk with you, since I haven't really been around that much."

"Oh, uh, okay then. Go ahead and come in."

The door opened a few seconds later, revealing the pink Celebi and mother of Zorua's girlfriend. Zorua was wondering when he'd finally formally introduce himself to her... if ever. Although his reputation as the infamous prankster of the woods had settled down ever since Wigglytuff's "disappearance" - thanks in part to a combination of good word of mouth from Lopunny and the fact that nobody had actually been pranked in the woods for a few weeks now - Celebi's mom was still looking out for her daughter, and Zorua didn't want to be the cause of a conniption fit if she discovered her darling daughter had a boyfriend. But who knows, maybe she'd be more calm about it than he expected. Either way, suddenly revealing himself in the room right now would definitely NOT be a way to make good impressions on the pink Celebi.

"So, was there anything in particular you wanted to talk about?" the younger Celebi asked.

"I mostly just wanted to see you again, sweetie," her mom replied, before pulling her in for a hug. Celebi was close to the age of being embarrassed by her parents showing her affection in public, but went along with the hug to avoid being suspicious... much to the amusement of the invisible Zorua, who gave a smirk at the events in front of him.

"I love you too, mom," the green Celebi said.

"So, what about your friends, are you still keeping up with them?"

"Yeah, I just saw Gardevoir today."

Celebi's mom knew that the green-haired emotion-sensing psychic loved playing matchmaker, and decided to take this opportunity to nudge the conversation towards romance. "Did she try to match you up with random people again?" she knowingly asked. She wanted to make sure that if her daughter was actually interested in someone, that they were a good person and influence. After all, she only wanted the best for her girl.

As for the younger Celebi, she didn't want to reveal that she was already with Zorua, as her mom would probably disapprove greatly of him, so instead she pretended that she was still looking for the right guy. "Yeah, a few of them seemed okay, but none of them were quite my type." 'Not that the one I'm with is even close to my type, either,' Celebi mused mentally.

"Well, you're still young and have plenty of time to search for the right guy. Don't feel bad if you can't find him now."

"Thanks, mom."

"No problem, sweetie. Now I'm off to bed for the evening, so good night," the older time-traveler said, before giving the younger one a kiss and heading for the door. "Enjoy your rest, dear."

"Thanks, you too."

The door closed and Zorua waited a few seconds before dispelling his illusion, before whispering to his girlfriend. "Hey Celi, how do you think she'd feel about... y'know, us?"

"Depends on how and when we reveal it. I've heard your reputation as a scoundrel is mostly diminished, much like you are when you get shrunken~." Celebi said, a cyan ball forming in her hands. "She does believe in the goodness of people, so she'd believe you truly changed your ways."

"That's good to hear, Celebi. Now go ahead," Zorua stated, before Celebi shot the shrinking ball into his body and reduced him back to doll sized, the pillow he was on large now enough to be its own bed for him.

"Now then..." Celebi said, before getting up, flipping off the lights, and getting back into her bed. "Good night, Zorua," she said, pulling him off of the pillow and cuddling him to her chest, as she was so accustomed to doing now.

"Good night, Celi," he replied, letting sleep quickly claim him.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Mother, Daughter, and...wait, is this title reuse?

choices: "Let's do something together~ just me and you~"
"Been a while since we last saw Espurr... let's go see her!"
"... How about I grow you back? We could go many more things~"
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Celebi was someone many pokemon called an ‘early bird’. She had a reputation for waking up quite early in the morning and bury her head in a book.

However, things changed since Zorua had started sleeping in the same bed with her. Celebi had started waking up slightly later, usually forcing Zorua to wake up as well to make up for lost time.

However, today was different.

The night went on quietly for the sleeping couple... and so did the day.

Only when the clock stroke midday, Celebi slowly started to fidget in her sleep as she readjusted.

Then, fate decided to be cruel with the poor fairy. A breeze blew inside the room through the open window, gently moving the curtains aside.

Not by much, but enough for sunshine to seep inside the room, hitting the time traveler's dark eyelids. Bothered by the sudden feeling, Celebi started to move in her sleep, shaking the tiny fox in her paws in the process.

Zorua groaned as he tried to get comfortable in between the paws and the chest of the fairy.

But in the end, Zorua was forced to wake up because of the movement; at the same time, Celebi finally opened her eyes.

She gave a yawn, making the ground beneath Zorua rise. The fox hazily looked up at her, watching as the two gigantic blue eyes of his giant girlfriend were fixed on him.

Celebi blinked a few times, before wearing a sleepy smile on her face, which he returned.

The two stared at each other in silence, savoring the moment together.

"Mhh~..." Celebi broke the silence as she stretched.
"Good morning my little Zorua~"

One of the paws resting on the fox's back started caressing him. In response, he started nuzzling her chest.
"Mornin' Celi..." he happily chimed.

The green fairy smiled brightly as she gently lowered her head towards Zorua.

She gave him a gentle, loving peck before she raised her head again, watching with glee as a blush spread on Zorua's black fur. He laughed awkwardly, causing her to giggle while her gaze casually shifted onto a clock on the wall.

Immediately, she froze up, her smile dropping and her hand stopping its petting.

"Celi...?" Zorua called out, noticing the green titan looking to the side with a shocked expression... although he couldn't make out what she was looking at, his vision eclipsed by the bedsheets and by Celebi's monolithic arm.

However, Celebi soon made clear the reason other weird behavior.

"... M-Midday?!" she exclaimed, looking back at Zorua, who was surprisingly calm. He yawned.
"Oh... it's still early..." he said as he closed his eyes and leaned his head on his green 'bed', hoping to catch five more minutes of sleep.

Sadly, Celebi wasn't going to let him.

"E-Early?!" Celebi couldn't believe what she heard.
"Zorua, we lost half the day! We've got to get out of this bed - every second that passes makes the day... unproductive..." she whispered that word like it was the worst one in her vocabulary.

Zorua groaned as he attempted to stop the giantess.

"Celi-" it was too late.

Celebi had gotten up.

She walked into her kitchen, and smiled as she noted that the breakfast was already set up... her mother was probably in a pretty good mood after the talk they had yesterday.

As a confirm, she spotted a note on the table,

‘See you later honey. Love, mom.’

--

"So? What do we do now that you've thrown me out of bed and spoiled a wonderful moment?" Zorua sarcastically asked as he bit into a cookie Celebi gave him for a late breakfast.

She lazily sat on her chair, sipping juice from a cup.

She made sure to leave some for her boyfriend, cleaned her lips with a napkin and gently placed the glass in front of Zorua, before gripping said fox and lowering him into the cup, letting him sip the sweet liquid.

Celebi smiled. She learned something by Zorua's stay in her house: he hated being woken up.

"If there's something your taught me, it's that is important to spend some time outside too," she commented, and he grinned.

"... And that's exactly what we're going to do! D'you agree?" she continued.

Zorua happily nodded as he gave a satisfied sigh, half of the giant cookie gone into his stomach.

He patiently waited for Celebi to finish with her own meal, before she pulled her chair back, put away the bag of cookies, washed her cup and grabbed Zorua.

She gave a sweet smile as she headed to her room to grab a book... Zorua didn't let her.

"No Celebi!" he said as she reached out for a book, causing her to stop with her arm hovering in midair.

"B-But..."

"Going outside... it means me~ you~... no books." the fox firmly stated.

Celebi meekly sighed, knowing the she couldn't oppose to his logic. She begrudgingly abandoned her book on top of her nightstand as she exited the room... only to enter again to grab the tiny bow and top hat from her desk.

"No..."

"Yes~

--

Celebi exited her house, holding an annoyed-looking Zorua, who was wearing his blue bow and his tiny top hat.

"I hate ya." he said. Celebi childishly stuck her tongue out in response.

Her other paw joined the other as he enclosed Zorua in a hug, the warm sunshine hitting the couple as she walked out and psychically closed the door behind herself.

Zorua stretched in her paws.

"See? Much better~" he snickered.
"You get to carry me more easily~"

Celebi simply sighed at her boyfriend's antics.

"... So? What do we do today?" he asked.

At this, Celebi smiled as she explained what she had in mind...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Late awakening

choices: "... Maybe it's the perfect time to introduce you to mom." Celebi said
"... I don't think we should tell her yet..." Celebi said
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"I do have a suggestion~" Celebi chimed as she gently started caressing Zorua, who gladly let her, enjoying her gentle touch on his head.

"What?" he asked, already knowing what she was about to suggest - pokedoll shop, book store, boring romantic movie... he caught himself sighing.

Sure, he loved Celebi's company... and loved Celebi herself, but THIS was his new life?

Noticing her tiny roomie frowning, Celebi deducted that he already figured out what she had in store... but, she decided, it was time for a change.

"I'll grow you back Zorua." she said.

Zorua reacted only after several seconds.

He slowly looked up at his girlfriend and blinked.

"What?"

The giant fairy nodded.
"Yep. We can do more stuff if you're normal sized, so..." she gently put him down, before shooting a familiar cyan ball into his body, which grew in size until Zorua was standing at his full height.

He looked at Celebi for a moment, dumbfounded, before smiling uncertainly.

"Okay Celi..." he said, a smirk taking place on his muzzle.
"But that means..." his paw rose as he took off the bow, lifted the top hat from his head and unceremoniously let them fall on the ground.

Celebi sighed as she gently picked the now normal sized accessories up, opened the door of her house and floated them inside with psychic, before closing the door again and catching up with Zorua, who had started walking in the meantime.

"So? Where are we headed?" he casually asked, before grinning at the green girl.
"Oh, let's go to my forest!" he suggested.

There, the two could relax, play together, enjoy sunshine, wait for someone to throw rocks a-

No... he was reformed now... still, it'd be hilarious, he thought with a snicker.

Sadly, Celebi disagreed.

"Nope~ I've got a better idea~" she said, grabbing one of Zorua's paws and speeding up, literally dragging the fox to an unknown destination.

"C-Celi, slow down!" he exclaimed, desperately trying to keep up with the fairy, who smirked as she glanced backwards. Zorua noted what she was looking at...

"No! No! No! N-"

He couldn't resist as Celebi dragged him inside of the clothing store.

--

"Oh~ cute~... ohh, that one that one!"

Zorua sighed as he followed his girlfriend through the store while she excitedly watched clothes, commented how cute they'd look on her and picked up some to examine them up close.

Zorua sighed again, bored, before lazily gazing at the prices...

"Wow! How can you afford these clothes?" he asked her, shocked that such things could cost that much.

Celebi giggled.
"I save money. How can you afford the stuff you use to prank?" she retorted.

"I steal."

Celebi abruptly stopped to glare at the dark type.

"Yeah... because you're done with that, right?" she asked.

Zorua simply snickered in response, while Celebi sighed... before she eyed a blue, simple bracelet on a shelf.

She smiled, and quickly picked it up, before putting it around her wrist and showing it to Zorua.

"Hey Zorua, how does this look on me?" she asked. Zorua looked at it half-heartedly.
"Ehm..."

A few moments later, an indignant Celebi exited the store in a rush, Zorua running behind her.
"Celi!" he exclaimed, wondering the reason of her weird behavior.

Perhaps... was ‘I'm clueless’ a wrong answer?

--

Zorua had to apologize several times before Celebi finally decided to move on.

"Fine..." she said, finally unfolding her arms and looking at the dark type fox, wearing a smile.

"Zorua, let's go watch a movie!" she suggested, and he smiled.

"Sounds..." he abruptly stopped to look at her.
"... You're not dragging me to see some romantic trash, are ya?" he asked, already knowing the answer.

Which was a smirk appearing on Celebi's face as she started walking in direction of the movie theater, Zorua giving as sigh as he followed.

Once out of the movie theater, Zorua eyed a particular poster and quickly ran up in front of it, tail wagging in front of the image of Giratina, encircled by Gastly, towering over a scared Eevee who was running in a spectral scenario, chased by the huge dragon.

‘A date with the devil’ Zorua read with an excited snicker.

"I know what you're thinking, and I totally approve it." a voice chimed behind the fox. He recognized it and snickered as he turned around to high-five a shiny Braixen.

"Are you here to watch this Braix?" he asked, and she snickered while Celebi got closer.
"Of course! I've been waiting for this to come out for months!" she chimed, before eyeing the couple with a grin.
"Please tell me you're coming to see it too." she said.

"Sure!"
"No!" Celebi exclaimed, before sighing.

The fairy looked at Zorua and pointed to another poster... the blue eyes of the fox shrunk.

An Espeon and an Umbreon, cuddling on a green field, tails wrapped together and mouths locked in a kiss.

"And... no thanks... Braixen can I come with-" he was interrupted as Celebi pulled his tail.
"No Zorua, we're out on a date, you can't leave me all of sudden!" she scolded.

Braixen snickered.
"Don't worry, Zorua! I'll tell you everything later on! See ya!" she said cheerfully as she walked inside the theater, while Celebi literally dragged the poor fox inside.

He sighed.

--

"Isn't it beautiful Zorua?" Celebi asked with clasped paws and sparkling eyes as she watched Espeon and Umbreon nuzzling each other.

The fairy received no response.

"Zorua?" she looked to the seat beside hers... Zorua was snoring on his, head resting in his paws and tail wagging slowly.

"Zorua!"

The fox's eyes shot open as he looked at a frowning Celebi.

"How much time have you been asleep?" she asked as he yawned.
"I dunno... when Espeon moved from her old town?" he asked.

"But... that was the beginning!"

Zorua snickered.

"Arceus... you're hopeless." Celebi sighed.
"Isn't that why you're dating me?" the fox asked, causing Celebi to smile a little.

"For once Zorua..." she leaned to kiss his chest, before hugging him.
"You're right."

The fox snickered triumphantly.

--

"Well, I think I had fun... kinda..." Zorua stated as he and Celebi walked home. The sun had set down a while ago.

"Me too~ it was great to spend a day without thinking about Azurill..." Celebi chimed with a smile as they finally approached the house... noticing that the lights inside were on.

"Hm... mom must be home. She must have finished work early." the fairy told to a confused looking Zorua.

"About that..." he said, drawing the attention of Celebi.
"Celi... when do you think we're going to tell her about... us? She'll either find out herself or we tell her... and I think the second would be better, trust me." he told.

Celebi put a paw to her chin as she thought about it.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Fox and fairy on a date

choices: She cautiously lets Zorua in and talks to them both about their relationship.
Celebi's mom wants a one-on-one with one of the two lovebirds.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Celebi knew Zorua's musings were valid. After all, her mom had already come close to discovering the shrunken dark type on two different occasions, and her suddenly stumbling upon him in her room would likely lead to the elder Celebi breaking off their relationship. Thusly...

"Maybe it's the perfect time to introduce you to mom," Celebi said.

"Right now? Are you sure about this, Celi?" Zorua asked, concerned.

"Yeah, we're still only a few weeks into our relationship, so it'd be a lot less awkward to do it now."

"Sounds about right."

"Alright, you just wait here, I'll go in and start the conversation."

"Gotcha. Lemme just get in a bit closer though," Zorua said, masking his presence once more with an illusion of a yard without him in it and walking to Celebi's front door with her, lying in wait next to the porch.

The younger Celebi opened the front door and walked in, and quickly noticed her mom sitting down in the living room with a cup of tea and a plate of food, watching a movie that no doubt would have Zorua knocked out. Unsure of how exactly to break the news to the pink Celebi, the green one simply said "hi, mom," and got her attention.

"Oh, hi, sweetie!" the elder Celebi happily exclaimed upon seeing her daughter. "Where have you been?"

"I was just... out with friends."

Celebi's mom smiled at this. "I'm glad to see that you're getting out more, sweetie. I know you've always been a bookworm and all, so it's good that you're doing things with others, getting fresh air, and meeting new people."

'Let's just rip the bandage off now...' Celebi thought, attempting to psych herself up for what she was about to do next.

"Yeah... speaking of new people... I think I finally met... someone..." Celebi said, her demeanor getting more and more demure. Her mom snapped to attention at this.

"Are you sure, sweetie? I know I brought it up yesterday, but you didn't need to go and look right away!" the elder Celebi jokingly stated.

"No... it's... I've actually... known him for a while..." the pink Celebi raised an eyebrow at this. "We've actually been... together for a little bit..."

At this point Celebi's mom was simultaneously intrigued, concerned, and confused. Her daughter just told her yesterday that Gardevoir was still trying to match her with people, and today she was admitting she's been with a guy for some time? Her sweet daughter had never been the lying type...

"Why didn't you tell me before, honey?"

"Because I... didn't think you'd approve of him..."

"Why would that be?"

A sudden knock on the door interrupted the moment between the two time-travelers. "I'll get it," the older time-traveler said. Celebi already had a good feeling who it was, and followed her mom over to the door where, true to her expectations, her mom was now looking at Zorua. The pink Celebi quickly put two and two together and looked back at her daughter.

"You're in love with Zorua?" Celebi looked away after being asked this. "I'm not mad, sweetie... I'm just making sure."

"Yeah... him and I... like like each other..."

"Okay, sweetie..." 'Wait a second... didn't she have a Zorua Pokedoll?... No way that was...' Now Celebi's mom had put four and four together, and was beginning to realize Zorua had been right under her... nose?... this whole time. She obviously wanted to know how long this had been for, whether Zorua had truly changed, if he was a gentleman... all sorts of stuff. But which one should she ask? Obviously there would be lots of bias since they like each other, and her daughter had lied about being in a relationship, but was Zorua any more honest than Celebi?
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Belated Introductions

choices: "... If you truly changed, then you're free to stay."
"... I'm glad that you changed, but you must go, I'm afraid."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Celebi's mom looked at her daughter, then at Zorua, who gulped.

Even though he was normal sized, the pink time traveler had the power of scaring the fox.

The pink Celebi didn't know what to think about this whole thing. Celebi had lied to her about having a boyfriend... and such boyfriend was Zorua, a scoundrel.

Sure, word of him changing had spread through the village and, while many didn't believe that, Celebi's mom had been intrigued by the news.

And now, there they were, her daughter and him, admitting that they liked each other. And, while every mother is always happy to see her child in love, she had to make sure Zorua was a good boyfriend for Celebi.

The older time traveler sighed.

"Come in you two."

--

Zorua felt uncomfortable, sitting at a table with Celebi beside him and her mom staring at the two of them as she sat in front of them.

"... So, Zorua," Celebi's mom attempted to break the ice.
"Lopunny told me you changed... that you quitted with pranks..."

Zorua put a paw to his chest.
"It's true, miss... I quitted pranking others... Celebi gave me a big help..." he admitted, although leaving out the details of his reformation.

Celebi looked at him gratefully. He called his broken leg a help in front of her mother, a blessing in front of Buneary, always told that she had given him a new life.

Her mom smiled.
"I'm glad to be hearing this, honey... and you Zorua, I'm quite impressed by your change too... but I need to know something else - how long?" she asked, adjusting in her chair.

"How long have you two been together?" she repeated.

"Long story..." Zorua replied.

"We have time."

Celebi sighed as she looked at Zorua, but he turned his head away, making her understand that he was letting her do the talking.

"Well... a week or two ago, I found Zorua sleeping in the woods..."
"I'm homeless, miss..."

The pink Celebi looked at him, he nodded.
"... You have nowhere to go?" she asked. Zorua shook his head.
"And... your parents?" she asked, genuinely curious.

Zorua sighed.
"I never knew my mom... and my dad wasn't exactly what I call the perfect parent... he was a jerk... I ran so much time ago..." he admitted, causing Celebi to look at him, flabbergasted.

He never told her this!

The green fairy nervously scratched her head.
"... And so, I offered him to... to come living here... and he agreed, he's been living with us since then..." Celebi admitted.

"B-But... I never noticed you!" her mom exclaimed, perplexed, before yet again remembering the pokedoll she held in her own hands some time ago, noticing that it was well made... that seemed like real fur... and Zorua was able to use illusions.

Every piece went to its place... except...

"... Why pretend to be a pokedoll?" she asked before he could explain, and Celebi gulped.
"I mean... of all the illusions you could use, why a pokedoll?"

Celebi sighed.

This was the most awkward confession she had to give.

"Technically mom, I do this..."

Before the pink Celebi's green eyes, a free chair around the table was hit by a cyan ball and reduced in size, before growing back at its original size upon being hit by the same ball again.

The pink fairy looked back at her daughter.
"... Since when you can do such thing?" she asked, not sure whether to feel proud of her daughter for having such unique ability or disappointed because she used it to let a scoundrel live in their house.

"A Minimize TM... I used that to develop this... I shrunk Zorua so that he could freely stay with us... he still does... the pokedoll was the perfect disguise..." Celebi admitted.
"... Please mom, let Zorua stay, he's nice now, you won't even see him, I'll take care of him, please..."

Zorua looked at his girlfriend longingly.

He knew that if her mother disagreed, he'd lose his girlfriend and his home... sure, he'd go straight back to living in the woods, but losing Celebi was something he didn't want to deal with.

Alright, maybe Celebi was a bit boring at times, and she loved dressing him up like a doll, but he loved her...

The pink Celebi looked at the two young pokemon staring at each other... she saw the worry in Zorua's eyes, and smiled.
‘Young love...’ she thought.

The older time traveler gave a sigh that successfully earned the attention of the two pokemon in front of her.

"I'm glad about this all, kids, and I'm glad you told me the truth... I'm happy you helped him change, honey, and I'm happy you like someone..." she said.

Celebi fought back a smile. That was a good sign.

The pink fairy turned her head to Zorua.
"As for you, Zorua... did you REALLY change? Are you truly done right pranks?" she asked, unsure if she could trust him yet.

Zorua chose his words carefully, knowing that his girlfriend was the price to pay if he told something wrong.

"Yes miss... I'm done pranking for good... please, I really like Celebi..." he told.
"Same goes for me..." the green fairy chimed in.

Her mom nodded. She had enough answers to give her response, she decided.
"Zorua...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: A lot of awkward confessions

choices: Celebi and Zorua get in bed to sleep
"Honey, Zorua? May I talk to you for a moment?" Celebi's mom called
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"Zorua... if you truly changed like you're saying... like my daughter is saying, I'm happy..." the pink fairy gave a sigh, which sent shivers down Zorua's spine.

But Celebi's mom smiles.
"... And you, young man, are allowed to keep dating Celi..." she said, eliciting a sigh of sheer relief from the fox.

"Thanks miss..." he told, beaming. The pink time traveler gave a bright smile.

However, Celebi still looked bemused.

"... And? What about him... living here with me... us?" she asked, hopeful. Her mother looked at her.
"Honey, that honestly took me aback... but I guess he can stay with us..." she said.

Celebi got up from her chair, unsure whether she wanted to hug her mom or Zorua.

But in the end, her choice fell upon her mom as both hugged each other.

"Thankyouthankyouthankyou!"

"Thanks miss!"

The pink Celebi smiled - it was nice to see her daughter happy. However, she still had to make sure Zorua was good... she had his word. Now she had to see it with her own eyes.

"Just... a few rules, okay?" she said, releasing the green fairy.

Zorua tensed up again, and Celebi moved beside him as her mother spoke,

"One: no weird stuff going on between you two. I don't want to see or hear anything weird from you two." she said.

Celebi blushed.

"Mom!" she screamed in embarrassment, while Zorua blushed too.
"Wouldn't dream of it miss..." he said.

The older time traveler nodded.

"Two: Zorua, while in the house, you'll have to be tiny like you were back then..." she said, before noting the confused looks on the couple's faces.
"Don't misunderstand me, I do trust you, but it's just to make sure..." she justified.

Zorua nodded.
"That's quite alright... I was used to it by now..." he said, and Celebi smirked.

"Three: I'll be checking on you for some time, until I think you're truly what you claim to be. Follow my rules, earn my trust, Zorua, and you'll be free to stay at normal size in the house." the pink fairy said, before looking at Celebi.
"Same goes for you, honey. Don't make me reconsider about this..."

"Yes mom." Celebi nodded eagerly. She was on cloud nine. She got to keep her boyfriend, she got to let him live in her house and, most importantly, she could keep him tiny and adorable!

The pink fairy finally gave a smile.

"That all said... be happy, you two. Take care of each other." she said sweetly, before getting up from her chair.
"Dinner will be ready soon~"

"Miss..." Zorua chimes, obtaining her attention. He grinned at her.
"Thanks."

Celebi's mom smiled brightly in response.

And then, a cyan ball was shot inside the fox's body as she found the chair he was sitting on growing bigger, until he was sitting on a wooden land.

Celebi gently picked him up, smiled at her mom and went to her room, closing the door behind herself.

Then, Celebi moved on the bed, sat down with her legs crossed and moved the tiny fox up to her face, noticing his tail wagging

Without saying a word, Celebi kissed him.

--

"I'm so happy!" Celebi chimed as she returned to her room after dinner.

Zorua smiled - he was interrogated by the mother of his girlfriend during dinner.

The questions were quite easy - ‘When did it happen?’, ‘How did it happen?’ and other questions along those lines.

But Zorua seemed to have answered to them all correctly as Celebi's mother smiled brightly when they finished eating and quietly let them go back inside the fairy's room.

"Yeah... me too..." the dark type responded from her paws.

Celebi gave him a gleeful smile, before gently putting him down on her pillow and reaching inside her closet.

"... Please don't pull out the chess board." he told with a sigh.

Celebi looked back to smile as her paw emerged with a bag of chips... Zorua's hickory chips!

"It was nice, finally telling it, huh? We can finally, freely be together~" the giant fairy sang as she set the bag down in front of Zorua, who started munching on a giant chip.
"Mh-mhmmh~" he said, mouth full.

Celebi smiled, and gently gripped him, setting him down on her lap.

Zorua grinned, and snuggled closer to her belly.

"Are you happy?" she asked.
"Elated. You?" he asked back.
"Blissful~"

Celebi turned to her closet, psychically pulling out something... Zorua's smile faded.

His most dreaded nemesis after the bow - the chess board.

Celebi smiled as she gripped the checkered board.

"One match before bed? Pretty please?" she asked pleadingly, eyes sparkling.

Zorua huffed.

--

"Checkmate!"

The black king was kicked hard, and it slid across the chess board to hit the white king, which fell from the board, in front of a flabbergasted Celebi.

Zorua had beaten her. Zorua.

He snickered.
"Only because I'm bored doesn't mean I can't do it, ya know!" he exclaimed cheerfully.

The giant green fairy in front of him smirked.

"I let you win..." she said.

"No you didn't... nice try, Celi." he answered. She opened her mouth, but he intercepted what she was about to say,
"You were looking surprised since I cornered you when my bishop took down your queen!" he stated proudly, Celebi's mouth hanging open.

"... Okay, you're being too smart now." she said playfully as she scooped him up.

"Why? Don't like it?"

In response, Celebi pecked him on the forehead.

"That was a fair victory... you earned your reward cutie~" the giantess said as she happily nuzzled the tiny dark type, who nuzzled his head against her giant cheek.

The whole thing went on for a whole minute, before Celebi pulled back and smiled brightly.

"Let's go to bed Zorua, what do you think?" she asked, putting the chess board away inside her closet again, before looking down at the dark type, who nodded happily.

Celebi gently picked him up and moved towards her bed.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: The blessing of a mother

choices: "...we go and see our friends. It's been a little while, after all."
"...my mom wants to spend some time with us, getting to know you."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
A psychic flip of the lights brought darkness and calm to the bedroom, whose occupants quickly curled up under the blanket on Celebi's bed.

"Goodnight, cutie~," Celebi chirped, holding Zorua to his familiar green "bedding". Zorua himself mustered a half-asleep "goodnight, Celi", as he adjusted the best he could to get into a more comfortable sleeping position.

Much like the lights, the young couple's falling asleep also went quickly.

--

About half an hour later, Celebi's mom decided to check on the couple. After all, they were a pair of teenagers who were alone in a bedroom together, late at night. Floating in through the doorway, she moved over towards the bed and its sleeping residents. They were asleep already, giving the elder further credence to Zorua's statement that he wouldn't be engaging in any "weird stuff" with her daughter.

But where was he? The pink Celebi telekinetically lifted the blanket, revealing... Zorua being held like a doll in the paws of his girlfriend, her stomach making itself his bedspread. If she wasn't trying to be quiet, Celebi's mom would've chuckled at this.

'I thought you were too studious to be playing with dolls, sweetie,' she sarcastically thought, before letting the covers fall back onto the sleeping couple. The elder Celebi levitated back out of Celebi's bedroom and closed the door, before returning to her own bedroom and letting out that laugh. She quickly let sleep claim her as well.

--

The door of Celebi's bedroom creaked open, but the happy couple ignored it. After all, they were in the middle of a quite pleasant sleep and didn't want to be interrupted. The cause of the creaking? Celebi's mom, come to wake her daughter (and by proxy, her boyfriend as well) at a reasonable hour. Plus, she had already made breakfast for the two and didn't want it to go to waste. Fluttering over to the sleeping pair, she gently shook Celebi (and by proxy, her boyfriend as well) and jostled them awake and away from dreamland.

Both of the Celebis immediately heard the groaning coming from under the blanket, with the green one giving a knowing smirk towards her stomach. Moving her right paw, she pulled the blanket off of herself (and by proxy, her boyfriend as well), exposing him to the air and light once more.

"Celi... can't we sleep in one of these days?" the small fox grumbled.

"We were asleep until noon yesterday, was that not enough?" his girlfriend asked back.

"In a word, no." Celebi mockingly scoffed at this reply. "Now what time is it?"

"About 9 in the morning," Celebi's mom said, leading to Zorua suddenly realizing she was also in the room.

"O-oh! How long have you been there?"

"The whole time, Zorua. Now I've made breakfast for you two, so come and get it," the pink Celebi stated, before fluttering back out of the room.

"Well, you heard her. Let's eat," Celebi said to her boyfriend, before getting up and heading for the door with him as well.

--

Sitting down at the table, Celebi set the tiny Zorua on a napkin next to her plate, which was adorned with meat and eggs, with a glass of juice. She broke off some meat and eggs from her own meal and set the smaller portions next to Zorua before digging into her own. They ate in pleasant silence for the most part until Zorua looked up and asked Celebi, "what's the plan for today?"

"Well, Zorua, I was thinking..."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Chill Night, Peaceful Morn

choices: "... Can I come normal-sized?" Zorua asked
"... Nevermind... I'm fine with this size Celi," Zorua said
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"... Let's go see our friends. It's been a while since I saw Espurr... it's been a while since we went out all together." Celebi suggested.

Zorua swallowed a piece of meat.
"Yeah... since Wigglytuff ‘disappeared’..." he had to choke back a snicker. Celebi's mom was still in the room with them, sipping coffee, and she didn't know anything about Wigglytuff's sad end. She only knew that he was gone.

"Still can't believe those kids had to leave the village..." the pink fairy remarked pitifully, and Celebi gave her boyfriend a warning look.

"... But we've hung out with Gardevoir the other night Celi." he added to change subject.

Celebi sighed.
"And it was totally weird... Zorua, pokemon kept glaring at you... have you seen the look on Ninetales’ face?" she asked.

Ninetales was one of the teachers of the school. When she saw Celebi at the same table with Zorua, she shot a questioning look as well as a disappointed one. Celebi promptly ignored both, sure that she was going to have to give a lot of awkward explanations whenever school started again.

Zorua snickered.
"Why should I care? I don't even go to school." he replied, causing Celebi to giggle and her mom to sigh - she became quite serious when it came to school business. With a daughter like Celebi, it wasn't hard to see why.

"... Anyway, going out with the other sounds good." the dark-type finished.

He reached to grab another mouthful of meat, but Celebi picked him up from his napkin and pecked his left cheek... or better, the left side of his head.

In response, he nuzzled the fairy's giant cheek.
