Watching the scene from the other side of the table, Celebi's mom giggled.
"You two make a cute couple after all~" she said, sending Zorua in a state of deep embarrassment and causing Celebi to giggle awkwardly.
"... We're heading out in a bit then." she said Zorua, who nodded, his cheek flared up.

--

"Seriously..." the dark type stood still while Celebi tied the familiar blue bow around his neck.
"Your mom knows about us... no need to hide anymore..." he meekly opposed.

"Still, other pokemon don't, and it'd be weird if they did... and, by the way, you look cute with this~" she chirped in response, before placing a tiny top hat on the fox's head.
"And this~"

Zorua sighed - this was humiliating...

The thought faded from his mind as Celebi, noticing his dejected stare, picked him up from his perch on top of her pillow and pecked his forehead.

"Come on Zorua... you've got to believe me, you look even more cute with those on~" she chirped.

Zorua meekly looked up. When your giant girlfriend wants you to do something, it's hard to tell her ‘no’.

However, Zorua thought about making one last attempt.
"... At least the hat?... I saved Azurill?" he asked.

Celebi smirked.
"... Something that big over this Zorua? That's dumb... but seeing you plead is so cute~" she said cheerfully, removing the hat from the head of her boyfriend and throwing it onto the bed, earning a grateful smile from the dark-type.

"Come on cutie," the fairy said, holding the fox against her chest and starting to walk.
"Mom! We're going out!" she shouted, getting a prompt response,
"Okay sweetie~... Zorua. Just don't be late for dinner!" her mother exclaimed from the living room.

Soon, she heard the front door closing.

She smiled.
"... My little girl is grown up so fast... and now, she has a boyfriend..." she said to herself.

Then, she looked around the quiet house.

She had a day off and was alone in the house. She smiled once more.

A nice armchair, ice cream and a good movie.

This was going to be the perfect day.

--

Half an hour later, Celebi, Braixen, Gardevoir and Espurr were walking down the road... Zorua held by a very affectionate Espurr.

Celebi, mind opportunely shielded by a psychic block, was trying to keep herself from acting jealous... a hard task to achieve when another girl was holding her boyfriend right in front of her.

As for Zorua, he enjoyed the embrace of the pokemon who was probably his best friend, happily ignoring his internally-seething girlfriend behind them. Since the sleepover in which he learned about Espurr's crush for him, the psychic-type had been way more affectionate around Zorua.

And the two didn't escape Gardevoir's eyes, which were quite vigilant when it came to this sort of things.

"Aw~ aren't these two cute~?" she intoned, causing Celebi to clench her fists and Braixen to snicker with a paw over her face.

She could already tease Zorua because of his bow, but this was even better! Shame Lopunny wanted Buneary to hang out with her and Azurill, she would've enjoyed herself.

Espurr blushed as she picked up on her friend's thoughts, but shot her an annoyed look. Braixen stopped laughing instantly.

Espurr smirked - it's not so hard to make your friends stop teasing you when you can read minds and have eyes as large as your mouth.

Speaking of mind-reading, Espurr sensed Zorua's thoughts and smiled, comprehensive.

"Hm-mh... I see your point." she simply said, stroking the dark-type, who sighed. As much as he liked Espurr, he wanted her out of his mind.

Celebi saw the perfect opportunity to remind Zorua who his girlfriend was.

"What? Anything - you tell me - now." she quickly said, picking him from Espurr's arms and holding him in front of her face.

The bow-adorned tiny dark-type and Celebi's boyfriend shrugged.
"No big deal Celi... just, I was thinking - I can't do anything like this... I thought it would have been nice if I could be big again for today, that's it." he explained.

Celebi stared at him, before giggling.

"Zorua, that's up to-"

"No wait, don't!" Braixen chimed in, snickering, earning the attention of the couple.
"That bow looks cute on him, it'd be a shame to let him take it off~" she teased.

"... Why don't you shrink and put this bow on Braixen?" Zorua snapped back.

"Hm... it'd look nice on you..." Gardevoir chimed, looking at her purple friend, who looked betrayed.

"... Keep that thing away from me or I'll roast it." she playfully threatened.

Zorua perked up.
"... Do it!" he exclaimed, the perspective of getting rid of the blue piece of fabric making his eyes gleam.

Celebi sighed.
"Shut up Zorua..." she said before smiling.
"Anyway, it's up to you! Say, do you want to stay like that or grow back?" she asked.

"Hm..." the dark-type pondered.

Sure, this size had it's advantages. He was carried around, food lasted longer - he saw Celebi grabbing money, so she was either buying other pokedoll clothes or snacks - Celebi was way more affectionate with him.

But growing back... he'd get rid of the blue bow still tied around his neck. That was really a tempting perspective, even though pokemon tended to be nicer when he was at his current size... those he knew and befriended anyway.

If someone from the village saw him, it'd be bad... for them anyway since Celebi could shrink them to specks.

As for Zorua himself, he finally told his girlfriend his decision.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Four friends and a half

choices: "I want to chill in my forest at some point."
"I'll look as we go, maybe i'll see something in the village..."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Zorua weighed his options. He got carried, pokemon were less likely to bug him, and the food and warmth at this size were fantastic.

He'd put up with the bow.

"I'm good like this I suppose...though you should try this sometime Braixen." He teased and he saw the larger fire fox tense.

"Yeah, ha ha Zorua, ain't happening." She said and Celebi and Gardevoir giggled.

"She's scared." Espurr chimed in, deadpan as Braixen flushed red. She wanted to smack the little psychic cat sometimes.

Espurr just smirked as Zorua looked over.

"Oh please, it's not scary...when you get used to it. Ask Azurill." Zorua said and Braixen shrugged.

"Let's just drop it...I want to hit a few places and I can't do that tiny." Braixen said as the group entered the village.

"So what exactly IS the plan?" Zorua asked and Celebi's eyes sparkled. "We'll go see a nice movie~"

"Oh yes~" Gardevoir said.

"Not romance." Both Zorua and Braixen chimed at the same time.

"Then we'll go see some shops...grab some lunch..."

"Hit the arcade..." Braixen said making Gardevoir sigh.

"I don't want to do that..."

"Too bad, it was my choice of place. Espurr wants to go look at antiques....again."

Espurr just gave Braixen a deadpan look before nodding.

"Zorua, what about you, you want to pick a spot?" Celebi said and he thought.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Making the plan

choices: "... Let's go watch a movie."  she suggested
"... We can go see some shops." she suggested
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Celebi smiled.

"Mom wants to spend some time with us, getting to know you Zorua." she explained, causing the pink fairy to smile at them as she sipped tea from a cup she held.

"Hm..." the tiny dark-type responded. He was hoping to be alone with his girlfriend again today. But he quickly recalled the words of her mother, ‘I'll be checking on you for some time’... maybe that was what she meant.

"You don't seem too happy Zorua..." said pokemon pointed out with a smirk, causing her daughter's boyfriend to blush.

"... I'm elated miss." Zorua replied, hoping that the pink fairy didn't catch the hint of sarcasm in his voice.

The elder time traveler simply stared at him, smirk glued to her face.

Celebi giggled.
"See mom? You two are getting along just fine!" she chimed cheerfully.

Zorua wordlessly returned to his meat and swallowed his embarrassment along with another mouthful of food.

Sadly, Celebi didn't let him finish.

"Hey!" the fox cried as he was suddenly lifted away from his meal, which was still far from being completely eaten by Zorua.

The fox flailed in midair, but couldn't resist and was hugged by Celebi who got up from the table.
"We've got to prepare for the day Zorua~" she chimed.

Knowing, what she was referring to, Zorua shot her a glare.
"I'm not putting the bow on." he said firmly, forgetting what predicament he was in.

"Yes, you are so going to put the bow on~ not to mention the hat~" she replied, hilarity in her voice. Zorua paled.

Celebi's mom looked amused, before realizing what the two pokemon in front of her were talking about.
"Aw, you got him doll clothes sweetie? That's so cute~" she stated.

The color returned on Zorua's cheeks, and it was a bright red.

He started mumbling embarrassedly as Celebi carried him into her bedroom, leaving her mom alone. The older time traveler looked at her cup of tea, before taking one last sip and giggling to herself.

"This is going to be fun."

--

Zori could only watch dejectedly as Celebi tied the bow around his neck.

She stood at her full height, looking down at the fox with... disappointment?

The fairy started shaking her head.
"Not even two weeks and I've already broken you Zorua? You used to put up quite a fight back then..." she said with a mock sigh as she placed the tiny top hat on his head.

He glared at her.
"I hate ya." he said while Celebi picked him up and gave a sweet smile.
"No you don't... my little cutie~" she replied, her lips touching his forehead. He sighed, smiling.
"... You're right. I don't." he responded, risking to return Celebi's kiss; his own tiny lips touched her chin.

Celebi pulled back, looking at him with a blush spread across her cheeks. Zorua gave a serene smile.

"... Did you just...?" she wasted no more words.

Zorua suddenly found himself flipped on his back, the head of his giant girlfriend pinning him down as she nuzzled him with glee.

"C-Celi! You know I hate this!" he cried in annoyance, only to later discover that Celebi was completely ignoring him.

Sadly, the moment was spoiled when her mom called for her,

"Honey? Are you ready?" she asked from outside.

Celebi froze - did this count as ‘weird stuff’? - and giggled at Zorua.
"Yes mom, we're ready!" she replied, hugging Zorua to her chest and leaving the room.

--

From his perch on his girlfriend's paws, Zorua watched the mother of said pokemon closing the door and turning to them, smiling.

"Let's get going you two~" she said cheerfully.

The day ahead of her was quite bright - she had Zorua's word that he wasn't going to get involved in weird stuff with her daughter, she had gotten her confirm last night, now she only had to know the fox a bit more.

Speaking of Zorua, she noticed him staring in front of him neutrally.

"You do seem quite unhappy Zorua..." she mused out loud, drawing the attention of both him and her daughter, who looked down at her boyfriend with concern, noticing that he indeed looked weird.

"... Perhaps, you really don't enjoy my company?" the elder Celebi then supposed, feeling both concerned and offended.

Zorua looked at her, shaking his head.

"What - no! Miss, I do enjoy your company," he said.
"... I was just thinking about something, that's all. Celi, don't look at me like that." Celebi was, in fact, glancing at him worriedly.

Celebi stared for a couple seconds more, before realizing.

"Oh~" she giggled, fluttering back inside the house.

She returned a few moments later, Zorua's hat was gone and they were discussing something.

"It'll be more fun if you come that size, cutie~" she said cheerfully. Evidently, Zorua had confessed her what was troubling him.

Celebi's mom finally understood what was going on and smiled.

"Zorua, I said you had to be tiny in the house... technically, we're out of the house and you're both under my watch... I don't think there's any actual problem if you want to go back to your size." she said.

Zorua looked back at Celebi, who stared at him with a smirk.

Her opinion was clear. And when one's giant girlfriend is that firm on a particular subject, there's no denying her desires... for obvious reasons.

"... I'm fine, let's go." he said, Celebi smiling triumphantly.

Her mother shrugged, before smiling again.

"Well you two... I've got the perfect idea..."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Fox and fairy... fairies

choices: It's just a friend of the older Celebi saying hi
It's Lopunny, with Buneary and a very realistic Azurill doll
It's someone who spotted the tiny Zorua that hates him
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"We'll go see some shops you two, it'll be a great time~ Just like a few days ago, right Celi~" Her mom said and Celebi smiled, Zorua for his part just looked on in dread.

"Oh...oh no..." He muttered as both girls looked at him.

"Oh don't be so pouty Zorua, it won't all be GIRL shops, we'll stop somewhere you want to as well." Celebi said and Zorua seemed to be a bit less pouty.

"...No pokedoll clothes." He said and both girls giggled.

"Yeah, good luck with that." His girlfriend said, and he didn't push back against it.

"You'll have fun." The older Celebi reassured.

-

'Fun huh?' He thought, but didn't speak. He had been with the two girls for hours like this. He was sure people could see him too, but no one dared to approach and ask about it...which he supposed was fine enough. The less drama the better, and no one seemed dumb enough to challenge or confront two legendaries on the subject. 'Last one that did was a dumb kid...' He thought with a bit of a smirk.

'Not to mention Wigglytuff...wonder if he's already kicked the bucket...I wonder how it'll happen if it hasn't already.'

His thoughts were interrupted however.

"Zorua, I don't know what you're thinking but that grin is creepy..." Celebi said and Zorua immediately shook his head and shot a harmless carefree grin. "Just thinking about a few things." He said in a happy tone, before noting that Celebi was holding a dress at length from him. "Well think on something else, like this. How do you think i'd look in this Zorua? Pretty?" She asked and he sighed.

"Celebi, you ARE pretty..." The older Celebi giggled.

"Well thank you, but how do you think i'd look in the dress?" She asked again.

"Uh...okay I guess...?" He said as he tilted his head.

"Just okay? Hmm..." She seemed to be in thought and the older Celebi sighed.

"Zorua, you're not the best at this, are you?"

"I don't know ma'am! This is...did I say something?" He was confused as Celebi smiled at him.

"Don't worry about it. I'll look at another dress." She said and Zorua just looked on perplexed.

-

"Thank you!" Zorua said as he looked at the burger in front of him. It was enormous, dwarfing him easily.

Celebi just smiled at him from her salad and the older Celebi came back with hers and some drinks.

"Jeez Zorua, you won't be able to finish it all." She said as Celebi gave a smirk.

"Yeah he will." She said, as the burger shrunk down and Zorua looked horrified.

"B-buh-burger...giant burger..." He said and Celebi looked at him.

"This way you can eat it all and not worry about overeating." She said in far too nice of a tone for it to not be an intentional jab for some reason.

"Well...fine..." He said as he grabbed the burger between two paws and sat on his hind legs.

"You look so adorable like that..." He blushed red.

"Just holding a burger..." He said as he bit into it.

The older Celebi looked at the two smiling.

'I suppose he's harmless enough...a bit clueless but my Celi can be like that in her own way...they'll probably be fine.'

Her thoughts were interrupted as she felt a tapping on her shoulder and she turned in her chair to see...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: A peaceful day with two fairies

choices: "... You see, he wasn't really who you thought he was..." Lopunny replied
"... I don't know. Maybe he really disappeared." Lopunny replied
"... Forget it. Better if you don't know anything." Lopunny replied
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
The pink Celebi turned around and smiled as her eyesight was filled by a certain tall, brown bunny, holding the paw of a smaller bunny, who was holding a very realistic Azurill doll against her chest with one free paw.

"Hi there you three~" Buneary chimed, letting go of the paw of the older bunny girl to wave it in the air as she greeted her friends.

For a moment, Celebi's mom frowned.

Three...? Buneary-

"They already know, mom," Celebi giggled from behind her, while Zorua gave a a shrug, before resuming eating his tiny burger.

That was a cheap shot of Celebi, and he still couldn't figure out why. Maybe... because of that dress in the shop? She seemed disappointed. But he didn't say anything wrong... or did he?

"So you already know everything, huh?" Celebi's mom wore a smile, while Lopunny and Buneary nodded cheerfully. The pink fairy swore that the smile on the Azurill doll's face was widening.

Celebi smiled.

"Mom, me, Buneary and Zorua are going to look at those shops over there." she said, pointing at a few places.

"Oh, that's fine with me... just don't wander off too far." Lopunny agreed, knowing the real purpose behind such words.

Celebi's mom also agreed. She saw nothing weird - one of the shops was the book store.

Celebi grabbed a hold of Zorua, who was still eating his burger, and got up, snatching Zorua's burger out of his paws.

"Hey!" the fox cried indignantly as Celebi put his food onto the table, before smiling at him and pecking his nose. Several giggles erupted around the fox, he felt his cheeks flaring up.

Regardless, he hugged Celebi's own cheek.

"I hate ya. I hate ya so much..." he said - Celebi's mom ignored the comment - and Celebi giggled.
"No you don't~"

Buneary giggled as she followed Celebi and Zorua.

Once they were alone, the elder time-traveler that was Celebi's mom looked at Lopunny, who met her gaze.

"So-"

"Azurill, huh?" the fairy interrupted with a smirk, the bunny girl blushing.
"Yeah... adopted the kid... but he had to be that size, I can't afford two... full-sized kids. Celi lent me a hand. How did you...?" she asked.

Celebi's mom smiled.
"Azurill can't use illusions, and I could sense his life energy... thinking about it, I sensed it in Zorua when he was pretending to be a doll in my house, but his illusion interfered with my powers." she explained.

Lopunny smiled.
"Yeah... your daughter and him... hard to believe, huh?" she said, the pink fairy nodding.
"They told me last night... Zorua seemed really redeemed to me." she said with a smile as she eyed the four pokemon who were walking in direction of the shops.

They seemed to be having fun. Then, they disappeared inside one of the stores... the book store, Celebi's mom noted with a smile.

--

"So, how are you two doing?" Celebi asked, trying to make casual conversation, as she picked up a few books.

Azurill smiled sympathetically from Buneary's chest.
"We're-"

"Zorua, what do you think of these?" Celebi interrupted, telekinetically holding three books whose titles gave Zorua a sense of drowsiness, which he expressed with an exaggerated yawn.

"I think that if I was big, I'd burn the whole place." he responded, causing Celebi to gasp, horrified.
"I'd kill you right after Zorua... this is easily the best place in the village!"

The dark-type snickered.
"Bookworm." Celebi smirked.
"Doll."
"You can do better."

"Scoundrel. And I'm buying these." Celebi snapped back, Zorua shooting a bored look.

Behind them, Buneary and Azurill giggled, drawing Celebi's attention.

The fairy blushed. Even if playfully, causing a scene in public is embarrassing.

"Sorry you two... were you saying?" she asked.

"Kid... don't ever fall in love," Zorua said Azurill, before noting the look his girlfriend was giving him.
"... It's too late for me."

The second those words left Zorua, Celebi leaned in to peck his cheek, causing Buneary and Azurill to laugh again. To Azurill, it was fun to see Zorua humiliated after what he did to his doll... although, he had to admit, all his sour feelings towards the fox that once was a prankster were gone, replaced by friendlier ones; to Buneary, the whole thing was cute to extreme levels.

"We're doing fine Celi... Mom is happy about Azurill too, she says she loves having another kid in the house." she revealed, making Azurill blush.

Celebi giggled.

"Glad to hear that. Zorua?"

She got no reply.

She looked down at her paws, but Zorua wasn't paying attention. Instead, he was looking intently, a frown on his face, out of the store, in direction of Lopunny and the pink Celebi.

The green one followed his gaze, and understood why her boyfriend was acting like that.

Her mom was frowning.

--

"... Lopunny, what happened to Wigglytuff? He disappeared, they say..." Celebi's mom asked at some point as she and her friend sat down on a bench.

Lopunny shivered at the memory, she had nightmares about it for a few nights.

If it wasn't for Celebi, Zorua, Braixen and the others, she'd have a hole in her chest now, while Buneary would be an orphan under Wigglytuff's ‘care’...

Wigglytuff and Weavile.

She wondered if they were already dead...

"Lopunny?"

"Hm?"

Celebi's mom was looking at her.

"Look, you said that you already knew about Celebi and Zorua. But that means that you also knew about Celi's powers, and that was why you asked her to shrink Azurill... after Wigglytuff's disappearance." she said.

Lopunny wore a confused look.

"... I don't follow."

The pink fairy sighed.

"I don't know... I feel like Celebi and Zorua might be involved with his disappearance. Do you know anything about it...?" she asked.

Lopunny looked at her.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Casual meeting

choices: "Maybe another time."
"Sure, i'm sure the kids would enjoy that."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"...It might sound bad, but your daughter...she did the right thing in this situation." Lopunny started. "His schemes came out when his house was investigated, his records but...it was more than that." She wanted to say this delicately, but she didn't want to keep this a secret from her friend.

"Celi..." She was addressing the older Celebi with this. "Wigglytuff tried to kill me." At this the pink Celebi's eyes widened a bit. "He had lost Azurill, due to...other circumstances surrounding Celebi and Zorua, and wanted to replace him for his 'adopted family', his workforce. He intended to adopt Buneary, but I needed to be out of the picture for that."

"Arceus above..." The older Celebi murmured and Lopunny nodded.

"Azumarill, Jynx, somehow even Mamoswine...Wigglytuff and his partner Weavile killed them all."

The older Celebi looked over to her drink, an ice coffee and took a shaky sip of it.

"Lopunny, they were gonna..." She shook her head. Wigglytuff was really going to do that!? The table quaked a bit as the older Celebi's eyes glowed, but she caught herself and took a shaky breath.

"Celebi and Zorua knew...they caught on to it. Celebi and her friends showed up, with Azurill right before Weavile was going to cut out my heart. Your daughter...her power is amazing. Truly amazing." Lopunny murmured. "In the hands of a pokemon that was less sweet than her though...it'd be downright frightening."

Lopunny looked down.

"The truth is...I don't know if Wigglytuff and Weavile are alive. But Celebi shrunk them down so much in the forest, so so much that I don't think anyone will ever find them. Even the slightest breeze would be enough to carry them to who knows where. I just hope you don't blame her for this. Celebi...made the right choice. Those two pokemon were too dangerous, too vile to just let go, or even go through the justice system."

The older Celebi considered this and let out a sigh.

"I'm glad you're okay Lopunny...and i'm happy for you that you've helped a kid find his way through this too...even through some particularly odd circumstances."

She had to talk to her daughter about this though. She leaned back in her chair and rubbed her temples as she thought how to handle this.

Celebi had done something she can't take back in the eyes of society. That was...not something to take lightly. Considering the circumstances surrounding it though it could be considered self defense.

Or being judge, jury and executioner.

She'd hear Celebi's side she supposed. And Zorua's.

Azurill's too.

"Buneary doesn't know everything about this Celi, please, I know you have 1000 questions but be careful about this around her. Azurill knows that too." Lopunny said gently.

"Lopunny, why don't you and your kids join us for a bit? I'll ask Celebi and Zorua about it later but i'd like to talk with Azurill as well." The older Celebi said. Lopunny looked down.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: From one mother to another

choices: "... it's fine I guess..."
"... As much as they deserved it, I don't approve your methods."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Lopunny shook her head.

"Maybe another time Celebi... I need to head to a few places with my children..." she giggled cheerfully. Even if for two days, she felt like Azurill was fully part of the family now..

The pink Celebi nodded her head.

It was better in a sense. If Lopunny didn't want Buneary to know what really happened... or was about to happen, she couldn't have her around. She'd talk to Azurill some other time. But now, she definitely needed to talk to her daughter and Zorua.

Celebi had shrunken Wigglytuff and his partner instead of letting them face justice...

Speaking of the younger time-traveler and her boyfriend, they were coming back, along with Buneary and Azurill. Celebi was holding a bag, but she and Zorua wore confused looks on their faces.

Lopunny got up.
"Come on sweetie... we need to go buy some sweets~" Buneary cheered, and Azurill too... before he remembered he was supposed to be a doll. Celebi's mom smirked.

"Hi there Azurill dear." she said, unsurprised.

"H-Hi miss..." the blue mouse timidly said, before shooting Lopunny a questioning look, which she answered to with a smile.
"That's alright Azurill... Celebi knows. Say goodbye kids..." she said, grabbing Buneary by her paw.

"Bye you all~" the younger bunny chimed, Azurill freeing his tail from her grasp and waving it.
"Bye... see you around Zorua." he said.

"Anytime kid." the dark-type snickered as the trio started to walk away.

Celebi's mom watched them leave, before her smile fell as she looked at her daughter and her boyfriend... discovering that Celebi was busily pecking him, a very happy Zorua nuzzling her face in response.

"Ahem..."

Celebi perked up in mid-kiss to look at her mother - she was frowning again.

"... Come on mom, this isn't weird stuff..." she meekly said, Zorua blushing. Celebi's mom internally smirked.

"No honey, in fact it isn't..." she said, eliciting a sighed of relief from her daughter and Zorua. The pink fairy looked around, before sighing.
"You two... let's head to the park. We need to discuss something." she said, starting to flutter off, emulated by Celebi.

"... About?" Zorua questioned.

The pink Celebi smiled. She decided against a classical ‘not angry, just disappointed mom’. She had to put Zorua and Celebi at ease, that way they'd be more willing to talk.

"For now, only about what ice cream you like."

--

Celebi reluctantly grabbed the ice cream her mom was insistently offering to her, while Zorua gladly accepted his with his tail wagging.

Celebi smirked.

"Oh cutie~" Zorua briefly looked at her, discovering her smirking down at him wordlessly. He shrugged, and turned back to his ice cream... but it was reduced to the point he could hold it in one paw.

Zorua seethed.

"... When are ya gonna stop doin’ that to my giant food?" he asked, annoyed.

"You mean, like the hickory chips back home?" Celebi asked innocently, and Zorua looked horrified.

"You wouldn't dare."
"Try me~"

Celebi's mom let out something between an amused giggle and an exasperated sigh, resulting in a weird sound similar to a menacing growl to come out of her mouth, drawing the attention of the two young pokemon in front of her.

The pink fairy held her own ice cream as she sat in front of them on the bench in the park.

"So... about Wigglytuff..." she decided to rip the bandage off straightaway.

Celebi looked surprised, but her clever mind immediately pieced it together. Lopunny told her about him.

Zorua seemed to be on the same line of thinking.

The green fairy nonchalantly took a lick at her ice cream, feeling her cheeks flaring up. She liked it, but she wasn't a kid anymore. She looked at Zorua, he was licking his ice cream repeatedly, suggesting that he was letting her do all the talking.

Celebi sighed as she met her mother's gaze.

"... I don't think there's anything to say mom. Wigglytuff and his partner Weavile tried to kill Lopunny to adopt Buneary... but she told you that, no?" she asked.

The elder Celebi nodded solemnly.

"She also told me about the consequences of such actions..." she said. Celebi glanced at her mother.
"Mom... if you could do what I can... wouldn't you have done the same thing?" she asked back, and her mother looked taken aback.

Would she have done that...?

"... No Celi," she answered.
"And it's only because I have someone to teach right and wrong to." she admitted, her words falling hard on her daughter's heart.

"Lopunny also told me about something you did to Azurill..." the pink fairy continued. Celebi sighed.

But Zorua perked up.

"He attempted to blackmail us ma'am." he chimed in, the pink Celebi's gaze traveling down to him as she adopted an expression of curiosity. Zorua nodded. Though the situation was serious, Celebi's mom couldn't help but smile - he had ice cream all over his face.

"Yeah ma'am... he wanted to tell about my current size... pokemon would have hunted me and Celebi down..." he revealed, Celebi nodding each word that came out of his mouth.

Her mother sighed.

"That's not a reason to deprive him of freedom... you could've told me for example. I would have given the kid an earful... I would've taught him to respect my daughter..." she said, before smiling at Zorua.
"And her interest."

Celebi blushed, but remained serious. Her mom looked down at her half-molten ice cream, looking deep in thought.

Celebi felt what every other daughter feels while witnessing her mother looking like that.

"Mom... are you angry? About Wigglytuff... Weavile... Azurill...?" she meekly asked, causing her mom to look up.
"I mean, it ended good for Azurill... bad for Weavile and Wigglytuff, but they might be still alive... I doubt it, but they deserved it, no?" she asked.

"Every single bit of it." Zorua agreed.

Celebi's mom sighed.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Confronting Celebi and Zorua

choices: "Wigglytuff and Weavile...i'd like to try and find them."
"Let's go see some more shops."
"Come on kids, let's go home."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
The older Celebi was about to speak when Zorua spoke up again.

"It's worth noting that Azurill as he is now...he's like that of his own choice. Lopunny and I made the offer." He wanted to get that out before she rendered judgement.

"It's fine I suppose...it ended well for the child and Wigglytuff and Weavile...would've probably met a grim end either way with the law." She relented. She sighed as she licked at her own ice cream.

"That said...never again Celebi." She was putting an end to this now.

"Just because you can do something like this...doesn't mean it should be your solution to problems that you need to meet. I don't want you shrinking pokemon down against their will anymore. Azurill...Zorua...I get it. In some circumstances it works to their favor but...you'll meet more pokemon you don't like, or that you disagree with and you shouldn't rely on a might makes right mentality. If I wanted to do that I could, same as you but...it isn't the proper way to go about living. It isn't what's fair to everyone." She lectured.

'She is a far cry from my old man...' Zorua thought to himself.

"I understand mom..." Celebi said as she looked at her ice cream and licked at it.

"For what's it's worth Celebi...thank you for saving Lopunny's life." Her mom gave her a small smile and Celebi smiled back.

"I do still want to hear Azurill's side of things too but...that'll wait for another day I suppose." The group sat eating their ice cream for a bit before Celebi's mom spoke again.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Accepting what's been done.

choices: Celebi or her mother sensed Wigglytuff and Weavile!
Zorua eventually discovered the two, dead...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Celebi's mom went quiet for a while and didn't speak while a somewhat embarrassed Celebi, an annoyed Zorua and an uncertain herself licked off their cones.

Only when the cones were polished off for good, the pink Celebi looked up, her green eyes staring straight at her daughter and her daughter's boyfriend.

"I've been thinking, you two," she said, obtaining the attention of the green fairy and of the tiny Zorua.

"Hm?"
"Hm?"

"You mentioned that you didn't kill those two, right?" Celebi's mom recalled.

"Yeah, shrinking them to nothing was way more than they deserved." Zorua commented nonchalantly, earning a stern gaze from the elder time-traveler.

"... There's a good possibility they're dead by now." Celebi chimed in.

"You're right, that's a possibility, like it's a possibility they might be still alive. And I... want to try and find them." the pink Celebi declared solemnly, causing her daughter's eyes to widen and Zorua to take a few steps back.

"What...?"

"Mom, those two were a threat to society! They-"

"I know," Celebi's mom calmly interrupted,
"And that's why, if they're still alive, they're going straight to jail."

The couple put up a feeble resistance.

"But mom..."
"Miss..."

A mere glance at the pink Celebi's face, at her solemn expression, at her folded arms told the two that there was no discussing.

And since she could easily throw Zorua out...

The dark-type found the world around him shrinking as he appeared at his full height in between Celebi and her mother.

He blinked, perplexed; Celebi's mom did too.

Celebi sighed.

"He'll be more useful like this," she proceeded to explain,
"Plus, if they're alive, they're not laying a finger on Zorua."

The fox blushed, but accepted what his overprotective girlfriend decided.

After all, he DID want to be big for today, he thought to himself.

Celebi's mom nodded.

"Lead the way, Zorua. I believe you know the forest more than we do."

--

"Sure they should be here?" Celebi's mom asked as she hovered in front of her daughter but behind the dark-type who was leading the two fairies.

"I'm sure... Lopunny hit Wigglytuff right here," Zorua recalled as he stood in the middle of the clearing where Wigglytuff and Weavile were doomed,
"... Then, he crashed into that tree over there," be pointed to a particularly large tree,
"And Celebi shrunk him and his partner."

"They couldn't have gotten too far..." Celebi mused.
"That's right... let's split up. We'll find them more easily... though I still don't get why we have to find those two murderous ba-"

"I mentioned that already Zorua, we have laws, and what you did, Celebi, wasn't an option." the elder time-traveler interrupted firmly.
"Now, if they're dead, whatever; but if they're alive, we'll have to save them... and then turn them in. Sometimes, prison can be worse than death, Zorua."

The dark-type snickered as the trio began searching around: the two time-traveling fairies tried to sense the two minuscule pokemon, while Zorua wandered around, nose glued to the ground as he scanned the grassy floor while trying to hold his breath.

The thought of those two being inhaled disgusted him... even though the idea of the weird places where they could end up was quite intriguing.

"Found anything?" Celebi called at some point, fluttering around while trying to focus - it was a hard task to sense a living being that small: even Zorua, back when a cookie crumb was a mountain to him, would have been a skyscraper to them.

Celebi's mom kept scanning the ground too while she tried to sense the nanoscopic pink rabbit.

"Come on, kids, they must be around here, keep searching." she encouraged as she shifted her location, focusing her psychic powers again to try and locate the two minuscule pokemon.

Eventually...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Searching in the woods

choices: Wigglytuff and Weavile cooperate
Wigglytuff and Weavile try to attack!
Wigglytuff and Weavile are scheming something down the line.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Celebi's mother opened her eyes slowly as she looked to the two teens.

"I sense them...it's weak, but there." She said slowly, and she pointed to a nearby patch of grass, not far at all from the tree.

-

Wigglytuff and Weavile were cowering, they knew the giants were there...Celebi and Zorua they recognized sure enough, and Wigglytuff was sure that the other power that was there was Celebi's mother.

"This is all your fault!" Weavile said for what must've been the 50th time.

Wigglytuff whimpered in response to this, he knew if Weavile wanted him dead she could do it at any point, and in fact had threatened to do so multiple times. The only reason Wigglytuff was still around was that he'd managed to scrounge up bits of edible stuff better than her...even then, they hadn't been living well. Both had lost weight, were firmly dehydrated, and in general dirty and in rough shape.

The world rumbled and the sky shook as a giant iris took their vision.

Celebi's mother was gazing down at them as if a goddess.

"THESE TWO SPECKS? I SENSE IT'S THEM!" The rumble shook the two pokemon to their very cores as more titans came by.

Celebi and Zorua looked down to see them and soon a sensation took both Wigglytuff and Weavile...they were growing, the world around them shrinking away as soon the titans were giants to them...and eventually...normal sized.

Wigglytuff and Weavile had been restored, but the second they were a powerful force bore down on them as the elder Celebi pinned them with psychic.

"You both have a lot to pay for...but this isn't the right way to go about paying back society." She said sternly, Wigglytuff met her harsh gaze...then looked to the two teens that had sentenced them to this harsh fate.

"Y-you monsters..." He croaked out, the force bore down harder.

"That's rich coming from you, you demented bunny..." Zorua said, Celebi glared.

"This is better than you deserve." She spat out.

"What now then?" Weavile asked simply, she was willing to take this blessing at this point, no matter where it led.

"We will be taking you to the authorities, you will confess your crimes and you will not say a word about the shrinking. You will spend the rest of your lives in prison, but your family may visit you Wigglytuff and you will both live, at the very least fed and repaying society. If you don't agree to this...it won't be so hard to send you back to where you were a mere moment ago." It was a harsh deal, but comparative to what the two had gone through, it was definitely an improvement.

"Damn it all!" Wigglytuff cried out and Zorua huffed.

"If it were up to me you wouldn't even be getting this...you two ought to be grateful...killing all those pokemon." He glared.

Wigglytuff and Weavile were on the spot right now.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Two monsters located

choices: Wigglytuff fled!
Celebi managed to shrink Wigglytuff!
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Wigglytuff and Weavile didn't initially reply to Zorua's provocation.

Instead, the glaring Wigglytuff seemed to be staring at his partner for consultation, but she seemed to be avoiding his gaze, too focused on something pinned against her side.

Something sharp and shining sinisterly.

Usually, Psychic didn't work too well on dark-types; and, while it had an effect on the inexperienced Zorua, the trio quickly took notice that the more experienced Weavile was able to move her arm.

"What the-" Zorua didn't get to finish; the cyan aura surrounding Weavile faded all of a sudden, taking aback the two fairies and the fox.

"Wh-"

Faster than a speeding bullet, with the agility her species was known for, Weavile sprinted towards the pink Celebi who, immobilized by surprise, couldn't do anything as the taller dark-type grabbed her head with a claw an leaped up, her knee colliding with the legendary's face.

"MOM!" Celebi cried in alert while her mom hit the ground with a horrible thud, unconscious.

Zorua stared daggers at Weavile, his teeth gritted, while Celebi rushed to her fainted mother and knelt beside her.

"And so now it's just the three of us..." Weavile noted with a maniacal grin, her claws hovering in mid-air as she regarded the angry-looking Zorua.

"Four." Wigglytuff corrected as he landed on the ground, the Psychic holding him gone along with the consciousness of Celebi's mom.
"And I believe you two have a lot to pay for."

Reluctantly, Celebi left her mom and stood up, a death glare in her eyes.

"You..." she hissed furiously, her expression matching Zorua's; on the other hand, the two murderous pokemon were smirking, seemingly having forgotten a near week of sufferings.

Only one feeling kept the two from collapsing now: revenge.

"You're right," Weavile snickered as she regarded her opponents.

Nothing more was said.

The ice-type suddenly leaped forward, claws extended in direction of Zorua, who hastily jumped back; Weavile's claws connected with the ground, a few sparks forming around them.

Before Zorua or Celebi could react, an orange sphere was flung at Celebi; the fairy flew to the side, the Focus Blast hitting a tree and exploding.

Hastily, Celebi turned around to send two green spheres in direction of Weavile and Wigglytuff; the first, who was towering above Zorua, was hit and was sent flying back; the second managed to dodge the Energy Ball and opened his mouth wide.

Then, a scream erupted from Wigglytuff's oral cavity as he performed Hyper Voice, causing Zorua to collapse to the ground while holding his ears and Celebi to hold her head in pain.

Then, Zorua felt a searing pain spreading through his body and urgently realized that Weavile had slashed his flank, which was now bleeding.

Weavile snickered, before her claws came down on the fox again; this time, Zorua (grunting because of the burning pain in his side) dodged and jumped up, his fangs sinking into the arm of the taller dark-type.

"AAARGH!" she screamed in pain as blood started to roll down her arm.

The dark-type weasel was then hit by a powerful Psychic, which made her stumble back.

Celebi flew beside her boyfriend with a worried expression,
"Are you okay?" she said breathlessly as she eyed the slash on Zorua's flank.

"Don't worry. Let's take care of these two." he boldly stated, glaring at the two bigger pokemon

Wigglytuff laughed.

"That's adorable, kiddo!" he mocked as he started walking towards the couple.

But Wigglytuff soon understood the mistake of underestimating a younger pokemon when a seething Zorua ran up to him and turned around, driving both his hind legs into Wigglytuff's groin, causing the pink menace to bend, the air knocked out of his lungs.

Zorua smirked as he backed up, but soon ran into Celebi.

Wigglytuff got up and glanced at his partner, before him and Weavile charged the couple from both sides: Weavile's claws rose above Celebi; Wigglytuff fist clenched and was aimed at Zorua.

However, the green fairy grabbed Weavile's arms before her claws could hit her and kicked her in the stomach, while Zorua dodged Wigglytuff's punch and slammed his paws on the ground, a wave of darkness knocking back the overgrown rabbit.

Seeing the bent Weavile on her knees, Celebi decided to aid Zorua.

The couple turned to Wigglytuff, who was assaulted by both pokemon; Zorua miraculously managed to tackle him to the ground and both fell to the ground.

"Nighty night, worm." Zorua said from his stomach while Celebi glowed green behind him.

However...

"Enough!"

Celebi glanced backwards, and a horrified gasped escaped her: Weavile was right beside her unconscious mom, holding her head up while pointing a claw to her neck, smirking.

The dark-type looked at the expression of terror on Celebi's face.

"Now you and your friend - huh?" she looked at Zorua, but the fox wasn't there anymore.

Instead, Weavile suddenly discovered something heavy hitting her in the stomach and tackling her to the ground. An invisible presence was holding her down.

It didn't take long for the ice-type to realize that Zorua had cloaked himself in an illusion.

"Celi!"

Startled, Weavile slashed the invisible body on hers; with a grunt of pain, Zorua appeared: there was a new scratch on his leg.

But, before Weavile could get rid of the fox, she was pinned down by Psychic, coming from the green Celebi.

Then, around her, the world started growing, until she was the size of a bug. A bug that had Zorua's now humongous paw all over her body.

"Not again!" she squeaked, drops of blood falling from Zorua's paw and hitting her; it was like being in the middle of a bloody rain.

Zorua snickered, while Celebi turned around to face Wigglytuff, who had gotten back on his feet.

The rabbit pondered his next move as Celebi moved towards him menacingly, that dreaded glow in her eyes as well as a murderous glare.

"This is the end." she stated.

Too bad that Wigglytuff had no intention to surrender; but he couldn't keep fighting, he was far too weak now.

There was only one option left... too bad for Weavile.

Without even replying, the pink rabbit spun around and sprinted away from the couple, leaving Weavile under Zorua's paw.

"Hey!" she screamed in utter terror and rage, before Zorua's paw quieted her.

Celebi was furious,

"Oh no you don't!" she shouted as she gave chase.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Wigglytuff and Weavile try to attack!

choices: “We’ll leave them as we found them, tinier than before.”
“They can’t be allowed to live, not after this.”
“We’ll take them with us, discuss things with my mom.”
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Wigglytuff ran as hard as his tired and battered body would allow him, wanting nothing more than to escape the fate he’d certainly suffer if Celebi got ahold of him with that damned ability of hers!

Teeth gritted he dug deep inside himself for any ounce of energy he could, adrenaline and fear being the only things keeping him up and running.

It wasn’t enough however, as the wind was knocked out of him at the same time he heard a scream of rage...Celebi had tackled him to the ground from the back, and she was now pinning him to the ground, a sight that may have been comical in lighter circumstances considering how much smaller Celebi was to Wigglytuff.

“It.is.over!” Celebi said through gritted teeth as Wigglytuff groaned, noting the weight on his back getting heavier...and heavier. He knew what was happening as he blearily looked at his surroundings grow around him.

“S-stop it...please!” He pleaded uselessly. A paw larger than his face smacked him hard, and his senses filled as he fell unconscious. Celebi glared as he kept shrinking, down to bug size. She hovered a paw over his body menacingly...before it shook with hesitation and she sighed, lowering it. She picked up the tiny body and got up, going back to her battered boyfriend and unconscious mother.

When she got back she saw that Zorua had already hoisted her mother onto his back...and his mouth was shut, him wincing every few seconds...when he saw Celebi he quickly spat out some blood...and Weavile.

“She was cutting me up pretty bad in there...that was a bad idea.” He said as he looked to Celebi, she looked down to her paw then glared at the tiny blood soaked Weavile, Celebi picked her up with psychic and let her float for the moment.

“Zorua, I need to heal you up.” Celebi said in a worried tone as she approached him, but he shook his head.

“Nah, I’m fine Celi, scratches and scrapes...I know the healing you do wears you out, save it for your mom.” Zorua said, flashing a grin before wincing again.

Celebi shook her head before flashing Zorua a genuine smile.

“Thanks...” She said, wiping a few tears from her eyes with the paw that didn’t house the bug sized Zorua.

“Now...about them.” Zorua said darkly, glaring at the floating Weavile who gulped.

“J-jail...prison, I’ll go, please!” She pleaded but Zorua shook his head before sighing and looking to Celebi.

“You know my vote...but even now it may not be what your mom would want...Celi, what do you think we should do?”

Celebi bit her lip, but answered quick
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Celebi managed to shrink Wigglytuff!

choices: "You two are getting some rest right now, i'll deal with those two."
"We'll all deal with those two later...you need to rest."
"We'll end this right now."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"As much as I want to crush them to dust right now." Celebi said, fury in her voice, clenching her free paw into a fist. "I think...we should hold off and discuss it with my mom...you're right Zorua...she wouldn't want us deciding their fates like this, even now."

She glared at the tiny Weavile, who seemed to cower a bit in her presence. "You're going to pay dearly for what you've done, but that will come later." Celebi's hot breath washed over Weavile, and soon enough the unconscious Wigglytuff was floating beside her.

Celebi turned her attention to her bleeding boyfriend at this point, as he started to walk, a limp in his stride, Celebi bit her lip.

"Zorua, I can heal you, it really isn't any trouble..." She said and Zorua looked at her.

"Look, everytime i've seen you heal stuff it wears you down, and i'm sure you're exhausted from all of this too. Your mom could use the healing more than me, i'm durable, don't sweat it." Zorua said, though the wince in his stride was obvious.

Celebi sighed and Zorua felt a weight lift off of him as Celebi used psychic to carry her mom.

"Fine then tough guy, but you're not walking home." Celebi said, and soon enough a familiar feeling came over Zorua as his surroundings expanded. Soon enough Celebi was a towering giant to him once more, and she gently picked him up in her paws, stroking him a bit, getting droplets of blood on her paw in the process.

Zorua was flushing beat red at this point, and Celebi cupped her paw to her chest, letting him rest against it.

"I can carry us all, don't worry." She said and Zorua muttered something that she didn't catch, but ended it with a "thanks."

She smiled at him before glaring at Weavile again. "My mom and my boyfriend, you did this to them. I won't forget that." She said as she floated the three pokemon behind her and carried the tiny Zorua to her house.

-

Weavile was looking at her unconscious partner, next to her in her prison, glaring. This was frustrating...when they had gotten to the giant Celebi's house, she dumped the two of them in a jar and stuck them in a dimly lit closet...this was all that she had to go on right now, she was sure that the three pokemon in the other room weren't going to let them off easily...that prison offer was probably dead too.

She looked at her claws, then to Wigglytuff...considering some options before her.

In the bathroom however, Celebi was trying to put those two out of mind as she got some bandages and some disinfectant alcohol.

"This is gonna sting...a lot." Celebi said to the tiny Zorua on her counter and Zorua nodded...she took a swab and dabbed it into the alcohol, before she started applying it to Zorua's side.

"Holy hell!" Zorua yelled out, making Celebi wince and pull back slightly, but she started applying it again soon after.

"Sorry Zorua, but we want to get you healed up...in a practical way, as you insist." Celebi said softly and Zorua bit his lip, trying not to cry out.

"I'm gonna wrap this up as well as I can, then i'm doing your leg..." Celebi said, trying to reassure Zorua. He was not looking forward to that...

"So what are we gonna do now?" Zorua said as Celebi wrapped him with her giant paws.

"Well when i'm done with you i'm gonna tend to mom as well as I can...I think she's fine but...when she's awake I gotta make sure she gets healed up entirely, her healing ability isn't as strong as mine..." Celebi said and Zorua chuckled.

"Guess you got some kinda supercharged genes or something."

Celebi smiled at this and gently patted Zorua's head.

"Something like that I guess."

She then got more of the alcohol and went to rub Zorua's leg.

Zorua bit his lip again as Celebi tried to be gentle.

"Once she's healed we'll discuss...the two in the other room...and how to go about dealing with them as safely to us as possible...even if it means a harsh fate for them." Celebi said coldly.

Zorua nodded. "They fully deserve whatever comes to them...with how many pokemon they've killed...what they tried to do to us...Lopunny...Azurill...your mom." Zorua said.

"And you Zorua..." Celebi said, gently wrapping his leg up as well as she could. Zorua blushed and looked away.

"I'm fine." He said, Celebi smiled.

"Tough guy." She said, as she finished wrapping it, she lifted him up and brought him to her lips, kissing his face. He enjoyed her kisses at this size, her lips feeling like soft pillows.

She pulled away, smiling and he was smiling too.

"Alright then...let's go see how your mom is then."

The two went to the room of Celebi's mother, where she was laying on her bed, still sleeping. Celebi sat in the chair next to her with Zorua in her lap.

"...She'll be fine." Zorua said, but Celebi didn't even seem to register him.

They sat like that for what must've been hours before she started to stir. Celebi bolted up, careful to keep Zorua from tumbling to the floor as she set him on the bed and went to her mom.

Zorua watched the stirring giantess from the end of the bed as she got up, rubbing her head.

"What...what happened...?" She said, somewhat slurring as Celebi hugged her mom.

"Mom! I'm so glad you're okay!" Celebi said and the older Celebi hugged her back as memories came back to her. Weavile attacked her then...

"Celebi, what happened?" She said, much more coherently as she took note of the tiny dark type on her bed...wrapped in bandages.

"Let me explain mom..." Celebi said as she pulled away from the hug, and went over the events of the last few hours, the older Celebi closing her eyes as she processed the information.

"I see...you did the right thing, ultimately." Celebi's mother said as she opened her eyes, she went to get up, but winced and reached towards where Weavile struck her.

"Mom, don't worry." Celebi said as an aura filled the room, a glow coming over Celebi's mother who seemed to grunt for a moment, then sigh in relief.

Celebi herself seemed tired after this.

"Sweetie, you didn't have to..."

"She wanted to ma'am, even if she didn't want to say it out loud." Zorua said, his voice firm, despite his reduced frame.

Celebi's mom nodded as Celebi fell back in her chair, taking a long breath.

"So what should we do now? About the two pokemon in the jar I mean..." Zorua asked as the older Celebi looked at him.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Rest and recoup

choices: "I made dinner, just checking to see if you're ready."
"Just checking up on you two...it's been almost a day."
"Those two have escaped!"
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"Those two can wait right where they're at...right now, i'm more focused on you two kids...you both need to get some rest." The older Celebi said firmly.

Zorua went to open his mouth before his eyes drifted to his girlfriend who looked about ready to fall asleep with a sigh Zorua looked to the older time traveler.

"Fair enough...I guess i'm pretty tired."

The older Celebi smiled and with a simple motion with her finger both Celebi and Zorua were lifted into the air. "Okay kids, let me take you to your room." She said.

"Mom, you don't need to carry me..." Celebi said drowsily but she just got a smile from her mother.

"Dear, I insist." She said, and gently she moved the two pokemon with psychic, towards Celebi's room. With another flick the blankets on Celebi's bed were lifted back and Celebi was put into them, Zorua put down right beside her, ready to nestle into her stomach.

"Get some rest...we'll deal with everything else after." The gentle voice left as the lights flicked off.

"...I've never seen you do anything so dexterous with your psychic." Zorua said, kind of impressed by what just happened, with the older Celebi expending almost no effort.

"She's uh...way more powerful with that stuff than I am." Celebi said, still sounding sleepy. "I can shrink and grow things now, and my healing is really good, but my mom is...a true monster with her psychic, if Weavile hadn't knocked her out in that one blow that fight would've been over in a moment." Celebi finished.

Zorua whistled a bit, but scooted himself closer to his girlfriend, wincing with his paw.

A paw very gently wrapped to him, doing her best not to hurt Zorua where his bandages were.

"Things'll be alright, we'll get rested up and then..." Celebi went quiet. She didn't know what they'd do to those two...surely her mom wouldn't go as easy on them now though...not at all.

Celebi looked down to see Zorua already sleeping peacefully against her, she smiled weakly before closing her eyes, letting the exhaustion take its tole and finally falling asleep.

-

"...ids....kids." Celebi groaned as her eyes came open and she saw her mom. Her mom noted this, and the next words helped Celebi regain cognition.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Put to bed

choices: "We'll need to keep an eye on them... we'll keep them."
"I don't want those two anywhere near us... let's just leave them on their own."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
The first things Celebi noted upon opening her eyes were the green ones of her mother.

"... Mom?" she called out, yawning.

"I made dinner, honey," Celebi's mom informed, before adopting a frown and sighing,
"Also, we need to discuss the fate of those two in the other room, if you feel ready."

"It's fine." Celebi replied, using a paw to remove the blankets from her slim form, noticing that she was still holding an asleep Zorua.

The green fairy looked up, a smile on her face.

Her mom took the hint and smiled back.

"I'll leave you a moment." she declared, fluttering out of the room. Celebi swore she heard a giggle before the door was closed.

With an even wider smile, Celebi turned to Zorua.

"Zorua~"

Celebi was surprised to hear an answer after just five seconds.

"Yeah yeah... I'm awake." the dark-type said from her arms,

"You, waking up on your own." it was hard to believe to Celebi.

Zorua snickered.

"Don't use that surprised voice every time you talk to me, sweetheart." he said.

"Can't help it. You never cease to amaze me." his girlfriend retorted with a grin, hugging more tightly.

"I'm full of surprises," Zorua self-praised,
"Also, grow me back. I think your mom is waiting for us... and I also think this discussion will need me full-sized."

--

With a bit of help from his girlfriend, the wounded Zorua was able to stumble to the kitchen table, where the pink time-traveler was waiting for the couple.

Celebi's mom shot a pitiful stare. It must have been a rough battle, she judged.

The couple sat at the table, eyeing the food hungrily.

"So..." Zorua started, pulling a plate of meat closer.
"Those two."

Celebi's mom bit her lip.
"Right. We need to deal with them somehow - no Zorua, we're not going to kill them." she said, noticing the murderous spark in Zorua's eyes.

Zorua's lips shook, but quickly stopped.

"Pardon me but... I can't believe you're saying this, ma'am. Not after what they've done to you. To Celebi." Zorua inhaled deeply and showed his bandaged flank.
"To me."

Celebi shot a look that screamed ‘Calm down’, but Zorua ignored her.

Celebi's mom quietly pulled back on her chair.

"I'm not saying they're going unpunished, Zorua," she spoke calmly, but the fox quickly interrupted.
"They're not going to jail, either, if that's what you mean." he said.

A moment full of tension followed.

"Zorua-"

"I know that kind of pokemon, miss, they're just going to break out and they'll start killing again! They won't hesitate to come searching for us again! And what will we do then, send them back to jail so that they can break out again?" Zorua screamed.

Celebi's mom glared.

"Watch your tone, young man." she said with cold anger.

Beside Zorua, Celebi swallowed.

"He does have a point, though," she stated.
"We can't take risks, mom... do you know why we are still able to talk?" she asked calmly.

Her mom looked at her, her anger dropping to some less dangerous level.

"... What is this supposed to mean?" she demanded.

"Didn't you ask yourself why Zorua is covered in bandages?" Celebi said, smiling at her boyfriend.

This was going to solve the tension.

"He saved you mom." the eyes of the pink Celebi shot open. Zorua looked to the side.

"Weavile was about to cut your neck, but Zorua stopped her... and she gave him this..." Celebi psychically lifted the wounded paw of the fox onto the table.

The elder time-traveler stared wordlessly, her rage evaporating like water under the sun of a hot day.

"I-I..." she stuttered after a while of silence.
"I didn't know Zorua... I'm sorry..."

Zorua finally decided to look back at the pink Celebi, but found himself being physically assaulted by said pokemon, because she suddenly leaned forward and enveloped the slightly bigger fox in a hug, causing his cheeks to flare up.

"I... uh... nothing..." he said, shooting his girlfriend an embarrassed stare, being answered with a smile.

After a few awkward moments, Celebi's mom finally pulled back.

"Thank you, Zorua. You have my gratitude." she said. If possible, Zorua's cheeks became even redder.
"... And a permanent place here with us, if you wish," Celebi's mom continued, smiling gratefully.

Her daughter giggled.

"See mom? He truly changed, if you still if you still have any doubts left." the green time-traveler chimed.

Her pink mother nodded, before her smile fell back into a serious expression.

"Now... if what you're saying is true... You both are right. Those two are two dangerous to let go, even to prison." she declared, before looking at the dark-type sitting in front of her intently.
"That doesn't mean, though, we are going to get rid of them. Murder is never a solution."

Zorua muttered something under his breath.

"So? Do they remain tiny? Then what? Are we going to keep them like, y'know, pets?" Celebi asked.

The gaze of the elder time-traveler went to her, and lingered on her for a moment, before the older Celebi answered.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Dinner Discussing

choices: "I think you and I need to have a talk with Celi about this in the morning."
"So you're concerned that you're going to always have no power, then."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"Come on kids, let's go home. It's getting a bit late," the elder time traveler said to the two lovebirds, the trio getting up from the park benches. The sun was setting, meaning it was time for certain size-distanced couples to begin making their way home.

"...'kids'?" Zorua questioned.

"Sounds like mom has taken a bit of a shine to you, Zorua~," Celebi said, her face radiating happiness. Zorua let out an approving "hm" before polishing off his ice cream. The pair of Celebis returned to their own cones as well, continuing their stroll home with only the pleasant sounds of nature around them.

--

"I'm surprised you managed to stop complaining about the doll clothes, Zorua," Celebi sarcastically remarked. The couple had retreated into Celebi's bedroom for the night, as per usual.

"Oh, believe you me, I'm still complaining. Just not out loud," he replied, having left the bow and hat on the pillow for her to put away.

"That sounds about right," Celebi jokingly said, telekinetically lifting the diminutive Zorua into her hands. Placing the doll clothes on her desk for the night, she flipped the lights, casting a shroud of darkness on the bedroom once more.

"Goodnight, cutie~," Celebi said, pulling the blankets over herself and her boyfriend.

"Goodnight, Celi."

--

It had been about 20 minutes since the lights had gone off. Celebi was fast asleep, but Zorua was deep in thought. So deep, in fact, that he barely registered Celi's bedroom door creaking open. Her mom was just coming in to check up on the happy couple, and perhaps get a laugh out of her wanting to play with dolls again. Once more, she fluttered over to the bed and lifted the blanket psychically, but instead of seeing the couple asleep, she noticed a very awake Zorua being held against her daughter's stomach. Putting a paw to her mouth to signal him to keep quiet, she lifted her daughter's paws, gently pried Zorua out of her embrace and left with the tiny fox.

Taking him over to the living room, Celebi's mom sat down in a chair and put him on the armrest. A brief silence ensued as the two looked at each other in the dark room. Zorua was the one who breached the quiet.

"So, uh... is there a reason I'm out here right now?"

"I was checking on you two to see if you were doing anything weird... but I sensed you were still awake, and wanted to know why."

"I'm just... thinking."

"Thinking about what?"

"Me and Celi." The elder wasn't expecting to hear this.

"Don't tell me you're getting cold paws, Zorua!" she exclaimed, believing the worst.

"N-no, it's not that! I do still love her... but I'm a bit concerned about the relationship itself."

"What about it?"

"Well... it's about my power in it. Now, I know this sounds like something petty, but you're the one who wanted to know what I was thinking about." Zorua had piqued the pink Celebi's interest.

"No, no, go on."

"Well, lately... I just feel like I don't have any say in this relationship. Like, no agency. What Celebi says, goes, no matter what. Since I'm so small, she can basically force me to do anything, and since she's the only one who can change the size of people, I can't change that fact."

"Oh..." The older Celebi leaned in closer to Zorua, wanting to hear the rest of his thoughts.

"Like, up until now, she's only used that for extremely..." he thought about the doll clothes again, "...minor, but annoying things, like forcing me to wear doll clothes, waking me up extremely early, or interrupting my eating. But earlier today, we were talking about me possibly being my regular size while I was hanging out with you guys, but since she's in control of who changes size, and she prefers me like this for... some reason... I basically had no say in the matter. Which is kinda concerning, considering it's my life and my size, not Celi's. So now I'm thinking, 'what if she does this with something more serious? What if she forces something that's actually significant upon me and I'm powerless to stop it?'" Having said his part, Zorua stopped to let the girl before him gather her response.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Budding Concerns (which will be nipped in the bud)

choices: "Okay... thanks miss..." Zorua accepted
"Don't worry, I'll handle it... I think... but thanks anyway," Zorua refused
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
The pink Celebi stared at Zorua in silence for a minute after he had revealed his feelings.

She didn't believe that her daughter wasn't going to consider Zorua's feelings, she knew her. Celebi was far too sweet, and Zorua was the only boyfriend - that she had approved - her daughter ever had.

Yet, Zorua felt powerless in their relationship and she had to admit that she saw his point: Celebi could literally do whatever she wanted to him.

Sure, shrunken food or doll clothes seemed dumb things to complain about, yet...

She smiled. Well, maybe she could lend a hand after all... she doubted Celebi wasn't going to listen to Zorua, but in the improbable eventuality that she did not, she was going to listen to her mother for sure.

"Hm..." the pink Celebi finally spoke, staring at the small fox on the armrest of her chair.

"Well Zorua, looks like you and I need to have a talk with Celebi in the morning," she declared, expecting the fox to smile in approval.

But, against her predictions, Zorua looked up, staring at the pink giantess blankly.

"Wh-What?" he stuttered,
"No, I need to talk to Celi, this is between me and her miss..." he told.

The mother of his girlfriend smiled.

"There's another reason." she said,
"Am I wrong?"

Zorua blushed.
"How'd you-"

"Zorua, I raised a child, I know when there's something else that someone doesn't want to reveal," Celebi's mother revealed with a hint of a smirk on her face,
"So, what is troubling you? Let me know, I'll see what I can do to help... and any secret you may have is safe with me,"

Zorua sighed.

"Okay then..." he mumbled, meekly looking to the side.
"Miss I-I... I fear that... if you step in this, it might bring some... unwanted consequences in my relationship with Celebi... I know, it sounds stupid, but it's how I feel... I can't change it..." Zorua admitted.

The pink fairy blinked, before smiling a bit.

One of her paws moved, one of her fingers traveled to Zorua on his perch as she started patting his head gently.

"I understand, Zorua, but let me tell you something," she said.

Despite the large finger tapping his skull, Zorua managed to look up to see the elder time-traveler smiling reassuringly,

"Listen, I know how you kids are: you always want to fight on your own. I too wanted to fight my own battles at your age. But since you're - forgive my lack of delicacy - powerless to stop Celebi, I'm the one that can help you," she said softly.

Zorua looked down.

Celebi's mom spoke again, her tone became sweeter,

"You don't have to fight on your own Zorua, me and you can talk to my daughter in the morning and solve this thing once and for all,"

Zorua remained silent for a moment, before he unexpectedly started snickering.

He looked up, grinning,

"... Would you have made the same offer before, miss?" he asked. Celebi's mom smirked.

"Admittedly, no. But you've changed a lot Zorua. And, knowing you better, it turned out that you have a good heart despite what you always tried to show. You're not who you claimed to be all these years in the village," she said sweetly.

Zorua smiled, grateful.

"What do you say Zorua? Will you let me help you? Consider it a reward for making my daughter happy," the pink fairy continued.

Zorua sighed,
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Motherly help

choices: "Zorua, you could've told me on your own, I understand. I'm sorry."
"I understand mom. I'll try to be more careful about your feelings Zorua."
"But mom, I can't help it, he's just so cute when he's pouty."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"Okay...thank you ma'am." Zorua said. He didn't know how to feel about having his girlfriend's mom help him talk about his feelings of powerlessness TO his girlfriend, but Celebi's mom did have a point.

He was outmatched in pretty much every regard on his own, and on the off chance Celebi DID decide to brush his concerns off, he couldn't really do anything to stop her. He didn't want to be away from Celi, but he didn't like being pushed around either, even if Celebi didn't mean anything by it or even realize she was doing it.

The elder time traveler patted his head again, something that still felt kinda odd, but it was reassuring. "Don't worry, my daughter didn't mean anything by it i'm sure, and in the morning we'll clear all of this up." She lifted Zorua up and carried him back to her daughter's room. She set the teen on the bed near her daughter and smiled.

"Goodnight Zorua, get some rest, okay?" She said gently as she departed to her own bed.

"...Hope this doesn't stir the pot, all i'm thinking..." He muttered to himself, with a sigh he approached his giantess girlfriend on the bed and laid down against her. Celebi's smile widened a bit in her sleep and her paws gently curled around him. Trapping him in a sheet of warmth and comfort. Zorua closed his eyes and went to sleep, at least somewhat relieved that come what may, they'd talk in the morning.

-

"Celi, Zorua...up and at 'em." The gentle voice made both teens groan as they slowly opened their eyes. Celebi sat up groggily and looked at her mom.

"Ma...? What time is it...?" She asked only to get a smile in return.

"5:30, i'm about to get ready for work...don't worry, you can go back to bed after this, we just need to talk, the three of us for a bit." She said and Celebi blinked in tired confusion.

But Zorua knew what was coming and mentally prepared himself. Celebi got out of bed and slowly fluttered out of her room, carrying her tiny boyfriend in her paws as they sat at the kitchen table.

There were two mugs of hot cocoa at the table.

"...mom?" Celebi seemed a bit more awake as she asked this only to get a smile in return. "Go ahead dear...have a drink. Let Zorua have some too." Her mom said as she sipped one of the cups. Celebi lowered Zorua to the mug and let him have a few sips, before she took a sip...they all looked at each other and Celebi's mom broke the silence.

"Zorua, why don't you start, okay?" She said gently, and Zorua looked up at his girlfriend's face from her paws, she looked confused.

"Celi...I...last night...maybe it's just me seeing something that isn't there, but your mom pulled me aside after you fell asleep and...i'll be honest, sometimes I feel really powerless around you...like you're dictating what I do."

Celebi blinked. "What...?" She said, confused by all of this.

Celebi's mom intervened.

"What he's talking about is the way that you're using your size and psychic powers willy nilly on or around him dear...it's what we talked about when you were a child on occasions...being very careful not to use your overwhelming powers to...well, overwhelm. It's a hard thing to do, and I admit i've stumbled in it when I was your age, but it can make the pokemon we care about uncomfortable, and it might've made Zorua uncomfortable...we just want to clear the air, right Zorua?"

Zorua gulped. "Right ma'am...it isn't that I entirely hate being this size...i've gotten used to it and to an extent enjoy the benefits of it...but you see fit to keep me like this when you want and...you shrink the food I eat, maybe to tease, maybe out of concern for me overeating, and you make me wear the doll clothes...I know this all seems petty, and I still love you...it just makes me a bit uncomfortable..." Zorua was also remembering that Celebi had almost killed him not too long ago...and doomed Wigglytuff and Weavile to a horrid fate, though much earned.

Celebi internalized all of this and finally responded.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Just a talk

choices: "I'm going to make it up to you today!" Celebi chimed
"Zorua, what do you say if we do what YOU want today?" Celebi suggested
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Zorua looked down, not finding the courage to look at his girlfriend in the eye. He could feel her gaze on him, it was a crushing weight, like a sleeping Snorlax had just rolled onto him.

"Zorua."

Celebi moved a paw towards him, her finger sliding in between his chin and neck and pushing his head up so that he was looking at her: Celebi was smiling sweetly.

"Zorua... my little, sweet, silly Zorua," she intoned.
"You could've told me on your own! I didn't mean to push you around or anything, but I understand. I'm so, so sorry."

Speechless, the dark-type found Celebi lowering herself. Then, his world became green, his eyesight completely occupied by the giant lips of his equally giant girlfriend.

The mother of said pokemon watched the two with a smile, the scene before her eyes just as sweet as the hot cocoa she was sipping.

"Finish it up you two," she said as Celebi broke the kiss, pointing to the cup of hot cocoa that the two lovebirds shared.
"Then, you can go back to bed."

Celebi nodded, Zorua grinned.

"Thanks miss... I appreciated your help," he said, while deciding that be didn't really appreciate being awoken at 5:30 AM... though he was going to keep that particular thing to himself.

Celebi's mom smiled and got up.

"I need to head to work now. Have a nice day you two, see you in the evening," she said, waving a paw as she fluttered to the front door.

"Thank you mom, you too." Celebi replied as the door closed, her mom gone.

The fairy looked down, her eyes meeting with the adorable sight of Zorua sipping the hot cocoa from the cup.

"Enjoy it, Zorua. I admittedly put you through a lot, you deserve it," Celebi chirped happily.

Zorua briefly looked up to smile gratefully, before turning his attention back to the cup.

"... We still need to discuss a few things though..." he casually said at some point.

Celebi sighed: she saw this coming.

"Go ahead... before we go back to bed. This is no hour to be up..." she admitted, lazily rubbing her left eye.

"Shrunken food." Zorua started, his girlfriend smiled.
"That's not going to happen... not that often anyway~... then?"

"Doll clothes."

"Oh no, you're keeping those..." Celebi opposed, before looking at her boyfriend's face: he was glaring.
"... Okay, only the bow?"

Zorua sighed, figuring that this was all he was getting from her.

"Doll shops AND romantic movies! Seriously! I hate those Celi, I fell asleep the last time!" he complained.

"That's debatable~ it's fun to drag you to watch those... not as fun when Gardevoir and I drag Braixen to watch them though..." Celebi mused.

"Celi..."

"Okay, we won't go unless we both want it." the time-traveler reassured, concealing a smirk,
’That doesn't mean I can't 'convince' you...’

Zorua nodded, before yawning.

Celebi simply smiled. She got up, drank the rest of her hot cocoa and quickly washed the cups, before picking Zorua up.

The dark-type fox was hugged by the loving fairy as she hovered in mid-air, before fluttering to her bedroom.

She laid back in bed, wrapping the bedsheets around herself (and Zorua), smiling down at the fox.

"I'd say ‘good night’ if it wasn't morning already..." she giggled.

Zorua snickered.
"Oh, trust me, it's night for me."

Showing a surprising flexibility, his girlfriend leaned down, her head resting on her chest as she pecked Zorua... repeatedly. She greedily showered the face of the fox with quick kisses, before pulling back, leaving the fox blushing furiously but smiling brightly.

"See you later cutie, love you~" she chirped.

Zorua grinned, laying his head against the gigantic one of Celebi.

"Yeah... love you too Celi..." he responded.

Silence fell between the two and into the room, and the couple soon was asleep again.

--

Zorua started to stretch and gave a big yawn as he woke up from a wonderful, long sleep.

"Finally." someone chimed from above.

The fox opened his eyes, noticing that he was laying on the stomach of his girlfriend, her looking down at him with a book in her paws as she laid in bed.

The fox blinked.

"You let me sleep..." he mumbled in confusion. Celebi had never let him wake up on his own!

Celebi smiled.

"Of course silly!... But tomorrow I'm definitely waking you up... I mean..." she pointed to the clock on the wall.
