It was 12:30.

"Oh..."

"Yup. You made us lose the whole day again... oh, and Zorua, you should really keep your paws in place while you sleep, you kept scratching my chest!" Celebi said, causing Zorua to blush.

The fairy giggled as she shut her book.

"Come on cutie, let's go get something to eat and then we'll head out," she said, putting her book down and picking Zorua up.

"... Where do we go?" the fox asked as the fairy closed him in a hug and started walking.

Celebi looked down at him and smiled,
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Fixing a relationship

choices: Celebi and Zorua got home safely
Celebi and Zorua encountered one of their friends on the way home
Someone spotted the tiny Zorua and approached...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"Well Zorua, what do you say if today we do what YOU want to do?" Celebi asked sweetly.

Zorua looked up, an incredulous expression on his face.

"R-Really?" he asked.

His fairy girlfriend nodded. Zorua's mind started racing, she was letting him pick what they were going to do today!

His initial excitement slowed down as the fox adopted a more calm expression.

"Celi... there's no need to, really." he chimed,
"We can do what you want... just don't force me to do anything I don't like..."

The time-traveler smiled.

"There won't be anything you won't like Zorua, because you're going to pick what we're doing today." she stated, before pecking the fox on the cheek.

Zorua smiled again. Celebi left the house.

"So Zorua, where are we going first?" Celebi asked.

Zorua scratched his head.

"I dunno... I've only been in three places so far: movie theater, book store, doll shop." he mused.

"And knowing that you hate the last two..." Celebi said, hovering in mid-air and hugging her boyfriend closer.

"Movie it is... can I pick that as well?" Zorua asked. Celebi's smile shrunk: she already know what kind of movie would be picking.

The day before, Braixen had called her at some point and kept her on the phone for half an hour, gushing about a new movie: ‘The Forest of Death’.

Despite Braixen's complaining about Celebi not wanting to see it, there she was, carrying Zorua to see it on her own free will.

She sighed - at least, she'd have him to cuddle during gruesome scenes.

The fairy hovered to the movie theater... as expected, Zorua's eyes instantly fell on the poster showing the image of a Togepi staring at a humongous Victreebel, who had its mouth gaping open as it towered above the small pokemon.

Celebi gulped, Zorua wagged his tail.

"That one." he said.

"Lookee here..." Celebi turned around to see a smirking purple vixen staring at her.

"Hey Braix..." the fairy greeted.

"Hi Zorua," the fire-type saluted, Zorua grinning at her.

"I take it you both are here to see..." she made a bored face as she pointed to a poster that showed an Altaria and a Flygon, holding paws in the sky.

‘Draconic Love’ the poster read.

"And... no." Zorua said; Celebi stared at the poster longingly.

"I know what I said but... pretty please?" she begged, making puppy-dog eyes.

Which oddly didn't manage to get to Zorua's heart.

"Oh no, that dirty trick ain't gonna work... you already dragged me to see that Espeon and Umbreon the other day, and I fell asleep..." he recalled.

Braixen snickered.

"This is going to keep me - and you - very, very awake." Zorua spoke with a sinister grin.

Celebi thought that it was justified payback, given how he apparently felt about her.

"... Okay. Okay, I'll do it..." she said, swallowing.

"Awesome, let's buy the tickets!" Braixen chimed, grabbing Celebi's paw and literally dragging her to buy the tickets, before dragging her into the movie theater the same way.

--

Togepi walked around the forest, searching for the ball he had lost.

It was getting darker and darker, he wanted to go home, but he had to find his ball first, he couldn't head home without it, his mom was going to be upset if he did.

She would have been upset anyway, she always told him to stay out of the forest.

A few plants around him started shaking, causing him to jump in place, startled.

Shaking like the plants, Togepi watched as purple snake came out: an Arbok.

The snake hissed sinisterly, and was about to lunge forward to eat the tiny pokemon in a single bite... but suddenly, the ground started quaking.

The Arbok backed up, knowing what it was.

Startled much like Togepi, it started shivering.

Togepi followed its terrified gaze: a humongous Victreebel was approaching the two, it was almost as tall as the trees!

Before Arbok or Togepi could do anything, the Victreebel jumped forward, the leaf on its mouth moving out of the way as it snatched both terrified pokemon in its cavernous mouth and chewed before they could even scream.

A thin river of blood slid down his face as it swallowed...

--

"This is so cool!" Zorua screamed from Celebi's grip, which was growing tighter and tighter: the fairy was staring at screen, pale, furiously biting her lip to keep herself from screaming.

"Agreed dude! Whaddya say, Celi?" Braixen chimed.

Celebi seemed to slide down on her seat.

"Mommy..." she whispered, causing both foxes to snicker.

--

"Let's go get something to eat!" Zorua stated cheerfully as his girlfriend stumbled out of the movie theater, mumbling a quick ‘goodbye’ as Braixen walked away to leave the couple to themselves.

"I don't think I'll eat ever again..." Celebi muttered, still pale.

She was going to have nightmares tonight, she knew it.

"... Your mom makes us breakfast almost everyday now, I don't think she'd be too pleased..." Zorua stated.

"She wouldn't be pleased with me watching these movies either!" Celebi retorted.

Zorua snickered.

"Pick: hungry Victreebel or angry mom?"

"Are you kidding? Hungry Victreebel! I don't want to be erased from existence!" the fairy responded.

"You're her daughter..." her reduced boyfriend pointed out.

"Exactly. That's why she'd go easy on me..." Celebi mused.

Zorua snickered again, while briefly wondering what Celebi's mom was truly capable of.

Another motivation to not upset her.

--

"Please Zorua... I don't want to go..." Celebi said.

"Come on, there's nothing to be scared of!" Zorua reassured.

The sun was about to set down, but Zorua wanted to go to one final destination: his forest.

After the movie, Celebi was understandably scared, but Zorua didn't relent.

His whining girlfriend gave up: she had told Zorua he could pick what they could do, she had to keep her promise now... much to her regret.

Reluctantly, Celebi fluttered into her boyfriend's home and sat down on a log, placing Zorua on her lap.

"There. Now what? Can we leave this place soon, before I get a heart attack?" she asked, imagining that giant Victreebel coming out at any moment.

"Not yet Celi... y'know, few pokemon come here, the others are too scared..." the fox proudly stated, although the number of scared pokemon leaving his forest with tears in their eyes was reduced to zero.

"We're alone Celi..." Zorua continued, tail wagging.

Celebi blushed massively... so that's why Zorua wanted to come here.

The fairy forgot her fear and grinned.

"Oh, I get it..." was all she said, before Zorua found himself traveling upwards.

With no hesitation, his giant girlfriend started showering him with gentle kisses.

Zorua closed his eyes and grinned, feeling the smooth pair landing all over his body while he floated in front of Celebi, held by psychic.

At some point, Celebi smirked, and psychically lowered Zorua onto the log, before laying belly-down on it, pushing the fox down with her head as she kept smooching him.

"T-That tic-tickles..." Zorua laughed.

He dared to return some of the kisses he received, getting rewarded with less gentle but more loving pecks.

The whole thing went on for twenty-five good minutes, before Celebi finally pulled off, blushing furiously but smiling brightly.

"Well, that was some experience~" she chimed.

Zorua sprang back on his feet. He was blushing too, but unlike his girlfriend, he wore an almost wicked grin on his face.

"Oh, now you're happy we came here, aren't ya?" he rhetorically asked.

Celebi smirked as a paw traveled to Zorua, scooped him up and brought him to his bed, mode of transport and anything else he could conceive: her chest.

Celebi hugged him, before she got up.

"Come on cutie... let's go home now... if mom saw any of this..." Celebi shivered slightly at her own musings.

"Oh, she won't know about any of this as long as we do it here." Zorua snickered.

His girlfriend smiled in response as she fluttered out of the forest and headed back to the village.

One good way to end the day.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: A big day for a small fairy and a tiny fox

choices: The couple decided to spend the next day with their friends
Celebi opted for an indoor day, just her and Zorua
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
The couple headed back into the village as Celebi, apparently holding her ‘very realistic Zorua doll’, lazily fluttered back home, looking at a few shops as she went and shooting a tempted look at the doll shop, earning a displeased stare from her boyfriend that made her relent.

Eventually, the fairy made her way back home, finding that the lights inside were on.

"Mom is home." she said cheerfully as she opened the door and walked inside; as expected, the pink Celebi was sitting on the couch, reading a book whose title made Zorua yawn after one quick glance.

"Hey mom," Celebi broke the silence, making her mother rise her head and smile.

"Oh, hi sweetie," she greeted, abandoning her book on the couch to hover towards the couple.

"Hi Zorua," Zorua felt a pain on his right cheek as one of the paws of Celebi's mom pinched it affectionately. The fox rubbed his cheek with a paw, while his girlfriend started giggling.

The green gaze of the pink Celebi was occupied by both pokemon as she flew back, staring at the two with a smile,

"So? Have you two made peace?" she asked with a hint of expectancy in her voice.

"Yep~"

"... Why, were we fighting?" Zorua stated with a smile.

"Oh Zorua, you little-"

"No, seriously, it was just me complaining about something, that's all..." Zorua interrupted, earning a giggle and and peck from the green giantess.

Celebi's mom watched the scene with a smile.

All was fine between her daughter and her daughter's boyfriend.

"I'm going to start dinner you two," she said as Celebi pulled back from a blushing Zorua.

"Okay mom, we'll be in my room." the green fairy said.

Celebi turned around and walked to the familiar place that was her bedroom.
She closed the door behind herself and laid down in bed, setting Zorua on her chest. He was blushing.

"Seriously Celi, we weren't fighting..." he repeated, causing the green mountain he was laying on to giggle.

"I'll keep it in mind for when we have a real fight," she replied, smirking.

"... Do we have to?"

"No. But you're cute when you're angry. And pouty. And sad. And cute in general." she giggled, leaning forward to peck him.

Zorua flushed red.

Celebi pinned him down with a paw, while the other telekinetically drew a book from her desk.

Holding the book with a paw and hugging Zorua with the other, the fairy started reading in silence.

The fox, bored, decided to take a nap, and managed to sleep for fifteen minutes before a familiar voice rung in the room,

"Kids! Dinner!"

Celebi smiled, shut her book, shook her boyfriend awake - much to his annoyance - and headed to the kitchen.

--

"Honey, isn't it a bit early to go to sleep?"

The question took aback Celebi, who was about to leave the kitchen table upon finishing dinner.

"I wasn't," Celebi shrugged,
"I was thinking of playing chess with Zorua."

Her boyfriend shot a bored stare, one that was answered with a snicker,

"Hey, you beat me the other night, are you still complaining?"

"It's. Boring." Zorua replied.

Celebi's mom got up as well.

"I was thinking... why don't we do something all together? Like watching a movie?" she asked.

Again, Celebi was taken aback, but then smiled,

"Sounds good!"

Zorua looked at the pink giantess warily.

"What kind of movie?" he asked.

Celebi's mom smirked.

--

Celebi stared at the TV screen with sparkles in her eyes as she sat next to her mom, a bored Zorua sitting on her lap.

He huffed as he watched the TV as it flashed with the romantic movie.

Something told him that Celebi's mom thought that him watching it with the two of them would have made the experience more pleasurable.

She didn't have any clue about how wrong she was.

He pretended to watch in silence, but slowly, his consciousness was fading. His eyelids became heavy, and he yawned drowsily.

"Isn't it beautiful Zorua?" Celebi whispered as she looked down at her legs.

Zorua wasn't moving.

Celebi glanced at her mom, which was watching the movie intently, not paying Celebi or her boyfriend any mind.

So, carefully, Celebi lifted the small fox from her lap, bringing him up to her face to examine him up close: he was asleep.

Celebi smiled. Quietly, she grabbed his tail in two fingers and pulled,

"OW!" his eyes shot open as he stared daggers at Celebi.

"Y-You mo-"

"After all you made me do today, you deserved it." Celebi replied with a smirk.

Before Zorua could make any smart comeback, he was pushed forward, right into the chest of the fairy. Shortly after, her lips landed on his head.

"Good night Zorua..." she whispered as she leaned back against the couch.

The response of the dark-type never came as he closed his eyes once again, grumbled and relaxed, soon falling asleep again.

Without paying the movie anymore mind, Celebi watched her boyfriend.

She yawned - watching Zorua sleeping gave her a sense of drowsiness.

She closed her eyes for a single instant.

--

The credits rolled on the screen. Celebi's mom smiled.

"How was it you two?" she asked, stretching.

No reply.

"Kids?" she turned her head, but nothing could have prepared her for the adorable scene her eyes met: Celebi, asleep next to her, an as well asleep Zorua cuddled to her chest.

The pink Celebi giggled.

"That is one adorable doll, honey..." she whispered to herself.
"Let's put these two to bed."

The unconscious Celebi (and Zorua as well) were lifted psychically as her mom fluttered to her daughter's bedroom.

The blankets were telekinetically lifted, and the sleeping Celebi was gently laid under them.

Her mom leaned down, kissing the green fairy on the forehead, before her paw found Zorua's head as she gently caressed the fox.

Then, the psychic force holding the blankets faded, letting the sheet fall onto Celebi and her boyfriend.

With one last, loving glance, Celebi's mom left the room.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: A movie with mom

choices: "... Zorua, I'm really, really sorry about that..." Celebi sighed dejectedly
"... Why didn't you tell me? That was a cheap shot, you know," Celebi huffed
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Celebi's gaze traveled from her mom to her boyfriend.

Zorua had told her mom how he felt about their relationship, but he said nothing to her, his girlfriend.

The green fairy blushed bright red.

Zorua was staring back at her, the couple having a conversation without having to talk: it was a reciprocal exchange of feelings, a chat between their hearts.

"Have you got nothing to say, sweetie?" the pink Celebi broke the silence, staring at her daughter expectantly.

Celebi finally looked up.

"I-" she bit her tongue, figuring that she'd have to talk to Zorua alone, not wanting to cause a scene in front of her mom.

She was sorry about how her boyfriend felt, but she also felt offended that Zorua talked to her mom and not to her.

What was the fox thinking?

"... I understand mom." she said, before looking at Zorua,
"I'll try to be more considerate of your feelings Zorua. I am sorry." she said, unsmiling.

Her mom, on the other hand, was smiling sweetly, while Zorua smiled in relief.

The elder Celebi finished her hot cocoa, gesturing for the couple to do the same.

Celebi let Zorua take a sip, before she took the cup and drank the rest.

"I've got to go to work now," Celebi's mom chimed, getting up, while the two cups were psychically levitated into the sink.

The pink fairy got up, looking at her daughter.

"... Anything else you want to say, honey?" she said, noticing Celebi's blank stare.

The nearly identical Celebi shook her head, silent.

In the next few moments, Celebi, her mom and Zorua stared at each other wordlessly, each with a different feeling: Celebi stared at her boyfriend, upset; Zorua stared at his girlfriend's mother, confused; the pink Celebi stared at her daughter, worried.

"... I really need to head to work, kids. Go back to sleep, I'll see you later... have a nice day." Celebi's mom said, but couldn't shake off he feeling that something was wrong.

She considered taking a day off, but she really couldn't...

None of the two lovebirds gave any response when the pink legendary finally headed out of the kitchen and, eventually, Zorua and Celebi heard the front door closing.

Only then, Celebi automatically pulled back her chair and got up, like she was a puppet, controlled by the same psychic force she and her mom used.

Silently, the fairy grabbed the tiny Zorua, who was still feeling quite uncomfortable. She hugged him, but there was no warmth in her embrace, despite the warmth her body emanated.

Celebi fluttered through the dark kitchen and flew back into her room, shutting the door and moving back to the bed.

The blankets were psychically lifted as Celebi laid down. Then, she set Zorua down onto her pillow, before pulling the blankets up to her neck, staring at the dark-type blankly.

She still wasn't sure what to think.

She wanted to apologize, promise Zorua she'd make it up to him... but the fact that he talked to her mom and not to her made her feel bad... worse. Zorua was supposed to tell her!

The fox fidgeted nervously, looking at the twin blue lakes that were his girlfriend's eyes.

"... So, do you want to talk or-" Zorua couldn't finish.

The bed shook beneath him as the gigantic Celebi turned her head away, shifting on her other side.

Zorua gritted his teeth - he knew this was going to happen! He knew that if Celebi's mom stepped in it would have worsened things!

"Talk to me Celi!" he exclaimed, receiving no reply but the sheer, uninterrupted silence.

"Come on Celebi... I still love you, you know it! It's just... it's hard, okay?" he sourly admitted.

Celebi didn't even move.

"... You can do anything you want to me Celi. I know... you don't want to hurt me, you don't mean to humiliate me with the doll clothes, I don't know why you shrink my food, but seriously... it's how I feel Celi. I can't help it... what if I have to take an important decision, but that decision is made for me? This is what I'm afraid of... but, seriously Celi, I still love you..." he said.

The small confession seemed to have an effect: Celebi twitched.

The fairy stared at the darkness of her room, silent, not quite knowing what to do now.

How was she supposed to reply? Apologize to Zorua first? Counter his frustration with her frustration?

Again, the pillow Zorua was resting on shook as his girlfriend turned around again; her eyes finally landed on him again as she stared at him, still wordless.

Zorua talked again, relieved that his girlfriend was at least still willing to look at him,

"Please Celebi... I want our relationship to go on, I really love you," after saying those words for three times, Zorua opened that the green giantess would open up a bit,
"But... you need to understand me. I... I can't do anything... and whenever I ask you to grow me back, you simply won't... and I feel so powerless that... I feel like you don't care about my feelings, just how cute I look with that stupid bow." he admitted bluntly.

Being honest was the best option here.

Celebi didn't talk throughout his whole speech, but simply took in all her boyfriend's words.

And then, she finally talked,
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: A presage came true

choices: Zorua finally fell asleep
"What did you two do?" an awake Celebi suddenly asked
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Celebi's mom smiled sympathetically.

"So Zorua, you're concerned that you'll be always be powerless in your relationship with my daughter?" she asked gently, bringing her finger on top of the dark-type's head as she stroked him gently.

Zorua nodded - or moved his head up and down because of the finger patting him.

"Yeah... Celi's sweet but... firm on certain things... like doll clothes that make me ‘look cute’, ‘overeating’ and books..." he stated.
"I... it's horrible miss... feeling powerless I mean..."

The mother of his girlfriend smiled and got up from her chair, picking up Zorua as well.

"... Come with me."

--

"Are you... huh... sure miss?"

Celebi's mom smiled, although Zorua couldn't see it - she had her back turned to him.

She was making something, he could tell.

"Trust me Zorua," the pink Celebi told as a nice smell started to fill the whole kitchen.
"You should simply talk to my daughter, I know she'll understand your situation,"

Zorua watched as the pink fairy finally turned around, smiling gently at him as she walked to the kitchen table that currently served Zorua as a perch.

She was holding something, he noticed, and that something smelt really good.

Zorua finally knew what it was when Celebi's mom set a small - to her - cup in front of the dark-type.

"Hot cocoa," the giantess said upon noticing the questioning look Zorua was shooting.

She sat down in front of him, head resting in a paw.
"I bet you didn't get to have some of this back in your forest," she continued with a grin, before adopting a sweeter tone.
"Go ahead dear, drink without fearing Celi shrinking it."

Zorua thanked her, before approaching the giant, heavenly-smelling cup.

He sniffled a few times, before leaning to take a sip of the hot liquid.

Immediately, a soothing warmth spread through his whole body, while his tongue practically begged for more of the hot cocoa.

The little dark-type started drinking the steaming hot liquid enjoying the pleasant feeling it gave him.

Celebi's mom watched him, smiling.

"Feeling better young man?" she asked, and he raised his head, nodding.

"This is awesome miss! Thanks!" he chimed, before returning to his cup, causing the older Celebi to smile even more.

Only when he felt that he couldn't take another sip of hot cocoa, Zorua stepped back, sighing in satisfaction.

"Now Zorua..." Celebi's mom continued, dragging the unfinished cup towards herself, not wanting it to go to waste.

She took a sip too, before looking at the tiny fox again.

"Will you talk to Celebi about it?" she asked, and Zorua suddenly looked down.

"I... I will miss," he stated before looking up again.
"B-But... what if Celi doesn't agree?" he asked.

Celebi's mom took another sip.

"... I doubt it'll happen, Zorua. My daughter seems to really like you, and if she truly does, she'll have to consider your feelings," she said, before looking at the fox with a serious expression.
"... And if she doesn't, you can come talking to me about it... I'll make sure Celi learns that you're not a pet, that you have feelings and thoughts." she added.

Zorua had to admit, he felt slightly better after the statement.

He expressed it by smiling at the pink Celebi.

"Thanks miss... I feel much better." he admitted as the older time-traveler got up and put down the emptied cup, before turning to the tiny dark-type with a smile.

"No problem, Zorua," she replied, before walking to the table and picking the fox up.
"Now Zorua..." she yawned.
"I need to sleep... I've got work tomorrow. And you too need your sleep." she said.

The fox nodded several times as the mother of his girlfriend carried him into said girl's room.

The pink fairy telekinetically raised the blanket and placed Zorua right by Celebi's stomach.

"Good night dear," she said, letting the blanket fall back onto the two pokemon... not before having heard a faint ‘Good night miss, thanks’, which made her smile.

Soon, Zorua heard the door closing and sighed as he walked up to Celebi's stomach and cuddled to the green girl, reassured, ready to get a nice, long sleep.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Hot remedy for uncertainty

choices: "Zorua... why didn't you tell me sooner?" Celebi asked sweetly
"Is that so?" Celebi said with a smirk
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Sadly, Zorua's well-deserved sleep was negated as his surroundings shook, causing the tiny dark-type to open his eyes.

Only to notice Celebi's gigantic ones staring straight at him. His dark-type let him see through the darkness, he noted the smirk painted on her face.

Her paws darted under the covers like an Ekans striking its prey, her fingers gripping him and dragging him onto her pillow, where her gigantic face rested.

"So... what did you and my mom do, Zorua?" Celebi asked in a whisper, as if afraid to wake the pokemon in the other room up.

Zorua froze up.

While he believed that Celebi was asleep, Celebi wasn't asleep at all!

"... We just talked." Zorua said uncomfortably.

"About?"

"... Things..." Zorua started to feel flustered. Celebi's mom had told him to tell her how he really felt, but he actually felt like this wasn't the right time!

Celebi kept smirking.

"...‘Things’ huh?" she parroted back,
"What ‘things’?"

No reply.

"Come on Zorua... you know I can simply ask mom and I'd know anyway," Celebi encouraged, causing her boyfriend to look up meekly.

"Ca-Can't we just sleep? We'll talk to-"

Celebi shook her head.
"Nope... you're telling me now," that was an order.

Zorua mentally sighed - this was what he was talking about! Celebi abused her bigger size to force him to do things, and now she wanted to force him to talk about how he felt about it!

... But wasn't that the point of the situation?

Either way, he had to talk to her.

"... Okay Celi," he said with a sigh as he fidgeted nervously, a thing Celebi found adorable.

"For some reason, your mom came in here earlier-" he started, but Celebi interrupted immediately,
"Yeah... when she said ‘I'll be checking on you’ she meant it..." she huffed, causing Zorua to roll his eyes.

"... Anyway, I couldn't sleep and she noticed. She brought me into the other room and asked me why I couldn't sleep. And I..." he paused, knowing that this was a delicate point of the story.

Celebi was officially curious.

"You what? You told her I suppose... why couldn't you sleep anyway?" she asked, before starting to giggle teasingly,
"Was my tummy uncomfortable?"

Zorua sighed - his girlfriend didn't seem to be taking him seriously.

"No Celi," he responded.
"... It's us. Our relationship..." he admitted. Celebi's smirk faded as she stared at her boyfriend, flabbergasted.

"... Zorua, it's only been a little more than a week, don't tell me you want to leave m-"

"No no no, I still love you Celi," he stated calmly - why did everybody jump to conclusions? - earning a sigh of relief and a peck from the fairy.

The fox blushed.

"... What about our relationship, Zorua?" Celebi the asked in a calm voice, shifting on her side to see Zorua better.

He sighed. This was the point of the situation.

"Celi... I feel like... you've been abusing your size-changing ability lately, okay?" he bluntly stated.

Celebi's eyes shot open.

"... If you're talking about Azurill, it was you and Gardevoir who-" she interrupted herself, noting that Zorua was shaking his head. She looked at him questioningly.

Zorua turned around, turning his back to her.

"... It's me Celi," he admitted.

The green fairy looked surprised for a moment, before her mind started to put two and two together.

Unhappy Zorua plus the sentence ‘you're abusing your size-changing ability’ could only mean one thing.

Celebi started laughing merrily.

"SERIOUSLY Zorua?" she asked, struggling to control her laughter.
"All this speech about our relationship only because I make you wear doll clothes and shrink your food?"

Zorua blushed as he turned around again.

"That's not the point!" that was exactly the point.
"... You force me to do things Celi! When I wanted to be big this morning, you didn't grow me because ‘you'll have more fun like that’!" he exclaimed, Celebi's laughter ceasing as she looked at him with surprise.

She didn't expect such outburst from Zorua.

The fox continued,
"... I'm not saying that I mind being tiny Celi, but I mind if the decision of being big or small is made for me! It should be up to me, not you!" he exclaimed, Celebi's jaw hanging open.

Since when Zorua started feeling like that?

The fox hung his head as he breathed heavily, inhaled and exhaled sharply.

"... I know, doll clothes, shrunken food and the lack of sleep are all dumb things to complain about Celi... but I'm asking myself, ‘What if I have to make an important decision, and that decision is made for me because I'm powerless to stop you from forcing me to do whatever you wish while I'm in such state?..." he said in a much calmer tone, before sighing in what seemed exasperation.
"... That's all. There's nothing more to say."

The dark-type quieted down, clearly waiting for an answer.

And, after a few moments of being dumbfounded, Celebi gave hers.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Confrontation

choices: The next morning
During the night...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Zorua saw the enormous blue eyes of his girlfriend opening and closing as she blinked, perplexed

But then, her expression changed into one of endless sweetness.

"Zorua, my little cutie," one of her paws traveled to him as she gently picked him up.
"Why didn't you tell me sooner?"

In a moment, Zorua found himself being hugged hard by his gigantic girlfriend.

He blushed, not quite knowing how to reply to that.

"I thought you weren't going to listen to me..." he mumbled sheepishly.
"I mean, you seem to like whenever I'm dressed up as a doll... or when I'm helpless..."

Celebi giggled.
"You're right Zorua, I love it when you're powerless," she replied, earning a suspicious expression from the dark-type.

The fairy's smile widened.

"But, Zorua, I love you more than that! You have feelings, and you're not my pet or anything like that. You're my boyfriend," she said sweetly.

Before Zorua could respond, he discovered how it was to when his mouth, and face, was entirely covered by another's own oral cavity.

He felt his cheeks flaring up as Celebi kissed him lovingly.

The green giantess pulled back after thirty seconds, smiling and blushing.

"Got it Zorua? You're my sweet little boyfriend, nothing of what we do - heh, I do - will make me forget that. I know, sometimes it may look like I don't care about how you feel or I might not ask for your opinion, but I always care for your feelings." she finished reassuringly.

At this point, Zorua felt tears in his eyes - Celebi's speech had touched him... but figuring that her seeing him crying would be the ultimate downfall of his already damaged reputation, Zorua hid his emotions behind his characteristic grin.

"... Thanks Celi," he said, feeling reassured.

He leaned forward, starting to nuzzle his girlfriend's chest.

"I feel a lot better... I love you too..." he whispered the last part, but it didn't escape the green fairy, who smiled brightly.

She was happy that Zorua told her how he felt, she felt like she had helped him getting rid of a crushing weight on his heart... and she got rid of her own crushing weight on her heart too.

Zorua had been her only boyfriend so far, and the only guy her mother approved... she couldn't risk losing him, not when their relationship was blossoming! And especially NOT because of some dumb doll clothes or some shrunken food.

Her paw started to stroke the fox gently as she rolled onto her back, readjusting her position upon noting that her arm hurt, probably having fallen asleep.

"Now Zorua, what do you say if we go back to sleep? It's quite late..." she said, empathizing her suggestion with a yawn.

Zorua smiled and leaned down, legs spread as his girlfriend hugged him to her chest.

"Good night, Celi," he said, suddenly feeling drowsy. Doubts dissipated, he was finally free to sleep.
"Thanks..."

The fairy smiled.
"Good night, Zorua," she replied, leaning forward to press her lips on his forehead as she pecked him once more.
"And remember: I always love you," she repeated upon pulling off, causing Zorua to blush.

Once again, his world shook as his gigantic girlfriend adjusted.

Then, both pokemon closed their eyes and, soon, they fell asleep.

They fell asleep, happily unaware about the pink Celebi that was listening to their entire conversation out of the door.

She smiled, sensing that the two lovebirds were really asleep this time.

Happily, she made her way into her own room.

"Good work sweetie..." she whispered to herself, feeling proud of her daughter.
"And you too Zorua," she added, happy that Zorua had talked to Celebi and that they solve the thing by themselves.

As for her, she yawned drowsily as she closed the door of her room and laid down in her bed.

Soon enough, the last awake pokemon inside the house fell asleep too, joining her daughter and her daughter's boyfriend in the world of dreams.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Restored relationship

choices: "I'm cool like this, so long as we're staying in."
"I'd like to be big for the day."
Before he can answer, there's a knock at the door.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
The night gave way to morning as the older Celebi prepared for her day of work. She looked into her daughter's room to see her and Zorua sound asleep. She smiled to herself as she got ready to take off.

Quietly, she left the two to their day as she greeted hers and the morning continued to pass without much fuss.

The past few days had been...certainly odd. Her daughter had an unprecedented power...she befriended and reformed one of the most notorious local delinquents in town...and he turned out to not be a bad pokemon...a bit unsure of himself, and maybe more sensitive than he wanted to let on honestly from what she could tell. He was a good fit for her shut in daughter...and cared for her beyond what she could do, that was certain.

She was happy for them. Almost reminded her of happier days herself...she shook her head and smiled, chuckling as she left the house in silence.

-

A few hours passed from that point and Celebi awoke with a yawn as she looked around...morning. She smiled a bit to herself as she went to rub the sleep from her eyes and noted the sleeping form of her tiny boyfriend. She gently set him on the bed and got up herself. She looked at him...still sound asleep.

"This once Zorua...i'll let you sleep in." She said quietly as she ventured out of her room to the silence of her house.

She really didn't mean anything by what she was doing to Zorua, it was gentle teasing to her...though she needed to keep the balance in mind too, it was very easy she supposed how he could misconstrue things in his position. He was small right now and...though she didn't want to say it outright to him, their power gap was rather large, and he knew that too. She didn't want to push him around or discount his feelings, but that was a very real thing that he could assume from his perspective. She was good about avoiding this kind of stuff with her friends, but this was before the size ability came into play.

Sighing she got herself a bowl of cereal. Today would be simple...just relaxing at home with her boyfriend. Maybe watch or read something...she MIGHT even let him watch something horror related...during the day, with the lights on.

Silently, she ate her bowl of cereal and flipped through a newspaper on the table.

Not much, an article on Wigglytuff's disappearance and his...known deeds, and some stuff about Miltank's passing...that was sad...

Celebi finished up as she stretched a bit and went back to her room.

She noted that Zorua was groggily waking up on his own and he looked up at his towering girlfriend.

"...You let me sleep a bit longer." He noted and she nodded.

"I figured i'd let you do that today...I just want to let you know Zorua I do value what you want...and your feelings. I'm not...trying to push you around or anything, you know that, right?"

Zorua looked at her, and nodded.

"Yeah...I know." He grinned and she smiled.

"Do you want to be normal sized for right now?" She asked and he contemplated it.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: A quiet morning

choices: "Hm, okay... why not? Let's go call the others."
"Let's spend the day together, just me and you~"
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"I'm fine like this," Zorua said nonchalantly as he stretched.

Celebi smiled, gently picking him from his perch.

She gave him a gentle kiss.

"Come on Zorua, let's get you something to eat and then... we'll see," she said cheerfully.

She was happy all the bitter feelings between them were gone.

Zorua smiled happily as his girlfriend carried him out of her room and into the kitchen.

In a short while, Zorua was given a small piece of meat, a bit of an egg and some juice.

Zorua's mouth watered at the sight... before he thought it was too good to be true.

He sighed, and looked back at his giant girlfriend, who met his gaze.

"Something wrong?"

"You're going to shrink this all, ain't ya?" he wondered.

His words sank into Celebi, who smiled.

"Oh, no no no Zorua, I won't," she reassured, winking and blowing him a kiss.

Zorua smiled massively.

"THANK YOU CELEBI!" he cried, causing his girlfriend to smile brightly.

"Well... maybe..."

The glass of juice shrunk down to a medium size; it still towered above Zorua, but he could easily climb up to drink.

Celebi's received a grateful smiled, and she smiled back.

The fairy then walked back into the living room, letting Zorua eat his breakfast while she picked up one of the new books she bought and disappeared behind it.

She read the first few lines... but discovered that she lacked interest.

She continued, but she wasn't really paying attention to the book... what was happening to her?

Maybe... now that she was used to having Zorua around whenever she read, she couldn't read alone?

She discarded the seemingly silly theory and giggled - what was she thinking? - and resumed reading.

But, she discovered, she kept looking up, in direction of the kitchen every once in a while.

"Hm..." she mused, deciding to do a little experiment.

She got up from her chair and walked into the kitchen; Zorua was still eating.

"Zorua..." she said, gently picking him up. The dark-type almost choked from the surprise.

He forced himself to swallow, before staring daggers at his girlfriend.

"What?"

Celebi didn't respond. She psychically grabbed the unfinished piece of meat, the half-drank glass of juice and remains of the egg and walked back into the living room.

She sat back down on her chair, placing the curious Zorua beside her, setting the meat in front of him.

The tiny fox blinked, confused, before shrugging and resuming eating.

Celebi grabbed her book again, her head sinking into the pages again... and, she discovered, now she was able to read normally.

What could that mean, she wondered.

The two remained silent for a while, Zorua chewing was the only sound that could be heard in the house.

But then, the fox eventually finished eating and patted his stomach with a paw, satisfied.

Celebi looked up from her book, gently closing it and eyeing Zorua.

"Satisfied?" she asked.

Her boyfriend nodded cheerfully, before asking,

"What now Celi?... You're not planning to read all day, are ya?" he asked.

Celebi giggled.

"Nope... I'm done for now," she replied,
"And now, what do you say if we go out for a bit?" she suggested.

"Are you even asking?"

The fairy giggled, picking Zorua up in her paws.

She gave him another kiss, causing the dark-type to blush.

"Someone's happy today..." he stated, embarrassed but happy.

"You can bet~"

The little fox grinned.

"Hey Celi, do we call the others when we go out? Been a while since I saw Espurr..." he mused.

Celebi's smile faded.

She knew that Espurr did have feelings for Zorua, she heard them talking when the night she accepted to become Zorua's girlfriend... Espurr had told him to not worry for her if he liked Celebi herself more than her...

"Celi?" Zorua called her back to reality,
"Are you alright?" she must have been looking at the void for a while.

"Hmm? Oh, yeah, sure," she replied.

What was she thinking? Espurr was one of her best friends!

She felt bad for a moment, before shaking her head and looking at Zorua, who was still looking at her with worry despite her reassurance.

"Anyway..."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: A big day for a tiny fox

choices: "Sorry Braix... It's just me and Zorua today,"
"Okay... why not?"
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Before Zorua could respond to Celebi's question, there was a knock at the door.

"I'll get it." the fairy said, wondering who it could be.

Celebi walked out of her room and into the hallway, reaching the front door of her house. The knocks, she noted, were getting more impatient.

"Coming!" she exclaimed as she opened the door.

"CELI!"

For the briefest moment, Celebi thought about Gardevoir, right before a purple blur bolted inside the house, leaving a certain brown and cream bunny behind.

Said bunny held a tiny blue mouse.

"Hi Celi," both Azurill and Buneary greeted the fairy,

"Where's Zorua? He ain't gonna believe it!" Braixen screamed from behind her, wearing an excited smile on her face.

Celebi sighed as she turned around.

"Braix, if my hearing is damaged, I'll come and get ya..." she said, annoyed, before glancing back at Buneary and Azurill,
"And if you're talking about Lopunny adopting Azurill, we already-"

"No no, it's not that... it's that new movie!" the vixen chimed, eyes sparkling.

Celebi froze.

"What-"

"Lyncaroc's bloody midnight!" Braixen excitedly interrupted, Buneary nodding slowly.
"She literally dragged us here..." she revealed, Azurill nodding in confirm.

"Yep... ZORUA!" she called out loud.

Celebi huffed as she went back to her room; she returned a moment later, holding her tiny boyfriend.

"I heard everything - I'm in!" he chimed, the purple giantess grinning.

However Celebi shook her head. Zorua shot a pleading look.

"Zorua, last time Braixen brought me to watch a horror, I had nightmares!" she exclaimed, bad memories filling her head.

--

"N-No! Stay away from m-me!" Celebi cried as the Tyranitar walked closer and closer to her.

She tried to flutter away, but she couldn't move.

The Tyranitar opened its fang-filled mouth and bit her while she screamed...

--

"Well, I had nightmares after that movie you made me watch!" Zorua retorted as his girlfriend shook her head again.

Bad memories started filling Zorua's head too...

--

"N-No! Stay away from m-me!" Zorua screamed as the gigantic Espeon walked closer.

He tried to run, but he couldn't move, held in place by psychic.

"No! I have a girlfriend! I-" he screamed as the Espeon kissed him...

--

"But you slept throughout the whole movie!" Celebi recalled.

Zorua shot a blank look and shook his head.
"I guess I watched some of it... or heard..."

"Oh, I understand ya buddy..." Braixen chimed in.

The dark-type in Celebi's paws nodded, before looking up.

"Come on Celi, it'll be fun!" he exclaimed.

"Wigglytuff didn't let me watch horror... I want to know what's it like..." Azurill chimed.
"They're scary... somehow Braixen is always able to convince me to watch them..." Buneary stated.

"It's because you like 'em sweetie," the purple vixen said with a smirk, before looking back at Celebi.

"Come on Celi..." she insisted.

Celebi sighed.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: An invitation

choices: "...Fine Celi, we'll follow you."
"No thanks Celi."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Celebi eyed Braixen suspiciously.

"That, movie...wasn't it rated restricted for teens and under?" Celebi asked before Braixen grinned and dug through her tail, producing three tickets.

"I have my ways~" She said as Celebi looked at her with unimpressed half lidded eyes. "You had Marowak buy them, didn't you?" She asked and Braixen's grin widened.

"Dude owed me one, besides, it'll be a bonding experience!"

"Come on Celi, let's do it!" Zorua said enthusiastically.

Celebi DID say that she'd do what Zorua wanted today...and she had made him watch some romance stuff, and made him feel uncomfortable lately with his lack of relative power. She bit her lip.

"I want to see it..." Azurill said and Buneary reluctantly nodded.

"Celi, even the KIDS want to go...one of them is this big!" Braixen held her hands together to emphasize Azurill's size, to his mild annoyance, though he didn't voice it. "Do you want to let little kids come off as braver than you?" She said and Celebi groaned.

"THEY shouldn't even see this!" Celebi said though Buneary and Azurill averted their gaze at this. "Does Lopunny even know?" Celebi folded her arms and Braixen looked exasperated.

"It'll be a harmless secret." She said and Celebi nodded. "Until they have nightmares and Lopunny is left wondering why." and Braixen shook her head.

"Come on, compared to some of the weirder stuff we've done lately. Azurill, do you think anything would be as scary as when Celebi first shrunk you and you faced down Zorua?" She asked and Azurill shook his head.

"No...come on Celi..." He said and finally Celebi shut her eyes and seemed to go limp.

"I give up...sure, why not?" She said, smiling briefly.

How bad could it be?

-

Celebi was holding Zorua in what had to be a vice grip to her chest as she whimpered and shut her eyes. He was laughing and enjoying the screen as Braixen watched relaxed and Buneary watched the screen from between her paws.

The screen was filled with blood as the midnight Lycanroc went on his rampage while his brother, midday Lycanroc attempted to hunt him down and stop him.

Azurill for his part was hiding in the popcorn tub that Braixen was holding, much to Zorua's amusement as well.

This was totally what he wanted.

-

"THAT WAS AWFUL!" Celebi said as they stood outside the movie theater, while Braixen and Zorua grinned. "It was AMAZING!"

"Agreed! What did the kids think?" Braixen looked down at Buneary and Azurill who both were looking forward, eyes wide open.

"...It was an experience..." Azurill said. Buneary just silently nodded.

"Kids, this is why we SHOULDN'T have gone!" Celebi said, before Azurill chimed in.

"I'm glad we did though..." Zorua let out a triumphant whoop at this and Celebi rolled her eyes before hugging him tighter to her chest.

"We're watching a romance movie tonight for sure Zorua." She said and he just sighed before grinning. "Fine fine, you earned it." He said and Celebi grinned at Braixen and Buneary. "And you're all welcome to join~" She said, part joke, part offer and part threat.

Braixen scratched the back of her head but Buneary chimed in.

"Yes! Yes I want to do that!" She said as she squeezed Azurill to her chest too.

Celebi just smirked at Braixen.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: A horrifying experience

choices: Zorua proceeds to explain Celebi's power
Zorua lies to Celebi's mother
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
The pink Celebi looked at her daughter, then at the fox who apparently was Celebi's boyfriend - and who apparently had been for a while.

The elder time traveler didn't know how to feel... Zorua had a bad reputation... but such reputation had improved to some better one.

In fact, for the past few weeks, the pranks in the village mysteriously ceased and Zorua himself had changed... that was what Lopunny was telling around anyway.

But Celebi's mom was unsure.

She had to make sure Zorua was a good pokemon for her daughter. Otherwise, he had to stay away from her, no matter if her daughter's heart was shattered.

A mom always knows what's best for her child.

"Celi... honey, go inside. I need to talk with Zorua alone." she said.

"But mom..."

"Go inside." the pink fairy repeated, still gentle, but way firmer.

Celebi looked at Zorua, before meekly walking inside the house, closing the door behind herself, leaving her mother and Zorua alone outside.

The pink time traveler turned to the young fox with an inquisitive gaze

"So, Zorua..." she started.

"Miss..."

"I've heard quite a few interesting things about you... still, I need to make sure you're good for my daughter. No offense, but I'm not sure I can trust you." the fairy bluntly said.

Zorua closed his eyes, feeling uncomfortable.
"... It's understandable, miss. However, whatever you heard, it's true... I'm done with pranks..." he said, before opening his eyes a bit, allowing himself to smile.
"And it was because of Celebi."

The elder fairy looked amused.
"My daughter? My daughter made you quit with pranks?" she asked.

Zorua nodded happily... the memory of that fateful day was still fresh in his mind, and he was sure he was never going to forget.

Pain, blood, a broken paw... contributed to give him a house and a girlfriend.

"You see miss... your daughter had... helped me in a particularly rough situation..." he admitted.
"I-I... I couldn't help but... but fall in love with her..."

Celebi's mom watched as Zorua's cheeks flared up.

She fought back a smile - her sweet daughter had the power of making Zorua change. It was wonderful... however...

"Okay Zorua... how long have you two been together?" she asked, taking a step closer to the black fox.

"... A while... one/two weeks I think..." he sincerely answered.

Honesty was the only thing that could help him... if he lied to the pink Celebi, he was sure that he wasn't going to see his girlfriend again... even worse, he was going to be thrown out of his new house!... Although, Celebi's mom didn't know about that...

A new doubt found its way inside the mind of the fox - did he have to tell that too? But... if he did, he would have to reveal about Celebi's powers, and he wasn't sure how her mother would take the news, which would be surely followed by her asking all sorts of questions about it.

He gulped. The fairy in front of him noticed that the fox was getting nervous.

"... Are you feeling alright?" she asked with a slight hint of concern in her voice.

Zorua nodded.
"Anything else you want to ask, miss?" he asked back.

Celebi's mom pondered her next question.

Zorua had already told when it happened and how it happened... now she had to make sure he was loyal to her daughter.

"Zorua... listen, I need to know... do you truly like my daughter? Answer honestly, please." she said.

The dark type looked at her, before closing his eyes and opening his heart.
"Miss... your daughter is the best thing that ever happened to me... she's sweet, funny, caring... so yes, I do truly like Celebi, and I would never dream of breaking her heart if that's what you're thinking." he said sincerely.

The pink time traveler in front of him smiled brightly. There was passion in the little speech Zorua made... so, she assumed, he was being sincere... better for him if he was.

At this point, she really couldn't think of anything else to ask. She was quite tempted to give the fox and her daughter her blessing and let them be together.

However, one last question lingered in her mind.

"Zorua dear... one last question if you agree." she said, smiling gently.

"Ask miss... I'll be happy to answer." the fox responded.

The pink Celebi sighed.

"Quite some time ago... in Celebi's room, there was a Zorua pokedoll..."

The blood froze in the veins of the black fox.

"Was that you?" the elder Celebi asked.

Zorua pondered lying... but decided against it.

"Yes miss... that was me..." he admitted, looking down and blushing.

Celebi's mom nodded.
"Okay... but I remember picking you up that day, and it was like I picked up a real pokedoll... how was that possible, young man?" she asked, genuinely curious.

Again, Zorua felt his blood freezing.

He didn't think about that - obviously Celebi's mother would have asked herself why a normal-sized pokemon could be picked up with two fingers!

He gulped as he looked up at the time traveler.

Perhaps... was it the moment to reveal the truth?
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: One-on-one introduction

choices: "I'll have to ask Celebi a few things... but other than that, you may stay."
"You and Celebi lied to me... I think... I think you should go..."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Zorua sighed deeply.

There was no way out of this. He had to tell the truth... hopefully, Celebi's mom wasn't going to be angry.

They did nothing weird so far, no?... Well, shrinking a living... a few living beings could be considered pretty weird... and this might lead to the wrong way to see things...

"... You see miss... there's an explanation to this all... it's quite weird for me to explain, but it's... it's how it all happened." Zorua admitted.

The pink Celebi in front of him nodded, intrigued.
"Didn't you say that she helped you in particularly tough situation?" she recalled. Zorua nodded.
"She did... but let's proceed in order." Zorua responded.

The fox took a deep breath as he psychologically prepared to tell his story. Celebi's mom noted that he was tensed up.

This had to be something big.

"You see miss... nearly two weeks ago, I pulled a prank on Celebi." he admitted. The mother of his girlfriend narrowed her eyes. Zorua nodded and looked down.
"... And Celebi... totally justified... decided to... uh... 'punish' me." the fox continued.

"Hm." the pink fairy said.
"And what... 'punishment' did she have in store young man?" she asked with interest.

Zorua gulped. This was the moment.

"This... I can't quite explain it miss, but Celebi... Celebi can shrink things and living beings." he said. The fairy looked at him with confusion.
"... Come again?" she asked.

Zorua nodded.
"Your daughter... can shrink... or grow things and living beings at will." he repeated to the shocked mother of his girlfriend.
"... And she used that power to punish me for all my pranks "

Celebi's mom shook her head... her daughter did what? Since when did she have shrinking powers?

"A-And... what did she do to you?" she asked, eager to know the rest. It was getting quite late, but she didn't care - she had to continue... he had to continue.

Zorua sighed, bad memories filling his mind.
"I... was shrunk down to a nanoscopic size I believe... everything was so big... Celebi was a planet..." he recalled, struggling to keep gazing at the fairy in front of him.
"... I don't quite know what she had in mind for me... I only know that I was suddenly threw far up in the sky... and when I landed, I felt pain... a lot... I was seriously injured miss..."

Celebi's mom looked at him, dumbfounded... her sweet daughter did something like that, kidnapped and hurt a pokemon. Even though it seemed like he deserved it, this wasn't what she taught her...

Zorua seemed to sense the disappointment inside of the pink fairy... mostly because she suddenly glared back at the house, seemingly wanting to give her daughter a metaphorical earful.

"... Don't think bad of your daughter, miss, it was an accident. I don't think Celebi could ever hurt anyone on purpose... unless she's truly angry." Zorua quickly said.

Celebi's mom looked at him again.

"... Go on." she simply said.

Zorua nodded, feeling like this was going to be even more awkward.
"... After I got hurt, Celebi healed me and sent me back in my forest." he said. Celebi's mom looked confused.
"Wait, don't you mean ‘home’?" she asked. Zorua sighed.
"No... I'm homeless miss..." the elder time traveler looked at him pitifully after the revelation.

"But that's the point of the situation. Your daughter visited me a few days later, learning that I don't have anywhere to live but my forest... she suggested I went with her... in your house. On one condition though - I had to be tiny. Not nanoscopic again, the size of a small doll... the one you picked up a few days ago. I've been living with you two since then." he admitted.

Celebi's mother looked shocked again. The dark type fox nodded.
"And that's when... when I started to have feelings for her. I called Celebi my best friend, I called what she did to me a blessing, I... I confessed my feelings in a quite awkward situation..." he recalled the sleepover he had one week ago, Espurr and Gardevoir overhearing behind the front door of the house he and the pink Celebi were outside of.

Speaking of Celebi's mom, now she wore a look of disappointment.

"... One last question. Then I'll decide." she said.
"Ask miss... but keep in mind - I've been telling the truth so far." he responded. Celebi's mom mentally smiled.

"I appreciate it... now Zorua, why didn't you or Celebi tell me sooner about... everything?" she asked.

Zorua sighed.

"Miss... can I ask you something now? Would you have approved our relationship back then? Do you approve it now that you know everything?" he asked, looking ready to explode. The tension was killing him.

Celebi's mom went quiet. She had to think.

Did she approve this relationship? Or did she not? Zorua answered to her questions with sincerity, she could tell that... but Celebi had done terrible things, and lied to her own mother.

Plus, she and Zorua himself had technically lied to her, not telling her what had been going on for a whole week...

But... Zorua seemed truly reformed now, and he and Celebi were in love...

Did she have the heart to break theirs over a few lies?

She looked at Zorua again.

And finally, she gave her ultimate answer.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Bittersweet memories

choices: "Oh, are you going out?" she asked cheerfully. She didn't hear anything.
"I heard what you said..." she admitted. Uh oh...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
A Celebi filled both Zorua and Gardevoir's eyesight, but it wasn't Zorua's Celebi; it was the mother of his Celebi, the same pink Celebi that unknowingly picked him up a few days ago.

The green gaze of the elder time-traveler went from Gardevoir to Zorua, from Zorua to Gardevoir.

"... Hi Gardevoir," she greeted, smiling warmly.

She then eyed Zorua with a much colder expression.

"Zorua. Why are you here?" she asked bluntly. Being cautious doesn't justify being rude, but Zorua was a scoundrel.

Why was he knocking at her door anyway?

"Just came to pick up my..." the last word stopped in the middle of his throat and slid back down as he remembered who he was talking to.
"... Best friend Celebi."

The pink time-traveler blinked - her daughter hung out with such pokemon?

Gardevoir smiled.

"Don't worry miss, Zorua is good now... too good I'd say," she snickered, patting the fox on the back.

"That's right... I'm not pranking anymore miss..." he smiled at that,
"It was Celebi that helped me change, and I'm grateful for it."

He was about to praise his girlfriend even more, but decided against it. Better to save the sweet words for when Celebi's mom was going to find out about his girlfriend: her daughter.

Celebi's mom sighed. It was enough, she thought, if one of her daughter's friends assured that Zorua was good.

"... Celebi is in her room," she moved aside to let the two in,
"She's reading."

Passing beside her, Zorua noted a hint of disappointment on her face: she was probably thinking about her daughter wasting her life on books.

Zorua smirked - if only she knew how much little time Celebi was spending on books since he came into her life...

The duo thanked Celebi's mom and walked through the house.

Smirking, Zorua pushed the door, immediately noticing that his girlfriend wasn't reading at all. She did have a book... closed, under her elbows, paws resting under her chin and legs flailing in mid-air as she gazed across the room, looking incredibly bored.

But that immediately changed as she spotted Zorua and Gardevoir.

"Hi Celi," the pyschic/fairy-type chimed.

"Hi Ce-"

Zorua's salute turned into a gasp as the fairy flew off the bed at supersonic speed, wrapping her long arms around his neck. Gardevoir pushed the door close.

"You're home, finally! You jerk, you left me alone the whole day to go who knows where, I was so bored!" Celebi complained, contradictorily nuzzling Zorua as she did.

"Aw!"

Zorua smiled.

"I was with Azurill... and speaking of which, you need to shrink him again." the fox said, opting to get straight to the point.

Celebi pulled back, confused.

"Wha... I thought he was going to the orphanage!" Celebi recalled.

"He is, but he wants to stay here - with us - and Lopunny is more than willing to adopt him," Zorua revealed.

"What's the problem then? Why do I have to shrink him?" the incredulous Celebi asked.

"Problem is that Lopunny can't afford to raise two kids... but if one of the two is shrunken, the problem is solved." Gardevoir said, her words matching Zorua's thoughts so well that he could contain himself,

"... Espurr?"

Gardevoir smirked in a way that indeed reminded Zorua of the small psychic-type with lilac eyes.

"A bit of logic can be the equivalent of mind-reading, Zorua." she stated.

Celebi flew back, completely forgetting about the not-so-nice promises she wanted to make Zorua for leaving her alone all day long.

"S-Shrinking Azurill?" Celebi parroted back, unable to believe her friend and boyfriend were suggesting that,
"But... does he agree with this?"

Zorua nodded cheerfully.

"Yep... think Celebi, it all works to his advantage: roof, family, friends." he said.

"He just doesn't want to leave us... he'll accept it, you'll see..." Celebi meekly tried to oppose.

"I think you should do it Celi," Gardevoir chimed in,
"Kid is quite happy with the idea to remain with Lopunny and Buneary... oh, those two would look so cute together~" she sang.

"Gardevoir, they're kids." Celebi said, annoyed by her friend's antics.

"Means nothing~"

"Look Celebi, it's for Azurill's own good!" Zorua insisted.

"... And when school starts? What do we do then?" Celebi retorted, happy to have finally found a point against shrinking Azurill.

"You can grow him for class, then shrink him down when school's over." her boyfriend mused.

"Oh, yeah? Will I have to grow him, shrink him when school is done only to grow him back the next morning? For how long?" even to Zorua, that seemed like a point.

Celebi smirked. That was one good idea of what she was going to do to Zorua when she was going to school, shrinking him if he wasn't tiny already - and she doubted it - only to stuff him in her backpack, taking him out for lunch and when school was over.

Something that Zorua was going to hate, she thought with a giggle.

"He'll..." the dark-type fox quieted down, discovering that he had nothing to counter with. It was no surprise, Celebi was really smart after all, her logic surely enough beat his. But, still, this was for Azurill, his new friend, he had to convince her. If he couldn't, who could have done it?

Zorua sighed - this called for extreme measures.

He looked up at his girlfriend with big, puppy-dog eyes.

"Please Celi, do it, he'll be fine, Lopunny will take care of him, we'll all do, please please please..." Gardevoir repeated his words at the end, hands clasped together, red eyes gleaming with a sad spark.

Celebi sighed - stupid puppy-dog eyes...

"I... want to make sure Azurill and Lopunny are fine with this first." she meekly said.

Zorua and Gardevoir grinned - the battle was won.

Azurill and Lopunny totally agreed to it.

"Awesome, let's go then!" Zorua cheered as Gardevoir opened the door...

Either she came in that moment or she was there the whole time, because the pink Celebi didn't draw any attention.

For a split second, before her mom opened her mouth to talk, Celebi wondered if she had heard anything of what they said.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: A stubborn legendary

choices: "...We'll talk more later, about a lot...go, deal with what you must."
"You aren't going anywhere right now...we need to discuss a lot more."
"Very well...but i'm going with you, I want to talk to Lopunny and Azurill."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Celebi's mother had a relatively somber expression on her face as the older time traveler looked at the teenagers in the room, she folded her arms. "I heard what you said..." She finally said in a serious tone and Celebi gulped and looked down.

"...How much mom?"

"Enough, I saw you hug Zorua as well, and welcome him home? Shrinking? And what's this about Azurill and Lopunny? I think you ALL have some explaining to do." She let her eyes fall on Zorua and Gardevoir too, Gardevoir looked pretty nervous about this.

"Ma'am..." She said nervously and Zorua sighed.

"Welp, let's get this over with..." He said.

-

The four pokemon were at the kitchen table...or rather, 3 of them were sitting at the table, and Zorua was on the table.

"Why is it necessary for him to be like this on my table?" Celebi's mother asked, but Celebi bit her lip.

"Just...watch, please mom?" At this the older time traveler settled.

Celebi closed her eyes, and when she opened them a familiar glow was shining from them. Soon Zorua found the three girls in the room rising around him as the table expanded out below him, and he went down and down until he was doll sized once more, looking at the towering giantesses around him, he gave a sheepish grin.

"...surprise?" He said, but the older Celebi was looking at this in shock.

"So...when you were talking about shrinking..." She mused, and a few things clicked into place in her head.

"...he's been staying here like this, hasn't he?" She said and Celebi looked down, then nodded.

"...Yeah...I initially shrunk him to punish him for pranking me...and everyone else but...I took things too far and after that, he changed. Mom, he's not a bad pokemon, he did some bad things but...he just needed some friends." Celebi said, trying to explain and Gardevoir nodded.

"I promise ma'am, he's not who he was." She interjected.

Zorua for his part was flushing red.

Celebi's mom closed her eyes in thought then sighed and opened them.

"Okay...now the next part. Azurill, Lopunny, how do they factor into this? Shrinking Azurill for Lopunny to adopt him huh? I know she struggles to raise Buneary...but how does this all line up?"

Celebi gulped...she'd probably have to talk about Wigglytuff and his...gruesome, though earned, fate.

"Mom...remember how Wigglytuff vanished?" Celebi said, shakily.

Celebi's mom's eyes widened. "Don't tell me...you were involved?" She said and Celebi nodded.

Zorua took over from here.

"Ma'am...Wigglytuff was a murderer, in cahoots with another murderer. He killed many parents to get the kids he has for his money making schemes...Lopunny was to be his next victim to replace Azurill after we...um, kidnapped him for seeing and threatening me at my size..." Zorua sheepishly smiled.

"Arceus above..." Celebi's mom murmured.

"I promise mom...if you had been there, like Lopunny was...like all of us were..."

"She did the right thing ma'am..." Gardevoir said.

Things were silent for a moment.

"...Where is Wigglytuff now?" She asked, almost afraid of the answer.

"...I shrunk him down...him and his partner until...they would barely register as specks, and left them in the forest. If they aren't dead, they're impossible to track down at this point." Celebi said grimly.

"...Celebi, do you realize what you've done..." Her mom was almost without breath now.

"It was...it...yes, I do mom, and I know it was the right thing...Azurill himself...his mom was killed by that monster." She said.

"...And now you intend to shrink him so Lopunny can take care of him?"

The group nodded.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: A mother's discovery

choices: "Zorua's been here so far so... I'll let him stay." Celebi's mom sighed
"I'm sorry... but Zorua needs to go." Celebi's mom declared
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
In response to the silent confirm, Celebi's mom sighed deeply.

"I..." her words died down.

She had a thousand questions to ask, and didn't know where to start. Plus, Gardevoir was still there, and some of the questions strictly regarded Celebi and Zorua alone.

"... Go deal with what you must. Then," she pointed first to Celebi, then to the tiny Zorua, who fought the urge to cower as the pink finger was pointed at him.

"You two come straight back here. We'll talk more later... like a lot." the elder time-traveler declared.

"Yes mom..." Celebi agreed, but couldn't shake off the feeling that in the morning she wasn't going to have a boyfriend anymore.

"Yes ma'am..." Zorua agreed as well, feeling much like Celebi as the green fairy picked him up. Without saying a word, Gardevoir got up too.

Silently, the duo moved to the front door, followed by the gaze of Celebi's mom.

Gardevoir opened the door, the two got out and the door was closed again.

Only then the pink Celebi left in the house dared to let out a sigh.

Her daughter kept a lot of things from her... and Zorua! Zorua lived with them since... she recalled herself picking up a Zorua doll nearly one week ago.

Since then, or maybe more...

What did that even mean? Why did Celebi even invite him?

As hard as she thought, Celebi's mom didn't seem able to find an explana-

Her eyes shot open with realization.

"Oh..."

--

"This should be Zorua with Celebi, kids," Lopunny chimed as she went to open the door.

Expectedly, Celebi and Zorua were there; unexpectedly, Zorua was tiny and Gardevoir was there too.

"Hi Lopunny..."

Zorua grinned.

"It took a while, but we managed to convince her!" he pointed to the pokemon holding him.

Celebi sighed.

"... Azurill?" she looked at the blue pokemon sitting next to Buneary on the couch.

The mouse jumped down, an eager smile on his face. Clearly, he was happy about his new life perspective.

"What's wrong, Celebi? Why that long face?" Lopunny chimed, noticing Celebi's weird behavior despite the merry situation.

"It's... nothing." the fairy responded as Zorua was handed to Gardevoir.

"Now, are you really sure about this?" she asked, her gaze going from Azurill to Lopunny.

The tall rabbit girl nodded cheerfully.

So did Azurill.

And for Celebi was enough; that once dreaded glow returned to her eyes for the third time today.

And Azurill soon found the world around him growing as Buneary, Lopunny and everyone but Zorua became giants.

Buneary happily jumped off the couch and picked up the now tiny Azurill. The older bunny approached, hugging her daughter and her soon-to-be child.

"Thanks Celi~" the younger bunny said.

Celebi didn't reply, but turned around to see Gardevoir, with sparkling eyes, hugging an uncomfortable-looking Zorua.

"This is so awkward..." he stated upon noting that Celebi was staring at him.

The fairy sighed as Zorua was psychically pulled out of Gardevoir's arms and floated back to hers.

"We will be on our way now." she declared glumly as she flew over the door,
"Call me if you need Azurill big again."

She was about to open the door, but a soft paw landed on her shoulder.

Celebi turned around to see the red eyes of Lopunny, staring at her with concern.

"Celebi, what's wrong?" she asked.

The rabbit was staring at Celebi in a way that reminded her of her own mom... of the mom that waited her at home, possibly to throw Zorua out.

She sighed.

"It's... mom found about this whole thing... about Wigglytuff... about Zorua... she's waiting for us to discuss..." she revealed, Gardevoir nodding with a suddenly serious expression, Buneary and Azurill looking at the green time-traveler with shock.

Lopunny nodded, comprehensive.

"Want me to help? I'll have a word with Celebi, tell her that things are good." she offered, but Celebi shook her head.

She tried to smile.

"No... thank you, but we'll deal with it..." she replied.

Lopunny kept staring at her, but before anything else could be said, Celebi broke free from her grasp, forced herself to smile and left from the open door.

There was one last exchange of awkward looks between Gardevoir and the inhabitants of the house, before she too muttered a quick ‘bye’ and left.

--

"Come in." Celebi's mom ordered.

The fairy obeyed as she carried a silent Zorua to the kitchen, where two chairs were already pulled back, almost as is waiting.

Celebi sat down, placing her boyfriend on the table, before her mother sat in front of them.

"Mom..." a pink finger rose, interrupting Celebi.

The elder time-traveler inhaled sharply.

"Leaving the fact that you undeniably lied to me, kidnapped a child and doomed a pokemon and his partner to a horrible fate, I only want to know," she started in a lecturing tone, her voice filled with disappointment.

Her gaze made Celebi look down.

"Wigglytuff and Weavile Almost murdered Lopunny miss... Celebi saved her." Zorua said, his girlfriend internally thanking him.

The pink Celebi didn't reply.

"... Why Zorua is here, like he had for quite some time. You said he pranked you and you took his ‘punishment’ too far. That doesn't explain pretty much anything."

The younger fairy looked up and opened her mouth, but no sound came out, her words unable to leave her throat.

"It was me, ma'am." Zorua chimed in, causing the pink giantess to look down at him.

"After she... punished me, Celebi came into my forest for... some reason. We were already friends more or less and she... she discovered that I have no one and nowhere to go." that story had the power of making anyone sympathize with him.

Not as much as the ‘broken leg’ story though.

As a matter of fact, the mother of his girlfriend softened all of a sudden, looking at him with pity. Though the disappointment didn't leave her eyes.

"... And so, I asked him if he wanted to come with me and he agreed." Celebi finished.

Her mom sighed.

"A heartwarming story." she commented before placing both her paws on the table and standing up.

"Now... I want to know... what is going on between you and this tiny pokemon in front of me?" she said, before looking at Zorua,

"You said that my daughter is your best friend?"

"HEY!" Celebi cried, looking at her boyfriend sternly. That before she realized her mistake and placed both her paws on her mouth.

Her mom smirked. Zorua looked at Celebi, flustered.

"I must assume that there's more than simple friendship between you two then." she concluded, feeling something between happy and disappointed.

Her daughter was dating someone, which made her happy; her daughter was dating Zorua, which made her disappointed.

Celebi began muttering incomprehensible words.

"... There's no denying that now Celi..." Zorua sourly revealed, his girlfriend looking at him dejectedly.

"Really sweetie? Why didn't you tell me sooner?" her mom continued, softening.

"I didn't know how you would have taken it..." Celebi admitted.

‘Quite frankly, I don't know either...’

"You know I only want to protect you..." her mom said, looking at Zorua.

At this point, Celebi met her mother's gaze.

"Protect me? From Zorua? He's harmless, and a true sweetheart!" she exclaimed, causing her boyfriend to blush.

Celebi sighed.

"Please mom... let him stay, he makes me so happy..."

"Feeling's mutual." Zorua spoke, and the green fairy hugged him.

Celebi's mom stared at the scene... and her heart finally seemed to melt. A mother always wants the happiness of her child.

But it was Zorua they were talking about... could she really trust him?

Plus, there were the other things too...

"... Hurting others, lying, kidnapping kids, literally condemning pokemon... never again Celebi. I didn't teach you these things, and I'm clueless where you learned them." the older time-traveler said sternly.

Her daughter looked down, bit her lip and nodded meekly.

Her mother finally softened.

"As for you two..."

Both Celebi and Zorua perked up.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: The final confrontation

choices: Celebi's mom wants to spend time with the two of them
Zorua is given back to Celebi to spend alone time with her
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"I suppose he's been here for a while now...and he doesn't have anywhere to go right? He can stay..." Celebi's mom finally said, both Celebi and Zorua breathed a sigh of relief.

"But first...come with me young man, I need to talk to you on your own before I commit to this decision." She said, and Zorua found himself psychically floating out of Celebi's grasp as the pink giantess casually carried him away from his girlfriend. Zorua gulped but Celebi just gave a slight smile.

"Don't worry Zorua, it's just a talk." He heard from the older time traveler as he was taken to her room.

Zorua was set down on her master bed and he looked around...the room was nice, well kept. Had a bit of a classy look to it Zorua had to admit, his world shook as his girlfriend's mother sat on the bed next to him and looked down.

"...Zorua...for the longest time you've been a menace on our community, you know that, right? You and Graveler both...Wigglytuff too now I suppose." She started and Zorua looked down, somewhat with a look of shame.

"...who are you inside Zorua? I want to know everything, Celebi says you've changed and Gardevoir vouched for you too...pokemon dating my daughter...I want to talk to you about a few things with that." She said. "But first, I want to hear you out, tell me about yourself sweetie."

She was smiling at the tiny pokemon, and he looked up to her face, he took a breath and licked his lips in nervousness before he began.

"I uh...okay...I haven't really told anyone except Espurr this ma'am...and she got into my head partially to draw it out...I uh...a few years ago I ran out on my dad..." Zorua said

"He...wasn't great...kinda like Wigglytuff, minus the killing parents I guess...at least that i'm aware of he didn't, but...he stole, swindled, hunted...he uh...didn't appreciate my presence, said I was a hindrance to him...when things didn't go his way, he'd lash out at me to evolve..." Zorua's voice went low, almost whispering "beat me sometimes..." The expression on the shiny Celebi softened...it was clear this still affected Zorua on some level, even if he kept it to himself.

"I uh...ran and ended up here in the forest...made a name for myself I guess...doing some bad things. Pranked your daughter and she had just gotten that shrinking technique...hurt me bad..." Zorua said but smiled a bit bitterly.

"Healed me though...wanted to help me...she's real kind ma'am...pretty...smart...best thing that ever happened to me." Zorua finished, he sighed and waited for the response...a pink finger came down and patted his head.

"The things that happened with Azurill...with Wigglytuff...I wonder if some of you rubbed off on her in a bad way but..." She sighed. "Zorua, if you'd reached out before this then..." Zorua nodded. "I know ma'am, it was my mistake to become the terror of the forest...I did my own reputation in, but I want to be better. Genuinely."

"...how old are you?"

"15..."

"Hmm....my Celi turned 16 about 3 months ago. Zorua, when I was her age I made my fair share of mistakes...and a lot of pokemon I thought I trusted only got close to me because of my powers. I don't want that to happen to my daughter. Your feelings for her...they're genuine? For her, not her powers...I get that impression from your story..." She smiled.
