"Absolutely, I love Celebi for Celebi, her smile, her goofy nature...her kindness. I suppose her powers are how we met for real, and how I was kept hidden for so long, but I love her for her." Zorua said, making eye contact. Celebi's mom smiled.

"It's alright, you can stay with us...this whole situation is strange, but...maybe things'll work out for the better this way, right?" Zorua felt himself lifted up.

"I'll take you back to my daughter." She smiled as they exited the room.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: One on one talk with the mom

choices: "Mom's taken a day off, she wants to spend some more time with us "
"Come on Zorua, let's eat something, the we can call our friends and hang out."
"How about we spend the day together? Just me and you~"
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"He's all yours, sweetie."

Beaming, Celebi levitated her boyfriend back into her awaiting paws.

"Ca-Can he stay?" she stuttered unable to believe this all was happening.

Her mom was letting her date Zorua as well as letting him keep living with her? This had to be a dream.

A wonderful, lucid dream, one she didn't want to wake up from.

But then, reality hit the green time-traveler when both her mom and her boyfriend nodded their heads: this was no dream, this all was happening for real.

"Thanks mom!"

The pink Celebi found herself being physically assaulted by her green daughter as the younger time-traveler hugged her. She smiled as she returned the gesture.

It would a really adorable scene to watch, if it wasn't for the poor Zorua, who was in the middle of the hug, being squeezed between the two Celebi.

"Celi... ma'am..."

Both giantesses quickly broke the hug, giggling sheepishly while Zorua gasped for air. Something that didn't result too easy for the fox.

Luckily, before his lungs could pop out of his ribcage, the two time-travelers broke the hug, leaving him into his girlfriend's paws, red-faced, his mouth opening and closing as he desperately tried to fill his lungs with fresh air.

Celebi giggled nervously.

"Hehe, whoops..."

"Sorry sweetie..." her mom added sheepishly.

Zorua waved a paw in response.

Celebi smiled.

"Let's go in my - our - room Zorua, before dinner... we'll spend some time alone~," Celebi sang, causing Zorua's tail to start wagging.

However, the elder time-traveler had another idea.

"... What do you say if we do something together instead?" she suggested, before hastily explaining upon noticing the look on the couple's faces,

"I'd like to spend some time with the both of you... honey, I've been quite distant these days... plus, I need to keep an eye on both of you. To prevent funny stuff going on between you."

The declaration made Celebi flush bright red and Zorua snicker nervously.

The younger fairy decided to let it slide, and focused on Zorua, who shrugged.

"... Sounds good?" he offered.

Celebi's mom smiled, but said nothing more.

Instead, she turned around and disappeared into the kitchen, leaving her confused daughter and her even-more-confused boyfriend behind.

The elder time-traveler returned a few minutes later, telekinetically holding a plate of food, two steaming cups and a third cup filled with a dark liquid, small bubbles rising and popping in mid-air; Zorua identified it as soda.

The food and drinks were set on a coffee table in between the TV and the couch, where Celebi's mom sat, motioning for her daughter to do the same.

Celebi did as told and sat down next to her mom while she psychically switched off the lights, turning on the TV, which projected a sinister shadow on the wall behind the three pokemon as it enlightened the room.

"We can watch a movie." the pink Celebi declared with a smile. The green Celebi smiled too, while Zorua stared at the TV attentively.

Something told him that he wasn't going to like this evening.

--

Zorua's suppositions turned out to be quite true.

Only after two full hours of being forced to watch a romantic movie with the two fairies (Celebi kept crying all the time; although she hid it pretty well, her mom couldn't stop a few tears from glistening her eyes) he was finally being carried back into Celebi's bedroom.

"Seriously? Seriously?!" he screamed, annoyed.

"That was easily one of the best movies I've seen, Zorua," Celebi mused, one of her paws leaving the fox as she wiped her eyes.

The Dragonair of the movie had rejected the beautiful Milotic to stay with his love, Altaria. A scene that Zorua wanted to get rid of badly.

Celebi climbed in her bed, and the lights were turned off by psychic.

The fairy smiled as she heard the door of her mother's room shutting.

"I'm so happy Zorua..." she said, kissing the fox.

He blushed.

"Yeah... me too..." he said, and Celebi gleefully took notice that he was smiling despite his embarrassed behavior.

"Well then... goodnight Zorua. Sleep tight." she said, readjusting the fox on her chest.

The dark-type nuzzled himself into his giant girlfriend, getting comfortable.

"Yeah, you too Celi," he said.

Both pokemon closed their eyes and, soon, they both fell asleep.

--

"Rise and shine Zorua!"

The dark-type hazily opened his eyes, letting out a sound between a drowsy yawn and an annoyed sigh, before finding himself face-to-body with his gigantic girlfriend.

"W-What time is it?" he sleepily asked, while a green finger gently petted his back.

"About 9 AM, Zorua." Celebi giggled while Zorua groaned.

As nice as she could be after the incident, Celebi had a thing for forcing the poor fox out of bed too early in the morning

"... So? What's the plan for today?" he asked, attempting to change subject to avoid him or her getting annoyed in a fight over his right to sleep in.

Celebi smiled.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: A boring evening and an early awakening

choices: "I know, why don't I grow you and you carry me around!"
"Why don't we both explore like this!"
"I think I prefer the world of the giants, i'm gonna grow back!"
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"Well...since the whole incident, you've been going out and about in town on your own at times...but we haven't spent time, just the two of us much lately..." Celebi said with a smile. Zorua contemplated this and nodded.

"You're right." He said, looking at the green giantess, with this she leaned in, her face eclipsing his view, then finally, just her lips eclipsing his view. Her hot breath washed over him, smelling vaguely of mint as she spoke.

"I know I am, that's why it's just you and me today~" She whispered before her lips puckered and soon the warmth, the softness, the slight dampness of Celebi's lips overtook Zorua's face, pressing themselves into him as they seemed to invigorate the small dark type with an energy he didn't think he'd find at 9 in the morning. He leaned into the lips as much as he could, and tried to kiss back, his face flush red at this point, as he enjoyed the moment.

Celebi for her part felt him kiss back and started blushing herself...it was such an odd sensation though, having a doll sized pokemon as a boyfriend kissing her like this. Eventually she pulled back and stared lovingly at her boyfriend.

"So...j-just us, huh..." He stuttered a bit as he grinned. "That's cool! What are ya thinking?" He asked, hoping it wasn't just staying in and reading.

At this point Celebi put her paw to her chin, thinking.

"We could stay in...play some games, read books...could go out to your forest...or maybe..."

Celebi tried something that caught Zorua off guard as Celebi's eyes glowed and soon...she started to shrink...smaller until she looked like normal size to Zorua.

"Woooooow....this is so surreal...this is how you see the world when you're small like this?" Celebi said, looking around her room, then to Zorua.

"Yeah...i've gotten used to it though!"

"Hmm..." Celebi started thinking again then smiled.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Just the two of them

choices: Zorua opted to go see their friends
Zorua started walking, headed to his woods
Zorua decided to just walk around. Hopefully, nobody was going to see Celebi
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"I know!" Celebi chimed, smiling at Zorua.

Before the fox could ask what she meant, the green time-traveler wrapped him in a hug.

"Why don't we role-switch? You seem to enjoy your situation when you're this small - and with me of course - so I'm asking myself, why don't I try it out?... From a researcher's point of view, of course." she said.

Zorua blinked.

"Celi, sweetheart, I didn't really get the gist..."

Celebi grinned, before the familiar blue glow came to her eyes.

Ever since she created her size-changing ability, she never actually thought of shrinking herself. And after what happened to Zorua the first time she did, the thought seemed to elude her mind.

But now, seeing how happy Zorua looked when tiny...

As for the fox, he didn't know what to think.

You wake up one morning with your girlfriend being a towering giant, and the next moment you're the giant towering above your girlfriend.

He looked at the now doll-sized fairy that was barely taller than his red paws. She already was shorter than him (when he was normal-sized of course), but now...

"Celebi?"

"You still don't get it, do you my silly giant, adorable Zorua?" she asked as she flew up to muzzle of the now titanic Zorua.

"No. Not really." he said, before recalling something.
"... I get the role-switch thing though and- ohh..." realization hit Zorua along with a blush the spread across his cheeks.

Celebi nodded at the blushing titan.

"Yep! Today I get to sit back-" Zorua watched as his tiny girlfriend flew upwards; he soon felt her small, nearly weightless body landing on his head,
"... While I understand why you enjoy being tiny so much... and you're gonna show me, of course! How does that sound? You carrying me around..."

Zorua snickered.

"Sounds like I'm gonna get Braixen for a movie. You drag me to see those romantic-" he paused to grimace,
"... And now, I'll drag you to see what I want!"

If Zorua could see the top of his head, he would have wished he never spoke.

"You know, right, that I can grow back at any time, huh?" Celebi mused as she patted the head of the giant fox.

"Right..." he said with a hint of resignation, before grinning again.
"Well, let's get going." he added as he began walking towards the front door, shaking Celebi's world.

The fairy gripped the strands of slate-grey fur that surrounded her, momentarily forgetting that there was no real danger of falling off since she could fly.

"Zorua, going where?" she wondered as she regained her balance.

The fox slowed down a bit.

"Good question." he replied as he walked out of the house, closing the door back behind him.

He grinned

"Gonna show you how amazing being like that is!... Hopefully without breaking your leg, like you did to me! How would I feel then?" he snickered, causing Celebi to sigh.

"You would feel my wrath, that you would feel..." she said.
"Stop teasing and get going, big guy."

Silenced by the clear threat, Zorua looked around, deciding what to do...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Role Switch

choices: Zorua and Celebi got to the forest safely
Celebi bumped into someone, causing Zorua to drop his illusion!
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"I know Zorua, why don't we both explore around like this? It'll be fun!" Celebi chimed, admiring how her bedroom now seemed endless.

"Hmm..." Zorua hesitated, but a sudden twist of Celebi's face into a sad look made him grin.
"... Okay." he agreed.

Instantly, the sad expression Celebi wore faded into a beaming smile; she rushed to Zorua and wrapped her paw around his sides.

"Hang on Zorua, we've got to get down," she said, lifting herself and Zorua in the air as she flew down to the floor.

"Wow... everything's so... huge..." Celebi chimed as she looked around her room; she and Zorua couldn't be taller than two really tiny dolls.

"You'll get used to it... doll," Zorua snickered; his girlfriend just turned around, wearing a smirk.
"I might be a doll, but you're the one who wears doll clothes." she stated, causing Zorua to quit laughing to glare at her.

"Let's go." Celebi said smugly as she looked up at the door handle, which was pulled by the fairy's psychic.

Celebi motioned for Zorua to stand back; he obeyed as the door was opened. The green fairy fluttered above Zorua and landed on top of his back, her legs crossing under his stomach and her arms around his neck.

"Hey!" Zorua complained, but a familiar pair of lips touching his cheek silenced him.

Celebi giggled, her wings flapped as she, along with Zorua, rose up in the air.

"You're strong." Zorua commented as the floor receded under his legs.

"Being a legendary has its uses." Celebi self-praised as she peered past Zorua's head to see where she was going.

It took a while, but Celebi flew into her kitchen, landing on top of the table.

"Can we grab some breakfast? I'm kinda hungry." Zorua said as his girlfriend flew off his back, smiling at him.
"I was thinking the same thing." she replied, gazing at a cupboard, which psychically opened; from a bag of cookies, a single cookie flew to the shrunken couple: it was the size of a boat.

"This is awesome," Celebi commented, growing more and more excited each minute she spent as a shrunken legendary,
"I can't see why you were scared the first time I did this to you,"

Zorua huffed, sending crumbles everywhere, his mouth already full of chocolate.

"Throw yourself from this table without flying, you'll see," he snapped back, lifting the paw that was once broken by the same pokemon sitting in front of him,
"It still hurts, y'know..."

Celebi blushed, and giggled awkwardly.

"Sorry about that..." she said as she began eating too.

Zorua grinned.
"All forgotten - let's eat on it!" he said cheerfully, showing the he didn't hold any hard feelings for the fairy. Not anymore at least.

Celebi beamed.

The duo ate in silence, before both fell down.

"I can't grab another bite." Celebi declared, regarding the giant cookie: even in two, her and Zorua still couldn't eat more than half of it.

"Me neither..." Zorua agreed, scratching his ear with his hind leg.
"So... whaddya think of being tiny, Celi?" he asked.

"I think you complain too much about it - seen in this light, it's wonderful." she chimed, smirking at the fox.

"Well, I can't help but complain when you force me to do things! Seriously, wearing that stupid bow is humiliating!" Zorua retorted.

"Oh, shut up you," Celebi giggled, telekinetically drawing Zorua close to her and pecking his forehead.

The dark-type blushed.

"Hey Celi, wanna go outside?" he suggested, taking the fairy aback.

"O-Outside? But Zorua - there's other pokemon! If they see us like this-" Celebi trailed off when Zorua raised a paw.

"... You'll grow us back, but that ain't gonna happen because I'm going to cover us with an illusion." he said, grinning.
"We can go to my forest! We'll have fun, there's some stuff I wanna show you - at this size it'll be hilarious!... and we'll be alone..." the thought alone made something between Zorua's legs shiver.

Celebi seemed to be thinking.

"Hmm... it could work..." she mused, trying to not think of some angry pokemon chasing her and Zorua down if they somehow found them.

She smiled.

"Okay Zorua," she flew back into Zorua's... back, adopting her previous position,
"I think you're right for once,"

The fox snickered.

"For once?" he parroted back,
"You just don't like when I outsmart you."

"Shut up." Celebi replied as the table suddenly came up missing beneath the two, which soared across the kitchen and into the hallway; soon, the fairy and the fox where hovering in front of the from door, which Celebi opened with psychic, allowing the two of them to exit the house.

True to his word, Zorua hid himself and his girlfriend behind an illusion that made them look like they weren't there.

The door closed again, apparently shut by the wind.

Celebi looked back at the village, seeing many pokemon walking around, merrily unaware of the shrunken couple that would have joined them soon.

"Let's go." Zorua whispered.

Celebi obeyed as she started flying, headed to Zorua's forest.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: The Shrunken Duo

choices: One of their friends?
A mean Pokémon?
Someone else?
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content: Who does Celebi bump into?
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: A choice

choices: ... everyone staring at him with concern...
... Zorua and Celebi, asleep...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Screams erupted inside the room.

Azurill's brain didn't even register them. All he knew was that he did it. He attempted suicide.

The simple action gave him an odd sense of peace... no more Zorua, no more Buneary, no more life as a doll... just the warm, loving embrace of his beloved mom.

Tears flew from his eyes as she thought about her. He was about to see her again...

Time around him seemed to slow down as he fell towards the floor. Out of the corner of his eye, he saw Espurr with glowing eyes, Braixen diving to catch him...

But they didn't make it in time.

Azurill hit the ground, nearly breaking his head on the hardwood floor, making no sound at all. With his consciousness rapidly fading, he looked up, seeing alerted faces he couldn't make out because of his blurry vision.

Darkness started seeping in his eyes, and he greeted it with open arms.

Only one word found its way out of his mouth as he blacked out.

"Mom."

--

Azurill opened his eyes.

Was he dead? Was he still alive? He was pretty sure that he hit the floor... he should be dead for good...

He looked around, finding himself in an odd place... everything was white around... except for a blue spot in front of him.

As his vision fully cleared, he made out the figure, recognized it... and his vision became blurry with tears.

"Mom!" he shouted.

It worked! He was with his mom again!

He ran to her, wanting to hug her... but his body went right through hers. Azurill fell on the ground, before hastily getting back to his feet and looking at the Azumarill in front of him, who gave him a sad smile.

"Azurill... my sweet, sweet child..." she said, her voice making Azurill cry.

"Mom..." Azurill repeated as he sniffled. She nodded... before her smile dropped.
"Azurill... dearie, why did you do that? Why did you want to end your life?" she asked softly.

The small mouse cried.
"I couldn't... I didn't want to be a doll, mom! They were treating me like one just because of Zorua! H-He called me a coward!... I wanted to see you again..." he whimpered.

The Azumarill's expression didn't change.

"I didn't give you life for you to waste it." she lectured, causing Azurill to look up, tears rolling down his cheeks.

Azumarill continued,
"Azurill... I'm highly disappointed with you... you didn't have to try such thing!" she said.

He sniffled.
"Well... doesn't m-matter n-now, right? I-I'm dead..." he said.

And his mom smiled.

"No dearie, you're not dead... you're luckily still alive..." she said.

Azurill felt a pain in his chest.

It... didn't work... he was still alive.

"And you should be grateful for it, young man," his mom scolded, making him cry harder.
"M-Mom..."

"Azurill, listen to me," Azumarill said, her paws clasping.
"Don't do that again my sweet child... you're so young, live your life, be happy... you must live for me too... I'll always be with you, no matter what," she said as she stepped forward.

And finally, Azurill's wish came true.

He hugged her, hugged as hard as he could, crying into her chest.

She too cried.

"Now go sweet child... it's time for you to return where you belong, back to the living..." she said, hugging harder.
"And... try giving Zorua a chance... you might find that he truly changed..." she told.

Then, with a smile, Azumarill released her son.

More tears rolled down Azurill's cheeks.
"Mom..." he told, when his surroundings started shaking...

Startled, Azurill looked at his mother... but found that she was fading away.

The blue mouse cried harder.
"M-Mom! I... I love you!" he shouted.

Azumarill smiled, her lips moved... but Azurill didn't register the sound...


Azurill's eyes shot wide open as he woke up from what seemed an endless slumber.

Then, like someone was whispering in his ear, he heard a voice,

‘Mom loves you too my wonderful child.’

--

Azurill hastily looked around with his vision blurry. He was feeling oddly peaceful... so, it was true... he wasn't dead...

The blue mouse's vision finally cleared as he looked up, noticing...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Oniric remedy

choices: "... Bring him to your house, Buneary, and keep a close eye on him..."
"... Why don't you stay over? We need to make sure he doesn't try anything..."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Blurred figures appeared in front of Azurill's eyes.

He moaned softly as he started blinking.

"He's waking up." a voice said, clearly referring to him.
"Finally!" another voice spoke.

Azurill finally opened his eyes... Celebi, Espurr, Buneary, Braixen and Zorua were staring at him with concern, the last from his usual perch behind the paws of Celebi. Oddly, he too looked concerned... but quickly adopted a neutral expression once he noted that Azurill was staring at him.

The blue mouse noted he was resting on top of Celebi's bed, a bandage wrapped around his head. Azurill grunted as he felt a lingering ache in his temples.

"... I'll get some water." Celebi broke the silence as she stepped back and headed for the door, carrying Zorua along with her.

Buneary watched her leave, before looking at the blue pokemon on the bed.

"How do you feel Azurill...?" she asked softly.

He didn't respond.

"What you did was extremely dumb, Azurill! You could've died!" Braixen scolded, placing her paws on her hips as she towered above him.

"That was sorta his intention, Braixen - his mind was unstable... it still is, but..." Espurr stopped to smile at the small blue ball, having seen his thoughts and, as a result, the dream he had.

"... I'm sure you won't try again, am I right Azurill?" she asked.

And, for the first time since he woke up, Azurill finally responded by nodding his head.

"Mom... I only wanted to see my mom. She wants me to live... she wants me to be happy... she loves me..." he mumbled.

Braixen looked shocked.
"Ehm... Azurill, dear, don't know how to tell ya but your mom is kinda..."

"I know..." Azurill interrupted with a dejected expression as he tried to sit up... his headache acted up, leading him to lay back down in pain.

Azurill sighed.
"... That wasn't a dream... I saw my mom... she hugged me... told me to live... to give Zorua a-"

"... An earful for rejecting your forced apologies?"

Everyone one looked to see Celebi entering the room, holding a cup with one paw, while Zorua was riding on her head.

"... By the way, if y'all think this is a good way to travel, it is not." he remarked, causing Celebi to use her free paw to playfully smack him.

"Quiet you." she said with a smirk as she walked over the bed.

Her smirk dropped as she eyed the bed's tiny occupant.

"Here Azurill..." the fairy said, gently lowering the glass to the mouse's lips. He gladly accepted it, and drank slowly.

"... Azurill, know that we're highly disappointed... true, Zorua did wrong by not accepting your apology - though he had a good reason - but you didn't have to attempt suicide!" she scolded as the tiny mouse drank.

He signaled that he had enough water, and Celebi removed the glass.

Azurill took a moment to swallow, before looking at Celebi.

"Speaking of... do you accept his apologies now, Zorua?" she asked, looking up at the dark type, who eyed Azurill.

"... No."

Everyone in the room but Azurill sighed in exasperation.

"Zorua..." Celebi said as she frowned. But the fox was firmer than she was.

"No Celebi, no ‘Zorua’. I can't simply accept an apology coming from a pokemon who apologized only because he hoped to get away from Buneary!" he said, indignantly as he turned his head away from the mouse.

"His apology wasn't sincere, and I won't accept it. This is my last say, Celebi, and if you, or anyone else, is got something to say against me, just grow me back and I'm outta here."

Celebi looked up, shocked. For a moment, she couldn't help but admire her boyfriend, who had fiery eyes. He was right...

No one spoke after Zorua's outburst - they all knew he had all the right.

Celebi sighed dejectedly as she looked back down at Azurill.
"I'm sorry Azurill... there's nothing I... we can do for you... We can't force Zorua to change his opinion..." she told, before quickly adding,
"But you... can't deny he's right... you weren't totally sincere... please, don't try to commit suicide again..."

Azurill simply sighed, not caring about Zorua's refusal of his apologies. He had to give him a chance like his mom asked... but he'd take some time before apologizing again.

Right now, the fox was indignant, and apologizing again would end with another refuse.

"I won't... I don't want to die." he said.
"Mom wants me to live. And I WILL live."

Celebi looked at Espurr, the simple action of her turning her head causing Zorua to be thrown off his perch.

She caught him in her paws, him slightly startled, but maintaining his firm expression.

"... Espurr?"

"I don't know." that wasn't something Espurr told very often.
"His mind is in an inordinate state... I don't know what he will do in the near future."

Celebi sighed, before her gaze traveled to Buneary.

"Buneary..."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Another refuse

choices: "I'd prefer to just stay right here and think."
"Maybe a bit...I don't know."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"Why don't you stay over Buneary? We can make sure he doesn't try anything like that again." The bunny pokemon looked at her and nodded. "Okay, let me call my mom...can you talk to her too? I haven't been home a lot lately..." Buneary said and went to use Celebi's phone. "I'm gonna head out myself...i've stayed pretty late and this whole thing was...a bit of a disaster...it isn't over though." Braixen said, nodding to Celebi and Celebi had an unreadable expression before letting her leave.

"I'll be going as well. I need to do some cleaning." Espurr said, deadpan as ever as she made her exit.

"Zorua..." Celebi bit her lip. "If I grow you back, will you watch him for a sec while I talk with Lopunny? It'll just be a sec." Celebi said and Zorua, though a bit hesitant, nodded. "Yeah, i'll watch the brat." He said as he felt a familiar growth start to happen and his surroundings shrunk. His eyes fell on the tiny blue mouse who had an...unreadable expression.

"...I'll be back." She said as she exited the room.

An awkward silence hung in the air before, surprisingly, Azurill spoke.

"Insincere apologies? Yours were today?" And Zorua gave him a steely look.

"Kid...it's best for you to shut up." Zorua growled and Azurill didn't seem to change his expression. "Maybe you have changed Zorua, I wouldn't know...I haven't seen enough of you like this...maybe you haven't, nothing you've said or done has helped me make an opinion on it...my mom...seems to think I should give you a chance...but it doesn't erase what you did you know? You can't see it but...your actions made life harder for Swinub, for me...for a lot of pokemon. If you've truly changed, truly are different...I just want you to know that. I want you to understand that...the peace you have now...you took from others, that's all. You're right...my apology wasn't sincere, and honestly, it's kinda funny for me to say this now, but i'm sorry for that...and if the story about your dad is true...sorry for what I said...it was wrong of me...but it doesn't erase the past Zorua. And it doesn't make what you've done any less wrong." Azurill didn't raise his voice, didn't scream or cry, he simply stated it all in an even tone. Zorua listened to this all and contemplated a few things before sighing. The kid might have a point...but right now, emotions and tension was raw and he frankly didn't feel like hashing this out right now.

"Kid...let's save this talk for another time." And with that silence overtook the room again.

Soon Celebi and Buneary returned. "So...it's fine for her to stay over tonight."

"Yeah, mom just wants me home early tomorrow." The bunny smiled. Soon Zorua felt the room growing and Celebi picked him up cheerfully.

"Azurill...are you good to move around?"
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: A conversation between the two.

choices: "Tell me about your day..." he responds, trying to not sound uninterested
"Let's play with board games..." he responds, trying to not sound bored
Before he can reply, Celebi's mom comes into the room!
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Braixen shook her head.
"I think I'll go home now... I've teased you enough~" she snickered while looking at the tiny Zorua in Celebi's paws.

He snorted, before grinning.
"You also stepped in with Wigglytuff, so we're even." he responds, making Braixen blush.

Celebi looks curiously.
"Why? What happened with Wigglytuff?" she asks, before glaring at Zorua.
"You didn't pull any pranks, did you?"

The fox put a paw to his chest.
"I swear I didn't."

Braixen nodded.
"That's true..." she confirms, before turning around.
"Now I should really get going... but I'll keep in touch. See ya!" she said, venturing out of the forest and in direction of the village.

Celebi watches her leaving, before looking down at Zorua.
"So? What happened with Wigglytuff?" she asks again.

"Nothing."

"Tell me, and I won't make you wear the hat on the trip back home." the fairy says with a smirk.

Zorua sighed.

--

"Jerk." Celebi simply commented upon hearing Zorua's story.

He simply nodded as the fairy stood up from the log, the bags starting to float in midair.

"I don't blame him for what I've done to Swinub, but I've done absolutely nothing today..." Zorua says, quietly scratching his ears with his hind left leg.

Celebi sighs as she hugs the fox and proceeds to walk out of the forest, her bags floating behind her.

"I'll be honest Zorua: I really thought you'd pull a prank or two while I wasn't there... I'm impressed." she says, lowering her head to peck the fox.

He smiled.
"Try trusting me sometime."

Celebi giggles.
"You know... you deserve a reward, I think," she says cheerfully.

Zorua perks up.
"Oh! A matchstick and five minutes alone?!" he asked with excitement.

Celebi tilted her head.
"Why would you want a-" she started, before shaking her head as she realized.
"You're still planning to burn the bow and the hat, aren't you?"

"... No?"

The green fairy sighed.
"And... no." she said, causing Zorua to sigh in annoyance.
"But I guess you can take those off before we go to sleep..." she says.

Zorua smiled meekly.
"Better than nothing."

--

"You just ate. I don't understand how can you still think about chips." Celebi says distractedly as she reads her book, Zorua eating his hickory chips.

They had returned home. Zorua used an illusion that allowed him to disappear from eyesight - he was supposed to be still in Celebi's bedroom. That allowed him to eat along with Celebi and her mother. In fact, Celebi 'accidentally dropped' food onto her lap whenever her mother looked down or got distracted.

"I could seriously sleep in the bag - oh, can I?" he asked with sparkling eyes, earning a weird look from the fairy.

"You're weird."

Zorua shrugs.
"You're the one dating me - that makes you weird as well." he snickers.

Celebi giggles.
"Guess I asked for that~" she says, snatching the bag of chips up and putting it away in her closet.

"Aw come on!" Zorua exclaimed dejectedly.

The fairy giggled.
"Nope~" she sang, laying back on the bed and closing her book.

She then grabbed a hold of him and set him down on her chest, her paws resting on his back as she looked at him.
"Now, I believe it is way too early to go to sleep now, Zorua~" she said cheerfully.

"... And? You took my chips away to tell me this?" he asked.

Celebi giggled.
"Nope. We're doing something together Zorua... wanna play with board games?" she asked.

Zorua sighed.
"Seriously, have you got nothing else but board games and books for entertainment?" he asked.

"And I enjoy those," Celebi responded with a smile.
"But if you don't want to play, I can always tell you about my day... and you tell me about yours...?" she suggested.

Zorua looked at her, quite wanting to reveal that he had no interest in hearing about Celebi and her mother doing girl stuff... but then again, she was the girl he loved... he didn't want to disappoint her, right?

He sighed.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: After-dinner with Celebi

choices: "... why didn't you tell me sooner?" she said with a smile
"... needless to say, he'll have to go..." she sighed.
"... he can stay I suppose... ON a condition." she told
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Celebi's mom held Zorua in front of her face as she examined the well made pokedoll. That really felt like real fur beneath her fingers. She was staring at him intently, so she couldn't see he daughter furiously biting her lip.

"You know honey... after all you made a good choice picking this - it feels like a real Zorua..." she said, one of her pink fingers casually brushing against Zorua's nose.

His eyes shrunk as he felt a tingling sensation in his nostrils.

He had to sneeze.

‘Please stay in, please don't come out, please please please...’ Zorua thought.

Sadly, he couldn't contain himself.

His mouth opened.

"ACHOO!"

Celebi's heart stopped beating for a moment as she saw her mother staring at Zorua with surprise. And she was quick to formulate a plan.

"... Sorry mom." she said, rubbing her face, pretending that the sneeze came from her. The older Celebi didn't buy it as she looked at her daughter skeptically.

"Celebi..." she said.

Her gaze traveled back to the pokedoll in her paw... only to find that there was no pokedoll, but an alive Zorua, rubbing his nose with a paw.

Startled, the pink Celebi let go and he fell on the bed in front of the green Celebi.

"Sorry Celi..." he mumbled.

"We're dead..." the fairy whispered to herself, only Zorua able to hear her.

The pink Celebi placed her paws on her hips as she stared sternly at her daughter.
"Honey?"

Reluctantly, Celebi looked up into the green eyes of her mom.

"Is that the real Zorua?"

Celebi meekly nodded her head. There was no denying that now, Zorua was discovered.

And he would be thrown out he was lucky. As for Celebi herself... she didn't know.

The pink Celebi inhaled sharply in disappointment.
"Well... I think I deserve an explanation. Why is the most infamous pokemon of the village tiny and in your room pretending to be a pokedoll?"

Zorua meekly looked up.

However, Celebi tensed up.

"... Because he's not infamous anymore mom." she quietly said, earning a curious look from her surprisingly calm mother.
"Zorua here... went through something bad. I... I helped him." Celebi recalled the moment she healed his leg.

That moment, their friendship and successive relationship started... although Celebi was very careful to leave such details out of her speech.

The older time traveler blinked, her gaze landing on Zorua.
"... Hi, ma'am..." he meekly said.

"... Is that true, Zorua?" she asked softly.
"Did you change?"

He nodded.
"Yes... no more pranks..." he told.

Celebi's mom sighed.
"Okay." she said, closing her eyes.
"That's very nice of you, and it's nice that you helped him Celebi... but none of these things does actually respond to my questions. Why is he tiny? Why is he here?" she asked.

"I... I shrunk him..." Celebi admitted.

Her mother blinked in surprise.
"... Since when you have shrinking abilities...?" she asked, confused.
"... Remember that TM Gardevoir gave me?" Celebi responded, looking at her desk with glowing eyes.

A pen shrunk.

The pink Celebi looked at it with confusion, before looking back at the two pokemon on the bed.
"... Okay?... On to the second question... why is he here...?" she asked, deciding to just accept what she saw without an explanation.

Celebi bit her lip, before opening her mouth to speak... but Zorua preceded her.

"It was..." he nervously cleared his throat as the pink giantess looked at him.
"I really had... I really had no place to stay ma'am... Celebi discovered, and she offered me to stay here..." he explained.

Celebi's mom looked at him with a mix of pity and mistrust.
"You... are you homeless?" she asked, searching for a confirm.

He nodded.

The pink time traveler looked at Celebi on the bed.
"Celebi..."

Like she snapped out of a trance, Celebi clasped her paws.
"Please mom-don't throw him out-let him stay-I'll take care of him-you won't even see him-please please please please-"

"Celebi!"

Instantly, the green fairy went quiet as she looked at her mother pleadingly.

"... Let me understand - Zorua is not a scoundrel anymore because you helped him, and he's tiny because you shrunk him and suggested he came living into our house because he's actually homeless?" she asks.

Celebi meekly nods her head.

"Well..."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Discovered

choices: "Come on Zorua, let's have dinner with my mom."
"Zorua, want to hang out with me and my mom tomorrow?"
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"...Zorua, I need to talk to my daughter alone." The older Celebi said as she set the little dark type back on the bed. She motioned for her daughter to follow her and slowly, the younger Celebi looked at Zorua and got up, hanging her head as both of them left the room, shutting the door.

"Welp, back to roughin' it." Zorua said as he looked at the door, figuring that when it opened back up he was going to be thrown out.

-

The older Celebi had her arms crossed as she looked at her daughter, who seemed to be looking at the ground. Eventually she sighed. "Honestly Celebi, you know how I feel about you being around shady pokemon or boy pokemon..." She said and Celebi looked up. "But...but..."

"Okay missy, you need to tell me what has been going on since you've been taking care of him, EXACTLY what's been going on!" She said and Celebi sighed.

"You're going to throw him out if I do..." She muttered and the older time traveler just gave her a look. "I assume then, that you and him are-"

"Mom, he had the crush on me, and and he's a really nice pokemon now...he's funny and wouldn't hurt anyone...he's had his own share of issues too and and-"

The older Celebi cut her off with a sigh as she rubbed her own forehead. "Arceus above give me strength..." She muttered before looking at Celebi. "You know i'm only trying to protect you right?" She said and the younger Celebi nodded. "But please...I want to protect him too..." Celebi said. "He doesn't have anyone mom..." And the older pokemon looked at her daughter sympathetically before closing her eyes. Her daughter really cared about him huh...?

"Okay."

The younger Celebi blinked. "...Okay?"

"Okay...if you're sure about him i'll trust you on this...you've always been such a sweet girl Celebi, and i'm proud of you for that, you and I can do things that others can't and i've always been proud that you don't abuse that. Zorua himself might benefit from being around someone like you, it would explain why things are quiet with him...he can stay."

Celebi's eyes lit up before her mom continued. "HOWEVER! I have rules! And they will be adhered to!" She said and the younger Celebi snapped to attention.

"Rule 1! No pranks from him! At anyone! Ever! The second I hear of it he's out." She said and Celebi nodded. She'd reinforce that to him, but that shouldn't be hard.

"Rule 2! Nothing untoward for pokemon your age! From either of you! I know how kids are at your age and it's fine if you have feelings for each other, but if anything happens that shouldn't...he's not only out but he'll probably avoid the both of us after what I do to him!" She said and Celebi nodded, Zorua hadn't suggested anything like that yet so she thought that was fine too.

"Rule 3! Please...make each other happy." She smiled at her daughter who smiled back. "Thank you mom..." The older Celebi smiled. "If anything...maybe he'll help you spend more time outside, right?" She said to her daughter. "Now...I'd like to get to know him better too, so..."

-

Zorua sat on the bed thinking before Celebi walked back in. She breathed a sigh of relief before smiling. "It's okay Zorua...you can stay." She said and Zorua looked surprised. "...Seriously?" He said and she nodded. "But there are a few ground rules too, but don't worry, they're easy. As for now..."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Letting him stay

choices: Zorua goes with Celebi and her mom, doll-sized
Zorua goes with Celebi and her mom, normal-sized
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Celebi gave a smile as she eyed the tiny fox on top of her bed. He was still quite shocked that her mom was letting him stay... although that a big part of him was sighing in relief - he could remain in the only house he's ever had and he got to keep his girlfriend.

Celebi sat on the bed next to him, causing the fox to bounce a little. She gently picked him up and set him on her lap.
"Say Zorua..." she started, gently starting to pet the small dark type.

"So? About those rules?" he interrupted.

Celebi smiled.
"No pranks, no weird stuff - that's debatable~ - and make each other happy..." she repeated cheerfully, before getting to the point.
"Zorua, do you want to hang out with me and my mom tomorrow? She's got a day off from work and wants to know you better."

He perked up.

"... To sit back, watch you and your mom doing girl stuff while commenting on how ‘you're so cute with that bow’?" he glared at his dreaded blue nemesis which was resting on Celebi's nightstand.

Celebi giggled.
"Probably." she admitted gleefully.

"And my answer is: no." he responded.
"I'll just stay here."

Celebi grinned.
"Zorua, I asked for your opinion alright. But I didn't really give you a choice - mom wants to know you better. Get on her good side and we'll be free to stay together without... unwanted attention from her." she said.

That sounded enticing, Zorua noted. However...

"... I'll be bored..." he complained.

"I'll make sure we're doing something you like tomorrow." Celebi reassured.
"... Aren't ya too old to carry pokedolls with you?" that was Zorua's last, feeble attempt.
"Plus, I can't mantain an illusion for a whole day... I know it seems simple, but it takes a lot out of me..."

And it apparently failed as Celebi merely grinned.
"Whoever talked about me carrying a doll? I'll be carrying the REAL you, cutie~" she responded, gripping Zorua and laying down on her bed, her long green arms holding Zorua far up in the air.

Zorua blinked.
"... Are you kidding? It people see me like this, I'm dead!... Arceus, Wigglytuff would EAT me!"

"I'd strangle him right after... but I see your point." Celebi told, rubbing her forehead.
"Maybe... you can come with us... normal sized? I mean... it's not like you have to hide from mom anymore..." she reasoned.

Zorua pondered the perspective, but he couldn't do so for long.

"Honey~... Zorua. Dinner!" Celebi's mom called from out of the door.

"Coming mom!" the fairy says, grabbing her tiny boyfriend and heading for the door.

--

Celebi shook HER Zorua as she tried to wake him up.
"Zorua~ wake up~ we're going out~" she sang cheerfully.

Zorua groaned in his sleep, but managed to cling to his dream and remain asleep.

"Come on, roomie~ we've got a day of fun ahead of us~" the fairy said, leaning down to peck his cheek.

Not noticing her mom entering the room.

The pink Celebi watched her daughter kissing Zorua... and smiled.
‘Kids.’ she thought as she saw Celebi trying to wake him up.

She got a smirk on her face and moved forward.

Celebi cries in surprise as a pink arm suddenly pushes her aside.
"Out of bed!" her mom exclaimed, causing Zorua to make a leap.

"Yes ma'am!" he cried in alert as he turned around to see a snickering pink Celebi and his startled girlfriend.

The older fairy looked at the two pokemon.
"Well? Breakfast is ready you two. We're heading out in half an hour~" she told cheerfully while exiting the room.

Celebi blinked a few times, before looking down at Zorua, who was looking perplexed.

The green fairy shook her head and smiled.
"Good morning~" she said, pecking him on a cheek.

He blushed, but smiled.

"Mornin'..."

--

"... Anyway, are you coming with us like that... or do you want to be normal sized, Zorua?" Celebi asked her boyfriend as she and her mom sat at the table.

The pink fairy sipped coffee from a steaming cup she was holding.
"Honestly, I think you should remain like that... to prevent funny ideas." she spoke.

"I said I'm done with funny ideas, ma'am." Zorua meekly responded.

However, Celebi didn't share her mom's opinion.

"What do you think would happen if someone saw him like that?" she asked while chewing a cookie.

"He brought that on himself..." her mom told, before giving the small fox a sympathetic smile.
"... But I'll deal with whoever attempts to bother us." she added.

"... Wigglytuff hates him. He could try to harm him..." Celebi continues. The older fairy smirked.
"How far can you psychically throw someone? At your age, I was quite good at it." she snickered.

Celebi giggled, before looking at her boyfriend.

"So, Zorua? What do you say?" Celebi asked.

Munching on his own cookie, Zorua thought about it.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: A day with the time traveling fairies

choices: Wigglytuff
Graveler
Gardevoir
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Zorua mulled on it as he ate at his cookie. He was vulnerable at this size...incredibly vulnerable, and he knew that if he went out like this, Celebi and her mom would probably be stopping at a doll shop to tease him or buy another accessory. He'd also probably end up wearing the damn bow. He hated that bow...

But he also pondered the other end of it. Who wasn't vulnerable? Celebi and her mom. He imagined that they'd probably be enough to keep him from harm, hell, probably be enough to make anyone think twice on implying anything too. It was also what Celebi's mom wanted which...he was quickly learning just how in charge she really was. The happier he made her he figured, the better. Plus, he also got to be the lazy one this way, he wouldn't be walking around all day like this. Eventually he nodded.

"It's fine Celebi, I can remain like this while we're out and about." He said and the older Celebi smiled. "I think that's for the best." And the younger Celebi shrugged. "If you're sure Zorua...then okay." She then grinned at the little Zorua. "But that means I need to get you dressed for the day~" She said snickering as Zorua gave her a deadpan look. "I thought that thing was to hide me from your mom and didn't have any other purpose?" He said and she snickered again. "Yeah right." She said as she got up and the older Celebi smiled as well. "Okay you two, just be quick."

-

Zorua sighed from Celebi's grip as they went around town. He HATED this bow, but he supposed in the long run it was a small price to pay really. The two giants had been eyeing different shops, clothes, cosmetics, sweets, etc. etc. he had kinda lost track at some point. He almost felt like he was dragged along as an afterthought with the two fairies enthusiastically talking to each other about girl stuff that he had no context, desire, or motivation to engage with. Eventually though he was dragged into the conversation. "So Zorua, how do you think this would look on me?" Celebi asked as she showed him a pink hat. "Um...like you wearing a hat?" And the older Celebi face palmed. "Oh dear..." She muttered and the younger Celebi just looked at him. "Zorua, you really are clueless." She sighed as she put the hat back. "It's alright, you'll pick up on it sooner or later." He didn't know what he had done, but apparently it was something? Celebi however, just smirked. "Here, i'll show you how you're SUPPOSED to answer~" She said as the older Celebi followed her daughter down to a shop a little ways away before smiling. 'Oh, I see...' And Zorua saw the shop before he started struggling. "Not again! Not again!" He said as they entered the pokedoll shop...

-

"Celebi, no..." Zorua said.

"But it's adorable~"

"Ma'am..." He meekly tried before the older Celebi shrugged at him, smiling.

"You need to learn somehow young man." She said.

He groaned as he tried to shake off the sailor hat that Celebi had attached to his head, but he couldn't shake it off on his own, it was strapped around his head and his paws gave him no way of unstrapping it. "At least tell me you aren't buying it..." He said and Celebi just smiled at him. "Of course I am~" She giggled and he just groaned again. So now he was stuck with a bow AND this dumb hat! It didn't help that he felt like eyes were on him now that he wasn't even really trying to hide. No one had bugged him he'd found, but it didn't stop the fact that he, Zorua, the baddest pokemon around, the raddest of the rad from HIS forest, the pokemon you don't mess with!...was here, out in the open, with two giggling girly fairies the size of a doll, wearing a cute~ blue bow and an adorable~ sailor hat!

Soon Celebi paid for the hat and Zorua found himself rocking two accessories. There was no way he would be able to show his face to certain pokemon again at this rate...Celebi looked at him and her mom smiling. "Hey, i've got an idea! Why don't we go see a movie!" She said and the older Celebi smiled. "That sounds fun, what about you Zorua?" And he seemed to shrug. "Sure...at least it'll be dark in there." He said making the two girls giggle.

-

"No Zorua."

"But...but..." He was staring longingly at the poster of the Haunter holding his claw over the head of a scared Hoppip, but the older Celebi was putting her foot down.

"Zorua...what's the rating on that movie?" She said.

"...Adult."

"And what are you?"

"...A young adult?" He offered as the older pokemon looked at him. He was defeated he knew.

"Mom, Zorua, what about this one?" They heard as Celebi was looking at a poster of a Jynx and Bewear hugging. The older Celebi came over smiling. "Oh, Lopunny was telling me about this one, she said her and Buneary liked it."

"It's a chick flick!" Zorua complained making the two girls giggle. "Come on, let's go get three tickets." She said as they approached the ticket booth.

-

"I really...really...thought it was just okay." Celebi shrugged as they were back out, noting that it was getting later in the afternoon. "I quite enjoyed it, what about you Zorua, how did you like it?" The older pokemon asked as Celebi giggled. "I think I can tell you how much HE liked it." She said as she showed her mom the sleeping Zorua in her paws. The older pokemon laughed at this. "He must have adored it!" They both laughed until they noticed that a pokemon was approaching them...and quickly, the pokemon seemed to be eyeing the sleeping Zorua too. It was...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Out and about

choices: ... stepping forward menacingly...
... grumbling as he walks off...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
In front of Celebi, a shocked Wigglytuff, eyeing the tiny, unconscious Zorua in her paws.

The pink bunny looked at him intently, while Celebi looked at him, ready to shrink him to a dot if he tried anything against her precious dark type.

Her mom remained eerily quiet.

"Hi there Wigglytuff," she said.
"What can we do for you?"

Wigglytuff stumbled back.
"I'm sorry but... Is that Zorua?" he asked breathlessly.

Zorua... the same Zorua that had psychologically traumatized Swinub, destroyed Azurill's precious doll, lures Munchlax into a pit... he was right before his eyes, doll-sized and asleep, wearing a blue bow and a sailor hat.

Celebi bit her lip.
"N-No? It's actually a very realistic pokedoll and-"

"Yes Wigglytuff. He's the real Zorua." her mother chimed in. Celebi looked at her, instinctively hugging Zorua to her chest.

What did her mom have in mind...?

She looked into the pink Celebi's green eyes, an expression that told everything, ‘The cat is out of the bag. Let's see what he does.’

Wigglytuff smirked... before his smirk shrank into a smile.
"Oh... do you think I could have a word with him...? You know... tell him to leave my kids alone?" he asked with methodical gentleness.

Celebi backed up. Her mother didn't move of an inch.
"He's asleep, I'm sorry. But... if you tell me, I'll make sure to deliver your message when he wakes up." she says.

Wigglytuff giggled.
"Oh no... I have to say this myself... make sure he gets the gist... let me wake him up, tell him a few words, and then I'll be leaving if you don't mind..." he said.

The pink Celebi shook her head.
"No... and excuse me for telling, but I think that you don't want to ‘talk’ to him..." she frankly told.

Wigglytuff's smile dropped.
"Why are you protecting him, Celebi? I don't know why he's tiny, I don't care, I just want to make sure he stays away from my kids... and from the village - he's not wanted here." he said, his gentle voice assuming its characteristic gruff tone.

Celebi's mom smirked, her daughter watching from distance with Zorua hugged tightly to her chest.

"... Zorua changed, Wigglytuff. From what I've heard, he quitted with pranks... you have no reason to be rude." she said.

Wigglytuff snorted.
"Changed? How can I believe that? That black runt is and will always be a menace, Celebi... now, PLEASE..." he looked at the green Celebi, who gripped Zorua tighter.
"Hand him over."

And, right then, the fox started to regain consciousness. His eyes slowly opened as he looked around.
"C-Celi...?" he asked as he yawned, before looking forward, spotting the pink Celebi and Wigglytuff.

"Oh... Wigglytuff..." he yawned, before his eyes shot open.
"Wigglytuff?!" he shouted in terror, before Celebi covered his mouth with a finger.

The large bunny looked at him, having heard his annoying voice.
"Oh... you're awake..." he told with a glare as he stepped forward.
"Listen close you runt, you-"

Celebi's mom fluttered in front of him, placing a paw on his stomach, halting him while causing him to look at her.

Luckily, there was no one watching, Celebi noted. She buried Zorua into her chest, muttering a quiet:
"Mom..."

"YOU listen close Wigglytuff. Leave Zorua and my daughter alone, or you'll live to regret it." the pink fairy said calmly, but extremely coldly.

"Why are you protecting him?! He's just a scoundrel, he hurt countless pokemon of this village! Why are you letting him that close to your daughter? He could be a threat to her too!"

Both Celebi and Zorua felt offended.

"What my daughter and him do is none of your business Wigglytuff. Now, leave us alone, or you'll have me to deal with." Celebi's mother hissed.

Wigglytuff growls in frustration as he looks at Zorua, then at the pink time traveler, before...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Pink menace

choices: "I-i'll pass..."
"Um...okay, if you're s-sure..."
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Wigglytuff glares at the tiny dark type before him. "You're going to protect him! After all he's done to the kids of this village? To the good pokemon!?" Wigglytuff bellowed. It was infuriating! The little worm was right there! He could squeeze the life out of him if he could just get to him! But he knew that he was no match for...either Celebi that was there, let alone both at once. The older Celebi narrowed her eyes. "All he's gonna do is go back to his same old shtick the first chance he gets! Pokemon like him don't change!" Wigglytuff tried to say, almost pleading for them to hand him over.

"He won't do anything like that again, not on my watch. If you'd like to discuss apologies to the kids i'd be more than happy to oblige, but while you stand here implying threats and throw around accusations you will have no business with us. Good day, Wigglytuff." She said coldly as he stood there fuming before reluctantly, angrily storming off.

A few seconds passed after they watched him round a corner before Zorua let off a sigh of relief. "Wow, you're tough ma'am." And Celebi nodded. "You have to be to be a mom." She said simply before looking at them. She smiled. "Now that we're done with that sorry business..."

"The movie?" Zorua earned a stern look from both of the Celebi's for that before she continued. "Why don't we go get some ice cream kids?" Celebi looked at her mom. "Really mom, we're not little, we don't ne-"

"Ma'am, she speaks for herself and I am little so yes, I would like to get ice cream." Zorua interrupted, making Celebi sigh and the older Celebi smile and chuckle a bit. "Come on, it'll be fun Celi, how long has it been since we had a day like this where we finished it with ice cream?" And Celebi flushed red. "Since I was little..." But she was outvoted she knew.

-

"The biggest mint chocolate chip they have! That's what i'm after!" Zorua stated with Celebi looking at him. "You're getting a small."

"What, why!?"

"What do you mean why?! Zorua, do you THINK you could eat the biggest they have like that!?" And Zorua tilted his head at her. "I know I could." And Celebi sighed. "And when you do finish one at that size I promise to come to your funeral, but for today it's a small." And Zorua gave up. The older Celebi was listening to all of this and smiling, shaking her head as they approached the shop.

"Go ahead and sit down you two. Mint chocolate chip for you Zorua? And I already know what you want Celi~" Her mom said teasingly as she approached the counter and Celebi set Zorua down on the counter before slowly burying her head in her hands. "So embarrassing..." She muttered and Zorua snickered. "Glad to hear it!" He said, at least happy that he wasn't alone right now as he wore the hat and bow, his eyes slowly drifted out the window they were sitting at to see...Swinub? He was looking in the window longingly it almost looked like, not even noticing the tiny Zorua. "Hey Celi, check it out." Zorua said as she looked out. "Oh hey..." She said as her mom came back from ordering. "They'll bring it over in a few minutes." She said smiling as she sat in the booth, seeing them both looking out the window. "Oh, Swinub? What's he doing I wonder..." The older Celebi mused. "Probably wants ice cream but can't afford it." Zorua stated simply. The older Celebi got an idea...

"Hey Zorua, he's one of the kids you pranked right?" She said, almost sternly and he winced. "Uh...y-yeah. He's actually probably one of my biggest victims honestly...I dropped him down a pit and left him down there for hours...eventually I accidentally dropped Munchlax on him..." Zorua muttered before finishing. "Won't do it again! Never again!" And the older Celebi nodded. "I should hope not...here, i'll be right back." She said as she got up to step out of the booth. 'Pokemon can't change, huh Wigglytuff? That's an awful lesson to teach kids.' she thought 'And I won't let you teach it.' "What is she...?" Zorua wondered before he saw her on the other end of the window, crouching down and smiling at the young Swinub. "If I know my mom, which I do, she's inviting him to eat ice cream with us and make you apologize to him." Celebi stated simply and Zorua looked out before narrowing his eyes. "Seriously? That kid is scared of his own shadow...he's gonna book when he sees me, regardless of size." Zorua stated. "Well...just saying what she's doing."

Soon enough the older Celebi was leading the little pokemon into the shop. "U-um...are you sure miss?" They heard the timid voice say. "Of course, just come over to our table, someone has something he'd like to say to you." They heard the kind voice of Celebi's mom say. And soon Zorua felt the presence of Swinub down below. Slowly, he approached the edge of the counter to look down at him. "Um...hey, Swinub..." He said and he saw the giant to him kid start to shake like a leaf. "Z-z-zorua...Wh-wh-" Swinub was very nervous before the older Celebi gently put a hand on him. "It's okay, he won't do anything. In fact, I think the only thing he could do right now is captain a toy boat." She joked, hoping to calm the young pokemon down as he looked at Zorua flushing red with the sailor hat. Swinub seemed to relax a little. "Here, why don't you eat ice cream with us, our treat, and Zorua can tell you what he wants to tell you, okay?" She said gently as Swinub looked down. "I-I don't know..." He said and Zorua sighed. "Come on, dude, it's free ice cream...you don't want to pass that up, right?" He said, trying to reassure the kid.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Best way to end a day

choices: "O-Okay Zorua... I forgive you..." Swinub responded
"Sorry Zorua... but I can't simply let it slide..." Swinub responded
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"Okay, miss... If you're sure..." Swinub shyly says as he moves to the table Celebi and Zorua are sitting at.

Seeing the young pokemon coming closer, Celebi buries her head in her paws in embarrassment.
"Mooom... can me and Zorua go home? Please?" she asked.

"Why are you involving me? I'm not leaving without my ice cream!" Zorua stated, causing Celebi to look at him with an annoyed look.

"... That aside, he's not moving from here until he told Swinub what he has to... in the meantime, Swinub...?" Celebi's mom asked with a smile, causing the swine to flush red.
"... Chocolate." he quietly muttered, and the pink fairy got up to go to the counter again.

Celebi sighed as she let her head slide onto the table.

She was distracted... and her mom busy... it was the perfect moment, Zorua thought.

"Hey. Swinub." he called, drawing the swine's attention.

He turned his head away.

"Come on dude, I'm not going to do anything to ya!... Not that I can anyway!" Zorua said with a sigh, unsure whether he should have felt proud or ashamed.

Even at that size, he had the power of scaring kids... it was quite impressive.

Swinub remained silent.

"Look... I'm sorry for that pit trap, okay? I'm sorry for forgetting ya down there and making Munchlax fall on top of you..." he had to choke back a laugh at this point.
"... Look, let's just bury the hatchet, okay? Can't we be friends?" Zorua asked.

His words had the extraordinary result of making Celebi snap out of her embarrassment as she perked up to give her boyfriend a smile.

"Zorua, that's so cu-"

"So, chocolate for Swinub, mint chocolate chip for Zorua, and strawberry and whipped cream for Celi~" her mom sang as she came out, psychically holding four ice creams, backing Celebi into embarrassment as she laid her head on the table again.

Soon, she was handed her cone, a small cone... although still huge to him was placed in front of Zorua.

Celebi's mom gave Swinub his chocolate ice cream.

"Here you go kids, eat up!" she said cheerfully as she held her own ice cream.

"... Dark chocolate?" Zorua guessed, causing the pink Celebi to smile at him.
"You wouldn't tell I love that, huh?" she said playfully.

Celebi poked Zorua.
"Please Zorua... eat mine too..." she begged, holding her ice cream in front of him.

Zorua eyed the two cones, mouth watering.
"Didn't you say..."

"I'll cry really hard at your funeral - take it." Celebi promised.

Her mother giggled.
"There'll be no funeral, honey, because you're eating it." she said.

"But mooom..."

"No buts. And eat up, or it's going to melt." the pink Celebi said.

The green fairy groaned in embarrassment as she turned around, starting to eat her ice cream.

Her mom giggled, before eyeing Zorua and Swinub.
"Now, Zorua? Haven't you anything to say?" she said.

"I've already told it, ma'am... hey, speaking of, you didn't answer me." he said, looking at Swinub, who was hungrily eating his ice cream.

He stopped to look up at Zorua and blushed.
"I-I... I don't know..." he sincerely answered.
"Z-Zorua... you hurt me..." he said, cringing at the memory being trapped in a dark pit alone for hours... only to be hit on the head by Munchlax when he fell into the same trap.

Celebi's mom licked her ice cream, before looking at Zorua with a solemn gaze.
"Well Zorua?" she said.

The fox sighed.
"Dude..." he started.
"Ahem..."

"... Swinub. I'll repeat, I'm truly sorry about it and hope that you can forgive me, although I know I don't deserve to be forgiven for that extremely mean prank... though I really wish you do and that we could be friends and all that stuff... please." Zorua said in a monotone voice... only to find himself being pulled back.

It was Celebi.

The green pokemon pecked his cheek.
"That's so cute Zorua~" she said.

"Agreed." Celebi's mom commented with a smile, before looking at Swinub.
"And you, sweetie? What do you say?" she asked.

Swinub hesitated.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Attempting to make up

choices: "I-i'd like to try being small...for a little bit...if that's okay..."
"I-I should get going...I don't want to make Wigglytuff worry..."
Wigglytuff walks in, having seen the group through the window
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
"It's...o-okay Zorua, I forgive you..." Swinub eventually said, making Zorua sigh with relief. "And now that that's done and done..." He said turning to his giant ice cream cone making Celebi giggle. "You're transparent, aren't you?" She teased and he gestured with his head to Swinub who looked to be happily licking his.

"You'd better eat yours Celi, it'll melt~" He said as he started licking his, she looked at hers and sighed before picking it up and licking it. She still enjoyed it as much as when she was little, but it was embarrassing. She wasn't a little kid anymore! But she supposed it didn't matter. The group sat there, enjoying their cones for a bit before Celebi, her mother, and Swinub were finished.

"I-I really wasn't expecting something like this...thank you...I-I think I was wrong about you Zorua..." Swinub said and Zorua grinned. "Don't sweat it kid, I can't blame you for feeling how you felt!" He said and the older Celebi nodded. "See? This is nice, i'm happy that we all got to make peace, aren't you kids?" Swinub and Zorua nodded.

"B-but I do have a question...why are you so small...?" Swinub asked as Zorua kept licking at his cone. "Oh, this? Yeah...that would be green, big and bashful next to me." Zorua said, gesturing to Celebi who leaned in. "Enjoying your cone there, buddy boy?" She asked in a matter of fact tone.

"You know it! I could eat this for hours!" He said happily as she smiled. "Basically, I do this Swinub." She said as Zorua's cone shrunk down to scale for Zorua. He looked at it horrified. "Grow it back! Grow it back!" He cried making both Celebi's giggle. "Zorua you'll get a stomach ache from too much ice cream, just finish it like that." The older Celebi said as Zorua looked at her.

"Like mother like daughter." He shrugged as both girls looked at each other. "Is that so then?" They said in unison in such a way that he felt like he'd pay for that comment later. Swinub looked at the almost pouty Zorua as he quickly polished off his now tiny cone. "B-but isn't it scary? Everything must look so big..." Swinub asked as Zorua looked at him. "Eh, at first it was...that was an entirely different situation and set of circumstances than now though." Celebi briefly looked down, feeling a bit guilty. "Now though? Nah...it's got perks. I get to be lazy~ I get giant kisses~ the food lasts longer~"

"You get to wear doll clothes~" Celebi helped him finish as he shot her a look. "B-but why not just be normal?" Swinub asked before Zorua got quiet, as did the rest of the table. "...sorry..." Swinub said, feeling like he'd asked something he shouldn't. "Don't worry kid, I just have my reasons." He finally shrugged as the group started to get up from the table, Celebi picking up the tiny dark type.

"Y-you must be really brave to be like that Zorua...I wish I was brave..." Swinub said, making the dark type grin. "Don't inflate his head, i'll never hear the end of it." Celebi said playfully as Zorua looked back. "Heh, you know I live up to my own hype." He said as Swinub looked down.

"What are you thinking sweetie?" The older Celebi asked him.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Nothing mends bridges like ice cream

choices: The group gets home without issue
Someone stops them... turns out the Wigglytuff told about Zorua...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
Like emerging from the depths of Zorua's worst nightmares, Wigglytuff walked inside the booth, wearing a death glare on his face. And that glare, one that expressed all his hatred, was fixed straight on the small Zorua in front of Celebi.

The fox's eyes widened, but he stood tall, returning Wigglytuff's glare with his own. Celebi noted the large bunny too, and she was quick to pull Zorua in a protective hug.

Zorua sighed, figuring that he didn't look really intimidating, tiny and in the paws of a fairy.

The mother of the fairy sighed as she turned around to face the large rabbit, who eyed Swinub... instantly, he wore his best beaming smile.
"Swinub dearie... why are you here?... With him?"" he told as he rudely pointed to Zorua, causing Celebi's mother to glare at him.

"Miss... she promised me ice cream..." he timidly said.

Wigglytuff forced himself to smile.

"Oh... what did we always talk about? About accepting things from certain pokemon?" he told.

Big mistake.

"... What do you mean, ‘certain pokemon’? Are you talking about me? You've got some nerve to show your face to me after what happened earlier, Wigglytuff... or are you talking about Zorua? He merely wanted to apologize, and I swear I saw him doing it with sincerity..." Celebi's mom stood up.

Instantly, Wigglytuff dropped his smile.
"I just saw you through the window, and Swinub is one of my kids, so I think I know what I'm saying when I tell him to stay away from..." he made a gesture for Zorua, who was watching from Celebi's paws.

The pink fairy remained silent.

"And quite frankly... I don't know why you're protecting him. He hurt so many pokemon..." Wigglytuff continued, struggling to not lose his temper, knowing who he was talking to.

Getting on Celebi's nerves was dangerous; getting on her mom's nerves was lethal.

The pink Celebi folded her arms.
"Learn to forgive, Wigglytuff... He showed that he has a good heart, and that's enough for me." she said firmly.

Swinub moved beside the bunny.
"Yeah... he apologized... he's nice now..." he said.

Wigglytuff decided he heard enough. He stepped towards Swinub and grabbed his paw.
"Let's go... we'll talk at home." he said, before glaring at Zorua.
"And you... just pray I never catch you alone at that size... or you're going to pa-"

Celebi's mom floated in midair to grip Wigglytuff's chest.
"Leave. My. Kids. Alone." she hissed through gritted teeth as she let go.

Wigglytuff growled, before starting to walk away.

"Thanks miss... bye Zorua... bye Celebi..." he said, Wigglytuff speeding up as he heard his words. The duo disappeared past a corner.

Only then, the pink Celebi sighed.

Zorua looked bemused.
"‘Leave my kids alone’...?" he asked to the giantess holding him, who gave a beaming smile.
"That's a good sign, Zorua! It means she took a liking to you!" Celebi said, leaning down to peck his cheek.

He grinned.

Celebi's mother turned around and smiled.
"Kids? What do you say if we go home too?" she asked gently.

Celebi nodded and got up, adjusting Zorua's position in her paws as she walked alongside her mom out of the booth.

"Isn't it kinda early?" Zorua pointed out, looking at the sky. It was sunset.

"No Zorua... we wouldn't want someone else to bother us, would we?" she said as her daughter got closer.

The pink Celebi gently petted the dark type.
"You know, young one, you were honest... you truly changed... The way you apologized to Swinub was perfect," she complimented.

"Nothing, ma'am..." Zorua responded awkwardly, causing the pink Celebi to adopt a bright smile.

"You know you two, I'm happy... I think you and my daughter make a cute couple too..." she admitted.

Zorua blushed.

"Mom!" Celebi cried in embarrassment. Her mother giggled.

"Come on... let us go home..." she said as she started to walk away.

Celebi looked at Zorua, smiling.
"You did it, Zorua... you managed to get on mom's good side..." she said sweetly, leaning to kiss his head.

"Did ya expect otherwise?" he told with a grin, making Celebi giggle as she followed her mother on the road to their house.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: End of the day

choices: Later that day...
Later that night...
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.content:
The group of three made their way home, with the older Celebi hoping that nothing would come of Wigglytuff's outbursts, at the very least that nothing would happen to Swinub, she kept it to herself as she looked to the two teens and smiled. This might just be a good thing. Her daughter, though she worried about some kind of boy going after her to take advantage of her legendary status...it seemed to be a moot point with Zorua...Zorua of all pokemon, and she seemed genuinely happy with him.

The whole thing seemed to be making Zorua mellow out too, which could only be good for the village. Maybe she should try to help Zorua make peace in his own way...Wigglytuff certainly wouldn't help matters, but his voice didn't resound with EVERYONE in the village.

"Mom, you alright? You seem to be zoning out..." Celebi asked as she looked to the pink legendary who shook her head. "Oh, don't worry about it...just thinking about stuff...I need to work tomorrow kids, but I want you to know...I want to do this again sometime, don't you~" She said cheerfully and Celebi nodded her head and Zorua looked up from her paws and nodded as well.

"So long as we can skip the movies...and the shopping..." He said making both of the girls giggle as they started to approach the house.

-

"See, it wasn't so bad, right?" Celebi said to the tiny pokemon standing on the bathroom sink as Celebi got ready to brush her teeth, to his surprise Celebi lowered a towering toothbrush down to him and he blinked as he looked at it. "What...?" He asked and he saw the toothbrush shrink down to his size. It seemed to have a paw grip for him as a quadruped too.

"I got it when we were shopping...I know you weren't paying attention, but if you're going to stay with us you should take care of yourself." Celebi said as she put some toothpaste on her brush and the tiniest dab on his. He blushed as he looked at it, and picked it up gingerly. He looked up to see Celebi using the brush now and he looked to his again. He started to rub it in his mouth, against his canines and he winced at the taste of the paste.

He kept going though, not wanting to disappoint Celebi, and she did buy this for him...and that lame bow he was stuck with.

-

The older Celebi was sitting at the kitchen table with a cup of tea as she considered the day, the kids had gone to bed a bit ago and she smiled a bit to herself before she had to get ready for bed, she looked in the door at the kids one last time, Celebi nestling the tiny lump of black fur to her chest that could only be Zorua, she frowned a bit when she saw him though, he looked to be...shivering? And that's when she heard the cough from him too, tiny imperceptible squeaks almost, but she heard it, and it sounded pretty hoarse.

"Oh dear..." She muttered as she went to the kitchen to prepare something, and left a note before she herself went to bed.

-

"Ugh..." Zorua felt like his head was on fire as he woke up, blearily looking around and he felt an intense chill go through his body. His throat felt hoarse and lumpy and he looked around to see it was still dark out.

"Celi..." He muttered, his voice cracking and weak as he struggled against her grip. "Cele-" His voice was cut off by his coughs, now much louder and he felt his girlfriend stirring.

"Zorua...what time is it?" She asked, drowsiness evident in her voice as she sat up.

"I don't..." He started coughing again and Celebi blinked before looking at him and gasping. He was shivering and the temperature of his body felt much warmer, he also looked a bit pale in the face and his nose looked far slicker than usual.

Celebi looked at him sadly.

"You're sick." She said simply and he nodded.

"Yeah...I know, it's happened from time to time." Zorua said and Celebi looked at him sadly.

"It's because you don't take care of yourself..." She said and Zorua nodded. "Well, I didn't have the means really..." His voice definitely sounded different, congested too.

"I'll be right back, okay?" She said gently as she removed him from her belly and paws and set him on her bed, covering him with sheets as she went to the kitchen to find a note with a bit of money.

I saw that Zorua was sick last night when I checked on you. Here is some money for medicine. There's soup in the fridge that can be reheated. Had to go to work, will talk when I get home.

Love you
Mom


Celebi looked in the fridge to see the chilled bowl, and to see some juice as well. She smiled a bit as she prepared the stuff, and went back to her room to check on Zorua, he almost seemed to be falling asleep again.

"Okay Zorua, don't worry, some soup is heating up and then i'll go get you medicine in a bit when the store opens, okay?" Celebi gently said and Zorua nodded.

"Then what? We going out today?" He asked and Celebi blinked.

"No way buster! You're staying in bed." Celebi said and Zorua groaned but didn't argue.

"Fair 'nuff..." He said, and at that, sleep claimed him.

Celebi considered waking him for the soup, but figured she'd wait until he was ready to eat it. She at least went to get a glass of water so that it'd be ready for him when he woke up.
1223322222133211222211323132112222211131.title: Getting sick

choices: "I suppose... Yeah, that might work!" he replies
"Wh-What?! No, I need to grow back as fast as possible!" he replies
122332222213321122221132313211222222.content:
"... E-Eh?" Gardevoir stammers, shocked by Zorua's blunt statement, before adopting a very excited tone, "Really?!"

"Shh!" Zorua tries to calm the giant Gardevoir down before she wakes up the entire house, "She doesn't know it! Heck... I didn't even realize it until just now!"

"You didn't... Realize it?" Gardevoir repeats quietly with an expression of confusion, one which in some ways reflected Zorua's.

"Look, I... Always got kind of nervous around her," Zorua explains with a dejected voice, "But everyone did! I figured I was just being creeped out! She's a total creep, she stares at people and says weird things!"

"That doesn't sound very romantic," Gardevoir points out while sounding disappointed and looking over the kitchen to make sure they were alone.

"It wasn't. The only reason I didn't prank her was because I was legitimately afraid of what she'd do to me," Zorua continues with a shrug, feeling his fracture stinging with the trials and tribulations leading him to this point, "But after I got this small... And my life was literally in her hands... She didn't lecture me. She didn't make me do horrible tasks. She just... Wanted to protect me from more harm."

Gardevoir could tell Zorua was blushing now, because her Synchronize ability made her blush as well.

"It was kind of... Cute," he admitted quietly, "I never had anyone protect me before. Especially not someone like her."
