Giggling to herself, Gardevoir feels Zorua's ambarassment increasing. To see this roughskinned Pokémon, the same that had replaced the expedition group's Reviver Seeds with X-Eye Seeds, act in this manner was making her heart titillate.

"Zorua... That's so cute!" she suddenly burst out and hugged the small dark-type, "I'll be cheering you on!"

"W-Wait!" Zorua gasps as he is pressed up against her massive body, "You don't get it! I'm small!"

"Oh! Sorry," Gardevoir exclaims while feeling Zorua's sadness reflected in herself, "Wait... Why are you sad?"

"Like I said, it's all because I'm small. The size of a little doll," Zorua mumbled hopelessly, "The only reason Espurr or you or anyone even bothered to talk to me is because I'm completely harmless like this. Will she still care for me when I'm back to my original size? I'll probably just scare her off with my antics like everyone else."

"But... Your antics? You said you were reformed!" Gardevoir said and felt a pang of guilt synchronized in her.

"... It's not that easy, OK?" Zorua mutters with a hint of regret, "I just said all that so I could get out of here alive. Honestly, I don't... Know what'll happen when I'm myself again. It's not like I haven't tried to 'be normal' before, it's, just, some people see that as weakness and use the opportunity to get back at me. Once a scoundrel, always a scoundrel, you know?"

Gardevoir stares at him, her cheerful expression fading. This isn't really what she had in mind when it came to playing match-maker.

"Look, Espurr's too nice. There's no way she would like the real me," Zorua explains quietly and shakes his head, "I'm a ruffian and she's a softie. Well right now I'm a dustmite and she's a goddess, but that won't last forever. Just let me do my time here in Celebi's bedroom and I promise I'll never get involved with any of you again. Just forget I exist."

Still feeling like this is too good of a moment to pass up, Gradevoir decides there has to be a solution. Love finds a way. After thinking to herself for a few moments, she has an idea.

"I know!" she says with a sense of joy, "You should stay small until she gets to know the 'real you' and then decide!"

Zorua looks up at her.
122332222213321122221132313211222222.title: "Espurr!"

choices: "Okay..." Espurr says, giving a smile
"Uhm... I don't know..." Espurr says, thinking about it
"... Maybe next time Zorua..." Espurr says, sounding dejected
1223322222133211222211323132112222221.content:
"Y-Yeah... that might work..." Zorua admits, the blush unwilling to leave his cheeks.
"But how do I do that?" he then asks.

Gardevoir smiles. She always liked helping her friends out with romance-related stuff. And Zorua was one of her friends now.

"Well, you're living with Celebi now, no?" she asks.
"For the time being..." Zorua corrected.
"Why?" he then asked.

"Well, why don't you ask Espurr if you can spend a day or two with her? You two can get to know to each other better, one thing leads to another and who knows how this might end~" Gardevoir sang cheerfully, making Zorua blush even more.

"... Maybe you're right," Zorua admitted.
"There's still one thing though," he continued.

"What's that?"

Zorua sighs.
"What if she... she eventually falls for me?"

Gardevoir tilts her head, confused by the question.
"I don't follow," she bluntly says.
"That'd be great, no? Isn't it why you're even talking about it with me?"

Zorua shakes his head.
"That's not what I meant," he responds, before sighing.
"I won't be this size forever, Gardevoir. As a result, I won't be harmless forever. Whenever Celebi grows me back up, I might just start pranking others again," he reasons.
"What if Espurr falls for me now, but will hate me when I start... y'know... again?"

"IF you start pranking others again," Gardevoir interjects.
"If it happens... we'll make sure to help you change again, Zorua. Friends don't let friends ruin their reputations." she says with a confident smile, earning one from Zorua.

He then gives a small yawn. Gardevoir smiles.
"For now, though, I suggest we hit the hay. It's still early, and I'm done eating anyway," and says, getting up.

Gardevoir travels through Celebi's house, before slowly opening the door, careful to not make any noise. Then, the psychic type slides inside, heading towards the bed where Celebi, Buneary and Espurr are sleeping.

Gardevoir moves over Espurr: her eyes are shut and she's snoring, meaning that she wasn't reading Zorua's thoughts.

Good.

"Well... See you in the morning," Gardevoir says, using a paw to spread Celebi's arms.
"W-Wait... D-Don't-" Zorua doesn't get to finish as Gardevoir lowers him down. Celebi's elongated paws dart forward, grabbing him and snuggling him to her chest.

Zorua's cheeks burn with embarrassment. Gardevoir laughs a bit.
"Hehe... someone missed you." she remarks, before moving to her improvised bed and laying down.

Zorua sighs and lays still as he closes his eyes, Celebi snuggling him further in her sleep, causing the dark type to blush even more.

Luckily, the bedroom, Celebi, the bed and all the girls soon fade away as sleep claims him.

--

"... Wake up Zorua..." a familiar voice disturbed Zorua's slumber.

He simply ignored it as he kept on sleeping.

"Come on, my tiny roommate, time to rise and shine," the voice repeated in a gentle manner.

Zorua turned in his sleep.
"Five more minutes..." he groaned. A giggle followed his sentence.
"Aw... He's adorably stubborn..." another voice chimed. Other giggles were heard.
"Not even five seconds - wake up." the voice said, a bit more firm than before.

Zorua huffs loudly, before opening his eyes, noticing that Celebi is holding him in front of the four other girls.

Buneary was giggling, Braixen snickering, Gardevoir was giving a smile. Espurr looked deadpan as usual.
"Why good morning, Zorua," Celebi chimed happily.

Zorua grumbled a bit.
"... What's going on all of you?" he asked.

"The sleepover is... over. We're leaving," Braixen clarifies with a smile, reaching out to pet the smaller fox.

"Oh..." is all Zorua responds, dejected. Now that he finally made some friends...

"Yeah. Well, need him a second, Celebi," Gardevoir says, picking Zorua from the fairy and leaving the room, leaving four confused pokemon behind herself.

--

"You've gotta tell Espurr Zorua!" Gardevoir exclaims, holding the fox in front of her face.

Zorua blinks.
"Tell her what...?" he inquires, before remembering the talk he had with Gardevoir. He blushes.
"... Oh..."

The psychic type nods.
"Want an advice? Hurry up." she says.

"And do what?" Celebi chimes from behind her, startling Gardevoir, who hastily turns back.

"Nothing..." she says, gently handing Zorua to Celebi.

"... In that case," Braixen tells, smiling at Buneary.
"We'll be leaving. Come on Buneary, I'll bring you home,"

The bunny doesn't respond, but snatches Zorua from Celebi, hugging him to her chest.
"See you around Zorua~" she chimes, before giving him back to Celebi and hopping next to Braixen.

"Yeah, see ya around small one," the fox tells with a warm smile, before she and Buneary take their leave.

"I'll be leaving too," Gardevoir says.
"See you all around - and, Zorua," she turns around.
"Let me know." she says, winking as she disappears outside, leaving only Zorua, Celebi and Espurr.

Celebi blinks.
"What she was talking about...?" she asks Zorua, who freezes up.
"... I'm clueless." he responds after a moment, shrugging.

"Well you two, it was nice. I guess I'll see you around," Espurr says.
"Try to not choke him while you cuddle him, Celebi," she warns, sending both Zorua and Celebi in a state of embarrassment.

"W-Wait... E-Espurr..." Zorua calls out, stopping the psychic type, who turns around again.

"I-I was wondering... would you be okay if... if I came with you...? I'd like... I'd like to spend some time with you after... after last night..." he timidly explains.

"What? Why? When?" Celebi asks, growing more and more confused.

Espurr herself looks confused, and doesn't reply. Instead, her eyes suddenly widen... even more, and she adopts a surprised expression as well as a blush.

Zorua mentally slaps himself.

Espurr just read his thoughts and found out!

"E-Espurr..." he quietly murmurs, praying she doesn't blurt out what she just learned.

Luckily, Espurr remains quiet as she ponders an answer.
1223322222133211222211323132112222221.title: Gardevoir's idea and Zorua's doubts

choices: "Well let's do something fun!" Zorua grinned, trying to brighten the mood
"Sure you don't want to talk about it more?" Zorua asked
12233222221332112222113231321122222211.content:
"Okay...i'd like that. If it's okay with Celebi." Celebi just looked from the blushing Espurr to the blushing Zorua in her palm and started laughing.

"Oh~ I see~" She said, now understanding what Gardevoir was getting at. "Zorua, you little lady killer you~" She teased as Zorua's face flushed even redder and he looked away from both of them. "It's absolutely fine with me Espurr. I'm actually happy to do it, this would be good for both of you to come out of your shells a bit more." Celebi handed the tiny dark pokemon to Espurr, and he looked up at the giantess holding him. She looked away from him briefly, blushing furiously as she started to hug the tiny pokemon to her chest almost as hard as Celebi did when she cuddled him in bed.

"I'll make sure that he's safe Celebi, and i'll bring him back tomorrow. Thank you." Espurr said, not quite as monotone as she probably intended and she made for the door. Celebi just grinned. "This is DEFINITELY not what I expected."

-

"S-so um...Espurr...wait, are you in my head right now?" Zorua said from her chest as they walked the quiet road to Espurr's house. She lived a bit further out than he had expected, even passing through his forest.

"I'm uh...n-no." She hastily said. He was quiet.

'I guess it makes sense why I saw her so much if she passes through here to get home.'

"So...last night, um...thanks for...that....with my dad and all..." Zorua was trying to strike up a conversation with the giantess, and with how much they had talked last night or how many quips she'd have for a situation to poke and prod at her companions, she was being oddly quiet herself right now.

"Oh, anytime Zorua...I was happy to be there." She said, still with a hint of nervousness in her voice.

"I-if you want to talk to me about anything, you can...um...y'know, do that." He was looking down now at the far ground. 'Why is this so stinking hard Gardevoir!?' He thought.

"Is that what you two talked about...?" Espurr asked before she realized her mistake.

"...You are SO in my head right now!" Zorua exclaimed and Espurr started to get a bit jittery. "I'm sorry, it's a habit...I do it unconsciously sometimes."

"N-no, i'm not mad Espurr. I'm not." He said, feeling a little queasy from her jittery motions.

The rest of the walk was more silence and more awkwardness as they got to Espurr's house. A big, big nice house. "Wow..." Zorua said, a bit impressed. "Yeah...that's what everyone does when they see it for the first time, even if it's not out loud." Espurr remarked as she went to open the door.

Inside was...eerily quiet. Very eerily quiet. "Well, why don't I show you around...there's a lot of rooms." Espurr said as she gave him the grand tour of a game room, a library, kitchen, many many guest rooms, ball room, etc.

As the tour went on Zorua still noted that it was just him and Espurr...no other pokemon. And she didn't seem the least bit nervous about anyone turning a corner to see Espurr carrying a doll sized Zorua around. "That's because it's only me and my dad that live here, and he works all the time." She said frankly.

That comment last night about distant parents being normal started to make sense in his head. He looked at Espurr, but her expression was her default unreadable state. "I take care of my studies, chores, meals, and entertainment choices quite proficiently on my own and I enjoy quiet so it isn't so bad Zorua."

"Still Espurr..."

"No, it isn't the same. My dad is distant but he's still my dad, and he cares in his way. It's why we live in a place like this." Zorua said nothing to this, though the hollow mansion gave him quite a few thoughts that Espurr would see anyways.
12233222221332112222113231321122222211.title: The awkward times of a mind reader and a prankster

choices: "Well... It's a nice day... Let's go play outside!" Zorua suggests
"Hmm... I don't know... How about you pick?" Zorua asks
122332222213321122221132313211222222112.content:
"Are you sure you don't want to... to talk about it, Espurr? You know... like you did with me when I... Told you about my father..." Zorua sheepishly asks.

Espurr doesn't respond, but hugs Zorua to her chest again.
"... Come on, there's one more room I need to show you," she says.

"... That's not an answer..." Zorua points out perplexedly.

Espurr remains quiet, and starts walking towards the unknown room. The giantess takes a few minutes to reach her destination. Quietly, she opens the door, which leads to... the biggest bedroom Zorua's ever seen.

A nice, big bed occupied a good part of the room; a bookshelf full of books, a desk where some sheets rested. Some had drawings, some were written and some were blank, giving Zorua an accurate idea of what Espurr liked to do.

In the end, there was an armchair in a corner, while sunshine seeped through a big window.

"Yeah. It is quite nice in in here - completely silence helps me sleep," Espurr chimes, slowly moving to the bed and sitting down on it, setting Zorua on her lap.
"And speaking of - you'll be sleeping here tonight... If you don't mind of course..." she continues, blushing furiously.

Zorua flushed red too, even if the perspective is something he was secretly hoping for. Though, well aware that Espurr didn't keep the promise of staying out of his mind, he buries the thought deep into his mind, replacing it with another.

"... Say, Espurr," he starts, getting her to look at him.
"Answer me - don't you want to talk about your dad...?" he asks.

Espurr looks dejected for a moment.
"... There is really nothing to say, Zorua," she responds after a moment of silence.
"It isn't like you think. Sure, my father works all the time, and he can be quite distant at times, but he cares for me... I actually see him once or twice a week, and he always brings something nice for me..." she admits.

The revelation made Zorua a bit sad as his mind traveled to his own father. All those harsh words, all his tears...

"Yeah. Probably my dad is happy that I ran off, so I can't disappoint him anymore..." he bitterly says.

Espurr stared at the small fox for a moment, before pulling him in a hug to her chest. Zorua blushed, but he couldn't deny how nice it felt. Espurr's fur was warm and soft, and be could literally feel all the care in the hug she was giving him.

For a moment, everything faded from Zorua's mind.

The bedroom, his father, Celebi, the girls. Only Espurr remained.

He was alone with the girl he loved. Nothing else mattered to him at the moment.

Reading his thoughts, Espurr blushed even more, feeling her cheeks burning with embarrassment. But she says nothing about it. Zorua's new size made him harmless... but helpless, too. And Espurr couldn't deny just how cute he was like that.

"Just forget him Zorua," she repeats the same words from the last night.
"You've got Celebi. You've got a home. You've got friends..." she smiles sheepishly.
"... You've got me..."

The statement makes Zorua blush even more.
"Yes... you're right..." he replies while returning the hug.

Only after a good while, Espurr finally broke the embrace, holding the little dark type in front of her, a smile painted on her face.
"Let's... Let's leave our parents out of our minds for today, alright?" she suggests.
"Deal." Zorua responds.

Espurr smiles even more.
"Okay. I've shown you my house... what do you say if we did something together now?" she asks, laying back down on her bed, holding Zorua up in the air with her paws.

Zorua blushed.
"Sounds good..." he admitted, staring at the psychic giantess below. He was really starting to get used to those endless lilac wells that were Espurr's eyes, although he couldn't shake off a slight sensation of uneasiness whenever she looked at him.

"Well... what do you want to do then?" Espurr asked, ignoring his last thought.

Zorua thought about it.
122332222213321122221132313211222222112.title: Zorua and Espurr's alone time

choices: "It's a nice thought...but it'll take more than that to make it up to them."
"I'll talk to Celebi about it at least, down the road i'd love to."
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
Espurr stared up at him a bit. "You want me to pick? Are you sure Zorua? It might bore you." Zorua considered this, before returning with a grin. "Well...you unfortunately know my ideas for fun, but I want to get to know more about you Espurr, and what you like. I wouldn't be bored doing that." Espurr gave a small slight smile to that before she sat up and set him down on the bed.

"Okay Zorua, i'll be back in a little bit. Be patient here." She got up and left the room, leaving him in silence. 'Hmm...odd, but alright' He thought before stretching out. "Maaan, this bed is huuuge!" He said to himself before getting an idea. "I did say we could do what she wanted, and she told me it might bore me...welp, may as well get exercise now." He grinned before running to the other end of the bed, occasionally leaping to get a bit of a spring in his step. "Man! Feels good to get going, i've been taking it easy since Celebi shrunk me again!" He whooped as he turned on a dime at the other end of the bed and started to run back to his starting point, before stopping mid way to just start rolling around. "If you're stir crazy we can go outside." He heard a voice that immediately brought him back to reality and he covered his face with his paws to hide his embarrassment. "It's not what it looks like!" He blurted out.

"Yes it is." Espurr said in the same deadpan voice as ever, though he couldn't see the slight smile she had. Zorua heard her setting a few things down before he felt himself being lifted up to her face, she had lost the smile and was back to her default before saying. "Are you sure you're okay with doing what I want?"

"Yes Espurr, I was serious...what do you do for fun?" Zorua asked. She said nothing as she carried him over to her desk and very gently set him on a pillow. She sat down in her chair and gathered together the things she had brought in her room. she then slipped him a banana chip from a bag she had and took a small sip of a steaming cup that she had set down. It smelled...good. "If you want some apple cider, be sure to ask me during this. I won't be looking at your thoughts. I also got you this to read if you'd like, I tend to get lost in my own world when I sketch and draw." She said simply as a comic was set before Zorua. Of course, he had seen the drawing when he came in! That made sense. He took a small bite of his banana chip before sitting there silently and watching her. She was levitating a pencil over paper as she stared at the page before her. 'Wow...intense' He thought looking at her stare before catching himself...then realizing she wasn't in his head. He eyed the comic a bit, but realized he'd have an awkward time turning the pages or even reading all the panels. He opted to watch her instead.

-

As time wore on Zorua was actually far more impressed with her sketches than he had expected, and far less bored than she would have predicted. She said she had wanted to draw Buneary a few things to hopefully help the young pokemon feel more comfortable around her, and she sketched Braixen and Buneary fishing together, as well as one of a normal sized Zorua and Buneary running through his forest. The attention to detail was...impressive. "Can I have a sip?" Zorua had asked, this was really the only interruptions that had happened since she started and Espurr was quick to pick him up and lift him to the cup before she gently set him back on the cushion, wordlessly. 'Seriously intense...but impressive.'

She had just finished working on a sketch of Celebi hugging the tiny Zorua, intent to give it to her on her next visit, and she started in on another sketch before she spoke for the first time, the lack of silence startling Zorua. "So have you given thought to what you'll so when you're restored to your normal height?" She asked, frankly. "Oh...uh...not really, I was normal there for a bit between the 'punishment' and the 'roomie' portion of this whole thing and honestly...all I did was sleep and eat from my hidden stashes of food. I was kinda bored."

"Hmm, I thought so. You need an outlet." She stated simply, not looking away from her sketch.

"Outlet? That would be bad for me to have, I had that, it was my pranks." He said frankly.

"Zorua, you're boastful, love to be the center of attention, take pride in your skills in trickery, and enjoy making complex contraptions." She said, deadpan as ever, not even looking at him.

"...Well I can't deny any of that." Zorua hung his head in shame. Why was she doing this?

"None of those are inherently bad qualities by themselves Zorua. You went about it wrong is all. You're an extroverted pokemon, and you were lashing out when you got here. It got bad, and many pokemon suffered because of your tricks...and I need to apologize to you myself. If i'd taken the time to find the context to the bitter thoughts you had, maybe I could've reached out to you."

"I seriously doubt you'd have gotten through to me, it took a hiiiigh dose of fearing for my life, and a whole lot of pain to get me to rethink my choices. Sadly, you might've become a target to me..." Zorua said, slightly wistfully, he tried to eye the sketch Espurr was making but her paw touched his chin and had him look up at her face. She looked...sad, but still wore a smile. He was starting to see just how much she really could emote with her eyes. "I could've tried...knowing that you could've changed, and knowing what I know about you now I just think of all those years that you hurt others...and were hurting yourself and I think 'I could've said something'...i'm an introvert, I don't like trying to connect with others, usually they try and connect with me before i'll make the effort. Zorua...I want to help you find a use for your talents, and to make things right." At this she finished her sketch and gently let go of his chin. He looked down at it from his cushion and saw...himself, on a stage, fully grinning with fireworks going on around him, shimmering bubbles surrounding him with rings and halos of fire and electricity surrounding the bubbles. A crowd of young pokemon that he had tormented were watching him. Buneary, Azurill, Swinub, Pichu, Magby, and more.

"Your illusions, your tricks, your fancy ideas for contraptions...you could do shows, make pokemon laugh...smile. Zorua...you should give it a try, maybe discuss it with Celebi when I bring you back to her..." Espurr said gently. Zorua thought on it. It was...what he wanted. He realized he wanted that really badly right now, it would be great to make it up to them that way!

But...would any of them WANT to see that? He had stolen, swindled, trapped, tormented, and scarred many of those pokemon. Buneary forgave him, but that year she spent like that...and he had done just as bad to many of those other kids. A show like this...? That probably wouldn't be enough, he needed to earn this right.
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: Sketching a future

choices: "Perhaps... I suppose I can give it a shot..." Zorua admits
"I'm not sure it'll work, Espurr..." Zorua responds bitterly
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
"It's... it's a nice thought, Espurr," Zorua slowly admitted as the giantess eyed him with that small smile of hers.
"But... But I don't think it would work..." he admitted.

Espurr's smile faded.
"Yeah..." Zorua continued.
"I've done wrong so many times... I think no one would even want to watch that after the pranks I pulled..."

"Everyone would watch that, Zorua," Espurr commented.

Zorua shook his head.
"No, Espurr... it'd take more than that to make it up to... everyone. And then again, whenever I return to my normal size, there's a chance I'll start pranking others again..." he bitterly said.
"It's what I already said: once a scoundrel, always a scoundrel. And I'm the worst scoundrel around..."

Espurr frowns.
"You WERE a scoundrel Zorua. You stopped being a scoundrel when Celebi shrunk you down," she says, before checking Zorua's thoughts.

"You can keep telling yourself that you've apologized to Buneary and Braixen just because you were scared, but you can't deny it: you've changed, Zorua. A lot." she continues.

Zorua smiles bitterly.
"... That's because I'm small, Espurr," he simply responds.
"Whenever Celebi grows me back, you can't deny that I'll probably start pranking others again. That's just reality, Espurr,"

The giantess remains silent for a few moments, her pencil still levitating over the paper. Espurr briefly looks away from the little dark type, looking at her sketch instead.

The pencil touches the paper as she silently adds a few more details to the sketch. Zorua simply sits down, watching the giantess drawing.

"If you ask me, Zorua, you should at least try," she remarks after a while of silence. The pencil stops and is psychically lifted off the paper.

Espurr's gaze lands on the pillow where Zorua rests.
"You really should. Make other pokemon laugh... It'll work good..." she says, smiling again.

Suddenly, the pencil flipped over to the eraser as it landed on the sketch, erasing something.

From his soft perch, Zorua looks down, seeing the sketch below.

And he saw himself, still on the stage, now wearing a sincere smile instead of his toothy grin.

"Hm..." Zorua says, smiling a little as he looks up at the beaming Espurr.
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: Uncertainty

choices: Zorua takes the win
Espurr takes the win
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
Espurr's beaming smile started to fade to her neutral expression as Zorua said that. She put a paw to her chin in thought before she sighed and mentally said 'forgive me' to herself before she started. She knew what to say just based on Zorua's thoughts.

"Zorua...you grew up with a 'might makes right mentality' from your dad, didn't you?" She said, in her monotone voice and Zorua winced. "I thought we were leaving our parents out of today..." He responded before continuing. "But yeah, that's my old man, does what he wants, when he wants, because he can." Espurr nodded, keeping the same neutral expression.

"You as well right?"

"...I suppose so..." Zorua was feeling uncomfortable now. Where was she going with this?

"If you can do it, why not, right? That's how you lived...Zorua, I think you know better than anyone how fragile you are right now. All i'd have to do is step on you, or squeeze you, it wouldn't even take any effort." She said and now Zorua's thoughts were panicking, Espurr felt really bad for doing this, but she HAD to make this point so he'd understand.

"Y-yes...I know that..." He said, a small edge of the worry he had creeping into his voice.

"We can go further than that too. Braixen and Buneary" She started and levitated the picture she drew of those two fishing, they looked happy. Espurr continued "...they're close, like sisters, and Braixen loves her very much. But do you know what Braixen CAN do? She could push Buneary around, threaten her, even roast her if she wanted." 'If Braixen heard any of this she'd slap the living daylights out of me...' Espurr thought sadly.

"THAT'S-"

"Then there's Celebi..." She said as she levitated the picture of her hugging the small Zorua, smiling. "She's one of the most powerful pokemon I know, what she COULD do to any of us...what she did to you on accident, without even trying much...it's enough to send shivers down my spine."

Zorua was gritting his teeth at this point. "Espurr...why? Why are you saying these horrible things!?" He wasn't just panicked anymore, he was livid. Espurr dropped the act at this point. "I'm trying to show you Zorua...what someone can do isn't what they have to do or will do...I said that stuff about Braixen and Buneary...do you think Braixen would EVER do that or that Buneary fears her because she can do that?"

"Well no, of cou-"

"Do you think ANY of us fear Celebi? The one who was sorry that Braixen and Gardevoir had to take the floor or cuddled you like a goof?"

"No, but that's-"

"Are you afraid of me?"

"...what?"

Espurr looked at him a bit sadly now. "Are you afraid of me, or any of us Zorua?"

Zorua looked away for a second. "I know you wouldn't do anything to me, and I think I understand your point Espurr...it's just..."

"No, not 'it's just' Zorua...are you afraid of us?" She wouldn't relent, even though she already knew the answer. 'I'm sorry Zorua' She mentally said again.

Zorua sighed. 'She already knows, may as well' he mentally told himself. "Of course I am. It's hard not to be, considering my position, like you said, I know better than anyone...but that doesn't mean that I hate any of you, I don't! Not at all! You're all my friends, and i've had so much fun too! I like all of you! Especially you Espurr." He said, trying to put on a carefree grin. Espurr still had the sad look.

"None of us would EVER do anything to hurt you right now Zorua, you need to know that, I wouldn't do that...you need to stop hating yourself Zorua..." She said and his smile faded. "But I-I don't..." He muttered, looking down. "I just...worry about what will happen when i'm given my own agency back is all..."

"Just because you CAN do something doesn't mean you WILL do something Zorua, you know that...the thoughts you just had when I said those awful things confirms it to me, you HAVE changed and you wouldn't do that stuff anymore...i'm trying to help you Zorua...this show would work. I know it's what you want too." She said.

"I..."

"Before you tell me no in another way, I want you to internalize it and think about it...for now, let's just go outside, okay?" She said gently as she picked him up from the pillow. 'Maybe exercise will help him think about it.' She thought.

-

"Come on Espurr, you should get out here too!" Zorua said grinning as he ran through her backyard, she was sitting on her patio, watching him. He had done a complete 180 once he got going.

"It's fine, i'm not the running type." She said. "Oh come on! Try and catch me!" He shouted before he felt a tug, he was being lifted by a psychic aura and he went flying towards her as she hugged him to her chest, still deadpan. "Caught you." She said simply as Zorua struggled in her grip.

"That is NOT what I meant and you know it!"

"Like I said, i'm not the running type. It would've ended the same anyway, with or without me just using my psychic powers." She stated and Zorua felt slightly insulted. "Oh really?...is that so?" He said before grinning up at her. "You know, I bet you COULDN'T catch me without those powers, even with me at this size." She just looked down at him. "You're trying to bait me." She said simply. "Call it what you will, but tiny or not I could still outmaneuver circles around you. Few have ever caught me and the first was a legendary mystic so..." He stated cockily before Espurr set him down and pondered this. 'He's serious...' She thought reading his thoughts. He really did think he could evade her, even that tiny, she smiled a little, maybe...a wager then?

"Okay Zorua, i'll try to catch you...no psychic powers...and no illusions from you either." Zorua contemplated this. "Hmm...sounds fair." He said.

"All you have to do is avoid me for 5 minutes, if I pin you or trap you without any psychic powers, I win. If you can evade me for that time and remain free, you win."

"Okay, cool cool." He said carefree.

"BUT, if I win...you need to do the show." She stated as she smiled down at him. "For sure."

"WHAT!? No bet...i'll just head back out an-"

"But if you win i'll kiss you." She stated, blushing slightly and he stopped in his tracks. 'Got him' She thought.

"K-k-wh-" He was stammering, his heart had skipped a beat and he felt like he needed to steady himself. He looked up at her, she was smiling wide at him. 'No way she can beat me...i'll get my exercise, show my stuff, and get to kiss Espurr....it's in the bag' he thought grinning. 'Oh don't be so sure.' She thought before he said "Deal."
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: A point and wager made

choices: "Still, I won..." Espurr insists. Zorua is doing the show...
"Okay Zorua, you're right. You win..." Espurr gives in. Zorua gets his reward...
"I want a rematch!" Zorua exclaims before Espurr can talk...
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
"Ready?" Zorua asked with a confident grin as he stood before the towering giantess that is Espurr.
"Whenever you are," she responded from above.

"Okay, Espurr," the little dark type said.
"Five minutes starting..." he backed up slightly.
"NOW!"

At this shout, he turned around and started running away from the psychic giantess.

He could do this. Even without his illusions, he still had the wicked mind of a trickster, and that would be his trump card.

As for Espurr, as soon as she saw Zorua running, she... did absolutely nothing. She simply stood there in the grass, watching Zorua running.

Soon enough, the small fox noticed the lack of activity behind him. So, his running soon slowed down to a mere walk before Zorua halted completely to turn around.

He noticed Espurr staring at him while standing perfectly still.
"Uh... Espurr...?" he called out.

"Yes?"
"You are... supposed to chase me... You've only got five minutes..." Zorua sheepishly says.

Espurr smiles.
"I'm well aware of that Zorua," she simply responds.
"But, as I told, I'm not the running type. In fact, I was merely-" she takes a few steps in Zorua's direction.
"... Waiting for you to stop."

"Ah!" Zorua exclaims as the giantess moves towards him. Like a Beedrill just stung him, he sprints in the opposite direction, causing Espurr to halt again.

Then, realization hit the small pokemon.

‘If I keep running, she won't move... I've got this!’ he thinks, grinning to himself.

Espurr, who was reading his thoughts, smirked herself.
‘If you only knew how wrong you are, Zorua...’ she thinks.

Her plan worked. Now, she only had to wait...

--

Zorua kept running for a good while since he was almost caught by Espurr.

He thought he could win the game by merely keeping running. He was wrong.

After just three minutes, he was panting. His reduced size wasn't of any help at all.

"Got... this..." he panted. Espurr was still watching without moving.

Soon enough, Zorua came to the point where he couldn't keep it up no more. He ran as far as he could get from Espurr, before stopping.

The small fox panted, trying to regain his breath. But that was when the ground beneath him started shaking. It didn't take long for Zorua to realize that Espurr started moving in his direction.

As the shaking grows, he hastily makes another sprint, but he ends up stumbling and falling to the ground.

"No..." he muttered as a shadow eclipsed his view.

Then, Espurr gently bent over him and picked him up, hugging the small fox to her chest, a smile on her face.

"Looks like I win Zorua," she says.
"And sooner than I had anticipated."

Zorua sighs as he rests against Espurr's chest.
"So... guess I'm doing the show now..." he mutters.
"Yes." Espurr responds.

Zorua closes his eyes. Before abruptly opening them again as he puts two and two together.

Espurr had revealed him that she was just waiting for him to stop... but there was a second purpose : she only wanted to keep him running. And, when he was tired out...

"You got it right," she confirms happily.

Zorua frowns.
"NO fair!" he shouts as he starts struggling in Espurr's grip.
"You were supposed to CHASE me! You cheated!"

Espurr's smile faded.
"No I didn't. I only made up a plan, and it worked," she responds, deadpan.

Zorua looks up at her.
"Still, this is NOT how the game works!" he retorts.

Espurr looks back at him, seeming to be pondering something.
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: The trickster gets tricked

choices: They both wake up a bit later
They wake up and it's night
Zorua wakes up in Espurr's room
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
"I still won...the only rules were no psychic powers and no illusions." She insisted and Zorua just sighed. "You still think it feels dirty?" Espurr inquired.

"Of course I do!...but you did get me, bummer tactics or not." He relented. What else could he really do?

"So...?" She started, she wanted to hear it from him.

"Yeah, yeah...i'll do the show when I get changed back okay? That's still a ways off...and I still need time to plan it!" He insisted and she nodded.

"Of course, and i'll help you, and i'm sure the other girls will too, but we can worry about that later I suppose." She said as she set him back down. "So do you still want to exercise?" She asked, with a slight smile. He just grunted. 'Sore loser' she thought and chuckled a little. "I'm done with running around, but I still want to enjoy the sunshine." He said simply after a bit, and at that she picked him up again. "W-hey, didn't you just set me down?" He said, somewhat confused as she walked further into her backyard. "If we're done running around we have something over here." She said, deadpan as ever as she approached a...rather large looking hammock.

"Oh..." He said now understanding what was going on as she levitated herself and him into it. Espurr laid back and set Zorua down on her chest. He was blushing furiously as he looked over to her head, and she was giving him a slight smile. "We can relax here for a bit, if you'd like?" She said. He simply nodded and stood on her chest.

He looked out into her yard for a bit, and even tried his hand at making one of those fireballs surrounded by electricity from Espurr's drawing. It was difficult to make the electricity look like it wasn't fake. 'This is going to be a challenge.' He thought. 'In more ways than one.' He added to it bitterly. "Say Espurr, do you th-" He looked back, only to see her eyes shut. "...Oh" He said. A nap huh? It was a nice day, did he really want to do that? "Not much for it then." he said as he let off a yawn, and laid down in Espurr's fur. 'Can't believe I fell for her ploy, hook line and sinker...' He thought a bit, before he closed his eyes and sleep claimed him.
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: Sunshine

choices: The next morning, Espurr brings Zorua back to Celebi
A few days later, the show takes place
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
Time drew on as the two pokemon kept sleeping in the hammock. Espurr still had Zorua in her hug.

He deserved to be there.

Even if he didn't win the game, Espurr had to admit: without her plan, she would have surely lost. So, Zorua only lost because she outsmarted him.

Though, he lost anyway, so Espurr couldn't reward him... by kissing him like she promised. But she was sure he earned his rest with her. Zorua would have appreciated it, she hoped, since he seemed to really like her like he said...

Hours pass, and the sun starts to descend over the horizon as the sky darkened, the moon taking its place into the starry night sky.

And, at some point, Espurr started waking up. A breeze blew past her as her eyes start to open up.

The giantess yawns as she looks around, discovering that she's still on her hammock, it's nighttime and she's still cuddling the small Zorua to her chest.

Espurr blinks.
"How much time passed...?" she asks herself, before gazing at Zorua again.

He was still asleep.

The giantess smiles.
"Aw... he's adorable..." she mutters to no one in particular.
"And after the show, everyone will understand that." she adds, before looking at the starry sky.

Perhaps, she thinks, she could give him a chance...

Espurr's attention is drawn as Zorua starts fidgeting in his sleep. Her expression returns back to normal as the tiny fox wakes up as well.

Zorua yawns, before blinking a few times as his vision adjusts to the darkness.
"E-Espurr...?" he calls out upon noticing that the giantess he slept with is staring at him.
"W-What time is it...?"

"It's nighttime Zorua," she quietly says.
"We overslept."

Zorua simply stares at her dejectedly. Espurr smiles warmly.
"I know, after tonight I'm bringing you back to Celebi," she says, reading his thoughts.
"But we're definitely seeing each other more often now. Especially after the show..." she promises.

Zorua smiles a little a she makes eye contact with the giantess.
"Espurr..." he mutters.

Right before his stomach decided to ruin the moment by growling, remembering him that all he ate in the whole day was a banana chip and a sip of apple cider.

Zorua blushes and looks at his belly, silently cursing it for the bad timing. Espurr giggles.
"Let's head inside. We eat something, and we go to bed," she says, leaping off the hammock and starting to walk towards the house.

Espurr walks through the quiet backyard, reaching the even quieter mansion and enters, heading towards her dining room.

"You're wondering what I'm going to give you," she points out upon reading Zorua's thoughts.

He sighs.
"When are you going to stop doing that?" he asks, earning a smirk in response.
"... I think that your current size might be useful after all - anything can fill you, and you wouldn't even finish whatever I give you to eat..." she says, gently placing Zorua on a table.

"Yeah... you're right. I mean, last night I didn't eat much of Celebi's snacks, did I?" he asks.
"You barely ate one cookie and it was mainly because you were more irritated and bored than hungry because Celebi beat you when you at chess, and because she made you be the banker when we played Pokeopoly..."

Zorua blinks. As always, Espurr was hard to follow.

"... Yeah." he responds.
"I'm still wondering how you won that."

Espurr smirks, before starting to walk towards her kitchen.
"Be right back." she says.

--

"Something bothering you?" Espurr asked as she carried Zorua to her bedroom. They had just finished dinner, and decided to go to sleep... when Espurr noticed Zorua's dejected look.

The tiny dark type sighed.
"It's... it's about the show, Espurr..." he sincerely said.
"I'm clueless about how I should even do that..."

Espurr looked down at her chest, noticing illusionary fireballs, electricity encircling them. Although, she could definitely tell they were fake.

"You need to practice, Zorua," she suggested.
"Take a few days to do so, and when you feel like doing it, you do it,"

Zorua quietly nodded, not really convinced. All because of a plan and lost bet, he bitterly thought.

"Cheer up, Zorua," Espurr said gently while opening the door that led to her immense bedroom.

She walked over the bed and leaped onto it, before pulling back the blankets with psychic. She placed Zorua on a pillow, before sliding under the sheets herself, wrapping them around her form.

The lights were then psychically switched off.

Espurr lays her head on the same pillow Zorua his, her eyes piercing his soul even through the darkness.

And then, he noticed the small grin on her face.
"You know, Zorua? Maybe..." she said, her paw grabbing a hold of him and dragging him closer.
"... Maybe... I suppose I could give you that reward after all,"

A blush spread across Zorua's cheeks. He knew what she was talking about.

"Espurr..."

He couldn't finish.

Espurr dragged him even closer, before her lips landed on top of his head.

Then, after a few seconds, she pulled back, giggling and blushing.
"Heh, sleep tight, Zorua," she said, moving him to her chest and hugging him.

All she got in response was a mix of incoherent sounds, which made her giggle harder.

Then, she rolled over as she closed her eyes.

Zorua stays quiet for a good while more.

He couldn't tell how much time passed since she kissed him, but her chest started rising and falling along with her rhythmic breath, meaning that Espurr fell asleep.

"I..." Zorua muttered, before leaning against the giantess' chest and snuggling up to her. He closed his eyes.
"Wow..." was all he managed to say before he too fell asleep.
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: A night with Espurr

choices: "At her house."
"At school."
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
"And now, Zorua presents! 'I'm totally sorry for being a jerk and here's some tricks!'...title is a work in progress!"

Zorua stood on a stage, beaming down at a bunch of pokemon he knew from the village...they looked unimpressed.

"U-um, hold onto your hats for this one folks! It's a real electrifying trick!" Zorua said as he started to create some electric hoops and started to flip through them.

"BOO!"

"You really think we care about stuff like this after what you did to us!"

"If you were really sorry you wouldn't show your face around here ever again!"

"N-no, wait guys, I-YOUCH!" A rock clocked him in the head as the crowd got angry and started to throw stuff at him. In a panic he abandoned the stage and started running away. At the end of his run he saw the girls...Celebi, Braixen, Gardevoir, Buneary...Espurr

"G-girls, I-"

"It was a bad idea Zorua, but don't worry, we'll make it right."

Suddenly the world around him started to grow.

"We'll take care of you like this forever."

"And play with you lots~"

"You'll be our pet, Zorua!"

"Zorua...it's alright, we'll keep you safe...any more than that is a bit too much though"

He looked up at the impossibly big girls before hanging his head. "You're right...you're all right..."

"Zorua, wake up!"

"Hwha-?"

-

Zorua's eyes shot open to see him staring up into the soul piercing eyes of Espurr, with her usual deadpan look. "Gah!"

"You have got to be the most striking mix of egotistical boastfulness, unrepentant laziness, self loathing, and soul crushing cynicism I have ever met." She said blankly, seeing his dream.

"And you have got to be the most twisted mix of caring, compassionate, blunt, and eerie that i've ever met!" He shot back, his heart still racing from the wake up. She tilted her head. "Is that why you have a crush on me?" She asked and he blushed again, trying to feign annoyance. She merely smiled at this. "You know it won't happen like that, right?"

"Yes, I know it won't!...Jeez, nightmares are just that, nightmares!" He said, looking back at her. She merely sighed and picked him up. "Come on, we're gonna eat, then i'm giving you back to Celebi..."
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: Nightmares and blunt reassurances

choices: "Well... I guess that could work..." Celebi responds
"I... I don't think that's a good idea..." Celebi responds
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
"I'm gonna give you back to Celebi at her house," Espurr says as she gets up, taking the small Zorua in her paws, hugging him to her chest.

"Now, let's have some breakfast." she adds, walking into her kitchen.

--

The road to Celebi's house was quiet as usual. No one crossed the woods, dreading the possibility of being victims of the infamous Zorua... not knowing that said fox 'mysteriously disappeared'. But in this case, it was luck - what would have pokemon thought seeing Espurr carrying a minuscule Zorua and a drawing of Celebi hugging him levitating behind her?

"Obviously they're scared - and angry - and vengeful - but you'll see," Espurr smiles.
"After the show, no one will have these hard feelings anymore." she reassures.

"I sure hope so..." Zorua responds, not really caring. He was doing this to please Espurr... but if it turned out to be useless, he wouldn't really care.

Once a scoundrel, always a scoundrel, he repeated himself.

Checking his thoughts, Espurr frowns, but says nothing as she keeps walking.

Eventually, she finds herself in the village, and goes straight to Celebi's house.

"Now..." Espurr says upon reaching her friend's front door. She rises Zorua up to her face, before rising her ears.
"Celebi's mother might be inside. Be quiet." she warns, gently placing Zorua on her head, her ears falling back in place.

From beneath her ear, Zorua heard Espurr knocking. Shortly after, he heard the door opening.

"Espurr!" he recognized Celebi's cheerful voice.
"Did you bring my roomie back~?"

Things shake beneath Zorua, making him assume that Espurr just nodded. Then, light shined on him as the giantess' ears rise up again.

The first thing he notices is a smiling Celebi, staring straight at him.
"Hi Cele-" he can't finish as he's snatched by the fairy, and hugged to her chest.

"Missed you~" she chimes, before eyeing Espurr, noticing her holding out a sheet.

"What's that?" Celebi asks as she takes the sheet from Espurr's paws and glancing at it. Her expression of curiosity shifted back into a smile.
"Aw! That's beautiful!" the fairy says cheerfully.

Espurr smiles while blushing.
"It's nothing..." she responds, before her face returns to its usual deadpan expression.
"Now, if you'll excuse me, I'm going back home." she says.

"Sure you don't want to stay over for breakfast?" Celebi suggests. Espurr shakes her head.
"No, thank you. Already eaten," she says, before her eyes fix on Zorua.

"See you both around..." she adds, before snatching Zorua from Celebi, and turning around. Then, to his surprise, she pecks him, sending him in a state of deep embarrassment.

"See you soon. And practice." Espurr whispers with a smile as she nuzzles Zorua, before handing him back to Celebi, who eyes the two with a gleeful smile.

"Bye Espurr. See you around!" Celebi exclaims cheerfully as her friend turns around to leave.

Right before the fairy slams the front door close and moves to her bedroom at supersonic speed, closing the door and locking it behind herself.

Then, the time traveler looks at Zorua with a huge smile as she sets him down on the bed and places the sketch on her desk before leaping on the bed in front of him, making the small dark type bounce.

"EVERYTHING." she says.
"You've gotta tell me everything."

Zorua gulped.
"Is this necessary, Celebi?" he asked.

"Absolutely!" Celebi responds with a wide smile.
"... Also because I won't leave you alone until you've told me every single detail."

The small dark type sighs.
"We've done nothing, really. I've watched Espurr sketching, then we played outside. Then we took a nap, but we overslept and we woke up at night and we slept together." he explains.

Celebi blinks.
"That's it?" she asks.

"Yeah. I've also lost a bet, and now I have to do a show whenever you grow me back and-"

Celebi interrupts.
"... Show? What show?" she asks.
"... Right. Long story short, Espurr had an idea to... 'redeem' me. A show with my illusions. But I refused..." Zorua explains.

The fairy nods as she listens attentively.

"Well... I bet with Espurr I could escape her without my illusions or her psychic powers. If I won, she would have kissed me... if I lost, I would have to do it... the show I mean..." the small fox continues, blushing vaguely.

Celebi stares at him, before starting to laugh.
"And you lost? Aw, how sa-"
"She tricked me. And she kissed me anyway." Zorua cuts her off, blushing even more.

Celebi stops giggling to look at the tiny fox with amazement.

Then, she roughly grabbed him and hugged him to her chest as she started fidgeting on the bed.
"Ohmy-ohmy-ohmy! Gotta tell this to Gardevoir!"

Zorua's eyes widen.
"Don't! Please, she's gonna talk about it forever!" he begs.

Celebi laughs.
"Fine..." she says.
"But now, you have to do this show... right?" she asks while manipulating Zorua so that he's facing her whole still in her grip.

Zorua nods.
"Yes. Whenever you... whenever you grow me back..." he admits.

Celebi's smile fades.

"Yeah. I should do this... as a way to apologize... make others laugh..." Zorua mutters.
"What do you think?"
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: Back at Celebi's house

choices: The crowd begins to disperse, leaving Zorua with his friends...
Things get rough for Zorua...
Some pokemon steps forward, wanting to defend Zorua...
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
"Well... I suppose it could actually work Zorua..." Celebi chimes, causing Zorua to look up at her.
"... Ya sure, Celi? Seriously, this could go terribly wrong... what if someone tries to kill me before I even start?!" he asks.
"You're being paranoid."

"No I'm not! Everyone out there hates me Celebi!" Zorua retorts, making Celebi let out something between a sigh and a giggle.
"Quit acting like this you, it'll go well... you'll be amazing." she reassures with a kind smile.

"... Okay, one, there's a serious possibility that someone tries to harm me... two, I can't even do it right!" Zorua says, a few spheres of electricity starting to float around Celebi... although she can definitely tell they're fake.

The fairy giggles.
"A few days practice, and it'll be perfect... trust me Zorua, you'll be amazing. And you'll be redeemed, you reputation restored." she says.

Zorua sighs.

"D'you think so?"

Celebi nods her head determinedly.
"I know so."

--

The days passed rather rapidly for the small fox, who practiced with his illusions over and over with his friends.

Celebi and Espurr had told everyone, and Braixen, Buneary and Gardevoir agreed that it sounded like a good idea.

With the help of Celebi and Espurr, Zorua managed to put up a small scenography while he finally managed to make his illusions look more realistic.

And finally, the time came. The night when he would show up in front of the village to publicly apologize before getting this show over with...

Currently, the small dark type was wandering around the confines of Celebi's room as he awaited for his friends to come back... they were out telling about the show, they even made a small stage where he could perform.

All of sudden, the fox was assaulted by doubts.

What if the pokemon didn't like it?

What if they were going to hurt him?

What his friends hated him because he messed up?

What if...

"You really should stop worrying." a voice chimes as the door of the room opens, letting five giantesses come inside.

Celebi, Buneary, Braixen, Gardevoir and Espurr, all with smiles on their faces.
"It's time Zorua..." Celebi gently says, while Espurr moves to pick him up.

"We've told everyone! Even mom will be there!" Buneary says.

"I'm having second thoughts..." Zorua meekly admits.

"Too late, Zorua! Everyone is waiting for you out there!" Gardevoir tells.
"Even if they're kinda..." Braixen went to the window.
"... Frowny..."

Zorua gulped.

But he couldn't say a word more as Espurr starts walking, followed by the four girls as they move outside of Celebi's house, where the stage was built. Quietly, the five girls move behind Celebi's house.

Espurr gently places Zorua on the ground, and he soon finds the world around him shrinking as he grows back to his normal size.

"Good luck Zorua~ we'll be in the crowd cheering for you~" Celebi sings as she and the others move to reach the other pokemon. Only Espurr lingers for a moment.

"... Good luck Zorua. You'll be great." she tells with a smile as she leans forward, pecking his cheek.

Zorua blushed, watching as the small psychic type went to reach the other girls.

The dark fox sighed to himself, before running out from behind the house. And, with determination, he leaps on the stage.

All kinds of faces - glares, smirks, cold stares and not-so-polite gestures from the pokemon watching him. He sighs.

"Hi there everyone..." he says.
"I... I know I've been a jerk to... all of you actually, so, I hoped to apologize to y'all... and on that purpose, I put up this small show..." he paused to don his brightest smile.
"... Which I truly hope you'll enjoy."

--

The fireworks display came to an end as colorful sparks rained on Zorua, who was panting from the struggle... but was still smiling.

"And now for the grand finale people!" he shouted as he performed the trick that took a lot of practice.

Suddenly, the dark sky flashed with various shades of red as a figure soared.

A gigantic phoenix made of fire flies around, electric spheres encircling it, sparks of both fire and electricity falling down from the sky.

Then, the phoenix landed on top of the stage, spread its wings and exploded in a rain of sparks.

Zorua looked at the crowd, panting, sweating, but smiling brightly.

But... something was wrong.

Someone was clapping but... the pokemon were still wearing unimpressed looks...

"... That's it?" he recognized Wigglytuff's voice.
"I believe that so far you've done nothing but waste our time."

"Uh..."

"That was supposed to be an apology?" a Pichu chimes, and Zorua recalls the time he shoved him to steal his ice cream.

"... Yes?" he risks responding.

"You've hurt me..." Swinub timidly said... psychologically traumatized, Zorua recalled...

Soon enough, the whole crowd started yelling awful things... the whole crowd but his friends, who were looking devastated. Espurr was looking around in shock, he noted.

Zorua closed his eyes, listening to all the insults thrown at him...

‘Keep calm Zorua...’ he thought... before feeling something hitting his head quite hard. He opened his eyes... a rock fell on the stage, followed by another, and another.

The same type stared at them, before gritting his teeth. THAT was enough.

"Okay, y'all, I get it! You hate me, and you have a good reason to do so!" he shouted, his words having the effect of making Wigglytuff's arm stop in midair as he was about to throw a rock too.

Zorua was seething.

"I understand, I've been a jerk to all of you, I deserve all this! You're justified people, that's what you want to hear right?!" he continued.

"Zorua..." Celebi muttered from the crowd.

"I made this damn show because I was hoping to apologize! But I see none of you cares! Alright then, hate me all you want, but just leave me alone!" he shouted at top of his lungs, watching the crowd reacting to his words...
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: One bad night

choices: Zorua is mad
Zorua is...crying?
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
"Well I do hate you, but I won't leave you alone right now! You don't deserve mercy after what you've done!" Wigglytuff threw the rock and it gave the other pokemon in the crowd the incentive to resume their assault on him. Rocks, fruit, and other such junk assaulted him as he closed his eyes and bore the brunt of it with gritted teeth.

He saw Wigglytuff and Graveler crawl up on the stage through hazy eyes and he was punched hard by Graveler and slammed down by Wigglytuff's psychic.

A gout of flame erupted from the crowd stopping their assault though as Zorua laid down, he was bleeding from a sharp rock hitting his side and covered in sticky fruit and what looked to be soda covering him. He groaned a bit from the assault.

The flames died down as the crowd dispersed around the pokemon who made it...it was a very angry looking Braixen.

"Okay, you've all made your point! You still hate him! Fine!" She yelled at them all, making them wince. "But throw one more damn thing at my friend and see what happens! Go ahead! Be the first pokemon to try! And to you Wigglytuff and Graveler...oh, you two just wait!" She yelled and Celebi stepped forward glaring.

"I too would like to have a moment with the next pokemon to try something." She said coldly as many in the crowd let out a collective gulp. Wigglytuff felt himself sweat a bit and Graveler looked unimpressed, not phased by any of it as he went to kick the pokemon laying down.

He was grabbed by an intense psychic force and levitated harshly to the face of...Espurr. She was not deadpan.

"You're done with him Graveler." He was sent soaring into the air, flying far far away as he landed...somewhere in the forest. Probably hard.

The rest of the crowd averted their eyes and some dispersed, others stayed and mildly apologized but Celebi and Braixen were hearing none of it as they left.

Buneary ran up on the stage to look at Zorua, crying herself and the others followed.

"Zorua, are you okay?" She asked as Celebi gently touched her to get her to move away from Zorua and went to heal him. She saw his face though, and saw...
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: Assault

choices: Zorua eventually came out, wanting to talk things out.
Zorua didn't show up. He just needed to be alone.
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
Before his five, recently acquired friends, Zorua laid unmoving, his eyes closed, not producing any sound, an almost sinister quiet surrounding him.

The fox's unnatural behavior led Celebi to think her friend had fainted.

"Z-Zorua?"

Several moments in which no one dared to speak or move passed. Even Espurr was being oddly quiet, but the explanation was that she was reading Zorua's thoughts... and was bracing herself.

Before everyone's gazes, the dark-type began moving; slowly, very slowly, Zorua stood back on all fours, sticky substances of all sorts mixed with his own blood rolling down his body, rendering his fur sticky, the dark strands intermingled because of the stuff.

Despite the comical appearance, there was nothing to laugh about. At his normal size, Zorua easily towered above a few of his friends such as Buneary, Espurr and the one pokemon who started it all, Celebi; somehow, being covered in smashed fruit and blood only made him look rather imposing to the three girls. Even Braixen and Gardevoir looked quite anxious.

All of a sudden, his eyes opened, two bright blue disks fixed on each and every one of his friends.

Espurr stepped back, intimidated.

The bomb was about to blow...

"Zo... Z-Zorua?" Buneary timidly began, childish tears still rolling down her cheeks.

"I knew." the fox spoke in a low hiss, his paw rising. The five girls kept track of the fore leg rising up as its owner removed some of the gunk covering him from his face, letting it fall down to the wooden stage.

"I just knew." Zorua continued, beginning to walk past his friends,
"I just. Bloody. Knew."

Espurr read Zorua's next thought and winced, knowing that someone was going to take the blame for everything that had happened.

"Zorua..."

"This was the worst idea ever!" Zorua finally snapped while abruptly turning around, causing all the girls to flinch. Even Celebi, whose feet weren't even touching the ground at the moment.

Zorua shot Espurr a fiery stare.

"I cannot believe how you could think a dumb thing like this," he began,
"... Could 'redeem' me! 'Just do a bloody show, Zorua, you'll see'!"

The frustrated fox dropped back on the ground, paws over his eyes.

"... I did this all out of respect for y'all. You were so excited about the idea that I... I decided to give it a shot. I believed in it for a moment, pictured myself walking in this godforsaken village without anyone insulting me, or yelling at me, or throwing stuff at me, or even chasing me down!" he declared, his breathing growing heavy.

No one dared to speak after the outburst.

"I was such an idiot... believing in it to begin with..." the fox continued.

Finally, someone decided to speak up.

"... You're wounded." Braixen unnecessarily stated, her gaze shifting to her green friend,
"Celi, can you heal him? It'll hopefully calm him down..."

Zorua growled at the mention.

Celebi offered a slight nod as she hovered closer to the pokemon she shared her house with unbeknownst to her mother.

"Come on, Zorua," the legendary spoke sympathetically,
"Let's just fix that nasty wound so you can-"

The time-traveling fairy was interrupted when Zorua's paw darted away from his eye to intercept hers.

He was glaring at her.

"... Do what? Go back to being small? I don't think so." he growled, pushing Celebi away while standing back up.

"What?" Gardevoir spoke all of a sudden, alerted by the fox's statement. She shot Espurr a look, causing the psychic-type to blush.

Zorua ignored them.

"... I want to be alone. Like I've always been." he said in a calmer tone as he hopped down the stage and onto the hard ground, droplets of blood falling from his body, staining the surface.

The fox stared back at his friends one last time.

"Go. Go have your fun and leave me be. I'll show up again... eventually." he stated, beginning to walk away, in direction of his former home: the woods.

Espurr sided to Celebi.

"Don't let him go!" she whispered,
"He could try to get revenge! What'd happen then?"

Celebi stared at the dark-type walking away, putting a good distance between himself and the stage where the five girls stood in shock.

"He won't listen..." she pointed out resignedly.

"We need to stop him." the small psychic-type replied.

Celebi nodded.

Both psychics' eyes began glowing.

In distance, everyone could see Zorua suddenly hovering in mid-air. Braixen, Gardevoir and Buneary gasped, but quickly followed Celebi and Espurr when the duo began dashing towards the trapped fox, who was now struggling furiously.

"Let-"

"Zorua, be reasonable!" Celebi exclaimed,
"We're all here to help you! If you just listen for a moment, we'll let you go and I'll-"

"I am not going back to being small!" Zorua roared, causing Buneary to shiver. Even when trapped and outnumbered, Zorua looked scarier than ever.

She felt it, the old Zorua, the fox she had dreaded for so long... he was coming back.

"It's the best thing, dude!" Braixen chimed in, followed by Espurr,
"You're in a fragile state of mind right now, we just want to keep you from-"

"Will you shut up, all of you!?" Zorua snapped,
"You guys, you don't even respect me enough to let me take my own decisions! Since all of... all of this started, you've been just controlling my life, like you would with a damn pet!"

Everyone gasped at the statement.

Celebi and Espurr felt like their hearts sinking in an ocean of sadness.

"That's not-"

"Well, allow me to say, ladies," Zorua unceremoniously interrupted his romance-loving friend while adopting an enraged look on his face again,
"That this ain't happening, not anymore!"

In the split second that followed the fox's last statement, he glowed of a purplish/black light as a wave of pure darkness spread around him, knocking the pokemon surrounding him back while also causing the psychic grip that held him to fade, allowing him to fall on all fours on the ground.

With the five girls blinded by his Night Daze, Zorua took the opportunity and cloaked himself in an illusion, before sprinting away into the night.

Behind him, the cloud of darkness dissipated, allowing the five pokemon to see clearly again.

Especially Braixen, who angrily gazed around.

"Why that little-"

"We need to find him," Celebi interrupted,
"We need to clarify this."

"He's headed for the forest." Espurr told.

Celebi gave a hasty nod, before she began fluttering away, in direction of the woods, followed by Espurr... who ran in a very awkward way.

Gardevoir was next to sprint away, followed by Buneary.

With a last growl, Braixen followed too.

--

The group had no luck finding Zorua on the way to his forest.

And the woods were very quiet.

"Z-Zorua, come on out!" Buneary yelled despite the fear she felt towards the fox.

No reply.

"He must he be around here. Let's search for him." Braixen suggested.
"And watch out, this place is full of nasty tricks."

The group began searching for the fox, unaware that he was there.

Hidden behind his illusion, watching them as they searched for him.

He began feeling somewhat conflicted seeing the effort everyone was putting into trying to find him.

Hastily, he recalled some of the good times he shared with Espurr, Celebi... lies, he told himself, illusions even more effective than his, because he believed them to be a reality.

Still... he didn't feel hateful towards those pokemon.

Angry, betrayed, sad, but not hateful.

Maybe... should he have given them a chance to talk?

The fox felt conflicted, lest they'd feed him even more lies, despite them claiming those lies to be the truth.

But Zorua knew, they only acted friendly because, when tiny, he was harmless. Still, they had been nice to him...

What should have he done?
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: Zorua's madness

choices: For now, they force him to shrink
They try to reason with him some more
When they come back, he's gone!
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
Zorua looked on in disgust at the 5 girls looking for him. He didn't need their pity, if not for them he wouldn't be dirty, matted in blood...shit like this reminded him why he was better off alone. Even when he'd resolved to try and turn over a new leaf the village would have none of it. "Then let me be evil..." He muttered.

"Zorua...please come out, we just want to talk and help you feel better..." Buneary said. She couldn't have realized she was looking directly at Zorua, even if he was about 20 feet away. The illusion masked him quite well, but looking into those black eyes, full of worry from a pokemon he'd hurt so badly in the past. His expression softened.

"Zorua, come on...you can't just go back to this life. If you do then I won't forgive you." It was Braixen. She looked more worried than she was letting on in her voice.

"If you don't want to become smaller right away that's fine, just let us discuss this with you...we need to get you cleaned up too, it'll be good for everyone..." He heard Celebi saying, the worry clear in her voice.

"You aren't in any condition to stay here tonight, you've got bruises, cuts, and are quite dirty. Listen to reason...we're all sorry about what happened tonight, know that we didn't want this." Zorua heard Gardevoir too, more somber sounding than he'd heard.

"Zorua...i'm so sorry Zorua, please just talk to us..." It was then that he felt Espurr's eyes on him, those endless pools, full of so much subtle emotion, the more he looked into them, the more he felt like he understood. His heart beat faster as he looked on and with a grunt he dropped his illusion.

"Just go away girls, I ain't gonna go back with ya." He said, not sounding nearly as angry or confidant in that statement as when he'd just run off. Immediately 5 worried pokemon were in front of him, looking him over as he looked more stoic than anything. Espurr reached up, gingerly touching at a sticky spot on his muzzle where a fruit had popped on impact.

"Zorua, if I had known in any way..." She said gently, he looked down, his blue eyes softening a bit before they hardened. Espurr honed in on his thoughts and sighed.

"No, i'm not trying to leverage your crush on me...let us be there for you, okay?" Espurr gently said. Zorua's eyes wavered before he blinked and pulled back.

"Well whatever 'being there for me' entails, it won't entail me being small again, got it?" His eyes drifted to his floating legendary friend and she nodded. "Let's just...drop that detail for now then, we do need to get you cleaned up though."

"That night shade was a low blow Zorua." Braixen said, her arms crossed, the first thing she said to them, her facade cracked pretty early though as she dropped them. "But I can't blame you for feeling the way you felt...just don't do that again." She said, Buneary for her part jumped to hug around Zorua's neck.

"S-stop kid, you don't want this gunk on you too." Zorua said as he tried to shake her off. She was crying though, her tears mixing into the blood and sticky substances that coated him.

"Zorua, please don't go back to the way you were!" She said. "We're sorry about the show!" Zorua just laid down on his paws, making Buneary touch her feet to the ground again.

"If you're worried about me pranking you then that just isn't going to happen." Zorua said.

"...And the rest of the village?" Espurr said gently, 'Damn her mind reading...' Zorua thought. "We'll see." Was all he said. Buneary broke her hug as Zorua stood up again and started to walk further into his forest.

"If you want to talk then fine, follow me, i'm just gonna clean off in the stream near here." He seemed resigned to their stubborn concern, and a part of him appreciated it too.

-

"D-damn cold!" Zorua said as he got in.

"You could use a nice, warm..."

"What, sink?" Zorua said wryly. Celebi, cut off, blushed as that was exactly what her plan had been.

Zorua closed his eyes as he let the water wash away as much of the gunk as it could. "Look, I won't go back to the village, that's what I was thinking okay? It might be time for me to move on." Zorua said simply to his friends as they looked at him.

"What do you mean by that?" Braixen asked before Espurr gasped.

"You can't do that!" She said, the outburst surprising herself as well. Zorua opened his eyes and looked at her. "Well honestly, it's probably my best bet, I don't intend to be small again, and I recognize that i'm not gonna get the village to turn around on me, might just be best to find another place to hang, different stomping grounds." He said. "And I can start things on the right paw this time." He said, almost emphasizing his sentence with a small splash of his paw.

"Zorua that's...that's nuts! Come on, please!" Celebi didn't want her friend to go away. He seemed pretty calm after her outburst though.

"But what about...about..." Gardevoir sounded crushed as her eyes went between Espurr and Zorua.

"Zorua, I don't want you to leave." Buneary said sadly.

"Well it isn't that I entirely want to leave either but..." He muttered, more to himself than anything. "It's what I can do to make things right with everyone." He said before he sunk a bit more into the water.

"Girls, meeting." Celebi said with authority, they all looked to her.

"We'll be right back Zorua, just...don't go anywhere." Celebi said gently. He didn't say anything in response.

-

"Just shrink him and bring him with us, he'll be mad at first, but he'll come around." Braixen said.

"Braixen that's..."

"I agree honestly...this isn't pranking the village, but it's a short sighted rash action nonetheless, and not..." Espurr's mind drifted to the story of his dad. "Not in his best interests."

"Maybe we should just go to someone's place with him normal sized right now...he doesn't want to be small." Buneary said.

"Maybe Espurr's?"

Celebi bit her lip. "I'm worried that he might not even be receptive to that at this point..."

Braixen sighed. "What to do..." She muttered.
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: Zorua's somber solution

choices: The crowd starts cheering. It worked!
The crowd isn't pleased...
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
A few days passed since Zorua visited Espurr's house. She brought him back to Celebi, and she left him to explain what he had to do.

Celebi unsurprisingly found it a good idea, and suggested that he started training immediately while she told about the idea to Braixen, Gardevoir and Buneary.

It took Celebi a while of discussing - Gardevoir was very excited about Zorua spending the day with Espurr - but in the end they too agreed that it was a great idea.

And now, Zorua was resting on a pillow in Celebi's room. It was nighttime, but it wasn't any normal night. No, tonight was the night when his show would take place.

Over the past few days he practiced a lot. He managed to improve his illusions and made up a small scenography under Celebi's advices.

The five girls were out, telling the people of the village about the show...

Zorua shivers slightly. What if no one like his show? What if the pokemon don't even give him a chance? What if they get angry and try to ki-

The attention of the small fox is drawn as the door of the room opens, letting five pokemon enter.

Celebi, Espurr, Braixen, Gardevoir and Buneary. All wearing bright smiles upon their faces, minus Espurr who remains deadpan as always.

"It's time, Zorua," Celebi says, moving forward and scooping the small fox up.

Zorua backs up on her paw.
"I'm starting to have second thoughts..." he quietly says.

"What? You can't be serious!" Braixen states.
"You've been practicing for days Zorua!" Buneary chimes in with a smile.

"The show is perfect. You'll go just fine." Gardevoir encourages with a reassuring smile.

Celebi nods.
"And besides, it's too late to quit now - we told everyone. And when I say everyone, I do mean everyone." she says, eyes wide open for the excitement.

Zorua's eyes widened too.

EVERYONE?!

"Oh..." he quietly muttered.

"Yup. But look on the bright side - if the show goes well, we'll party here all night long!" Celebi chimes.
"And if it doesn't... we'll party here all night long anyway." she adds with a grin.

Zorua gulped, but smiled a bit, slightly reassured.

"O-Okay..." he stutters.
"Let's go."

--

"Wow..." Zorua mutters from Celebi's paws. She wasn't kidding - everyone in the village was in front of a small stage the five girls made. Everyone, obviously including all the pokemon who were the unlucky victims of the fox's pranks.

For some reason, all those Zorua pulled pranks on were smirking. Maybe they were thinking about Zorua failing, humiliating himself in front of the whole village as a result.

Celebi gently puts Zorua on the ground, before her eyes start glowing.

And, before the girls' eyes, the fox grows back to his original size.
"And the scoundrel was back," Braixen remarks playfully.

Celebi shakes her head.
"Now, you go up there and do it, alright?" she says as she and the others start moving towards the crowd.

"We'll be cheering for you!" Buneary says with a smile. Then, the five girls disappear among the crowd, leaving Zorua alone.

He gulped, before starting to walk over the stage. And, with reluctance, he hopped on.

--

Everyone.

Everyone was staring at him. Zorua was looking at all kinds of facial expressions - disdain, anger, hate even... and five smiles from five very familiar girls.

The fox felt a lump in his throat. He forcefully swallowed it, before starting to talk.

"U-Uhm... Hi, everyone," he started.
"I-I know, I've been a jerk to... all of you, actually. And I'm... I'm doing this... show because... Arceus why is it so hard... I h-hope you'll all accept my apologies... and that you'll enjoy the show..." he stutters incoherently.

No one talked. Nonetheless, their expressions didn't change, save for his friends, who smiled in satisfaction.

Zorua sighed as his eyes started glowing.
‘Here goes nothing...’

--

The rainbow shattered in a million tiny slivers that rained all over Zorua as the sky returned dark.

Someone from the crowd clapped.

"Now... time for the grand finale..." Zorua said as he focuses to perform the trick he's been training on for days.

Spheres of fire encircled by electricity appeared along with a bunch of shimmering bubbles. The spheres started encircling Zorua and started moving, faster and faster.

Then, suddenly, illusionary fireworks roared behind the fox, and all the spheres fused together, taking the shape of a large dragon surrounded by electricity, which breathed fire up in the sky, before exploding in a rain of sparks and flames.

Then, the night returned quiet, and Zorua gazed at the crowd, showing his brightest smile.
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: The show

choices: He turned around, and seemed resigned to his reputation
He turned around, looking bitter and angry
They heard him start sniffling, he had been crying
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
