Zorua wore his smile with a few rounds of applause from the audience before he heard. "...So, is that it?" A surprisingly gruff voice called out, before a Wigglytuff stepped forward a bit. "Or do you want to show us some other neat and empty tricks?" Zorua's smile started to fade.

"I mean...it did look nice and all Zorua, I suppose...I just don't see why this would be an apology, it was just you showing off. I appreciate the sentiment though...I think." A Deliberd added.

Zorua wore a completely neutral expression, before something hit him in the head...a ripped pokedoll. "That's what you did to my favorite doll, and then you laughed at me! You think I care about something like this!?" Azurill cried at him. Zorua said nothing as he stared at the doll, still stone faced. The crowd started to get riled up now, shouting one thing after another at him. He picked up 'glory hound' 'conniving' and 'callous' quite a few times in there.

Celebi was gritting her teeth before Braixen put a hand on her shoulder and shook her head before whispering. "This was always a possibility, and as much as Zorua has changed, it doesn't erase his past. Nothing probably could at this point..." She said as she looked up at him.

"Zorua..." Buneary whimpered looking up. Gardevoir was looking at the ground with her fists clenched, but ultimately said nothing nor looked at Zorua.

Espurr looked absolutely devastated but said nothing as well. Zorua let his eyes pass over all 5 of them, before looking at more angry faces in the crowd. He slowly shut his eyes before muttering. "Thank you for your time. Sorry." Before he sprinted off stage, still stone faced. The crowd erupted, throwing anything they could in his general direction.

"And don't come back!"

Celebi and Espurr were off in a dash.

"Zorua! Zorua come back!"

Braixen picked up Buneary on her back and was off as well, Gardevoir keeping pace.

"He went in the direction of the forest, if he doesn't want to be found he won't be." Espurr said, a twinge of remorse in her voice, the crowd at this point was starting to fade and disperse. 'I can't believe I was so stupid!' Espurr thought, not believing what she got Zorua into. Soon they were in his forest, and at night it came off as quite earie. The slowly split off into directions, trying to stay within shouting distance of each other. After about 15 or so minutes, Gardevoir saw him, out on a ridge, overlooking a lower part of the forest.

"Girls! He's over here!" They heard Gardevoir shouting as they convened on her location. Zorua's back was to them.

"Zorua...?" Celebi said gently, as she approached the small fox.
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: The crowd isn't pleased...

choices: "Sure thing!" Zorua responds with a grin as he follows
"I'd like to be alone for a while..." Zorua responds, still emotionless
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
As Celebi approaches him, Zorua turns around. He doesn't looks sad, or happy, or isn't showing any emotion at all.

He wears a completely neutral look on his face. Almost like he is bored with what just happened.

"Zorua..." Celebi mutters.
"What?" he asks, surprisingly calm with the whole thing.

"That... was rough..." Gardevoir says.
"How are you feeling?" Buneary asks as she hops off Braixen's back, wearing a concerned expression.

Zorua huffs.
"... I'm fine," he bluntly replies, his forepaws rising as he shrugs.
"I mean, that's what people think of me. That's what they always thought of me, since I started my 'career' as a prankster..." he says, sighing.

Celebi opens her mouth to speak, but no sound comes out.

"Sadly, that's the truth. We can't change that..." Braixen bitterly states.
"Braixen, let me ask you something," the fox gazes at Zorua.

"D'you think I could care less?" he asks, taking all the pokemon in front of him by surprise.

"... You're serious..." Espurr states, reading his thoughts.

Zorua nods.
"Of course. If the whole village doesn't want to accept my apologies, if they all want to keep hating me... why should I even care? At least I tried." he says with resignation.

"They said horrible things..." Gardevoir says, surprised with Zorua's indifference. He shrugs again.
"I've heard worse."

The five girls remain quiet after the last remark.

But then, the unexpected happens - Espurr runs up to him, wrapping her paws around his neck as she hugs the fox, tears running down her cheeks.

"It was my fault! All of it! I should have never suggested that show!" she cries.
"I-I was reading the thoughts of everyone, nobody wanted to forgive you! I should have warned you! Stupid me - I thought they would have changed their minds after the show!"

Zorua blushes, taken aback by the sudden display of emotions Espurr is going through. The always calm and deadpan Espurr crying... that's not something him... or the other girls ever saw.

Still, Zorua closes his eyes, wrapping a paw around her.
"It's not your fault, Espurr. You were trying to help... it simply didn't work..." he says gently, before releasing her, looking at the five pokemon in front of him.

"You are the only ones who ever gave me a chance..." he mutters, smiling a little, while Espurr wiped the tears from her eyes.
"I appreciated the fact you were there..."

"It was amazing!" Buneary exclaims, attempting to cheer Zorua up.

He smiles warmly, before his expression falls back into a neutral one. Everyone remains silent afterwards.

After a while, Celebi breaks the silence.
"Well... I did say it..." the fairy mutters as she adopts a small smile.
"It might have went wrong, but... we can still party back home!" she exclaims, causing the other girls to smile.

A blush spread on Celebi's cheeks.
"Just... Y'know..." she cupped her paw together. Zorua got the gist: he had to return to the size he was before of the show. The girls behind her started giggling. Espurr blushed.

Zorua looked at Celebi.
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: Zorua doesn't care

choices: Zorua is fine
As Zorua reflects on it, the show does start to bug him emotionally
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
Zorua started to laugh at this. Before grinning. "That size again huh, that really is starting to become my default." He said. "Well we need to go back through the village, an-"

"Sure thing." He cut her off. He didn't mind, the most fun he'd had in...honestly probably his entire life was at that size.

"It's not permanent you know" Espurr said, knowing that she was both reassuring him by saying that, and on some level disappointing him that she said that. He had a thought, and before Espurr could fully process it he acted on it and he ran to her to hug her. "While I can." He simply said and she blushed.

"Awwww~" Gardevoir's eyes were sparkling.

"Alright Zorua, are you ready?" Celebi asked as Zorua broke the hug. "That I am, make me a shrinky dink!" He grinned. And soon the world around him, the girls around him started to expand and grow. Soon he was staring ahead at Espurr's feet and she leaned down to pick him up, and hugged him tight to her chest. "Thank you Zorua...I really am sorry..." She murmured as he grinned up.

"I know you were trying to help Espurr! It's really fine!"

"Come on, let's forget all about this and go have some fun!" Braixen grinned as she turned around and started to head for the village. Soon they were passing through it and Espurr hugged Zorua even tighter to her chest. 'They don't understand...and they won't get him.' Was all she thought as she passed a few of the villagers, trying her best to conceal him in her chest. 'No, I won't let them.' And soon they were passing through a quiet and deserted part of the village.

"So is it just more board games, or-"

"You'll see~" Celebi said in a sing song voice as they got closer to her house.

"Ah, great..." He said, sarcastically dreading what she had planned. Espurr let a small smile play on her face. 'He really is fine...i'm so relieved...don't worry Zorua, I will definitely make it up to you.' She thought.

Soon the girls and Zorua were settling in, eating some snacks and laughing it up, Zorua did seem his normal self, and Gardevoir and Celebi were desperately putting him and Espurr on blast about going on a date while they tried anything to deflect it. Buneary sat there smiling and blushing while Braixen herself was just laughing at it all. Things seemed well, and as the night drew on...
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: Back to being small

choices: He uselessly resists and is captured...
He musters an illusion and burrows underground in the confusion!
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
"Just leave me be," Zorua muttered. He had never felt so humiliated before in his entire life. It had felt like stupid idea from the start as well as during its execution, but the aftermath was something else entirely. Wigglytuff had derided him. Wigglytuff! That spoiled, oily sack of crap deserved to be hung upside down-

His heart was pounding in his ears as he shook his head, his face flush with embarassment. What was he thinking?! He was reformed now. No more pranks. Although the whole bunch deserved to find a really nasty surprise inside their desks tomor-

"If it makes you feel any better, I feel like I got my revenge," Braixen said with a short snicker. Gardevoir jabbed her in between the ribs with her elbow.

"We're still your friends, Zorua," she explained calmly as Zorua glared back at her with an accusing expression, "... Uh, even if we did turn you into the laughing-stock of the entire neighborhood."

"Would you two shut up?!" Celebi jumped to Zorua's defense, "Can't you see he's feeling bad enough already?"

So this was it then, Zorua thought. Publicly humiliated. He couldn't help but snicker to himself as he recalled the stupid dragon routine he had attempted. It was the sort of thing he'd make other, weaker Pokémon do for his own amusement. He felt that he wasn't very good at being on the other side of the laughter.

No matter how hard he tried to block out the thoughts, he knew there was a way to make this all right. Another show. Promising even more ridicule of the school's favorite punching bag. But what they would find, oh so far from their expectations. Traps would be in place. Illusions to turn them white with fear. Sweet, SWEET revenge; He'd be the most infamous prankster of all time!

He looked back at the girls with a big smile on his face. Celebi smiled back cheerfully while Gradevoir forced a nervous smile, Braixen looked somewhat confused, Buneary had a flustered apperance and Espurr...

His eyes locked with Espurr's. Her tears were dried up, and she was looking a bit more dangerous than usual.

"Celebi," Espurr spoke up calmly, "Shrink him."

Oh crap.

"Wh-What?" Celebi stammered in surprise as Zorua felt the color on his face drain away.

"He is in a destabilized state of mind and will attempt something extremely dumb if you do not," Espurr explained while never letting her terrifying eyes leave your form.

"Th-That's not fair! Get out of my head!" Zorua shouted at them as he took a step back. He hadn't even done anything yet! Was just thinking about it a crime now?

"... Well, I suppose there's no harm," Celebi admits as he holds her arms towards Zorua, "I really do think he'll have fun at the party. Besdies, more more cute like this."

Zorua swallowed hard as he realized everything was getting bigger all around him.

"N-No! Not again! NOT AGAIN!" he shouted desperately as he made a mad dash away from the legendary. He felt a blast of Psychic lightly tugging at his Dark-type body to slow him down.

"... It is for your own good. You have to turst me..." Espurr's voice rang from behind, sounding louder and louder with each syllable. Another Psychic joined the fray as he was held in place by the mysterious power.

"Yes! SO much fun!" Gardevoir chimes in, her voice positively booming now. The strands of grass begin to tower over Zorua as he closes his eyes in terror...
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: "I'd like to be alone for a while......

choices: As the party goes on, Zorua starts to feel better...
Zorua still feels humiliated and betrayed...
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
Zorua watches with horror as the world around him grows.
"C-Celebi... stop it!" he shouts, unable to move a single muscle because of the triple psychic force keeping him still as he keeps shrinking.

"Come on, Zorua. I understand you're frustrated because of that show, but this party will make up for it," Celebi responds as she watches Zorua shrinking down to size, his height drained by her powers.

Until, finally, Zorua was back to the same size he was before of the show that definitely ruined his reputation.

"Aw, there we go," the fairy tells as the shrinking ends, while she, Espurr and Gardevoir release the now tiny fox from their psychic grip.

Celebi bends, gently picking Zorua up.

"... We aren't betraying you Zorua. We are your friends, we are only trying to avoid you doing something extremely idiotic." Espurr says upon checking the fox's thoughts.

"It's not idiotic! It's what they deserve - each and every one of those useless, pathetic pokemon!" Zorua responds, the thought of revenge - oh, sweet revenge - making him grin maniacally.

Espurr picks on a few of his thoughts, and shivers.

Celebi bites her lip. This situation is going out of hand.
"Let's... let's go back home, Zorua," she says, hugging him in an useless attempt to comfort the small dark type.

Zorua struggles in her grip, but can't even move her paws.
"Come on... we'll cheer you up..." Celebi mumbles in a comprehensive manner as she moves forward, in direction of her house.

"Maybe a nice chess match will do it..." she adds cheerfully.

This only worsens Zorua's mood. But he remains quiet as Celebi and the other girls walk away from the forest.

His mind remains on all the 'nice' things he would do to all the villagers whenever he managed to regain his size.

Espurr shivers again as she reads his thoughts. The ideas Zorua is having to get payback are horrible things to think of...

"He can't do anything while he's tiny..." Espurr mumbles in an attempt to reassure herself.
"Celebi won't grow him until he's stable again..."

--

"Come on, Zorua, could you at least try to enjoy yourself?" Celebi asks as she watches the unmoving, small fox lazily laying on the chess board, limbs spread as he gives the five girls a blank stare without answering.

"Celebi, he hates chess, remember?" Gardevoir states, while Braixen face-palms.

"Come on Zorua... play... you'll feel better..." Buneary meekly tries, not even succeeding in getting Zorua to look at her.

But Braixen had enough.
"Okay, this is ridiculous," she suddenly states as she leans forward, her paw grabbing the smaller fox.

"Alright, I understand - you were humiliated in front of everyone, but you gotta move on!" she exclaims. All she accomplishes is another neutral stare from the little pokemon.

Espurr suddenly moves, leaping up and snatching Zorua from Braixen. If he really has a crush on her, she thinks, maybe she could succeed in improving his mood.
"Come on Zorua... cheer up..." she whispers gently, her voice not as monotone as always. She hugs Zorua to her chest.

Zorua looks into Espurr's eyes, his half lidded as he keeps quiet. Espurr assumes a dejected expression.

Celebi moves towards the door of her room.
"Girls?" she calls out, obtaining general attention.
"May I talk to you all for a moment?"

They all nod. Espurr gently places the fox on the floor, before she and the other girls walk towards Celebi.

They all watch as Zorua spreads his limbs as he lays down in the middle of the room.

"Be right back!" Celebi exclaims, before pushing the four girls out of the door and exiting herself, closing the door behind herself, leaving Zorua alone.

Only then he dares to sigh.

--

"Okay, problem. He's depressed." Celebi says, looking at her friends dejectedly.
"And vengeful." Espurr adds.

Celebi opts to ignore her.
"How do we cheer him up?"

"I'm clueless."
"Attempting to comfort him with words didn't work..."

Buneary puts a paw to her mouth.
"What if... what if we do something he likes...?" she timidly suggests.

"Right now, all he wants is grow back, get out of this house, give Wigglytuff a piece of his mind and make Azurill swallow the remains of the poke-doll he threw at him..." Espurr reveals.

Celebi sighs.
"He's in a delicate state of mind right now..." she mutters as she tries to think of a way to help the small fox.

After a few minutes, Celebi sighs as she looks up.
"Okay, I say, we go on with the party - no harsh words..." she looks at Braixen.
"... And we act like that show never happened."

"Are you sure it'll work?" Gardevoir asks.
"I mean, he ignored Espurr too. Espurr!" she adds with a shocked expression.

"Why? What's with Espurr?" Buneary asks, genuinely curious. Espurr blushes.
"Nothing." she replies.

Celebi sighs.
"Well... it might work... He'll cheer up... hopefully..." says while opening the door.
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: Vengeance and depression

choices: Zorua comes willingly
Zorua clings to staying under the bed
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
As the five girls came back into the room they say that Zorua hadn't moved from his spot. "We're back~" Says Celebi "We were talking about grabbing something to eat, and we were wanting your input~ Come on, anything you want!" Celebi said cheerfully as she towered over the tiny pokemon. He said and did nothing.

"Zorua...come on..." Buneary got on her knees and in his face, he didn't respond initially, but cleared his throat. "Buneary...small, sweet, docile Buneary...what does my voice sound like right now?" He said, slowly, methodically. She seemed taken aback. "Well...normal, but sad..." She said before she added. "Also a little funny too, it's squeakier and quieter than when you're big." She giggled a little before putting her paws to her lips. "Oh um...sorry Zorua..." She said hoping she hadn't made him more upset, he smiled bitterly and laughed. "Huh, sounds normal to my ears! You know what your voice is, timid, quiet Buneary? It's loud. It's intimidating. It's powerful. All of you are right now. Why!? Why did you do this to me again!?" He got on his feet as he demanded an explanation. Celebi winced.

"It was for your safety Zorua, you were gonna...you were gonna..." Gardevoir started before Espurr sighed. "It's so you don't do anything rash. The thoughts of vengeance in your head were not pleasant Zorua. Let us calm you down, have some fun tonight." She urged as he stood there.

"I thought you said the show would work." He said bitterly, as his voice cracked a little. "I worked hard, we all did! I wanted to make it up to them and..." He turned away from any of the girls as he ran under Celebi's bed.

"Zorua!" Celebi shouted as she looked under there to see the small black pokemon curled up in a corner. She sighed before coming standing up and facing the other girls.

"Any ideas..." She said, knowing that Zorua could hear them, Gardevoir looked down, Braixen scratched the back of her head, Buneary was sadly looking at the bed and Espurr had her paw to her chin thinking. "We could...um...uh..." Braixen started hopefully before trailing off as she sighed. It really did seem hopeless.

"He's not entirely blaming us or even blaming the villagers, he's also finding ways to blame himself at this point. This isn't good, we NEED to get through to him." Espurr stated as she looked glumly at the floor.

Celebi got a determined look on her face. 'Don't worry little roomie, we'll get you out of this funk!' She thought as she went to reach under the bed to get him.

Zorua for his part was starting to get his thoughts in order, at least enough to realize how bitter he was at the villagers, but he still couldn't believe his friends had shrunk him down...just like that...and didn't trust him enough to try and talk him down normally. But his own reputation preceded him he supposed...even among friends, he felt himself getting misty eyes before we wiped them with a paw just in time to see Celebi's paw reaching for him, seeing her kind face in the distance. 'Tch...' He thought as he...
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: Running the gamut of emotion

choices: Zorua stares at Espurr with a small smile... It worked!
Zorua just stares at her blankly... he's still depressed...
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
"Come on Zorua... come out..." Celebi says with a smile, although using a tone that lets Zorua understand that she's literally begging.

He huffs in response and tries to crawl even further under the bed.

"Little roomie?" Celebi calls out, hoping that the cute nickname she's given him would make him change his mind.

Unfortunately, it does the exact opposite, and makes Zorua feel even more humiliated... as if he hadn't been enough tonight, he thinks.

Seeing as Zorua isn't willing to come out, Celebi's expression drops into a sad stare as she slowly pulls out, looking at her friends.
"He won't come out..." she mutters dejectedly.

Braixen nears the bed and leans down.
"Hey squirt..." she says, before Celebi slaps her tail.
"... Zorua." she corrects.
"Come out already, will ya? We're sorry over what happened with that show... but what can you do about it?... what can we all do about it? Surely, falling into depression won't help..." she says.

She doesn't get any response.

"Come on Zorua... we all are willing to help you... just come out, then we can discuss this together..." Gardevoir attempts, getting the same response as Braixen.

"Zorua... the other pokemon didn't like your show... but we loved it!... You were great out there! You don't have to be depressed..." Buneary says.
"Or vengeful..." Espurr chimes in.

Zorua still doesn't respond.

Espurr stared at the bed blankly, before realizing that she too could fit beneath it...

The psychic type moves up to the bed and kneels, before crawling under it.
"Yeah Espurr... you'll manage to cheer him up~" Gardevoir comments with sparkling eyes.
"Just what is it with Espurr and Zorua? You've already mentioned something like that earlier..." Braixen recalls, looking at Gardevoir.

"Nothing." Espurr's voice resounds from under the bed, before she turns around to crawl further towards Zorua, who doesn't even bother to turn around.

"Zorua..." she whispers, reaching out for him, manipulating his body so that he's facing her.

He tries to turn around again, away from Espurr's eyes, but her paw won't let him.

"Don't you want to talk about it?" she asks.

Zorua blinks.
"No." he responds.
"Besides, there's nothing to say. You were the one telling Celebi to shrink me. You were the one suggesting that show in the first place! If only I hadn't come to your house... if only... if only I hadn't..." he stops in mid sentence while blushing.

Espurr blushes too.
"Don't say that... I only did it for your own good..." she mutters dejectedly. Zorua is literally the first male pokemon who took an interest in her - the others were too creeped out.

"It's the truth Espurr." the small fox simply responds, finally managing to turn around again.
"Now leave me alone. I'll just stay here until starve to death, or I die of dehydration, or some bug comes and eats me." he says in an uncaring voice.

Espurr stares at him dejectedly. She knows, such thoughts are typical of depression. Still, she has to do something.

There must be something that would cheer Zorua up...

A thought crosses Espurr's mind, and her yes widen as she blushes.
"Am I really willing to do this...?" she asks herself. She looks at Zorua.

She had already done it before... so, she decides, why not?

"Zorua." she quietly says, picking the fox and dragging him closer.

Before he has a chance to respond, Espurr pushes her lips onto his forehead.

Zorua's eyes widen almost more than Espurr's. His cheeks flare up with embarrassment as the giantess kisses him.

All he can feel, hear and see are the giantess' lips.

Unlike the last time she kissed him, Espurr holds the kids for a whole, eternal minute, before pulling back.

Zorua notes she has her eyes closed, her cheeks red. The giantess breaths in deeply, inhaling the stale air under the bed, before opening her eyes to look at Zorua.
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: Under-bed comforting

choices: Later that night
The next morning
Something is creeping on Celebi's house...
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
Zorua himself looked stunned, he was flush red and having trouble keeping his footing as Espurr pulled away. Espurr looked at his thoughts to see...chaos, absolute chaos, but he wasn't focusing on vengeance, or his humiliation, or any of that...he was only thinking of Espurr. She blushed a bit as he got a stupid smile. "B-wha?" He said as he stumbled away before getting some coherence back. "That was...why?" Was what he got out as his thoughts started to settle and Espurr fidgeted a bit with her face flushing red. "Zorua...i'm sorry, I was wrong about the show, and I don't want to see you like this, none of us do...please come out?" Zorua sighed, he was lining his thoughts up and...was he really regressing to what he had been just a short time ago. He shook his head. "...I'm sorry too..." He muttered and Espurr sighed with relief, before she went to grab him. He didn't run or struggle as she wrapped her paws around him and wormed her way out.

"We're fine." Espurr said simply and Zorua, face still red simply nodded making the other 4 girls sigh in relief. "Thank Arceus..." Celebi murmured as Gardevoir's eyes sparkled seeing Zorua's face flushed red. "Ssoooo, what did you do down there Espurr? It took a little while and things got quiet." She said as she got close, making Espurr blush a little too. "We talked it out." She said in her monotone voice, with her deadpan expression but completely flushed red. Gardevoir just gave a cat like smile. "That so Espurr...Zorua?" She said, trying to get it out of the shrunken pokemon. "W-why does it matter...?" He stuttered out before Braixen's eyes shot open wide, as if she just connected the dots on something.

"...No way..." She stated quietly as Buneary looked up at her puzzled. "No way what Braixen? Do you know what's going on?" Braixen looked at the younger pokemon and sighed. "I'll tell you later." She said and Buneary just looked more confused.

"So are you okay now Zorua?" Celebi asked as she got closer, cutting Gardevoir off. And he simply nodded. "Yeah, i'm fine...sorry about that..."

Celebi simply pet at his head. "You don't need to be sorry, it's been a rough night...for all of us...why is your forehead wet?" She asked and Zorua's eyes shot open again as Espurr blushed more.

"...For real..." Braixen murmured again before Zorua shouted out. "Chess! Let's play chess! Yes, let's do that!" Trying desperately to change the subject while Gardevoir and Celebi got closer, as Espurr fidgeted away. "He wants to play chess." She said simply, trying to hide her face too, Celebi and Gardevoir just had sparkles in their eyes.

-

"And I win again!" Celebi shouted in victory as she looked at the board. Zorua was looking bored out of his wits, but that was par for the course in this case at least. "Yay" He muttered deadpan as he stretched himself out. "Oh don't be a sore loser Zorua, we can do 2 out of 3 if you want?" She earnestly offered before he shook his head.

"Celebi, don't send him spiraling again." Espurr said simply from the sidelines as Braixen laughed and Celebi flushed red. "Okay okay, i'll pack it up." She said as she started to grab all the pieces. "That offer from earlier is still valid Zorua, you want something to eat?" Celebi asked as she was packing it away. "Uh...yeah, that actually sounds pretty good right now." He said, he was mostly content just to get away from Chess for a bit and Espurr came to pick him up. As time went on...
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: The return of calm

choices: Buneary returns, holding Zorua!
Buneary returns, empty-handed...
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
Zorua looks around in desperation as his surroundings grow, as well as the five girls who watch him shrink.

Finally, the shrinking comes to an end, and the fox finds himself back at the size he was not even two hours ago.

The combined psychic powers surrounding him take their leave as Zorua finds that he can move again. He looks up to the smiling Celebi, fixing a stern glare on her.

He had called her his friend! His BEST friend! She betrayed him!

"It's for your own good, Zorua. Trust me..." Espurr quietly says, her eyes wide open and fixed on the now small fox. His glare shifted on her.

Espurr... the pokemon he had a crush on... the pokemon he slept with nights ago... she too was betraying him...

All of sudden, the faces of the pokemon he had called friends for the whole week were reduced to a mix of fake smiles and lies.

Espurr twitches.
"That's not true! Snap out of it Zorua!" she exclaims.
"You're not a scoundrel anymore, remember? You said you didn't care if the show went wrong!"

Celebi smiles in a comprehensive manner as she just assumes that he's only doing this because he's still frustrated from the show.
"Aw, don't worry. I'm sure that in a few days everyone will forget that show. Now..." she gently says as she starts to bend, intent to pick Zorua up.
"Let's go back home, so we can party all night lo-"

She never gets to finish.

Zorua growls in frustration as his eyes flash blue. Then, the vegetation around the five girls comes to life, and the blades of grass suddenly grow up, wrapping around the limbs of everyone, pinning them to the ground.

Screams of confusion and fear hit Zorua's ears, and he watches them struggling, trying to break free from an illusionary grip.

He hastily formulated a plan and bends as he starts digging up a hole.
"Z-Zorua! N-No!" Celebi cried. But it was too late.

Zorua disappeared underground.

--

The five girls kept struggling for a while more after Zorua's leaving.

They desperately tried to get free, but all their struggles were for naught.

Braixen gritted her teeth. Buneary was screaming. Espurr, Celebi and Gardevoir desperately tried to untangle the grass from their bodies.

All of sudden, Braixen managed to free her tail from beneath herself. And she gets an idea.

Fighting against the illusionary grass, she moves a paw over her stick. She hardly manages to grab it and pulls it out of her tail, before shooting a massive pillar of fire to the sky, the grass disappearing immediately after.

In the meantime, Celebi, Espurr and Gardevoir used their psychic powers to dispel the illusion, while Braixen freed Buneary.

The tall fox growls.
"Oh, that little prankster is dea-"
"No! He's unstable right now!" Espurr exclaims.

"We need to find him!" Celebi exclaims with worry.
"Girls..." Gardevoir says, pointing to something on the ground.

There, barely noticeable, was a small hole - the same one Zorua dug to escape!

"Great. How do we get him?" Braixen questions. Her question is soon answered though as Buneary moves towards the hole and bends down, starting to dig.

"Buneary..." Braixen says with a hint of worry. But Buneary ignores her.

"Zorua..." she mutters, widening the hole with her paws. Being a bunny pokemon, it results pretty easy for her to do so.

And, once the hole is big enough, she leaps down, chasing Zorua underground.

--

"Zorua is waiting for us to leave to come out..." Espurr reveals after finally managing to read the small fox's thoughts.

"What about Buneary?"

"She can't see much - Zorua is a dark type, he can orient himself in the dark quite well - unlike Buneary, who is trying to figure out which way he went..."

Espurr quiets down as she keeps reading the thoughts of the two pokemon underground.

Until she suddenly perks up again.
"She found him!" she exclaims, before gasping.
"He noticed her - he's running away!"

"Zorua..." Celebi meekly mutters as she stares at the hole.

Then, all of sudden, the noise of someone digging could be heard.

And, before Espurr could reveal what happened underground, a figure emerges from the hole...
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: Zorua's escape

choices: "G-girls I-i'm sorry..." He stated
"Was that supposed to be convincing?" He says bitterly
Zorua says nothing and runs off into the night
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
Buneary comes out of the small hole, holding the struggling Zorua to her chest. He looked livid. "Let me go Buneary, set me down right now!" He growled out. She merely shut her eyes and shook her head no.

"The show got to him more than he wants to let on." Espurr stated simply, this was having the opposite effect, what he was saying would happen...happened.

"Oh it isn't THAT entirely Espurr..." He spat, still struggling to get out of Buneary's grip, but he couldn't budge it.

"You've got it wrong Zorua..." Espurr murmured. "That's not..."

"No, it IS Espurr, you knew didn't you!? You knew this was going to happen!?"

"ZORUA! She would never-"

"No no! You were all in on it! Give me that one last push right!? Maybe i'll leave the village for good right!? Set me down, grow me back and I promise you'll get what you want! I'll leave alright, maybe leave a parting gift here or there, but i'll leave!" He shouted, venom in his voice. He felt truly, entirely betrayed by them.

"That's horrible Zorua, we wouldn't do that, we're sorry about the show but you need to calm down..."

"So you won't let me go huh?"

"Zorua, you trying to run off at this size is tantamount to suicide! No we won't!"

"Then grow me back!"

"Quite frankly that's a poor option right now, you aren't in your right mind Zorua, if you'd let us explain-"

"Please Zorua, you were so nice before..." Buneary said, hugging him to her chest. He was still struggling against her grip.

"No! I know exactly what i'm thinking, I know exactly what you all are!"

Braixen, who had seen enough approached Buneary and leaned down. She started down Zorua, narrowing her eyes, and he glared back before she reached forward and flicked his head, hard.

All 4 girls gasped as Zorua looked back, stunned from both shock, and pain.

"Braixen, why did you-"

"Zorua, that illusion you just did was NOT cool, I get that you're frustrated, and I understand that somehow you think we betrayed you, but all those nights we helped you practice, all those nights we played games, laughed, the apologies you made, Celebi and Espurr cuddling you, reassuring you, do you REALLY think that's fake? Quite frankly, after this i'm ready to be done with you, if you want to leave, that's on you, but you need to figure your own crap out, and all we've done is try and help you sort it. If you want to sort it on your own, then I for one would let you, but after the crap you just pulled right here no one is going to grow you back right now, this is it for you at the moment, still want to run off? I wouldn't recommend it, no, if I were you i'd apologize to us, figure out a way to move on from this, and enjoy the rest of your evening with all of us, but honestly, I think it should be your decision." She stated simply as she grabbed Zorua from Buneary's grasp and set him down on the ground before standing at her full height, looming over him.

Zorua glared up at her, and glared at the ground. He let himself calm down a bit before he let out a shaky sigh.
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: Buneary returns, holding Zorua!

choices: The group eventually manages to find Zorua...
No such luck... Zorua is gone...
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
Zorua glared back up at Braixen, teeth gritted.

Then, without saying a word, the small dark type turns around and runs off into the night.

His ears catch several gasps coming from behind him.

"Zorua!" Celebi shouts, floating in midair as she rushes behind the fox. But Braixen steps forward, grabbing the fairy's arm, preventing her from following Zorua.

"Let him! He made up his mind!" Braixen shouts, having a hard time at pulling back Celebi.

The fairy turns around, glaring daggers at the fox.
"You told him those harsh words! You made him want to run off!" she hisses.
"Won't you understand what he's going through?! The whole village just declared its hate towards him! We could have only tried to reason with him some more, comfort him, but no - you had to hit him, make him feel even more frustrated! Braixen, this is all your fault!"

Taken aback by Celebi's ire, Braixen meekly lets go of her. The fox just seems to notice that everyone, including Buneary, seemed to agree with Celebi from the way they stared at her.

Gardevoir had a serious expression; Espurr looked devastated, much like she was earlier; Buneary was staring at her with delusion.

"I-I... sorry..." she meekly apologizes while lowering her head, realizing that she went overboard with the harsh words.

Celebi turns around again, desperately trying to spot Zorua anywhere... but he was long gone. And, with his dark type, along with his black fur, they'd have a hard time finding him in the darkness of the night.

Desperately, Celebi puts her paws over her mouth.
"ZORUA! IT WAS A MISUNDERSTANDING! PLEASE COME BACK!" she shouts, hoping that the small fox would hear her and comes back.

A few minutes pass after the echo of Celebi's shout died down in the forest and Zorua doesn't show up.

Celebi lets her head hang in shame. Why did she have to shrink him again?! How could she have been so irresponsibly stupid?!

"... We've all been..." Espurr mutters dejectedly, recalling that she was the one telling Celebi to make Zorua tiny again.

She had wanted to avoid him doing something dumb... but she apparently failed miserably.

Gardevoir takes a step forward, placing a hand on Celebi's shoulder.
"We need to find him." she quietly says, although she can't hide an hint of worry.
"Let's go."

Celebi perks up and meekly nods her head, before looking at Braixen, who is staring at the ground in silence, looking ashamed.

The fox rises her head upon noticing the glare Celebi is giving her.
"Know it Braixen, if something happens to Zorua, I will hold you responsible!" she spits venomously.

The fire type gulps. She doesn't want to know about the consequences of such statement.

Then, Celebi started to float deeper into the thick forest, followed by Gardevoir, Espurr and Buneary.

Braixen watches them leave in silence, feeling guilty.
"Arceus... what have I done...?" she mumbles to herself, realizing that perhaps she's really been too harsh.

Now, Zorua is lost somewhere in the forest, tiny and helpless. Braixen begins to worry - if they don't manage to find him... she doesn't want to think about it.

Zorua's words echoed in her mind,
‘I'll leave!’

...

Was it really what he was planning...? Leave the village to never come back...?

"Braixen! Are you coming?" Buneary cries from distance, interrupting her train of thought.

The fire type looks up as she sighs dejectedly.
"Yeah. Wait for me!" she exclaims as she hurries behind her friends.
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: Celebi's rage and Braixen's regret

choices: At her house
Something goes wrong along the way
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
"Zorua!" They were all shouting as they ran through the night, looking for him. "Zorua, i'm sorry!" Braixen shouted out as they walked until Espurr gasped. "I'm picking up his thoughts...he's trapped."

"What!? Where, how far!?" Celebi shouted, somewhat panicked as Espurr tried to figure it out. She shouted out. "Zorua! Let us know where you are! I know you're trapped, we'll come find you!" He had heard her, he knew from his thoughts, but he was too angry and prideful to respond, he even thought some nasty thoughts just from hearing her and she looked awkwardly at Braixen.

"...you really set him off a lot worse..." She said

"Braixen..." Buneary whimpered, all Braixen did was grit her teeth and shut her eyes. "Zorua, i'm sorry! Please let us know where you are so we can help. We don't want you getting hurt out here!" She shouted out.

It was silent for a bit before they heard, from his reduced voice in a kinda far direction "Piss off!" And the girls sighed.

"Zorua, we can't do that, you're in danger right now, you're trapped, if you stay there then-"

"I'll be out of the way, right? No, i'll sort my own crap from now on!" He said bitterly. He was scared, and he was sure Espurr knew it, but after what had just happened, no way was he going to go back to them, not after what he said, and not after what Braixen said. 'No, if this is it then so be it, no one has ever really wanted me around anyway, so what does it matter at this point honestly.' He thought bitterly as he struggled against what he was trapped by. A Spinarak's web. He heard pattering coming from above him and looked up. 'Oh great, the Spinarak...' He thought as it started its descent towards him.

Espurr read that and went into a full blown panic, darting in the direction she thought he was in. "Zorua, shout something, please!" She said loudly as she caught the green in the corner of her eye, looking around she saw it, Zorua was trapped in a web about level with her face and the Spinarak was closing on him. He was struggling pretty hard now, she didn't even know if he noticed her before she quickly darted her hands forward and yanked him from the web, destroying the web in the process and running off, leaving a very dazed Spinarak behind her.

"Espurr!?" He shouted, somewhat dazed from her running before she met up with everyone else. "I...*huff*...got...*huff*....him..." She gasped out. 'Not the running type, that's right...why did you....?' Zorua thought before she started again. "I....*huff*....won't....*huff*....let...you...die..." She was starting to get her breath again and Zorua looked down. "Maybe you should've...it's what everyone wants right?" He muttered. Before Celebi glared at Braixen, she straightened herself before approaching Espurr and leaning down again, Zorua winced, expecting another flick but she gently rubbed his head. "Zorua...I am so, so sorry I said what I just said, I was angry at you for the illusion and didn't fully think about how you felt at the time...I...please, we do care about you, all of us do. This whole thing...it was a mistake, a bad accident, and we don't actually want you to leave...come with us, okay? We'll talk more about it at Celebi's..." She murmured gently to the small dark Pokemon, He looked at her mouth agape before Espurr felt a wetness on one of her paws. Zorua was crying. "Why do I screw everything up!?" He cried out before Espurr hugged him tighter to her chest. "Come on Zorua, let's go home." Celebi said gently as they all started back to her house.
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: Relief and release

choices: Zorua falls asleep, feeling slightly better
Zorua falls asleep, feeling exactly the same
The next morning, the girls wake up to find that Zorua isn't there anymore...
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
The group walked through the quiet forest, Zorua glued to Espurr's chest, her paws keeping him in place. No one dares to break the silence.

Eventually, the five girls reach the village. And Espurr abruptly stops to look at her tiny passenger.
"If someone saw you this size, they'd hunt us all down to get you..." she reasons.

"You can just hand me to them. What does it matter at this point? My reputation is ruined for good." Zorua bitterly replies.

"Don't be silly. We'll never do something like that." Gardevoir says.

Braixen frowns.
"Great. First he's angry, now he's depressed." she huffs.

Celebi shakes her head dejectedly.
"It's been a rough night. But we can still save it..." she says.

"I doubt it." Zorua says.

"Your mind is in a state of extreme disorder. You don't even know if you should feel angry, or frustrated, or sad. Plus, you're thinking we betrayed you because Celebi shrank you again and you're thinking I betrayed you for suggesting it when we're only trying to prevent you doing something stupid." Espurr chimes in. Zorua remains quiet.

Espurr buries him in her chest fur, attempting to comfort him - and to hide him from the eyes of the villagers, but mainly to comfort him.

Eventually, the group found themselves at Celebi's house. Celebi quietly opens the front door as she and the other girls move into her bedroom.

Quietly, Espurr moves to the bed and leaps onto it, crossing her legs and setting Zorua down on her lap. He remains still.

Braixen approached the duo, snatching Zorua from Espurr.
"Hey Zorua..." she mutters.
"I'm... truly sorry over what happened earlier... I didn't really mean what I said... you don't have to... uhm..."

"Sort my crap out?" Zorua bluntly completes.

Braixen blushes.
"I'm... I'm sorry, alright?" she says, hugging the smaller fox to her chest.

Zorua doesn't reply.

"You still angry...?" Braixen asks. Zorua still doesn't respond.

"... He is. To all of us... to the whole village actually." Espurr clarifies in a dejected voice.
"I told Celebi to shrink him. Celebi shrank him. Gardevoir kept him still while Celebi did so. Buneary didn't let him go. Braixen... we all know what she did."

Zorua stares at the psychic type blankly, starting to reconsider his crush on her. Espurr reads this as well and shoots a dejected stare.

"I know. We all should have thought twice..." Celebi mumbles, before moving to Braixen, picking Zorua from her.
"But, try to understand, you're in a pretty weak state of mind and-"

"I am not - I know perfectly what I want!" Zorua cut her off.
"I just want my size back! Then you'll see!" he hisses.

"Everyone! Everyone will find one nasty surprise next time they get out of their houses!"

Zorua looks around with a glare, seeing all the girls staring at him. Buneary shivers.
"Zorua... you're scaring me..." she meekly says.

Celebi looks at the small fox in her hands without saying a word. She just hugs him.

Everyone in the room remains quiet for a while.

Until finally Celebi gives a slight smile.
"Come on... let's have some fun... You'll feel better..." she says.
"Some fun and a good night sleep will do it."

--

The night goes on with games, meek attempts to make Zorua eat something and subtle remarks about Espurr and Zorua from Celebi and Gardevoir.

But, eventually, the girls decided it was time to hit the hay. All Zorua did was agree meekly.

"A good night sleep..." Celebi repeats, attempting to sound cheerful, but sounding hopeful instead.

Much like last time, Gardevoir and Braixen have to sleep on the floor, while Celebi, Buneary and Espurr would share the bed.

With a smirk from Celebi and an excited expression from Gardevoir, Zorua is handed to Espurr, who blushes. Zorua, on the other hand, remains neutral.

Quietly, the smaller pokemon climb onto the bed, sliding under the sheets.

"Night everyone~" Celebi chimes, receiving answers from everyone but Espurr, who keeps gazing the small Zorua held tightly in her paws.

"Zorua..." she mutters dejectedly, before getting an idea.

If this couldn't cheer Zorua up... she doesn't know what else she could do...

Quietly, the giantess leans down, gently pressing her lips onto Zorua's head, before pulling off, blushing furiously.

Zorua looks up at her blushing, looking surprised... but, regardless, he says nothing.

"... Good night..." Espurr whispers, wearing a small smile on her face, before closing her eyes.

Eventually, every noise in the room quiets down as everyone but Zorua falls asleep.

The tiny dark type rises his head to glance at those he called his friends, sleeping soundly.

He still felt betrayed... although...

"Perhaps... they're really doing this for my good..." he mumbles to himself, before huffing.
"Still, I didn't do anything yet. Celebi had no right to shrink me... Espurr had no right to even suggest that..." he bitterly says.

At this point, his mind was reduced to two mere thoughts, whether to forgive his friends or not.

"They tried to cheer me up... Celebi, Espurr... Braixen..." he whispers, not quite knowing how should he feel. Then, he gives a yawn, leaning his head against Espurr's chest as he closes his eyes, deciding to sleep on it.
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: At her house

choices: For a while longer, until he felt safe with himself
forever
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
Zorua stood on the stage grinning at the pokemon below him, Azurill's tail was tied to a post, Wigglytuff was stuck in a honey trap, many many others with him...a spinarak was stuck on it's back and struggling, all was right. He turned around whistling to walk off the stage only to see...himself grinning back.

"Man, look at you go Zorua, you did it! Showed those villagers what is up! I was worried you were getting soft there for a moment, but the second you got your size back, wham! You let them have it!" The double grinned and Zorua felt his grin fading before the fake tilted its head.

"Oh? Are you having second thoughts...well come on, this'll clear 'em up!" The double said as it beckoned for Zorua to follow him past the backstage curtain. He followed into the darkness, the double being eerily silent as they passed contraptions that Zorua had considered for the show, when he rounded a corner...he saw it. Braixen was tied up in vines, Buneary was stuck in a syrup trap, crying, Gardevoir was hanging with her limbs tied away from her, struggling, Celebi was in a small cage covered in his pidove prank, and Espurr was being hung by her ears with her eyes stuck shut.

"Your so called 'friends' getting theirs for trying to stop us! Isn't it wonderful!?" The double spoke up excitedly as Zorua tried to back up. "N-no, no it's not, this is...this is..." He was about to turn and run before he was stopped by vines latching his legs. The double stepped in front of him, before it started to contort, twist, and change into...a Zoroark

"You're finally here, you've made it! Shed your weakness and are ready to follow in my footsteps!" The Zoroark claimed as it reached out to Zorua as he started to contort and change too. "No...No I don't want this! I don't want this!" He cried as he started to evolve himself.

-

Zorua woke with a start, the world around him...soft...and dark. He looked up to see Espurr sleeping...to his sides, Celebi and Buneary sleeping...still giant to him. He gasped and thought of last night. 'Was I gonna...?' He gulped before sighing and laying back against the giantess's chest. He had time to think he supposed, after all the things he had done, he was going to revert back to it? Because others didn't forgive him? He shut his eyes thinking. His friends HAD shrunk him back down pretty quick, because...he really was gonna do it, wasn't he? He was going to seek retribution and he wouldn't stop even for them, the ones that cared about him. He tried to look at Gardevoir and Braixen on the floor...Gardevoir always so intent to try and help him with his crush...Braixen, though blunt and easy to rile up, trying to help in her own way...Celebi, who wanted to give him a roof and second chance after she had hurt him, Buneary, kind and forgiving him for what he had done, and Espurr...the one who could see inside his head and tried desperately to help him mend the bridge with everyone in the village. He sighed again.

"I'll wait for them to wake up and tell them."

-

"Zorua...are you sure?" Celebi was shocked by what he had said. He had calmed down and apologized for the illusion last night, and he said he knew they made the right calls, but even still, what he just said surprised them all. He was fine with being this size...
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: Introspection

choices: ... one of the villagers!
... an unknown pokemon...
... a legendary?!... Maybe a friend of Celebi...?
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
Celebi flew back.
"You... You're willing to remain that size?!" she asks, truly shocked by Zorua's words.

The small fox nods from his perch on Celebi's bed.

"But why?" Braixen asks, eyeing Zorua with confusion.

"It was just a dream Zorua..." Espurr chimes in.
"You're stable enough now... You don't have to remain tiny if you don't want to... although I don't want to be hung by my ears like that..."

Everyone gazed at Espurr after the last remark.

Zorua timidly nods.
"And that's the point. This size will prevent me from... getting revenge... sweet sweet reve-" he says, suddenly grinning as he thinks about revenge again.

But he abruptly stops, noting that the eyes of everyone were on him.
"... See?" he asks, his grin dropping.
"I need... I need to be sure... I need to feel safe with myself."

"Well... I think it's a good idea Zorua. You can stay here as much as you want, until you're sure." Celebi replies.

"Plus, you're adorable at that size!" Buneary chimes in cheerfully."

"There's no denying that." Braixen states, before realizing what she just said and blushing, the blush not very unseen on the white fur of her muzzle.

"And~" Gardevoir says merrily, eyeing both Zorua and Espurr with glee.

Both blush.

Braixen notices that.
"Why are you-" she says, before reality hit her like a Double Slap.
"Oh..." she meekly says, shocked.

"What Braixen?" Buneary asks, clueless, receiving no response from the flustered Braixen.

"I... I need some fresh air..." Zorua mumbles. He felt like he couldn't bear to stay in the room anymore. He wanted to be in his forest.

"Your forest, Zorua?" Espurr asks, moving towards the bed to gently pick Zorua up.

Celebi's face brightens.

"Oh, that's a wonderful idea!" she exclaims, before turning around to face her friends.
"Let's hang out together!" she cheers.

--

"Here we are." Celebi says as the small group reaches Zorua's forest. Once, they all would have dreaded coming here... but, with Zorua doll-sized, there really was no problem with it.

A breeze blew past the group as they walked deeper into the quiet forest.

"Heh... without that infamous scoundrel that was Zorua around here, this place sure is quiet..." Braixen comments.
"That's because it's deserted... there's really just me here... and the occasional pokemon who I pull pranks on when they pass by..." Zorua admits.

"And then there's me passing through here to get home - though Zorua never pulled a prank on me because he was creeped out by me, and kept thinking I was creepy - you actually still think it..." Espurr says dejectedly as she looks at Zorua.

"I'll stop thinking it whenever you stop staring at me like that! Oh, and whenever you get out of my head!" he snaps back from her chest, making Espurr smirk down at him.

Silence falls among the group.

"... Let's play!" Buneary suddenly chimes while moving in front of the group with spread arms.

Espurr picks up on Zorua's thoughts before he can reply.
"I see... you want to make order in your head..." she quietly says, gently putting him down on the soft grass.

All the girls look at Zorua, who nods.
"I'd... I'd like to be alone for a while... I need to think..." he says.

"... Without me reading your thoughts..." Espurr sheepishly completes, making Zorua blush.

"... Exactly." he admits.
"You really gotta stop doing that." he says, causing Espurr to smirk.

"Well..." Celebi says, thinking. Zorua was still in a delicate state of mind... thinking would help him.
"Fine with me. Just... don't wander off too far." she approves.

"And come back soon, so we can play!" Buneary says.

"And yell if anything happens." Braixen adds.
"We'll come and get you... wouldn't risk losing you. Right Espurr~?" Gardevoir sings cheerfully while looking at the smaller psychic type.

Espurr blushes, while Buneary wears a curious expression. Before she too starts to understand.

"That's so cute Zorua~" she chimes.
"I still can't believe it." Braixen tells.

Zorua blushes. To avoid further embarrassment, he quickly turns around and sprints away from the group, leaving the five girls alone.

For a moment, an awkward silence falls among them.

"Sooo... what do we do?" Celebi suddenly asks, clasping her paws together.

"... I think a better question would be, ‘How long?’" Braixen replies while eyeing Espurr. Gardevoir, Buneary and Celebi start giggling.

Espurr blushes as the four girls encircle her.

--

Zorua sprinted through the green vegetation, wanting to find an ideal spot to just think.

That's all he needed.

The shrunken fox made it past another tree, before an unforeseen obstacle came out of nowhere.

Zorua noticed it too late, and ended up bumping into it. Luckily, it was oddly soft... he realizes that he just bumped into a pokemon.

"So-Sorry... I wasn't really looking..." he apologizes while looking up, noticing what pokemon he bumped into, and what pokemon was staring down at him with a surprised expression...
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: A temporary solution and a forest stroll

choices: Nice villager
Nice villager that hates Zorua
Mean villager
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content: Was it a nice villager, nice villager that hates Zorua, or a mean villager?
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: A choice chapter

choices: The girls catch Carnivine and Zorua
Carnivine gets away
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
He looked slowly at the vines he had bumped into...up at the sentient foliage to a toothy looking plant face, looking surprised by his find...Carnivine! "...oh." Zorua said flatly as he slowly started to back away before a vine wrapped around him tight and lifted him to the giant's face.

"...Zorua...is that, heh,...are you..." And then Carnivine started to outright laugh. "Oh man, this is rich! Look at ya! You're freaking tiny!...oh, but wait until Graveler sees ya like this!" His expression changing, taking a more sadistic turn as he said this and Zorua gulped as Carnivine started to move, planning to leave the forest with his catch.

"GIRLS!" He shouted out, at the top of his lungs, hoping and praying that they'd hear him before the vine that ensnared him wrapped around his snout.

"Oh, you're not alone!? Better move then!" Carnivine said as he picked up the pace. He wasn't losing this opportunity!

-

"So do you reciprocate Espurr~" Gardevoir sung as the girls circled her, giggling.

"I think...maybe...I don't entirely know yet an-" They heard Zorua's small voice in the distance shouting for them, and immediately the group fell silent before they started moving in his direction.

"Crap, crap, crap! Maybe letting him go on his own was a bad idea." Braixen said as they quickened their pace.

"Well we aren't his wardens, he needs to have some level of freedom and privacy, right?"

"Be okay Zorua..." Buneary said as she ran with the girls, and they continued for about a minute or so before they saw something moving in the distance...observing it they saw that it was Carnivine...with the tiny Zorua ensnared by one of his vines, and they were both far ahead and moving fast.

"That jerk!? What's he doing out here!?" Braixen immediately reached for her stick as she ran before Celebi started up.

"Don't even! You might hit Zorua!" Celebi said startled as Braixen reluctantly put her stick away. "Well he can't get away, could you imagine what he'll do to Zorua!?" She said, before all of them found the energy to surge forward a little faster at that.

They didn't note that Espurr had been entirely silent during this whole chase. She was only focusing on running, only focusing on movement. She HAD to get to Zorua.

Carnivine at this point has noticed that he's being pursued and dares a glance. "Gardevoir...? Espurr? Braixen!? AND Celebi!? Oh crap!! That's who you were shouting for!? You little piece of crap!? Do you know what could happen to me if i'm caught!? That ain't happening!" Carnivine said as he tried to leave some grass knots behind him for the girls to trip on, he managed to get Buneary.

"O-oof, i'm fine, keep going!" She yelled quickly as Braixen looked back.

"We'll be right back with him!" She shouted back as the chase continued...
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: Chase down

choices: The girls make it in time
This looks like the end
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
The 4 girls continued the chase, even starting to gain on Carnivine. "Heh, I ain't gonna lose here!" He said as he started to shake his head a bit, letting off spores that trailed behind him. The girls realized their mistake too late as they started to find it harder and harder to move. "Enjoy your rest ladies, i'll be taking Zorua now, my associate and I just have some past transgressions we need to go over with him, ta ta!" Carnivine continued, almost seeming like he was dancing as he slithered away.

"Ugh...I can't believe this..." Braixen said as she struggled to move, all 4 of them had fallen to their feet. "So Zorua even made an enemy of those jerks..."

"I don't know, I don't have anything on them in that journal I kept on Zorua's pranks...Espurr did you..." Celebi looked to her friend to find her struggling the hardest.

"He's gonna...he's gonna give him to Graveler, and he knows that Zorua might not make it out of that alive...I saw his thoughts, I saw them!" Espurr continued to struggle to move as the other girls gasped. After about a minute of this she started crying. This was not something the other girls had seen before. "No no no..." She sobbed weakly as the small form of Buneary started to appear in the distance.

"Girls! Did you...did you get...Zorua..." As Buneary approached and saw them her voice got more and more crestfallen as she saw them on the ground. Braixen looking furious, Gardevoir trying to get to a crying Espurr, and Celebi doing her best to get to her feet. "Oh no, you're paralyzed! Um...um...i'll be right back! I think I saw some cheri berries a bit ago!" Buneary said as she scampered off.

-

Carnivine eyed his catch as he approached his and Graveler's hideaway in the village, turning a few alleys. Zorua for his part did his best to glare back, though he couldn't deny just how scared he was right now. His muzzle was still shut tight by Carnivine, and anytime his eyes glowed blue to try and start an illusion, Carnivine broke his concentration with a painful squeeze. "You're in some serious trouble, heh, you know that, right? Just wait until we're done with you!" He said as he ducked under a broken board to reach what appeared to be an abandoned lot with a dilapidated shed in the corner of the lot. He approached it and called out. "Graveler~ Heh, I got us a treat~" He said as he entered.

"Yeah, you steal something good then?" Graveler said, his back to Carnivine as he appeared to be reading a comic. "Oh, in a way yes." He said, approaching Graveler and putting Zorua between the comic and Graveler's eyes.

"What, a pokedoll? Seriously Carnivine?" He said unimpressed before he unmuzzled Zorua's mouth and he continued to struggle. "Let me go right now Carnivine!!" He yelled, snarling and Graveler's eyes lit up.

"Is that...the real Zorua, but small? Wow...heh, yeah, i'd say that's something good!" He said as his features went wicked and he grabbed Zorua from Carnivine's grasp. Zorua gasped out at the grip, Graveler was squeezing him tight, very tight as he lifted him up. "Do you remember when you stole from us a week and a half ago, laughed at us, and then drove us off with your cowardly illusions? Well now it's payback time!" He said as he squeezed harder and Zorua's vision started to blur. "Oh no no, can't have you black out before the fun starts!" Graveler said as he roughly dropped Zorua on the table, who gasped for air before fearfully looking up.

'Girls...please...' He thought desperately, unaware that Espurr was doing her best to keep on his thoughts. As Graveler's fingers clamped down on a front paw. "Let's make this interesting...the longer you stay conscious, the longer you live, once you pass out well...you need to make up for stealing our snacks, poor Carnivine never got to eat one before you made off with them...so you're gonna be filling.him.up!" He put emphasis on the last part as both the pokemon grinned at him, Zorua's eyes becoming pinpricks.

-

Buneary returned with the cheri berries as promised and went to each girl to feed them. Soon enough they got steadily, shakily to their feet before Espurr wiped her eyes and did her best to get Zorua's thoughts. Gardevoir and Celebi for their part also tried to sense him but were having minimal luck. "He's too far away..." Gardevoir seemed to slump down as Braixen kicked a rock hard. "GAH! When I get ahold of that laughing walking weed i'm gonna-!" Buneary put a hand on Braixen's shoulder, tears starting to well up in her eyes. "We have to go get Zorua, please." She said as Braixen let out a sigh. "Yes I know, alright, Espurr, hop on!" She said as she approached the smaller pokemon, who was looking sad, she looked up reading Braixen's thoughts.

"You think that because i'm the weakest runner but have the best shot of finding him that we can cover both of our shortcomings this way, Braixen I-" She was cut off as Braixen picked her up and hoisted her onto her back.

"Less talky more runny!" She said as she took off, Celebi, Gardevoir, and Buneary hastily following them

-

"GAAAAAAAH!" Zorua cried as Graveler continued to apply pressure from his two finders onto Zorua's paw. The pain was excruciating, almost on the level of what Celebi did to him on accident before.

*CRACK*

Graveller laughed as he let go, Carnivine joining in as Zorua fell back, face pale almost ready to go into shock from the pain, he stumbled around before falling on his side, panting and wheezing.

"G-huh-gah..." Zorua looked at his broken paw with silent, breathless tears as Graveler loomed over him. "Still conscious huh? Well that's a shock, but that just means we get to have more fun~" He said as his fingers reached for another paw, Zorua tried to crawl away but found no escape as the fingers clamped on a back paw. "N-no..." He whimpered as the pressure came back.

-

As they entered the town Espurr started to cry again, she had found his thoughts and..."I'M GOING TO KILL THEM!" She shouted, almost making the other girls stop from sheer shock as everyone but Braixen got a good look at her face, crying and full of rage. A far cry from her deadpan expression they had gotten so accustomed to at this point. Celebi gritted her teeth. 'Whatever they're doing to him...they'll pay...' She thought as they continued on their path, desperate to reach Zorua before Graveler and Carnivine finished him off.
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: Torturous times

choices: Zorua is fine - Celebi agrees
Zorua needs rest - Celebi still wants to go home
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
The five girls kept running, following Espurr's indications.

Celebi was seething, Braixen was snarling, Gardevoir was frowning, Espurr was crying while Buneary was doing her best to keep up with the group.

Finally, the girls halted in front of the broken board. Espurr's ears rose up, and the board was sent flying completely in pieces from a strong psychic force.

"In there!" she shouted from Braixen's back, pointing to the shed.

The group moved closer to it, hearing laughs coming from within and, listening carefully, muffled screams of agony.
"I'm... gonna... murder... them..." Celebi snarled as she and the others stop in front of the door.

Braixen lets Espurr on the ground before reaching out for her stick.

--

"Ah...Ahh!" Zorua screams in pain as Graveler's fingers keep applying pressure on his hind leg.

"Heh, this one is harder to break it seems!" Graveler laughs as his fingers slowly apply more and more pressure.

"Heh, hurry up Grav! I still want my snack from last week!" Carnivine snickers as he watches the scene.

Right before an explosion echoes in the whole shed as the door is destroyed by a massive wave of flames.

"What the...?" Graveler says, letting go of Zorua while turning around to see five girls rushing inside, murderous glares on their faces.

"Y-You again?!" Carnivine stutters, backing up.
"Go away ya dumb girls! We're busy at the moment!" Graveler shouts.

Celebi ignores him. Her eyes land on Zorua, whimpering while he tried to crawl away on just three of his legs. It wasn't very hard to figure out what happened.

Five screams of rage.

The group moved forward. Braixen, Gardevoir and Buneary started fighting Graveler and Carnivine, while Espurr and Celebi rushed to the whimpering Zorua.

The small fox looks up, noticing - much to his joy - the faces of his friends.

"P-Pain... So much p-pain..." he stutters, beckoning his broken paw with the other.

"Don't worry Zorua..." Espurr says brokenly while carefully picking Zorua up, holding him in front of Celebi.

Various screams echo in the shed, making Zorua cringe.

"You'll... you'll be fine... just stay still..." Celebi says, gently placing a paw over Zorua.

Right before the whole shed starts shaking, making the fairy shake too.

She turns around, noticing Gardevoir psychically slamming Graveler on the walls and on the floor, while Braixen repeatedly shoots fire to Carnivine. Buneary keeps bouncing on the grass type's head.

Shaking her head, Celebi turns back to Zorua, her paw gently touching his broken leg.
"Now... this'll hurt a bit..." she warns as she starts glowing green.

Instantly, Zorua was hit with a wave of pleasing, soothing energy... right before his paw roughly snapped back in place, causing him immense pain as he screamed.

Well... better than the alternative, he guessed.

Celebi keeps healing Zorua for a minute more, before pulling off and sighing.
"Done." she says in exhaustion and relief.

And the same time, Graveler and Carnivine collapse in front of Gardevoir, Braixen and Buneary.

They smirked.

--

"Aw come on! I'm fine now!" Zorua complains from Celebi's chest.

"Don't care. You need to rest. We're going home." she responds. Braixen giggles from behind her.

"You're being overprotective." she comments.

"I'm being safe!" Celebi retorts.
"But Zorua IS fine now. I can read his mind, remember?" Espurr chimes in.

"That aside, he looks fine." Gardevoir says.
"See Celebi? It doesn't hurt anymore!... Well, maybe a little, but not that much!" Zorua exclaims.
"And, after all, it's not like we'll be seeing those two anytime soon!"

Celebi sighs.

"Come on Celi, let's hang out some more!" Buneary chimes with a smile.

Celebi sighs again.
"But... your paw..." she meekly attempts to change Zorua's mind.

He grins.
"It's fine. Let's not go home - it's a beautiful day too!"

Sighing again, Celebi takes a decision.
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: Rescued

choices: Braixen and Espurr burst in to find Zorua about to be eaten
The girls don't make it
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
"P-ple-GAAAAAAAAAH!" Zorua was crying harder as Graveler applied more pressure to his back paw, slowly twisting it with sadistic glee. "Pl-pl-plwhat Zorua? Please stop? Please keep going? You need to specify these things!" Graveler said as he twisted hard and...

*CRACK*

Zorua's vision was starting to blur at this point as he looked at the laughing giants, he saw lips moving and believed them to be talking or laughing but his brain was far from being able to process any words. He could only process pain, agony, and the bitter desire to stay conscious and not die. He believed he was screaming at this point too, he was barely able to process that in the white hot torrent of pain he felt, soon Graveler pinned him down on his stomach and started to apply pressure there too. He vaguely made out "Ribs" from Graveler as the pressure intensified and he found it getting harder and harder to breathe.

-

Espurr was seeing Zorua's thoughts in all this and was gritting her teeth and crying harder "We need to hurry! Please!" She cried as Braixen nodded. "Girls, i'm the best runner here, Espurr and I are going on ahead, okay?" As she started to speed up. "Braixen wait! How are we supposed to find..." Celebi said as she saw Braixen running in the distance, but she pulled her stick out of her tail and started to leave light scorch marks on the ground behind her. "Good call..." Gardevoir noted as they continued at their pace, with the duo of girls getting farther and farther away.

"Braixen...what we find there...we need to wait for Celebi to be able to heal him. He's not..." Braixen nodded. "Don't worry, we'll get there and keep him safe from them until Celebi arrives, and then..." Braixen gritted her teeth as a small bout of flame carried to her stick and as quickly as it appeared it vanished.
-

Zorua had no concept of time or place anymore. All he knew and all he thought he ever would know is pain as his chest started to burn with agony too, if he lost consciousness he wouldn't wake up, he was able to keep that thought in his head and was fighting to stay awake, but the more and more the pressure mounted on his chest, the harder a time he had breathing and the more he wanted to drift away.

*CRACK*

Zorua heard it and the pain at this point was too much for him to bear any longer, with one final scream he felt the world around him fade away beneath him as he passed out from the pain.

"Well, he lasted longer than I expected...alright Carn, I tenderized the meat for ya, dig in!" Graveler laughed as Carnivine did too. "Sure thing Grav, this was a great find!" He said as a vine wrapped itself around the broken dark pokemon and slowly lifted him to Carnivine's maw...
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: Down to the wire

choices: "They'll be seeing the world from Zorua's tiny perspective from now on."
"We let them off easy I suppose, but they won't bother us again."
"We taught them a lesson they'll never forget."
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
As Carnivine is about to put Zorua in his mouth, the door burst open in a gush of flame to reveal two very furious pokemon, Braixen and Espurr. Their eyes quickly fall on the tiny Zorua dangling from a vine right in front of Carnivine's open mouth and both Graveler and Carnivine are looking at the two shocked. "Hand.him.over.now!" Espurr commanded with gritted teeth as a psychic aura surrounded Carnivine and he found himself unable to put Zorua in his mouth. "Oh no, he's our find ladies, you need to-" A gush of flame hit Graveler before he could finish, with Braixen harshly glowering at him. "You have 3 seconds to say you'll hand him over, and i'll release the psychic aura on you to bring him over to us. 1...2..." Espurr started before Carnivine felt the psychic pressure intensify. "Gak! Okay, okay, stop and i'll let you take him!" He said as he felt the pressure relent and the aura simply surrounded the tiny dark pokemon tangled in his vine. "Tch..." he said as he released him and he was gently floated over to the two girls. Espurr gently set the aura in Braixen's palms since she was still on her back and they both looked him over...one of his front paws and another back paw looked horribly mangled and misaligned, and his chest looked compressed and almost caved in. He was breathing, but barely and it was weakly. "You two..." Braixen snarled, looking at them as Espurr cried before glaring at them as well. Graveler shrugged. "At this point letting Carnivine eat him would probably be a mercy." He said, almost gloating as a psychic aura pinned him harshly to the ground. "H-hey, we gave your dumb friend back, so take him and leave!" Graveler said, now irritated as Carnivine nodded. "Y-yeah, just get out of here!" He said as soon 3 other pokemon filed into the room. Celebi, Buneary and Gardevoir. "Did you get him back!?" Buneary cried as she went over to Braixen to see him in her palms, relieve she looked closer to see the state he was in and gasped, before tears started to well up in her eyes.

"Don't worry Buneary, Celebi will fix him right up." Braixen said gently as she nodded to the small green mystic who gently took Zorua from her and looked him over, she winced. "This is...gonna take concentration...and it won't be pleasant..." She said as the others nodded. Espurr harshly pinned Carnivine to the ground as well at this, and psychically forced their mouths shut. Carnivine looked frightened and Graveler looked miffed as all hell. The room was silent as Celebi lowered her head to Zorua. A glow surrounded him before he started to stir and his chest slowly filled back out making him scream, even still unconscious, soon his legs started to pop back, as well as his paws as his screams intensified. Through the silence Gardevoir, Espurr and Braixen just glared at the two bound pokemon across from them while Buneary silently cried, trying not to make a sound. After a bit the screaming stopped and Celebi lifted her head and sighed. "He's stable, and healed as well as I could do at the moment...we'll need to see how he feels when he wakes up." She said and the others sighed too. "Buneary, could you come here please?" Celebi asked as the younger pokemon complied. She went over and Celebi gave her a kind smile. "I want you to take Zorua and watch over him outside, can you do that for me?" She said and Buneary gently took the small unconscious pokemon, he looked a lot better than before, but still so fragile...she cradled him to her chest and nodded before looking back at Graveler and Carnivine. "But what about..."

"Buneary...you don't need to be here for this." Braixen said, gently but firmly to the younger pokemon as she nodded. "Okay...i'll keep Zorua safe..." She said as she started towards the entrance. "Good girl." Celebi smiled and praised, but as the younger pokemon left the room the smile faded and she glowered at the two across from them. Slowly, the psychic force was released from them as Graveler and Carnivine stood up.

"...What? You've got the little piece of crap, and you even undid my handiwork, what more do you want?" Graveler said, annoyed before he continued. "Do you really want to get back at us for that? Zorua brought it on himself you know! How much trouble has he made in the past for YOU or all of us? I know for a FACT that you hate or at least hated him Braixen! Can you say only we'd have done that to him? Hell, who made him that small in the first place? That's what I wonder!" Graveler said before Espurr spoke.

"You'd say anything to get out of this, yes, Zorua was a problem for many pokemon, but none would do what you just did to him, maliciously, callously, slowly torturing him before intending to kill him over what? An ultimately minor slight against you. I can see inside your head Graveler, I know what he did to you two...it wasn't worth what you did to him by a long shot." She said coldly as all 4 girls took a step forward. "W-what are you gonna..." Carnivine said before...

-

Buneary was sitting outside, cradling Zorua with one paw to her chest while she very gently pet him with the other. He seemed to be at peace in his sleep right now at least. "You're gonna be okay Zorua...and when you're better we'll play lots, okay? For now, you can rest...i've got you..." She said gently, knowing that he probably couldn't hear her. Soon enough the other girls stepped out, looking none the worse for wear. "W-what did you do in there?" Buneary asked. Celebi looked at her and smiled.
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: Saved

choices: Follow Zorua and the girls
Follow Graveler and Carnivine
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
