"They're in a much bigger, and much scarier world than they've ever known right now." Celebi said in a foreboding voice. Braixen and Gardevoir nodded while Espurr had an unreadable expression.

Buneary went to look behind the girls into the dilapidated building but Braixen gently put a paw on her head and turned her away. "You wouldn't be able to see them anyway, Celebi made them uh...very, very, very small..." She said and Celebi nodded. Buneary gulped.

"Are they gonna be okay...?" She asked and Celebi also had an unreadable look before she shrugged. "Maybe after some time i'll come back to check on them...but they tried to kill our friend, whatever happens to them, that's their karma." She said coldly and Buneary nodded, with a slight look of fright before looking at the tiny dark type in her paws.

"E-espurr, do you want him back...?" Buneary said, though Espurr still had an odd look to her, but she smiled at the small bunny pokemon. "Thank you Buneary, I can take him from here." She said as she gently picked up the dark type pokemon in her paws to look him over.

He was so fragile like this...and so quiet when sleeping. She almost felt herself tear up before Gardevoir nodded to her.

"Come on, let's take him to your place Espurr, that should be fine...right?" She said smiling.

Celebi nodded. "When he wakes up, we'll make sure he's nice and healed, and also happy!" Espurr felt the tears drop from her eyes as she held Zorua to her chest.

"Thank you girls..." She said.

-

For Graveler and Carnvine, the discussion taking place outside reached them like thunder, the voices of gods. When the girls left the shed it was the biggest of earthquakes too.

"G-G-Grav...I don't know h-how we're gonna come back from this one..." Carnivine whimpered.

Graveler just gritted his teeth. No way was it gonna end like this.
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: A fitting punishment and moving on.

choices: Zorua settles down
Zorua cannot shake his thoughts
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
"Few scrapes, few bruses, and some very choice words and a clear consequence if they bother us again...they'll stay away." Celebi smiled at her. "I wouldn't have let them off so light..." Braixen complained but Gardevoir shook her head. "We're not avengers or anything, we have our friend and we should be more concerned about him than getting even." She said and Espurr nodded as well. "Still, if they come near him again..." She said, more than threateningly as she levitated a littered glass bottle and it shattered. "...can we please go back to Celebi's house now?" Buneary said, just wanting to be gone from this place, and they made their way back.

-

"...nggh..." Zorua's senses were returning to him, a very noticeable ache in his front paw, and a much larger one in his back paw. "He's waking up!" Zorua heard from somewhere at his side, the familiar friendly voice confirming to him that he was away from where he was last, and the volume of it confirming that he was still small. "Zorua? Hey, you doing okay?" A gentle voice called to him as he slowly opened his eyes to see Espurr and Gardevoir's giant faces looking over him, both looking relieved. "Hey..." He said, as he attempted to adjust himself, which proved to be a mistake as he put pressure on his back paw, making him stifle a scream and immediately collapse into a heap. "Careful! You've been through a lot and aren't healed all the way clearly..." Gardevoir said as Espurr reached out to gently get him back into a comfortable laying position. "Yeah...clearly...what happened?" He asked before the images of Graveler and Carnivine came flooding back into his head, and what happened to him...he suddenly felt ill, and his face paled while Espurr gently pet his back. "You're fine now Zorua...Celebi, Braixen and Buneary went out to get some supplies and dinner, they'll be back soon. Don't worry, everything is fine..." She said, seeing his thoughts and trying to soothe him. He wanted to gag, he needed to...to...Espurr shushed him more, still petting, trying to calm him down. He tried to focus on her, and the gentle warm touch on his back. Then his mind shifted...Graveler and Carnivine...he grimaced. "They won't bother us again, we sorted them out." Espurr said gently before Zorua thought and said something that she can't say startled her...but she hoped he wouldn't do this. "Can they walk?" He said bitterly, catching Gardevoir's attention again. "Zorua..."

"Can they still walk?" He repeated, louder and both Espurr and Gardevoir gave him a sad look. "Yes, we roughed them up a bit but gave them a firm threat to stay away, we can't do more than that." Espurr said before continuing. "And no, I can see your thoughts, i'm not going to lecture you on them. Honestly...I can't and won't blame you for feeling how you feel right now, not this time, but all the same we can't let you act on those desires." She said, still petting him and he just sat there angrily.

"Just give me my size back...i'll dig a pit, sharpen some stakes...oh they'll get theirs, RIGHT UP THEIR-"

"We're back~" Buneary sang as she entered the room seeing that Zorua was awake. "Zorua! Are you okay?" She got close and leaned her face in to see his dark expression. "Um...Zorua?" She asked, a bit more awkwardly this time before he shook his head and tried to smile back. "Yeah, i'm...well, no...i'm not fine...but i'm not with those two anymore so that's a marked improvement." He said, trying to at least curb his thoughts around the younger pokemon. 'Get a grip...get your size back...and then take care of it discretely...' He thought, though he knew Espurr could see all of this anyway. "You're an open book squirt." Braixen said from a corner, as she and Celebi had also entered the room. "Though in this case you and I are on the same page...all the same though, there are more important things to worry about now. Get some food in you and get yourself some rest before trying anything like what i'm sure you have in mind."

The group ate, trying their best to put up small talk, and Zorua attempted at least to get some food in him, but the nausea and intense desire to get even were overwhelming. He managed to keep it down though at least, and was grateful to have survived at all...soon enough though, the subject came back around to him.

"So...are you good to go Zorua?" Braixen asked.

"Yeah, how's...your chest? And your legs?" Celebi asked, almost afraid of the answer. He looked away for a second. "My chest is fine...my front leg hurts but it's not so bad...my back one..."

"He tried to put pressure on it and collapsed from the pain." Espurr said sadly. Zorua just nodded, and Celebi looked glum. "I see..." She said sadly. She healed him up as best as she could manage, but the break on the back one must've been pretty damn serious. "Well...Zorua, i'm truly happy that we got there in time. And...those guys, don't worry about 'em, okay? They won't come around again, and if they do...then you and I, we can do something about it, but until then, take it easy and try to heal and let Celebi and Espurr take care of you." Braixen grinned as she got up. "They come near us again and i'm making them the size of gnats." Celebi said frankly, those were the words she had for them when they parted. Braixen nodded "Buneary, I need to get you home, you have plans with your mom tomorrow, right?" She said as the younger pokemon looked at Zorua and nodded. "Okay...please get better Zorua..." The younger pokemon said, before pecking him on the cheek and taking off with Braixen. "Get better and we'll play okay?" She said cheerfully as the two exited the room. "You gonna hang around Gardevoir? Espurr?" Celebi asked and the two nodded. "For a bit longer, yeah, I need to head out in an hour though." Gardevoir said before Celebi got up. "We got some sweets and tea while we were out, is that good for you Zorua?" He slowly nodded, still processing everything that was happening. "You'll be okay Zorua...right as rain, just give it time to heal." Celebi said, trying to cheer him up. "Take it slow Zorua, you're mad, you're hurt, and you need rest. Try to focus on that." Espurr said gently as he tried to get his mind off of Graveler and Carnivine, still...
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: A lingering hurt and burning desire for revenge

choices: "Give me back my size. Then you'll see." Zorua responded
"Help me get my revenge!" Zorua responded
"Zorua! Don't!" Espurr interrupted
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
Zorua tried his best to shake the thoughts of revenge off, but he found it extremely hard.

He was still humiliated because of that cursed show, and now two jerks mangled him because of a stupid bag of sweets?!

Zorua gritted his teeth in rage, his body trembling as he started to came up with ways to get his revenge on them.

All he needed was his size. Then, hist tricky mind would do the rest.

Unfortunately for him, Espurr was still in that same mind of his.

"... Zorua, calm down." she stated while gently picking him up, hugging him to her chest in a gentle manner.
"Those two already got what they deserved - and I can assure: they'll get worse if they try anything again..." she said, looking determined.

"Exactly." Celebi chimed in, gently filling up a few cups with tea, while Gardevoir put a plate with sweets on the table.
"I already told it - the next time they get too near, I'm making them the size of gnats... and then treat them like ones." she said venomously.

Zorua huffed.
"All really encouraging, believe me," he interjected.
"But it wouldn't be the same. I want to do it. I need to do it!" he exclaimed with rage.

Celebi bit her lip.
"Zorua, we understand, you're frustrated. And you have all the right to be, those two did something horrible to you..." she started, taking a sip of her tea.

"... But with your size back and your current state of mind, your revenge could get out of hand and/or possibly extend to all the inhabitants of the village, us included." Espurr stated worriedly, although hard to follow as always.

"It wouldn't be like that! And get out of my mind!" Zorua exclaimed in response. The giantess whose lap he was sitting on sighed as she lowered her cup of tea to him, letting him sip the hot liquid.

He then hungrily munched on a small cookie Espurr had given him.

"Seriously Zorua, maybe Graveler and Carnivine didn't get enough, but still..." Gardevoir said, before looking at a nearby clock and gasping.
"Oh my - I gotta go now!" she said while hastily getting up.

"See you all!... And get well soon!" she said to Zorua before heading to the front door.

Once they heard it closing, the remaining three pokemon sighed.

"Seriously Zorua..." she tried, but was cut off.

"Celebi. Just let me do it... I promise it won't be like Espurr said... I've forgotten about that stupid show, okay? But those two - they wanted to kill me! They almost did! Don't do I deserve some payback?!" he shouted, his thoughts terrifying Espurr.

Celebi on the other hand looked deep in thought.

It was true.

Zorua was tortured by those two jerks and he was almost killed by the same two. He definitely deserved revenge... as long as it didn't extend to the whole village.

"You know what?" Celebi says.
"As long you don't take things too far or try to get revenge on the villagers as well..."

Espurr's eyes widened, while Zorua started grinning.
"Really?!" he exclaimed in excitement.
"Celebi that's idiotic!" Espurr interjected.

Celebi merely grinned.
"No it's not... although you'll need to control yourself, Zorua..." she said.

Zorua nodded his head.

"Alright - what do you have in mind?"
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: Thirst for vengeance

choices: Celebi meekly agreed with Zorua
Celebi tried to talk Zorua into shrinking again
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
Hearing the words of his green friend, Zorua grinned maniacally.

"My size." he stated before Espurr could speak to interrupt.
"All I need is you to grow me back, Celi. Then, you'll see. And most importantly, they'll see!"

Espurr frowned - this was getting out of hand.

"Zorua, no!" she exclaimed, gripping the fox and removing him from her lap,
"You need to stop this! And you too Celebi! They had enough, you shouldn't-"

"He should. As long as he doesn't do anything that might kill them though..." Celebi reasoned, making eye contact with the shrunken fox, who grinned back at her.

At least he had someone on his side...

"Zorua you've come so far! Think about this!" Espurr tried again, causing Zorua to look back at her.

"I am. Oh, this is gonna be so sweet~" he replied sadistically.

Before his gigantic girlfriend could oppose, Zorua was psychically snatched by Celebi.

The time-traveler grinned as she shot the familiar ball into Zorua's body, which began growing.

He snickered as the feeling overtook him.

Soon, he was normal-sized again; the Psychic let go of him, letting him fall on all fours on the floor.

He snickered to himself - now, both girls that currently occupied the room with him were even smaller than him!

"Tell you what, Espurr," Celebi began as she wrapped her long arms around the neck of the dark-type with an unusually evil grin on her face. Not
a mischievous or playful one, but a totally malicious grin.

"We'll keep an eye on Zorua as he does whatever he has in store for those two. Y'know, we'll make sure he doesn't go too far..."

"Celi..." Espurr started, but couldn't deny that there was logic in what her friend said.

But it seemed just wrong to push Zorua right back towards his past as a prankster. She feared that, if he found it even slightly amusing, he would have started pranking yet again.

All his progress would have been destroyed by a single bad choice.

But she knew - she couldn't do anything to stop her friend and boyfriend now. He was normal-sized now and, unless Celebi was willing to shrink him down again.

And that wasn't going to happen, at least not for the time being.

Espurr lowered her head, defeated.

Zorua snickered.

"Stay out of my head." he said while walking closer to the psychic-type,
"Wouldn't want to spoil the surprise."

--

"Dumb girls... and that sack of crap Zorua..." Graveler grunted, feeling his stone body in so much pain.

"Why d'you think they were protecting him...?" Carnivine wondered from beside him while repeatedly touching his scorched mouth, right where Braixen had burned him with her staff.

His stone friend was instead slammed around by Gardevoir, only to be then psychically tortured by Espurr.

The small psychic-type never looked so angry... no, angry wasn't the right word. Murderous seemed more fitting. Only when she was pulled away by her three friends she had finally stopped, though not before having warned the two about the consequences that would have occurred if they ever got close to them or Zorua again.

"I dunno." Graveler grunted.
"That little pest must have-"

"Talkin' about me boys?"

Both pokemon looked up to see a certain fox standing on the other side of the abandoned lot where their shed was.

Zorua was wearing a sadistic grin, his eyes seemed to shoot fiery sparkles, his canines shined sinisterly.

He only had to get the two of them.

This was going to be incredibly sweet. Not only he would have gotten payback, but he would have also taken out some of his lingering, annoying frustration from the messed up show.

"It's rude to talk behind people's backs, y'know. Mommy never taught you manners, Graveler?" he snickered.

Not caring if his body was still sore, the stone pokemon sprang on his feet, seething.

"You!" he hissed poisonously,
"I don't know how you got back to normal, but ya made the biggest mistake of your useless life! You're dead!"

Zorua faked a look of stupor, before he began snickering.

"IF you can catch me, stone-head!" he shouted in response while turning around.

Before either Graveler or Carnivine could speak, Zorua bolted off.

Snarling, the stone pokemon got up.

"Get him! Big or small, we can always beat the hell outta him!" he shouted, wanting Zorua to hear his clear threat.

"That's right! Let's go!" Carnivine agreed.

Without adding another word, both sprinted behind Zorua.

Obviously, the fox was more agile than them, but he kept going at a relatively slow speed so his chasers could keep up.

They had to, it was part of his grand plan.

He ran through the whole village with the two chasing him down.

Soon, he ran out of town and one direction of his forest, both Graveler and Carnivine barely keeping up.

But finally, the dark-type stopped and turned around.

Both his chasers stopped as well, panting and growling at the same time.

Zorua snickered devilishly.

"Come at me boys! Or are you afraid of little ol' me?" he shouted.

His statement only caused both his opponents to growl as they sprinted towards him.

They got closer and closer, until...

Zorua flew back.

Flew.

Carnivine and Graveler blinked as they stepped where Zorua was shortly ago, but couldn't think about it too much, before the ground beneath them suddenly gave away, causing them to sink deep into the ground.

Zorua was released from the psychic grip that held him and rushed to the edge of the pit.

"OW!"

The combined scream resounded as Graveler and Carnivine landed on their butts on broken glass and sharp rocks.

Zorua peered into the pit, while behind him Espurr and Celebi came out of a few bushes, the first wearing her usual deadpan, if not dejected look, the second with a triumphant smirk on her face.

"Anything broken, guys?" Zorua exclaimed, his voice echoing around the pit,
"I sure hope so!"

A growl replied to his taunt, mixed with a scream of pain. Carnivine apparently placed his vines on the broken glass.

"When I get back up there Zorua, I'll-"

"Whoever said that you're coming back up here?" Zorua interrupted Graveler's threat while looking back at his two companions.

Celebi's eyes began glowing as a large pile of soil began hovering in mid-air and above the opening of the pit.

Zorua shot a malicious grin to the two prisoners.

Graveler and Carnivine had their jaws wide open.

"No..."
"Grav...!"

The pile fell straight into the pit, blocking the only exit its two captives had.

Zorua let out a howl of sadistic glee as he watched them disappear from his sight, their muffled screams ringing in his ears.

"Awesome!" he laughed manically.

His revenge was complete!

"... They'll suffocate down there, you know." Espurr chimed in a lecturing tone.

"A ground-type and a grass-type? They'll be fine." Celebi mused, grinning at Zorua, who howled with laughter again.

Celebi's gaze softened as her grin was replaced by a wide smile.

"And now that's done, ready to go back to the world of giant pokemon Zorua?" she asked sweetly.

Zorua immediately stopped laughing to shoot his friend and girlfriend a serious look.

He took a step back while Espurr's eyes widened... even more, if possible. Zorua was thinking about-

"I don't think so."

Celebi adopted a confused expression - what?

Zorua stared Celebi down.

"I'm not going back to being small Celi. You saw what happened, and I'm not letting it happen again. Not a chance in hell!" he cried.

Espurr felt like she was kicked in the stomach.

"B-But Zorua... when you're small..."

"I know, me staying at your place, alright." Zorua interrupted with a blush.
"But you said your dad is never home, no? It'll be fine, Espurr." he said, before looking elsewhere.
"And if you don't want, I'll just come living right back here. I don't mind."

Celebi was dumbstruck.

"But Zorua, think about it! We're your friends, we'll protect you from... from..."

"Everything?" the fox completed, before shaking his head,
"Thank you. I appreciate that, but I'll protect myself as well if I'm big. I'm sorry, but I'm not going back."

"But... didn't you say...?" Celebi recalled the dark-type's previous decision, but he shrugged.

"I... changed my mind. I'm better off like this." he stated.

Espurr didn't know what to say.

"Celi..." she addressed her green friend for support.

If Zorua didn't want to be small again, she couldn't force him.

But if he was tiny, she could protect him.

Ironically, Zorua seemed to read Espurr's mind.

"I'm sorry. But I'm not going back." he stated firmly.

The small psychic-type looked down wordlessly.

At this point, all she could do was hope Celebi managed to convince Zorua.

As for the fairy, she too made a decision.
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: Justified Revenge

choices: "Look, i'm sorry girls...i'm just better off on my own, you're better off too."
"I'm sorry girls...I don't intend to be tiny again, with or without you."
"Maybe you're right...it might be better for everyone if i'm small. Me too..."
Before he can respond, Graveler's hand pops out of the ground.
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
Celebi sighed as she looked at her friend. She didn't want to admit it, but Espurr was probably right, Zorua was slipping back a bit once he got a taste of revenge. Graveler and Carnivine sure as hell deserved it, that much was NOT up for dispute, but it might've had a poor effect on the dark type.

She opened her mouth to try and fix this.

"Look Zorua, I know you more or less can handle yourself...and you had a nasty incident or two when you were tiny..." She started, she really didn't know how this was going to be convincing, and from what she could tell by Zorua's face, it wasn't convincing.

"Yeah, an incident or two is putting it mildly..." He said and she sighed before straightening herself and looking to Espurr who looked a bit down by all of this.

"Zorua, look, things have been rough at points, but since you agreed to be small you've been happier, made friends, been able to be more open, right? And I mean no offense by this, absolutely none but..." She sighed before continuing.

"We can protect you better than you can protect yourself." Celebi said. This would either work or backfire tremendously.

It backfired tremendously.

"Excuse me Ms Legendary? I do just fine by myself, I have since I-I..." He gritted his teeth and Espurr approached him to stroke his head.

"Please Zorua, you can be honest...please trust us on this." She was trying to salvage it but Zorua shook her away.

"No, i'm fine!" He said glaring now at the two pokemon.

'If you two weren't my friends i'd...but there's still a lot of pokemon who need to figure out why NOT to mess with me.' His thoughts were going back to how they had been and Espurr looked at him sadly.

"Zorua..." She said sadly, he had come so far...

Celebi bit her lip before she shook her head and put on a serious face.

"Zorua, do you intend to go back to your old ways? If so then I WILL stop you, both for the village and your own good. This is your choice on the promise that you don't take your anger out on the villagers." She said firmly and Zorua scoffed at this.

"I wasn't gonna do anything to anyone that didn't have it coming..." Her look didn't falter and he snarled at this.

"Okay fine! I still agree to lay off, but this is why i'm better off on my own!" He said finally and she looked at him sadly.

"Zorua, we just want what's best for our friend, you have to believe us."

Espurr nodded and ran forward to hug Zorua.

"Please...just come with us..." She said and he sighed.
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: Trying to convince Zorua

choices: "Zorua...the revenge idea...why don't we not worry about that right now, okay?"
"Okay Zorua, so do you have a plan for how to get those two?"
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
"Zorua! Don't!" Espurr interjected their conversation of vengeance as she gently hugged the small pokemon to her chest. "Celebi, you need to stop too!" She said, looking at her green friend who shrugged. "Is it really so bad if he goes after THOSE two? After what they did to him, after all they've done to lots of other pokemon?"

"Is that how you felt when you shrunk Zorua down in the first place?" Espurr said, knowing full well it to be a sore spot, but she needed to get through to her. Celebi winced at this before looking down. "That's different...that's not what this is about!" She said, getting heated. "Zorua has every right to want to get back at them! They tried to kill him and came very close! Not to mention what they did to him in the mean time!" Celebi yelled and Zorua nodded at this. "Espurr, i'm only going to get those two, I won't get anyone else! And I WILL get them!" He gritted before Espurr sighed and gently set Zorua down on Celebi's bed.

"Celebi, i'd like to talk to you alone." She said simply, getting up. "Hey, what you have to say to her you can say to me right!?" Zorua demanded. Espurr just looked at him with...an unreadable expression, and then looked away, saying nothing as Celebi got up. "Okay, fine Espurr, let's go talk!" She said, still clearly offended by what Espurr had said moments ago as the two towering giantesses left Zorua on the bed, shutting the door. He was contemplating that last look Espurr gave him before looking down then tried to get up, only to collapse again with his leg and wincing. "Ghh....I can't let this go unabated Espurr...I need to get those two..." He grunted, looking back at his leg.

-

"You are not helping him by offering his size back for the express purpose of getting revenge in this one specific instance Celebi." Espurr said plainly as the two entered her kitchen and Celebi huffed. "In this instance I don't think Zorua is out of his bounds to want a little payback! Honestly we DID go too easy on them, and you know you agree, as well as Braixen!" Celebi said as Espurr sighed. "Zorua is alive, Zorua will recover, and those two, barring that they're even dumber than i've been lead to believe, and trust me, they WERE scared away by your threat, will not be a problem to him, Buneary, or any of us in the future." Espurr stated plainly. "That doesn't-"

"This isn't about what I want, or what you want, or what he wants right now Celebi, it's about what is best for Zorua in the long run at this point right now, and giving him this, that is not what will help him mentally recover. I can see things you can't when it comes to this Celebi, and I know things about him that you don't. Being blunt, enabling him is the exact thing that will set him back on the path that you pulled him away from in the first place, which you did through kindness and remorse of your own actions, not getting revenge on him, which was your original intent." Espurr stated, leaving Celebi to think for a moment before sighing.

"Those two though...they deserve this, no amount of kindness would get them to stop what they do." Celebi said.

"Hence you threatening them and us roughing them up. I'm not thinking about what's fair here, what they did wasn't, and i'd love nothing more than to hurt them...but what's important right now is being a good friend, and a good friend wouldn't let him do what he wants to do right now, they'd keep him company, keep him healthy, and keep him safe. Even if you gave him his size back right now, he's wounded inside and out, he still has a hurt leg, and is a complete miasma of chaos, vengeance, and confusion in his mind. But ultimately, it's your call Celebi, I can't give him or take away his size, only you can." Espurr was doing her best to keep a level voice and Celebi just looked away before sighing, and giving Espurr her answer.

-

The two came back in the room, Zorua figuring that Espurr was trying to talk Celebi out of giving him his size back. He couldn't read her expression though, which he was used to by now, Celebi slowly approached the bed and gave him an answer.
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: Trying to sway away

choices: "Meloetta, what are you doing out here?"
"I don't believe we've met, who are you?"
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
Zorua was staring into the surprised blue eyes of a pokemon he had never seen before. She had long green hair, a white face on a (not to him) small black body and she seemed oddly graceful even in her shock. She slowly leaned down to him, making him take a small step back as her face got larger and larger.

"Oh my, and who are you?" She asked kindly as he scratched at his ear with a front forepaw. "Um...Zorua, miss." He muttered, feeling shy and awkward. She reached out her tiny paws, though it looked like they had no way to grab him, being small circles, both gently clamped around him as he felt himself being lifted.

"Well i'm Meloetta, I believe i've heard of you, according to rumors you're quite the little trouble maker, right?" She said, not a hint of malice in her voice, just curiosity. Zorua felt himself feeling even more awkward with that being brought up. "Well...I was, trying to clean up my act more or less right now." She giggled a little. "I don't see how such a small guy could cause much trouble~" She said as she set him in her lap and started to pet him.

"Well...that's kinda the point right now..." He muttered, looking out at his forest a bit. 'So much for being alone.' He thought, feeling awkward around this unknown. She had started to hum something as time went on and he felt himself slowly relaxing. He wanted to ask her something, but he didn't want to interrupt her.

He didn't know how much time had passed, but he heard something approaching that made Meloetta stop petting him and soon...his friends came through the clearing. "Sheesh Zorua, you've been gone for a while." Said Celebi, almost scolding as her eyes fell on Meloetta, startling her. She gracefully stood up and approached Celebi, handing him over to her. "I assume he's your charge then?" She said happily before Celebi responded.
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: Meet Meloetta

choices: Zorua joins in anyway
Zorua still wants to think for a while
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
Celebi took a step back, her eyes widening.
"Me-Meloetta...?" she asked, her grip on Zorua tightening.

The green headed pokemon nods happily.
"Hi Celebi." she quietly says, giving the fairy a hug.
"Long time no see..."

It would have been a nice scene, if it wasn't for the fact that Zorua, held by Celebi, was in the middle of the hug. As a result, he was being squeezed between two giantesses.
"Ce-le-bi..." he whispers, running out of breath.

"Celebi!" Espurr cries in alert. Instantly, Meloetta and Celebi break the hug.

Meloetta's gaze lands on the four pokemon behind the fairy.
"I see you're with some friends..."

"Oh... an old friend Celebi?" Espurr chimes while reading the newcomer's mind. Celebi looks at her, glaring, before looking back at Meloetta with a blush.

She just giggles politely.
"Oh, are you a mind reader?" she asks while eyeing Espurr.

"Yes. And you're actually a friend of Celebi and you came here because you-" Espurr is silenced by Braixen, who covers her mouth with a paw.

Braixen sighs, before eyeing Meloetta.
"Forgive her... she does that." she awkwardly says.
"And it's really, REALLY annoying..." Zorua chimes in, glancing at Espurr with annoyance.

Beneath Braixen's paw, Espurr smirks.

Meloetta smiles.
"Nice to meet you all~" she chimes, before her gaze returns to Celebi.

"Meloetta, what are you doing here?" the fairy asks. The newcomer does a graceful twirl.
"Just paying a friend a visit," she replies.

"I was actually coming to your house... when I found Zorua." she explains, before giving a giggle.
"I actually heard about him a lot. An infamous scoundrel. How can someone that small be a scoundrel?"

Celebi sighs.
"He WAS a scoundrel, Meloetta. And he... he isn't usually that small..." she awkwardly explains.

Meloetta gracefully tilts her head in a curious manner.

Celebi sighs.
"Y'see... he pulled a prank on me like a week ago... and I reduced him to an even smaller size. It was meant as a punishment... but I - accidentally of course - took things too far when I-"

"Stop thinking about it Celebi." Zorua says from her chest, interrupting. She looks at him sorrowfully, quietly nodding her head.
"Still..." she says bitterly.

Meloetta nods in a comprehensive manner.
"Must have been something terrible..." she comments.
"But, may I ask, why he's still that size then? I mean... if you took things too far..."

"It was my choice," Zorua says, staring back at all his friends, who don't dare to interrupt. Espurr is still silenced by Braixen, who watches Meloetta, Celebi and Zorua intently.

For a moment, Zorua's dream flashes across his mind.

"And why so?" Meloetta asks sweetly, giving a smile.

Zorua sighs and turns around, now sure that he can trust Meloetta. She's proven to be quite nice.

"Initially, it was because I... because I don't actually have somewhere to go..." he explains.
"Dear."

"Yeah. So... Celebi told me I could stay with her for some time... but I had to be this size..." Zorua continues.
"And for a while, my prankster nature seemed to disappear. Recently, Celebi grew me back but... I went through something truly humiliating... that awakened the real me... the scoundrel..." he pauses to sigh.

Meloetta stares at him.
"You mean, you meant to cause trouble again...?" she asks. Zorua meekly nods.
"This size is to prevent me from doing so." he concludes.

"Poor Zorua... he almost died..." Buneary chimes, remembering a panting Espurr holding a startled Zorua, a Spinarak running off.

Meloetta gives a kind smile.
"This all must have been rough..." she comments with a low giggle.

"You have no idea." Celebi says with a sigh.

"And here we are," Gardevoir chimes in.
We just came to get Zorua after talking about... things~" she cheerfully says while eyeing Espurr and Zorua.

Espurr blushes while sliding out of Braixen's grasp.
"... Stop talking about it Gard..." she says, the blush spreading on her deadpan face.

Celebi giggles, looking at Meloetta.
"Why don't you join us?" she asks.

"It'll be fun~!" Buneary sings.

Meloetta smiles.
"Of course I'll join you. I wanted to pay you a visit anyway." she responds while moving up beside Celebi.

"And you Zorua? Are you done thinking~?" the fairy asks with a giggle, her gaze landing on Zorua.

"I didn't think at all..."
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: Legendary friends

choices: After lunch
In the evening
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
"I didn't really get a chance to..."

*Grumble*

Zorua was about to finish when his stomach started growling and he flushed red. "Zorua is hungry." Espurr said, seeing his thoughts while the others giggled. "I think we got that on our own Espurr." Braixen said, looking at the smaller pokemon with a grin. "Yeah...I guess i'm good to go with you girls now." He said as Celebi simply patted his head. "Let's go get some lunch then, come on Meloetta." Celebi said cheerfully, beckoning her friend who gracefully followed the group back to her house.

Zorua also found himself handed off to Buneary, who wanted to hold him for a bit. He didn't mind it, though he knew the younger pokemon was more eager to play than to get food, and he definitely noted that during the travel time back to her house.

"So Zorua, how long are you thinking of staying that size anyway, if you're doing it of your own volition right now?" Meloetta inquired from somewhere behind him and Buneary. He was about to respond until. "He isn't sure yet, he thinks that right now his situation is more beneficial not only for him, but those around him." Espurr said. "Seriously!? Stop doing that!" He called out, not seeing her small smirk.

"Well, it seems regardless of feelings, Espurr still enjoys messing with you~" Gardevoir sang out, immediately making Espurr fall back to her default and start blushing, Zorua flushing red as well. Buneary was giggling as well looking at the small pokemon in her paws. "That's still so cute Zorua~" She said as he tried to make himself smaller in her paws. "Yeah yeah..." He muttered, wanting them to change the subject, but he was in luck as Celebi's house was in the distance.

"Alright, we'll grab a quick lunch and then we can enjoy the outdoors some more, alright?" Braixen said to Buneary who nodded.

"I've got stuff for sandwiches and some chips as well, so feel free to help yourselves!" Celebi said smiling as the group entered the kitchen, Zorua finding himself on Celebi's table as he watched the giantesses put together the food.

"And you Zorua, what do you want?" Celebi asked before Espurr called out from somewhere behind her. "Don't worry, i'm taking care of it."

"Oh, have what he wants in your mind already, that's so kind of you Espurr~" Gardevoir said, eliciting more giggles. Espurr said nothing in response and Zorua couldn't see her face before a small amount of meat, cheese, bread and a chip was placed in front of him, no veggies he noted. "Thank you thank you!" He grinned as he started to dig in.

"So he was a trouble maker huh? Seems hard to believe from what i've seen of him." Meloetta noted, Espurr looking at her thoughts. "You think he's an awkward goof with a good heart huh? That sounds about right." She smirked making Zorua gulp a bit and give her an annoyed look. "Well, that's certainly what I would say he is too, at least now...you have made a lot of progress Zorua, regardless of your own feelings on it...even that moment of weakness last night you already regret...you can seriously grow back if you want to for today." Celebi said, trying to reassure him before he shook his head. "No, this is fine for now...I can eat more like this." He joked, trying to move them off of this. 'I wish I was just an awkward goof with a good heart.' He thought sadly, as the revenge ideas briefly flitted through his head and he smirked bitterly. 'Oh well, i'll deal with that later, for now I feast!' He thought as Espurr smiled a bit sadly at him.
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: Lunch

choices: Zorua smiles genuinely, happy to have his size back
Zorua snickers as he suddenly thinks about revenge again...
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
Zorua lets out a satisfied sigh.

He was right - he ate like he never did in his life. Maybe that size wasn't all disadvantages, he decided.

"Satisfied~?" Meloetta asked with a giggle as she munched on a meat and cheese sandwich she made herself.

"Stuffed." he responds with a smirk, before looking at Espurr.
"Thanks Espurr." he says, making her smile in his direction.

"Hehe, you sure were hungry squirt! You finished up before us!" Braixen giggles cheerfully, almost choking on a piece of sandwich.

It took several seconds of Gardevoir patting her back before she finally managed to swallow and sigh in relief.

Buneary soon finishes eating too and goes pick Zorua up, before closing him in a hug.
"Come on, let's hurry! So we can play!" she exclaims eagerly while doing a pirouette that causes Zorua to feel nauseous.

"Ugh... do you really have to keep me restrained Buneary?" he asks, trying to fight off the feeling of nausea. The bunny pokemon giggles.
"Sorry Zorua... it's just that you're adorable~" she chimes in response.

Zorua blushes.
"To think that one week ago you wouldn't have even wanted to see me." he recalls, making the bunny giggle behind him.

"Since you apologized to her for your prank, she grew more and more comfortable around you - she actually does think of you a lot." Espurr says, deadpan.

"Heh, easy there Buneary - Espurr might be jealous~" Gardevoir chimes, making Espurr not-so-deadpan as a blush appears on her face.
"Stop that Gardevoir..." she quietly mutters.
"We're not even on that level yet."

"Wait and see~" Celebi chimes in, swallowing her last chip.

"Will you cut it?!" Zorua screams, his face completely red.

Meloetta starts giggling.
"I think I understand now - and it's extremely cute of you both, Zorua~" she says.

"Not you too..." he mutters from Buneary's chest, trying to bury his head in the cream-colored fur around her waist. Too bad, her paws keep him from moving and, as furiously as he's fidgeting, he can't move of an inch.

The dark type fox gives up as he gives an embarassed sigh.

Braixen snickers.
"Wouldn't have dreamed of telling it before... but that's really extremely cute..." she remarks, causing Zorua to blush even more, Espurr to look away in embarrassment and the other girls to laugh.

Braixen looks at Buneary.
"Oh, and it seems that we're all done eating, Bun," she says.

Buneary looks around, noting that Braixen is right. Beaming, the bunny makes a leap.

"Let's go play!" she shouts, almost breaking Zorua's ears as he once again feels nauseous.

"Help..."

--

"Okay Zorua..." Espurr pants as she stops chasing the small fox.
"You win this time."

Zorua smirks as he stops running.

He had told the girls that he wanted a rematch with Espurr, recalling how she beat him days ago - he still belived that it wasn't a fair victory. Although this time they had set up a new rule: obligatory chasing.

And he finally won.

Reading his thoughts, Espurr blushes... although it went unseen: her face was already red from all the running she did in order to get Zorua.

"Yeah... the same bet we did back then... and I lost - although I would have gotten nothing if I won..." she pants.

"Still..." Zorua tells, excited.

Espurr nods as she bends to pick him up.

"Bet? What bet? What are you talking about?" Braixen asks. She and the other girls were watching the game sitting on a log, while Meloetta sat on a large rock.

Espurr blushes even more and turns around, back turned to her friends as she holds Zorua in front of her face.

Then, with an imperceptible movement of her head, she presses her lips on Zorua's head, making the little dark type snicker.

Gardevoir's eyes literally gleamed.
Aww!" everyone exclaims, having seen that despite Espurr's discretion.

"It was amazing Zorua!" Buneary chimes while getting up.

"Agreed. You're quite the runner." Meloetta says.

"Heh, I think I'm the only one who ever caught him... although I was very pissed..." Celebi proudly states.

"Come on now!" Buneary says while picking up a ball they had brought.
"Let's play!"

Zorua looks at her from Espurr's chest.
"Buneary. How am I supposed to hit that?" he reasons, noticing that the ball is probably four times his size.

"You can ride on it while we play~" the bunny suggests. Zorua pales.

Celebi shakes her head.
"Let's not be silly, Buneary," she says, before eyeing Zorua with a smile.
"Y'know Zorua, the offer is still valid: you can grow back if you wish."

Zorua tilts his head.
"But-"
"He's not sure it's a good idea because he could just start thinking about getting revenge again - he has seriously nasty ideas about that and he wouldn't be taken by surprise this time because-"

"ESPURR!" Zorua cries from her chest, interrupting her. She smirks.

"Well, aren't they adorable?" Meloetta comments with a graceful smile.
"You can say that!"

"... Anyway Zorua, it'll be just for a bit! I'll shrink you again later if you want!" Celebi resumes, giving an encouraging smile.

"Come on Zorua - we can play all together if you go back to your size!" Buneary chimes.

"It'll be fine. I mean, you're not thinking about getting revenge on the villagers, are ya?" Braixen asks.

Before Espurr could read his mind again, Zorua quickly nods in agreement.
"Okay, Celebi, fine..." he says, convinced.

Espurr gently puts him on the ground while Celebi gets closer, her eyes glowing.
"Okay... stand still..."

Zorua is enveloped in psychic energy. And soon, before everyone's eyes, he starts gradually growing up more and more.

Espurr remains glued to his thoughts as he grows back to his original size.

Checking his thoughts wasn't really necessary, Espurr discovers as she looks at Zorua's facial expression...
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: After lunch

choices: "I-I'm fine now... let's... let's just play..." he meekly says
"I knew this would have happened!... Shrink me again!" he responds
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
Zorua starts snickering to himself. He got his size back! Now, he could finally play with his friends, without caring about reve-

...

His mind suddenly goes back to that moment.

Insults. Angry faces. Stuff being thrown at him... Sure thing, all those pokemon really deserved to be thrown down a-

Zorua shakes his head, trying to rid it from the thoughts. Not again. The more he tries to get rid of them, the more his mind is bombarded with images of suffering pokemon and the more the grin grows wider on his face...

No.

He couldn't. He was the one insisting to remain tiny to stop thinking about those things!... But... revenge was a sweet thing to think about. Too sweet for the dark type fox to just stop imagining what he'd gladly do to Wigglytuff whenever he passed in front of his forest again... one rock thrown at his head to knock him out, and whenever he woke up he would find himself tied to a-

Espurr's mind is assaulted by Zorua's thoughts.

He was doing it. He was really doing it.

He was thinking about revenge again!

"Zorua. Stop it." she says, while stepping forward. Surprisingly, Zorua remains calm and grins at Espurr.
"Stop doing what?" he asks, acting oblivious.

"You're thinking about revenge again, and you're trying to conceal it so that Celebi doesn't shrink you again - you're forgetting I can read your mind, which is something I do really often, and you can't hide it from me."

Everyone looked at Espurr, mouths wide open, then at Zorua.
"A-Again?" Braixen stutters.

Meloetta stares at the three in confusion... although, Zorua did mention that he went through something that made him want to cause trouble again...

The dark type snorts.
"What? Can't I even think about it anymore? Yes, I'm thinking about revenge. So? I haven't done anything yet." he states, while looking at all his friends.

"Zorua... it's true, but you need to understand that you're still in a delicate state of mind, and you could attempt something extremely idiotic..." Celebi gently says while getting closer.

"Knowing you, you would Zorua." Espurr chimes in, earning a glare from the fox.

"Zorua..."

"Espurr. Weren't you the one telling that because I CAN do something it doesn't mean I WILL do something?" he recalls while backing up slightly.

"Correct." the psychic type responds, while getting closer.
"But you're seriously considering the idea Zorua. Your mind - disorder. Again. You need to be shrank down again before you attempt something in a fit of ire and humiliation that you would later regret."

"... Could you repeat that...?"

Zorua simply snickers defiantly.
"What if I don't want to return tiny, Espurr?" he says, backing up again, ready to run if things got nasty for him.

Espurr stares at him in silence, those endless eyes of hers reflecting his snickering face.

Then, Espurr turns around to face Celebi.
"Celebi."

The grass type fairy bites her lip as she slowly nods her head while moving towards the duo.
"Sorry Zorua... you can't take risks... but, we can still play all together." she says with a gentle smile while her eyes start glowing.

Not this time, Zorua thinks, his own eyes glowing as a ring of fire suddenly erupts from the ground, scaring Celebi and Espurr, making the other girls gasp.

Then, Zorua swiftly turns around and starts to run away... only to find himself suddenly pinned to the ground by a psychic force, much like he had been last night.

Celebi gets closer.
"Sorry..." she repeats.

But, before she can shrink Zorua, she's gently pushed aside by Meloetta, who hovers in front of Zorua, giving a smile.

Then, she strikes a pose in midair, legs bent, one paw in the air while the other rests on her belly.

And then, Meloetta starts singing. It's no normal song though - it is an enchanting sound, almost heavenly.

Everyone in the clearing falls under Meloetta's spell as she keeps singing.

Zorua's mind is soon ridded from all the vengeful thoughts and is replaced by the sweet song. He finds that he can't actually think about anything else while his heart is filled with serenity.

Meloetta sings for a while, her sweet song filling the clearing for a whole five minutes, before she finally - sadly - stops.

The girls and Zorua return to their senses.

Buneary is the first to talk,
"Beautiful!" she cheers, followed by the others.

Meloetta bows cheerfully, before looking back at Zorua with a smile.
"Feeling better~?" she asks, gently petting his head.

He looks down, breathing heavily, before rising his head again.
"Yes..." he responds, before smiling a little.
"Thank you..."

Meloetta smiles brightly.

"... You're stable again now..." Espurr points out while looking at the fox.

"Thank goodness..." Gardevoir sighs. Celebi nods, before looking at Zorua again.

"Still... that might happen again..." she says.
"Zorua... do you wanna be tiny again...?" she then asks in a gentle manner.

Zorua looks down.
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: Bitter thoughts

choices: "I'm gonna stick with Celebi for now, thank you though Espurr."
"Sure Espurr, that sounds great!"
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
Zorua stared at the ground. "I knew this was going to happen...I was scared that this was going to happen..." He muttered, not wanting to look his friends in the eye after he was in this state for a second time.

"Zorua, you don't need to be ashamed, we know you're trying to be better about it...we'll keep working at it, okay?" Espurr said in her deadpan voice before he slowly raised his head and looked at Celebi. "You need to shrink me again. It's the best way to keep me from thinking about that again." Celebi nodded and moved forward towards him. "Okay Zorua, if you're sure." And with that her eyes glowed and Zorua found the world around him expanding once more. Soon enough he was surrounded by 6 giantesses as Celebi gently reached down to pick him up.

"Don't worry Zorua, those thoughts'll go away sooner or later." Braixen tried to reassure.

"Yeah, you're so nice like this, you just need to learn to be nice all the time!" Buneary chimed in, smiling at him. He smiled back but thought to himself 'Yeah, they'll go away after it only took me 2 seconds to flip right back to revenge and pranks when I got my size back.'

"It'll take time, there isn't denying that Zorua, but it's only been a day. Don't be discouraged, try and have fun." Espurr reassured as she stared at him with those endless eyes.

"Um...so do you want to ride on the ball Zorua?" Buneary asked as he stared at her incredulously. "I'm gonna pass on that..." He said slowly and she put a paw to her chin. "Oh...well I know, what if we all play catch, and you try and touch the pokemon who has the ball before they can pass it? Like mankey in the middle!" She said happily. Zorua thought for a second..."Yeah, that could work." He said happily.

-

"heh....heh....heh..." Zorua had been at it for 20 minutes, and as fast as he could be, his size made it nearly impossible to reach one of them before they passed the ball off. Arceus forbid they passed it to the pokemon right next to them too. "Are you getting tired Zorua?" Meloetta meant it as a kind offer for him to rest, Zorua took it as a challenge to his pride. "N-never...i'm gonna do it...i'll catch the one that has the ball...just need...to dig deep for the energy..." He said as Braixen tossed the ball as he was getting close. "Sorry." She said a little too innocently. He turned around and started to run towards Espurr who caught it. 'I can do it, I can do it.' With no expression Espurr merely passed it off to Gardevoir when Zorua was getting close. She didn't need to pass it right away she noted, he was slowing down. "We can take a break Zorua." She said. "No way....none of you are tired yet...and neither am I!" He said as he surged towards Gardevoir only to trip up and fall flat on his face. "Zorua!"

"Ugh...just give me a sec...then i'm gonna catch that freaking ball!" He said as he stumbled to his feet only to feel himself being lifted. "Break time." Celebi said as she gently lifted him from the ground and they went to sit on a log. The rest of the group joined them as Zorua rested in her lap.

"You sure look pooped Zorua." Braixen teased.

"Bite me." Was his response and she just chuckled.

"It really is hard to believe the stories i've heard about you when I see you like this..." Meloetta said, looking at the tiny fox as he laid on his side on Celebi's lap, just enjoying the rest. He sighed.

"Well believe 'em. I ain't happy about it and I clearly still have the desire for it in there." He said frankly as Espurr reached over to grab him from Celebi's lap.

"Listen Zorua, I know you and I know that you're struggling to move past it, but at least you have the will and desire too. Like I said, give it time." Espurr said frankly "If you want...you can stay with me too you know..." She said, fidgeting as Gardevoir's eyes lit up. "If anyone can help you with it, it's Espurr!" She said and Celebi looked at the ground for a bit, Zorua took note of this. He was her roomie, right? She looked at him with a smile though. "It's up to you Zorua, i'm with you 100%" She said happily and he thought.
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: Still a long way to go

choices: "Well... I guess there's really no harm..." Espurr responds
"Maybe the next time..." Espurr responds
Before she can respond, a Meowstic suddenly comes out... her dad?
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
Zorua's heart started beating faster. Celebi had given her approval!

"O-Of course, Espurr! That sounds great!" he exclaimed while a smile took place on his face. Not only she was the girl he had a crush on, she lived in a literal palace too!

Espurr smiles.
"Yeah, that fully works to your advantage Zorua," she remarks.
"And I get someone to make me company - you already know my dad isn't very present. This way, you get to stay with me and I get to solve my solitude problems." she finishes by hugging Zorua to her chest tightly.

He blushed vaguely, but returned the hug.

"That's. So. Cute!" Gardevoir chimes with sparkling eyes.
"More than that! It's adorable!" Buneary chimes in.

"I have to agree." Meloetta quietly says while giggling a bit.

Celebi giggles.
"Aw... now my roomie is going away..." she says while placing a paw over her eyes.

From Espurr's chest, Zorua looks at the fairy.
"Sorry Celebi..." he apologizes. The grass type simply smiles.
"Hehe, trust me Zorua, you'll be better with Espurr... although I will miss cuddling you~" she responds, making the small dark type blush.

Espurr reads his thoughts and smirks while letting him down. Zorua grins at Celebi, before making a leap towards her.

Celebi is taken aback, but catches Zorua anyway, hugging him tightly.
"Little roomie~" she sings cheerfully, moving her head and pushing her head against his body, nuzzling him gleefully.

"Aww..." all the girls say, beaming at the scene.

Then, Celebi breaks the hug, letting the dark type on her lap while Buneary goes pick up the ball.
"Come on! Let's play again!" she chimes.

Braixen smirks.
"Yeah, you still have to catch it squirt!" she exclaims while eyeing Zorua, who grins.
"I'm gonna catch it sooner or later!" he says with determination while leaping onto the log from Celebi's lap.

"We'll see~"

--

The rest of the day quietly goes on and, eventually, the girls decide that it's time to go to their respective homes.

"Next time we see each other, you're gonna have to tell me EVERYTHING." Gardevoir stated as she started leaving, her eyes fixed on Zorua.

He blushes, but gives a warm smile.

"See ya around!" Braixen chimes while taking Buneary's paw in hers. Her gaze lands on Meloetta.

"It was nice meeting you, Meloetta," she says.
"Same here." Buneary, Espurr and Gardevoir tell at unison.

Meloetta smiles brightly as Braixen, Buneary and Gardevoir take their leave, only Celebi remaining.

The fairy moves towards Espurr- who is holding Zorua - and gently pets him with a paw.
"See you next time, roomie~" she says cheerfully. Zorua snickers.
"See you next time, my best friend." he risks replying, well aware of what's coming next.

In fact, Celebi pushes her head into Espurr's chest, nuzzling the tiny fox with glee, before standing up again and starting to leave.

"See you three around~" she chimes, before she too leaves.

Only Espurr, Meloetta and Zorua remained.

Espurr reads Meloetta's thoughts.

"Coincidence?" she asks while giving a small smile.
"You and us are going to walk on the same road."

Meloetta smiles.

--

"I don't understand - where do you live?" Zorua asks from Espurr's chest as she and Meloetta walk. Every once in awhile, Espurr would stop to pet him.

"Just outside your forest." Meloetta simply replies as she walks beside Espurr.

For a moment, the psychic type holding Zorua looks shocked.
"No way..." she whispers to herself, only Zorua able to hear her.
"You own THAT house?"

Meloetta giggles. Zorua looks confused.
"What house...?" he asks. Espurr doesn't respond. Her grip on him tightens.

"You'll see~"

Soon, the trio gets out of the forest.

And, after a short walk, they arrive to Espurr's house. Espurr's huge huge house, and not only from Zorua's point of view.

The small psychic type stops.
"I actually live here..." she says.

Meloetta's face lits up.
"Really?" she asks with sudden excitement.
"But that means we're neighbors!" she chimes, turning around to point at a shortly distant house... if house it could be called.

If Espurr's house was a palace, Meloetta's house could be compared to a small royal palace.

It was huge, with an immense yard in the front. Looking better, Zorua could see a sculpture shaped like a musical note in front of the house.

"Wow..." he mumbles, mouth wide open.
"I've always wondered who could have owned that..." Espurr says.

Meloetta giggles.
"Ironic, because I've always wondered who could have owned this~" she says cheerfully while grabbing Espurr in a hug.
"Neighbors~"

Then, an idea springs up in Meloetta's mind.
"Hey, why don't you come with me? I can show you my house if you'd like~" she kindly suggests while releasing Espurr.

"Please, let's do this, I gotta see it!" Zorua says while fidgeting in Espurr's grasp to turn around and face her.

The psychic type remains silent for a moment, seeming to be thinking, before she responds.
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: Moving in with Espurr

choices: "We should head home now." Espurr said
"Okay I guess..." Espurr said
"You can stay if you want... I'm heading home..." Espurr said
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
The pokemon holding Zorua blushed vaguely.
"There's... there's no harm I guess..." she responded.

Zorua grinned at her, while Meloetta beamed.
"Splendid!" she chimed. Zorua's world shook as he suddenly found himself balancing on two pair of paws. Meloetta just grabbed Espurr's in hers, he discovers.

"Come on!" the green headed pokemon chimed, her feet leaving the ground as she started floating towards her her house, dragging Espurr along with her, threatening to throw Zorua off his perch.

He gripped Espurr's fur as she was dragged by the overexcited Meloetta.

The normal type stopped in front of her immense house and floated to the door, opening it.
"Come in~" she sang.

Espurr didn't move.
"Good thinking Zorua, you should hide or use an illusion, if someone sees you like this they'd be freaked out and we'd be in trouble unless..." she stopped, seeing Meloetta smirk.

"... You live alone..."

Meloetta gracefully nodded her head before moving inside the house.
"Will you please?"

--

"You can sit here. I'll make some tea." Meloetta said as she led Espurr into a huge living room.

The pokemon holding Zorua looked around with wide eyes. A huge couch with an as well huge TV. Bookshelves around and several doors leading to unknown rooms.

Meloetta gestured for the couch.
"Get comfortable." she said, before moving towards one of the doors and disappearing inside another room.

Zorua grinned.
"This house is huge!" he exclaimed in excitement as Espurr sat down in the couch, setting her small friend onto her lap.

"... ‘Huge’ is an approximation... but yeah, it's pretty big..." she responded, smiling a little as she hugged the fox against her belly.

He snickered, leaning back and relaxing.
Shortly after, Meloetta came back holding two cups, a third one floating in front of her along with a plate of sweets.

"I figured you'd want something stronger than tea," she said Zorua, the cup levitating onto a coffee table in front of the couch.

Espurr released the fox from her hug and moved on the table, where he looked inside his cup, which was filled with a yellow liquid.

"Lemonade," Espurr told while taking the cup being offered to her.
"Thanks Meloetta."

Meloetta smiled while she gracefully sat beside Espurr, holding her cup with both, fingerless paws.
"If only we knew each other sooner~" she said with a smile.

"We know each other because we have one common friend: Celebi." Espurr responded.

"Yep. And if wasn't for her, we wouldn't have known about each other. Right Zorua?" Meloetta gently asked.

"Mh-mhh." Zorua responded, busily munching on a few sweets, causing Meloetta to giggle.

"Quite frankly, I already knew about Zorua. I mean - pokemon scared to death running away from his forest..." Meloetta continued.

Zorua snickered and swallowed.
"Glorious days." he proudly responded, before thinking about the past day again.

Angry faces...

"Zorua."

Insults...

"Zorua!"

The fox turned around.
"Hey, I'm harmless at this size, I can freely think about it without doing anything at all Espurr!" he snapped.
"Still, you should stop thinking about it. Forget that stupid show once and for all!" Espurr responded.

Meloetta looked amused.
"Show?" she asked, taking another sip of her tea.

Zorua looked at her, nodding.
"That's the cause of me wanting revenge... remember the humiliation I told you about?" he recalled.

Meloetta nodded.

--

"Dear." the normal type said, picking up Zorua and hugging him.
"I understand they were angry, but you only wanted to make things right."

"It was my fault..." Espurr muttered dejectedly.
"I was foolish to even suggest that show... if only I had known..."

"Don't blame yourself." Zorua interjected from Meloetta's chest.
"Not you, not me, not the girls, none of us could have predicted that."

Espurr smiles dejectedly at the statement.

"You two make such a cute couple~" Meloetta sang, before getting up.

"Now, why don't I give you a tour of this house~?" she suggested, not really waiting for an answer.

"I'd say it's a good idea, not only because I've always wondered what this house looked like from the inside but also because you're not letting us go before we do explore it." Espurr replied, reading Meloetta's mind.

"That's right~" the green headed girl giggled as she hugged Zorua more tightly and headed for one of the many doors.

She guided her guests through many rooms: library, kitchen, another library, backyard swimming pool (‘I don't really like swimming, but I like singing here.’ she explained to an amazed Zorua) and many guests rooms, before finally stopping in front of one final door.

"My bedroom~"

She opened the door.

Zorua's eyes widened along with Espurr's as they realized that Meloetta's bedroom put Espurr's to shame.

It was humongous. And extremely clean.

There was a huge bed that occupied at least half of the room, bookshelves in there as well, a personal TV and a desk with several music sheets on it.

Espurr went from deadpan to amazed.

"Wow..." both Espurr and Zorua said in amazement while Meloetta giggled.

"You like it?"

"Yes. We both do." Espurr responded upon seeing Zorua's mind.

"... Stop that..." he said, causing her to smirk.

Meloetta smiled... before an idea came to her mind. And it didn't escape Espurr's.

"... Us staying for the night? Are you sure?" she asked in her monotone voice.

Meloetta nodded.

"I'm in." Zorua immediately responded with excitement. Espurr sighed.
"That's not up to you..."

"Hey! I can make my own decisions!"

Espurr shook her head and Meloetta giggled, before the small psychic type gave her response.
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: Visiting Meloetta's house

choices: "To the library, i've got a book i've been reading."
"To my room, I want to show you something."
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
"I'm sorry Meloetta, maybe next time." Espurr smiled at her.

"Aw, come on Espurr, why no-" Zorua started but then his not turned into a big yawn in her arms and Espurr looked down at him. "That's why not Zorua." She stated simply. Zorua was far more tired than he let on, the playing today had made Espurr a bit tired as well, even if the other girls were still full of energy, but Zorua was definitely the most exhausted of all for how much harder he had to try to keep up with them.

Meloetta just nodded. "I understand. All the same you two are welcome to visit anytime~" She said as she waved goodbye and made her way to her house. Zorua himself was just thinking 'how have I not seen her in my forest before?' and Espurr for her part wasn't sure why either, though they figured that would be something for another time.

"Alright Zorua, let's head in." Espurr stated as she walked to her house and psychically opened her door to see the giant empty house before her once more. She quietly walked to her kitchen and gently set Zorua on the counter before grabbing an orange and started to peel it. "A snack?" Zorua stated, edging himself closer to the giantess. She just nodded as she finished peeling and took off a tiny bit of the orange and set it down for him. 'quiet...' Zorua thought but Espurr picked up on it and said. "Sorry, just a little tired myself, though I know you're far worse right now." She said before he grinned. "I've still got plenty of energy in the tank, I could go for hours!" He said before she let herself give him a small smile. "You don't need to try and impress me you know, the effort isn't necessary and I can always see in your mind anyway." He just looked away for a sec before he started to eat his tiny bit of orange. She silently started to eat the rest of it too after she took a seat across from him on a small stool and they enjoyed the peace of each other's company for that moment. 'Sun's going down...' Zorua mentally noted as he looked out the kitchen window to see the twilight filtering in. "Yeah, we were out there for a while." Espurr said, reading his mind. Zorua yawned again as Espurr finished up and got a glass of water.

"Come on, let's go..."
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: Quiet evening

choices: "I'm fine going to sleep..." he drowsily replies
"Let's do something together! It'll be fun!" he exclaims
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
"Let's go to my room," Espurr says while moving towards Zorua's perch on the kitchen counter, while the glass of water psychically floats behind her.

Zorua lets the psychic type pick him up. She then hugs him. He fidgets a bit in her grasp, trying to get comfortable as she starts walking.

Zorua smiles as he leans his head against Espurr's chest. The giantess blushes a bit, but says nothing as she keeps walking, secretly finding it adorable.

Espurr quietly walks towards her bedroom, before opening the door and stepping inside, gently letting Zorua on the huge bed. As soon as she lets go of him, he starts rolling around.
"Man, I missed this bed!" he snickers.

Espurr smirks, sitting beside the dark type, her glass of water hovering onto a nightstand.
"Guess you're happy now that you're going to sleep in here every night..." she remarks.
"Oh wait - you are."

Zorua snickers.
"Of course! Your home is just awesome!" he responds sincerely, thinking that its owner just improved the situation even more... he quickly buries the thought under other ones so Espurr couldn't read it.

Luckily, she doesn't, and smiles, gently starting to caress Zorua, making him moan.

Both pokemon enjoyed the quietness of the moment for a while, before Espurr talked again,
"Listen Zorua," she says, stopping her petting.

"Aww..." Zorua sighs, already missing the comforting warmth on his back.
"What?"

"Well, there is actually something I want to show you," Espurr responds while getting up, walking towards her desk.
"Remember what I did when you came here the first time?"

"Yep. Showing me around, sketching, beating me to that game - I still think it was unfair - sleepi-"

"... Yeah. About the sketches," Espurr interrupts, grabbing a sheet from her desk, staring at it for a few moments.
"I've actually been working on this one... I started it the day you left..." she says, while turning around and starting to walk to the bed again, her sketch held under her arm.

"A sketch? Lemme see it!" Zorua says excitedly while recalling Espurr's amazing drawing skills.

Espurr smiled at his excitement as she sits back beside him on the bed, causing him to bounce a little. Slowly, the small psychic type pulls the sheet from under her arm and holds it in front of Zorua, whose eyes widen.

He was staring at... himself. Himself and Espurr.

Though, he was normal sized, grinning back at Espurr, who was riding on his back while displaying an unusually beaming smile. The both of them were under a starry night sky, he noted.

"Like it?" Espurr asked while looking at the small fox expectantly, blushing vaguely. For the moment, she decided to stay out of his mind, not wanting to spoil his answer.

Zorua steps back from the giant sheet in front of him.
"Espurr... that's..." he tries a couple times to force the words out of himself. In the end, he blushes and smiles up at the psychic type.
"That's beautiful..."

Espurr smiles, her smile almost matching the one she has in the sketch.

She gently set it aside on her nightstand before facing Zorua again.
"Glad you liked it..." she said, gently picking Zorua up.

Without any kind of warning, she pushed Zorua against her lips, kissing his cheek for a brief moment before pulling off, smiling down at him.

Zorua snickers to himself.

Espurr then lays down on the bed, legs flailing in the void while her arms lift in midair as she holds Zorua up in the air.

"So... what do we do now? I mean... "

"Yes... In fact, it is a bit early to go to sleep..." Espurr says, reading his mind.
"See?" Zorua responds.

Espurr just stares at him for a while, her eyes, those endless pits of purple piercing his soul. If by any chance she let go of him, he was sure her eyes would swallow him whole.

"... That's totally weird." she frankly comments upon seeing his thoughts, causing him to blush.
"Anyway, I don't know what we should do now, so I'll let you pick. Any ideas?" she asks.

Zorua thought for a moment.
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: A nice moment before bed

choices: To not look in his mind, she'll trust him for now
To just peak inside his mind...a little
She actually sees Zorua out of the corner of her eye!
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
Zorua thought before a grin came to his face. "Le-"

"Hide and seek seems a bit odd to want to play with a mind reader, don't you think?" She stated simply as he returned a deadpan look to her. "That's why you won't read my mind for this, right?" He said, more as a statement than a question, she simply smirked. "Sure sure, though what makes you think I couldn't find you even without it, I know this house and where you can get to better than even you do."

"Look, it's something we can do together, it'll be fun! Let's try it Espurr!" He said. "Besides, it won't just be me hiding..." At this Espurr found herself laughing. "Do you think you'd have a hard time finding me Zorua? I imagine this whole thing is rather uneven considering the size difference." She giggled a bit more and he flushed. "Hey, maybe you're great at hiding, who knows..." He said before she set him down on the bed. "Okay, okay. I suppose we can give it a shot. You can hide first then..." She said as she got up and picked him up yet again, setting him on the floor where she absolutely towered over him. "I won't read your mind, YOU won't use any illusions, and you'll hide from me until I give up or find you." Psychically the doors on the floor they were on opened up, including her bedroom door effectively giving Zorua access to the upstairs. "Don't go near the stairs Zorua, that's the main thing, and if you're in danger of being underfoot around me holler, I don't care if it upsets the game. That's it...you've got 60 seconds." She said deadpan as he took off, eager to find somewhere to hide. 'Heh, let's see what I can find.' He thought as he made a mad dash for another room.

-

Espurr was starting to realize a few inconveniences afforded to her right now. One, her house was annoyingly big and full of nooks and crannies, even up here. Two, not being able to read his mind irked her due to the sheer fact that she wasn't used to being in the dark. And last, her either friend or boyfriend was tiny enough and smart enough to take full advantage of the first two inconveniences and seeing in his mind or no, she knew that he knew that too. "This is ridiculous..." She muttered as she finished up looking in the room she was currently in and sighed, making her way to the next one. Was this a way to get back at losing the ball game for a full hour and a half? Or him just innocently wanting to play a game? She had no idea and she really WANTED to know. "Maybe a peak..." She thought, she could look in his mind and...no, he wasn't cheating with illusions, right? So why should she cheat with...wait...WAS he not cheating with illusions? "It's possible..." She thought. Zorua was nice and truly genuinely liked her and playing with her, but he still had a conniving side to him, and she was keenly aware of that. But if he wasn't cheating and she looked in his head, how would that make her feel? Hmm..."This is tough..." She muttered, almost whining before deciding...
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: Hide and seek with moral conundrums

choices: "Let's just just go to bed now." Espurr says while yawning
"I'd like to hide now..." Espurr says, eager to continue
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
Ultimately, Espurr decided to stay out of Zorua's mind. If he wasn't cheating and she found out where he was hiding, he wouldn't be so pleased...

So, Espurr gave a sigh as she started walking around the quiet house while searching for her tiny friend, or boyfriend or whatever he was to her - she still was very unsure about the whole thing.

--

As for Zorua, he was feeling quite proud of himself. He managed to find a truly nice hideout, nestled in between the cushions of a rather large couch.

Espurr would never find him there.

It was extremely hard to hide for the small fox. He had to climb up on top of the couch and, being a quadruped pokemon, he couldn't grip the leather properly. So, the tiny fox had to use his mouth to climb. It was particularly hard, mainly because he couldn't breathe. Plus, the leather tasted horrible.

But he eventually got to the top and dug his way in between the soft cushions, silently snickering to himself. How he managed to get up there before Espurr checked the living room, he didn't care.

He snuggled further into the cushions.

Right before Espurr walked into the living room, causing Zorua to choke back any sigh of relief he meant to make.

Espurr started walking around the big room, checking beneath a coffee table and in a bookshelf that belonged to her dad... but there was absolutely no trace of Zorua.

Espurr sighed as she went sitting on the couch, completely unaware of Zorua. For a brief moment, she thought if Zorua could be actually hiding ON the couch... but she discarded the idea... Zorua was too small to climb onto it.

She looked around the room dejectedly, suddenly hating the fact that she was all alone in there.
"Zorua?" she called out, her voice echoing around the house.
"Wherever you are, come out! I give up!"

At this point, she pretty much expected him to appear out of nowhere after an illusion was dispelled... but nothing happened.

"So he wasn't cheating... good." Espurr muttered to herself as she looked around.

Little she did know that she was actually sitting ON Zorua's pillow, making it hard for him to climb out.

"E-Espurr!" he called from behind her as he tried to crawls his way out of the pillow.

Eventually, he finally managed to surface from the leathery trap, collapsing next to a very surprised looking Espurr.

"... You were there the whole time?" the giantess asked. He nodded slowly, in a proud manner.
"Clever, huh?" he self-praised.

Espurr smiled, gently picking him up, setting him on her lap before starting to pet slowly.
"Yes Zorua. Admittedly, that was truly clever..." she quietly admitted as the small dark pokemon sighed from her lap.

Espurr then stopped.
"Aw!" Zorua complained.

"Relax... I think you do deserve a small reward for winning this, you know..." Espurr said while suddenly blushing, gently picking the fox from her lap and lifting him up, holding him in front of her face.

Quietly, Espurr leaned forward, gently pecking his head for a few moments before pulling back. Zorua smiled at her, pushing his head against her furry cheek.

Espurr giggled.
"I agree with you," she said while checking his thoughts.
"You living here with me might actually be fun."

Zorua nodded.
"Y'know Espurr, that was fun!" he exclaimed.
"But what do we do now?"

Espurr looked at the fox for a moment, before responding.
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: A fair victory

choices: himself ready to give up. He gives Espurr the win.
A pair of wide eyes staring back at him from a small nook up top. He found her.
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
"Well, it's my turn to hide now, right?" She said, more eager than she let on. She had underestimated Zorua to an extent and where he could get to and she was wanting to see if she could reclaim victory from him. Zorua just smirked at this. "Right right, just make it somewhere I can at least get to or make it possible for me to find you." Espurr looked at him. "Well I know that of course." She said as she set him down on the ground and got up, heading for the door. "Don't come after me for 60 seconds." She said as he eagerly started counting. "I'm gonna be two for two." He smirked, ready to find her. She was a giant to him, he definitely had the advantage here, right?

-

Zorua had spent the last half hour scouring many of the rooms and had come up empty. Espurr was either thoughtful and kind to open up every single thing so he could look...or she was cruel and calculating by the same measure since there was so MANY OPENINGS to check that she could fit in! Regardless of size! "Man...no wonder she didn't find me, let alone me finding her..." He muttered to himself, trying to keep from being bored looking for her. It didn't help that this much traversal was making him more tired than he already was. That bed was sounding really nice right about now...he left his musings on that behind though and tried to bury it, he couldn't quit now! His thoughts though were interrupted by his own yawn. "Man..." He muttered, if he didn't find her soon he just might throw in the towel. He entered a small closet in one of the rooms and tried to look around for her some more before sighing. He looked up and found...
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: Seeking the cat

choices: In the morning
Something happens overnight
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
Zorua looked up at the darkness of the closet. Being a dark type, he was used to being in dark places, so his vision was pretty good even in darkness...
