That's why when he looked up, he spotted two familiar lilac, endless eyes staring straight back at him from a corner of the closet.

Zorua grinned.

Espurr sighed.
"Okay okay, you found me." she said while bending to pick Zorua up gently, before leaping out of the closet, holding Zorua close to her chest.

Zorua snickered.
"And that makes two... three actually!" he proudly stated, recalling his rematch with her earlier today. Espurr smiles.
"I'm actually impressed," she admitted.
"I didn't think you'd find me... And I honestly thought I would have found you."

Zorua laughed.
"See? Told ya Espurr!" he said cheerfully.

After all, he WAS a prankster. And a prankster must be quite skilled in hiding and quite good at finding victims.

"... Yeah Zorua, you're good at this." Espurr rolls her eyes as she reads his thoughts, noting that he's still praising himself.

Smiling, the psychic type lowers her head over Zorua's as she gently kisses him.

He laughs... before yawning.

"Yeah... can't we-"

"Yes, we can go to sleep now as you're tired after having to find me and I'm pretty tired too - you're good at this kind of things and-"

"And the creep was back." Zorua interrupts. Espurr stares at him, deadpan.
"Stop thinking that or I'll stop kissing you." she remarks, fighting back a smirk as she checks his thoughts... she finds it rather hard to fight off the incoming smirk.

"... Sorry..." Zorua meekly says.

Espurr lets the smirk spread on her face as she gently starts petting Zorua while starting to head for her bedroom.

--

Upon reaching her bedroom, Espurr yawns and heads straight for her bed. Her huge, huge bed.

Before her eyes, the blankets are psychically lifted as she leaps onto the mattress and laying down, setting Zorua down on her chest before releasing her psychic grip on the bedsheets, which fall back in place.

The giantess reaches for the glass of water she left on the nightstand and takes a sip, exhausted.

Then, reading Zorua's thoughts, she nears the glass to him. He sighs as he leans forward, taking a few sips.

Espurr smirks.
"I won't stop reading your thoughts..." she says, placing the glass back on the nightstand and laying her head on a pillow.

"You should before I think something I would regret..." he comments, making Espurr giggle.

"Well... sleep tight." she says, her paws clasping around the dark fox.
"You too..." he responds as she leans forward, pecking his forehead.

Then, both dark type fox and psychic type cat relaxed, enjoying each other's company... well, Zorua enjoyed it a bit more.

Espurr's chest was warm, smooth, and the beats of her heart crafted a sweet lullaby that soothed him. The tiny dark type yawned again, before he finally started to drift off to sleep.

Espurr took notice of that and smiled, her paws gripping Zorua tighter. The fox now lived with her in the big, almost deserted house...

"This is gonna be... interesting..." she mumbled to herself, before she too fell asleep.
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: Double victory before bedtime

choices: He wakes up on his own
He's woken up by Espurr
He's woken up...by Espurr's dad
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
Zorua was vaguely aware of his surroundings in the corners of his mind, but it didn't pull him away from the surreal dream he was having and the pounding headache that was taking over.

"She's not around anymore kid, which means you need to be of some use to me finally, no more of your piddling or whining, brat."

"Zorua, wake up."

A drumbeat pounded on his head as the impact of the claw slapped at him.

"YOU let it get away, what the hell is wrong with you you stupid kid, I can't believe I helped raise an incompetent like you. She went too damn easy on you and look where we are now."

"Zorua, stop it."

Another drumbeat

"If you'd hurry up and evolve then this wouldn't be an issue, you wouldn't be an awkward freaking quadruped anymore and you would be able to fall back on far more that useless parlor tricks, but no, you refuse to grow up, I ought to throw you out for what you've done for me, which is nothing. You just eat what I bring and whine some more."

"Zorua..."

His eyes opened and immediately the headache pounded and he felt himself shivering hard, he was damn cold and his throat felt like it was on fire.

"You're sick..." Espurr said sympathetically, towering over him, he coughed in response and she just pursed her lips at this. "I'm gonna go get some fresh water." She said as she left the room, and him. He wasn't thinking of much but Espurr was back really quick as she gently picked him up and brought him to the levitating glass. Slowly he took a drink and she set him back down. "Dreams..." He muttered before coughing. "So what's the plan today Espurr?" He asked and she just gave him an incredulous look. "The plan is that you aren't leaving this bed Zorua, that's the plan. Your mind is an incoherent jumble and your body is weak right now."

"Yeah, i'm a conflicted revenge seeking prankster and i'm also the size of a doll, both of those check out on that statement." He chuckled before having a coughing fit. She gave him a sympathetic look. "Not what I meant, look, why don't I go see if I have some medicine, just...sit tight." She said as she got up. He leaned back against the pillow she set him next to in response as she went to check if she had any medicine he could use...which was pretty much just liquids. She wasn't gonna even try to talk about the recurring dreams with him right now. Especially since she was sure that was a fever dream. Looking in her cabinets she only found pills, which there was no way he could use. She sighed in frustration as she went to at least get him a bit of fruit to see if that'd help. She ate most of the banana she grabbed quickly before grabbing a tiny bit left to take to him. When she got back she saw that he had tried to get under her cover to warm up a bit. "Oh, sorry Zorua! You've got the shivers, right?" She said sympathetically as she helped lift it up for him to get under. "Heh, first time something like that has slipped by you..." He said and she bit her lip. "Like I said, you're mind is incoherent right now...i'm not in there. Here, I brought you this, potassium." She said as she handed him the bit of banana. "...Espurr, that's a banana, not whatever you just said." And she rolled her eyes. "Just eat...I need to see if I can go buy some medicine you can take." And Zorua sat up at this.

"Espurr, you don't need to go get anything, this sort of thing happened from time to time in my forest, after a few days I bounced back on my own." He said as he coughed again. "Yeah, and I assume it happened often because you didn't take care of yourself. Seriously Zorua, it's not trouble, i'm just gonna head to the village real quick and grab some, okay? It's what friends are for." She smiled at him and he chuckled.

"Friends? Not more?" He chuckled a bit more before going into another coughing fit. "You're delirious, not all there, and we aren't talking about this right now." Espurr said as she went to get up, pulling a chair forward and stacking a few things on it with the glass of water at the top so Zorua could access it, then turning her lights off psychically and going to her door. "Try and get some rest, okay?" She said as she shut the door, leaving him in silence. He leaned back, his head still pounding as he slowly ate at his bit of banana. Soon he had finished it and found himself drifting off again, ready to sleep.
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: Sick

choices: "I've got some chores to do. You just stay there and rest."
Suddenly, there was a knock at the door...
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
"Why? Why can't you simply live up to my expectations?"

Zorua turned around as he looked away.
"I'm not talking to you." he said in a neutral tone.

A dark snicker from behind him.
"You can't ignore me forever."

"Says you."

"... Why do I even bother? You're not even evolved. You will never be able to survive by yourself. All you can do is dumb tricks, with the great power you're given..." yet another snicker.
"I should correct myself though... all you COULD do were dumb tricks. Now, what are you reduced to? A doll in the hands of some cat weirdo..."

Zorua seethed.
"Leave her alone." he growled through gritted teeth.

Another snicker.
"What's the matter? Did I hit a weak spot?" it sounded evil.
"Your little girlfriend... Doesn't she realize just how pathetic you are...?"

Zorua snarled and turned around, leaping forward, ready to bite the dark silhouette of...

"Zorua!"

Zorua's eyes shot open.

He drowsily looked around, spotting Espurr standing in front of the bed with a glass of white liquid.

"E-Espurr...?" he hazily said, coughing a bit.

"As noble as that can be... I don't think you could do much in that state and size... by the way, I'm back." she said with a smirk as she sat on the bed next to the fox, grabbing his chin in her paw and moving the glass closer.

He turned his head away.

"... What's..." he paused to cough.
"... What's that...?"

"It's medicine, Zorua. Drink up." she reassured, again nearing the glass to the tiny fox, who started sipping the white liquid, before assuming a disgusted expression and pulling back once more.

"It's bitter!" he exclaimed.

Espurr smirked.
"What did you expect?" she said, before remembering that Zorua never actually took medicines.

"... Sorry." she adds, returning deadpan while nearing the glass to Zorua. Who obliviously shut his mouth close.

"Drink Zorua. You'll feel better." she said with a smile, gently him on the head in a reassuring manner.

Reluctantly, Zorua decided to drink... mostly to please Espurr than because he really cared.

"... Don't know if that's adorable or dumb." she said with a smile.

Zorua drank until he felt he had enough of the bitter liquid and pulled away, coughing.

He stuck his tongue out in disgust.

Espurr placed the glass on a nightstand next to her bed.
"You'll take the rest later - yes, you've got to." she said, and Zorua assumed a disgusted expression, before sliding further under the bedsheets.

"In the meantime, I'll go make you something warm for your throat..." she continued, getting up from the bed and starting to walk to the door...

Zorua's thoughts made her halt.

He didn't want to be alone.

Espurr smiled and turned around to walk back to the bed, gently laying down next to her tiny guest, her head pushing against his body.

"E-Espurr..." he stuttered, before coughing.

Espurr giggled as she started nuzzling him, unafraid of catching something due Zorua's size.

"You DO need warmth Zorua..." she said in a cheerful tone that Zorua never actually heard from her.

He smiled.
"Guess..." he coughed, feeling a lingering pain in his chest.
"Guess that means you like me back...?"

Espurr smirked.
"If I found you pathetic, we wouldn't be here, don't you think?" she said, her lips touching Zorua's head.
"Make an answer out of this." she responded cheerfully, starting to pet the now blushing fox.

Regardless, he smiled gratefully at her. He wanted to hug her, but she read his thoughts and held him down, although smiling at him.

"So..." he then said.

"No. You're not leaving this bed anytime soon." Espurr interjected, making the dark type huff.

"So? What do we do now?" he asked, horrified by the thought of having to stay still for Arceus knew how much time.

Espurr briefly stared at him, before starting to stroke him as she responded.
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: A day in bed

choices: "Okay then! I'll help you with Zorua!" she said
"I'm sorry... but I should go now... I'm a bit busy." she said
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
Espurr turned her head as a sound got her attention.

The door.

"... Not now..." Zorua heard Espurr mumbling, before she eyed him.
"I'll be back Zorua... whoever it is, I'll try to tell that it's not the moment... you need to rest..." she said, heading out of her immense bedroom and towards the door.

She sighed as she mentally prepared to send away whoever it was out there. She stopped before the front door, focusing on the mysterious pokemon knocking.

She could read its thoughts, she discovered. Good.

She read the pokemon's thoughts... happy faces, an invitation, a nice song...

Espurr smiled.

Meloetta.

Slowly, the psychic type opened the door, finding indeed Meloetta waiting outside. Seeing her, the green headed legendary smiled with glee.

"Meloetta." Espurr greeted. Meloetta grabbed her in a hug.
"Hi Espurr~ I came to visit you~" she sang.

Meloetta broke the hug.
"And where's that little trouble maker Zorua~?", she asked as Espurr gestured for her to come inside, before closing the door.

"He's in bed... he's sick. And he's having bad dreams about himself and his father, who apparently despises him, and Zorua hates him right back..." Espurr responded, deadpan.

Meloetta stepped back, smiling sadly.
"Dear... can I see him?"

Espurr nodded.
"Could you actually watch him for me? I was going to make something warm for his throat..." she said.

"Sure thing~" Meloetta said, following Espurr as she guided her guest to her bedroom.

Meloetta quietly entered the room while Espurr walked in direction of the kitchen.

The legendary looked around, finding herself in Espurr's immense bedroom. And there, laying in bed, she saw Zorua. Her smile widened as she walked up to the bed.

Zorua's eyes fixed on the newcomer. Someone he recognized.
"Me-Meloetta...?" he coughed a bit.

The green headed pokemon smiled in compassion.
"Yep... it's me. How are you doing Zorua?" she asked gently, sitting on the bed beside him.

One of her paws traveled to his head as she gently stroked him.

Zorua smiled.
"I'm fine... Espurr's keeping me in bed though." he told. Meloetta giggled.
"That's because you're not fine. Liar~" she said cheerfully.

She placed a paw on his forehead.
"Hm... fever..." she muttered.

Zorua coughed.
"Where's-"

"Right here."

Espurr appeared on the door and walked inside, holding a steaming cup. Her eyes began to glow, and the cup left her paws to float in front of Zorua.

"Have your tea, Zorua. Drink it while it's warm, it'll be a good remedy for your sore throat." she warned. Zorua coughed again, feeling his chest in pain.

Anything was better than that, he decided as he started sipping the hot liquid, feeling it descend into his empty stomach.

Espurr leaped on the bed, sitting next to Meloetta.
"... So? What brings you here?" she asked, attempting to make casual conversation.

Meloetta smiled.
"I thought it would have been nice to visit you... am I bothering? I wouldn't want to bother poor Zorua." she said, smiling dejectedly.

Espurr shook her head and smiled.
"Nope, you can stay as much as you desire."she offered.

Meloetta smiled again.
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: Visitors for Zorua

choices: He wakes up feeling better
He wakes up still sick
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
"I think I have an idea~" She sang as she leaned in close to Zorua. "Um...what are you doing?" He asked, and she gently smiled before a soft melody seemed to invade his mind. She was singing. "What...are you..." He was getting drowsy, very drowsy but her voice was nice...so nice...he felt every other sense fade but the voice. And soon...even that too...

"This should help him sleep peacefully~" Meloetta said. "No nasty dreams, sleep well Zorua~" She turned to smile at Espurr.

"Meloetta...thank you." Espurr said as she smiled back.

"It's no trouble, now tell me a bit more about yourself~" Meloetta said as she got up, they went to sit away from Zorua, to let him rest in the bed.

-

Zorua was sitting peacefully on a big hill looking out, as he watched a sunset before him. He was alone he realized, but a gentle breeze seemed to sing on the wind as he watched it.

"It really is nice out here" Someone was coming to join him as she sat. It was Espurr...normal sized.

No...he was the normal one, she never changed size.

"Yeah..." He said as he turned his attention back to it.

"So you're not thinking of him...?"

"...I don't want to think about anything right now. You can see that if you want." He said simply and she quieted down, looking at it with him.

-

"So you live by yourself then?" Espurr said as Meloetta sipped tea. "I do, have for a few years now~" Espurr tilted her head. "How old are you?" She asked and Meloetta giggled. "Not much older than all of you~ That's a rude thing to ask you know~" She said playfully as Espurr sipped her tea looking down. "What about you? You seem all alone here, aside from being with Zorua~" Meloetta said.

"Oh um...my dad lives here too...sometimes." Espurr said. "Work, you know?" She finished and Meloetta nodded. "You seem responsible for your age~" And Espurr looked down.

"Not really that responsible..." She muttered before looking up. "So you and Zorua huh~ It seems like..."

"The odd couple? Well we're both odd." Espurr said as Meloetta giggled. "I think it's cute~"

"He's got a lot going on with him, i'll say that...lot going for him too though." She gave a small smile. "He's just gotta realize it himself..."

"He seems pretty full of himself already though~" Meloetta teased and Espurr laughed. "Oh he is! But I meant...more than that. He'll figure it out though."

-

Zorua felt himself stirring from his sleep only to see Espurr and Meloetta's giant faces looking down on him. "Oh...hey..."
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: A peaceful rest

choices: "Fine, let me go move the TV into here."
"You need to sleep Zorua. That's that."
"Talking huh?...I suppose we could get to know Meloetta bit more."
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
The words left his mouth before he had another violent coughing fit and Espurr looked at him worried.

"I'll go get more of the medicine." She said as Meloetta smiled.

"Do you want me to put you to sleep again~" She asked and Zorua shook his head.

"No...just let me lay here I guess...i'll be fine. I've done enough sleeping." He muttered before coughing some more.

"You're really lucky Zorua~" She said and he looked at her confused.

"I don't know about that...i'm stuck here in bed sick while-"

"Espurr takes care of you~" Meloetta said and Zorua looked at her.

"You and her...make a nice couple~" Zorua sighed.

"I mean...yeah, I just wish I could do more for her...she does way too much for me, y'know?" Zorua said and Meloetta reached out with a circular paw to pet his head.

"I have no doubt you'll figure it out Zorua~" Espurr came back into the room with her standard deadpan look as she walked over to the bed. Zorua looked up at his towering girlfriend as she gently held the cup to him, he leaned over, not looking forward to the bitter taste again as he swallowed and made a sour looking face.

"Don't worry about impressing me so much Zorua, focus on getting better." Espurr gently said as he looked away.

"Get out of my head Espurr..." He muttered, trying to avoid his thoughts. She leaned down and pecked him.

"If I wasn't in your head then how would I know what you need right now?" She said and he didn't turn to meet her gaze.

"Asking?" He offered before another coughing fit and she had her standard deadpan look at that.

"You don't want to go back to sleep, but you need to Zorua." She said and he groaned.

"Let me at least watch or read something in bed, i've slept enough..." He said.

"Or hang out with me, talk, I don't know."

"He has slept a lot Espurr~"

"And he needs to sleep more to get better."

"...Just for a little bit?" Zorua pleaded before coughing again.
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: He wakes up still sick

choices: A few hours later
A few days later
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
Espurr sighed. "Alright Zorua...I can see inside your head and I know you want to watch TV. I suppose you've gotten a lot of rest lately and being cooped up in bed isn't your ideal...so for a bit you can watch it." Espurr said.

Zorua got his hopes up as Espurr started to leave the room.

"No, you aren't leaving the bed to watch it. I'm bringing it in here." She said, seeing his thoughts.

Meloetta for her part got up.

"I'll leave you two to it then~ Feel better Zorua~" She said as she gently patted his head with her circle paw.

"Bye Meloetta." Zorua croaked out, as he watched the giantess leave the room.

He sighed before coughing. Her singing really did help him sleep without nightmares, he had to give her that, and besides that she was nice, but he still just wished he could be out of bed and doing stuff with Espurr.

"I'm flattered every time you think that Zorua, but we'll worry about that later." Espurr said as she came back in, deadpan with a giant TV levitating behind her. She rearranged some stuff in the room with her psychic and gently set the TV on a stand in front of the bed.

"Psychic has to be the most convenient thing in the world." Zorua said, before coughing and Espurr smiled as she hooked up the TV.

"It has its uses...you have those neat illusions though." She said and Zorua smiled a bit to himself.

"Oh, and we aren't watching horror." Espurr said, seeing Zorua's thoughts.

"Whaaat?" He sounded disappointed and she smiled.

"You want more nightmares? It ain't happening. Don't worry, i'm not Gardevoir or Celebi, so I won't make you watch romance either."

Zorua leaned back into the giant pillow.

"Not a comedy either? Fine fine. Thriller? Kinda close to horror..." She sighed and relented. "Okay fine. I'll find one. My dad loves his movies on his very few times he can enjoy them." She left the room again.

Zorua sighed. The silent conversations between Espurr and his mind were starting to become more and more second nature...but he was worried about genuine conversations being put on-

"Relax Zorua, i'm doing this now so you can rest your throat. You don't need to be talking as you are." Espurr called back into the room as she went to get a movie. Zorua smiled a bit.

Espurr was far more caring than he ever would've initially thought.

-

Zorua was leaning against the wall that was Espurr's chest as they watched the movie in bed. He had honestly kinda zoned out into it, something she noted but she left it on to at least placate him with his request. And it was nice to lay with him like this. She wasn't too worried about getting sick from him and he enjoyed the contact.

She made sure he had a drink of water whenever the thought entered his head of being thirsty and eventually the credits started rolling and Espurr looked down. "Okay Zorua...you need to go back to sl-" She cut herself off to see that he was asleep. How did she not catch that? Maybe she let herself get into the movie a bit...

She smiled a bit.

"Get better, okay?" She pecked his cheek as she gently set him back on the pillow and covered his lower body.
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: TV with Espurr

choices: "I don't want to talk about it." Espurr said
"Okay... Listen up..." Espurr sighed
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
Just when she was about to give up, she saw something sliding in the shadow out of the corner of her eye. She hastily turned around, noting that Zorua was doing his best to be quiet... a quite pointless effort since she saw him.

Espurr smirked as she started tiptoeing in his direction, ready to take him by surprise...

"Tiptoeing doesn't work when I'm tiny, Espurr. The ground kinda shakes under my feet." Zorua told with a smirk as he immediately started running from the titaness, who stood confused for a moment.

"... I honestly didn't think about that..." she said to no one in particular as she started chasing after the small dark type, her steps making the floor boom beneath Zorua, who kept running in a dark hallway, trying to get away.

He didn't have to wait for long.

As Espurr started to gain ground, she started losing her breath at the same time. She knew she couldn't keep up for long, Zorua was a better runner than she was.

She opened her mouth as she desperately tried to inhale, attempting to catch up... but in the end, the poor psychic type fell to her knees, panting, while Zorua easily reached the end of the hallway and disappeared inside her living room.

--

"Hehe... good luck now Espurr..." Zorua snickered to himself as he ran inside of what looked like to be her living room.

He stopped in the middle of the room as he tried to figure where he could hide.

The couch?

‘Quite predictable.’ his eyes shifted on the next spot.

Under the carpet?

‘Quite lethal.’ he shivered as he thought that he could suffocate or be stepped on by Espurr.

Zorua looked at a staircase. He wondered where that would lead him...

‘Espurr told me to stay away from those...’ he pondered.
‘But... there would really be no harm if I did, would it? Aw, I'm doing it.’ he thought as he dashed for the stairs.

He took a great leap and managed to get on the first, before he started climbing up the stairs.

When he reached a good point, he briefly turned around and looked back down in the living room.

Espurr walked inside.

--

Zorua climbed up the stairs.

Now that he thought about it, Espurr didn't show him what was up there the first time he came into her house.

He got on the top of the staircase and looked forward, finding himself in front of a single door. It looked quite old, he judged from the dust on it.

More curious than eager to find a hiding place, Zorua moved up in front of the door and stood on his hind legs, before nudging the door.

Much to his surprise, it creaked open.

He slowly reached inside, finding himself in a dark, dusty room with many many objects in it.

Old toys, childish sketches, an old crib...

But what got Zorua's attention was a big painting resting on top of a table.

Zorua's mouth hung open as he stared at... a little Espurr.

She had a bow on her head, and was smiling, two Meowstic behind her, giving Zorua lifeless smiles. One was majorly blue, with white paws and feet and green and blue eyes; the other was the exact opposite, with white fur, blue paws and feet and yellow and red eyes.

Two Meowstic... male and female, Zorua noted. But... Espurr only mentioned her dad...

"What did I say about the stairs, Zorua?"

Zorua gave a startled cry as he turned around, noticing Espurr staring down at him.

"E-Espurr..." he stuttered as the giantess pointed behind herself.

"... You left the door open."

--

Espurr gently bent as she picked Zorua up and walked out of the room, closing the door behind herself.

"E-Espurr... I'm sorry..." he said from her paw.

His call went unanswered as she simply kept walking. Espurr climbed down the stairs and walked towards her bedroom.

Silent, deadpan, she moved up to her bed, gently putting Zorua down on top of a pillow, before turning around and leaving the room... not before having closed the door as she did.

"... I don't understand." Zorua mumbled to himself.
"It was only a painting! I mean, it's not like I knew!... But... Guess she did tell me to not go there after all..."

Soon, the fox's sensible ears detected the noise of water running and he assumed that Espurr was showering.

It made sense, he had her running for a while, she must have been sweating...

"Still... I don't get why she's acting like that..." the fox mumbled dejectedly as he looked around the huge room... it looked so empty with only an extremely tiny dark type as its current occupant.

It was like even the room itself was disappointed with him.

He sighed, fully aware that, when Espurr came out of the shower, he'd have to confront her.

A terrible fear overwhelmed his mind... what if Espurr didn't want to be with him anymore after that? What if she threw him out?

How could he survive all alone at that size? He would have to get Celebi... but how could he make it to the village? Even if he did, he would have to slip past the villagers, who hated him...

...

Or, perhaps, he could get Meloetta's help... she lived right next to Espurr...

"Arceus... why do I keep ending in these situations...? Now Espurr's mad, I know it..." he said dejectedly.

"... No, Zorua, I'm not mad."

Zorua looked at the door, seeing it opening to let Espurr walk inside, a towel wrapped around her small body.

"Espurr..."

The giantess sighed as she walked towards the bed and climbed on it and sat next to Zorua.

She lowered herself to give the tiny fox a small peck on the cheek, causing him to blush.
"I... uh... take it you don't want to throw me out...?" he asked.

The psychic giantess sighed.
"No Zorua... don't know how can you even think about it..." she reassured.

Then, Espurr laid on the bed and kept quiet.

An awkward silence fell into the room.

Zorua just sat down next to the psychic giantess, who laid motionless on the bed, thinking to herself. Zorua had discovered about her mom...

She DID tell him to stay away from the stairs... she wasn't sure how to feel... maybe it wasn't such a big deal... but, still, Zorua disobeyed her...

Her train of thought was interrupted as Zorua cleared his throat, breaking the silence. Her mind quickly found his as she instantly discovered what he was about to say.

"Ehm... so..." Espurr interrupted him as she read his thoughts and responded...
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: A secret upstairs

choices: "It's fine, Zorua," Espurr said
"Never, and I mean never, do that again, Zorua." Espurr warned
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
"Listen up," Espurr simply said in a neutral tone as her face turned, her seemingly endless eyes pointed straight at Zorua's soul.

The fox felt like he screwed up his first night at Espurr's, but kept such thought well hidden so that she couldn't read it.

"You know about my mother now, even though I never mentioned her. Why? Why did I always only mention my dad? That's what you're asking yourself," Espurr said, her voice a single, nostalgic note.

Zorua blushed, but regardlessly walked closer to his girlfriend, nudging her with his whole body.

The giantess didn't fight it.

"Yeah... that..."

"Mom left me a while ago, Zorua, she left me with my dad, do you understand? That's why I don't like talking about her... and that's why you're not going to talk about her, am I right?" her expression didn't change, and neither did her tone, but Zorua swore he saw a glare on her face.

"O-Of course." he stuttered pointlessly, since Espurr could read his mind and figure whether he was lying or not.

"Good." the lilac-eyed giantess nodded, her voice softening.

"Espurr, I'm sorry... I had no idea-"

Espurr's mind detected his thoughts, and she interrupted the tiny fox before he could jump to a wrong conclusion.

"Wait wait wait, that's not what you think!" she exclaimed, blushing while mentally scolding herself for being too vague.
"I said ‘my mom left me’, but she's not dead! She simply divorced dad!"

It was Zorua's turn to blush.

"Oh..."

A while where nothing was said or done passed, before Zorua spoke again,

"... Kinda like my mom did," he admitted with an awkward snicker.
"Only my dad was a true son of a-"

"Glad dad isn't." Espurr chimed, feeling some of her nervousness waning.

Zorua cleared his throat.

"So... uhm..."

"Because of his job." Espurr admitted, and Zorua mentally thanked her for not letting him formulate such personal question,
"Dad works all day, all days. He and mom argued, like a lot. Mom always waited for me to go to bed, before they started. She said that dad didn't spend any time with us, but he couldn't do anything about. They started arguing more and more often, even in front of me at some point. And then, one day-" Espurr trailed off and turned her head.

Zorua felt an idiot.

If only he hadn't gone upstairs...

"I guess that's why dad takes some time to see me. I wanted to stay with him Zorua, because mom wanted to leave the village and I had friends here, I had Celebi." Espurr mused.

For some reason, a blush appeared on the fox's face at the mention of Celebi. He missed her already...

He quickly shook the thought off, but Espurr was now talking without stopping, without paying any mind to his thoughts,

"Mom really did it, you know. She moved to another city. She stills writes me a lot, says that if I ever get tired of being alone I can go find her... that she missed me more than anything, and also misses dad after all... she doesn't know that I'm all but alone." Espurr mused.

The giantess went quiet, but blushed slightly at her last sentence. Zorua blushed too.

Time passed with the two laying there, Espurr wrapped up in her towel despite the fact that she was completely dry and Zorua laying against her.

At some point though, Espurr finally removed the towel from her body and unceremoniously threw it aside; before Zorua could process the action, the titaness grabbed him and laid him on top of her belly.

Then, after embracing the dark-type fox, Espurr began getting up.

She moved to the upper side of the bed and psychically pulled the covers, before she slid beneath them, Zorua firmly held in her grip.

Telekinetically, Espurr wrapped herself in the covers again, letting the soft fabric fall all over Zorua, who was surrounded by heat.

"Seriously Espurr," he broke the silence in a sorrowful tone, though he still couldn't understand why she was doing all of that when her mother was still alive.

He didn't even know his mom, and was perfectly fine with it.

Espurr read this, but remained silent, finding her boyfriend's obliviousness adorable.

"Are you sure you're not mad?... I'm really really sorry?"

Espurr sighed as the lights were psychically switched off.
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: Espurr's confession

choices: Pokemon start to come out of their houses... too late...
The girls find Zorua and try to convince him to stop...
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
The sun shined and sunlight seeped inside Celebi's room from the window.

The five girls sleeping in the room eventually started to wake up.

The first one was Celebi, the early bird among the five.

The fairy sat upright, yawning, before opening her bright blue eyes... noting that she was sleeping in the same bed with Espurr and Buneary, while Braixen and Gardevoir kept snoring on the floor.

Celebi hazily looked around for a moment, before remembering.

"Oh, right... the show..." she said, before new details were added to her memories.

Zorua was depressed because that show went terribly wrong..

Instinctively, Celebi's gaze traveled to Espurr, who was supposed to be holding the fox... but Celebi's heart sank as she noticed that Zorua wasn't there anymore.

Her mind started racing. Did her roomie try to escape while she and the others were asleep? He DID feel betrayed after all...

"... Espurr!" Celebi cries mindlessly, causing the psychic type to open her lilac eyes, startled.

She looked around, spotting Celebi awake and worried next to her.

"Celi..." she mumbled as she rubbed her eyes, before her mind detected the fairy's thoughts... she was far too worried to block Espurr off.

Instantly, Espurr stopped running her eyes as she looked down... Zorua was gone for real.

"Arceus above..." she mumbled breathlessly.

"Girls!" Celebi cried, instantly waking Buneary and Braixen up. Gardevoir kept sleeping.

"What?!" the tall fox cried, startled.

"Zorua is gone." Espurr quietly said in her monotone voice, although she sounded worried... Zorua was the only guy who really, REALLY liked her...

Braixen blinked a few times, while Buneary held her mouth in her paws.

Then, the vixen yawned, stretched and proceeded to shake Gardevoir to wake her up.

--

It was still early in the morning, and everyone was still asleep in the village, Zorua noted from his hideout on the top of a hill.

He grinned.

His plan had worked!

Sure, the last night he had lost half of his size in the commotion, but he was able to craft an illusion. The girls believed that he was really reduced to that pathetic size while he was in reality still able to set up traps!

He burrowed underground, sending the illusion of a tiny himself in Buneary's paws and waited, making sure to not think about anything to evade Espurr's mind-reading powers.

When his friends left him alone, he got out of the hole, reached his secret hideout underground.

His precious ‘storeroom’.

And now, all he had to do was wait. Overnight, he set up traps around the houses of those who insulted or threw stuff at him last night, during that damned show... though he was very careful to miss out the houses of his friends.

With half of his size gone, Zorua had to work until dawn... but it was worth it, he guessed.

He was going to be the most infamous prankster the village ever knew!

--

"Oh!" Espurr cried as the group walked down the streets of the village, searching for the tiny fox.

"What?... You picked up on his thoughts?" Braixen asked hopefully.

Espurr nodded, looking shocked. She took a few steps back, looking like she was going to fall at any moment.

"Where is he? And why do you-"

"He tricked us... for the whole time, he wasn't with us... it was an illusion!" Espurr revealed.

"W-Wha..." Celebi stuttered breathlessly at the revelation.

"... We need to hurry - everyone is in danger. His mind is completely out of control, he scattered traps everywhere and covered them with his illusions! Watch your step..." Espurr told, alarmed.

Zorua... her beloved Zorua was back to being a scoundrel... they had to find him, make him reason...

"B-But where is he?" Buneary asked timidly, suddenly dreading Zorua again.

In response, Espurr meekly pointed to a small hill.

Braixen picked her and let her on her back.
"Let's go!" she cried as she and the others started to move, hoping to make it in time...
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: The hoax

choices: ...Zorua eventually comes out
...The girls leave eventually leave
...The girls leave, but one of them remains
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.content:
Celebi, Braixen, Espurr and Gardevoir watch as Buneary's large ears come out of the hole, followed by her body.

Celebi feels a lump in her throat as she takes a good look at the bunny.

She's empty-handed, and she's tearing up.
"I'm... I'm sorry girls. I-I couldn't get him... he used an illusion, he made up many other passages down there... I lost him..." she says, tears starting to roll down her cheeks.

Braixen picks Buneary up and hugs her.
"Don't worry... You tried..." she says, before glaring at the hole.
"I swear, whenever he comes out of that hole, I-" she starts angrily, but Celebi interrupts.

"... You help us comforting our tiny friend because he's in an unstable state of mind after the whole village frankly said that they hate him before throwing stuff at him and sending him away - and also because, if you try something, you'll regret it for the rest of your days Braixen." she says, sounding much like Espurr... only, far from deadpan.

Braixen lets go of Buneary.
"We were trying to help Celi!" she exclaims, moving a step towards the fairy.
"And he scared us off with one of his usual tricks! He dug that hole!... literally!"

Celebi grits her teeth as she glares daggers at Braixen, who takes a step back, starting to feel nervous. Celebi - the sweet, caring, cheerful Celebi - is the most powerful among the group... if not the most powerful pokemon in the whole village!

If she got truly angry-

"You can't blame him for feeling that way Braixen," Espurr chimes in before Celebi could do anything against Braixen.
"I can read his mind - it's in a state of complete disorder. Zorua doesn't even know what he's doing, he only cares about one thing right now: vendetta."

"We are he are his friends, Braixen, the only ones that care about him. It is our duty to help him make order in his mind... right Espurr~?" Gardevoir chimes, looking at Espurr, who blushes.

Braixen doesn't reply.

Then, she feels something tugging on her arm.

Buneary.

"Braixen... Zorua is just disappointed the show didn't go well... and I can understand that. I would have done the same... without the revenge part..." she says.

Braixen looks at her, the pokemon she considers a sister, before lowering her head and sighing.

"You're right - you all are. Zorua isn't thinking straight, and we gotta help him out..." she says dejectedly, before looking at Celebi, who wears a more soft look on her face.

"And... I'm sorry Celebi... I shouldn't have said those things..." she apologizes, holding her arm out.

Celebi sighs as she moves forward, taking Braixen's paw in hers.
"I'm sorry too... It's just... I'm so worried about Zorua..." she replies.

Braixen pulls her in a hug, which Celebi returns.

"Aw~" Gardevoir chimes, before the two pulls off.

Braixen looks at Espurr.
"... You said he won't come out until we leave...?" she asks.

"... Yes. He wants revenge, with or without his size. Even if he can't put up traps, he's still got illusions on his side - be actually has some truly terrifying ideas to get payback..." Espurr responds.

"Well... he won't do anything until we left no? Then, we're staying here. All night long if necessary." Celebi says with determination as she moves up and sits down near the hole.

The other girls emulate her as they too sit down, soon forming a circle around the hole.

Whenever Zorua comes out, he won't have any way to escape... IF Zorua comes out...

Time passes quietly as everyone keeps gazing at the hole, waiting for the small fox to come out.

Braixen nears her muzzle to the hole.
"Zorua?" she says.
"If you can hear me... come on out... Please... We can talk about this together, don't you think?" she says, shocking a the girls.

Not ten minutes ago, she wanted to kill Zorua.

Braixen receives no response.

"Uhm... I deserve it I guess..." she says with a sigh, sitting back down among the others. Celebi smiles bitterly.

Silence falls again, interrupted only by a small nocturnal breeze and the cries of some pokemon of the forest.

At some point...
1223322222133211222211323132112222221122.title: Buneary returns, empty-handed...

choices: "Let's just forget about this, alright?"
"Yeah, I suppose maybe i'll give that a shot."
1223322222133211222211323132112222222.content:
(AUTHOR'S NOTE: Due to contradictory nature of the last chapter, i'm going to treat Zorua's insecurities about his size as that he'd just intimidate them at normal size and that his stay with Celebi won't last forever, and that he may be tempted to revert to his old ways even if he's reformed now)

-

"Gardevoir..." He sighed. "Sooner or later, my stay here will end and when i'm normal again...I dunno, going my separate ways with this village might be for the better. The temptation to do what I do...it may come back. And if I were to become a Zoroark down the line? Forget it, who knows what I would do just to prove a point."

"Zorua you shouldn't think so little of yourself...well...not in a literal sense, but a-"

"Yeah, I get it. I'm just worried...i've got baggage, alright?"

"Clearly. And i'm sure Espurr knows it too...just TALK to her about it, because i'm sure she's going to talk to you about it. Or talk to you about it with everyone in the room." Gardevoir said, with slightly good humor and Zorua knew she was right. "I know! You're staying with Celebi, right? What if you stayed a few nights with Espurr too? If she wanted, that might help you get to know her a bit better and you would be able to sort these thoughts out with her!"

Zorua did blush at this. "And now that it's in your head you have to ask her too." She grinned.

"...You're scary Gardevoir."
1223322222133211222211323132112222222.title: When i'm grown

choices: She lives in a library
She lives a very, very nice house.
She lives a little bit away from the village, in a strange house.
12233222221332112222113231321122222222.content:
After some thought were given about what Gardevoir proposed might be a good idea, Zorua came to a decision. "Alright, I'll try your idea." Zorua says with a meakly smile as he was nervous of the idea still. Gardevoir gives a warm hearted smile as she's glad Zorua is going to take up with her idea. Though something came up to Zorua. "Wait, what about Celebi?" Zorua ask as he knows how protective she has been to Zorua after the incident, as well as clingy since she has been treating him like a snuggle buddy for the last day.

"Oh I'm sure she's willingly to let you go with Espurr." Gardevoir says with confidence.

"I don't know, something tells me she's want to think about this." Zorua say.

About thirty mintues before Espurr, Braxien, and Buneary woke up from their sleep.

"Oh, my tiny roommate has a crush on Espurr." Celebi squels in joy once she heard Zorua asking if he could spend time with Espurr and hugs him to near death.

"I....only said...could I spend time.... at Espurr's...." Zorua struggles to say as he could feel the life coming out of him to the point he's going to evolve into a ghost pokemon if Celebi hugs him any tighter, which she did.

"And it doesn't take a genius to figure out why." She says with a smirk as she looks at Zorua, whose gasping for air right now.

"Zorua and I had a nice talk a few hours ago. I figure we would want to discuss this with you while Espurr is still asleep and unable to read Zorua's thoughts." Gardevoir says with a smile. Though she gasp a little when she realized what she just said. "That's right, how are we going to keep Espurr from reading Zorua's mind during the duration with her?"

Zorua forgot about Espurr's habit and got nervous of the idea that she would figure out long before he could at least mention anything to Espurr. Though he also remembers that Espurr promise to try to stay out of his head. "I don't think i have to worry about that, me and her talk about it."

"In that case," Celebi says as she sets Zorua down. "You just need to think of how to spend your time with your crush." Celebi says with a smirk as she looks at Zorua. The comment made the tiny fox flabbergasted amd his face flare up so much that he couldn't think of something snarky to say. Unfortunately, Celebi left before she could say something.

"I might be regretting my decision a little." Zorua says as he felt very nervous.

"Too late to turn back now." Gardevoir says with a giggle as she is enjoying every moment of this situation.

About a hour later after everyone ate, though for Zorua's case, he had to eat at Celebi's room...

"Well, see you girls later." Braixen says to everyone as Buneary follows the tall fox.

"It was fun spending time with all of you. I hope we can do this again soon." Buneary says, clearly enjoying the sleepover with the girls and Zorua.

"I'm sure we will, let's go". Braixen says with a smile as she and Buneary wave the group bye. The girls and Zorua wave back as the two left.

"Well, I must be heading home now." Espurr says as she packs her stuff. "It was fun sleeping over with all of you." She says with her usual monotone voice. She looks at Zorua and she started to smile. "See you later Zorua. Try to not get snuggle to death by Celebi." She says, deadpan as always. She was about to leave when Celebi stops her.

"Actually Espurr," Celebi says in a cheery voice, as she plucks Zorua and heads to the small psychic pokemon. "Zorua here wants to ask you something in person." Zorua got extremely nervous once all eyes were looking at him.

Espurr was rather curious about what Zorua wants to talk about that she was about to read Zorua's thoughts until she remember her little promise with Zorua last night. "What do you wish to ask?" Espurr askas she leans in closely to Zorua, making him more nervous. The fluster nervous fox struggle to gather his nerves.

"Um....can i.....spend some time....at your place...?" Zorua struggles to blurt out the question that he thought Espurr's gaze would do him in. Speaking of Espurr, the question took a while to set in Espurr's mind that she thought she imagine it.

"...s-sorry, but... can you say that again." Espurr says, clearly now nervous.

"I said, i want to spend some time at your place....of that's ok." Zorua says more clearly, but had to advert his eyes a little to say it. Though, as nervous as the fox was, he was nowhere near as nervous as Espurr.

"Um...um..." Espurr, probably for the first time in her entire life, struggle to find any words to say.

"Espurr?" Celebi and Gardevoir looks at the small psychic and wonder if she is ok.

"GOTTOTHINKABOUTTHISBERIGHTBACK!" Espurr says so quickly that the group didn't had time to understood what she says as she bolts out the door....and the house....and a nearby tree until she was quite the distance away.

"...."

"...."

"....I think that question broke her." Gardevoir says as she and Celebi never seen Espurr act like that before.

A few minutes later.

"S-sorry about that..." Espurr says as she walks back into Celebi's room.

"I take it you came with a decision?" Celebi ask, though nervous of asking as she has no idea if Espurr will bolt off again and break something else in the house. Espurr didn't say anything as she nods her head and extendes her arm out a little towards Zorua. Zorua sees this and jumps into Espurr's paw.

"I...I'll glady let you stay with me for a bit." Espurr says with a nervous smile and a large blush across her face. Gardevoir and Celebi smiles as they are glad for Espurr. Zorua smiles as well, though he duck his head a bit as he blushes.

Waving goodbye to Celebi and Gardevoir, the two small pokemon head their way out. It would be a wee bit before the two makes it to Espurr's home, the two didn't talk as they were extremely nervous. About twenty minutes of awkward silence, they finally reach Espurr's home
12233222221332112222113231321122222222.title: Giving each other a chance

choices: Espurr made it to the section of the library she lives in
Pokemon ask her for help and she has no choice but to help all day.
Espurr finds a spot that she and Zorua can hide in until some pokemon leaves
122332222213321122221132313211222222221.content:
It turns out that Espurr lives in the public library. Zorua has heard that the library is also a home but he never bother to found who lives in it. Well, better late then never, he thought.

"Not exactly the most ideal place to live, but its still a nice place to live." Espurr says without lookimg at Zorua, prompting Zorua to wonder if Espurr is reading his thoughts again. Espurr simple smiles as she can guess that Zorua is giving her a look.

Once inside, the smell of books old and new, and a tad bit of dust, runs to the two pokemon. The two looks around and can see pokemons looking at books and other stuff. Espurr walks in with Zorua held tightly within her arms. The fox looks around and watch as pokemon were minding there own buisness untill one pokemon decides to walk over to the tiny psychic.

"Oh hello Espurr." It was a Nidoqueen. "Do you happen to know where some recipe books for plants and herbs, i can't seem to find it."

"It would be in the horticultural section." Espurr says as she points at the section.

"Oh thank you." Nidoqueen says until she spots Zorua. "Oh what's this? A tiny doll of that prankster?" The elderly pokemon says as she reaches and pinches Zorua's cheeks like he is some kind of doll.

"Um..." Espurr tries to think of something. "Its a doll that Zorua gave me. Isn't it cute?" Espurr says with a smile while trying her hardest to not blush, though not as much as Zorua.

"My, seems like Zorua does like someone in this village." Nidoqueen says with a cheery tone, causing Espurr and Zorua to blush more. "Don't worry, i won't tell any rumors about you and Zorua." Nidoqueen says as she walks off to the section that the book she ask is supposed to be. Once Nidoqueen is out of sight, Espurr's face blushes more.

"She is going to tell..." The psychic says as she continues to walk, not even seeing Zorua's face as he realize what she means. After a few minutes of trying to avoid more pokemons that wants to ask Espurr where books are at...
122332222213321122221132313211222222221.title: From One Bookworm to Another

choices: "Go for it, trust me, Braixen is more open minded than you think"
"Wait a bit on telling her, she may brush you off right now"
122332222213321122221132313211222223.content:
Gardevoir looked absolutely stunned by what she had just heard and then she burst out laughing. "B-Braixen!?" She said in between giggles. Zorua was beat red at this point. "Why are you laughing at me!?" He demanded and she just laughed harder. "I-i'm sorry, I just didn't expect that!" Zorua looked away, feeling absolutely humiliated. Gardevoir eventually settled down, giggling lightly and then eventually not at all. "Zorua...that's adorable, it really is...I just expected it to be someone else." She said, hoping that she didn't make him feel bad for her outburst.

"Well...I admire her, she's spirited, upbeat, kind and fierce, she's exactly what I would want to aspire to right now...and..." He started mumbling at this one. "I think she's cute too." Gardevoir got her cat like grin back. "So...why don't you tell her? Trust me, i'd LOVE to see her reaction." Gardevoir said eagerly before Zorua turned away with a wry smile.

"She hated me not 24 hours ago, hated me a lot more than probably anyone else in this house, and had justified reasons for it too...no way she'd like me like that, even if she tolerates me right now. She also likes to poke fun at me right now too...look at me, even if she did like me, I doubt i'd impress her when she can pin me with a finger." Gardevoir gave a gentler smile.

"You definitely got Braixen's good qualities down, but I don't think you understand how she treats her friends. The poking fun is EXACTLY her way of showing affection." Gardevoir said. "If she weren't interacting with you, or making light jabs i'd be worried that she does still hate you, but I guarantee she's moved past that. Trust me, i've known her for years." Gardevoir said.

"Even then though...I think she'd just laugh if I said I had a crush on her..."

"THAT might be true, either that or you'd be the first to manage to get her to shut up for a few minutes just from sheer shock." Gardevoir chuckled a bit and Zorua couldn't help but smile at the image too.

"I'd say..."
122332222213321122221132313211222223.title: An unexpected revelation

choices: "W-well...I don't know how to respond..." Braixen looked as flushed as he did
Braixen starts laughing
"Look...i'm flattered Zorua, but..." She gently rebuffs him
1223322222133211222211323132112222231.content:
"Go for it, Braixen is...more open minded than you'd think Zorua, and maybe a bit kinder than you think too, if a bit of a goof. Honestly, you and her are pretty similar in a weird way from what I can tell." Gardevoir encouraged and Zorua sighed. "I just don't know...what if she just looks blows me off...I don't want that to happen, and just when she's beginning to like me." Zorua muttered before Gardevoir gently pet his head. "Why don't you sleep on it, okay? Come on, let's go back to bed." She stated before picking him back up and carrying him to the room.

"Alright, back to your BFF..." She teased as she moved Celebi's paws and started to set Zorua back into them. "No wait, you don't need to-" Zorua found himself snatched by Celebi's unconscious paws as she hugged him to her chest, eliciting a giggle from Gardevoir. "Good night~" She whispered as Zorua flushed red and muttered something incomprehensible before yawning. 'Oh well, can't help it...' he thought before he let the admittedly comfortable warmth lull him to sleep.

-

"...up..." Zorua heard something prodding at his sleeping mind before a gentle force pushed at him. He grumbled before the force pushed at him a bit harder. "Sleeping...tired..." He muttered before a round of giggles erupted around him. "Come on Zorua, don't be lazy." He heard the voice much clearer now as he opened his eyes to see his 5 towering friends looking at him. "What? What's up?" He muttered as he got up with a yawn.

"Sleep over is over squirt, we're heading out here in a minute." Braixen grinned. "Oh...right." He said, feeling a little sad that it was coming to an end. "We wanted to say goodbye Zorua, but you were sleeping so hard." Buneary said cheerfully, getting in close to him. "Heh, yeah I uh...like to sleep in." He said while she giggled. "Hey Celebi, can I have a word with him?" Gardevoir asked, as she reached out to be handed the tiny dark pokemon. "Uh...sure." She said handing him off to Gardevoir. Zorua knew what was coming. "It'll just be a sec." She said as she left the room. "What's this all about?" Celebi wondered and Braixen shrugged. Espurr started grinning before laughing. "Oh, that's rich!" She said, having looked in Zorua's mind, confusing the other 3 even more.

-

"So are you gonna confess?" Gardevoir was leaning her face in uncomfortably close to the tiny dark pokemon. "I don't know...it's just so...sudden, and so...awkward, and what if she doesn't-"

"Zorua, trust me, just get it off your chest and I promise, even if she doesn't like you that way she won't stop being your friend, or hate you again, or any of that...it'll be good to say it, okay?" She said, trying to encourage him. He shuffled his feet a bit in her palms before closing his eyes and saying. "Okay fine, i'll do it...but I want to do it with her alone! I don't want the others around." Gardevoir nodded. "Okay."

-

Gardevoir entered the room again, with Zorua beat red to see the girls all trying to interrogate a giggling Espurr who wouldn't say anything. "Um...Braixen...can I talk to you in private...?" Zorua flushed red, looking away before Braixen shrugged, looking away from the giggling loony psychic. "Uh...sure squirt, i'll be back, okay girls..." She said as Espurr started to laugh harder again. "J-just wait for this..." She said, desperately wanting to see Braixen's reaction. The fire type took the tiny dark type in her palms, making his heart skip a beat even more as he shut his eyes. 'This is it...just be brave Zorua....' He thought as she exited the room and Gardevoir glared at Espurr. "Really?" She said as Espurr calmed herself down. "I can't-I can't help it..." She said in between giggles, as she settled back into her deadpan expression.

-

"So what's up?" Braixen said, Zorua was acting...odd she noted, even considering his recent change in demeanor he was acting far more shy than anything from last night. "Listen Braixen...I know that we're just starting to be friends..." She nodded. "And that we haven't always seen eye to eye..." "Not like we do now either." She grinned a bit, trying to lighten his odd demeanor, he just seemed to shrink away from her in his palms. "No seriously Zorua, where are you going with this?" She said gentler. 'Here goes nothing...' he thought. "Look Braixen, what i'm trying to say is...I think I like you!" He shouted, taking her aback. "Well...I mean, I like you too squirt, it's been rough goings in the past I admit but-"

"No Braixen, I mean I think I LIKE you..." He said, gathering courage as she looked at his face seeing the blush he had. 'O-oh...' She thought, taken aback and shocked at this. She was silent for a moment. "W-well..." Zorua said, desperately hoping for a reaction, any reaction.
1223322222133211222211323132112222231.title: To confess to a spitfire

choices: "O-Okay Zorua... Maybe I can give you a chance..."
"I'm sorry squirt... I don't think it would work..."
12233222221332112222113231321122222311.content:
"Z-Zorua..." Braixen quietly mutters, shocked by the revelation.

Just last night, she would have squeezed the life out of him if she got to hold him like she's now... and there he is, openly confessing his feelings towards her.

Braixen can't help but flush red.

"Braixen..." Zorua mumbles, blushing furiously when waiting for any kind of reaction from the bigger fox.

"Zorua... I'm... truly flattered by this... just last night I was the one pokemon that hated you the most... and here you are..." she sheepishly says, one paw leaving Zorua as she gently caresses Zorua with it.

Zorua perks up.

"But... I don't really know what to say now..." she slowly admits.
"I mean... you've caused so many troubles... you did that to Buneary..." she recalls, tempted to start squeezing Zorua as she does.

"Yes... I know... Admittedly, I've been a jerk, okay?... I don't even know why I'm doing this... it's just... it's just... I really like you Braixen." he says, feeling like a weight was lifted from his heart.
"I... you're so strong, confident and cheerful, and at the same time you're so sweet and caring... That's why I really do like you..."

Braixen looks at the tiny fox in her paws, her face completely red, much like Zorua's own face.

"Please... don't laugh at me... I- I can't help it..." he sourly mutters, looking at the white palms beneath him.

Braixen smiles sympathetically.
"Zorua. I wouldn't even think of laughing at you for this... okay, probably I would, but I'm not going to do that!" she says encouragingly.

"Listen, that's extremely cute of you, okay? And, admittedly, you changed a lot. The Zorua I knew back then was sadistic, cruel and heartless. The Zorua I know now is - hehe - adorable." she admits.

Zorua looks up again, a hopeful spark in his blue eyes.

Braixen starts petting him again while adopting a thoughtful expression.
"Although now I'm really, REALLY speechless..." she says.

Zorua just stares in silence at her as she thinks about this new situation. The smaller fox hopes that she would give him at least a chance.

After a couple minutes, Braixen makes up her mind as she looks at Zorua again and speaks...
12233222221332112222113231321122222311.title: Fox-to-fox, face-to-face

choices: "We're heading to my house," Braixen responds
"Didn't you hear before? We're going shopping," Braixen responds
122332222213321122221132313211222223111.content:
"Y'know Zorua, this whole thing is kinda new... I'm not sure..." Braixen says.

Zorua looks down.
"Is it me or just my nature?" he asks, now sure that Braixen is rejecting him... and finding that he can't blame her for doing so.

After all, he WAS a je-

"Lemme finish." Braixen continues. Zorua perks up and looks back up at the fire type giantess, who starts snickering.
"Perhaps I could give you a chance..."

Zorua flushes red while starting to feel extremely dazed, his heart pounding the inner walls of his chest.
"R-Really?" he asks, hopeful.

Braixen nods, before she pulls the smaller fox in a hug.

"We'll see... In the meantime, you're coming with me - what do you think?" she asks while turning around to head back into Celebi's bedroom.

"Of course!" Zorua exclaims as the bigger fox walks into the room, greeted by a weird sight.

Espurr laughing, Gardevoir with sparkling eyes, Celebi looking extremely confused, Buneary staring at the other three with naïve curiosity.

"... Just what's going on in here?" Braixen asks.
"If you could tells me, I'd be grateful." Celebi responds.

Espurr's laughter reduces to a mere giggle.
"We-Well... I really have to go now. Thanks for letting us stay for the night, Celebi." she says, starting to head to the door, stopping to give Braixen and Zorua a smirk.
"And good luck."

Espurr disappears out of the door, leaving the two foxes blushing.

"Just what was she-"

"Well! I gotta go home too now! See you all around~" Gardevoir interrupts Celebi as she too walks towards the door.

She gives Braixen and Zorua an excited gaze while slowly bending to make eye contact with Zorua.
"Let me know everything. EVERYTHING." she says, before walking out.

"Just what was she-" Celebi desperately tries to talk, but Braixen interrupts her,
"I've gotta go too - come on Buneary, I'll bring you home," she hastily says, grabbing the bunny's paw with her free hand.

Buneary smiles.
"Oh and... mind if I take Zorua for a while? I'll bring him back... uh... tomorrow,"

Celebi looks even more confused for a moment.
"... It's his choice to make." she manages to blurt out in confusion.

"... See ya later!" Zorua exclaims from his perch on Braixen's paw.
"Bye Celebi~ thanks for letting us stay!" Buneary chimes.
"Yeah, thanksforeverythingbye!" Braixen hastily says before exiting the bedroom, leaving Celebi standing in confusion.

Soon, she hears the front door closing.

The fairy blinks a few times, before shaking her head.
"He's gonna have to give a LOT of explanations whenever he gets back..." she sighs, before heading for her kitchen to get something to eat...

Then, it hit her.

The blushes upon their faces.

Espurr and Gardevoir's words.

Celebi's eyes widen in shock.
"NO way..."

--

"Braixen, why is Zorua coming with us?" Buneary asks, skipping beside Braixen as they head to the bunny's house.

Braixen blushes, but quickly shakes it off.
"He... uh... he's coming with me... we're going... uh... shopping!" she quickly makes up an excuse... before thinking that it wasn't a bad idea. That would be a good way to bond.

Buneary giggles.

Silence falls among the small group as Braixen and Buneary keep walking, Zorua simply sitting onto Braixen's paw.

Luckily, there was no one on the road to Buneary's house, so Braixen could keep her tiny passenger out.

Eventually, the trio arrives to the bunny's house.
"Sure you don't want to get some breakfast, Braix?" she asks while hopping to the front door.

Braixen shakes her head.
"No Buneary... I... we need to go now. Take care!" Braixen responds while kneeling to hug Buneary, careful to keep Zorua out of the hug.

The two remain locked for a few moments before pulling off.
"See you soon you both~" Buneary chimes while opening the front door.

Then, waving goodbye, she disappears inside.

--

"So? Where are we headed?" Zorua asked from Braixen's chest.

No longer having to hold Buneary's paw, Braixen could keep him restrained in a hug - mainly to keep him out of eyesight from the inhabitants of the village, but also because she found it extremely cute.

The fox was walking on an unknown path... unknown to Zorua anyway.

Braixen giggled upon hearing his question.
122332222213321122221132313211222223111.title: A chance to be together

choices: "Let me introduce you to her, okay? She's cool."
"Just let me hide you real quick, i'll be back."
1223322222133211222211323132112222231111.content:
"We're heading back to my place for now, got something i've been eager to watch." She said with a grin before Zorua gave her a mixed look of confusion and disappointment. "But it's such a nice day, don't you wanna...I dunno, hang out, get some sun, play some games?" He said before she smiled at him.

"You're really the outdoors guy aren't you? Sorry Zorua, but as much as i'd love to do that too, we're kinda out in the open and...I don't think you could keep up with me right now." She finished this last part a bit wistfully, Zorua wanted to push into that, but the way she ended that made him think there was more to that statement than just him or his size. "Yeah but...watching something?" He said incredulously before he noted her getting a more passionate look.

"It isn't just watching SOMETHING, it's the new Hitmon Hitmon Ha movie! I didn't get to catch it on the big screen and it just came out to buy yesterday! I picked it up but we had the sleepover! Come on, don't you want to see it too?" She said, surprising Zorua with her...passion for this. "Uh...I don't know, never seen one." Braixen looked shocked.

"You've never seen any of the Hitmon Hitmon Ha movies?" She said, kinda taken aback before he shrugged. "I've never seen any movie." At this Braixen looked horrified before stopping in her tracks and lifting him up to her face, looking him over.

"Are you for real?" She asked, as if he just said something that offended her, he was starting to be confused. "I mean...just never really had the opportunity come along, is it that big of a deal?" He was seeing a side to Braixen that he didn't expect. She was a movie buff? Odd...at this though her face became fiercely determined.

"I know what we're doing today Zorua, we've got some catching up to do! Don't worry, i'm going to fix this right now!" She said enthusiastically as she hugged him to her chest again and picked up her pace. "Wha-hey!" He said, startled a bit by the sudden movement and increase in speed. 'Oh boy...this is NOT what I had in mind...'

-

Zorua was enraptured by the screen in front of him. It was a relatively medium to maybe smallish television for Braixen, but for him it may as well have been like watching it on the big screen. He was in Braixen's lap as she leaned back in a soft chair she had with a small bowl of popcorn kinda watching Zorua's reaction as well as the movie. She had decided to pop the first movie in the series in to get him somewhat familiar with the main characters, Hitmonchan and his young apprentice Tyrogue. Zorua watched action scene after action scene in total awe of what was before him, as Hitmonchan dodged a barrage of 100 punches from a Machamp who was the top enforcer of the villain to lay him out in a single shot, or him take on 16 Throh's to defend the young vagrant Tyrogue before taking him under his protection. The movie started to ramp up with a final challenge from the evil Mienshao and it was taking place on a stormy night at the top of his criminal headquarters. Zorua had a piece of popcorn in front of him, but he'd barely touched it. He couldn't look away. Braixen for her part was seeing something she hadn't seen in Zorua before. 'Wow, he's really kinda innocent in his own way...' She thought, seeing him react with childlike wonder to this. As the credits rolled Braixen gently picked up Zorua to look at his face.

"...I want to watch the next one." He said after a second before mimicking a punch with his front paw. "That was so cool! Man, the way he took out that Machamp, and how even though Tyrogue was a little punk jerk Hitmonchan still saw the need to help him! That was..." He got quiet before grinning. "I loved it!" Braixen nodded enthusiastically towards him. 'It really resonated with him huh? well okay then.' She grinned before setting him down to get up. "Alright, there's about 2 more before the new one, I don't mind marathoning them to get to it."

The rest of the day played out like this as the two pokemon watched the movies enthusiastically together, Zorua absolutely shocked by how much of a good time he was having. After the last one Braixen even started to gush more as they talked about how great it was to see Hitmonchan finally avenge his fallen brother Hitmonlee, about the emotional evolution of Tyrogue into Hitmontop and landing the final blow WITH Hitmonchan. Neither had realized that it was starting to approach dusk before the front door started opening.

"Braixen? I'm home!" Her mother sounded from a hallway away.

"Oh hey mom! Give me a sec, i'll be right there!" Braixen then grinned at Zorua.
1223322222133211222211323132112222231111.title: Movie day

choices: Braixen brings Zorua back to Celebi anyway
Braixen keeps Zorua for longer
1223322222133211222211323132112222231111.content:
"Now, don't worry, I just have to hide you real quick and then I'll be back okay?" Braixen said while carrying Zorua into a mysterious room that he assumed was her bedroom.

It wasn't quite large, but looked rather comfortable. A nice big bed, a bookshelf in a corner and a desk. Plus, there were a few pictures of Braixen herself here and there.

Zorua noticed the bigger fox moving to the bed, gently placing him on it. She grinned at him.
"Now, you stay there and be good," she said while gently petting the smaller fox in the head.
"I'll be back."

"... Okay." by the time Zorua answered, Braixen had already gone out of the door, closing it behind herself, leaving Zorua alone in the room.

Only then he seemed to notice how big and empty that room looked from his point if view.

He looked around, before sighing and spreading his limbs wide in the soft bed as laid down. Until Braixen was back - preferably with something to eat - he would be bored to death.

"Please be quick." he mumbled to himself.

To keep himself entertained in the meantime, the small dark pokemon decided to just think about the movies he saw for the whole day.

"Totally awesome."

--

"So? How did the sleepover go?" Braixen's mother, Delphox, asked as she put a plate of meat in front of her daughter.

Braixen beamed.
"It was awesome, mom! We even called Buneary over!" she exclaimed as she started eating, making sure to keep Zorua out of the details.

He didn't have a good reputation in the village after all. And, although Delphox did mention a few times that she pitied him, she always added that she didn't approve his methods. Discovering that said fox was shrunken, in love with her daughter and in the other room would be a little too much to take in.

Delphox giggled as she sat in front of the younger fox.

"And I assume today you watched that movie you were talking about since it came out?" she continued.

Braixen nodded, mouth full.
"Avefome." she responded, swallowing.

Her mind momentarily traveled back to Zorua, and she genuinely smiled thinking about the tiny guest in her bedroom. He looked so innocent in front of that TV, it was an adorable sight to think about.

Delphox noticed Braixen smiling and smirked herself.
"Something's up..." she pointed out.

Braixen blushed a bit.
"I actually watched that movie with a friend..." she admits. Only to immediately regret it.

"Was it a male?" Delphox asked, leaning a bit closer as her motherly instinct kicked in.

Braixen quickly pondered her choices.
"... It was Espurr, mom," she said awkwardly.

"And why are you blushing then?"

Braixen took another bite and shrugged.
"Because she's totally weird." she said, sounding believable.

"Her dad is really nice," Delphox pointed.
"I know," Braixen responded, pulling her chair back, her plate empty.

Braixen got up, taking a berry from a nearby bowl.
"I'm going to my room mom," she said, heading to her bedroom, smiling at the thought of Zorua waiting for her in there.

For a moment, she wondered what he was doing all alone in there.

--

"Okay, we agree - the best part was when Tyrogue evolved into Hitmontop," Braixen stated as she sat on the bed beside Zorua, who was hungrily biting on the berry she gave him.

"Of course!" Zorua said, looking up with a grin.
"Hitmonchan told him he wasn't ready yet and when they less expected it, he actually evolved!"

"Why, that final blow together?" Braixen said, excited at the memory.
"So cool!"

Braixen giggled, before yawning as she looked at a nearby clock.
"Eight hours straight of movies and the rest of the day gushing about it..." she snickered.

"I actually owe you one now - I never know movies could be that entertaining!" Zorua chimed as he finished his berry with a satisfied sigh.

Braixen giggled in response.
"You should get used to it. Y'know... the whole 'crush' thing..." she said, blushing.

Zorua smiled as he too blushed. Braixen picked him up, gently lifting the bedsheets. The bigger fox then got up, turning off the lights.
"But for now, let's just go to bed..." she said, sliding under the blanket of her bed, still holding Zorua.

Zorua blushed even more.
"Wait... Are we actually SLEEPING together?!" he asked. Braixen snickered.
"What's wrong about it squirt?" she said, hugging him to her furry chest.

"See ya later, squirt! Sleep well!" she said cheerfully as she closed her eyes.

Zorua sighed, leaning his head against her chest, closing his eyes as well. His mind traveled back to the movie... and then, to this moment.

"Best day ever." he mumbled with a grin as he drifted off to sleep.

--

"Wake up squirt!" a voice chimed, waking Zorua from his slumber.

He looked around drowsily, noticing and indistinct mass of colors in front of him. As his vision started to return, he noticed that it was actually Braixen, in front of the bed, smirking down at him.

"Mornin' ya sleepyhead!" she said cheerfully while scooping him up to give him a hug.

"Mornin'..." he drowsily responded as he gave a yawn, before smiling a bit.

"So? What are we doing today?" he asked.

Braixen giggled.
"... I'm bringing you back to Celebi, squirt, remember?" she said.

Zorua remembered what she was talking about and sighed.
"Aw..." he said.

Braixen smiles sympathetically.
"Yep. That's pretty disappointing... we were getting along so well..." she said, mentally asking herself if she could keep Zorua with her a bit more.

Things were going swimmingly between the two of them.

But, from how Celebi acted, Braixen understood that she was quite overprotective about her 'roomie'... and plus, he still had to avoid her mom...

But, if she got out with him, her mother wouldn't be a problem... and Celebi won't surely be angry if she kept Zorua for a bit more...

... Right?
1223322222133211222211323132112222231111.title: Bonding

choices: "Only if she wants to do that."
"No way Celebi, I don't want to risk it."
1223322222133211222211323132112222231111.content:
"Look, I told her i'd only keep ya for a day, and she can get...passionate about these kinds of things." Braixen said, rubbing the back of her head and Zorua grinned. "Nah, I get it. Still though, we've gotta do this again another time!" He said and Braixen nodded.

"For sure!"

-

The walk back was relatively peaceful, Braixen kept Zorua concealed to her chest as she made her walk, occasionally looking down when no one was around to check on him. Soon enough though they reached their destination, and Braixen knocked on the door, holding the tiny dark pokemon in her other paw. "Seriously though squirt, this was probably the best date i've been on, and that is not something I ever expected to say...definitely the most surprising and interesting one i've had too!" She grinned, surprising Zorua. Did Braixen do this a lot? He suddenly felt...awkward, though he wasn't sure why. The door was answered soon enough by Celebi, who lit up when she saw the two. "Hey Braixen! Zorua! So...how'd it go!?" She asked, giddy as Braixen scratched at her chin a bit with her free paw and shrugged. "Went well enough, i'll be seeing you two around for sure." She said nonchalantly as she handed Zorua back to Celebi and turned around to head off. "Later Celi! Later squirt! I'm looking forward to hanging out again!"

"Well she's in a hurry..." Zorua muttered as he felt himself wrapped into a vice hug by Celebi as she hummed and shut the door. "Oh Zorua~" She said in a sing song voice as she fluttered to her room, prepared to interrogate him. "Could you loosen the hug a bit please...?" Zorua asked, afraid of what was going to happen next. He found himself set on her bed as she got on it, laying on her stomach, head propped up on her paws and gave him a teasing look. "You've got some explaining to do, don't you?" She said as he gulped.

-

Braixen was whistling to herself as she walked back down the path to her house. She was honestly kinda surprised at how well that had went. It was pretty casual, nothing like any of the other disasters she'd gone through, and it was with a guy that genuinely seemed into one of the things she really liked. He was full of energy and an enthusiasm that she shared, and it made the hours kinda melt.

Sure she could overpower the guy with a finger because of how small he was...and also, it was Zorua. Both of which she'd never have found appealing within the last 48 hours in the slightest. But...she had fun. Her thoughts were interrupted though as she felt an invisible tug on her tail, stopping her in her tracks. Her eyes immediately narrowed. "Gardevoir." She stated simply, as the psychic hold on her tail released and the pokemon stepped out of the brush to her side to greet the fire fox.
