"Well hello Braixen, what a coincidence running into you here~" She said, her eyes, full of sparkling energy completely betraying her ulterior motives. "You're not gonna let me go until I tell you what happened, are you?" Said Braixen as Gardevoir enthusiastically nodded. "Fine fine."

-

"I just can't believe it Zorua, there are some things in this world that just shock me. And this is one of them. You and Braixen. Never in a million years would I have-" Celebi was going before Zorua rolled his eyes. "Well it's true, and honestly I did have a blast with her! One of the best days of my life, easily!" He said and Celebi grinned. Zorua was getting wound up. "So what'd you two do together~" Celebi inquired in a teasing manner. "Well you see, an AWESOME new movie had come out that she wanted to watch and-" 'Oh no, I see where this is going...' Celebi thought as her eyes widened. Maybe Zorua and Braixen WERE strangely alike.

-

"-Completed the arc that Tyrogue had been working towards for all 4 movies while Hitmonchan finally found closure himself, it was a perfect conclusion! And so we watched all 4 of them together! It was amazing!" Braixen said enthusiastically as she accentuated her words with arm motions. Gardevoir for her part was trying hard to keep her smile. "That's...great...and he shared your enthusiasm?" Gardevoir said, maintaining a cool voice while Braixen nodded enthusiastically. "He had never seen anything like it, so I suggested it! But he adored it too! We were up for hours talking about it!" Braixen said. 'Oh i'm sure...' Gardevoir thought before saying. "So when's the next date then?" Genuinely happy that it went well for them, at this Braixen scratched at the side of her head and shrugged. "Dunno."

"What do you mean 'dunno!?' It went well right!?" It was Gardevoir's turn to get passionate and Braixen looked taken aback. "Look, i'm not a planner or date keeper, but it'll happen again, okay Gard?" She said as the psychic pokemon huffed. "Well what are you going to do next time? Any ideas?" Braixen looked like she was thinking before shrugging again. "It was a blast what we did, and I have a lot more movies I could show him!" She grinned before Gardevoir gave her a flat look. "Well it isn't like we can do much together when he's not even big or strong enough to open a door!" Braixen said defensively.

"Why don't you go out with him at his regular size then? It isn't like he's incapable of being bigger. It's something to consider." Gardevoir said.

Braixen contemplated this as well before nodding. "Yeah...yeah! That could work! i'll bring it up next time I see them."

-

"And then Tyrogue evolved into Hitmontop in a huge emotional climax! And then-"

"Okay! Okay! I get it! Sheesh, I can definitely see why you and Braixen would hit it off." Celebi said as Zorua nodded. "So when are you gonna hang out with her again?" Celebi asked, curious and Zorua looked down. "I don't know...we didn't really talk about it. She seemed in a hurry to get out of here." And Celebi sighed. "That's just her being her, don't take it as anything more than that. But hey, i'm glad it went well Zorua, when you want to go again, who knows, I could even grow you back for a normal date with her if you want." And Zorua fiercely shook his head, confusing Celebi.

"Why not?"

"I mean...Braixen likes me now, and she's super cool to be around, but if i'm normal...I dunno, it might make her think of how she felt about me before, when I actually did all of those...nasty things to other pokemon, and what happens if I get the urge to do that again? Then she'd go right back to hating me..." Zorua said. "I don't want that! No way!" And Celebi's look softened. "You won't do that and she won't feel that way, you're a lot different than the pokemon I thought you were a week ago...and she knows that too...just give it some thought, okay Zorua?"

Zorua looked down and sighed.
1223322222133211222211323132112222231111.title: The romance between two nerds

choices: "Let's go get something to eat, okay?" Braixen suggested
"Let's just walk around a bit." Braixen suggested
"Do I need to say it? Let's go to the movie theater." Braixen suggested
1223322222133211222211323132112222231111.content:
Zorua shrugged.
"Only if she's okay with that... I mean, you do seem to enjoy me way too much like this... " he mused, causing Celebi to smirk.
"I don't seem to enjoy you, Zorua, I do enjoy you~" she said, patting the fox laying on her stomach with a paw.

The fox sighed while Celebi gently started petting him.
"You'll see." she said with a smile.

--

When finally Gardevoir let her go on her way after what seemed hours of endless interrogating her on the subject ‘dates’, Braixen could make her way home. She had to spend some time alone with her thoughts.

She opened the front door and walked inside. Her mother wasn't home, so she could freely think about what to do. Surely, she was going to have another date with Zorua, but she wanted to see how it would work if he wasn't actually tiny... maybe the two would even enjoy themselves more. She was definitely bringing up Gardevoir's suggestion whenever she saw Celebi and ‘roomie’ again...

Braixen perked up.

Why wait, she thought, she had nothing to do right now. Might as well confront Zorua and Celebi now.

The tall purple fox turned around and exited the way she came in, closing the door behind herself and starting to walk in direction of Celebi's house where Zorua currently resided. She couldn't believe it... all this for the guy she hated the most the other day.

Braixen snickered.

Zorua wasn't bad after all, she truly enjoyed his company yesterday... and she enjoyed the four movies she watched with him for eight hours straight.

Awesome.

Yeah, she thought, this was definitely going to be fun.

--

"Coming!"

The door opened in front of Braixen, a certain fairy appearing.

Celebi flashed a smile.
"Oh, Braix, back so soon?" she asked as she gestured for the vixen to get inside.

Braixen nodded her head, before grinning at her friend.
"Celi, where's Zorua?" she asked, causing the fairy to smirk.

Braixen was practically begging her to tease her.

"What? Can't stay more than half an hour without him already?" Celebi asked jokingly, causing Braixen to blush, the red shade not very unseen on the white fur of her muzzle.
"... Yeah yeah ‘roomie girl’," she snapped back.

Celebi giggled as she guided the vixen to her room.

Immediately, Braixen spotted Zorua on top of the bed, looking exhausted. She gulped - probably Celebi had interrogated him for the whole time before she came... was she going to do the same to her?! Wasn't the near-hour with Gardevoir not enough?

Mercifully, Celebi sat on the bed next to Zorua. Braixen picked him up and sat down where he was.
"So Braix... why back so soon?" the fox asked.

Braixen smiled.
"Well... kinda had something to say..." she admitted.

--

"No way!" Zorua exclaimed, looking at Celebi.
"She was tormenting me with the same suggestion!" the fairy smirked.

Braixen had told them about her encounter with Gardevoir and the chat they had.

"So, you mean to say that you'd actually like it if I was big while we're out on a date?" Zorua asked. Braixen nodded.
"Of course Zorua! Look, no offense, but you can't do anything like this... and i think we'll do just fine with you being normal." she said, Celebi nodding each word that came out of the vixen's mouth.

Zorua looked down at the white palms of his not-actual-friend but not-his-girlfriend-either... yet.

"I dunno Braix... what if I start thinking about pranks again? What if I pull pranks while we're on a date?" he asked, uncertain. Braixen snickered.
"I'll roast you in both cases." she simply said, before standing up.

Celebi giggled.

"Now you two... I really need to go... got something to do..." she lied. This situation was becoming awkward, and she needed to think.

Alone.

What Zorua said was an actual possiblity... would she forgive him if he pulled another of his pranks? It depended on the prank, she guessed...

"See ya Braix... speaking of, when I'm actually seeing ya?" Zorua asked, hopeful.

"Hm..." she had to think about this.

Tomorrow - she was going to hang out with Buneary.

The day after?... That seemed fine.

The fire-type smiled.
"A couple days... I'll come pick you up." she said, before leaning forward to gently peck the small fox, whose cheeks burned hot, eyes widened.

Braixen gently put him back on the bed, snickered, waved Celebi goodbye and left the room and, eventually, the house, leaving an excited fairy and an embarrassed fox behind.

--

He was excited.

Today was the day... another date with Braixen!

"Sheesh Zorua... It's just a date... you've didn't stand still one minute today..." Celebi remarked next to him, looking away from her book.

"Just a date?!" he asked, disbelieved.
"Celi-"

A knock at the door interrupted.

"It's her!"

Celebi sighed. Good thing her mom was at work, Zorua was overexcited. She shut her book and looked at the tiny dark-type, eyes glowing as Zorua grew to his size.

The fox snickered as he went to get the door.

As expected, the purple Braixen was waiting outside, smiling.
"I see you're ready Zorua... she said as he walked out. Celebi caught up with the two foxes.

"See ya later Celi." Zorua chimed while Braixen simply smiled at her friend.

Celebi waved a paw, silently saluting her friends, before closing the door.

Zorua looked at the fire-type.
"So? What's the plan?" he asked, eager.

Braixen smiled.
1223322222133211222211323132112222231111.title: The second date

choices: Zorua wants to retaliate
Zorua takes it in stride
Braixen wants to retaliate!?
1223322222133211222211323132112222231111.content:
“Let’s walk around a bit, see the village, hit up a few places.” Braixen said casually, her hands folded behind her head as Zorua seemed to slow in his tracks and Braixen looked back.

“...In the village? They may not like me walking around...and if I’m seen with you...?” Zorua seemed nervous and Braixen shrugged.

“What? You gonna pull something in the village?”’ She asked and he shook his head. “No way, I don’t want to start anything!” He said and Braixen grinned.

“Then relax, nothing will happen aside from maybe a few nasty looks. As for me, I don’t care if I’m seen with you. Other pokemon will come around to you, or they won’t, but it shouldn’t affect how we go about our day so long as we keep to our business and they keep to theirs.”

Zorua looked at her. She seemed so confident in how she carried herself...he admired that.

-

“Jeez dude, you suck at this.” Braixen grinned as she had won another round against Zorua at the arcade in a fighting game full of colorful fighting pokemon. Zorua growled. “Blaziken is cheating! He has a fire thing that’s impossible to dodge!” He grumbled and she laughed.

“It’s called jumping dude. It’s a projectile, you can jump or block.” She said.

“Do you know how hard it is as a quadruped to try and control this!?”

Braixen rolled her eyes. “I was a Fennekin once upon a time dude, and I still beat everyone here, right Marowak!?” She gestured to the bored looking pokemon running the counter.

“Don’t argue with her man, you won’t win...” He said.

Zorua sighed.

“Fine...let’s try a co-op game then.” He said and Braixen grinned.

“Cool, then let’s grab some food!” She said as they left the game they were at to look for something that wouldn’t make Zorua such a sore loser, but he felt a yank as he was roughly lifted up by the scruff of his neck. “Yowowow!” He said before he found himself looking into the face of Graveler.

“The hell are you doing here punk?” The rough voice assaulted Zorua’s ears before he felt himself being shaken. “H-hey s-stop...” Zorua said as he got dizzy.

Fire lit the dim interior of the arcade and Marowak looked over to see Braixen had her stick out and a flame ready to shoot of at Graveler. “Put my him down Graveler.” She said eerily calm before Graveler eyed her then Zorua, and started laughing.

“That’s rich! Really Braixen!? It’s Zorua...you want to try and take me on...over Zorua!?”

The two glared each other down as Zorua roughly kicked himself out of Graveler’s grasp, wincing as the rock hands scraped at the back of his neck.

“Back off asshole.” Zorua winced as he shook his head before a fist made contact with his face. He growled and Braixen was about to shoot of her fire before they heard a voice.

“ENOUGH! Graveler, get the hell out of my arcade!” Marowak said as Graveler looked at him shocked.

“You’re taking their side!? I know you play favorites but re-”

“Oh shut it, they haven’t attacked you and you harassed them first. Out! Or I can call your dad if you want.” Marowak intoned And Graveler grumbled before leaving. “This ain’t over...wait until everyone hears that you’re hanging out with a punk like Zorua Braixen...” He glared at the two and Braixen glared back.

Once he was gone, Zorua rubbed his jaw. “Ow...” He muttered.

“You okay?” Braixen asked sympathetic and Marowak brought a cup of water and an ice pack.

“You might want these dude...” He said as Zorua took the ice pack and applied it to where he was punched. “Thanks...” Braixen took the water and offered it to Zorua who had a small drink and Braixen finished it off.

“Marowak...I still have that bone I snatched off of you. I’ll bring it by sometime.” Zorua said and the normal type just shrugged.

“He’s a good guy...apathetic to most stuff though...” Braixen explained and Zorua seemed to nod.

But Graveler...that jerk...Zorua growled
1223322222133211222211323132112222231111.title: Arcade encounter

choices: "Nah, i'll stay home for the night. I want to do this again though."
"For sure! Of course I do!"
1223322222133211222211323132112222231111.content:
Zorua's growl died down and he sighed before wincing again from the punch. The ice was helping but he was sure it'd still leave a mark.

"Zorua...you still wanna play some games? Maybe grab a bite to eat?" Braixen said sympathetically.

"Yeah...i'll be fine. Come on, let's eat." Zorua was about to walk off before he realized that holding the ice pack and keeping pace with Braixen would be difficult. The taller fox seemed to realize this too as she looked at him.

"Marowak, you have anything we can use to tie the pack to him?" Braixen called to the apathetic pokemon at the counter, who turned to them.

"Yeah...but he won't like it..." He said.

-

Zorua grumbled as he walked out on the street with the pack tied to him with a pink ribbon that had hearts on it.

"You know, that normally costs tickets, you kinda got a neat prize for free." Braixen said, though she had laughed at him as she tied it to him.

"What i'll do to this string when I don't need it anymore..." He grumbled and Braixen rolled her eyes.

"Come on, let's grab some food then maybe catch a movie, it'll wash the taste of that encounter out of our mouths. What were you thinking for food?" She said, trying to change the subject and he considered it. "Something...I dunno...with meat?" He said and she grinned. "Predicable, but good with me. Let's grab some burgers."

-

Zorua was awkwardly trying to sit in the chair with the burger in front of him and he sighed. "Sometimes I DO wish i'd just evolve..." He groaned and Braixen laughed. "I won't lie, it was a relief when I did." She said and he looked at her.

"Honestly at times it feels like being TINY is more convenient" and she shot him an odd look.

"Really? Huh, well I guess it allows you to be lazy..." She said as she took a bite and he grinned.

"Yeah it does, this burger would also be AMAZINGLY huge, and I wouldn't need to worry about walking and having an ice pack at the same time, if i'd been tiny when I took the punch-"

"You'd be paste." Braixen said and Zorua shivered a bit.

"...Okay, if I were tiny NOW after the punch I could just hold the pack and be carried." He said and she looked at him.

"You wouldn't be able to run around on your own though..." And he sighed.

"Yeah, I love doing that in my forest...still, I wouldn't be wearing this pink string!" He said as he took a bite and she looked around to see eyes on them.

'Eyeing Zorua and myself huh? That's fine...' She thought, though she did feel the judgement of others on her.

-

"Definitely The Madness of Mimikyu." Zorua said as they looked at the movie posters.

"I tried convincing Celebi to go to that with me and the look on her face was priceless. For such a ridiculously powerful pokemon she can't STAND horror." Braixen chuckled.

"Really...heh, i'll keep that in mind." Zorua said with a malicious grin and Braixen looked over.

"Oh, i'd love to see you try to get her to go along with you on this. If anything prepare to be subjected to romance movies." She said.

"Or worse...romantic comedies." She gave a fake shiver and Zorua laughed.

"Come on, let's go and watch this, after that...we should probably call it." Braixen said and Zorua looked at her.

"Aw, what?"

"Well it will be getting late by then. Come on though, let's enjoy it."

-

The Pikachu ran and ran, but it didn't seem to bridge any distance between herself and the Mimikyu that was stalking her.

"I admire you, let me...be you"

The voice assaulted her as she ran into the Mikikyu in front of her. Black tendrils gripped the Pikachu as she felt the breath leave her and she was dragged it felt like, under the Mimikyu as it laughed and laughed at her struggles.

-

It was then that the Pikachu woke up in her bed and sighed. "A dream...a dream..." She said as she got up to do her morning routine...only to note that her form seemed to be different...her feet didn't feel like feet, they felt...she gasped as she saw her image in her dresser mirror in her room to see...Mimikyu, staring back at her.

-

"Aw man, that was great, I GOTTA see it again when it comes out...i'll make Celebi watch it!" He said as they walked back to Celebi's house and she snickered.

"The part where Mimikyu straight up killed that Dedenne was messed up." She said and he nodded.

"Yeah it was, I loved it!" He said as they approached Braixen blushed.

"Hey uh...so I know you're gonna be tiny again...it's kinda required." She said as she looked at him and he looked up.

"Yeah...?" He wondered where she was going with this.

"And like you said, it's a bummer to cut this short again so I was wondering...want to stay the night again? We can run it by Celi, i'm sure she'd be cool with it." She said and Zorua looked ahead to the bookworm's house.
1223322222133211222211323132112222231111.title: Rolling with the punches

choices: "It's fine, you two have fun!" She said enthusiastically
"I wanted to spend time with him tonight, maybe another time." She said
"Why don't you stay over tonight Braixen?" Celebi offered
1223322222133211222211323132112222231111.content:
Zorua grinned. "Hell yeah, for sure! Of course I do!" He said enthusiastically. Braixen smiled at this as they continued to Celebi's home. When they got to the door and knocked though there was a surprise as Celebi's mother answered. Braixen and Zorua were immediately nervous as Celebi's mother just looked confused. "Braixen?...Zorua?" She said, the tone of her voice showing fondness for the former and...confusion and disapproval for the second pokemon.

"H-hey miss C. We were wondering if Celebi is available?" Braixen said, rubbing a paw on the back of her neck nervously.

"Well she's here, yeah...Zorua, if you don't mind me asking...why are you here?" She took a look at the dark type and noted his eye...with a pack tied to it with a pink ribbon.

"What happened?" She asked, more concerned now as she got a good look at him.

"It's a sorry story ma'am...Graveler did it." Zorua said and the older Celebi eyed him suspiciously.

"You two got into a fight?" She said in a lecturing tone and Zorua winced at the accusation, but to the Celebi's surprise Braixen interjected. "No, Graveler started the fight, Zorua didn't even really attack him beyond a kick to get himself free from Graveler's grasp."

"...Hmm, I see." The older Celebi looked at the two teens and sighed.

"Come in, i'll get Celebi, would you two like some tea? I still want to talk about a few things." And with that the two were invited in.

They were led to the kitchen table as they sat, Zorua having an awkward time as a quadruped, much like earlier as he sighed and Braixen looked over at him while the older Celebi went to get her daughter.

"We need to keep quiet about your living situation..." Braixen whispered and Zorua nodded.

"Yeah...I know." He muttered. He didn't expect to be meeting with Celebi's mom so quick, and she seemed to be suspicious of him...a fair reaction considering his history.

Soon both Celebi's entered, the younger teen looking slightly nervous as they all sat at the table, the older one preparing tea in the background.

Celebi saw Zorua's eye as she looked at him and gasped, though tried to keep her mother from looking at her.

"Oh, Braixen...and Zorua, what a surprise." She said, trying to play it off and both pokemon greeted her.

"Hey Celi."

"Hey." Zorua decided to try to keep it impersonal for now.

"So Zorua, I know what happened to you with the fight with Graveler, but if you don't mind me asking, why are you two here? I'm surprised to see you with him especially Braixen." Celebi's mother asked genuinely curious.

"Well...truth is Ms C., Zorua and I kinda made peace. He's really settled down lately." Braixen said and Zorua nodded.

"I've come to my own realization that my pranks were wrong, i'm trying to make peace." Zorua said and he got a genuine smile from the older Celebi.

"Well that's wonderful to hear! I'm happy for you Zorua!" She said and he nodded, blushing.

Braixen had an idea at this and voiced it.

"Actually, I brought Zorua here to get him healed by Celebi, if possible." She said and Celebi's mother seemed to have a realization, then nodded.

"Oh, that makes sense. Well alright then."

The older Celebi returned to the table with 4 cups and set them down.

"Go ahead and have a nice drink, Celebi, do you want to heal the young man?" And Celebi nodded, trying not to make it too quick.

She reached out to Zorua with her paw and a gentle glow surrounded him for a second before both pokemon sighed and Braixen helped Zorua get the ice pack off. Celebi was breathing a bit heavy, though it was a pretty minor wound to fix at least.

"Glad to be rid of that..." Zorua muttered as the 4 pokemon had their tea.

-

"That was way too stressful." Zorua complained to the two girls as they stood outside Celebi's house.

"I didn't expect her to get home so early...sorry." Celebi said before going to the subject she wanted to talk about.

"So you and Graveler..." She said in a threatening tone and Braixen shook her head.

"He tried to pick a fight with Zorua, but it was ended quick, hopefully he backs off." She said and Celebi nodded.

"If he doesn't...we can take care of it." Celebi said in a foreboding tone and Braixen folded her arms.

"Celi, relax, it won't happen again." She said and Celebi nodded.

"Okay."

"...But we did want to ask you something." Braixen said, but she noted that Celebi's eyes were glowing and Zorua felt a familiar sensation as the world around him grew and grew. Soon enough the two girls were towering titans to his tiny form, and he was lifted into a hug by Celebi.

"H-hey!" Zorua complained and Celebi giggled, Braixen cracked a smile at this too.

"You're just too adorable like this!"

"Anyways Celi...what we wanted to ask is, mind if Zorua stays with me tonight?" Braixen said and Celebi pulled Zorua away from the hug to look at both of the pokemon in front of her.

"Really?" Celebi asked, seeming a little dejected but Zorua nodded.

"Just for tonight Celi! We had a great time today!" Zorua said enthusiastically but Braixen picked up on Celebi's hesitation.

"Hey, if you want him to stay in tonight, that's fine too." Braixen said and Zorua looked back at the fox giantess.

"Aw what..." He said, but Celebi voiced her answer.
1223322222133211222211323132112222231111.title: A bluff and evening decisions

choices: "I don't want to talk about it." He said glumly
"Yeah, yeah, i'll be fine. What's on the agenda today?" He said, brushing it off
Braixen interrupts, she came back?
122332222213321122221132313211222223112.content:
"Look squirt...i'm sorry, but I don't think it would work." She offered him a small smile, hoping he wouldn't take it the wrong way. "Is it my size, is it me, is it..." Zorua was muttering, looking down before Braixen gently raised his chin with a finger to look her in the eye. She was giving him a small smile. "Zorua...it's both of us. I like you, you're a friend but...considering our history, where we were not just a day ago...it's too weird. I'm sorry." She said before she got ready to head back into the room. "I don't want you to feel bad about this though, I truly am flattered by the offer." He felt like he had been crushed, but did his best to not let it show, he gave her a grin as she moved. "It's all good Braixen, I can't blame you for feeling that way." She gave him a small smile back before re-entering the room to find Gardevoir with sparkles in her eyes...holding a hand over Espurr's mouth, just showing her deadpan eyes. Braixen smiled a bit at this before chuckling. "Relax Gard, the air is cleared." She said as she handed Zorua back to Celebi and awkwardly scratched the back of her head. "So...i'll be heading out with Buneary, alright you two? Take care Zorua...and don't let this get you down, alright?" She said, trying to encourage him before weakly waving and leaving the room with Buneary. "Um...bye girls! Bye Zorua!" She said following Braixen. "Bye girls...?" Celebi said, confused by the whole thing. Before looking at Zorua in her hands, he looked a bit down, but was trying to smile.

She looked over to see Gardevoir who looked positively gloomy and Espurr looking deadpan. "Well you can't really blame her, can you Zorua?" Espurr said and he shook his head. "I don't blame her...not at all. Just a bit down about it, y'know?" He said glumly and Celebi was starting to piece things together. "Do you have a crush on Braixen?" Celebi asked, genuinely surprised by this. Zorua slowly nodded and she nodded too. "She shot you down, didn't she?" Zorua nodded again. Gardevoir straightened herself up and started marching for the door. "I'm gonna talk to her!" She said before Zorua shouted. "Hey hold up! It's her choice right, she hated me yesterday, and I told her I have a crush on her today! It's not something that you can change overnight...literally in this case." He said and Gardevoir stopped. "But...but..."

"You always do this Gard, honestly things are probably gonna be awkward for a bit so don't make it worse." Espurr said, deadpan before she started for the door. "Either way, i'm gonna head out too, have a good day Celebi, thanks for having us over. Don't strangle Zorua in your or his sleep." She smiled. "And don't be down in the dumps for too long Zorua." She said before taking off.

Gardevoir looked back their way and said. "If you want me to help Zorua, we can still try!" She nodded before waving. "I'll see you around Celebi, Zorua!" Leaving the two around in the room. "So..." Celebi started, ready to interrogate him.

Celebi knows she has to find you, but first she has to deal with her mom, so she calls out to her.

"Hey mom, I have to go to the restroom, and it feels like it will be awhile, so can you bring the food to my room, and I'll eat it when I'm done.

The first thing she did is check the desk her mom would place the food on, and the path to the door, not finding you, before flying over to the bed and checking there, while her mom came in and placed the food down on the desk and left.

Celebi flew around checking everywhere unable to find you, until she only had ten minutes before her mom came back, when she stopped directly above her food and stomped down in midair with the foot you were still unconscious on, before growing back to normal size.

1223322222133322.content:
Zorua, was still unconscious for a bit before he recovered a bit. He opens his eyes, trying to remember what happened to before looking around to find himself in a unrecognizable place. All around him was a rough, blurry terrain that went on for countless miles.

"Let's see, I remember, Celebi shrunk me, and was trying to find me before something cause her to toss me up and land....where exactly?" Zorua talks to himself, trying to see where exactly he is at. He sees nothing that is recognizable, all he see beside the strange land was a vast horizon of green that goes to the sky and beyond. However, Zorua does notice something else about the area, it smells delicous.

Suddenly, a roaring thunder could be heard above as something absolutely massive was falling. Zorua looks up and sees something metallic falling down and crashing into the ground. The mere event cause the whole area to shake none stop, but that wasn't the worse. Zorua got up and look at the metallic landscape before it started to rumble and rise up, along with a big chunck of the alien land as well. Little does Zorua knows, he's on Celebi's dinner, and he's about to be part of it if he doesn't do anything.

Celebi was thinking to herself, wondering where could Zorua be. She takes a bit of her meal before plunging her fork into the meal and wonders if Zorua landed in her floor or on her bed. If so, it will take forever to find him. She continues to think as she devour her meal, unaware of the danger she is putting on Zorua.


Zorua ran as fast as he could, where exaclty, anywhere that is safe from the metallic object that is falling and threatening to crush him. Zorua watch in fear as one by one, large amount of landscape went high to the sky and never return. Soon, there was only one piece of the meal left, and Zorua was on. To make matters worse, the metallic object came crushing down again and was heading to Zorua'd location. Zorua cover his eyes he watch the object ready to crush him. The object made contact, and was about to crush Zorua when it stops at a certain spot. Zorua looks around and saw that he somehow is still alive, but that just make the situation worse as he felt the land he was on rising with him on. The fox felt sick as the g-force of the land rising felt too much. It only got worse as Zorua saw something headong towards him, Celebi's mouth.

In a slow motion, a strong warm air hits the fox as Celebi opens her mouth and prepare to munch on the food. The bit that Zorua is on is slowly entering the fairy's mouth. Zorua watch in fear as everything grew increadibly dark until....

Especially since legendaries are incapable of puking, and are too effeciant to get out without being absorbed into her bloodstream,so he could not get out that way either.

12233222221333222.content:
Celebi was about to place her food in her mouth, unaware of the utterly terrified Zorua who was about to have a heart attack that was on the bit she was about to eat.

Zorua watched as the green planet in front of him became pink as the goddess opened her mouth, a hot wave of air that smelt vaguely of mint blowing past the fox.

He closed his eyes as he saw the muscles of Celebi's mouth and her teeth approaching him.

That way, he didn't notice when Celebi closed her mouth, placing a paw to her chin, lazily observing the food on her fork.

She felt a tingle of guilt in the bottom of her stomach, along with the annoying sensation of worry.

She decided that she wasn't hungry anymore. She wasn't hungry to begin with, but ate to avoid disappointing her mom.

She had so many thoughts in her head right now.

"Where are you Zorua? I didn't mean to take it this far..." she mused out loud as she carelessly let her fork fall down on the plate.

The words fell on the ears of the nanoscopic fox who, surprised that he was still alive, reluctantly dared to open his eyes.

The pink universe had become green again while he had his eyes closed.

He looked up, and had to crane his neck for several seconds before he could catch a glimpse of Celebi's face. She had her eyes closed, he noted.

"Damn it, he's so small I can't even sense him..." she said.

The worst thing of this situation was that she couldn't be sure whether she ate him along with her food or not.

Sure, there was that one last bit she didn't eat, but how many probabilities there were that he was on it? How many probabilities there were that he was even in her food?

... How many probabilities there were that he was melting away in her stomach right now?

Celebi sighed.

What to do? Time-travel to prevent all of this happening? Keep searching for Zorua until he came out? Move on?

Another sigh.

She knew she wasn't going to move on after this...

"Please Zorua... wherever you are, just make me understand that you're alive... somehow..." she told in a resigned tone.

Yeah, right. And how was he supposed to do that?

Zorua, who had heard Celebi, was wondering the same thing.

How to signal his presence to Celebi before she changed her mind and ate the one bit of food he was on?

He couldn't simply jump up and down shouting ‘Celebi!’, she would never hear/see him.

Maybe he could try to rely on some of his moves? What could he do?

Night Daze or Shadow Ball didn't seem like they could do anything to Celebi.

There was his ability, of course, but...

Zorua's eyes shot open.

There was his ability, and it was perfect!

Celebi stared at her plate longingly, when someone knocked at the door.

"Honey? Are you done eating?" her mom asked.

She sighed and looked up, uncertain on how to reply.

Was Zorua really in her food? Or was he not?

Her gaze lingered in the last bit as she tried to spot the black fox.

"Honey?"

Celebi didn't see anything.

Another sigh.

She opened her mouth, but her paws immediately rushed to it as she noted a normal-sized Zorua suddenly appearing in the middle of her plate.

"Celebi...? Can I come in?"

The green time-traveler recovered from the surprise way quicker than she had anticipated.

"No mom, I'm still eating!" she replied in a high-pitched tone.

She swore she could see her mom shrugging on the other side of the door after a moment of her being utterly perplexed.

"Okay honey, but be quick. I have to do the dishes."

Celebi heard her mom walking away, and she looked back at Zorua.

"... Zorua?" she whispered, dumbstruck.
"Did you just learn Growth?"

The fox in front of her opened his mouth, but no sound came out of it; he began jumping on place without the desk being shook under his weight.

Celebi's eyes widened, and her mind couldn't help but praise the fox.

An illusion. Zorua was signaling her where he actually was, and she couldn't hear what he was saying because he was too tiny!

Instantly, she looked down, glad she hadn't eaten that last bit of food, given that Zorua was on it.

"Hold it!" she cried as she lowered her head into the plate.

She scanned the area around the illusionary fox's paws.

Her heart pounded her chest from within.

There he was, a nanoscopic speck on her food!

A shaky light appeared in Celebi's eyes, causing the illusionary Zorua to open his mouth in a sigh.

The illusion faded while the tiniest pokemon that ever existed began growing, and grew until he reached the size of an extremely tiny doll.

Basically, he was just a bit tinier than a Joltik.

Before he could speak though, Celebi removed her plate from under him and got up, before she left her room;

She came back several moments later and shut the door behind her before locking it.

Only then she made her way back to her desk and sat down to observe the tiny fox.

"I was... you were... I really just almost are you, didn't I?" she asked.

"Bingo."

Celebi leaned back, signing in relief while placing a hand on her forehead.

"Oh my God."

"Yeah." Zorua stated with a glare.

Now that he was safe, he could be angry.

"Now that I'm alive with minimal thanks to you, could you grow me back and let me go before something like that happens again?"

Celebi looked at him, before she...
12233222221333222.title: Illusive Rescue

choices: "I think you need to be a bit smaller again."
"We're going to play a game."
"I'll deal with it tomorrow, for now we're going to bed."
122332222213332222.content:
Celebi got a mischievous grin on her face as she looked at the tiny angry pokemon. "Oh no Zorua, this has just begun~" She said in a teasing manner and Zorua looked shocked by her words as a paw wrapped around him, lifting him up and keeping him immobilized as her face took up his entire vision.

"Celebi, this isn't funny! I seriously almost died!" He said, half angry half frantic at her actions and she tilted her paw a little, making Zorua dizzy.

"Hmm...so small, eh Zorua?" She said and he was starting to actually get back to freaking out now that he realized Celebi was serious about toying with him more.

"P-please!" He cried out, now fear entirely taking his voice and Celebi evened out her paw, letting him stand on it as he looked fearfully into her eyes.

"If you're worried that i'll kill you, then relax, I won't okay? I admit I was a little careless with what happened a little bit ago. But that doesn't mean that you're off the hook, this is still a punishment Zorua, for all your pranks."

"I NEVER TRIED TO FREAKING KILL ANYONE!" Celebi just sighed at this, her breath washing over the still tiny pokemon before her expression took on a more serious one.

"I wasn't trying to kill you, i'm trying to teach you a lesson, one you won't ever forget." Celebi intoned and Zorua gulped at this before he felt the platform he was on lowering and he was set on her desk.

With a great tremor she stood up and Zorua looked at the titanic pokemon who picked up her plate and started to walk away.

"I'll bring you back something to eat at least, you deserve that much." Celebi said before she rounded the corner out of her room, leaving a frustrated and fearful Zorua on the desk.

"You freaking green bookworm...oh, when I get back to normal the HELL i'll raise on this village." Zorua seethed but he realized he couldn't do anything right now, not until he got his size back, and to do that...he had to wait until Celebi was done with him. With a grunt he laid down on the wooden desk, sulking, waiting for the giant to return.

He was idly scratching at the wood when she came back with a small scrap of meat and a glass of water.

Zorua felt the tremors as she approached and set the meat in front of the dark type and he just glared at her.

He didn't move as she sipped on the water and she started to reach for the meat.

"If you don't want it Zorua..." She said teasingly and he got up and ran for it, taking a large bite. She took her free paw that would've grabbed the meat and put it under her chin, giving Zorua a smug look as he ate, his pride damaged.

When he was done he looked up at the green giantess with a scowl.

"You're seriously messed up."

"You're welcome by the way. I'm gonna have to teach you some manners I suppose..." Celebi said with fake exasperation and Zorua simply glowered.

With a yawn Celebi reached for the tiny dark type and lifted him between two fingers.

"H-hey, what now!?" He cried out, but all she did was lower him to the water glass for a drink.

He sighed at this and took a few drinks before he was pulled away from it.

"Well...now what are you going to do with me?" He asked in a snide voice, at this Celebi roughly set him on the table, a bit frustrated by the smaller pokemon.

"You know, you've got a real attitude problem Zorua, i'm hoping to address it...teach you humility." She intoned in a serious voice, making Zorua gulp as she loomed over him, ready to decide his fate.

Other legendaries

1223322231.title: Lake Trio

choices: "Don't you get it Zorua? It's the ultimate prank!" Mesprit chimed
"Ehm... kinda had to tell something..." Mesprit said, embarassed
12233222312.content:
"Argh!"

A scream echoed around the forest, followed by a loud snicker.

"Get back here!

He ignored the angry screams behind him as he kept running...

And, finally, Zorua leaped behind a bush. The angry Infernape chased him, teeth gritted as he snarled in direction of the dark type, who pranked him by luring him into his forest, only to for the poor monkey to find the illusion of Giratina waiting to scare him off.

It didn't take long for Infernape to realize that it was Zorua.

And finally, he had the fox cornered; he reached the bush Zorua was hiding in, a large tree behind it. There was no way the dark type could escape.

"You're dead..." the big monkey muttered as he opened the bush with his paws... Infernape wore a confused look.

Zorua was gone.

--

The snickering fox materialized in a hidden clearing of his forest, in front of a giggling pokemon.

His pranking partner.

Mesprit.

"Did it work?" she asked, her golden eyes sparkling mischievously. He laughed.
"Yes!" Zorua chimed.
"And you kept telling that I was losing my touch~"

Mesprit giggled.
"Guess I was wrong..." she said as she floated around the fox.

It was ironic.

No one could believe that Mesprit, Zorua's pranking partner... was in reality one of his victims.

--

Mesprit happily strolled through the forest, humming to herself. She had the perfect day, and she was just heading back to the village, wanting to get home to rest.

It was getting dark, she noted.

So, she decided to speed up... she didn't want to be in the forest Zorua lived in... he was an infamous scoundrel, and she wanted to have nothing to do with him.

She floated past a few trees...

A noise got her attention.
"Hm?"

She looked around carefully, examining her surroundings while psychically checking the area to check if she was alone... she wasn't.

The pixie started to panic as she turned around, trying to get out of the forest as fast as she could.

She rounded a corner... and there it was. The body of a Turtwig, laying flat on the ground. It must have been another one of Zorua's victims.

"H-Hey... are you alright?" Mesprit with concern as she got closer to take a look at the green pokemon, who was looking quite weak... Her heart stopped as the Turtwig suddenly got up, opening a pair of black eyes and emitting a loud roar.

Mesprit screamed as she flew away. She kept flying aimlessly, when a tree suddenly appeared in front of her... and she flew right through it.

The pixie was sadly unable to stop as she hit a real tree, before falling flat on the ground, feeling extremely dizzy. Her vision blurry, she looked up... and saw a snickering Zorua walking up to her.

"Heh, should've seen your face!" he snickered loudly.

Mesprit blinked, stunned.
"W-Why...?" she meekly asked as the dark type lowered himself to face her.

"Why?" he parroted back, before laughing in her face.
"Because it's fun, sweetheart."

With that, he started walking away, leaving a dazed Mesprit on the ground...

--

‘Because it's fun.’

Those words obsessed Mesprit for days after her encounter with Zorua.

She constantly heard his voice in her head telling those simple words, they haunted her...

Until she tried too.

Her first prank was a common one - a pit trap. She lured a pokemon into falling in it and... she surprisingly enjoyed it.

She laughed, laughed without stopping for a while.

The pranking princess of the village was born... although no one knew her true identity. All the villagers believed that it was Zorua. That worked to Mesprit's advantage.

No one knew about her new nature... no one but the same Zorua.

The dark type noted Mesprit's actions, he observed her for some time.

Then, one day, Mesprit found a letter out of her door. A simple sentence was written in it,

Meet me in the forest.


And so she did. She went into the forest, following a track of illusions that lead her in a hidden clearing... Zorua was waiting for her.

‘Be my partner! We'll be the most infamous pokemon of all time!’ he told her.

And she gladly took his offer.

--

"Seriously, you should have seen his face!" Zorua snickered as Mesprit rolled her eyes.

"They still don't know who I am Zorua... and they mustn't." she said with a smirk.
"And I don't think you mind the fact that I'm the one pulling you out of trouble when pokemon chase you down." she snickered.

"You're right - I don't." he said, raising a paw.

Mesprit giggled as she high-fived her friend, before he walked past her... Mesprit got a devious smirk, her eyes glowed.

"Next time, I'll - uh?" Zorua asked as he turned around, taking notice of something odd... the world around him was growing!... No... he was shrinking!

"Mesprit!" he cried in panic as he looked at his friend... noticing her with glowing eyes.

Finally, Zorua shrunk down to the size of a small doll, the blades of grass towering above him. Those, and a certain pink headed pokemon who flew closer as she shrunk.

Startled, Zorua looked at Mesprit - she was huge!

"... Cute." she commented as she picked him up with psychic.

Zorua floated onto her gigantic paws.

"Y-You did this to me?!" he cried in fear. Mesprit grinned down at him as she nodded.

"B-But... why?!"

Zorua watched Mesprit giggling as she gave her response...
12233222312.title: Pranking prince and pranking princess

choices: "I think we can continue this back to my house,"
"Let's have some fun,"
"I'm curious: I want to see how far I can shrink you..."
12233222313.content:
Zorua peered from behind a tree, rope in his mouth as he noticed who was coming his way: the pokemon had a yellow head, a red jewel on her forehead and had her eyes constantly closed. Also, she had two identical tails, and was hovering in direction of the hidden fox.

Uxie was the smartest girl in the village. No matter if it was something simple or complex, she knew it all better than everyone.

As always, the pixie had her head sunken in a book.

Zorua snickered, this would be his chance: Uxie always avoided being pranked, and normally ignored him, but not this ti-

The yellow-headed pokemon suddenly shut her book, placed it under her arm and sent a blast of psychc energy in direction of the bucket that contained the feathers, honey and berries that were supposed to hit her.

The bucket unceremoniously fell on the ground, scattering what it contained across the ground as Uxie looked at Zorua; somehow, she seemed to be able to see everything clearly even when her eyes were closed.

Zorua huffed while Uxie shook her head.

"Seriously Zorua? I knew about this little prank of yours since I left home..." she said.

The fox came out, sighing, knowing that nothing was going to happen to him: Uxie wasn't the type that liked to hurt others over dumb things like pranks. He had tried several other times to prank the pixie, he had always failed and he always only received a sarcastic comment and words that weren't implied in his vocabulary.

"If you knew what was going to happen, why did you even come here?" the fox asked, annoyed.

The yellow-headed pixie smiled.

"Because I need help with something, and you're the one that can give it to me," she said calmly.

Zorua looked at her.

"And why would I help you?" he asked. Uxie's smile became a smirk.

She floated closer to the fox,

"Did you forget that you owe me?" she asked. Zorua looked confused.

Uxie sighed.
"Of course you did..." she muttered.

--

The seething Altaria chased after Zorua, her cotton-y wings covered in mud, making it hard for her to fly.

"Get back here!" she screamed, Zorua snickering as he ran.

Just as the blue dragon-type was about to catch up with him, something happened: a certain yellow-headed pixie flew in between the fox and the dragon, blasting her with psychic.

Altaria seethed,

"What are you doing Uxie?!"

Zorua stopped, looking at the pixie in front of him as she spread her arms in a protective manner.

"What did he do to you? You want to use violence because of a prank that caused you no harm?" she said, disappointment creeping in her voice.

"B-But Uxie! My wings!" Altaria whined, staring at Zorua venomously; the fox grinned behind the pixie.

"Wash yourself."

Altaria shot one last glare at Zorua, before turning around, indignant, and taking off.

Uxie turned to face the fox, whose smirk faded.

"... I didn't need your help." he said, before turning around and sprinting away.

--

"... Oh, that..." Zorua muttered, before realization hit him.

Uxie smirked upon seeing Zorua's eyes widening.

"... You totally did that because you knew this was going to happen, didn't ya?" he asked.

"Heh, perhaps you're not so stupid like the others in the village say." she chimed.

It was a clear provocation, but Zorua didn't reply.

"... What do you want?" he asked instead.

In response, Uxie flew back a bit.

"So you're going to help me?"

Zorua snorted.

"Splendid."

Uxie put her book down, before she extended her paws forward.

"Just stand still. It should be over in a couple seconds..." she said.

"... What should be over in a-" before Zorua had a chance to finish, he found himself enveloped in psychic energy coming from Uxie's glowing eyelids.

Before his mind could process what was going on, Zorua found the world around him as he shrunk down.

Before his incredulous eyes, Uxie grew to a giantess! But that was incorrect: he shrunk to the size of a really small bug...

"U-Uxie...?" Zorua stuttered as the shrinking came to an end, leaving Zorua at a pitiful size.

Uxie smirked, as she flew over the tiny fox.

"... Looks like it worked..." she stated.

Her victim suddenly found himself shot across the air as he was telekinetically lifted up to the paws of the pixie, which were raised up to her closed eyes, as if they were staring down at him.

"Uxie w-what's this?!" Zorua screamed, terrified by the sudden change of perspective.

The yellow-headed pokemon whose paws he was on smiled again.

"Is it a rhetorical question? Because it seems pretty obvious to me," she stated, her voice nearly deafening Zorua.

A giggle erupted from below the fox, who was still staring at the now giant eyelids of Uxie.

"B-But... w-why?" he questioned, before thinking that the answer was obvious.

Uxie didn't reply; she moved Zorua on a single paw, before raising the other above him.

The fox thought that she was going to crush him, and emulated her by closing his eyes.

But nothing happened, aside from a large paw gently stroking his back.

"If you're thinking that this is because of your pranks, you're wrong... well, not entirely. I mean, you do deserve it, but I don't want to hurt you," she said gently, almost sweetly.

Zorua looked up.

"Then grow me back!" he shouted.

The pixie giantess smirked.
"Oh no Zorua," she said, causing the fox to pale,
"I said that I'm not going to hurt you, but I said nothing about letting you go... not yet anyway."

Zorua swallowed, wondering how he ended up in such situation, how he could get out of it and, most importantly, what was going to happen to him.

Uxie was being quite nice towards him, but she mentioned that she wasn't going to let him go, and she was clearly enjoying the situation.

Before Zorua could ask her to grow him back up once more, she spoke again,
"Well Zorua, my little experiment worked," she giggled. Even though his situation, Zorua rolled his eyes, and Uxie spoke again,

"As for now..."
12233222313.title: A little experiment

choices: Uxie eventually came back
One of her two siblings came into the room...
Both her siblings came into the room!
122332223131.content:
"Now Zorua, I'm going to bring you back to my house. As much as your forest is... um... secluded, I don't think it'll do for what we're going to do," Uxie said as she turned around.

Her book was telekinetically lifted from the ground and started floating behind her.

"My house will be a good place... although I'll have to hide you from my sisters..." she continued.

Despite the large paw covering him, Zorua perked up,

"... Sisters? I didn't know you had siblings..." he mused, causing Uxie to smile.

"You don't know anything about me, do you?" she said.

Zorua blushed.

"And what do you know about me?" he retorted. Uxie giggled,
"You're homeless, you have a major superiority complex and yet you're full of insecurities; you try to hide your true self behind that hateful prankster. Quite a weird mix if you ask me."

Zorua's jaw hung open.

For the rest of the trip to the house of the giantess, the fox went quiet, not finding anything to say.

The pixie eventually fluttered to a very secluded house; there was a lake nearby.

Listening carefully, Zorua could hear noise coming from the inside.

"... Your sisters?" he asked Uxie, who nodded.

"Now Zorua, I'll have to hide you... you're going to collaborate, aren't you?" she asked.

"... You know that you technically just kidnapped me, right?" he retorted,
"And why do you need to hide me anyway?"

"It isn't kidnapping, I did nothing to you so far... aside from shrinking you, I mean. And my sisters... well, it'd be quite complicated to explain this." Uxie responded.

Zorua nodded. He decided that, if he wanted his size and freedom back, he had to do like Uxie asked. Until the giantess didn't hurt him, it was fine.

"Also, I'm quite sure Azelf doesn't like you." Uxie continued.

"Wh-Why?" the fox asked.

"She disapproves your pranks... and now," Uxie started to float towards the door.

Zorua knew he had to play it safe: for a moment, Uxie looked back down, discovering that she was holding a tiny Zorua doll.

She smiled.

"Good thinking." she complimented as she opened the door.

Immediately, she spotted a blue pokemon in the living room, sitting on the couch in front of the TV.

"Sis..." Uxie called, causing Azelf to look at her.

"Oh, you're back... where have you been?" she asked distractedly, before eyeing the doll in Uxie's paws.
"... Why do you have a Zorua doll?" she asked again, contempt in her voice.

"Oh, ehm, I bought it... it looked cute." Uxie sheepishly responded.

"What looked cute?" Uxie's second sibling, Mesprit, chimed in after floating out of another room.

Behind his illusion, Zorua stared at the entirely blue pokemon, then at the pink and blue one. Both were similar to the giantess currently holding him, but they had different heads and colors: one was blue and had a pointy head, the other was pink and with four... things hanging from her head. For the rest, the three sisters were identical; they even had the same red jewel on the forehead.

For a moment, Zorua felt fear: which one was the Azelf that disliked him? What if Uxie had other sisters? She didn't mention how many siblings she had...

The gaze of the pink-headed pixie suddenly fell on Zorua: she stared at him suspiciously. The blue pokemon noticed, and stared at Uxie in silence.

The yellow-headed pixie blushed, feeling nervous.

"... I'm going to my room, I need to do something." Uxie hastily stated as she flew out of the living room. Zorua choked back a sigh of relief.

Azelf looked at Mesprit.

"... What's wrong with her?" she asked, looking back at the TV screen.

"I dunno." Mesprit lied.

There was something weird with the doll Uxie held: since when toys could feel fear?

--

"... How many sisters do you have?" Zorua asked as Uxie reached her room, closing the door behind herself.

She set Zorua onto a bed with yellow covers. The fox looked around: it was a spacious room, with several bookshelves full of books, a desk and a telescope near a window.

Everything suggested what Uxie liked to do.

"Only them. The blue one is Azelf - steer clear of her - the other is Mesprit." Uxie explained as Zorua dispelled his illusion.

"Now Zorua, you stay here while I go get something for us to eat, then we can do something together." she said.

"Uxie," Zorua stopped her,
"Why are you doing this? When are you going to give me back my size, let me go?" he asked.

Uxie, who was turning around to float out of the room, stopped.

She smiled at Zorua.

"Zorua, you pulled a lot of mean pranks. Consider this like a harmless punishment." she explained.

"... So you're basically keeping me cooped up? Like jail?"

"Not like that... we'll have fun, too! Don't worry, I'll send you on your way," she said, turning around again and smirking,

"Sooner or later."

With that, Uxie left the room, closing the door.

Zorua sighed: how did he end up in this situation?
122332223131.title: The pixies' house

choices: "Open that door... let's get this over with." Uxie huffed
"Zorua, hide." Uxie instructed
1223322231312.content:
The musings of the poor shrunken dark-type were suddenly interrupted as he heard the familiar creaking of the door as it opened.

He lazily looked at it, expecting Uxie to return with food like she promised; but he immediately sprang up to his feet when he noticed something pink and blue floating inside the room - Mesprit!

Hastily, Zorua cloaked himself behind the same poke-doll illusion and waited for Uxie's sister to leave the room, trying to hold his breath.

Sadly, Mesprit did not leave, and actually gazed at the ‘doll’ with a smirk, after having closed the door.

"Well well... sis brought home this tiny doll... she was right - it's kind of cute..." she told to no one apparently, but felt a tingle within her body: embarrassment. And it was not hers.

The pink-headed pixie quietly floated over the bed where Zorua was resting.

"But I wonder," she continued,
"How come my sister Uxie finds a Zorua doll cute?"

A earthquake shook the soft ground under Zorua as the newcomer giantess sat down, making the tiny fox bounce a little.

"But more importantly - how come an object can feel emotions?"

Before Zorua could ask himself what that was supposed to mean, he felt something jabbing his side.

He looked around, his brain frenetically processing the tip of Mesprit's left tail in his side and the smirk on her face.

Before the fox's eyes could widen, the tail started to swing like a whip, the tip causing an unbearable tickling sensation.

Zorua's cheeks puffed out and became bright red from the struggle to keep himself from laughing; pearly drops of sweat started running down his face, his tiny body started fidgeting involuntarily.

He felt like he was going to explode, and the tail gave no signs of wanting to stop anytime soon.

And in the end, Zorua could do nothing but give up.

"HAHAHA!" his mouth roared out a significant laughter for someone his current size.

He rolled on top of the bed with Mesprit's tail still tickling him.

"St-Stop! P-Please!" he stuttered pleadingly as he laughed.

And his prayer was answered as the swinging tail slowed down, before it stopped completely.

Mesprit smirked. Now in front of her was a real Zorua, not a doll.

Zorua kept laughing for a while more.

"See? Was that so hard?" the giantess chimed as the fox finally stopped laughing.

Before Zorua got a chance to stand up, a large paw came down on him and scooped him up and brought him up to an immense field of pink, interrupted just by a red spot in the middle of two golden lakes.

Zorua remembered what situation he was in and re-became visibly nervous.

"I... uh... I-I..." he quieted down after a few, meek attempts to speak. What was he supposed to even say?

"I don't think we've personally met. I'm Mesprit," the giantess introduced herself, before smirking again,
"You don't know me, but I know you... in fact, I don't think there's anyone that doesn't know you. You're a trouble-maker, and quite a mean one too... " she spoke.

There was no hint of malice in her voice, Zorua noted, just playfulness. A playfulness that almost fell into mischief.

"I... y-yes..." Zorua admitted.

"Let me guess: you somehow shrunk down, and my sister found you, and despite all the things you did to make everyone hate you she brought you home to help you? That's adorable." she spoke.

"But it's not how it went."

Zorua just seemed to notice the third presence in the room; Mesprit quietly turned around to see Uxie putting down a plate of food, before closing the door and accurately locking it.

Then, the yellow-headed pixie turned to her sister, arms on her hips.

"Why are you here - in my room?" she inquired, annoyed.

"Meeting this little guy you brought home," Mesprit replied,
"Speaking of, any clue of how he shrunk?"

"He owed me a favor, and I do this..." the telescope near the window was shrunken down and grown back up in a few seconds, so fast that Mesprit blinked for several times before her mind processed what she just saw.

"So you can shrink things? Cool!" Mesprit chimed, before she grinned,
"And so? What is Zorua doing here?You wanna teach him a lesson?"

Zorua gulped.

"Don't. Dare." Uxie stated,
"Zorua will be staying here for some time, in which I - me alone - will try to make him understand that what he does is wrong... harmlessly."

This time, Zorua sighed. But Mesprit giggled.

"You alone sis? I could help - I do know about him anyway..." she offered, her gaze again finding Zorua beside her,
"Hear that, cutie? We're gonna have lots of fun!"

Uxie sighed deeply.

"Mesprit..." her eyes hastily opened and fixed on Mesprit's... which were suddenly covered by her tails.

"Nice try!"

Zorua wondered what was going on between the two giantesses, and looked at Uxie, catching a single glimpse of two golden eyes before those were covered by her yellow eyelids as the pixie groaned.

Her head turned in direction of Zorua.

"Just for you to know: don't ever look at me in the eye." she stated.

Among other emotions, curiosity poked out.

"... Why?" he asked.

"Just don't, or you might regret it... or not." Mesprit snickered as she removed her tails from her eyes and patted Zorua on the back.

Before Zorua could wonder what that was supposed to mean, someone knocked at the door.

"Girls? Just who are you talking to?"

The tiny fox on the bed backed up, scared. He knew that was...

"Azelf." Mesprit quietly stated, looking at Uxie,
"You think we should tell her?"

"Are you kidding?! She hates him!" she whispered as the knocking got more insistent.

"I can fix that... and if things get too far, you can do your... y'know, thing. Or you could grow Zorua back in the worst of the cases..." Mesprit mused.

It took Uxie less than five seconds to ponder all the possible scenarios and reply.
1223322231312.title: Discovered so soon?

choices: Yes
No
1223322232.title: The Wish maker?

choices: the size of a small doll
the size of a bug
Speck sized, maybe smaller!?
12233222321.content:
Zorua snickered to himself as he awaited the approach of his target.

To be honest he hadn't intended on going after this one initially, she seemed pretty run of the mill, but she'd been going around the village excitably telling different pokemon how she was going to grant a wish to a pokemon that needed it most, and her excitable attitude...it was beginning to grate on Zorua especially. He'd heard the rumors of the wish maker Jirachi, and that she slept for millennia before being awake for a week.

He also learned that that was bogus because she'd been in the village for 3 months. He'd learned that Jirachi had found the one who she wanted to grant a wish, and that she was visiting Zorua's forest today.

That gave Zorua an idea...he'd prank her with his berry plan! She'd look like a Pidove and hopefully buzz off. He had the rope in his mouth, waiting...and then he heard the cheerful humming, signaling her approach.

"Mmkay...ghotta thime righ" He muttered, with the rope in mouth, and he waited for the opportune moment and...!

...When he released the bucket it hung in the air...not moving. It was being held in place by...

"Hello!" The cheerful voice came from behind Zorua and startled him as he frantically turned to see Jirachi smiling at him with her eyes closed.

"Gah! H-hey Jirachi..." Zorua said nervously and Jirachi opened her eyes and tilted her head.

"Boy, you must think me pretty clueless to fall for a prank like that! Ah well!" She said, no malice nor even batting an eye. She floated around the dark type as he tried to step away.

"W-well you know me, had to try!" He said, a little less nervously as Jirachi landed and approached Zorua with an outstretched paw. Zorua looked at her confused and she giggled.

"Congratulations!" She said and Zorua blinked.

"...huh?" Zorua said, bewildered.

"Congratulations, i'm going to grant your wish!" She said and Zorua looked at her perplexed.

"The only wish I have is for an infinite supply of food and for this village to fear me. I've got the second one, you giving me the first?" Zorua asked and Jirachi shook her head.

"Maybe you don't remember your wish...but I can see it, buried deep within you...and it's a wish that SHOULD be granted...the you now though, he may not agree. But no fear! You'll understand in time!" And with that a glow seemed to envelop Zorua as he looked around confused.

"What's going on?" He asked, now nervous again, and Jirachi seemed to be growing...until he saw his surroundings getting bigger too, he was shrinking!

"I need to keep you with me to help you with this...and you don't seem like you'd cooperate unless you have no choice so..." With each syllable Jirachi's bubbly voice seemed to get louder and louder to Zorua's ears. Down and down he went until he was...
12233222321.title: The wish maker and Zorua

choices: Jirachi happily carried Zorua away, undisturbed...
Zorua tried to convince her that this wasn't his wish again!
Suddenly, a foreign voice spoke - someone was looking for Zorua...
122332223211.content:
Zorua watched with sheer horror as the world around him kept growing and growing.

With his brain racing, he made an attempt to run, but discovered that Jirachi was holding him in place with Psychic.

"Told you, I'll need you to cooperate so I can grant your wish silly!" the expanding pokemon intoned, the same smile seemingly glued to her face.

Either she was telling the truth or she was a total lunatic, Zorua thought, obviously reasoning on the second line of thinking.

He looked around in desperation, but all he saw was a forest indeed... but a forest of grass!

Just then, the shrinking seemingly came to an end.

The fox looked up at the giantess before him. Jirachi smiled down at him.

"Wish granted!" she chimed happily as she regarded the now pitifully small Zorua, who looked to be the size of an incredibly small doll.

She mentally praised herself for not overdoing the shrinking.

"Aw, look at you, you look so cute like that!" Jirachi exclaimed. Zorua's cheeks flared up, but he paid the comment no mind.

"Jirachi, lis-" Zorua's words were thrown right back down his throat as he suddenly found himself shot across the air at supersonic speed.

After a short though utterly frightening flight, Zorua landed on top of the palms of the white giantess.

Repressing the need to vomit, Zorua looked up at the blue eyes of the giant Jirachi.

"Jirachi, why did you do this!?" he cried, causing her to giggle.

"I told you, this was your wish, silly!" she intoned playfully,
"I saw it in you, and it was a truly amusing wish, so I decided to grant it! Isn't it great?"

Zorua took a deep breath, opting to remain calm while he explained to Jirachi why this situation was all but ‘great’.

"Jirachi," he started, using the same tone one would use to lecture a mischievous child,
"Would you be so kind to explain me how do I get food now? Or how do I do anything in general? How do I survive? It couldn't be my wish to die, no?"

The giantess listened to each word carefully, before she giggled again, while Zorua found himself shoved into the white warm wall that was her belly, into what looked much like an eyelid.

With a blush he realized that Jirachi was hugging him.

"And that's when I come in!" she chimed enthusiastically,
"I'll help you with your wish, little one, and you'll realize that, indeed, this was your wish... for quite a while I'd dare to say!"

Another deep inhale was her reply.

"But this can't be my wish," he insisted.

"It was."

"Why would I wish being so helpless!?" Zorua shouted, losing his cool,
"Look at me, this size is pathetic! My reputation is gone! Why would I wish this all!?"

He expected the giantess to glare down at him, or at least to adopt a frown, but that stupid smile of hers kept lingering on her face.

"Well, that's one good question. I'm clueless, I just know it was there. It's a complicated thing, which I can't really explain myself, I just knew you wished this all and I... granted your wish, do you understand?" she asked after a not-so-clear explanation.

"No." Zorua replied bluntly.
"I don't understand at all. This is seriously your idea, lady, because I never wished, and never will wish, something like this... I mean, people hate me out of this forest! Oh, what I'm going to do now? They'll kill me!"

Zorua suddenly began to understand how bad his situation truly was.

Pokemon were going to rip him apart if they knew he was like this!

However, Jirachi smiled reassuringly,

"No fear, friend, I won't let that happen! I'll take care of you throughout this whole thing, okay?" she reassured. Zorua's eyelids half-lidded his eyes.

"So I'm basically your pet." he mused.
"Great, this was totally what I was wishing for."

"Oh, not like that Zorua," Jirachi said, and the shrunken fox noted that it was the first time she spoke his name since the whole thing started,
"I'll... oh, you'll see. For now," the white giantess began floating away

"Let's go to my house. We can keep talking there."
122332223211.title: The forgotten wish came true

choices: Jirachi lives alone
Jirachi lives with another pokemon
1223322232112.content:
"PLEASE listen Jirachi! I'm telling you this ain't what I want! I can't care for myself, I can't fend for myself! I child could tear me to pieces right now!" Zorua pleaded from the grasp of the giantess that was holding him, with a lurch he was lifted to her face and she smiled, a bit more gently.

"I'm saying Zorua, this was your wish...or, a means in which I could grant it. Don't worry about a thing, alright? Let big sis Jirachi take care of things." Jirachi said as she placed the tiny dark type on top of her head, his vantage point now making him quite nervous with how high up he was. He was sure he wouldn't survive the drop to the ground if he fell. Jirachi started walking again and humming, both of these simple actions raising quite a bit of hell for the shrunken pokemon. He made a meek attempt to dig his claws in and maintain his balance, without hurting or annoying the giantess that now was taking control of the situation.

With each step though it felt like Zorua was slipping more, Jirachi's loud humming a dizzying experience with his far more sensitive tiny ears.

Jirachi for her part was seriously contemplating the pokemon on her head. It was a...peculiar wish, and one that was contradictory in general to how Zorua behaved. That was part of why she wanted to grant it, her curiosity took a hold on this one...but this might also help Zorua get over his loner tendencies too, as well as his rather rude pranks. It was none of her business on that though, for now she would grant his wish to the best of her abilities. After all...there was the root of it all that she needed to find, right?

"JIRACHI! I'M GOING TO FALL!" Zorua cried and she snapped out of her thoughts and stopped walking to feel that...Zorua was very close to the back of her head.

"Whoops, sorry there little guy!" She said as he felt a psychic pull lift him up, he looked down, gulping with the fall but was gently levitated to her paws once again.

He looked up with fear, but Jirachi was smiling, there was a slightly gentler demeanor to it though.

"I guess I didn't think that part through. I'll just...carry you like this." She said, and Zorua got as low as he could and whimpered with his ears down, truly frightened now.

"There's no way...I w-would wish for this...please Jirachi...if this is b-because of the pranks i'm s-sorry..." He managed to stammer out.

Jirachi saw and heard this and hugged him to her chest.

"Don't worry, okay? I truly will protect you. And this really was your wish...I promise."

Jirachi kept on her way, Zorua feeling her warmth radiating around him, it felt nice, but he was damn scared...it had been a while since he felt like this. Not since.

...he didn't like to think of that bastard though, he was far away now.

Zorua closed his eyes, almost feeling himself nod off before Jirachi spoke.

"We're here, my home!"
1223322232112.title: Precarious position and Jirachi's protection

choices: "P-Perhaps it could... work?" Zorua admitted
"I'll say it once more: this is NOT my wish!" Zorua insisted stubbornly
12233222321121.content:
The house in front of Zorua was nothing out of ordinary... of course, aside from the fact that to him it was the size of a really tall mountain.

Jirachi unlocked the door and hovered inside, before hastily closing the door behind herself.

She wasn't sure if someone saw Zorua, but she swore she caught a glimpse of someone glancing at her with curiosity as she made her way to her house. It was no surprise, almost everyone did since she came to the village, but, uncovered as he was, someone could have easily seen Zorua.

"Well, home sweet home." the giantess chimed to her small passenger, who huffed in response, still trying to process everything that has been going on today.

"Why so grumpy, Zorua?" Jirachi asked.

"I dunno. Maybe because I'm pathetically tiny? No, it can't be that... oh wait, it is!" Zorua sarcastically replied, causing Jirachi to giggle.

"You're funny." she praised.

"I'm serious! Grow me back, Jirachi, please!" he begged, but his plead fell on deaf ears.

"Nope, Zorua. This is your wish, and I shall help you with it no matter what!" the giantess replied with a determined smile as she began hovering through the house.

"This isn't what I wish for!" Zorua insisted.

At this point, Jirachi stopped; one paw left Zorua as she placed it over her mouth, seemingly deep in thought.

That gave the stressed Zorua the chance to look around. The house looked much bigger from the inside than the outside: there was a small kitchen, but the living room was rather large, mostly occupied by a big, nice-looking couch, an armchair, a coffee table and two full bookshelves; a secondary door led to an equally large bathroom, while another door led to a hallway, which was occupied by a staircase.

Probably Jirachi's room was upstairs. Not a single speck of dust could be seen, everything was sparkling clean. Evidently, Jirachi liked things pretty clean.

Said wish-maker looked back down at Zorua and sighed, her smile fading for the first time as she did.

"You really don't get it, do you Zorua? I know you think this isn't your wish, you convince yourself of it, but my power goes beyond your perception. I can see the most intimate wishes of people, buried deep inside oneself," she paused to sigh again.

"Since I came here, I've been telling that I was going to grant the wish of someone that really really wanted their wish to come true." she began moving again at this.

Jirachi hovered to the staircase. Her smile was back, but it didn't look like the happy smile she was wearing for the whole day, it looked much more like a forced one.

Zorua didn't relent,

"But I really really didn't wish for this Jirachi, you have to believe me!"

At this point, Jirachi hovered through a door and into a spacious room, which was undoubtedly her bedroom.

There was a bed with yellow sheets in the corner, two windows with yellow curtains on the wall and a desk nearby; a telescope rested near the windows.

Like downstairs, everything was extremely clean and fancy-looking.

Keeping Zorua restrained against her chest, Jirachi hovered to her bed and laid down on it.

"Zorua, it is your wish, trust me. I see it, I know you want this. It may be that you may have forgotten it, or that you consider it something stupid, but I intend to help you." she said, her sincere smile reappearing.

The dark-type prepared himself for another verbal assault, when his mouth stopped.

He had an idea.

"Jirachi," he started,
"Can you tell me, please, what is my wish? You say I wanted this, but it's pretty... generic, don't you think? What is that I really want, according to you?" he asked.

In response, Jirachi closed her eyes, while the grip that held Zorua still tightened around him.

"Hmm..."

The area right under Zorua began burning hot; he turned his gaze downwards (or backwards?) and choked back a scream.

On Jirachi's belly, an eye had opened. What looked like an eyelid on her belly WAS an eyelid on her belly...

"J-Jirachi..."

"You wish..." she spoke, her voice adopting a deeper tone,
"... To be happy, to be safe from the people who hate you... you wish a friend who detains the power to protect you, and that's why you wish to be so small, because it would make it easier for said friend to protect you."

Slowly, the looming eyelid closed back up.

Jirachi's actual eyes opened again as she looked at Zorua.

"Content now?" she asked, her voice returning to its characteristic cheerful tone.

Zorua raised his head.

"You're officially delirious, lady." he stated.
"This is definitely not what I want. Let me go."

Jirachi sighed.

"May I ask something?" she demanded.

"No."

"Even if this wasn't your wish, Zorua, would it be so bad? I mean, me protecting you, being your friend... would it really be so bad? You mentioned you wished for infinite food... that's pretty close to it, wouldn't you agree?" she giggled at this while Zorua blushed.

The wish-maker giantess continued,

"Tell me Zorua, and be honest with me, and with yourself: would this be really so bad?"
12233222321121.title: Alone with the giantess

choices: It's a storm, it knocked over a tree branch.
A pokemon is breaking in! They saw Zorua!
122332223211211.content:
Zorua looked at the giantess wish-maker, with her smile, looming over him and he looked down. He shook his head, wanting to tell her no, but the way she said this was his wish...

Damn useless brat...you won't evolve, you're pathetically whiny, and you can't contribute jack shit.

WHAM!

He winced, and another memory came back to him.

P-please, I haven't eaten in days...I just came across this village and-

Buzz off brat. I got my own problems to take care of.

B-but....

His expression darkened as these thoughts came back, and he let out a shaky sigh, knowing that Jirachi was seeing all of this.

"I don't..."

Well fine then...they won't help me...i'll help myself...they'll see, that bastard, pokemon everywhere...oh they'll see.

Zorua felt a few tears welling up inside of him, before he tried to calm down.

"I think...maybe...it could work. For a bit." He said, trying to keep the crack in his voice from showing.

Jirachi had a gentle smile before her giant paws picked him up and lifted him to her face. He tried to avert his gaze, but two fingers gently took hold of his head and turned him to look at the giantess.

"I don't know what could've happened to you in the past for this to be your wish Zorua, but just know that from now on, everything is going to work out. You can't hurt anyone...and no one shall hurt you. I promise." With that Jirachi hugged the teen to her chest again, and Zorua felt the warmth permeate through his being, her heartbeat lulling him.

Zorua almost let himself fall asleep for a second time in this position before.

*GROWL*

That...was his stomach. Zorua realized how hungry he was and Jirachi started moving, not removing Zorua from the hug.

"Now I know I have something you'll like in here somewhere..." Jirachi said, her movements being felt by the tiny pokemon, but she kept him secure in her hold as she went into the kitchen, grabbing a knife with her free hand and psychically opening her fridge door.
