There was a bit of chilled beef in there, that would surely be to his taste she thought. She pulled it out with her psychic and set in on her cutting board, preparing a small slice for the pokemon in her charge.

Once all was said and done, there was a thin slice made...at least 3 times bigger than Zorua. She opened her hug and with her paw set him on the counter in front of it, her face smiling down on the tiny pokemon.

"Eat to your heart's content Zorua...you haven't had a good meal in a long time, right?" She said and Zorua looked up, mouth agape before looking at the slice, and smelling it. It almost made his mouth water...he shook his head and felt the words in his throat.

"T-thank you..." he said, emotion in his voice as he approached the meat and took a bite...then two...soon enough he was eating at a rhythm as Jirachi watched, paw on her chin, smiling down.

Once Zorua was done, he sighed, then looked up.

"So...why did you pick me, I suppose..." He murmured and Jirachi giggled.

"Easy, I try not to grant terribly selfish or bad wishes, I grant something that can benefit everyone, and you like this...it benefits absolutely everyone, as far as I can tell. You're not a bad pokemon, right Zorua? You just try to be tough..." Jirachi said and Zorua blushed and looked down.

*CRASH!*

They both heard something that made them go alert, and Jirachi moved to her window to see what was going on.
122332223211211.title: Zorua's realization

choices: Sneasel snatched Zorua and fled!
Jirachi stopped Sneasel in time!
1223322232112112.content:
The rather large knife still solidly held in her paw, Jirachi looked at Zorua, who looked quite startled after the crash, which seemed to have come from Jirachi's living room.

Gesturing for the fox to remain silent, the wish-maker hovered toward the kitchen door and peeked out, before sighing in relief as she saw a rather large tree branch laying in front of a broken window, glass shards scattered everywhere across the living room.

But, how did that branch break the window? It couldn't have done it on its own, or could it?

Alarmed, Jirachi went to the window.

"Hmm..." she observed the darkened sky, the sun hidden by black clouds: it was going to rain soon, she judged, and it was quite windy too.

"J-Jirachi...?" Zorua called from the kitchen, startled.

The legendary sighed, piecing it together.

"Relax Zorua, the wind snapped a branch and it broke the window," she explained, before giving a sigh as she regarded the glass shards and the branch that was still resting in the middle of her living room.

She smiled back in direction of the tiny fox,

"Go on, eat up while I clean up this mess. Then we can spend some time together and maybe we can get to know each other, okay?" she suggested.

Zorua flushed red, but said nothing.

Getting to know each other meant bringing up his troubled past, and bringing up his troubled past meant humiliating himself.

He looked at his host, who was busily gathering the glass shards with psychic, forming a small, glass pile in mid-air.

Sighing, he returned to his meal and began biting into it again while trying to recollect his thoughts.

All that happened today was quite weird, but Jirachi assured that this was his wish... and if she really was able to see the most intimate wishes of people, who was he to question that?

Plus, living in an actual house, sleeping in an actual bed and not on the ground, eating giant food which was offered to him without him having to search for it, those all were good bonuses.

Zorua's train of thought was interrupted as a shadow loomed over him.

"Oh, are you done?" he asked Jirachi as he looked up from his meal, only to find the shadow didn't belong to Jirachi at all.

He froze up, feeling his blood freezing as well despite his heart beating like a drum.

"Y-You?!"

In front of the kitchen counter stood a short and slim, dark-furred pokemon with clawed hands and feet.

A Sneasel. And the same one that held a grudge against Zorua for the last stunt too.

She smirked.

"You didn't think I didn't notice you with that weirdo Jirachi, did ya?" she snickered, her claws shining sinisterly.

On his perch on the kitchen counter, Zorua backed from his meal.

"... What do you want?" he asked, attempting to appear imposing. Something that resulted quite hard, given how he looked like a doll right now.

"What do I want?" Sneasel parroted back in a whisper, her grin gone, replaced by a glare,
"You hid those eggs in front of my house! Mandibuzz hunted me down!"

Zorua snickered, much like he had been doing when he saw the same pokemon that now towered above him running from an angry Mandibuzz.

"That was totally your fault, y'know. You stole my food when you passed by my forest!" he retorted, before smirking smugly,
"And now, you broke in the house of a legendary... how d'ya think she'll react?" he wondered, shooting Jirachi a nervous look, but she was still gathering shards from the floor, unaware of the third presence in her house.

Sneasel grinned again.

"Oh, but she won't know about me... she'll only know that you're gone. I don't care how you shrunk or why you're here, we gotta have a nice lil' chat, don't you agree?" she hinted as a claw rose menacingly, ready to start forward and grab Zorua.

The fox thought fast, there was no way he could escape or fight back. So his only hope was...

"JIRACHI!"

In the living room, the wish-maker perked up, looking back into the kitchen, wondering the reason of such alarmed scream.

Almost immediately, she noticed the slim figure of a Sneasel inside. Next, she saw Zorua backed up in a corner on her counter, while the intruder glanced back at her, panicking.

Without wasting time, Jirachi let go of the glass shards, which fell to the floor, breaking into even tinier shards.

The legendary rushed into the kitchen, warily staring at the Sneasel.

"Wh-Who are you?" she asked, before hastily piecing the situation together.
"... You broke my window, didn't you?"

Sneasel put up a calmer facade.

"Chill out," it was an ironic thing to say for an ice-type,
"I only saw my friend Zorua like that and was wondering why he's so tiny."

Jirachi didn't looks like she bought it.

"If that's so, why did you break in instead of knocking at my door like normal pokemon do?" she wondered, causing the Sneasel to shrug nervously.

"Um... my nature, y'know!" she replied.

"That's not true! She wanted to kidnap me!"

Jirachi gasped and, in the time she realized that her facade had dropped, Sneasel calculated the distance between the broken window and the kitchen, before turning around to grab Zorua...
1223322232112112.title: Dark Grudges

choices: Once this is all done, they decide to go to bed
Once this is done, they talk some more
12233222321121122.content:
Sneasel was reaching for the shrunken pokemon who gulped before a shiny, sharp knife stuck into the counter, inches from Sneasel. She looked back shocked to the legendary, who had thrown and aimed the knife, keeping an eerily calm face.

"I will allow you to leave empty handed right now if you choose to flee. That was a warning shot, and not even a demonstration of the power I have. Zorua is in my charge right now, and will not disturb you any longer if you had an unfortunate run in with him. I apologize for what he may have done to you nonetheless but he will NOT BE LEAVING WITH YOU!" Jirachi said, almost intimidating the Sneasel to flee right then and there.

But she had her pride too.

"Lady, don't think i'll run with my tail between my legs, He will PAY!" Sneasel slashed at Zorua quickly as Zorua closed his eyes, expecting the worst.

When no pain came he opened his eyes to see the sharp claw right in front of his face...stopped. He looked at the towering giantess to see that she wasn't moving an inch at all.

Jirachi was looking far more serious...and her true eye was opened. Her voice taking on a deeper tone.

"You have tried to interfere with his true wish...and tried to kill in my home. I allowed you the opportunity to flee after breaking in and you foolishly spat in my face. Now then..." Sneasel was whimpering, not looking forward to her punishment at all. She was lifted with the force and felt a sickness in her stomach as she was launched out the window she broke, far far into the distance, leaving Jirachi and Zorua alone.

Moments of silence passed as Jirachi's middle eye slowly closed and she sighed.

"...She got off light, all things considered." Jirachi mumbled as she floated to the tiny dark type, who seemed spooked by what had just happened.

"Sh-she almost-" Zorua was stumbling over his words as Jirachi picked him up.

"Don't worry, I won't let anything happen to you, okay?" Jirachi tried to reassure him, but his breathing was heavier.

"Do you want to finish your meal?" She asked and he shook his head.

"I'm not hungry anymore...just, keep me with you?" He asked and she nodded.

"Okay, I can do that. Let me finish cleaning up this glass."

Jirachi hugged Zorua to her chest as she continued to clean the broken window, getting it all into a psychic pile in the air.

"Sneasel had it coming you know...what I did to her..." Zorua said and Jirachi hummed.

"She stole from me...I hadn't eaten for a long time when she did that too..."

"You enjoy mischief, right?" Jirachi said and Zorua said nothing.

"But the you buried deep...he didn't want to turn into that either, he doesn't like to hurt others. You need to find that Zorua again..." Jirachi gently said and Zorua sighed.
12233222321121122.title: Sneasel stopped

choices: "Wanna go outside? It's still early after all,"
"Let's play a game Zorua!"
There was a knock at the door. Who could it be this time?
122332223211211222.content:
After being unceremoniously thrown out of the window, Sneasel kept going for a while because of the mere force of Jirachi's Psychic. The wind did nothing to ease her situation.

The screaming dark-type drew the attention of several pokemon as she soared the street, before ungracefully landing on the ground, her head hitting a patch of grass.

Her vision was very blurry, but she could make out the figures of several pokemon encircling her, concerned expressions on their faces.

She didn't have the best reputation around, but it was still better than Zorua's.

"Hey, you alright?" a Glaceon asked as she helped the dark-type up.

Sneasel rubbed her head with a grunt of pain.

"Yeah... I'm fine..." she said, while glaring in direction of the house she was just thrown out of.

‘Needless to say, this ain't the last you hear from me.’

--

"I'm sorry for your window Jirachi."

"No problem. I'm sorry for not noticing her sooner."

The still startled Zorua nestled himself into the chest of his newfound friend/host; she held him against herself with her paws while she gathered the multiplied glass shards with Psychic.

Once she picked up every shard, she threw them away; next, she removed the knife she had used against Sneasel from her counter, before picking up the branch from her living room and throwing it out there way it came in. All while she hummed a familiar tune, soothing Zorua.

Jirachi looked at her window and sighed, while Zorua shivered as a gust of wind entered the house through the broken window.

The giantess smiled.

"Don't worry, I'll have that fixed soon. Now, what d'you say if we sit down and talk for a bit?" she suggested.

Zorua sighed, he knew this was coming sooner or later.

"One condition," he told while the giantess hovered to her couch and sat down, nestling the fox in between her arms and her chest.

"Hm?"

"No personal questions. There are a few things I don't want to talk about, got it?"

Jirachi giggled, her usual behavior back.

"Zorua, I'm your friend, and you'll be living with me for a while. You can open up with me, we can be like brothers!" she chimed, before looking at the shrunken fox with a pink shade on her cheeks,
"Or better..."

One of her two tails traveled to Zorua's chin, but he pulled back.

"You're going too far already, lady," he said, causing the blushing titan to giggle again.

"Doesn't mean it can't be~"

The fox shook his head.

"... How about you begin?" he said, before looking elsewhere,
"... There's nothing to say about me, really. I'm a prankster, I live alone, people hate me."

Jirachi smiled sympathetically, and the grip around the dark-type grew tighter.

"Zorua, I believe there's a world more about you... but I'll start if it makes you happy. As you may have already understood, I grant wishes and I can see the most intimate desires of pokemon. It's... good, y'know. To see the happy faces of a pokemon when their wish comes true..."

Zorua pointed to his face,

"Does this look like a ‘happy face’?" he asked, causing the giantess to giggle yet again.
"Give it time, you'll get used to it little one," she replied.

Zorua huffed, before continuing,

"Look, from what I knew about you, you should be sleeping for a millennia right now, you've been here three months. Why...?"

Jirachi flushed red.

"That..." she muttered.
"Y'see, that isn't false, but... look, sometimes it takes time to find someone whose wishes aren't selfish or malicious, so sometimes my kind sleeps for a bit..."

"For a bit." Zorua parroted back without even blinking, choking back a laugh.

The statement itself was ridiculous, and the fact Jirachi was blushing didn't help at all.

"... I know, it sounds stupid, but we can wake up sooner if... if someone that fits the requirements shows up. We can also not sleep at all, y'know... I mean, not sleep for a millennium, that is..."

Zorua began snickering at Jirachi's awkwardness.

She shook the blush off her face.

"... But let's go back at you, Zorua!" she chimed, a smile brightening her giant face,
"You mentioned you had something you didn't want to talk about... but I think you should."

Zorua shot a determined look.

"Jirachi-"

"No, listen, it'll make you feel better! I won't tell anybody, promise!"

Zorua made eye contact with the titaness, her deep blue eyes sparkling with excitement.

"No."

"Aw come on! If we're living together, we need to know everything about each other! EVERYTHING."

"Jirachi, you're delirious again." Zorua declared, but the giantess didn't relent.

Instead, she showed an irresistible pair of puppy-dog eyes.

"Pretty please?"

Zorua tried to resist, but failed miserably. The power of the puppy-dog eyes was multiplied a hundredfold because Jirachi's eyes were truly gigantic.

The small dark-type huffed in loud annoyance.

"FINE!" he cried, before looking down.
"Just don't make fun of me, okay?"

Jirachi placed a paw on her heart.

"It was... I had problems with my dad when I was younger okay? He was a true bi... he was really a jerk to me. He beat me up and always ‘encouraged’ me to evolve by starving me. And that's the tip of the iceberg for a thief, ain't it? Yeah, I can remember his good mood when he got caught..."

At this point, Zorua paused, breathing heavily.

Jirachi looked horrified.

"Zorua-"

"Huge, spoiled sack of crap..." at this point, he wasn't there anymore. He was himself right now, but facing his father years ago.

His mind flashed with all sorts of violent scenarios, his tiny claws sank into Jirachi's white skin.

"How could you be such monster... with your own son, man! You filthy-"

"Zorua!"

"Huh?" he was suddenly snapped back to reality, back into Jirachi's paw, onto her couch and into the living room.

He blushed.

"D-Did I say that all out loud?" he wondered, looking at his host sorrowfully,
"So-Sorry... It happens every time I think about him..."

Jirachi didn't respond, but embraced the fox even more.

"Don't worry Zorua, he can't hurt you anymore... wait, can he?" she suddenly mused,
"Didn't you mention you lived alone?"

"I do."

"But then... where is your dad?" Jirachi wondered, before gasping as one of her tails traveled to her mouth.
"Did you...?"

Unexpectedly, zorua grinned.

"D'ya think I was just going to sit back and let him turn me into a punching bag? No way, lady, no freaking way! One night he went to steal, and when he got back, I was already far. And sayonara daddy, hope I never see you again!"

Zorua breathed in deeply, before staring at the speechless Jirachi, as if daring her to laugh at him.

"Happy now?"

"I... I had no idea..." she meekly stated, and Zorua was enveloped in an even tighter hug, which threatened to break his bones.

"It's... okay..." Zorua said, feeling his breath waning.

After a while of silence, Jirachi smiled again, her cheerful behavior back.

"Well! Now we do know everything about each other! I'm so happy!" she said cheerfully,
"Now, wanna do something together Zorua?"

Taken aback by the quick change of mood (was Jirachi moody?), Zorua couldn't offer an answer different than,

"Like?"
122332223211211222.title: A chat with the host

choices: Jirachi wins
Zorua wins
Zorua is cheating
1223322232112112222.content:
"Oh, I know, how about a game! That could be fun!" Jirachi said as she pulled Zorua back from the hug and he took a moment to breath deeply now that he could.

"A game? Don't you think the fact that i'm tiny and you're...well not puts you at an advantage?" Zorua said and Jirachi mused to herself.

"...A word game?" She offered and he cringed.

"Please no." He said and she smiled lifting him to her face.

"Well...do you have any ideas for what we could do for a game?" Zorua put a paw to his chin and mused.

"I have something of an idea I suppose." He smirked, this was something he was good at.

"Jirachi, you're a powerful legendary, a wish granter, and at least a millennia old, right?"

"Well...you didn't need to bring that last part into account..." Jirachi pouted, but then nodded. "I am."

"I'm tiny, not all that powerful in general, and barely 15...but I bet I got something on you that you can't suss out." He grinned and Jirachi brought him closer to her eyes, now curious.

"What is it? What is it?" She asked, almost like a child, her curiosity piqued.

He flashed a genuine grin, his ego feeling sated.

"I'm the best there is at illusions and tricks of the eye! I even have my jerk of a dad beat on it i'd imagine!"

'Though he never put much stock in illusions' Zorua thought bitterly.

Jirachi tilted her head and Zorua took a deep breath before shimmering shards of glass seemed to levitate from Jirachi's trash bin. She looked at it confused before they coalesced into the full window pane that was there before the incident. It seemed to fit into place before she looked at it...it was as if her window had come back. She blinked before an image appeared on the window, almost like a way to peer into places far away as a shimmering crystal cave seemed to be right outside her house. She blinked again and it was a rainbow...blinking again, it was as if she lived in the sky on fluffy clouds. She was entranced and before she realized it was walking to her window and reaching out before.

"STOP!" Zorua yelled, frantic and Jirachi blinked again and gasped. She almost put her paw on some broken glass...the illusion was gone.

"I didn't think you'd try that..." Zorua said, surprised, hugged to her chest with the paw that didn't reach out.

"Anyways...that's my power. I can make you see things...and this house...has something in it right now that doesn't belong." Zorua said and Jirachi was perplexed.

"There's an object in this house that isn't real right now." Zorua said, then he grinned.

"Think you can figure it out?" He said, almost cocky and Jirachi grinned.

"NOW I get it Zorua! Ah, that's a fun kind of game!" Jirachi said, lifting him to her face again.

"Indeed it is..." Zorua smiled.

He had an idea with this...

"Wanna go for some stakes?" He asked and Jirachi put a paw to her chin.

"Uh...well I only have that beef in the kitchen..." She said and Zorua sighed.

"No, not the meat, a wager!" He exclaimed and realization dawned on her. "Though a steak does sound nice..." He muttered.

"OH! Um...depends, what are they?" She asked and Zorua went for it.

"If you win...i'll tell you the rest of what there is to know about me." Zorua said, and then gave her some extra incentive. "And maybe try that...other thing you suggested." He blushed at this and Jirachi smiled.

"Okay, and if YOU win?" Zorua nodded.

"You grow me back." He said and Jirachi looked surprised.

"No deal Zorua, sorry, I can't do that regardless of how high the wager is on your end. It goes against the foundation of your inner most wish." She said, almost sternly and Zorua sighed.

"Worth a shot..." He said but Jirachi mused something else.

"But say that you do win Zorua...I can give you a different kind of reward. Something I know you'll like." She said and Zorua's interest was piqued.

"...Yeah?" He was curious and she giggled.

"Secret~" She teased and he grumbled.

"Fine..." He considered his choices, Jirachi seemed to be a total wildcard...in terms of everything but protecting Zorua, on that she hadn't let him down at least.

"...deal." He said and Jirachi nodded before setting him on her couch.

"The object is something I can actually find, yes?" Jirachi asked and Zorua put a paw to his chest.

"It absolutely is."

"And let's say...I get an hour." Jirachi said and Zorua almost choked on such a long time limit but sighed.

"Sure...an hour."

"Hmm...easy peasy~ Just you wait Zorua, i'll figure your illusion out!" Jirachi said as she marched off from her couch, Zorua still sitting on it.

"Yeah, good luck with that lady..." He mumbled as he reclined on the giant piece of furniture.
1223322232112112222.title: A game among the wish granter and prankster

choices: "Let's play something else! I pick now!"
"Let's just rest for while."
12233222321121122222.content:
Zorua watched as the giantess wandered off into the hallway that led to her bedroom and smirked, his victory sure.

As much as smart as she proved to be, Jirachi was naïve. She was never going to find the object.

She was already searching in the wrong place after all...

"Zorua! I think I found it!" her voice rang from upstairs.

"Is it something you can touch?"

"Um..." a small pause,
"Yeah!"

"Then it's not an illusion!" Zorua replied smugly as he relaxed on the couch satisfied, hearing the loud sign that followed his statement.

The tiny fox snickered, this was going to be way too easy, almost boring.

The only question was: what Jirachi's mysterious reward was going to be?

--

Zorua watched with eyes half lidded as the wish-maker hastily hovered around her living room.

"Tick tock Jirachi. Time's almost up." he reminded her with a grin,
"Why don't you give up?"

"No way Zorua! You'll earn your reward only if I don't find the object in time!" she replied determinedly as she flew into her bathroom.

Zorua snickered to himself as his gaze went to a clock on the wall.

5... 4... 3... 2... 1...

"Time's up Jirachi, I win!" he called lazily as he stood back on all fours, looking at the giantess with satisfaction.

"D'aww..." she said, arms hanging resignedly as she turned around to face the small dark-type.

"Do I get an extra minute?" she tried.

"You were the one setting the time limit."

"Yeah! So I can change that, right?"

"Uh, don't think so."

Jirachi gave a resigned sigh as she flew back onto the couch and sat beside the shrunken fox.

"Fine." she said,
"Just out of curiosity though, what was the object?"

In response, Zorua grinned and pointed to one of the bookshelves; a book was slightly peeking out from the rest, before it faded away.

Jirachi blinked. How did that escape her sight?

"Oh..." she meekly said, before being awash with the feeling she was tricked.
"You cheated! You said I could find it!"

Zorua didn't even blink at her glare.

"You totally could, but you didn't check the bookshelf. For one time, I can say I won honestly, lady." he said, feeling content with himself.

Jirachi sighed.

"Wow, I didn't know you were a sore loser," Zorua taunted,
"Now, if I'm not mistaken, we had a certain deal..."

Jirachi perked up, blushing furiously.

She began giggling.

"Well... I guess that's fair..." she said, looking extremely embarrassed while she looked at her shrunken victim, who, on the other hand, looked confused.

"Jirachi?"

The fox was suddenly surrounded by psychic energy and began floating in mid-air, before hovering up to the face of the giantess.

"Ready Zorua?" she asked.

"For what?"

The tiny dark-type floated closer to the white visage of the giantess, and soon discovered what his reward was as Jirachi's lips made contact with his cheek.

At least, she intended to take up his cheek, because the smooth pair took the vulpine's whole face, which grew a bright shade of red that spread throughout his whole visage.

"Hmm~"

Zorua began struggling against the psychic grip to break free, but couldn't fight back. Jirachi was simply too strong for him.

Only after a minute and a half, the wish-maker finally pulled back, blushing madly but giggling merrily.

"Oh wow, that was some experience! Wouldn't you agree~?"

While saying that, she was staring a the dark-type, but he seemed to have shut down, his brain unable to register what had just happened.

"Zorua?"

"I... you... what was the meaning of this...?" he asked after several moments of hesitation.

Jirachi giggled.

"I told you I would have given you something you'd have liked!... Why, didn't you like it?"

Zorua didn't reply, but his blush grew more intense.

Jirachi grinned.

"Thought so," she paused to giggle,
"Y'know, you're pretty cute at that size!"

That last comment did nothing to help Zorua's embarrassment.

But Jirachi seemed to be perfectly fine with this whole situation, despite the fact she just literally kissed the worst of all pokemon that lived around here.

But she had learned his story, she was sorry for him. He was nice to be with... when he was adorably tiny and couldn't pull any pranks.

"Can I know the rest of your story anyway?" she asked hopeful, while Zorua recovered himself from the kiss he had just received.

When was the last time someone kissed him? Never, since he didn't have anyone that loved him. Surely not his dad or the villagers.

Maybe Jirachi? She seemed pretty affectionate during his short stay with her. Maybe he could really consider her like a sister... or-

"H-Huh?" he asked to dissuade himself from such line of thinking, wondering where that even came from.

"Can I know the rest of your story anyway? Please?" Jirachi asked again, a hopeful spark in her eyes.

One that the fox was sorry to break.

"Um... no." he bluntly replied, Jirachi's expression dropping almost immediately.
"... M-Maybe some other time." he quickly added, seeing her upset expression.

The giantess smiled again.

"Okay Zorua, that's fine!" she chimed happily, completely forgetting she was the one losing the match with the shrunken fox.

"But now come on! We still have lots of things to do!" she continued, leaving the fox curious.

"Like what?"

Jirachi smiled.
12233222321121122222.title: An awkward award

choices: Zorua just barely wins
Jirachi takes it
122332223211211222221.content:
"I want to play another game! I pick now!" Jirachi said in an excited voice, Zorua looked at her deadpan.

"As long as it's something I can win." He said and she nodded.

"Oh, you can win, the same way that I could win the last game." She said smiling and Zorua eyed her suspiciously.

Was Jirachi making a jab or an innocent remark? He wasn't sure...but he was curious.

"...What's the game." With that Zorua found himself set on the ground, and he looked up...and up to the towering Jirachi, who hadn't lost her smile.

"It's easy, almost similar to the last game really. You just need to hide from and evade me." Jirachi said and Zorua understood.

Hide and seek huh?

"Hmm...reasonable." Zorua said smirking, and Jirachi didn't bat an eye or lose her smile, almost making Zorua's falter.

"And all you need to do is avoid me for 15 minutes~" Jirachi said and now Zorua was getting worried there was a catch to this with how sweet she said it.

"...okay." He said, wary and she nodded.

"Also, no illusions." Jirachi said almost in a scolding tone and Zorua sighed.

"No illusions, fine fine..." He said and smiled.

"Okay, agreed." He said, and that's when Jirachi stepped forward and reached down to grab him, shocking him, he leapt back, avoiding her paw and looked at her surprised.

She looked disappointed, but smiled at Zorua.

"Almost had ya." She said happily.

"What gives!? You haven't given me a chance to hide yet!" He said, his voice huffy and she giggled.

"I never said i'd give you that chance~" She said in a sing song voice and Zorua realized he'd been duped.

So THIS was her game.

Without a word he turned tail and started running for the hallway and Jirachi got up, lazily following him as he ran as hard as he could, Jirachi easily keeping pace.

"Oh, don't think i'll give it to you!" Zorua said looking back as he darted into a doorway to his left, seeing himself in a pantry he dove into a crevice at the corner of his eye just in time to evade Jirachi's line of sight.

She walked into the pantry and looked around...it was a cluttered mess, she frowned.

"Aw..." She said as she got on her hands and knees and started looking low.

"Zorua, where are you~" She called out in a sing song voice. As the minutes passed Zorua was able to keep himself hidden...he just needed to last...he didn't know how many more minutes he had to go, but he just needed to...his thoughts were broken as a white paw reached for him, a giggle being heard.

"Hey little guy!" Jirachi said playfully and Zorua's eyes nearly bugged out of his head as he went to full sprint to try and avoid her hand, just barely succeeding as he ran past where it descended.

He turned to circle around her as he ran out of the pantry and down into the hallway again.

Jirachi looked at a clock.

8 minutes had passed, she smiled, he really was putting up a fight. She walked out of the pantry and saw Zorua's tiny form slip into her bedroom now.

She giggled as she went in, once again him not being visible to her.

"I'm gonna get you little one~" She sang out, as she resumed her lazy search for the tiny pokemon.
122332223211211222221.title: Jirachi's game

choices: Yes
No
12233222322.title: Victory legendary

choices: ... himself shrinking down!
... Victini growing!
122332223221.content:
Unlike most pokemon in the village, Victini didn't hate Zorua. Actually, she didn't even dislike him just like everyone else did.

Victini was probably the only one pokemon who could say that Zorua's pranks amused her. The other pokemon of the village didn't really approve this behavior of hers, but she didn't care.

She seemed to like Zorua, despite some of his pranks being sadistic and potentially lethal.

For his part, the fox always tried to stay away from the legendary; she generally acted friendly towards him, but her behavior only made Zorua feel uneasy and led him to walk away from her whenever she approached him.

The fox bit the rope in his mouth harder, what was Victini doing in the forest? In his forest?

Zorua, grunted and looked away for a moment, briefly wondering if he could still play his prank on the fire-type; a grin spread across his muzzle - if he did, Victini was probably going to finally leave him alone... probably make him regret his choice, but ultimately leave him alone.

Zorua snickered, looking back to the approaching legendary... who wasn't there anymore.

"Wha-"

"Hi Zorua!"

"Ah!"

The moment a pair of paws connected with his back, Zorua screamed, the rope sliding out of his mouth, burning his tongue while also causing his bucket full of feathers and honey to fall from its perch and to the ground, where it dropped all of its contents.

An alerted Zorua turned around, noticing the same pokemon he was planning to prank, and the same pokemon who ruined his prank.

The cream colored legendary fixed her blue eyes on the fallen bucket and shook her head in an upset fashion.

"Really, Zorua? I've seen your greatest pranks, I gotta say that this is pretty disappointing..." she stated, before giving a playful giggle.

"Tha... That's none of your business, Victini!" he retorted, regaining some of his composure,
"What are you doing here?"

"I wanted to see something cool!" the legendary stated with a smile which was then replaced by the same upset expression she wore before,
"But this one prank... you're getting rusty."

Zorua snickered awkwardly, feeling nervous like he always felt whenever Victini acted like that.

"You wanted to see something cool? You're in the right place, lady," he said.

Victini smiled again, though it was more of a grin than an actual smile.

It made Zorua feel even more nervous.

"Speaking of cool things, I've got something you may like, " she spoke mischievously, hovering closer to the fox,
"A prank of my own, if you like."

Zorua gained a smirk of his own.

"Never figured you were a prankster too," he spoke, stepping back from the approaching legendary, not really wanting to find out about what prank she was talking about.

If he had learned something from years of pranking, it was that a prank was only funny when he wasn't the victim.

"I'm not, but this one thing is really cool. Wanna see?" Victini continued, her unnerving smirk striking fear into Zorua.

"I don't think I'm really interested in-"

Zorua couldn't finish his sentence, because right there, before his incredulous eyes, Victini's own blue oculars began glowing q blinding light.

Zorua stepped back again, noticing...
122332223221.title: Victini's prank

choices: "So sure, i'll grow you back."
"So I think for now, i'm gonna keep ya."
"So i'm willing to cut you a deal for your size back."
1223322232211.content:
Zorua felt like his head was swimming as he looked into Victini's eyes. "Lady, I don't know what you're doing, but..." He shook his head, trying to get rid of the daze, as he noticed his surroundings seemed to be getting larger...quite a bit larger in fact. He looked to Victini to see that, with her smirk and glowing blue eyes, she was getting larger too.

He stumbled back in surprise, only to trip over his own feet as he fell over a small rock, something he wouldn't have even noted a few moments ago. "What the hell..." He muttered, looking around as he started to shake off the sense of weariness from his head. He took a good look to see the grass around him was...now taller than him!?

"V-Victini!?" He cried out in a panicked tone as immediately his ears rang from a girlish giggle above him, at a far larger volume than he was used to.

"Oh man! You should see your face! And your voice, it's so squeaky! See Zorua, now THAT'S a prank!" He heard, the ground beneath him shuddering as Victini casually walked forward towards him. He audibly gulped as he regained his footing and looked at the looming legendary. She had to be as big as a building to him at least. A glint of mischief in her eye that he knew all too well and a smirk played across her lips as she looked at him.

"Aw...you're so adorable at that size, like an iiiiiiitty bitty doll." She said, taunting him in a cooing manner before she giggled. Zorua felt his face flash red, both from anger and embarrassment, still, he needed to play it cool...cool...

"How the hell did you shrink me!?" Zorua felt himself cry out, a bit of panic creeping into his voice, hopefully masking his anger. Victini just kept a smug look about her as she got to her knees, something that made Zorua jump about 10 steps back.

"Hmm, something I picked up pretty recently. Cool, right? I gotta say Zorua, I expect better from you...you really let me one up you on this." Victini said.

'Yeah, like I could ever hope to pull something like this off' He thought bitterly. He swallowed, clearing his throat before he spoke again.

"W-well, maybe i'm having an off day. I gotta say, you really got the better of me on this one Victini. Good prank!" He said, looking into her giant eyes as he praised her. "But, you can grow me back, right?" He asked, trying to play it off.

"Oh of course I can!" She said, smiling genuinely at him. Zorua sighed with relief. Good, once he got his size back he'd drop a quick illusion and get the hell away from this weirdo.

He looked up at her expectantly, her smile never faltering. He was smiling too, but after about 30 seconds of this it began to waver.

"...Well?"

"Well what?" Victini asked innocently.

"Are you gonna grow me back?" Zorua asked, raising his eyebrow.

"Hmm, I wonder..." Victini said playfully.

"You just said-"

"I said I CAN grow you back, not that I would, silly little Zorua." Victini said, before a giant finger reached down and gave Zorua's head a noogie, threatening to push him down into the ground with the amount of power she had over him right now.

"Victini! I can't stay like this! My parents would freak!" Zorua said, dropping his cool, and letting panic take over again.

Victini then pinched Zorua's body with two of her fingers as she got to her feet. Zorua felt a great sense of vertigo take hold as he was lifted high into the sky, up to her face as she looked at him.

"Look Zorua, I like you..."
1223322232211.title: Victini's shrinking prank

choices: Accept her deal
Go to Victini's place
12233222322113.content:
The dark type's ears perked up at the prospect of getting his size back but Victini's offer of a deal sounded a little ominous. "A deal?" Zorua questioned, kicking his legs in the air. He was lowered backwards down onto her hand and he scrambled up to see her large blue eyes staring at him. Interested as he was in getting fast-tracked back to his original size he was extremely worried a part of her deal would involve demeaning or embarrassing him. Then again, for Zorua spending time being small enough to sit in her paw was embarrassing enough. Victini watched him before she suddenly pressed him to her cream-furred chest. Zorua struggled for a bit until he could feel gravity push from above and his fears were confirmed when he managed to look past the long strands of fur to see the tops of the trees.

He stopped his struggles immediately and he let Victini take him wherever she was going, the sight of being that high up was not what he needed right now. Thankfully, the trip was short. A couple of minutes later Zorua found himself being pulled away from the warm fur of her chest so he could see where he was; just outside the local Pokemon Village. "I'm willing to give you back your place of number one prankster in the forest and your size if you can do this one little thing for me," she said to him.

"And what's that?" Zorua asked, almost dreading the answer.

"I just want you to pull off a prank while you're all tiny!"

"Excuse me?"

Victini began to gush as she tried to explain. "Well you're so creative and smart and uh..." she paused for a moment before she composed herself. "...I'm curious to see what you would come up with."

The praises from the giant legendary gave Zorua a whole slew of sudden emotions. He wasn't sure if he should be feeling gratified, embarrassed or anxious. Although, anxiousness seemed to be the most prevailing. He could be held between two fingers of Victini; a Pokemon that is comparably small among a lot of other Pokemon. Even Zorua would usually find himself looking down at her when she was hovering and flying everywhere. If she looked like the size of a building then the more larger types might look like a mountain. "I don't know, I'm pretty sure most of the Pokemon in the village would either stomp me flat or eat me alive if they found me like this," he muttered.

Victini giggled. "Just don't get seen then!" The fire-psychic waited for Zorua to reply as he was deep in though but quickly got impatient. "I'll let you choose who you want to trick and I'll take you there. Then, as promised, once you return and they've been thoroughly japed you'll get your size back." Victini could feel the small dark-type shifting uncomfortably in her paw and his expression clearly showed hesitation. She started feeling disappointed for assuming he would do something so risky. Victini was sure he could have thought of something even with the huge disadvantage she gave him.

"I don't know..." Zorua hummed.

"Well, if you really don't want to do it I guess we could hang out at my place for a while." Victini softly said.

Besides being annoyed that there was no 'just let me go' option, Zorua was honestly torn on what to do. On one hand, he could take the more dangerous option to try and get him out of this situation as fast as possible while also maintaining his reputation as the best trickster in the forest. Victini also seemed to genuinely believe in his ability to pull it off despite how small he was... On the other, he could just accept going to her place and hope she won't keep him there long and not make him do anything silly.

What does Zorua decide to do?
12233222322113.title: Victini's deal

choices: Gothorita as she passed by Victini
Vulpix with her snooty attitude
The little Eevee window shopping for candy
A different pokemon
122332223221131.content:
Zorua looked up at the giant legendary that...oddly enough seemed to admire him in her own way. He gulped down a bit of fear before he nodded to her. "Okay then Victini, i'll do it...i'm gonna thoroughly show you just why they call me the best prankster there is. Tiny size or no, i'm gonna blow your mind and send a shiver down my victim's spine." He felt a familiar smirk play across his lips, he himself felt like he could pull it off with those words uttered. That's right! His size and strength might be gone, but he was not stripped of his two strongest assets. His devilish ingenuity and his convincing illusions, and with them, he'd definitely get through this with flying colors. Zorua's grin was cut off as he felt himself ascending again.

"Hey, what-" He was cut off as his face and in fact entire body was pressed against Victini's furry cheek. "See! That's why you're so cool Zorua!" She said, the close proximity of her voice making his ears press against his skull to try and dull the loud sound. Victini grinned as she pulled him away from the cheek to look at him, he was thoroughly dazed by this. He shook his head to regain his bearings and looked up at her, doubt creeping into his head again.

No, he'd pull this off, he wasn't about to throw in the towel on this, not only for his size, but his pride as well.

"Okay Victini, take me into the village. I need to select my victim." He said calmly, the gears in his head turning as he considered exactly what he could do

-

"Hmm, who to pick, who to pick..." Victini said as she looked at her paw to see that Zorua didn't look like he was there. She wasn't fooled though, she could still feel and hear him.

"That's my choice there, I need to play this one carefully. If I get caught or snatched I could end up as paste..." Zorua shuddered a bit as Victini grinned.

"You won't. At least...if you aren't as rusty as I fear." She said and Zorua closed his eyes to steady himself.

"I ain't rusty..." He muttered before he looked around, a few pokemon immediately caught his eye.

There was one of the school weirdos he could do it to, and that was Gothorita. She tended to keep to herself and he had done a few pranks to her in the past, though she never gave much of a reaction to him when he did do that. He was a little creeped out by her if he was being honest, though he figured she'd be an easy enough mark. She even seemed to be coming towards Victini...

...Then there was Vulpix, a frequent and fun victim. A neat freak, a perfectionist, and snooty and condescending as all get out, she HATED Zorua, and he LOVED to get a rise out of her. Oh the things he could do...but getting caught, oh that was definitely not something that would be fun at all at this size. Still though, a grin played across his lips, he really could feel the satisfaction that would come from nailing her like this.

And finally, Eevee...she was a few years younger and Zorua had pranked her in the past, causing her to cry, and he'd gotten an earful for that one. He tended to take it easy on her since then, but she would be the easiest mark here, and the quickest ticket to his size back. He could see that she was well distracted at the candy shop too. This one might even be TOO easy, size or no size.

Zorua mulled his options as he took in a few different villagers as well before he spoke up.

"Alright Victini, I know who i'm gonna prank." And with that, he announced his victim.
122332223221131.title: Zorua takes the deal

choices: Zorua slipped away and crafted an illusion, remaining unnoticed
Vulpix walked into the bush and noticed Zorua!
1223322232211312.content:
"And?" Victini asked with excitement, eyes sparkling in a childish anticipation.

Zorua snickered.

"There is someone..." he declared, his mind rapidly filling with malicious ideas.

The fire-type giantess' eyes lit up.

"Who is it, who is it?" she asked with excitement. Zorua laughed.

"Do you know that Vulpix fella?"

Victini hesitated for a moment.

"... That smug little vixen? She hates ya." she unnecessarily stated.

"And that's why I pull my pranks on her... and it's also why this is gonna be glorious." Zorua replied, his own grin reflecting on Victini's face.

"It's decided then," she said, giving a mischievous giggle,
"I must say, Zorua, I'm curious about what your tricky little mind is gonna pull this time... and make sure it's something that'll make me laugh for hours."

"You'll laugh for days if this plays out fine." Zorua snickered.

Victini needed to hear nothing more.

Once more, she shoved Zorua against her chest and fluttered into the village with the tiny dark-type hidden by her creamy fur.

Knowing Zorua, this was going to be lots of fun.

"I'll get you to her," she whispered.

Zorua snickered.

"Don't bother. She'll come to me, like she always does." he replied, continuing upon noting Victini's confused expression,
"Just get me back to the forest and hide. The rest is a surprise. I'll show ya I earned my title."

Victini smirked.

--

Zorua's declaration was true.

Sadly for her, Vulpix had to walk across the woods where Zorua usually played his pranks to get back home. She would have never done so otherwise.

She hated the dark-type's guts and everything related to him since his first prank on her, in which she ended up in a puddle of water which not only hurt her, but got her fur wet.

Since then, she had tried to avoid Zorua at all costs; sadly, the fox seemed to know the forest like his own fur and always managed to pull pranks on her, much to her rage. Even more sadly, she could never get a hold of him, because the prankster would use his illusions to get lost rather quickly before she had to chance to burn his tail off with a Flamethrower.

Today was no different.

Vulpix had to, like every day, walk across the woods to get home.

The forest seemed rather quiet today, she mused, meaning that maybe Zorua wasn't up to something. Or maybe, if she was lucky, he wasn't even there.

Anyway, Vulpix sped up, hoping to get home before the fox showed.

She walked across the thick vegetation until she noted something unusual.

Resting in between two trees was a large mirror. Obviously, that didn't belong in the forest.

Vulpix stopped, confused, but her mind put two and two together quickly... and she came to the wrong conclusion.

"Why would he have a mirror? It'd shatter reflecting Zorua." she smugly said, nearing to the circular glass.

While she was at it, she mused, she could check on her beautiful form; Vulpix was so lost in her perfectly brushed fur that she didn't even bother to look up. If she did, she would have noticed a large pair of blue eyes looking straight at her from one of the trees. Her gaze was straight so that all she could see was her perfection... and not a certain fox that stood at short distance from the illusionary mirror, hidden by a bush.

Just a moment more...

Vulpix was still admiring herself when she noted that something was wrong.

"What the..." she muttered before noticing the reflection changing.

Before her eyes, Vulpix saw a Zorua that was staring at her from the other side of the glass, and he was right behind her.

Hastily, the vixen turned around, but no one was there.

She turned back to the mirror... only to notice that her reflection disappeared, fully replaced by the Zorua, who was now grinning.

Just when she began to understand, the image shifted once more, this time becoming a Tyranitar.

The huge pokemon roared, and the mirror exploded in a million tiny pieces, freeing the giant rock-type.

Vulpix screamed in terror as she tried to run, but the giant blocked her path, and began walking towards her with a ferocious expression on its face.

Vulpix backed away, until the ground came missing under her paws and she fell... straight in a puddle of mud.

Instantly, the Tyranitar faded and a loud snickering was heard. Vulpix didn't initially recognize the voice, but screamed as she saw mud clinging to her fur.

That wasn't an illusion, not at all.

"ZORUA!" Vulpix screamed in rage, climbing out from the mud and looking around furiously while the laughter still raged around the forest, belonging both to Victini and her tiny victim.

Even the tiny Zorua was, in fact, laying flat on the ground, laughing to tears.

However, loud tremors shaking the ground caused him to look up to see the fuming giant Vulpix coming straight towards where he was, apparently seeking for him and make him regret pranking her.

She was already too near for Zorua to craft an illusion, so, while still chuckling to himself, began walking away.

No way Vulpix would notice him while he was like this... right?
1223322232211312.title: A foxy prank

choices: Vulpix opts to try and finish Zorua off
Vulpix takes Zorua with her
Zorua has a trick up his sleeve to get away
Victini intervenes at this point
12233222322113122.content:
Zorua was walking away carefree, sure that his size would disguise him from Vulpix and her rage, Victini watched from her perch as Vulpix was coming close to Zorua and she wondered if she should intervene, before a smirk of her own played across her lips.

"Let's see what happens here..." She said to herself, curious as to what could happen if he DOES get discovered.

The tremors at this point were getting loud as the bush above Zorua stirred, the muddy, angry face of Vulpix looming above him. It was then that his grin vanished as he had a serious risk of getting discovered by her now.

"I KNOW YOU'RE AROUND YOU PEST! SHOW YOURSELF ZORUA!" Vulpix screamed, her voice loud enough and close enough to cause Zorua to crumple to the ground. Vulpix herself was even bigger than Victini, a veritable towering beast in her own right, and she was out for his blood.

Zorua started to try and slowly walk away, discreet as possible before he felt the unbearable pressure of a gaze on him.

"...What the heck?" He heard to confused voice of Vulpix, almost disarming her rage as she saw what looked to be Zorua, but incredibly tiny.

"I'm out!" Zorua yelled, knowing he was found before he started to run away. He was going full speed ahead as Vulpix blinked before she shook her head.

"Oh no you don't! I don't know what's going on but you're NOT escaping me!" Vulpix nearly screamed as she leapt into the air, ahead of where Zorua was.

As she landed, the ground quaked hard beneath Zorua, almost as if Vulpix's leap had caused an earthquake as he once again lost his footing, and was forced to look up and up and the visage of the muddy, furious Vulpix.

"Oh...hey Vulpix...you uh, look like you took a fall...heh, you okay?" Zorua asked a bit nervously. A moment after this he felt crushing pain as Vulpix pinned Zorua down with her paw.

"I don't know what happened to you, but I must say, this form fits you quite well Zorua. This is where you belong." Vulpix said, her voice icy cold as she applied more pressure, very easily on his tiny form.

"H-hey, stop! You're gonna kill me if you keep this up!" Zorua choked out. Vulpix just smirked at this.

"Oh? Is that fear I detect Zorua? I hardly thought one such as you was capable of that...aren't you the greatest prankster around? Surely not, I believe a Joltik would be more than a match for you now..." Vulpix let off an obnoxious laugh as she felt control of the situation.

Zorua for his part was struggling and just hoping that Victini hadn't abandoned him at this point, if so then he didn't like his odds now, he was sure Vulpix would have no mercy for him.

Vulpix removed her paw as she got down on her stomach, bringing her giant head close to Zorua. She opened her maw and Zorua gulped at the cavern in front of him. He wasn't sure if she was going to eat him, or...it was then that a gale force came from her mouth as she blew on him and Zorua flew back what felt like 20 feet, rolling to a stop and groaning.

"So pathetic...so fitting." Vulpix cooed. This might've been worth the mud dip even, she'd clean off at least, but for now...she could do as she pleased to her hated enemy.
12233222322113122.title: Discovered by Vulpix

choices: Victini restored Zorua's size as promised
Victini wanted something else from Zorua first...
122332223221131223.content:
From her perch up on the tree, Victini watched her tiny friend and his enemy nearing him slowly.

She pondered if she had to intervene. Certainly, she didn't want Zorua to be killed when Vulpix got tired of toying with him, but she decided against helping for now.

"I believe in ya, Zorua," she said with a grin, although the fox couldn't see her right now,
"Show me what you've got up those famous sleeves of yours."

It was part of the deal that Zorua didn't have to get seen after all, and now it was up to him to get lost before Vulpix became too vengeful, in which point Victini decided she would step in.

As for Zorua, he felt his heart pounding the walls of his chest as the shadow of his gigantic opponent eclipsed his whole form.

"Now Zorua, what should I do with you little filthy insect?" she asked, mostly to herself, a devilish grin similar to Zorua's spreading wide on her face,
"I can do everything to you! Like-" Vulpix trailed off, noticing Zorua's expression.

He was snickering.

Victini may have forsaken him, but he could still rely on a Zorua's most famous (and infamous) ability: deceiving enemies with illusions.

As for Vulpix, she was confused, why did the little vermin before her eyes have that expression on his face.

"Yeah, laugh while you still can you miserable bug, because I will be the one laughing when I-"

"Ya think you got me?" Zorua interrupted, his laughter dying down; Victini leaned from her branch in an attempt to hear what the two pokemon were saying,
"No one will ever do that, ya drama queen."

Those words said, the vegetation around Vulpix sprang to life, trees extended their branches like arms to reach down; the fire vixen screamed as she was entangled by the thick plants of the forest and began struggling to break free.

Victini watched in amusement, seeing Zorua's opponent struggling all of a sudden, as if fighting an invisible enemy. This was Zorua's doing, the legendary thought with a smirk. She leaned over so much that she fell from her perch, managing to remain in mid-air thanks to her wing-shaped tails.

"Go Zorua." she murmured.

Said dark-type snickered at the face of the giantess in front of him.

"I see you're busy Vulpix, so I'll be on my way now. 'Till the next prank~" he sang, slowly backing up before turning around and sprinting away, disappearing behind a vegetal wall.

Vulpix snarled.

"Z... ZORUA!" she screamed, letting out a Flamethrower around her, burning the illusionary plants off.

"GET BACK HERE!" she exclaimed, chasing after Zorua.

The fox felt the ground trembling beneath him and snickered again. He slipped into another bush before Vulpix could see him, but he wasn't just going to hide, no. He had another, devious plan in mind.

Vulpix stopped to look around, when she caught a glimpse of a black thing that looked like... Zorua's tail!

"Found you!" she screamed, once again chasing after the fox, not even bothering to look back to see a certain legendary following, not to lose sight of the duo. This was becoming rather fun for Victini, who was furiously pressing her paws against her mouth to keep her laughter in.

She watched as Vulpix chased the tiny Zorua right back to where they were before.

The vixen was so angry that she didn't even notice that Zorua wasn't showing any signs of being tired while she was panting. She didn't even notice where Zorua was bringing her.

In fact, only when the illusionary fox faded, she noticed she was headed straight for the same puddle of mud she fell into earlier.

She desperately tried to halt, but in the middle of her sprint she couldn't stop and ended up taking a second dip into the 'mud bath'.

Realizing that she was once again tricked by her hated enemy, Vulpix howled in anger.

In the same moment, Victini howled too, but with laughter.

Zorua was able to pull not one, but two awesome pranks while tiny!

"Victini! Quick!"

Thanks to her big, V-shaped ears, Victni was able to hear Zorua despite his tiny size and looked down, spotting the fox on the ground underneath her.

Giggling, she hovered down and hastily got a hold of the fox before fluttering away, leaving the seething Vulpix in the mud, screaming out Zorua's name along with terrible insults.

--

"Amazing! Incredible! Marvelous!" Victini loudly praised in a secluded spot of the forest, far from where Vulpix was left.

"Easily one of my best pranks ever!" Zorua laughed while he rested on the giantess' orange palm.

"Yeah! I thought you were about to get caught, y'know, rusty as I thought you were, but you managed to trick her twice! You're so smart, Zorua!" the legendary exclaimed cheerfully.

The fox grinned.

"Yeah... now, about that deal you struck me..." he hinted.

Victini looked at him.

"Yeah?"

"Well... I did it! You're gonna give me back my size now... right? A deal's a deal?"
122332223221131223.title: Zorua's illusive escape

choices: I can grow you back but um...will you go on a date with me?"
"I can grow you back but...will you be my friend?"
"I just...need you to prank one more pokemon for me."
"I don't...quite know how to grow things yet."
1223322232211312232.content:
Zorua's grin didn't falter as he looked to Victini, expecting her to honor her end of the deal when she bit her lip. She even started to fidget in place, rocking Zorua a bit as he looked up at her.

"Zorua, let's go talk at my place..." Victini said nervously as Zorua raised an eyebrow. "Victini, we had a deal!" He said, starting to sound slightly agitated, though there wasn't much he could do. Victini held all the cards, hell, she'd hold the cards even if he were normal sized.

"I know we did Zorua, just...hear me out, okay? It'd be better if we got out of this forest, away from Vulpix too." Victini said as Zorua felt the surface he was on shift, Victini hugged the diminutive dark type to her chest as she fluttered into the sky, away from the potential wrath of a certain vain fox. Zorua for his part was struggling slightly against the plush cream fur, but it did him no good and once he realized how high up he was he opted to stop, instead groaning.

'Why do I gotta deal with this crap?' He thought, as right now he just wanted to go home.

Victini flew towards the village, ready to head home when she grew a bit nervous about how she was going to tell Zorua what she needed to tell him. It wasn't like he could resist her, but that wasn't what she wanted anyway, she admired the dark type in her own way despite the vast difference in power between them and she needed to make sure that things didn't go awry. This was her chance to connect with him.

-

"So here we are!" Victini declared as she touched down near her home, opening the door to a modest looking house. Zorua was struggling a bit against her grip as he was gently deposited onto a table. "Victini, you can't back out on this deal! I gave you a double prank! Grow me back!" Zorua demanded, glaring up at the legendary, she just gave a sheepish smile. "In time, I promise. Here, let me go get you something to eat, alright?" She said, changing the topic as Zorua's stomach growled at the mention of food. He blushed and sighed before looking up at the titanic legendary.

"Meat please." He said and she grinned. "You got it!" And with that she walked off, leaving Zorua stranded on his table perch as he looked around. It was a nice place, pretty clean too...and quiet he noted. "Hey uh, Victini?" He felt himself calling out.

"Yeah Zorua?" He heard from around the corner she went as he looked towards it.

"Do you live alone?" He asked as he started to walk around the table, looking at more of his surroundings.

"Yeah, I do." Was the simple reply. Zorua blinked. She was around his age right?...Eh, didn't matter. She was a legendary, who knew what went on in that regard.

"Cool, cool..." He felt himself muttering, finding himself out of things to talk about, as well as being a bit bored now. It was moments later that Victini came back with what seemed to be a slice of ham and a thimble of soda.

"Here you go Zorua! Go ahead and dig in!" Victini said, setting the stuff down near him. The ham slice was bigger than him and there was no way he'd finish all that soda! With a grin he muttered a quick thanks and started to chow down. Victini leaned her head on her paw as she watched him before he piped up.

"Alright Victini, what's it gonna take for you to grow me? You brought me here to discuss that, right?" He said between mouthfuls as Victini frowned a bit.

Here goes...she thought as she spoke up.

"It's, well, Zorua...ya see, it's..." Her nerves were getting the better of her, but she did manage to get it out.
1223322232211312232.title: Victini isn't done

choices: Zorua accepted, what could go wrong?
Zorua refused. Victini was going to understand, right?
12233222322113122321.content:
Zorua's eyes went as wide as two miniature golf balls.

"What?" he asked, not sure he had heard right; maybe his pranking mind was turning itself against him.

But seeing Victini blushing and with her hands covering her eyes in embarrassment suggested that it was the exact opposite.

"... Could you repeat that?"

Victini's mind was racing right now. She had found the courage to say what she wanted to say, but her courage was abandoning her now.

Zorua seemed incredulous, maybe this was her chance to take her words back, grow the little prankster and send him on his way... that way, she'd lose her chance to get closer to him.

No, she had to get to the bottom of this.

"I said..." she began, slowly removing her paws from her eyes to connect her fingertips, adopting an awkward smile,
"... I can grow you back but... will you... go... on a date... with me?" she said very slowly, having to force each syllable out of her mouth.

Zorua's eyes became even wider, he didn't mishear! This giant legendary wanted him to go out on a date with her!

Thousands of questions began racing across the fox's mind.

How?

When?

Why?

Nobody had ever showed interest towards him, everybody seemed to hate him instead... and now this legendary was asking him out so bluntly and so suddenly?

What was he even supposed to say?

"B-But, Victini..." he murmured breathlessly, his own cheeks flaring up,
"... Why me?" was all he could ask.

Victini sighed. Her tails began flapping on their own, something that happened often when she was nervous, causing her to take flight involuntarily.

"I admire you, Zorua," she spoke slowly and softly, her tone very quiet,
"I really do. I mean, you're probably one of the smartest inhabitants of this village! Some of your pranks, like the two you pulled earlier, they're so cool!"

Zorua blushed even more at the praising, though that didn't answer him.

He expressed it.

"Get to the point, Victini." he said quietly.

Victini nodded slowly.

"The point is: I really like you." she admitted, feeling like she was going to explode; Zorua took notice of the temperature increasing in the room,
"... I have for quite some time. Seeing all those pranks you pulled, it was so fun... but every time I tried to talk to you, you simply walked away." the legendary paused to sigh,
"It was so frustrating. I wanted to talk to you badly, become friends with you, but you seemed uninterested."

Zorua took a step back, uncertain how to tell the giantess that he avoided her because he considered her a weirdo. As for now, he didn't know. He guessed his opinion hadn't changed much, given that Victini had shrunken him only to see him pull a prank and escape Vulpix by pulling another.

All of that paled to what she was asking him now though.

His ears perked as Victini kept speaking,

"... So when I developed the power to shrink things, I figured I could use it... to finally talk to you. I wanted to see how clever you really are when pranking, and you got past all my expectations," she said, offering a sheepish smile,
"Now you know..." Victini sighed deeply, then inhaled sharply,
"... I really like you Zorua. I see everyone hating you and I think to myself that I'm probably the only one who actually respects you for who you are... that's why the more time passed, the more grew my wish to... talk to you, connect with you... the more grew my opinion of you." she said.

Once more, Victini paused to look down, feeling her heart pounding her chest from within, but she ignored it. Getting her feelings out was a priority now, she had gone too far to stop. Might as well get this over with, she figured.

Zorua watched the titaness in front of him, shocked by the rapidity of the events; he opened his mouth to say something, but immediately closed it again, his vocal chords having shut down because of the embarrassment.

Victini finally raised her head again.

"I don't know what you think of me now but... I'm sure it'd work if me and you... y'know..."

Victini trailed off all of a sudden, her large blue eyes fixed on the tiny dark-type sitting on his perch on top of her table. Her mind flashed with images of her and the fox together, causing her to smile sheepishly.

As for Zorua, he stood there in silence and disbelief, realizing that the fire-type was waiting for an answer.

He couldn't believe how weird today had been so far; he was shrunken down, forced to pull to pranks on a pokemon that hated him before being asked out by the same pokemon who shrunk him in the first place.

Everything was going too fast for the tiny dark-type, resulting in him being at a major loss for words.

"Victini..." he muttered under his breath, feeling conflicted. If he agreed, he would get his size back; if he declined, would Victini still give him back his original stature? He did honor the deal after all...

The fire-type mustered enough courage to meet his gaze.

"Yeah?"

By the time she had spoken that single word, Zorua had taken a decision.
12233222322113122321.title: Victini's 'little' fondness

choices: The next day, before the date...
The next day, at the date...
122332223221131223211.content:
Zorua looked up at the titanic, legendary fire type, mouth shut as he felt a blush creeping onto his face. She was kinda cute...and he did need to grow back. He looked down at his front paws as he nervously scratched at his ear with a hind paw. "Um...I guess we could try it...right? It could be fun..." He said, nervousness entering his voice, something incredibly foreign sounding coming from him.

Victini's eyes widened as slowly, very slowly she started to gain a hopeful smile. "R-really?" She said, her chest about to burst as the butterflies in her stomach started going haywire. Zorua looked up at her face before slowly nodding. "Yeah..." He said, still feeling oddly shy. It was then that soft but powerful paws lifted him quite quickly from the table as he felt himself pressed against her chest in a tight but not painful hug.

"Awesome! Thank you Zorua! Thank you thank you thank you!" The voice reverberated through the tiny dark type as he felt a bit dizzy by this relative giantess and her strong signs of gratitude. He would've said something, but he was afraid to open his mouth and bit his tongue with how much shaking was going on in his world. After about a solid minute of this he vaguely felt himself being pulled away from his warm and shaking experience as Victini held him in front of her face, a gentle smile and red blush covering it as he stared ahead at her.

"So uh...I mean, we can do it tomorrow after school right? It's Friday tomorrow!" Victini said and Zorua's eyes widened. That was soon! But he felt himself nodding "Yeah, let's do it." He said. Victini's smile only widened as suddenly Zorua felt himself being lowered down to the floor. He looked up the the building sized Victini as her eyes took on a glow and Zorua's head felt cloudy once again. The world around him started to shrink around him as he grew bigger and bigger. He staggered back as this was going on, accidentally bumping into her table as he groaned before the process was over soon enough. He blinked as his senses became sharp again and he looked at the Victini in front of him, now smaller than he was. He felt like a giant...which itself was a disconnect since this was his original size in the first place.

"So uh...yeah, date tomorrow..." Zorua felt at a loss, far from the cocky prank king that he was. A blush crossed his muzzle as he looked down at the floor, anywhere but Victini's gaze right now.

"Right! Let's um...meet at the village plaza!" Victini said excitedly and Zorua felt himself nodding. "Yeah, it'll be f-fun. I uh...I gotta get home! It's kinda late! Reallylookingforwardtoitbye!" Zorua said nervously as he bolted for the exit, only to run into Victini's door.

"Ow..." He muttered as the door was opened by Victini, her smile never fading. "Thanks for today, Zorua." She said as she gently pecked him on the cheek while he was dazed on the floor.

-

"Man she's a weirdo...right? She's pretty cool though too...really cool...cute too...what the hell am I saying!?" Zorua was muttering to himself as he passed through the forest he'd basically claimed as his territory, as close to his and his family's house as it was. It was pretty dark now and he was sure his parents were gonna grill him about what he'd done today, assuming the worst. Well...he had done pranks...but he could leave that part out. He just made a friend and hung out with her and was going on a date with her tomorrow. Wasn't a lie. He kept musing, unaware of the vicious glare that was on him.

"H-W-You were tiny!" He heard the familiar haughty voice of Vulpix. He blinked, she was still out here.

"Nah, you're nuts." Zorua said nonchalantly as he stifled a chuckle at the angry looking, still fairly dirty Vulpix, though she'd done what she could to clean up while looking for him. "Go home, this is just sad." He said, a smirk on his muzzle as she glared at him. "I-I was looking for you! You were supposed to be small! I was-I-STOP PRANKING ME!" Vulpix shouted, her composure clearly not there as she ran off into the forest, probably to go home. Zorua finally let a chuckle come as she was gone. Man, she was always such a fun target...

As he started to approach his home, a carefree whistle came to him as he started to think of the next day...he wondered what would happen with Victini. What exactly was a date like? Would it involve more pranking? Or usual couple crap he saw when his mom or sister were watching some sappy movie...or maybe more of that weirdo size thing Victini could do? Hell, she was a legendary, who knew what ELSE she could do. That was when Zorua gulped.

"...What if I piss her off?" He muttered before shaking his head. "Nah, i'll be fine." He chuckled, whatever happened, he could always handle it.

"Zorua! Butt in here! Now!" He heard a familiar voice coming from the door as he approached his house.

"Here we go..." He said with a sigh.

-

"What have I said about staying out this late! And on a school night too!" His mother was scolding him as he just looked on ahead, his sister was thankfully already in bed so she wasn't getting too loud, but he knew he probably wouldn't get out of this easily. "Look, sorry mom, I lost track of time, you know how it goes..." He said, avoiding her gaze as his dad entered the room.

"More of your pranks?" He said, sounding weary as he looked to the two Zoroark's before him. He smirked. "Actually I made a friend, and we hung out. Doing it tomorrow too." He said, carefree. Both of his parents blinked.

"...Really?" His dad asked, trying to hide that he was taken aback by this.

"Yeah, really. They approached me actually! You'll never believe it too, it was a girl! She wants to go on a date with me tomorrow!" Zorua figured that if he played it this way his parents MIGHT back off.

His mom at this point interjected.

"You'd better not be planning to prank her Zorua!" She said. Her faith in him was pretty low...not that he didn't give her reason most times.

"Nah." He simply said, leaving out the part that he had planned to prank her today...albeit with a pretty crummy prank.

He went to move towards the kitchen, trying to get by his parents before he felt a tug on his tail from his dad. "Come on, let me eat then go to bed..."

"How about homework? Just because you got home this late doesn't mean you're skipping it, we've talked about this..." His dad said before he sighed. "Fine, fine...just let me eat..." He muttered. Arceus above what a long day...

His dad let go as the two parents shared a look. "Think he's finally growing up?"

"Oh I hope so..." His mother said, the weariness entering her voice now too as she felt a small smile on her face.
-

Zorua was laying in his bed, finding it hard to find sleep as he thought about Victini. How DID he feel about her he wondered? He frowned as he started to blush. She was kinda weird...but so was he he supposed. And giving her a chance...that should be fine, right? She liked him, and it was how he was gonna grow, it wasn't like he was the one that wanted to do it at first so he shouldn't feel pressured about messing it up...it was her idea...

So why was he nervous?
122332223221131223211.title: Accepting it.

choices: She's not planning to use her size powers
She likes the idea of tiny Zorua with her...
1223322232211312232111.content:
Zorua stood outside the restaurant, gulping at the glamorous lights before him as he scratched at the fancy necktie he had around his neck. This was way out of his depths...he went to open the door before, as if out of nowhere a paw shoved him back.

"I'm sorry sir, do you have a reservation?" Zorua blinked at the Furfrou with a star trim that was blocking his way before he shook his head. "Uh...n-no? I'm here to meet my date." Zorua said before the Furfrou chuckled as two arms grabbed Zorua from behind.

"No need to lie like that, you just want ta cause some havok in there, right?" The rough voice of Pangoro from the village informed Zorua of who had grabbed him as he was shoved back. He looked at Pangoro and glared, showing his canines before he shook his head and tried to calm down.

"Look, i'm here for a date...just let me through..." Zorua said. Both Pangoro and Furfrou moved out of his way as he smirked. Only to be grabbed by an invisible force and shoved into a mud pile.

"HEY! WHAT GIVES!?" Zorua cried out as he looked to see who the two had moved for, as two fancy looking Ninetales were entering the restaurant...with Vulpix looking as smarmy as ever. She looked over to him with a smirk as she walked in as Zorua grew more and more irritated.

"JUST LET ME DO THIS STUPID DATE!" Zorua yelled before he felt his surroundings start to melt around him, the mud dripping into oblivion as he looked around at the dark space he was in now.

"Stupid date...? Is that what you think? I poured my heart out for you and it's a stupid date?" The voice was from all around him, as the ground quaked. The surroundings started to coalesce into a home...his home. But it was giant. Was he tiny again.

"Wow bro, that's callous, even for you." He looked up to see a Zorua with a bow around her neck...his sis, but she was a towering giant! "A-Abby!?" He cried out in alarm as he turned to run, only to crash into a cream colored paw. He looked up to see Victini glaring down at him.

"Victini! D-did you shrink me again?" He asked as her glare grew more narrow.

"I liked you, and this is how you treat me! You'll pay Zorua!" Victini said as tears started to well up in her eyes as her foot lifted into the air...over Zorua. He went to run, only to find that he couldn't move.

He looked around, his parents in the distance.

"This is for the best, right dear?"

"Of course it is, Zorua just couldn't behave himself...he'll never learn."

"Bye bro! I'll take good care of your room!"

As the voices sounded around him, the foot was getting closer and closer as he looked up, shutting his eyes before the inevitable...

-

Zorua opened his eyes to see himself in his own room, his heart beating fast as he looked around. He threw his covers off of him as he went to look around...it was quiet, normal. 'A dream? Holy crap!' He was breathing harder than normal as he calmed himself down and sighed. He looked at his bedside digital clock and groaned. His alarm was gonna go off in 5 minutes.

"Crap...school." He muttered before his mind drifted to after. A date, right? With Victini...he didn't know why he was so damn nervous about this. He blinked some sleep back as he looked at his clock and reluctantly shut the alarm off. No point in trying to go back to sleep now...

-

"Come onnn, tell me what you did yesterday!" His sister pouted next to him as they walked to school, passing through the forest as Zorua tried to ignore her. "Tell me tell me tell me tell me!" Zorua's eye twitched as he looked at his annoying younger sibling.

"What I always do! Pranks! Now shut up! I had a rough night..." Zorua muttered as his sister pouted...followed by a grin. "Rough night? So it wouldn't be annoying if I did..." Zorua groaned as he looked around to see that his sister was nowhere around him. She was learning to use illusions really damn well and this was one of her new favorite things to do...he tried to mentally prepare himself for whatever was about to happen before she...

"THIS!" It sounded off loudly in his left ear as she yelled into it. Zorua glaring at his now visible sister.

"...You know you'll pay for that later, right?" He said, deadpan in tone as she grinned. "As if, you know mom and dad would ground you~" His sister said as she playfully skipped ahead. Zorua sighed as he followed her into town, towards the school.

-

Zorua was sitting bored in his class as he considered what was coming up after...he looked around, but Victini wasn't in his class...he wasn't sure what class she was in, now that he thought about it. Why had he only tried to get to know her yesterday? He supposed it was because she forced it but...she did seem pretty cool right? Why even think this much about it...he was just pretty much hanging out with her right? It was called a 'date' but what was it really gonna be? Probably pranking right? That's why she liked him...or maybe it would be going to get some food, that'd be fun too.

"Zorua! Stop staring out the window!" The teacher's voice snapped him to attention as he looked to the Miltank at the head of the class.

He stammered a bit before nodding, the class either giggling at him, or giving him looks more likely than not related to pranks he may or may not have pulled on them.

He wasn't keeping his mind straight right now...he knew that.

-
